hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: First off...staff extremely friendly and very helpful.However, the online videos DO NOT portray an accurate condition of the rooms. I stayed in two bedroom suite...and upon arrival, room was very worn and in need of updating. Our room was also dirty. So much so, I immediately went to front desk and voiced concern. I provided photos and front desk sent someone up to clean!. Was terribly dust ridden, for $500 a night I expected far better. Once cleaned, things went much better... but room condition not on par with other Embassy Suites. The two best features were the breakfast/pool area and overall location. Breakfast a wonderful experience for family of 5. Pretty much same thing every day but well worth it and good variety. Staff at breakfast wonderful! Every evening also had drinks and snacks...all this included as part of staying with Embassy. Location of hotel adjacent to and connected to Beach Walk on one side, however opposing side of hotel nearly abandoned and run down. Location to Beach just short walk away... maybe one block or so straight ahead on path. Car rental available next door and could return after hours at Embassy for small fee.I would stay again, but not my first choice and currently does not warrant as high a rating as is shown. With remodel...no hesitation... would highly recommend! For comparison, I checked out Trump hotel next door... night and day (Trump elegant and absolutely beautiful), however Trump similar room $1500 per night and no breakfast included, plus very small pool.When I return, I wy check out Embassy again, but if not remodeled... would pass.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here in October 2020 and we were not impressed. Really had a lot of difficulties with the overall appearance of the hotel being worn and dated and a little less than clean. Yes, we understand it is a high volume hotel and location and yes, we understand that is clearly caters to families, but, with that being said, that isn't an excuse for less than stellar front desk personnel and the overall feel of the property.It is in desperate need of an update, some cheerier paint and a wee bit of attitude adjustment in some of the front desk staffing.As a loyal Diamond, we did receive a lovely room upgrade, no complaints there, however with the quick turnaround, the room was just not satisfactorily clean. At all. Grimy would fit the bill and so would dusty.The location is great, a very short walk to so many things and that is an absolute plus.Would we stay here again? For the price...maybe??? If you're traveling w/ family, then I think you'll find this place acceptable and will met your needs.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We were beyond impressed with our stay at the Embassy Suites in Waikiki! First, they had a welcome drink for us when we checked in. Second, we were upgraded to an ocean view room...I think because we have gold status. (I booked the room through Costco Travel.)Third, happy hour was amazing! They had an entire menu of drinks that they served for free every night. Nice Hawaiian drinks too.Fourth, the full breakfast! This not only saved us money, but it’s was a legit full and fresh breakfast. They had two lines, so there’s was never a wait. Fifth, the location! I don’t think I’ll stay anywhere else after staying here and seeing just how central it is to the beach, restaurants, and shopping. Overall, between the amazing customer service, the kind house keepers, and everything listed above, I will return. I will recommend this hotel to there too. I don’t think you can go wring by staying here.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at the Embassy Suites in Waikiki March 2020. The hotel is amazing. Beautiful, clean, spacious rooms. And having free breakfast (which is awesome) every morning was a huge plus. And if that wasn’t enough...from 5:30-7:30 every evening, complimentary snacks and drinks were provided. How awesome is that!But what truly set this hotel apart from anyone else, was their staff. Never have we stayed at a hotel with such friendly staff. Words cannot describe how amazing the staff was, especially Cary (at morning breakfast) and Keala and Keola (at the complimentary evening reception). They truly went above and beyond. These 3 made our vacation beyond amazing and they are the sole reason we will always stay at this hotel when visiting Oahu. They all made us feel like we were at home. If you stay here, look for them! Their helpful and warm personalities will win you over in 2 seconds flat.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Absolutely love this place. Our second time here, and Arriving just after all the coronavirus hysteria surfaced… The governor just announced Hawaii is closing to tourism, and we are so grateful that we made it here in time

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My family (myself, my husband, 3 year old, and 5 month old) stayed at this hotel in the middle of February for 10 days. My parents and 2 adult brothers also stayed at the hotel for 7 days. We all agreed that it was the perfect location, walking distance to everything you need! The hotel staff were friendly, and made sure that we were taken care of. The hotel room was always clean, and housekeeping always made sure we had enough towels. We were often in the room at different times during the days so our boys could nap, but housekeeping was extremely considerate and would ask us for the best time to clean our room. Our room was a king room in the Aloha Tower. It was perfect for two adults and two young children. You can hear the elevator throughout the night, but it did not bother me. Some days the elevators were busy and it was difficult to get up or down depending on the time of day. Breakfast was unreal! I was so impressed, never bored of the options. The omelettes were great! Evening reception was good, some people enjoyed the free drinks more than others! The entertainment was amazing!The pool was never crowded even though the hotel was full most of the nights we stayed. Our 3 year old loved the kiddy pool and always found a friend or two to play with!We were unable to use our balcony during our entire stay due to construction. We spoke to the hotel staff and they gave us a choice of late checkout or a free night. We were very thankful and chose to have a free night. Overall, this hotel is amazing for families! The hotel rooms are spacious and allow for parents to stay up while the children sleep! I would stay again!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Marriott Embassy Suites Beachwalk is by far the best full value accommodations. I travel to Oahu on business frequently and have stayed at other hotels. Hands down this hotel is my favorite. It’s centrally located, has morning Buffett and afternoon managers reception. The rooms are always very clean and the entire staff treats you like family. They really make you feel like Ohana.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel exceeded my every expectation. I've stayed at many embassy suites all over and have sometimes been disappointed, but Beach Walk Location is amazing. The staff could not be any better. Professional, friendly, a0nd helpful.We had 2 adults and 4 kids we shared the 3 room suite. Having 2 bathrooms made everything so much easier. Our room was in the Hula tower. The beds were so comfortable and clean. Every elevator, common area had hand sanitizing stations. The staff was constantly cleaning and maintaining the grounds.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We enjoyed our stay at Embassy Suites. Most evenings there was entertainment during the evening reception. The band that was there was very good and made the evening fun. The breakfast selection was varied and tasty. The location is close to the beach and convenient for pick up by tour buses and shuttles. I would recommend Embassy Suites.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The hotel is conveniently located near shops and restaurants. Royal Hawaiian Center is just about a block away and International Marketplace is just few blocks away. The beach is just block away. Valet parking staffs are really nice and friendly. The breakfast food is very good and many variety but there is this one day that many plates are still dirty and not washed properly. It was pretty disgusting with still some left over food in it and still very oily in the bottom.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Warm reception, expedient and early check-in which we found accommodating. Our room on the 20th floor had amazing views, was quiet, clean, comfortable and spacious. The room offered a few perks such as chips, Hawaiian coffee and cookies. Additional amenities included soap, shampoo, conditioner and lotion. There is also an iron, hair dryer, refrigerator, microwave and coffee making station. This hotel is in a terrific location, close to the beach, restaurants and shopping.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Comfortable and clean room. Top breakfast. Great service. Staff very friendly. Would stay again. Perfect position. This was my first trip to Hawaii so it was important for me to find a good place to stay. This was perfect.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My husband and I have stayed at this hotel a few times now. Partly because it's a very nice, clean, friendly hotel, in a great location. The other thing is they have the absolute best happy hour....besides the free mixed drinks/soda/snacks, on Mon, Wed, Fri and Sat. nights they have a group called Kanilau perform during happy hour(5:30-7:30pm). They are the most talented family, GREAT singers, who can pretty much sing everything from Neil Diamond to Guns & Roses to The Righteous Brothers to Bruno Mars...and more. The only downside and it's not horrible....they do have birds flying in the patio area so you have to watch your snacks. To tell the truth...I'll take a few little birds any day....the entertainment is just that good.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The best hotel and location for traveling families. You simply cannot beat the room layout and size, breakfast, hotel services or location to the beach and Waikiki shopping. Simply the best for families and the staff was truly accommodating for us. We have a preschooler and toddler and had enough space in the room to not feel cramped. The pool is just right for our littles and did not feel overcrowded.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Everything was amazing. Short walk to the beach. Excursions were plentiful. Access to all sorts of shops and restaurants. The view from our room was wonderful even at night. The hotel staff was very accommodating.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Staff always eager to help and provide service. Easy walking to all of Wzikiki and convinient to bus stops. Evening entertainment for some Happy Hours was a terrific bonus. Proximity to all kinds of dining options a real plus.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Resorts is located in the heart of Waikiki, short walk to the beach, tons of shopping and tons of restaurants. Views from our room were surreal looking out on Diamond Head, Waikiki and a touch of the water. Resort is clean and the staff is friendly. NA Drinks greeted us along with very accommodating staff. Pool area has beautiful view and is a great place to hang out. Exercise facility is clean, modern but small. Breakfast buffet is awesome with omelet bar and plenty other choices that change daily. This is NOT just a coffee and danish bar... it's a full breakfast. There is also a happy hour with light food that we were not able to attend but was available to all guest. Love this location and the hotel was clean, rooms felt big and comfortable including beds!! Highly recommend!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Loved our stay at Embassy Suites. The rooms were large and had everything we needed. The evening happy hour was a great way to wind down at the end of the day and the free breakfast had lots of options. Thank you Natalie C for your help!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My wife and I stayed here for a week 2/11/2020 thru 2/18/2020, and the Embassy Suites was perfect for us. We walked the block to the beach twice, but the water was too cold for us...nothing ES could do about that. Neither could ES do anything about the crying babies at all hours of the night. My wife never eats breakfast, but we ate breakfast here every morning. Waiters in the dining room like Aldrin worked very hard to keep the area clean and welcoming. With 2 chefs and 6 omelettes going at once, it was a very short wait for yours and well worth it. Wide variety of food at the buffet. The evening manager’s party was lots of fun. Drinks were free and very good. Shane behind the bar made excellent margaritas. With 2 bartenders the line went fast...very little waiting. The band on Monday, Wednesday, Friday, and Saturday was excellent (see picture). The manager of this event kept the room and tables clean and atmosphere inviting. For us the dance floor was a bit small, but we love to dance, and not everyone does. Relying on the reviews, we gave up our king room when we checked in due to the close proximity to the elevators. When waiting for an elevator, they did not seem that noisy, but perhaps in a room immediately adjoining them it may have been noisy especially if you are a light sleeper. Our queen bed was perfect for us...no lumps, no sagging just a great comfortable bed. Would have preferred a king away from the elevators, but I understand there were none. We had a city view room, and we were happy with it Loved having two rooms with each room having its own television. So we would definitely stay here again and hope to make that happen next year. Thank you Embassy Suites!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Really enjoyed this hotel. It's in a perfect location, 1 block to the beach, or out the door to shopping and restraurant areas. Pool was nice, water was warm. 10 minute walk along the beach to the marina where many of snorkle and sail trips originate. Can't beat the morning breakfast and managers reception.Beach is nice, there is a place on the beach to rent chairs and umbrellas. Highly recommend this property. Pictures attached are from our corner room on the 12st floor.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Embassy Suites Waikiki is one of my top hotel picks! The staff are always so friendly and accommodating. Beautiful hotel. My favorite parts are the complimentary breakfast and complimentary Manager's reception. Oh em gee - omelettes made to order, yes please. In addition to the omelettes, there's a wide range of breakfast choices which include an oatmeal station, juice/coffee/tea station, bread/bagel/pastry station, fruit, yogurt and hot food station (rice, scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage and french toast). And the Manager' reception helps kick off the night with complimentary cocktails and snacks. Thanks Embassy Suites Waikiki for a wonderful stay! Until next time...

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My friends and I enjoyed our weekend stay at the Embassy Suites in Waikiki!!! The location is perfect...close to shops, restaurants, and the beach. The staff were excellent and friendly. The complimentary breakfast with the made to order omelet was delicious!! I’ll definitely return for a longer stay and recommend to friends and family. Mahalo~

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Good location! In the heart of Waikiki. Close to everywhere! Hotel is very clean and staffs are very helpful. Love the breakfast that come with it. Good variety of food. It is very nice to hang out by the pool and enjoy a drink. Would recommend my friend and family to stay here!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: First time at Embassy Suites Waikiki, and pleasantly surprised - hotel is very clean and very friendly staff!... and yummy all you can eat breakfast! Hope to come back and stay longer with family! mahalo for the lovely experience.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great location, close to beach. Very friendly staff.Complimentary breakfast for all staying guests. Love their made-to-order omelette station, the chef made my over-easy eggs perfect! Will choose here again for our next stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great breakfast! Omelette is yummy! Made to order! Friendly staff! Came with friends and celebrated a birthday! Wonderful location! Near shops and the beach! Great weather here in Waikiki! Would come again!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️Thanks Embassy Suites ! Nice hotel and great breakfast selection ! Employees are nice and friendly ! As a return guest , love the newly installed gate/ door so no birds flying around like other outdoor restaurant ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I've always loved Embassy Suites; while this experience was triple-fold (business, group destination vacation, pleasure), there were multiple avenues for possible challenges. I must admit though, from the planning process to day of departure, the experience could not have been more pleasurable. Both the Sales Director and the Manager (Natalie/Jay) were very responsive and receptive throughout. 10+++ all the way around :-). The hotel's location is fantastic and it's a short walk to shuttle stops, beaches, shops etc. Added bonus points are for Embassy's separate bedroom/living area, as well as the awesome breakfast and complimentary happy hour in the evening.Sending thanks to them for a wonderful stay!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: For those individuals who are fortunate enough to have these employees servicing their rooms, you are in for a treat - Literally!I just wanted to thank Leonida Ophelia and Jane for their kind, friendly hospitality. I'm quite sure that because they work behind the scenes, their awesome efforts go largely unnoticed and unrewarded; so to you three I say "thank you" for making my stay @ Embassy Suites Waikiki so much more enjoyable. You will all be in my thoughts and prayers each time I fondly reminisce about my wonderful stay in Honolulu.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is a great location and very nice. Close to everything and beach is one block away. Amenities are wonderful. Breakfast was very good and the manger's reception each night is great. Entertainment was so fun.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We really enjoyed our visit, staff and service was great. Had a wonderful time on our Island Tour, our guide Cousin Kevin from Hoku Hawaii Tours was amazing, funny and very accommodating. We thoroughly enjoyed the entertainment at Happy hour In the hotel, it keeps bringing us back. The family band are excellent, we enjoyed every minute and can't wait to come see them preform again.Donna WallaceCheryl BodieMichelle Kimber

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Excellent a 10+. The staff at breakfast are so nice, especially Cary. He gave us so much info about places to go and where to get good eats! He even gave us a goody bag which was totally unexpected. Our housekeeper was also nice. Cindy at the front desk was also great in moving things around so we didn't have to change rooms even though I added another day and had two separate reservations. She even upgraded us to an ocean view room. Mahalo!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel has the largest rooms we have ever stayed out! We are a family of 4 and booked a 2 bedroom suite. Each room had its own bathroom which was great! The kids had their own bathroom and we had our own bathroom. Every morning the hotel offers a breakfast buffet served on a beautiful lanai which was included in our stay. The kids enjoyed the pool and the beach is only a short walk away. The hotel is in the perfect location right on Beachwalk and the main strip of Waikiki. The staff was very friendly and our rooms were cleaned immaculately! I would definitely stay at this hotel again and highly recommend it to anyone visiting Waikiki.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great hotel to stay at, especially if you have a family. They have a great breakfest buffet that is included, with an omelette station. The staff is very friendly and helpful.The room has a small fridge and microwave. There are a lot of shops and restaurants right next to the hotel, very convenient. The beach is right across the street with beach access.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Loved the location of this hotel , staff are friendly . Cook to order breakfast and cocktail hour is a nice touch . However you do get sick of it because they don’t really change it up daily . But it’s good for a few days . Swimming pool was too small wish it was bigger but it was nice and clean . I give this hotel 3.5 stars because of location . Can walk to beach like 2 blocks away and close to all restaurants and pubs

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed in two different rooms...the first one for 2 days was a partial ocean view on 17 th foor...it was nice nothing fancy very traditional Hawaiian them...and the 2nd room was a premium ocean view room this room came with threats/ water pop etc...was more fancy but the same Hawaiian decor...we really enjoyed the view of this one!! Hotel has a nice complimentary breakfast...omelets station/bacon/sausage/pancakes/ rice / miso soup/ salads/ fruits etc....plus a nice complimentary manager night every nigjt with beer/ wine/ cocktails....we would recommend base in the amenities closeness to the beach/ shopping/restaurants etc...they also have coin/Credit card laundry facilities....

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My wife and I just recently completed our annual visit to the Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach Walk which we believe is the best location, best value, and best staff in Waikiki. The complimentary breakfast buffet, evening reception with complimentary drinks and snacks are great value which is not found anywhere else in Waikiki. Four nights a week the Hawaiian family band, Kanilau, plays at the evening reception and is one of the main reasons we keep coming back. We are always greeted warmly by everyone from the bellman, Mr. Dean, to the front desk personnel, to the housekeeping, breakfast and evening reception staff. While all staff are always very friendly and helpful, certain staff stand out each time we stay here. Aldrin, Resty and Jay on the breakfast staff always greet us with a warm handshake or hug and say “welcome home” and ask us what they can do to help us. Cary came by our table at breakfast each day to check on us and to offer suggestions for things to do, places to eat or places to buy souvenirs or clothing for the best price. Justyn, at breakfast and also in the pool area was also very helpful. Our housekeeper, Crisfel, was so nice and made our room very comfortable during our stay. Alma, does a great job at the evening reception. At the evening reception Keola and Dennis, the bartenders, do an outstanding job with the drinks and keeping the line moving while interacting with the guests.We are looking forward to our next trip here.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Loved staying at this hotel. We travelled at the end of January at the start of our honeymoon.Pros: happy hour and talking to the staff. Always so helpful and kind. They were entertaining and jovial. One tip - always sit at the bar, the service was exceptional!Rooms are clean and quiet. Location was excellent. Lots of restaurants and shopping outside the hotel and a 5 minute walk away from the beach!Cons - breakfast is included, but options for vegetarians wasn't great.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Overall this place was fine and I am sure you will enjoy staying here, however I enjoyed other accommodation much more. My experience is as follows:1. When checking in there is no clear queue, so although I was standing around at the desks for 5 minutes, someone else that just walked straight up pretending they didn't see me was served first. I asked staff if I was waiting in the wrong spot but they said there is no queue and would be next. Then someone else tried to push in front of me, the staff member told them I was next. Given this happened to me twice in the 5-10 minutes I was waiting I am guessing it would be an ongoing issue - I think clear signage is needed for people to queue up. I didn't wait long and not a big deal but annoying for people that wait their turn.2. I booked and paid in full through a third party around 4 days before I was staying at this hotel. When I was checking in I was asked for ID and a credit card. I assumed, (as all hotels do) they were holding a token amount on my card. The lady checking us in whipped it out of my hand and swiped it through the machine in .5 of a second. I asked what amount she was holding and she advised the entire accommodation cost. I asked why given I have paid already and she stated she did not know I had paid and asked for my evidence, which I showed. Then when I said she has now used up the entire credit left on my credit card, she stated I should have told her I had paid already and this would not have happened. So apparently it was my fault that she wrongly charged my card leaving me with no credit, which took over one week to reverse. While I had cash and another card (that I didn't want to use), many people would have been caught short by her doing this. Staff should be clarifying with customers what they are charging the card for before swiping it though taking incorrect amounts. Also don't blame customers, why would I think you were charging my card for a room I had paid for.The staff member said she will get the manager to look at it and stop the payment. No-one followed up with me to tell me what had happened. I had to follow up at the desk the next day to see if had been stopped.3. The rooms were big enough for 2 adults and 1 kid, clean and tidy and I like having the separate lounge area.4. The breakfast was pretty good, some of the food (bacon) was rock hard and gross but the omelettes were nice and there was plenty of choices. Yogurts, fruit, pastries etc. The coffee was not nice. Overall I thought the breakfast was really good. 5. The nightly drinks and food: (the food consisted of carrot sticks or broccoli and dip, chips and goldfish biscuits and some pretzel mix) The beer was fine, the mai tais were fine, the blue cocktail was way to sweet and the scotch and coke (very crap scotch, I could not drink). The first night there was one staff member serving (who was super quick) but massive queues. There was one other person in the bar with him pretty much doing nothing, not sure why he was there. The second night and third night there were two staff actually working and the queues moved quicker. The band on one of the nights was great and it made the night much more fun. 6. The pool area was good, not many seats but there always seem to be some available and the whole area was really nice.7. There was a sign left in our room to say there were going to be renovations during the stay. This was obvious when we were in our room and could hear a very loud buzzing noise. No mention of this prior to booking of course.Overall I felt this place was fine, would I come back if I got a great deal, yep, but it would have to be super cheap, I would not pick it over other places I have stayed, just because of the little things.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our stay was really enjoyable in every respect. Lovely hotel, amazing location in the hub of Waikiki and excellent staff. Breakfast and evening cocktails food was a little underwhelming but overall the experience was superb. We will be back

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed here for a business trip. Accommodations were very nice, clean and friendly staff. I was on the 21st floor with a balcony. Amazing views of the city. I definitely would stay here again and will recommend others to as well!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel has EVERYTHING you need. My mom books here a couple times a year. The two bedroom units are the best. There are two bathrooms, a full living room and a full kitchen. Perfect for traveling as a family, but still having the privacy of your own room. And there is so much in walking distance. Embassy Suites is connected to the Waikiki Beach Walk. There are restaurants, clothing stores, convenience stores and entertainment. Definitely a great place to stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We loved this hotel! Lorena checked us in and when she knew it was our honeymoon, she really made it feel special for us. the hot tub was great, breakfast was felicious, the free drinks from 5:30-7:30 was amazing! rooms were spacious! location was so close to the beach!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our family of four had a great experience staying at the Embassy Suites in Waikiki. Great service began with the valet, check in, etc. All the worked so friendly. The room was very spacious and clean. After coming back from a long day of activities and shopping we'd take the kids down to the pool. They got to have fun as we relaxed and enjoyed free drinks (cocktails & non-alcohol) and an assortment of snacks. The setting was great for families, as well as those without kids. Our waiter, Justin, was awesome, always checking in to see if we needed anything. There was also a very kind worker there by the name of Ota, always so friendly, bringing us warm towels while at the pool...bartenders great as well. I can't forget to mention, the free breakfast! This helps out a lot in saving some $! There was a made to order omelette station with a huge assortment of other choices. Our family will definitely stay here again...

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We love staying here every year for our anniversary.Blessed with such a beautiful place to get away from it all.The kids loves the pool. We all love the buffet breakfast. Most of all we just love spending time together there.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great location and service! Staff was all great. Free breakfast with so many choices and cooked to order omelets. Night reception with lots of drink options and a few snacks. Close walk to beach and ABC store across the street. Many restaurants near by.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel is worth it everytime!! From the comfort of the rooms, to the daily breakfast and the evening reception, it's all awesome. I try never to stay anywhere else. This place was within walking distance to almost everything!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: As returning guests we had our expectations of the hotel, most of these met! All staff encountered were lovely and helpful. Breakfast was fine. Evening reception drink and snacks were appreciated and great. We missed the fruit infused water at reception- last time we stayed it was great to have the cold water waiting upon our return from being out in the sun. Some days the shower water was only like-warm- no biggie with the warm Hawaii weather! I recommend staying here if you’re looking for a friendly, centrally locates accomodation- close to the beach, shops, bus stop and eateries!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My family of 4 stayed at the Embassy Suites for 6 nights in January. We found the hotel to be clean and tidy and the staff friendly and helpful. The hotel is in a great location, close to the beach and main eating and shopping areas. The daily breakfast and evening reception are great value for money.We stayed in a 1 bedroom suite, but after seeing the 2 bedroom, I would definitely reccommend the bigger room if your budget allows.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Fresh, clean rooms that are a good size. Comfy beds. Perfect location for walking to shops, beaches, restaurants and the staff were lovely. Guys in the pool bar were so fun and always ready with drinks and smiles. A relaxed hotel where nothing is an issue. Pool area is great and although there were a lot of guests it was never crowded. Breakfast was lovely. Lots of fresh fruit and the omelettes were very popular. We got our coffee at Starbucks as we still can’t quite enjoy the taste of filter/instant coffee!We had a 2 bedroom suite on the 20th floor so lovely views. Family of 5 - suite was perfect in that we felt we all had our own space. Would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed for 4 nights in January, in a 2 bedroom suite. This was effectively two en-suited rooms, with an interconnecting door. This appears to be a permanent arrangement on our floor (15th) as only every second door was numbered. Hallway doors open at each end, allowing natural ventilation from strong breezes.Friendly reception at check-in, with a complimentary juice. Unfortunately our plane arrived well before check-in, but our luggage was stored. While the staff endeavoured to get early access, this didn't happen, but that's life. Room was well equipped, clean and tidy. Housekeeping service was good.Room rate included breakfast and an evening "reception".Made to order omelettes were excellent. Food otherwise typical US hotel fare. The dining room could be busy, but an adjoining function room was opened to cater for demand, so never left without a table. Beware the birds that can get into the dining area - can't leave your meals unattended, as one family unfortunately found out. Dining room staff friendly. Evening reception was a happy hour (1730-1930) with complimentary cocktails and snacks. Barmen were very friendly and entertaining to watch in action while rapidly dispensing drinks.Efficient check-out, and a taxi was readily summonsed for us when we found Uber was price surging about 5 to 7 times when we went to leave.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is the 4th time we have come here and this time we stayed awhile for 12 nights! We love it here with direct access into Waikiki beach walk, the beach just a short walk away, a few mins from Kalākaua Ave the Main Street of Waikiki. Surrounded by great restaurants and food courts shopping all within a short walk.Lovely walk through Fort de Russey Park is a stones throw. Our rooms were great 2 bdr 2 bathroom with connecting lounge and we upgraded to the partial ocean view this time.We were able to see the sunset and also the Friday night fireworks from the Hilton Hawaiian village.The complimentary breakfast was always excellent with freshly made omelettes which John expertly tossed. Our dining room Staff Aldrin and Jay in particular were so helpful and remembered us from our previous times also. There is a complimentary happy hour between 530-730pm with snacks as well. Keoni on the bell desk has always helped us over the years and is a real asset to the place. He has organised shuttles or taxis to waikele outlets,Aloha markets, snorkelling explained about the pink trolley and transport to Ala Moana just to name a few things.The staff at reception who welcomed us made everything seamless and the housekeeping staff were so polite and friendly.We wish to come back here again and again because not only is this the best location and excellent configuration of rooms for us but also it’s the staff who make it for us. Thanks to all !!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We loved it here! Super comfortable room and delicious breakfast as part of our stay. My husband took advantage of the Happy Hour every night and said the drinks were great! It rained and Hotel loaned us umbrellas. There is an on site gym and pools were nice. Centrally located to shops, beach and restaurants. We will be back!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Check in was smooth (no line), everytime I needed to stop by at front desk, some one was always available or short wait. Not too many rooms each floor, Never had to wait for elevator more than 2 minutes. Wall was thick, never heard any noise from hallways, next rooms. And we were 3 adults and it was nice to have 2 double beds plus sofa bed, room was big and comfortable.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Good we at front desk reception with immediate checkin. Very good location and nice rooms. The only flaw was the internet access. The room internet reception was average and none availible at the pool. Besides that, it was great time.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our family of six loves this hotel. Close walk to beach, shopping and food. Best breakfast with option of omelets included with stay. Lots of good drinks for kids. Free happy hour with stay with a fully bar and good snacks. Nice pool and hot tub where you can order food and drinks right there. The Waikiki burger is bomb and my mai tai’s were strong and delicious. Nice big, clean rooms with comfy beds. Staff is incredibly helpful and nice. Always asking if we need anything. Bringing us goodies, beach towels, and and laughs. I would never stay anywhere else in Waikiki.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: People are all good. Happy. The staff is comfortable and full of good people. The atmosphere is also good. Good location. You won't regret coming here. I will actively recommend it. It is very convenient for shopping and the sea is very convenient. The pool is nice because it also has a spa.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My family recently stayed at the Embassy suites Waikiki Jan 2020). This was our second stay at the hotel. Our party consisted of my parents, my brothers family and mine all caught up for 10 days, flying in from various parts of Australia, ten of us in total with kids ranging from 3 - 11.The hotel is situated across the road from the Beach. The hotel itself is a little 'dated' in comparison with other hotels. This is in regards to the furnishings in the rooms etc... Although some would see this as a negative, this worked out to be a blessing in disguise. The rooms are bigger and gave a little more space when the kids wanted to finish up for the day and just 'relax on the bed'. The pool area was a huge hit for the entire family. It was the right depth for the 'littler kids. Which put at ease the parents (myself included). This really came alive in the happy hour sessions from 5:30 - 7:30. Special mention must go to Keola - (the resident barman). He has got to be the hardest working barmen in all of Hawaii. Hilarious and super efficient (despite the long lines at the start). The breakfast buffet was a great way to start the day of adventures. There is always the danger of over loading here The reason that this is such a great place to stay (isn't it's great location/ pool / amenities etc...) but the staff. They are fantastic. Nothing was too much trouble and they really seemed to understand the needs of guests with families

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: For our 30th Anniversary, we returned to Hawaii for the first time since our Honeymoon. We stayed at the Embassy Suites on Waikiki and had a wonderful time. The housekeeping staff on our floor, especially, Chan, made us feel as if we were home. We also would like to commend the breakfast staff as they did a tremendous job.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: If you are considering the Embassy Suites, you already know the included breakfast and evening reception are big draw cards! This was part the reason we booked, and we were not disappointed. For Australians who are used to the breakfast fare in Sth East Asia, this is a more simple, less sophisticated approach but the omelettes are good (this is coming from a non-egg eater normally!)The room was spacious, nicely appointed and clean. Another big reason for our booking was the bed configurations. We were in a 2/Queen + sofa bed city view room. The sofa bed was terrible, saggy old foam mattress. Thankfully my 12yr old weighs next-to-nothing so didn't complain. No way would my 14yr old or adult been able to sleep on it. The beds in the bedroom. One was OK (just ok), the other was terrible and we kept rolling into the middle. I do have back issues, so this really impacted my stay here and in hindsight, I wish I'd said something whilst I was there.I've given my review a 4-star rating due to the poor beds and subsequent poor sleep quality.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We've stayed at a lot of Embassy Suites and this one is our favorite because of the location, the customer service, the breakfast, and the rooms. Upon checking in, we were greeted warmly and given glasses of passion fruit juice. We were able to go into our rooms right away and saw that they were clean and spacious. The view from our connected balconies was beautiful and the beds were super comfy but we were ready to do some exploring. One of the many highlights of this hotel is that it's located very close to the beach and stores.The customer service was excellent; we even received a wine, fruit, and cheese plate during our stay. The complimentary breakfasts is offered at every ES, but this one definitely stood out because they included items specific to Hawaii. There's also the nightly happy hour event with complimentary drinks and snacks, as well as live music.I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone and will likely stay here the next time we visit Oahu.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our family of 4 arrived from Australia at 7:30am and were advised that our room was ready and we were welcome to eat from the buffet breakfast! What a welcome after a long flight. We ate breakfast and had a few hours sleep. We had requested for a room away from the lift and ice machine (I wasn't too worried about view more about sleep). We rang and they were able to change us in the afternoon. Great customer service! They also gave us a upgrade to 2 bathrooms! The sleep quality during our stay was fantastic and our room was amazing. We enjoyed the breakfast and also the snacks and drinks in the evening. The location of his hotel is also great. You walk right out into Waikiki and it feels so relaxing. We used the pool and spa everyday and there were always fresh pool towels. Free wi fi was good and we liked having a fridge and microwave. Another bonus of this hotel is no resort fees. We caught buses around and immensely enjoyed our 4 night stay. Thank you and we'd love to come back and stay again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at the Embassy Suites last year and absolutely loved it. So we decided to stay here again. The breakfast was fantastic like last year. However, the lines are a lot longer and because of the rain which left the outdoor tables and chairs wet, we couldn't find a place to sit. I managed to find a towel and whipped down the tables and chairs. Not sure why the servers weren't doing that! This year, the hotel was at 97% occupancy when we arrived - pool was so crowded, I didn't even make it to the jacuzzi (we were there for 7 days). We had a pool-side, partial ocean view room on the 10th floor and it was noisy! We've been going to Hawaii for the past 10+ years, and this is the only hotel where I felt the staff was less than welcoming. The cleaning lady didn't even say good morning/aloha to us but asked bluntly "do you want your room cleaned?" The staff at breakfast was also less than friendly (aside from one ). The other annoying change that happened this year is they added more "cabanas" in the swimming area but they decided to charge for them. That just makes me mad. The hotel is not cheap. We paid $350+ a night and you're going to nickel and dime us? That just felt cheap and left a bad taste in my mouth. All that said, the hotel is in a central location to the beach and downtown waikiki (restaurants and shopping). The rooms were clean, breakfast was good despite the long lines. Ask for a higher floor if you're staying here.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We've stayed at this resort many times and it's never disappointed! We always take advantage of the breakfast and happy hour (which some nights include 'live' music) and it's always great. The food is hot, the drinks are flowing and the music is very entertaining. Our rooms are always clean, the hotel staff is always greeting you with a friendly 'Aloha', and always willing to assist at any level.I would highly recommend this resort to anyone, you get a lot of bang for your buck. Plus it's at a great location to the beach along with many fine restaurants. The pool is cleaned every day, along with fresh pool towels.Wouldn't stay at any other hotel in Waikiki!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The breakfast is great,..along with the superb happy hour. The staff is wonderful. I will try and attach a couple of pictures to show the view out of my room. You can be the judge if this is the type of "city" view that you would want on your stay in Waikiki.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was our first time staying at the Embassy Suites Beach Walk and I'm not sure we'd consider any other hotel for future trips. The room was spacious enough for 4 and the complimentary breakfast and manager's reception were great bonuses that we took full advantage of. The pool was one of the best I've seen for small children with several shallow sections but still long enough to do 25 m. laps if you wished (although only first thing in the morning or in the evening when the pool was relatively empty)The location is fantastic, right in the centre of the Waikiki strip - less than 5 min walk to tons of restaurants and the beach. We'll be back!A few suggestions:- would love to support the program to reuse towels rather than changing each day but there needs to be more places to hang them to dry properly; more hanging/drying space for bathing suits would be great too - a few basic dishes and cutlery for use in the little kitchen area (bar fridge, sink, microwave) would have been very handy for self-catering rather than using disposable items for everything

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The Embassy Suites chain is a great Hilton Brand. Not just a hotel room, but rather a Suite...two rooms. Great for families.The setting could not be better - right on Waikiki beach.. Come on...However, not only does this place have a gym and a fine pool, it boasts a free (very substantial) breakfast and a two hour reception every evening with all sorts of free drinks and snacks. Beat that?A very courteous staff will attend to your every need.The only down side of this place is the 40 dollar fee for parking. However, you can’t get parking neat Waikiki for much less and all the facilities here make Embassy Suites a very, very good choice.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We sadly checked out this morning after a 7 day stay.Really enjoyed the breakfast included and 2 hour free happy hour each night as well as the wonderful entertainment every other night and no resort fees! Staff were all really lovely.Our stay in Hawaii came after visiting New York so the space offered in the suite was a welcome luxury. The location although not directly in the hub of Waikiki beach was an easy walk to everything and we liked the beach at DeRussy park which was just by the hotel. We tried quite a few restaurants nearby and they were all good. Look out for the schedule of markets and entertainment in the Beach Walk.We would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My husband and I returned to the Embassy Suites Waikiki Beachwalk because of the great value but more importantly the wonderful staff here. At breakfast, Aldrin has looked after my husband and I with a smile on his face and always anticipates our needs. When he is not here the other staff is just as pleasant. While at the pool today we met a very personable young man named Justyn Wee. He took care of all our needs, kept the cocktails coming along with great recommendations on what to eat poolside. More importantly he was able to manage being attentive without being overbearing. This is a fine art. He made our visit to the pool extremely pleasant and fun which will remain in our happy vacation memories. Thank you all!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel is awesome. We have stayed in the Waikiki area before and this is by far the best hotel we have stayed in. Complimentary breakfast buffet with a great spread and free drinks and snacks in the evening. Pool and Hot tub are big and very kid friendly. Hotel staff are super nice. Rooms are big and clean, very family friendly. The sofa folds out into a bed (great for the kids) and they also provided a pack and play for us!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great staff, clean hotel, great location in Honolulu, close to the beach, free use of umbrellas if raining. Valet at hotel is very convenient for $40 per night. Helpful tour people to help with setting up your tours.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The overall experience was good. The location is excellent. The breakfast is one of the best. The area that fell short was the evening reception. While the adult beverages were nice, not all guests drink alcohol. Chips, carrots, broccoli, pretzels, goldfish, did not match the value paid for our stay. It would have been nice to have some simple hot options (pasta, hot dogs, hamburger, soup or chili) during the evening reception.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Staff is excellent. Every staff member we interacted with was very well trained. Location is in the middle of everything. Easy walking distance to dinning. Use the Valet service it is worth the price.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Very few rooms available during the holiday season but was able to secure one room at the Embassy Suites. The hotel manager was so cooperative in helping to secure a conference room for two days to meet my needs. All of the employees were friendly and assisted me whenever necessary. The location was great to eat, walk to the beach, and shop at night. There were no issues with the room that had more than adequate space.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The hotel itself presents very well with impressive foyer and entrance area. The lift areas in the tower we were in is looking a little dated. We had a 2 bedroom suite and the room was clean, and main beds were comfortable. The sofa bed is only suitable for children though which we weren't warned about and which made for uncomfortable nights for our son. Breakfasts were disappointing as the hotel seems to go for quantity rather than quality. There was music at the evening receptions which was good but very limited snacks - basically just chips and nuts. Overall we thought it was quite poor value for the amount we paid.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Booked a 2 bedroom wheelchair accessible suite with roll in shower which was EXCELLENT. This cost us about $600 per night on the Hilton website. Embassy suites immediately confirmed the ADA suite which is a must for our travel requirements as my son is in a wheelchair. Breakfast was very average especially as my family does not eat eggs and we ate Denny's pancakes for $2 instead. Alcoholic drinks served free after 5:30 pm is irresponsible and these should be charged to the individuals NOT to all guests. The rooms especially for special needs should be cheaper and there should be an option to pay for breakfast and afternoon reception.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was our third stay at the Embassy Suites and once again, they didn't disappoint. The service is amazing, the staff so friendly and helpful, a big shout out to Resty who went out of his way to welcome us (and who remembered us from the previous year!) We have two teenage boys with BIG appetites so we can't beat the free breakfast which is hard to find in Waikiki hotels. We are early risers so we never had a problem finding a table, there are plenty outside as well. The location of the hotel is perfect (I used to stay there when it was the Coral Seas YEARS ago), close to the beach and lots of shops and restaurants. The happy hour in the evenings with the free snacks just can't be beat. The bartenders are SO friendly and entertaining, my boys loved going to get drinks from them. You can't beat sitting out at night, sipping on your free drink, munching on free snacks and meeting travelers from all over the world. Great atmosphere. The ONLY con I would have is that, though the band is AMAZING, the music is SO loud that it made it very hard to talk to these other travelers. You'd have to wait until they were in between songs to talk. If they could keep the volume down just a touch, it would make the evenings absolutely perfect. I saw that one of the replies said you were going to improve your wifi in 2020 which will make my husband and sons very happy as it is truly awful. Me? I'm in Hawaii, I don't need internet. :) Thank you again for yet another wonderful stay. Hope to see you next year!!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Tired 80s style rooms, ocean view we bought is actually an ocean glimpse, nothing like the marketing. Feel Ripped off. Even the pictures on the rooms are bizarre - a picture of thongs in our room. No details of New Years Eve celebrations. Room furniture old, fridge decrepit. View is so misleading it’s not funny!!!! We’re going to find somewhere ‘nice’ instead and just double pay for accomodation - very disappointed!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Was just trying to sit down at the complimentary bar if you could even call it a bar and was told by bartender I think his name was kola long haired filipino that it was for paying customers only and made us stand up and leave. After he put up reserved signs but no one came and sat down the whole night.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed here again this year (2019) - when booking I gave them one simple request and that was -"could I please have the same room that I had last year, & the year before, and year before etc etc." I did not give them anymore information what so ever and we found ourselves in the same room that we have been staying in for years... how's that for being looked after. I will always stay here when in Waikiki as the staff are friendly, can't do enough for you, and a lot knew us by name.Just a hint for others, we used to walk we used to walk along Kahlia Road to the bus stop and it used to cost us just under what we paid for the taxi or limo from the hotel... so from now on we won't be walking to the bus stop and catching the bus.. its much better than the bus.Keep up the good work Embassy ans staff and I will certainly recommend you to others

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: As a group coordinator I can highly recommend this resort. From pre-planning to checkout we had a wonderful experience from everyone we encountered. Everyone was great including Natalie with sales, and Jay on site -- to a beautiful dinner with a very specialized and perfect menu with the amazing Chefs, Lee and Shantel . I highly recommend.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Loved the staff and the positive vibe every single day! This was the perfect Family vacation and suite for us! Thank you so much for such wonderful hospitality!! We had an amazing vacation!! Incredible customer service!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: December 14-25. ROOM - Aloha Tower. 1 bedroom suite. Ocean view (but was more like "partial ocean view" due to surrounding tall buildings. Room 1708 - corner (nice) except windows are not wall to wall but small so you don't get the view you expect for a corner room! quite disappointing. And the sun hits the room till late in the afternoon so room is suppppper hot.. and does not cool down . Generally good stay though. STAFF- friendly. BREAKFAST - Yes, omelet is very yummy- unlike those soggy ones you get at other complimentary breakfast places. COCKTAIL RECEPTION - I am not a drinker so cannot comment on the alcohol offered at the reception, but other drinks are plentiful and self-serve so easy. Snack options could have been better – usually 1 type of veggie stick, pretzel, potato chips or chips w/ salsa/cheese. BAND - What I truly enjoyed was the band that played 5 days of our stay. I opened the dance floor most nights and danced every night they were playing (yes, I know I think most guests thought I had one too many to drink but nope – cannot drink a drop of alcohol!). Had many take photos of me & probably on lots of Instagrams but that’s ok. So long as I had fun and quite a few joined me in dancing once I opened the floor! =) . LOCATION- great as it’s close to everything Waikiki.. but if you don’t like crowds… not the best place to stay. Also, make reservations for everything because everything, everywhere is crazy. In fact, the hotel is the quietest place (even though it’s packed)! PARKING is $$. We had a car for the whole duration of our stay and we used it a lot.. but parking and tipping adds up (a lot)! POOL - small but worked for us. Towels always available. They had a towel drop off bin for when you return from the beach which carrying things up & down (including sand) lighter. PROBLEMS- a couple during our stay but staff efficient and quick. All taken care of quite immediately. So nothing really to complain about, except that I wish it were a little more affordable!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We have stayed at this hotel several times as well as many others. We love staying here. The staff are friendly, helpful, happy and make our stay really enjoyable.Pros - rooms are all suited so your kids can watch their own television. Breakfast made to order is always excellent. Evening welcome snacks and drinks (alcohol and non-alcoholic). A local family band plays several nights a week and they are awesome!Cons - terrible Wi-Fi (virtually non-existent)! Lack of lounge chairs on the pool deck and running out of pool towels. Construction which caused us to move rooms cause we couldn’t use our balcony otherwise. We also decided to attend a Hilton Vacation Club timeshare presentation (first one of theirs we ever attended). See review on Hilton Vacation Club. If you are serious, I’d suggest giving yourself 4 hours cause although the presentation is only 2 hours, it takes much longer to see options, paperwork...

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here four years ago with my son, wife and daughter in a 2 bedroom suite - otherwise we have stayed in the Hilton Beach as it is fine for my husband and I. This time we were travelling with my sister-in-law and so the normal hotel room would have been cramped for the 3 of us. Hence, we returned to the the Embassy and were not disappointed. We took a one bed suite and she used the pullout sofa which worked well - enough space for all. As mentioned by the other reviewers, the breakfast is excellent and the cocktails at the pool are a bonus. We took them up to our room on several occasions. There was live music which everyone seemed to enjoy. The Hula tower is nearer to Lewers and therefore more convenient than the other where we stayed earlier. It does seem a little older than last time but the location and convenienceare not equalled for the price if you are more than 2 people. We stayed on the 11th floor and were a little taken aback when our room was beside the lift - we never heard it once - not a peep and perhaps quieter than having noisy neighbours - out of our room and into the lift - what a treat in fact!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at the Embassy Suites for 10 nights this December, and had a phenomenal time! The buffet breakfast had many delicious options, and the nightly reception with free drinks and snacks were a nice bonus. We are a family of 5 and stayed in a 1 bedroom, double queen bed room. It was comfortable and had enough space for all of us. The housekeeper was great at keeping the room well stocked with fresh towels and toiletries. The staff were great, and in particular Marsha, who gave us a gift of chocolate covered strawberries! We hope to be back again soon!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We though the hotel was in a great location, the staff went above and beyond! The free breakfast is a great inclusion however the food was average and ran out at times, so did the plates and finding a table was difficult and the line was often long. We thought the room was over priced for what you got but that seems to be Honolulu in general.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Fantastic stay at the Embassy Suites Waikiki. Breakfast was amazing, staff were amazing. Pool was way to cold for most adults, kids didn't care. We will most definitely be back soon and are already looking forward to made to order omelets in the morning and the awesome family band they have playing live in the evenings.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Embassy Suites was a fantastic place to stay. loved the breakfast buffet and reception by the pool each night. Clean and lovely service. Would highly recommend for anyone staying in Hawaii. Will stay again!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Excellent service from the moment we checked-in to the front desk. Awesome complimentary breakfast in the morning which had variety of food choices and a great managers reception in the evening. The room was outstanding and the view from the balcony was very beautiful.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at this location for a week in October and it was so amazing, the location is smack in the middle of Waikiki beach with only a minute walk to the beach. The suites are large and you don’t feel you are in a box with beds, they have two balconies all with a stunning view of city and ocean. The breakfast is well organized and with a large variety of things to make sure to keep you full for most of the day and the afternoon snack is a nice treat. If you are renting a car you can go through enterprise and pickup is just across the street at Outrigger, you can drop off at the embassy for an additional $5, we rented a car for two days and instead of doing one rental paying $40 for overnight parking we did two separate rentals which turned out cheaper. The pool area was rarely busy and when it was it was never crowded.Jay at the front desk is a big asset to the company, he understand customer service and how to make customers feel special, this goes for the rest of the staff at the pool area and our room attendant, they were all so nice. Susanna at the front desk on the other hand could use a bit of training on how the hospitality industry works and how to treat people. Overall this was the best vacation we have been on and we will be back - Mahalo for everything!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The Hotel is located near the beach and close to shopping centre and restaurants. And guess what "no resort fee" best of all free alcohol and nibbles from 5:30 to 7:30 how good is that. Room is very clean with Balcony. Live Band on different days! Loving it.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: A fantastic all suites hotel with awesome staff. Includes a wonderful breakfast buffet and complimentary drinks in the evening daily, makes it an outstanding value! Plus live entertainment four nights a week. Our favorite hotel!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The Embassy Suites Hilton Waikiki made Julie's birthday week in Hawaii just that much more wonderful and comfortable!! The proximity to the beach, great balcony views, daily evening poolside happy hour, and fantastic breakfasts made a great and essential part of my birthday present to her.The awesome food and shops along the Kalakaua Ave City Walk added a close, convenient, and festive addition to our romantic trip!!Will DEFINITELY be back and THANK YOU ALL at The Waikiki Embassy Suites!! :) :)

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: So comfortable. One block back from world famous Waikiki beach which has a very large lagoon perfect for young families. Hotel includes breakfast, a good pool and a FREE 2 hour 'nappy hour', perfect for adults and literally dozens of great restaurants within a 15 minute walk. All perfect with a wonderful climate; no bugs and usually a warm gentle breeze blowing. It all makes for the perfect family holiday!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We visited the hotel during our Son's break from school. We had an amazing room overlooking the pool and because we were returning guests our greeting was splendid. They even put small gifts in our room throughout our stay. The staff from housekeeping to breakfast buffet are always smiling and engaging! Our Son loved the Surf store in the lobby and even tried surfing for the first time! The worst part was leaving, can't wait to go back!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is our second time staying here and it has reconfirmed how awesome it is. It has a great location with a very short walk to Waikiki beach. Upon check in they serve you the most amazing fruit juice! The rooms are all suites with plenty of space. We happened to have a view of the pool. Our friends had a beach view that was amazing. The breakfast that is included is amazing and has everything you could possibly like for breakfast. The pool is lovely and clean. The happy hour includes snacks and drinks and the family that plays music is amazing. We love this part of the day simply to heat them play. Wow! What a nice family. We stayed in the Hula tower which opens to the ABC store in the lobby which is so convenient for anything you may require. We will definitely stay here again for our next trip!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Embassy Suites Waikiki BeachWalkThis is the second time we have stayed at the Embassy Suites and we weren’t disappointed.We last stayed in 2015.We noticed that a lot of the staff from 2015 were still at the Hotel.The staff at the Embassy Suites we superb. Friendly, attentive, knowable.Upon arrival, at about 7:30am we were met by a number of staff, we checked in without any hassle. We were given a delicious little Hawaiian tropical drink, which was refreshing considering we just arrived by plane. We were then given our wristbands and told all the Hotel facilities were open to us and our room would be ready after lunch. They took our bags, which was still available to us to get changed into more comfortable/appropriate clothing.The Hotel has a buffet breakfast with a reasonable variety of food and some made to order omelettes, a couple of varieties of coffee, juices etc which a lot of other hotels don’t have.During the evening the Hotel has the ‘Managers Reception’, which is a couple of hours of free poolside drinks, where there is a variety of beers, cocktails and spirits which are all free. On Monday, Wednesday and Friday you also get free entertainment during these drinks from an awesome local Hawaiian band (Kanilau) doing a variety of cover songs. Absolutely sensational!The Hotel itself is clean, very Hawaiian, and spacious. It’s well located, in the heart of everything good in Waikiki…… Restaurants, shopping, beaches.The rooms are well catered, spacious, clean and comfortable. The beds are adequately comfortable, with a couple of different pillows to choose from. There is daily room service, which being America you tip the cleaner for (generally about $1 per person in the room). We elected to have our room services every second day which they were happy with. There is a plentiful supply of soaps, shampoo’s and other toiletries, which were Neutrogena brand.The rooms have strong, fast WiFi which was reliable and easy to access.Access to and from the Hotel is easy with a number of open air exits to all the best places in Waikiki.Again, the staff were excellent, often chatting and asking about your holiday when they see you throughout the Hotel.I would recommend this Hotel over many others in the area.Cost was $6704 (Aust) for 5 people, 14 nights, this included ALL resort fees, taxes, breakfast, evening drinks and entertainment.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was my second stay here in the past 7 years! I returned because it is such a great value.I booked using Hilton Honors Points, so paid for four bites with points and got the fifth nite free. Excellent value and no resort fees to pay as well.We got a suite on the pool level which we loved. We could walk right out of room and be at the pool, bar and breakfast area. We could also take the escalator down to the street level and not have to use elevator.We found the room ver y comfortable and had everything we needed. Our maid, Karen, did a great job.We were happy to see that Keola, was still tending bar, we remembered him from 7 years ago, for the excellent happy hour every night! Great personality, mixes a great drink and keeps the line moving! This happy hour is free for two hours every night!All the staff at the hotel very friendly. The free breakfast is very good and we enjoyed sitting on the patio and chatting with many. We spoke with Keala a couple nights and she was very nice as well.There are many families at this hotel as you get two rooms for the price of one. We were traveling as a couple and did not mind being around the kids at all.There are tons of restaurants, bars and shops right outside your door. The escalator drops you at Waikiki Beach Walk. The beach is a two minute walk. You can grab a great catamaran cruise 3 times a day just I. Front of the Sheraton.We rented a car a couple times, just for the day, thru Thrifty and picked up across the street at the Outrigger Reef Hotel. We avoided having to pay for parking this way.We loved everything about the Embassy Suites Beach Walk. Such a great value and we would definitely stay there again!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I have stayed here twice now and love it. Perfect location and great staff. Each time we booked 2 X 2 bedroom 2 bathrooms suites which are perfect for the family and for friends sharing. Another bonus is Daily breakfast is included and no resort fees! Can't get any better than that...but wait, there's more... A great pool with a bar and great menu for meals. AND... Daily Happy 2 Hours with free cocktails and entertainment for its guests. The staff as mentioned are wonderful and very accommodating to our needs. They helped make a 60th Birthday celebration even better with their attention to detail and assistance when setting up for the main event. Thank you Keala, Matt and Justyn in particular, you certainly made the birthday boy feel very special indeed. Cannot recommend this hotel highly enough.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I have never had a staff so friendly, nice and helpful. I can’t express how much I enjoyed this stay. I have hundreds of nights with SPG and this stay was amazing. A great part of the stay was the nightly manager’s reception. The staff was fun and helpful especially Keala. She never let the celery or carrots go empty and talked football. The band were amazing, great musicians. The rooms, staff and overall positive vibe is very impressive. I will be trying out more Hilton properties

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Staying at Embassy Suites Beachwalk is the ONLY place to stay when you go to Oahu! They have the best of everything right there. All the staff are so wonderful & very friendly. I'd recommend them to everyone. I can't say enough good things about them. I love Embassy! A very central location, very knowledgeable staff, great amenities & they are like your Ohana. You never want to leave & you always look forward to your return, which can never be soon enough!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The Embassy was an excellent experience! Fantastic service from the greeting at the front desk (shout out to Jinny for the help resolving a minor issue in the booking!) to the employees in the dining room/managers reception. Special shout out to Keala for the friendliness, service and help with ideas for activities (and for remembering our names every night!:). This hotel is just an easy 2 minute walk to the beach and is central to all the markets and food options. Will visit this hotel again!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel is in a perfect location. The rooms are nice and the staff is awesome. Jinny was very helpful at check in. Keala was always attentive and gave us suggestions on things to see and do. We are very happy we chose this hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Excellent service from staff and lovely amenities. Staff sang Christmas songs during breakfast. Hotel maids great you with a smile and are very welcoming. Excellent location in the heart of Waikiki. Best value for the excellent location and service.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We come to Hawaii every year for our anniversary. This year is 27 years. We normally stay at the Sheraton or Hilton Hawaiian Village, but Embassy Suites has customer service that we have never experienced from either. Breakfast service was always provided with a smile and there were multiple people checking with us to see if we needed anything. The night time reception was at times lacking with the types of snacks provided BUT it was made up with the service from one of the best people I have met in hospitality industry. Keala Lester always greeted us with a smile and genuinely wanted to make sure everyone was happy. She addressed any needs a person might have had. Her spirit of aloha was felt by all she made contact with. By the end of our trip we not only walked away feeling great about our experience, but we walked away feeling like we were a part of the Hilton Embassy Suites’ ohana.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Embassy suites was a great accommodation for family reunion.They provided great complimentary breakfast, convenient valet service and cleanness of rooms. I would revisit this hotel for the possible future Oahu trip.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The best place to be when your at the hotel is the secret 4th floor. Free food and drinks on many days. Access can be through the elevator access or the North or South stairs. Service at all locations of the hotel are top notch. Rooms are great and I loved that the walls sheilded noise fro outside. Balconies all around the building.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Loved our 12 night stay at the Embassy Suites Waikiki who showered us with their awesome Aloha spirit and hospitality. Excellent service, friendly staff and workers & a special thanks to Justin for our bday treat. Loved every minute of Hawaii, their people and culture. Until we meet again!!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Very friendly staff, great value, given full breakfast, and generous evening drinks and munchies, you will drink alot, and they are stuff and good. The location is sweet. Enterprise auto rental drop off at valet, thus no need for parking fees!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My family stayed at embassy Waikiki for two nights and it was amazing! Firstly, the room sparks elegance and Hawaiian charm. The hotel was safe clean and full of friendly staff. The pool and hot tub was not over crowded and a perfect way to end a day after the beach. The made to order breakfast and night social was perfect! We had a fantastic time! The hotel is only a couple of blocks from Waikiki beach and many local shops. There is a coffee/surf shop located inside which was convenient for some afternoon surf lessons. As a world traveler, I highly recommend!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I requested tower and floor according to my room price range and granted request, easy check in, mobile, as always great service from Hilton, the breakfast was great, everybody helping in the breakfast area were great including Rose and Aldrin, location was great, our stay was expensive but like I said service was awesome, no complaints, this is one of the few times where I did not mind paying for more than $500 per night for a room but did not mind because I thought it was worth it

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was our first family vacation and trip to Hawaii... the Embassy Suites was a great location, and the staff was wonderful. Especially a host at the evening Managers Reception, Keala Lester, she would great us every night with a smile and chat with us about what we had done that day and what we had planned.
