She gave some excellent recommendations and referrals which helped make our trip the perfect experience for us! Thanks Keala!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Look for Keala Lester at the free happy hour by the pool! So much fun and what a great host. The live band rocks. Their free breakfast buffet was amazing and accommodates all cultures. Big Wave Dave Surf lesson’s downstairs was reasonably priced and the instructors were very patient and helpful for even the beginner

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Not enough words to express our total satisfaction with our seven day stay at the Embassy Hilton. I made reservations three months before my trip and requested a nice view of the pool in the Hula Tower. It exceeded our expectations. The hotel receptionist staff are very professional and helpful, Reza was great. The food services staff, Rose and Aldrian were very sociable and efficient. The bartenders can really pour a drink. Breakfast was delicious, got to watch all those tasty calories. Room service a 5 star. The only thing missing was not having a separate computer room and the ability to use my USB; otherwise, this is our home away from home : )

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Fantastic hotel, no resort fees, free cocktails from 5:30-7:30, super friendly and helpful staff. Will definitely be back! Child friendly and close to everything, Waikiki beach only a 5-10 minute walk away.Mahalo Embassy Suites for making our stay so welcoming!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We gvae stayed several times prior to this visit, but its always nice, to get a great reception, at reception,. We had two bookings , 1 paid for and 1 using points. This being said , we had the best room first, but Victor, linked the bookings, and kept us in the same better room, so a big thanks for all your help, The hotel has no resorts fee,s a big plus, but it does offer outstanding breakfast, happy hour, and great staff,. The poolis on the 4th floor,same as breakfast, and Managers cocktail party, happy 2 hours, The staff at all three are great, and have been doing their jobs for many years, Great hotel, great staff, excellent value for money, saunders family,

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Spent much needed 4 nights break at the Embassy Suites after a long 5 weeks round the World holidays. The room was clean, nice and big with a very nice ocean view from the balcony. Room service was amazing. Breakfast, including made to order omelette, was really nice. Managers drink every evening was really good, though the free pour gets you at times. From the time of check-in to check-out, the entire stay was awesome.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Aloha tower 18th floor two bedroom suite... quiet, fantastic view and clean.Staff where friendly, location perfect.Breakfast was great. Managers reception a good bonus, nibbles and cocktails.Hope to go back soon.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was our 7th stay at this resort and again it was the perfection.Everybody very helpful from Victor at check in, to Aldrin at breakfast and of course everybody's favorite man in the evening Keola. Location is excellent, close to beach and all restaurants. We will be back again next November.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed in the Aloha tower, corner room with partial view of ocean and pool (no complaints) I booked this hotel because of the breakfast included and free happy hour. Without having any high expectations, I was happy with the results. I'm not a complainer, it is what it is, especially for the evening happy hour. The pool is great for kids, lots of families. ABC deli is right across the street, subway, Denny's, PF Changs are all super super close

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had a real good stay at this hotel,the staff were great and very friendly. We had a gorgeous view of Waikiki beach. Friday night at the Hilton Hawaiian Village was stunning from our balcony. Hated to leave the hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The Embassy is my favorite place to stay in Waikiki. Recently stayed their for the 5th time and am still more than satisfied. Natalie Caceres helped us with our booking and everything was smooth as can be, we even had a complimentary upgrade!! The hotel is beautiful and clean, the rooms are large, the staff is always friendly and helpful and the location is perfect for a well rounded Waikiki experience!! Love this place!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We have visited this hotel almost every year since it opened, we have always had a great experience. Many employees have been there since it opened and its always good to see them again. Thanks to Garrick, front office manager for his proactive assistance on a question that we had prior to our most recent stay. Can’t wait to go back!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: From the check in greeting with a refreshing glass of Passion/Guava juice, to the nightly reception poolside on the Grand Lanai, the Embassy Suites staff treat you like royalty. Clean, Quiet, cozy. Paradise

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: From the Valet to Check in to bell service to housekeeping to breakfast to Managers Night all staff were pleasant and friendly. They do their best to accommodate your request.Valet charge $40 /day (in & out) 2 streets down has free street parking if u prefer to park n street. But for us the valet was worth it so convenient and fast. Nothing to worry where to park. Breakfast 6:30 to 10:00am buffet ( made to order omelet, miso soup, rice, salad, fresh fruits, yogurt, breads,pastries, cereals,oatmeal, bacon, pancake, sausage and etc. a lot to choose from. Drinks (milk, coffee, juices & hot chocolate) Managers Night 5:30-7:30pm free limited Alcohol drinks & sodas. Peanuts, chips, gold fish, crackers & celery sticksHotel is walkable to restaurants, waikiki beach, honolulu zoo, aquarium,international market and other shopping areas. ABC stores just across the hotel. Upon check in you will be greeted by friendly staff with welcome drink. Since were celebrating my birthday, I was given a box of Chocolate as birthday gift. Kudos to the following staff who made our trip memorable. Arvee (valet), Cyrus (bell service), John (omelet station), the Filipino guy from housekeeping at 10th floor Aloha tower (Nov 8 onwards) Sorry I forgot his name. Arvin (breakfast staff) thanks to all the staff.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel is in a great location, easy to walk to lots of restaurants. Rooms are spacious and well appointed. The complimentary breakfasts were amazing. The nightly Managers reception was a great bonus. Keola who serves up the drinks is definitely worth visiting.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My family and I visit Waikiki almost every year and always stay at this hotel. We love the location, the breakfast buffet and happy hour, the pool and the staff is always friendly and kind. We heard this year that management of the hotel has recently changed and we can notice a difference this trip. The most visual difference: the pool area has new furniture and cabanas for rent. And there are renovations being done to the towers. The rooms also have changed. Little things like no more pool towels in the bathroom, less bath towels available in the room, overall cleanliness of the rooms isn’t the same - it doesn’t seem to be as clean as it used to be. We don’t blamed the staff as we see them working hard and trying their best to accommodate our requests. The staff also has a lovely attitude and are super friendly. To us, it is obvious that the management is trying to save costs. As we have stayed at the hotel many times, we have noticed the little changes. And the little things sometimes make a huge difference.I hope that during the renovations and transition with the changes, the hotel works out where to cut costs and how to still provide a great place to stay.We would still come back for our family trips and stay at this hotel. We have heard of others would didn’t like the cleanliness of the rooms and chose to check out but again it’s a transition period and the kinks need to be worked out.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Every time we come to this hotel we love our trip from the beginning to the end. The staff is amazing very helpful from the front desk to the breakfast group to the evening reception. The room are very clean and we enjoy our time there and it's located in a great location.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Room smelt bad, come to find old smelly socks under the bed. Ask to move room but told cannot cause the hotel was full. Night see plenty lights off. I think they didn't likes cause I stay local. Auwe these guys

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Here we are back again at our Happy Place. Love this hotel. Starting with the fabulous Jay-Mar checking us in to our favourite room. Great breakfast every morning, but the star of the show is Koeni , who remembers our name from one year to the next. Love this place.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The breakfast selection everyday was great! The variety alone was great. Something for everyone of all ages in the family. Kids were happy with the cereals, muffins and fruits. Husband and I had a great omelette and bacon on the side. So worth it!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Fantastic facility, delicious food, wonderful staff, and great location.This hotel holds a special place in our heart for unique occurrences happened for family and I. We discovered with greater clarity our life calling.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great hotel, service was exceptional. The breakfast buffet is terrific, especially loved the omelette station. Being only about a block from the beach was perfect. Loved every minute I was there, will definitely return for another stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Wonderful Hotel With Friendly Helpful Staff. Great Location in Waikiki Food Shopping All within A few Short Blocks. Breakfast Buffet And Happy Hour Outstanding. Rooms And Housekeeping Excellent ! Closest Beach At Fort DeRussy Is Horrible With Sharp Coral I Cut My Foot. I Recommend Visiting A Different Part Of Waikiki Beach But Not Here At Fort DeRussy Where the Hotel is.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The Front Desk Staff, Bellman, Housekeeping and Servers were amazing and the welcome beverage was a nice touch! Nice hotel for Kamaaina to enjoy and staycation! Best complimentary Breakfast and complimentary Cocktails at night in all of WAIKIKI!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I stayed here over the weekend with my family, even though it was such a short time I had an amazing experience. The workers here were always friendly, the actual hotel room was amazing. Not to mention the awesome breakfast that the hotel offered, it had pretty much everything you want and needed. The embassy suits Waikiki is definitely a place you need to stay!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Absolutely beautiful!!! Great customer service!!! Will book again in the future!! The beaches are so close to the hotel, walking distance was about 5 minutes. Happy hour is a must at the hotel. You won’t be disappointed!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is the 7th year that we have taken our group to the Embassy Suites. The service is great and the breakfast is the best in Waikiki. They have always treated us well and are willing to work on making our stay better every year. We will be coming back for business next year.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My family and I really love staying at Embassy Suites because of the delicious complimentary breakfast, spacious rooms, fun pool, managers reception and awesome service. Whenever I stay in Waikiki, Embassy Suites is the first hotel I look at.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: If you want true Aloha spirit, beautiful views, and top notch service this hotel has it all. Our one week trip began with a friendly greeting and a complementary tropical cocktail. Sandra at the front desk checked us in quickly. Our room on the 21st floor had a stunning view of Diamond head. The room was very clean, and had a separate bedroom with two sets of doors leading out to the balcony. Every morning we took advantage of the free made-to-order breakfast with lots of variety. Carey, Jay, Rusty and Aldrin went above and beyond with their friendliness and knowledge about local places and activities. Evening reception was fantastic - a great local band and free drinks and snacks. Pialana treated us as family and took the time to help us out. A special shoutout to Keala, who embodies the aloha spirit with her kindness and friendliness. This hotel was wonderful to stay at and all of the staff are beyond exceptional. The interactions we had with the staff enhanced our vacation and has made this hotel our favorite to stay in.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Love the heart of service with the lunch and breakfast buffet. Most buffets you go to they don't really care and treat you just like a number. The services were excellent and I felt like I was dining at a special restaurant with the wife. I love the place and would recommend it to anyone and will go back.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Housekeeping associates were very niceBreakfast was goodCarpets smelled badRoom smelt bad. 4th floor carpets in hallway were always wet as the pool was on that floorFrint desk associates can be friendlyBell desk associates were very friendly and nice

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Phenomenal, every aspect of our stay at the Embassy Suites just blew us away. The Customer service delivered by ALL hotel staff was world class. Upon arrival Sandra checked us in and went above and beyond to speed up the check in process. Kenny the hotel’s porter just about unpacked our bags for us. Daniel our floor’s cleaner greeted us every morning with a smile and off course an ‘Aloha’. The Manager, Matt was attentive, friendly and was always making sure we were happy. Matt, your leadership skills are on point and is evident in the way your staff are. Full breakfast buffet and complementary cocktails and nibbles every night was awesome. Spoilt by great location, surrounded by amazing restaurants but the service provided by the staff was the best we have ever experienced in any Hotel we have EVER stayed in - priceless. Thankyou does not seem enough for the unrivalled experience. Donna & Maria

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Pros- Friendly service from Embassy staff (excludes activities desk)- Great location you are a couple of mins from beach and main Waikiki stripBuffet breakfast and free drinks and snacks every evening for 2 hrs- Good gym, was being upgraded though when we were there - Spacious suite, separate lounge and both rooms had air co and 2 TVsNegatives- We were allocated a room next to the lift shaft. Avoid this if you can, rather noisy and messed with my sleep- Lifts in the Aloha tower are painfully slow- Staff that help to book tourist activities are a bit pushy and rude and expensive to use (try book it yourself or go straight to source). The pushy sell was not necessarily, some of them have no clue what customer centric service is.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at this resort for 3 nights and it was fantastic. We stayed in a 1 bed Suite so our 15 year old son could use the sofa bed in the lounge for free. There is no resort fees in this hotel which is very rare in Waikiki.The good thing is they offer complimentary breakfast and there is also a complimentary evening reception with drinks and nibbles from 5.30. There is also live entertainment and thus local band is fantastic.We would recommend this resort even though it’s a bit away from Waikiki beach and would stay again we go to Honolulu again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: All staff were very helpful. Housekeeping staff were exceptional and very responsive. Management always asking if there is anything else I need or they can help with. Would highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This Hotel is in a Great area.....Close to the beach...The staff is excellent!You will not be disappointed.....They know how to treat a guest.Kudos to all of the Hosts.....( Kaiana Lee - Best Operations Administrator )Thanks, Todd

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Wow what a gem in Waikiki. Natalie Caceres was tremendous with setting up the perfect stay for my family. At every touchpoint my wife and kids were just blown away. The manager’s reception staff recommend us watch the Friday night fireworks from the pool deck. What a sight.We were so comfortable at the pool on that Saturday we stayed all day. The cabana and service was at the highest level!Mahalo to all!Natalie, mahalo from my Ohana!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This property is perfect for families: spacious rooms, breakfast included each morning, manager's reception, and a great pool. We've stayed at this property many times as it's our young children's favorite place to stay in Waikiki.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We absolutely loved Embassy Suites Waikiki! The staff, service, food, and location were excellent and I would definitely recommend them to my friends and family. Special shout out to Justyn in F&B. He was very attentive and recommended delicious food items from the Pakini Bar for a bite to eat. Thanks again Justyn for the awesome service and for really making our experience at Embassy Suites Waikiki outstanding.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We chose this hotel based on personal recommendation and also good trip advisor reviews and weren't disappointed!The rooms are looking a little tired and could do with a refurb but they were clean and spacious which was the main priority for us. The complimentary breakfast and managers reception was great particularly as we have 4 kids and saving on breakfast was helpful.We were happy with the location, it's a short walk to the main strip and there were plenty of restaurants right near the hotel too.The pool was a good size, it has a wading pool for small children and a spa and was never particularly crowded. I think alot of people are out doing day trips or beach trips so it always balances out the pool use which is good.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Couldn't be more happier with my stay here.The staff was super friendly and rooms are pleasant to stay in. Breakfast was included every morning and even served free cocktails in the early evening.Walking distance to the strip and everything else you might be looking for.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The hotel provides suite room accommodations in the right location and a great price considering no resort fees, free breakfast and evening reception. It is not directly on the beach but only steps away from a great beach location.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We loved the hotel, large suites, it's very helpful staff, it's fantastic location and the complimentary breakfast buffet and evening happy hour. We highly recommend this property !Visiting from Australia.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Wow! Waht an experience! I am a special needs teacher for one of the local schools in the area and we have been given the great opportunity to partner up with Embassy Suites for the last 2 years. This year we have 8 interns across 5 different Outrigger Properties. We are so blessed to have been given the chance for our students form 3 different nearby schools to intern at these wonderful properties. Embassy Suites Waikiki opened their arms to us last year and this year. Our interns work really hard because they see the hard working individuals on property to ensure guests are treated like family. From the bellmen to the front desk to the servers and wait-staff, the housekeepers and maintenance crew... ALL have made it their mission to make guests feel the ALOHA and warmth from their hearts. These hard workers inspire and forge the way for our interns. In addition to the care, this hotel also has a wonderful complementary breakfast buffet. I have one intern who works in the food and beverage department as a busser. On the many occasions I visit him, I always see smiling faces because of the amazing food and service.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Wonderful hotel, highly recommend for a family friendly place to stay, includes buffet breakfast and cocktails 1 street away from the beach and a short walk to shops and restaurants or $2 bus to Ala Moana Centre..super friendly staff made our stay amazing

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We needed to be out of our home for a night and decided to try the Embassy Suites on Beachwalk Street. We have stayed in numerous hotels on Waikiki over the last twenty plus years we have lived on Oahu; in doing so we have seen most levels of accomodation available. This property is well priced and central to the attractions found in the Waikiki Beach area. It is situated in the Beachwalk shops shops, less than five minute walk from the Royal Hawaiian Arcade shops/restaurants and roughly a ten minute walk from the International market place. Unlike most Embassy Suites there is no central enclosed atrium where the evening reception and morning breakfast are offered. On this property the reception and breakfast is on the 4th floor between the two hotel towers in close proximity to the outdoor pool. On Saturday evening the hotel has live entertainment for your listening pleasure while attending the manger's reception. The breakfast offerings are suitable for both an American and multi-national clientel. There is more than adequate seating for both events. The front area (bell hops, valets and front desk) personnel are polite and efficient. The check in process is well rehearsed and quick. The rooms are slighly smaller than mainland Embassy Suites yet comfortable. Our suite offered us two balconies with two seats and a small table overrlooking the pool. The room was quiet.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This a a family oriented hotel with lots of kids, for this reason it was good for our family group. Other positives included the breakfast & location. The housekeeping staff were also excellent, with great knowledge & care.However, do not get a room near the elevator. Staff pretend there is no issue with elevator noise at night and in the morning, but it is widely spoken about among guests at the bar and pool. Soundproofing is clearly not something the hotel cares to invest in. After a sleepless night due to the elevator, I was thankfully moved to another room, for which I am thankful. It beggars belief that these rooms are made available.I also found that some staff (not all) were curt and a little rude. This does not apply to the housekeeping staff. It seems front of house and bell desk staff did not want to be there.Bar staff were lovely, but it should be noted that there are no poolside attendants to enforce rules, especially as children dangerously jump into the pool.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Friendly staff, spacious suites, best daily breakfast as well as nightly cocktail reception poolside, best bartender and best location to shops, the beach and restaurants! Never gonna wanna stay anywhere else!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our family stayed at the hotel and we had such a great time!! Staff was welcoming, room was VERY roomy and comfortable, all you can eat buffet was AMAZING! Did I mention the buffet is FREE!! Housekeeping was friendly and very accommodating to our requests. We can't wait to stay there again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Had our Mother’s Day Luncheon. Had such a great time. My wife and the rest of the Mothers of our Church felt so blessed. Everything from the food to the hospitality of the staff. It was amazing. I would recommend it for anyone thinking having an intimate event.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We hosted a Mother’s Day event for church here back in May. The staff at Embassy Suites made the planning so smooth and easy. They not only helped us find a room and menu but they also donated to our Mothers. They also helped serve us during the event and catered to our every need with smiles. I am definitely looking forward to having another event here.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our Men’s Ministry held our Mother’s Day banquet at the hotel. Some of stayed there over the weekend. The staff management and the facilities exceeded our expectations. The service was terrific. Food was on point and our rooms were very nice. The breakfast buffet in the morning is really good. Our children enjoyed the pool very much. I would definitely recommend Embassy Suites to my family and friends. Leo Liugalua Windward Missionary Church

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My family and I had a wonderful time at Embassy Suites in Waikiki. Food was great, service was excellent, and we will definitely go again.Mahalo Embassy Suites!Rory-James Santosorangobass@yahoo.com

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: From beginning to end Jay and Justyn were were the most helpful. They were in the room and available prior to any of us in the morning and after our day ended. They were able to assist with our change request, like moving tables, adding extension cords, etc. We would highly recommend your staff and venue again to other partners and friends and definitely use you again in the future.Thank you for providing a clean, fun and safe facility for us to use. And an extra Aloha & Mahalo to Jay and Justyn for everything!!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: As a local "kamaaina" resident, I have been staying at this exceptional property in Waikiki for years whenever I want to "play tourist" in my own back yard. You feel the "Aloha" as soon as you drive up to the porte cochere, and greeted warmly by Cindy, Sandra, and Malia at the Front Desk. These three gracious ladies are always extremely pleasantly accommodating, and willing to go to the proverbial "extra mile" for you. The rooms are all suites, and have the luxury of a separate living room. Wake up in the morning, and enjoy the included full breakfast with made to order omelets, and local staples of rice and miso soup. The complimentary evening cocktail reception with live music is a great way to end your day. A few years ago, I hosted 17 suites for a birthday overnighter, with a private reception in the Beach Walk banquet room. The reception was a great success, thanks to Shantel, who followed through with every detail. I just checked out yesterday after two nights from the Embassy Suites Waikiki, and was happy to see that Shantel is in charge of F&B. She's a wonderful asset to the property - I can see why the breakfast buffet and evening reception have maintained their consistent level of service and quality over the years. Visiting with her at breakfast one morning, I was surprised to see her still working on property later that night. To our fellow "kamaaina", and our visitors, come and book the Embassy Suites Waikiki. I'm certain that like me, you will return again and again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Staying at the Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach Walk I'm absolutely amazed at how Fantastic this hotel !! We have stayed in Waikiki several times but never here before this is definitely the winner in every aspect! location is absolutely fantastic the staff at this property amazingly friendly and helpful the rooms we have spacious large comfortable and very clean.. every day has been a pleasure so far ! the breakfast buffet is awesome the drinks at night by the pool are spectacular we have a partial Ocean View room and it is gorgeous. special shout-out to Keala who has been serving us at night by the pool whilst we are having our free drinks she is an absolute pleasure to deal with so friendly and helpful!!! Makes such a difference to have lovely stuff around the property.. we have three rooms here three separate one bedroom rooms and each family is loving every minute !! would not hesitate in recommending the Embassy Suites Waikiki we will be telling all our friends back home in Australia!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Just returned from a week vacation staying at the Hilton Embassy Suites, feedback as below:The Good:Excellent location, close to all the action and beach.Very friendly service, everyone we met who work at the hotel made us feel very welcome.Good breakfast and free evening drinks and snacks included as part of the price.The pool area was clean and well maintained. Great family feel around the hotel, note that this place is full of kids so if you're looking for a quiet romantic break away then this isn't the place for you.We were lucky enough to get into our room having arrived at 8am, check in isn't until 3pm and we had a small toddler with us. We appreciated this gesture and pass on our thanks. The Not So Good:No plates or cutlery within the rooms which seems very strange when there's a small kitchenette. It became a pain having to call down to have plastic plates/cutlery delivered to the room.Charging for shade umbrellas at the pool, absolutely ridiculous to cash in on the safety of families staying at the resort by charging $30 for shade from the blistering sun - Hilton take note and do the right thing. Lifts and proximity to the rooms. We stayed in room 1811 and our relatives stayed 1901 and both rooms are next to the lifts which run all night and are noisy. If you are a light sleeper then avoid these rooms per floor i.e. all rooms that end in 11 or 01.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We landed in Honolulu at 6am and we were at the Embassy Suites before 8am with a reservation for 7 nights. Our check in time was 3pm but the hotel did an amazing job and we were given a room by 10am which allowed us to unpack, clean up and have a productive first day in Waikiki. We were also offered breakfast which was unexpected - a lovely gesture. We loved our stay at the Embassy Suites by The Hilton. Loved the afternoon canapés and drinks from 5.30-7.30pm. The hotel is only a 5 minute walk from the beach. It is perfectly located to many shops and restaurants while the busses are a short walk away. The pool was big, clean and comfortable and the pool was perfect for my daughter who is not confident in deep water. Staff were pleasant and very helpful throughout our stay.The only hiccup was our room located right next to the elevator that when starts, you car hear a rattling noise coming from the wires that feeds the elevator. We told reception and they upgraded us to a two-room suite with 2 bathrooms.I would definitely recommend this hotel and would love to return next time we visit Hawaii.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had a great time! The room was beautiful I wanted to take the mirror home!! Very clean and the living room was so comfortable and we were able to entertain visitors. The staff were so friendly and the location is great. So many good places to eat out the door! Breakfast is so good but could be extended a little later, for those like us who like to sleep in on vacations LOL Free drinks 5 to 7 live entertainment!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Looked forward to a weekend respite and Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach Walk did not disappoint. Our King bed non-smoking suite with partial ocean view was comfortable and relaxing when we just wanted to lounge in privacy. Our dining experiences with the complimentary Cooked-to-Order Breakfast, and Evening Receptions exceeded our expectations. Friendly staff, attentive service, and most especially - was made to feel special like a tourist - even though we did not venture too far from home. Must compliment the following staff who provided outstanding services; Shane the bartender, Dominick the cook and Kaiana at the Front desk. Mahalo for extending the Aloha spirit above and beyond. You helped make our Staycation a memorable one.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Always enjoy staying at Embassy Suites Waikiki. Perfect location and we always enjoy the full breakfast buffet and evening reception. Excellent service from staff brings us back year after year . Would recommend for family, couples or traveling for business

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: When we arrived we had AC issues in one of our rooms, but IIda took good care of us and moved us to a better rooms. Thank you IIda!!! Also, I want to give kudo's to Sandra one of the manager's for helping us at the end of our stay! Thank you Garrick for being so kind on check in! And also the maid the week of Oct 1 on the 21st floor in the Hula tower. She was so sweet, helpful and kind!! Honestly, the breakfast crew was great too!! Wonderful place to stay with wonderful people!! Great evening reception too!! Thank you to everyone for making our stay memorable!!!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My wife and I stayed at the Embassy Suites Waikiki for seven nights. With their complementary omelet bar breakfast and happy hour in the evening you can't go wrong! The hotel is one block from the beach, and close to all the fun areas of Waikiki. Our two room suite was very spacious and the bed comfortable. It was nice being able to have some alone time during our stay where we could each occupy a room and watch our own TV shows! HeheWe'd like to give a special mention to staff who were all very friendly and helpful, especially the following staff members:Daniel, our housekeeper who greeted us every morning with a big smile and tended to our needs.Cynthia (sorry, I think that was her name), who at the front desk arranged for us to have an early breakfast box for our 530am sunrise tour.Matt, one of the in duty managers who made sure our needs were met.The entire food services staff who dealt with 1200-1500 guests for breakfast, especially Cary, Alma & Jay. And last but not least, Keola the bartender who poured some mean drinks at happy hour! Salamat po!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel is an amazing hotel with luxury rooms and comfortable beds. since we were on the 15th floor, we also got amazing views! However, the pool was impossible to relax by and packed with noisy kids. but I do understand that they cant control that. the staff were excellent and friendly and overcame the struggle of cleaning our messy room! another bonus is its proximity to the beach and the military museum. overall a great hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was our 4th trip staying at Embassy Suites Beachwalk in Waikiki. Our visit was absolutely perfect & very memorable.We celebrated two birthdays & got the royal treatment. The hotel staff are very friendly & treat you like Ohana. They are very knowlegable about the surrounding area & fun things to do.The buffet breakfast is very filling with a huge variety of food to eat. The kitchen staff are forever cleaning up after everyone. We had very personal service from an always smiling helpful "Aldrin" & Kary (always telling us helpful hints about the area)The housekeeping staff are extremely helpful in making sure all your items are always filled up & keep everyone's room in good working order.The entertainment at the managers reception four nights a week is extremely enjoyable to listen to & snacks are even provided by very friendly hosts.Then there's Keola, the best bartender in Waikiki. He is very entertaining & a joy to be around. Makes us the best drinks.We will miss absolutely everyone at this resort. We can hardly wait to save enough money to return once again to our " home away from home".A special thank-you to Vincent Robinson, the kind hearted new hotel manager. He goes above & beyond the call of duty to make sure your holiday is just perfect. We enjoyed listening to many interesting stories he told us. He is someone that truly cares about everyone that stays at this fun resort.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Really nice hotel and staff. Love the location. Right in the middle of Waikiki. Many nice stores and restaurants nearby. Rooms have very good views of Waikiki. This hotel was remodeled some years ago and is very modern and clean.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: From the check in to checkout, everything was perfect here. Although not on the beach, it is only 1 block off of it. Otherwise, great location as is just a block or so from the main downtown shopping area which also has tons of restaurants there. As usual, happy hour and breakfast are included. Both are held around the pool area so is a nice relaxing setting and both were up to Embassy’s standards. If back in the area, I will definitely stay here again (was in Hula tower with great view of ocean).

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Whereever we travel we look for an Hilton Embassy Suites Hotel. They are always clean and spacious and offer a complementary breakfast and cocktail hour. This location was no exception. The location on Waikiki Beach was centrally located with a great view . The rooms were clean and the staff friendly. The price was average for that area. We would definitely return to this location!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Room was lovely and clean. Two queen beds, separate living area. Bathroom was good size. The staff were so kind and helpful, from the maids to front of house. The pool was a good size for us and the kids. The happy hour(s) was fabulous and gave a real good atmosphere! The breakfast included was delicious and the kids were given colouring ins to keep them occupied whilst we finished our coffee. Marsha made our holiday that bit sweeter by finding out it was our 10 year wedding anniversary and gave us chocolate strawberries and wine delivered to our room! The bartender in the corner by the pool was amazing and funny. My daughter was treated to a lovely drink that made her feel like a big kid and special and still talking about it on our return from holiday.Fabulous holiday atmosphere with staff would will go the extra mile to help. Cant recommend this place enough!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I felt like family from check in to checkout. Employees are friendly and treat you like family. Our room was spotless, well supplied and maintained, our housekeeper was friendly and caring. The best part of our stay is we needed a roll in shower for my husband and we got one no problem. Breakfast selections great and an upgrade from Embassy hotels. The breakfast employees friendly and made us feel at home especially Marsha and Rose. Front desk employees always smiling and welcoming. I highly recommend this hotel, a must when in Waikiki. My home away from home and hotel of choice every time!!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed 5 nights at the Embassy Suites. Our family of 5 had a one bedroom city view apartment! Was a little bit small for all of us but we only ever sleep and shower in our rooms! Awesome location right amongst the heart of things in Waikiki! A short walk to the beach! An ABC right downstairs and plenty of restaurant and shopping options!! Buffet breakfast was included each morning which was awesome! Omelette and eggs cooked to order! A bonus when you have a lot packed into your holidays and need a good start!!! Staff were always friendly and helpful! Happy hour was on every night too! My teenage boys loved that! Snacks included and even alcohol for the parents!!! Lovely atmosphere for happy hour! Always had an amazing band playing!! The only bad point was having to pay $40US per night for valet parking for our hire car!!! But overall we were so impressed by the Embassy Suites and would def recommend it to anyone! We will def come back!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our family enjoyed our staycation, for my sons 10th birthday, at this beautiful hotel. We worked with Natalie and she was the best, she went over and beyond to make sure we had a great stay. I will recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Waikiki.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We are in the middle of a one week stay in this hotel, and we are so pleased with everything, right from check-in to everything else in this resort. We arrived early on Thursday morning ( 9:30), and we thought we would simply have to leave our luggage, go out and explore, and come back later to an assigned room. Not at all!To our great surprise, Victor, a Reception Associate, checked us in, gave us our key and check-in package, and we were good to go! We had asked for a nice location, and despite it being so early in the morning, Victor was able to give us a room on the 7th floor with a lovely view. So many high-rise hotels in the area can make having a view problematic, but Victor found us a great room.Minutes after we had checked in, Victor texted us, asking about the room, etc, and indicating that we should get in touch with him should we need anything else. A first for us when it comes to checking in at hotels! He also texted the next day, asking after our enjoyment of Honolulu. Again, a first with any hotel stay we have had. We have stayed at many, many Embassy Suites in our frequent travels because of the value for your dollar, the free breakfasts, and the evening Manager Specials. However, I have to say that this particular location is the BEST of the Embassy Suites that we have experienced. The breakfast offerings are exceptional, with many varied items on the menu to better accommodate the many varied guests of the hotel. Similarly, the Manager's Reception, while quite simple in food offerings, is always kept full, and the bartenders pour a generous drink, especially given the large numbers of guests present in the evenings.Hats off to Embassy Suites Beach Walk! A lovely stay, with full delivery on its promises!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I stayed at the Embassy Suites since they were the only decent hotel that allowed me to keep my bicycle in the room. I rode in the Honolulu Century ride and brought my bike rather than renting.Two big reasons I recommend this hotel, a) free breakfast and evening reception, b) no resort fee.These are great benefits and adds to the value.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: And my title should be a hint for why I didn't give it 5 stars. Place is packed with kids!Especially watch out for Australian school holidays, which we weren't aware of while booking. Kids will take over the pool that is already too small for the size of the hotel.But overall we really enjoyed staying there.Pros:Great location, handy to beach, shops, buses.FREE breakfast that includes cooked eggs any style (omelettes too), bacon, sausage, fruits, grains, etc.FREE cocktails, beers, and soft drinks from 5:30pm to 7:30pm EVERY NIGHT, along with snack food.Great sized suites, with separate lounge/living room with plenty seating and a table.Comfy bedsFriendly staff ConsToo many kids.Small pool (and deepest point is 4ft).Breakfast, bar, and pool are on the 4th floor making it a bit of a hassle to get to and from shops and beach, and elevators can be pretty busy around popular times of day.No poolside service as far as we could tell. (which can be a blessing for some)Not enough lounge chairs/umbrellas by the pool. This is partly because they have these Cabanas and bigger beds that you can pay for the day that take 3 times the space of regular beds (we didn't see anyone rent these, and I think it's appalling to have that many of them occupying all the space while guests are scrambling to find a spot). To sum it up. Don't go there for a "Romantic getaway" or a sophisticated experience. But you can't deny the value for money if you're travelling with kids.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel chain is known for its inclusive breakfasts with made to order omelets as well in as comfortable accommodations. It doesn’t disappoint. The location is very convenient. The employees were friendly and made us feel very special for our 2nd honeymoon. I’ve stayed here before and it’s still as well maintained and pleasant as earlier stays.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: A great property centrally located to Waikiki, especially if you're interested in shopping and dining in the area. Rooms are spacious and nicely designed. The hotel is a block off the beach, but easy access. Staff is warm and welcoming and always with a smile. The daily happy hour is a huge perk - we enjoyed getting a drink and taking it to our balcony. The only downside of the hotel is that the breakfast can be crowded and a bit hectic at times.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We recently stayed here to celebrate our daughter’s 10th birthday and we’re extremely pleased with the excellent service we received from the entire staff!! At every interaction we were greeted by exceptionally friendly personnel! From the minute we arrived - Our bellman noticed we were celebrating a birthday and made my daughter feel so special! He provided her with birthday chocolates that we hadn’t received at check-in and asked “hows the birthday girl enjoying her stay?” each time we saw him throughout the weekend. It truly made for a memorable experience for her. Wish I could remember his name - Gary, maybe?The breakfast buffet and managers reception were GREAT! The breakfast buffet had many options, including delicious made-to-order omelettes. The evening reception was also fantastic!! Special thank you to Keala who was super attentive, friendly, engaging and made the birthday girls night super special! She was AWESOME!! The live band ( Kanilau) was also AMAZING!! The room was clean and accommodated our large family. We were in the hula tower on the pool level which we found perfect! This hotel is great for families and those traveling with kids. The staff is exceptional and really provided a great experience from beginning to end. I would definitely recommend to family and friends.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: General Mgr Simeon Miranda and his staff did an excellent job from the time we parked the car at valet until we checked out. All department was friendly and gave excellent service. I will highly recommend to friends and business associates. Aloha

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Thank you very much for the wonderful hospitality, efficient and friendly service. Every phase of the Embassy Suite Hotel Waikiki’s operations from valet parking, to the streamlined check-in process, clean room accommodations & prompt & efficient services, to include the amenities and banquet hall services were nothing short of excellence! Most noteworthy were the staff and employees who always greeted me with an Aloha and a smile creating a warm and friendly atmosphere. I want to thank the management and staff team of the Embassy Suite Hotel Waikiki for a memorable experience and quality stay. I will definitely return to the establishment and highly recommend it to all my family, friends and business associates. Thank you - Ben F.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The Embassy Suites are located in an ideal location. Very close walk to the beach. You are situated in the middle of Waikiki, so you can go left towards the Duke (where the waves are bigger), or right to the beach areas where the waves are smaller and more ideal for families with younger children. You are close to everything that goes on in Waikiki. The rooms were a great size and ideal for families, we had 2 adults and 3 children aged 12, 13 and 15. The hotel as perfect for us. Highly recommend staying here.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: When you plan for months and expect the best it happened at the Embassy Waikiki. You’ll receive a warm welcome from staff; Valet Service, Front Desk, Bellmen and Housekeeping Services.The environment is amazingly clean with a beautiful decor of Hawaiian art and culture. The suite is perfectly decorated and user friendly. Come with amenities and then some.This hotel demonstrates a strong commodity of passion and management. Everything you can expect may exceed your expectations because it did for our group.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The staff went above and beyond. They allowed us to use a room to change and held our bags for an 8pm departure, this enabled us to enjoy our entire last day. The breakfast and happy hour was Fantastic. The band was GREAT! Special Thanks to Keala for her hospitality and to Vince for making our anniversary special.The only negative for us was that this is a Family hotel and the pool was packed with kids. Kids and babies. We wish there was an adult pool, or at least a couple hours set aside for adults only.The location couldn't be better. The rooms and staff were great. We may be back next year!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Review of embassy suite wakiki hotel was nice location to beach shopping and food. Room was comfortable. Buffet breakfast with made to order eggs was a bonus evening happy hour food was substandard, chips and carrot sticks , very disappointing

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed there over Labor Day. Overall very dissatisfied. No diamond upgrade (got a low level room near the patio/buffet area). Poor location and the beach nearby is small with strong waves. Very forgettable breakfast. Rude staff and called our room at around 11am and just asked us to check out. I asked for check out around noon and he just responded "check out is at 11, huh". What is that? Will not stay there again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I've stayed here several times over the years for work. It has exceptional included breakfast, and a very nice evening reception. The suites were very nice and clean.The only negative was poor wifi - service was in-and-out. Ok for vacationers but not for business. 4/5 - very good stay. Should have more reliable wifi for the price paid.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We have had so much fun !! Great place to stay with children. If you don’t have children, it is probably not the place to stay though. The pool is so super busy, and over run with kids. My children had so much fun. The rooms are very clean, and the hotel very nice.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The suite gives you a large sitting room, along with bedroom that has 2 queen beds. The room had a nice view of the water. We were on 17th floor. Elevators run pretty quick. Need your keycard to operate the elevator. They give you a welcome drink at check in. Breakfast is included everyday. They always have scrambled eggs, bacon, make your own omelet or egg station. French toast and pancakes rotated every other day. Toast, muffins, danish, yogurt, fruit, cereal, juices, coffee, etc. Just watch out for the birds wandering around the open air eating area. Every night from 530-730 they have a free cocktail party. Drinks, beer, wine, soda, chips, pretzels, nachos, nuts. Convenient to enjoy a drink before going out for dinner, or after returning from dinner.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The hotel is located right next to Waikiki Beach Walk and our two bedroom suite had a great view of the ocean. Loved the fact that as soon as you stepped out of the hotel lobby you were right dead smack in the middle of Waikiki Beach Walk. Not only was the location and view were excellent but service was great as well. Natalie Caceres was very accommodating and made sure that we had everything we needed. Highly recommend it and can’t wait to be back.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My family and I stayed for a few days at The Embassy Suites Waikiki Beachwalk. I must say that we enjoyed our stay here than our previous stays at the Beachcomber and Hilton Hawaiian Village. Staff was very accommodating. We had a 2 Bedroom oceanview room, nice and clean. We were greeted by Natalie Caceres Director of Sales, who ensured our needs were met and we were comfortable. Housekeeping Yuen was very nice and made sure our room was well stocked and clean. She was also very accommodating to my 5yr old son.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed for a week last week, its a great location, good sized room, average condition of the building, helpful staff (except the guy who checked us in, who basically grunted at us), breakfast was like a food hall food quality average, queue for an omelette was to long so we never bothered, pool was small and shallow. Probably a better place to stay if you have a family, not so great if you are a couple. Considering the high price we paid for this Hilton I would have expected a higher quality. I wouldn't stay at this Hilton again, not at the prices we paid (watch out for the taxes, they are steep). I would look at something on the beach next time, was a similar price with a better outlook, for the same money.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We have stayed at this hotel on numerous occasions for many different reasons, Embassy Suites Waikiki never fails to impress. The nightly manager's reception is always a good way to kick back after attending all day conference meetings and just unwind. The live music is OUTSTANDING!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at Embassy Suites for 9 nights and enjoyed our stay tremendously. There was buffet breakfast every morning, and the service staff was very friendly. We want to commend especially Justyn and Cary for giving us advice on places to eat, local tours and referrals for car rental. Justyn had a tray of fruits delivered to our room and gave treats to my kids, which made them super happy. I recommend this hotel, especially for the service from the hospitality staff.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Overall this hotel is great, it’s in a fabulous location close to the beach, Beachwalk, restaurants and the main strip. It has an excellent pool for the kids to be safe and have a good time and the complimentary breakfast and drinks was a real plus. The only reason I marked this down was because of a few annoying things for example the suite was aged and the fridge too small to keep snacks for young children. We also had an issue with staff member on the front desk when my husband misplaced his phone, she dismissed us quite quickly when we checked with another person they looked up lost and found and found the phone. This was the only downside of our trip.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We cannot speak highly enough of this place... if you are a family with more than 2 children, look no further. Location, staff and amenities were all exceptional plus you get the free breakfast & free evening happy hour (yes free alcohol) our family can’t wait to return!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel was excellent in every way. First, the upper management was very responsive and kind to a request that we had regarding a late check out. Mr. Miranda, Mr. Otsuka, and Mr. Robinson, all responded to our email which blew me and my husband away. I know these men have busy schedules so it was even more astounding that they answered us within minutes to a few hours. Customer service seems to be a thing of the past but these gentlemen are bringing back high standards. Mr. Otsuka even arranged for us to have a key to hang out at the hotel while we waited for transportation to the airport. Our flight did not leave until 9:00 p.m. and he saved us from hanging out at the airport for a long period. While Hawaii is beautiful, the airport harks back to 1960. Check in at the hotel was very easy and reception was actually aware of our late check out so that went smooth. The same with check out. No issues with giving us a key to hang out until we left for the airport. As someone who travels quite a bit, when everything goes smooth, it is always a delight. The management at the Hampton in Seattle (see my review for that) may need to see the blueprint this administration has in their handbook. The breakfast buffet had an amazing selection. I know some people thought the food was bland but when you are serving that many people it is easier for the guest to add salt/spices than to make something that may not appeal to those who have issues with certain additives. Also, you can have an omelet made to your specifications. The hotel has nice amenities. There is a manager’s reception with free beer and soda, as well as some snacks, a laundry room if you need to freshen up your clothes, a very nice swimming pool, valet service, and you can even drop off your rental care from Enterprise at the hotel. The rental car company closes early so this was a welcome feature. I know I am missing some things but I encourage anyone to stay here. It will start and end your holiday/vacation in all the right ways.Words cannot do our housekeeper Yuat (hope I spelled this right) justice. Our room was very clean and she fulfilled a few requests for us. Also, I would be remiss if I didn’t mention this woman has skills and speed! She offered great advice for us regarding touring the island.The hotel was in a perfect location. There were activities nearby, a great store across the street and all the tour companies we contacted were able to pick us up at this hotel.Thank you to everyone at the Embassy Suites for helping make our vacation special. We walked around quite a bit and never doubted we stayed at the best place possible for us.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had an excellent experience with this Hotel. The location was convient to the beach and surrounding shopping. We were in town for a Beaver football game ( they lost to Hawaii) everyone was very polite as we wore our Beaver gear. Will return to this hotel for the next game

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Took a mate for his 50Th and shouted him with us hence two bedrooms....clean but super old and in dire need of makeover....probably ok but not Hilton std i used to nor value for money at all as we spent over $1100 NZD per night. Pool basic but nice and clean, pool service shocking virtually none as staff disappeared during day, some days no clean towels either...shame but we had awesome tie despite.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Loving every minute of our family trip to Waikiki, definitely better when you know your safe and employees treat you like your family. Thank you Keala for everything you do to make customers have the best vacation of their lives!!!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Solo trip review. check in experience was really good- it took a bit longer that I am used to ,but they were friendly and gave you a free fruit drink. *Room was spacious and with really good views to tiny bit of the ocean and sunrise- My mirror had some dirty spots *. everything else was good. *Location was extremely convenient- ABC store and Dennis restaurant walking distance access to the beach. Post office and shopping and restaurant also walking distance. *Room service- didn't experience, but the menu looked good with lots of options. *Elevators- My room was 21 floor and sometimes the elevator too more than 5 mins to show, so it was a pain, going up an down even for the reception or breakfast.*Complementary Breakfast and Reception Really good options for breakfast,*including salads* receptions was had really good options too and they switch out, so you don't get the same snacks everyday. *the only minus that i give them is because, they had a *bird*issue. I am not sure but birds were flying in and out of this area, and sometimes landing on top of the food. (not sure if that is very sanitary. *Check out really easy. with the digital key you don't need to stop in at the front desk. *For a solo trip, for me it was an amazing stay and I would recommend and also stay again at this location.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had a great stay at Embassy Suites by Hilton Waikiki Beach walk! Natalie Caceres is so awesome. She made the trip extra special. Highly recommend staying here. The breakfast buffet and happy hour is a bonus.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The place was full of kids. Spacious suites for 6 easily. Beds were comfortable even the sofa bed was better than most. Breakfast was good, reasonable amount of variety. Managers special times for free drinks and snacks was really nice. Pool was busy with kids. The only downside is even though the hotel was geared for families they had no kids programs and only 1 bathroom in 1 bedroom suites.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We have stayed at this Embassy Suites before and have really liked the location. It is a block off the beach and right on the Beachwalk where there are numerous stores and restaurants. It is also very close to the Royal Hawaiian Center where there are many stores and restaurants. The room is just like other Embassy Suites, with a separate bedroom and living area. The rooms were very clean and housekeeping was excellent. We called housekeeping because one of the TV's was not getting a clear reception. They came up within 15 minutes and replaced the TV. The AC worked very well; it was really nice to come back to a very cold room after being in the sun on the beach. The complimentary breakfast was excellent, but I thought the evening reception food and snacks was just okay. Our rooms were on the fourth floor, which is where the pool is located and where the complimentary breakfast and evening reception are also located. That was very convenient for us, as the elevators can sometimes be very slow. There are only two elevators for each of the two towers where the suites are located. I found the valet service to be excellent. They were very prompt in getting our rental car when we needed it You do have to pay $40 a day for parking. I would definitely stay hear again when visiting Honolulu. It's not the cheapest place to stay, but the combination of the location, great room with great AC, and excellent service makes it worthwhile to us.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had 3 rooms and everyone was accommodating and helpful. We all had 2pm checkouts and appreciate that because the night before was a little more partying than expected. Although the hotel is pricier than others, the free breakfast buffet and nightly receptions put it over the top. We are pleased...thank you again!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was our first time staying at Embassy Suites Waikiki and it won’t be our last. The staff was so helpful and so welcoming. Natalie Caceres was a huge help in maximizing our time there! From complimentary breakfast, happy hours with snacks and drinks and the Suite Summer bash, the entire staff made our vacation oneto remember! Location was also a huge plus!! Close to the beach and near great places to shop and eat! Will definitely be returning!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Excellent front desk reception with immediate checkin. Great location and nice rooms. Everything was exceptionall good or better. The only flaw of the stay was the internet access. As a diamond member, there should have been premium access made availible, however there didn't seem to be any. The room internet reception was average and none availible at the pool. Besides that, it was great time.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My family had such a great stay. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Natalie C made sure we were happy and comfortable and made our stay perfect! We will definitely be returning for another staycation soon! Absolutely loved it here.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here with our 2 children in a one bedroom suite.After reading so many amazing reviews, we were super excited but were underwhelmed.We weren’t greeted on arrival and the lobby wasn’t welcoming.The room was spacious and comfortable but was lacking some essentials. Shower caps, cutlery, mugs, wine glasses and crockery of any sort isn’t provided (why have a microwave if you don’t provide any of the basics to go with it?). When we checked in, there were only 2 towels even though there were 4 of us (annoying after a long flight when you just want to have a shower right away).The managers nightly reception with the free drinks was appreciated and sets this hotel apart in terms of value for money.The pool was extremely crowded and there weren’t enough pool chairs.Breakfast was a nightmare. There were long queues (didn’t even bother with the omelette station after the first day) and not enough tables. The food was the same almost every day and not enjoyable.Location is fantastic - walking distance to everything.We love Hilton hotels but probably wouldn’t stay at this one again. It’s not that there’s anything “wrong” with it - there was just nothing impressive.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Like most of the people staying here, we were with kids. The two-room suite was perfect for this, as we could close the door when the kids were sleeping and still chat and relax in the living room area. Having a microwave in addition to the mini fridge was great as well, for heating up left overs. Even the coffee makers was good. The staff was super friendly for the most part, especially housekeeping and at breakfast.The breakfast was pretty good, a kicked-up hotel breakfast with both cold and hot items. I had rice and miso soup every morning we ate there, along with salad. Nice and light. There are tons of birds bothering people at the tables outside, but they open up the meeting rooms so we were able to eat sans birds. We didn't really do the happy hour, just a few snacks but we didn't want to drink so that part was a wash.The location is fantastic. A block away from the beach and crossing Kalia was much easier than the larger block most hotels are across from. The beach right there is rocky but pretty, but if you walk down to the Hilton Hawaiian Village past the dock, the beach there is without rocks and calm. Oh, and definitely do that walk at sunset. Simply stunning and absolutely free. The pool got super crowded later in the day. It's small (although large for Waikiki apparently) but it has a little kid area and a hot tub. The area around the pool was very nice and had a tropical feel although it was on the fourth floor.The only negatives were:Wi-fi was awful. Not a big deal for us but if you need to do work on business you will need your own hotspot. No business center to speak of (they closed it) just some computers in the hot lobby area. Fine for us to print our boarding passes but again if you need to do business, you will need another option.Also they assign rooms before check-in. We had to wait until 3, which fine that is the check-in time but even then the room wasn't ready. After all those calls we made to check on the room, at past 3 when we went back they said, Oh housekeeping still has to clean your room. What? On the phone they said it was guaranteed for three at the latest. We had pants from the flight and large electronics bag that we didn't want to check. My 7 year old was hot and sweaty and in tears, and I got upset as well, so they magically found us another room that was ready. There is no airconditioned space to wait. No lockers for valuables so you can change and swim, etc. while you are waiting. Apparently they assign you a room, and that's your room, and even if there are tons of rooms available in the class you booked, you wait for your specific assigned room. If they gave the previous guests in that room late check-out, you have to wait. Again, overall not a huge deal and I do highly recommend this hotel, but this is one area that can be improved upon.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at this property for 2 nights while vacationing in Honolulu. Although we tried to get our room earlier since our flight came in, the room wasn't ready until about 3pm. We had a 2 bedroom suite on the 12th floor and it was beautiful. Our views of the water were incredible The only frustration was that one of the elevators kept breaking down and only 2 elevators remained for the enormous amounts of people trying to use them. Other that that, it is a great location to walk to shops and restaurants.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I usually stay at hotels for the price and location depending on the occasion. However, this is my go to place that provides that AND the staff! Where do I begin? The happy hour staff is great- making it happier whether it's pineapple juice being dispensed by a "pineapple" or a mai tai. During the first evening there, the bartenders, Keola (he's going to be mad if I spelled his name wrong?) and Shan, made sure we were remembered as they poured all 9 of us our usual drinks. Also, our breakfast omelets and egg preferences were remembered and served with a lot fun by John and Dominic. Servers Cary and Aldrin always made our large party of 9 feel accommodated. Their newest add is Keala, one of the runners during happy hour. She is such a character and striked the right balance of professionalism and humor! The only downside to this trip was expecting our usual valet staff that always provided recommendations for our next adventure. Most of their staff looked new, but life does go on and it's certainly understandable to support career growth and aspirations- We miss Gilbert! Although the breakfast options are by far the best out of most of the Embassy Suites that I've stayed at, it seemed to have a few things missing from prior years. 360 more days till our next time there!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Good friendly checkin but our debit card would not work Tami was ok and helpful to fix the problem. Our baggage had not been delivered from the airport so she gave us a goody bag to take away.Air conditioning malfunctioned in our room number 1731 on 15/7/19 with water cascading from the air conditioning unit onto the carpet.A quick call to maintenance and that was sorted out. Our room was not set up for 4 adults but again a quick call to housekeeping and that was also sorted.17/7/19 was a wake up call be the hotel workers using equipment to remove the plaster from the side of the hotel suspended on a cradle on the outside of the hotel prior to the hotel being painted. VERY NOISEYWORK!The hotels free evening reception was ok but the drinks are just cheap copies of famous names, when the fact is that this hotel is an expensive hotel to stay at and we have stayed at other Embassy Suites and had much better standard of drinks. The hotel is centrally located close to the beaches shops, and restaurants (if you can get into the restaurants) as it is a very busy area with not lot aof decent eating places but a lot of fast food joints. Good breakfast choice with 2 omelette stations but it is a big hotel so it does get very busy !! Plenty of bacon eggs pancakes ,fresh melon and fruits and biscuit and gravy act.All staff throughout the hotel speak and are friendly to youWorkmen were very Noisy on three occasions using breakers to remove old paint from the outside walls, and the walked through the breakfast area in the morning with there work cloths on, They were working from a cradle hanging from the roofNot very good when you have paid a lot of money to stay at a nice hotel!!The air conditioning in our room 1731 malfunctioned pouring water into the room , we used our towels and ice bucket to catch the water until maintenance arrived. He fixed the leak which he said it was a blocked drain. On check in credit card did not work and we had to make an International phone call from our hotel room to our bank.Tami on reception that this charge would be waived as it was to do with paying our hotel check.On checkout we were charged $75 for that phone call.!!We questioned the bill and the hotel waived the fee.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I'm a Hilton Gold member and we typically stay at Embassy Suites when we travel with our children. Embassy Waikiki was fantastic and exceeded our expectations. Was greeted with fresh juice on arrival and when they learned it was my twins birthday the staff gave each of my kids (including non birthday one) a box of Macadamia chocolates. What a way to begin vacation! Our room was on the 15th floor and had a great balcony view of the ocean. Hurricane Eric and Flossie were threatening but turned out to have little impact on the weather other than a nice breeze. Breakfast was AWESOME and really appreciated the mix of Asian cuisine and American choices. Location and pool are an A+. My only recommendation might be to make sure that hotel guests only are using the facilities. Seemed that some folks were using the facilities who didn't have wristbands which potentially inconvenienced guest (longer lines) but overall terrific time. Special kudos to the bartenders, night wait staff and morning wait staff who were all super friendly and helpful during our stay. Valet parking was also very nice and attentive and never ook more than a few minutes to get our car! Looking forward to our return one day!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We are halfway through a weeks stay at this wonderful resort. I checked in using the Hilton app early hours of the morning of my arrival. The idea of bypassing the front desk and going straight to your room unlocking your door key on your phone is great. However I still had to give my passport and credit card at the front desk. We are staying in a one bedroomed king suite on the 20th floor Hula tower. Room number 2032. And although it was adjacent to 3 elevators, it was quiet and peaceful.Breakfast was included and there was a large selection of food to suit everyone. There was also a managers reception which provided complimentary alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks between 5:30 pm and 7:30 pm every day. They were also complimentary snacks which was a nice touch. Our room attendant Yuet Chun was attentive and friendly. She made sure we had everything we needed and always bid us a good day. She is a credit to the embassy suites and her hard work should be recognised.The location of this resort is amazing. Very central and walkable to many shops and restaurants. The bus stop is very close to hotel which took us to ala moana centre and diamond head. The beautiful beach is just round the corner from the hotel about five minutes to walk it.I would recommend this hotel 100% you will not be disappointed! I can’t wait to come back!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Amazing hotel and trip everyone was very helpful! The complimentary food and drink were awesome! I even made a mistake with booking and they fixed everything up for me with no problem! The valet were helpful as well and very fast and patient and knew where everything was at!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We liked the location of this hotel, which is ideal for Waikiki restaurants and shopping. However, it was extremely crowded and noisy with lots of young children. We did not even attempt to use the pool. Breakfast was also extremely crowded and noisy. Not a property to sit back and relax, but the location is good for Waikiki activities.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The location is nearly perfect, right on Waikiki beach and within walking distance of an array of great restaurants. However, the hotel, especially the pool, is extremely overcrowded. Additionally, the breakfast is nearly inedible every morning, likely because they are serving such a large group.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at the Embassy Suites for 5 nights in July. The great 1 BR suite was perfect for our family of 5, with 2 Queen beds in a bedroom and a pull-out sofa bed in the main area. The room was clean and was stocked daily with ample towels and toiletries. The location is great with a short and easy walk to the beach on one side, and to the commercial strip on the other. There are tons of selection in terms of restaurants withing 5 minutes walk, which is key having to feed 3 teenagers... The hotel's amenities we liked include a pool, valet parking ($40 per day), daily happy hour with free drinks and snacks, coin laundry services and in room dining. The only con was the breakfast.
