This is a great property to stay while vacationing in Oahu. The breakfast was good and the manager's reception was a nightly treat. They even had live hawaiian music during the manager's reception. Our housekeeper, Yuet Chan, was awesome! She made sure that we were taken care of during our entire stay. Overall, we were very pleased with our stay and will most certainly return.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed here recently with my husband and two kids. It is half a block away from Waikiki beach. The room was spacious and overlooked the pool. We could even see the beach from our balcony. We spent most of our time in the heated pool and jacuzzi.The free drinks by the pool from 5:30-7:30 every night were great and not too busy. Room service was pretty expensive in the hotel, but there is a great restaurant underneath the hotel called The Yard House which was excellent. Breakfast was busy and sometimes it was hard to find a table but overall it was pretty good. The made to order omelettes were great. The only downside was the housekeeping came at a different time every day. Sometimes it was 8:30am and sometimes it was 3pm, so it was difficult to plan the day. But overall this is a great place to stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Ending our three week trip to Hawaii and Japan, we wanted a nice hotel in Waikiki for our last few nights before heading home. Our priorities were: a central location, close to, but not necessarily directly on the beach, and a reasonable (for Hawaii) value. The Embassy Suites Beach Walk hit the mark! We loved the extra space, microwave and small fridge, and the fact that both the bedroom and the living room each had balconies. Every staff member (save one) was extremely helpful, friendly and accommodating. Special kudos to Kenny, our valet/bellman and the front desk/registration woman (we forgot her name, but she was originally from Okinawa, Japan) who helped make our visit so pleasant. We booked a city view room and requested an upper floor to avoid the noise of traffic. We were assigned a wonderful suite, in the Aloha Tower, on the sixteenth floor with a glorious view of Diamond Head. We underestimated the value and quality of the breakfasts and thoroughly enjoyed the evening cocktail receptions. A block from the beach (the widest stretch fronting Fort DeRussy) and smack dab in what we consider to be the best part of Waikiki. The pool and spa are located on the fourth floor where we found plenty of loungers. If you're looking for a hotel with a grand lobby, this is probably not the place for you (reception was located on the ground floor and oddly open to where the cars and taxis arrive.) If you are looking for a good value, a spacious suite, in a great location, with welcoming employees, look no further!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: WE were impressed by this hotel as it was handy to shops, restaurants and the beach. The staff were also very helpful and the Happy Hour was a popular event to try. They even had some great live entertainment when we were there which was very good to listen to. I would definitely stay there again if I had the opportunity.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The full breakfast was excellent in quality and variety. The evening manager reception on the grand Lanai was awesome! We enjoyed our stay and will likely stay here again. Also will recommend to other for the value received.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We would definitely stay here again! It was great for our family of five (my husband, kids - 15, 13 and 11 and I). The kids had their own bedroom and bathroom as did we and there was a common area so we had plenty of space. The free daily breakfast was good and really helped us save money; we enjoyed the Manager's Reception each night. The Embassy Suites was clean and near to the beach. This was a great value and we had a great time in Oahu.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Finishing off a four week trip to the USA from Australia this was our last stop for 4 nights before the long flight home. We were beyond impressed with this hotel and we have very high standards. We booked a suite consisting of 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms with a sofa bed which very comfortably accommodated our family of 5. The rooms were clean neat and spacious decorated in Hawaiian themed décor. We had a partial view of the ocean and looked down on the pool area which was gorgeous. The complimentary breakfast was the best we have had with a wide variety of hot and cold foods. The afternoon welcome home service was fantastic including complimentary snack foods, beer and cocktails, YES FREE COCKTAILS!! The staff were always very helpful and friendly. The hotel is located just a 5 minute walk to the beach and so many shops and restaurants are walking distance. We could buy waters and alcohol from the ABC shop located opposite the entrance and bring them back to the room to store in the bar fridge. We loved this hotel and could not fault it. I would recommend to everyone, families and couples.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: this place was amazing. we stay at embassy all the time and this was by far the best. everyone went out of their way to take care of you and ur needs. managers actually came to the happy hr and circulated the area to make sure ur stay was good. anything u wanted they would accommodate if possible. would go back in a second. all the bartenders at the pool bar are great. just the beat place ever. book as soon as u can don’t miss out we stayed for close to 2 weeks and never got told “no we cant do that”. ty so much for such a great time. location is great.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The hotel was comfortable and located within a short walk to the beach, walked to all restaurants and shops. View to ocean is very limited due to other hotels blocking the majority of view. Good and affordable eateries are available within walking distance if you look for them.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We checked in yesterday for our 7 night stay and since then, we have been nothing but impressed. Arrived at 7am with our 1 year old and was given a room straight away! Meant she could have breakfast, bathe and sleep before beginning our adventure. The staff go out of their way to make you feel comfortable, the rooms are cleaned to perfection and the Manager’s Reception (daily from 5:30pm-7:30pm) is amazing! We recommend the Margarita! My daughter has been treated like a princess by staff and we want to publicly thank the staff member who let her feed the fish with him - we can not tell you how much we appreciated your kindness. Stay here, relax and unwind - everything is included and the location is central.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed 5 nights The location is superb close to the beach and centre of Waikiki were checked in early which is most appreciated One bedroom apartment, strangely there was no crockery or cutlery in the kitchen Not sure if you have to request this Little strange as we opted to eat lunch in a couple of days Breakfast selection is varied if a little busy with number of guests Managers reception is a nice touch with free flowing cocktails and beer snacks ie chips and peanuts One small complaint was the hairdryer It would be nice to have a decent dryer as you are swimming everyday

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We decided to make Hawaii our gift to each other for our 25th wedding anniversary. We had stayed at other Embassy Suites properties before and enjoyed them. We simply loved our stay at this one in Hawaii. The staff was wonderful and very friendly and made our stay a very comfortable one. The location is premo! It is in heart of the Waikiki beach area and just a stone’s throw from the beach. We were there from Nov 2nd till the 7th. Nothing beats the morning breakfast buffet and the manager’s reception from 5:30 until 7:30 is an unexpected treat. We will be returning to this hotel on our next trip and many after. It made our first trip to Hawaii a memorable one! Thank you.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: But dated. Great location but just wasn't made to feel welcome. I booked a high floor in the Hula tower and got a low floor overlooking the food trucks in the Aloha tower. When I queried the room I was given a shoulder shrug in response and told they were all the same. I booked the hotel because they offered a one bedroom apartment that I thought I would need after being in Canada and the U.S with my son for a month, but this hotel did not meet my expectation. In addition to the dismissive attitude, worn linen, dodgy wifi and slow lifts, they did not replenish the essentials; such as milk, tea and towels every day. They were quick to respond when I asked for them but wouldn't expect to have to.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: In late Sept'17 we spent 5 enjoyable nights at this hotel. Our very large one bedroom suite with ocean view was comfortable, clean, had a coffee maker, two TV's (bedroom + living area) and also a balcony off each of these rooms overlooking the pool area. Location couldn't be better - an easy walk to the beach, shops etc. The 'Happy Hour'- actually 2 hours (5:30 - 7:30pm) nightly around the pool area was relaxing. The included buffet breakfast was amazing with a huge selection to choose from including cook-to-order omelettes. Would definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great location,walk to beach and bus stop,resturants and shops.Room was clean ,tidy and roomy.Tour desk people were amazing.2hr happy hr every night.Breakfast was simple with amazing omelets cooked fresh.Dinner was ok.would stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great location half a block from the beach. decor a bit dated, but great service and very clean, breakfast was all you could hope for, catered for all tastes, however there could be a better variety of snacks at the afternoon drinks, variety of drinks amazing and staff always accomodated your every request

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I like this hotel.. it is very NIIICE. If you like this hotel, you are vice. it has very nice towels and the number in the elevator was nice. I like the mirrors in the gym they are very nice. Fi you like to meet many beautiful women and sometimes ladyboy you can stay stay here. -Borat

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Once I arrived the staff that was working on Halloween night were outstanding! Best service I've gotten from any hotel yet!! Once I got there from the valet crew and the front desk staff crew they were just so amazing accommodating me. They were all so full of energy and just great. They kicked butt! From that point I knew I would absolutely recommend this hotel to any. Having staff like that is the most important part in Bussiness, without them I wouldn't come back. The staff made an amazing experience for me and because of them my next hotel I'm going to stay at is the Embassy Suite! Thank you all very much for having me and I hope the employees would get to read this because they deserve it and work very hard!! Thank you very much!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel is absolutely fabulous. I’ve stayed here many times and it’s never changed. It’s the staff that make it so special. They are warm and always helpful. Cleanliness is impeccable. I can not fault anything with this hotel at all. Perfect down to every detail. See you soon!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great location and spacious room. Another day in Paradise package provided reasonable rate. Complementary breakfast didn't meet expectations; welcome drink was tasty, though. Walls were thin, and I could fully understand what they were talking about in our neighboring room who happened to be speaking in Korean like us and they were not shouting.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Well suited for one person to work and other to relax. Nice kitchen/bar for making coffee early, keeping food. Comfortable living space. Wonderful made to order omelette sand fresh pineapple for breakfast.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great family holiday. We had 10 nights in an 1br ocean view room. Clean comfortable room with a great view. Pros: breakfast was included in price. Quality was okay, as many have said the best part was the made to order omelettes. Nightly cocktails was also excellent Cons: only complaint- we had to ask for our room to be serviced twice during our stay( they had apparently forgot) We also asked to be moved to away from the exhaust grill from the outrigger hotel next door. The smell was pretty bad (meat/deep fryer smell 24/7). So they moved us from 929 to 1429. Small improvement but nothing noticeable. Overall would most likely book again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Hotel is in excellent location with many restaurants, shops and beach activities within a 5 to 10 minute walk and the rooms, breakfast, evening reception and amenities are well presented and comfortable. Wifi is fast, gym is good but a little small and the valet ($38/day) is quick in getting your car. Hotel does sit in a busy area but we had a 4th floor room and never heard the crowds around the hotel -- breakfast choices are typical Embassy Suites but area is open-air which is a nice touch. No resort fee which is hard to find (Hilton Waikiki has no resort fee also) so added value when staying here. As a Diamond member there were no benefits awarded us and no concierge lounge -- as evening social and free buffet breakfast included as part of hotel. We enjoyed stay and will be back for sure.Tip: Uber is available so no need for a car if you are to spend majority of time in Waikiki which saves you the daily parking fee of $38. Some come and only rent a car for the day they decide to drive around the island.Tip: Only a few rooms (high facing beach) offer a view as the hotel sits back away from the water and is surrounded by many other buildings -- so if you want the beach view and are willing to pay for it, make sure you reserve the room as busy and complementary upgrades are few.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel should get a 5 star rating, but there were two major problems here. I'll start with the good parts of this review. My husband and I spent 4 nights here before joining a small boat cruise on the Big Island. We thought it would be a good place to recover from jet lag after an 11 hour trip. We also wanted to see the sights in Honolulu as it's highly unlikely that we will return to Hawaii. The positives: The staff is very helpful and friendly. Rooms are spacious and comfortable. The cooked to order breakfast buffet has lots of delicious offerings. There is a great cover band at the nightly cocktail hour and cocktails flow freely. We've been to other Embassy Suite properties that impose a 1 drink limit. Now for the reasons for the point reductions: This is a tropical destination that was quite hot and humid when we were here. The halls and elevators are not air conditioned and there were no tropical breezes to make those areas comfortable. Sweating profusely while waiting for and riding in an elevator is definitely a negative. Additionally, this property is located a long block from the nearest beach. There is, however, a lovely pool area that would have been very nice to use had there been shaded areas. There were no umbrellas, except at a few tables, and no other shelters from the sun. We've been to many tropical resorts in many places. In all of them, we could sit at the pools or beach areas and be shaded from the sun.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The complementary drinks every evening along with the life music make this a hotel I would definitely recommend. Let’s not forget the free breakfast every morning. I would recommend to the hotel to change the breakfast menu every once in a while so people don’t get bored of it

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Lovely hotel in a good location.Close to restaurants and shops.ABC store just across the road. We had a two bedroom suite that was modern and clean. The buffet breakfast of a morning was lovely with many options,great for families on a budget. Happy hour poolside was great to. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Would i recommend Embassy Suites ? YES I WOULD. Would i stay again? YES I WOULD.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Nice hotel and convenient location with nice service. Was assigned a bottom floor rom with 2 small beds despite Hilton Honors profile stating high floor and king bed room. This was corrected but the new room was adjacent to the elevators which disrupted my sleep throughout the week. Room service started cleaning the room at 3:30 in the afternoon which is highly inconvenient.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Overall a very nice stay. Very nice clean modern rooms, prompt housekeeping, expensive parking for your vehicle. A short two block walk to the beach. The comp breakfast is pretty good and saves a bundle for a family compared to going out everyday for breakfast. Nice location, near lots of shops and restaurants in Waikiki. Typical Embassy suites, my score is 8 out of 10.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The suite was very nice. Elevator is card enabled so only guests can access any floor above the lobby. Close to some nice places to eat. Traffic during rush hour is pretty slow but other than that it was easy to get around. Big ABC store across the street. Stayed on the first floor and didn't have a problem with street noise. Breakfast was nice.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Found myself in Waikiki for a couple of days and LOVE the AWESOME VIEWS and BALCONIES (yes, plural, balconies) at my favorite Embassy Suites Beachwalk.Just when I thought they could not possibly improve, I open the door to these images (see pics)!Employees here are always helpful and accommodating and as I have reviewed in the past the location just can't be beat.On to the Manager's reception and the Friday night beach fireworks!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our experience with Embassy Suites has been exceptional and this visit to Hawaii was superb. From welcome to check out our experience wsuperb. Breakfast was made to order, fresh and tasty and the time available was great so we could sleep in when we desired to. Evening reception was fun and on someevenings even had live entertainment. We're going back and staying at the Embassy Suites.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel surpassed our expectations. The location was ideal for shopping, getting to tourist sights and walking. The staff was excellent and you were always greeted with a smile. The morning breakfast and evening reception were nice additions to the day. The music was fun and entertaining. The rooms were clean and provided all we needed. Great hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I greatly enjoyed my stay at the Embassy Suites. The location is perfect; walking distance from everything in Waikiki. The staff was very friendly, rooms were clean and spacious with separate living room and bedroom. The free buffet breakfast was amazing with lots of different choices and a great way to save some money in Hawaii. The pool was very nice, not very big but the beach is only a few steps away from the hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: A great place to stay. The staff is very friendly and the rooms clean and comfortable. Breakfast is included every morning; drinks and snacks every evening with live music on Wednesday's and Friday's. We always stay at the Embassy Suites Waikiki because it's centrally located next to restaurants, shops, the beach, trolley/bus service and fireworks at the Hilton on Friday. The Pink Line trolley takes you right to Ala Moana Mall, the number 2 bus takes you directly to the KCC farmers market on Saturday, and The International Market Place is two blocks away by foot.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Perfect for couples ( friends). Breakfast included. Two hours of free drinks every night. Pool on level four ( so pool not on beach level, if that's what you are after). Great location! Short walk to beach and all the Waikiki shops / restaurants. Rooms serviced daily. Had a great stay at Embassy Suites.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Very comfortable hotel staff were excellent location was great not much negative to say really . The evening free drinks and nibbles were really good and a great way to settle in. Rooms were very clean and breakfast was very good and the staff at breakfast were really good

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Waikiki is all about location I guess. The location of this property is great... central and close to everything that you want to be close to. Give its a block off the main beach the prices are cheaper than the bigger hotels, which is attractive to some people who don't need to be on the beach.We had out 1br suite upgraded to a 2br suite...... certainly can't complain about that.Whilst the rooms were spacious, modern and comfortable, the property felt like a cross between a train station and a college cafeteria! The floors were not enclosed as they left the fire escape doors open at both ends of our floor all night which increased a little noise and increased the internal temperature.Breakfast was served in what was literally a cafeteria! Probably the worst meal we had in 2 weeks in the USA..... very basic, but also very boring.Good location though, so for that reason we would consider for next time, given we only stay in Waikiki for shopping and sleeping in transit to another Island!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The Embassy Suites is an all Suites hotel - located in walking distance to Waikiki beach. It's a large hotel (2 towers + a central reception, function, food & pool building). It has large comfortable rooms with nice views from the higher floorsIncluded are a large buffet breakfast (very good) + evening reception (snack food & drinks).

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We decided to try this hotel because next year we want to plan a trip with our family and it has 2 bedroom suites which could work out well for us. We were skeptical but quickly very pleased on arrival. The free breakfasts were really nice. (Be sure to have some POG with breakfast from the drink area - delicious!) The location is great, really close to beach and shopping. The pool area is really nice, we loved it and this is where the nightly happy hour free drinks are served. Try ordering some appetizers to go with your drinks instead of dinner - we did and loved it! Several nights a week there is live music in the same area which was enjoyed by all. We will definitely return with family.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We were a party of 12 (6 kids and 6 adults) and stayed in 3 apartments. The things I loved about the hotel:- 1 bedroom apartments were great, especially with kids- Breakfast was included, great with kids. The omelets were fantastic.- Happy 2 hours near the pool. The kids could swim and all the mums and dads could watch them while having a drink (drinks were in plastic cups).When we first arrived, I had read reviews that the pool was small, and while it was, it was fantastic for us because we could watch all the kids from in the pool or beside it. For us it was great. The location was perfect, 5 mins from the beach.All the staff were excellent, they couldn't do more to help us. We will certainly go back to this hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We just stayed at the Embassy Suites for 10 nights. We found it to be an excellent place to stay with our two boys (8 and 13 years old). We arrived at 8am after an long flight from NZ and they got us access to the pool and breakfast so we could use those until our room was ready. The breakfast included is good and we never had any trouble getting a table. The omelettes were good but there was also cereal, fruit, toast, bagels, bacon and a few things that changed each day like pancakes and french toast. The drinks for the managers reception were also excellent. The kids enjoyed the snacks that were also included. The pool was nice and the room was clean and big enough for the four of us. There was a microwave and small fridge, but no cutlery or plates available. Great location - close to beach, shops, restaurants, and food court.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great location; location close lots of shopping, in the heart of Waikiki , great service, great staff; staff was pleasant throughout the hotel, the bartenders were fun and accommodating . Pool was very busy with many children.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed at the Embassy Suites Waikiki to celebrate my birthday. Location is ideal. The daily cook-to-order breakfast and evening reception are an added bonus that are simply excellent. We didn’t have to wander around each morning looking for a restaurant for breakfast. The staff was the friendliest I’ve encountered at any hotel - and I’ve stayed in a lot of hotels the last five years for work. This was the best. I will definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Very family friendly. I’m not into having kids around so I should have booked Marriott down the road or Sheraton for the better views and larger beachfronts and don’t recall ever seeing children there. However, staff here are very friendly and go above and beyond to make sure you’re happy.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My husband and three teenagers have stayed at Embassy suites all over the continental United States. This by far is the best one. The breakfast is great with tons of fruits and lettuce salad. My only complaint is the $38 parking fee. Ourageous! We had a corner room which I believe was larger than a typical two queen room. Very spacious. All of the staff we encountered were professional and friendly. I wish more hotels would be like this one.Saved so much money by having the full breakfast and snacks/drinks at happy hour and no resort fee. I cannot wait to return.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed for 10 nights. Warmly welcomed by friendly, helpful staff. Excellent location. Very comfortable bed. Hearty breakfasts. Rooms are starting to look a little tired and dated and could do with a refresh. The lifts drove me a little crazy as they were so slow. Often there was a queue so everyone couldn’t get on when one eventually arrived. However overall a great experience.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We very much enjoyed our stay at The Embassy Suites Waikiki. The hotel is located off of the Beachwalk strip which is lined with restaurants, boutiques galleries and convenience stores. There is a beautiful pool on the fourth floor. Next to the pool is a small bar which serves free drinks at the managers reception every night for a couple hours. Light snacks and nonalcoholic beverages are also availableThe suites are reasonably large, beds are comfortable and the housekeeping staff is efficient and friendly. A bountiful breakfast is included every morning. The only complaint I have is with their business center. The security levels were set so high I had difficulty printing boading passes from my airline. I had to find a work around to get it accomplished. I also had difficulty accessing my e-mail. Otherwise this place was perfect.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We loved our four night stay at this hotel. We had a top floor corner suite that offered amazing views of Waikiki Beach. Our suite was comfortable and clean. The complimentary breakfast buffet and evening reception were a nice touch. Breakfast included everything from made to order omelettes to yogurt, fruit, and cereal. The evening reception offered cocktails and light snacks. The pool area was nice with comfortable seating. The location is a block from the beach and within walking distance of shopping and many restaurants. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Good to have some extra space for our 9 night stay( especially with teenager's)in a standard hotel room. Room cleaned daily to a high standard. Demi was always friendly and courteous, has pride in her work. The bonus of Embassy Suites is no extra resort rort ( no daily extra fee) breakfast included ( not our favourite mainly due to the 'free for all mentality of many people just loading plates up, in preparation it would seem that may never get another meal and some eating like it too ! )However I am completely aware that Embassy Suites can not alter human behaviour .This in mind we chose to eat at other venue's .The Managers Reception drinks and snacks was appreciated.Great location, quick walk to waikiki Beach, excellent restaurants and shopping. Overall a very good family choice.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay again. All staff were very helpful. Made to order eggs were great, could perhaps change the other breakfast items available every few days. Just add some different things. Evening drinks were fantastic.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed for 6 nights on October wirh my family. I liked the fact that it was like a mini studio...1 room with 2 queen beds, 1 bathroom and a living room with queen sofa bed and mini-fridge and microwave.Excellent location: 3 blocks from Waikiki beach where you can take surf classes or canoe riding, on Beachwalk with tons of restaurants and shops. Really like the fact that breakfast is included....a plus when traveling with family!Would definetely recommend it

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The hotel is located on the Waikiki Beach Walk in a vibrant shopping area with a variety of restaurants and bars within an easy walk. We stayed in the Hulu Tower overlooking the pool with a view of the ocean. This is not an ocean front property, but I knew that prior to booking. Parking is valet only which is an additional daily charge, however, the full-buffet complementary "Embassy Suites" breakfast adds to the overall good value. Our room was spacious, clean, and well-appointed. Even with the numerous hotel options in Waikiki, I would not hesitate in staying here again or recommending the Embassy Suites to friends.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We chose this hotel because of being close to the beach. It is also close to restaurants, stores, the Army Museum, and the shopping mall. The rooms were large and clean. The pool, breakfast area, and evening reception area were nice. The evening reception had good drinks with snack type food but nothing hot.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My husband and I had an exceptional 35th Wedding Anniversary Vacation! Mr. Simeon Miranda and his staff went out of their way to make sure we had such a special vacation! A BIG Thank You to this fantastic Hotel! The Managers Reception and breakfast were unbelievable! Great location, Great Views--Fantastic Management and Staff!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: In my opinion if you have kids 12 and under they will enjoy the pool. We had a room facing the pool and it was great. Also, the continental breakfast is very decent and the staff very accommodating and friendly.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stay here! No better value for the money in Honolulu. From the room, to the complimentary evening cocktails, full buffet breakfast. The views from room1930 were outstanding. Short, easy walk to the beach, with a perfect view of diamond head in the distance, right by main drag for shopping.(high end)

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: complimentary breakfast and drinks for happy hour by an awesome pool made this a five star review. I also had a late flight on my last day. The staff let my know about a hospitality room where I could shower after a full day at the beach. These perks allowed me to easily write a five star review of a great place to stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We are a couple in our 60s on our first visit to Hawaii. Embassy Suites was everything we could have wanted. Check-in was efficient. Our room was lovely. Everyday the terrific housekeeping staff freshened it up. The bed was so cmfortable. The breakfast buffet was delicious. They were busy but we never had a problem. I do suggest securing your table before getting your food. The kitchen staff keeps the food buffet full and hot. The bus staff cleans tables as soon as guests leave. The evening reception was much more than we expected. A nice spread of simple snacks, complimentary drinks all with terrific music! We booked tours at the Expedia tour desk in the lobby. Expensive but worth it for us. Also, from the lobby is easy access down a hallway to the shops and restaurants behind the hotel. Also, if you walk out the front of the hotel to the right it is a short walk to Long Drug Store and Hard Rock and Tommy Bahamas. Walk out the door to the left and across the street is a sidewalk to the beach. There is also complimentary Wi-Fi. You need to use your key in the elevator for security. The only thing missing in a concierge and a little shop on the premises.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was the perfect set up for my family of 5. We got a 2 bedroom suite with 2 baths and a LR with sofa bed in between, and partial ocean mountain view. The teens were able to have their own beds, didn't need to share. The hotel accommodated a lot of Japanese families and the restaurant offered a wide variety of Asian and American cuisine.The breakfast is included and definitely worth it. About a block to the beach and plenty of great shopping and eateries nearby. Only 1 incident when we had to evacuate from a top floor in the middle of the night. Cleaning staff was so-so the first week and awesome the 2nd. Be sure to leave a tip in your room if you want happy service. I could not find a better deal with the bed situations than Embassy Suites. Clean, good price and value. Loved it.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Everyone at the hotel was incredibly nice. This hotel would be amazing for family or leisure travel, but the internet speed made it hard to do business. The beach is a block away and shopping is at your finger tips.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: all the staff were very helpfull made us fell very welcome the location is fantastic near the beautiful beaches and close to lots of bars, restaurants and shopping areas the rooms are a good standard for the rates you pay would stay their again

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We arrived and the lady at the reception kindly upgraded my mum and I to a 2 bedroom suite. The hotel is pretty tired and the rooms too. The pool got windy because it was on the 4th pool rooftop. The pool was good very big with a childrens area that was shallow, a hot tub and the normal pool. The poolside food is ok and the staff was very good. The hotel is very family friendly and there is a lot of kids (especially at the pool). The staff was kind everywhere and the cleaning staff changed the beds everyday. The location was excellent and downstairs there was a great restaurant called Roys. Also the beach was just minute walk away. Might stay there again!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We just spent five nights at the ES Waikiki and had a wonderful, relaxing stay. Fantastic service from check-in to check-out. Our suite had city view on one side of the lanai and partial ocean view on the other. How cool is that? Fabulous location, close to shops and restaurants (including food trucks), and a five-minute walk to the beach. I enjoyed the complimentary yoga lessons by the pool and the Happy Hour as well, especially when there is live music playing. On Thursday afternoon, there is a farmers market across from the Yard House restaurant. There, you will find a variety of Asian foods, including yummy pad Thai noodles and fresh fruits at reasonable prices. We booked our vacation package through Expedia and this hotel is a tremendous value. Great for couples and also for families with children.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My husband and I had the most wonderful experience as we celebrated our 4th anniversary at Embassy Suites on Waikiki. We LOVE this hotel because it offers the suites and breakfast buffet, and the Embassy Suites staff is ALWAYS amazing. It's walking distance....right outside the elevator....from many great restaurant options as well as shopping. In addition, the beach is just across the street, where you can rent all sorts of water craft as well as lounge chairs and umbrellas. When we first arrived, we were greeted with such kindness by Julia, who gave us such a beautiful room with a view overlooking the ocean. In the morning, we watched the surfers and at night had stunning sunsets. It is so worth it to get an ocean view room. We arrived very early so Julia set us up with access to the pool and towels and the staff secured our luggage while we waited for our room to be available. And we got a call at 12:00 p.m. from Julia that our room was ready. Each staff person....from Ok Soon to Jay and many others.....exuded such overflowing warmth and kindness to provide us with dazzling service and information to make our stay the BEST! Although we LOVE being home, we're also a little homesick for Embassy Suites. It was our home away from home as the staff....and all the people we met on our journey....made us feel so warm and welcomed. It felt like a "kindness" portal had been opened and we got to receive ALL the kindness Oahu had to offer. We will be back.....ABSOLUTELY!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Hotel was excellent; centrally located to great dining; easy access to beach. Valet parking very convenient. Rooms were great; very clean and spacious. Housekeeping staff was very courteous when we would see them in the halls. Definitely would stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We just love staying here. The Staff are happy to help, the suites are comfortable, all the facilities in the room actually work and if they don't they get fixed within the hour. No argument. Breakfast is great, The Managers reception is great and the location is excellent. Only downside is the cost to park a car $38/night but this is common to all hotels in Waikiki. This was visit No5 and we are looking forward to trip No6 and 7 and 8

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Had a great stay here with my Family. Location is spot on for the beach and Waikiki shops and restaurants. 20 mins drive from the airport. Staff are friendly and professional. Public areas and rooms are furnished to a high standard. The pool and deck area are spacious. The buffet breakfast is a winner and the managers reception every night is the icing on the cake. Would definitely recommend and will be back here myself at some point in the near future.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great vacation venue in Honolulu, right along the beach walk. Excellent inclusions:the Managers reception each evening, great cocktails!Cooked to order breakfasts.Rooms were comfortable with excellent views.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I stayed here with family who use a wheelchair. We were able to get a 2 bedroom suite with roll-in ensuite shower, which was perfect. All areas of the hotel we wanted to use were accessible and the elevators straight to the Beach Walk were very handy, as were the bus stops on the same block. The staff were all incredibly friendly and helpful too, both in general interactions and helping us arrange cabs, a trip to Hanauma Bay, airport connections and anything else we asked about.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We were visiting Honolulu for the 6th time with our 2 children in September. We actually saw this hotel on our last visit. We stayed for 5 nights. Loved the location. Fabulous breakfast included, great omelette bar. Kid friendly hotel. Managers reception in the evening - its happy hour 530-730pm except its free. Cocktails, nibblies, kids drinks by the pool. would definitely recommend this hotel as its very central to restaurants, shops and across the road from the beach, bus stop to ala moana shopping centre, car hire, food trucks.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Really enjoyed our stay. It was the 2nd time we were able to get in so we were very happy. They do not disappoint. The room was clean and fresh, the breakfast..what can I say..delicious. Only downfall...they stopped serving Portuguese sausage for breakfast.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had 8 days jere with 4 adults and 4 kids staying in 2 rooms. It's a great family place and the kids were in the pool everyday and it's also very close to a nice part of Waikiki Beach where we hired canoes and other equipment for the kids. The included breakfast and free cocktail reception each night really saves you a heap of money and staff were very helpful with booking tours and the like. The only negative I'd point out was we agreed to do the Hilton timeshare presentation which was supposed to be 90 minutes long and they picked us up over half an hour late and then were very aggressive when we told them we had other commitments after already allowing them an extra hour of our time. I'd avoid the timeshare presentation as when I ran the numbers myself it worked out to be an expensive fort.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We celebrated my wife's birthday and our anniversary at the Embassy Suites Waikiki this September and could not be happier with this location. Service is top flight and the location is superb if you enjoy being near the beach and have access to awesome dining and shopping options. The custom breakfast is another great reason to stay here. Cheers and Aloha!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel is not a 5 star luxury accommodation but the location is really handy. pretty much in the Waikiki beach walk zone so downstairs and you are in amongst it. not noisy either. complimentary breakfast - not the nicest food but able to find something in there. pool is a bit of a let down - very small and not deep and just heaps of kids in it. we did receive a complimentary upgrade to a 2 bedroom suite on our return to the hotel which we really appreciated! we found it strange that there were no cups or utensils of any sort in the hotel suite -just to have a cuppa or a snack (even though there is a jug). Maybe it's an American thing?

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I was pleasantly surprised to learn that a Waikiki hotel offered a full breakfast and nightly happy hour, just as the Embassy Suites on the mainland do. The location is very good. Although not immediately next to the beach, it is a short walk across the street. I also love the proximity to the various Waikiki shops and restaurants, as well as close access to Fort DeRussy and the Hale Kia Hotel (especially beneficial for military members and their dependents, with a small px/shopette, restaurants, and discounted parking for those with a military ID). The suite was well appointed, with two rooms. The room needed a deep cleaning and could have used more attention to detail by the housekeeping staff. All in all, my experience there was very good.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: A different kind of Embassy Suites. Two towers, 21 floors and an open air lobby and dining area. Located one block from the ocean right next to the Trump tower. Beautiful pool area. We upgraded to an ocean view corner room and it was really nice. Two balconies, one off of the living room and one off of the bedroom. This proved to be an ideal location to watch the spectacular fire works at the Hawaiian Village on Friday night. One advantage with the Embassy is that there is no resort fee. Most of the resort hotels in the area do have a resort fee of about $40. Parking is valet only and it costs $38 per day which is pretty standard for the area. The breakfast buffet is pretty normal for an Embassy with a few Asian selections added for the many Japanese tourists. The evening manager's reception will be familiar to those who have stayed at other Embassy Suites hotels.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: the complimentary breakfast and evening cocktail two hours make this hotel extremely good value. The location is great, close to great restaurants, the beach, nail salon, massage, ABC stores, Pharmacy, Supermarket - everything you could want for a relaxing holiday. Also 5 minutes walk to a big Ross for Less store!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Second stay here.... Has to be the best place in Hawaii...Rooms are amazing... Service is perfect... Staffs are extremely professional and friendly...Entertainment at night is the best... Specially Wednesday and Friday.. A must do and its free.. But I would pay to see them singing.... Don't ever let them go....Pool is perfect for kids....Breakfast is greatPlace is really cleanLocation is perfect right in the centre....Keep up the good work as it's all about a team effort really...Another week to go before we have to leave but one thing is sure.... We will be back....Thanks again for the amazing stay we are having.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed in this hotel in August this year for 7 days, great hotel in regards to accomodation, service and location. We had a great time up to the last night when we woke up and found someone had opened our door and stole our Ipad which was sitting on the kitchen bench, the entry into the room is via a security card so I am at a loss to know how anyone could have got access to our room - I can only assume it might have been someone who works at the hotel or the door security code had been hacked by someone - strongly suggest you buy and use a door wedge alarm if you intend staying here.Have not received any comment from the hotel in regards to the incident..

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Very clean, comfortable and modern. We booked our 8 night stay here and we had a very enjoyable stay. the staff were friendly and a beautiful refreshing drink was offered to everyone at check in. The breakfast and managers reception was a lovely surprise. Plenty of food options as not everything is appealing for overseas visitors. Made to order omlettes are worth the wait in line. YUMMY and a great way to start the day. The hotel is in amongst all the shops and very close to beach. Price was on the higher side of average (only just) but worth it. Highly recommend and I would stay again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Located very conveniently to shops and the beach this was an excellent place to stay. Clean spacious room with a view across the city and to a limit extent the beach, easy access to the pool and friendly staff all made this hotel a great experience.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We have just completed a 7 night stay at the Embassy Suites as a family of three.The rooms are clean and comfortable with the major advantage being that the accomodation has a seperate bedroom and living space, which is brilliant if you have a baby/toddler that needs to sleep during the day. The blinds are block out so you can darken the room which is another plus.The buffet breakfast is good, but you will have to wait 10-15 minutes in line if you want cooked to order eggs.The only downside to this property is that there is no shade in the pool area after 11am, so for us, with a one year old, it really meant that we couldn't be there during the heat of the day which is a shame as we had thought our afternoons would be spent poolside, and we couldn't do it. The staff were all friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: A wonderful experience. Not the least expensive option, but worth every penny. Traveling with a party of six including one infant. The two bedroom suite was perfect with our needs. Only negative, the walls are a bit thin. You can hear your neighbors talking.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel is a great property. The hotel is very clean. The staff are super friendly and are attentive to the guests. The staff worked hard during the busy complimentary breakfast buffet. They checked to make sure the guest had a pleasant breakfast. The bartender was nice during the evening reception. I really enjoyed my stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great value. Great staff. Clean rooms with plenty of space. Great for families. Breakfast and managers reception was great when traveling with kids. Not on the beach but great beach view and less than a block away. No complaints.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed for 10 nights with my wife and 2 young kids. The pool area is great for kids. The breakfast & the manager’s reception were fantastic. All staff were very helpful. The hotel is close to shops & the beach. For a family you won't find a better.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: It is located to walking distance to any beaches and shopping main streets. This hotel comes with unbelievable amenities. They have free buffet breakfast every day and it is not simple continental sort but order to Omelets, potato, fresh salads and all the different varieties. They also have managers reception between 5:30 to 7:30pm every night which you can get all kinds of free drinks...not just beer or soft drinks but cocktail, wines, spirits and some light snacks. No hotel provide this varieties free of charge. Room is very clean and some room has nice 180 degree ocean view(though it is not very ocean front but good enough to see beautiful sunset and surfer drifting the waikiki beach-my room was hula tower 2033). Only issue we had was a little pricey daily valet fee of $38 but I assume all other hotel in the same area may charge the same or higher...anyway, this is a definitely good option for big family and somebody for like to enjoy some adds-on savings!!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We were here for 7 nights. Checking in early simply cos you arrived on a morning flight is always a bonus. Room very spacious. We were in a odd number room on the 7th floor so we had the sun on our balcony from around 2pm and great sea partial view. You get a very generous free bar and some snacks each evening. Breakfast is very good provided you like omelettes/fried eggs otherwise good. On the downside some housekeeping issues Internet didn't work on android phone note did on iPad and wished breakfast staff prioritised their time clearing tables rather than offering to get you a coffee. Special thanks to the hard working bar server nearest the food area. Cheerful and welcoming every night

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was our New years eve getaway. It was just the best location, best room, best view, across the street from the beach and down the street from amazing shopping. Could hear the waves at night. Happy hour managers special free drinks, the pool was beautiful, free breakfast. Everything was perfect from beginning to end.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We brought our two little ones to Oahu and stayed at the Embassy Suites in Waikiki, which was a great location, the beach was a few blocks away and shopping was down the street. We rented a car but didn't drive much. The weather was perfect, although it was very humid most days, and it stormed one afternoon. I am rating this hotel high because we had great service - at check in, bell hop helped with the bags, valet folks were always nice and helpful! I really liked the breakfast buffet, helped saved us money, we were always so full until late in the afternoon. The waiters were so understanding of the mess my baby boy made at our table. We were only able to enjoy the hotels managers reception one evening - drinks on the house and some snacks (nacho cheese and Chex mix), there was live music and we loved it, our boys danced along and loved it as well. I would highly recommend attending the managers reception. The only thing that bothered me was the knock on the wall by the neighbor when my baby was crying in the middle of the night (he was teething), not the hotel's fault but I didn't think the walls were that thin. Anyhow, Thank you Embassy Suites for a fabulous stay!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Free breakfast! Free drinks at sunset! Free internet! All for under $300. In Waikiki. Who can ask for anything more. Pool is in the shade until after noon time. Great! 5 minute walk (if you walk slow) to the beach! WOW!! And all suites with mini kitchette

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My family and I always stay at Embassy properties when we travel. The accommodations are comfortable, the amenities are amazing and the staff is always so friendly, helpful and professional. We recommend Embassy brand hotels to all of our friends and family and we always get wonderful feedback. Embassy has a way of making you feel like you're at your home away from home.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I loved this hotel, the staff were super nice, the hotel itself was perfect for the location (beach, shopping, restaurants), great breakfast and happy hour. The only downside was the $38 daily valet parking that was the only available option. That could consider either losing the price, or having a self parking MG option.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We loved this hotel. We splurged and got an ocean view. The rooms were very clean, nice bed and we had a living room with large couch and a second TV. This hotel has a great location for the price. There is a beach access right across the street and an ABC store right across the the street from the elevators.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I booked the room weeks in advance. Request not to be next to the elevator and that is where they put me. Told them and they said the hotel was booked but, they were still cleaning rooms and could have moved me. I stay with Hilton every week and have for over 12 years and they ignored my request. May no stay there again

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I selected Embassy Suites as I needed a separate sleeping area for my 16 year old grandson for the duration of our stay in Oahu. Embassy Suites was a perfect choice. The kitchenette and the oversized bathroom both added additional comfort for our stay. The breakfast, happy hour and pool were all terrific, but the best was the location. Just outside of our balcony was street entertainment. We were able to walk to a beach, have dinner across the street, run a few steps to ABC as needed and browse in the myriad stores - all in close proximity. I would recommend Embassy Suites to those needing privacy and a spacious hotel room with the added benefit of a marvelous location.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This Embassy Suites delivers as usual rspeciallyt with the breakfast buffet containing some local favorites for. visitors like rice and lots of pineapple. The pool is nice and it's walking distance to Waikiki Beach. The view from the top is nice. I love getting up early and being a short walk to the beach for sunrise while the family slept.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel is huge but the staff is the most hard working, helpful and friendly of any Hilton we've stayed at. The complimentary breakfast buffet is varied and well prepared but be prepared for crowds, long lines at the omelet stations and scarcity of empty tables. To alleviate some of the problems,staff members quickly bus emptying tables, find places for guests, refill coffees without asking and offer to get additional items. Rose seemed to be everywhere helping, smiling and making us feel at home. Aldrin, named after Buzz, also was so very helpful and friendly. The front desk staff, the housekeepers and the many staff working on maintenance were uniformly hardworking, friendly and always ready with a smile. The suites were immaculate and well appointed. The hotel's location is fantastic for walking to restaurants, stores, Fort DeRussy Beach, and Waikiki Beach. There is a nightly managers reception with great live entertainment on three nights. Our only complaint was the very crowded and rather small pool for so many guests and the noisy, crowded breakfast area.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Fantastic, best hotel , great Rooms. Included buffet breakfast was tops. Evening complimentary cocktails by the pool for 2 hours - unlimited!!! Nice. I'll be back, we stayed for 5 nights then one more at the end of the trip before departure. Pool was nice too but easy walk to the beach.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: After traveling for 7 weeks we decided to have a 7 day stopover in Hawaii to relax before heading home. From our arrival at the Embassy Suites to the day we left the staff there were always helpful, pleasant and friendly. Nothing a problem. The room was very comfortable and comfortable. Central to attractions, beach, restaurants and beach. Will defiantly stay again

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Wonderful latge suites which more than make up for any minor short comings. I suggest that you request rooms away from the elevators as they are quite noisy at night. Staff at reception and concierge are very helpful

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Almost everything about this hotel is excellent. The location is fantastic, the staff are all happy and helpful and the rooms and facilities are spot on. Added benefits like the manager's reception and complimentary breakfast are icing on the cake.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had 7 nights in the pride of America visiting all islands which was great but to come back to Waikiki and stay at the embassy was breath taking Hate lifts was able to stay in the pool level 4 floor accessible via escalator.Had a suite with separate bedroom and small lounge area was beautiful.Easy quick check in our room however wasn't ready but booked our bags in hired a car drive to north shore how amazing.Shopping at outlets was out of this world.Bonus was happy hour every afternoon didn't pay for a drink yet Thank you will defiantly be returning.A quick easy walk across to the beach Love love love Thanks you embassy

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed 8nights, 9days, We have stayed at this Hotel before,also stayed at the Hilton village, both locations great, This is a little more expensive than other Hotels, but well worth the extra , for family of 2 Adults, and 2 kids,. They want wi fi,breakfast fast, We like the great Breakfast Buffett ,which is included in price, Anyway fast check in , nice upgraded room, as Diamond member, plus no Resort Fee. The Hotel is to a very high standard, and its easy to find everything, near the centre(center) of everything, next to Yard house, and PF Chans, both great to eat at,along with Hard Rock, and of course Cheesecake factory, in fact loads of food places, The Happy two hours , with excellent bar service, and really great made cocktails, all servers , brilliant., so were the drinks,The cleaners, and all staff , were so friendly with us all, nothing too much trouble, this have gone to a triple A rated hotel in our opinion,, Excellent value , as stated, , pool, gm great, but get under the shade, at the hot times,many thanks to all at the Embassy suites, Saunders Family

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Loved the greating and cocktail, very spacious suites, unfortunately we had one by the life butCan request not to be there, good breakfast all we need, cocktails were a fun experience, we will stay again

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We spent three days in the Embassy during our trip to Hawaii Our room was looking located at the 14th floor with a nice view on Waikiki beachThe room is very well equipped and perfectly welcome families with possibility for children to sleep in the sofa bed We were warmly welcomed for check-in. The pool is very pleasant and the complimentary breakfast is very tasty. Of course it will be somewhat crowded between 8am and 9am but obviously this is clearly manageable The hotel is few feet from the beach and shopping centers. We had other experiences in Honolulu and clearly the Embassy is the best option with no hidden costs (no resort fees, notably)Will certainly come back for future travel to Honolulu

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We absolutely loved staying at this hotel. The staff were amazing and nothing was too much trouble, they really went out of their way to make our stay excellent and very enjoyable. The hotel is in a fantastic location and great for families. Breakfast and happy hour drinks each day is a great inclusion and added to the overall value, I don't think you could find better in the area. Thank you again, we can't wait to return at the end of August.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This Embassy Suites was convenient to Waikiki, but was the smallest Embassy suites room I have ever been in. On the positive side, they had excellent Hawaiian drinks at their free happy hour. Their breakfast buffet was also excellent. Their pool was nice and they had a hot tub. The hotel was not directly on the beach, but was close. Parking cost $38/day.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here for 5 nights on the first leg of our 25th wedding anniversay vacation early July. We booked a city view room to save $ as we had beachfront rooms at other hotels on our trip and got upgraded to a corner room on the 21st floor that had both city and ocean views (thanks Hilton Honors). The room was clean and comfortable, the bedroom a bit on the small side but the living area complete with dining table and chairs was spacious. The housekeepers were efficient and very friendly, I thought all the staff were good that way. Part of the reason we booked this hotel was the included breakfast and happy hour. I thought the breakfast was pretty good, the chef cooked omlettes were great and poplular and while the range of food wasn't huge it was different every day. The happy hour by the pool was a great deal with a wide range of drinks, the snacks were pretty basic (nuts, veggies & dip and chips), and they have live entertainment a couple of nights per week. Hard to complain when the alternative is being back home at work! Location wise it is not quite in the center of Waikiki but pretty close and everything is in walking distance. Plenty of restaurants nearby (the hotel coupons have a discount for Cheeseburger Beachwalk which was a great spot for delicious messy burgers), and we enjoyed dining by the beach at the Outrigger Reef (where we met in 1989) accross the road. I would say this hotel is a great spot for families, there were a lot of kids there, particularly around the pool which some might not like but we enjoyed the atmosphere it created. Comparatively speaking I think it would be difficult to find comparable value and would return.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We have just returned after a 10 night stay at the Embassy Suites from the start at check in we enjoyed the refreshing drink, to the free upgrade and exceptional staff service was fantastic, we enjoyed the daily breakfast and the evening Managers reception, our room was a 1 bedroom with a pull out bed which suited us as a family of 3, our housekeeper was very friendly and always greeted us each morning. The location is very central to the beach, bus lines, the city centre, and restaurants. The Embassy Suites exceeded our expectations in every way and we look forward to coming back. Mahalo

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed in a top floor corner suite city view room which allowed us to have a partial ocean view and spectacular city view, especially at night, from the roomy private lanai. The room was very quiet since you had no one on one side of you or above you. The hotel staff were all great and the location of the hotel was perfect for walking to the beach, shopping, and a good variety of restaurants to choose from. The only thing that needs improvement is dealing with the unsanitary conditions caused by the many birds going after your food in the outside 4th floor eating area during breakfast. We observed a large bird dive bomb a lady's food tray while she was eating. Another lady left her food tray on the table to go get something which allowed several birds to have a tasty breakfast of their own in her absence. The hotel needs to address this problem with some type of netting or just totally enclose the eating area. Other than this one problem, we loved our stay at this hotel and would most definitely stay here again. Trust me, you want room number 2124.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We booked a two bedroom suite with sofa bed. Perfect size for family. Comfortable beds. I believe that 6 people are allowed per suite. Hotel lobby is open air. Clean. Friendly staff. Pool. Reception hour early evening. Breakfast includes scrambled eggs, made to order omelettes, fresh fruits, pastries/breads, potatoes, white rice, sausage or bacon, cereal, oatmeal, etc & beverages. Only 1/2 block from beach. In the middle of main shopping area. Waikiki trolley depot is down Leward St. inside Galleries parking garage (short distance). Tons of ABC stores (however Longs Pharmacy/CVS is cheaper on many items). Subway restaurant, PF Chang's & Starbucks short distance. Shopping mall next to hotel also has Food Court on 2nd floor. Burger King & KFC about five blocks walking distance. For our family, using the Waikiki trolley (7 day pass) takes you everywhere important (hop on & hop off). If you book the luau at the Waikiki Aquarium, you will need a taxi back to hotel (approx $15 cab ride, too far to walk back with children in evening). City bus also has day routes around shopping areas. If you like flea markets, you can use the purple trolley route & shop to your heart's content (Tshirts 7 x $20, key chains $1, trinkets $1 - $2, shawls $5, etc). Pearl Harbor is also on purple route. Post office one block away. I believe this hotel was in the best location overall for everything. I will stay at this hotel again!! Very satisfied.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel is great, if you want to stay in the middle of the action then this is the place for you. The hotel was clean and very nice. The breakfast was great and even though the hotel was full the staff made the process very easy, they offer 2 lines of food with same options on both sides this way it moves all the people through quicker. They have a very nice pool deck with live music some nights. The rooms are very nice and clean. The only 2 complaints I have is the internet is slow and you must sign in every day on this trip this was the third Hilton property we stayed at and it had the worst internet setup, might be due to all the hotels around the property but it would nice if they could work on this. The other problem with this hotel for me is location, I would not stay in downtown waikiki, too much traffic and too much congestion. Now this is nothing on this hotel, so if you want to be in the middle of it this is the place to be.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stay here 1 week. The room really clean! The bed is comfy . The staff are nice! . Morning breakfast everyday the same( boring). May be food at Hawaii is expensive. Happy hours 5-7 free drink and snack same every day. We fly out late but we need to check out ontime.. In meantime they keep our luggage in lock room and they let us use the room in haft hours to take shower and change. Yes we recommend this hotel

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The Embassy Suites Waikiki was our first stop on vacation. The staff greeted us at check in with a smile and a fruit drink and we were quickly in our room. The suite was clean and maid service was fast and friendly. We chose the Embassy Suites Waikiki because of the Hilton quality, the location, the free breakfast and managers reception. The location is perfect for Waikiki Beach, restaurants or shopping.The only minor complaint was that the hotel was very busy and at times the elevator wait was long.I planned this trip in February. After booking the hotel, I called the Embassy Suites directly to ask questions about planning sightseeing activities. They transferred me to the Concierge Desk with an Expedia Local expert within the hotel for information. I spoke with Ross Asato and he was just great! Over the few months before we arrived, I emailed Mr. Asato many many times for information. He quickly responded and would add valuable information that made activity planning a breeze! So much so that I booked all of our activities on Oahu, The Big Island, and Maui with him. The evening that we arrived he had an activities packet completed and waiting for us, no waiting in lines! Thank you Ross!I highly recommend the Embassy Suites Waikiki, the Expedia Local Expert Ross Asato, and the Old Lahaina Luau!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our family vacation was extremely enjoyable. The staff was welcoming and friendly, and accommodating. Our room was clean and well kept. The breakfast was great, except the birds that had to be kept away from our food!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our close group of seven family friends stayed in the two bedroom suite in Waikiki. By far the best location and right next to all the shops. The free happy hour was great and the bar tenders were hilarious! The service of the staff was excellent, with the two breakfast chefs even remembering my omelet order every morning. Beds were extremely comfortable, including the pull out sofa bed which has a memory foam mattress. Definitely recommend to groups or families.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our family stayed at this hotel around July 4th. We were in a two bedroom suite which was really convenient for the whole family. The two separate bedrooms are joined by a common area in the middle. There was also a working mini fridge (not lukewarm), coffee maker and a microwave. I think there was also a complimentary microwave popcorn but I'm not sure since it disappeared so quickly. Check-in was excellent as was check-out. The hotel was packed an always busy but we never really had to wait for anything. Unlike other hotels we have stayed at (I'm talking to you Royal Hawaiian). The rooms aren't luxurious, but they were clean, well maintained, quiet and had everything anyone could want. If you still need anything, there is an ABC store selling everything you might need right across the street next to the Denny's. We were fortunate to be there for the 4th of July and although we couldn't quite see the fireworks from our room, we figured out that by standing on the beachside terrace at the end of the hallway, we had a great view of the fireworks. The only thing we didn't like was the breakfast buffet. We were traveling with our kids who have food allergies. So our negative experience is only intended to provide information for other travelers with food allergies. At breakfast, we asked if there were any items that would be safe for them to eat given their allergies. Perhaps we asked the wrong person, but the waitress we spoke to wasn't sure and didn't inspire confidence with her response which was kind of a shrug and a general warning that pretty much everything was off limits. I assumed it was because of the potential for cross-contamination. We asked to speak to the chef or anyone else about it to get more specifics. The waitress then went and spoke to what I presume was one of the chefs and then came back and reiterated what she had said earlier. Not wanting to take a chance, we didn't really eat anything and skipped it entirely on the following days. That was the only negative I can think of for this hotel. Other than that, everything was very nice. The location is close to everything, the beach is a short walk away and the main shopping areas even closer. The staff was always friendly and the valet was efficient and helpful.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: If you are going to Honolulu any time soon we would highly recommend the Embassy Suites at Waikiki. All round this hotel was fantastic, from the attentive staff to the quality of the suites and location we could not find fault. Complimentary Breakfast and the Managers reception included in the rates really differentiated the Embassy Suites from all of the other stops on this vacation.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The hotel was great - had all the amenities we were looking for. We stayed in a two bedroom suite for two adults and two teens, very comfortable and up to date. Beach was a short walk but somewhat rocky once we got there. The breakfast buffet was great and had lots of options for everyone. The nightly cocktail hour was also nice after a long day of touring. Great location for shopping and dining. Also food trucks right next door that we all enjoyed.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: For the amount I paid I thought I would get a memorable night at Hiltons finest hotel but they fell below my expectations. I debated wether to take a night and treat myself by even the room service food was bad. It looked like I ordered nachos from a movie theatre stand.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: An excellent place to stay , for a very relaxing holiday. We used the disabled room and it was very well equiped for a disabled person to stay. Room service was done twice a day. Staff were very helpful with anything that we asked for, or about.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: As a Hilton Honors Diamond member for many years, my wife and I were disappointed with the overall hotel. Don't get me wrong, the staff was friendly but again, as a Diamond member I feel we could have stayed at another Hilton property on Waikiki or probably another brand and received equal to or possibly better service. Bathroom area was not clean upon arrival. Hair in tub and toilet area. Crumbs left on table and living area which lends to not wiping off tables not vacuuming. Room smelled musty. Wife and I sneezed every time we entered room. Breakfast good however could have offered more variety. Complimentary managers reception was very nice but could have had better choices for snacks. Entertainment was extremely good.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great bartenders. Front desk staff were very efficient and helpful. Room was slightly small,but we were there to only sleep at night. Breakfast was good! It filled the kids up. The location was a good. It was a block away from Waikiki Beach, but you have to walked through another hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This Embassy Suites is pretty much like most other Embassy Suites, but its location across the street from an entrance to the beach and with a 1-2 block walk to the city buses which will take you everywhere in the areas along with a very good American-style (eggs, toast, cereal, fruit) breakfast make it an excellent base for seeing the Honolulu area. The breakfast, which received mixed reviews here, really was quite decent, with plenty to choose from and a pleasant place to sit and eat, although it did become a mob scene by 9am. So, if you want to partake of the breakfast, plan to get a fairly early start. The rooms were standard hotel, but clean and comfortable and the hotel is nearly attached on one side to a long arcade of shops and restaurants which runs along Kalakaua Ave. Getting to Honolulu proper and its museums and other sights will cost you a fortune in cab rides, so take the city bus which is both reasonable and convenient from here. The concierge desk can arrange transportation to Pearl Harbor on a common van service which stops at all the area hotels. Car rental for day trips is also available at a desk in a hotel a few doors down. This is a quiet and convenient place to stay in Waikiki.
