I cannot believe that management did not pass on the excellent reviews to Ray and I know that the guests leaving the reviews would be appalled to know this! I read some of the many reviews out to Ray who had tears of gratitude and I believe a sense of relief that his hard work and beautiful demeanor wasn't going unnoticed. Higher management, please pass on the reviews to staff when mentioned on here and especially to Ray! Isn't obvious that when staff are acknowledged for their hard work and rewarded they continue to be happy and productive employees. I have many friends coming to stay next year at the Embassy based on my reviews and I will ask them to check to see if Ray has been acknowledged and rewarded when they seen him next!!!!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Excellent all at the Embassy Suites in Waikiki. The best Embassy suite I ever stay. No other hotel compares with the brand. For the price you get the best deal. If you stay in any other hotel more expensive you won't get as many a helpful amenities you get here. If you stay at a hotel for a lower price the quality of the hotel facilities and amenities won't be even close of what you get here. Parking is the only drawback as it is with all hotels in Waikiki, but at less than a block from the hotel you get a secure inexpensive (cheaper if you are government or military) parking facilities at Fort Le Rouse.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My family enjoyed our stay at the Embassy. Breakfast had a good selection. Made to order egg station. Evening reception had a selection of wines, beer, and mixed cocktails.Hosts were friendly and frequently checked how we were doing. Restaurants and shops are walking distance.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Wonderful helpful staff. Breakfast and happy hour plentiful and never too much bother for any of the staff. Room impeccably clean. Central enough to bars and dining. Must visit the Yard Bar which can be accessed through the back of gge hotel. Would definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed 5 nights at the Embassy Suites. Upon arriving, we wereassisted by Jay, Eriko and Johnny at the front desk. From the momentwe arrived, they treated us like they wanted to do all they could to makeour vacation the best! We sat in an open air lobby to be checked in andgiven a guava drink which was quite refreshing! We were celebratingour 35th wedding anniversary and so we wanted it to be quite memorable.We weren't disappointed! The room was very nice with a view over the pooland out toward the ocean. Most mornings, we worked out in the gym whichwas never crowded. We went down to the 4th floor of the Hula Tower, acrossthe Lanai to the Aloha Tower and down to the 3rd floor to fitness center.Breakfast was best for us around 6:30. The evening receptions were nicewith bartender, Keola. He always had a smile and seemed to really enjoymeeting the guests and went out of his way to find something fun to say.We were on the top floor of the Hula Tower next to elevator but we had no problem sleeping. I can truthfully say...we didn't want to leave. I don't ever rememberfeeling that relaxed the entire vacation!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My preferred lodging when in Honolulu. Staff is excellent. Perfectly located. Great value for the money. Checking and checkout process is so comfortable. Only wish I had more time to just enjoy the accommodations.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel certainly epitomizes the spirit of Aloha! The staff were quite accommodating and pleasant. The beds were quite comfortable. The sofa bed in the living area was not real comfortable for sitting though. Be prepared to pay $35 a day for parking at the hotel. Valet only. This hotel is within easy walking distance of Waikiki Beach

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Will definitely be back. Staff was amazing. The evening managers mixer even had live music. Everyone went out of their way to make us happy. Rooms are comfortable and quiet. Close to everything. I definitely recommend.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great hotel in perfect location. Staff are very helpful and amenities are exceptional. Breakfast was very good lots of variety and staff always willing to help. Housekeeping were very good, always making sure the room was clean and tidy.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We've been to Honolulu on many occasions and stayed at different hotels along the way. These included the Outriggers (both of them). But this was clearly the best hotel have stayed at on the island. We always arrive on the early flight from Melbourne and I know that some hotels will hold your bags until check in (2-3pm) and not sway from this. However, despite the hotel being full the staff provided a nice refreshing drink on arrival, provided us with vouchers to the buffet breakfast upstairs and towels to lounge beside the pool. At 11.00am we were then told that they had cleaned our rooms and we could check in.We had thee bedroom suite with city views. I was amazed at the size of the suites and knew we'd made the right decision as soon as we entered the room. 2 queen beds were in one spacious room and then there was a living area with a sofa bed, table, mini fridge, coffee making equipment, TV, safe etc. The rooms were spotless, bathroom immaculate and 2 balconies.The beds & pillows were so comfortable and enabled us all the have a great sleep after long days tours, swimming, shopping etc.There are a few things which made this hotel very different. There are a lot of hotels that have a 'resort fee' hidden away until you check out. These vary from between 15USD to 30 USD per room per night. You get very little for them.Embassy Suites had no resort fee but even still you get certain extras that other hotels don't provide.1. Free breakfast. Cooked omelettes, fresh fruit, bacon, sausages, hash browns, cereals, breads/bagels etc. This can save a family $30USD a day.2. Manager's reception beside the pool. Free complimentary drinks (including beer / cocktails) between 5.30-7.30 every night. And boy weren't the cocktails potent! No watering down on these drinks. 3. Wi-Fi was fast and reliable.All in all, we had a brilliant trip staying here. I would find the extra dollars and look no where else. The location is in the best pocket of Waikiki on the Beachwalk too. Bars and restaurants close by and easy access to the beach across the road.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at this hotel 11/3 through 11/10......this was our fifth stay and again we completely enjoyed the room, staff, amenities and amenities of this Embassy Suites. Breakfast was fantastic each morning.....the reception was a great place to relax in the evening. I only stay at this hotel because of the all round quality. You can't go wrong.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The hotel's two room suites are unequaled by single room hotels in Waikiki. The accomodation makes you feel in a vacation home. Access to the beach, transportation, and nearby attractions were a leisurely stroll away.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Was at the Embassy Suites by Hilton Waikiki Beach November 10-17, 2016. Everything was absolutely fabulous and I am a hard person to please. The rooms were very roomy, clean, great view from the 17th floor. Bathroom was in pristine condition. The housekeeping staff always wanted to clean my room, even though I didn't need it. Breakfast: OMG...was wonderful. Slight variations every day. Omlette station was very very good. Everyone was extremely friendly and helpful throughtout our stay. We ran into one issue and the management staff went above and beyond to make thing right. Our favorite manager was Ray Rodney who checked on us every morning during breakfast and helped make our stay memorable. We miss you Ray! If you want to be in the middle of shopping and restaurants, and don't mind a very short walk to the beach, the Embassy Suites is the place to be. I didn't hear any noise from my room during my stay so the walls must be well insulated. Again, it was a fabulous stay and I will be back in 2018.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The Embassy Suites is the perfect location in Waikiki. The hotel is located just off the beach. Conventional to shopping and restaurants. Unlike most hotels nearby there is no resort charge and breakfast is complimentary. The front desk upgrade us to a ocean view after seeing it was our honeymoon.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Booked this hotel after reading recommendations from Trip Advisor since it was a reasonable cost with amenities provided, had good views of ocean, & close to dining/shopping/transportation. We had a wonderful 2 week stay here & were very happy with our choice. They have a nice friendly staff, got a great room w/view & had nice breakfast buffet included in cost.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The suite, staff/service and breakfast were great. The room had nice conveniences: microwave, variety of tea, coffee, comfy sofa and bed. The pool is nice. The food at the reception was nothing spectacular but it wasn't an issue since that and drinks at the reception, and breakfast, were included. I didn't mind being at a location that wasn't right on the beach and I'd definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: If you are looking for a clean room, friendly staff, and delicious free breakfast, all within walking distance of restaurants, shopping and the beach, then this hotel is for you!! We booked this hotel based on the trip advisor reviews and we were not disappointed. The free breakfast offered freshly cooked omelets to pancakes and fresh fruit. There is also plenty of seating outdoors to enjoy the beautiful atmosphere!!! What a treat! The complimentary evening reception was also fun!! Wines and mixed drinks were offered along with basic snacks such as carrots and chips and dip. Will definitely return here in the future!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I must admit when we booked this place, while the location was great and it is a Hilton, we were a bit hesitant regarding what the inclusion on the breakfast and nightly drinks. But wow, we were impressed. Firstly, the location is amazing. Secondly, the hotel is great, it is more quieter and less bustling than the other hotels in Waikiki and this makes it more peaceful to stay in. We were on the top floor in a 2 bedroom ocean view suite (I think only about 8 rooms on the floor in total). Big bedrooms, great to have a lounge and large decks.The breakfasts were incredible, don't believe the other reviews. Everything was there and so long as you made it down before 8.30am the omelet had no wait (and if you did wait, who cares, you're on holiday AND you can watch the chefs (2) cooking 3 omelets at a time to order......if you don't want to wait the rest of the buffet has everything anyone would ever want. And as for the evening drinks......a band every second night, nibbles (crudites, nachos, nuts, best crisps ever), and whatever you want to drink. I would definitely go back to this hotel again. And the staff were amazing.....they'd do anything for you.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was our 1st time in Waikiki and we had researched what we thought would be the best place to stay for ages. We took advantage of a Hilton Honours special which was great value. The hotel was in a perfect location so close to everything, shops and beach. The evening reception was great fun and the drinks so good. There cocktails were all fantastic and definitely very generous with amount of spirits in each drink!!!! Snacks great and plenty available. Pool was great temperature and plenty of space. Very clean and lots of space around the pool to park yourself for a day in the sun :-) We stayed in a 1 bedroom suite - ask for 2130. It was on a corner with a huge balcony. It was such a surprise to have been given such a fantastic room. Bed was lovely and comfortable. Only thing for us with a 17b year old and 10 year old would have been better if we could have another rollaway bed but they do not offer these. We would have to have gone to a 2 bedroom suite but would have to have compromised on the location. Staff all very friendly and happy, Overall you could not find better value for money.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at this hotel for 10 days in November and we can truly say we had a great time. We had other family members also staying at the hotel for a family reunion/wedding. The location of the hotel was perfect. It was close to the beach, the Royal Hawaiian center and the Ala Moana shopping mall. The one bedroom suite was spacious and clean. We chose to stay at the 19th floor and had a great view of Diamond Head and the Ocean as well as the boardwalk shops below. The breakfast and managers reception were an added bonus. The staff were always friendly and courteous and made us feel like family. We had a great time, specially at the managers reception which included a wide variety of mixed drinks such as mai tais, blue Hawaii, beer and wine. Having a band play every other day was a plus. We will definitely visit again, hopefully soon.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Ideally located. Great Service! Well appointed breakfast with friendly staff. Nice large suite. Good for large families. Atmosphere was always respectful and pleasant. Good advise if looking for entertainment ideas. Very close to all shopping and restaurants in the Waikiki area. Great fro daily walking.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Excellent location. Music and dance shows in the evenings just outside the hotel. Nice complimentary breakfast. Try to go before 7.30 AM to avoid the rush. Complimentary evening drinks in a relaxed atmosphere. Comfortable rooms. Complimentary wi-fi. Friendly staff. We found valet parking a bit expensive but it was definitely convenient.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed in a two queen bed city view room which had lots of space, two TVs and a large bathroom. The room felt spacious and had two balconies. Would definitely recommend this if you have adult children, just to give a bit more space. The hotel is well located just behind Outrigger Reef on the Beach. It's also in a great area near lots of shops and restaurants.The manager's reception was good value with cocktails, beer; corn chips, carrots, celery, ranch and goldfish. There was also a band playing.Breakfast was simple but good as it can be expensive to eat breakfast around Waikiki. With hot food, bagels, toast, juice, coffee etc. The gym was well appointed with three treadmills, weights area, cross trainers etc. The pool was spacious and a great area with lots of chairs and towels. We later checked into the Luana for a couple nights on a short stop off and Embassy Suites was a lot better than the Luana even for the extra cost. The hotel is also on a lot of the tour bus pick ups.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We arrived to find that our requested (and confirmed by our travel agent) bed configuration arrangement was not what the Hotel had for us. However, given the time of year we were able to get a two bedroom suite without much extra cost. The hotel staff noted that they have a lot of issues with wholesalers saying something has been confirmed when from their perspective it has not. But after that wee hiccup all was good. Great suite, great staff (especially Ben on the Expedia counter who arranged all our activities), great breakfast, fantastic location. Would certainly staff there again and happy to recommend it to all!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Couldn't be more impressed with the Embassy Suites Waikiki. Our one bedroom apartment (15th floor) was plenty large enough, with the bedroom (separate to the family room) containing two queen size beds. We had our 9 month old in a port-a-cot (supplied by the hotel) in the family room which worked fine. Everything was clean and all staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The breakfast (included in our rate) is just amazing - especially the made to order omelettes!It's a very short walk to the beach, the shops and even the rental car outlets are close by. The free drinks each night by the pool is also a very nice touch, with a lovely atmosphere of happiness and joy - which is how we felt the whole time staying at the Embassy Suites - we'll be back - no doubt! Valet parking is available onsite, but it's expensive ($52AUD) which I understand is comparable to most other hotels.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Big 25. Great breakfast and free happy hour. Awesome suite with great view and in a prime location close to downtown and major shopping and dinning areas but also just a two minute walk to the beach front.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had planned to stay two nights at the embassy suites on our way home from New Zealand. However after a long day and night traveling we arrived at the hotel thinking it was Saturday but found out it was still Friday. An extremely helpful resevationist Jinny was able to get us another night in our room. She also enabled us to check in to our room right away. Later in our stay, she provided valuable advice on places to eat, etc. All staff throughout the hotel was very friendly and helpful. Our suites was large with a partial view of the ocean which we enjoyed. The hotel is an easy walk to Waikiki beach and close to more shopping than your wallet can handle as well as lots of places to eat. One downside is that parking is $38 per day, which seems high. (We noticed that at trump tower across the street parking is $34 per day.) The other issue is slow elevators, one of which never worked the entire time we were here and service elevator was broken too. We had a similar problem at the embassy suites in saint Petersburg Florida apparently the Hilton doesn't value maintaining all elevators so that guests do not have long waits whenever they need to go someplace. Overall I would recommend this hotel for a very nice stay in Hawaii.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Overall I had a very good stay at the Embassy Suites. The location is good with multiple restaurants in very close walking distance, but unfortunately the hotel really only has city views. If you keep in mind that you receive free breakfast and 2 hours of free drinks every night, the price isn't too bad. When booking, definitely watch the pricing. I was ready to book, and the price went up during that process from $279 a night (for 2) to $578 a night. I kept looking and was ready to book elsewhere, when the price dropped back down. The only other issue was that we were thinking about bringing our daughter, but the price rose over $100 a night.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The great things about this hotel are that they are suites with 1 or 2 bedrooms, our rate included breakfast, wifi and evening drinks and nibbles. There was also no resort fee which is a HUGE bonus!!!The location is fantastic, it is only a 2 minute walk to the beach and to shopping.It is kid friendly and the staff are friendly, helpful and accomodating!!Valet parking was good as well at $35 a day.We will stay here again on our next trip and would definately recommend it to anybody going to hawaii!! :)

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Despite not being directly on the beach the Embassy Suites is a very good location for restaurants, shopping and a short walk to Waikiki beach. We overlooked the pool and had a great view of the ocean beyond Fort DeBussy park. All staff were helpful and friendly. The breakfast buffet was great especially the made-to-order omelet station! The band at the Manager's Reception was really talented and got the crowd involved.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: 2 room suites: check. Breakfast included: check. Free wifi: check. Free cocktail reception daily: check. No resort fees: check. Reasonable valet parking fee: check. Ocean view: check. Walk to the beach: check. Travelers underestimate the 2 room suite, but they are key with little kids. Would definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I checked into the Embassy Suites on Saturday and Jay at Registration was extremely professional and courteous. I mentioned that I had received the email to select my room the day before and when I went to finalize, the room was gone. I then chose another room. Jay looked and gave me a corner room in the Aloha Tower that provided a great view of the pool and ocean as well as the city. The morning Buffet was very good.This is my third visit to the Island and the first at the Embassy Suites. If I come back I will definitely stay here!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is a great place to stay close to the beach. The rates are comparable with other hotels in area, BUT Embassy provides full Breakfasts and an evening Reception!! The pool area is beautiful and plenty of lounges for sun bathing!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: From check in to check out our stay at Embassy Suites was fantastic. We were greeted with fresh drinks and warm smiles at check in. My family of 5 shared a 2 bedroom 2 bathroom suite with ocean view for 5 glorious days. We had to change rooms initially because we were place right next to the construction site however our second room was nice and quiet. There was more than enough room to share without tripping over each other. The daily breakfast, snacks, and happy hour were all fantastic. This breakfast is actually better than other Embassy Suites plus the staff at breakfast are amazing. The live music is a must the band is outstanding. I can not wait to return to Embassy Suites Oahu we thoroughly enjoyed our total experience. Everyone was top notch.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: After arriving early and exhausted thankfully we were given an early check in. This was greatly appreciated! We all enjoyed the breakfast, managers reception and pool immensely. Staff were all friendly and helpful. Our daughter was stung by a bee at the pool and Lewis was a great help, very caring and made sure she didn't have any reactions. He gave her a fruit punch which then became her favourite poolside drink. Thank you for your help Lewis. Room service and poolside meals were fantastic! We will be back :)

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed in a 2bedroom unit with 3 adults and 3 children. Its not a huge amount of space, but with the fold out couch in the lounge perfectly adequate and was good having 2 bathrooms. Service was great as always for Hilton and the breakfast huge though not flash. Big points for location - really great, thought the beach closest is very rocky. Pool gets very very busy - kind of like human soup in late afternoon which is not particularly appealing though cocktails and snacks another nice Embassy Suites touch. Our room however was on the second floor on the rd side - Whatever you do, try not to stay there. Its right across the road from the Food Trucks and when they close up for the night its very very noisy.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I stayed at the Embassy Suites with my family when we travelled to Hawaii.... For us this resort was perfect.. Good location - close to beach, restaurants, and shopping... The buffet breakfast each morning was very nice... rooms clean and spacious .. and the managers reception was perfect to unwind and relax after a busy day... Would highly recommend this resort for your stay in Honolulu ... you will not be disappointed ... Looking forward to staying here again when we next visit Hawaii...

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Had a girls trip to Oahu with my mum for my 30th Birthday. We stayed at the Embassy Suites for one week and paid for a Partial Ocean View Room. We received a lovely drink on arrival. Check in was quick. We got a top floor suite in the Aloha Tower which we were stoked about!! We had a lovely view of Diamond Head as well as part of the ocean through some buildings. I knew this building was located one block back from the beach so I still got the view i expect us more.. I thought it was a treat to have a view of Diamond Head! Note: you can also go onto the balconies at either side of the building on your level. For us this meant we could take a look overlooking the pool and the at the other side of the building overlooking the city buildings.The suites are awesome.. I booked this hotel because i wanted the decor to feel Hawaiian. I wasn't interested in a modern hotel room. The rooms were very clean and in my opinion well decorated! Loved the palm tree sheer curtains! Breakfast. FREE. What's to complain about? They alternated the pancakes and french toast each day otherwise it looked the same to me. Fresh pineapple everyday, yum. As a suggestion only; It might have been nice to have some plain low fat greek yogurt as a healthy alternative to the strawberry/berry/banana yogurts. Plus more of a variety of cut up fruits each day. As I said though, I'm not complaining.Evening drinks. Also Free! 5:30 -7:30pm. Great variety of drinks. We just had Mai Tais...delicious. A variety of snacks you can nibble on. Room service although great, came at a different time each day. Once at around 9am (bit early if you are having a sleep in?) And another time after lunch. Didn't bother me, just commenting as Ive read reviews that have commented the same. Consistency would be nice for some people I am sure.Pool. It was closed when we checked in. I won't lie, I was disappointed as we weren't told about the maintenance upon booking or prior to our arrival. They gave us access to the pool at the Outrigger across the road. Luckily for us though the pool reopened sooner than expected and perfect timing for us as a pool day was planned that following day. Beach access. Easy. Across the road down the pathway. Or walk down to the main beach area of Waikiki.Free wifi in room. No resort fees. Close to shops and restaurants. ABC store across the road from hotel is apparently the only one that has the Dole Whip (pineapple ice cream) according to one of my tour guides..another win! In conclusion; Definitely staying here again in the future. I had been to Waikiki before and stayed at the Hilton Hawaiian Village and the Royal Hawaiian. Obviously the Royal Hawaiian is a prestigious hotel. The Hilton Hawaiian Village is great also but Embassy Suites offers a wonderful location, no resort fees, free wifi, free breakfast, free evening drinks... Awesome stay! Thank you for making my 30th Birthday trip such a relaxing wonderful week!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I am a huge embassy Suitrs booster, but this one has outdone all of the locations that I have had the pleasure of staying in. Staff very friendly, accommodatiing, anticipates your every need. there not one thing our small group needed that was not available at this resort. Breakfast was to die for, plenty of hot fresh cfood, great variety and taste was great. My room bould not have been better.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our stay at the Embassy Suites was amazing. The entire staff was very nice and helpful. The only thing that I didn't like is that pool at the hotel became available to us towards the end of our stay, other than that you would have to go to the pool across the street at a different hotel. The concierge desk was very helpful and informative. The breakfast area and the happy hour area rocked. They had great food and snacks. I recommend this hotel, although it's not a beach front property, the beach is super close by. Our 2nd year anniversary was great and look forward to coming back with the entire family in 2017.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Have always been a big fan of the brand "Embassy Suites" I believe they've outdone themselves with this one. Very friendly staff, rooms kept neat and clean. Breakfast buffet had lots of choices (scrambled eggs a little stiff for my taste, but you can always get them cooked to order...line can be a little long at times, but worth the wait). Evening manager's reception nice w/live local entertainment. In perfect area w/lots of restaurants, good ole' ABC store, right across the street and the beach a stone's throw away. Mommy & me in Waikiki had a great time! :)

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My daughter & I stayed 3 nights in the Embassy Suites & found it to be in a good location & had all that we needed. We both had comfy Queen beds as well as a lounge area. The view towards the beach was lovely & the staff helpful. We were offered complimentary breakfast but after the first day ( straight off the plane ) we found local Cafes much more to our liking. There were food trucks just across the street & a short walk to all shopping needs.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My husband and I, and my parent's in law stayed at this hotel on the recommendation of a friend of a friend. Our room was one of the 1 bedroom suites with a city view. My parent's in law were in a similar room on the floor below. The view from our room at night was spectacular with the lights of the city as a back drop. As we were out most of the time an ocean view was not important to us. The bed was super comfortable and we both slept well. There is a mini kitchen with a microwave, fridge and sink. We loved the breakfast that is included and we were spoilt for choice with food ranging from cereal to a hot breakfast and everything in between. The wait staff were super friendly and helpful. There is also a gym and a laundry at this hotel which came in very handy on a couple of ocassions. This hotel is a family friendly hotel and there were families with children ranging from almost birth upwards. There is a beautiful pool area with shade umbrellas available and a children's pool, although halfway through our stay they closed the pool for maintenance. But it was more than made up for by the fact that the hotel had made arrangements for their guests to use the Outrigger hotel pool. Happy hour at 5.30 pm was our favourite time of the day. Free drinks and cocktails until 7.30 pm along with nibbles. The hotel is very central to everything - beaches, shopping, restaurants and transport. You could also book buses at the bell desk if you needed to go places such as the Waikele Outlets for shopping or Pearl Harbour. We even walked one street over and caught a trolley bus to the Ala Moana shopping centre. The trolley buses are very convenient and very cheap. The recreation booking desk in the hotel was also very good and helped us to book a day tour around the island with Huka Tours. We had a fabulous day and visited the Dole Pineapple Plantation, had lunch at the Polynesian Cultural Centre and stopped off at many points of interest on our way around the island. We highly recommend this tour. we absolutely loved our stay in Honolulu and were very sad to leave. We are making plans to come back in a couple of years and will be definiltely staying at The Embassy Suites. For comfort and value you couldn't get any better.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Just a perfect hotel for a relaxed and trouble-free holiday - highly recommended for a romantic get-away, genuine 'down time', or a family get-together.Ideally located for the beach, shopping, restaurants, and transport.Accommodation is in suites so large that they almost qualify as apartments, a large and well appointed lounge with a separate mammoth bedroom, a small kitchenette and an ample (well stocked) bathroom complete the suite.Beds are mammoth and VERY comfortable.Complimentary WiFi is efficient, reliable, and FAST - European and Australian hotels, take note and learn. (remember to log on daily)We appreciated the colonial charm of the 'Hawaiian' timber furnishings and dismiss comments that it is dated; this hotel is NOT all chrome, faux marble, and glass and it is SO right for Hawaii.So nice to constantly enjoy a GENUINE warm welcome from delightful staff in every area - NOT the 'have a nice day' that you get in so many American Hotels but all staff seem to a delight in giving great service.Tariffs include excellent breakfasts; you will NEVER go hungry and the menu covers American, European, and Asian tastes.Complimentary cocktails are served nightly with nibbles around the pool for 2 hours and the party rocks. Here's a hint, tip the barman a dollar or two and the 'kick' in your cocktail will treble !!To the people who complain that the cocktails are served in plastic glasses - it's party time around the pool, so glass is a no no. Entertainment from a local band who just 'get it' and create just the right vibe.This hotel combines excellent facilities and service with a truly relaxing atmosphere.We are looking forward to our next visit.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Location - one block away from the beach. Easy to walk to the beach using a walking path between buildings. The kids were not impressed with a homeless guy sleeping on the path but we stepped over him. He was still there hours after we were done at the beach and had to step over him again on our way back to the hotel. Close to places to eat and shopping.Price - A little spendy but expected staying in Hawaii. Room - Very clean and updated. Had no issues with noise in the room. Kids loved walking on the balcony and looking at the ocean. Not an amazing view but you could see it from the balcony. Food - The breakfast area was always clean and plenty of seating. There was a lot of people during breakfast but the food was always stocked. Never had an issue. Tables were cleaned quickly as guests left. The evening drinks and snacks was a great way to end the day. The live entertainment was great and the kids loved listening to the band. The snacks usually included pretzels and goldfish. Nothing too exciting but it was standard snack items kids would enjoy. The drink options were limited but was okay. Staff - Nothing over the top for front desk. Those working the breakfast were always friendly and helpful. The bartenders next to the pool were also friendly and made for a welcoming area. Overall - Open area from lobby to the elevator leaving outside traffic to walk around. In order to take the elevator to your room you had to have a key. That became an issue when one of us was waiting on the other. You were stuck standing by the elevator waiting for the other person. While outside walkers were with you basically just checking out what the area was. Downfall - There was a lot of homeless people sleeping around the property in walk ways. Wife wouldn't have felt comfortable on her own going to the beach knowing she had to deal with homeless people.We had 5 - 2 adults, 3 kids (8,10,15).

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Last weekend my sister and I went on a staycation at Embassy Suites. We originally had a room with only one king bed however my sister and I needed two beds. Julia in reservations was so nice and upgraded us to a 2 bedroom suite. We had a bathroom and balcony in each room. I love the Keurag coffee maker and liked having the pool towels in the room. Also when we checked Davin greeted me when we arrived. Super friendly and full of Aloha.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We've been staying at this hotel for our vacations for the last four years and we'll definitely come back. We love the morning breakfast, the happy hour is amazing and our daughter enjoys the pool a lot.Even though this year the pool was closed one of the managers, Tammy, went over and beyond to make us happy. She promptly helped us with our check unexplained that we can go to the Outrigger neighbour hotel for the pool and gave us a very nice room. Thank you for paying attention to all the small details

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is an ideal hotel in Waikiki for families especially those with small children. We also saw a lot of couples and I personally don’t think you can come to Waikiki and not expect families at your hotel – especially since this one has free breakfast, 1 and 2 bedroom suites, and a free happy hour – what’s not to love! The hotel itself is more up to date than I thought it would be. The room was very nice and had a Hawaiian feel to it. The mini kitchenette was more than adequate with a fridge, microwave, and sink. The room also had a desk and chair, a sofa and side chair plus coffee table. We had 2 decks off our suite. The bedroom had plenty of space for our pack-n-play that my toddler son slept in. It also had more than adequate storage including an armoir and dresser plus another TV! Our room must have been upgraded – Hula Tower 2032- ask for it! It had a great ocean view and was quiet even though we were next to the elevator. Avoid floor 4 through – that’s the floor for the pool and breakfast area – I imaging that floor would get loud. The hotel has an amazing happy hour that is essential a 2 hour open bar!! Every night we went at 5:30 on the nose, to grab a drink before dinner. It was a little hard with the time change and a toddler – he was super tired at dinner at night and he woke up for 2 days before 5am, finally on the last day he slept still 6:30. It’s fine though since then you can get breakfast before the crowds and be ready to hit the beach early! The pool was closed while we were there but we made do since the beach was super close and the pool next door was literally a 1 min walk away (don’t listen to the complainers below). They opened the pool a few days earlier than expected and it was open on our last day but we didn’t even use it. The location is ideal – walking distance to everything! Lots of cheap restaurants too – we found a bunch that we liked – there’s spam musubi shop nearby, several amazing ramen spots too. We liked AGU ramen, Ramen Nakamura and Aloha Table. The food court in the plaza next door had great burgers (Mahaloha burger) and yummy desserts. The main Waikiki beach is really nice despite being busy. We rented a standup paddleboard for an hour ($25) and took turns on it – we both got to see sea turtles swimming! My son enjoyed playing in the sand for hours at a time! If you walk down the beach to the sea wall, there is some structure near the wall that you can snorkel around and see a few fish. We love snorkeling but with a toddler we don’t get many opportunities to see fish!We also rented a car and parking was expensive ($38/day) but it allowed us to check out a bunch of other amazing beaches. Lanikai was our favorite. We also went to Kailua next door. And we did a bunch of beaches on the north shore which were less ideal for toddlers. We did see more turtles there though! Overall I would definitely recommend this hotel for families or really anyone wanting a convenient location with plenty of included amenities. We stayed at the Hale Koa (military hotel) with my parents before and it was also nice, but this was even better! Just check for when the rates are decent and be aware that parking is expensive. Have fun!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We have just come back from an 8 day stay at the lovely embassy suites. The staff the breakfast and the drinks each night made for a wonderful holiday. Our only disappointment was not being told beforehand that the pool would be out of action for the time we were there. Also our room was located in the aloha tower room 1411 and our bedroom wall backed on to the lifts and the noise from this did not allow for restful sleep. So beware of all rooms on any floor ending with 11. The air conditioning was rather noisy this time. We would stay there again but definitely no where near the lifts.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: After completing the Norwegian Circle Island Cruise we decided to stay a few more days and just enjoy the beach. We booked a suite for 2 couples which had 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms and a common area. The staff treated us very well and we took advantage of the amenities and services. They had live music one night while we were there. The band played oldies and new releases with equal accomplishment. It was a short walk to the beach and the hotel proved totes and towels for us to use. It was a great experience!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel is amazing, the rooms sizes are great, the breakfast amazing, the evening drinks are fabulous and above all the staff are amazing. You management should be so proud that this hotel offers exceptional customer focused service... all our needs were meet in this hotel, and I'm fussy!! Our arrival was met with a box of chocolates to help us celebrate our 20th anniversary, we are upgraded to a 2 bedroom partial ocean (I'd booked a one bedroom ocean view). the rooms were spotless, and spacious for all our luggage. I cant fault anything with the room and all it's amenities. The staff were so friendly and willing to provide you with an exceptional holiday .. and they did.There is only one thing that I think would be nice to see... Vegemite for us Aussies at breakfast!!there's a huge Japanese influence for breakfast and considering us Aussies are flooding Hawaii continuously throughout the year, I think it would be great to see the only item I can think of that I did miss whilst overseas.. Vegemite. Special mention to Lewis, thank you for my Chi Chi's around the pool. Also the lady that looks after room service, again exceptional service and brilliant people.we'll be back .. I just have to pay off the credit card after assisting the economy in Hawaii. :-)

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Booked (and REGRETFULLY pre-paid) for a stay 10/15/16 - 10/20/16. We stay at Embassy suites across the globe (GOLD Honors member) so we know what to expect. In fact, I've stayed at this particular hotel 4 times previously with no problems. This time, EXTREMELY disappointed. So here's my view of the "Goods" and the "Bads" for this past week.Goods:(1) Easy access and close to the beach(2) Breakfast and nightly happy hour included (I'm not stating "FREE" because I'm sure we pay for it in the cost of the stay).Bads:(1) Booked in May, arrived Saturday afternoon 10/15 and was told the pool was CLOSED. We should have been advised prior to arrival and given options to cancel or relocate. When asked, many of the employees themselves did not know until a day or two prior to it closing. How can one go to Hawaii and the pool be closed for the entire week? Although they offered a pool at a different hotel across the street, it would have been very inconvenient to transit back and forth, especially if we needed something from our room. We decided to forego the offer to use a different hotel's pool and did the beach instead.(2) Every time we retrieved the car from the valet, it arrived with more dents and scratches than when it was turned over. Significant scratches.(3) Visitors with LARGE inflatables crowded the small elevators night and day making it difficult to comfortably and conveniently reach the room. When we approached the manager, we were rudely informed that Hawaii did not have laws against bringing inflatables on elevators. Ok, we get that....but shouldn't the hotel think about applying a local "Hotel Policy". Either take the steps, or deflate the toys prior to getting into an elevator for the convenience of other guests.(4) The hotel was crowded with kids running and screaming all over the place, in the dining area, on the patio, in the hallways, etc. I know this is not the responsibility of the hotel, but it certainly made the stay less enjoyable.(5) Upon returning to our room one evening, we exited the elevator and were met with someone's dirty, sandy shoes, and laundry laying in the hallway. Again, not the hotel's fault, but really? That's just gross.(6) We asked to speak to a manager about all of the above, and were met with a ho-hum yawning attitude. We were informed we needed to speak with the manager the next morning.(7) Next morning, asked for the manager. Advised him of our concerns and informed him we had decided to depart 2 days early (hence, this is why I regretted pre-paying because we lost 2 day's stay at $239 a night....nearly $500 down the drain). His response to us...."Ok. You're all checked out. Bye." Now that's Customer Service (not). Additionally, we had to pay 3 nights at another hotel because of our disappointment in this Embassy Suites. Another 3 nights is not cheap on top of what we lost by moving early from Embassy.So, would I recommend this hotel again? Maybe or maybe not. If the hotel values its customers and customer service, they should review their policies and make a few changes.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Excellent location. Staff very friendly & always willing to help. Breakfast was great as well afternoon happy hour with good entertainment several nights a week. I have stayed here at least 3 times per year since it opened in 2006.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had a wonderful staff. All the staff were friendly and helpful. We hated to leave. We had a great view of Diamond Head from our room. The breakfast was especially good, and we enjoyed eating outside each morning. The hotel is in a great location.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We loved this motel. The people treated us great, the suite was large and clean. The bed was very comfortable. The amenities we used, such as the business center and the laundry room were well kept. The complimentary breakfast was a fantastic plus. We most definitely would stay here again if we come back to Oahu.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Absolute perfection, from each and every staff member, management are to be congratulated on their exemplary customer service. Nothing was too much of an effort, for this we thank you. The evening entertainment by the band was an absolute standout, they are super amazing. Highly recommend the guided tour of Pearl Harbour, particularly on the twenty seater, very informative, our guide was the best.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: It is a bonus having a suite and the location of this hotel is in the prime position in Waikiki. It is very family orientated with an excellent buffet breakfast of generous proportions. The Manager Cocktail 2 hours each night was a further bonus. However, the snacks offered each night could be more appealing. Superb housekeeping, fast and efficient. Rooms are a little old but certainly well maintained and clean. Aircon was not able to lower the rooms temp to a low level. Free WiFi (for HHonors members anyway) was very good, BUT why you have to log-on every 24 hours I don't understand. Surely (as other hotels do), the access could be coded in for duration of the stay? The swimming pool being down for maintenance for the last 4 days of this stay was a bummer and guests should have been advised of this before making a booking!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our family of 4 stayed in a two room ocean view suite for 5 nights. Views were nice (blocked a bit by the Outrigger, but didn't bother us). We had a fantastic view of the fireworks from the big Hilton complex up the road. The free breakfast daily was good - reasonable freshness and variety, and very convenient. Bills Sydney is just down the street (about 200m walk) if you need a 'real' coffee. The accessibility to Waikiki shops and the beach was good. A short, easy walk. Our kids are 6 and 8. And they are happy with just the beach, so we only need to carry a room key and a towel each. There's a free Managers Reception each night. This involves 2 hours (5.30-7.30pm) of a basically open bar (free cocktails, beers, juices, etc) and snacks (nachos, breadsticks, carrot sticks, dips). Some nights there were big lines. Some nights were quiet. They also have the kitchen open, which made an easy dinner option after a big day. The hotdog and cheese pizza were winners. So was the grilled chicken and veg. The spring roll appetizer was extreme (see photo).Only frustration with the dining was some mornings at breakfast they were really slow at clearing and cleaning. And some nights it was near impossible to find a server to place a menu order with. The room itself was good. It had a lounge/dining space with a sink and bar fridge. The bedroom had 2 queen beds. Beds were comfortable. Pillow options were amble. There were balconies off both the lounge and bedroom. Bathroom was a good size. Room was well cleaned daily, by lovely staff. We'll probably stay here next time we come to Honolulu.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The location is fine, the cleanliness average but this "all suite" hotel is misleading. The two rooms are tiny, not what you expect for a one bedroom suite. The advertised kitchen/kitchenette was a joke. There is a sink, a microwave and a coffee machine. That's it. No silverware/cutlery. Not even a spoon. No plates or bowls. You get 2 water glasses and 2 paper cups for the coffee machine. Front desk staff were surly each time spoke with them. I would not stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Loved our stay at the Embassy Suites. The suite was super clean and spacious. The service was excellent as they make sure your stay is great. The free breakfast was awesome every morning. They had quite a variety but changed out a few items everyday. Still good. Managers reception was super awesome, loved the free drinks and the entertainment was awesome. Those guys, father and sons playing were awesome. They played a variety of music from different decades. My kind of staycation. Eat, drink, relax, and enjoy the music.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Can't beat the hospitality and convenience of Embassy Suite, Beachwalk. You are centrally located! You free breakfast alone would cost $$$ at a restaurant and the free evening drinks are a great start to an evening out or relaxing evening in. Have stayed at this hotel the last 4 yrs and will do it again!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The housekeeping staff is amazing. My housekeeper, Jenna, is quick, tidy and very sweet. The breakfast staff is outstanding, making omelets quickly and they even use fresh eggs if asked. Aldrin, in the breakfast area has been a delight every morning of my stay and always freshens my coffee with a smile on his face. Of the breakfast staff, he is the most friendly and helpful. The bartenders at the manager's reception are very friendly and make a great Mai Tai. Overall my stay has been lovely, even with the pool renovation going on. The only annoying thing is the internet. Constantly having to reconnect and will just go out randomly, but I guess that's to be expected with a large international hotel with a bunch of users.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed a full week the food was excellent the managers reception 5:30 to 7:30 at night was excellent. it's in the middle of the hub for all activity pick ups. 1 block in each direction in the middle of shopping in the middle of great restaurants surrounding it one block from the beach nice pool that the kids enjoy. the staff at the bar at the breakfast and at the managers reception are very helpful very courteous. there is a Starbucks at both exits within a half block.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We have stayed there a few times , but this thins the manger Ray went out of his way to help me . He was so good in fixing our room up , the second time we came back . I rang him a few times and I said I was sorry but he was so good thanks , Ray .

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This Embassy Suites location is conveniently located, steps away from the beach, shopping, and restaurants. However, I woke up with insect bites every morning, in an increasing amount each day. The housekeeping is not meticulous, given this is a beach location, and many families likely stay on the lower levels, which is where we were. The complimentary breakfast every morning was well stocked, and saved us time and money in the mornings. Valet and front desk staff are very friendly, and give great advice on where to visit. Overall, it's a very good value for the location, but the bug bites make me second guess returning again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great staff, great rooms and good rates...what more can i say. The rooms accommodate families with 5 or more which makes a big difference for me. The breakfast buffet is da bomb and allows you to get an early head start on enjoying your vaca. They take pride and really work hard to make you comfortable...

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Embassy Suites Waikiki has a great atmoshpere for family and business patrons alike. Great service, professional employees who care about the customer and a very nice facility as well. A great value and a great time!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We spent a total of 10 nights at the Embassy Suites.The rooms were very clean and tidy. Small but spacious enough for a family of 6. We were on floor 4 in the aloha tower which is the same floor as breakfast, happy hour and the pool which was handy. Breakfast was excellent and a great selection. Freshly made omelettes were delicious.Happy hour was fun, lots of drink options - alcoholic and non alcoholic. Kids enjoyed the snacks available.Close to shopping and restaurants.Would have given 5 stars however when we first checked in they loaded the accommodation cost to our travel card. They appeared to have done this twice meaning we were unable to access funds that we had for our holiday. We tried to email whilst we were on another island but had a poor response. We spent a further 2 nights at the embassy suites at the end of our holiday. We tried to sort out what had happened with our card however this did not happen and we ended up having to use our NZ credit card despite having a significant amount of American dollars on our travel card. Very frustrating and we are still waiting for it to clear so we can then transfer back to NZ dollars.They did upgrade us to a lovely 2 bedroom room for the inconvenience but we would rather of had our money to use!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: this is one of the best hotels we have ever stayed in. The staff was great we did not like the first room so they moved us no question the 2nd room looked out on the street very nice and was on a higher floor which we like. The breakfast was great and the atmosphere was great like being outdoors but covered in case of rain. The managers receptions was the best free snacks and great free drinks. The way to go and free wifi. If we ever come back to Honolulu we will stay here.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Centrally located in Waikiki, close to an excellent beach, and many dining and shopping options. Complimentary, cook to order breakfast offsets the daily cost. Valet parking was very efficient, never waited more than 2 minutes for the car.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Loved staying here, super friendly housekeepers who provided anything requested. Kept rooms very clean and well stocked on coffee and creamers in the room. Everyone had smiles on their face and made it enjoyable. Breakfast buffet has great selection of choices. This is located in a excellent spot for Restauraunt's & shopping.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Ben Puccetti at the concierge desk in the Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach was awesome. He helped us book 3 days of things to do while there at very fair prices. We golfed, went to Pearl Harbor and chartered a van to the North Shore. He was very knowledgeable and courteous. I would recommend him to anyone staying in the area. I would like to mention our driver of the van was named Che. We told him we would like to go up to the North Shore and swim with sea turtles. He took us to the spot. He was a very nice guy and we had a great experience with him.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was our second visit to Embassy suites in 18 months. We enjoyed our last 9 night stay here so did not even look at alternative locations for our recent 9 night stay in Waikiki. I must say that we were extremely disappointed this visit and found that standards have slipped significantly.I'll start with the positives.. Breakfast and evening drinks are included in the room rate. Housekeeping service was excellent and our Housekeeper quickly learnt our routine and cleaned around it. She was great! The location is as good as you can get in Waikiki - close to everything without being over-crowded. The rooms are an ok size. Valet and Bell Service were very positive and helpful and the team who worked the breakfast were happy and friendly. Pool area is nice but shade is limited.Unfortunately, the negatives outweighed the positives for us. We arrived a 2:55pm from another island and were told our room was not ready but would be ready in 5 minutes. We were then left waiting for 35 minutes with little care factor from the front desk. In fact, every dealing we had with the team at the front desk ended with us feeling disappointed and upset. We never received our welcome bag. The bag would have come in handy. The quality of the breakfast has declined and we found one of the omelette cooks did not know how to cook an omelette. Being Australian, we learnt from our last visit and brought Vegemite with us so that we could have toast each morning. Pool side service was slow (if any was provided). Advertising states a kitchenette. This is little more than a teeny fridge with a basin and microwave that doesn't work. No crockery or cutlery provided. Probably deceptive to call that a kitchenette... WiFi was simply awful. If you need this to work or it is important to you, stay elsewhere. It was frustrating having to log back into the system with passwords every time you wanted to access WiFi and then wait 30 minutes for a couple of emails to download.I also hate to say it, but many of my fellow guests would leave their children at the pool for hours at a time unsupervised and as there are no hotel staff present, nothing was done and the kids running wild impacted the safety of other children in the pool and the comfort of other guests. On check out, they stuffed up our room charge and then charged us twice. The girl on the desk clearly did not know what she was doing. Whilst we managed to get this resolved about a week later, the entire incident ended up costing us an additional $300 in currency conversion fees and lost currency rates. This was not about holds on funds (which is standard hotel practice). They do take random holds on your funds throughout your stay of amounts that do not make any sense - we never queried this. I was left feeling extremely unhappy with the way the situation was handled and could not trust them to conduct any more transactions. Please ensure you check all transactions they conduct against your cards.Do ask for a higher floor. We had no major issues from noise on the street. Sadly, it is unlikely we will ever return to this hotel and whilst we are planning a return to Waikiki, I have begun researching alternatives.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our family enjoyed our stay at the Emabasy Suites. From the time of booking, until departure all the staff we encountered were friendly and helpful. We were fortunate to be given a corner room on the top floor, which gave us amazing ocean views and was also very quiet. It was a good size for our family of four. We ate breakfast early to avoid long waits and it provided us with a good start to the day. There is no doubt that this is a family oriented hotel, lots of young children occupy the pool all day, so this may not suit those looking for a quiet or romantic get away. The location of Embassy Suites is excellent - close to the beach, shops and restaurants. It is definitely a good choice for families in Waikiki.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great accommodation in Waikiki, block from the beach.....no resort fee, complementary breakfast was very well done. Great staff--concierge and bellman very good at what they do. Beach walk stores and restaurants within easy walking distance. Would definitely stay here on any future trip!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Everything is perfect in this hotel. It's clean , the rooms are great and well furnished . The service is remarkable . Check-in was quick , we use the valet parking , pricy but worth the price. The breakfast is generous with a lot of choice to eat. And what a great way to finish the day by the pool with the happy hour, absolutely super. I recommande it.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Hi we recently stayed here and it was a lovely place with such lovely friendly and helpful staff. The room was great and we had organised a ocean view. We were travelling with our 14 year old daughter so she had the sofa bed in the sitting area which gave her a bit of privacy, The location is fantastic and the shopping near by the best. The included breakfast reception drinks each evening and free wifi and no resort fees make it a winner. Check in wasn't until 3 and we arrived at 7am but they gave us a card to be able to have the breakfast and use of the bathrooms so we had breakfast and then changed into our bathers and hung by the pool . they got our room ready by 12. I also need to mention the tours desk again so helpful and we had a great day with custom island tours thanks to their suggestion. We would definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Definitely rate the Embassy Suites as a good family friendly property. We enjoyed our stay here and the breakfast included was great value. Rooms are comfortable and a rare 2 x queen size bed offering was perfect for us with slightly older children, plus a pull out couch was a bonus! We made good use of the complimentary evening drinks by the pool. It really helped not being stressed about finding somewhere for pre dinner drinks / dinner at an early time.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Hotel is well managed with a very friendly staff. Location is right in the center of Waikiki one block off the beach so we never had to walk far to shop, dine or swim. Only thing lacking was the evening reception. Limited variety of food. However, that did not detract from our overall stay that was very pleasant.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I really enjoyed it just wish there was adult pool to separate from the family pool location was great close to everything also too many kids and Jacuzzi staff is excellent everybody was so friendly thank you

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Staff is alway welcoming and accommodating. Very clean and love the hot breakfast every morning, saves time, money, and stress of getting breakfast. Locations is perfect, close to variety restaurants and across the street from the beach

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is my third time staying at Embassy Suites, and again it did not disappoint. I absolutely love the location of this hotel. Close enough to the beach, great restaurants and ala moana shopping centre. I was able to check in online 24 hours in advance which was great, especially knowing where our room was. Requests were met for a quiet room. Hope to stay here again next time we visit.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Love trip advisor because after tips about elevator noise & road noise put in requests for higher floor & away from elevators.We were 1 room away from elevators could faintly hear the dinging noise but not enough to bother us. We were able to check in about an hour early if we went for a lower floor. We opted to do so it was the 12th floor. We did still get woken around 6:30am by the rubbish trucks as we were city facing but it wasn't too bothersome. Probably the higher you go the better this might be. This was the end of our stay after been to Maui & other end of Waikiki, so great to have breakfast included for convenience. We didn't find it too busy at breakfast. Kids loved the pool. And spa was great too. Strong smell of chlorine on our togs after but better that than germs! Elevators are slooooow. Don't expect to get anywhere in a hurry. LOVED location after staying right down other end of Waikiki much preferred this end by all the great restaurants/shops. Roy's is practically in the lobby. And beach isn't too far. Check in was easy, we didn't have big cues like other hotels. Options for families can be more limited in Hawaii i.e. Getting 2 bedrooms etc can be hard/expensive. And did lots of research. Embassy isn't cheap, we were able to cover some with air miles which helped but there's no doubt having 3 rooms i.e. 2 bedrooms, a lounge & 2 bathrooms was great for our family. We booked about 4 months out but lots of the more family type hotels were already booked out so my advice is to get in early. We were more than happy with embassy though, despite the price (we're paying in NZ $ so everything's a bit more expensive for us anyway)

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Overall experience was good.Poolside service was terrible.No monitoring of pool activities led to lots of dirty babies being allowed to swim without swim diapers or even naked in both the pool and spa rendering unusable by hygiene conscious guests.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: All staff were professional and very friendly. Stayed with our family of five. Great central location one street back from the beach but close to great shopping. Bonus of complimentary breakfast and evening drinks and snacks.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We found the hotel very accommodating.Had a lovely two bedroom, two bathroom suite.Close to everything you need, shopping beach and restaurants. Staff were impeccable. Happy hour(2hrs) every night with free drinks. Free continental breakfast.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This place offers a lot for the money. Having a living room made it so much more comfortable than just a bedroom. And the full breakfast and happy hour make it a great value, especially in Waikiki where accommodations are so pricy. We had an ocean view room and enjoyed it thoroughly. Would definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We love to stay at this hotel because of its location. The hotel is very pretty on the outside, the interior could use some updating, but it is clean and orderly. The bed could use new mattress. The rooms are small like most of the older hotels, it is not a complain, but a note. The hotel hosts great afternoon munchies and programs. The location is close to everything. There are tons of things to see and places to eat. The beach is just across the street and thru a hotel. I already used my Hilton honer's points, so I can't tell if it worth the $$.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Embassy Suites was place to stay during our nine day family trip to Honolulu. Great location (three minutes walk to Waikiki Beach) with breakfast and evening Manager's reception included in the room rate. Good size swimming pool for the kids and overall and great place for families.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Embassy Suites had adjoining living room. Full breakfast daily, complimentarysnacks and drinks every night. Five minutes to everywhere. Could not fault theexcellent service. Hotel,staff very kind and friendly nothing was too much trouble.Sheets changed every three days, and towels everyday. Beach towels provided inroom and also around pool. We were very happy here and would most Definately stay here again. Connect to WiFi and gym on third Floor. No resort fee.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Other than not being able to sleep well because of elevator noises all night this hotel is great. If you enjoy a cooked breakfast each morning and take advantage of happy hour it's a good savings from going out. Drinks in Waikiki are extremely expensive so this was nice. We love having the fridge/micro/coffee maker and two rooms.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The embassy suits are a great place to stay with a family. The rooms are large and comfortable. The staff are amazing and helpful. The people at the expidea desk are great for booking activities. Wonderful shopping near by and the beach is not far away. Great pool and wonderful breakfast. We will definitely be back next time we are in Waikiki.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Excellent stay & excellent staff. We would definately stay at this hotel again. The rooms were a good size & the pool area was nice and well maintained. The staff were all very helpful and the room attendant was lovely.We arrived pretty early in the day but were given our room straight away which was great after traveling so long.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The service we received at the Embassy Suites Waikiki Beachwalk was phenomenal! Everyone we dealt with went above and beyond to make our stay comfortable and memorable. The staff are friendly and so helpful. Would definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The location was great. Not beach front but only a short walk. Close to the Main Street of Waikiki where all the shops and restaurants are. We were surprised to have a room on the TOP floor facing the ocean, so the view was fabulous. Beds were comfortable. Our room had two double beds separate from the living room,which had a sofa bed and a desk and a small kitchenette. There were two TV's to watch. The staff were very helpful and accommodating. Breakfast was included and it was wonderful. Lots of choice. And the best thing of all was 'Happy Hour' between 5.30pm - 7.30pm. Free drinks and every second night they had live music. It was great. Would definitely stay here again

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is my first trip to Honolulu. Embassy suites had a great, charming and helpful staffs. It was easy to get info about Tour around Honolulu and also to another islands. Hotels exactly placed on sidewalk beach - a shopping area and mall and also restaurants. Beach was within walking distance.Hotel also prepared afternoon snack and beverages for free!Enjoying stay in Embassy Suite Hotel

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel was fantastic! My wife and I stayed here for our honeymoon and had an amazing time. The staff was great, the hotel is beautiful with great views of either the ocean or the shopping strip. Shopping, dining and beach are all within a short walking distance. The complimentary reception is very nice and be sure to stick around for the band! Only downside is that (at the time of this review) you can't book any portion of your stay with HHonors points. Other than that, this hotel has it all.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Centrally located, nice clean suites. Breakfast included is a plus. Downside $35 a day to park. Tv didn't work well, only got some stations, but not in room a lot so didn't matter to us but it might matter to you. Lastly, make sure you don't get a room next to the elevator. It was loud. Still giving it 4 stars, but would've been 5 if not for the above.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We recently stayed at this hotel for a week. The location was incredibly convenient for the beach, restaurants and shopping. What helped with this convenience were the numerous entry points to the hotel & lobby. The pool was smallish and tended to be populated with families with small children which is great for families. There were however plenty of sunloungers which was nice. I'd definitily look to stay again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Embassy suite Waikiki beach walk!!! Has a great customer service and friendly staff. The location of the hotel was pretty close to the mall and walking distance to the Waikiki beach!!!! And the room was very clean!!! And they gave us a welcome drink while we're checking in! Plus the breakfast buffet was really great!!!! The valet parking was a great help for us. Just a lil pricey but kinda worth it! But overall? This place is the bomb!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our stay was fantastic. Hotel is clean, staff friendly, breakfast tasty (eggs your choice), each evening from 17:30 till 19:30 free drinks by the pool, tour desk just in case you want to book something. Also car parking available if you rent a car. Just fantastic!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel ticked all the boxes for us. Three girls on tour for a 50th birthday. We wanted to be close to the beach, close to shops and places to eat, sea views. This place was amazing. Very generous sized rooms. Amazing view from one of our two balconies. 2 mins walk to beach. In the middle of he shops and places to eat all around. The breakfasts every morning were amazing and the happy hour was great. Cocktails, beer and wine as well as great snacks all free from 5.30 - 7.30 every night and on Monday, Wednesday, Friday and Saturday they had entertainment as well during happy hour. The staff were all very friendly and accommodating and the place was very clean. Would recommend this hotel. Couldn't fault it

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel made my trip to Waikiki phenomenal!! Great amenities - yummy breakfast (go early to avoid lines!) awesome pool, happy hour every day, and they give you a nice Hawaiian CD when you leave. Less than one block away from the beach and also one block away from Lewers street which is the main shopping street in Waikiki. Everything felt really high quality and my stay at the embassy suites was amazing!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We booked a 2 room suite and it was spacious, but pricey for not being waterfront. Property is generally clean and up to date. Best part was the free breakfast. All staff were very courteous and friendly. Would probably rate higher if it was a better value or on Waikiki beach (it is across the street).

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Excellent location, convenient to the beach and to shopping in Waikiki. Excellent staff, very friendly service. The free breakfast buffet was a great way to start each day and the manager's reception was a great way to start each evening.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Location is excellent. The facilities are excellent and even better they all work.(TV, A/C, shower, radio). Nothing worse than entering a room with all the right facilities but they don't work. Suites are a good size and the beds are really comfortable. Breakfast is great and managers evening happy hour is a great way to end the day. This was our fourth visit. Cost is getting expensive but we will still find the money to come back.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I liked my room has two rooms separating a bedroom and a living room with reasonable price. Each has a TV. We have a 8 y old daughter, then it was good to have a separate bed room, allowing her to sleep well. My room seems to have been kept in good condition and daily room cleaning was also good. The breakfast was cafeteria style and a little busy but providing good fruits. The pool has also enough size as a hotel pool in this area, although again a little busy with families. This may because many families like this pool and there was a free reception serving nice cocktail and snacks. Lastly, coming back to our arrival, the receptionist was very helpful, though we had to wait a little bit before checking-in. Check-in process itself was rather smooth and check-out was in a flash. We had good impression on the staffs there overall.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We enjoyed our stay at the Embassy Suites. The location was good, close walk to the beach, restuarants, bus etc. We were in room 1911 and had partial ocean views. The hotel has some decent inclusions, such as free breakfast and happy hour cocktails. A bonus is definitely the coin operated laundry. The pool is really quite shallow and not that big. We had a room near the lift, so it was quite noisy at night/early morning but I still slept fine (although this being the first child free holiday in several years may have contributed). I would definitely stay here again, I think it's a good option for families.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our son graduated from high school and we wanted to treat him to a memorable vacation before he headed off to college.
