review_body: Loved staying here! You won't regret it. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Breakfast Buffett every morning. Great location.We have several friends who have stayed here at Embassy Suites Beach Walk many times and never had anything bad to say about their stay. We will definitely be back again!!!!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My husband and I stayed 6/11-6/19. He came for work and I got to tag along. This hotel was outstanding! The rooms were nice, roomy and clean! Great housekeeping! Delicious breakfast every morning (different selections each day). Fun managers reception. (Great band and good drinks!). This is definitely a family friendly hotel. But not a problem for us as a couple. It's close to shopping and many restaurants. An easy walk to Waikiki beach. I hated to leave. Can't wait for our next trip! No more big resorts for us!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Excellent accommodations. Service was great. Free breakfast. Beautiful view. What more could you ask for. The passion orange guava juice during check in was a refreshing and welcoming treat especially after a long flight.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Breakfast very good can't get a better hotel buffet than the Embassy Suites. Dinner reception mostly bar type food like chips and some vegetables,dont expect a meal. Liquor or but bottom shelf beer and liquor.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We loved the location. Had teenagers and they had easy access to shopping and beach no need for a car. Check out the local restaurants for good food and friendly trip advice. Hotel staff very nice and helpful.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here for 4 nights before heading to Maui. It was great! We had our 2 kids with us and the room was clean and nice. The pool is great for the kids to play in and cool off. There was always room to find a chair around the pool too. My only complaint is that the pool bartender could have been a bit friendlier. The breakfast was nice in the morning. Sometimes it's hard to find a table to eat at since it gets busy. The best part of the hotel is the location. So convenient to walk around Waikiki. We also took Uber around town since we didn't have a car and it was great. The fire alarm went off one night around 7:30pm and it really scared our kids. It was just a false alarm but it went off twice just when the kids were falling asleep.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: What I found at this hotel was Island Hospitality at its best. At the top of my vacation list was someone to make me breakfast every morning, there was Dominick making me an amazing veggie omelette. I wanted to take yoga classes during my trip and the resort instructor Yoko was terrific in starting my day off. Jay at the front desk helped me navigate The Bus to attend the LPGA event. Lin in housekeeping was lovely and did an outstanding job. Karen was helpful too with information about the island and activities. I truly can't say enough about this property and the service you will receive when you stay there.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The hotel personnel went above and beyond. Could not have been any friendlier and accommodating. Room was clean and spacious. We had a very early tour picking us up at 6:30AM and breakfast opened a little early to allow my grandson to have something to eat before being picked up for the tour. Everyone from the valet, registration, bellman watching our luggage during our tour and using a hospitality room was just sensational. Could not ask for anything more from Embassy Suites. Excellent stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: "What a hotel! We were in the Aloha Tower and faced onto Lewers Street. The 1 bedroom suite was spacious and except for no crockery or cutlery in the kitchenette it had everything we needed. Fantastic having a made to order breakfast and happy hour every day. Staff were always happy and accommodating. Close to everything. Would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed one night here before heading to Aulani for a week. It was perfect for 5 of us in a 3 room suite. We walked across the street to House Without a Key for dinner and then went to the beach for fireworks (Friday nights). Everything was a 3 minute walk. The breakfast was great and included some local fruit and Hawaiian favorites. I would stay here again!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Room was clean and spacious for family of four. Breakfast was good with made to order omelets and plenty of fresh fruit and other typical breakfast items. Evening reception was fun with live music and free drinks and snacks. Pool was nice but a little crowded. Great location and walk to beach and shops was easy. Only annoying thing was that construction across the street was noisy throughout the day. We were in the Aloha Tower.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was our first time visiting Hawaii . Spent a week here with my husband and children. Hotel is close to everything. Excellent hotel and extraordinary staff! This will be my hotel of choice when I'm in Hawaii.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great hotel for a family stay in Waikiki. Plenty of room in the ocean view corner room. No issues with night time party noise from the streets of Waikiki from the 15th floor. Breakfast in the morning was great with a wide variety of food choices and wonderful coffee. Easy access to the beach. Most tours will pick you up at the hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I stayed at the Embassy Suites in June 2016 for my brother's wedding with about 20 other family members. We had the time of our lives at this hotel and every single staff member I met at this hotel was incredibly helpful and hospitable. The highlights of this hotel included: 1) Fast check-in with a welcome refreshment (don't forget your AAA card for great discounts!) 2) Spacious suites with kitchenettes 3) Beautiful partial ocean views from the balcony (we had two!) 4) Expedia travel counter right in the hotel to book various tourist adventures (though a bit expensive--do your research on Tripadvisor before booking!) 5) Helpful and friendly staff 6) Right next to the beachwalk with tons of shopping from low to high end 7) Free breakfast every morning with TONS of delicious options (my personal favorites were the omelette station and the oatmeal station). 8) Free wi-fi, fitness center and business center 9) Free happy hour every night with delicious and strong drinks 10) A live band every Monday, Wednesday and Friday and they had our entire family happily and wildly dancing every night.You cannot go wrong with this hotel and I will definitely stay here again the next time I'm in Waikiki. Thank you Embassy Suites for giving our family incredible memories to last a lifetime.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Traveled with a large family group and stayed at this hotel and what a great experience! From staff to amenities! I have stayed at many Embassy hotels all across California and I must say, this is one of the better of the hotels.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed Sunday until Thursday. Had TV issues for two days. When I finally called and spoke to Ray Rodney the customer service manager, he was prompt, and very professional. He came to the room with an engineer. The engineer was baffled and wanted to replace both tvs. Ray went above and beyond and just upgraded us to a suite. The next day he checked on us to make sure we were comfy, in his own words, "youll always have a home here". Oustanding employee! We will be back

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Spent 4 nights/5 days at the Embassy Suites in a great room with ocean views. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Location was great for dining, tours and the beach. Breakfast and reception were well managed, roomy, and delicious.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is a great hotels at waikiki. The service was excellent and the amenities exceeded expectation. It is a great hotel for families. The valet service is excellent but mandatory. The hotel is not beachfront but it is an easy walk to the beach via public access.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great location, food and impeccable hospitality! Everything about this hotel was great. The rooms are up to date, the staff is very friendly. It's in a great location close to everything, no need for a car rental. Well worth every penny

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The breakfast buffet was great! The eating area was spacious and there was enough variety for the 5 days we stayed there. We had an ocean view room with a balcony, which was perfect. The staff was friendly and helpful. When I return to Oahu, I will definitely stay there again!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed here for 2 nights prior to taking Cruise on Pride of America. Excellent room with great view. Excellent location, with easy access to dining and shopping. Everything you need within walking distance.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We booked a two bedroom suite that we shared with other friends of ours. One room had a king and the other had two queens. All seemed very comfortable. All three rooms had TVs; handy considering I wanted to watch the Golden State Warriors game while we were there. The room was near a several shopping areas on the street behind the hotel that was handy and yet didn't have any noise that would bother us. Waikiki was a short walk away and we enjoyed eating meals on the beach. The breakfast that came with the room was great. Custom omelettes, including smoked salmon, were great as was a nice assortment of fresh fruit and several Japanese food items that the Japanese guests found much more to what I'm sure they are use to. All in all the room was just what we were looking for; that is 3 brief and enjoyable days within the busy atmosphere of Waikiki and then off to a week on the South Shore enjoying more of a solitude visit enjoying the warm ocean and sunsets of Oahu.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Not really a Hilton Standard, ok, but not great. But super location. Very few king-bed rooms and all next to the noisy Elevator, so rather book room with 2 queen beds. Make sure to ask for a room on a higher floor, else you might get noise from the swimmingpool/evening cocktails

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great hotel and very convenient location. We did not rent a car as we were not staying two nights and had booked a tour to Pearl Harbor the full day we were there. Good breakfast each morning and evenings reception was nothing more than chips, some veggies, nuts and crackers BUT there was an open bar at this time. Drinks was better than the snacks :) we had a room right beside the elevator and I am a very light sleeper and always sleep with my white noise app going on my phone and it didn't bother me with it going. Comfortable room and bed.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I booked 2 rooms for 5 days and I so want to come back. The front desk asked about our visit which was to celebrate my battle with cancer and my father of 89 years. Not sure if it was our story but she assigned us to the 21st floor with wrap around balcony. The best views of Hawaii ever, especially watching the fireworks on Friday night.The staff in the breakfast / pool area are the best you could ever meet. They chat to you like they have known you for years, so welcoming.Buffet breakfast included, free drinks at managers reception every evening and fantastic music every second night. It is a central location and I can't wait for my next visit to Embassy Suites.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My family (mother in law, 10 year old daughter, 6 year old son) and I stayed at the Embassy Suites in Waikiki Beach for 4 nights. Our room was ready when we arrived from the airport around 2pm so no waiting. Everything went smoothly and we loved the punch that was presented during checkin. We had an Oceanview room 1908 in the Aloha tower (further from the beach) that had a great view of the pool area. While the view of the ocean was OK, we all preferred the pool view so we could see what was going on there. The room was a classic Embassy Suites room. 2 Queens in the bedroom and the living area with a kitchenette with microwave and mini fridge. Our room was clean and we had no issues with daily housekeeping.We were so tired from traveling the first day but could not pass up the managers reception. We truly enjoyed our complimentary cocktails everyday from 5:30-7:30p. The drinks were strong, sometimes too strong, but were easily fixed by adding a little more of the chaser. Also, don't be put off by the drink lines. They go really fast!Breakfast buffet was also really good. Made to order omelettes, eggs, bacon, sausage, potatoes, pancakes, French toast, yogurt, fruit, beads, danishes, cereal and a bunch of stuff that I didn't eat. I believe they were Japanese options. All of it was delicious. We always found ourselves up at 6am so would always be waiting for breakfast to open at 6:30a. The time change really messed us up. Haha. But it helps to get our day started off right.We used the Expedia travel desk to book our Luau. Ended up at Chiefs and it was amazing from start to finish. Pickup was at Trump Resort next door with entrance on Saratoga. We splurged on the Royal package because I wanted to be in the front and didn't want my kids to have to look over too many heads. It was perfect!Little tips :--Check out the Long's drug store on the corner of Beachwalk and Kalakaua for all your needs. It's in the CVS family. --There's also an ABC store directly across the street on Lewers. --There's an entrance to the hotel right beside Yardbird on Lewers (found this out after two days). Don't miss the Lobster Garlic Noodles there. Yum. --Don't miss the Steak Shack. Cheap delicious eats just 3 minutes away right on the beach. --Cute little place called Beachwalk Cafe had the best macarons. It's two minutes away on Beachwalk and Kalia. --The beach is a two minute walk away but we much preferred the beach in front of the Outrigger Beach Resort (not Outrigger Reef Resort). The vendor there rented beach chairs and umbrellas which was important to us. It was about $10 per hour for the 2-chair and umbrella set. And we didn't have to worry about the rocks. --You can easily catch the bus (routes 42 or 20) to Pearl Harbor with no transferring. Ride is about one hour. It's $2.50 one way per adult and $1.25 per child over 6 (exact change). Sure beats the high cost of tours and you can go and leave when you want. Just one tip. If you MUST go to the USS Arizona memorial, you need to reserve tickets online in advance for about $1 per ticket. Otherwise the ticket is free on site but there may be a wait. For example, we arrived around 11a but the tour to the memorial wasnt available until 2pm. There is a lot to see without the memorial and we found that with my kids, the museum was enough. We stayed about 2 hours. We would have stayed another 2-3 hours to ferry over to the memorial and back.Last but not least, our flight home on the last day was not until 7:30pm. After we checked out, we were able to store our luggage with the bell desk. After that we had a pool day until around 3. Then asked for the hospitality suite to freshen up. This one last thing really made the Embassy Suites stand out to us. We are able to shower, repack our things and get ready to head out for our flight. It really made a world of difference for our family. Great service overall!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The Embassy Suites was in an ideal location in Waikiki--close to restaurants and shopping. The hotel was clean and the staff was helpful . The breakfast was wonderful and included custom omelets and breakfast fare. I would recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is a very clean hotel and great for families. The staff is very accommodating and friendly. The breakfast and manager's reception are both good. I travel frequently and stay in quite a few hotels. Most Embassy Suites are spacious, clean and friendly. This hotel is a step above other Embassy Suites and many other similar chains.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The location is excellent - next to the park, on the Beachwalk with dozens of shops and restaurants and nearly on the beach. The rooms are pleasant and very well kept in a typical Embassy Suites layout. The pool and surrounding area are perfectly maintained, large and easy. Breakfast is slightly below Embassy Suites standards in terms of choice, but is certainly more than acceptable. Japanese foods are available for tourists. The staff was more than pleasant - we actually began to know the valet's names after a few times. Note that parking is $35 daily and there are limited alternatives about - but there are alternatives about 4 blocks away.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at Embassy suites because we were attending a wedding at the Halekulani resort. From the minute one of our family walked in to the lobby, they were the most accommodating, personable staff we have ever encountered. I understand that this is a tourist area and pleasantness is required, but these people act like they truly love to do what they a doing. I don't know if most travelers are rude or what, but just a couple of words of conversation and it was like we were family to them. Everyone went above and beyond if we had a request, even called the bus company to check on routes and times for our return trip from surfing because of the memorial day parade. Lleuellyn had a bright smile every morning when we headed for breakfast and a cheery "how are you, what are you doing today?" followed by a short conversation. We got on the elevator with a smile every time because it was contagious. Aldin at breakfast picked up where she left off, John the omelet chef, Kenny at the bell desk, Ray the night manager, Tali on the checkin desk that arranged a late checkout, and on and on. We'll stay here again next trip to Honolulu. The hotel is clean and fresh, the pool and the service at the pool bar are wonderful, the breakfast is amazing with made to order omelets and of course the fruit. Comfortable and roomy.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our First visit to Honolulu- it was a bucket list trip. Suite was clean, roomy & nice! ALL staff was very accommodating. Free cocktails daily & free breakfast-top notch. Loved the live entertainment during the Manager's Reception. Best for value, amenities, easy beach access. Will definitely stay here again!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is a really good hotel for a family requiring suites. Makes for a very comfortable stay. We came in after a long flight and had a good welcome. Smooth check in and we were upgraded to a two bedroom suite which was a pleasant surprise. The location is excellent. Very lively dining on the beach walk. Great ambience there. Managers reception had a very good band which made it great fun. Overall great value for money.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Large rooms, great courtesy room to be used after you check out (e.g. showering before a late night flight and spending all day at the beach). Downside is expensive parking which might be in line with other hotels in the area so maybe I won't stay in Waikiki next time (too touristy in my opinion)

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel is perfect from service to location to amenities to room decor! I highly recommend corner room 429 for garden view. It had two large balconies overlooking palm trees. The free breakfast and cocktail reception were great. Valet easy and never a wait.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We celebrated 30th anniversary in Hawaii and stayed 4 of our 7 nights here and as usual, it exceeded every expectation.Location was great and central to shopping, beaches, restaurants, etc, and view was very good.Always look at the breakfast and the managers reception as a great value.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here while we did our Honolulu excursions. It was pretty basic - nothing to scream about. I appreciated the "free" breakfast and I appreciated that it was so close to other restaurants. Because we were out all during the day, we didn't get to visit the pool. I tried to visit the happy hour but all they had was chips and crackers so my girls didn't want to stay. The rooms were clean, but I did have a roach surprise me in the bathroom when I turned on the light in the middle of the night. It was not big like the ones on the mainland (thank God). I was also somewhat disappointed in my "ocean" view. I know that there is always a difference between "ocean view" and "ocean front", but I didn't know it would be that drastic. I had to look to the left just to get a sliver of the ocean that was blocked by another hotel. Had I known this, I would have just reserved a standard room. I felt as if the internet photos were somewhat misleading.Overall, everything was pretty decent, but I can't say that I would stay here again - not because of the hotel, but because I didn't like Waikiki.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Embassy Suites Beach Walk Honolulu is well located near the beach, shopping, parks tour busses and historical Fort Derussy. Great folks that take great care of you in this top notch facility. Have stayed several times and it is always the same gracious people with a smile and hello every time they see you.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I have been to many Embassy suite hotels From los angeles, san francisco, new york, las vegas, florida and i can personally say that the waikiki beach embassy suites is my favorite! Excellent location with all the shops an restaurant surrounding hotel, superb staff and service and such a great ambience and atmoshere! My family and i are very happy with our stay ! Will defintely be back again !

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Embassy Suites by Hilton Waikiki Beach Walk is located one block from the beach. It has two tall buildings with pool and restaurant (for morning breakfast buffet and afternoon happy hour) in between two buildings on the fourth floor. There are many restaurants, shops, convenience stores, and one drug store within walking distance.  Our family of four stayed there for 4 nights last month. We had a pleasant time. However, we felt we did not get good advice from the concierge service. I talked to the staff at the concierge desk a couple of time. I told her we were going to drive to North Shore one day and she recommended Polynesian Cultural Center. I followed her advice and bought 4 tickets at $453 total for luau and show (Breath of Life) on a weekday night. She said very specifically that the earliest check-in time was 4pm as luau seating would start at 4:30pm. The time was also printed clearly on the receipt. When asked if the park entrance was included, she said NO. We thought the price was high but accepted it as we did not know any better. After tasting the garlic shrimp (from the famous shrimp truck) and shaved ice in Haleiwa, we drove around North Shore aimlessly because we did not want to arrive too early. Once we got there at 4pm, we were told that park entrance was included in the tickets we bought. In other words, we could have seen shows and taken canoe rides in various parts of the Cultural Center if we had arrived earlier. I was very upset when I heard what we had missed. The customer service person regretted that he could not give us any credit but we could go back within the next three days which was no help because we were leaving the next day.  After expressing our displeasure to Embassy Suites, the assistant general manager responded as follows: I’ve forwarded your comments to Expedia as it appears that you were given some misinformation. Their area manager will recommunicate with his staff about providing the correct information to all Expedia agents about all tours, especially the popular ones like Pearl Harbor and Polynesian Cultural Center. We felt that the staff wearing Embassy Suites uniform sitting behind Embassy Suites counter represents Embassy Suites not Expedia. There seems to be some misrepresentation here.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great place - good location, friendly and efficient staff, good rooms and a great cocktail reception each evening. Good sized pool area. All of the main retail and restaurants are in walking distance and only one block away from the beach.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Australians! Take note Embassy Suites in Waikiki were a great surprise!Free cooked breakfasts,free Wi-Fi,Free Happy Hour with musical entertainment on selected nights,no resort fees,beautiful spacious 2 bedroom suites with view of the ocean.Lovely and clean and comfy beds.This hotel has very good staff that cater to all your needs,you can't go wrong picking this hotel for a great vacation.ALOHA!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: we only stayed here one night as we were waiting for our 7 night Hawaiian cruise! BUT this hotel was only a short walk to the beach. Breakfast was very good and rooms were clean comfortable and nice! We were right in the middle of all the shopping so we had plenty to do killing time!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: very close walk to beach, right in the middle of all the shopping rooms were very nice. No noise problems and breakfast was very good! we only stayed 1 night as we were waiting to board our 7 night Hawaiian cruise!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had a fantastic time during our 10 days stay here. All the staff we encountered were friendly and helpful, the hotel was clean/well kept. The breakfast buffet is a great feature too - plenty of hot and cold food and lots of places to sit. The staff at the buffet and table staff were outstanding.Even better is the managers drink reception by the pool four nights a week - unlimited drinks and snacks for a few hours - a great setting and good to relax and chat with other travellers.Our room was very comfortable, clean and modern - a beautiful partial ocean view as well - housekeeping was excellent.Special mention to Lemaile (from the Trip Advisor Desk inside). She was so helpful and organised a tour within 24hrs so quickly (as our original plans had fallen though) She even went to the trouble of contacting the original tour company to ensure we would be refunded, and gave us wonderful travel tips and things to see. Very understanding and made our stay!Overall an excellent stay and PERFECT location - so close to everything it was awesome.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: 4.5 stars. My room was by the service road and it was noisy in the middle of the night. Otherwise, it was a beautiful hotel with easy access to the beach & shopping and restaurants. The staff was fun especially at the evening reception very friendly. Everyone was helpful and friendly. I was surprised that there was a different people everyday at the front desks and tour information desks.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Family of 4 spent 3 nights ahead of our week on the big island. Beautiful resort in all aspects. One bedroom suite was clean and comfortable with ample room for all. Breakfast buffet was wonderful and afternoon reception excellent except for poor drinks (weak and limited choices). Facilities and staff are outstanding. We chose not to rent a car and wound up saving some money using shuttles and taxis but there is so much to do and see within a 15 min walk. Great value in Waikik, would come back in a New York minute.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My husband and I were celebrating a delayed 40th anniversary with this stay. We had honeymooned in Waikiki in 1975 at the Outrigger Reef and have returned to Oahu numerous times. This was our third stay at Embassy Suites and it could not have been more perfect.Months ago we requested one of the corner rooms in the Aloha Tower on the 21st floor. Kay Lee, Revenue Coordinator at the hotel told me she would do her best to satisfy our request – and she came through! Our suite was at the northwest corner of the building with a wrap around balcony. The views were amazing! We could see the ocean from our couch in the living room and downtown Honolulu. What a treat! The suite had a dining room with table and chairs, living room with enormous flat screen TV, a spacious bedroom with a king bed and a roomy bathroom. We couldn’t have been happier!Since our last stay, the furniture has been replaced with a new comfortable couch, chairs and Hawaiian art on the wall. Tasteful, warm colors were used for everything.The nightly managers’ reception was fun with live music on Mondays, Wednesdays, Fridays and Saturdays. The house band really rocks and people were blissfully dancing to the tunes.We used the pool several times and found it quite pleasant and not crowded with ample beach lounges.Our housekeepers couldn’t have been more professional, polite and thorough. Leave them a tip – they deserve it! The location of the hotel is outstanding and it’s a quick walk to the beach. Hanging out at the beachfront of Fort DeRussy park is my personal favorite.Now that I’m back home, I’ve got the post-Waikiki vacation blues. But all I have to do is think of my 8 days and nights at the Embassy Suites and a smile comes to my face.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had a great 2-night stay. The suite was spacious and well appointed. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The evening complementary receptions were spectacular, but the complementary breakfast was even better. The pool was the perfect temperature and had lots of room, and the hot tub was amazing. Finally, the location was perfect!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Staff are just wonderful! Hotel and amenities are beautiful and our kids were welcomed like family! See Lewis at the bar for the best Blue Hawaiians on the island :) location is easy and close to everything you could need.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: It's a good hotel and on a good spot right on beach walk on Waikiki Beach. Good breakfast and manager special in the evening is also a nice touch. Big enough room with two balconies. We chose sea view room and it was nice. Staff is nice and friendly. Only one bad point they charge $35 valet parking no other options provided like self park etc. It wasn't mentioned at the time of booking. Otherwise everything good

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed 10 nights at the Embassy Suites Beach walk hotel and were very happy with the decision to stay there. The service and staff were excellent, the room was perfect (great ocean view) and the complimentary breakfast was better than most restaurants.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had a great time for the week we stayed at the Embassy Suites. From helping with room selection and early check in to holding our bags and giving us a hospitality room on our last day, the staff was always accommodating and friendly. The breakfast buffet, manager's special (a free happy hour by the pool) and no resort fees sealed the deal; I will definitely come back here to stay again. Mahalo!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: First time visitors to Hawaii, we compared several hotel options based on distance to the beach, convenience (restaurants, shops), room, and value. We decided on Embassy Suites and were very happy with our choices. The hotel staff kindly upgraded us to an ocean view suite, which was roomy, clean, and had a really nice view of the ocean. The location is very central to Waikiki - there are several top restaurants nearby as well as food truck. We literally could go downstairs to Henry's place to buy sliced papaya or mango and come right back upstairs to eat. The breakfast was included and bountiful - egg station, miso soup, salad, fruit, and many more. Valet is $35 and there is no self parking. The only thing I felt that could have been better is the swimming pool area - too crowded especially at the Manager's Reception, but it's minor. Overall, I'm really happy that we stayed there. It was perfect for a family of three or four, since there are two rooms which gives everyone some space. Next time we visit Waikiki, this will definitely be on my list.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The embassy suites Waikiki is in a perfect spot for traveling to Hawaii. Restaurants, shops, and the beach are literally A block away. Very clean with a helpful staff. You can't beat the breakfast buffet, and the cocktail reception was inviting especially on the nights when they had live entertainment. I have stated many Embassy suites here in the south and was looking forward to their omelette with grits. (I forgot not everyone eats grits, they didn't have them but that's ok) I was surprised to find salad, rice and miso soup on the breakfast bar, however it makes sense due to the high number of Japanese guests as well.Will definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My husband and I stayed there for nine nights starting May 10, 2016. It was one of the best experiences that we have ever had in all our many travels. From the free daily breakfast which included a huge array of choices, to the evening reception with entertainment, everything was very well done. The manager, Ray Rodney, is to be especially complimented because he went out of his way to make sure that all details were taken care of in a satisfactory manner. He's absolutely the best! When we return to Honolulu we will definitely stay at the Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach Walk again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great location, with lots of great restaurant right around the corner and beach is also really close. The complimentary breakfast and the happy hour is really good as well. Updated facility and room. You can get pretty good value from this hotel than some beach front hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Wonderful hotel with clean comfy rooms and friendly staff. Evening reception was fun each night and the breakfast can't be beat. We would definitely stay here again. Traveled with my husband and 10 year old daughter. She loved the pool. Great place!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My ladyfriend and I had the pleasure of staying at the Embassy Suites by Hilton Waikiki Beach Walk hotel (quite a mouthful there) in mid-April, and while other aspects of our trip to Oahu left something to be desired, our accomodations at the Beach Walk were truly superb. We were provided with a suite on the southeast corner of the hotel on the 11th floor, so we had balconies on both the south and east side of the room. Now the ESH Waikiki Beach Walk is not directly on the beach, but back about a block - however our south-facing balcony had a nice view of the ocean, though flanked by the Halekulani and Outrigger Reef hotels on either side.If you like to shop - particularly in high-end stores, you'd be hard-pressed to find a better location than the ESH Waikiki Beach Walk. You are literally in the middle of a newly-renovated shopping district with Beverly-Hills-esque shops and galleries in every direction. Chanel, Gucci, Tiffany's, and many more, all within a block - and of course, a Starbuck's on just about every corner. Lots of well-reviewed restaurants within minutes as well, though, to be honest, the best meal we had during our 7-day stay was at the Denny's just across the street!Our room was open and airy, comfortably appointed in a tropical style, and included a little kitchenette containing a mini-fridge, microwave and sink. The fridge didn't have a freezer section in it, so stocking up on Haagen-Dazs ice-cream bars for a late-night snack was not an option (I think that was the only negative criticism I could come up with!). The beds were firm but comfortable, and everything was scrupulously clean and in good repair. And the SHOWER - let me expound a bit on hotel showers...Most hotels - even the really nice expensive ones - use these "water miser" shower heads, where you have to stand under them for a five full minutes before you can even properly call yourself wet. I think that if you're spending hundreds of dollars every night to stay at a four-star hotel, management should spring FOR MORE THAN A NICKEL'S WORTH OF WATER!!! (You can tell that I feel strongly about this.) Okay, that said, the Embassy Suites by Hilton Waikiki Beach Walk hotel's shower, at least in my room, was quite possibly the best hotel shower I've ever experienced. I'm talking awesome-water-pressure, full-on, high-volume 'water-waster', get-wet-in-five-seconds, best-ever shower! And even though we were on the 11th floor, the water was hot in under 15 seconds. Now, the ESH Waikiki Beach Walk is not a new hotel, but it IS well-run, well-maintained, and all other aspects of our stay were just as pleasant as were our showers.From concierge to housekeeping, the entire hotel staff was extremely attentive, efficient and friendly, and we had the feeling that they were actually happy to be working there. Just good energy all around. Next time we stay in Waikiki, this hotel is where you'll find us!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great location, my room was located in a great place. The Aloha tower on a high floor away from the elevator. Good size room with a great view of the ocean, the beach, and city. The room was very well decorated. Breakfast was great, a wide assortment. Rice, miso soup, as well as the usual suspects. Though parking was expensive, the staff was really nice. I would highly recommend it.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I class this hotel to be the best we have stayed in when we travel to Waikiki. The staff make this hotel your home away from home and go out of their way to ensure your stay it faultless. Without exception whether they were the receptionist, housekeeping, pool staff everyone would greet you with Aloha and ask if everything was OK and if they could assist you with anything. I have not had this happen at the other hotel were previously stayed at in the centre of Waikiki. The complimentary breakfast is a huge plus and so is the Managers Reception each night. The room are large and well appointed with a separate lounge and bedroom.The rooms & bathroom are very clean and well appointed. The location is across the road from the beach and is a quieter area of Waikiki. We have decided to now stay here on our yearly trips to Waikiki. Congratulations to the management at Embassy Suites, Waikiki and to Hilton Hotels in having staff that are so customer focused. Hello to Dennis, Lewis & Keola who looked after us at the nightly Managers Reception and make us feel like we knew them for years.....you guys are the best. Look out in 2017 because we will be back.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The staff was awesome from check in to check out. Everyone was super friendly and always willing to help. The concierge service was superb. Our desired tours were set up and handled professionally.I would not hesitate to visit again

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: After reading the reviews about the noise of the rooms located near the elevator at check-in I was told that was all available unless I wanted a room with two queens rather than a king. I was then told there would be another room available the following day if I wanted to change at that point. We knew immediately we could not stay in that room for the remainder of our trip. There is no way possible we could sleep with the constant roaring of an elevator and bells going off. The management made it better and we switched the following day to a much better room from a city view to an ocean view.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great hotel. Great location. Great staff. Highly recommended. The complimentary breakfast was well above expectations. They when all out. Great place for people all ages. Very family friendly. Would definitely go back.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I stayed at this hotel with my family(three people in total) at the end of April going into June for 4 nights. This hotel is great, especially the location it is in the centre of everything. No you are not directly on the beach but just in a minute walk your on the beach, just across the street! There is ABC store on every corner, there is two next to the hotel it just takes 30 sec to walk to both. Also there is two Starbucks in a 30 sec walk, for all the coffee lovers. All the activity was right next the hotel, you walk a couple of minutes and you in the heart of the shopping area. For the Aloa Moana mall and the Outlets you will have to get a taxi but its a short ride(we never went there). The staff were great, especially the concierge(the Expedia expert) who helped us book The Pearl Harbour Tour (highly recommend). It was around 40 mins from the airport, when we arrived we got a taxi from the airport which cost $50 (bags and tip included), on the way back from the hotel to the airport we ordered a Limo (recommend, so much better) it was $60 which included our bags and plus tip which was $70. The buffet breakfast was delicious, every morning I had a fresh omelet with fresh fruit, especially pineapple so good! The only negative comment I would have to make about the breakfast was the coffee was not good (personal opinion, so I went to Starbucks to get it :)). Also, just a heads up, in the morning getting breakfast, seeing how its beautiful everyday you get to enjoy breakfast outside, there are a few birds flying around, the staff do their best to shoo them away but your outdoors with food! The rooms are beautiful, we stayed in room 2106, the top floor with an amazing view of Diamond head, the beach, a partial view of the ocean, and the city with a nice size patio and the sun hits it in the morning. Just use caution when out on the balcony with kids, to me the railing is on the low side for being so high up. The room had two comfy queen beds and in the sitting area a pull out sofa (which we didn't use). The bathroom was nice and big. Also there was a wet bar with a mini fridge(we bought water, some fruit, and sandwich meat). The pool area was amazing the sun is on it the whole day, and just a tip when we were there was not that many people there so it was nice to get a break from the busy beach area for a day. In the evening time the recepetion time had the bar opened (which the bartender was great, knew how to mix drinks which is always a plus) plus it had a few snack to munch on and on certain days they had a live band playing music from different eras (they were very good, they also played todays music but with their own twist, which I loved). Overall I would definitely come back to this hotel and highly recommend this to anyone going. To me this is the number one hotel in Honolulu.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed March 22/16 - April 01/16. Breakfast Buffet Amazing and cannot be beat. (Well Done Embassy Suites)!!! The Expedia desk promised 500 hilton points for checking in at the desk. To date no 500 points as of 05/21/16. Rooms nice and clean everything top notch. However front desk has not added points to our hilton account. As a hilton gold member we should not have to call to require as to the status of points. Fruit punch upon check in very nice. Kona coffee would be nice in rooms since this is a trademark of Hawaiian Coffee. The resort has more asian guests then previous years but therefore a more subdued and quiet atmosphere. The managers reception every evening 5-7 with free alcohol and non/alcohol drinks fantastic. Pool side service has slipped a bit so you need to go to the pakini bar to order. Food very good! The Pool is small but adequate. Sun does not hit the pool till around 11:30am. Go to the beach for the am then hit the pool and order food for lunch. Always chases available. Staff has been there forever saying it is a great place to work and they love their jobs. Dennis is awesome. Only annoying thing is the alarm sound across the street from the trump hotel when vehicles exit the parkade. This goes on till around 2am. Garbage trucks park and are noisy very early every morning with engines running and backup beepers waking you up. Not a bad thing if you want to go for a walk at 6 am. Enough said.!! Might try something different next time only to try something different. Great place for families not couples.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Flew in from the east coast, so wanted a hotel in a great location for 2-nights to adjust to the big time difference. This Embassy Suites did not disappoint, and is a great choice for a few nights before jumping off to visit the other islands.Yes - it is expensive, and $35/night to park a rental car is a little much, but if you get over the price, the rooms, location, and friendliness of the staff (I experienced none of the issues other reviewers have referenced regarding rude staff - on any given day I guess) are all outstanding. We did pay for the ocean view and lucked out w/ a 21st story location. View was outstanding (yes, you are a block from the ocean).Pro's - Great location (although not oceanfront), very clean, very quiet, breakfast is one of the better Hilton buffets, nice 2-room configuration, friendly staff.Con's - High price, parkingSummary - Enjoyed the stay and would absolutely choose this hotel again when flying through HNL and looking for a layover location.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The location was great. We walked to beach every day. Hotel was close to restaurants and shopping. It is in a very vibrant part of Honolulu. Staff were very helpful and friendly.Our maid talked to us every day and asked if we needed anything and how our day was going. We loved the fresh omelets and breakfast. Concierge helped us set up a tour to Pearl Harbor. We loved having two rooms and two tvs so we had a little space to relax.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: great location. Was a lovely hotel. Loved that the all the rooms were 2 room suites that separated the bedroom from the lounge area. Unfortunately did not enjoy the breakfast. Managers reception was excellent! Especially with the live music! Great pool area that was suited for young children and for adults too!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We were booked for 4 nights at the DoubleTree and lucked out in that Hilton was having a flash sale and we could now afford to stay here. Then we hit the jackpot when I checked in online to find that a partial ocean view room on a high level was available!-Located in the heart of the strip (right by all of the shops and the beach!)-Beautiful lobby-Welcome drink-Immaculate halls and bedroom-Tons of free drinks during happy hour with great snacks ranging from nachos and veggies -Entertainment during happy hour -Free gift (2 cookies from Honolulu Cookie Company)What's not to love if it's in your budget??

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Upon check in the gentleman with hair that sticks up was immediately not friendly. He asked us our Hilton rewards number. He told us although he checked us in we could not use free wifi until our room was available. We had to wait a half hour for our room. We asked him to make change and he was rude again and made us wait. We could not sign into wifi. He said to call maintenance rudely. Then he looked up our name to put in order and said it was under our last name with the IV. My husband is a fourth. He told us how did we not know this, didn't we make reservation. I said my husband formal name is on passport. But our family name is .... I explained we would not have known this and he repeated didn't you make the reservation. I became upset by his continued rudeness for 3 days and the manager was very nice and changed our name quickly and made it right. To deal with him was so stressful and VERY unwelcoming. WE hated to pass him. If we approached him at any point from check in his first response to us was Hello you need to give me a minute, even if he clearly was not doing anything, WE are not needy but he was NOT nice. The bell men was sooo professional. Our room was clean. The wifi is horrible. The happy hour is fun. WE at the restaurant for inexpensive food that was very good. Our waitress Christina was Amazing. Friendly and my kids looked for her until we left. The beach in front is very rocky, just go to beach and head left over a bridge to where they are surfing. It is amazing there. If use Expedia for anything they charge even if free. But Gabby did a great job going out of way to help. When checking out we asked for receipt and was told zero balance. WE said we needed it for our records and it was too much trouble for staff to print

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: One of the best places I have stayed having traveled around the world. It started with the courtesy and hospitality during check in all the way to check out. The whole family unanimously decided to be back.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Amazing staff helped to make our trip one to remember. Every encounter we had with a staff member was better than the last. The breakfast was always on point and the wifi was a plus. Not one complaint from our entire one week stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We were here between 5/12-5/16 and got a Ocean View room on the 21st Floor. The room was in excellent condition , very clean and well maintained. This is my second visit to Hawaii and have travelled extensively in the US from New York, Chicago, D.C, Seattle, to L.A etc and what stands out is the Hotel Staff, they are very well mannered and very helpful. As soon as we checked in we wanted someone to unlock our bag as we lost the key, the bell boy was there within 2 mins. One of the days they missed Room Cleaning because we were out (DND Decal was put by us), they called us again in the evening to check if we need any service, The also have complimentary Breakfast with personalized choice of omelette and a variety of other things. They also host a Manager's special Evening Snacks and drinks. I have been traveling in the US for last 8-9 years and have stayed across 15-20 different hotels and I have to say this was the best Hotel I have stayed at.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights before travelling to Maui. The hotel was very clean and comfortable. It is well located for access to eateries, the beach and the trolley to the Ala Moana Centre. It has no resort fees and breakfast was included in the rate. Also included was a nightly manager's reception with complimentary drinks and snacks. A very pleasant stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Very clean, great pool on the 4th floor and rooms cleaned daily. Breakfast included and free cocktails for guests each evening for happy hour.The staff were really friendly and it's really close to beach/shops and restaurants We loved it

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed with this hotel a number of years ago and whilst reasonably happy with it, the last few trips we've taken to Waikiki we chose to stay in a timeshare apartment as we felt it offered more space for our family of five. This trip our timeshare was undergoing maintenance work which put us off and we decided to try our luck again at the Embassy Suites. All in all this stay was so impressive that we have decided that we're done with the timeshare and the Embassy Suites will be our regular hotel for future stays. Upon check in we were allocated our partial ocean view room on a very high floor with a small view of Diamond Head and a distant slice of Waikiki Beach. We spoke to reception and asked if there might be a room with a view of 'closer' beach and were promptly directed to a lovely corner room on the 11th floor with beautiful views across the Outrigger reef with the beach beyond...very happy. Our first morning in paradise, we wandered down to breakfast expecting a frantic free for all (it is of course included in the room charge) and were pleasantly surprised by minimal crowds, plenty of tables and a great selection of food choices to keep all 5 or us happy. After a long day at the beach, the complementary Managers reception with drinks, nibbles and a live band (?!!!) was a beautiful and fun way to end the day, meet some new friends whilst the kids frolicked in the pool and head out to dinner relaxed (thanks to the complementary mai tais!). All in all we were so impressed with the value this hotel provided along with the lovely suites, friendly staff and great amenities that we cant wait to get back for our next stay. Mahalo and we'll see you again soon!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This stay was a challenging one since my grandmother had visited from the outer islands. What started as a nightmare stay from booking the reservation at the get go, turned out to be very accommodating thanks to the front desk manager Garret O. Who helped us to acquire the 2-bedroom with roll in shower as we had requested. The breakfast buffet is always a delight, and since grandma was in a rented wheelchair, it was easy for us to enjoy having breakfast with her. I suggest eating at 6:30am as the buffet is open then, it is not busy, and the staff are nice (probably because it's not crowded). There's a business center, but only in one tower, so if you are in the second tower you may have a little walk but it's easy to get to. On Mondays, Wednesday, Friday's, and Saturdays there is live music during the managers reception (complementary non-alcoholic/alcoholic drinks and snacks). It's fun, you could have a quick show for 2 hours and just relax with some drinks from draft, blue hawaii's, white, and wells liquor. The bartenders are very nice and courteous - I tipped a $1 per drink - but it's not necessary...as I'm sure the price for the complementary drinks are factored into your bill. The cleaning staff are really nice, and very helpful if you need more towels, pillows, or toiletries. The room gets pretty cold if you have it on high, so be prepared to stay cool and enjoy it after being outside at the beach or walking around waikiki. This hotel is close to many stores, main malls, and eateries. If you want to dine in, I suggest Ruth's Chris steakhouse - it's connected to the hotel, just have to take the elevator from the pool deck down one floor or you can take the escalator - very convenient. Also, there's yard house - good beer, good burgers, good fish and chips (make sure it's not too oily before you bite into it- that sucker burns). Other than that, it's an overall nice place to stay, and leave from to roam waikiki.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My family of 5 (2 adults & 3 boys aged 13, 10& 10) stayed 8 nights in early April. Interior Looks a little dated but otherwise excellent amenities. Rooms were always clean & plenty of fresh towels each day. The pool was smaller than we hoped but it was still fun and was often busy late in the day. The managers reception each night was great although more variety in snacks would have been better. Alcoholic drinks were very strong - I had to water mine down with more soft drink. The bands were always great. Gym was adequate - could have been better. Location was perfect for us - 1 block from the beach & all the shops were at the end of the street. Great restaurants right outside our hotel. Would recommend for families & would stay there again. Great there are no resort taxes too!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The Embassy Suites is very close to Waikiki Beach. My oldest son and I were going to the beach on Spring break. He only had 4 days and wanted to be near warm water in March. We chose this trip using Costco travel services. In the past, traveling through Costco gave us extras and upgrades. When we checked into Embassy Suites, the desk staff mentioned a couple of times that I booked through Costco instead of Hilton. It definitely felt like our treatment would have been better if we had gone through the hhonors program.When we finally checked in, our room was nice and it was very clean. However, there was almost no natural light in the room. We were one floor off of the street and the window light was blocked by all the tall buildings in the area. Also, there was a lot of street noise.The beds were super comfortable. And we had a separate sitting space so I could go to bed earlier than my son if I chose to. The pool area was full of kids in the afternoon. The reception included free drinks and some light snacks. Some nights, there is live music. People got into the live music and there was some dancing a couple of evenings. The bartenders were super!Breakfast is boss at this Embassy Suites. There are tons of choices and chefs are making omelettes to order. Because food is so expensive in Honolulu, this included breakfast gives a lot of value to the room.The hotel is right on Waikiki Beach Walk - close to restaurants and shops. And just a short stroll takes you to the beach.There are no restrooms near the exercise room.Great location, breakfasts and receptions! Book through hhonors for better room choices.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Embassy Suites is a quality accommodation destination which could not be faulted in any respect.. The Waikiki location is perfect with numerous restaurants, shopping and recreation facilities right on the door step. It was impossible to fault anything from check in to check out. The staff hospitality was always professional and welcoming. I would recommend this hotel without hesitation and make it my first choice the next time we return.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Hilton property just a short walk from one of the most beautiful beaches in the world. The hotel itself has two towers with views of the city that are beautiful at night. All of the normal experiences you expect with an Embassy Suites. Convenient area to walk to many restaurants and shopping areas. Breakfast and evening reception are very crowded during normal usage times, so you may want to plan to use at non-peak times to avoid long lines.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel is in a great central location with shopping and eateries at the doorstep, it was great not having to pay a resort fee. Our King Suite included a microwave and was very spacious and comfortable however there was road noise coming from the adjacent 'Beach Walk' road. All King Suites are located in this Tower, the second Tower away from the road has two Queen beds (no King beds) Complimentary wifi, breakfast and complimentary evening drinks/snacks were available from 5.30 - 7.30pm which was very nice.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Truly enjoyed our stay while on vacation with our family. The front desk staff was friendly & helpful. The manager on duty was so sweet to give our son a box of chocolate macadamia nuts. The service was excellent from the beginning to end. Enjoyed the breakfasts & manager's socials daily. The cleaning staff are truly the unsung heroes of this property. A great stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Spent two nights at the Embassy Suites while on business. The location was perfect, at the start of Waikiki Beach and with lots of tourist amenities (shopping, restaurants etc) surrounding the property.The staff at the location were excellent and the entrance to the hotel is very impressive. I received a complimentary upgrade to a two bedroom suite which was far too much space for a lone traveller but would have been nice for a large family (one king, two queen and a sofa bed with two bathrooms, living room and small wet bar area). Although, the room did seem dated but in tune with the Hawaiian theme. Internet speed is enough to do some basic surfing but certain times of days (evenings) it does slow significantly.I opted for room service on my first day after a long trip, my lunch (burger and fries) was nice and very fulfilling for one person however my evening meal was a let down (Mahi fish with rice), everything was very bland and boring which was a surprise to me in Hawaiian. The hotel services complimentary buffet breakfast but it's pretty basic even though they cook to order your eggs/omelets.I'd probably stay at this hotel if I travelled with my family given the size of rooms and the proximity to the beach/restaurants but I think the value and star rating there are better hotels nearby.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had a lovely, roomy suite in the tower closer to the beach (an upgrade) which appeared to have fairly new furnishings and was quite comfortable. The shower head sprayed all over but everything else seemed to work. Small frig and microwave provided. The breakfast was well run and offered a fair number of choices and the hot dishes rotated every other day. The staff in the hospitality area was excellent: the omelette lines were run better than any Embassy Suites I have visited and there were helpful attendants to clear tables and even offered refills on juice and coffee! The same area is used for a lovely happy hour each day--it has an open covered area next to the pool and also seating inside. HH features basic bar snacks but a large variety of drinks. The bartenders are really great. 3 days a week there is live music during happy hour. It was an impressive perk of staying at this hotel. The hotel is not on the beach, but only a block away from a beach access path. While not my favorite part of Waikiki beach, it's only 5 minutes by foot to the ocean. The main reason that I gave only 4 stars is that the lobby area is lacking any feeling of cohesion. The two towers are connected by long corridors and a walk through the entrance to the parking lot/valet area and a rather unimpressive lobby. When compared with the nearby Sheraton, Outrigger or Moana, the lobby and public areas of the Embassy Suites don't measure up. For me, it didn't matter at all. The pool and hospitality areas made up for the lack of a nice lobby but I've been to Waikiki many times. Also, in a fairly tough area to drive around in, the Embassy Suites is easy to navigate. Valet parking is efficient, though expensive, and there is room to unload luggage and passengers. Also, there are many shops and restaurants in the same block as the hotel, including a deluxe ABC just across Lewers which seemed to be open all hours. I will stay here again if I'm able and will recommend it to others.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We liked the hotel so much that we will use it again when we return to Honolulu in two years. We have stayed in two others in the same location but plan to use this one upon our return. We liked Roy's dinning and will go again our next stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great location! The breakfast is fantastic ! The happy hour was very enjoyable with live music most nights. You are only across the street from the beach so it's a easy walk. The rooms are very nice plenty of room. Morning newspaper . The pool area is also a good place to hang out with plenty of seating.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our absolute favorite place to stay in Waikiki. Staff is always wonderful and the breakfast is abundant and delicious. If you're lucky enough to stay there when they have entertainment at the managers reception, don't miss it!Lots of dining options around and shopping is very close by.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: 3 night stay celebrating partners Birthday. Have always loved staying here, will again. The location is the best, special rate made it a great value. Loved the total experience. The pool furniture choices was special.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Liked the hotel, the hotel staff is excellent in all areas except the front desk. The front desk people are nice to begin with but when you deviate from the norm they get short and rude with answers. Susanna left a bad impression upon checking out but she was not alone in that dept. Christina who works in the pool/bar area as well as her manager was friendly and nice to be around. The women who took care of our room was the best I've every had, she was friendly and inviting. We stayed on the 14th floor.Breakfast was awesome and well worth the effort!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We chose this facility in order to have an oceanview suite on Waikiki. We were pleased with the view and took advantage each day of the complimentary breakfast and evening reception. Room was spotless! Lots of restaurants and fine shopping nearby.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The staff here always greeted us with a smile and "Aloha!". The hotel is within easy walking distance of Waikiki Beach, which is beautiful. The complimentary breakfast was wonderful. They had a buffet line with eggs, bacon, biscuits and gravy,as well as salad fixings and steamed rice. There was also a line to have a custom-made omelet fixed for you. In the evening, there was a complimentary happy hour with free drinks and snacks. Some evenings, they have live music also. Our stay was very enjoyable!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Complimentary breakfast is excellent with made to order omelets and a lot of choices for omelet ingredients. Quite a few options for a complimentary breakfast. I enjoyed the evening complimentary drinks, snacks, and occasionally live music. It was close to good places to eat and drink.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had a one bedroom suite with three adults, two balconies. Amenities and bath and pool towels were provided. Pool rules said no inflatables but the pool was full of them. The hot tub was attached to the pool (which was salt water). It would have been nice to have a separate hot tub for adults. The turf by the pool was crumb rubber (not good). Breakfast is included and was terrific every day. Everything was cooked to order. Evening snacks are just a few veggies and chips plus drinks but nice nevertheless. Valet service was very efficient but a bit pricey at $35. per day. Don't get a room by the elevator. We had to request a fan to be run at night to drown out the dinging of the elevator. Business center was great. We were able to check in for our flight home and print our boarding passes. Aldrin at the breakfast service was wonderful and much deserving of an extra tip. Housekeeping was less than optimal as we had to request clean glasses, cups, tea, sugar every day. One day the room was not cleaned until after 6PM.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel is centrally located. Great rooms, beds and room service. I would especially recommend it for families with young children. If you do not want a lot of children around the pool area this hotel is not for you. Parking available at $35 per night, but adjacent parking is available for around $25 per night. My grown son and I stay here each year and love it for the rooms, complimentary breakfast and happy hour. We do not utilize the pool as we prefer the beach.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Everything was exceptional. Except the terrible reservation department for after hours. Steer clear of Ella. Terrible Customer Service. She should either get some serious remedial training or maybe find another profession.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had an ocean view 2 room suite. While not direct ocean, view was OK not wonderful. We were on the 25 floor. I would recommend a corner room if possible.Nightly cocktail hour was good, but do not expect not replace dinner with food offered. The band which played one evening was fabulous. Breakfast was outstanding. Our maid service in room was wonderful. Great location!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: In downtown Waikiki, walking distance to everything from the beach to shops, to high end mall, to Walmart....lol The staff truly displayed the spirit of Ohana (family) during my stay. Their attitude makes everything else perfect. Alooooohaaaaaa!! Best breakfast on the island, without a doubt! Manager's reception every night makes it hard to leave the hotel and go out in town! lol

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Only a short walk to the beach and straight outside is some fantastic shopping. Super friendly and helpful staff. Love cocktail hour by the poo and the complementary breakfast. Our suit was clean and we were upgraded to be able to share space with our friends.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Although it was just my wife and I staying, it is an excellent hotel for families, having a more kid friendly atmosphere, yet still having accommodations for adults and children alike. The complimentary breakfast and "happy hour" are well worth it, especially in a destination that has a very high cost of living.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our room was large enough for 5 adults, kept very clean everyday and the fresh supply of towels and beach towels. Great pool to swim always kept clean. Daily breakfast was a added bonus when you have teenagers. So close to all your dining ,shopping only about 150m to the beach.; The bonus was having Denny's right outside. Would stay again

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Just back from my 2nd stay at this property in the past 9 months and truly... In 46 years of traveling, have not experienced a better stay anywhere. Sure, the location... just about 100 paces from the gorgeous Waikiki beaches doesn't hurt a bit... But more than anything, it was the wonderful people I experienced each and every day of my 8 day stay there that made the experience so wonderful! Ultra comfortable and spacious 2 room suites are sooo appreciated (even as I was just traveling by myself, the extra space to move around and "live" makes a stay so much more comfy)!! The staples of Embassy Suites with their full, cooked-to-order Breakfast and Evening Manager's reception have stepped it up a very big notch at this property in particular with a very enhanced Breakfast menu (many additional Items from Miso soup to a light Asian-influenced salad, to a terrific assortment of Cereal add-ones; not to mention the terrific omelette bar and more) and a very Island enhanced Comp Reception every evening (no less, with talented Nightly Island entertainment)...I travel quite a bit... For work... and for fun! Can't say I remember a better SERVICE experience than my stays BOTH TIMES (April '16 and June '17)!!!Throughout my entire stay, enjoyed meeting so many of the hotel staff (from Valet, Bellstaff, Front Desk, Concierge, PBX, F&B (breakfast and evening recent staff), HOUSEKEEPING (best housekeeping attendant ever) that genuinely CARED about me and my stay...Thank you, Embassy Suites on a job very well done!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great two room suite gives you a little space. Although I got stuck with the room next to the elevator there was no elevator noise. Had a nice view of the pool. Breakfast is included and appeared a little chaotic or just too many hungry people getting there at one time. Recommend getting there when it opens and not during the mid part of the feeding frenzy, like I did

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had a lovely stay. The hotel's location makes it ideal for dining, shopping, the beach and entertainment. We would definitely recommend it for the value and location but the staff was the icing on the cake.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We really liked this hotel - wonderful pool area, only one block from the beach, very clean rooms with a never-ending supply of fresh beach towels, great breakfast (loved the omelettes!) and the nightly reception is brilliant (big shout out to the two friendliest bartenders in the world!). We had hoped the evening entertainment would be more hula than Tom Jones, which it wasn't, but that's a really minor complaint in an otherwise flawless stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We spent four nights at the Embassy Suites Waikiki and enjoyed a wonderful time! The Embassy Suites is right on Beachwalk Street with quick and easy access to Waikiki Beach. There are many, many shops in the area. The hotel itself is a beautiful property. Our room had great views of the pool and some limited views of the ocean. Each morning started with a breakfast buffet served in a dining area near the pool. It did get hectic at times but it was always well-managed. There were two chefs preparing eggs-to-order and there were two buffet lines for other hot items (i.e., scrambled eggs, meats, potatoes, etc.). In the dining area itself, there was a large station for beverages (coffee/tea and soft drinks) and there was a cold buffet in a separate area which had cereals. The chefs did a great job and we enjoyed great omelets each morning. From 5:30P – 7:30P there was a manager’s reception. On several nights there was live music. In addition to complimentary cocktails, beer and wine, there were appetizers which changed nightly. They included veggies & dip, chips & salsa, peanuts, potato chips, etc. The appetizers were replenished throughout the evening. All staff at the property were warm & friendly. We did have to pay $35 per night for valet parking but the cost isn’t too unreasonable giving the price of parking nearby. The valets did a great job in bringing the car up as soon as requested. Again, we had a great stay and we recommend this property to others!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Had a nice stay in King Suite, view was nice, even had a view of the beach, anyways, beach is close by. Room recommendation - Aloha Tower - avoid room numbers ending in '01'. Lot of noise from elevators next to it right through the day and night. Other than that stay is very comfortable. Everything is available around the hotel. Don't really like their Expedia travel help desk though. They are selling packages and instead of offering deals, are charging higher than the actual charge of the activity.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The hotel is very well placed with easy access to the beach and adjacent to major shopping areas and restraunts. The Hotel rooms are spacious, clean and well appointed. The FREE breakfact and complimentary entertainment and drinks every evening just add the reason to stay here.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stay for seven night .Excellent service from the entire staff. Great breakfast. Easy walk to beach. Short walk to shopping and restaurants. Everyone was so friendly and helpful. Alhoa tell next time

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our kids love this place! The breakfast is great! The managers reception with free entertainment is absolutely inviting. Can't go wrong here! Most of the staff have great attitudes and they make you feel welcomed.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great 8 days with the family at this terrific Waikiki Beach hotel. My wife & 2 kids (16 & 12) & I found this 2 room suite to be perfect amount of space & very clean & comfortable which is most important to us! We had a fabulous ocean view in 1831 Hula tower on the 18th floor to enjoy incredible sunsets & all the warm Hawaii nights!! The hotel is in a perfect location on beach walk with tonnes of restaurants, shopping nightlife & a super fast < 5 min walk to beach! Great place if you do t have a vehicle. The room was always kept very clean & spacious enough that we weren't't tripping over each other in the minimal time spent in the room. The only 2 things that keeps this from a 5 star rating in my view is that the pool area was swarmed by very young kids from early morning until at least 9-9:30 at night everyday which even my 12 & 16 year old found annoying & exhausting. It was very loud & I can only imagine how hard the chlorine had to work!! But it is a family hotel so if you are looking for a quiet space I suggest the Trump or Halekulani but those will be in a different price category as well. The other disappointing part of the stay was the managers reception every night at the pool area from 5:30-7. We were looking forward to having a nice place to relax at the end of the day, have a couple free drinks & some nice appetizers before going out for a later dinner.
