When we checked it out on the first evening we were disappointed at the quality of the drinks & especially the appetizers....nothing more than some tortilla chips with melted cheese & some broccoli florets, ranch dressing & goldfish crackers......really!! And it was basically the same every night, a little more upscale & some variety would have been nice. Even though it was free, it wasn't worth it to us.Overall, a great family hotel in a perfect location on Waikiki with some potentially terrific views. If you are looking for good quality at a reasonable price (for Hawaii LOL) this is your spot. If you want a little more quiet or upscale, it will be too loud & hectic with families! I would probably not stay again as we like more peace & may look elsewhere but it is everything it promised to be.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: As a former personnel executive in the Hawaii tourist industry before I moved to the mainland, during my annual return trips to Hawaii, I would try out various hotels in the Waikiki area to compare quality of service, location and accommodations of hotels of different price ranges from Trump, Halekulani, Royal Hawaiian, Moana, Hyatt, Marriott, and Wyndham. Our last week in Embassy Suites has convinced us that it is difficult for the other hotels to match the price value of ES in terms of location (we prefer Beachwalk area to central Kalakaua because it is quieter, cleaner, and close to our preferred less congested beach area around Hilton, Fort DeRussy area). ES is surrounded by its own area of shops and restaurants right outside its door. The room size and cleanliness and up to date decor of ES was right on with a living room area with a pull out sofa, dining area and microwave/sink/and mini fridge and two full size TVs. Nice size pool and lounging area and a small fitness center. In terms of service, top drawer from Garrick taking our request for early check in and higher floor room assignment, to Ray with his wonderful Jamaican accent who greeted us royally when we checked in. Great first impression. Housekeeping was great and did I mention the room rate includes full breakfast in addition to a daily cocktail reception with wine/beer/ and specialty drinks with local live entertainment. Traffic entering and exiting hotel is efficient although there is a daily parking fee. Example of excellent service is Lacy, catering manager who graciously allowed us to see the last minutes of the San Antonio Spurs game at the cocktail area. Note their General Manager personally responds to all social media reviews. This general manager's attentiveness to service and details is reflective on the management of this specific ES hotel. The Tom family no longer needs to check out hotels for Honolulu vacations. We have found our home, Embassy Suites and will be back with our whole family next time around.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Good breakfast and staff, lousy internet. good location. We enjoyed our stay and it suited our family - it catered well to those with children. Maybe this would not be the place for young adults looking to go out and party.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: On our honeymoon, first time in Hawaii.We usually don't mind some bad customer service as maybe one staff member doesn't represent all others, but this place, it's reception and registration staff are probably the worst I have come across ever.They were rude, abrupt and were very authoritative in their approach.For example: when we first arrived, there was no "hello, welcome to embassy suites" etc, it was just "NEXT!" And there was no one in line or around the desk.We were told to go away at 1PM because the room wasn't ready, no offer of a "hey upstairs is our bar, why don't you go enjoy a drink there we will call you", we just got a "your room isn't ready till about 3, come back then"When we turned up at 3, and I said to the guy "we were told to come back around 3 to get our room" his exact response was "did we say 'around 3, or after 3'? Because im sure we said after 3" then someone came around him and said "the room is ready just let them have it now"Infront of us.I didn't want to create a scene, so I thanked themTook the keys and my wife and went to the room, but when you pay almost 4000$ for a weeks stay, I expect some courtesy.On the plus side, all other staff, including the porters are very friendly. The room is fairly clean and has good ammenities, it's near everything and the view is awesome.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: First and foremost, the Embassy Suites by Hilton is by far my favourite hotel when travelling. I love the comfort of a separate living area and bedroom along with amenities such as a fridge and microwave. Secondly, the hot breakfast buffet in the morning is just what I need to get my day going. It is so convenient and includes a variety. Eggs made any way you like, fruits, cereals, meats and potatoes. It's just phenomenal. The hotel is located directly across the street from Waikiki beach which is convenient. There are lots of places to eat in the area. The pool is nice. Staff are friendly. Beautiful location. Valet Parking. Nothing beats the Embassy Suites in my books!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This place is great for families and the outstanding features are the free breakfasts and happy hours every day. The staff are friendly and helpful, the beds and pillows very comfortable....as Australians we don't take this for granted because hotel pillows here are made at the cement factory....three things would make this a five star experience for us. One, the pool is too small and shallow.....I understand real estate is at a premium but ideally, considering the number of people and families that stay here, perhaps two pools would be best to cope with the demand.Secondly, laundry facilities in the apartments would be a great asset. We travelled as a family of five and I found myself staying up when exhausted in order to get to the laundry when our clothes were done, every second day.Oh and thirdly, before I forget, the wifi connection was very unreliable and sketchy. It cut in and out constantly.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: very helpful staff with a location that is easy to get in and out of with a car. Close to shopping and a good range of restaurants. Nice rooms and breakfast location. Better than the doubletree nearby, but they tend to be significantly more per night.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: If you like to be in a crowded area but surrounded by a lot of shopping this is the spot for you. Nice view of the ocean once you look pass the other buildings. Would visit Hawaii again but not this particular area again. Overall hotel is nice but didn't like area; too congested for me.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had 3 days here and really enjoyed our stay. Well located in Waikiki - on the edge of the hotel strip, and just one block from the beach. Better priced than the expensive beachside hotels, and it included a full buffet breakfast and free snacks and alcoholic cocktails each night. Our room was spacious and clean and the bed was great - the best of our trip. Its not a cheap hotel, but with its great location, included breakfast and cocktails, its worth the money. We found it was usually the last pickup of shuttle buses, and the first drop off, that worked out well. It also has great shopping around it with Beach Walk shops, and the Hawaiian Centre across the street. It also had good food options from expensive to cheap food trucks out back to choose from .....

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed 10 nights at Embassy suites, and we are so glad we selected this hotel. Our rooms were a great size and exceptionally clean - really impressed (housekeeping were amazing and went above and beyond to make our stay more comfortable). Pool and location fabulous. Breakfast, great for us We will be back

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our family of 5 had a wonderful stay here. It was so close to Waikiki beach and the shops. It was only about a 20 minute walk to the Zoo or Ala Moana Shopping center. Staff, rooms, pool and food were excellent.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Although this hotel is not waterfront, it is a mere short stroll away to the water. And "Beacwalk" is just beside it with so many restaurant choices. The rooms are comfortable and well appointed. We would stay here again if we return to Honolulu.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Rooms at this hotel were clean and always well supplied. The staff is Rooms were clean and well supplied. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Breakfast is outstanding. Location is right on the Beachwalk and short walk to the beach. My husband and I really enjoyed our stay here!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We have just returned from staying at The Embassy Suites in Waikiki and would definitely recommend it. The location is great and the suites are well appointed, clean and spacious. The evening reception is fantastic!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The breakfast stopped exactly 10am. My room was cleaned after 2pm everyday where I couldn't relax, one day I told housekeeping just give me more towels and don't clean the room. I enjoyed the pool. It's a beautiful hotel and the location was great.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: If you are looking for a great place to stay in Waikiki the Embassy suites should be your be the choice .It is well placed in Lewers St and right in the centre of major shopping and dining areas .Also transport to Ala Moana mall is all close by

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We checked into the Embassy Suites when our room at the Waikiki Hilton fell through. I had stayed at the Hilton Waikiki beach several times before, but likely never again. Our stay at the Embassy Suites was simply amazing. I had some interactions with the Hotel manager, Malia Espinda, and she was incredible. Very polite and attentive and everything I would want if I were hiring a manager. She was everything a Guest services manager should be and more. We also had a couple of instances to talk to Dean at the bell desk and he went out of his way to help us and set up transportation as needed. When we checked into the hotel, the wrong tower, but correct room number was written on our check in ticket. Dean noticed it and insisted on going up with us to make 100% sure we were in the right place. He actually said, "i don't want you to have to come down get another key if its wrong so I'll make sure. If a different key is needed I'll let you into the room and personally go get two new keys for you". Who does that anymore? Service from top to bottom at this hotel was no less than some of the best we have ever had.Family friendly for sure, but very quiet overall. The only noise we noted was kids having a blast at the busy area around the pool as they should. There were quieter parts of the pool area is you wanted them, but we had fun watching the crazy kids. The food and happy hour (or two hours) at the pool every day was great. We met many people and had a great time mingling. The full breakfast buffet was also amazing with cooked to order eggs or omelets. 100% a very good breakfast with no room for complaints. Breakfast is also served from 6:30-10:30 which is great. Many hotel limit these hours, i'm assuming in an attempt to limit the number of breakfasts served. The Location is truly the best part. Very central to Waikiki, the Royal Hawaiian Shopping center and the beach. Its really about the best of all worlds when you are looking for vacation. We looked out our balcony at the Prada store and all the shopping up and down the area. Extremely central. The Royal Hawaiian Village is also a very nice hotel, but just a bit far from everything. This hotel gets a 10 for location without question.The rooms are very clean and very nice. Not extravagant, but very nice and very quiet. Linens are top notch and the mattresses are very comfortable. Tons of pillows as well! Great selection of TV channels for everyone and incredible views of Diamond head from the one side of the hotel. The only thing we really didn't like was leaving! Not a complaint anywhere and we thank the whole staff that offered any help as either of us needed. I can assure you that we will be back.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Many times you have taken care of staff also spent time a comfortable hotel in friendly We look forward every time in the humor of live also enjoy bartender Also I looking forward to request each time the omelet favorite in the Morning

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Weve stayed her twice in the last 12 months. The first time was a 10 night stay family vacation. This last stay was a 2 night stay for a funeral.Checkin was a breeze. The corner room on 19th floor has a spectacular view. The cook to order breakfast is plentiful. The evening reception is always well received.A little pricy, but when yoy add in the above, price point is competitive.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: the hotel ,staff and complimentary breakfast was great and location was fantastic.whenever we needed anything , we got it , if there was a problem it was fixed .services like shuttle to Pearl Harbour and the airport was also very good !

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Very nice hotel. The room was clean and well stocked and quiet. You are not right on the beach so don't expect a stellar view of the ocean, but, the location was great with a short walk to Waikiki Beach and great shopping. The complimentary breakfast offered lots of options including made to order omelets. The staff went above and beyond to take care of us at this hotel. As our flight was at night, and checkout was 11:00am, we had almost a full day in Waikiki, and the staff held our luggage and provided a hospitality suite where we could freshen up a bit and change clothes for the flight. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Decent breakfast in morning, snacks in evening included for free as with all Embassy Suites. Good location with beach a block away. ABC stores (3) and a 7-11 all within a block to stock up the in room fridge with snacks and drinks. Room service is reasonable if you're all ready to collapse but stops service ~10pm - just keep that in mind. We skipped a car except for one day and could walk to everything we wanted in Honolulu.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The best value for the price. The breakfast and happy hour saved us a lot of money. Having a microwave in the room was perfect! The room is spacious with double lanai's and the bed is very comfortable. The only "quark", and its a small one, I wish they had a magnified mirror in the bathroom. But the service and accommodations were the best we've experienced in Waikiki.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Forget price - you are in hawai'i after all. For a branded hotel - it was well worth it. Walk to the beach and the shops or leave in your car around the island with the valet parking.Checkin was pretty slow process - but once we got to the room - 16th floor with balcony - we had a smile on our face with the view and comforts. The breakfast was great every day of the stay - make to order, and buffet with a miso soup station! I usually don't say this but I loved the water pressure and hand sprayer were the best I have had in a hotel! The staff was very friendly - embraced the aloha spirit.A little tip here and there and good karma when you run into those workers again Will return!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The rooms are clean and have plenty of room with the additional living room area. Staff is friendly, complimentary breakfast is great, and the managers evening reception is the best. A+++++Terry Kenyon

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My sister and I recently stayed in this hotel. It is a huge hotel but very well run. On arrival our check in was quick and efficient and we were offered a delicious cool juice to drink. We were given a suite on the 11th floor which was extremely comfortable. The hotel is extremely well located on Beachwalk to give access to the huge amount of shops and eateries, also the beach and easy connections to The Bus and shuttles. While here we had two problems which were sorted out very quickly, no trouble at all. All the staff were very happy, cheerful and very friendly. I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our party of 5 adults had both a standard suite and a 2-bedroom / 2-bath suite, which were very comfortable and provided desired privacy. We were particularly impressed with the staff friendliness and great valet car service. We never waited more than 3 to 5 minutes from the time we requested our vehicle. Breakfasts were good, and a great start to each day, and the manager receptions in the evening were very nice too. Over the past 8 years we have stayed at this property 3 times, as well as at other properties in the Waikiki area. If it is not a requirement that you stay right on Waikiki Beach, we think you would enjoy this property whether you are traveling with or without children.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We love the Embassy Suites, the location is perfect, the rooms are spacious and clean and you cannot beat the breakfast. Staff is eager to help with any needs and always upbeat. We have chosen this hotel 4 times now and will plan to come back.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our family of 2 adults and 2 kids visited in the end of March. Everything about the hotel was perfect. Friendly front desk staff, nice welcome beverage, the 1 bedroom suite we had was extremely clean and well supplied, everything from towels to beach/pool towels. Breakfast buffet was very generous with good variety, freshly made omelette was great. Plenty of tables and space. Drinks and snacks reception in the evening was good too. Pool size was excellent as well. Proximity of the hotel to the beach was a major plus. In short, we loved everything about this hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed as couple for anniversary nice champagne touch on arrival.Have stayed here 4 other times 10plus days each. Breakfast great staff wonderful.front desk staff there 8-10yrs seem bothered by questions.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Location was terrific and the staff was fantastic. The only thing I felt is that $35/day parking is a little bit steep. If they reduce the parking fee, it would be fantastic. Otherwise, had a nice time.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had a 2 bedroom suite for us and three kids and it was WONDERFUL!! The pool and hot tub are great, but a little crowded at times. Get to breakfast early to beat crowds and it makes lunch an option! The free drinks are nice to unwind in the evening. Don't spend twice as much for a hotel on the beach - this is less than a block away, all beaches in Hawaii are public, and they even encourage you to take the pool towels to the beach! Traffic noise is bad on the Beachwalk side, even though we were on the 9th floor. The day before you check out they leave a CD of Hawaiian songs for you and there's a free beach bag in your room when you check in, among other niceties. The store off the lobby is great and has most anything you'd need. The staff, without exception, is fabulous; they want to make sure you're having the best vacation possible, especially Cindy at the front desk. Only gripe is that they only have valet parking $35 a day. There is a big parking ramp down the street; not sure if that would be cheaper. And be sure to leave the air conditioner on, it's kind of weak if the room gets too hot. I can't imagine any way this stay could have been better!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is the place to stay for a weekend getaway! Evening Managers Special gets you free selection of beer and cocktails. Also, free complimentary breakfast was more than expected. It included a made to order egg station and several hot and cold items. Only negative comment - no breakfast room service. Looking forward to next stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had a fabulous week, staff were excellent. Rooms were spacious, clean and well designed. Complimentary breakfast was wonderful with a good selection of food. These suites are close to downtown Waikiki - it was easy to get to any place we wanted to go. Most definitely recommend to anybody wanting a top class stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed in August 2015 with family of 5. Big enough rooms, great central location. Breakfast was fine - a bit of a huge free-for-all but expected. No big issue. Drinks in the evening was very good - nice and strong drinks! Would stay here again - good value and excellent location.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: First time to Hawaii and decided that Waikiki would be a good first time for my family and me. The room was big enough for 2 adults and 2 children and we liked that door divided the bedroom and living area which doubles as second bedroom. We were not on the room most of the time. The location was great you are in the middle of great shops and easy walk to bus tours and about a block to the beach. I would use this hotel again when back in the area.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My family of 7 is here now. We have two rooms side by side. They are clean, modern, and very comfortable. The breakfast is good, valet and front desk service are good. The location is just about perfect. It is right in the center of the shopping and restaurants. It is full, but not super crowded. We walked over to the Sheraton last night and oh my goodness. That place was packed! I really want to give Embassy Suites an excellent, but there is one point that is keeping me from doing so. The hotel is not on the beach, and therefore does not have beach chair/ cabana rentals. I have been trying since yesterday to get some chairs reserved on Waikiki, to no avail. The Royal Hawaiian has some public chairs and umbrellas available to rent, but they sell out quickly. I wish I had known this. So, if you are coming here and want to spend the day on the beach, in a chair and not on a towel, reserve your chairs early. Also, the pool here is small, but it looks like all the hotels have small pools from what I have noticed. All in all, this is a great place. Just reserve your beach day early.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel is in a good location, with nice rooms and a nice pool area that isn't too crowded. The thing that set it apart from other hotels for us was the staff. My son has recently gone on a gluten free/dairy free diet. Every morning the hotel serves buffet breakfast that includes hot and cold items. When my son saw pancakes he was so upset that he couldn't have them. One of the staff got the head chef who offered to make some special pancakes for him and delivered them to our table personally. All the staff were great! Only downsides were the kids found the pool quite shallow and a bit small, but better than many hotels in Waikiki. The rooms didn't have cutlery, but I'm sure we could have asked for it.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The a Embassy suites we always stay at as the position is the best and also very spacious suites.The pool is great on the 4th floor and complimentary cocktails, beer etc everynight from 5.30pm-7.30pm.A 5 minute walk to the beach via the outrigger hotel. Tidy, clean and friendly.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Hotel staff was extremely friendly and trying to accommodate additional requests to the best of their ability. Great breakfasts cooked to order by happy chefs and a wide selection of items that changed daily. Views and proximity of the Ocean.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here for 5 days, 4 nights and everyone was so courteous and friendly. When you check in they bring you welcome drinks. All the staff was very helpful and knowledgeable. My only complaint is that the rooms appeared more spacious online than in real life. We had a suite to sleep 6 people and it was a bit cramped.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I cant say enough about this hotel and the excellent staff and service provided. I have been coming to Embassy Suites Beachwalk for years and every time I am blown away with the amenities, friendliness of the staff, cleanliness, and overall appearance of the hotel. I also do a very thorough inspection of the mattress, and surrounding areas and I have NEVER found any bed bugs which is a big problem in many of the other hotels on Oahu. I will continue to use this hotel for all future visits.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel charges twice more than some others in the area. The main reason is that it provides suites and free breakfast. But, the so called suites are kind of small and not very comfortable. The breakfast, other than omelets, is rather poor and selection of food is really unsatisfactory. Did they see the selection at Hilton Frankfurt for example. Orange juice does not taste like real orange juice and there is only one kind of milk. I had to get eggs in addition to the omelet since I did not know what else to eat. Overall the hotel seems much better in photos and on paper than in reality. In order to get to the beach you have to walk quite a bit through a narrow alley between other buildings and, at least in the afternoon, this is the smallest beach I've ever seen. The pool is not big enough for such a big hotel. It's overcrowded during the managers reception where you have to wait in line to get a lot of ice and a bit of orange juice in your glass. There are some carrots and other snacks...it seems like they spent a minimal amount of money. Small fridges, no utensils in room. The location is nice but it's much better to stay at hotels right across the beach like Hyatt Regency which are also cheaper and closer to everything. The Beach Walk stores and restaurants seem overpriced. For example the Cheesecake Factory has the same prices as Chesee Burger on Beach Walk, but Cheesecake Factory is so much more superior in every way. Perhaps this would not be so bad if Embassy Suites was not charging more than others because of things like breakfast but then they warn you to better come at 6:30 hour... or later you may have to wait in long lines. The view from the room is onto several concrete buildings. It does have flat screen TV but the kind that's outdated at this point. No smart TVs.The Internet works but it's not strong enough for streaming TV for example.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: A clean,large 2 room suite with a king size bed. That would be enough, right? But it had an ocean view, great free alcohol drinks at cocktail hour, and amazing breakfasts (and yes, the omelet chefs make salmon omelets!) Beautiful pool.Did I mention- awesome location?

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I really love this Embassy Suites. It is by far the best Embassy Suites I have stayed in. The Waikiki location is convenient to shopping, dining and the beach. The suites are very nice and clean although the furnishings are a little dated. The bed was good. The view fron the room was good. The free breakfast is the best free breakfast I have ever had. The short order cooks making omelets are the best. It's amazing to watch them while they cook your omelet. The staff in the breakfast area couldn't be more accommodating. The breakfast area is outdoors adjacent to the pool deck. This was my second stay at this hotel, and there isn't any place that I'd rather have breakfast. The hotel is probably over priced, but so is everything else in Hawaii. I highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We arrived at 10:30am after a long flight from Australia are were checked in straight away and given keys to our room. When we walked in, we were immediately impressed as the room was large and spotlessly clean. We had a great ocean view from one of our balcony's. The room was well appointed and had 2 queen beds and 1 sofa bed which was more than enough for our party of 4. The beds were SO comfy!!!The location of the property was PERFECT! There were plenty of shops and restaurants within close walking distance and Waikiki beach was only a block away. All staff that we came in contact with were very friendly and helpful. We loved Terry from the Concierge desk!Thank you Embassy suites, we will definitely be back!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My wife and I along with my nephew and his wife spent 5 nights at, in my opinion, the best hotel in Waikiki Beach. This is my fourth stay at this hotel and each stay seems to get better than the previous stays. The buffet breakfast is an amenity that is not included in the rate at most other Waikiki hotels and the food and service are excellent. The breakfast service staff are all very friendly but one in particular, named Aldrin, has always greeted us personally and goes out of his way to see if there is anything we need. The evening reception with snacks, free drinks and entertainment four nights a week is also very nice. The local band which plays at the reception is very good and is one of the reasons we continue to stay here when we go to Honolulu. The bell staff are also very friendly and courteous. One in particular, named Dean, has always been very helpful to us and always says to us, "let me know if there is anything you need". During this stay, Ray Rodney who is a customer service manager greeted us personally at almost every evening reception with an offer to let him know if there is anything we needed to make our stay more comfortable. During this latest visit, Mr. Rodney and one of the servers (Christina) delivered a complimentary large fruit, cheese and crackers tray to our room, which came totally unexpected to us. The tray was excellent. Our housekeeper, Josie, was very friendly and helpful our entire stay. Also, the check-in process went very smoothly and when I asked if there were any complimentary upgrades available we were put into an ocean view room. We couldn't have been more pleased with the room and I only wish I would have gone back to get the name of the lady who checked us in. In summary, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay, as always, and can't wait until we can return here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great location, close to all the amenities in Waikiki. Superb service, very clean and spacious. Great for the entire family both the young and old. Some staff members could have been a bit more relaxed but others were wonderful. Thank u embassy suites Waikiki!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The Hotel is good for its price and is located at a good street only a block away from the beach. It is a one of the best deal you can get for Waikiki but it is no Hilton, Hyatt, Halekulani, Four Seasons, Westin or Shearton but affordable.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Location couldn't be better. Service is fantastic and rooms are very good size and very clean. I travel to Hawaii for business one week a month and although in the center of a highly trafficked tourist destination, this works great for business too. Highly recommend Embassy Suites Waikiki.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is my fourth visit to the hotel but this time I travelled as a family of 6 adults. We stayed in two 2 bedroom suites for 8 nights and the Reception Staff were very accommodating to our request for the rooms to be located nearby. In fact, we were able to have the rooms across from each other. We received a lovely welcome at Reception where we were greeted with a smile and a cold glass of juice. Since my last visit, the hotel has undergone a “refresh” with new carpeting, curtains, lounges and bedding. The linens were beautiful and bedding was very comfortable. Housekeeping staff were very friendly and interested in our daily activities. They were very prompt with servicing our rooms each day. A daily buffet breakfast and nightly cocktail reception are provided to all guests at the Embassy Suites. Breakfast provided a range of choices for everyone – you could choose from a fully cooked breakfast or continental options each day. The cocktail reception provided a choice of beverages, snacks and entertainment – a relaxing way to end the day. Breakfast and cocktails are located on the 4th floor Lanai near the pool – a lovely partly open space. The hotel only offers Valet Parking, no Self-Parking – it seemed quite expensive at $35 per day but it proved to be a great service. Our car was retrieved very quickly each day and the Valets were very courteous. The Embassy is not located on the beachfront but is only a short walk away – however, is located is a great part of Waikiki with all the amenities close by. My family had a wonderful stay and would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a great stay in Waikiki. Good value for money.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is a good place to stay, we had our family and all were catered for young and old. The staff are friendly and but they weren't great at solving a few problems that we encountered.Room was a little on the small side with limited views. Great breakfast and the managers drinks were an excellent way to end the day. The parking made it a very expensive stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I've been going to Embassy Suites Waikiki for about 8 years now, and the hotel has to be one of the best. Gigantic breakfast buffet, free cocktail hour, late night snack time are all one of the best features the Embassy offers! They're pool is nice not to hot or cold, they have a toddler section of the pool with a nice hot tub. Also Embassy is in the perfect section of Waikiki. Walk a half a block and you're on the beach, walk a half a block the other way you're in the city. I'd recommend Embassy to anyone staying in Honolulu.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We began and ended our vacation at the Embassy Suites. Both times, the staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean and comfortable and the separate living room allowed us more space to sit and relax. The breakfast choices were good and they even offer some Japanese food (miso soup, pickled vegetables, rice)- this was a great addition to our breakfast, especially since we like our eggs with rice.... We have always stayed at the Ala Moana hotel in the past, however, since remodeling, they've raised their prices and it is no longer such a bargain. We are going back in May and are planning to stay at the Embassy Suites again!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is an excellent hotel and is what I expect when I stay in Hi! The staff is professional, and ready to assist in every need. The location is perfect. This is one of the few hotels that have the breakfast included and the evening happy hour!!! This is a HUGE plus and well worth it. Highly recommended!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The staff have been here for years, and they still provide exemplary service with a genuine aloha. The value is great. A delicious breakfast, managers reception is a nice touch with varied entertainers...it is all great!!! Having said that... The wifi is non existent!! I would like to see more recycling in hotels in Hawaii.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was a great place to stay.Location was great, rooms clean, staff helpful. We had a 2 bedroom suite, as we were traveling with our adult son. Couldn't have been better. We enjoy the evening reception and included breakfast. Our suite had views of the ocean and mountains from the lanai.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Fantastic location in the heart of Waikiki. This is a great urban hotel in the heart of it all. Located across the street from the beach front hotels, it is only a short walk to the beach. It is within walking distance to great shopping and endless restaurants. The pool area is located on the 4th floor and has a large area to lounge. Breakfast and happy hour cocktails are included every day! The room views are not great, as the city has many high rise hotels - but the location makes up for it. This is not a secluded beach get away. It is an urban hotel with many families staying here. All in all a good base to explore Oahu from.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Chose the Embassy Suites in Waikiki for the room size since traveling with wife and two kids (between 5 and 10 yo) and stayed 7 nights. The room was great, very clean and spacious. We had a ocean view corner room (SE side of hotel, Aloha tower which is closer to the beach side) so had two lanais. We were on a lower floor (< 10) so the smell of the grills from the restaurant below (Roy's) could be a little overwhelming if the lanai doors were open - not a problem if closed. The two queen beds were comfortable but on the soft side. The sofa bed was actually very comfortable since it had a memory foam-type mattress vs. those old spring mattresses.The free breakfast was a good bonus but got less appealing after the 2nd day as the selection was mediocre and the pastries were horrible. The best part were the omelette and cereal stations. We're not much into to drinking alcohol but the evening reception seemed popular.The location was both good and bad. The good - close to shopping and restaurants and a 5 minute walk to the beach. The bad - it is surrounded on all sides by other hotels so street noise at night is a problem. Starting at about 3am, you can hear semi-trucks, delivery trucks, trash trucks, etc. backing into to bays in the various hotels and they make that loud beeping noise as they reverse in. This happened just about every night except maybe Sunday. If you wear ear plugs, you should be OK. If it wasn't for the noise, I would give this hotel a solid 4 instead of the 3.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Loved staying here :) We stayed for ten days. The rooms were really nice and clean; daily housekeeping was great too. The breakfasts were amazing! Lots of food, plenty of variety with slight changes each day; also an egg chef was available who cooked the most amazing omelettes or you could order fried, poached or boiled if you preferred. You most definitely would not be leaving this breakfast hungry! Everyday, from 5:30 to 7:30pm, was 'Happy Hour' with free drinks like. Blue Hawaii, Mai Tai, wine and beer and snacks. There was no limit on the drinks and the snacks could certainly fill you e.g. nachos, crisp veges with dips like broccoli and carrot; edamame beans; nuts and other snack mixes. The swimming pool was a great size and had a large spa pool attached; there were plenty of poolside chairs, tables, loungers and canopy day beds. If you're lucky you will get a room with a view out to sea; however, the surrounding views are also pleasant. We did ask for a room change (which was no trouble to them at all) and that was because our first room was right beside the lift i.e. the lift walls were in our bedroom so we could hear it going up and down all night; that would be our only recommendation: ensure you're not beside it! Also, the word apartment (which was used to describe our accommodation at booking) in this case means your room does not come with crockery, cutlery, glasses or tea towels etc. You can request them if needed. The room has a microwave and kettle/jug, tea, coffee etc but no other cooking facilities. Overall, a great place, located in a really handy position with relaxed staff who make you feel at home. I would definitely go back!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We really enjoyed our stay in this hotel for the second time .The only reason that I don't give it 5 star is the Internet Speed .The internet of Hotel was so weak and we almost didn't have any connection most of the nights .

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I stayed in this hotel from 2/20/2016 to 2/26/2016. The first room I was in, room 1006, for 3 days. After that they moved me into another room for 3 more days because the first room had bedbugs. They didn't tell me why I had to move, but I saw a maid working in our first room and I asked what he was doing. He said they were spraying for bedbugs. One day before I was to leave the bedbug bites started showing up on me. The day I left I was loaded with them so much and itched terribly. I was with my wife and we went to the manager. He gave us back the money for the room with the bedbugs, but had to pay for the other room. I went to the doctor the day I arrived home and he told me they were bedbug bites. He couldn't believe how many I had. When I got home I had to throw away my luggage, wash all clothes in hot water and dry them, freeze my shoes and any other things I couldn't wash. They didn't reimburse me for that. It was a lot of work to keep the bedbugs from coming into the house. My wife and I were celebrating our 50th wedding anniversary. Some trip. It was awful

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: - Room we stayed in had a nice view of the city and water.- Room included a very nice hot breakfast in the AM. - Also nice cocktail time in the evening.- Staff was very friendly.- Easy access to the beach.- lots of shopping and restaurants near by.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Nice clean suite, comfy bed, in-room safe. Hotel offers delicious breakfast including made-to-order omelets and a huge variety of both hot and cold items on its buffet. Daily manager's reception is an added bonus with free cocktails and snacks. Location is excellent - a short walk to the beach, restaurants and shopping. Hotel staff is friendly, cold water awaits your arrival in the lobby daily. Free wi-fi and a balcony add to the perks this hotel offers.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The room was very nice and spacious. The hotel is very well located on the Beach Walk and there are multitudes of restaurants and shops within walking distance. Access to the beach is a short walk. They have a large pool with plenty of seating. Not a destination hotel since it is not on the ocean, but perfect stay for an overnight or short stay. They met all of our needs and the complimentary tote bag was a lovely and useful gift.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My stay at the Embassy Suites was fantastic and could not fault it. Breakfast was delicious Evening entertainment and managers reception was great and I found the selection of nibblies and drinks to be great. Staff at reception assisting with tour bookings were brilliant and very informative and made selecting tours and things to do in the area a breeze. The rooms and particularly the beds were very comfortable. Loved the location - walking distance to everything we wanted to do. Would definitely recommend to other guests interesting in staying at this hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed in this hotel while waiting to settle into a home after transitioning here with the military. We had a 1 bedroom corner unit, which comfortably accommodates a couple with three small children. The staff are wonderful!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Trip Advisor will not allow reviewers to post a second review on the same venue until 3 months has elapsed and the reviewer has stayed there a second time. I’ve only recently been reminded that I did not post this (second) review, so it my now be “out-of date”, but still relevant. If I was aware of this prior to posting my first review of this venue, I would have included it in my first review of 24th July 2015.My review on that date applies in all respects to this visit as well.HOWEVER:Firstly, our advice is ENSURE THERE ARE NO USA SCHOOL HOLIDAYS during the period you wish to stay. The local Hawaii paper publishes weekly snapshots of how many visitors the State receives. I think (from memory) the average is 70,000. 50,000 come from mainland USA and 20,000 from other countries. So accommodation venues are pretty well booked out over holiday periods (which is also reflected in their room rates).Also,VERIFY CHECK-IN TIMES. If, like us, you have arrived at your accommodation after a long, sleep-disrupted overnight flight you may find that you have to wait several hours for a room to become available, even longer if you are in a group and want suites close to each other. Reception staff do the best they can, but it’s just the timing – they are waiting for other guests to book out so rooms can be prepared for the next “wave”. They are happy to hold your luggage. BEWARE of rooms ADJACENT TO LIFTS– we had room 1901 in Aloha Towers for over a week and were awoken every night by the noise of the lifts. Perhaps Management might consider staying in this room for a few nights when the premises are “fully loaded” to assess the problem? SAFETY ISSUE – in support of other reviews already posted by others - Management appears to have no reasonable procedure or communications in place to deal with evacuation in case of emergency e.g. fire alarm. To hear a loudspeaker blast out in the early hours of the morning and having to cope with stairs for 15 floors without sighting or receiving instructions or assistance from anyone in authority was not a good experience. A printed apology delivered to rooms did not mention the cause of the event. That was left to word of mouth and a statement by the General Manager in response to another review days later. Hopefully this will be resolved before I next visit Hawaii?

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I stayed in February. The lobby was nice, offered us water and fruit drink. The hotel is clean and in a good location. The mail issue from 10PM to 4AM you can not sleep. I was switched to 2 different rooms, than another tower to no avail. This hotel was not built very well at all in regards to sound proofing. I will never stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Rooms are very small and very noisy. We pre selected the room we wanted, but were given a upgraded room that was suppose to have a view. The only view we had was of other hotels. Bell service lost a bag that we found ourselves. Hotel itself is nice. Avoid room 1130. Very noisy.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Having stayed in many different hotels this is a great location and very quiet considering it's location. Your right next to the Beachwalk stores and restaraunts. The rooms are clean and you have two rooms. The breakfast is great every morning. In the evening there is a reception with drinks and snacks near the pool with live local music it was great.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This Embassy hotel lives up to the standard that I expect with all Embassy's. Comfortable room, good service, good pool area, and manager's reception and breakfast service had many options and was well stocked. Hotel location was good. It was a one block walk to beach and a 5-10 minute walk to central location of Waikiki beach by the Duke statue. There are many restaurants close to this hotel within a easy walk. I recommend this hotel for your Waikiki stay. My only negative thought is that Hilton did not let me earn Honors points because I booked through "booking.com". And that was disappointing. I do try to stick to the Hilton brand and would hope they (Hilton) would just be glad I am staying at their chain and recognize my loyalty even if I booked through someone else.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great location near the beach and a lot of shopping. Great amount of space to spread out. Love having 2 separate bedrooms with doors and a living room area. Hustle and bustle area so you definitely fill like your in the "middle of it all".

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed 10nights ....great food and drinks...central to everything..will def.go back one day!Breakfast omelettes were fantastic but you tire of them after 3-4 days straight...happy hour is mayhem ..huge line up..so get there early!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Embassy Suites in Honolulu is a great place to stay. It is close to shopping, restaurants and the beach. As Hilton Hhonors members, we were able to select our room a day ahead of arrival. We were in room 2002 for 4 nights. It is a 1 BR King, 2 BA. It was a roomy corner suite, with a city view, but had some water view as well. It was quiet, but we did hear the garbage trucks early one morning, in spite of our windows being closed. This suite does not have a balcony, which we did not miss at all. The suite was very clean and housekeeping service was great. The buffet breakfast was very good and we enjoyed attending the reception in the evening where there were snacks including veggies, dips, chips, etc. I did have difficulty connecting to the Wi-Fi, even with a relatively new device. The staff was friendly and helpful. We would love to stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed 7 nights while attending a conference @ the Hawaii Convention Center & would have no qualms about going back. Though we had stayed @ the Waikiki Beach Marriott numerous times, we found our room @ this hotel quieter (with the lanai door closed, of course) than at the Marriott even though we were only on the 17th floor @ the ES vs. the 30th floor or higher @ the Marriott. Just not as much street noise @ the ES. We had a 2BR/2BA in the Aloha tower, which is the tower furthest from the beach, but looked out onto Diamond Head & a slice of the ocean if one leaned far enough out. The breakfast buffet is not the usual ES buffet, likely due to the high number of Japanese tourists who stay, but that is fine-made for a very nice change of pace. Beach/pool towels provided in the room along w/the usual ES room amenities including fridge & microwave. Unfortunately also the same annoying Hilton internet that has to be renewed every 24 hrs on the nose-this is one area where Marriott wins hands down! Did spend one afternoon @ the pool, which is on the 4th floor & shaded, somewhat, by the taller towers around it. Very short, not even 5 minute walk to the beach for anyone who wants full sun instead. Like most of Waikiki, plenty of shops & restaurants w/in an easy walk.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: When I got there I found out we were upgraded to ocean view room. That was fabulous with 3 patio doors and corner balcony. Thank you embassy. We got there at 1 and the only downfall front desk girl L ?? Was a bit different she said I could check in and not get keys until room ready at 3. I told her I would come back usually the hotels offer to store bags She told me she needs my daughter's name ? I case she gets locked out When we came back a real nice gentleman checked us in Room was fabulous 5 star amenities as well

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We moved from another hotel due to very bad noise problem and were happy that we did. The rooms are great - it's nice to have a separate bedroom. Very clean and they did have a free breakfast (eggs cooked to order) and an afternoon happy hour. We did have a few minor issues. Valet Parking is $35.00 per day and twice they brought me the wrong car. I could have easily driven away with someone else's car. They need to check closer. My biggest complaint was that you need to swipe your room key in the elevator. More than once I had my hands full and could not select my floor because my room key was in my pocket. This is an easy fix - the reader needs to be a proximity reader. It should be able to read my key from my pocket and let me select my floor. Over a nice hotel and I would go back.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: If you want a place to sleep or rest at night, choose another hotel! We stayed there in February. For 7 nights. From the first night all we heard from 10pm to 2am was sounds from upstairs. From balcony furniture being moved to stomping etc. We figured it was a fluke. Same thing the next night. We called and spoke with MYLES. The WORST "manager" ever. Without getting into details, Myles must be fired or reduced to cleaning service. After calling him several times and being insulted, they finally sent security to our room. Security admitted that the room over us had kids in it and the parents told the security guard that HE had to speak to their kids!! WOW!Finally we were able to sleep. The next day I spoke with RAY the day manager. Now Ray was AMAZING! He offered us another room I did not want that. But he insisted. The other room ended up having the same sounds from upstairs on our final two nights. I believe after traveling and staying in 5 start to 2 star hotels that this one has building issues. Overall the staff are decent and the hotel is clean...but not a place to sleep or rest. We will NEVER stay here again and will be seeking a refund.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great hotel for a family event. Loved the location close to the beach, shopping, and many excellent dining choices. The buffet breakfasts and daily manager's reception are hard to beat. Housekeeping services were prompt and efficient. If only the internet service in the hotel was as good as everything else, but is was slow and frustratingly hard to access.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I try and stay at the Embassy Suites whenever I travel to Oahu for work or vacation. With the location, great breakfast and evening snacks and drinks you can't go wrong. The only area that can cause some concern is the front desk. At times they are little hard core and not very flexible regarding rooms assigned, but all in all a great place to stay

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We loved absolutely everything about this hotel and have not one complaint. Check in was a breeze, they gave us a nice refreshing juice drink and also a box of chocolates since it was our anniversary. The buffet is quite good considering it's mass production. A nice variety too. Evening drink is nice--the pupus could be a little better. Pool and hot tub are wonderful! Never was crowded. All of the workers were super friendly and helpful. Room was super spacious and lots of storage. Everything was in good shape and not worn at all. This is the PERFECT location too. Super close walk to beach. Cheeseburger Beachwalk was good. The Denny's across the street is NOT. Subway is super handy for a light meal. We also enjoyed the steak house over at the Outrigger--you grill your own meat and it's like a $20 meal. includes a huge salad bar that also has rice and vegetables. Probably the best value for a really great steak! Embassy Suites has done a beautiful job. We loved our view of Diamond Head from Room 1806--really stunning. Oh remember to be on the beach for the fireworks show at about 7:30 on Fridays--we were told 8:00 and missed it and from what we could tell it would have been amazing!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Everything about this accommodation is superior. Breakfast and cocktail party is exceptional. Perfect location on Beach Walk in Waikiki. Personnel are especially friendly and caring. Hotel is well-designed for comfort and efficiency. Good views of Waikiki Beach from the higher floors.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Non HHONORS member get priority. Made reservations for 3 people, I was the only HHONORS member, I requested a suite in the Aloha tower. Both of the other travelers (non HHonors) were placed in the Aloha tower ocean front suites. I was told there were no rooms in the Aloha tower. After explaining my previous request, I was told I would have to wait 7 hours if I wanted a room in that tower. The suite I got was a middle hotel suite with no view.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We checked into this hotel on February 1 2016, from the moment we checked in we were treated like VIP's........ Check -in was flawless with a room change from the 4th floor to the 14th floor ( which was terrific for us). Breakfast every morning was delicious with a huge assorted of hot made to order eggs and other hot and cold foods available every day. The mornings chefs were always friendly and helpful. Aldrin in the morning was such a hard dedicated worker. We actually waited one morning to sit near where he was working because he was such a great worker and always a pleasure being helpful in what ever we asked. You can see he really cares about his position there and is dedicated to his work Keole the evening bartender was also a pleasure to meet. He is also another dedicated hard worker whom was full of life and enthusim each evening we enjoyed evening cocktails with him he truly is special Christina is another evening staff person we met at the evening reception very polite and kind and a hard worker going out of her to make our stay more enjoyableThe last person I want to mention is Lacy the evening food and beverage manager. What a breath full of fresh air. Lacy truly made our vacation extra special. We enjoyed meeting her and watch each evening as she took care of the daily business of very busy cocktail hours.We know hard work and she made her hard work look easy and fun Taking care of us and many other guest each night. Lacey and her team shows true dedication to the organization. The live music was also very enjoyable each evening. The Pool and reception areas were very up to date and clean. The room itself had a good view of the ocean and both the bed and sofa bed were very comfortable. We really want to thank the staff for a great vacation. Mahalo

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed in a corner 1 bedroom city view room (809). We actually had the view of the ocean too. Hotel room is clean. The outside of the buildings are starting to show their age a bit. Music "Kanilau"

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed in a one bedroom room 809. It was a city view corner room. Even though it said city view, we saw the ocean. Staff is great! The night music 4 nights a week "Kanilau" are wonderful. The free breakfast is good. Nightly appetizers are so so. There could be more of a selection each night, and mix it up a bit. We had early makeup each morning. Great staff.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: There are flashier, beachfront hotels in Waikiki which are great if you have unlimited funds. Make no mistake, this is an expensive area to visit! This hotel will give you some extras for a more reasonable price. It's not beachfront but you can see the ocean from many balconies and the view is just fine. It's nice to have two rooms and not always be relaxing in your bedroom. Best of all is the very good complimentary breakfast buffet. You can eat heartily and skip or go lightly at lunch. The Manager's Reception is a great bonus, free drinks with some so-so snacks, but the savings on the drinks is terrific. The location is great, an easy walk to an open beach and many restaurants.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: When you check in to the embassy suites hotel you r greeted with a wonderful juice and fantastic service! The receptionist are very helpful and begin your vacation with a warm aloha! From the fantastic bellman to the housekeeping everyone is very cheerful and happy to help with whatever your needs. Only criticism would be the free Mia Tia's at the happy hour are not good, go to Mia Tia Bar at the shopping center.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Staff and property was great. Very friendly. Tried to address all our needs. Hotel was close to restaurants, shopping. Breakfast was awesome. Could use a little more variety of food for the happy hour, but it was still great. The entertainment for the happy hour was excellent. Great band and dancer. Rooms were clean. Would visit this hotel again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I stayed here with my family and we were all very happy with our stay here. We absolutely loved the convenience of having breakfast right in the hotel (included), and our meals were always very good. I eat gluten and dairy-free and it was always easy for me to eat since eggs and bacon were always available! The cooks were great with over-easy eggs, omlettes, everything. We also loved being right in the middle of shopping, really close to the bus pickup station, etc. Very happy with this place! The only thing that wasn't great was that the 5th guest who slept on the extra bed had to walk through one of the other bedrooms to use one of the bathrooms.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Upon check in, you receive a wondering mango drink, the rooms are beautiful and clean. The staff was engaging and gracious. Breakfast and evening reception are amazing. Close to the beach, shopping and restaurants.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We are frequent visitors to Waikiki and for several years now have stayed at the Embassy Suites on each visit. Easy access to the beach, backing on to Lewers St with its many restaurants and TheBus only steps away the location is hard to beat.As the name implies it is an all suite hotel with breakfast included, complimentary business centre and a daily Manager's reception by the pool.Staff are invariably friendly and efficient.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We have just come back from 8 nights there and loved every minute of it. The breakfast each morning was awesome and the omelettes really made it for us! The managers reception each evening was also a great extra at no additional cost. The location was great and the pool was perfect. Overall we loved it and will stay again!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: You really can't find a better deal in Waikiki than this location. You aren't on the beach, but you are within a 1-minute walk. The breakfast has many gf options, and the chef was able to point out what was safe. I have many food allergies, so I used their gf bread and bought some less processed jam at the ABC store. The omelettes are a great gf option. One thing I have to say about this hotel is that not only is the staff great but the guests are as well. For all the Australian people who go and can't find the Vegemite, I sent a bottle to the hotel for you. Please ask for it while it lasts :0) It seems that many of the cocktail items are gf as well but check on the drink mixes. I didn't have time to do that this trip. Directly across the street is a food truck park and the chicken from the truck in the photo is excellent. They say it's gf, I didn't get sick, so I'll agree. $18 for a whole chicken but we're gf so we're used to those prices, right? Go out the back side of the hotel to The Yard House for fabulous gf choices. This was our third stay at this location, and the room we got was spacious. I give this hotel 5 stars not because it's the Ritz but you are treated very well, and the rooms are great for the money. The beds are more comfortable than the Heavenly Beds at Westin. The bathrooms are a nice size; you get a living room and the kitchenette is perfect for the stuff you lug up to the room. We had free wifi but I'm not sure if that was a perk of being an HHonors member or just the way it is. I always enjoy the Embassy Suites and, this time, was the best. Everything is consistent and the staff seems so happy. What more could you ask for?

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed for 2 nights the first week of February 2016 before heading to Maui. I read the previous reviews on this Embassy Suites hotel. It helped making my choice. I am happy I did. The location was great. Walking distance to shopping, restaurants, and the beach. I booked an ocean view room. Yes, there are other hotels blocking the full view of the ocean, but our corner room 1030 was perfect. You could see the ocean on the front balcony and the ocean and pool on the side balcony. Our room was very clean and comfortable. The hotel was nice and quiet in the evening. Loved the strong water force in the shower. No trickle of water! We had breakfast both mornings at the complimentary breakfast buffet. The chefs accommodated my dairy allergy with care by preparing my eggs exactly as I asked them too! We traveled on to Maui and stay in another chain hotel for a much much higher cost. Both my husband and I commented we wish the Embassy Suites in Oahu was on Maui too. Not sure when we will get back to Oahu, but I would definitely book this hotel again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here after staying at 2 other hotels in Hawaii, one in Oahu just a few minutes down the beach and another in Kona on the Big Island. We liked the Embassy Suites a lot, but it may have been a little too much for us. It was just my husband and me traveling, and the first hotel was Vive, which is a small boutique hotel. The suite style room ended up feeling huge and wasteful. We were there originally for business for my husband, but made a vacation out of it.The room was beautiful though. Had balcony that overlooked city, and view was still gorgeous. Had a corner room on floor 15, plenty high to see over pool deck. Also, got view of ocean out of the front window in the living room. Breakfast was, of course, typical delicious Embassy Suites breakfast--no complaints here. It was also very nice if you have a business meeting or something early in the morning, it starts at 630. They also have a "manager's reception" from 530-730 every night with cocktails and snacks. I only participated one night, and since I was 7 months pregnant, did not have any cocktails. But it looked like a pretty cool thing.The walk to the beach was short and there is a pretty nice stretch of beach for Waikiki.If you've never been to Waikiki before, many hotels are across the street and you use a public access walkway (they are located all over). All beaches in Hawaii are public so they are very easy to access. To stay actually ON the beach, you would probably have to book a resort, which charge resort fees on top of the ridiculous tourist prices. We walked down to the Hilton Hawaiian Village Wakiki to see what all the fuss was about. It was a very nice hotel, but there was really only one pool that was key card accessible, so really we could've just used the amenities as random people off the street. On our last day, we checked out early to hike Diamond Head. Embassy suites provided a "hospitality room" for 30 min or so to shower before our flight home. I found this is fairly common of Hawaii hotels, if they are not completely booked. Definitely worth asking about. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay, and if you're looking to splurge a little (but not so crazy as to do a resort) we recommend this hotel. If you do it right, you're not going to be in the room much, so to me as long as it is clean and has a bed, that is all I need. But breakfast does cost something, and it is very convenient to have it there and be pre-paid...and delicious!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Had a ball, the staff were the most friendly and welcoming staff ever encountered at any resort. The buffet breakfast with chef's cooking fresh eggs, omelettes was a bonus.The happy hour should change its name to heavenly hour

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Hotel is right in the middle of great shopping, wonderful restaurants and the beach is right across the street. We had two oceanview rooms and though the property is not oceanfront, the ocean view is up front and center. The beds were super comfortable and the rooms modern and clean! The daily breakfast was great. They change the menu daily and there is an omelet/egg station, always 2-3 types of breakfast meat and so much more! We used room service on a couple of occassions and that was really impressive, timely and delicious. Roy's restaurant is right downstairs. The food was awesome and the service really efficient. We did not have a chance to experience the evening festivities at the Embassy, as we were always out and about. One of the most pleasant things about our stay was our housekeeping person, Ms. V Chiang! She was so kind and accommodating. She was very attentive to our needs and worked with our schedule with regards to special requests. Our rooms (2) were always immaculately cleaned. Kudos to Ms. V Chiang and to the Embassy!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Wonderful hotel and staff, the evening cocktail get-together is not to be missed. We've stayed here annually and would highly recommend this hotel. The staff goes above and beyond to take care of everything. Only down side is trying to find a room at the gov't per diem rate.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed here for 4 nights and loved the location. A couple of minutes walk to the beach and all the top end shops.Breakfast and happy hour every day was included in the price.We would stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had a great five night stay at the Embassy Suites - Waikiki in January. I booked an ocean view suite and felt well rewarded for the extra cost of getting the ocean view. The hotel is a block back from the beach but still has great views from our room's balcony. The location is super convenient with shops, restaurants, and the beach all just a block,or two away. The rooms are very comfortable and nicely furnished. Staff was friendly and helpful. Breakfast and manager's reception are held in an open air facility on the fourth floor by the pool. We plan to return.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel is a short walk from Waikiki Beach and the staff made the effort to treat us in a personal manner. We were upgraded to a two bedroom suite.Rooms were clean and had good beds and wi -fi. I am amazed that they were able to provide a tasty cooked to order breakfast with very little wait.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: If you want more than just a hotel room the Embassy Suites are perfect. Great staff, great location, great atmosphere. Second stay for us and we will definitely be back. To have full breakfast included is a plus. Managers reception in the evening always fun.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Excellent Service, Staff, and accommodations!!! A special thank you to the Housekeeping Staff, made us not only feel like guests, but "Ohana"! With friendly smiles and wonderful service daily - I wished I could stay forever!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I have stayed in Embassy Suites in Several locations and just came back from Embassy Suites in Honolulu Hawaii. Once again, Embassy Suites does it right. One block from the beach which is good for noise. The pool, breakfast buffet, and managers reception is on 3rd floor away from people traffic on street. The breakfast is awesome, great variety, and quality. The managers reception is great after beach and for mingling. The staff is outstanding and hotel does all it can to make sure your stay is the best it can be. I will always reccommend Embassy Suites as they deliver the same quality at all of their hotels no matter where you go. Keep up the good work Embassy.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel is centrally located. Very clean but most important they offer cooked to order breakfast and a manager hosted happy hour from 1730-1930. Best deal ever!! You'll have some extra $$ in your pocket to use as you shop at the stores on BeachWalk. The pool was not crowded (Pro-Bowl weekend) so you had your choice of loungers and cabanas. The staff at the front desk, valet, breakfast and managers reception were nice and very welcoming. The room(s) were great...separate room and living room.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at the Embassy Suites Waikiki with our 3 children for 10 days. I love Embassy Suites for their spacious rooms. There is room for a family of 5 without having to pay for 2 hotel rooms.Complimentary full breakfast every morning is the best! One less meal to pay for in an expensive tourist city. So many choices, it's easy to start your day off with a good, healthy meal.Happy hour every evening with free drinks and snacks is also awesome. Great way to end the day and curb the starvation before dinner after a full day at the beach. Fridays and Saturdays, they had a live band playing music, both modern and Hawaiian.Location was also great. Right in town with a short walk to anything you need or want to do.The staff was so helpful, kind, polite and full of Aloha! I would absolutely stay here again when I come back to Waikiki.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had never been to Honolulu so decided to stay at Waikiki Beach. We booked into the Embassy Suites and found the accommodations more than adequate and quite comfortable. The room was located in the tower and had a view of the ocean from the bedroom. The room was quiet though next to the elevator and during the five nights we stayed at the hotel we never heard any noise off the elevator. The staff were friendly and the concierge was very helpful. Some pluses to the property are the breakfasts which are included in the price of the room along with a two hour "happy hour" where your drinks are whatever you want to tip the bar tender. There also is an area that serves sodas and snacks for those not wanting any mixed drinks. The hotel is very close to the beach as well as to some excellent restaurants and good shopping areas. The only thing we would have done differently on this trip is not rent a vehicle as the hotel does charge $35.00 per night to store your vehicle. Since we took several tours from the hotel we should have just taken a taxi from the airport and saved the cost of the rental plus the storage costs for the parking. A vehicle is a waste of money when staying here because a lot of things are within walking distance.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here for 6 nights in a one bedroom apartment. Our stay was great - we had enough room for the 4 of us (my brother slept in the loungeroom on the fold out couch as he snores), mostly quiet for inside noise (however you can hear a lot of outside noise in the Hula tower facing the pool - music, kids and partygoers), and very clean. The staff are especially friendly, Aldrin near the food area was incredibly helpful and went above what was expected of him. Beds and pillows comfortable, access to a microwave (but no cutlery) and two tvs. Great location - within walking distance to heaps of restuarants/cafes, the beach, and across the road from the ABC convenience store. We used assistance from the bell boys twice to get a cheaper shuttle service to the Waikele outlet stores and Pearl Harbor. The complimentary breakfast was great, good variety of hot and cold food, however some of the fruit was a bit dodgey (good pineapple though). Pool was good, but very busy so we only used it once. Overall experience was very enjoyable.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed for 6 nights in January.We paid a little extra to stay at this hotel, compared to others - due to location, the free breakfast and the happy hour - it was worth every penny. This hotel made our holiday just that much better. The staff were all happy and helpful. The rooms were clean, large, and comfortable. The location is excellent. We loved the Fort De Russy beach for it's snorkeling - we saw turtles everyday, and then spent the afternoon on waikiki beach. Would recommend and stay again in a heartbeat

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I really enjoy staying at this Embassy Suites. Everyone is so customer friendly. The breakfast is great and Ardrin starts your morning off with a smile. All the staff will always look you in the eye and warmly greet you. The afternoon reception is the best deal in Waikiki and Keola and Lewis serve you with atmosphere with a smile. Victor at the front desk is absolutely the man to see for any of your accommodation needs. Will see you guys again on the 20th!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Went on a quick business trip and stayed at this Embassy Suites in Waikiki. Great choice and great location. Short walk to the beach, but right near shopping and Roy's Waikik. Staff friendly and helpful. Overall wonderful for a quick stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I had an awesome time at this Embassy Suites /Beach Walk Waikiki. The staff and accommodations were as good as you would get at a 5 star resort.
