The complimentary breakfast was very good as well as the manager's reception. There were 2 musicians playing during our cocktail hour and they were just awesome. We were close to shopping and the beach and the pool and hot tub were never really crowded when we would lay out. This resort takes pride in their employees and in providing excellent customer service. We will be back soon!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: There is an amazing staff at this hotel, and everyone one should be commended. I cannot remember everyone, but the entire valet and bell staff are some of the hardest working people I have ever seen. Rika and Jenny at the front desk made checking in a breeze, and the ultimate shout out must go to Aldren in the breakfast staff. He will stop at nothing to make sure you start you day with a hot breakfast and a warm smile. I could not help but give him a hug on my last day and I left with tears in my eyes. Thank you so much!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at the Embassy Suites, Waikiki in January, 2016 for 4 nights. We have two teenage girls and a 14 month old toddler, so we booked hoping that the girls could have a separate bedroom and we would have enough room for a crib. I was pleasantly surprised by the size of the suite. Girls had separate bedroom and bathroom, our room was spacious and the central lounge room was great. It also had an alcove that had a sink and a small fridge/microwave (something most of the hotels we stayed at in the US didn't have). I haven't even got to the good bits yet. The hotel itself is nicely located in Waikiki. It's within walking distance of everything. Directly downstairs is the Yard House restaurant (which has 130 beers on tap) and just across the road is the beach. On the 4th floor is the pool/spa area. It had ample room when we were there, but I could see it being busy in summer. The hotel offers a free breakfast, which is awesome to get you off to a good start before exploding all that the area has to offer, and more importantly, for the parents, between 5.30 and 7.30pm each night they have a 'managers reception' which basically means free drinks. Beer, wine, spirits and nibbles!! It's pretty awesome. We ended up making dinner plans around getting back to the hotel to catch a little bit of happy hour each night, along with most of the other guests. Add to that a band 4 nights a week and you have s great little spot to meet other travellers whilst the kids are in the pool. Staff were great, no issues what so ever. I'm sure there's nicer, more expensive hotels in Waikiki, and some with better views or better pools, but if you want a nice, comfortable hotel, with a great atmosphere, this might be the place for you.... At least between 5.30 and 7.30!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This chain has got it right. Focused on the customer. Free breakfast, two hour nightly cocktails and nibbles free of charge. Clean and tidy rooms, little different in that they have a small lounge, with a big flat screen, then a bedroom with a flat screen, nice having the two options. Drive right in to reception. Little competitions to share in social media. I have loved being here. The only disappointment is, they are USA, Canda, and not to many other places in the world. Thank you, I have really enjoyed my stay. The shopping is right on your door step. The beach is across the road. Excellent views from hotel rooms.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We were lucky to get into this hotel at short notice after leaving our first accommodation early as it was awful. What a delight it was to arrive at Embassy Suites cool and welcoming lobby. The front desk staff were amazing, special thanks to Jay who even managed to secure us an upgrade to a two bedroom suite. Even better! The family loved the pool and spa, the amazing breakfasts and the nightly managers cocktail event. We would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: You can't beat the Embassy Suites. It was our first time in Oahu and did plenty of research before our stay here. I ended up paying more to stay here and I'm glad I did. While at check in we were greeted with a tropical drink (nice!). All the staff we dealt with were very nice and courteous. The wife, our friends and I really enjoyed the breakfast in the mornings. The food tasted great and you can't beat the made to order eggs. It helped us start our mornings right! The room itself was plenty big with a separate living room and bedroom. Our room had a microwave and a mini fridge that came in handy for our Coconut Rum and guava juice!! The Managers nightly reception was an added bonus. Every night we were treated to free drinks with live music every other night! The only thing that could use an upgrade were the snacks that consisted of gold fish crackers, pretzels and potato chips (although much appreciated!). The booze wasn't always the best buy you can't complain when it's all you can drink! We really liked the red sangria that they served and ended sticking with that throughout our stay. It was $30 a day for valet parking (now $35) and there is no self parking. I can really fault the hotel for the $30 since it seems to be the average for all the hotels. You do have in and out privileges. The Hotel is close to everything with just a ten minute walk to the beach. Some reviewers warned of making sure not staying on the second floor where the pool is because of the noise. I guess this is true if you are older or just need your quiet time. I was place on the second floor but didn't realize it until I got to the room. I figured I would complain the next day if it was too much for me, It wasn't. In fact, I was the one making the noise (sorry!) by staying up till the pool was closed. Then in the morning I just stepped out the back door and walk to breakfast with the wife and friends. So I would actually recommend staying there. You don't have a private balcony or much of a view but I was happier with what I got in return.Whenever I'm back in Oahu (and I will be back!!) we will for sure be staying at the Embassy again!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: OK, I must say that the hotel associates were very nice. And I did also like the pool deck and manager's reception in the evening. I'd have liked to have rated it higher except for two issues:1) The waste receptacle had not been emptied from the prior guest's stay AND there was toothpaste residue on the vanity--so the housekeeping was not done well. Yuk!2) The quality of the tap water was so bad that I didn't even want to use it to brush my teeth. They should have included bottled water.Aside from those two factors, I did enjoy my stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My family enjoyed everything about this hotel and location. the one bedrooms was perfect for a family of four and the two television helped, we could hear the neighbours if their television is too loud, have to enter the wifi password everyday to use the premium wifi was the only problem.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I can not recommend this accomodation highly enough - the rooms are excellently appointed and serviced - they are spacious and we, as a 3 generation family with a 2 year old, the two bedrooms with en-suite bathrooms were perfect for our stay. We were able to have the privacy of our room with being able to eat and live in the lounge. The kitchen area is fine too. Three assets are stand-outs - the pool area is excellent with sufficient loungers and a wonderful spa. The second is the complimentary breakfast - try the salmon omelette with jalapeño peppers - the apple pancakes are too good too! Then there is the cocktail hours in the evening - swimming in the pool and then a cocktail - gorgeous. There are tasty food trucks just down the road too. A wonderfully situated site on the Beachwalk and over the road from the beach. As I said, the only problem with it is that I am not there now!!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We loved this place!! The staff was very friendly and helpful. It's sad to say but we enjoyed the free breakfast, more than the restaurants we spent plenty $$ on. When we go back to Hawaii, we will definetly stay here again. We only went to the managers special one night, since we were very busy. It was GREAT, we watched the football game and enjoyed the free drinks. I won't complain about the snacks they had, "the drinks were free and not watered down" MAHALO...Embassy Suites, Chris & Nelle

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Can't beat Embassy Suites for value. It's the best hotel I have stayed at in Waikiki. Enjoyed breakfasts every morning and also drinks in evening for our two week stay. Staff are friendly and helpful. Rooms are generous in size.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: A great place too stay. Very close to everything- beach, transport, food and shopping. Rooms are very good but don't expect to self cater as a microwave is all you get. There is no cutlery or plates. The free drinks and snakes each night is a nice touch!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I always love the Embassy Suites signature free breakfast buffet and the managers special that saves several hundred dollars right there. This property is close to the beach (take the public access path marked 141A between the Outrigger and the Halekulani) and also has a pool. Not everyday involves pounds of sand being brought back to the room. Plenty of dining choices very close by and on the property. We got a nice free hula dance show on Tuesday evening at 5:00 in the small park next door.There is an ABC grocery store right next door that sells everything you would expect as well as sushi, cold sandwiches, hot food and drinks. They also send you off with plastic utensils and napkins. Perfect to bring back to the rooms.If you can try and get the rooms at the end of the hall (i think they all end with 29 and 30 in the Hula tower) on the water side. The front room has two sliding doors on two walls with an ocean view. Great breeze and great view.The staff has been very friendly and accommodating.Yes there is some noise at night but I think that is unavoidable considering the thousands of rooms at the dozens of hotels in this area. We didn't find that it was an issue but if you are not used to nighttime noise you might be bothered. I think the trade-off is worth it staying right in the heart of Waikiki Beach.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Hotel was in the perfect location for walking to key attractions. Morning breakfast and happy hour are fantastic. The front desk help were very nice and there was no wait time. We were in our room quickly. The booking agent in the lobby helped us with a trip to Molokai, saving us money over doing it ourselves. The room was wonderful, plenty of drawer space, nice TV's, refrain, microwave, coffee maker, table and chairs. View. The maids were all very nice and accommodating. The breakfast was outstanding--plenty of food and variety. Two separate lines. The happy hour was very nice with a large selection of cocktails or beer or wine. The music at happy hour was some of the best we heard on Waikiki. Every person employed by your hotel was friendly and accommodating. The location on Waikiki was excellent, also.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Wonderful Location! Loved walking to shops, dining options & the beach; felt like we were in the heart of Waikiki. Very friendly staff & we enjoyed the spacious clean room, lazing by the pool, generous breakfast & the entertaining evening receptions. We'll be back!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel was located in the noisest place! Every night around 2 to 3 am we had large wholesale trucks coming to unload to the ABC stores on the street. The trucks were loud, the workers didn't try to do their unloading quietly at all. The weather was so nice we had our patio door open but had to shut it after 2 nights to minimalism the noise. Regardless, we were woken up every night by this.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Overpopulation of noisy screaming kids will make the pool area unbearable if you are hoping for peace and quiet. Dumpsters and delivery trucks starting at 4:30 am will ensure you are awake in plenty of time for a delicious breakfast. On the plus side, housekeeping (really all) staff are excellent as are the rooms.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: this hotel was perfectly located and situated for all things needed to make one feel as though I was on a cruise ship with many food choices ,shopping, amenities and activities. loved it and will sail again

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We frequent Oahu several times a year and Embassy suites by Hilton Waikiki beach walk is our favorite place to stay. Well appointed rooms with very comfortable beds and a separate living area. We had two balconies with an amazing ocean view, free happy hour and cooked to order breakfast. We always enjoy staying here.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Loved this hotel. Perfect location medium price. The staff was great, very friendly and accomodating. The cook to order breakfast every morning and the evening g reception were great. My family really enjoyed our stay here. The view from our room , so beautiful love the sunsets. I recommend this hotel to anyone that is looking for a great place to stay in waikiki.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great hotel perfect with kids. Great food and great staff... Great breakfast buffet. Best value for money. Monday Wednesday and Friday live show are not to be missed the ukulele is amazing.... Only downfall is that it's not long enough.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The embassy suites are perfectly located in Waikiki Beach Walk. There are so many great places to eat nearby from food trucks to high end restaurants like Roys. The hotel is surrounded by nice boutique shops and art galleries. Ala Moana huge shopping centre is a $2 trolley bus ride away. Ross outlet is a 15 min walk away. The bell desk were so helpful organising shuttle pick up and returns to the hotel- Waikele outlet, Aloha stadium flea market ( this takes you to Pearl Harbour too if you want to do your own tour) and snorkelling at Hanauma Bay. The beach is a 2 min walk past the US Army Museum. The ABC convenience store is across the street. Walking at night in the warmth, evening browsing of shops is a real treat where Waikiki beach walk and Kalakaua Ave are just a stroll away from the hotel.The complimentary hot breakfast is a great way to start the day. The 2 bedroom suite is very comfortable and the laundry user friendly. If the pool opened for early morning swims before 9am it would make this place perfection for me.We love Waikiki Hawaii and will come back to this friendly place.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed for 10 days in the Embassy Suites Waikiki Beachwalk. This is a great hotel with very friendly staff and nice large rooms. We had a two bed two bath suite which worked well but would have worked better if we had had the option of two beds in the second room. This was not available as we understand it. The location is brilliant - right near the shops and opposite the handy ABC store. Breakfast comes complimentary and is of a good standard. Overall I'd recommend this hotel for its staff and rooms alone.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Excellent location, generous size rooms and nice breakfast selection. Evening canapes just dips and chips but nice around the pool. The rooms were serviced regularly. Ask for an ocean view on a higher floor. Close to amenities and beach.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We booked three suites for ourselves, our children and our grandchildren for a family vacation. The rooms were spacious, very clean and well-appointed. The variety and quality of the food served at the breakfast buffet was outstanding. The pool was perfect for the kids. The entertainment provided at the "happy hour" was fantastic. The staff was extremely friendly and genuinely helpful. We were a party of 8 adults and 6 small children and trying to find a table large enough to accommodate all of us at breakfast was a real challenge. One of the staff observed our predicament and, without a word, she relocated a couple next to us to another table and took their table and moved it next to ours to provide us with more space. (I have dined at a number of high-end restaurants where I wished the wait staff was as attentive as she was!!)The beach is about a two-block walk. At the beach, you can rent umbrellas, chairs, and water toys. There are a number of fast-food places as well.A one-time only bonus was encountering President Obama and the First Lady one night as they were leaving the restaurant across the street from the Embassy Suites. We have resolved that we will be back at the Embassy Suites in 2017 for another family vacation.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I stayed at two different hotel chains during my visit. Embassy Suites far exceeded my expectations. A few minutes walk to the beach. Easy to get to. Great breakfast, evening reception with entertainment. Walking distance to other stores and restaurants.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We arrived at this hotel after a 10 hour flight from Australia at 9AM tired and hungry as the food on Jetstar was expensive and un appetising. We asked if we could store our luggage for a while as check in isn't until 3PM and we needed to go find food. The wonderful lady checking us in invited us up to the buffet breakfast gratis. As well as this she prioritised the preparation of the three rooms for us and arranged to phone us as soon as they were ready. We were in our rooms by mid day having enjoyed a hearty breakfast before hand.The rooms were spotlessly cleaned each day by friendly staff with a mind for security. I had to go back into my room one day while it was being serviced. The lady working there very politely asked me to scan my door key to ensure I am who I said I was.The free drinks at happy hour Monday, Wednesday and Friday were a pleasant surprise and we enjoyed these sitting by the pool. From here we also got to see the fireworks on Friday night. The pool was never crowded.The hotel is in the perfect spot just 100 metres from the beach and at at the end of the Main Street for shopping. Dukes and The Cheesecake Factory are just a short walk around the corner and there is a convenience store right next door along with some of the many ABC convenience stores just across the street.One of the best hotels I have stayed in.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Family friendly option. One street from the beach. Close to main street and shopping. Very friendly staff. Valet parking is excellent and worth the money. Highly recommended for stay in waikiki. Morning breakfast is basic but wholesome. Plenty of options and the omelet option is very popular. Evening drinks at the pool is a highlight. Kids can play in the pool while you can have a drink.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We've just returned from a 7 night stay and were generally happy with the facilities. On previous holidays I've stayed at Trump and Hilton Village and this sits somewhere in the middle. Hilton is just crazy and chaotic and crowded whilst Trump is luxurious and quite peaceful. Embassy suites are dated and the service average but it met our needs for this trip. We had two suites opposite each other for 2 teenagers and it worked well. Breakfast was ok, nothing to rave about, bit cafeteria like but at least you didn't have to queue up and wait. Same goes for poolside chairs. No towel draping invisible guests in sight! Didn't go to the managers drinks as not really into that sort of thing so can't comment. Location was great for getting about and safe for 2 teenage girls to do ther own thing.The noise factor at this hotel was just awful. We actually went out and purchased ear plugs as we could hear everything going on in the next room (and I mean EVERYTHING!) extremely annoying. Moving rooms was not an option as we needed to be close to the teenagers. For this reason alone I would not stay again. You could literally join in the conversation, and at 1.00 in the morning, it just is not on. I can honestly say that it was the worst I have come across in years of travel. Housekeeping was also of a very low standard. Beds made, towels changed and that was it. In summary, this is a 3 star hotel and 3 star is what you get all around. If you prefer a more upscale place, this is not for you. And noise is a problem. It wins on location and is not as chaotic and busy as many waikiki hotels. For 2 of our group this was their first trip to Hawaii and so the obligatory lei on arrival was greatly anticipated but none to be seen, budget cuts maybe? The fruit drink on arrival was obviously the alternative.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed with wife and three kids, 1 street back from the beach,ideally located near shops & restaurants.Happy hour was always a treat Hung around the pool one afternoon and ordered 1 serve of sliders ( 3 small burgers) and some coconut prawns which feed the whole family.Not a great deal of time spent in the hotel room itself , but we had a great view and recommend it to family's who aren't after 5 star.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I highly recommend Embassy Suites to any family wishing to have a fun and relaxing holiday. We loved the spacious and modern bedrooms, and the location was ideal. The hotel pool and dining area was brilliant for the adults and kids. My husband and I particularly enjoyed the managers free cocktails by the pool at the end of each day.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Was expecting a luxury hotel, but the rooms are quite small and no different than any other hotel I have visited. The best part about the hotel is the breakfast, but that isn't enough to explain the room cost compared to other hotels in the area.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: One of the best holidays I have ever had. Aside from the magic of Hawaii and its people, this holiday was a truly memorable and relaxing one due to facilities and staff at the Embassy Suites. The rooms are large and kept very clean. The staff are extremely polite and helpful. The clear winner with the whole family is the excellent range of choices for a complimentary breakfast every morning (including a custom made omelette). For the adults, FREE drinks and nibbles at the pool bar every night between 5:30 - 7:30pm. Hundreds of places to shop and eat within a few minutes walk and 300m from the beach. Absolutely a winner!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: On paper, the Embassy Suites has so much going for it, and so many travellers are very happy with what Embassy provides: excellent location, free daily buffet and cooked breakfasts, a great pool, free cocktails at sunset at the poolside bar, good sized suites. Our family of 7 stayed at the Embassy suites for 6 nights in a 2 bedroom plus living room (pull out sofa bed) suite immediately after staying 3 nights at the Trump (right across the road) in a 2BR plus den/3 bath suite at almost the same nightly price (we got a suite deal) so we can’t help but compare. Aside from the excellent location, everything at the Embassy was simply good. We frequently commented that the hotel and what it offers seems to be on par with a P&O ship (as opposed to a Celebrity/Royal Caribbean). although breakfast is free you know the saying you get what you pay for....The breakfast dining area is busy, not particularly tidy and perpetually occupied with hard working staff pushing trolleys of either mass produced foods (in) or trash (out), which partly explained why the floors had that slippery feel to them. The queues to the omelette/egg stations were invariably long but eggs well prepared (John was fabulous). The rooms were older but good – a tight fit for 7 but great for a family of 5: the bathrooms were compact and a little old but clean, they had the old school shower in the bath; the bedrooms were comfortable; amenities very basic; kitchenette tiny but useful; room service questionable (when would the cleaner not remove pizza boxes, empty the trash etc??). The pool area was very good – in particular the kids shallow section that was perfect for under 5s and the bar snack menu gave us an alternative for lunch (even if it did mean being snapped at by the grumpy barman).  We must single out two people that constantly provided excellent service: Carlton on the concierge desk provided fantastic job in arranging hire cars, recommending day trips, restaurants and chatting with a great sense of humour and upbeat attitude. Aldrid was fantastic to us and many others in providing service and arranging tables for our large group each morning that we had breakfast at the Embassy. Thank you to both. Overall, we were happy with our stay but we won’t be back. We look for the finer things on our holidays and the Embassy didn’t have the polish or added luxury we expect on holidays. We have marked the hotel down noting that comparing it with the 5 star Trump is almost unfair, but this hotel was the same price. It is a very good hotel for families, but just not for us. Duke’s view: breakfast was good for scrambled eggs and toast, but no chance of getting an apple juice; the pool was great – particularly the shallow part for me; the pull out sofa bed was good but I was always the last one asleep; the location was great – easy for Mummy to get to the best shops in Waikiki and for all of us to get to the beach.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My family and I have stayed at the Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach Walk for 4 out of the last 5 years that we have visited the Hawaiian Islands. Normally we only stay for a night or two before we check into our vacation rental or moving on to a neighboring island although we had stayed for several nights in the past due to an incident at a vacation rental. With this being said, I have to say we were really dissapointed during our last stay in December 2015 not only at the service but also for the very uncomfortable bed. We arrived after midnight from a late inbound flight and we sat in the valet drop off for 15 plus minutes waiting for a valet to take greet us. On top of that there was no offer of a bell hop to assist with our luggage. Maybe because it was late there were less employees to assist but why should your service suffer? After all, we are not paying less for the accommodations. In addition, the king bed that we had in our room was a mattress in which it appeared the "pillowtop" was all but gone. It was very uncomfortable even with the memory foam that we brought with us. We could have saved hundreds of dollars and stayed somewhere else to receive the same level of service and uncomfortable bed but we paid a premium because we thought that we would receive the same level of service and accommodations we had received during previous stays. In short, we were really dissapointed during this last stay

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is a good resort in a great location. The rooms, we had a one bedroom suite, are spacious, clean and well maintained. Initially we were put in a room which adjoined the lift shaft which is to be avoided by light sleepers, however the staff were very prompt and courteous in relocating us.The design your own omletes is a great idea and there were many breakfast options but the hapy hour(s) was the clear winner. The barmen were very friendly and professional and this was a nice entree to going out to dinner.Just across the road from the beach and surrounded by shops and restaurants the location is perfect and for a lot less than the beach front resorts.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My husband have stayed in the Embassy Suites chain for over 22 years and the Waikiki Beach Walk location is the best! You can't beat the complimentary full service breakfast and manager's reception. The location was wonderful. Close to everything!! I would highly recommend!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We arrived after traveling for 15 hours straight, from Ohio. Hawaii is beautiful. We stayed at this location as close to the beach and Pier for the Norwegian Cruise Line- Pride of America. They have the breakfast included and Evening reception with drinks and snacks and great music entertainment.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Embassy suites usually meets my standards but this hotel was very outdated. The place needs to be revamped.The breakfast as usual is superb. Ate tons of pineapple and enjoyed the omelet bar.The hotel staff were not very friendly which was a surprise to me since coming to Hawaii a few times I've always been treated so kindly. The room wasn't ready when we arrived at 4 pm and when the front desk called to check when it would be ready the person on the other end was complaining we checked in early...again we arrived at 4--that's not early.The concierge asked us to wait 20 minutes so we obliged but something must have happened where he might have mistook us for being upset and said he'd upgrade our room. We were given the top floor. The views were AMAZING! Talk about the real experience--180 degrees of beautiful views. We originally were given floor 17 but got upgraded to 21. No complaints there.I wish that was the end to the experience but sadly no. The toilet was leaking terribly and we called it in and no one came to fix it. It was so bad we had to put a trash can to catch the water and that filled up quite fast. The maintenance guy eventually came and he still didn't fix it. We dealt with a leaky toilet the entire time. It was ridiculous. It's a good thing we weren't inside the hotel the entire time because it would have driven me nuts.There's many other hotels to stay in Waikiki and even though the hotel is close to many good restaurants I do not think anyone on vacation should have to deal with the stuff we did. Find a more modern hotel, there's plenty around Waikiki.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The experience at Embassy Suites at Waikiki was poor due to extreme noise issues. We stayed at Aloha Tower suite 102. The second bedroom which is adjacent to another suite has an acoustics problem. We could hear every conversation of people in the next suite. They were not talking loudly - they were having a conversation in a normal tone of voice. Unless the acoustics issue can be fixed structurally for that suite, that suite should not be sold as a 2 bedroom suite, but as a single bedroom suite.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We were given our room immediately on arrival at 8am after a long haul flight. This was very welcome although we were given a room next to the lift - avoid this as the bedhead backs on to the lift shaft. We asked for another room and were given a 2 bedroom suite as there were no 1 bedroom suites available. The room was well appointed, king bed in each bedroom, separate lounge and a small kitchen which included a microwave fridge and kettle. The rooms were clean and the beds very comfortable. As we were at the end of the hall it was also extremely quiet. Breakfast had an extensive selection and the managers reception each evening with free drinks and snacks (and live music 3 times a week) was great fun and very relaxing. The hotel is well located, easy walking distance to beach, restaurants, shops and transport. The hotel was a little on the pricey side (especially with the poor Australian $) but that was ok as the hotel certainly had extra benefits. We would certainly choose Embassy Suites again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Friendly staff, enjoyed our 3 nights there. I thought the $35 per day for parking was high, but I was willing to pay it - so I can't really complain. Room was clean. Our whole family enjoyed our stay. Free breakfast and open bar each night were very nice features! I'd recommend being a Hilton Honors member, if you book through their site and find the price lower elsewhere - they will match it. Saved our family some money.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We arrived at this hotel with very little expectation. Fortunately we were pleasantly surprised! The rooms were modest, but very comfortable. Buffet breakfast was included each day and was one of the most extensive I have experience!Each night there was a happy 2 hours were the drinks were incredibly priced (tip for the bar staff only!) along with a live band playing. This would rate as one of the best family friendly value for money hotels we have stayed at.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I was dreading my visit. I had a last minute overnight in HnL on my way to Kona. This was one of the only hotels with rooms available. I did not have a good impression of the hotel.most hotels in the area are usually old and junky.As we pulled up, valet was top notch. Checkin staff were so laid back, helpful and patient. The rooms were very clean, modern, and beds were comfortable.The Aloha tower faces Beachwalk street. Local delivery trucks were noisy at 5am. Elevators require you to put your room key next to a scanner. Once the light turns green, you can select a floor. One key cannot be used for more than one floor.The hotel breakfast started promptly at 630a. Drinks and cold breakfast was available at 6am. Breakfast food was good.Staff everywhere were so darn friendly. They said good morning, held doors open for you, asked how your day was, could they help you etc..If you need your car in the morning, get it before 715a. The tour buses show up in waves at 7:30a.There were plenty of ABC stores and eateries nearby. Hotel had prime location.Very pleasant surprise. I would recommend this hotel. Parking was valet only at $35 night.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Thank you, Embassy Suites for a wonderful holiday vacation! This is easily one of the best hotels I have stayed in. Every aspect was great. Every staff member we encountered was very friendly and seemed to really enjoy his or her job. The rooms were clean and updated, the breakfast buffet with made-to-order eggs was great, and the hotel was in a great location near the beach, as well as near a seemingly endless amount of shops and restaurants. I also participated in the free yoga class and enjoyed it very much. Although the gym was a bit small, it was fine for a hotel gym and was very clean with updated equipment. Overall, I can't say enough about this hotel and if we return to Hawaii, we will definitely return to Embassy Suites!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Alohaaaaaa!!Where do I begin to describe what a wonderful week we spent at the Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach?? So many things that made our vacation absolutely awesome!Check in was a breeze.. loved that after a 12 hour trip from NY that you could sit down as you were checking in. Loved the complementary tropical juice that was offered to get you into the Hawaiian vacation mood. We are a family of five and we stayed in the 2 bedroom - 2 bathroom suite and it was perfect. Plenty of room and with three teenage daughters, the second bathroom was surely appreciated. The beds were super comfy and the towels were soft and plush.Breakfast was served each morning from 6:30am to 10am and it was always delicious.. very fresh and plentiful. A bounty of hot and cold choices and outstanding omelets and eggs that were made to order with a smile. Speaking of smiles.. the workers at the breakfast had a huge task of clearing hundreds of plates to get the tables ready for the next occupants and they did an amazing job.. all while being incredibly friendly and welcoming.From 5:30pm to 7:30pm there was a complimentary cocktail party each night on the same open and scenic space where the breakfast was served. This was another huge plus in such a pricey city as Honolulu. There were enthusiastic bartenders and lovely entertainment.. could not have been better.The location of the Embassy Suites was right smack in the middle of it all.. easy walk either direction on Kalakaua Avenue. Walk 20 minutes to the "left" and you were at Ala Moana Mall.. walk 5 minutes to the "right" and you were right on Waikiki Beach. Walk right out your door and you were at the busy hub of The Beach Walk with it's many restaurants and shops.And the nicest part of it all.. the genuinely friendly smiles of everyone who worked at the hotel.. from the front desk staff.. to the breakfast staff.. to the chambermaids.. to the bartenders.. to the valets.. to the bell staff.. you absolutely felt that they were happy to host you for your vacation and they were anxious to share the spirit of Aloha with their guests.Thank you Embassy Suites Waikiki.. our vacation was truly awesome..

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed seven nights and had a very good time. The free breakfast as particularly enjoyable so that I still miss, although at the end of our stay, we were a little bit bored with the selection. Evening reception was also great. So was the pool Jacuzzi was quite large.The suite that we were in was bit smaller than expected, but still great and functional. The sofa bed was quite useful. Our room on the Aloha tower faced the beach walk so we could enjoy nightly little performaces at the balcony.The location is also great with an easy access to the middle of Waikiki beach. A bus stop is only a few minutes away. We hopped on the bus 23 to Diamond Head for hiking. Malls are quite close. We enjoyed eating out at Royal Hawaiian Center.The only complaint is thin walls: we could hear conversation of our neighbors. I could tell the names being called and other details of the conversation.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Had two suites - both with 2 bedrooms and 2 baths. Staff ensured that the rooms were near each other. Staff incredibly helpful - room attendants, evening reception staff, breakfast staff. Just a very professional group of folks. Rooms were neat, clean, updated and nicely refreshed everyday -- including pool/beach towels. A great experience!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We recently stayed at the Embassy there in waikiki Hawaii and had a really great time. Flying in from Australia we got in pretty early but at the check in counter, malea was very accomdating and was able to get us in. My kids were very tired from such a long flight so checking in early allowed us to catch up on some rest and get the day started. Breakfast was AWESOME! Aldrin remembered us every morning we went down and my kids enjoyed the managers reception. We look forward to coming back to Hawaii and we have already told our friends about this hotel. Thanks Embassy Suites for making my family stay very memorable.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed eight nights at the Embassy Suites Waikiki in December. We were very satisfied with our stay. We stayed in the Hula tower/city view. On our balcony, we had a limited view of the beach. The breakfast had much variety of quality items. My family particularly loved the create your own omelet/egg station. The evening reception had an awesome band, free drinks and several options for a snack. When considering a hotel in Waikiki, you can't go wrong selecting this hotel. The hotel is steps from the beach, the rooms are updated/very clean and comfortable and quiet. The pool area is large with plenty of chairs/tables. The staff is friendly and very helpful.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We really enjoyed our 5 nights at the Embassy Suites. The location was perfect - close to everything we needed. The room was lovely - spacious with separate bedroom, living room (with microwave, fridge & kettle) and a large bathroom. Staff were friendly and very helpful. The check-in experience was easy & the fruit juice offered welcome. We requested a change of room as the one offered was next to the lifts & this was arranged with a minimum of fuss. Included breakfast was a plus as was the free drinks each evening. Would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Embassy Suite is a good place to stay with family, especially with kids. The staff are very mice and the facility is in good quality. The service is great. The complimentary breakfast can save you a lot of trouble finding quality food for the kids in the morning.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here a few weeks ago and it was my first time in Hawaii. Of course, the airlines decided to play tiddly-winks with our flights so we got there a day late. In the middle of the mayhem of booking flights and rescheduling various details, the easiest call was to the Embassy Suites Desk. I told them my flight was grounded they changed my reservation without asking questions or threatening me with some onerous surcharge. I'd stay here again just for that. What else should you know? The location is good, the concierge were nice people, the breakfast was good and happy hour was good. Both the breakfast and happy hour were adequately staffed and filled up so there wasn't much, if any, waiting for anything. I also loved having Miso for breakfast !

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had two rooms close together which included everything we could want.Location is ideal with a short walk to beach and an equal distance in the other direction to restaurants and shopping.Breakfast and evening reception are fantastic but the outstanding feature to me is the friendly staff with Roy on reception and Aldrin at breakfast worthy of special mention.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My wife and I stayed here a few weeks ago on our honeymoon, and it was so good! Everyone was really friendly, and the hotel helped us plan our 3 days in Honolulu with advice on activities and attractions to see. Their recommendation of the Surf Bus to the North Shore was one of the (many) highlights of our trip! The breakfast is good - highlight being the "omelette bar". Make sure you hit that. The managers reception from 5:30pm - 7:30pm is also a great way to kick off the night, so is also a must.On our last day our flight was delayed 15hrs, which we found out just after checking out. The hotel stored our bags, gave us lift passes, another ticket to the mangers drinks, and also a hospitality room for us to freshen up before heading to the airport. Amazing service.All in all a wonderful time, and we'll definitely be staying again next time we're in Waikiki.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Embassy Suites by Waikiki Beach Walk is one of the best hotels we have stayed in. The location is ideal for restaurants, grocery stores and shopping. Situated one block from the beach. The hotel includes a buffet breakfast with 2 chefs who will cook you a fresh made omelets.The suite has 2 large rooms. One room is the lounge area with a large sofa which contains a pullout bed. This room also has a TV, microwave and a small kitchenette with a sink. The bedroom is large for a hotel and also contains a TV.The staff at this hotel are extremely friendly and helpful. The pool area is pleasant with plenty of seating. The pool area is where the complimentary cocktail service is served.The cocktail hour is two hours long from 5-7 pm and on most nights a band plays live music. We would like to thank the best bartender in Waikiki Keola for his friendship and hospitality. Aloha.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: THANK YOU Embassy Suites for another AWESOME vacation! This was my 8th time staying at this wonderful hotel! Bob and Linda have always been so accommodating when booking my annual trips to Oahu! Great location and friendly staff! This place is just TOP NOTCH! I had another FABULOUS experience and created such great memories during my recent trip! I LOVE the hotel facilities and the hotel staff are so accommodating and FRIENDLY! Everyone from the front desk, maintenance, admin team, valet, bell hop, chefs (they made the best omelets btw), catering staff, bartenders and the lovely ladies in house keeping!! The rooms were immaculately clean and the services this hotel offers is just the BEST!LOCATION and SERVICE is key to an exceptional vacation and Embassy Suites checks all boxes! Words cannot express the gratitude this hotel has brought to my "Aloha experience"!Jay D

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had 5 nights at this awesome hotel during Thanksgiving. We were upgraded from a standard view to an ocean view and it was lovely. The rooms are spacious and it has a small “wet bar” you can use to heat leftovers – keep in mind there is no cutlery provided.The included breakfast has everything you could need, I ordered poached eggs daily and the chefs were very accommodating. It can get busy just as any complimentary breakfast would get.The happy hour (5.30 – 7.30) was fantastic! Strong cocktails, snacks and on every second night they had wonderful Hawaiian bands playing a mix of Christmas songs, top 40 and Hawaiian songs. The location is right in the middle of Waikiki, in the “nicer” section, you have so many restaurants and shops 5-10 mins walk (as well as the beach). The pool area is great for kids and adults, we noticed it was very busy on the weekend but by the Monday was lovely and quiet. Don’t hesitate to book here – it has everything you need from big rooms, free breakfast, free happy hour, great location and great staff! Thank you Embassy for a wonderful family vacation.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: It is really nice to have breakfast and happy hour included in your stay. You can have a customary omelet, Japanese style breakfast, and smorgasbord of breakfast items. Also at happy hour, snacks and drinks. Live music several nights a week. Nice large suites, bedroom, bath and living area, with microwave , wet bar and fridge. Very comfortable beds and furnishings.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I come through Honolulu often and have stayed in almost every hotel along Waikiki, the Embassy Suites is by far the best. Their customer service is outstanding. The rooms are spacious. Breakfast is fantastic. Don't stay anywhere else.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is not your 5 star hotel but it was very comfortable and clean. The staff were very friendly and helpful. There is a pool on level floor and adequate laundry facilities on level 3. The hotel is positioned one block (really just a walk past another hotel) away from the beach. ABC grocery store right across the road, plenty of eating places. If you are a family on a budget Denny's is right across the road but there are many other great eating places within walking distance. Good shopping is close by. There is a fabulous army museum 3 mins walk away. If you have teenagers, this is a safe location for them to go off and do their own shopping. The streets are full of people until late. There is also good entertainment on the streets. And with everything going on outside it was still quiet. The rooms are air-conditioned.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Ideal for the whole family, we travelled with teenagers, the room was spacious, the breakfast is great and the afternoon drinks are perfect for Mum & Dad.Close to beach, shops, restaurants and nightlife what more could you want.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Can't speak highly enough about the staff at the Waikiki location, they're always friendly and helpful! The location is perfect on the beachwalk and close to everything you could want while on vacation. The rooms are spacious and clean. The wi-fi is excellent. The breakfast is good, and the nightly managers cocktail reception is great, the band that plays Mon, Wed, Fri/Sat is truly amazing!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I have stayed in many hotels before but the Embassy Suites are right up there with the best of them. Waikiki hotels generally lack space but not the Embassy Suites, we were over the moon with our suite. We have played the game before where you pay for either a partial or full ocean view only to be disappointed. Therefore this time we opted to forgo an ocean view and settle for a city view knowing full well that a very short walk would have us on the beach. The hotel staff were fantastic and even gave us an upgrade on arrival. Mahalo! Housekeeping did a great job with a daily service. Breakfast provided a good variety and the freshly cooked omlettes were great. Every night free drinks for 2 hours by the magnificent pool area, no skimping on alcohol either, was terrific. Well done! The location of the hotel was central to everything. If we ever come back to Waikiki we will definitely be staying here.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I have been to the Embassy Suites before in 2013 and the room and service was fantastic so when some friends suggested that we all go to Waikiki Beach for a holiday I recommended the Embassy Suites. Well I wish I didn't . The view from the three rooms booked is over looking a car park and our rooms are all next the the lift. So during the night when trying to sleep you hear the lift going up and down during the night. I apologised to my friends for the room they have been given. If you are considering staying here, please don't expect rooms that finish in 01 because your bedroom is next to the lift and in the Aloha wing city view. It's not nice. I'm embarrassed I suggested the Embassy Suites to my friends tonight at dinner.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: It's a bit pricey at this hotel, but you get what you pay for! The breakfast is satisfying the staff is very friendly and helpful and the rooms are large for a family. You get a microwave and minifridge which is very helpful and room service is quick and friendly as well. You get what you pay for!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My husband and I had a perfect stay at this Embassy Suites. The staff were friendly the hotel immaculately clean and for as many guests that they provide services, it never felt crowded. I love the free breakfast of anything you can think of and the happy hours were generous. They had the salty crunchy snacks but I ate tons of fresh sweet carrot sticks and black olives; what a nice change. I don't drink alcohol but those who did in our party said they did not skimp on the alcohol in the free Mai Tais. My favorite morning routine was crossing the street to Starbucks to get my 5 am coffee! Location, location, location.... Perfect for dining or walking to the beach. Thanks Hilton for being so dependable! I always know I'll enjoy my stay.  Susie

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My friend and I had a "girls weekend" in Hawaii for our "significant" birthdays and chose to stay at the Embassy Suites. The hotel was in a great location, very close to shops, restaurants and only one block back from the beach. Usually I prefer to stay in accommodation facing the ocean but my friend wanted to save a little on the room cost so this was a great alternative. Our room had a little balcony and if you slightly leaned over you could actually see the water.Another reason we chose this hotel was the suite rooms. The bedroom is actually separate to the lounge area which would be ideal if one wanted to rest and the other didn't. The bathroom is also on the lounge side so that was handy if one wanted to use the bathroom whilst the other was sleeping. Have to say the beds were great, very comfy.The room also had a "wet" area on the left hand side near the door. This had a sink, a small fridge and a microwave which all maybe useful if you were travelling with children. We were on the 12th floor and had an ice machine on our floor so the wet area was great to empty the ice bucket.Breakfast is included in your accommodation cost and catered for everything from a cooked breakfast to a continental breakfast with the chefs preparing individual omlettes, eggs etc on request.One highlight was the free cocktails and nibbles between 5.30pm-7.30pm every night around the pool area. Also some nights a live band played and they were great and entertained the crowd quite well.Also had free wi-fi.All around Waikiki there are lots of these shops called ABC shops that sell food, alcohol, souveniers, chemist stuff, suitcases etc. There is also a similar shop on ground level of the Embassy Suites that was excellent.Overall we had an amazing holiday, amazing weather and a fantastic time. The staff were lovely and friendly (except for the lady checking us in at reception who didn't even say welcome or thank you for staying when we left). I would highly recommend the Embassy Suites if you are thinking of holidaying at Waikiki.Tip: If you go to Concierge and ask for a taxi and a limo is there doing nothing, you have to be offered the limo for the same price.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We enjoyed our stay at Embassy Suites, very central to shops, restaurants and the beach. Staff were extremely friendly and helpful and rooms very clean. Breakfast variety was limited and our bedroom was next to lift which was a little noisy. Overall would definitely recommend and would stay here again if travelling to Honolulu.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Really enjoyed two nights here to end our holiday. Easy and efficient check in and out. Staff are are attentive with out being OTT- waiting for tips etc. rooms are spacious, clean and comfortable. Good happy hour and excellent breakfast included in price. The hotel is kid friendly .... So not the best for relaxing by the pool ( if you are mature couple). Close walk to everything and bus system in Hawaii is very easy and cheap.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: On the negative side, the coffee was not so good (but there is a starbucks across the street). On the positive side, based on our one week experience, there were many positives that more than made up for the mediocre coffee. The location was great, not far from the beaches, shops, and restaurants. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Our room was spacious and kept clean. The breakfasts (apart from the coffee) were good with a nice selection of items and an omelet station. The late afternoon/early evening snacks were a bonus along with the band that played nostalgia music four nights a week. We did not try the pool area as it was noisy and full of children. Most of all, we liked the feel of the hotel. It is mid size and does not have an institutional feel like, say, the big Hilton nearby. People get together for breakfast in the morning and music and fun in the late afternoon, giving the place a sense of community. We certainly would return here. And for Waikiki, the price was reasonable.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Right in the heart of Waikiki but only a stone's throw from the beach, position could not be better.Manager's nightly reception with free cocktails for two hours makes it the best value around. Only complaint was poor quality of snacks. We had a two bedroom partial ocean view suite which had absolutely everything we needed.Would definitely recommend.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed for four nights, that was our only mistake, we should have stayed much much longer!The room was a great size and had everything you could need, bath (for small kiddies), coffee machine (for tired parents) and a TV in the living room and bedroom (for everyones sanity).The pool was great, not too deep for my littlies and a nice temperature. My husband enjoyed the pool bar too, but I wasn't allowed out of the pool long enough to sample for myself!The inclusions of breakfast and the manager's reception (free drinkies and nibbles, with live music that I did get to partake in, YAY!!) were excellent and really added to the warm and friendly atmosphere of the hotel.The location of the hotel smack in the middle of Waikiki was also excellent and lent itself to everything from eating out to some serious shopping!We really enjoyed our stay in this hotel and will definitely be staying there again (hopefully soon)!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here for 5 nights. Lovely drinks upon arrival easy to check in and out. Great friendly staff all around the hotel. Breakfast was suitable not to everyones liking in my family but good enough for the start of the day. (my family aren't breakfast people) . We really enjoyed the Managers reception that was held in the pool area nightly. It was very generous of the hotel to provide complimentary drinks & nibbles from 530pm, some nights there was a band playing, it was a "chilled out" atmosphere. Location of hotel was perfect easy walking distance to everything. Room was great as the kids could have their own beds ( sofa bed lounge room was great for my son). Room was clean and stocked with everything you need & had two balconies. Tour desk and lobby staff were very helpful. Overall a very pleasant stay at this hotel and I would highly recommend it. We picked this hotel for the extra room and it was worth it with all the included extras I would definitely stay here again. Thanks Embassy for a memorable stay. Oh and when we arrived we were told we had been upgraded to ocean views so that was a lovely bonus.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had a great time in Waikiki despite the rain! This hotel was great for our family, everyone enjoyed the omelet's each morning and each night the reception, where we enjoyed drinks while watching live entertainment almost nightly! The band was excellent!! The location was great, right on Beach Walk. Close to shopping, dining and the beach. Would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This accommodation deserves more than five stars. The service, cleanliness and location are second to none. The only setback was that we had booked an ocean view corner suite and upon check-in we were given a partial ocean view suite. This situation was resolved after I had made them aware of the error. Make sure that you get the type of suite that you booked and paid for. The food, was excellent and the managers reception was great. I would not hesitate to stay here again. It was a great two weeks. The lady who looked after our suite deserves special mention. We were on the 10th floor and her name was Josie. A fantastic lady and she made our stay most enjoyable.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: When tarveling as a family, we are always in the look out for bigger rooms. I tried looking through VRBO for homes or condos. The problem I ran into was that the condos are usually rented for a week at a time and they are specific to days to check-in and check-out. I came across this hotel offering a 1 bdrm suite conveniently located in Waikiki near the beach, restaurants, and shops. Check-in was a different experience... pleasant and along the theme of "Aloha and welcome to Hawaii". The registration desk is none like I have ever seen... when its your turn, you sit at the desk versus standing and given a guava juice cocktail to quench your thirst from the challenging stressful day. The registrations was also very nice and accomodating. For security, the room keys are tied to the elevators so you cannot go up and down the elevators without a room key. When we got to our room, 1 bdrm suite, we were amazed at the view. Instead of a city view, we got an ocean view! Who am I to complain about that! Room was spacious since there is a living room and separate bedroom and there was a microwave and fridge. Keep in mind that since its a kitchenette, there are no pkates, bowls and cutlery. No cooking in the room just enough to warm up leftovers or microwavable meals. Wi-fi and full breakfast is complimentary a included. The breakfast is the best where they included breakfast items for everyone even miso soup and kimchi! The hotel holds a managers reception which is a social bear the pool several days within the week where they have drinks (alcoholic and non-alcoholic), snack foods, and awesome local entertainment from a local family group.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: great location & free breakfast & happy Hour! Had many options for drinks and breakfast was hot buffet. They put locals by the elevator, was hard to sleep. The room was nice but felt grimy. Would stay again but for a little less.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was a great location with top notch amenities, including the breakfast and manager's evening social. The rooms were clean and quiet and the hotel staff was friendly and accommodating. From the moment we arrived until we departed, the hotel staff was helpful and our stay was very memorable. The Fitness Center and pool were clean and were a bonus as was the in-room Internet connection. We would stay here again!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Have no hesitation in recommending Embassy Suites Waikiki as the ideal place for Couples/Families to enjoy their Hawaii experience. Stayed 10 days - good value, good food, excellent quality accommodation, and Happy Hour is a plus. We had a ball. Thanks Embassy Suites Waikiki

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Could not have asked for anything more!! The breakfast and happy hour included in room rate was a great deal! Hotel staff went out of their way to be helpful and courteous. No noise problem in rooms from Waikiki traffic. Location was right in the middle of so many super places.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Perfect Location to the Beach, stroll away from all the Shops and restaurants for any Budget. Rooms are especially spacious, modern and friendliest staff. Wifi was great - Had several work conferences online and didn't drop out. Breakfast Incl was GREAT!!! Love this hotel...

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I have stayed at several hotels across the US and they don't always deliver what their brochures promise. Embassy Suites by Hilton Waikiki Beach Walk DELIVERS! I was pleasantly surprised that this level of customer service still exists today. Upon checkin, Ray (manager on duty) came to greet our party with drinks. Everyone had the warmest smiles. We were offered assistance many times with our luggage. Our suites were clean, nicely decorated, and spacious enough for our group to congregate in the living room before leaving out. Breakfast was really good each morning and I think the staff handled it really well for the large crowd that they hosts. You have the option to eat in the covered area or patio area. Both are nice. During happy hour, there is an awesome band that plays each night. I think what really, really, let me know that this is where I have to stay when I visit Honolulu again is my housekeeper Lleuellyn. Her spirit was so warm and personality so bubbly that I know she has to be a long-lost relative from 5,000 miles away from my home so I called her "Aunty" while I was there. She remembered ALL of our names and maintained our suites with the highest standards. When she found out it was my birthday, she was so excited and sang to me. I hadn't seen that level of attention given to guests since I was on a cruise ship. Embassy management should thank God for Aunty Lleuellyn because I do. Thanks for a great stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The Outrigger group manages this hotel NOT HILTON and they act liike it. I am a Diamond Hilton memeber and I have generally found that matters to MOST Hilton's even ones not managed by corporate like the Hilton Hawaiian Village. I come on business at least 10 times a year and have always felt appreciated for my business. Not here!. I checked in and Malia tried to give me a double queen room even though my profile says I prefer a King. Her response? "We don't GUARANTEE an upgrade sir and we are 98% booked. I took this to the manager on duty who proceeded to find me a king room by the elevator. I took this room and found the air conditioner was inoperable. Maintenance informed me thatI would have to find a new room and he would inform the front desk of this and they would get back to me. 90 minutes later and no word from the front desk. I called and they said "we were just about to call you, we had some airline cancellations and we can get you that room you expected." Coincidence? I will let you decide. I am a Hilton DIAMOND member and they treated me like anyone else. So if you aren't a Diamond member GOOD LUCK. The GM has been UNAVAILABLE the last three days. Oh and by the way the room was $351 a night with a AAA discount which they insisted I present to honor that rate!. If you like Hilton find another. If you like Embassy Suites by Hilton? This isn't one. Maybe I should try Marriott

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: friendly staff when check-in with welcom drinks. very good location with clean & quiet rooms m easy access to the beach . just one call needed in the room for check out. only thing i dislike is breakfast which has same stuff every morning.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our first time in Honolulu and I spent hours and hours going over customer reviews with the result - there is no one perfect hotel. Embassy Suites is in a great location for shopping, eating and a quick walk to the beach. And there's no resort fee like all other hotels.We were there for 5 days the first week of November and enjoyed our stay. The room itself was very clean, very spacious. I was ready to become a permanent resident (as the suite is bigger than most NYC apartments!) Bathroom is very clean, nice towels. 2 big screen tvs, lots of storage room/drawers. We had "ocean view" on the 18th floor (see pics). I'm not sure anyone has a great ocean view at this hotel, and not of Diamond Head. The lanai is VERY narrow and made me a little nervous that high up. Breakfast buffet is awesome - the omelets ARE best in the world. They really cater to their Japanese clientele with miso soup and rice etc at breakfast. The nightly happy hour is nice and the band that was there 10/30 & 10/31 were awesome (didn't get the name). Halloween they brought out lots of extra treats.The place was full of families & kids. So pool & hot tub weren't quiet unless you go first thing in the morning or late at night. There aren't enough lounge chairs especially in the sun so you sorta have to stalk those who are leaving. The beach closest to the hotel is very rocky. If you want the nice part of Waikiki walk down to the Hyatt and past there for the nice sandy areas.The staff were pleasant but sort of invisible. The check-in & out was as impersonal as can be. Not much explanation just given a booklet and that's that. Only cons- the mini-fridge froze everything and there was no visible way to adjust it so had to call for someone to fix it (dial is behind the fridge), tea kettle didn't work and the coffee at the breakfast buffet tasted like instant coffee.We were sorry to leave and look forward to coming back!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Im a travel professional and I have stayed at my share of hotel locations. The rooms were not as big as I thought, but where they lacked in size they made up for in service. They gave red carpet service from the time I pulled up until I checked out. The careful attention they payed to the number of guests was refreshing. I never once had to call and request extra towels etc. That was greatly appreciated. they serve complimentary breakfast. Not just continental three-item selection the run out by the time you get there. A full breakfast with a large variety of selections to fit all tastes!! Made to order omelettes brought it to another lever of excellence. Thanks for the amazing experience. I cannot wait to promote this brand because I have first-hand experience. Tammie

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The hotel views were spectacular. The Oceanviews, Sunsets and occasional rainbows over the ocean were SPECTACULAR. The Manager's nightly reception with live music set the mood for a true "Happy Hour." The hot breakfast choices were great and "hot." Great coffee too. I certainly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was our first stay at the Embassy suites as we had usually stayed in a one or two bedroom suite at the Hilton Hawaiian Village. I was nervous about how crowded embassy suites may be at the pool area and what the rooms would be like.To start, check in was fantastic. Everyone was very friendly and helpful for our visit. The rooms are pretty basic but they're nice and clean and quiet as long as you're up high. We were on the 16th floor and judging by the noise j hear when I opened the balcony door on a Friday night, we wouldn't want to be any lower. The pool is pretty basic so his is more suited for people with kids who like the beach more Han pools. The winning point for this hotel though is the breakfast which is included in the package. It is a fantastic buffet breakfast including cooked to order omelettes and different foods to cater for all tastes. My kids and husband loves it.If you want a hotel in the heart of Waikiki but need a suite, this is a good option which I would recommend.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Fantastic holiday with excellent service I would recommend to any traveller. All staff were so helpful and always had time to acknowledge us. The rooms were perfect for our stay, clean, tidy and spacious with all of the amenities required for a long stay! Breakfast is excellent and the pool area very well looked after with pool bar. The location is fabulous and within easy access of the shopping, bars, restaurants and beach! Would stay again!!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Overall our stay was great in every aspect. However Jinny made the experience all the better when we checked in with her exceptional customer service. Would gladly stay again when celebrating an occasion.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Accommodation is expensive in Waikiki for New Zealanders at the moment.This hotel was in primo position for the beach restaurants and shopping in Waikiki.Three ladies shared a suite because of the fold out sofa bed in the living room.The cleaners were wonderful so we left them a wee tip daily. (We don't do this in NZ or Australia).Complimentary breakfast was ok. We went for the fresh fruit bagels and omelette made to order. Saves you on another meal where you have to tip.Definitely come again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The hotel was a bit confusing. We had two rooms, my room was ready hours after the rest of the family. The front desk was so, so, so busy and not orderly, you had know idea where to check in and out. HUGE and fabulous waiting area, free orchids for your hair, free coffee vouchers. Rooms were nice and large. The BEST shower EVER!!!! Bed was awesome. However, I had to ask for my room to be cleaned. Twice. I had to ask for amenities. I was locked out of my room twice and had to show ID, which was difficult because I was locked out of my room. The customer service is so above and beyond. All Hawaii was. Free DVDs, free towels for the pool, a very clean laundry room, you can almost spit to the beach. No breakfast, small pool but nice. Great place.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed at embassy suites with my husband for 9 nights. Our hotel room was amazing. Nice and big. Room was very clean. Was happy with the service from the hotel. Breakfast was average. And sometimes our shower was cold. But the maintenance guy from the hotel attended to the problem almost instantaneously. They served happy hour drinks and snacks down by the pool every night between 5.30pm and 7pm with a live band every second night. Andrew from the hotel concierge was very welcoming and friendly. And the tour desk was reasonably priced and very helpful. They were able to answer all our questions on things to see and do in the area. Overall a very good hotel. Thanks for a great stay we hope to stay at embassy suites next time we are in Oahu!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here for 4 nights and had the best experience. After spending many days researching hotels, it became clear that the best value was simply Embassy Suites. you are literally across a small street from the beachfront hotels who will charge you twice as much for half the room, and most likely with worse views. A walk to the beach was 5 minutes away.We stayed on the corner of the 19th floor facing the ocean and it was fantastic. The one bedroom suite had plenty of room and was nicely furnished. The bed was very comfortable, the staff was incredible. Breakfast was included each morning and was first rate. Overall, a super good experience and I will definitely return here when visiting the islands again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: If you haven't stayed at an Embassy Suites before, its Hilton's large suite-style room property where every room has a separate living and sleeping area. They are what we love for family travel because the living rooms typically have a fold-out couch so a family of 4 is set if you get the two twin set-up for the bedroom. The hotel itself is centrally located, not on the water, but behind the waterfront Outrigger Reef hotel and is part of a newer shopping and restaurant complex called the Waikiki Beach Walk with good higher end chains like Hawaiian Roy's (very goof fish) and Yard House (great beer selection and good food and sports on TV) and Ruths Chris Steakhouse restaurants among others. The hotel itself has two towers, the Hula Tower, closer to the water and the Aloha Tower. If you can get one of the end ocean view rooms in the Hula Tower, you will get one of the few water facing balconies with a view between the Holekulani hotel and Outrigger Reef. The hotel has valet parking for $30 a day that is pretty quick and efficient and open air to the lobby. Check-in was smooth where you sit at desk and are treated with a welcome tropical juice drink. Because of the open nature of the lobby to the street and its central situation in the shopping area, you need the room key to access the elevator floors. The rooms themselves are large with two tvs and include the usual amenities like coffee and tea and water and a small fridge and microwave and popcorn. I think they are the most comfortable room set up in Waikiki. The BIG plus with Embassy Suites are the complimentary Manager's Reception from 530 to 730 in the evening with full cocktails and various appetizers like chips and salsa and cheese sauce and also vegetables and dip, etc. This in held in a large open area by the big pool on the 4th floor (they call it the Grand Lanai). The big bonus is the complimentary breakfast buffet with cereals, an omelette bar, and fruit and rolls and juices and coffee. Food in Hawaii is expensive and with a family. The breakfast alone more than offsets the slightly higher room rates. The Shorebird where you can grill your own steaks and enjoy a huge salad bar and is a fun place to eat on the beach under the Outrigger Reef hotel across the street (your dinner receipt will get you a discount on a meal on another night) and you can catch a glimpse of the Hilton's Fireworks from there on a Friday night if you sit on the rail. There are also some good food trucks if you want casual on same side as valet (Beach St). There's also free decent fitness area, beach towels and wifi. Overall, Embassy Suites isn't a full scale resort and its not on the water but their great staff, location and nice rooms and nightly reception and breakfast makes it on my shortlist of hotels especially if you are with a family.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We have just had a great 10 night family holiday. From the moment we arrived early in the morning and we were offered breakfast even though we had not yet checked in. The hotel staff were excellent, every staff member was so happy and helpful, nothing was too much trouble for anyone. The free breakfast was brilliant, really good selection of hot and cold food, plus beautiful fresh fruit, the egg station was a winner. Our room was next to the lifts, we were a bit concerned as I had read other reviews about how loud the lifts were, we did not hear a thing. The room size was very good, the 2nd room was great. Beds were very comfortable. Our room was very clean and the cleaning lady was very friendly every time we saw her. The location of the hotel was really good, close to everything but still far enough away that you could walk off the extra cheesecake from the Cheesecake Factory.Great hotel and we will certainly be back.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We arrived early in the morning and we were offered free breakfast even though we could not check in till later in the day. Reception were very helpful and happy.
