Pool area was great for our young family, deepest part was only 4ft. Our room was directly opposite the lifts and I had read before how noisy they were, we did not hear the lift at all from our room. The 2nd room was great to give us more room plus when our kids went to bed we could stay in the living room. Room facilities were great. The room was very clean and serviced everyday. Free WiFi was very good, my wife had a US sim card and was connected to the WiFi the whole time, I kept my Aus sim card and had to reconnect everyday plus occasionally would struggle to connect but usually worked great. The breakfast everyday was great, the egg station was really good plus there was a great variety of other hot and cold food plus beautiful fresh fruit. Location of hotel was great, a couple of minutes walk to the main strip and about 20 minutes to walk to Ala Moana. Overall it was a great experience and we will certainly stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We spent 10 lovely days here and were impressed by the location, the facilities and especially the staff. This hotel definitely treats its guests well. Staff were all considerate and helpful. Housekeeping was timely and excellent. We would stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Very Nice Hotel!!! We gas rhe two bedroom suite with 2 bathrooms.it was great for our little ones to have lots of space. Their morning breakfast section was incredible and had something for everyone from an fresh omelet station to just plain ceral. Also every night they had a free reception with snacks and drinks. The hotel was in the center of waking to the beach and to shopping. Loved the hotel and would stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Don't expect too much. This is a good hotel, with a great location, great facilities but average/old style room fit out. Nothing at all wrong with the very spacious one bedroom - just a bit old school! Our room had full ocean view, but partial view would be most rooms. Facilities included free breakfast which was fine, evening free drinks and snacks (all alcoholic drinks!) average sized pool. Waikiki isn't my favourite place, but this hotel is very well positioned about a 5 min walk to beach lots of shops around and it's a good option.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We were greeted with a refreshing drink and a aloha.The staff were very friendly, especially the housekeeping and waiting staff at breakfast.Breakfast was amazing every day, love the omelettes!.This really set us up until dinner.Free cocktails for 2 hours just made our night.They don't pour singles and the bar staff entertained you while you watched them pour unrestricted amounts of drink. We were by the lift but we didn't hear it much. The room was big enough for 2 of us and the cleaning done daily was great.Didn't have the best of sleep as the air conditioning was noisy and the bed wasn't very comfortable.Loved the local radio station 107.9 GoldFM.Had some sounds from the 70's and Casey Kasem from the 80's too.The location was fabulous, just a small walk to the main shops and lots of eateries around. The guys on the Expedia Desk helped us with our tours.Their local knowledge was invaluable.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Extremely DISAPPOINTING. Room not what was booked - King Suite with Ocean view was in fact barely an ocean view from one window. All other windows were looking directly into other buildings. Bedroom had 2x Queen beds squashed in and not the King bed we booked. Photos are VERY misleading. All Day Dining - as long as you call by 9.30 pm. Asked for some "fresh milk" only to be told I could go over the street and purchase myself. Room had no bottled water or in fact anything in the fridge. As Hhonors members and having stayed in many Hilton Hotels in both Australia and Europe this would rate as the WORST. Suggestion would be to look for alternative accommodation if visiting Waikiki

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our 2 room suite was both roomy and comfortable and very clean. We had excellent housekeeping service. Every service person we met at this hotel was helpful and welcoming. Great breakfast with lots of choices.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Lovely property, nice complimentary breakfast and awesome happy hour...but don't be fooled by the website floor plans and photos of the rooms. Based on our room/type description, we were expecting a quiet oasis on a high floor with a private lanai. Instead, we got a noisy high floor room adjacent to the elevator, no lanai and small windows that don't even open. Especially unfortunate was the overwhelming indifference from the front desk when I raised these issues. Aside from this experience, the staff and service was awesome, but 9 days without a good night's sleep helps me quickly forget the good parts.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach Walk is an excellent hotel. Roys is right under the hotel and the beach is less than a 3 minute walk away. The ABC stores are right across the road, and everything is just a short walk away. The staff is very friendly, service-oriented and breakfasts are complimentary. The pool is nice also. Excellent value for the location...right next to Trump.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I was hesitant to stay at this hotel primarily because there were less expensive hotels in the area. After the first day I knew we had made the right choice of hotel. The free breakfast and free drinks and snacks at the managers reception more than made up the extra cost over other hotels. The breakfast with cooked to order omelets was delicious. The managers reception was well attended. The music (M,W,F,S) was good and the drinks from Keola (bartender) were excellent. The whole staff at this hotel from the maids to the front desk went out of there way to make our stay enjoyable. Keola in particular was very personable and you could tell he really enjoyed his job. The hotel is lucky to have him. The room was great with everything one would expect including beach towels and a small refrigerator. If I came back I would definitely stay here again. The one and only complaint was that the elevators were a little slow.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We are a family of four, and we stayed in a two-bedroom suite. The floor plan was perfect for our family. The two bedrooms are separated by a living room. The room, and the entire hotel, was very clean. All of us found the beds and pillows very comfortable. The rooms are quiet, and we never heard other guests. There is a separate thermostat in each bedroom and one in the living room. We were in room 1824 which had a great view, better than we expected. From the balconies, we could see the Beach Walk to the left and the ocean to the right. The hotel itself is in a great location. There are many shops and restaurant within walking distance. The beach is a very short walk away. The breakfast was good every morning with a good variety of food. The tables are cleaned and turned over quickly for the crowds at breakfast. The food at the manager's reception could have been better. There were nachos a couple of nights that we went. There was broccoli one night. There was usually goldfish or chex mix also. People seemed to like the free drinks as there was usually a short line. The pool was nice. It was clean and cool enough to be refreshing. The hot tub was very relaxing because it was hot like a hot tub should be. One thing that needs improvement is that there is no foot shower. Whenever we came from the beach, our feet and shoes were covered in the very coarse sand. We didn't want to track it into the room. The only place to find a shower is at the pool, but there is no foot shower. There is a shower halfway up the wall that has a fine spray, so you must lift your foot up to waist level and put it right next to the shower head to get the sand off. It is very awkward and difficult to do. I love that the entire hotel is non-smoking. There is a lot of cigarette smoke on the sidewalks and streets. But, not at the hotel. I was pleasantly surprised to be able to use the balcony without having to run back inside because of smoke. When we go to our beach condo or on a cruise, we cannot use the balcony much because of the smoke. So, the non-smoking is great! Our room was very expensive, even using the non-refundable cheaper rate. We were there for eight nights. It was worth every penny. However, I'm not sure why they have to charge $35 per day for valet parking, which is the only option if you have a car. We also tipped the valet every time we took the car out, which was at least once per day. Even though it was pricey, the guys at valet were nice and always got our car quickly. Great location, great staff, great floor plan, great breakfast, great beds, great air conditioners. We would definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Very nice hotel..Staff never stopped giving their all! If you need to relax after the Beach walk, then this is the best escape. Just the breakfast made this choice the best. The food at the pool ordered off the menu is as good as any of the restaurants within walking distance. I would come stay here again in Honolulu.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We have used Embassy Suites for over 20 years. We find them always spotless with staff who are very friendly and most obliging. This property is very well located with plenty of shops and restaurants in easy walking distance. We took a friend with us who was very happy with the two bedroom/two bathroom unit we shared. This meant that at the end of the day she was not in an empty room on her own. This made her time in Honolulu a happy experience.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I stayed in 1809 and the view was worth it for sure! Getting to watch the surfers and sailers from the room was fun. The staff was great and this location is within steps from the beach, great food (Roy's, Ruth's Chris, Hard Rock ) among a few, and shopping. The room service was exceptional as well.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: What a wonderful hotel, centally located, very comfortable rooms, outstanding customer service. Great Breakfast, did not have to eat again until dinner. Delightful evening reception.. We had a wonderful time. Family visit with 4 little grandkids and they were also treated nicely...

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We looked for a hotel that could offer 2 bedrooms so as to cater to our kids and Embassy offered a 2 room hotel room unfortunately all the bedding was in the same room! However, it worked out really well with a lovely sitting room and large bathroom with great views over other hotels to the beach and to Diamond Head. Better still was the included buffet breakfast each day and the wide ranch of alcoholic drinks & snacks at night as well as entertainment. The kids loved the pool and the laundry room was hugely useful. I love most gyms but didn't like the Embassy Hotel gym as it mostly held cardio machines, a small number of weights and very little room to move however as a holiday I was more than happy to take a break from my very active lifestyle! The hotel is well located very close to some very good restaurants such as the Yardhouse, Hard Rock Cafe, CheeseCake Factory and many others. Its also very close to one of the best stocked ABC stores which is right across the road and the walk to the Ala Moana Centre is 15 mins which is pleasant.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Excellent service and standards. Breakfast and evening happy hour inclusions were excellent.Staff very welcoming from first day till the last day.Concierge staff were very good although you are not allowed to pay for your tours with cash, strictly credit card or travel card.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at the Embassy Suites for a week while in Waikiki. This hotel is a block from the beach, and you can easily walk. I think that the staff is exceptional at Embassy Suites. Everyone we encountered (valet parking attendants, bartender, hotel manager, cleaning staff, and Ester - who replenished the snacks during the daily happy hour) was friendly and helpful. I got the feeling that many of the staff have worked at this hotel for many years. With Embassy Suites, you get two rooms, and I really like having that extra space when you stay for a week. There is a small kitchenette with a sink, microwave, and small refrigerator. We were happy to have those amenities. We also had a balcony that we used frequently. No, it did not look out onto the beach, but it did look out onto Beach Walk where we could see the food trucks. We loved the breakfast that was included. This is probably the best breakfast you can get at a hotel. We had salmon two mornings, and always had bacon. You could get a made-to-order omelette if you wanted one. The Japanese influence was seen in the breakfast menu: Miso soup, tofu, and salad. There were always scrambled eggs, yogurt, fresh fruit, potatoes, pancakes/waffles/French toast, juices, coffee, and pastries. In the evening, the manager hosted a cocktail hour where you could have free alcoholic beverages. There were also snack foods provided such as chips, celery, carrots, pretzels, and nuts. On some nights, a wonderful local band played all sorts of music. You do have to pay to park your car - $35 a day - but every time we went to get our car, we never had to wait. It was a seamless process. The hotel is really on a side street that is fairly quiet. You can walk to anything in Waikiki from the hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: the location was convenient to Waikiki and restaurants, shopping, transportation. The room was spacious and clean. the area was fairly quiet. the only complaint was the ice machine on our floor never worked after we reported it at leasts four times.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Embassy Suites was a fantastic place to stay in Waikiki. Ocean view, king room was comfortable and spacious with excellent views. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast and evening cocktails and entertainment included made this holiday even better. Pool area was relaxing and a great place to spend the afternoon after a morning of beach and shopping. Kids loved the pool and fitness room. Would definitely recommend Embassy Suites and will stay here again on our next holiday to Hawaii

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We were greeted by Ray who provided us all with a refreshing drink whilst we checked in, he was lovely with the children and gave us all the information we needed. Our room was in an ideal location close to the pool and breakfast buffet/managers reception so super easy for our young children. Room suited us perfectly as did amenities. Thanks

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at this great resort in May of 2015. We chose the embassy since we've had great stays at other embassy hotels in the past and we love the big breakfast spread they offer in the morning.This hotel is very close to the beach area. Only one small street and another hotel (their sister hotel) separating you from the beach. There is a sidewalk like walkway that takes you there. Be warned though the beaches are not very big. There is not a lot of room to set up chairs and towels or umbrellas etc due to the fact that other hotels are beach front and use that space for their chairs etc..Upon check in you are given a wonderful delicious fruity drink. This was great and I only wished they offered this pool side. We were given a room on the top floor facing the pool and ocean. There really isn't wonderful ocean views as the other hotels are very tall, so you basically have a ocean view between other hotels. There is a trump hotel next door that is huge and towers over the embassy preventing you from viewing anything in that direction. But we still enjoyed sitting out on the balcony. The rooms were nice and the hotel staff was very nice. We met several people who went out of their way to remember our names and help us with whatever we needed. The maid for our floor was very friendly and very accommodating to clean our room around our schedule. This hotel is situated in a great location. You can walk to many restaurants and sites. There is plenty of shopping. Built right on the side of the hotel is a two level shopping area with some great restaurants. We didn't feel the need to keep a rental car. Instead we rented from the airport and drove to the market to pick up water and snacks we wants (and alcohol) and then dropped the car off the next morning across the street at a hotel that was a satellite drop off location. The cost to park your car at the hotel is $$$$ very high so we opted to get rid of the rental. Public transportation is everywhere and its very easy to get around Waikiki. We also booked some tours and embassy is a big enough hotel that most tours stop right out front to pick you up. Only one did we have to walk across the street to wait in front of the Trump resort. The morning breakfast buffet was very good. There are fresh made eggs and lots of choices on the buffet for things like pancakes, bacon, and fresh fruits. There is a lot of people from Japan who vacation in Hawaii and their menu includes many items that were custom for them as well.At night they have complimentary h'orderves and drinks available in the pool area and a great house band to plays live. Over all we were very pleased with our trip and our choice of hotels. The rooms were decorated nicely and everything seemed clean and updated in the rooms. The elevators were clean, but I don't enjoy having to swipe my room card to get the elevator to go up. This led to a lot of confusion in the beginning as no one told us we had to swipe our card prior to pressing the floor button. The hotel itself is very open so once you are out of the room you do feel the humidity everywhere inside. (halls, eating areas, elevators etc)There was a nice exercise room and business center available as well. The lobby area was nicely decorated and gave a true island feel. There was also fresh fruit infused water available.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I absolutely love this property! I loved everything about our stay from the moment we stepped on property until our departure. The front desk greets you with a complimentary beverage for all guests upon check in. We had a two bedroom suite that was absolutely beautiful and spacious. The welcome package is wonderful, offering free gifts from the hotel and coupons for surrounding shops and restaurants. The full breakfast buffet is the best and biggest I've ever seen. You can't go wrong with the manager's reception When staying in Waikiki, this will be my first choice. It's a must!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is a brilliant hotel. Not only are the rooms a bit bigger, we have a 1 bedroom suite, which gives a bedroom with 2 queen beds(a bonus most waikiki rooms only do 2 doubles) plus a lounge/dining room and kitchenette. Travelling with hubby and two teens so just gives a bit more room. The added bonus is breakfast each day on the Grand Lanai, and a managers reception each night with free drinks and nibbles. There is no restriction on how many times you go to the bar which is great. The staff from your room cleaner to the bar tenders to the reception staff who give you a nice cold juice on arrival are all fantastic. Overall a great family hotel which has a brilliant vibe. Couldn't recommend it more highly.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I stayed here for a week and it was a great! They include breakfast and happy hour drinks and snacks every day, which made it so convenient to just go downstairs and grab a plate and then get the day started. The room was spacious. We had a king size corner view room with a balcony. There was a separate living room with a small kitchenette, which included a small fridge, microwave, coffee maker and electric kettle. Could not hear too much noise from the other rooms. The staff was super friendly and accommodating when we asked for extra towels and toiletries. The location is great as well. Just a few steps from Waikiki beach.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Not my usual experience from Embassy Suites. Staff was hostile at check-in, elevator was slow and had issue with opening closing 4 times before departure (Aloha Tower) room across from elevator create noise and distractions. Hair in tub and floor of bathroom. Kids in pool doing cannon ball from planter boxes, brought to attention of staff that was cleaning pool area. Staff broken English pretended to not understand. Food items at breakfast were hard (waffles, other bread items) Egg station great. May be a 1 off experience. Wont stay again. Lots and Lots of other choices in area to stay. Love Hilton and every other Embassy Suites experience in all my travels. Feel that this was just a bad experience.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We just had to come back to the Embassy again. We were here 5 years ago and it is still a really nice place to stay for us as a family. There were 5 of us: my husband and I plus our 3 teenage children.We stayed on the 20th floor of the HulaTower in a 2 bedroom suite. The views of the ocean and pool were amazing.PROS:When we checked in, we each received a complimentary orange passion fruit guava drinks in fluted champagne glassesHot buffet breakfast was included from 6:30 - 10 am dailyManager's special 5:30-7:30 pm every day but Sunday; drinks were great, bartenders were fantastic, snacks were just okayOur housekeeper was absolutely terrific. She made sure we had everything we needed every day; gave us sightseeing tips; and greeted us each morningWe love the location, proximity to the beach and shoppingCONS:The information desk wasn't always very friendly; they kept telling us to speak to the bellhops to get more information instead of answering our questions themselves

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our travel agent said this was a busy place a bit tired but spacious and this was accurate, its good value in terms of location and the rooms are spacious but dated. The breakfast is pretty busy and the food is very ordinary, healthy options are hard to find. We pretty soon tired of the free cocktail hour and stopped going in part because holding the kids back from the free soft drinks was such hard work. I am sure there are nicer places to stay but you pay for them - whether you choose to take this place for its space, location and free food but lack of charm is a definite choice.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Just returned from a 10 night stay at the Embassy, was a great place especially with kids. Wouldn't recommend if childless as pool area loads of splashing and noise! Children having way too much fun. Buffet breakfast and nightly drinks ticked all the boxes. Staff extremely friendly

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had an ocean view room on the 20th floor of the Aloha tower. Lots of space for our family, but the ocean views are not sweeping as shown in the pictures on their website and the tv console was right in the middle of the picture window! One of the queen beds sagged in the middle. Service was very good, except when we asked about the views and we got the same scripted response. 'This is one of our best rooms. You are a valued customer.' Loved the managers reception. Breakfast is a great plus. Pool bar service was also great, except the bartender refused to make a mojito (Mai Tai was amazing, however!)

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I've been to Oahu many times and have stayed in many different parts of the island. So my 5-star review here is just for this little location and this hotel here. This hotel has:- a good location in the middle of everything. It's very convenient to food, shopping, beach, transportation, etc.- clean and comfortable rooms. The beds are very nice. The suites are large and have everything you need for a nice beach vacation.- nice free breakfast, with the usual breakfast foods (plus plenty of vegan options like brown rice and tofu and salad and fruit.)- free evening happy hour with fun bartenders - free wi-fi- an incredible Roy's restaurant on the main floor (make reservations in advance)But its drawbacks are the same as all the hotels in this area: since it's surrounded by other hotels, restaurants, transportation, and shopping, it's very crowded and noisy. You can walk to a zillion things, but you trade that for tranquility.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: If your going to Waikiki you should already know that you are most likely not going to have the picture perfect Hawaii view out of your hotel as this is a major city. It felt more like being overseas in Shanghai etc but with an awesome beach just a couple of minutes away. As for the hotel I am not sure there is a better deal. The rooms provide enough space for a large family, they come stocked with coffee and plenty of pool/beach towels. The breakfast selection is great including Korean specialties such as kimchi which is great for a multiple day stay to break up the same old same old. The pool area is good for kids and the evening reception is great including live entertainment. The hotel has a good sized gym, laundry, and is located right on the beach walk with plenty of shops and restaurants.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The Good and the Bad. The hotel is in a good location though not on the beach, and the rooms on the lower floors can be quiet dark and noisy due to being close to street level, and not a lot of natural light due to surrounding buildings. Always get a room as high as possible to avoid this. Breakfast standard has dropped by Australian standards and seems to be catering more to the Asian and American markets. Basic cereals would be nice in the breakfast bar rather than sugary cereals. Simple rice bubbles, corn flakes or special k would be a better alternative. The hotel has been redecorated to modernise though it probably wasn't required and lowering the prices on the hotel rooms would have been a better objective. I think the extra lounge room area and second television is great for a family but the extra room comes at a cost as does the breakfast as this hotel is pricey for the standard and location. I think they need to consider the pricing for the Australian market as this is not a cheap option.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: the rooms where very comfortable to stay in with plenty of space for a family of 4,very clean,and well appointed.the location was great with plenty of things to see and do,there where heaps of places to eat as well(just have a look around before you choose).The pool area was very nice,breakfast was good,and the afternoon free drinks went down well except the barman with the ponytail was a real DH. Overall a great stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Loved the hotel! You never have to leave the hotel! The daily buffet breakfast was outstanding. The staff continually added food, made sure people had access to the food and drinks. The chef who made our omelettes were so pleasant and helpful. He always made us feel comfortable and he kept an eye out to make sure we were taken care of in the right order. Very admirable. The staff always greeted us and made us feel like guests even though they knew we were locals and the Suites are beautiful. Made us feel relaxed with great amenities. Our stay was wonderful!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I love this place. Check in is a little arduous and they put our three rooms on three different floor but otherwise flawless. The staff are polite and helpful, location is as close to perfect as possible being very slightly off the main road and the rooms are clean and tidy. Perfect for a family. We are very lucky to be returning next week for a couple of days. Cannot wait! Mahalo!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: So here is the deal. Great location, lots of stuff just steps away from the hotel doors. The rooms are all suites, and are a great size. They are in good shape but I would stay renovations will be needed in a year or so. The rooms are clean. Minor issues most related to keeping me as a Hilton Diamond Happy, as someone who is in and out of a lot of Hilton hotels, this hotel just feel short on something that would make me second guess booking with all the options in town.#1 Check in line, I waited over 15 min. There was no HH line for Diamonds. I also did "online check in" but there was no way to get access to an agent to get a key. After a wait it did get an agent who was nice but just did not listen to me. I said I did the online check in. She kept asking for items like credit card and other items that Hilton corporate tell hotels not to ask for when a guest uses the online check in. Also there was zero Diamond recognition. Again just little things. #2 Did not get the room I picked online, my profile states away from Elevator, and on a high floor. They got 1/2 that right. High floor yes, put a room right next to the elevator. #3 Slow elevators, that are packed most of the time#4 Breakfast is not as good as many other Embassy's but they do have a lot of people to feed. It is like a feeding for people who never ate before. I do not fight for food, I had to here. Very sad how people act. Also peoples kids, dirty little hands touching all the food.#5 The speed of the internet is slow, as a Diamond I should have gotten the faster internet for free. If I did the speeds are bad. My room was nice, beds were nice, bathroom was good. Night time managers reception is nice, but if you want a strong free drink make sure you tip the bar tender first, this will effect your service.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Friendly staff, terrific pillows and comfy bed. Nice and quiet. Mountain room was great. Very happy with free full breakfast. Great location. Well worth staying here. I have no negatives about this lovely hotel

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at this hotel for five nights at the end of September, and would highly recommend it to families! Located in a very handy spot between Beachwalk and Lewers Street, it was easy walking distance to many Waikiki attractions, and handy to buses and tours. The pool and pool deck is a great place for families to play (or for parents to relax). And we found all staff friendly and helpful. Breakfast is included with the room, and offers plenty of variety, although everything we tried seemed to be overcooked perhaps just a consequence of buffet service? The Manager's nightly reception is a great way to meet other guests, and for children to make friends. The band playing four nights a week were highly entertaining. One note, the kitchenette did not include any plates, cups, glasses or cutlery...we needed to buy disposable ones from the local ABC.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I have traveled to Waikiki several times and stayed in many hotels but I wish I had found this one earlier. The location on Beach Walk is excellent. You are right in the middle of many shops and restaurants and walking distance to everything else. The beach is only two blocks away and not as crowded as the main beach further down. It's a little rougher for small children but fine for adults. The staff was very friendly and accomdating.Parking is also a little less expensive than at some of the other "brand" hotels and they don't charge that ridiculous "resort" fee.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Excellent Hotel for family holiday. We stayed in 1 bedroom suite with family of 5, which was ok, but would probably book a 2 bedroom next time, my kids getting a bit too old now. Hotel is well situated, quiet, clean and staff very friendly and helpful. Pool and Bar staff best I've experienced!! Only negative was cleaning staff trying to delay clean so we'd say don't bother by 4pm or so. Otherwise great for families. Enjoy!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I stayed here in November 2014 with my husband. I booked through British Airways and the deal came with breakfast. Breakfast was of a good standard - omlettes cooked to order and lots of fresh tropical fruit. We had upgraded to a sea view and the view was lovely. We were quite high up so it was slightly scary out on the balacony but we braved it. Only a 5-10 minute walk to Wakiki beach and right in the heart of Honolulu! Good service and the room was always clean. Managers cocktail nights went down a treat with free cocktails and snacks too!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: All of the hotel staff are so nice, friendly, and accommodating. There is an awesome complimentary breakfast- complete with omelet station, and very relaxed- non-stressful ambiance. There is also a complimentary manager's reception on certain nights that include an open bar and snacks from 5:30pm-7:30pm. Both the adults and kids loved our stay!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel was great. We had a 2 bedroom suite. Both rooms had their own full bathroom and tv. It also comes with a small fridge, microwave ,coffee and tea machine . Breakfast buffet included every morning on the grand lanai. Enjoy your breakfast with the ocean breeze that flows through. Omelets made to order. You pick what you want and they cook it right in front of you . Staff is very friendly and helpful. Shopping is walking distance. Every store you can think off surrounds all the hotels. Beach access is across the street. It also has a pool, gym, and laundry room. This hotel has valet only. It's around 40 bucks a day.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I've come to think of Embassy Suites as my go to place when visiting Oahu but this visit wasn't my best. The room had the smallest balcony that you couldn't even sit facing forward - you had to sit sideways - Rm 1410! This is a Romeo/Juliet balcony only for standing. I thought that since I come every year that I've come that I would receive some favorable treatment but I guess you don't have a list of loyal patrons. And with the cost of your suites - let's just say very disappointed. The housekeeping staff was phenomenal and she was just a gem and ray of light everyday that we encountered her! The location is the saving grace for this hotel. In the future, I may have to entertain other accommodations.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This Hotel was wonderful for our stay. It is in the heart of Waikiki, the free drinks at the bar every night was an added bonus, Allowed us to have a drink while the kids were in the pool. The buffet breakfast was great. The staff were very helpful and attentive. The hotel itself was clean and well maintained. The Waikiki beach was only 120metres away (2 min walk).

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Everyone at the hotel is fantastic. They met all of our needs and were very helpful. The room was clean and the breakfast that is included was pretty good with lots to choose from. My only problem with the hotel was their ad, it says that the hotel is only steps from Waikiki beach. It seemed like more than a block especially if you want a sandy part of the beach. Other than that it is centrally located and a fun part of the island.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The rooms were well equipped with a small fridge and microwave. Having a separate living area meant there was loads of space. The decor looks a bit dated but that wasn't a major issue. The manager's welcome reception with free drinks and snacks and a talented live band was a nice touch. The location was fantastic, in the heart of Waikiki and close to all of the lovely shops. The porter staff were friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Awesome holiday staying at this great hotel. Everything was just perfect. Great local. Embassy Suite staff very happy and helpful. Breakfast, pool, happy hour plus, plus was all great. Would suggest my family and friend to stay at the Embassy Suites.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Spending the last night of our Hawaii vacation. We have been here at the Embassy Suites since Tuesday. Everything has been perfect since we arrived. When we got here, we were several hours prior to check in and didn't expect to be able to have a room ready. Sharon was amazing. Not only did she find us a room, but it was an upgrade! The room was clean and comfortable with an ocean view. Amazing! We love Embassy Suites and stay at them frequently. This location is above aqn beyond!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had a fantastic stay here. The location is excellent, right in the heart of things and very easy to get around. We could walk to the beach, shops, and lots of different restaurants.We found everyone who works here to be super friendly and helpful. The pool area is great and good for all ages - including my 16 month old.Room was excellent - we had a partial ocean view one bedroom apartment and it was great. There is a microwave and a little fridge but that's about it for cooking.Great stay thanks, would definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We just returned from 10 night stay at Embassy Suite Honolulu. We have stayed at an Embassy Suites prior so knew the advantages of this hotel. It did not disappoint! Wehad a beautiful corner suite on the 18th floor where we could enjoy the ocean view,pool view & city/mountain view. Our room as very accommodating, as was the full course breakfast each morning & managers reception each evening. We had thebest maid service from Wai Lin who never failed to be friendly & helpful if we neededanything for our room. She was a real sweetheart who always had a smile for us. The walk to the beach was a short one & no problem, but the beach itself was a huge disappointment. Very rocky & uninviting & we always love to beach it for a couple of days but rain prevented that as well. We spent our time in the sun at the hotel pool& it was fine. it had a huge Jacuzzi & plenty of loungers to pick from at the pool. Themenu at the bar was a bit high & we never did order from it. We were surprised by thenumber of children in mid-Sept. as we thought they would all be back to school. That was not the case but all children we encountered were well behaved & just enjoying their "holiday".. We had read the reviews prior to booking & most complainted about the elevators. We can see why. There are only two & they do a bit slow, but actually wasnot that big of a problem. We dined one evening at the Ruths Chris Steak House atEmbassy Suites & although very pricey, was delicious & had an awesome waiter. We did try to get a late checkout as our flight did not leave until late afternoon but they for some reason were not able to give us that. Don't know why & we were unhappy with that. Overall, we would not hesitate to book again with Embassy Suites.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Embassy Suites is a perfect hotel for the area. They have a good breakfast included with your room. What a great idea for a vacation, you can sleep in and still make the 10am cut off for breakfast. Start your day with breakfast and fresh pineapple by the pool. The hotel is located in an upscale shopping area of Waikiki so when you are not at a beach you have lots to chose from. The pool has a good area for very young children and an adjoining area for adults with lots of lounge chairs for all. You have one hotel between you and Waikiki Beach and a good restaurant in that hotel called Shore Bird. There you cook your own meat with an all you can eat salad bar and watch the sun set over the ocean. We rented a car for the week and toured the island at our own pace. The only downfall of E.S. is the valet parking fee of $35.00 a day. Parking was more than our car rental fee. However parking is at a premium so there is no other option. The local transit did not work for us and the traffic requires you to pack your patience with you. It is not uncommon to take 45 minutes to get 5 to 7 miles. Honolulu has not done a good job of streets and mass transit. Do your homework before you go and have an idea what you plan to see each day. Running over to the North Shore is not that far away but the traffic could make it an hour or two or longer depending on the time of day. The H2 and H3 can be a little confusing and our GPS sometimes gave us a route that was not the best so again homework first. Some of our favorite things were a helicopter flight with Blue Hawaii. A little pricy but since my husband is a helicopter pilot too safety and equipment are very important. It was so fun and a great tour. Be sure to see the big Turtles on the N. shore just to the right of hwy 99's intersection with hwy83. Snorkel in Hanauma Bay, take your own equipment or rent theirs. Make reservations for Pearl Harbor early tours fill up quick. We found a great Italian restaurant in the large shopping mall two blocks west of T J Maxx. IT is located just off Hwy 92. We can't wait to go back. My Husband had to work and I felt comfortable driving on my own. Have a great time. E. S. staff was great after a day or so they recognized us and went out of the way to make us feel comfortable and welcome. Look for Adrine at breakfast He will always meet you with a big smile and welcome. I even got a big hug the day we left!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: After reading many reviews on Trip Advisor and being guided by this to select family friendly accomodation we booked Hilton Embassy Suites. This hotel lived up to our expectations and more. We booked a one-bedroom which was perfect for our family of four. We have two children 12 and 8. Our room was serviced daily, unlike Australia where in most cases a long term stay in a one-bedroom normally means self-servicing. The beds were super comfy and the layout suited our needs. We appreciated the free daily breakfast and enjoyed the reception most nights by the pool from 5:30pm - 7:30pm with free cocktails and soft drinks for our children. Live music played during most of these nights which was an added bonus. Our kids loved the pool. I was happily surprised by how well the hotel was located to EVERYTHING! We were so lucky. We all agree that this would be the place we would stay again. Only downside was the tour desk which was with Expedia - they would only accept visa or travel cards to book tours and we only had cash. There were no signs to advise this or anything in the Embassy brochures to indicate this. After we spent an hour organising and booking tours we came to pay for them and discovered this. We were really disappointed. We then had to reaarange visa finances to finalise our bookings. Had we of known this we would have put some money on a travelcard. Other hotels advised that this was not common practise in other hotels. Although we could have gone elsewhere we would have wasted our time and we trusted the Expedia name as a booking agent. That aside our experience was overwhelmingly positive especially since after arriving with little sleep our room was ready on arrival at 2pm and we were able to go straight there with our luggage. Thank you for everything!!!!! We are raving to our friends and did so on all our tours to guests from other hotels.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here for three nights as a stopover. This is a family friendly hotel and gets good raves from people who have children who like to spend time in and around the pool. There are two towers which make up the complex, both of which were full during our stay. So a very busy place. The  "complementary" buffet breakfast which runs from 06:30 to 10:00 am is fairly extensive but it reminded us of farm animal feeding time, especially the closer you get to 10:00am. Great for watching human nature though.  We didn't make it to the nightly Manager's reception and free drinks but suspect it might  be similar.The hotel is adjacent to Beachwalk with its many shops and restaurants and is close to Waikiki Beach and the Army Museum at Fort de Russy. We also found it fairly easy to walk to Ala Moana Shopping Centre. We had a corner unit which had partial views of the ocean and a much bigger view of the neighbouring Trump Tower....which looked nice...maybe next time! Most rooms have small balconies (lanai) but they are not much more than a chair width so we felt nervous sitting out there and opening the windows shut down the aircon. Room was quiet with no discernible street noise. The hotel has self service coin operated laundries in each tower which are very good and open 24 hours. Housekeeping staff were friendly but perhaps some more attention to removing the foreign black hairs from the bathroom is called for.We had complementary wifi which was pretty fast so a big tick here. Checkout was painless. Overall commentary ... ot bad if you are comfortable with a resort style crowded hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Nice property (clean and great location) with excellent breakfast and cocktail reception. Only drawback is there are no restaurants on property to use room credits (only pool food and room service). Not a huge deal, but when you book expecting to use a room credit on the on premises restaurant and find that you cannot it is a bit of a disappointment.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed here for 8 nights with two small kids in a twin bed city view room, 20th floor. The Embassy is WOW. Staff are amazing, special mention to Dean at the Valet and Christina by the pool. The rooms are great with everything needed and enough size to be really comfy. Housekeeping did a great job daily, plenty of towels and always watching when we were going out to service room accordingly. ES is in a great spot, so close to everything. Lots of cheap and quick takeaway options right down stairs and yummy food trucks across the street. 50 m yo Starbucks and 80m to the beach. If we return to Waikiki, ES will be top of the list.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed during the peak season the last week in July. We had a wonderful time. The staff was great. Our housekeeper was wonderful, and went the extra mile by always getting us fresh towels for the beach. Our room was clean and comfortable, but was a bit smaller than I viewed on the website. The sound proofing was excellent. We couldn't hear from one room to the other, bathroom included. The manager's reception was fun and lively. There were drinks and snacks for the entire family. The snacks consisted of pretzels, nachos, vegetables with ranch dressing, and chips. You can order food there as well from the restaurant in the hotel. The prices are reasonable. The food was good too. The breakfast was superior. There was something slightly different from day to day in the buffet. There was even green salad and white rice on the buffet if that is something you enjoy for breakfast. The beach is a short walk across the street. If you need to get around town, I would recommend taking The Bus. We went all over the island on The Bus. It cost $2.25 for adults, and $1.25 for kids. Take EXACT change, because they don't give it. If you would rather rent, there is a rental company in the basement of the Outrigger Reef across the street where the Starbucks is located. We rented a car for one day of our stay, and it was super easy to get the car. We even returned it to the Embassy Suites and they took care it from there. The Embassy Suites also has a limo you can rent. We did this another day, and his rates are very reasonable. We will definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Just got back from staying a week at the embassy, beautiful hotel, great location and the staff were all fantastic people, the rooms were serviced daily by lovely friendly people alway happy to help if needed. We had two one bedroom suites and the size was perfect, beautiful views great pool area and poolside service. The pool menu was delicious. Thank you to everyone there. Also the boys that play at the 2 hour drink time were wicked well done.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Throughly recommend this Hotel, ideal spot close to beach and shopping. Loved the 2hr cocktails and drinks each night along with the fabulous breakfasts, all inclusive. Would definitely stay at The Embassy again!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Can not fault this hotel. The room perfect for a family of 4. Kids were comfortable on the sofa bed and parents comfy in their own private room. Bed and linens very luxurious. The view from the suite is magnificent! Room is next to elevator but never heard it, quiet floor with quiet guests! Breakfast included in our stay was delicious and lovely to have by the pool each morning. Room service quick and meals also delicious. Beautifully located, can walk to everywhere, beach, shops & restaurants etc. Would book this hotel again with no hesitation.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I just got back from a week at this property and thought it was a great. It is in a fabulous location surrounded by shopping and dining and just a block away from the beach. There is a band playing on four nights during the happy hour and the band really got the guests into dancing and having fun. There were more drink options at happy hour at this property than other Embassy Suites I have been to. The happy hour food consisted of chips, gold fish crackers, dip and veggies. The service from everyone from the front desk, tour desk, housekeeping, bell hops, etc. was outstanding; maybe the best I have ever had. The one thing that I did not like is that the lobby was not air conditioned nor was the floor we were on (16th); our room was the only place with a/c. Since it was so humid while I was there it was awful to sit and wait for a pick up ride or talk to the tour desk after being outside. I would recommend staying at this property but stay away from a room by the elevator or you will hear it all the time.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We loved this hotel. The hotel is located one block from Waikiki Beach, and it is a quick and easy walk to the beach. The hotel is next to great shopping and restaurants. Roy's is in the same building as the hotel. The pool area is great. There are plenty of pool chairs at any time of the day. The breakfast buffet was amazing, particularly the omelette bar. Our favorite part of the hotel was the free happy hour every night. The drinks were very good and the bartenders were friendly. We tipped a few dollars each time we got drinks, but tips are not required or expected. The band that played during happy hour was fantastic. Some guests even got up and danced. We stayed in a one bedroom suite, and we had plenty of room for 2 adults and 4 teens. There was an extra sink outside the bathroom. We liked having the refrigerator in the room for water and soft drinks. We had 2 balconies with a view of the ocean. Housekeeping was excellent and always cleaned our room before noon. The valet was quick and easy. We were greeted at check in with cool towels and glasses of orange guava juice for the whole family. We highly recommend this hotel for families.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is a newer property that was built or refurbished when Lewers Street got a make over about 10 years ago. While it is across the street from the beach, and not beach front, it is only a couple minutes to walk to the beach in front of Fort Derussy. The room was nicer than many I have seen in Waikiki, but certainly not 5*. Three things that were negative and worth noting:1) Trash trucks make a substantial noise beginning about 6AM through 8 or 9 AM.2) I think hotel workers union has it written in their union contract that they get to use hotel facilities like the pool on weekends. Or maybe non-hotel guests can buy day passes or memberships. I don't know.3) Avoid the rooms that have a bedroom behind or adjacent to the elevator shafts. They cables make a really annoying noise --- all day. All night.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Most incredible breakfast, for the money very good all 2 room suites with balconies, good location. You never know what you are getting into; until you are there, I say in nice high end places and this was MUCH better that I expected. THX

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The rooms are typical Embassy Suite layout. Bathtubs are small but comfortable. The corner rooms provide (xx29 & xx30)an excellent view of the beach/ocean in the Aloha Tower.Valet vehicle parking is 35.00 per 24 hours. Public parking is 3.00 per hour at most nearby facilities so the 35.00 is a bargain, albeit high. Two privately owned restaurants are attached to the facility, Roys (Asian cusine or Ruth Chris). A third option would be the Dennys about 30 yards away from the hotels back side. You should also consider the ABC Store (sells alchohol) but functions mostly as a gift shoppe/deli. You can purchase a prepare meals (steak, potatos, vegetables for $9.99. They also have sandwiches, soups, non-alcoholic drinks. Local coffee is better here than at the Embassy which offers run-of-the-mill Hilton and tastes awful.Their is a Pastrami Deli(offering a full course menu) available near the ABC store and a Subway 100 yards or less away. Safe Travels

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is now one of my favorite hotels. Their attention to detail is exceptional. The room had a bit of wear and tear but was well thought out, had everything we needed or wanted, had a view of the Waikiki beach, and was quiet and comfortable.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I really enjoyed staying at this hotel. It is in a very good location. Restaurants and stores in walking distance. I just stayed one night on my way home from Japan. I was very impressed with the size of my room and it had a very comfortable bed and pillows. Breakfast also had a good choice of items to eat and drink. Was very crowded but that is a sign of a good establishment. I and my wife plan to come back to this hotel for our anniversary and stay at least five days. It was the best out of the three hotels we stayed at in Honolulu on our visits here. I do recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: It is located out of the beach front so you might have to think about it have a lot of stores and restaurants around but in Waikiki that is normal I like more SPG westin Sheraton hotels in the beach front

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Having been to Honolulu several times, this was the first time staying at the Embassy Suites and I was so impressed! Fantastic, clean hotel, wonderful staff, excellent facilities and a lovely surprise to find out breakfast was included in our rate! We stayed in a 2 bedroom apartment which was perfect for our family of 4 with enough room for everyone to feel comfortable. The location was perfect for everything we wanted and needed.....walking distance to beach, great restaurants. Could not recommend this property more and we will definitely be back!!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is a newly remodeled hotel and a great place to spend your vacation. The rooms were very nice, quiet even though we were adjacent to the elevator. Our room opened to the pool deck area and our little patio was nice. Breakfast buffet was included daily and there were lots of options and lots of fresh fruits. Sitting outside in the early morning was a great way to welcome the day. The happy hour nightly was a blast with the house band playing almost nonstop covering lots of current hits and some oldies. The bartenders were personable and made good drinks. Karen was our housekeeping attendant and was absolutely wonderful. She was sweet and kind and took great care of our room and needs. She is an asset to this hotel. From this location you can walk out to Lewer street and lots of restaurants and shopping and of course the beach was a short half block away. I highly recommend staying here and enjoying all it has to offer. No resort fees and free breakfast and happy hour with a spacious suite. It has it all. We already have reservations to return.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at the Embassy Suites in September 2015.The suites are well appointed and well positioned, right in the heart of Waikiki, close to shopping, food and of course, Waikiki Beach.The bed in the suite is huge and really comfortable. Buffet breakfast was included daily and was a great and easy way to start the day, as was the managers reception, boasting free cocktails and snacks every evening.The hotel offered other additional activities including yoga 3 mornings a week.We were really happy with our stay at the Embassy, and would highly recommend for families, couples and singles.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This resort after checking many trip advisor reviews, was exactly what they said. Is this your first time in Hawaii? Great for families, buffet breakfast included always fresh, saved us time & hassle. In the middle of everything, walking distance to all the popular spots. You can buy dinner, lunch and snacks from the food court across the street from reception, because this hotel only has breakfast available. Also plenty of restaurants at your fingertips. The ABC shops are the best for souvenirs and great for off the shelf wine, beer, champagne, spirits, everything you need these shops have it, SO CHEAP. ABC shops on every corner you will love them, deli food, snacks, post cards, beach items, tshirts all at ABCs. We ordered pizzas from Pizza Hut, one night in and they deliver to reception, make sure you have the correct cash. This was the best Hawaiian pizza we had there Aussie style. Your not on the beach but a two minute stroll easy enough. My tip is book a corner room, part oceon view, above level 4 and you won't be disappointed, great views no street noise, at night. Great laundry and gym with a lovely spa & pool, happy hour with free drinks, snacks included. You can take back to your room & enjoy on your balcony or laze at the pool. Two to three days is enough in Wakkiki for shopping, if you can do an island tour a few nights is best, but if you choose to stay on an island, and like nothing to do then that's for you. What more do you need, this is the place "The Embassy Suites" on beach walk, Waikiki just book it.......You won't be dissapointed. Hope this helps! Marie..

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The hotel is modern and has large comfortable suites. There is a 2-3 block walk to the nearest beach and about 8-10 blocks from the heart of Waikiki beach. The pool and breakfast area is very nice. Close to lots of shops and restaurants.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at this hotel our past four visits. This hotel is located in a very convenient place. When we have a chance to visit Honolulu again, we will stay this hotel. We satisfied their breakfast and night reception drink. Our granddaughter likes the pool a lot.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Loved our stay here, couldn't have asked for better. Rooms were very clean and tidy. Lots of room for our family of 5. From the welcome drink on arrival to our final day (didn't want to leave) the staff were always extremely friendly and helpful. They go out of their way to make sure your stay is enjoyable and hassle free. Breakfast included is a massive bonus, heaps to choose from, happy hour from 5:30-7:30, includes food & drinks. We will definitely be back, thank you for the best holiday we have ever had.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The Embassy Suites in Waikiki is cute and nice. We came for a quick family get away and were not expecting a hotel in the heart of Waikiki! We did not have the greatest greeting by the valet guys because they seemed short handed, but the nice lady at the front desk turned everything around. We got to the room and did not expect to see such a nice room. The room was spacious, clean, decorated nice, and comfortable. This property holds the Hilton Standards to a high level.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: As a 22 year old (going on 23) it's lovely to go on a holiday and play the role of a kid again, but at such an age we are no longer so easily assumed...What made this stay great was that I was able to play and sing the ukulele to the beautiful cleaners who made sure we were as comfortable as possible. We only stayed for three days, so we had the same cleaner for our whole stay. She completed me, as she laughed at my sub par jokes, probably even when she didn't think they were funny. That trait alone, is a trait of not only a great woman, but a great cleaner.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: While it is not the best spot, it is a solid win for a family vacation spot. The high points are the breakfast, the site (close to all sorts of dining and shopping options and, the beach just 1-2 blocks away. Our stay in rm 1708 in Aloha tower was enjoyable, the view was pleasant if not quite the ocean view shown on the website (surprise!). Despite this we found the housekeeping staff quite wonderful and our stay overall, enjoyable. Positives: location, clean, breakfast and the partial ocean view. A/C worked well in the roomNegatives: wornout lobby and hallways, creaky overloaded elevators (long waits at peak hours), A/C does not exist in common areas of this facility, which made it quite stuffy and warm. The elevator in particular was unpleasantly warm and crowded - c'mon Hilton, it is 2015, are you kidding me?

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Embassy Suites, particularly in Waikiki is a perfect place for many reasons. Many hotels cannot accommodate 5-6 people in one room, but ES can.It avoids you booking two rooms. Many hotels do not offer free hot breakfast and charge daily resort fees which quickly make the daily rate a lot more expensive. This is not the case when staying here. The location is in the middle of the daily Waikiki activity, 1 block from the beach. There is a fairly new shopping area connected to the hotel. I was very pleased with the entire arrangement.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: A one-bed room suite is just perfect for a family. The bathroom has two doors so that parents and kids do not have bother each other at night when using it. Great breakfast! plus fabulous manager's reception. Also, after your check-out, they can still offer luggage storage and courtesy room for a shower, which are very convenience. All in all, we would choose it again next time my family visits Waikiki beach.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel is fantastic. I can't praise enough the Waikiki Embassy Suite Hotel and all of the wonderful employees, the way they treated and looked after us. I have to salute the professional check in process and a complimentary passion orange guava drink. The location is second to none, definitely in a prime location. The free breakfast was delicious, with a myriad of choices and made-to-order omelettes were pièce de résistance.This hotel also offers nightly “Managers drinks” around to the pool area, with free cocktails, music, refreshments and a great atmosphere.  With such a great location, it offers walking distance to restaurants, shopping, beach, The War museum...just perfect.Our room was a great room, it was clean and spacious, our bed was comfortable, the bed linen was white, crisp and clean. We enjoyed our great nights sleep every night of our stay... I have to say it was a great choice and I would definitely stay here again if we come back to Hawaii.Thank you all for making our stay so memorable!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed 4 nights with a family of 4 (2 children 5,8). We booked direct and was about us1200 for 4 nights. The check in process was easy and got a welcome drink. The room was on 17th floor and spacious with 2 rooms, one with 2 queens and a sofa bed in the other. 2 balconies and 2 tvs. Rooms were clean and had all amenties needed. Only complaint is the queen beds are a little small and one rolled into middle a bit. The pool area is lovely on lev 4 and staff keep it clean constantly, staff always sighted around. Pool was nice and large and kids enjoyed.The free buffet breakfast was wonderful and omelette bar was great. Cereals pancakes, bacon eggs and breads all available. Breakfast catered for gluten free member of family well.The nightly reception was fantastic, 2 hours drinks and nibbles (crisps, corn chips, carrots, dips, pretzels). Drinks were strong and 3 was more than enough :) live music was wonderful and really nice vibe there.The location is brilliant, right near everything.There are abc stores nearby and dennys across road for cheap feed. Cheesebuger place nearby also fantastic feed.Highly recommend embassy suites, stayed at before in texas and arkansas and waikiki was another winner. Would definitely return and hope to one day.Another note was a big Mahalo to bell man who was able to locate my sons missing special cap in a back of a cab that he left behind when we departed and have it returned to us at another hotel. You made my son a very very happy boy.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Hotel is in great location for shops and restaurants and approx. 400m walk from Waikiki beach. Rooms spacious and clean, with kitchenette (without cutlery or crockery, so not that useful but oh well). We had 2 bed suite, but next time would just get interconnecting rooms (much cheaper given kitchenette not encouraged to use). Staff very friendly and helpful. Overall a good holiday.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Hi my young family (2 adults + 1yo) stayed here for 7 days in Aug15. The hotel were fantastic with special mention for Garret (Mgr), Ray (Check-in), Dean (Bell Valet) and Llewelyn (Housekeeping) for looking after us so well. The location is second to none on Lewers St with so many restaurants and shopping close by. The beach was only a 5min walk.The free breakfast was limited but the made-to-order omelettes were pretty good and the relaxed atmosphere of the area was just perfect.The pool was great for our family and there is a bar for refreshments. The nightly Managers drinks was also a nice touch, with a lot of people heading down to the pool area for drinks.We were upgraded on our stay to an ocean view room which was bright, spacious and clean. A great room and would recommend the extra money to get this room.Will definitely stay here again for the facilities and friendliness.A great choice.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Hotel location is great! Close to everything you want to be in Waikiki. Accommodations were nice and the staff helpful. Breakfast and Happy Hour were wonderful! Would recommend to anyone. Very family friendly!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed 2 nights in 1 large, 2 room "apartment". 2 double beds + pullout sofa. Excellent location - very central to all the eateries. Room was decent size for 5 of us. Breakfast was good although lines were a bit chaotic. Evening reception was good. Hint: tip the barman when you get the first drink and he'll ensure you get a good amount of alcohol on future rounds otherwise they water it down!Staff are pleasant enough but it's such a large place that you are just a number. Beach: although not the hotel's fault, is way too rocky!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We've actually stayed at this location a few times already, but taking the time to write this review because we've consistently had good experiences here.We live in Honolulu, so we use this as one of our go-to staycation spots. Good price, good location. We really like the suite option, having the physical separation between the bed and other area lets us watch tv, unwind, etc. without disturbing the sleeping kids.Here's how the experience should go for you:1. Drop your car off (it's valet only, and a bit pricey, about $25 a day, but at least there's in and out privileges).2. Check-in, and get a complimentary POG drink (passion orange guava). nice touch.3. Get into your room. Small little details, big difference sometimes. The rooms are always clean. The bathroom door opens into the living room, versus opening into the bedroom, so lights, sounds, and...smells...don't affect people in the bedroom.4. Free breakfast and manager's reception. Full spread, not your typical lite continental breakfast. They cater to the Japanese tourist contingent, so there are a lot of things for breakfast that people are accustomed to in Japan, but more than enough selection for your usual traveler to be happy.Great walking distance to a few of the beaches, nice and quiet too.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was our first stop on a two week trip to Hawaii. We are Hilton Gold members and frequently stay at Embassy Suites because we find them to be a good value. We stayed here for 3 nights and used points to get two nights free. We were given a room near the pool. I didn't like it. There was no privacy and I thought it would be loud. We asked to change the room and they immediately complied and we got a room on the 9th floor. It didn't have an direct ocean view but if you stood out on the balcony you could see the water. This hotel is not directly on the beach. It is about a block from the beach. This didn't bother us. We were visiting 4 islands and there is so much to see in Oahu that we figured we really didn't have time to go to the beach in the three days we were there any way. We did walk over to the beach. It is less than a 5 minute walk. The hotel had a nice pool. As with all Embassy Suites, there is a free cocktail hour at night. The bartender made a mean mai tai. A decent variety of munchies were served. They had a live band one night we were there. Breakfast is also included: made to order omelets, bread products and a variety of things that appealed to their Asian guests--soup, salad etc... Although this is a large hotel and breakfast was always crowded there was never a lack of seating and they kept things moving pretty smoothly. the hotel is situated in an area with a lot of restaurants and shops within walking distance and seemed pretty safe at night. We enjoyed our stay here and would return.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel is right in the middle of everything + no resort fees!!!. Excellent breakfast every morning and free drinks in the evening. Very short walking distance to the beach. Close to very good restaurants

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Very clean and staff was friendly. I enjoyed having free breakfast in the morning, too. Clean rooms were the most important thing for me, not being right on the beach. It is only a block or so away from the water. I preferred the location as it is on the beach walk where the shopping and restaurants are. I will stay here next time I'm in Waikiki. Pics from my balcony rm 1810 city view facing Trump Towers

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great check in process--nice gifts for HHonors members. Room was upgraded complimentary. Staff were very helpful. They answered all of my questions on the hotel and surrounding area. Of course in the busy season it is hard to get a late checkout but that is the price of being in a prime location.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Feel this place is more suited to families rather than couples, good location quick walk to beach, very slow check in but room was in excellent condition could not fault it. Finally Waikiki has been somewhat updated with the Beachwalk shops looks very pretty at night with the lights good variety of Restaurants handy.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Had a quick one night stay here stopping through from the other islands and thought it was fantastic. The location is perfect to go walk around the city or to head towards the beach. Had a corner room with a nice view of the ocean and the city with lanais facing each direction. The suite itself was clean and modern with a nice large bathroom. The Manager's reception in the evening was a lot of fun; we were allowed as many drinks as we wanted. The band they had sounded great, my fiancee even went as far as finding videos of them on YouTube when we got home. We had to check out at about 4 am to catch our flight home so we didn't get a chance to try the breakfast, but even at that hour we were able to get our car from the valet very quickly and were on our way. As much as I like to stay right on the beach, I would not hesitate to stay here again

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our family of four adults spent three nights in August 2015 at the Embassy Suites Waikiki. I would recommend this hotel for location, value of accommodations, comfort and quietness. Our room on the 10th floor looked down on the Beach Walk and it is only a block from the beach. Coffee Bean, Starbucks and restaurants are within a block. Beach Walk has shops, entertainment, farmers' market and restaurants. Pros - location, extra room, sofa bed so our kids each had their own bed, comfortable and quiet. Cons - not enough elevators, quality of breakfast was not good. Valet parking was very good as were the people working at the activities desk who helped us to arrange a last minute trip to Pearl Harbor and for parasailing.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying at Waikiki. The evening Reception is fantastic as is the included buffet breakfast. My two daughters and I also loved the pool and hot tub. The staff are warm and helpful. The hotel is in a great location with an easy walk to the beach.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I have always had great experiences with Embassy Suites so I was looking forward to staying here while in Hawaii. We were greeted at registration with a delicious island drink and our rooms were ready to go. The bed and pillow were amazing! Every morning we woke to a buffet with an omelet station. Not to worry if you have special requests, they do it with a smile. At 5:30pm you have a free happy hour at the managers reception area next to the pool. Great bartenders and there were simple snacks. The beach is maybe a 3 minute walk and I suggest going a bit west towards the Hale Koa hotel. The beach area is open and you can sit on the sand with room around you. Overall, we would definitely stay at the Embassy Suites again. It is perfect for a family. Two rooms, microwave, and fridge is all we needed.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I couldn't say enough about the Waikiki Embassy Suite Hotel and its wonderful employees. We had the most memorable stay because of the way the employees treated us. 5 star hotel located in an excellent area for shopping, beach and restaurants. Breakfast had lots of variety and the pool was been cleaned daily. We can't wait to come back!!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We checked into our room on the 16th floor- my husband felt it was a little tight, backed up to the elevator shaft- but the views and balcony were great. After calling the front desk, they moved us up to the 19th floor- a corner suite with 2 balconies. It was larger and a better layout as well. The hotel front desk, and all employees we encountered were polite and friendly. Buffet breakfast was nice with good variety, although the property was very busy when we were there. They had cards which showed times for the busiest and slowest breakfast service, we just didn't see it until our last day. This location was very convenient, and there were food trucks nearby for inexpensive meals.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is a wonderful hotel conveniently located in the heart of busy Waikiki. Outstanding management and staff will go out of their way to satisfy every customer. Here you are treated like family! The rooms are nicely appointed, beds are comfortable, and housekeeping is terrific. The manager's evening cocktail reception is very nice. All the amenities you expect from Embassy Suites, with the added plus of being in Hawaii! The pool area is most attractive and adjacent to where the complimentary breakfast is served every morning. Be advised, the higher the floor, the better, as far as ocean views are concerned. Keep in mind this property is very popular for families with children, so expect lots of busy activities involving active children. However, once you retire to your suite you will find peace and quiet. Highly recommended!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Arrived late at night and our room was alot smaller than we imagined from the pictures on the internet.
