We decided very quickly that it was going to be too small for all 4 of us for 8 nights. The next day we moved to a wonderful huge room, as a upgrade price - which is a much better deal than if we had originally got it online - we were just lucky that such a room was available! it was $100US a night extra for alot more space, an extra bedroom, an extra bathroom and a huge lounge area! The first morning when we went down for our breakfast - to be honest was a bit of a shock! The breakfast area was totally full - full of dozen of families and hundreds of children, concrete floor, lots of noise - quite chaotic to be honest!! The choice I thought was varied enough, but basic and alot of the food was budget quality. No special diets catered for - ie no soya milk - I was told I needed to email ahead of our trip. We decided after that morning to take trays of breakfast up to our room and enjoy in the view and quietness from our room! The internet was really slow - but free. The rooms were cleaned to a high standard and being in a higher floor room, ocean side having more space definitely made our trip ALOT more enjoyable. Happy hour (infact happy two hours!) everynight was included in the room rate. Lots of cocktails and bar nibbles to choose from. Pool area - lots and lots of loungers - which is always great. Staff always helpful and friendly. A great family hotel - would not stay here if it was just me and my husband. Once block from the beach - ABC convenience store right near the hotel, lots of shops and buses one block over that go to the Ala Moana shopping centre.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We recently spent 7 nights at the Embassy Suites, after 7 nights on Kauai. It was a bit of a shock to the system after a relaxing week in a huge 2 bedroom villa on the beach in Kauai, the rooms are on the small side but as big as you will get in Honolulu. We specifically chose this hotel as have 2 young children and wanted separate rooms. We were given a room on the 10th floor with a city view, which was adequate, until that night when we went to sleep...the bedroom was directly next to the lift (on another note, 2 lifts are not enough to service 21 floors, it stopped at every floor seemingly). After a terrible nights sleep my husband spoke to Vic who managed to find us another room on the 20th floor, a corner suite. What a difference! It was quiet and had lovely ocean views. The bathroom for this room also went off the bedroom rather than the living room which was great for us as could close off the other room once kids in bed. Breakfast was a shock to the system as the whole hotel seemed to turn up at once, but once you got over that and relaxed it was reasonable and the best such a large hotel can do (we did eat at Bills around the corner a couple of times as craved real eggs and bacon and most importantly non American coffee)! The evening drinks were great but unbelievably too potent, which is very unusual! Also provided snacks which was good. Pool was huge and plenty of sun lounges. Free wifi which was a bit slow at times, but free. Hotel is very central and easy to access all the sights, we avoided the pink trolleys to Ala Moana as they were so unpredictable and a cab wasn't much more. Overall I would stay here again but only if I could be guaranteed a high floor, and an ocean view is worth the extra $$.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great apartment, top quality service, huge choice of free breakfast and a free bar from 5.30 to 7.30 every night and a quality band for several nights of our stay. Highly recommended. Also very convenient for restaurants,shops and the beach. St5aff were all very friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I have stayed here numerous times with my family and it is awesome!! The suites are spacious so there is plenty of room for us to relax and watch 2 separate TVs if we chose to do so!. I am a breakfast person so the buffet breakfast is an absolute treat and extremely convenient! Cook to order omelets are the best and you can always bring with you some fruit and or some yogurt cups to your room for the mini fridge for a quick snack later in the day!!! Book in advance or use AAA discount because it can get pretty pricey! It's only a block from the beach but it's on the Waikiki Beachwalk so there are lots of shops and nearby restaurants too!! Roy's Hawaiian Fusion restaurant is located on the property and that is one of my favorites too!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We travelled as a couple to Honolulu and stayed at Embassy Suites for 9 nights. Embassy Suites is conveniently located near the heart of Waikiki, an easy walk to the beach and main shops as well as the majority of other hotels along Kalakaua Ave. Our room was on the 11th floor with a city view. We enjoyed the extra space and amenities the suite offered. It had a good sized bathroom, comfortable bed and was basically clean. Although our room was located next door to the lifts we were not unduly disturbed by the lift noises. Breakfast buffet was provided daily on the 4th level with a good variety of hot and cold to choose from. It was often a bit chaotic in the food area at breakfast time but once you got your food and table you could then relax. We would not hesitate to recommend or return to the Embassy Suites.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was our first trip to Hawaii. We had four nights on Oahu before heading to Maui and chose the Embassy Suites, because it offered the two bedroom layout that works for our family. It was quite reasonably priced for its location a short walk to the world famous beach and shopping of Waikiki. From the moment we arrived every staff member we had contact with made us feel like ohana(family).Our room was on the 20th floor and had a partial ocean view from the balcony. The room was spacious, clean and comfortable. There was a microwave and a minifridge which came in handy for leftovers. Aside from location one of the best aspects of this hotel were the free breakfast daily and the manager's happy hours in the evening. The breakfast was a great way to start the day and often allowed us to skip lunch or have a late lunch. We often found ourselves back at the hotel just in time for the poolside manager's special that consisted of free cocktails and snacks - a great way to unwind after a day of beaching it or exploring Oahu.If you are looking for a family friendly, reasonably priced, two bedroom option and don't need to be right on the beach in Waikiki then the Embassy Suites is a top choice.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We usually stay at the other end of Waikiki near Kuhio Beach, but that facility wasn't available for our 3-night stay before moving to a house on the North Shore. We chose the Embassy Suites because we wanted a two-bedroom suite and other options were limited. There are lots of positives for this hotel, including the generously sized suites, clean, well-maintained rooms and a good location surrounded by shops and restaurants. We were on the 18th floor of the Aloha Tower and had a lovely view of the Royal Hawaiian "pink palace" and Diamondhead. The suites are typical for this hotel chain in design and amenities. The "kitchen" area includes a sink, coffee maker, electric teapot, microwave and mini refrigerator. The typical Embassy Suites breakfast is included and it is well done, although less "Hawaiian" than other hotels where we've stayed. No macadamia nut muffins or banana pancakes, but a freshly made omelet with "choose your own" fresh ingredients is always nice. The staff is friendly and helpful and we have particularly been impressed with the fast and very friendly valet service (which is good because valet parking at $35/day is the only option available). The only two negatives are that the elevators and slow and seem inadequate for the size of the hotel and the air conditioning, while it does work, is not impressive in its cooling ability. Otherwise, the hotel is pleasant, clean, well designed and well located about half a block from the beach. We especially enjoyed the Yard House restaurant adjacent to the hotel on the ground floor with pineapple cider (who would have thought that would be good?) and a gorgeous grilled shrimp cobb salad.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had an amazing stay before moving on to Maui. Great breakfast and night fine reception with drinks and snacks. Very nice pool and friendly staff. Very close to everything. Rooms are very nice double balconies and separate living room area. Highly recommend especially with families.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Very welcoming and helpful staff. All questions answered and great activity recommendations. Breakfast was excellent and so is Happy Hour! Many varieties to choose from. I loved the ocean view from my room. Spacious and comfortable room. Definitely would stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Lovely spacious 1brm suite, we stayed on level 14 with partial ocean views overlooking the pool area. It was lovely, very clean, staff are attentive, complementary breakfast was a bonus but get in early as hard to find a table under shade after 9am (very busy)!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our family likes the Embassy Suites for the two-room layout and the breakfast. This location is in the middle of a new shopping/restaurant complex, so it's a busy spot. We were thoughtfully upgraded to an ocean-view room on the 21st floor. Breakfast was exactly what we expected/wanted. Everyone liked their omelettes and the fresh pineapple was wonderful! Plenty of towels, comfy bed, and nice gifts like a beach tote and a Hawaiian music CD. We used the valet service daily and those guys run a tight ship - well done! Definitely recommend this spot for families visiting Waikiki!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel has a great location right in Waikiki with restaurants, shops and the beach just steps from their door. The staff from front desk, to valet, to housekeeping were very friendly and always helpful, they have a true Aloha spirit. We were there for a week, they let us borrow a couple of bodyboards, a beach umbrella and beach mat. They provide a fabulous free breakfast each morning and free cocktails each evening. The "local experts" conveniently located in the lobby were very knowledgeable about the area and had several very good recommendations from surfing lessons to sunset dinner cruises. Our room was clean and comfortable. All in all a great place to stay. I would highly recommend this hotel and my family and I will return.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Spent a week in mid July at the embassy suites to get away from the freezing winter in Australia .We had a partial ocean view and as a family of five felt comfortable with the room layout . The room had 2 queens in the bedroom and the lounge room with a pullout sofa bed. Loads of cupboard space and just a importantly a place for all our suitcases . The bathroom was a touch small and after we asked housekeeping for 5 of everything ( we are the fun 5) even less room. There were 2 big TVs with plenty to watch and balconies in both rooms( very good for drying swim wear).In terms of facilities very well suited for our family ( and others too as the place was full). Good laundry facilities . It was great to see enough washers /dryers and even better they all worked!Each day breakfast on the pool deck was a great way to start the day and there was plenty for all .the Buffett style has lots of choice and even though the hotel was full worked smoothly ( even the wait for the omelettes was ok). What's even better is the managers drinks 530-730 each night. Lots of drinks ( soft, beer,wine , cocktails and nibbles) was a great way to end the day and move on to the various restaurants around the area.The pool is good , a little shallow and the spa very hot! At times a little full but the bonus was less than a 5 minute walk you were on Waikiki beach. The hotel is very centrally located and the trade off for space for 5 vs beachfront smaller room worked well for us.Special call out to the front office who I went to see at 11pm on what we thought was out last night who after working some back room magic accommodated in a full hotel and even better same room after our flight was cancelled back to Oz. really good service in the situation.Would highly recommend for families and anyone looking for space...

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great hotel - good location and the facilities are great. The poolside reception each night and breakfast were great. There's a great family vibe at the hotel, even though we didn't expect it. Hotel staff are helpful and the cleaning staff were friendly and excellent. Would definitely recommend to families - we had a room next to the lifts and never heard a lift or a lift bell with 2.5 year old and 4 month old.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: First off let me state property has a beautiful physical plant, and the "free breakfast and drinks at night" (even though you're really paying for them as the room rates are astronomical) especially comparing other Hilton properties right on the beach--which this is not. ANYWAY, my gripe as a top-tiered HHonors (Diamond) member was not being recognized as such and being "relegated " to a 10th floor standard room (of a 20 floor plus hotel). I politely inquired about an upgrade and was given a terse "we're completely sold out". I'm sure that I was not the last person to check in that day and what good is Diamond status if I cant bump someone whom hasn't even checked in yet nor has my status? In retrospect would have been better off staying ON the beach at Hilton Hawaiian Village with guaranteed Executive lounge access if not an upgrade. My fellow seasoned HHonors members should appreciate this.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel is perfectly placed along Waikiki Beach. It is a perfect location placed near a bus stop and in t5he center of Outriggers mall. In addition the made to order breakfasts, hotel reception and ability to check in early or out late with use of a hospitality room was outstanding.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was our first overseas holiday as a family, travelling with a 4 year old and 21 month old. From the moment we arrived ALL of the staff were so accommodating, pleasant and helpful. As our booked room was not yet available when we checked in (early flight), we were upgraded to the top floor and had fantastic views of the ocean and downtown Waikiki. The rooms were very clean and tidy and spacious enough for us to spread out and feel comfortable (7 night stay). The breakfast and Manager's Reception were great ways to start and finish the day. The cocktails were certainly not watered down!! There were a few birds around, but the staff were well aware of them and kept them away. The staff were so friendly and helpful with our children too without being "over the top" or too intrusive. The shallow pool was great for our little ones and a great idea having a shared wall with the deeper pool, so that we could stand in the deeper pool whilst supervising. It was great having a consultant on site for other day trip bookings etc. We found the location to be just perfect - far enough back from the traffic, noise etc of the main streets of Waikiki (we were there for Halloween) but close enough to walk to the major sites, restaurants etc. We plan to travel to Hawaii again and will not hesitate to stay here again and have already recommended it to close friends.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: It was the first time we stayed at this hotel. We enjoyed it, they had free breakfast, and the hotel was in a great spot, close to shopping and the beach. It was also across the street from "Denny's, which was good for us, we could stop by and get lunch, or dinner, if we wanted to. We had a great room that had a separate sitting room, with a mini kitchen. This was very nice.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great service, good shopping and excellent restaurants nearby. Walking distance to the beach. We didn't have to venture far to have fun. Our family really enjoyed our stay and we hope to do another stay-cation here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Embassy suites Hotel was a very nice, clean place to stay with our family. It was nice because we stayed in a 2 bedroom suite which was big enough for us; 6 adults and 1 child family. The staff were friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here for two nights before cruise. It is in a great location near the all the Beach Walk shops and restaurants. The breakfast area was really nice. Good choice of breakfast foods. They also have a complimentary reception in this area with snacks, drinks and a live band.Rooms were clean and well maintained.If you are looking at staying in this area, this hotel is a great choice.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: ....THE BAD RATING IS FOR HOTWIRE NOT EMBASSY SUITES....Ok, so the vacation hasn't even started and hotwire has mislead and outright lied to me about my accommodations. I booked one of those flash deals I knew what hotel I was getting just because I know the area so little risk there and I am happy about the hotel. So when I received the conf. it had no room details at all, I have 4 people traveling, I told hot wire about this as well. So worried I called them the rep was less than helpful, she said that she could not tell me what type of room I was going to get but the hotel would ensure that 4 people could stay in the room type. I said that I need to ensure that I get double beds to accommodate my group. I was told that would not be a problem since I had 4 people the hotel would do that. So I had to wait a couple of days to get confirmation of room type. Well when I called the hotel I found out from their reservations that 1, hotwire requested 2 queens but confirmed 1 king!! I also found out that when the reservation is being made by hotwire they know the minute the reservation is made, so the rep lied when she was on the phone with me just ensuring that the 24 hrs I have to cancel the reservation would expire. So I called hot wire 2 days before my trip and as of writing this have spent 4 hrs being passed around and hung up on by mistake. any savings was not worth this DONT EVER BELIEVE THEM when it comes to details get it in writing 1st before you do anything. I spent over 5 hrs on the phone and got nowhere!!!! I called embassy direct and as true to a quality hotel the manager made it right for me in less than 10 min..........

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I'm a bit sorry to say that by giving this hotel an excellent review that all the more people will be visiting and when I want to go again I won't be able to get a room. However the management, staff and hotel do work hard to give everyone such a beautiful place that you could not give them a bad review. I certainly will be going back there. Its situated in a good section of the beach Walk, beautiful clean rooms, friendly staff, free breakfasts, great pool, childrens wading pool and a fantastic hot spa. only one fault was that the synthetic grass was so hot to walk on, it nearly burned your feet, so my suggestion is that you leave a pair of thongs near the pool edge if you can't run fast enough to get you to your lounge and towel All that said this place is excellent for position, service, staff and rooms.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We recently spent 8 nights in Honolulu staying at Embassy Suites. The hotel was in a great location close to the beach and the shops. Our room was on the 19th floor with a lovely view to the ocean. Breakfast is provided in the form of a buffet and omelettes are made to order. At night the complimentary cocktails and nibbles by the poolside were a great way to kick off the evening. The staff were friendly and very obliging. On our last day we had an evening flight, the hotel gave us a late check out and we were welcome to use the pool facilities during the day. They stored our luggage and offered us a room to freshen up in (no charge) when we collected it later in the day. Our taxi to the airport was the hotel limo, so we left in style! It was a wonderful display of great customer service.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had a great stay at this property but were only here two nights. Evening reception was unique as they had two gentleman playing Hawaiian themed music and a woman hula dancing. It was a nice atmosphere. Breakfast was also unique with many options for Asian guests such as salad, miso soup and rice. Not seen this before, obviously they are smart to cater to their clientele. We went early each morning as it gets VERY busy! If you eat outside, birds are all over your plate if you leave your table for even a second. Location was close to shopping and just a block off the beach. No self parking here, but no resort fee like others charge. If you can get south tower it is closer to the beach. You couldn't call down to have Valet get your car. You had to physically be there and it took about 5 minutes. Minor annoyance but an annoyance. Elevators were extremely slow and they were small. Probably took five minutes each time we had to use. For this reason I would try for a low floor and use the stairs as much as possible.They give welcome gifts (beach bag, snack) but you have to redeem at the Hilton Vacations desk where they try to talk you into their timeshares. Luckily we weren't there long enough that they were interested in pressuring us to the pitch.Lots of shopping and restaurants within a block or two, lots of foot traffic and energy around. I would stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Check in was a little slow but nothing to complain about. Our room was excellent on level 12 with full oceanfront view (partially obstructed by surrounding high rises). The suite itself was huge.The pool was busy but plenty of room for the kids to swim. We only stayed two nights as a stopover during our move from Canada to Australia and so wanted to relax before the long flight. The manager's special free drinks and snacks in the evening by the pool was an excellent touch, and the breakfast was extensive.We went to the beach for a few hours in the morning which was only a 5-10 min walk away. Overall its a great spot to stay, however, Honolulu is a busy city and we were happy to have spent 5 days in Kauai prior.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is the best experience I've had at any Embassy Suites hotel. The rooms are a little on the small side, as others have mentioned, but this is Waikiki-so that should be expected. Our 9th floor room was very comfortable.The staff is excellent from the valets, bellman, front desk, housekeeping-all were very welcoming and accommodating. The bartenders at the evening manager's reception (free drinks for guests) handled large crowds with limited wait time and never stopped smiling! The first night we were there had live music at this reception. We had one lunch and a late night dinner at the Yard House, directly behind the hotel in the Beach Walk area. Very convenient. There were several other good restaurants within a few steps off the hotel elevator.This hotel is not directly on the beach, but the way it is situated, nearly all the rooms have ocean view. It is a short and easy walk (right across the street) to Waikiki Beach. The Trump Intl.Hotel is right next door.This stay was only two nights, as we had rented a North Shore condo for the majority of our stay on Oahu. If I would have known how nice this Embassy Suites would turn out, I'd have considered staying an extra night!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Okay, this is really nice. I loved the location! I prefer the location closer to Fort Derussy Park. This is a less congested side of Waikiki it is well worth the money, we slept 6 comfortably. The Sofa bed mattress is actually quite nice. I had a teenager sleep on it but would have been willing to do so myself. Directly across from the hotel is a little ice cream shop - you MUST try the Avocado Ice cream. Everyday they offer a full breakfast and it is a hearty breakfast, one that would please every appetite. I would absolutely stay here again. Especially if you have children.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My wife and I stayed here twice in the last two months.The first time was for two nights only to “scout out” the environment prior to a longer stay with a larger group recently.On the first visit (May 2015) and after a lengthy overnight flight we were allocated a room (1903 – Aloha Tower) without much delay and were able to unpack and rest up before midday. We had requested a one-bedroom suite and were surprised to find we were given a two-bedroom unit – en suite off both rooms, small kitchenette and small, but comfortable lounge/dining area. TV in both bedrooms and 1 in the lounge. More than we required. Iron, ironing board and hairdryer are in the suite.The roomy bathroom/ensuite comes with a shower-over bath, toilet and vanity unit. More than sufficient towels, hand towels pool towels and flannels provided. On a hygiene and aesthetic note however, NO toilet brush!!!.Kitchenette equipped with an electric jug, coffee maker, microwave and small under-the counter fridge. No mini-bar. Drinking glasses and disposable cups are provided. I subsequently noticed that in other reviews the General Manager, Bob Y informed clients that cutlery and crockery are available on request. Perhaps if you are eating in your suite while you are staying you might consider throwing a tea towel and dishcloth in your luggage or finding out what the staff can provide in this respect.The suite is on the inland east corner of the Tower with a view of the business/retail sector and Diamond Head. Nice to relax on the balcony and enjoy the view. Made use of the small but adequate gym on the 3rd floor. The laundry is also on the 3rd floor, providing coin-operated washers and dryers. A coin machine is installed which accepts notes so you can use the machines and purchase detergents etc.An electronic safe is in the lounge. Separate air con switches in the lounge and bedroom/s.Many people have reviewed the breakfast (included in the room rate) and Managers Reception (5.30pm – 7.30pm) (free drinks and nibbles – though the busy (and humorous) barmen appreciate (and deserve) a small tip) We considered the breakfast (starts at 6.30 till 10???) catered to all – children and adults, light eater, health conscious and “gonna eat all I can” diners.There is a poolside bar which appears to operate from about mid morning to late afternoon and also offers a limited snack/meal menu. You can have a laugh with the barmen, especially Lewis.Location has been covered by numerous reviewers as well. To precis, if you just want a coffee, pizza, Chinese, burger or a-la-carte fine dining, they’re all within a couple of minutes walk from the Lobby. A Dennys and ABC shop are in this street. The main street, Kalakaua, is within easy walking distance. The beach is about 200 yards away, and about 300 yards to the Army Museum. The Bus is about opposite the Museum, a cheap alternative to hiring a rental If you have a high enough room on the west side of your building you may catch the fireworks display at about 7.45pm on Friday nights, otherwise it’s a short walk to the beach to see it. In conclusion, an enjoyable stay, great service, friendly staff, and comfortable accommodation.HOWEVER, tune in to my next review which I shall post shortly (as this one is getting rather long) which deals with the shortcomings of our second visit.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: we loved the location and had the Best ocean view, corner suite.. the only issue was w/ noise sometimes but being that we weren't on the water, that is to be expected in Waikiki.. overall the hotel, staff and amenities were excellent!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: So you see a water bug in your room and as a manager all you can waive is parking for the night? It took over 20 min for housekeeping to come to the room after I spoke to the manager on duty. She said it wasn't common but the housekeeper didn't agree.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We are a family of four with two teenagers. It was challenging to find two queen beds in Waikiki (who sleeps well on a sofa bed? ) but the Embassy Suites had the perfect room. it was close enough to the action to walk to everything on Kalakua Avenue but not so close that it was noisy. And nice that the beach was just across the road. Head to the beach, turn right and wand along the boardwalk to view the Friday night fireworks by the Hilton. Great choice for our family

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel was exceptional because of the closeness to all bunch of very nice stores and restaurants. The hotel pool was very nice and we really enjoyed the Saturday night concert with free food and drink poolside. Our room was very nice, very clean and roomy, the view was excellent.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Lots of people seem to like this hotel and I'm sure we would have if we had a different room. We arrived late at night and got a room on the same level as the pool and adjacent to the breakfast buffet area. It was a dark room with no view and a bit of a squeeze for a family of 4. It was a one bedroom suite with 2 queen beds. I'd recommend a two bedroom suite if you are a family of 4 or more. The breakfast is crazy busy - expect to wait in line for everything. There's something for everyone but it's pretty basic food. We tried to change rooms but unfortunately the hotel was full. This is a very popular hotel but it didn't suit us.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is unlike any other Embassy Suites because it has a very distinct Hawaii sense of place in ts decor, furnishings,artwork, uniforms and especially it's Aloha spirit. It is the primary flagship hotel of the exciting Waikiki Beachwalk with numerous restaurants, unique stores and easy access to Waikiki Beach. I had a wonderful view of the ocean and watched the early morning surfers from the private balcony of my one bedroom suite with coffee bar and mini refrigerator. Very quiet with the doors closed. Separate A/C in living room and bedroom was convenient. . I was in the Hula Tower with lamps that had hula dancers and artwork. Really liked all the traditional native Hawaiian patterns used in the design of carpets, shower curtains and furniture cushions. Very,very clean and excellent quality. If you've seen other Waikiki hotels, they are not as well maintained. The free daily buffet breakfast with made-to-order omelettes, fresh fruit, meats,potatoes, rice,, pastries, oatmeal, cereals, yogurt, juices, milk,coffee, tea, was abundant and constantly kept filled. Their free cocktails/snacks in the afternoon is very generous - very delicious sangria, beer, wine, mixed drinks. Parking is pricey in Waikiki so I wouldn't 't rent a car - absolutely everything in Waikiki is within walking distance and the public bus system is really easy to get around. If you want to tour outside of Waikiki, rent a car for the day.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: ...which may or may not be a bad thing!There are a couple of reasons why staying at this hotel is a good thing. Firstly, its in a good location close to (but not on) the beach. Secondly, its right in the heart of the night time action with a very nice set of shops and restaurants immediately close to the hotel. Thirdly, breakfast is include in the room rate as is a nightly "manager's reception" which includes free drinks for a two hour period, this makes the room rate seem quite good value.The less good things:The rooms are quite small and while this shouldn't be a problem (as you will be outside most of the time) it is a factor. Secondly, this is a hotel where you will feel at home if you are one of those people who like to expose their tattoos and believe that the salsa with your evening nacho's is healthy eating. I.e. it feels a bit low rent.Parking is $35 a day which feels expensive and their are few alternatives locally but on the other hand there are no resort fees. WiFi is ok but tempremental and you have to reregister every day.Make sure you ask for a room on the highest floor possible as otherwise the rooms (expecially those overlooking the pool) can be noisy. We asked to be moved from by the pool to a higher floor which they did but then put us next to the elevator. Very annoying.So overall this feels like a good value family hotel but if you're looking for something more upmarket then stay elsewhere.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We (two adults, two teenagers) spent five nights at Embassy Suites, Waikiki and had a great time. The room was spacious and well appointed and the staff were friendly and helpful. The complimentary continental breakfast had plenty of variety with the sides changing daily. The hotel is in a great location on Beach Walk and had easy access to the beach. Our room was on the 16th floor and was quiet with almost no street noise from Kalakaua Ave.We were given a complimentary Hawaiian music CD on departure which was a nice touch.Over all a great hotel for a family holiday in Waikiki.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed for a week with family in a two room suite. Breakfast included in the room rate (buffet: bacon, eggs, potatoes, rice, waffles/French toast/ hot cakes - it changes daily, fruit, bagels, English muffins, cereal, yogurt, and an omelette cooked to your specifications). Also included is drinks and snacks by the pool from 5.30. Great to be able to have a drink by the pool and watch the children. There is an Expedia local expert in the lobby who can assist with bookings for any trip you wish. Very handy to shops and restaurants. Our room included a fridge, microwave, coffee machine and electric kettle. I think it is rather strange that no cutlery or crockery is included in the room. Had to drink wine out of a water glass, and was unable to open a bottle of wine with a cork. Pool towels supplied.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I want to start my review with ABSOLUTELY FABULOUS!! I arrange and book all of my families holidays and I put many hours into research looking for what will best suit our family of four. We have travelled the world and I believe that staying in the right Hotel can make all the difference. I looked at many images of the Embassy and my concern was that it looked like it needed updating. We booked an Ocean View room hoping that we would get a "real" ocean view. I made contact with reservations and Kay Lee was very helpful and always quick to respond. Our room was a corner room in the Hula Tower (level 20, room 2029) which provided lovely views. You need to be located high in the tower to look over Hotels located on the beach front. We had a room with two queen beds and a lounge room which includes a sofa bed. There is a TV in both rooms. There is a small area with a sink, tea & coffee making facilities and a small microwave. The microwave comes in very handy heating up takeout and leftovers from the night before. The furniture is a little outdated but very comfortable and very clean. From the moment we arrived, the staff were extremely friendly. As we came out of the lift making our way to our room we were greeted by Yuet Liang Chen, Housekeeping, who was so incredibly helpful and friendly and continued throughout our entire two week stay. Yuet is the nicest Housekeeping staff we have ever come across! Yes there is a Managers Reception from 5:30pm - 7:30pm each night where the drinks on the well listed menu are free. It was so nice to end each day with a refreshing drink made by the very funny bar man Keola. Every second night entertainment is provided with a band. For all those Australians who know Bill Granger (TV Chef), he has a restaurant called Bills Sydney a couple of minutes walk from the Embassy on Beach Walk. We picked up a latte each morning and we ate many many times at his restaurant for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Very Very Nice! I want to end this review saying that our family loved the Embassy's hospitality and we can't wait to return. Thank you :-)

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Hotel is clean and staff are friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. Location is great for beach and transportation to other parts of the island. Will stay here again when I return to Hawaii. The breakfast is very good, with a good selection.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The hotel was very welcoming, we were lucky to get early check in after long overnight flight from Australia. We also had a lovely suite (2 bedrooms/2 bathrooms and lounge. We had requested a room on a high level and got it. Great for 3 friends sharing. The staff were very happy and helpful. Bed linen/towels very high standard. Would definitely recommend Embassy Suites.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I had been asked to be in a destination wedding in oahu, and all of the out of town guest were recommended to stay at his hotel. It was awesome! Buffet breakfast is included everyday, which included an omelet station and plenty of the traditional breakfast items as well. Lots of outdoor seating and serve yourself juice, coffee and water station. There is also Happy hour every day in the pool area! live music, snacks and really strong drinks (the best kind of drink) are a major plus to this hotel. Exercise classes including yoga in the morning was fun and relaxing. Outside of the hotel is an outdoor shopping area with nice clothing, surf, and jewelry shops. A lot of restaurants within walking distance as well! Waikiki Beach walk is right outside the door basically so it was fun to walk to the beach and hang out. Theres plenty of things to do, you will never get bored! The hotel room was big and clean! It was great to have coffee in the morning and sit on the balcony while staring at the ocean. I recommend requesting a ocean view room on a higher floor. The room came with beach towels to use at the pool or to take to the beach. Staff is very nice.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: If you enjoy emergency alarms going off at 2:20 am then this is the place for you. No one notified us that it was a false alarm and that we could return to our room. The room rate remained the same even after the holiday rush period. Why????

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: If you are looking for a good place to stay in Honolulu, this is an excellent choice. My family and I are many times spoiled by the amenities that we receive through the luxury brand hotels that we stay. The Embassy Suites delivered a very comfortable and excellent quality experience that we could generally expect to receive through a more luxury brand.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Not much to add to my others. This is such a great place to stay with great employees. Still waiting on the internet to get better though. That is still the one downside to staying here. The housekeeping staff that I have interacted with are great. They are always smiling and do a good job keeping the rooms clean. The front desk staff is great. Good luck to my friend going to the Air Force. Special thanks to Mary Ann in reservations. After 5yrs of staying here for business trips it's still my go to place when possible.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was our very first time to Hawaii. We have stayed in Embassy Suites in the past and were very impressed with this one. It is beautiful! We had an ocean view room and the sunsets were gorgeous! We had a view of the pool but were high enough we could not hear it from our room. We used the pool, we really enjoyed the evening reception and met many people. The location was great, we took about a 1 1/2 block walk to get to the Waikiki beach. There is shopping right out the door of Embassy Suites. We really enjoyed our stay!.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel provides first class service to all of their customers. The rooms are well furnished and the pool is a good size and family friendly while breakfast and the evening receptions make this an absolute value. Excellent experience at this hotel!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is a really clean place!! From the time you walk in, walking to your room, and when you go in the room! Excellent space, a room where the bed and TV, and a room with fold out couch and TV. you have a frig, a bar sink, coffee maker, and two tv's, and two sliding glass doors which really gives you a wonderful ocean air! You are about a block from Waikiki beach!! The hotel location is close to many shopping store we enjoy shopping at! The breakfast in the morning is excellent! You name it they have it as well as many beverages! And the evening reception with adult drinks are wonderfu! Sitting out with other guest from the hotel with simple snacks, and the sometimes have a small group performing music. This hotel doesn't charge a resort fee either! I love this place!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was our second stay here. Once again good location, and great to have a 2 bedroom suite with two bathrooms. Breakfast is OK - great that it is included in the price, but it is nothing to get too exited about. Likewise the cocktails each night. Good that they are free (and very strong!) but it felt a little tacky after a couple of nights. Would be great to have some wine glasses and plates/cutlery in the room. Also Wi-Fi was painfully slow

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is our third stay at Embassy Suites and we keep coming back to the same hotel because it's a great space for a family. We get a two bedroom suite which has a king bed in one room and two double beds in the other room with a living room in the middle and two bathrooms. There's plenty of space for everyone. The staff are very friendly and helpful, the rooms are not fancy but are clean, comfortable and everything works. Breakfast is included as are drinks by the pool during happy hour. The location is great for restaurants and shops and it takes about 2 minutes to get to the beach from any direction and some rooms have water views.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at this suite hotel for 4 nights in July and I found it a bit disappointing for the price we paid. Our room was at the top on the 21st floor which turned out to be a nightmare when taking one of 2 very slow lifts there. We rarely had a trip all the way to the bottom without stopping (sometimes at 8 different levels) for people to get in and out. The rooms were okay but don't think you are getting a kitchen. There are no utensils or plates. The breakfast area was busy where you were always queuing for omelets or fresh fruit. The pool was small and always full of people especially kids. The cocktails were good in the evening although served in small plastic cups. The position of the hotel was good, close to shops, beach and restaurants. Overall I think there are better places to stay around Waikiki which are better value for money.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Had a great time. The room was a ocean and city view,on the 18th floor(1829).Was very clean,2 queen beds and fold out in den area,with kitchen table,sink,only thing missing was a stove,but nice free breakfast and m-w-f-s-sunday drinks by the pool,from 5:30 to 7:30 pm.Had 3 piece band. Would recommend.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Hawaii has been on my things to do list. As a 10 year anniversary celebration hubby gifted me an awesome visit and stay to the Embassy Suites by Hilton Waikiki Beach Walk. STAFFThe team was accomodating and kind throughout our stay. We enjoyed giving them daily greetings of ALOHA. Nice way to enjoy our stay as it felt like home away from home.ACCOMODATIONSOur KING bed and Suite was GREAT. The bed was so nice and we enjoyed our balcony. The awesome Friday night fireworks show was easy to see. The nearby hotel does this on the regular. Don't fret if you don't want to leave your room. Enjoy from the balcony.OVERALL Family friendly, couple friendly, wheelchair accessible and just a great way to enjoy this beautiful island.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: An all suite hotel, perfect for families with separate living room and bedroom. Living room includes table with 4 chairs plus kitchenette with coffee machine, kettle, tea & coffee supplies, sink, bar fridge and microwave. Clean coin-operated laundry which is easy to use. Good gym with plenty of equipment. Warm and friendly service from any staff member we met, even when the hotel was packed for the 4th of July weekend. Staff are keen to meet any request. Aldrin at breakfast stood out for us. We had room 129 in the Hula tower for 9 nights - great corner room with 2 queen beds in bedroom. Room is on 1st floor and above a restaurant but we didn't have any problems with street noise at night, even on the 4th of July weekend. Room was clean & well-maintained and housekeeping did a great job of looking after our room.Smaller folks in our group couldn't get enough of the pool on 4th floor. Older folks appreciated the comfy lounges on the pool deck as well as free wifi, breakfast and managers reception each day. Who doesn't love watching a sunset, mai tai in hand while enjoying the fun covers band! Smaller folks would want you to know the free corn chips & snacks at the reception were a holiday highlight.Hotel has room & pool-deck food service. There is also a good range of grocery items & simple pre-prepared meals plus wine & beer available in store in Hula Tower foyer and nearby ABC stores. Remember to ask for plastic cutlery when you buy food at stores (ask when you are paying) - hotel rooms don't have any.Hotel is in a great location - beach across the road, plenty of shopping if that is your thing, close to good restaurants in Waikiki beach walk and Royal Hawaiian centres. We enjoyed Yard House in Waikiki beach walk, happily welcomes families plus great craft beer menu with good food and service. Also good choices for families in nearby Royal Hawaiian food court. And Royal Hawaiian centre offers great free Hawaiian cultural classes and shows Mon to Sat each week.We loved our holiday at Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach! Smaller folks in our group had some tears as we left and are already asking when we are going back. Thank you!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We chose this property because it was the best value we could find in Waikiki with a good star rating. For a family of 4 the suite was perfect for us. The kids could watch TV in one room while we watched in the other. It gave us enough space so that we weren't always tripping over each other. The buffet breakfast (included) is fantastic, with a good selection of food to satisfy most diets. We enjoyed the made to order omelettes as you could control the ingredients. The manager's reception in the evening is fantastic! Not only do the adults get to have a few alcoholic drinks to get the party going, there is also entertainment on some nights and the band is awesome. The hotel is located a 5 minute stroll to the beach and in the other direction, Beach Walk. Staff was great. We arrived very early (6am) and although they said the room wouldn't be ready until after lunch, they called to let us know it was available by 11am. Pool was very nice - always clean and cool. If you are looking for good food at a reasonable price, there are some food trucks nearby offering a good selection at good prices. Just ask reception how to find them. I would stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: What a perfect hotel for a family. A full breakfast with made to order omelettes, eggs, bacon, sausage,a third or fourth meat option, different potatoes daily, bagels, donuts, toast waffles/french toast/pancakes, danishes/cinnamon rolls, miso soup, salad, coffee, juices, cereal, oatmeal, fruit, soda. Breakfast is from 6:30-10:00. Manager's reception is from 5:30-7:00 with free sodas, mixed drinks, beer, wine, and snacks. The suites are large with a wet bar (sink, small refrigerator, and microwave) and two balconies. We had plenty of room with two adults and two teenagers. The location was in the heart of the city and was always booming. The fitness center was large with plenty of equipment. The laundry room was never busy and always clean.The beach is about a five minute walk and tons or restaurants and shopping within walking distance. No one wanted to leave and we definitely would return again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed in this hotel for a few days as it was part of our package with the airline. Let me say that if I had known just how good it was I would have had our whole holiday here - its out of the way and with some very nifty quick entrances to get into off a couple of streets. Staff were exceptional and nothing was too much trouble. Our package included 'free cooked to order breakfasts ' these were fresh and omletts, eggs any style etc all cooked for you, the remainder was a buffet which was always being restocked and was fresh, with endless varieties of food. Fresh fruit either cut or whole. The package also had a 'Happy hour 'down by the pool which was great as well, even though we only managed to get to one.The pool was great, but you had to pick your time or share with a large amount of children, the hydro pool was especially popular, with another area for children which was only 30cm deep. the only problem I found was that the artificial turf around the pool burnt your feet when it was hot, but I guess that made for some remarkable people watching and their reactions to the turf....the rooms are nicely decorated, very comfortable, lounge and two TV's, microwave and small fridge. We have a beautiful view of the beach as well from our balcony - we will certainly be going back there again as the area it is situated in is close to all the restaurants and beach. In saying that I hope that not too many of you all go there, as I may not be able to get a room then when I am ready to go back there

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed with for a week with family (2 teenagers) its not a new hotel but still very adequate. Service levels are high across the hotel. A lot of young families here too so the pool was quite loud and its not a deep pool. OK breakfast menu and 2 chefs cooking eggs/omelets each day for us. Managers reception each night 5.30-7.30 free drinks was a pleasant surprise. Concierge (Google lady) is very helpful & Expedia onsite do a great job organising your activities. Great location for restaurants & shopping although the closest beach doesn't have much sand but a 5 min walk fixes that problem. We enjoyed our stay, weather was perfect for the whole week.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We have returned to this hotel time and time again. There are many things we LOVE about this hotel. The separate bedroom, hot breakfasts that are the best, nightly reception with drinks with snacks and music are just some of the things we enjoy about this hotel. The rooms are very clean and a good size. I highly recommend the Embassy Suites. Oh and the location is great too. There are many restaurants to choose from like Cheese Burger in Paradise, PF Changs, Yard House, Ruth's Chris to Roys. The shopping is great too.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had a room on the top floor overlooking the ocean and Waikiki Beach after booking through Costco Travel. The room was very spacious for the 3 of us. Very comfy sofa bed. Great balcony around the room. Great location very close to beach, restaurants, bus lines, etc. Nice breeze on the lanai at the pool and evening reception. Hawaiian music at the reception three times a week was a nice addition. Breakfast was more than adequate with omelet station and large buffet.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We were in town for one night and enjoyed our hotel experience. The amenities were well worth the price we paid. The valet staff was great, the check-in process was easy, and they even mailed some postcards for us. The room was plenty big for a family of four, including two teenagers. The bathroom was large and able to accommodate our family with elbow room to spare. Would definitely stay here again and would highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is our second stay at Embassy suites.. 2014 we took our Children and grandchildren to Hawaii from New Zealand. Having a separate lounge was a great relief when putting the young ones to bed. It was central and within walking distance to all the cafes and close to beach. The fact that breakfast is included was a factor too as the children were able to choose from the buffet what they preferred and we didn't have extra costs for breakfasts.. The rooms were large and spacious.This year my husband and I went on our own to have an adult holiday. First night my husband didn't sleep as we had a room next to lift - (didn't worry me because I'm hard of hearing!) However next morning w talked to reception and within a short time we were moved without any problems at all into another suite. The staff are helpful and answer all queries with good humour and efficiency. We have recommended Embassy to other friends and everyone who has stayed there enjoyed the happy hour and the fact they didn't have to fork out extra each morning for breakfast were definite plus attributes.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our family of four stayed here for 3 nights on our way to Alaska. The room was great - very comfy sofa bed for mum and dad whilst the kids had a queen bed each in the bedroom. Breakfast was delicious and the location was very central to all the things we wanted to do in our short stay. I had booked a three night stay even though we were leaving on the third night with a late flight to Anchorage (I did not want to have to get packed up early that day then check out and have no where to rest until the flight left). So imagine my surprise when checking out to be told that instead of paying for a whole extra night she would only charge us a 'late checkout fee'. This reduced our bill by about $180! Outstanding service and we will be staying there again when we next travel to Hawaii.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We were greeted in the open air reception area with a refreshing drink and were upgraded upon request to a water view room which was large and well appointed. The room was really nice even better than the pictures. The bathroom was also large and lovely. There was a complimentary reception as well as a very good breakfast. Bed was very comfortable and the room was very quiet had a great nights sleepHighly recommend dinner at "Room Without a Key" stunning water views and hula dancers.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The hotel, though not situated on the beach front, is just a block away, which posed no problem to us as we made our way to and fro from the beach. in fact, there is a lot to experience in Waikiki, apart from the beach, and this location was pretty much okay.The rooms, rather suites, are generously sized, with two balconies, sitting area and two queen sized beds in the bedroom. Quite comfortable. The check in process was smooth and efficient. We missed the famous Hawaii garlands, though. There is a happy hour thrice a week where a live band plays and drinks are on the house! We sampled all the Hawaiian cocktails and ended up with quite a buzz!The breakfast was adequate and on the last day, realising that as vegetarians we didn't have much choice of a hot meal, the chef presented us with superbly made sautéed vegetables. Much appreciated.There is one of the many ABC stores right opposite the hotel and it came in handy to pick up essentials . There is also a good selection of shorts, swim wear, beach wear and stuff. The live band played with gusto and were cheered all the way. The cocktails did help. There is a guest laundry which helps in packing clothes to a minimum. The gym was cursory and dingy, but then who in his/her right mind comes to Hawaii to hit the gym?All in all, a nice, comfortable hotel, conveniently located with good, professional staff. And yes, hospitable.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed one night before the Pride of America Cruise then 5 nights afterwards. The staff could not have been more helpful and friendly. The 2 room suite was ideal for the family and the lovely buffet breakfast set us up for the day. The location was also ideal and it was so easy to get to all the attractions and wonderful restaurants that Waikiki has to offer

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here a couple of nights on points before heading to Ko Olina and was reminded why we love Embassy Suites. The location was fantastic, with pretty much anything we wanted within walking distance. Our 18th floor "partial" ocean view was amazing, especially given that this is not a beachfront hotel.The included breakfast was fantastic. They only complaint (or is that thankfully) is that they didn't have Portuguese sausage every morning. The valet service was fast, friendly and quick to offer assistance.I would highly recommend a stay here for anyone with older kids or who is just looking for a little extra room to spread out.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The hotel was beautiful with a very kind staff. The breakfast which is included in the room rate was the best I've ever had. The location was great, downtown Waikiki. There were a number of shops on the hotel premises.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The worst complaint I can offer this place is that at times their breakfast buffet had runny oatmeal. That's it.The staff was cheerful and really helpful. If something broke, they were on it quickly. One of the washing machines broke and they had it repaired within a half hour. Two of the treadmills in the gym wouldn't turn on, and they set maintenance to the problem instantly.The valet staff was superb, ready to answer any questions concerning transportation. A young lady named Tawny Spragling was very sweet and helpful. Today was her last day, as she was applying to the airlines for a job. They lost a gem with her.The breakfast buffet was great...runny oatmeal or not. Made to order omellettes, salads, miso, fresh fruit, kim chee, eggs, potatoes, pastries, bacon and sausage. They had one new breakfast meat for every day we stayed here. That was eight meals.The cocktail hours were good, too.This is our second time in this hotel in five years. We'll be back.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was a great place to call home for our time in Waikiki! The staff is friendly and the amenities are great! Great breakfast andWalking to the beach or to shopping. Not a thing I would change! Aldrin in the breakfast room was our favorite!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: WOW!! What can I say this place was amazing and great for money, you pull up in this beautiful foyer the people are so friendly, you get a drink on arrival... They had personality when you checked in and joked with you.. The way you want to start a great holiday after 9 hour flight! The rooms where wonderful great balcony the beds where very comfy.And our maid house keeper I just wanted to bring her home she made the kids feel very special,, The breakfast on the pool deck area was very american and filling The happy hour drinks/cocktails where AMAZING... The food you can also order on the pool area where just YUMMYY!!! There is nothing I can fault about this hotel other than I never got to have my massage as I always got caught up with shopping.. And they closed before I got back I would highly recommend this hotel to any family wanting to go to Hawaii...

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This Hotel was recommended by our travel agent, as we wanted a suite for 2x children (15 and 10) and 2x adults. We booked a one bedroom suite with two x queen beds and a pull out couch. We also requested a high floor with an ocean view. I do not regret paying extra for the view as it was impressive. The lounge and bedroom was very spacious, in fact we ended up moving the extra queen bed in the lounge so the kids were together and there was still plenty of room. We were on the top floor which was amazing, it felt like we had the best view and it was nice and quiet. The breakfast was great, lots to choose from and it slightly varied from day to day. The happy hour/s were wonderful. Free drinks and nibbles (chips and vege sticks!) and some days there was a live band. Location was perfect. So central for shopping, the beach, restaurant's, buses etc.We will definitely be back. Everything exceeded our expectations.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here for a couple nights over a weekend because we wanted to be close to the beach. Our room was on the 14th floor with a water view and it was a very enjoyable stay. Both the bedroom and the living room had a balcony with views of the pool. There is a view of the beach, but there is another row of hotels between this property and the beach, so it is not actually "beach front" although there is easy access to the beach.Parking is valet only. $10 for 9 hours or $25ish if you charge it to your room for a night.As with all Embassy Suites, there is a nightly happy hour and cooked to order breakfast included. The happy hour was better than most with Mai Tais and tropical drinks included in the complimentary managers reception. There was also a decent snack buffet with nachos and fresh veggies. The breakfast was better than most as well with options such as salmon for the omelettes and a wide variety of proteins, fruits, and pastries. Nothing is inexpensive in this area, but some extra perks like free breakfast and happy hour make it a little easier to spend the money.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My husband and 2 young children recently stayed 8 nights at Embassy Suits Waikiki. We had a fantastic stay. Special mention to two staff members who went above & beyond to ensure our stay met our expectations- Victor at the front desk and Dean the bellman. Pros:Great location - especially for shopping & eating out.Buffet breakfasts were enjoyed each day. The omelettes were fantastic!Nice pool- great temperature. Was easy to get a beach chair and we were able to get a cabana on two of the days.Reception drinks each night & the band that played 4 nights a week created a fun & lively atmosphere.Fantastic that the bedroom is separated from the living room. This was the reason we chose this hotel and is a big plus when travelling with kids.Cons: Would have liked to see pancakes available each day at breakfast & a greater assortment of tropical fruits.Balconies are tiny. But we enjoyed a great view of the ocean & pool in the hula tower.Close to beach-but not the best part of Waikiki beach.Some considerations for families: Whilst the resort is child friendly, the staff generally are not as welcoming & accommodating of children as some other places I've stayed. We looked into hiring a babysitter, but it was a little pricey as we were informed by concierge they would need to use an agency which incurred a significant fee on top of the hourly rate. The beach closest to Embassy isn't the nicest part- we worked towards the Hilton Hawaiian resort and found the sand softer and less of a drop off which suited our young children better. It would be great if the hotel had a little play space for young children.Other: There is a great little organic cafe around the corner from the hotel called Marie's health food organic cafe. They do a delicious acai bowl and well priced too.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: From the moment we arrived at Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach Walk, we were certainly impressed. A glass of guava juice was offered to us while we waited to be checked into our room. The room was clean and well maintained, which included a coffee machine, two TV's and free WIFI. Nightly, the hotel offers a Managers Reception near the pool, which allows guests to enjoy a free light snack, beverages (including certain alcohol) and entertainment. Staff were helpful and courteous towards guests. I would definitely stay here again. Mahalo!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: As a family of 5 it is always a bit of a challenge to find accommodation without the added expense of adding an extra room. We couldn't recommend Embassy Suites any higher. The Embassy Suites have some of the cleanest rooms that we have ever stayed in and the service from all staff was fantastic. a two minute walk to the beach and the shopping mecca is at your doorstep. The complimentary breakfast, no resort fees, managers drinks and entertainment are all added extras that make your stay easy and enjoyable. The pool is also one of the largest in Waikiki which the kids loved. As a travel agent I am always recommending this property and would stay there again tomorrow.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My stay at the Embassy Suites by Hilton Waikiki Beach Walk was fantastic. The hotel and amenities were great and all of the staff were courteous and gave warm greetings. But one employee really stood out from the rest and that was Brandon, an associate you works at the front desk. He provided by far the best customer service I have experienced in a long time. He took the time to make sure my stay was to my highest satisfaction and did everything with in there means to make it so. So thank you Brandon for making trip to Honolulu a fantastic one.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel is very consistent over the past few years. The location is great and accommodations average. The key is a few highly motivated and engaged team members that really drive the experience and results of your stay, you just have to hope it is not their day off. Otherwise, a very pricey and average stay to say the least.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I searched all over Oahu for hotels that would allow a family with 3 children in a single hotel room. Trust me - this is the only one that will! Therefore, we stayed here on our most recent trip to Hawaii with our kids. The location is great. The rooms are ok - a bit dated. The patio furniture reminded me of something my grandmother used to have. Breakfast and 'happy hour' are packed with people - maybe good or bad depending on your perspective. We had fun, and will stay there again if we come back with all 3 kids. Otherwise, will likely check out some more modern hotels.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I used this hotel while in the process of moving. The hotel was beautiful and graciously took in my family and I. The breakfast was awesome and the pool made my daughter's stay one to remember. The parking is a little expensive, but in Waikiki it was nice to know I did not have to worry night after night about where I was going to park. The hotel was in walking distance of all the restaurants and shopping stores, which made the location of the hotel a premium. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Waikiki Beach.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My Family and I recently travelled to Waikiki for a family holiday in May 2015. The Embassy Suites was a lovely hotel close to everything, The rooms were spacious and clean and having the buffet breakfast included each day saved us a lot of money. The 2 hours nightly reception was also nice to kick back and relax at the pool with a drink and a few snacks, as well as the added bonus of not having to pay a resort fee! The beach was only a block away and the shopping was right there, we wouldn't hesitate to stay at the Embassy Suites again as the location is just so convenient.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Hilton HHonors has treated me and my company at this hotel excellently especially the on site Hilton HHonors Diamond rep Linda Linda Lacaran. She is wonderful, always ensuring our comfort and works hard for us each time. She is one of the reasons we return to this hotel. The staff is also excellent from the Wait staff in the dining room to the Bartenders Dennis and Assistant manager. The music is great also. I want my whole family to visit. You do a top notch job and have for many years.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Just stayed a week in Waikiki and stayed here at Embassy Suites. This hotel was great in all respects, very nice rooms, most with great views, and a great breakfast every morning to start off the day. All staff very helpful and friendly from top to bottom; especially Lei and Aldrin at the breakfast service. Very good Happy Hour every afternoon, and band in the evening.Great hotel for a base of exploring Oahu.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Loved the complimentary Made to Order Breakfast each morning. The omelets were awesome! Plenty of other good choices to accompany breakfast. The complimentary evening reception was a nice perk too. WIFI included. Private balcony and the 2 room suite made the perfect vaca for us with our teenage son. Plenty of space and saved money not having to buy breakfast or WIFI like many other resorts charge for. Was on 19th floor and could see great view of beach to the left and mountains to the right. Directly over the pool.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The room had a separate bedroom. It is less than a block to the beach. On Beach Walk and Lewers Street (the back) there are many restaurants, places to shop and it is near the main avenue, where most of the non-beach action is. The hotel is clean and near the beginning of Waikiki. Recommended. Many families stayed there. Breakfast was free and plentiful, even accommodating Japanese tourists. I'd stay again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was our 2nd overseas holiday staying at the embassy suites. We requested room 2124 in which we were provided with. It is a King room with fold out sofa.Great city and ocean views from the balcony. It is on the top floor with a wrap around balcony as it is a corner room.Staff are all amazing and go out of their way to make you feel welcome. Even the security were so friendly. Special mention to Travis who helped me when I was ill late one night.The list of pros is endless....buffet breakfast, clean pool area, afternoon drinks, amazing rooms, friendly staff. I cannot rate this hotel enough and will be returning again.Thank you for another amazing holiday!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We have just returned from 7 nights here and all I can say is oneWow wow wow. This hotel is excellent. From check in to check out nothing was a problem. The staff here are so friendly and helpful. We booked a one bedroom ocean view room and we were given room 2131 in the Hula tower top floor with fantastic ocean views. The room itself was brilliant with a separate living area to the bedroom which was great as if one of us were not tired we could watch TV in the living room.They do a happy hour from 530 to 730 nightly with entertainment on some nights. This was also good as you could have pre dinner drinks then go out for a meal. The hotel is in a great location,not right in the Centre of Waikiki which is good as it can be a bit noisy. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel and will definitely come back. It was a fantastic holiday.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The hotel is really nice with lots of friendly employees and staff. The rooms were excellent and clean. We had no problems at all. We were able to get the room that we wanted for a great price. You can't go wrong with the location. Its in walking distance of great places to eat and shops. Oh and lets not forget the beautiful beach, sunsets and lots of fun activities to do night & day for all ages. We have no complaints and will be back again soon. Aloha!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We went for our 50th anniversary and brought our daughter, her husband and 3 kids with us. We chose the 2 bedroom suite for them. The kids slept in the 2 Queen beds and they had a King. We had a 1 bedroom suite down the hall. They told us it was the best thing in the world because they were used to being in one room when they traveled.We were all overwhelmed by the wonderful breakfast buffet that even included omelets made to order. Even though it was during Spring break you never had to wait more than a few minutes in line.The cocktail time from 5:30 to 7:30 was also over the top. You could have any drink you chose, lots of drinks for kids and they they had a great band most nights. Our kids loved dancing to the music. Our 5 year old granddaughter even danced by herself with lots of adults and didn't want to leave!The pool was never overcrowded and there are lots of different places to sit down. The beach is only 1/2 block away. The hotel is situated in a wonderful place, near buses, beach and restaurants.The staff was very friendly and always helpful. One detail that guests should know is that if you want a King suite you are going to be next to the elevator. It bothered my husband and the next night we switched to a room with Queens. Great place for families. I would go to this hotel again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We really enjoyed our time at this property and were pleasantly surprised by the effort this hotel goes to in order to ensure that everyone feels that they are welcome.This is a generous hotel that offers a useful welcome gift, rate is inclusive of breakfast buffet and evening 2 hours of drinks and even a parting gift was left on my pillow on our last day at Embassy Suites. It was a lovely touch.We would recommend this hotel to families and couples. It is suitable for both given the proximity to great shopping, restaurants, beaches and tour pick up points. Staff were helpful and friendly. Though we did not ask for much, all of our needs were met promptly and with a smile. Room service food was very average and not something we would recommend (unless just ordering a pizza as these were ok).A couple of tips. We payed extra for a partial ocean view and got just that. However, it came at what we consider to be too big a cost for the extra charge. A quarter of what would have been room space in any other room was taken up by the stairwell. This made for a cramped living space for 4 people and 'partial oceanview' was not worth paying extra money for as a result. We would not recommend a room ending in '09' in the Aloha tower on this basis.The bathroom was also SMALL (though clean) and there was nowhere to hang up wet clothes after a day swimming in the pool or at the beach. This was a bit of a problem for us and we found it very unusual given every hotel we have ever stayed at provides this facility in their bathrooms. These could be installed at the hotel for very little expense and it seems a glaring omission that this is not in every room.Also, we booked a transfer to Hanauma Bay through the Bell and later found out that we were charged $8 extra per person than if we had booked direct. I was not impressed by this and would tell others to book this particular transfer direct with a vendor (there are A LOT on offer).We stayed as a family of 4 (two 'tween-aged' children) and really loved this hotel. We actually missed it when we left as it was such a great base to explore Oahu from. We will definitely return but would request a different room next time.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I've stayed at the Embassy Suites in Waikiki on four previous occasions and always found it to be a very good family option for a vacation stay. On this occasion I was surprised to see that things had actually got better in many respects.My room (1905) was recently renovated with new carpet, furnishings and beds. It was great and the 'partial ocean view' was worth every extra cent from the two balconies. The housekeeping service here is excellent and superior to that I have experienced at other Embassy Suites in the US. Sleep quality was truly excellent with great beds and good block-out curtains. Internet service is excellent and free.While this remains primarily a family hotel I was surprised to see many US government guests staying on business. The second half of May is usually quiet but the hotel was full for most of my stay.The pool is very good for families with younger kids. It is not really a relaxing venue for couples or singles. There was no competition for sun lounges and the pool was kept pristine.The hotel has the standard complementary breakfast and evening reception but with a Hawaiian twist. The breakfast is good but varies little from day to day. The free cocktails at the reception are well mixed using quality ingredients. The drinks are definitely not watered down.
