An excellent Hawaiian band plays 3 or 4 times a week and their performances were a real highlight of the stay.Hotel staff were generally knowledgeable and genuinely helpful. Check-in (with Andrew) was really well done. The food and beverage manager (Lacy) was well on top of things and other frontline staff (particularly Aldrin) were notably enthusiastic. I used the concierge service for some general advice and they were also excellent.The location of this hotel is very good - one block from the beach and right on Lewers St where there are many good restaurants suitable for families.While not cheap, I still really love this hotel. More importantly my wife and 6yo daughter absolutely adore staying here. Still a highly recommended option for families seeking to spend a few nights in Waikiki.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Excellent customer service! Accommodations, amenities, cleanness, price is best in the whole Waikiki. Although the beach is not right next to it, the environment in that area is much better. Beaches were between 3 to 5 mins, and close the most convenient and inexpensive vehicle parking access in Waikiki. Some of the other hotels were more expensive and horrible comparing to this hotel. I was really surprised of the huge difference! In many ways the Embassy Suites at Waikiki is unbeatable or one of the unbeatable hotels.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The Manager's special delivered tasty mixed drinks along with a nice variety of appetizers. Also included a live band--with music to suite all genres. Can't forget to mention the outstanding full breakfast ... made-to-order eggs, fresh fruit and pastries. DELICIOUS. The stay here was amazing.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Have stayed here several times and it is always wonderful. Great location, close to the beach and shopping. The entertainment that is there 4 nights a week is top notch.. It is the main reason we choose to return. Super talented friendly family group, playing traditional Hawaiian, oldies and very current hits. The complimentary breakfast is always plentiful and satisfying. The best part about the breakfast is the attendant named Aldrin. He is the friendliest, hardest working person we have come across in all of our travels. His greeting and big smile just makes your day !

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The room, buffet breakfast, valet service, chef service, housekeeping service and most importantly the front desk made our 2 night stay so awesome. There could've no better hotel than the Embassy Suites Waikiki. Two thumbs up.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is a great hotel with the best breakfast and 'happy hours' both colimentary.The staff were over the top and the location is right across from the beach and situated among other very classy hotels. The shopping is 'right there' and also only a couple of blocks to the downtown Waikiki - we will definitely stay here next trip and also will reccommend it to others.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Combination stay of business/pleasure and the Embassy Suites was a great fit for both. The manager's reception in the evening is staffed by top notch bar tenders. Breakfast offerings are exceptional and cater to a variety of cultural tastes. Rooms are spacious and allow you to save some $ by eating in, with in-room kitchenette. Onsite fitness center and laundry facilities add to the convenience. Beach is a 2-minute walk away and the pool/hot tub/deck area at the hotel offers plenty of space to catch some rays. Valet parking service quality depends on timing (early morning service is a little slow) but overall experience was satisfactory. Connected mall offers plenty of shipping and dining options. Plan to stay here again and would definitely recommend to other potential customers.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel was one block from beach and had shops and restaurants within walking distance. A great breakfast was included and happy hour in evenings! The made to order omelets were delicious and lots of other items to choose from. We ate a big breakfast every day and were able to skip lunch.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was a great choice. From the extra space in the suite for my family to spread out to the unbelievable complimentary breakfast. The Hotel is in a prime location, in the middle of everything and only a block walk from the beach. We will stay here again for sure.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Wow, the size of the room exceeded expectations, the bathroom was bigger than the whole suite of the cruise liner we'd just come off! The "icing on the cake" was the Happy Hour, a couple of hours really, wine / cocktails / nibbles all for free, plus a great local band!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This place has it all, 1 block from the beach, near by great food, shopping. The staff is great, they remember me staying here week after week. Been here at least 10 times this year. The rooms are clean and have a microwave, refrigerator. Ice machine close down the hall. I have no complaints about anything here. Nice pool, happy hour is free well drinks and food, great band as well. Free breakfast as well.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Service was top notch, we felt welcome and all requests were addressed with care. Great location, steps from the beach. The downside from that is that every part of the hotel was packed with tourists - so it feels more like Vegas than a hotel on a tropical island. But that is to be expected from Honolulu. I would recommend avoiding the room service - overpriced and sub par in taste But the afternoon free happy hour is a fantastic concept! Overall, a good stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: the service was great, the staff lovely. the location was ideal. we had a bedroom with 2 double beds and a mini kitchen and it worked very well for us with 2 small kids. they also supplied a portacot and sheets. the Expedia person in the lobby was also very helpful for booking trips. breakfast was plentiful and the egg man was great!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Excellent service, rooms well-kept, and serviced. Complimentary breakfast and evening reception were excellent. Best - not even 100 yards from a very cool Starbucks that opens at 4 a.m. Nice for us East Coast folks who wake up early even if we don't want to.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The most beautiful hotel i have stayed in. Privacy, buffet breaky every morning a short walk to the beach or you can relax near the gorgeous pool. The staff went above and beyond to make you comfortable. The best darn security in waikiki that's for sure!! Highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: From the moment you pull into the valet area to check in you start to relax. No one is hurried with you and they take their time to make sure you get all situated. The hotel itself is across the street from the beach so very easy access. We liked the access to shopping as well to the Waikiki Beach-walk which we recommend. The rooms are 2- rooms one being the bedroom and the other a large living area. 2 lanais as well. We will definite stay here again! they also have a 2 hour happy hour that is wonderful! the music and the bartenders make it fun. Very relaxing right at sunset. They have snacks as well during this time. The breakfast which is included was more than we expected. We couldn't get over it , all sorts of food. This would be expensive anywhere else but it is free here.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We are a family of five with teenagers. We greatly enjoyed our stay. In particular, we enjoyed the respectful and friendly service of each and every employee we interacted with. We stayed 8 nights and enjoyed the breakfast and managers rec emotion most evenings. Our basic schedule was breakfast, drive to a sight, eat dinner, return for drinks by the pool. For this trip we booked multiple hotels ar different price points and in the end we chose this one. Although on the more expensive side, many other reviewers often comment you get what you pay for. The rooms are clean and safe. The bathroom is moderatley large. There are two thermostats. The balcony is good. The pool is med size and is no more than 4 ft deep. I think the only real downside is that if you have a rental car its 35 a day. There is no self parking. Kinda steep. Our room was cleaned every day. There were fresh towels each day. You are a block away from the beach. What really sells this place is the staff. Respectful. Friendly and accomadating.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: If you have to be in Honolulu, the Embassy Suites is a good place to stay. They are in a great location, right on Beach Walk which is "almost" pedestrian, with lovely shops and restaurants all along the way. You are not on the beach, but it's virtually across the street, so it's easy to be on the beach in a matter of minutes. We opted for the city view, but they do have ocean view rooms. Our bedroom had two comfortable queen beds and was very spacious, as was the bathroom - lots of room for the two of us to spread out. Our living room had a nice balcony where we could sit and people watch. Housekeeping kept our room tidy every day, with plenty of towels, shampoos, soaps, etc. Breakfast was very nice, with a wide array of fruit, pastry, cereal, juice, etc. as well as scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, and made to order omelets. My advice - go for the omelets. They are made while you wait, so the eggs are hot. In the early evening there is an open bar with tropical drinks, beer and wine. The snacks are pretty pathetic - chips and cheap savory mix - but the drinks are good. They have a band three nights a week and they are really good, which made the cocktail hour much more fun than just sitting there with a drink and some chips. Front desk was prompt at check in, and the valet was super-helpful with advice on getting around town - and Honolulu is not an easy town to navigate. I would not attempt to drive here - worse than NYC! The valet arranged for taxis to take us to various sites, and also arranged for a shuttle back to the airport, which saved us money. It cost $45 for a cab from the airport, and half that for a shuttle back to the airport! I've stayed in more elegant hotels, but the Embassy Suites is very good and in a wonderful location - we'd stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This place is wonderful! The location is in the center of Waikiki, it is very clean, well managed and even though it is very near the beach, we enjoyed the lovely pool and the hotel amenities. In fact we never even walked to the beach! The suites are very nice. The breakfast is outstanding, with two omelet chefs working, there is minimal waiting and with the very wide assortment of breakfast items a small lunch is adequate. In the evening there is a Manager's Reception, particularly suited for Mai Tai enthusiasts, but plenty of non-alcoholic drinks and snacks are also available. As for value for cost, I would rate this hotel as excellent. I would not have a car but use taxis for local trips. Parking can be a headache and traffic is heavy. We spent a week at this hotel and for families with children it was perfect.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My experience here was one to remember. The price was good and it came with free drink/'pupu hour and breakfast in the morning. Every staff person was friendly and easy to talk to. Family friendly and a good way to get away from the hustle and bustle of the week and enjoy a weekend at the Embassy.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Aloha! At check in, we were welcomed with a cold non-alcoholic local fruit punch and chilled cloth towels. Very refreshing! Suite was very spacious. Nice amenities, including slippers. Just a four minute walk across the street to Waikiki Beach. Walk straight out to the beach on a path in between hotel and Army museum. (There are several other paths that lead to beach.) Turn left and your can walk at the ocean's edge on a small cement walkway. (There is a sand gap in some areas and a couple of stairs, so if you are traveling with a wheelchair you may not be able to use this walkway.) Managers cocktail (complimentary) begins at 5:30 (be there at 5:25 since a line begins to form). I finally tried the Blue Hawaii and MaiTai drinks; personally not my favorites but it was fun to try! Breakfast (complimentary) was absolutely delicious, they have two lines and plenty of seating so it was not crowded! Made to order omelets, fresh local fruits/asian food were amazing. ABC shops for souvenirs and snacks are right across the street. Ruth's Chris Steak House is right downstairs, as well as other well know chain restaurants. Your room has a coupon book for local businesses, you can get a free appetizer for Ruth Chris, as well as other treats/discounts for other places. This is a perfect high-end area for strolling/shopping. Be sure to walk thru the Royal Hawaiian shops and garden, very pretty. Be sure to try the Hawaiian Shaved Iced with local fruits flavors (they have all flavors) and condensed milk!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: They only valet but you pay one-time parking fee for unlimited valet throughout your stay. Felt like royalty at this hotel. No waiting for registration, valet was quick. It was close to everything from local markets, to food trucks, and right across the beach even live entertainment outside our balcony. This is the happening part of Hawaii where there's people, shopping from high end boutiques to little food marts. My kids loved it. We have never gone wrong with Embassy Suites. Breakfast buffet was very good. Staff was very attentive. Will totally stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Absolutely amazing! Incredibly nice rooms, superb breakfast and nightly cocktail hour, and in the heart of Waikiki. It's literally a two minute walk to the beach, shops, or any of the restaurants. Couldn't be more happy with our choice. Wow!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Embassy Suites is located in a perfect location, close to shopping, the beach, and restaurants. The rooms are clean and beds are super comfortable. I was put in a noisy location, but they made it right after I told them I didn't like the room I was in. Staff is so friendly and attentive, most large hotels are impersonal, but not this one. The breakfast buffet is delicious, and the band's that play for happy hour are first rate. I would highly recommend a stay here !

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed for a week at this hotel. Everything was great. The included breakfast was lovely as were the free drinks every afternoon. Having two rooms ie lounge and bedroom plus a fridge and microwave makes life very pleasant. Have been to Honolulu three times and would highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: One of the best places we have stayed, this hotel has everything.Rooms are big and clean, we got a fantastic upgrade to room 1908 and it's lovely great view and very quiet.Pool is fantastic and has two shallow areas for small kidsCocktail hour is an extra special treat and the breakfasts are delicious.Fantastic location and staff are brilliant.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: First time I have ever stayed at a hotel that offered 2 hours of free drinks each evening - I'd happily go back!Apart from that, this was a really great hotel in the centre of Waikiki only minutes from the beach and with the main shopping strip pretty much starting at this hotel. Reception, concierge and valet parking staff were all very friendly and helpful as were those in the food and beverages areas of the hotel. Our suite (2 bedrooms & bathrooms and large lounge) was very comfortable, clean and modern and even the settee that converted to a double bed had a very comfortable mattress. Very effective and quiet airconditioning made for a pleasant stay.The hotel didn't offer dinner but breakfasts were extensive and kept us going for the day! The omlettes made to request were to die for! Not offering dinner was hardly an issue as there were dozens of alternative venues within only minutes walk.No views of the water unfortunately but the price suitably reflected this.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We requested for a partial ocean view and got a Diamond Head view. We are Kamaainas and we really got the Royal Treatment! We ate at Roy's Waikiki and BLT Trump Towers and it was so convenient to stay at the Embassy Suites.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The location is wonderful...5 min walking from the Beach...steps from the strip mall and restaurants...great location...the breakfast could be better tasting with less birds flying around your head and table as you dine.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Not many people know that the name of this hotel includes a comfortable suite as well as cozy beds. We had a comfortable balcony so we could watch those early morning rains so common on Oahu. We had a small view of both the ocean and Diamond Head. Staff were very professional and friendly. The Embassy Suites offers a brunch in the mornings and later a happy hour is offered. My daughter and I selected Embassy Suites because we stayed in the Monterey Beach, California and were very impressed with the offerings of this fine Hotel. Ben from Expedia coordinated all our outings which were taken care of right at the Embassy Hotel. Ours was a vacation to remember so fondly.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Absolutely Amazing, from check in to check out. This hotel felt more like home than a hotel; the friendly staff went above and beyond! There is a free breakfast every morning and a manager's reception/cocktail hour each evening. The location is perfect for all that Waikiki has to offer in the way of restaurants, shopping and beaches. Lastly, there is a fantastic family band that preforms in the hotel most nights during the week, making it feel like your own private concert!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Being our first visit to Hawaii we did not know what to expect when we arrived for a 6 day family holiday. But having said that Embassy Suites exceeded everything we thought it would be. Our room was very clean and was always serviced every day to a very high standard by very friendly staff. We had a corner standard queen suite (meaning one bedroom with a separate living area). The balcony from the bedroom and the living area overlooked the Waikiki Beach Walk (which we did not find to be noisy at all) and from the kitchen area we had a lovely view of the pool and the beach.The real bonus for us were the friendly helpful staff who provided all the assistance we needed including booking restaurant reservations/excursions, the extensive buffet breakfast with made-to-order omelets and of course, the free cocktails from 5-7pm every night! What more could you ask for?!! Oh, that's right - free WiFi :-)A perfect place for the family and within walking distance of the main shopping area, the beach and transport. Highly recommended.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We have stayed here many times before. Rooms have recently been renovated. New carpet, black out drapes and fresh bathroom. Poolside is great. Happy hour is even better. Friendly staff and clean grounds. Coin laundry $3 for washer . $1.25 for detergent. Andrew at reception is the best... Recommend poolside view for a quieter night sleep. beach walk side is very noisy.. Good breakfast.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Personable greeting at check-in, great music, drinks and pupu's at the cocktail reception. Eggs-cellent omelette made to order at the complimentary breakfast! In a great location in Waikiki, Roy's, Ruth's Chris' Steakhouse and the Royal Hawaiian Shopping Center. Very friendly staff, even to Kamaaina's.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is a great family hotel in a terrific location in Waikiki. I had been debating whether or not to splurge at the Trump (which is literally next door) and am glad we chose this spot because the breakfast buffet and ample lounge chairs makes Embassy more of a kid zone. The omelet station was a great plus, not something that is at every Embassy Suites. We got upgraded into a two-bedroom suite and that was ideal with the kids. They each had their own bed in the extra room and we could use the main room for those who stayed up late or got up early without disturbing anyone. The fridge and microwave come in handy, especially if have leftovers or want to grab a few things at the ABC stores nearby. Overall, a more budget-friendly option in Waikiki that is great for families.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: An absolutely wonderful hotel, set one block back from the beach and central to everywhere. Fantastic friendly staff from reception through to housekeeping, waiters and bar staff! Managers reception brilliant and the two nights with entertainment made it perfect. We had a one bedroom ocean view apartment with romance package, which was very clean. No champagne and strawberries on arrival but room service soon rectified that with the added bonus of an extra bottle of prosecco. Fantastic and hopefully we will return in the future!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Unfortunately, we only stayed one night pre-cruise but this was a fabulous hotel. Sandra at check-in was great. She upgraded us to a corner ocean view suite. It was so nice and very quiet. I didn't hear anything. Also, the bellhop staff was super nice. The housekeeping lady on our floor was very friendly and always said hello. The evening reception was awesome. The breakfast was superb. I would definitely stay here again!! The Embassy Suite Hotels are my favorite of the Hilton Chain. I have never had any issues with any of the Embassy Suites I have stayed at!!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Location is fantastic -- rooms are large, nice and the entire facility is quite accomodating. Location cannot be beat for access to beach, restaurants and sites on Waikiki. Breakfast buffet is quite good and large selection with two lines for cook-to-order eggs and buffet items. Manager's Daily Reception is good -- out on pool deck and a good place to start the evening festivities. Wifi fast and staff truly provdes that Aloha Spirit. Gym is a little small with approx 6 cardio and a small selection of weights and one multi-purpose machine. Valet parking is $35/day and in/out was quick.Room Tip: Stayed in 1129 -- corner facing the Ocean and it was awesome. Recommend asking for 1129, 1229, 1329, 1429.....etc as they will give you spectacular views.Will be back as best Hilton property on Honolulu -- better than Hilton Hawaiian Village as not so crowded and no resort fee.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Booked direct with hotel for a week and saved $600 over bookings.com! Seaview king on website says "balcony" but our first room in Aloha tower had no balcony. Back to reception, who offered a queen twin in Hula tower which was perfect. A great location and we felt the breakfast was excellent with plenty of choice and the evening reception dispenses copious amounts of grog, if you want it. Good musos 3 times a week.Otherwise it was the cheerful demeanour of all staff we met and the standard of maintenance and housekeeping which were real standouts .Yes deservedly popular for families, but some quiet pool times too.Overall a great first time stay in Waikiki.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Except for breakfast menu designed for Japanese guests and the open air registration and valet parking area, this hotel offers nothing but the same as any Embassy Suites, plus $35 per day for the valet parking -- tho an easy one block walk to Waikiki beach. The bkf food options were the same, though lacking bananas, as anywhere. The reception food was the same, boring options, with live boring pop music on MW -- located under bright, ugly lighting. Do not accept a room next to the elevators, as very noisy.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Gorgeous spot, we were upgraded to a two bedroom suite as our room wasn't ready, which was fantastic. Yummy breakfast included daily, and a 2 hour All you can drink Happy Hour was the icing on the cake. Keola our barman was so much fun. Please just remember to tip the bar staff, as they deserve it. Highly recommend it to everyone.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Most friendly place I believe I've ever stayed at. Accommodations, First Class. Breakfast was cooked to order and had a wide range of items. Shopping very near and beach was within a minute or two walk.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: As first timers to Honolulu, we had no idea what to expect. This hotel was perfect. We were greeted with a cold fruit beverage. The service at check-in was fun and efficient and we were upgraded to a 2 bedroom suite. Very nice and plenty of room for our family of 5. Rooms were clean and tidy and ours overlooked the pool and dining area. The conceirge staff were always friendly and helpful when we were booking taxi's, tours, asking for directions and advice etc.The hotel location was perfect and placed between Lewers St and Beachwalk, close to all the shops, eateries and Waikiki beach.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Although this property is not located on the beach it is a short five minute walk away.The pool and hot tub and staff are great. There is a 530 to 7:30 PM happy hour every day including beer wine and local drinks did I say free?another great benefit is the included buffet breakfast which is amazing again every day.The rooms are typical suite rooms great for families or couples wanting more space.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I was there a week on business. The staff was great. The room was also great with a good layout, roomie and comfortable. The breakfast each morning was great as well as the manager receptions. On checkout I had a late night flight and was able to use facilities, to include pool until time for flight. They let me use a hospitality room to shower before heading to the airport. Highly recommend for business or vacation. Oh and across the street from the beach.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Upgraded to high floor HULA tower, sweeping ocean views, fantastic family holiday, great service, very clean. Staff went above and beyond to help us with any requests. When making memories with the family you want a hotel that exceeds your expectations. Nightly free drinks while our kids were in the pool with their new friends. Buffet breakfast is legendary. Highly recommend for families with children.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Having do much fun on our staycation. The manager reception is the best. Is on the pool side with tons of seating. Free booze, pupus and live music. People are dancing to the music. So much fun!! Staff are super friendly... Free breakfast buffet is better than any other paid breakfast buffet on Waikiki and its free for all registered guest, great when you have kids with you. Room is great cuz it has separate living room. And 2 lanais. Hotel location is right in the middle of shopping center. Can't beat this hotel for the value and location... Awesome stay and very satisfied.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach Walk was a great find. Close to the beach and the famous Waikiki Beach Walk. The Staff was incredibly nice and accommodating, fantastically close to the beach, clean and spacious rooms --(the bedroom layout was a bit difficult to stow two bags in, had to place second bad in front room.) Five minutes to the major freeways. I would recommend to family and friends.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed in March 2015 with my parents and our 6 month old. They accommodated us in giving us 2 rooms side by side. The rooms contained 2 twin beds separate to a small lounge area, separate bathroom and a kitchenette with sink, fridge and kettle. It was central to all our needs- shopping, restaurants, beach and transport.Staff were friendly and helpful, rooms were spacious and clean and not outdated like some other Hawaiian hotels we've previously stayed in.The included breakfast was basic but the complimentary cocktails and snacks for all guests every afternoon made up for it. The pool/spa was a great size and there was always seating available.The only downfall was roadworks directly outside our window for the entire week which made for an unhappy baby at sleep time and especially early in the morning. Of course we understand this can not be helped by the hotel. I would absolutely recommend this hotel to all types of travellers.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Hotel is well located right on Beachwalk, one block from the beach, and adjacent to the Royal Hawaiian shopping center. Rooms are nicely appointed and quiet, each with two balconies. We had an ocean view suite, and it did have a great view. Also overlooked the recently updated pool area. The included breakfast is good (but not great, but hey, it's included!). The late afternoon cocktail and pupu event hosted by the manager, is a great deal: 2 hours of free cocktails and munchies poolside. Fast, free internet also. Worth a visit.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: On my first day in Honolulu I took a shower, the shower had no non-slip surface and no mat. Needless to say I slipped and fell hard. Badly bruised and hoping no broken bones I called the desk. They brought me a mat, nice! We were scheduled to stay 3 nights but we noticed Saturday night that Sunday all the streets were closed for a marathon run. I asked why weren't we notified upon booking or at least check in and they pointed to a small notice about 4x6 with the notification. I was told in order to make my flight I would have to carry my luggage 3 blocks as taxis couldn't get in. I couldn't barely walk due to the fall now she told me to carry my luggage 3 blocks.Bottom line I had to check out early pay for the room which I didn't occupy and go to another hotel outside the marathon race and pay again. I'm cancelling my everything I have with Hilton Honors including the American Express. The attitude of these people was unexplainable poor. Maybe I should sue for the fall!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Everyone at this hotel was fantastic. The staff that worked the breakfast which was insanely good and a great value. The housekeepers added the perfect touch, leaving candy bars for my kids one night and bottles of water. The free cocktail reception was great too. Bartenders remembered all our drinks every night. Again great value. The rooms are clean and newly updated. Definitely will be back!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Half my family stayed at the Hilton Hawaiian Village and the other half stayed here. This place was fantastic!It is near a TON of stuff like shopping, eating, etc. We walked within a few seconds to some wonderful places to eat and shop.The rooms were very nice. Very clean and roomy. The pool on the roof was great and not very crowded.The breakfast for Hilton Honors members was one of the best I have had. Even though it was crowded (we went art Christmas), the selection was great.The beach is about a three minute walk. And some great places to eat as you walk there.I prefer this over the Hilton Hawaiian Village on Waikiki. Not as crowded and very clean.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We (a family of five) stayed at the Embassy for 10 days in March 2015. We booked a two bedroom suite on the 9th floor, paying extra for a partial ocean view which was worth it. I am a bit OTT with cleanliness and was pleased to see that our accommodation met and exceeded my high expectations, cleaned daily with fresh shower and pool towels. The lounge, bedroom and bathroom were a good size as was the sink/bench area that included a fridge. Freebies in our room when we arrived were bottled water, chocolates and a tote bag. Free daily newspapers and wi fi was a nice bonus. The breakfast facilities at the Embassy seem to cater for everyone. Pancakes, Made to order Omelettes, donuts, bagels, toast, porridge, bacon, eggs, rice, miso + so much more. The breakfast drinks self serve station had fresh orange/ fruit drinks, coke & coffee facilities. The breakfast was so generous that we managed to fill up and not require lunch which saved $ on food during the day. Free cocktails and nibbles poolside in the evening were fantastic. The only downside (but I am being picky) is the pool itself isn’t that big and can get slightly crowded, there is nothing unique or themed about its design but it is functional and the kids enjoyed it. The loungers beside the pool were generous and comfortable. The Sheraton hotel puts on a fireworks display every Friday night and with the great, central location of the Embassy we could view for free. The hotel was centrally located and within perfect walking distance to restaurants, ABC stores and boutique shops. The Embassy lobby area was well positioned and I especially like the open space (no walls) breezy and tropical like. The hotel was adorned with external gas lanterns that were lit in the evening providing a really nice ambiance. There was a bit of construction and maintenance going on around the Embassy (which you can’t fault the Embassy for) so there was a little noise pollution during the week but given that we spent most of our time out and about exploring the Island this didn’t affect us much. We had a small problem with our door swipe system which hotel staff swiftly corrected and then presented us with bottles of water and chocolates for the inconvenience which was a nice gesture. The Embassy falls within the middle to high price range of Waikiki Accommodation but we highly recommend it and would most definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel does a lot for its customer. The location is a block from the main Waikiki Beaches and has excellent amenities to include good gym, FREE evening reception, and an amazing breakfast. The staff is friendly and does everything to make your stay enjoyable.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: For the price and location this hotel is not bad. Walking distance to the beach and shopping and central to mostly everything in Waikiki. There is a free buffet breakfast which is very helpful when you have growing kids as in our case we filled up and didn't have to spend much on lunch. Between the hours of 5:30pm to 7:30pm every night they offer free drinks and cocktails at the poolside bar for guests. The barman (sorry didn't get his name, he was the barman with the ponytail) was really funny and entertaining. It's people like this, that make your holiday great. A very pleasant and comfortable stay with great staff. Free and fast wifi too.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Pros: Great views. Nice pool area. Happy hours every day. Cons: Decour is dated e.g. 80s wallpaper. Breakfast same every day - no variety. Delivery trucks start reversing (beeping) up the street out side from 6am.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was my first trip to Oahu and this hotel made it very worth while. I will definitely be staying here again! the staff was very friendly and helpful. Very good breakfast and the evening receptions there are awesome. They have live music with some very good bands. Love this place and it's close to all kinds of shopping and restaurants.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I stayed here with my brother for 1 night on his HHonors points during our weekend trip to Hawaii. We love Hawaii and try to get back here as much as possible to just relax, unwind, and enjoy paradise. The hotel is in a good location. It is walking distance to Hard Rock Cafe,and the ABC store across this hotel is probably the biggest between the hotel and Hilton Hawaiian village...it is right across the street by the elevators. A Denny's restaurant is also across the street. We arrived on Friday and there was happy hour by the pool with free drinks and alcohol...just the basics. Breakfast included was good...omelettes were great! There are food trucks across the street from the lobby next to Henry's ice cream place (A MUST TRY!). Shopping is nearby and more restaurants...all walking distance. We were on a higher floor above the pool so we had a partial view of the ocean from our lanai, be it somewhat obstructed by other hotels. The staff was friendly, and our room was what we expected from this brand hotel...but remember this is Hawaii, you don't spend a lot of time in your room except to sleep, shower, and change clothes. The beach is across the street and there are 2 beach access walkways.If you are into high end shopping, the shops are ALL walking distance from here. I jogged in the early morning and around the shopping district and beach area...seeing the sunrise on a clear day is beautiful! There are also public picnic areas nearby. Take the beach access from the hotel, when you get to the beach, turn right and walk towards Hilton Hawaiian Village. On the way to your right there will be sand volleyball courts and picnic area. Walk a little further (closer to the village) and you will see another one with a nice shaded grassy area to your right.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The Embassy Suites are situated in a fantastic location. One block back from beach, close to restaurants, across road from a huge ABC store. Our room was spacious, and great aspect with beach & pool view. Breakfast included was great, omelette's fantastic. Manager's reception wonderful. Entertainment a few times a week. Pool busy but we mostly went to beach. All staff we came into contact with we're friendly and helpful. Free yoga classes are great way to start the day. Stayed in many hotels in Honolulu this was the best.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The staff at this hotel is outstanding! They are very accommodating and made our stay pleasant and fun. The rooms were wonderful and you can't beat the FREE Manager's reception in the evening and buffet breakfast. I won't stay anywhere else when I'm in Waikiki.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Just got back from Waikiki - aloha! We stayed in the Aloha Tower, room 1209. Great room, very clean, recently refurbished (we watched them refurbishing last spring from our room across the road at the Trump and thought we'd give the embassy suites a go this spring!). Good choice! Housekeeping brilliant, without fail and same goes for every other person we encountered at this hotel - very friendly and helpful. Ocean view room was great and contrary to others I did not find the elevators slow at all! Small gym but has everything you need. I saw them cleaning it every time I was in thereLocation is excellent, short, maybe one minute walk to either the shops/restaurants (an abundance of them!) or the beach. Pool on fourth floor very nice although faux grass needs replacing as black little bits of rubber everywhere which stuck to everything! Beach/pool towels provided in room everyday day. Pool and pool area very clean, also saw them cleaning that every day. Cocktails and lunch service provided at the pool too (bit expensive though, but oh well, who cares you're on holiday!).Rooms very quiet at night. We were one room away from the elevators and didn't hear a thing from them nor our neighbours either next to us or above or below. Makes for a welcome change compared to some other hotels. Very comfortable sofa bed in living area, pulled it out every night and watched movies from their awesome selection (some still in theatres). We love everything about waikiki and will no doubt be back. Embassy suites will definitely be on our list for suitable accomodation.Mahalo.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Rooms are nice and clean. Great restaurants close in walking distance. And a ABC store right across the street. The complentary Breakfast was Awesome. Great food and great service. Short distance to the beach. Location is perfect for shopping and beaches.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Although the bathrooms needed to be cleaned a little better, the suite and internet were great! I received a complimentary upgrade to a two bedroom suite that I did not need, but appreciated. I enjoyed the Complimentary full breakfast buffet and evening cocktails. This is a great hotel for families or large groups. I would definitely return!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I stayed at the Embassy Suites in Waikiki with my 2 teenage daughters over Easter and all I will say is we loved every moment. We arrived early morning and the greeting we received was outstanding, our room was not ready of course but we were able to freshen up and get accustomed to out new home for the next 8 nights. All the staff are there to help you in any way they can, my daughters kept saying how friendly everyone is. This was a special time for us and staying at the Embassy Suites made if very special. The location is perfect, the room was spacious and well appointed, the cocktail hour every afternoon was a great way to unwind after busy days shopping and sightseeing, and of course the Wifi is a must with teenagers. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Waikiki, we are now in serious post holiday blues.........

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The room was clean and comfortable. We took full advantage of the breakfast which has everything you could want. We also enjoyed the manager's reception. The walk to Waikiki was a little farther than I expected, but not bad. Our only complaint is that the pool was VERY crowded. Felt like people were on top of each other. There is plenty of room to sit and lounge poolside, but the pool itself is crowded!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Very close to decent restaurants, shops and beaches. However there may be better deals with this place (eg combining flight/accommodation). Booked this for suite ie separate bedroom. Decent sized lounge with basic kitchenette. Wifi ok. Complimentary drinks offered each night 5.30-7.30. No checking drinks vouchers so place becomes similar to queuing for a Disney ride. Buffet breakfast ok- not much fresh/wholesome choices. Omelettes on demand best bet. Would return if better deal. Avoid pool/dining level on 4. Would be too noisy.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Took us ages to pick a place to stay and we are glad we picked here. Stayed with husband and 17 yo daughter in one bedroom apt. Room was big enough and whilst we had a 'city view' room we had a beach view from our balcony which was nice. We were next to the elevators and yes they made a little noise - but not enough to make an impact - we certainly didnt feel the need to ask to move or anything like that. The only issue we had with them was they could be slow and then when they did come were often full so had to wait for the next one. Its in a great place, just back from the beach is good, some of the hotels right on the beach are quite open and have a lot of 'non guests' walking through - this didnt happen here so it was good. Breakfasts and the evening drinks were really good - lots of choice and the staff moved very quickly to keep the place clean to ensure the birds were not a pest. It dosnt take long to get to the beach - we prefered the beach in front of the Sheraton and thats just next door so was easy to get to. Pool not fantastic, but ok and comparable to others - not needed anyway with the wonderful beach. Plenty of good restaurants nearby - and not too hard to walk Waikiki anyway - highly recommend this hotel - would stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We left another hotel to come here because the other hotel was just too busy and manic. The Embassy Suites is the opposite - excellent customer service with super friendly and helpful staff - it was probably full but you never feel overwhelmed by lots of people everywhere. We had a 1 bedroom suite which suited 4 of us and had amazing views. The hotel is central and easy to get to everything. Unlike other hotels where you have to pay a resort fee, breakfast is included and even pool side snacks and free cocktails for happy hour - amazing! I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to others.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was our first family trip to Hawaii. We would happily recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for great value, top-notch staff and fantastic food all in a perfect Waikiki location. We had a great vacation, and we're looking forward to returning ASAP.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: If you are reading this review, I encourage you to book a reservation at the Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach Walk. We really enjoyed our suite on the 18th floor of the Hula Tower. The suite was clean with modern amenities. The beds were very comfortable...even the sofa bed for my teenager. We enjoyed the view too from the balcony. Our room was across the hall from the elevator. We stayed for a couple weeks and heard absolutely no noise from the elevators. We were bothered more by the noise outside from Waikiki...loud garbage trucks, traffic noise, beeping sounds of vehicles backing up....etc. We spent a lot of time at the pool. It is an awesome pool in a fantastic location. Great for the kids with a shallow toddler section and lounging area in the water. The pool has a new and modern type soft flooring which is really nice. The pool is shaded from the Hula Tower for most of the morning. There is a nice artificial turf area beside the pool to hang out or play with the kids. Be sure to remember your pool towels from your room. There is limited supply of towels at the pool placed on the bar. At night, the pool is fun too with all the Tiki Tiki torches. There are a lot of reviews about the amazing complimentary breakfast. These are all accurate and true. Love the omelette stations! Enjoy! The complimentary beverages during the Manager's Special are fantastic. You will not be disappointed with "free" drinks and snacks. The "live" entertainment was very enjoyable and fun. We found the Wifi to be fastest in the covered Breakfast eating area with tables and chairs.If you have a room without a view, take a ride on the elevator to one of the top floors and walk to the end of the hallway. The doors are always open for a natural breeze and a beautiful view.The ABC store is close and convenient across the street from the Hula Tower elevators.Tip...When you are going the beach with inflatables, take the beach walkway beside the Museum...you will find a rental stand for Aqua Cycles at the end of the walkway that offers "free" inflation. Its also a good idea to buy water shoes for swimming in the ocean as some areas are very rocky. Or walk towards the pink hotel for a more sandy section of the ocean.Aloha!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We were on top floor facing the Hilton Hawaiian Village side. Right next to the hotels infamously loud elevators!!!! They didn't bother us that much!!! :-)We had amazing views of the beach and ocean and especially the sunset!!! The location was great!!!! Beach access across the street. Lots of shopping, dining etc.... within a one minute walk!!!! Rooms were tidy and staff was friendly. One complaint was the price for a vodka and tea at the pool bar.....$15!!!! It was the house vodka that they serve at Happy Hour!!! LOL....no worries though.....we had a great time!!!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Embassy Suites Waikiki Beachwalk is a wonderful hotel that provides an excellent service. The daily complimentary breakfast is unreal, with plenty of choices to please all pallets. The manager's social provides a nice ending to the work day as well as a step-off for an evening of fun. The accomodations were wonderful and the staff went out of their way to ensure my stay was comfortable. Excellent hotel only minutes from the beach.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: During a recent business trip to Hawaii I found the meaning of Aloha. The staff and management worked to make sure everything a guest could want was offered and always with a smile. The Embassy Suites Waikiki was a sanctuary in bustling Waikiki. Offering shopping, dining, entertainment and only steps to the beach.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We adored this hotel. It was immaculate and the location was perfect. The staff was kind and professional. We specifically want to thank our maid, Wai Lynn for the epitome of cleanliness to our room, bar staff, Dennis & Keola for serving awesome drinks, the pool dude, Daniel for finding us a cabana, and Ray of guest services, for insuring all our needs were met. The cook to order omelets made by Tomas were out of this world, as were all of the delicious foods. 5 stars! Mahalo for an AWESOME stay!
user_location: South Kingstown, Rhode Island, United States

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: 1st. Time staying here. Other Waikiki stays, waikiki shores, outrigeer reef x3, waikiki parc, illiaki and this one. I know the area, costs, noise etc. I will not stay here again nor will I refer anyone. Front staff was quite accomidating during some issues, but due to us not getting a promised credit on our bill, and the fact the walls in two of the suites were paper thin, I will not be staying here again. Two seperate room, 2 seperate floors, no bathroom fan working. This can be a big deal with multiple quests. Dont think your getting a kitchenette. You get a microwave, bar ridge, no coffee maker and cream and sugar with bad coffee. Plan to eat with your hands, no utensils are provided, nor are plates or bowls.Food staf and housekeeping are awesome. They make this hotel. That and the fact its close to the beach. Breakfast is A1. You dont need anything else. If you stay and have any promises of credits or whatever get them in writing. Also bring earplugs, I mean it!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is a great option close to the beach - a two minute walk. It has a great breakfast buffet, which was a big bonus when traveling with teenage boys. We've stayed here twice in the last 8 years and were happy with the property and service both times. Good suite options for families.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We decided on Honolulu for a last minute family spring break, we were somewhat apprehensive as we are a family of five and usually hotels require a second room once you opt for a room larger than 5What a great find this hotel was, not only was there no extra charge the rate included breakfast and managers reception every day.Let's chat about the breakfast - made to order omelets with practically any item, want just eggs no problem the chef's make any style egg you want and any number of them too. At the side of the omelet station there are potatoes with peppers and onions other sides included bacon, sausage, french toast, pancakes. Let's not forget about all the fresh fruit you can muster and if pastries are your thing there is a selection of breads, bagels and muffins. If soup is your breakfast item there was a miso soup station. Drinks included fresh Kona Coffee, Passion Fruit/Guava and Pomegranate/Acai Berry plus an array of juices. My kids 8-10-13 loved the breakfast and it kept us going all day until dinner time the price FREE this would have been an easy $80 tab every day.Thirsty - from 5:30 - 7:30 every day there is a mangers reception which includes beers, wines, mixed drinks and cocktails. Munchies were also provided usually chips, pretzels,peanuts and a fresh vegetable with ranch.The facilities were just fine, i read a review regarding a room near the elevator being noisy, we were next to an elevator and didn't hear a thing. The pool was extremely clean and well looked after. I noticed hotel employees taking water samples from both the pool and hot tub every hour. The hotel food served pool side was extremely good value for money and the waitress was friendly and attentive.Location was fantastic, in the heart of everything and next to great restaurants and shopping. The staff were super friendly and very helpful when ever we had general questions or requests.Cant say enough good things, if you are travelling with family or youngsters i would highly recommend this hotel

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great hotel awesome location! Breakfast was free and fit for a king! Late afternoon reception by the pool free 2 drinks were a nice start to the evening! Hotel was clean helpful staff. Just 2 min walk to the beAch. The hotel is on the main shopping and reasturant blvd and really posh! Abolutely beautiful area if you have kids, or couples or even singles! Had a fantastic time! RoCk on Hawaii!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Due to Hilton Honors status, we were upgraded to a lovely corner suite with excellent views from two different rooms/porches. It made the hotel stay really nice! I think I would have been disappointed if we had not gotten the upgrade. I have stayed in the Hilton Hawaiian Village and other places on the beach and much prefer them...they don't cost much more. That being said, the breakfast and cocktail reception are nice perks. As others have said, the breakfast doesn't have many local touches, though there ARE chopped macadamia nuts to put on your oatmeal...yum. The last day they did have papaya YAY! The local drinks were delicious, though the "snacks" were basically chips and vegetables.The pool area was fine but not special. We had just come from three days at Turtle Bay so perhaps I was spoiled. It is well worth renting the two beach chairs and umbrella when you walk to the beach..it makes it as convenient and lovely as staying beach front. The shopping and energy all around the hotel is fun.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The staff was super friendly. The rooms were nice. We enjoyed complimentary breakfast with made to order omelets in the morning and happy hour with snacks and a live band in the evening. Overall, we had a great experience and I would stay at this hotel again. I think the best part was that the hotel was centrally located and literally less than 5 minutes walk to the beach. I think this hotel offers the best of what Waikiki has to offer within walking distance: the beautiful beach in Waikiki, shopping in Honolulu, some of best restaurants and of course the night life. One of the best surprises was that the week we visited was during the Honolulu festival. We were able to walk to the beach and enjoy the most amazing firework display over the water. I've recommended this hotel to family and friends and this is definitely on my return list the next time we visit Honolulu!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our family had a fantastic experience at the Embassy Suites. Terrific location for beach, restaurants & shopping, very friendly staff, clean, spacious rooms (we had 5 and had no issues, even the hideaway was comfy,) great breakfast and highlight managers event in evening with live band several nights a week. We couldn't have asked for more for our holiday in terms of service and value Thanks to all the staff for making it such a great trip, we will be back because of the service you provided!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Good breakfast, great location, fun pool. Evening reception can be missed as food not good quality. Small refrigerator in room and microwave. Room had lovely view. 1/2 block walk to beach. Works well for families

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: All of the staff at this hotel really understand service - each and every interaction we had was positive. The hotel room and facilities were always clean, the breakfast of high quality and the managers evening reception a highlight we looked forward to every day, especially when live entertainment was playing. Cannot recommend highly enough.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: went to attend 50th birthday with a good friend, so we needed / wanted two rooms ,and the embassy suites came to the rescue. good sized bedroom with a king bed. lounge room with a comfy sofa bed ,by all accounts the main bed was comfy too.TV in each room ,balcony in each room overlooking Waikiki beach, good size bathroom ,very happy.Breakfast was very good , the managers reception each evening ,two hours of snacks and drinks ,with a great cover band belting out tunes was a great place to meet people.All the staff are super friendly !The suites are one street off the main beach, central to bars, restaraunts , the ABC shop is across the road for all your needs, bottle shop ,supermarket ,deli .Rent the stretch limo for the return airport transfer, cheaper than a cab.when I come back it will be with the family

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Friendliest staff, great location on the Beach Walk with many shops and restaurants, wonderful buffet breakfast and Manager's Reception every day plus fantastic band 4 nights of the week. 2-room corner suite was a worthwhile upgrade.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I stayed at the Embassy Suites for four nights at the end of my vacation. Frankly I didn't know what to make of it so I'll just give a description of what was good and what wasn't.Location -- in the heart of Waikiki. Not on the beach but a moment's walk. Very convenient location.Lobby -- what lobby? Reception area is adjacent to the valet/drive in area. There is no wall between the valet and check-in. Bizarre. Check-In -- I had an end room and was told it would face Fort Derussy. It didn't, it faced Diamond Head. Was this a factor in my enjoyment of the hotel? Of course not. But I thought that if the receptionist was going to offer the information it should be correct. Room -- in the Aloha Tower, ninth floor. Clean, bathroom was nice, bed was comfortable. Noisy. Very noisy. Could easily hear people in the next room and noise from the street. Sitting in the living room -- scratchy upholstery and uncomfortable sofa. Definitely not for my back. Housekeeping -- very nice lady, did a good job, friendly.Breakfast -- a highlight. Plenty of variety, quality was decent. Made-to-order omelets were excellent. Staff was friendly. Baked goods were mediocre. I appreciated the miso soup and the pineapple was delicious. I liked that they offered salad.Evening reception -- I don't know why they bothered with the food. Some chips, some veggies and a dip. Hot cheese sauce one night. Not worth attending for the food but the entertainment was quite good. They had a lively band, a father with his three sons, and they were fun and enjoyable.Would I stay again? Probably not.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel has a good location, close to beach with great Waikiki shopping nearby. The complimentary breakfast was good though would have liked to see more fruit. Staff in food area was very attentive. The pool area is not very large and pool was very busy.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed for 8 days at this wonderful Embassy Suites. The staff was very helpful and the complimentary breakfast has the most options that we've ever experienced at a hotel. In addition, we had many healthy options at breakfast everyday. The rooms were excellent; spacious, comfortable and very clean. The pool area was lovely and it is an easy, quick walk from this location to Waikiki Beach. Finally, the manager's daily reception/happy hour was always enjoyable with good entertainment on many evenings.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed 5 nights at the Embassy Suites... Close to the beach...shopping...restaurants... Centrally located... enjoyed our daily walks! Ask for suite 421...close to the pool, restaurant... Included with the stay was the daily hot breakfast, manager's special at 5:30 with drinks and live entertainment!! Alvin at the front desk was always very helpful and Esther at the manager's special was the best... Overall, a great place to stay!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Husband and I visited for the 1st time, We loved the location, close to food, shops, and walking distance to a great beach, where we rented paddle boards, and kayaks. Hotel had a beautiful view.....the included breakfast buffet, and in the afternoon managers happy hour, with live music was icing on the cake!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Right next to the shops on Lewers Street, it's a quick walk away from the Royal Hawaiian Shopping Center and any of the Waikiki shopping, restaurants and other attractions. This hotel is what you would expect from a well kept Embassy Suites: Two rooms, free breakfast and evening reception, wet bar, microwave, small fridge, in room safe and great service. Great rooftop pool with kiddie pool and hot tub which also has the area for the evening reception. Excellent housekeeping and friendly staff. One complaint, there are way too few elevators and if it's during peak times be prepared for huge delays. Parking is about $40/day and valet only so if you're ok with outdoor parking a a 2 block walk, Fort DeRussey parking is available for about half the price. Overall, I loved the hotel and will be back!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Spent another week at the embassy suites on Waikiki on Oahu. Even better. All rooms have been refurbished and look great. The breakfast buffet is great although I would prefer my food hotter especially cooked sausage and scrambled eggs. The managers special at 5:30 as always is awesome and the guys behind the bar are fun. Had marvelous entertainment a father and his three sons played all kinds of music. We stayed and ate in just to drink and listen to music. Draw back - once again asked for trolly maps from Expedia desk and once again they were all out. You would think they would increase their stockpiles. Happened in November also. Preferred it the way it was before Expedia but it is what it is I guess. Great great place to stay

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This past trip was my 11th time to Honolulu. I have stayed in a variety of places in Waikiki and this is one of the best especially for families. The hotel isn't very old as the Beach Walk was only developed about 8 years ago. The hotel is well maintained and very well organized.We arrived quite late (almost midnight) and was greeted by Miles who was very helpful. I had checked in online and chosen my room via the Hilton Honors app but the only rooms available for me to choose for my category (1 King bed Oceanview) were rooms next to the elevator. I asked Miles if there was anything else closer to the corner as recommended by many reviews. He would look into it as the rooms roll over, overnight and would leave me a voicemail if he could find something.We proceeded up to the room and spent the night in the room to the left of the elevators when looking at the elevators. You could definitely hear a bit of elevator noise but I never found it to be annoying. It was noted that the property was changing out some of the rolling parts of the elevator to quieter parts as they've noted the previous comments. The only thing that is a bit annoying about this room is that the elevator shafts do take up part of the room so you do get reduced space.Upon waking up I saw the message light flashing and Miles had indeed found us a room away from the elevator. And, we ended up getting 1630 which is the corner room.This room has two lanais. One facing the ocean and the Halekulani and the Outrigger Reef. The other faces the Trump and the pool and Grand Lanai below. The room is very spacious with a nice sitting area and wet bar when you first walk in and the bedroom is quite large with the adjoining washroom. I was there with my wife and my 15 and 12 year old sons. It was a good amount of room for 4 of us which is what I was looking for in an all suite hotel. Everything worked very well and it was well maintained and clean.The service was also very good at this hotel as evidenced by our front desk reception. But, also the cleaning staff and the staff that run the bars and food service.Included in the price of the hotel is a made to order breakfast each morning and a manager's reception. The made to order breakfast is excellent and we took advantage of it each day. Even the omelette line moves quickly given the demand. And, it was nice to be able to sit in the open to eat.The manager's reception is also a nice perk with some light snacks and free drinks. On many of the nights they had a live band that was also very good.The parking is valet and costs $35 a night. The valets were always very quick so don't worry about waiting for your car to get to you.Just another note, this is one of the hotels that does not have a resort fee so remember that when you see how much the hotel costs. That and the other added benefits makes this one of the best hotels I've stayed at in Waikiki. We would definitely return.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Pros: Central location in Waikiki, great breakfast buffet with omelet bar, efficient check-in, friendly staff , evening reception for guests, just across the street from the beach, business center with several computers. Cons: Band music during evening reception can be loud and overwhelming, very small fitness center that makes you feel claustrophobic.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I stayed here for two weeks this month, and was very comfortable. The first room I checked into was on the 2nd floor right next to the elevator. There was no lanai, and it felt cramped. I requested a room change, and they were able to move me to the 4th floor next to the elevator. This is NOT the place you want to be if noise bothers you, as I heard kids running in the hallway and the elevator going pretty often. Noise doesn't bother me much, so I was content.The rooms are modern, spacious and clean. Beds are comfortable. I've stayed in rooms all around the world, and this one is definitely a notch above most as far as the room goes. The made to order breakfast was wonderful, as were the complimentary drinks every evening. This hotel is in a great location. Close to the beach, plenty of dining and shopping options.The valet parking is expensive, but normal for Waikiki ($35/day). I wasn't overly impressed with the friendliness of the front desk staff, but the bell hops and valet guys were great! Highly recommend this hotel, and would not hesitate to come back to it for business or with my family.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel is in a really good location for restaurants and shopping. The staff is accommodating and the rooms are clean. The only thing I dislike is that the closest beach isn't the best, soyou have to walk about 15 minutes to get to the better beach areas.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Roomy, very clean suite. We did not pay for a rm. with a view but suite 1427 had a view of the ocean from both verandas. The pool/hot tub was large and lovely. The included breakfast was amazing. I had a salmon/onion/ egg white omelet cooked to order everyday. The free drinks were not skimpy on the liquor. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The Only negative was the food with the liquor (only pretzels, potato chips and carrots) was not up to the high standards that they otherwise set.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Just got back from 8 nights...the hotel staff was very outgoing,pleasant and went out of their way to make our stay an outstanding experience...room was spacious,a little noisy near the elevator,but they are in the process of fixing that..full breakfast every a.m. and managers cocktail reception every p.m., were two of the highlights....everyone was super friendly,beach access was a mere 3minute walk across the street...the beach walk shopping area is a mixture of shops,bars and restaurants and its right outside the hotel..the concierge,Ben P.,was the best,he will make sure your stay is well planned..not a big pool,but your there because of the beautiful sandy ocean,planning a return,and will stay there

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: First the people here are great! So nice and so accommodating. Congrats to the hotel for the consistently great staff.Having said that, this hotel is like most of the properties ive been in in the Waikiki area. Definitely has a 60s vibe and that's part of the product offered in Waikiki. Not many big glass towers here. The property location itself is tough to get to...you will spend considerable amount of time in traffic getting to and leaving the property. There are two elevators for the Aloha tower and three for the hula tower. The elevators in the aloha tower are very fast.It is not beach front and beach view generally consists of a glimpse of ocean between two high rise condos.The rooms are very clean, the beds are comfortable and water pressure is good. The internet was free for diamond members and was also very fast. Again definitely a 60s vibe but that is consistent with other hotels I have stayed in in Waikiki.Upon check in I was given suite 1809 and informed by the very nice front desk attendant that I had been "upgraded" to an ocean view room. The reality was this is one of the smaller rooms in the property Like all the 09 tier rooms in the aloha tower, the living room lost half of its space owing to the fire exit stairs at the end of the building and the ocean view was a silver of blue between two massive condo towers. The primary view off the balcony was the tail end of a 40 story condo which was about 30 yards off my balcony. The rest of the view is a nondescript streetscape. I had to keep the drapes closed for the times I wanted privacy. In the evening with the room lights on in your room you will have an audience of 100 plus people who can easily see into your room.The bathroom door is right off of the bed in the bedroom so beware if you have a friend sharing situation you will have to deal with the bathroom traffic and smellsSo that's what I have observed. Hope this helps others when they plan their stay.I rated the location low only because I had to travel to downtown and the airport for work so had to use a car. Pedestrians will fare much better. Vehicular traffic in the Waikiki area is very bad

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great hotel, great service. One of the best embassy suites I've been. Probably the best. Close to restaurants, beach and night life place. Arrived very early and still got a room for me to put my stuff. Very helpful staff.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We arrived in the hotel at 10:30 PM to find out we were upgraded to a partial view room. We had a early morning tour next day so didn't have time to enjoy the view or the free drinks in the afternoon.The upgrade was to a room behind the elevators so the noise from the equipment was loud. Not really happy but we solved the problem by turning the A/C fan on.The hotel is very nice and the staff very friendly and helpful.Location is great.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Traveling with a family can be costly. The beautiful breakfast served and the evening snacks and cocktails really helped our budget!! The room was very spacious with great views. Our air quality in the room was the best we have ever experienced in a hotel. We played hard sun up to sun down and then had awesome rest to start over again the next day. Would stay there again if ever back in Waikiki Beach area!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great location, clean comfortable rooms would return any time they were working on the elevators and although posted it was noisy during the day time only.This sometimes made waiting from 19th floor during the day.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is our third visit to Embassy Suites Hotel in Honolulu. We wil be returning. Our stay was excellent in all aspects....from the time of arrival to when we left. The hotel is lovely, the staff is helpful and welcoming. We highly recommend staying at the Embassy Suites. And the location is perfect.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We were a family of 5 on our first trip to Oahu. We arrived at 10am hoping to leave our luggage until we could check in but, we were able to check in immediately. Staff were always polite & friendly. The included breakfast was a stress free way to start the day with plenty of variety. The fresh fruit, yoghurt & my personal favorite, made to order omelettes were a highlight for our family. The managers reception at night was great fun too. The kids enjoyed the pool and making new friends while we kicked back and enjoyed the atmosphere, it was a nice way to end each evening!! The location was ideal. We were close to the beach, shopping, public transport & nice restaurants. Our 7 night stay here was money well spent!! We will recommend this hotel to everyone as we share our holiday highlights! Looking forward to coming back in the future!!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Recommend this hotel for families vacationing in Waikiki. Can't beat the location and value. The hotel is close to everything that you would want to experience with a family. The breakfast is great. The staff is welcoming and dedicated to customer service.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Best Breakfast, entertainment, service. Very clean, staff cannot help you enough. Linda Lacaran in reservations is great & cleaning staff also, very happy, we do not what to stay anyplace else on Beach.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I'm impressed that every single staff person I encountered at this hotel was very friendly. In such a touristy and busy urban area, it can't be easy to keep good staff like that. We stayed in a 2-bedroom unit with my in-laws on a quick visit to Oahu to see Pearl Harbor. The location is very convenient to the beach and plentiful shops and restaurants if you are without a car. A note if you are taking an early morning tour: breakfast starts at 6:30 - if you need to leave before that, make a reservation well in advance for a takeout breakfast. We tried to get a takeout breakfast the evening we checked in and were told we were too late. Have to say I was kind of disappointed that the breakfast buffet was fairly typical of any other Embassy Suites. I was expecting a profusion of tropical fruit, this being Hawaii, but there was just the standard melon-and-pineapple on offer (though there was miso and rice for folks of Asian culinary persuasion). A quibble - we were four people staying in a 2-bedroom suite, but there were only enough coffee and tea supplies for two people, which we did not notice until morning. The staff did, of course, remedy the situation as soon as we brought it to their attention. I downgraded the sleep quality because of street noise. Even though we were on an upper floor, I was still disturbed by partiers on the street in the evening. Then there was the early-morning awakening from street construction. BANG!!! Chunks of concrete being loaded into a dump truck. Why do they have to start this before sunrise?? No fault of the hotel, but note that this is an urban area and street noise happens.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We chose the Embassy suites initially because there was to be four families and we needed one ADA room. When I first tried to make reservations in Jan. 2014 for our Christmas trip the Hilton website stated there were no rooms available, so we ended up using a wholesaler to book our rooms. Ended up with three families, one in an ADA room, a two bedroom suite and a one bedroom suite. The ADA room and two room suite had a great view of the air conditioning units of the hotel next door. The one bedroom suite (14th floor) had a nice view. The pool was great, the breakfast gets very busy but the staff was great. The shower in the ADA room was flat and water ran everywhere. The two rooms on the fourth floor received lots of street noise, especially at 6 am when trash and delivery trucks were making there rounds. Evening drinks and snacks were awesome. Close to lots of good restaurants and a short walk to the beach. When we checked out we found out that we received no Hilton Honor points since we had to use a wholesaler to book the rooms.
