I had experienced this problem with Hilton properties on several occasions. They seem to have lots of rules that limit you ability to receive Hilton points.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed with my parents (aged 60+) for 4 nights of a weeklong trip to the islands. After many delays from the icy midwest, staff was friendly and I had no problems checking in late. Highlights:Morning breakfast: good selection and the omelette chefs(esp John) were wonderful. Minor issues, the coffee could be a bit stronger and the juices more interesting, but we loved having breakfast on the patio. free Morning yoga: loved it! Very easy paced class taught in both English and Japanese. Great way to start the day, especially since the time change will probably have you up anyway. Pool/hot tub: no complaints, bar available in the afternoon, lots of sunny and shady spots to relaxBeach:one block walk. This section of the beach is busy but feels lovelyArea: the beach walk shopping area has lots of restaurants, some chains, some not, but generally high quality. Fancy shopping just around the corner. Managers reception: how could you ask for more? Free drinks from friendly bartenders legit, a few snacks, and an AWESOME band. Seriously, I loved them! They had a huge repertoire of brand new songs and classics. A highlight, especially after a couple of busy days of activities. Room: bigger than the last embassy suites I stayed in, partial ocean view that you didn't have to be a contortionist to enjoy, free wi fi, friendly housekeeping. Secure as card keys are required for each floor. Valet and bell desk services were so helpful and incredibly knowledgeable about the area/directions etc. I really loved our stay at this hotel. We felt so comfortable, the amenities make staying here a no brainer. I would recommend it to anyone!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: From the valet service to registration to the housekeeping staff, everyone practiced Aloha!The most chance for staff interaction however occurs with the dining room staff. Gary and Lei in particular were pleasant, helpful and over the top with advise in a respectful and non intrusive way. Lei you helped us plan our days so much, your smile is infectious and your snowman made us miss home, not really! Thanks for sharing your knowledge of both Oahu and Maui, thanks for sharing about yourself and taking an interest in us. We miss you

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: When I and my friend were checking in this hotel, the employee must gave us a welcome drink, it was really nice work to make both of us feel cool down. Also, they give us a free upgrade room for two of us in the two bedroom, we were really grateful of it. When everything was great, we found little things which are the same as other Emberssy suite hotel, we saw a hair above of the pillow which is not below to us. Ok, it's small things not real bothering us, we still enjoy the evening cocktail. Every servers were giving us a big smile whenever we have a eyes contact. However, we did house cleaning on third day when we stayed in this hotel. We found they didn't change the sheet, this is a third days,how come! And we found many hair on the tub, table, bad and etc. This is not a hotel cost $300 per night should do. I hope they could change this part and I would like give five star of my stay. The breakfast was real nice to keep me away to think what should I get in the morning. ( by the way, this is not about the hotel but part of. We ask a shuttle from hotel to airport, never ever do this, if u want a save life. The lady who ride us to airport with a horrible driving hobbit, she never look road and continue pick up the phone and write something while she drive. Many times I felt we are get into an accident. Also, I help the hotel manager see this review and change the shuttle company.)

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This embassy suites has it all and right in the heart of the city. Friendly efficient service. Clean and well maintained from the rooms to the pool. Lovely views of the city and ocean. Access to the ocean, parks, gardens, and shopping all right outside the door. We relaxed and refreshed for the weekend.
user_location: Thousand Islands New York, New York

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Hotel is only blocks away from the beach, Daily Breakfast and Nightly Happy Hour was great for a chance for the family to have a quick snack before trying to book 8 at a bistro or sushi bar. It was a family vacation and had so many choices for the kids, which made it relaxing for Mom and Dad. As we do Cruises, we are used to the floor service, however never have I seen the floor staff help so quickly from a request to get extra soap to a special service time for the room to not disturb anyone's mid-day nap. Parking service, Bell Hop, Front Desk ALL helpful on everything, Restaurants within 100 feet of the hotel on every side. PF Changs, Yardhouse for some of the Chain Restaurants, and certainly some of the local places that you will seen in some of my other reviews. You can pass this place up if travelling with a family.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The location was great for walks in both directions and for beaches, the park, and restaurants. We loved the breakfasts each morning. It was a buffet but good choices, usually hot food, and two omelet stations where lineups usually were not long and the omelets and eggs done nicely. We also enjoyed the late afternoon drinks and snacks, with a band that played lively (but not raucous) music three times a week. The room was very nice and clean. The only snag we had was that our room was by the elevator, so we could hear the elevator noise each night though we got used to the rhythms. The staff were friendly and helpful. Overall, we had a great stay and would not hesitate to go back assuming the price was reasonable.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Just stayed here for a short 3 night getaway from the cold of Iowa. Absolutely loved the hotel location, staff, and hospitality. Check-in was smooth and comfortable, and friendly. The room was spacious, with a nice view overlooking the bustling night life below, and a small ocean view. Amazing breakfast is included, with a super friendly staff always available to help out. The managers reception every night is great, with a nice selection of free beers, cocktails, wine, soda, juice, and finger snacks, and a fun band a few nights a week playing sing a long music. Warning - be careful. The drinks are not watered down and weak - they will bite you. The only negative thing I could say is that the room we were in had double beds, instead of queen size. I'm not sure if that's standard throughout as we booked last minute (airline employee going standby). It was tight sleeping with 5 of us (1 took the pullout couch).There is so much shopping and restaurants in the immediate vicinity (I recommend Giovanni Pastrami's for New York pizza), you never worry about having to walk to far to dinner after a long beach day. And the beach is only 1 - 2 blocks away as well.I'm going to end on a real positive note. I had forgotten my Ipad in our room. When I boarded the plane home, I realized this. I was hoping it was packed away in my checked luggage. It wasn't. The next morning, I received a call from house-keeping that they had found it and turned it in. I guarantee that wouldn't happen everywhere. They were kind enough to take down all my information and deliver it to the UPS store on property, and I will be receiving it next week. So kudos to the good, honest, hard working house keeping staff. And finally along with that, the 2 or 3 times we called for supplies (toilet paper, towels, etc.), it was delivered within 10 minutes to our room, which is fantastic.We will be back for sure.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The staff is what makes this such a great place to stay. Everyone from the bellman to the breakfast staff is there to make sure your stay is the best it can be. We had a two room suite on the 8th floor overlooking the water, so the view was great. The bedding was crisp, white, and the bed really comfortable. The breakfast buffet has a good variety of choices including a wonderful omelette station. We really enjoyed the evening music at the two hour open bar each evening, which is complimentary. From start to finish, our stay was first-rate.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed here for 8 days in February..,.was beyond our expectations! From our greeting at the front desk to the time we checked out, we were treated like ohana (family). Leimaile and Joanne, the concierge staff, were very helpful and knowledgeable in booking our tours. The breakfast staff was always friendly and had smiles on their faces. Breakfast buffet is amazing! Plenty of choices for all nationalities and food was fresh and delicious. Nice benefit as most hotels don't offer this option. Rooms were very clean and well-kept; housekeepers even smiled and said "Aloha" when passing them in the hallways. The only two issues were a slow drain in the tub, reported it to the front desk and within 10 minutes a maintenance man was there and fixed it. The second issue was our initial room was next to the elevator and the sound kept us awake the first two nights. The front desk was helpful in moving us to another room further away from the elevator. The manager's reception was also excellent - free beverages and snacks but even better was the live band and the opportunity to mingle with other guests. Location of the hotel is great; lots of shopping, restaurants and of course, the beach within a short walking distance. Difficult to find anything bad to say about this property; never encountered an unfriendly staff member and property was well-maintained. Will recommend to all our freezing friends.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We started our Hawaiian vacation at the Embassy Suites. We were immediately impressed with the friendly greeting and welcome refreshment. The valet parking and checkin process is simple. Upon arrival in our room we enjoyed the view from our 21st floor balcony of the city and ocean. The breakfast buffet with omelet stand and evening reception are exceptional adds. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. Waikiki beach access is close by with many options available. The biggest surprise was access to Beachwalk which has everything imaginable. No doubt we will be back. Perfect experience.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was our first time staying in the main part of Waikiki. The hotel is perfectly located in walking distance to all the shops, restaurants and beach. From the moment we checked-in we were met with friendly and welcoming staff, the room exceeded our expectations with two views, mountain and ocean views, well maintained by maid service and no noise heard from other guests or the bustling roads below us. The complimentary daily breakfast and evening drinks/canapes reception was a nice touch. Would definitely stay there again and recommend to others.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here for two nights while visiting Pearl Harbor. The two bedroom suite was spacious and perfect. The location, right by the breach and great shopping, couldn't be beat.The breakfast buffet was one of the best I've had for a hotel like this. It was great and convenient.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: There are so many outstanding things to say about this hotel, but first and foremost, it has the most helpful, congenial staff I've ever encountered. Everyone, from the bell men, to the registration staff, to the housekeepers, to the wait staff, were just superb. Friendly and efficient. The breakfast buffet is plentiful, and there's never a wait for tables, even during peak time. The pool area is pleasant, and there are plenty of chairs available. Sit on the west side for morning sun, In addition, the location is great. Lots of restaurants in walking distance, and the beach is only a block away. I would absolutely return.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Within minutes you can be at the beach or shopping upscale stores. This facility is clean and the employees are extremely helpful. Rooms have just been redecorated and are comfortable. Breakfast is good and comes with the room as well as a manager reception with local music. It's well worth the stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This property is one of the best I have ever stayed in the service was excellent the location very central to everything we wanted to do , a little more expensive than I planed but when you consider the accomodation was amazing we were on the 17th floor,large rooms comfortable queen beds good size bathroom excellent views from our balcony the pool area was beautiful also included was full buffet breakfast and in the afternoon 5.30 till 7.30 happy hour with full bar menu and buffet snack absolutely no cost at all the best value for money after all had a fantastic 4 day stay

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The Embassy Suites is my choice to say weather I am home in the U.S. or traveling away such as in Hawaii. A full breakfast in the morning to start my day and a evening relaxing time at the cocktail hours. This is a hotel for families.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I have stayed in a few hotels in this area, and I really enjoyed this Embassy Suites location. My mother and I went to celebrate her retirement, and although she was off, I still needed to work (albeit remotely). The internet in this hotel worked very well and was high speed. Our suite was perfect since it had a bedroom separate from the other "living" area which was great. I was able to work very early in the morning, and my Mom couldn't hear me being on conference calls. The beds here are very comfortable. We had a suite with 2 double beds that were so comfortable, I didn't even miss my bed at home. The breakfast buffet here they have is good with an omelet station, either french toast, pancakes or waffles each day, eggs, japanese soups, etc., cereal and a decent selection. Since it was included in the price of our room, this really helped us save money on our trip. Also, if you're a Loyalty member, they have a nice Manager's reception daily, and music on several nights a week as well. The bartenders were very friendly and generous with their pours (please make sure you remember to tip them even though the drinks are free :-)) This also helped us save money during our trip, since on those nights we weren't too hungry, a few veggies, light snacks and a drink hit the spot. This hotel is in a great location, within walking distance of many, many restaurants and great shops. Since it is a busy part of Waikiki, I recommend that you request a room on a higher floor, as that really helps to avoid a lot of the noise. We stayed on the 19th floor and I didn't hear much at night or in the morning at all with the windows closed. The balconies are VERY small though... I am afraid of heights, so didn't venture out there much but there was a great breeze coming through leaving the window open. Good news in this hotel, at least on our floor, our room was right by the elevator and we also never even heard it. Our room didn't really have too much of an ocean view, but that was OK because in Waikiki, there is always something else to do. We could walk to the beach in just a few minutes.All of the staff here were very friendly and accommodating. I would stay here again, with the breakfast included in my room, comfy beds and great location, it is a very good deal.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was our fourth trip to Ohau, and our second stay at the Embassy Suites. I can't imagine a better place to stay! The accommodations were clean, comfortable, and all newly renovated. You could not ask for a better breakfast, and the evening reception was a nice bonus, although we do not drink alcoholic beverages. There were plenty of options for soft drinks, coffee, and tea. I would not consider staying anywhere else in Waikiki. Our stay was perfect. Parking is rather expensive, $35 a night, but we knew this before we came. Valet service was excellent. We were even given lessons on operating our rental car. They were familiar with folding back seats in the van, etc.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: As others have noted the location, the staff, the breakfasts, and "happy hour" were all terrific. But be aware that suites are not always as described. I checked in on-line to what was described as a king suite only to find it was actually a double bed in a very small bedroom. Having arrived at midnight we just collapsed into the bed for the night and were given another room in the morning, but rooms should be accurately described, and doubles should not be charged at the same rate as kings. Be aware also that suites with king beds are mostly by the elevator so you get a lot of rumble rumble creak ding ding throughout the night. If that is a problem make sure you let them know and take double beds.Only other caveat is don't plan on using the pool for swimming - way too many children, but there are comfy loungers for us adult types.On a more positive note, the hotel guests comprised a very nice mix of age and ethnicity which created a happy relaxed atmosphere-- much nicer than a regular business Hilton or a crazy busy resort. Hope to return.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: When travelling with my children, we often opt for Embassy suites and are generally very satisfied with out choice. I would not stay at this hotel again, I think it likely serves a purpose for many people and was clean in general but our reservation requests were not met and in addition we a small family with young children were placed in a room next to a group of young males who spent their time smoking and swearing so we could not use our balcony and could not use the room that shared a wall with them. And on our second and last night there, we were woken by the people in the room on the other side when their alarm clock went off a 5am. The walls are apparently thin and we got to listen to them from 5am until they left their room at 8am. As usual the breakfast was nice. The location is great for getting around to shopping and dining and close to bus routes. However, as I stated, I do not think I would stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Can't beat this hotel for Waikiki. It is one block from the beach and located on the Beach Walk where there is hundreds of shops and restaurants at your doorstep. Staff was excellent. Rooms seemed newly refurnished. Good pool area. Plus you get all the goodness of the normal Embassy Suites adventure (2 room suite, grand breakfast, evening cocktails/snacks, Hilton points). Also free entertainment on select evenings at the happy hour.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I've stayed at this property roughly a dozen times now. Each time, its been a great experience. Great staff, rooms are very comfortable, solid happy hour, and top notch breakfast. All of this at a fair price for the Waikiki area. Close to great food and just a few minutes off the beach. If you can, try for the 17th floor or higher. The view is worth it!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My son and I decided to do staycation in Waikiki since it is both our birthday month in February. We needed a room with suite, kitchenette, view, and within our budget. Embassy Suites just perfected our expectations and wishes. With its excellent service, newly renovated, wonderful amenities, in the heart of Waikiki - this is an absolute place to stay. Thank you to its wonderful staffs, from reservations down to housekeeping, all A+. Aloha! Josie and Marvin

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Loved this hotel!* Warm welcome and drink on arrival* Great location, right in the heart of Waikiki shops and restaurants* Roomy Suite (2 double beds and a double sofa bed in the living area - Ideal for a family of 4 with older kids & 2 TV's. Microwave and fridge and dining table* Evening drinks (cost of a tip only), and snacks and live music (every other night)* Helpful information desk for booking tours, cars and obtaining directions* Great housekeeping staff - Rooms spotlessly clean and once they realised that there were 4 of us in the suite we received generous supply of bathroom toiletries and receiving and hand written note to thank us for leaving a tip was very nice* Nice buffet breakfast with made to order omelettes and eggs and a good variety of dishesThere is nothing I would change about Embassy suites and I will be staying here again and I can't wait!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: For comparison, I've stayed in the Hilton Hawaiian Village, the Ala Moana, the Sheraton and the Hyatt, and this was by far my favourite stay. While not inexpensive, if travelling with a family the additional room in these large suites makes a big difference to enjoyment. Even if not, that extra space really changes the hotel experience. Check in was courteous and prompt; we arrived early and a room was not ready, but they gave us pool towels and a key to go to the pool. We enjoyed a drink, watched the superbowl, and had something to eat while we waited. We were treated to a partial ocean view room (I am Hilton Gold so not sure if that was it) even though I had booked city view.The hotel is very conveniently located. It's one block from the beach (public access is well signed) and has a very nice, large pool area with a bar adjacent. The kids really liked it. The hotel is located just off the main Honolulu strip, so it's easy to get into the nearby mall etc. The mall is a short $10 cab ride or there's the bus nearby as well. Breakfast which is included is complete in every way I can think of, including cooked to order eggs. They also have some Miso Soup and rice out, should you prefer that. There is the standard Embassy Suites managers reception, but the timing never worked for us so I couldn't comment on it.I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel over all the others I've stayed at, and expect this to be our preferred choice in the future.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We are a family of 4 and booked a 2 room suite. We were given a 16th Floor room which had great views. We were lucky to have a view of Diamond Head. The 2 room suite was great for 4 of us. They say it can house up to 6 people but I feel it would probably be a bit tight for 6 unless they are small children. The coffee machine in the room was a nice touch. The rooms were very clean and the cleaning maid went out of her way to make sure we had everything we needed. The Embassy is about the only hotel in Waikiki which includes breakfast. The omelettes were really lovely and fresh as they cook them in front of you with fresh ingredients that you choose.The rest of the breakfast was really average. The staff were very attentive.The cocktails at night was such a bonus. And 3 nights a week they have a band playing while you enjoy your cocktails. The band was fantastic. It was a lot of fun. As Waikiki is quite expensive for drinks and food the complimentary Cocktails, nibbles and breakfast made this hotel the best value in Waikiki in my opinion. The location is very central, only a block from the beach and lots of shops and a ABC store just opposite is very handy. The pool area was also very lovely. It was not too hard getting a seat beside the pool compared to other resorts I have stayed at.There didn't appear to be people reserving chairs with towels and leaving them for long periods unoccupied. The pool staff seemed to keep on top of it if this was happening. Would stay again in a heart beat.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great hotel in the heart of a great place to stay, stayed here before and will again. Very close to the best places to eat and enjoy the beach, staff very friendly and always great to enjoy the managers reception at night. Great hotel in the heart of a great place to stay, stayed here before and will again. Very close to the best places to eat and enjoy the beach, staff very friendly and always great to enjoy the managers reception at night.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: From the moment we arrived to celebrate our 24th Anniversary we were warmly greeted by Kenny, who brought us to the front desk, where we were given a refreshing drink. (delish)At this point I knew this would be good..Andy checked us in and he was friendly, courteous and professional. We were given an upgraded room along with best wishes for our anniversary celebration. (awesome!) The room was magnificent, with a view of Diamondhead and Waikiki beach!!The breakfast in the morning was superb and very tasty.The managers reception was complete with drinks, snacks and the baddest band on Oahu, whom serenaded my bride and I as we danced under the beautiful starlit sky!We dreamed about this trip for sometime and this experience exceeded our dreams !Thanks and gratitude to Bob (the GM) and to the entire staff at the Embassy Suites Waikiki...A heartfelt Mahalo!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My husband and I are fans of the Embassy Suites chain and are Hilton MVP members. He booked here a few weeks after I gave birth to our daughter as an overnight getaway to relax. As always, I wasn't let down. We definitely enjoyed our stay. This was the first managers reception that I've been to that's provided entertainment. Mind you, I've stayed in the Embassy Suites in multiple states and countries. The band was amazing! The margaritas were delicious and the snacks as well. Breakfast as always was AMAZING! The staff during breakfast was very friendly and attentive. We actually just booked another staycation here for next month for 4 days. Unfortunately the room we want wasn't available. Hopefully we get lucky on check in and it is....

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at this property twice in December, en route to Sydney and on our return - totaling 7 nights. This was the ideal place to stay for several nights each way to recharge from a long flight and enjoy the beautiful resort area near Waikiki Beach. Spreading out in a suite is always a preferred option to doubling up in two beds in a room, or spending on two hotel rooms. The service and staff were well organized, professional and very friendly. Buffet breakfast is included in the room price and was a big bonus so that we could leisurely go downstairs to eat and start the kids favorite part of their day, which was swimming in warm hotel pool. The pool was actually a highlight of our stay as it has a shallow swimming area for the babies/toddlers or kids just learning to swim, as well as a large area for better kid swimmers. And for the parents, a huge hotub pool that was attached where you could easily relax while watching your kids in the pool. They were also flexible about letting the kids come into the hot tub, which both of our kids enjoyed for brief periods. And the best part - the pool was always warm and had night swimming, which became part of the daily routine. The hotel interior is clean, nothing fancy, but again, worth it for having a suite with kids. It could use a refurbishment but that would probably drive the price up quite a bit and I would rather have this as an affordable family option for the spacious rooms. I would recommend asking for an upgrade to the larger suite, which really had considerable more space than the standard. We got lucky the first visit but for the return they were completely sold out, as expected, for the peak Xmas season.Location of this hotel is perfection. Steps from the beach and in the heart of outstanding shopping and restaurants. This is the ideal family hotel and we would absolutely come again on our next (and hopeful trip) to Honolulu!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Check in was quick, efficient and our room was upgraded. Room was large (accommodated four adults very easily), clean and well appointed. Facilities in the hotel were also very good - complementary WIFI, buffet breakfast and evening drinks with live band playing covers from the past 30 years. Pool was surprisingly quite and, again, very clean. Most of all, staff were very helpful and friendly. We are returning in a week so I hope our second experience is just as good as this one.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was the cleanest hotel I have stayed at in a long time. The public areas were always spotless and the breakfast and managers receptions were excellent. The hotel in a great location, just minutes away from the beach and around lots of shopping area.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Overall, a great hotel in a prime Waikiki location. Staff were quite friendly and helpful. Room smelled musty upon entering, left the fan running continuously to combat this. Fitness room with good and functional equipment. Would recommend this hotel to others.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Embassy Suites was perfect for out over night in Honolulu. The location is right near the beach for me, and my husband had a very nice exploration on foot in the city. Nice balconies, plenty of room to spread out, in the suite. We enjoyed the great breakfast in a hurry as we were heading off to Pearl Harbor. We would stay here again for sure.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great room with great service. Very central location and the buffet breakfast and the free cocktails (early evening were great). The staff here were fantastic and the room and hotel and amenities were clean and well functioning. Has all you need in a stay because you are out most days. Great value

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Embassy suites was our first stop on our recent 3 week holiday in Hawaii, after our flight from Australia. I actually booked 2 nights to ensure w could check-in and catch some ZZZ's after arriving at 6am.The rooms are comfortable and what we needed for really only one night before we headed off on the POA cruise, you see a lot of reviews where people hope to get in early, but booking the extra night meant we got our room at 8am, had breakfast and them a quick snooze whilst our teenage daughter lazed around the pool.Comfortable Hotel rooms in a great location

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We are familiar with this brand of Hilton hotels and have stayed in several Embassy Suites before. They are very comfortable for families. This one was by far the most expensive one (more than the NYC one) that we stayed in but that's Honolulu for you! It is certainly a comfortable place and although it was a bit more expensive than Hilton Hawaiian Village where we stayed at the end, the included breakfast and evening drinks make it a good choice if it's more than 2 of you. It is right bang in the middle of everything so it's an easy stroll to the beach and only a few minutes walk from Kalakaua Avenue with all the shops, restaurants, etc. The breakfast was very nice, a couple of egg stations with hard working guys making omelettes (but not getting tipped much, unlike bartenders in the evening who were getting A LOT of tips!). Perhaps they too should have displayed some dollar bills around (like the bartenders) to hint :-)...Coffee was rubbish though - really weak, but that's more to do with the way Americans like it, I think. I would say that the only other disappointing thing was that the (rather small pool) was always full of kids splashing around and I was (during our 4 day stay) never able to swim a length without having a kid in the way. It would have been nice if there was a time/ an hour or so allocated for adults only or if at least one section was cordoned off for just adults. This is certainly a family oriented hotel with a majority of guests from Japan. (A lot of signage in Japanese and even early morning yoga class was conducted in both Japanese and English).

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Top notch experience. Excellent customer service. The hotel was neat and clean. The room was nice, clean, and quiet (even though it was right next to the elevators). Excellent view. Happy hour and breakfast buffet were a welcoming bonus to our stay. Location is near happening locations in Waikiki making it a great place for a "staycation" or vacation!! Thank you Embassy Suites.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Very disappointed on opening door to room 102 to find we had no balcony. Room was very dark and not at all what I was expecting after seeing the beautiful photos on hotel website. No floor to ceiling windows. Very dark and disappointing.The first night was very noisy with kids in the room next door but after that the room was relatively quiet (apart from the 5am rubbish truck wake up call each morning).The room itself was adequate, clean and well stocked with towels and toiletries. Bed was comfortable.As stated by others, this hotel is in a good location, close to shops, restaurants and beach.The Expedia concierge at the hotel organized an enterprise car rental for us to pick up across the road at the Outrigger Reef and we were able to drop this back at the Embassy Suites after hours (compact car, 1 day, $80 (+$40 insurance) ).Breakfast at the hotel was OK (omelettes were very nice).Evening reception, great drink selection and food was nice for a quick snack.All in all this was an OK hotel - only let down by the unrealistic glossy brochure type website. What you see is not necessarily what you get!I feel the ratings on this hotel are dependant on the room that you get….had we been given a decent room it would have been given 5 stars, with the average room we were given it gets an average rating of 3.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My husband and I visited Oahu for the first time in January 2015 and I blindly booked this hotel. Winner! This hotel exceeded my expectations! Excellent personable staff! Comfortable suite! Great location-just steps from the beach, shopping, and well known restaurants such as PF Changs and Cheesecake Factory! Our favorite part was the complimentary breakfast bar with cooked to order eggs/omlets and the Manager's Reception in the evening that included complimentary snacks, cocktails, and a wonderful band who played classic tunes as well as top pop songs with a unique sound. The entertainment made up of a Hawaiian father and his 3 sons (one of which was a master on the ukulele!) This hotel is also moments away from the Fort Derussy museum which was a huge perk for my military husband. Very pleased with this hotel!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Had a wonderful 8 night stay at this fantastic hotel. The Embassy Suites is in a great location and the service and value for money is outstanding. We loved everything about this hotel from the rooms, the pool and spa, the breakfast and the evening reception and importantly the staff. Would recommend this hotel to any family. Really felt like a home away from home. The buffet breakfast and evening reception are two features of this hotel that I think make it stand out from other hotels. You got to know the staff and we were made to feel so welcome.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Wow, so glad we found Embassy Suites for our stay after finishing our cruise on Pride of America! Clean, spacious and convenient to shops and beach. Much nicer than beachfront hotel we stayed in before our cruise. Highly recommend and wish I'd found sooner!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The internet connection was poor, kept dropping off and at times we couldn't receive WiFi at all in our room. Apart from that, our stay was absolutely perfect. Special gratitude to the warm and friendly help from the doormen, bellmen, reception staff and most particularly the delightful housekeeping staff. We spent three night at Embassy Suites, then moved to the Hawaiian Hilton Village for four nights. After just one night at that less than pleasant hotel, we checked out, phoned you and asked if we could return to Embassy Suites for the rest of our stay. We were even given our same room-929. How lovely! Your hotel is in a great location and provides a quiet, intimate setting in midst of the bustle of Waikiki. I needed a late check-out for January 29th and was provided a most generous offer for a very reasonable rate. We will be back! My daughter and I look forward to future stays at Embassy Suites. The children agree. It was difficult to have leave your clean, warm pool, even to eat the delicious food served poolside. Congratulations! The staff at Embassy Suites know how to make a vacation the very best it could be. With gratitude for all you do - Judith MacKay

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at this hotel over the Christmas Holiday and we had a great experience.  The breakfast is one of the better ones that I've experienced even when compared to properties across Asia where they can get quite elaborate.  The evening reception was always enjoyable - the snacks are not suitable for a substitute for dinner, but the complimentary cocktails and live music were great. The rooms were nicely equipped and the beds very comfortable. The pillows weren't to everyone's liking in our family - some found them too soft. The hotel is relatively easy to get in & out of if you drive - it's just off the very busy Waikiki beach road - so you get slightly less traffic. Only downside is the elevator capacity is pretty limited. 2 banks per building - and during busy times we'd sometimes get frustrated and walk down 10 flights of stairs vs waiting longer than the 5 minutes we'd already wasted. One night the people above decided to have a jumping competition or something to cause a lot of banging around 10PM - it subsided around 30 min later and when we called the front desk the next day - they asked us to let them know if it happened again and were very apologetic.Finally - the staff everywhere in the building were always so positive and helpful. Maybe it's because they live in HI, but they certainly made us feel great about our choice for a hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel has two towers- Aloha and Hula Tower. We initially had lvl 6 aloha which overlooked the busy street below. It was a tired room and noisy from airconditioning units and street noise. The lovely gentleman at reception moved us due to wrong bed configuration. We were moved to level 20 same building but it was next to the lift shaft in fact part of the room accommodates the lift shaft. The room was extremely tired, small and noisy with view being rooftops, back alleys and air conditioning units. Stay well away from the lifts. No balcony just tired windows that open 15cm or thereabouts. At 6am we approached reception who were very understanding and looked for another room. We ended up paying for an upgrade to get something decent. We were moved to the hula building lvl 17 ocean view. This tower was not as tired looking. We didn't expect street noise to be a problem but we were awoken very early each day by trucks collecting trash and truck reversing noises. Once we accepted the fact the view was worth the upgrade we opened the windows only to close them as the people next door were smoking! Sadly and I don't blame them but I think reception was hiding when we went and 'aired' our concerns!The location of the hotel is great and the people who work there are friendly. The swimming pool is small for the size of the hotel, and it is quite shallow. The free buffet breakfast was lovely especially the custom omelettes. Reception man at front desk was very kind and helpful.Probably the best part of the hotel are the included extras--breakfast Good selection of juices, omelet station, miso soup etc. So, The location is both good and badIf you're looking for a posh resort experience with an ocean view, spa, water features, beach, etc., definitely look elsewhere.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Loved Embassy suites! Had a bad experience at another property and had to make a last minute reservation here and so happy we did. Our room was 410. It had 2 queen beds and a separate living room with a pull out sofa. Our room was the same level as the pool and food area so it was very convenient. Loved the the Free daily breakfast! Made to order omelets , fruit, salads, bacon, rice.. you name it. After a long day sightseeing, it was nice to unwind during happy hour and get a free cocktail and snacks. Absolutely loved the location. It was 1 block from the beach and right in the middle of all the shopping and restaurants. Most of the stores didn't close until 10 o'clock at night. I didn't like the fact that we had to pay $35/day , but at least Wi-fi was free too. Laundry , gym and business office were all located on the 3rd floor. Would definitely come back.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was our first hotel of four on our recent trip to Hawaii. The junior suite was lovely, the view very nice, the breakfast better than most, and the drinks by the pool (manager's reception) in the evening very relaxing. There were many families enjoying themselves by the pool each day and at first I was concerned about the noise traveling at night but this turned out not be a concern.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was our first time at this property and we were very happy. The location was so great being in the heart of Waikiki, we enjoyed walking on the beach, going to the shops, Ruth's below, and able to catch the bus near by. We certainly enjoyed the Manager's Reception each night and Breakfast each morning, what a nice special way to treat your guests. Your staff members were all so friendly and helpful, they certainly enjoy their job and enjoy talking with the guests. We also had a partial ocean view/city view too; thank you for the early check in and to receive a higher level view room as requested. "A hui hou" (Until we meet again)

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed here with my family of 5. What a great place, the staff are very accommodating and really nice people. The rooms are clean and spacious. 2 separate rooms, one with queen other with lounge and a sofa bed. And a mini kitchenette. The hotel has daily breakfast, this was delicious. The bonus was 5 pm free cocktail drinks, wow they are great. We went to Hawaii last from our USA adventure, this was the place where we can relax. This was so the case. This hotel is fantastic for families and it is near the beach, near restaurants, near everything. Great place, highly recommend.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We chose this hotel because it had a separate bedroom & living room arrangement. So nice for a ten day vacation! The first two nights, we were on the 11th floor near the elevators - a little noisy at times. We requested a top floor room and, based on other Trip Advisor reviews, asked for 2029 or 2030. We were lucky enough to get 2030!The room was clean, roomy, and king-sized bed was comfy. Two lanais overlooking Waikiki beach, although not very wide, provided great views. Small details: desks with lights, TVs and extra chairs in both rooms; shower head in bath is detachable; sink, micro, anf fridge all handy.The staff at this hotel are friendly, helpful and seem to like their jobs - great energy. Our chambermaid, Yuet Chun Liang, was super & helped immensely.It's a family oriented hotel so lots of kids in the pool - only downside if you're looking for a quieter type of vacation. Free breakfast is basic but good as long as you're there by 9:30 before some things run out. Bought my own peanut butter as theirs is 'fully hydrogenated' i.e. transfats - no biggie. All in all, a good choice.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great convenient location, excellent value for money. Our third stay at the hotel. Only minor issue is wifi is slow throughout the hotel. The all you can eat breakfast and manager's reception really top off the experience. Will definitely be returning.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our group of six spent the last 4 nights of our 11 night Oahu vacation at Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach Walk. I had e-mailed the hotel requesting that our 3 suites be on the same floor, as high up as possible. Upon checkin (one suite was ready early at 11:00) we were thrilled to all be assigned on the 20th floor of the Aloha Tower! The suites are spacious and views awesome. We were all happy with the complimentary breakfast and the managers reception (who cares if the drinks are in plastic cups? You are in the pool area which always serves drinks in non-breakable glasses but more importantly the drinks are FREE!!). We were all impressed by the staff. I can't remember the names of the Bell staff or housekeepers but they were all excellent and very friendly. Brandon at the front desk was so efficient and helpful! Both checkin and checkout were a breeze. Aldrin, a waiter at the breakfast buffet was an absolute joy. We tried to sit in his assigned section because he was always so friendly and helpful. The location of the resort cannot be beat. A short walk and you're on the beach, the front overlooks restaurants and food trucks and the back is attached to a food and shopping mall. We will definitely return.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Simple choice & why the Embassy, purely because of our first experience 4 years ago, it was truly excellent. That's why we chose the Embassy again this year and again the experience was truly excellent.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My wife booked this hotel to visit Hawaii for my 60th birthday which she notified the staff of and it was not acknowledged on the day, first time ever as we always travel on both of our birthdays.We were allocated the room that we booked which was on an upper floor away from the elevator which was clean and quite large with the 2 rooms but our first opinion was that the property especially the corridors was a little tired.Plenty of the guests were from Australia and many other countries besides the US but the television programs were for US guests and did not even have BBC news which has been in almost every hotel we have stayed in worldwide and the television basically showed US programs where most adverts were health care related which is a little sad when you are on a holiday. The breakfast though included was basic fare which we only ate twice due to it reminding us of a cafeteria and the swooping seagulls which were very annoying.Happy hours as have been previously commented on though free, were only visited a couple of times due to children running around and the soft plastic cups, we went to Roy's on the corner for evening cocktails due to fantastic ambience and drink quality.We have booked an adjacent hotel on the beach this year due to friends who were staying there at the same time by coincidence, and after seeing their hotel and their room though smaller it looked like a vacation hotel should as they have a dedicated bar and a couple of restaurants.I have made many Trip Advisor posts before so this is not a one off "just OK" post but this is a hotel for families with children and not couples in our opinion, though all of the staff were fantastic and nothing was a problem for them.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The layout of the Embassy Suites on the Waikki Beach Walk is unlike other Embassy's at which I have stayed. Personally, I prefer the Embassy's with the atrium at the center around which the rooms are placed. This hotel had two "towers." I was completely unhappy with the view our suite afforded, which was rooftops, back alleys, and workmen. The bedroom in our suite had some kind of "hump" under the carpeting that we tripped over every time we headed to the bathroom. The location of the hotel is great; the people who work there are friendly. The evening receptions were very average, as were the breakfasts, and they served the same offerings every day. The swimming pool is small for the size of the hotel, and it is a shallow water pool. While the staff was great, I won't be staying at this property again. For the price, I'm certain Oahu has better to offer.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our family of five had an amazing stay at the Embassy. When we first booked, we were given a room with three beds (including sofa) instead of four. This was promptly rectified by a lovely young gentleman at the front desk and we were in our new room the next morning. The new room also had a partial ocean view which was gorgeous! The free buffet breakfast was amazing - especially the custom omelettes. Loved the variety and always walked away satisfied. The free managers reception at night was also a hit and we LOVED the entertainment (the father and his three sons). Location is AMAZING. A few pathways right outside the hotel lead you straight into beach (less than a two minute walk). Everything else was also at our fingertips with restaurants and boutique stores right underneath one side of the hotel and all around it. Thank you for a wonderful stay, we'll be back!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed over the holiday period with a family of 6. Close to all amenities including the beach which is a 5 min walk across the street. Loved the breakfast buffet. Staff so friendly and helpful. Good start to the vacation pre-cruise.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I wanted to love this hotel as I did much research and was looking forward to our stay.ProsGreat location, very centralGreat breakfast, fresh and tastyGreat Managers reception, fantastic drinks and the band was so much funRoom very nice however not enough storage with 5 peopleStaff friendlyConsThe only downside was the very thin walls. Could hear everything in room next door, talking, sneezing etc. room above sounded like elephants walking around.Our room was on 8th floor and faced street, being so high I didn't expect street noise to be a problem but I was awoken very early each day by trucks collecting trash and the sound of breaking bottles was very loud.If you are a heavy sleeper this is an amazing hotel for you. If you are a light sleeper think twice.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Like other reviews suggested, this is a great hotel with great location. You can't beat free breakfast, and evening reception with free drinks. I give it 4 star because I am HHonors Diamond Member and didn't receive any recognition for being as such. Therefore if you have Gold or Diamond benefits, I would not recommend staying here and choose a hotel that gives recognition.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: From the great location to the cook-to-order breakfast to the hospitality the Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach Walk was fantastic. Walking distance to the places we went including Ala Moana Shopping Center.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is the greatest place. Not your usual Embassy Suites. Room very nice and staff great. The breakfasts are the best. So close to the shopping and restaurants. Nice Happy Hour cocktails. The bar at the pool is really great. Absolutely would stay here again. We were there for 10 days and wish it was much longer. Will definitely go back.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Very good value hotel, the rooms were nice and staff were very welcoming, giving us a choice between waiting for check in time for a higher level room, or check in early and stay near the bottom. We of course waited had a few drinks by the pool.This location is perfect walking distance to Waikiki beach and upstairs to many good restaurants and across the road from the main bus depot for all your tour needs :PReally enjoyed our stay thanks

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is the 3rd hotel that we have stayed on Waikiki Beach and it is the best.The staff are super helpful with anything you need.The location is right in the middle of all the activities on the beach.The free breakfast is really good and fresh with made to order omelets.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is our second time to stay here and we love it even more than the first time. Conveniently located and is within walking distance in proximity with shops, restaurants and the beach ! Full breakfast buffet that's inclusive with your stay and the suites (yes, all suites) are clean and well-appointed. Hotel staff is second to none! They genuinely want you to enjoy your vacation to the fullest and they take good care of each guest. That to me is what Ohana is about. We're always excited to go on trips but we love visiting Oahu and having Embassy Suites in our itinerary just makes things a lot easier for us as far as planning. We do look forward to the day when we come back and say Howzit to everyone !!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at the Hilton Hawaiian Village at the beginning of the week and wish we would have stayed here instead. We stayed here one night at the end of our vacation. The most amazing breakfast of any Embassy Suites we have ever been too. A lot of Asian options for the international tourists. Soda machine which I enjoy.Rooms were clean and decent sized. Very quiet. During the nightly reception the band is outstanding. After their show, guests were going up and shaking their hands and thanking them. They played everything from Gotye to Neil Diamond.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great hotel and staff... Have stayed here many times over the years and each time has been awesome. Great staff, rooms are nice, great location (it's in the middle of everything), managers special, hot breakfast, and much aloha!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: If you are looking for a great family place to stay...don't look any further, this is the place. The staff, and I mean everyone, are so friendly, courteous and sincere. They are always smiling and will go out of their way to ensure that you have a great time. The location is a convenient 3 minute walk to the beach and there are numerous shops and restaurants adjacent to the property. The place is meticulously clean and in very good repair. The best news is they offer free all you care to eat breakfasts, in fact I think they make some of the best omelettes I have ever had. The pool and whirlpool are spotless and so is the surrounding deck area. If you want a safe family friendly spot with nice cozy rooms book a room here...you will not be disappointed. Oh, they have a nightly 2 hour "happy hour" around the pool with free cocktails and snacks and the entertainment is quite good.Free wi-fi is also available.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The facilities show that this place takes hard wear. It's a family sort of accommodation, not a resort meet market, which is nice. The furniture in places looks slightly tired and it is not the place where the sophisticates hang out. But it is right next to the excellent shopping Waikiki has to offer and just seconds from the beach. It has an excellent set up for the pool and breakfast. The suites are a nice size with large bathrooms and every room seems to have a bigger than average balcony. There isn't much to complain about, in other words, except some marks on the furniture.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Really good location for beach and shopping. Stayed in a 2 bedroom apartment and are a great size. Could quite easily accommodate a family of 5 or 6, or even a group of friends travelling together. Each room had it's own ensuite and balcony access. Very happy with the breakfast inclusions, and the happy hour was a nice touch to the evening.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Let's talk about what this hotel is not: Trendy, sophisticated or a good place to hang out and drink cocktailsThat being said, I spent 8 days there during Christmas and New Years. Embassy Suites is in the middle of The Beach Walk aka a collection of shops and restaurants, so the location is very good. It is not on the beach itself, but it's about a block awayThe hotel delivers on value(although the price is crazy during the busy times of the holiday). The staff is excellent and are very accommodating as a groupOther pluses include a decent suite like room with small living space. Breakfast is surprisingly good as well with a buffet of pretty much any morning itemI like the hotel for good service and location. Not a party place or a truly upscale retreat, but decent for all the other reasons

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great Location, right in town and a block from the beach. Offered free wifi which was heavenly for my teenage children, complimentary breakfast and free drinks at happy hour every evening. All the staff were very friendly. TIP: Don't get a room next to the lift. The noise keeps you up all night.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My husband and I selected this hotel baser on its location. We were positively surprised from the moment we got there. From the welcome glass of guava juice, the staff, breakfasts, and happy hours...we were indeed pleasantly surprised. A couple of tips---when you make your reservation, make sure your room is not next to the elevator (we initially had a room next to one and requested a move, which the hotel accomodated), and if you get a room on the 4th floor---be ready to have a lot of traffic, as the lanai patio where they have breakfast and the happy hour occur. The breakfasts were awesome---from fresh fruit to an omelet bar...we were very happy with our stay!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights on the way back to Sydney from LA. 1.5 blocks from Waikiki beach, good aircon, ocean glimpses (not views) from the 15th floor separate bedroom and I slept very well after having the flu and no sleep for 4 nights coughing all night.I have to mention the front desk manager, Brandon who found a solution to every little thing I needed. (I was kinda needy during the stay, because of being ill and travelling alone)Breakfast was excellent, everything from a traditional American breakfast to loads of fresh fruit selections for the health conscious.Staying at Waikiki Beach is pricey and this hotel is moderately priced considering the location and standard of service.The only downside might be like so many hotels in Waikiki it is big and some people might prefer a cosier smaller hotel.But not me.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Lovely hotel. Rooms were great!! Loved the complimentary breakfast and evening receptions that were offered. Nice and close to the beach and shops. Staff were very friendly. Bell service was excellent!! Pool and hottub were great. Reserve your lounge chairs early though!! Xmas & New Years is a very expensive period to stay though but we still had a nice time. Would stay again on our next trip to Waikiki

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The Embassy Suites Waikiki has so much to offer. I love the manager's reception in the evenings. It allows me to unwind after a long day of business. And the outdoor pool is awesome too. It's located next to great eateries and is steps from the beach. The gym is spacious and the breakfast is tops!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our room the first night was a King bed with a pull out sofa bed. The room was next to the elevator. In fact, the elevator shaft takes up part of the room and you can hear the cables and movement of the elevator. My wife is a light sleeper and this was a problem. The next morning the front desk had no problem moving us to a new room. This room had two queen beds and a pull out sofa and was not near the elevator. The room was much larger as a result and it had a view of Diamond Head. Breakfast is included and was very good. Can get fresh made eggs any style including omlettes. Hotel is a block from the ocean and there are many restaurants nearby including a Roy's. Pool was nice. I did not give it 5 stars b/c I reserve that for luxury hotels where food, service, and amenities are top of the line. But this hotel was perfect for our family, great location and had very good, friendly service.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We found the hotel to be extremely accommodating. We were there for 12 nights and the first night our room was near an elevator shaft which was so noisy we were unable to sleep. I phoned the front desk and we were moved immediately to an identical room one floor down with an ocean/pool view, the same as our original room, this one was away from the elevators. The breakfasts were great with a good choice and the made to order omeletts were worth waiting for. We also loved the managers reception and the band is great! Our room was newly renovated and there was some problem as the cable for the movie channel was not hooked up, this never did get resolved, but not a big deal for us. Reception was very kind and helpful.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Embassy suites is the best hotel we have stayed at. The staff especially Ray, and the cleaners go above and beyond to make your stay as comfortable as they can. The staff always greeted us with a smile and the band is excellent. We will be back....

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is a brilliant hotel and the rooms and pool area are perfect for couples with children. The customer service here is beautiful - smiles and a complimentary glass of water infused with fruits upon arrival was a refreshing way to start the holiday. While the rooms aren't overly modern, they have everything you need in them. Comfortable beds, clean linen and towels, a working TV, minibar facilities and free wifi too. Our room even had a side view of the beach, which was beautiful to look at during sunrise/sunset. The hotel offers a 'happy hour' for the guests, where you can get a free cocktail by the pool and enjoy the atmosphere while they play music. Our stay included a buffet breakfast every morning - for a free breakfast, this did not disappoint. Hot food was nice and hot, and fruit was washed and fresh. Lots of tasty selections.Great location as well - the hotel is about a 5 minute walk to Waikiki beach, as well as other shops and restaurants on the strip. The reception staff were very helpful in organising transport to other attractions around the island; there's a big undercover drive-in bay for taxis and buses to pull in and pull out of.Overall, a fantastic hotel offering excellent value and hospitality.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Location is very good. Easy access to Waikiki beach and Kalakaua Ave.Lots of shops nearby.Room charge is very expensive. Facility is old. Poor choice of breakfast.Reception at front desk was unkind and unhelpful.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here 3 years ago and so we were back again this time with extra family members in tow. We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite.From arrival to checkout the staff are fantastic. After two weeks our housekeeper was like family with hugs for Christmas and New Year. Family is the word to describe this hotel as it does have that feel. The managers reception every night is a highlight with the band always a highlight. Whilst drinks are free please remember to tip the barman as I saw many tourists not doing this.The inclusion of the cooked breakfast is great including the cooked to order on omlettes. There are signs on tables telling you about the times when breakfast is at its busiest so if you go then expect lines for food. I have seen comments talking about the birds at breakfast but whatever they have done this is now under control. Guests can assist by not leaving food lying around and for goodness sake don't feed them. We stayed here for two weeks and our suite had more than enough space for 5 people to move about comfortably. The small kitchenette is great too for families. We will be back again!!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I have nothing bad to say about this property! It was in a great location. It was close to the ocean, close to lots of shopping and food locations. Really enjoyed it here. I went with my 2 kids and wife (2 boys ages 15,13) The buffet I must say was amazing!! They had everything that you could possibly want and the service was incredible. The fact that the buffet is included in the price may the hotel a lot more reasonable. I know that for the type of buffet that they had it probably was equivalent to about $100-120 for the four of us if we went to a buffet on our own. The rooms were very nice and the beds were very comfortable. I will definitely stay here next time we come to Hawaii. The only negative that we had was that we were only there for 2 nights. (we ended up staying at the Disney Aulani property as well, which was also amazing) Well done Embassy Suites! You made a great impression on my family and gave us a great start to an amazing vacation.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at Embassy Suites on Waikiki Beach days prior to and following a seven day Hawaiian cruise. We selected it based on recommendations from friends. The staff were friendly, resourceful, and accommodating. Pros were the included breakfast buffet, the daily manager's social (including snacks, drinks, and entertainment), early morning yoga classes, and location. Our rooms were clean, comfortable and I we did not hear much street noise. In fact, I had to sit on my balcony to hear the live music from the pool area. We had beach views from both our rooms. You won't walk out of the hotel and be on the beach, but you will be very close. Great hotel for a reasonable price. I am planning another visit and plan on staying in the same hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I found the location of this hotel just steps away from the beach, and close to top end restaurants. The breakfast and the service staff went above and beyond to ensure that all of your needs are met. Fantastic service.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We enjoyed our stay, when check in, front desk staff gave us pineapple cookies as gift and juice. This place provides free buffet breakfast, amazing! Also when we stayed around Christmas time there were live entertainment and complimentary snacks and drinks from 5 to 7pm every day. Services are perfect, truly deserve five star rating. Valet parking costs $35 per day, we always get our car promptly.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: One of the few hotels in Hawaii that can accommodate a family of 5. Very friendly staff. Comfortable beds (even the sofa bed). Very clean. Great breakfast. Noticeable street noise, but that comes with Waikiki Beach. Ideal location for beach, shops and restaurants.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We loved our stay in the Embassy Suites. It is centrally located with easy access around Waikiki shops and beaches.The hotel itself had lovely appointed suites - ours overlooked the pool area - so lovely views of the tropical themed pool area especially at night time. The suites have a good sized bedroom, living area including kitchenette and bathroom. Great features include complimentary breakfast buffet (which included made to order omelette and eggs - which I loved). There was also complimentary drinks between 5.30 and 7.30pm with a band playing every other night - we made the most of this - and really enjoyed the atmosphere with the band - and enjoyed a dance or too as well :)The service was so friendly and it seemed like nothing was too much trouble. We hired a care for a couple of days and it costs $35 per day to park at the hotel - however this is a valet service so ultimately worth it. I would definitely recommend the Embassy Suites and would love to return.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at Embassy Suites for 4 days during the Christmas. It was very pleasure stay and all staff were very friendly. There was only kind bed available when we booked. We called to ask for two queen beds before going. It turned out that we got free upgrade to ocean view two queen beds. $35 for parking is a little expense but the service was very convenient and efficient. The room is very spacious, clean and comfortable. Good location and no resort fee. Complimentary hot breakfast was great!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Most of the hotels along Waikiki Beach insist on using double beds and having a full grown family of 4 makes it impossible to stay in one room (where they provide 2 x double beds). The Embassy Suites is one of those exceptions that provide 2 x queen beds in the same room allowing a grown family to stay in comfort. The hotel is ideally located near the beach (maybe a 1 minute walk to the beach) and is near a multitude of restaurants and bars. Shopping is literally outside the rear of the hotel. This is the 4th time we have stayed at this hotel and it continues to wow us on each stay. Throw in the free complementary breakfast and wireless internet and it provides excellent value for money. You will not be let down if you choose to stay here. I could not recommend this hotel more!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Just stayed at the Embassy Suites Beachwalk and it truly deserves all the 5-star reviews. All the staff were very friendly, super courteous and very efficient. They should all be commended. I loved the fact that the front desk check-in person took my request for early housekeeping seriously. Ou room was serviced everyday at the exact time I requested. Our room was great. Obviously, since it is an Embassy Suites, you got a separate bedroom and living quarter - which in Waikiki is like a palatial manner. We got the top floor and a great view (course it was rainy and windy for a few days on our trip so we didn't get to enjoy the balcony as much as we would have liked). Loved that it was ver quiet!! thank you to the staff for putting us in that room (I am not a fan of loud and unruly people). Some reviewers don't like the security card for elevators, but I appreciate them. The layout of the hotel is very open. While you can't guard against everything, deterring unwanted would-be thieves is a good thing. The added layer of security is nice.The breakfast buffet is huge - and included Japanese favorites (miso soup and greens) that made me feel like home. The staff at the breakfast were all super friendly and helpful. We only looked at the manager's reception - which seemed like a very nice benefit (we noticed a couple who seemed to really take advantage of it - we counted 14 cups of alcohol).The gym was fine - typical cardio and free weights. Just perfect for me (love that it is a 24 hour facility as I workout very early). The business center's 24 hour access was perfect because I could be on conference calls early in the morning.All in all - great location, great facilities, excellent staff! I hope it continues to maintain this high level of excellence as the years go on.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed in Dec 2014 for 9 nights and our 3rd time there. Would not stay anywhere else in Honolulu.Customer service is out standing and the rooms are great. The managers drinks at night are just a great day to end your day and the band is the best i have seen in ages.Will be going back again next time i am in Hawaii.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Just got back from here! we stayed at this hotel for 8 nights with a family of 6 in total. my 4 kids ranging from 13 to 4. check in was a breeze, asked for our 2 room suite to be next to pool and got it one floor up from the pool in the hula tower. The breakfast was great every morning! Omellete stations were awesome! fill your bowl with whatever meats or veggies you would like and they make your omellete or eggs any way you would like right in front of you. tons of stuff for kids to choose from, bacon and pancakes or cereal and fruit, coffee, juice or pop. just a fantastic breakfast buffet for free!! saved us money every morning to have this included. our room was always spotlessly cleaned and the housekeeper always left us a ton of extra towels on the table. We would do our daytime activities and then head to the pool after supper to relax and let the kids enjoy the pool. between 5:30 and 7:30pm everyday is free drinks and snacks for everyone. i usually had chardonnay or a blue hawaiian. cant beat free drinks for 2 hours everyday. the staff here is amazing and always aiming to please! we will return!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This place surprised me as I expected a regular Embassy Suites. It has a feel of a luxury hotel. The location is excellent. The beach is a block away and one can rent chairs and umbrella there. The breakfast and evening special is typical embassy but it helps if you are going with kids. Their are many stores and restaurants around the hotel. As for travel, there is public transport a few blocks from the hotel.We had two suites on a high floor, one faced the diamond hill and the other the beach. I personally preferred the one facing the diamond hill.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Hilton hotels have provided a safe and clean experience everywhere I've traveled. When times are rough and you need a place lay. Hilton is the way... I've stayed at the Hilton hotels for all occasions such as weddings, vacations, business, retreats and most of all, a peace of mind.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is the fifth time I stay at the Embassy Suite Waikiki and never been disappointed. Thank you for the great service and experience. Breakfast is awesome and the location of the hotel couldn't be better. This will be my hotel every time I go to Hawaii.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We were pleasantly surprised with the quality of this hotel. Very clean, comfortable, and staff were hospitable. We appreciated having a suite so that we could have a separate living space area to hang out in when our son was sleeping. The complimentary breakfast was generous and good (everything from made-to-order omelette station to miso soup to French toast to bacon). Pool was also good, though sometimes a little too crowded and the manager's nightly reception with free drinks was also great. Location was perfect - just one block (if that) from the beach and an awesome choice for families. The only thing about the location is that it is definitely in a touristy area and if you want interesting, different food (i.e., other than Hard Rock, PF Chang, Cheesecake Factory) choices you'd have to leave Waikiki, though there are some awesome food trucks across the street. Overall, we'd definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Looking forward to our 10th return visit to our wonderful friends at "Embassy Waikiki". This hotel has an incredible staff, comfy beds, lots of peace, tranquility and most importantly the ALOHA spirit . You can spend the whole day at the hotel and not be disappointed. Yes, the mornings do have birds grasping for breakfast smidgens. We find the birds fun to watch, (Just remember to not leave your plate unattended). The pool is awesome for a relaxing time with the kids.And then there is the managers reception which tops off the evening. We are looking forward to our next trip in April 2015 with the grandkids.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Arrived early in the morning expecting to be told to come back later with Ray at reception telling us we can not only checking us in but giving us an upgrade and breakfast, we have never had anyone so happy and helpful before so impressed! Very clean and extremely friendly and helpful staff. Fantastic breakfast with the chef prepared to cook what you want and the way you like it, and the happy hours for drinks is incredible, perfect location for entertainment,shopping and close to the beach. Would stay again as my family really enjoyed our stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had a one bedroom apartment which was spacious and clean. We loved the fact that breakfast was included and free drinks and band at nights. The band was a father a sons Hawaiian band which were great. We were there for a week and made sure we were there whenever they played. The pool was great and staff friendly. Parking was $35 a night which I thought was a bit pricey but other than that we loved the hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My family and I recently returned from our second stay at Embassy Suites Waikiki in just over 12 months and once again we were extremelly satisfied with the hotel and its amenities. The complimentary breakfest and evening cocktails are fantastic. The staff are friendly and helpfull and the hotel is in great location.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
