review_body: Stayed here 5th Dec 2014 for 8 nights - 1 brm/2QS beds were actually 'double' not Queen as we know it, still it was fine. Room was great, loved having a separate living room with cable TV (as well as in bedroom) & extra space for the 4 of us. Room was cleaned daily, wifi good although needed to re-connect each day. Good breakfast each morning, not to mention happy hour each night from 5.30-7.30 and fabulous band. Staff were excellent, very friendly and pool was great - there were always enough lounges and spa pool was nice way to relax. Great location - close to restaurants & lots of shopping. Downside to eating out is turning up & having to wait 45-60 minutes each time as they're so busy - ie: Cheesecake Factory, Yard House, Dukes - they take your name & while you wait outside give you a 'beeper' that flashes when your table is ready. We tried different times varying from 6.00pm - 8.30 pm but always had to wait as these were popular restaurants. Would definitely stay at Embassy Suites again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We looooove all things HILTON and all others were booked out-so we cam here with our held breaths?? WOW-the welcome was THE BEST we have ever had in ANY Hotel-worldwide!! AND the team here is so well trained, so helpful and nothing is too much hassle-sooooo refreshing considering it is a not a top end, 5 star hotel.The rooms are large, clean and having a "Suite" with a lounge-room and kitchen is very handy if you are here for a longer holiday. The hotel is old and the rooms are very, "Retro" and although not luxurious or modern, very functional and a great place to stay.A great, 24 hour gym-clean and spacious, the pool area is WOW, breakfast is included and this hotel is close to all things Waikiki!!Have fun here, we are!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I was fortunate to discover this hotel while walking through Waikiki during our recent visit in December. We were unhappily staying down the road at the Hilton Hawaiian Village and realized that we (now a family of 3) needed more space. So I stopped in and spoke with one of the managers who was happy to accommodate us. We made the move for the remainder of our trip (6 days at embassy suites) and I couldn't have been happier. Brandon, the manager, was very thoughtful and found us a very quite room as I requested. While this hotel is not located on the beach, we made the decision to pay for "partial ocean view" and I was beyond thrilled with the view. I could sit on the couch in our living room and see the ocean and sunsets. The hotel's physical location is in what I call the "heart" of Waikiki surrounded by the best shops and restaurants. I don't know if the hotel is new or recently updated but the entire property was very well kept and seemed new. All of the furnishings appeared in perfect condition and I'm a sticker for chipped furniture or peeling paint and I saw none of that. My only criticism would probably be with the quality of the bed linens. They were not that soft and the sheets on our king bed did not reach or tuck under the bed, but those seem like minor complaints for all that the Embassy Suites has to offer.The pool, though not fancy, was never crowded and got a good bit of both sun and shade. I loved that they had several cabanas that were FREE. I've paid $50+ per day at the fancier hotels to use a cabana, that alone was a huge savings. I was also pleasantly surprised to find that they had waitstaff to serve food/drinks at the pool, something I wouldn't have expected of an Embassy Suites. We definitely took advantage of the free breakfast and managers reception. I thought the food was fine, not gourmet, but the reception was the best. Again we saved a ton on cocktails that we would normally have paid for at other hotels. Best of all the service was excellent. All of the staff was beyond friendly and helpful. It seemed like we saw the same faces throughout the day, bartenders, housekeepers, valet etc. It really had a friendly homey feel. I'm so glad that our need for additional space brought us to the Embassy Suites. It is now one of my absolute favorite hotels and I cannot recommend it highly enough. The location, service and amenities make it equal or superior to all others. I can't wait to return!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Now this is cool. Not cheap but do they provide an excellent accommodation. My wifey was pleased with the bath and had her nails done next door at the convenient shopping venues. Welcoming drinks for the whole family on arrival and double rooms with cable TV, free internet and great room cleaning service. A gym and happy hour every day. We all loved the very generous breakfast provided every morning from 6 till 10am, try not to eat too much !!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We have been staying at Embassy Suites locations since the early days when it was Granada Royale. They are great.This one is great although the rooms are smaller than other ES's. The staff is great, the rooms are clean and up to date, and the location is good. It is not on the beach but is just a short walk to it.Suggestions: go to the Army Museum nearby- It is free and worth your time. This location is in the heart of the tour district and there is good walking.We went to an oceanfront bar at the Sheraton that was good. At night we went to a restaurant called the Shorebird that was in the Outrigger Hotel (?). The Shorebird is different in that the server brings your entree to you raw and you have to cook it yourself. It sounds odd but was fun.Negative points: Honolulu has a very bad pigeon problem. During the free happy hour my wife put a tray of tortilla chips on our table in order to get some more treats and upon her return there were five (count 'em) pigeons duking it out to wolf down the chips. They are aggressive in the afternoon. In the morning during the free breakfast the sparrows have that shift and they are more low key.Overall, I'd give the E.S. five stars. Aloha!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Visited for 8 nights with family and loved everything about the hotel. Used the gym every day - not huge but had everything we needed. Pool was nice and never crowded. Spa pool is great too. Our room was lovely, nice balcony and an unexpected sea view. Good toiletries too! Breakfast were a notch above the standard buffets with the omelette/eggs station and the wide variety. Great location (one block from the beach). 1mile to Ala Moana (walk there, get the $2 shuttle back when you've got all your shopping!) Lovely housekeeping staff too, friendly and efficient. No complaints at all, would definitely stay again and would recommend! One tip: if you go to the Saturday farmer's market you can get the public bus for $2.50 each or the hotel's limo for $15 .. We were a party of 4 so for a big $5 more it was a cool experience!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: From the warm greeting at check-in, to the manager's special bar staff (who are amazing), to the fabulous breakfast. Beautiful view of the fireworks on Friday night. Can not forget to mention the comfy bed. ahhhh.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The hotel is an excellent choice. Great location in the heart of Waikiki, HI. There are many things to do including shopping, Restaurants, Tours, Beach, Sports activities etc.. My hotel experience was Great!!!!!!! I would definitely come stay at this location in the future. I would recommend hotel to friends and family. However, there was only one issue of concern. During the morning Breakfast, birds are flying around looking for food. The breakfast area is on the outside in the center of the hotel. Over-all the hotel is an excellent choice.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: the Embassy sultes was ok the rooms were not at standed. the spa and pool was great also the FREE DRINKS it was 5 min from the beach I would of liked it to be more closer to the beach. the staff were very nice.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Spent 6 nights at Embassy suites in Hawaii with my wife in mid November. Weather was sunny and warm most days.Attracted to this hotel from other reviews and not disappointed. Location is one block to beach and perfect if you want to walk everywhere. Very friendly staff made us welcome from check-in to departure. Rooms are spacious with separate lounge area. Bed provided best nights sleep in a long while. We arrived early in the morning and Reception were happy to arrange early check-in and provided a partial-ocean view upgrade. The room on the 10th floor was spotless and just like the web photos. Complimentary breakfast was as good as most buffet gets and the fresh egg station lifted it a bit above.The pool area was never crowded and we even managed to secure one of the huge circular cane-canopy day-beds on two occasions. Went to the free Manager's drinks on two occasions with free cocktails etc and snacks...good for families but not so romantic drinking wine from plastic tumblers although cannot complain.Would stay here again!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Nice place. Not on the beach. In the area of the goings. Excellent service. HAS EXPEDIA FOR BOOKING EXCURSIONS free breakfast it's outside and there are birds but I didn't encounter any near me while eating

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Pros: Centrally located in Waikiki with beautiful and spacious island-inspired rooms. Nice pool area and very good breakfast buffet compared to most Embassy Suites in the mainland. Outstandingly customer-friendly employees like Aldrin, Lucy, Deme, Esther from the breakfast and happy hour areas. Cons: Gym is too small and felt claustrophobic for a big hotel. Band music during evening reception is way too loud and don't play enough local music.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We're not huge fans of staying in Waikiki, but for convenience sake of visiting spots on the East side of the island we did. The Embassy Suites fit the bill as a good value, conveniently located option. Their suites are built to accommodate families--particularly if you have more than four people. Our suite had two queen beds and a queen sofa bed so could have slept six. For under $300/night in Waikiki it was good deal. It is a landlocked hotel but only a one block walk to Waikiki Beach. It's surrounded by other towering buildings as well so there's really no ocean view to speak of. It has a pool/lounge area on the fourth floor terrace that was okay. It wasn't super crowded when we were there so there was plenty of room. Probably the best part of the hotel are the included extras--breakfast is included and is great for being free. Good selection of juices, omelet station, miso soup and kimchee--not bad. Each evening they have happy hour with free alcohol. Free drinks are free drinks--can't deduct stars for that! They also had a pretty awesome band playing--it's kind of a evening pool party. Wifi is free and works well. Parking however is $35/ night valet. The location is both good and bad. It's landlocked as mentioned so it's not a beach resort. It is absolutely surrounded by awesome shopping and dining options all within easy walking distance. Roy's Waikiki was right outside the elevator door of our tower. Probably the biggest downside is that this hotel--like most of the hotels we've seen in Waikiki--looks old and outdated. This place was probably the bomb when the original Hawaii Five-O aired, but not anymore. The walls are old, the furniture is old, the fixtures are old. The rooms need updating. The beds don't have fitted sheets. The microwave and mini-fridge are old. The bathroom fixtures are old. The balconies are tiny and scary and we just forbade the kids from going out there. There's nothing to see anyways! But having said that, everything was functional and the service was perfectly fine--we had zero problems during our stay. In summary, if you're looking for a posh resort experience with an ocean view, spa, water features, beach, etc., definitely look elsewhere. Heck, get out of Waikiki and go to Ko'olina! But if you didn't come to Hawaii for the hotel and just want excursion/attraction convenience and a place to sleep, you could do worse.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Beautiful hotel and the best service. Rooms are spacious and while it can be a little loud during the manager reception but I didn't care because I love that they provide live entertainment. Also have a great made to order breakfast selection.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We were three girls travelling together and found it difficult to get anywhere that we could all have own space and room for luggage. The suites at hotel were large and very comfortable and only quick walk through Outrigger resort to sit on sand. Great location with plenty of restaurants and shops it seemed to be a great family hotel with lots of kids at breakfast

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We recently had 2 suites here for 2 couples and a 4 year-old. We had the option of the lower-priced, on-the-beach Hale Koa Hotel, but ultimately decided on the Embassy Suites because of the extra space (separate living and sleeping rooms), the included hot breakfasts, and the daily free drinks at happy hour. We made the right choice for us.The location is quite central and an easy walk a block to a nice beach. Surrounded by restaurants, from Subway to Ruth's Chris Steakhouse and everything in between. Lots of high-end shopping in the area. Seven Eleven and ABC variety stores/delis/grocery nearby. Useful to have a car to get around town and the island, though parking is a bear everywhere and the hotel's efficient valet-only parking is approx. $37/night (+ tip). For military folks, the hotel offers a military family rate that is reasonable for this hotel and the area.Breakfasts were hearty (cooked to order eggs/omelets, Asian choices, scrambled eggs, sausage/bacon, fresh fruits, yogurts, cereals, breads/muffins, etc.). Efficient - we never had a wait in line except for a few minutes if you decided to order specialized eggs. (Signs discourage you from taking food out of there to eat later.) It's in an indoor-outdoor setting (with birds awaiting your crumbs) on the 4th floor.The staff throughout the hotel are incredibly friendly and helpful. Security is excellent - you need a key to access your floor (& can't access other floors except 4th floor) and the housekeeper challenged my husband when he came into the room when she was cleaning (she took his key and tested it in the lock).It's child-friendly, including the nice pool area (has decent-sized pool - though don't count on space to do laps; hot tub; 1.5 foot child pool area). Bar food is reasonable there (approx. $8 kids meals, good adult burgers and other choices for approx. $15). Every other night (M-W-F; maybe Saturday?) there's live music at the happy hour, which is lovely.There's also free yoga (7am) classes and hula (3 or 4 pm on Thursdays?).Since Embassy Suites is a Hilton Property, you can sign up for a very soft-sell timeshare presentation for $100 Am Express credit card or 20k Hilton points, etc, for 2 hours of your time.The rooms were quite comfortable and included a mini-fridge and microwave. We were on the 15th floor, city view, next to the elevator, but it was very quiet and the room (odd numbered rooms) overlooked a city park and hotels in the distance, with a peak of the ocean. This was a family trip, but I've also stayed here for a business trip in the past and was equally satisfied then.We did some of the area activities such as the Atlantis submarine (it was great - the regular/lower-priced version was perfect; no need to pay more for the slightly larger window sub) and a luau (at Hale Koa). The 4 year-old loved them both, as did the adults.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I have family in Hawaii, but their house is tiny, so we stay here.Let me start with the bad: - It's Waikiki, so you're not going to have a peaceful, romantic morning, listening to the wind through the palm leaves. You're more likely to hear typical morning traffic sounds and the occasional dood stumbling back to his hotel. Solution: close the windows. The soundproofing in the rooms is great. - Parking ain't free. It's not cheap, either, but you get in-and-out privileges and the parking attendants will treat you right if you treat them right (*cough* tip *cough*). - This is not a sleek boutique hotel where you're likely to find half-naked, glossy, celebutantes on the pool deck. You're going to see dozens of laughing kids and their pale, doughy parents (like me) splashing each other in the pool. - You are not going to walk out the hotel and be able to flop onto the beach. It's about a block away.Now to the good: - The staff. The staff here are great. Everyone goes out of their way to make sure your vacation is incredible. If you don't see something, or need ideas for activities, feel free to ask. - The rooms. Despite family recommendations, we've stayed at other properties. If you're into European or Asian hotel rooms, all the others are fine. If you're used to American hotel rooms, this is really the only option in town unless you're prepared to spend serious cash. - Breakfast. It's not fancy, but the breakfast buffet is great for putting some fuel in the furnace and planning the day. You can mix and match American, Continental, and Asian breakfast items to your heart's content. - The pool. Sometimes I just want to sit around by the pool and fry in the sun whilst enjoying an umbrella drink. The pool deck is perfect for this. It's not huge, but it's one of the biggest in Waikiki. - Location. At first, you might be dismayed that the hotel isn't on the beach and that it's at the end of Waikiki. After a few days, you'll realize that's perfect. Less traffic, less drunken frat kids, a little more quiet, and really, it's a pretty easy walk to the beach. When you get to the beach, it won't be a mob scene. - Dining options. Looking for a Spam musubi and a can of iced coffee? 7Eleven and ABC are just out the door. Oh, out for a romantic evening? Roy's is just downstairs. There are also noodle shops, tonkatsu restaurants, and more familiar American fare all around. Take a little stroll and you might find some of the hidden jewels in Waikiki. - The staff. Seriously. They are awesome.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I enjoyed my stay here very much. Breakfast was excellent and there is live music most nights during the managers reception. Although not on the beach, the central location is close by to everything with many places to dine very close by. Room Keys are needed to access the elevators which makes the rooms feel secure. I would stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel is more expensive that others but it includes breakfast and a dinner reception. The hotel and the staff was very nice. The breakfast was good. I ate a homemade omelet everyday. The cook was so used to seeing me he knew what I wanted. The dinner reception had live entertainment. The food consisted of chips, veggies and dip but you could order "real" food from the staff. The kitchen staff is extremely nice and friendly.On the downside, I had a problem with Expedia ( inside the hotel). They sold the excursion. Unfortunately, it didn't get straighten out until after I left Hawaii. The hotel manager didn't follow through and that was disappointing. But overall, I enjoyed my stay. I would recommend the hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I highly recommend this place if you have kids! Centrally located and we felt very safe the entire time here. We have been back to this Hotel 7 times over the past 4 years and each time we are happy. The breakfast included daily is a real value as you can take things to snack on later through out the day ( mini fridge in suites )

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: quick and early check in. luggage taken to our room straight away.Beautiful spacious room with separate lounge and kitchen area.Stunning decor comfortable beds.Managers reception the highlight with free drinks for 2 hours every night with an amazing band 4 nights a week.Buffet breakfast was beautiful.Excellent facility laundry,gym,business room .Very clean excellent well mannered and happy staff.Had a excellent time location was perfect cannot wait to returned loved it favourite hotel to stay .Will be back worth paying the extra for good service.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We have stayed at Embassy Suites before and this one doesn't disappoint. After a 17 hour travel day, the valet staff greeted us with smiles, info and a friendly hand with our bags. The reception desk welcomed us with a wonderful glass of juice and we were checked in and on our way to our room in the blink of an eye. The room is a two room suite( a sitting room and a bedroom) and was clean and up to date with beautiful hawaiian decor that added to our experience. We stayed on the 20th floor in an ocean view and although this Embassy Suites is not on the beach, we had a great view of the ocean, sunrise, sunsets and local traffic.The breakfast buffet was pleasing as always and the made to order omlettes were awesome. If you are not a big breakfast eater, you can have your choice of cold cereal, pastries and local fresh fruit. Once you complete your day on Waikiki Beach, shopping or at Pearl Harbor, you can return to the Manager's Reception for some great drinks, snacks and a local family group that was very entertaining with music that had a local Hawaiian flare and was great for all age groups. The Embassy Suites is located within walking distance to shopping, restaurants and the beach. I am not sure you could ask for anything more. Even with renovations occurring, the noise did not bother us and we will return to this Embassy Suites on Waikiki Beach in the near future. We definitely felt the Aloha here and are looking forward to a return trip. Great job everyone! You do your job well and this guest will never forget it.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I have four kids and have traveled across the US for a variety of sporting competitions in the last decade. I have seen a lot of Embassy Suites. Waikiki is by far the best. The two room suite, the free breakfast, pool, workout facilities, good staff and quality facilities are the same for all the Embassy Suites, but Honolulu excells in the Aloha service. The staff is excellent, the food is superb and the facilities are nicely maintained and well located. Top it off with a very competitive rate and you've got the best family hotel (unless your kids are 10 and under -then I'd look at Disney) in Honolulu.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We frequently stay at Embassy Suites when travelling for the great hot breakfast and comfort. The Beachwalk location is our best experience yet with this chain of hotels. From stepping out of the car, we were greeted by friendly staff, brought yummy welcome juices to enjoy during check in and assigned a room which perfectly fit what we needed for our family. There were 2 queens in one bedroom and a queen sleeper sofa in the living area, a small refrigerator and microwave. We tried to find the brand name on the sleeper sofa as it is easily the MOST comfortable we've run across in any hotel! The morning breakfast had good choices and cooked to order eggs, delicious! It is short walk to the beach, just down Lewers or Beachwalk and hang a right, there's beach access next to the Outrigger Reef. The manager Happy Hour is a fun start to the evening and there was music on Monday, Wednesday and Friday when we were there. Also, there's little park just below the Embassy on Beachwalk where they had a band and hula dancers for free on Tuesday around 5 pm and we could see them from our balcony. There are lots of restaurants nearby, but there's also a food court in the Royal Hawaiian on the other side of the Sheraton. It's worth it to walk through the Sheraton lobby for the sand sculptures. There is an ABC Store/Deli just across the street from the hotel. It had basic groceries and a deli in case you don't feel like going out. There's also a Giovanni Pastrami across the street on Lewers that we ordered pizza from and delivered to the pool one day. It was good pizza and service was very quick.Just West of the hotel on Kalia Road, there is the Hawaii Army Musuem, which was interesting.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Upon checking in I presented my honors card and receptionist said she did not need it. I explained to her that I was a honor member,and ask my point be issued to my account, She explain to me that since my travel agent booked it I am not eligible to receive credit for my stay. I explained to her that I paid for the stay on my credit card and offered it for confirmation on the booking. She would not check with a supervisor at my request to address my issue. I am currently requesting for them to issue points to my account, hopefully they will.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our family of 5 LOVED it. It really is the best value for a family. Every room is a suite and can comfortably fit us. The free breakfast is amazing and the happy hour is a great way for the family to unwind. We can't wait to come again!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Was charged more than what i booked for by over $500 extra and more on top off what i was quoted. And them using the reason cause of the conversions when you make sure you look at the prices of AUD to get qoutes

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We were treated well by the staff, since we stepped out of our car to our check out time. The room had all the amenities we needed, microwave, fridge, sofa bed, etc. Location of the hotel is very close to all the shopping stores. There's also a place to eat across the hotel that has different food trucks called Pau Hana Market. I would recommend this hotel to anyone!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Having stayed in other great Outrigger properties, we decided to try out the Embassy Suites.They are one block back from the beach and right in the heart of Waikiki, being on the Beach Walk.Our family of three loved pretty much everything about this hotel. The rooms were spacious and well maintained. There was a balcony which looked over the pool and offered views out to sea.The beds were very comfy, including the pullout in the lounge for our daughter. The pool area was great, with plenty of room and lots of loungers available. The free buffet breakfasts and nightly manager's reception drinks were a great bonus. The nightly free drinks and nibbles meant that guests got to know each other, with the wonderful family band (four nights a week) adding to the happy vibe. All the staff we encountered were professional and friendly, nothing seemed too much trouble. I would note that this is more a family property than a place for couples wanting a quiet romantic spot. We had food from the bar menu which was good value, and being on the Beach Walk you are spoilt for choice for dining options nearby. We can thoroughly recommend the Embassy Suites.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My Wife and I visited this property for the fourth time. It seems that each stay is better than the last. They are presently refurbishing all their rooms on a floor by floor basis. We were booked into a newly done room and it was fabulous. Their housekeeping staff are the best and happiest I have ever encountered in all my travels. In reading all of the reviews, there is really not anything I can add. Breakfast and Manager's receptions are great. You can't miss their entertaiment at night, the group is fantastic. Bar staff is great, parking is expensive but as stated by others, it is no more than others in that location. There is a bird problem all over Beach Walk. I know they are working on it because I talked to a pest control officer at the property. I recommend this Embassy Suites to all types of travelers.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here at the end of a month-long trip around the U.S. And it was the perfect place to unwind before heading home!Great lazy afternoons by the pool (where you can get a poolside massage for $21/15 mins), a very short walk to the beach (100m or so), Starbucks, Denny's and an ABC Stores (grocery items, snacks, fresh foods, alcohol, medicines, souvenirs etc) shop across the road, an incredible breakfast on offer plus the most amazing happy hour I've ever experienced for 2 hours every day (with awesome live music Mon, Wed, Fri, Sat).Happy hour offers an extensive range of drink options, far more than any other happy hour I've ever been to (and it's free!). Plus, tip the barman ($1 per drink will do) and the drinks certainly don't skimp on the alcohol. The staff are crazy friendly, enthusiastic and a pleasure to speak to.Amazing stay and highly recommended!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Hotel is located near everything you can think of...great shopping, restaurants, beach, etc. Parking is pretty high $35 a day for guests, but location and public transportation (trollies and buses) mean you don't really need a rental car.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here recently with our 16month old. We arrived at 8am after a 6.30am flight arrival and although our room wasn't available they found another that was and then informed us it was cheaper than our original room and gave us a refund of the difference! It was so nice to be able to go straight to the room and put our little one to sleep.The hotel is in a handy location too - we walked to the beach, shops and restaurants. Would definitely recommend for families with the space of the suites.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I stayed at this property during a business trip to HNL last month. Several "notches" above your typical Embassy Suites. Very friendly and professional staff. I would stay here again either on business or with my family (should the opportunity arise).

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is a well maintain excellently located hotel. Great wifi which is rare in hotels. Free drinks from 5:30 to 7:30 nice. Across the street from the beach and the Hawaii Military museum. Breakfast is great!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We upgraded on arrival for ocean view room. Glad we did. The best view ever, massive room... We didnt want to leave. Very convenient to beach, shops, restaurants. Brekky lovely, omlettes every day. Pool area great, toilets down there very clean. Safe and secure hotel. Family friendly. Loved it here!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great resort. The people were extremely helpful in changing our rooms for the ones we had booked only because it turned out we did not choose the correct configuration. Buffet breakfast was good with plenty of choices. The rooms were neat and airy. Overall good location, just a walkway away from beach, happy hour and live band entertainment. Plenty of free ice (it's really hot there) available.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here last week... The hotel is clean and rooms spacious! Ray checked us in, he has great custom service skills and went above and beyond to find us a room with all our needs.The bartenders, breakfast staff,and housekeeping were helpful and friendly. Yvett on 20th floor housekeeping always welcomed and thanked you for staying at the hotel, she has a way of making you feel at home. The ladies at the front desk were not firiendly and came across like they didn't want to be bothered. We enjoyed the band at the managers reception, the snacks were okay, but breakfast was excellent. The birds can be annoying but that is at every restaurant in Waikiki .. The staff works constantly at keeping them away from you and your food. If you like gelato there is a great gelato shop at this hotel. I do have a request for the hotel manage to have 2 bedroom suites available on points and have suites available on points for more than 5 days so we don't have to make 2 reservations and a family can stay together.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I couldn't fault this hotel. Staff were outstanding. Room was fantastic especially as we were upgraded to a 2 bedroom king apartment. Ocean view. Good breakfast, free cocktails and nibblies nightly. Entertainment was excellent. The highly rated Trump hotel was next door and I would often see their patrons out on the balconies enjoying our entertainment. Close to the beach, restaurants and shops. What more could I ask for?

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Pay attention to parking charges. Hotel double billed me. Uncontrolled pigeons in eating area. Don't leave your food alone or these flying rats will attack. this hotel site wants a complicated write up. Instead Im filling space so it hits 200 characters.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great staff, nice big rooms, just need to get the birds away when people are eating...front desk is great help, bell guys where big help with taxis and directions. breakfast staff was very funny and helpfull, the entertainment was great, we liked the happy hour.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Nick and the male bartender with the long hair (I think his name started with a K) who worked at the pool was extremely helpful and always smiling and lovely for our entire 7 night stay. I was there with friends to celebrate my birthday and Nick especially went above and beyond by giving us strawberries with whipped cream for my birthday which was unexpected and also very much appreciated and he gave us lots of tips on what the best things to do in the city. We also really enjoyed the band that played every second night at the manager's reception who really added to the atmosphere and made us want to stay during the reception rather than look for entertainment elsewhere. We had a fantastic stay and the breakfasts were great and all the staff from the front desk to the breakfast cooks, wait staff, front desk and housekeeping were exemplary and we we very much loved this hotel!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We visited ES in November 2013 and September 2014. This is a great hotel. Centrally located in Waikiki. Close to beach and lots of shopping. Breakfast is always good. Parking is expensive, but it is expensive to park anywhere in Waikiki. The best thing about this hotel is the local band playing at the managers reception. It is a father and his 3 sons and they are AWESOME!! If you stay here, don't forget to check them out. We already have a trip planned for February!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed in this hotel for our Honeymoon. It was absolutely perfect. Front desk, Bell desk, Bartenders, Breakfast Staff and Maids were always smiling and friendly and always so helpful. The hotel is absolutely gorgeous. We had such an incredible stay. We hope to come back one day! Hotel was very clean from the rooms to the lobby. It had great access to shops and restaurants and the Shuttle pickups. The beach is just a short walk from the hotel. Pool area was beautiful. We loved the cabanas to relax in! The only thing we wished there was was an adults only pool. At one time there was at least 30 kids in and around the pool! It made it a little difficult to enjoy the pool.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our family of 4 agreed that the Embassy Suites Beachwalk is nothing short of perfection! We were able to book our 1 bedroom suite with Hilton Points, which was great. The suite was clean and roomy. We even had a view of the ocean, which we were not expecting. The hotel’s beachwalk location is perfect – plenty of shops and restaurants to visit just steps away. The included breakfast was fantastic, but the thing we enjoyed most was the manager’s reception on Saturday night. The included drinks and snacks were good, but it was the band that we really loved. The entire family, even our teenagers, agreed that listening to the band was one of the best things we did in Hawaii. If you have the privilege to stay at this wonderful hotel, do not miss the manager’s reception and the band!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed at Embassy Suites from Sept 25 through the 29th. Chose the hotel based on staying at other Embassy Suite hotels. Was not disappointed. Check-in was different as registration, bell desk and valet are all out in the open, at least the area is in the shade-not a bad thing. There are two hotel towers and ours was the Hula tower on the 3rd floor. Enter the room and to the right was the wet bar area with coffee maker, hot water maker for tea, microwave and mini frig. The bedroom was a couple more steps to the right, two beds, armoire, with hangers, iron, ironing board. One nitpick-the height of the hanging space was too low for dresses and pants. (After reading this before posting I got it-the height is because this a handicap room geared for a person in a wheelchair, so the height issue is a non-issue for a person in a wheelchair.) Also a dresser. The bedroom and living area both had separate temperature controls-NICE.Bathroom nice counter space, plenty of towels, and this was a handicap room-roll in shower. Slight raise into the bathroom, shower seat. I just wish there was a bathroom fan to exhaust some of the heat and moisture. The breakfast area-open lanai, friendly staff there. They kept up with cleaning the dirty dishes, asking if we needed anything-drinks, coffee. Expect birds in the area, and do not leave your food out in the open for any length of time. One suggestion-place spikes in the rafters so the birds don't roost there.Convenience store in the tower and a small souvenir store. There is also a restaurant that we didn't use. For additional souvenirs go across the street to the ABC store, and there are plenty of other restaurants in the immediate area as the area is two level shopping area. One bad experience-the fire alarm went off one night about 12:30 am; forget everything you have but grab your room key and cell phone. Hint-keep your key near the door or the dresser in the bed area.Close to the beach, did not use the pool area on the 4th level, nor did we use valet parking. I recommend this hotel as convenient to the beach, shopping. The rooms are comfortable.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I really enjoyed my stay at the Embassy Suites, the room was beautiful, and very clean! The check in process was fast and easy, Lorna checked us in, she was great! The comp breakfast was very good and had a good variety of options. The pool area was also very relaxing, was never to busy which allowed you to relax on the chairs.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Have stayed in various hotels in Waikiki because of business engagements but this was my first time at the Embassy Suites. What a super place! I have definitely found my home away from home! Great property! Great staff! Everything was perfect!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Highly recommended.Always at the best conditions in all aspects except valet parking (run by outsourcing company)Not as Noisy as Waikiki HeartClose to Everything which are newer and fresher in WaikikiSwimimg Pool is a bit small, but that's that care for all Waikiki hotels.All suites are amazing concept for a accomodation buildings !!Corner Suites are even better for the size and views.Lobby Hallways deco for Hawaiian Music is like a small education center,m love it.Restaurants nearest to the hotel are wonderful. Yard House and ABC Gourmet, Roy's Nobu....Best value choice of the hotel so far the the price and location.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed from Sept 21 to Oct 1 2014 with my husband, my son (16yo) and my daughter (14yo). Our room was in the Hula tower on the 4th floor. We were on the same floor as the pool and we were the first suite. We walked out of our room and straight to the pool or to the dining area. Very convenient. Our suite had 2 bedrooms and a living area. It was an extremely comfortable room with lots of space from us and our teenagers. Each room had a desk and plenty of storage. The kids had 2 queen beds in their room and their own bathroom. It felt like a home away from home. The cleaners were very thorough and left a different card on my pillow every morning telling me something about Hawaii and its customs. We loved the free egg/omelette breakfasts and the 2 hours of free drinks (alcoholic) and nibbles every evening while we enjoyed the live band. The Embassy suites are located close to everything with an ABC store across the road, restaurants all around (recommend The Yard House) and plenty of shopping at your doorstep. Beach is very close but if you want to go to the main beach you can easily cut through the Sheraton. We will definitely stay again next time we visit Waikiki.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Hotel in general was great except for room location. Try not to get a room with room number #11 or #01 (ex 601, 611, 1801 or 1811) because these rooms are backed up to the Elevator itself and is very noisy though the night with both the sound of the elevator going up and down and the floor ding. I tried to change rooms but they said they had nothing available. I was on business travel so I had no choice but to stay even though it made sleeping at times difficut.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I stayed at the Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach Walk with my husband and 15yo daughter between 27th Sept - 2nd October 2014. This was our second stay, having stayed there for 10 nights back in 2011. We simply love it. Though the cost had increased significantly since 2011, we still chose to stay this time because we love the location, size of the suites, the complimentary full breakfast including the made to order egg/omelet station and the nightly 2hr evening happy hour and entertainment. In 2011 we stayed in the Hula Tower in an Oceanview suite on the 21st floor. This time, for the same cost, we stayed in a standard suite on the 8th floor in the Aloha Tower. Still great, same room size and amenities as the Oceanview, this time overlooking the Beach Walk, which was just as pleasant. The suite was well proportioned and the sofa bed comfy for our 15yo to sleep in (though there were two double beds in the bedroom our daughter prefers to sleep in her own room). We love the Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach Walk and would stay there again next time. It is our only choice when staying in Honolulu.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We very much enjoyed our stay at the Embassy Suites in Waikiki. The room was spacious and clean. It was great to have two rooms. We had a nice view to the west of Honolulu. We could also see the beach from our balcony on the 17th floor. The walk to the beach was no more then five minutes. The pool and hot tub were nice although a bit crowded. The pool had a large deck with lots of lounges and some cabanas. The included buffet breakfast and managers happy hour were just great. The happy hour entertainment was good and we had fun listening to them. The staff was helpful and courteous. We only rented a car for one day but found public transportation was good. We will stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great location just off the main strip- one block back from beach boardwalk and one end of main street. In house Expedia- Emily was very helpful about tours. Great size rooms and balconies for 2 people- 9th floor ocean view room -pleasant views between hotels to ocean-Large pool area great for families and adults

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Loved this hotel, it's the second time I have stayed here. Well priced, but a little more expensive than I would normally pay. They have great suites with 2 bathrooms, wifi, great happy hour around the pool every night, and amazing breakfast, but dining room a little crazy in the morning, birds everywhere and a little slow to clean tables and spills on the floor. That was the only minus. Still worth doing. Short walk to Alomoana Shopping centre and designer shopping on the main strip. Walk through Outrigger reef hotel to beach, and great food at Shore Bird for lunch, and happy hour from 2pm for $4 cocktails. Also half price second meals on your receipt. Enjoy. Will defiantly return:)

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We have vacationed in Waikiki and have had great stays at the Hilton Hawaiian Village (several times), Hilton Grand Vacation Club (Lagoon Tower, several times), Beachcomber, etc. Hilton does a great job at both locations, and years past the Beachwalk area was nothing special. Now it is. And wonderfully set in the heart of the Beachwalk area is the Embassy Suites. We have stayed here several times, with each stay being wonderful (other than one stay made less enjoyable due to an assistant manager who was candidly a jerk to a large group of guests watching the World Cup four years ago). The hotel is benefitted by the #1 aspect of real estate, location, location, location. You can walk out the front entrance and are within a very short walk to the beach, great restaurant option, and plenty of early and late happy hours. The location doesn't get any better. And I must say the Yard House restaurant under the hotel is a great option. And a short walk to the Hard Rock, which is first class. Ther are numerous options nearby if these don't meet you needs.Besides the location, this hotel does it right. Rooms are clean and comfortable. The morning breakfast and afternoon reception (read free drinks) are well done. The bartender (local Hawaiian gentlemen) at the Managers reception is a friendly great guy. Never forgets your drink. And this year the Manager has music (entertainment). A family band named Kanilau. These guys are awesome.MANAGER TAKE NOTE - this was a great decision and selection. Kanilau are very talented, friendly and worth every penny that you pay them. We have attended many Manager receptions at Embassy's (we are Hilton Gold and HGVC owners) and your reception with Kanilau is by far the best.I also have to say thanks for the room upgrade we got (Hilton membership has some benefits), we were assigned a high floor ocean view (corner room). We had an adjoining room with family and our stay was the best yet as we got to enjoy both the first class rooms and the views. Thanks to the staff and manager for this room assignment. In closing, if you need to consider this hotel if you are visiting Waikiki and want to be in the heart of the action. Have a great visit. Aloha.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here 2 nights after a cruise. We were surprised and very happy when they had a room ready for us at 9:00 in the morning!!! We had expected to leave our luggage and wander around until afternoon. Our room was right next to the elevators in the Aloha tower. It was noisy during the evening, but not too bad at night. If you had children who went to sleep early, it would be a problem.The location is great and we had no problem walking around. The breakfast was very good. They provided beach towels in the room, a nice touch.I would stay again if we were in Waikiki.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I've been coming to this hotel with my sister for several years now and I'm always glad to arrive. The staff are very personable and very accommodating. And after arriving from a 10+ hour flight, the refreshingly cold fruit beverage is wonderful. Our room was on the 10th floor which is good away from the street noise and those early morning deliveries. The breakfast was as wonderful as expected but the juice bar has changed - not real fruit juices - disappointing. The entertainment on Monday, Wednesday, and Friday at Manager's Reception are awesome. Great music. Great time - can't wait to come back

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The friendliest staff I have ever experienced at a hotel! What a joy to be so well taken care of. I will stay here again! From the front desk, to the bellmen, to the housekeepers and staff at breakfast, everyone went out of their way to work around our schedules and make sure we not only had what we needed, but what we wanted. If you are looking for a great experience in the heart of Waikiki, this is the place!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The Embassy Suites Waikiki is slightly different than other Embassy Suites in the Continental US. 6 night stay. First off, we would stay here again the in future. Service was excellent. When registering, they provide you a glass with fresh juice. Walking distance to the beach and you can walk to Ala Moana Center but it is a longer walk. Many shops and restaurants closeby. The hotel is composed of two towers, Hula and Aloha. We were in the Aloha tower. The Aloha tower contains the Fitness Center (quite large), Business Center (4 computers/3 printers), Guest Laundry (5 washers and 8 dryers - $3 for a wash and $3 to dry, coin change machine, and laundry soap/etc, dispenser) on the 3rd floor. Note that if the washer becomes unbalance due to what you are washer, it will stop. The breakfast and pool are on the 4th floor between the 2 towers. Being Hawaii, the lobby is open and not enclosed and generally comfortable, I would have liked a common air-conditioned area to just sit and relax. Only valet parking ($35/day) with in/out privileges. The room key is needed to select the floor in the elevators. The breakfast is very good with the normal Embassy Suites fair, but they also have local items like white rice, portuguese sausage, hawaiian fruits, etc. The line at the omelet station can backup quickly. We didn't partake in the free happy hour in the evening. Our Aloha tower room had a TV, dresser, desk/stool and wardrobe (ironing board and iron, 10 hangers) in the separate bedroom (we had a single king bed). No built-in closet. The living room had a sofa, chair, desk/chairs, and safe. The cabinet under the living room TV has additional drawers for clothes. Unlike other Embassy Suites, there is no full kitchen. There is a dorm size refrigerator which was really good in terms of keeping things cold. Bar size sink, coffee maker and microwave. There is no stove, utensils, plates, etc. Air-conditioning worked really well with separate controls in the bedroom and living room. Also both rooms have a sliding glass door to a narrow terrace with chairs/tables. Both rooms are slightly smaller than other Embassy Suites. Bathroom is good size with a single sink, large counter space, hair dryer, and tub/shower combo. We were on the 16th floor and wifi work great. Wifi is normally not free unless you have the HHonor status, etc. Ice and drink machines located across the elevator.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I booked a room at the Hilton Hawaiian Village for 6 nights, when I arrived there they had made a mistake and gave me only a room for 5 nights. They graciously booked a one night room at the Embassy Suites. I wish I had 5 nights at Embassy and 1 at the chaotic Hilton Hawaiian Village.First I got to give 5 stars to Lee. He showed us to our room which was right next to the elevator. I asked if the elevator would "ding" all night. He thought it might so he immedately got on the phone and got us another amazing room. He was awesome and I hope the Embassy gives this man the recognition for the great job he does.The location of this hotel is perfect for shopping and beach lounging.I only wish I had 6 stars for the Embassy Suite of Waikiki.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: A fantastic place to stay. Nothing was too difficult for anyone. Service was amazing, rooms were fantastic and the hotel is in a prime location. This hotel made our trip. Couldn't get any better. The party atmosphere around the pool every afternoon was great. Definitely will come back to this amazing place.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our family of five stayed at the Embassy Suites hotel for four nights at the start of a three week holiday around the Hawaiian Islands. I chose this hotel due to its convenient location and inclusions and was not disappointed. We had two queen size beds and a sofa bed in our suite, and the room was certainly big enough for our needs. We could see ocean glimpses from our Lanai and I also used the fitness and business centres that were well equipped and free. The inclusions of a buffet breakfast and free drinks each evening makes this hotel very good value for money. They do not skimp on the drinks and we enjoyed the uncrowded atmosphere by the pool each night. The staff here were helpful and friendly and it is only a two minute walk across the road to the beach area near the Halakulani and about five minutes to be right on Waikiki Beach in front of the Royal Hawaiian Hotel. There are good shops and restaurants all around. If this hotel was beachfront (which I knew it wasn't) I would give it six stars.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our family group of 10 (ages from 15 to 70) has just returned from 10 days in Waikiki. We stayed in 2 x 2 bedroom suites on the 6th floor in the Aloha tower Embassy suites. The rooms were quite roomy & very clean. The beds were very comfortable & the small kitchenette was handy as was the lounge room between the two bedrooms. All the staff were so very helpful & our rooms were always kept clean with fresh linens everyday. The included breakfast has a large variety of foods & the made to order omelettes were yummy! The nightly managers reception was great with free nibbles & drink & wonderful bands a few nights. Such good value.The pool area was nice with lots of sun beds, chairs & tables. I liked the central position, so close to shops & restaurants & a few minutes walk to the beach. We had a great stay, would recommend to all.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We were really impressed with Embassy suites from the moment we arrived. Family friendly suites. Convenient location to beach and public transport. Staff are friendly and helpful and rooms were clean and furnished to a high standard. We have already recommended this hotel to family and friends as a great place to stay, and are in the process of planning our next stay with Embassy Suites.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My stay was in room 508, a 2-bedroom suite. As I was traveling alone, this was quite a lot of space for one person. The bed was comfortable, with nice sheets and good pillows. The bathrooms were well-stocked with lots of towels and good amenities. The small kitchen was a nice touch. All of the employees that I encountered were helpful and friendly. The complimentary cocktail hour and breakfast were nice and offered a good selection. The fitness center was adequate. Temperature control in the room was good, but, the hallways were hot and humid. The location is good, especially, if you exit through the hallway to the rear to Lewers Street where there are many stores and restaurants.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We enjoyed one night here so much we tried to book our last two nights here but no room and cost had gone up. We had two rooms : one consisting of two beds and the other one a lounge area which worked out well for us-family of four. Pool large by waikiki standards and buffet breaky great as well as free happy hour. Location great. Staff superb and we appreciated them giving us dentist recommendation for our uncle who was just flying in from mainland.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Oh my… Where do I begin! My one and only previous stay at an Embassy Suite was Outstanding- So my expectations were already set rather high. The Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach Walk far exceeded those expectations. For starters- the location was PERFECT.-Very Short walking distance to Waikiki Beach-Steps away from “Luxury Row” Kalakaua Ave- the Hawaiian equivalent of Rodeo Drive -Across the street from Aloha Landing Bus Depot (Departure point for the Tour Buses)-Around the corner from the Pink Trolley Line ($2 Double Decker Bus) A Must for Sightseeing!!!The Check-In process was smooth and prompt- which I appreciated because I was very tired!The room was impeccably clean and very weel appointed- Kudos to the Housekeeping Staff.The dining area staff was very friendly and attentive. The breakfast selection was Plentiful and Delicious.But by far- I was blown away by the Exceptional level of service that I received from the Bell Desk. I approached them for directions to meet a bus tour. I was confused about how to get to the pickup location. Not only did the attendant provide directions- He actually walked me two blocks away to ensure that I wouldn’t get lost- Now THAT is Service!!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel is in a great location. There is plenty of shopping in the area. It has easy access to the beach. There are bus and trolley tours that you can sign up for within walking distance. The rooms are amazing and the staff is very friendly.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We wanted a pull out coach away from the bedroom. That allowed us to avoid paying for 2 rooms, and kept kid in our suite. Plus King size bed! Pool was awesome. Hotel was very close to the beach and various "Action" in the area.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed in a partial ocean view suite with 2 queen beds for six nights and found it to be an outstanding choice. The position of the hotel is perfect, close to the beach and many restaurants. Even better, it is one of the first stops on any shuttle trip from the airport, the shopping centres and attractions such as pearl harbour so you are not stuck on the bus while every one else gets off.The room is spacious with a very good size bathroom. Had two teenage kids so one was able to sleep on the sofa bed while the other got the second bed in the separate bedroom. Housekeeping was efficient and always provided clean bath towels AND clean beach towels every day. Love the strong water pressure.The breakfast is part of the package and was terrific. Cooked to order omelettes ,where you choose your own ingredients was a highlight. Plenty of space and the food was varied and plentiful. The managers reception each night between 5:30 and 7:30 was a real bonus. Free cocktails, wine or beer was a great way to end a busy day! Bar staff are terrific and even when busy they get to you very quickly. And they don't skimp on the alcohol! The cocktails are definitely full strength...... As my wife found out quickly! They also provide nibbles to enjoy.All the staff were friendly and efficient. Always happy to help when needed. The gym is well equipped and a great way to burn off the food and drink.....well it could be anyway!!!! The pool is well maintained and there was always deck chairs available- not deep so perfect for young children.Just a tip - if you hire a car take a trip to Kailua beach as it is magnificent. If we came back to hawaii I would definitely stay at the Embassy Suites again. Mahola,

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed for 3 nights before heading to the big island and had a great stay. The service that we received went above and beyond and made you feel like a real guest. The great service started at check in. The wonderful attendant (I think Jay) was pleasant and served us some juice to enjoy as we checked in. We were early, around 12:30 and we were offered a room right away if we wanted but said we would be willing to wait if a better room would be available a little later. We waited and went to have a little sushi for lunch and took a quick walk around the area. When we returned we were given the keys and a bellman came up with our luggage, gave us a quick tour and a great suggestion for dinner (Room With Out a Key). The room was lovely and we had a partial water view out on the balcony. The room had plenty of towels and robes to wear (one of my favorite perks). I always love having two rooms, one to hang in and one to sleep in. Makes it nice!! We went to the managers reception two of the nights and the bartenders were efficient, friendly and even remembered what we drank. One evening there was music with a great local band, a Father and his son. WOW, they could play, songs that you would recognize but with a local flavor and of course a ukulele, we called the restaurant we were going to and moved our reservations back to continue to enjoy. The manager and assistant manager were taking around pizza and making sure that everyone was having a great time (which we were). Breakfast was good, and quick but you do have to watch out for the birds. The pool was great and with the buildings one side stays in the shade (which we like). Only problem was that they had 6 cabanas and I guess do not have rules about just "claiming your spot". Someone came out early we, were there by 9:30 put their towels down and came out sauntering out at about 11:00 am to claim their spot. There were several people who had come by and were wanting to use it but since we were all polite it was left for them.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great location, friendly staff. clean, fab breakfast and great managers reception. However, rooms are dated and on the small side. We felt that the swimming pool was too small for the number of rooms the hotel has plus there was not enough sun shade. We paid for a full ocean view but the view is really only partial as it is one block away from the beach. Great for families but not really for people like us with no kids who we're looking for some restful time out

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My husband and I stayed at the Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach Walk for 3 nights recently, split over a Friday/Saturday night and then the following Thursday night. On our first two nights, we were upgraded to a top floor, beach view room for our anniversary - what a treat! Little did we know but another beah walk hotel holds fireworks on the beach on Friday nights, which we were able to enjoy from the comfort of our own room! Our only complaint about the top floor room was the airplane noise, not too bothersome, but did sound like a very loud air conditioner running occassionally throughout the night. On our second stay we were on the 17th floor, and did not notice any noise issues at all. The hotel is about a 2-3 block walk from the beach, across the street from an ABC store (think Hawaiian 7-11, great to stop in and pick up water/snacks and even souvenirs), and near a number of restaurants. We didn't think we'd eat at many chain restaurants during our visit, but were ecstatic about having a Yardhouse right next door after arriving in Honolulu after 13 hours of travel! The hotel itself has great ammenities including a breakfast buffet daily (lots of choices ranging from eggs, an omlette station, a breakfast potato, pastries, cereal, etc.) which we took advantage of. The hotel also provides beach towels and Crabtree and Evelyn toiletries. The staff at the front desk and valet stand were all very helpful and nice! We would highly recommend this hotel for your next vacation!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We have stayed at Embassy Suites Beachwalk a total of three times and each one has been great. Our trip is always some business and some family time. The service is above and beyond what ones expects. It is a great value when you add hotel, full breakfast and evening reception with entertainment into the mix. We always meet great people when we go there. The staff is always friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My family with two teens stayed here for six nights and we loved every minute of it. We were upgraded to a partial ocean view instead of a city view and it was much appreciated. Embassy Suites also allowed us an early check in after a long flight. We were on the 18th floor with gorgeous views and a very comfortable 2 bedroom/2 bathroom setup. The Managers reception was fantastic and drinks were certainly not skimpy or weak! We loved the breakfast and facilities and our housekeeper was so friendly and attentive. Congratulations Embassy Suites. We will definitely be staying here again and recommending to our friends.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I booked this hotel knowing that it is not ocean front. My Ocean View room was more like a partial, but that's what I expected.Everything is super clean. Suites are good size. Service is excellent, from Valet to front desk to housekeeping.Roy's (excellent food) is on property. Location is great.Very happy with our stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: A pleasant hotel with beautiful staff ruined by allowing the breakfast and evening drinks area to be over-run by birds. Birds literally fly onto your table trying to eat off your plate. The great staff can't do anything to currently stop this and to have fresh bird droppings in an area designated for eating on top of the birds landing on your table makes for an unhygienic experience to say the least. Unfortunately our families checked out a few days early to move to another hotel due to this. Really needs to be fixed as it was a big talking point between guests.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My husband and I spent 4 days at this Embassy in Waikiki. We had a great time from check in to check out. All of the staff were personable and friendly. We had a small maintenance issue that was taken care of immediately. The breakfast was good and not overly crowded. The pigeons were an issue but we found that if we sat outside as opposed to sitting in the sheltered area, it wasn't bad. The area is busy with a lot going on: shops, restaurants, bands...so much to do. Had an enjoyable time at the Embassy in Waikiki!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at this location for several days and everything was perfect. Great suite with ocean views. Staff was attentive and anxious to please. Perfect cook to order omelets every day along with a good selection of items on the breakfast buffet.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We chose this hotel for a 5 night stay for self, wife and two teenage sons because it's one of the few Waikiki hotels with 3 beds (one of them a sofabed in the sitting room) at an affordable price.We really enjoyed our stay - the room was functional and fine (though nothing spectacular), the incuded breakfast OK (but not particularly memorable) but the location (about 70 yards from the lovely, sandy Waikiki beach and beachwalk) with really great shopping and restaurants both in a two floor parade attached to the hotel, and a good value supermarket across the road.And the pool was great with loads of beds available (when we stayed, anyway).And, if you do like shopping as well as sun, sea, sand then Waikiki will suit you ..... loads of high end stuff (I think we counted 4 Tiffany's) to local craft shops and everything in between. And in restaurant terms, everything from megabucks top end restaurants through chains like HardRock (we really liked this particular one with a whole wall open to the outdoors) to street food and food courts.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The hotel is a bit tired but still very nice. This is my second stay and I wouldn't hesitate to stay a third or fourth time. Our room was on the end, we had views out the living area and the bedroom. It was amazing.The breakfast that was included was quite nice. Equal if not better than many cruises I've been on. Nice staff as well.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The minute we pulled up to the valet in our rental car, we were greeted by the friendly staff who helped with our bags, and directed us to the check-in desk. The front desk staff was super friendly. Unlike typical hotel lobbies where you stand during the check-in process, here you get to sit to do the paperwork. Another staff member soon appeared from behind a door with refreshing tropical drinks for everyone in our family (fruit juices for the kids, too!).We had a two bedroom suite, with a "moderate" view from the lanai. The suite was clean and nicely decorated, though not super fancy. The pool and restaurant (where complimentary breakfast and afternoon receptions are held) on the 4th floor are easily accessible. The pool is not huge (no lifeguards on duty), but it is clean and warm, and the kids enjoyed it. The breakfast is quite nice, as compared to other Embassy Suites (which I've stayed in many). There are numerous Hawaiian and Japanese items available, in addition to the usual American breakfast selections.Outside of breakfast, the on-site restaurant doesn't serve any food, but plenty of food options are within easy walking distance.As a family traveling with 4 adults and 2 kids, this hotel was pretty ideal as few properties on the Waikiki strip offer 2 bedrooms. We would definitely recommend it for large families, or even small ones that appreciate the extra space that a suite provides (not to mention you'll save big money on breakfast given the high cost of everything in Hawaii).

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The service at the hotel was fantastic. All of the staff were very pleasant and helpful. The location was great for accessing the beach and the main area of Waikiki. Our room was a one-bedroom suite and gave us a separate sleeping area from our son. The beds were decent (not too hard). It was nice to have a sink outside the bathroom to wash water bottles and containers in. The hot breakfast was definitely a high-lite! There was so much to choose from! The one complaint that I have about this property is that the elevator were so slow most of the day (2 elevators for 21 floors!). There is also no way to bypass the elevators if you want to go up (they lock the stairwell access). Most days we would wait at least 2 or 3 minutes before being able to get onto the elevator. The elevator was faster early in the morning and late a night.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Okay, I'm a bit prejudice as a Hilton Diamond and Embassy's are my favorite in the chain but truly a very nice hotel. The staff is extremely friendly, helpful, cheerful and customer focused. It's just a block away from the beach and within walking distance of many shops and restaurants. There are many choices in Waikiki but I wouldn't hesitate to come back again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We just came back from a wonderful holiday in Hawaii at the Embassy Suites. This hotel is perfect for families with a decent sized living area that is separate to the bedroom (we stayed in a one bedroom suite). Our room was wonderful - right on the end of the building, so we had a ocean view out the living room window! We travelled with our 7 month old and so it was perfect for his day sleeps and putting him to bed early - we could relax in the living area on the comfy sofa and have a bit of peace and quiet to ourselves. It had a sink, microwave and mini bar fridge which we needed for our babies food and bottles. Strangely though, there was no washing up liquid, cloths or plates, cutlery etc ...this small thing would be a big help. We loved the inclusive breakfast and even better - the cocktail hour from 5.30pm to 7.30pm! The location was ideal ... close to everything! Just a short walk to the bus, beach, all the restaurants you could want and shops. The staff are all so friendly and helpful too! A huge thank you to the hotel staff for checking us in early too ... we were exhausted from an overnight flight from Australia and it was wonderful to get to bed (and the baby down for a nap) before the 3pm checkin time!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The arrival staff was very pleasant and jovial. The hotel was very nice and provided an upgrade to partial ocean view on an upper floor. The breakfast was good, however the scrambled eggs could have been cooked longer. The room was pleasant. I liked that the hotel did not nickle and dime for things like breakfast and internet connection.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Ok, where do we start? I burned 140,000 Hilton points for the 2 days we stayed here. Why did we choose here and not the Hilton Hawaiian Village? Well that was an easy choose as the HHW is now so big that they have no room around the pools and the staff are damn right ignorant. i have stayed there many times and progressively it has got worse. I have stayed here once and it was a good experience but as they say "one swallow doesn't make a summer" and I thought we would run with them again.It was the right choice for sure. We checked in and were handled very well and the bags dealt with by the bell service. The room was OK. I say that because we got a nice room but a big chunk of it was lost because of the stairwell next to us.The breakfast was fine. A little busy on one morning but take note of the signs that show when the quieter times are. That is very valuable to know. Food was good. I see there are posts about oats missing etc but guys you are in Hawaii for goodness sake, eat what they do. A good fruit selection, omelettes, good range of Japanese choices. The chef at the omelette (and yes this is the correct way to spell it!) station was fantastic. I cannot each cheese due to an allergy with certain types and he make a fresh egg omelette for me each day. I saw no one was tiping as they seem to do in other Embassy Suites but he deserved it. There is an issue with birds as you pretty much eat outside. One of the guys clearing tables was always trying to get rid of them. He was really helpful and I wish I could remember his name to give him the kudos that he deserves. He cleared tables helped with drinks, really good guy.On the first night the managers reception was short lived. We were at 11 hours time difference so we grabbed a drink and hit the sack. The second night we attended by accident as we were late back from going shopping (yeah, no my idea but let the girls shop and I get to play a couple of rounds of golf!) and caught a last couple of drinks. The band that were on were pretty good too. Once it finished though it was like the bar shut! I am guessing people dont like to buy drinks out their own money! Note to Bar Manager, get a decent Bourbon, the one you serve is really poor and for the price difference surely cant be a problem.Check out was good, but the staff in hotels need to realise that when you knock on a door when you havent checked out, I am not going to tip you! Off we went to the airport to fly to the Big Island (see my report on the Hilton Waikoloa and Kohala Suites). Got half way to the airport and my daughter realised that she had left all her jewelry in the safe. I rang the hotel and to cut a long story short they arranged to get it all shipped to the Big Island for me. Thank you.I would recommend it for sure. The 2 bedroom suites are great and it was a shem we didnt get upgraded as Diamond Members but when we are back in Waikiki we will be back here for sureMahaloPS. If you want a great taxi then Bob has a Surburban and is a great guy. His number is 808 426 4408. Tell him the Brits who left the jewelry in the room recommended him!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: There is simply no other place on Waikiki like the Embassy Suites. The location, breakfast, and manager's reception, along with the great facilities, make it my favorite place to stay on Waikiki. A short walk to all the restaurants and hotspots in Waikiki. The staff is friendly and welcoming--they have the Aloha Spirit!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed six nights as a couple and had a brilliant time. All staff were wonderful and helpful. The entertainment was fantastic and the drinks in the evening at the managers reception is perfect. Breakfast is included and well organised. We cannot recommend this hotel enough. We were there when a hurricane was approaching and the hotel was so organised with information and advising us what to do and what the hotel was doing. They organised breakfast boxes to have in our rooms and it ran so efficiently. The location is perfect with shops and restaurants at the door, the beach is a minute away. Thank you to all the staff for totally fulfilling our expectations, and a big thank you to the family who entertained us. The impromptu Hulu dance from the daughter and son on the father's birthday was a highlight. The only issue is the birds. Keep an eye on your breakfast, and don't sit under the eaves as I did. I was special enough to be defecated on by two birds at the same time. My husband thought that this was a good luck sign. He was being nice.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had a fabulous stay at the Embassy Suites and would highly recommend to anyone, but particularly those with families. Location was excellent.We have two teenage daughters and they (we) felt safe with them walking around the hotel and surrounding areas. Particularly liked the fact the pool was on the 4th floor and only accessible with a swipe key. The band who played most nights at the manager's reception were outstanding.
