All the staff were very friendly although I did wonder if we were a little bit 'ripped off' with some of the trips/arrangements we booked thru the hotel. Know your prices and check reviews before booking. Our room was lovely and clean and having the extra lounge space was invaluable as we stayed for 11 nights. Thank you for your hospitality - we will be back!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our family of four had a very nice stay at this Embassy Suites. Our room was spacious and had a great sunrise view of Honolulu and the surrounding mountains. Staff were not just polite but also warm. We were greeted with complimentary fruit juice and beach bags.The walk to Waikiki Beach is very short, and this property is in the middle of the Honolulu shopping district. It is distant from the USS Arizona Memorial, and taxis are expensive, but there is a lower-priced shuttle if you wish.Pro-tip: eat your non-breakfast meals at the nearby lunch wagons (ask staff). In addition to being cheaper, we ate some of the best food we had in our entire trip.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I was very pleased with our stay at the Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach Walk. It was in an outstanding location, the only way it could have been better is if it was directly on the beach, but frankly, in Honolulu, that isn't necessary. The beach a 5 minute walk maximum and there are tons of places that rent chairs & umbrellas right on the beach. The pool at Embassy Suites was a great size, heated just right and the pool & pool area were always clean. I can't say enough about the room set up if you have kids. Essentially it is two rooms, ours had two queen beds in the bedroom, and a pull out queen in the living area. The microwave & mini fridge were ideal for the teens too! The room was very clean & nicely appointed. In order to fit two adults and two teens, at most hotels you would likely need two rooms, so while the price was higher per room than some of the other hotels, you get more space for your money! There is a daily breakfast that runs until 10am. Having teens, 10am was a little rough so they didn't get there everyday, but the days we were there, we were very pleased! Omelets cooked to order, and they were fantastic! Lots of hot food choices, fresh fruit, various breads to toast, yogurts, and the list goes on. Great value. My favorite part was the 5:30-7:30pm manager's reception/cocktail hour. There is a fairly good variety of cocktails to pick from, and a snack bar that varies each evening with things like chips/salsa, veggies/dip, potato chips, nuts etc. This too was a great value for our stay! There were two things I didn't really like, one was that parking is $35/night and it is Valet only. I felt that was a little high, and in our situation, we were moving my daughter in to college at UH, and we did a lot of in/out of hotel, so tipping each time gets a little steep. The second was the Hospitality Suite after you check out, if your flight leaves late at night like ours did, they only allow you to freshen up in the suite for a half hour and only if it's not already being used. I have traveled this route several times and other hotels have had better hospitality suite set ups. Other than those minor details, you literally walk out of the hotel and you could go towards the beach, or to any number of shops & restaurants. I would stay there again for sure if I had kids with me again!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We were on a combined business and pleasure trip to Waikiki. We were looking for a hotel within walking distance of a good swimming beach and with a friendlier/homier ambiance--ideally at a "good" price for this area. This hotel met our expectations perfectly--I would stay here on mhy next trip to Waikiki.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel is absolutely beautiful!! The scenery from outside the room is wonderful & staff and management are golden ! High recommended when people come for business or for play. This is also a very family oriented hotel so that's a plus when families are traveling

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: It is with a heavy and full heart that this review is submitted for Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach. From start to finish, the hotel staff went above and beyond the call of duty to make everyone feel welcome and cared for. Yes, it is pricey (actually very pricey -- from the view of a timeshare owner), but well worth it. Just a note; Our family owns 2 timeshares, and after this experience, we will call our timeshare association to see if they can add this hotel in their resort directory. The location and most importantly the level of service alone is worth the price. Some hotels charge a lot less, and some charge alot more, but even if you cut Embassy's level of service and amenities in *half*, it still would be alot more than what you get from those other hotels. Located just one block from the Waikiki beach front, it can get quite "loud" outside, but we had a 1 Bedroom Suite (City View), for 4 adults (which could easily fit 8), and not only had 2 queen size beds, but the living room had another pullout queen sofa bed. It came with a half kitchen (I've seen mini fridges which should be called "ice boxes" and if there ever was a true "half" fridge, this is it) and the bathroom was fully (and I mean *fully* stocked with all the toiletries (towels, shower caps, etc.) as well as beach towels. The in room coffee maker and electric hot water pot came with an assortment of instant coffees (decaf/caf) and teas and even convenient cup covers/holders. The hotel staff (which is quite possibly the best I have ever encountered *ever*) is ready to assist with any supplies (toothpaste, for example) that you might have forgotten to bring. The balcony overlooked the city, and through the buildings you can see a part of the ocean). Families, you will love this hotel, as the hotel hosts alot of complimentary activities: three yoga classes each week (Mon, Wed., Fri), two hula classes each week as well as two hoop introductory classes *all free*. They also have a nightly managers reception by the pool where they serve complimentary drinks, and have live music. However, what separates this hotel (apart from their outstanding staff) is the complimentary breakfast buffet (it really should be called a feast) every morning. This buffet has everything anyone could ever want (eggs, bacon, sausage, hash browns, pancakes, waffles), and features a cooked to order omelet in which you can add whatever fix-ins you want (green peppers, onions, tomato, sausage, ham, bacon) and even salmon!!You just can't go wrong at this hotel: the Business Center on the 4th floor was a wonderful resource with 5 computer workstations, two printer/fax machines, 1 scanner, just wonderful. The hotel also has a gymn, bathrooms on the 1st and 4th floors as well as a bar by the pool.Speaking of which, a special shout out to the outstanding staff at Embassy Suites Waikiki, especially to Cary, who took the time to map out key spots for us to visit, and gave us helpful advice particularly in regards to the two storms (Hurricane Iselle & Julio) which fortunately didn't affect the island of Oahu too much. The hotel also went out of their way to keep all guests informed about emergency procedures and supplies to keep in hand in case of evacuation which fortunately, did not occur.The hotel is located right in the middle of Waikiki Beach Walk, a three level shopping extravaganza with all types of stores, restaurants and cafes. This hotel is literally right next to the #1 restaurant in the city: Roy's. Pricey, but if anyone is looking for the Food Network Master Chef experience, this is the place.The only negative thing I can say is that it is easy to forget that you don't need your room key card to go down to the lobby, and sometimes it takes several swipes to get the elevator moving. Also, the open resteraunt area where they have the breakfast is also frequented by birds who know where the good stuff is. The hotel staff are responsible for cleaning up after each table is vacated, but sometimes the birds get there first!Also, even though there were 5 computers in the Business Center, one needed troubleshooting which left 4 and sometimes there was a waiting line of people.Can I just once again thank the hotel staff for their exemplary service: The guy who came and unstuck our toilet in the wee hours of the morning, many thanks! The housekeeping staff for not throwing us out everytime we called for yet another item we forgot to bring. The front desk for working with us and making sure we made our shuttle after check out. We definitely will be coming back soon!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great location with lots of places to eat and shop just outside the hotel. Hotel staff, concierge was very helpful and friendly. The beach/pool towels are soft and good size. Got an in room massage while there, if was very good. Took surf lessons right off the beach. The beach is across the street from hotel and down the breezeway.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: A bit on the pricey side but if you can swing it, do it. Super friendly staff that really wants your stay to be wonderful! Great location, right in the middle of everything. We were in the Aloha Tower, room 1907 with FANTASIC view of Diamond Head and to the right a great view of the ocean. It does get very loud outside at night (sirens, and yes people outside you can hear even 19 floors up) so bring some earplugs. Walls seem to be thin too so if you have some on the loud side next door, you will hear them. Breakfast buffet a HUGE plus, very good food. You eat outside on an open Lanai and Pigeons and other birds are all around so DO NOT leave your food on the table to get your beverage, you will come back to a feeding frenzy! lol. Even with that, I loved every minute of eating out there. Managers reception at night (5:00-7:30) is great, free drinks and appetizers (please don't forget to tip ;) Can't wait to come back someday!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Arrived early morning after a overnight flight. We were thrilled to be able to check in the morning so early. Allocated a room in the Aloha tower room 709. I was a bit disappointed as I had requested a highest level floor available. I was told it was a corner suit with great views. They were correct, views if the pool and ocean. Only problem was that I had request a twin room for our 8 night stay. Back down to reception and with out skipping a beat we were allocated room 1226 in the Hula tower. Perfect room,location, people....I cannot stop telling people they must go to Embassy Suites, only not to book our room...as we want the same room when we come back again. Thank you for a wonderful holiday and we dill be back.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We were so happy with our suite, clean great location and plenty of room for the four of us. Highly recommend. We had friends staying in other hotels and for families this would be one of the best value hotel. It would be great if they could fix the problem with the birds getting into the restaurant area in the mornings as felt not very hygienic.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: As a family of 7 we stayed here for 1 week from 1st August and the front desk staff were very accommodating as we had 2 rooms on different floors. Upon request we got 2 suites on the same floor which was a bonus and found every staff member to be very helpful and friendly and accommodate to every need. The managers reception and breakfasts were top notch and would not find better anywhere. We were on 18th floor on front tower which had great views of beach. Would definitely stay here on next visit as all staff made the stay a pleasant experience. Highly recommend .

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was a great hotel. Location was wonderful - close to Waikiki! The breakfast was robust and loved the managers reception . We r a family of 5 and our room was perfect with plenty of room. We would stay here again!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: With the complementary breakfast and evening reception the value of the stay is much higher than similar hotels. Breakfast alone is worth about $25 per person. The beach location is not the best but is within reasonable walking distance.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Fantastic in every aspect. Service and staff are amazing. Managers Nightly drinks and snacks encourages staff and guests to get to know each other. Buffet Breakfast Awesome variety. Planning to return soon.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel is located one block from Waikiki's beachfront. Well located as a base for exploring Waikiki and Oahu. Rooms were not as large as other Embassy hotels we visited. Good reception desk and concierge services. Good vallet parking service. Breakfast was regular, with lots of junky food. It does have some japanese food added to the regular american breakfast. Elevators had carpets, not a good idea for a beachside hotel; there was always a terrrible smell inside the lifts.Good WiFi.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We (family of 5) stayed here for four nights and it was all that we were looking for. We are hilton honors member and were upgraded to a two bedroom suite! Location is perfect. The Bus to ala moana stops just around the corner, there are restaurants just outside and is only 2 minutes from the shopping center (great inexpensive grub at the food court). It's not on the beach, but it's a short 5 minute walk. Grab lunch at the steak shack before stepping on the sand. The best part is the managers reception. Kids can play in the pool, while the adults relax with unlimited drinks at the bar and snacks. The even better part is the live band. The best hawaiian cover band I've heard (wish I could have gotten their name so we can follow them on social media or YouTube). The only con is the price of parking, but that is expected in this part of town. Overall great experience and will definitely be back

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Family of four with two teens stayed here for a week. The complimentary breakfast was great to get everybody fed a quality meal before leaving for the day. Room was clean, comfortable and quiet. Location to Waikiki made it easy to hop back to the room between activities. We will definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great place to stay, rooms were a good size with separate bedroom, great buffet breakfast. It also has a guest laundry which is really handy. Happy hour every afternoon with complimentary cocktails & snacks close to the beach & shops. Staff very helpful. Definitely recommend.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Everything was absolutely great. The room was the cleanest hotel room I've ever seen, the complimentary breakfast was a huge buffet with anything you might want on it plus an abundance of fresh Hawaiian fruit. They also had a complimentary cocktail hour with 2 free drinks and a snack each evening. The snack was different each day. Service was extraordinary. The views were amazing. We were in a corner room and we had a lanai toward the ocean and a second one toward Hilton Hawaiian Village and the Military park next door.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Super room, Great location, Helpful staff, and the Manager's Reception at the pool with live music!!! We stayed four nights over the 4th of July and had a great time. When we return to Waikiki, this is where we will stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is a great place to stay. It's close to Waikiki beach, a short 3 minute walk and also all the shops. The hotel has very friendly and helpful staff. There are nice clean rooms with great views. Lovely pool area and buffet breakfast Really enjoyed my stay there and would definatley recommend to others

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed there waiting for our other hotel res. in another location. Wanted the Waikiki experience. This is a beautiful hotel right in the hustle bustle of Waikiki Beach. But once you're in your room it is wonderfully quiet and restful. They have thought of everything by way of kitchenette needs and design. The pullout couch was more comfortable than most. Probably a good place for smaller children. The views of the city and mountains were lovely. Very clean. Staff was very friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: After wasting our money at another hotel for the first week in Honolulu we moved to the Embassy Suites. Had a huge 2 bedroom ocean view, for less than half of what ONE room at the other hotel cost us and this place was amazingly clean and the people were so nice and staff so helpful. Best location, Best hotel, Best of everything. Loved it.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed for a week and thought this place was excellent, the rooms very clean and spacious, perfect for our family which included 2 kids. Location was fantastic as it was only 2 minutes walk to the beach, without having to cross a major road, if you have small kids, go to the beach on the right of the breakwater. There were heaps of restaurants close by as well as as ABC. Breakfast was great as it had lots of variety for everybody. Valet service was quick and easy and happy to pay $35 to keep the car off the street. Housekeeping was very quick and efficient and we know as we kept asking for more towels. Kids loved the pool and the fact that it stayed open till 10pm. Loved the free wifi also. Overall we had a great stay and would highly received to others, thanks for the great stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: They say first impressions are everything and I certainly got a fabulous first impression at the Embassy Suites, from the friendly staff that greet you on arrival to a refreshing arrival drink while checking in. My room was clean spacious and tidy. The Embassy Suites are situated very conveniently close to several shops and amenities. Overall a very enjoyable stay and I would recommend it.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The Embassy Suites Beach Walk is the best hotel in Waikiki, because it is right on street with all of the best shops and restaurants in Waikiki. The Hotel is so close to all of the shopping that you can just walk to everything. The only negative is the complimentary breakfast buffet, because the food tastes terrible and there is rumor that the coffee makes you feel sick. The roof top pool is really nice and it even has a hot tub. There is a sushi restaurant in the hotel as well. The staff at this hotel is really friendly and very helpful. The rooms are nicely designed and are well updated. Out of all the hotels I have stayed at in Waikiki the Embassy Suites Beach Walk has to be the best by far.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The rooms were well taken care of and perfect for our needs. The breakfast and bar service was absolutely amazing, can't beat it!!! To top it off the location was a block away from the beach and everything else to do in Wakiki.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We spent one of our most memorable vacations here. The evening drinks are awesome. They don't limit your choices and make you whatever you'd like. The breakfast in the morning is also very good! The view from the rooms is beautiful. The pool area is also great! But the absolute best part about this hotel is its location. You walk out of the hotel and right in to the shops of Waikiki. Although it's not right on the beach it's very much in walking distance. I have not one bad thing to say about this hotel. If you need a suite, this is the perfect hotel!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: AlohaWe arrived at 8am after a long 10 hour flight we were offered a delicious glass of punch (so yummy). Our room was ready on the 8th floor in the hula tower but i asked if we could get a higher floor the attendant was very helpful and we got room 2024 on the hula tower the views were amazing! Breakfast was delicious every morning, the pigeons enjoyed breakfast as well. The pool area was lovely and happy hour was great. I found The Embassy Suites location perfect walking distance to everywhere. We will be returning back but next time for 2 weeks. July was perfect weather.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great place to stay, we have 2 little boys and there was enough room for them as well as us. Central location makes it great to get around by foot. Service and staff are wonderful. Great place to stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We wanted to spend 4th of July week on Waikiki prior to a cruise. This was the best for a family of 6! Worth the extra if you can to do ocean front. Great breakfast, although the bird thing is a bit of a challenge. We just left someone at the table to 'defend'. Evening reception and entertainment was awesome! Staff is kid friendly. Great location with an ABC store across the way and Hard Rock down the street. Barely a short block walk to the beach and the on site pool is great! Laundry facilities were clean and plenty of working machines. Valet parking was pretty quick (for $35 a day it should have been). The extra space the suite provided was great, especially with a "living space" for time together rather than just beds as two regular hotel rooms would have provided. The the two balconies were nice as well.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Embassy Suites was affordable, great location, close to many places to eat and had a free breakfast and Managers Reception each morning and evening. There were a lot if kids but that doesn't bother me much. Staff was super and my massage was fantastic.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Location of this property is excellent - convenient walk to shopping, beach, and restaurants - and ocean views from the high-floor rooms (19 and above) are superb. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay, great to have an extra room with a teenager. Breakfast buffet is good, and a good deal, but the birds will attack the food as soon as you walk away (surely, the hotel can do something to address this). And if you happen to be around between 5:30-7:30 pm, it is house wine and beer, and mai tai, not bad for the price (complementary).

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: One hotel back from the sea, large suites with bedroom, living room and bathroom, free cooked and continental buffet breakfast and free drinks every night with pupus. Need I say more? Yes there are Embassy Suites with larger rooms, but this is Waikiki, where thousands of tourists are packed sardine-style into box-type hotels, so this is a luxury. And yes, at $379/night, the room charge is anywhere from 5x to 8x a comparable Thailand hotel, but again this is Waikiki not Phuket. A walk down the main street after dark does not incite hundreds of Thai massage or Indian suit merchants or dodgy English timeshare scammers. Only overpriced crap that came from China the week before, and they don't need to bully customers inside because the mainly US and Japanese audience here is happy to pay. The weather is great, the streets are safe, the food and activities overpriced and over-rated but there are heaps of free things to do if you can be bothered. Or just put the feet up and buy....I like it here although I won't be buying a lot from the retailers.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: As we didnt want to drive on the opposite side of the road that we were used to we found this hotel ideal for the beaches, shopping, eating out in a great variety of places and easy public trAnsport to Ll the other places we wanted to go to. The actual hotel ammenities themselves were great. Great views from the 20th floor and loved the way the end doors were left open to give a fresh breath of air through. Staff were a great help at all times of the day and night and helped us organise events to give us a great overview of Oahu in the six days we were there.Rooms were very comfortable especially the bed. Appreciated the use of a laundry as we had been away 3 weeks.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I have been meaning to write my review since I got back. The rooms were fantastic. A suite with two queen beds in the bedroom. How awesome! The cocktail hour was awesome. The bartenders were lovely. The pool area was great. The location is second to none. When I was reading the reviews I thought it was odd how many people mentioned the staff and how nice they were. I quickly came to realize once I got there why. They were so nice! I live in Canada but travel to Honolulu twice a year. This was the first time I stayed here. I can't wait to come back. It's not cheap but it's so worth it. The breakfast was good too. Everyone mentions the birds. I did not see the big deal. When you eat in an open area in Hawaii there are birds. The band during the cocktail hour was great too. I just loved this hotel and I wish I remembered to review it sooner. I cannot wait to come back.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was the last stop on our 12 days family holiday and it was also where I wanted to carry out a bulk of my own retail therapy - I was not disappointed!Our family of four had two adjoining rooms and it was perfect for what we needed. We were on the top floor - 21st floor so our views were significant - the city, the sea.We were located in downtown Waikiki and the shopping there is abundant! I took a trip out the the infamous Ala Moana Mall and quite frankly I neednt have bothered as the very same retail shops can be found within easy walking distance to the Embassy Suites - and so much easier to find.The Managers hosting (happy hour) from 5.30pm is well worth it too - free drinks and live entertainment is fantastic! we also had a buffet breakfast included in our price and this was well worth it.The beach and all its activities is also a stones throw away.I would highly recommend this hotel for your holiday destination.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: this was our second time staying at Waikiki Embassy Suites and just as great as the first! The staff was friendly and helpful, some familiar faces from 3 years ago. The made to order omelets were great. The beach was less than one block away. It was great to have a room to freshen up before a late evening long flight. Will stay here again!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great location and great hotel. Staff there were extremely helpful and pleasant. Wish there were a way that they could keep the birds out of the breakfast/eating area, but other than that, a great place to stay. Would definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We were a group of 4 mature ladies, away from our families for some fun in the sun. We can not fault the embassy suites at all. We had a two bedroom apartment with a kitchenette ( cutlery would have been good although we never asked!) and a lounge area. We loved the fact we had a balcony and could let the beautiful evening breeze cool us down. The evening reception with great snacks and drinks included was a lovely inclusion and much appreciated. Breakfast was fantastic and the omelette ( cooked to order) were the best i have had. Plenty of choice on the menu. Close to the beach with towel supplied. The pool area was not as busy as I anticipated and we were always able to find a lounge chair or table in the sun or shade. The location to shops/transport/beach was excellent. I would not hesitate to stay again. We booked shopping, Luau through the agent down stairs which was very convienient. Thanks to all.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Very good location for dining and shopping. It has great buffet breakfast and afternoon cocktail. The valet parking is expensive and very slow in peak times. After all it is Hawaii and Waikiki is a must but the beach access is pretty bad.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This 21 story, two tower property has a lot to offer. Compared to other hotels that offer complementary breakfasts, Embassy suites Waikiki Beach Walk is the champion. The breakfast spread while not quite to the standards of an all-inclusive luxury resort, it is certainly more than I expected: omelette and fresh egg bar, several fruit selections daily including papaya and pineapple, bacon, French toast, etc. A good way to start the day. The evening Manager's Reception- while short of snacks beyond sliced squash and chips- is long on alcohol. The property itself is clean and the service staff was superior. We stayed on the 14th floor of the Aloha tower for 11 days, and the cleaning lady did a great job for us daily. We had a corner suite which was very comfortable, and the bed was wonderful. The bell desk and reception staff were also helpful. Great experiences all around. DeRussey Beach is a five minute walk while Waikiki is closer to ten. Lots of shopping and food choices within spitting distance. The elevators could be slow at certain times of the day. Only real negative- the patio balconies. Tiny slices- maybe 24 inches wide- of pure fear- I couldn't relax on it even though I know they are entirely safe. A great holiday was had, anchored in a very good hotel complex.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Really enjoyed the hotel. Breakfast featured many hot items including two omelet bars. Staff was very friendly. Hotel was clean. View from the balcony was very good although I understand they are getting ready to knock down the hotel diagonal to the property and put up a mega hotel which will block the views. I'd have to believe that's a multi year project which would cause a bunch of other inconveniences. So that is a must check if you are booking for 2015 or beyond. The managers reception wasn't worth going to as there was only one bartender and a long line. They probably need to improve on that.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We were there on the business weekend of the year, service was good, staff friendly. The pool clean and inviting and not over crowded. Very handy location and very helpful staff on the desks at entry - bell boy, concierge etc

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I stayed at the Embassy Suites with my husband and 2 sons (12 and 14) for 6 nights after having stayed at 2 different resorts in Maui and prior to a 3 night end of holiday splurge at the nearby Waikiki Sheraton. We were very satisfied with our stay and would recommend the ES for families. I selected the Embassy Suites based on the style of accommodation offered. The fact that it offered 2 queen size beds (as distinct from the double beds that seem to be standard at most Hawaii hotels/resorts) and a separate living area suited our family circumstances. We found that it certainly delivered in this regard. The beds were comfy, and being queen size, relatively spacious. Those of us inclined to go to bed early(or late) or get up early (or late) could do so without disturbing the remainder of the family. We appreciated the space we had here after having previously spent 4 nights sharing a room. We found the rooms and furniture to be well maintained without being flash or fancy in any respect. The living area had a small but adequate mini-fridge, a coffee maker which we used every day and if my memory is correct, a microwave (which we didn't use). My 12 and 14 year old sons rated the wireless internet connection as the best we experienced in Hawaii and Housekeeping were very thorough and accommodating (for example when we asked for an extra towel and were provided with 2). A minor point of criticism is that there was limited space to hand and store clothes - but this wasn't a huge inconvenience. Although the nearby area can be quote noisy of an evening, we found the rooms very quiet once we closed the sliding doors. Being on the top floor and at the end of the corridor would have helped with noise. Unlike the Sheraton (where we stayed for 3 nights after the ES), we were not disturbed by noisy neighbours or noise from the hallway. We booked an Ocean view room and were given a corner room with a view of the ocean in between 2 other hotels (Halekulani and Outrigger I think) in one direction and a view of the Waikiki area (including the iconic Pink Palace) from the other direction. We were very happy with the location of the rooms within the hotel and the view. The ES Hotel is conveniently located, being one block from the beach and close to various restaurants and shopping options. A word of warning - it can be difficult to get a table for dinner during peak times - so you may want to make reservations ahead of time. The Ala Moana Shopping Centre is only a $10 (approx) taxi ride away or if you prefer, the public bus stop is in the next street. Various other shopping options are available in nearby streets. We used the Expedia desk to arrange a trip to Pearl Harbour and also to arrange a car for a couple of days. We didn't think that the prices were any higher than what was available via the internet (the car may have been even a little cheaper). We were able to return the car to the hire company by just handing it over to the valets at the ES hotel (they have an agreement) and this was very handy. Breakfast was varied and plentiful - lots of different hot and cold options, sweet and savoury, replenished regularly. The birds in the open air breakfast area were a bit of a nuisance and quick to pounce on any food left unattended. I can't comment on the manager's reception or the pool facilities - they both looked nice from a distance but we didn't access either. I had booked the room with a late checkout option included (based in availability). I had to assert myself a bit before they agreed to the late check out, however I do understand that they were very busy given that it was the day before 4th of July. We compromised on a checkout time that worked for us. One staff member that I spoke to in this regard was a bit abrupt but I spoke to another staff member on the morning of the check out who was very cordial. In summary, we found the ES well maintained, well located, very functional but not fancy or flash. I would recommend it for families and would certainly consider staying again if I ever return to Waikiki.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We have just returned home from two fantastic weeks at Embassy Suites. The hotel staff were so warm and welcoming. The rooms were very clean and bedding very comfortable. Breakfast in the morning and happy hour by the pool in the afternoon provided a lovely vibe and opportunity to meet other travellers. This was my fifth trip to Honolulu and this hotel was by far the best choice for our family. I would highly recommend Embassy Suites to all age groups, families and singles alike.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We loved our second honeymoon here. View of Diamond Head every morning was great and location could not be beat. Service was top notch. Room was great but not perfect. Breakfast was great start and convenient. Drinks at night were crowded and you could not get too many. Snacks were good but nothing exciting. We got a great rate from AAA - joined it just to get this discount. Beach Walk was great place to waste an hour. Location was close to bus, beach, and everything else.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was a great choice for our first visit to Oahu (we live on the Big Island). The hotel met and exceeded our expectations in every way. From check0in through check-out we were made to feel welcomed. The hotel is a beautiful, clean facility. It is in walking proximity to the beach, shops, restaurants, etc. There is not need to rent a car if staying here, as you can walk to shopping, eating, and beaches, and can sign-up in the lobby for tours if you desire.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My daughter and I just spent two weeks at this Hotel. It was great for us as we had a bedroom with queen size beds and a separate lounge/kitchenette, two way bathroom and balcony - which meant we were not under one another's feet!! It also included a free breakfast every morning - which was more than ample for us. Mind you - a lot of people wasted a lot of the food (their eyes were bigger than their stomachs)! Another bonus was the generosity of the happy hour (actually two hours) from 5.30 - 7.30pm. A very generous occasion both with the alcohol and snacks - a lovely time for the families there. They also provided live music four out of seven nights - a great family of males who sang and played well - especially their ukulele player. It was also in a great position and it was good to do a lot of walking (although not too far). The beach was nearby, the pool satisfactory and all around - a great place that made our holiday very enjoyable. Two disappointing comments I would make was we couldn't use the gym or laundry in our Tower - and although a small kitchenette - there wasn't any cutlery or plates. In view of large servings of food when we went out - and everyone happy to give you the leftovers (which were very ample) - there wasn't anything we could eat on or eat with. All in all a great place to stay - thank you Embassy Suites.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My daughter and I had the pleasure of staying at the Embassy Suites in Honolulu. It is a fantastic Hotel, located a block from the beach with all sorts or stores and restaurants within easy walking distance. It is also very close to the Galleria where you can catch the various trams. We had a room overlooking the pool which was excellent. There is a large pool with attached large hot tub and children's pool. These pools have an incredible bottom surface which is so soft! There are cabana type double chairs available on a first come basis [no extra charge]. There are also plenty of regular lounge chairs. Included in your stay is an amazing buffet breakfast including an omelet station, fresh fruit, juices, tea/coffee/milk, pastries, pancakes, cereals, yogurt, etc. They also have a happy hour in this area, which is a huge lanai adjacent to the pool. Complimentary drinks [beer, wine, cocktails, sangria] and munchies are available nightly from 5:30-7:30. The 2 room suite set-up is very nice and includes 2 TVs, a work desk, complimentary internet, bar fridge, microwave, kettle and coffee maker with the accompanying amenities. Also, for those on a longer stay in Honolulu, I really appreciated the self-serve laundromats on the 3rd floor of each tower. The staff at Embassy Suites were all very professional, friendly and most helpful. They will also hold your luggage at no extra charge if you have a late flight or are travelling onwards. I would definitely choose this location again - it is perfectly situated for eveything and a great hotel in itself.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We enjoyed our stay here. Check in is usually from 3pm. However, our flight from Australia arrived at 7.45am and we were at the hotel by 9.30am. We were able to check in straight away, as they had a room available. We had a 2 bedroom unit and it was perfect for our holiday. We stayed in room 524,for 6 nights then went across to Hawaii Island for 3 nights and then came back and stayed in room 724 both in the Hula Tower. On both check ins we received a lovely, refreshing cold juice punch drink. The units were identical and consisted of a room with a queen bed and an ensuite, kitchenette (not much crockery or cutlery), lounge dining and a 2nd bedroom with 2 single beds and a bathroom, perfect for our 2 teenagers. The units were very clean and comfortable. Usually I find pillows a problem at hotels, but this place had great pillows, so I could get a good nights sleep each night. The Embassy Suites include breakfast, which is very good, lots of variety in the food and a nightly Managers Happy Hour from 5pm - 7pm. There are free drinks and snacks. We went a few times to this. Some nights there was a great band entertaining everyone. Our accommodation package also included a Roberts Stars and Stripes tour for everyone. Embassy suites is conveniently located across the road from the beach, there is a Coco Cove convenience store under the building, a large ABC convenience store and a Denny's across the road, the Royal Hawaiian centre is near by and many other places to eat are only a short walk away. It is about a 20 minute walk to the Ala Moana shopping centre. It is about a 2 min walk to the Sheraton, which is a bus terminal pick up point for some of the Islands tours. We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful and made our stay enjoyable. If you want ocean views from your room, then this is probably not the place to stay, though we did get a view of the ocean from the balcony of room 724. We would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The 1 bedroom suite was clean and comfortable, spacious enough for our family of four. Free breakfast was convenient for family members waking up at different times. The food was fine, but we would save the brunt of our appetite for brunch at the Hula Grill or Eggs and Things. My personal favorite things about this hotel is the location and the evening receptions. Free drinks and snacks every evening was a perfect way to cap a fun day at the beach or pool. There was great live music 2 of the 4 evenings we were there. I didn't get a chance to take advantage of the free yoga class this time, but it's nice to have the opportunity to do yoga while on vacation. For all of the amenities and services, it is the best price for a 1 bedroom suite in this location compared to other hotels along this popular block. We loved being able to step outside of the hotel and easily access delicious restaurants, fun shopping, and great beaches. No need for a car. We just had a shuttle drop us off and pick us up. Would definitely recommend this hotel to others.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is the second time our family of 6 has stayed at the Embassy Suites Waikiki. We enjoyed our 3-day, 2-night stay just as much as the first time. The 2-bedroom suites are perfect for our large family. Our adult kids enjoy the managers' reception (happy hour) and we all love the hot breakfast!!! We'll definitely be returning soon!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at Embassy Suites in June for four nights as a family of four. We loved the breakfast every morning which kept us full till the happy hour every night from 5.30-7.30. The rooms were big enough for everybody to have there own space and the area around by the pool is lovely. Would definately recommend this as a perfect place for families to stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: spent 6 nights recently. reception wasn't over friendly.great location quite end of town.stayed in room 930 one bedroom suite,bed was good, does have plenty of room for 2 people, 2 small balconies so you have 2 views of the beach from 2 sides of the building with 1 overlooking the pool.great full buffet breakfast with egg station,no resort fees,cocktails every evening 5.30-7.30 pm all inclusive great staff. would stay here again.everything you need within walking distant .

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was our second stay in 6 months and I thoroughly recommend it for New Zealand families. Many hotels in Waikiki are "rooms only" and we were given a great 2 bedroom/bathroom suite. Thank you to the man that checked us in (sorry I cannot recall your name) for accommodating our requests. The breakfast and evening drinks are really good. It is so close to the beach, shopping and restaurants. I recommend this Hotel over other places for New Zealanders and Australians that travel agents recommend.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Hotel was very nice. Service was prompt, friendly and accurate. Location was great. The complimentary breakfast and evening reception made it very nice. The suite was perfect for my family accommodating 6 people very nicely. I would like to visit again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Perfect, perfect spot right in the middle of Waikiki,one block off the beach,perfect size rooms,we had 2 king size beds and a sofa bed,perfect buffet breaky every morning,perfect happy hour each arvo (5.30-7.30pm) and its 100% free,yep free,go your hardest with nibblies as well right next to the pool and its perfect as well,pool is located on the 4th floor which gives some privacy as we noticed that most pools at most places were open to public traffic,pool side menu was also very handy and reasonably priced,perfect staff,very friendly,this place came highly recommened to us and we were not let down at all,embassy suites is right above the Yardhouse restaurant which was teriffic too as was Dukes,a ABC shop straight accross the road along with a Starbucks along with many other restaurants and shops,if you are taking kids this place is ideal because of location,room space,breaky,happy hour and super friendly staff,we will be back for sure,make sure you check out pearl harbour and waikele shopping outlets.Thanks

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Spent right nights here just recently. Property is in a fantastic location and Aldren at breakfast is exceptional and genuine.Could not recommend highly enoughValet (Tawny Rose) was also brilliant and very sorry, the tall guy on valet most days was also outstanding. Thanks for looking after us

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Could not ask for a better place to stay! Friendly staff, great views, amazing food and much much more! Rooms were clean and bell hops were on it :) We will stay again and recommend this hotel to others. Plus it's walking distance to the beach and shopping!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My family stayed at the Embassy Suites in Waikiki for 4 nights in June of 2014 and could not have found a place that better fit our needs. My husband and I have traveled to Waikiki at least once a year for the past 15 years, he used to live there and we met and were married in town. We know the area very well and have always stayed at either the Outrigger Reef on the Beach or Outrigger Waikiki. We love both of those hotels (I have reviewed them in the past) but since this was the first time we were bringing our children (ages 11 and 13), we wanted a little more space while staying in the same location and very close to the beach. Embassy Suites definitely fit the bill. For the same price as a room at the Reef, we got a suite at Embassy Suites, plus the hot breakfast every morning and the manager's reception in the evening, which was one of my favorite parts of the day. We arrived at 8:30 pm, hungry and tired and were greeted by the friendliest staff. We were offered an icy cold tropical fruit juice cocktail (my kids begged me to ask if we could bring a bottle home) and a fast and easy check in process. The bellman brought up our bags very quickly and gave us a tour of the room, letting us know that if we needed anything to please let him know. The rooms are a good size. It is a remodeled hotel, I believe it was originally an Outrigger, so the "suites" are more like two hotel rooms, with a connecting door. One room has the bathroom, a kitchenette (microwave, mini-fridge, coffee maker), a pull out sofa bed, television and table with chairs that could also be a desk. Both rooms have lanais, and I would suggest that if you are bothered by city noise to request a room on a higher floor. We were on the 6th floor and the noise doesn't bother me at all, but it isn't quiet as our room faced Lewers Street and Beach Walk. The bedroom had two very comfortable beds, an armoire, television, etc... Plenty of room and storage space for the four of us. We did call housekeeping for extra blankets and towels and they were delivered almost immediately and with a smile. In fact, every time we ran into housekeeping we were always greeted with a smile and an aloha, the women were all very sweet.The pool is on the 4th floor on a large deck that has beautiful views. Our first morning was spent eating breakfast there with a view of palm trees and a rainbow. We spent a lot of time on that deck, swimming and sunning. The pool was crowded in the mornings and later in the afternoons, but never so crowded that we had trouble finding a seat or feeling like there was too much going on in the pool. I did like that there were loads of kids, my son met a group of kids he played with in the pool everyday we were there which was great. The daily breakfast was perfect for us and after a few days you realize there isn't much variety day to day, but there is plenty to eat and something for everyone. It never felt crowded and we met many nice families while we were sitting out enjoying our food.We did order food from the pool bar for lunch one day, and while the coconut shrimp were delicious, they took forever to arrive. I'd like to chalk it up to being on island time, but it really did seem to take forever. It seemed that there was only one server working with the bartender, so maybe that had something to do with it. The service at the pool might be the only thing that wasn't great about this hotel. There is a pool bar with a television (which was great because the NHL playoffs were in full swing), and the bartender was a nice guy who made a mean lava flow. He was also the bartender at the manager's reception, so all of these guys are working hard! My husband and I loved the manager's reception every night, two hours of drinks included in your room rate! We sat on the deck and listened to live entertainment while the kids swam in the pool. Just a tip, the soda fountains that are open during breakfast are also open during this time as well, so you can send the kids over to get their own drink (or you can get one too!). I would say to PLEASE remember to tip those bartenders, especially since you aren't paying for your drinks. They served many a cocktail the nights we were there, and I was surprised at the number of people who weren't taking care of their bartender. There were also light snacks (chips, salsa, crudite, etc...) It was a great way to start our nights.The beach is a very short walk away, not even a block. It's not the best beach on Waikiki but if you can get past the rocks, the water is beautiful. Kayak and surfboard rentals are easy to find and it's a gorgeous walk in either direction once you're at the beach. You have beach (or pool) towels in your room to take, but remember to bring them back or you will be charged.The location of this hotel is perfect, great dining options close by, shopping, etc... I'm really glad that we chose it for our stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel is a great place for family on vacation. You are right in the middle of the action and almost on the beach. Staff is great. There is a family friendly atmosphere. Make sure you go and get breakfast it is good and free.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: If you want good value and a really handy location I can recommend Embassy suites. We returned to find the Wi Fi better, the breakfast and evening drinks just as good! Sometimes the pool is overcrowded, but hey, I am here for the beach and shopping!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Free open bar in the evening and free complimentary breakfast the next morning. This makes for a great value if you just want to spend a few nights in the Waikiki area. Very convenient to have all these complimentary amenities as well.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: One block off of Waikiki Beach, you could hardly ask for a more convenient location to explore the area. We spent a great deal of our time wandering up & down the famous stretch of sand, stopping in to the various hotels & restaurants to see what each had to offer. Upon check-in, we were placed in a room that had an unbearable aroma (details of which I will not go in to right now - let's just say that no one would want to remain in that room for any length). The individual at the front desk told us (in a rather unpleasant tone) that this was the only room available that would match our needs. We immediately returned to the front desk to inform them that this room was unacceptable. Another member of their staff was able to correct the situation (surprisingly, another room became available). This seemed to be the mantra for our stay - basics would require correction which some members of the staff were able to address after the fact. Our experience left us with the overall sense that perhaps the management of the property is in transition. You can see/feel the influence of strong leadership in the service industry. Likewise you can also note when it is lacking, and this is what we encountered on our stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stay at the hotel was good. Staff was very helpfull and efficient. Hotel was located near shops and restaurants. Suites offered additional space to be in. Only problem was difficulty in getting an elevator due to volume of people coming and going.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Embassy Suites Waikiki is an excellent place to stay in Hawaii; especially for military families being stationed at Fort Shafter. Great breakfast & managers special. Centrally located in Waikiki and close to FT Shafter.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at Embassy Suites for 12 nights. Wow what a great place with exceptional staff. Rooms were clean and spacious and well maintained. We stayed in the Aloha tower on the top floor, the views were amazing. Loved the location, we were able to walk everywhere. Plenty of places to eat nearby. Loved the included breakfast and managers reception. Would definetely stay here again :)

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was our 2nd visit to Hawaii and to the Embassy Suites. Unfortunately at the time of booking it didn't appear that an ocean view suite was available. As we liked the hotel so much the first time we decided to still stay there even without the ocean view. I have to admit the suite we were allocated didn't live up to our usual expectations. The suite itself wasn't bad as such, but it didn't have a view and it wasn't as big as the corner suite we had previously stayed in. As there were 4 of us (myself, my husband and our 10 year old twins) we felt closed in. t just didn't have the same feel and after the fist night I decided to speak with reception to see if there was any chance of being moved. Thankfully the lovely lady on reception took quite some time to search the booking system and eventually came up with a solution. We spent one more night in our suite and were then moved to a corner suite on a high level in the Hula Tower. It made such a difference to the rest of our holiday and we were very grateful for the time taken to help accommodate our request. Obviously this was at an extra expense, but it was well worth it. If you can afford it, I would suggest to ask for an ocean view suite. Although most people don't spend a lot of time in their suites, it's a beautiful view to wake up to, and to look out at whenever you are in the suite. You also don't feel so closed in, and the corner suites are definitely bigger than the others..... plus they have 2 balconies.Everything else about our stay was wonderful. The staff were friendly and helpful from reception and the guys who organised taxis etc, to the bar staff and chefs who cooked our eggs each morning. One chef even remembered us from our visit nearly 2 years prior. The person who stood out the most was Aldrin. He also remembered us from our previous stay and was there each morning with a smile and a lovely welcome. He's a real asset to the hotel.Of course we took advantage of the Manager's Drinks each night and the wonderful live entertainment. Our children loved meeting other kids at the pool and there's a real family atmosphere. We have recommended the hotel to many friends and they have not been disappointed. We love the location, the size of the suites, the Manager's Drinks, the breakfast, the staff and the feel of the place. Yes it has hula girl bedside lamps and pineapple tree carpet, but there's something very charming about the almost tackiness of the decor. It's clean and comfortable and had everything we needed.I would've given it a 5 star rating if we had have been able to have our requested room from the start of our stay. We will be back!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: There are 2 towers. Hula and aloha. Hula is a little older but better proximity for the pool and happy hours. Aloha is more modern but we had a look at both rooms and decided on Hula as the room reconfig was better. Our 2 bedroom had a separate king room and the kids bedroom had 2 queens. There was a rollout in the sofa in the separate lounge. Aloha tower only had 1 king in the second bedroom. There is a gym on level 4 of the aloha tower. Some free weights and treadmills. Was open when we were there. Have to be over 18 to use but no one checks. Laundry in both towers on level 3. 3$ for washing machine and $1 for laundry detergent. Coin machine was handy to get coins. Pool area was nice. Large pool and spa. Happy hour goes for 2 hours every night. Cocktails and spirits and mocktails for the kids. You should tip the bar tender a few dollars. Most do but not essential. Other tips. Taxi and expensive. About 75$ each way to the outlet centre but you can get a mini bus Shuttle About $55 return for a family but we got a cab. Friday night fireworks are at 745pm on the beach about 100mtr away. Pf Changs was good for a quick meal with kids about 140$ usd for 5. But Bills sydney. Bill granger's restaurant was great. About 100mtr away from the hotel and the best coffee in hawaii. God I don't know how anyone can drink Starbucks. It's horrid dishwater!!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: One of the best values in Waikiki. Our only disappointment was that we were not informed that the fitness facility was temporarily unavailable due to it being refurbished. We were afforded a fitness facility entry at a sister facility, although it took time to access. All in all, the ES did its best to make our stay rewarding.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Rooms were clean and comfortable, and the cleaning service was very friendly. The location is good - a short walk to the beach, and many dining options nearby. The morning breakfast was the best complimentary breakfast we have had, and the evening reception was nice, with free drinks and snacks and a band one night. The pool area is a nice place to relax. My only complaint is that they charged me for 1 more night of parking than what I used. I could understand the confusion, but the staff was really unpleasant about correcting it. This experience left a bad taste as we were leaving. As annoying as this was, I cannot really justify marking the whole experience down based on it.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Convenient place. Difficult to find the hotel, becasue the name of hotel was shown along the street, not easy to find, if you drive. The restaurant, The Roy's need reservation if want to go. The reception of restaurant was not friendly at all, simply told me "fully booked".

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Embassy Suites was fine. The windows were dirty inside and out, but otherwise it was decent. Always nice to have a suite. The beds were comfortable. It's close to shops. The evening drinks are pretty bad, a lot like Mexico. There is no real lobby, it's just part of the valet. Parking is $35 a day and pretty necessary. It's a block from the beach, next to Trump tower. Honolulu is a disgusting city, we were offered LSD (out with our 2 teenaged girls who don't dress/look like drug users!) and saw a prostitute working a deal the first evening we walked to Waikiki Beach - it was still light out and we were in front of the Out Rigger, not lurking in some seedy area. Oh wait, all of Honolulu is seedy! It's a nasty, dirty city and I will never stay there again. The rest of Hawaii is so beautiful, go out and see it!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel was perfect for our family! We were traveling with two other families (15 people total) and this hotel was great to work with and put our rooms next to each other. The rooms were very spacious. We stayed in a two bedroom suite (1 King, 2 Queens). The 2 bathrooms in the suite were so nice to have. The beds and pillows were great.From the moment our shuttle dropped us off, we were treated warmly and felt like family to all the staff. Check in was very smooth and quick and the kids enjoyed the juice that they were given while they waited for us to check in.The first day we were there, our 3 yr old fell down and split his forehead open while hiking Diamond Head. The front desk staff was very helpful and gave us band-aids and told us how to get to the nearest Urgent Care clinic.The breakfast area was nice. There was plenty of variety each day and my kids (ages 3, 6, 10, and 14) had no problem finding something to eat. We especially loved the staff in the breakfast area. Aldren and Lei were very helpful when we asked questions about the destinations we were planning on visiting. Aldren was so sweet and greeted us with a "Hello family!" each time he saw us. Coronado was also very helpful when we needed utensils or napkins after the breakfast area was closed.We loved the pool. It was just the right size for our kids. I loved the couch cabanas that were around the pool.If your schedule allows, I recommend the free Yoga classes that are offered. The instructor was great.I would highly recommend this hotel for any one traveling with children. It's in a great location with beach access near by and plenty of restaurants and shopping within a short walk.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Outstanding service and value geared to accomodating hotel guests. Establishment and staff are definitely oriented in hospitality services and customer satisfaction, amazing service. My family and I enjoyed our stay and will definitely stay there again. Dont change a thing. Thank you from an extremely satisfied guest.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel by far was the best I've ever stayed in!! The staff was so courteous, helpful and professional!! This was our post cruise stay and we were surprisingly upgraded to a 2 bedroom suite! Oh my goodness! Huge room! Amenities were readily available and the view from 1 of the 3 balconies (yes 3) was mesmerizing! We could see the Pacific Ocean and it is in walking distance of just every thing. There was so much going on that a one night just wasn't enough time to see everything! I plan to stay here again very soon! !

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our stay at the embassy suites in Waikiki, was really enjoyable and one of the memorable vacation we had: specially the front desk agent by the name of Andrew and one of the bell boy which is older guy (Asian descent) which we forgot his name, made our stay homey the treatment we had with this guys it feels like we were a turn guest delightful . The breakfast cook name Thomas was very friendly and always makes a conversation while he was cooking, gives a great customer services especially when my daughter was asking for French toast which it wasn’t in the menu that day. When we requested he was gladly to make that specially request. Overall this hotel was one of the best in the customer services they really knows the meaning of great hospitality.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We were wow'd from the minute we arrived with a warm welcome after a long flight and a quick check-in despite being early. The facilities are clean, the service excellent, and the amenities (ie pool, breakfast, manager's reception, free wi-fi in the room) were enjoyed and appreciated.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I had to reread the reviews just to check I really did have the right place. I booked this hotel purely because of the trip advisor reviews and I have to say - just not impressed! The rooms need a make over, our view is just ok - we're at the back so the view is on the side, the walls are paper thin, we were woken by our neighbour watching tv at 4am this morning. Whoever wrote that the evening nibbles is substantial is on a different planet to me! Corn chips, crisps and nuts? The drinks are ok but really they're included in the room rate, there's no sparkling wine and the only other thing I drink - bud light keeps not working. Breakfast is very nice but that's about it. As for the great customer service. Huh? I emailed the concierge before our stay asking for nanny agency referrals - still waiting for an answer, I emailed and explained this trip was our honeymoon and could the room be booked under our married name (which was done at the 3 previous hotels we've stayed at on this trip) - not done, I requested it again at check in - still not done (my husband is walking around being called by my previous name - he hates that!) the concierge desk is all about selling time shares and tours which means we're avoiding them like the plague. We really wished we stayed somewhere else! It's a shame because our other three hotels on this trip have been awesome.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: From the big comfortable double rooms, to the excellent staff, to the outstanding complimentary breakfast, to the relaxing managers reception...there is no better place to stay anywhere in the world. I dare you to find a higher quality hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: First off, the maid service was amazing! If she only works the 14th floor of the Aloha Tower I would request that I stay there again. Room was nice. View from 1408 was great. I could see the Ocean, pool, and was able to sit on my balcony and watch the hula show below on Lewers Street. The Valet are wonderful and fast. My husband is working on the island and his car is already waiting for him every morning! All shopping is right there as well. If you want a fantastic place off the beach yet just steps away then this is the perfect place to stay!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We enjoyed our stay at Embassy Suites Waikiki. Everything was perfect from the staff to the room and the complimentary breakfast. Would definitely recommend to friends and family. Will return next year when I visit my son stationed at Pearl Harbor.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Embassy Suites met more of my desired preferences for our four night stay in Waikiki than any other hotel. The extra space of a suite was a definite plus and the only negative was that it isn't on the beach. Upon arrival, I was delighted to learn that we had been "upgraded" to an ocean view room. We had a great view of the ocean and the pool from our balcony. The short walk to the beach was easy and there is a separate elevator from the pool area to the beach. The daily breakfast was always very good and the drinks at the evening reception were generous. Our suite was laid-out efficiently, the bed and sofa sleeper were comfortable and our room was very clean. Towels are provided to take to the beach, and in room safes are provided for things you don't want to take to the beach. Guest laundry facilities are available. There are many restaurants and stores nearby, including some within the property. Customer service was first-rate!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Yes it is fairly expensive but it is Waikiki and you get drinks and breakfast so it is a great value. Staff is nothing but fantastic, go out of way to help you. Breakfast is good, crowded at times but overall no issue. Happy hour is great. They have good drink selection and some light snacks. Overall a great place.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I can't rate the Embassy Suites Waikiki highly enough. The location is perfect, breakfast wonderful and the afternoon reception a real treat. We thoroughly enjoyed sipping cocktails and listening to a band while the children played in the pool. I have no negatives and look forward to having the pleasure of staying again one day.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I have stayed at a few of the top hotels in Waikiki and rate the Embassy Suites the highest. Whilst the location is not right on the beach it has an excellent pool area with cabanas (that you do not have to pay extra for), the great "Managers Reception" for 2 hours each afternoon with complimentary cocktails and snacks, the rooms are tastefully decorated, buffet breakfast is included, the the service is the best you will get. This hotel attracts families so keep that in mind. You will love this hotel!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We've stayed here 2 times and once was for 21 days. It isn't the right place for that long of a stay but it's good for 10 days or less. The breakfast doesn't have much for gluten free people but when I talked to the chef he got turkey bacon for us and that was really over the top service for a free breakfast buffet. I love eating on the lanai with the wind blowing and looking at the pool area. They have the afternoon snack and drink buffet but they was very little we could eat. I like a margarita but the mix had preservatives and ingredients I couldn't have but that's not a big deal. The hotel is attached to The Yard House which is an amazing gluten free/allergy tolerant place so that makes it awesome. It backs up to Lewers Street which is really nice for shopping and eating. The people at the pool are consistently the friendliest hotel guests we come across. Our kids make friends easily and we have people to chat with. The staff at the hotel are very nice and helpful. The location is great as long as you don't want a beachfront view.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We liked this hotel. Exceptional complimentary breakfast, good service, clean rooms, nice pool area. Accessible to many shops and restaurants. Rooms slightly smaller than other Embassy properties, but still roomier than many inter-city hotel rooms.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: If your staying in Waikiki and you don't need to be beachfront, then this is the place for you. It is in a great location near all the restaurants and shopping in the best part of Waikiki. If beach is an issue then you are still only 1 hotel away from the sand. The pool area is large and no problem getting a lounger. They also have the evening and breakfast reception in the same area which are both included in the price and are among the best you will come across. The evening entertainment at the managers reception is a nice touch and well worth going to.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great location. Friendly staff. Very clean rooms. Double rooms super for families, with beds in one room and living area. Pool was fantastic - clean and great for kids. Short walk to shops, bars and eateries. A pleasant experience.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: From the time I arrived in Waikiki to the moment I left, the Embassy Beachwalk went above and beyond to offer first class accommodations.After I spotted the tiki torches that mark the entrance to the Embassy, I valeted my car and was soon greeted with an "Aloha!" by the front desk agent. She quickly assisted me with check in and even gave me free POG (passion orange guava juice)! The open air lobby is beautifully kept, well staffed, and convenient to both Embassy towers.Because I'm a HHonors Diamond member and was using my points for the stay, I was upgraded to an ocean view, corner room on the 15th floor of the Hula tower. When I got up to my room, I was pleasantly surprised to find 2 spacious rooms and the biggest bathroom I've ever seen in an Embassy. The best part was, the room had three sliding glass doors leading to two different lanais, overlooking the Waikiki shoreline on one side and the Embassy pool and Trump Tower on the other side. A nice touch was the voucher for Honolulu Cookie Company cookies that I found on my pillow as a welcome gift.I arrived late afternoon, so the evening reception was my next stop. Fun island music and fruity drinks will whisk you away and help you forget the troubles of the mainland. The band is extremely talented and all the bartenders who served me made excellent drinks (blue Hawaiian, Hawaiian Punch, mai tai).The next day, I was jet lagged and woke up early so I was at breakfast when it opened at 6:30am. The breakfast staff was so friendly and accommodating -- anticipated my needs, and they even made me a custom juice blend!! Breakfast selections are plentiful ... something for everyone here.I was a little unsure where exactly I wanted spend the limited time I had on Oahu so I stopped by the Hilton Vacations desk adjacent to the hotel's front desk before I took off for my day's adventures. If you haven't been to Oahu before, I recommend stopping here to get tips on how to maximize your time on the island. The agent there who helped me was knowledgeable about the island and pointed some 'musts' out to me that I would've otherwise missed. She was extremely patient -- took about 10-15 mins -- to explain everything to me. Her recommendations were spot on! Not a moment of my day was wasted.The next day, I spent some time by the beautiful pool even though the weather was a tad overcast. The cabana pods come with pillows and are so comfortable. Theres only five cabanas so if you want one you should plan to strike early. Otherwise, there's plenty of chaises -- they were never full that I noticed. The nice thing about the cabanas and chaises is they're all FREE. I've been to places in Florida that charge you if you so much as glance at a chaise. The pool is well maintained and clean, and there's a hot tub and a children's pool all attached to the big pool so you're never far from either of those.The location of the Embassy is walking distance to Wakiki Beach and also upscale stores (Kate Spade/Coach/Tory Burch, etc.) and restaurants (Ruth's Cris/House Without a Key/PF Changs, etc.)The last night of my stay, I found on my pillow a complimentary Hawaiian music CD as the hotel's parting gift to me. Such a nice way to cap a truly amazing stay! I was grateful to take a little bit of aloha back to the mainland with me.I took the red eye out of Honolulu and was able to sight see before leaving for the airport because the valet will let you park at the Embassy until 11pm the day you check out. The hotel will even let you use their 'hospitality suite' for 30 mins to freshen up before departing for the airport.I highly recommend the Embassy Beachwalk. If I return to Oahu, the Embassy will one of my first stops!!Have a great trip!!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We have just returned from 12 nights at the Embassy suites. We had a suite and our daughter and her family had their own suite we were both on the 4th floor, which was where the pool was, the breakfast and the meeting place for the managers happy hour, which we took full advantage of and loved.The hotel is in easy walking distance to the beach ( take the 2nd entrance passed the Outrigger as the beach is nicer) and lots of good reataurants and of course shopping.We found the service excellent and would love to stay at the Embassy suites again it has a nice vibe especially for families.O

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The Embassy Suites at Waikiki is a convenient location to stay. Situated on the Beach -walk, the hotel is not on the beach front, but within walking distance of it. The suites are well appointed, with a living room and a bedroom, and a commodious restroom.There is a coffee maker and hot water for those who would love to have their morning coffee or tea in bed. Our suite was on the 18th of the 21 floors of the building. While the check out time is 11 am, the check in time is 3 pm, Our flight arrived at 8 am and we arrived at 9 am only to have to wait in the lobby for a room that we were allotted at 2.30 pm. Not really a great welcome to an otherwise good hotel! Rooms are clean with the house keepers coming in each day to do up the room. The pool area is on the fourth floor which also serves as the breakfast point and the meeting place for the managers happy hours each evening. Happy hours from 5.30 till 7.30 pm is time when drinks and snacks are on the house. It is meeting time for the hotel guests, but each group keeps to themselves. The bartenders are indeed a happy lot, and serve their guest copiously. The fitness Center is under renovation, but the hotel provides the facilities at the neighbouring location. Breakfast is standards, with chefs making your eggs to order. The hotel has a sports desk at the reception where you could make reservations for water sports or other activities. But do check outside the hotel for bargain prices. Good place to stay at should you come to Hawaii,

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
