review_body: This is our 3rd time at this Embassy Suites. Overall it was fantastic. They are currently going through some room revitilizations in the Aloha tower (north). We were able to stay in a renovated room. Renos are ongoing until mid June so in order to get to the pool area, it's a minor detour getting there. Ignore the posts about the birds - you are outside, it will happen. The issue visitors should be worried about is the homelessness problem in Waikiki. Yes - it is getting worse. This Embassy is in a good, safe location - it is on the beachwalk with plenty of shops and restaurants. Would definitely stay again. And try to book a AAA rate, it will save quite a bit on the nightly rate.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I have stayed at this hotel many times for work. The breakfast is good as expected at most ES. You do have to protect your food from the birds. The afternoon happy hour is nice and the bartenders good. The local music is nice for the evening drinks. The hotel is undergoing some renovations but where my room was not affected. If you can get a high level room you will get a decent view of the water. The location is great for Waikiki as there are many restaurants within walking distance and shopping if that is your idea of fun. The pool area is nice. I am staying here again for work. Always my first choice in town for work. The only 2 downfalls are the $35 parking but at least it is valet and unlimited in and out and the internet. The internet was horribly slow and at times was difficult to get work done. I hope they fix the internet soon. I had to use my cell phone to tether at times.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Very handy spot, we stayed here for 6 nights and it's so close to everything, a few minutes walk to the beach, the crazy Waikiki shopping is right at the doorstep, there's a nice pool and pool area to laze around if you're so inclined.The rooms were lovely and clean, with a view over the pool.The Managers drinks in the evening were great fun, a band played one of the nights and the atmosphere was really good.Very happy, would recommend for families!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The hotel is located in a convenient area where there are lots of shops & restaurants & it's particularly helpful to be so close to the beach as parking is difficult in this area. Try to get a room above 10th floor so you can have a partial ocean view & a good view of the Waikiki district. Access to different floors are controlled by the room key card, so I think the security of the hotel is good. Rooms seem to have renovated recently, the bed & sofabed are firm enough. Lobby is not air-conditioned & looks busy as it's open to the driveway where the guests' cars driving by all the time, only valet parking is allowed in this hotel. Breakfast is average but I'm a bit worried about the hygiene as there are lots of birds flying around the open dining room.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: It had been a dream of my father to go to Hawaii, so being a dutiful son I travelled half way round the world to take him there! Needing a suite rather than a room, and being a Hilton Hhonors Gold member, I decided to book the Embassy Suites, rather than the HHV which we could have booked as a timeshare owner. We paid a premium to have an Ocean View.The rooms aren't cheap, and the parking is an added expense (but everyone else seems to charge too!). However, on the plus side the suite was large and clean, with double queen size beds in the bedroom and a large living room, and kitchenette. Although we booked an ocean view, this could only be seen if you were sitting on the balcony, and the views from inside the suite are shown in the encloses photos (although, to give some balance, the view from the balcony is also shown). Would I pay for the "Ocean View" next time, when you can't actually get the view from the sofa/bed? Probably not.The complimentary breakfast buffet is a bit of a scrum, and there does seem to be a problem with birds - as soon as you left the table they would come to the table to take the crumbs!We did take advantage of the Happy Hours most evening - free flowing wine, beer and cocktails, with entertainment every other night.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I would highly recommend this hotel to family/friends and business travelers. The entire staff made you feel like family, services were excellent and the breakfast offered a variety of choices. Short distance from the beach... great location if you're a tourist...

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at the Embassy Suites over Xmas and NYE. I have been to Hawaii many times, and wanted something a bit more spacious. We stayed in the 2 bedroom cityview. The rooms were spacious enough for 3 females (2 bathrooms was a bonus). Breakfast was included everyday (including cooked to order eggs/omeletes). Every afternoon we had drinks and nibles by the pool. The band that played on most nights was good. The hotel is located down on beach walk with many restaurants to choose from. Ala Moana was about 20 minute walk away (we liked to walk).

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: if you want quiet room request an upper room with a partial or full ocean view. The 3rd room was the best. The first one they gave us was under street level by the main road. Noisy and dark. The 2nd room was better but had feces smeared on the outside of the toilet. They gave us a third room in the tower facing the pool and ocean (the partially view)--much better. It was clean and fairly quiet except the alarms. The fire alarm went off 3 times in the middle of the night while we were there. We had to call down the first time to see if it was real. It was not. But a loud speaker wakes you up telling you to leave your room and take the stairs. We were very high up and disabled. Not fun to hear at 3am. Okay now the good part. Great location! Walking distance to the beach and many fantastic restaurants and shops. We could also get fresh fruit close by. The concierge puts on a presentation so you can get information on things to do around the island. Many good tips. The free breakfast and happy were really great. Lots of food choices plus many Asian selections-- my daughter loved it. We had a nice full breakfast everyday then a nice happy hour in the evening. You get 1 or 2 free drinks and snacks. Nice way to end the day and the start the evening. Plus it really helps save money. I would stay here again! i would just be very specific about the room we want.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Everyone is very welcoming and friendly, from the valet staff who are quick and always ask you if you need directions to the massage staff who did an amazing job poolside. Very convenient to the beach and pool/beach towels are provided (great idea!). Breakfast and evening reception on the house provides convenience and cost savings. Room is very clean (especially the bathroom). We had a two-bedroom suite which gave our family lots of space.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We just returned from a 10 night stay in Hawaii, 7 of which were spent at the Embassy Suites Beach Walk. Let me say that I did a lot of research on Trip Advisor for hotels in Waikiki as the rooms are pricey and there is a vast selection to choose from. I am happy to say that we were overwhelmed with our stay here!While this is one of the pricier stays in Waikiki, it truly offers the most value for the money. It is not how much you spend as opposed to what you receive in return, and let me say that the Embassy Suites Beach Walk offered amenities by the bushel!Our suite was nice with double queen size beds in the bedroom and a large living room, kitchenette and wet bar. The rooms were spacious by Waikiki standards and each room had a separate balcony. Although we booked a city view room, by looking to the right, we had a nice partial ocean view. Location is important in Waikiki, and in my mind the Beach Walk area is the best place to stay right now. This area is modern, clean, nicely lighted and offers a great variety of mid and upper end dining, stores and boutiques. All within close walking distance is Starbucks, P.F. Changs, Cheesecake Factory, Ruth's Chris Steak House, Hard Rock Cafe and many others too numerous to mention. Right next door is the new Trump Hotel and high end Halekulani Hotel. We did not see one sleeping bum on the street during our entire stay here unlike many other locations in Waikiki! The hotel is also just across the street from the beach. The complimentary breakfast buffet does change slighty each day and does offer fresh made to order eggs and omelets. Also available depending on the day were scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, waffles, pancakes, biscuits and gravy, chinese soup(miso) and salads, pastries and fresh sliced fruits. This free breakfast served 6:30 -10:30 daily competes favorably, if not better, than many of the breakfast buffets in the area that you are forced to pay for. My compliments to the chefs!Unlike other Embassy suites that I have stayed at which offer one or maybe 2 free drinks, this one has a Happy Hour like none other running from 5:30 - 7:30 nightly, and it is all you can drink! Not only that, it's not no name liquors, but all name brands and are the drinks are garnished nicely! Tip these guys as they deserve to be tipped and they will not only remember your drink, but they will provide pours that comparable in the best drinking establishments. The mai tais that I had almost nightly here, were the best on the island by far! Snacks like chips, salsa and sliced veggies and dip were also provided each night. Four nights a week live entertainment is provided, and they play a mix of Hawaiian and current hits. The staff are all friendly, always with a pleasant Aloha and smile, no matter the day, time or situtation.I would like to put a special thank you out to our housekeeper Lleuwelynn on the 7th floor of the Hula Tower. She did a wonderful job in cleaning our room and providing us with plenty of fresh towels as requested. She was always around and would ask us how long that we would be gone so that she could clean our room without interupting us. No matter when we were coming or going, she would always greet us, strike up a brief conversation and wish us a pleasant day. Thanks for all of the notes and for the Hawaiian music cds, which were really a nice touch! She became almost like our Hawaiian Mom and on our last day she wished us well on our journey and said that she would miss us!Thinking back of our lovely stay at the Waikiki Embassy Beach Walk puts a smile to my face and you can bet that we will stay here on our next visit to Waikiki!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Just completed a week of business and a week of vacation. Our room was excellent and over looked the pool. The Breakfast is fantastic but I would recommend that consideration be given to installing bird netting during the breakfast hours. Nightly cocktails and beer were a big plus and all the bartenders were friendly and fun Kioli (sorry for spelling) was a riot and made the evening start off fun. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. I like the fact everyone that works there makes eye contact, smiles and speaks to you. Friendly people just make you feel good. I would also highly recommend Victor at the front desk to anyone needing help with reservations or any matter concerning your stay. He was always one step ahead of us on any questions or help we may have needed. Thousands of people stay at the hotel and when we checked in he remembered our name's and where we are from. From making sure we were more than satisfied with our room, giving helpful advise, ensuring your departure day is set up to maximize your time there, to making sure you know you can call him personally to set up your next stay...he is the model customer service professional. The entertainment was very good. Can't wait to go back in August!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here for 10 nights as part of our honeymoon. We had requested one of the end/corner rooms but on arrival were allocated one next to the lift. We found the lift incredibly noisy and requested to be moved which we were the next morning. We then got one of the end/corner rooms. We were on a high floor and had great views as well as sun all afternoon/evening for sitting out on the balcony. The hotel isn't ultra-luxurious in terms of decor etc but it is very clean and comfortable. We knew this when booking but were keen on other things the hotel could offer like a two room suite, included breakfast and the evening reception. The hotel did leave us a bottle of bubbly and some chocolate strawberries so do mention if you're honeymooning. We loved our stay here, good location for walking to shops, restaurants etc. breakfast was really good, loved the cooked-to-order omelettes as well as the waffles/French toast they had most days. Only negative was the birds around the breakfast area as others have mentioned. We really enjoyed the Manager's Reception, loved my daily Mai Tais and Blue Hawaiians. The band really added to the lovely atmosphere. Would definitely love to return,

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Overall a good experience expected from Hilton as a Diamond Member. BUT, the birds on the pool/hospitality/breakfast deck were incredibly annoying. I would expect some sort of abatement for $300/night.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at this Embassy Suites Hotel in April, 2014. The staff members were outstanding. They were all genuinely warm and friendly. Their professionalism was over-the-top. The 2-room suite was immaculate; the bed was comfortable and two of the pillows were down feathers. The food was excellent and the happy hour drinks were well-poured! I would recommend this place to anyone.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We have just returned from 9 nights at the Embassy Suites...and we want to turn around and go back again. We were in the Hula tower, on the 8th floor and were right beside the elevators. I was a little concerned, having read the reviews here on Trip advisor, about the noise of the elevators, but it wasn't a problem for us at all. With the air conditioning on, we hardly heard the elevators at all. We had a great view of the pool, as well as a limited but stunning view of the sea.Everything, from the time we checked in until the time we left, helped contribute to a fantastic holiday. The service everywhere was amazing. The rooms and surroundings were extremely clean. The breakfast certainly catered for everyone- we ate at different times every morning and never had to wait more than 5 minutes for a yummy freshly cooked omelette. The managers reception was greatly appreciated. We had expected watered down cocktails, due to them being complimentary- in fact, they were the opposite. I'm already missing my nightly blue hawaiian. The location is perfect. We didn't fly out until 11pm and really appreciated being able to use all the facilities for the whole day as well as being given access to a suite for 30 minutes to shower and refresh ourselves just before we left.We are already planning a return trip to the Embassy Suites for a similar time next year, this time bringing our children with us. Mahalo, Embassy Suites.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Good:•The room, or suite was large. • The Staff was helpful• Fast Valet service• Strong cocktails at happy hour• Close to many Waikiki thingsBad:• The elevator set up is strange.• Breakfast buffet is a crowded mess with average options•.Music one night was invasive not enjoyable• Limited Lobby area• Not a beach front hotel

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great location, good value, free internet, complimentary breakfast. Close to restaurants, main shopping area and beach. Staff friendly and happy and very helpful. Tour desk was convenient and helpful. Full laundry facilities.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our stay at the Embassy Suites was fantastic. The premises are very well located and are very clean and well appointed. Having two rooms in the suite allows a family of five to share the one suite which is very rare. The free breakfast was a great benefit and the free evening drinks (yes two hours of free alcohol for the parents, free softdrinks for the children and free nibbles with a live band most nights as well and no traps - it is just all put on for free around the pool on level 4) was a fantastic way to finish up the late afternoon around the pool before heading out to dinner somewhere close by. The staff are also all very friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The Embassy Suites at Waikki Beach is a great option for a family traveling. The full breakfast offered everyday helps to cut the cost of eating out for breakfast. The manager's reception is good for entertainment and light snacks in the evening. The hotel staff are friendly and accommodating and made our staff very pleasant. If you are looking to tour the island simply go to www.smart destinations.com and get a Go Card for Oahu and plan your daily excursions. If you are looking to purchase souvenirs go to the Aloha Stadium on Wednesday, Saturday, or Sundsy and get good pricing on souvenirs much cheaper than your ABC stores or Coco Cove.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The hotel is not going to knock your design socks off, and it could use some updating of some of the rather worn carpet and upholstery. However, the location and value are great. It's located near the beach and all the activity of Waikiki. Nearby are some great restaurants. The pool area is quite nice and very spacious. The breakfast is the typical Embassy Suites fare, not spectacular, but included so what the hey. I was a bit disappointed in the fruit, given it's Hawaii. The rooms are a good size and mine had a balcony where I had a narrow ocean view. The staff were helpful and friendly.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Met expectations, would recommend, would stay again.Though we're eligible for the Hale Koa, we monitored rates for the ES and jumped on some that made for a better value... rates fluctuated quite a bit, so keep checking back.Initially assigned a 4th floor room, we countered with a request for a higher floor. Due to renovations in some rooms, the only other room was one next to the elevators.Uh-oh, I thought... but... turns out we could only hear the elevators if the a/c fan was off, and everyone was absolutely still and quiet. Seriously. Just running the fan on 'low' was enough to mask any elevator noise.The garbage trucks in Waikiki at 5am are a whole different matter.Room was clean, with no evidence of wear and tear, all linens clean and crisp, bathroom spotless on arrival and every day after maid service. Soap/shampoo/conditioner restocked daily.Buffet breakfast: standard ES with some rotating items. Birds were not a problem for us. Plenty of seating. We ate early, never a line (0800-0830).Evening reception was standard ES. Other reviewers have lamented the snack selection; IIRC the company gives individual hotels some latitude in what they offer, IME the less interesting the locale, the better the munchies. Drinks were good, bartenders hustled so the wait was minimal. (Much, much better than our last ES stay in Chicago...)

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Extremely satisfied on the size of the room and suite, cleanliness, staff service and overall a fantastic experience. I would recommend this hotel for any family, couples or business traveler. Great place to stay in Hawaii.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed there over the Christmas period and could not have been happier. We go to Hawaii every 2nd year and this has been one of the best places we have stayed at. We had 2 suites on the 16th & 17th floors of the Hula Tower. This trip had 8 of us staying at the Embassy.Staff were always friendly, the breakfast buffet fantastic, the evening nibbles and drinks nice. The pool was okay, not too small, it never felt crowded even though there were many people there. The rooms were quiet, I did not even know there were people next door until we walked out of the lift together and walked the same way.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Had an ocean view suite. Great place! Our family had spent the bulk of our vacation at outlying resorts on Oahu, but we wanted to experience Waikiki, so we scheduled a short stay here before our departure. Very close to the beach. Surfing lessons on Waikiki and Friday night fireworks were highlights of our trip. I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel is great!! We stayed for 4 nights with our baby and were quietly surprised with what we received...free daily hot breakfast with omelettes cooked to order, fast wifi, a CD of Hawaiian music, little notes each day explaining a Hawaiian custom...all lovely touches which we didn't expect. The room is very dated but I'd prefer to call it 'vintage' - but it is meticulously maintained, comfortable and clean. The location is brilliant as well - close to shops and within walking distance to Ala Moana so you can avoid shuttles if you wish. After being away from home for over a week, we particularly appreciated the coin laundry and gym. If you don't plan on spending lots of time in your hotel room (and who wants to do this, in Waikik?!) then this hotel is worthy of your consideration!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel is such a bargain for the price and location! Nice large suites, partial ocean views, and nice shops and restaurants close by! It is right across the street from Waikiki beach with very easy beach access, umbrellas, etc. The free hot breakfast is wonderful with so many choices! The managers reception is also very nice with great variety of cocktail choices and live music on Mondays, Wednesdays, Fridays and Saturdays. A couple of blocks up the street is a public bus stop which takes you directly to the convention center for $2.50 each way. You can also buy a bus pass at the ABC store behind the hotel. When you arrive, you are greeted with a nice glass of chilled guava juice which is so refreshing after long flights! Everyone is so nice! Carlton greets you with such Aloha! I arrived before my friend and he told me he would be on the lookout for her! He brought her directly to our room when she arrived! We were given a nice upgrade in the Hula tower which was very nice. The hotel was quiet except for our last night where a party was held next door to us. We called downstairs and they took care of it immediately. I have stayed at many high end hotels on Waikiki and I have to say I prefer the quiet atmosphere and Hawaiian feel of this property to the larger resorts packed with people everywhere. It is also close enough to walk to the convention center. Don't miss the Friday night fireworks show on the beach located not far from this hotel! We had a wonderful stay at this hotel and will definitely be returning! My only suggestion is that the Hawaiian singers need to play some Hawaiian songs at the manager's reception! This Embassy Suites is a secret gem but probably won't be for long! Hands down, best hotel bargain you will find in Honolulu.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Everything here was great--they even greet you at check in with a glass of refreshing juice! You can't beat the location with the beach right up the street, and all of the shops you can imagine within walking distance! Happy hour on the roof was a blast, too--they even had a live band playing.Highly recommend going to Roy's as well (attached to the hotel)--I dream about their sushi now! Will be reviewing them next...The only negative was that the toilet would make an annoying sound for a few seconds after flushing, but other than that--it was great!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is a perfectly nice hotel with some real strengths and weaknesses.Strengths:- Nice location very close to Waikiki Beach and tons of great shopping- The free breakfasts are decent and the manager's reception is fun- The suites are spacious and not unpleasantSome issues: - Noise: There are a lot of young people and parents who interpret the concept of discipline loosely, and the walls and floors are paper thin and the sound of closing doors reverberates throughout the rooms at all hours- Views: Marginal - Service: Avoid the "hilton vacations" kiosk in the lobby at all costs - they will try to sell you on completely horrendous packages that you would be better off booking yourself or avoiding entirely. Overpriced and awful.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel is very kid-friendly. I had to travel for work and brought my husband and toddler. The hotel provided a crib and bedding, no problem. The pool had a toddler-friendly shallow end. The free breakfast and evening drinks helped our daily budget. It also provided a variety of different foods and snacks for a picky eater. The kitchenette and mini fridge helped keep juice and milk and sippy cups clean.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: After such a great stay last Spring Break, we came back again! You can't beat this Waikiki location for proximity to everything and what you get for the price beats any hotel we've stayed at in Hawaii. Last year we stayed in a room ending in #31 in the Hula Tower. If you want a 2Q room, that is the room you want, and above the 15th floor as the sunset view is spectacular. If you want more space and more balconies, then a room ending in #29 (2Q corner unit). We liked the unit but on the 11th floor, the view isn't great, so we requested a room change and went to the 21st floor (top floor) to a King corner unit. The view is spectacular but the rooms ending in #30 are quite a bit smaller because of the stairwell. If we come again, I'd request a #31 room for the view and space.Service everywhere is great! Friendly staff at the complimentary breakfast (Aldrin), housekeeping, poolside food service, bartenders at manager's reception (Keola), bellmen, valet (Maria) . . . You can't go wrong booking here!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: No better spot to stay for families with large large rooms, suites with wet bar, seperate HVAC one for each room, fold out sofa bed, large bathroom, excellent water pressure, and patios. NO resort $ fee. Free cook to order breakfast and free cocktail reception each evening, with live band, you can't beat that. Hula tower rooms have best views of ocean and pool and are located closest to 4th floor reception, pool breakfast dining, valet parking & lobby. We were in a corner Hula bldg. room with two queen beds and two patios one facing east and the other facing South towards the ocean, room 1229. The higher floors, i.e. 19 - 21 have unobstructed views of the ocean. All the stafff we very friendly and accomodating including, Bellman Jeff, breakfast hostess Lea and valet Captian Gilbert. Roy's five star restaurant is on first floor of hotel, as well as shopping and Yard House casual restaurant. Five minute walk to public beaches, I suggest the beach near the Sheraton which is out of the hotel garage and turn left and 5 minute walk to "public Beach access" see my photo. Stay away from Ft. Derussy Beach unless you want to be harassed by beach bums and panhandlers. ABC store across the street for gift items, tee shirts, sunscreen and lunch needs (sandwiches). One suggestion to the mgmt for better recognizing Diamond members would be to be recognize our Hilton loyalty by offering free valet and/or rooftop evening "Diamond" reception - Just a suggestion. otherwise, perfect. Aloha.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I am giving this hotel a four star rating because the people who work there are so nice. If they were not it would be lower. Feels a little dark and make sure you get a room away from the elevator. For the first two nights it felt like the elevator was in my room and I really could not sleep. After I was moved it was much better. And the room was bigger too. The rooms are small compared to other Embassy Suites I have stayed in. When going to the free breakfast do not go when it first opens or you will stand in line a very long time. Also if you get the omelette ask to have not a lot of oil. They pour too much which can make the omelette greasy. When I was checking out there was only one person on duty which made for quite a wait. The pool was very nice.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We have stayed at several Embassy Suites hotels as we are a family of 5 and the rooms there fit my family the best. This was by far the best Embassy Suites we have stayed at. The hotel was beautiful, the staff was very friendly, the rooms were up to date and clean, and it was located just a few blocks to walk to the beach, shops, and restaurants. We loved having the free delicious breakfast (with made to order eggs) and also enjoyed the managers reception when we were able to go. The bell staff was very helpful when we needed rides to different areas of the island and the concierge staff also was great with excursions planning. The only way the hotel could have been better is if it was located right on Waikiki beach. Loved it!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Could not have ask for anything else. Hotel is great location, staff was one of the best I ever had. Overall trip was "totally awesome". I felt so at easy and relaxed, nothing left for me to ask for it was all provided without asking. Breakfast came with our hotel stay plus it had a good variety of choices and the manager evening reception came with great live music and good cocktails. What a wonderful time we had, can't wait to do it again

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at the Embassy Suites in Honolulu and couldn't have more pleased. The staff was way beyond any place I have ever stayed at, and the location was close to the beach, or short walk to downtown waikakii.The wonderful breakfast served until 10 am carried us throughout the day, and the managers reception at 5:30/7:30 was enjoyable. For families, the embassy is tops with the pool, and other activities. We went with our son's family, our daughter so there were 8 of us.The rooms were wonderful, and we will certainly stay there again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We just returned from a week long stay at the Embassy Suites in Waikiki and couldn't be happier with our choice. The staff was fantastic all the way from check-in to check-out. They were always friendly and solicitous of our wishes. We were on the 17th floor of the Aloha tower and didn't have any issues with street or pool noise. The pool was great for our 9 year old daughter, and the breakfast buffet was a great option for not having the leave the property first thing in the morning. The Valets were quick with our car and friendly while we waited. It's a really nice location as well, as the beach is a block or two away and you're right by the shops if that's your thing. It's not the cheapest place, but there aren't any cheap places in Waikiki with these amenities.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We were welcomed with delicious punch and a very helpful front desk staff. The room was clean and in great condition when we arrived. The free breakfast was great - a variety of choices for the whole family. The beach is a very short walk away and the ocean is visible from the pool. They have a great manager's reception with live music a few nights a week. The whole staff at the hotel was very friendly and helpful. I'd highly recommend anyone who is looking for a place to stay to consider the Embassy Suites!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I just spent 35 days at this hotel on a work trip. Although Hawaii is one of the most beautiful places on earth, it is hard to be away from your family for that long. EVERYONE at the hotel is absolutely wonderful! there was Lei manning the breakfast drink area greeting me everyday with a smile and asking me how I was (and who also remembered me from my last stay THREE years ago!). And John at the omelet station who was always cheerful and kind...and ALWAYS making me the best omelets! to another cheerful staff member (who I do not know his name) refilling coffees. Then there is the happy hour crew, Keola, Dennis, Lacy, and Lewis making EVERYONE feel like they are royalty. They treat everyone the same, like every person is their favorite guest. it was wonderful. The valet staff was also fabulous! They were sprinting back and forth getting everyone's cars as fast as they could, which is no easy task because some guests were a little demanding! They busted their butts and were also wonderful. The house keeping staff had my room perfectly stocked with extra conditioner (which i need for hair that goes to the bottom of my back) and my room was always spotless! I want to give a terrible review because next time I go to this hotel I want people to stay away so its NOT booked to capacity....BUT i just can't. Stay here, its the best! And give the staff good tips, they are wonderful! I know this because 35 days is a LONG stay, i wasn't just there a week! They are consistently amazing and you can guarantee a wonderful time! MAHALO Embassy Suites Staff!!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My wife, my 3 children and I stayed at the Embassy Suites Waikiki during March of 2014. This was my 9th trip to the Islands and 6th to Waikiki. Of all the places I've stayed I would rate Embassy Suites as the most kid/family friendly. The hotel is located in a very good area of Waikiki. In my experience I would say Waikiki as a whole is a clean and safe place for families to visit, but I have found that the areas closer to the zoo have a number of street people hanging around, sleeping on the streets or begging. There is virtually none of this in the area of the Embassy Suites. The area nearby has lots of shopping and many good restaurants to choose from as well as a bunch of ( get ready for it ) ABC stores to shop at. This hotel is a short walk, less then 5 minutes, to both Waikiki Beach and Fort DeRussy Beach Park.We stayed in a one bedroom suite in the Hula Tower. The bedroom had two queen beds and the living room had a sofa bed. The suite, while not fancy, was very functional and had more then enough room for the 5 of us. The beds were comfortable and the sofa bed was ok. Our suite had an excellent view of the pool area as well as a view of Fort DeRussy Park and a partial view of the ocean. The pool area is simply outstanding. The pool is fairly long and has a tot wading area and hot tub attached to it. The pool is not deep, about 4 feet at its deepest, but it is big and provides lots of room for the guests. The deck area is very large and has an excellent layout. The deck has plenty of lounging chairs and five larger cabanas. The cabanas were a great place to hang out as a group or have a nap. There are a number of palm trees on the deck as well that provide shade. The deck has two bars as well. One is open for lunch and the other opens around dinner time. They serve a wide variety of drinks and some decent pub style food. I had shrimp tacos that were pretty tasty.The hotel offers it's guests a complimentary buffet breakfast. When traveling with a larger group/family this makes life easy in the morning. The food has your standard fare, scrambled eggs, sausage, yogurts, cereals, juices etc as well as a made to order omelet station. The entire property was renovated about 8 years ago and is still in good shape. The staff at this location were excellent. They were friendly, attentive and easy to locate. Overall this hotel provided us with an excellent experience and I highly recommend this property to families. We will stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is the best value in Oahu! Free breakfast buffet and a free managers reception! Plus you add on a wonderful staff, and you cannot find a better place to stay! Andrew at front desk/reception started our trip off perfect. Lacey and the rest of the evening reception were great, as well as the band that plays! Lei and the rest of the breakfast staff always made sure your day started off good. I advise look past all other hotels and stay here, we do as often as we can!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We loved this hotel for our family vacation in Waikiki! We had a great 2 bedroom suite with an ocean view and the amenities at the hotel were fabulous!! Just steps to the beach and shopping made it perfect for all family members.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My husband and I have stayed at the Embassy Suites Waikiki with our 2 children twice and are returning in a few weeks for a third stay. We have loved each stay at this hotel - you cant beat the location and the breakfast buffet with the cooked to order omelette station is a real treat. Each suite has a fridge and microwave which is helpful when travelling with young children with specific food needs. I would recommend this hotel for value for money.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great service with family, Fun pool, breakfast is great and evening reception. Band on some nights is terrific ,dancing for the family .OKAY It is expensive -but one or two nights at the Embassey Suites is like a vacation within a vacation!!!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our check in experience was not as expected because I had booked online and then phoned hotel directly about changing the promotion package, but they knew nothing about it when I arrived. I had to insist that they ask the manager before it was corrected. The manager not only honored the promotion package, but lowered our rate as well!One item I had forgot about when booking, because in small print, was $35/night valet charge because we had rented a car. But real estate is a premium, esp Waikiki so it makes sense that parking would be expensive. Valet staff very pleasant.After that, our experience continued to be exceptional for our week stay. Breakfast was as healthy as I could ask for - great salad, miso soup (with tofu, kimchee, asian pickles if desired), fresh fruit, eggs to order in addition to the assortment of rolls, cereal, various cooked meats and potatoes.Manager's reception had live music, free drinks 3-4 nights a week, and had veggies with dip and chips or munchies nightly. This was a fun way to hang out with our kids and saved us a lot of money eating out since we already had our "appetizers"The walk to the beach is a very short distance, about a block through the Outrigger Reef where you had use of their amenities as well. Location to walk to shops and restaurants was fantastic. Henry's, a hole in the wall right across the street, serves the best mango ice cream we have ever tasted!What made me decide to write the review was our experience the last day. We asked for a late check out because our flight was at 10 pm. They gave us an extra hour, so it allowed us to go the beach in the morning (even had time for surfing), We went back to check out at noon and put our bags in secure room with the bell staff. The staff let us know we were free to use the amenities so we went back to the beach and later returned to use the Hospitality Suite they recommended - no reservations, first come first serve basis. Since we weren't ready to change our clothes quite yet, we thought we would use the pool. The front desk person on duty even asked if we wanted fresh towels to go the pool with!! When we were ready to check if the Hospitality Suite was available, there were a couple of families ahead of us so we had time to go to the hot tub for a last bit of relaxation. We then used the Hospitality Suite for our allotted 30 min to shower and change. Picked up our car and drove to airport. What a perfect last day in Hawaii! Would definitely recommend Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach- great location, excellent amenities, exceptional family friendly service

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The hotel was well located near a nice part of Waikiki beach. The staff were extremely helpful and the service was outstanding. The units are large and have great amenities- a small fridge, microwave and counter space. The buffet breakfast was a bonus especially when travelling with teenagers!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The Embassy Suites is a great place to stay considering the location, price, and friendly service. We enjoyed the beach, the shopping, the nearby restaurants, and the people watching within a few blocks of the building! The staff was very helpful with arrangements for tours and shuttle service to the airport - it took a lot of stress off our shoulders. We stayed four nights and your maid service took great care of our rooms every day. We thoroughly enjoyed our time with you. God bless.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Simply put, a Hilton hotel, especially an Embassy right by the beach!!? Couldn't have had a better time! Great rooms, wonderful service, amazing atmosphere! Can't wait to return and take in all that Embassys have to offer.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We recently stayed at the Embassy Suites. We were rather disappointed in the room which was allocated to us on our arrival which was quite noisy,( lift, traffic, gym, laundry)...It took 2 days and the intervention of the lovely Lorena who understood my distress at lack of good sleep ( for the previous 6 nights).....but we were upgraded into a rather lovely room with lovely views of the pool area and glimpses of the ocean... again was a little noisy due to traffic noise but I now think that not many rooms in Waikiki are quiet..Anyway, the Embassy Suites were in a great position, rooms lovely, spacious and spotlessly clean. The complimentary breakfast is all that you could ask for or need. The nightly managers reception on the pool deck with complimentary drinks and nibblies for 2 hours was really great. The Mon, Wed, Fri and Sat receptions have a wonderful band who we thoroughly enjoyed. Great music, great atmosphere and a brilliant time had by all.Lovely pool area with plenty of lounges and other seating, a toddlers pool area and very warm relaxing whirlpool.Positioned so very well on the BeachWalk with lovely shops and eateries along with the ever so handy ABC shops.... All the staff were very welcoming and so very helpfulNone of those dodgy resort fees!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Just back from a week in Waikiki, staying at Embassy Suites (for the second time). Not disappointed! Rooms are very large (separate bedroom) with 2 queen beds plus a pullout...important when you are a couple with two kids, with all the clothes, beach towels, boogie boards and other vacation stuff.Hotel is set back a block from the main strip, so pretty quiet. Largest pool I've seen in the area, lots of room for the kids (and parents) to play in it.Full-on free breakfast a great bonus: custom omelet, bacon, sausage, french toast...not only a big money saver (try getting out of Denny's for less than $40 for 4 people), but also a major time saver. Evening free drinks and snacks at the Manager's Reception is also a nice touch.Probably not the best hotel for a relaxing adults-only romantic getaway, but for a family it's great value with super amenities.Tip: fastest way to main Waikiki Beach is down Kalia, through access alley below the Halekulani, then onto raised walkway past a couple of other hotels.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: booked a staycation for my daughters 16th birthday celebration with her girlfriends. From the time we checked in the hotel, got greeted with lots of aloha by Malia. She really was such a great help & very friendly. Then getting settled at the poolside. We met a nice gentleman name Daniel, who was nice with helping us get more towels & things we needed at the pool area. This hotel was worth the price & the girls & I enjoyed the managers reception & best of al.. the morning breakfast. You can beat that service. It was simply amazing! You will not be dissappointed!!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: A very pleasant stay with about 125 teenagers & 18 other adults on a high school sanctioned trip over winter vacation. That in and of itself creates a set of dynamics most institutions would much rather opt out of - regardless of the potential bottom line infusion. However, this hotel was a 9.5 on a scale from 1 - 10. I only remove the .5 because they all too efficiently awakened me at 05:30 each morning (they could have forgotten me once!). :)) They displayed a pleasantness and courtesy not too often experienced any longer in this business, it was the norm in hospitality environs. The staff was informative, knowledgeable & gracious, a great help when light years from home.  The location is superb with all in walking distance: food, booze, clothes, 24-hr conv. store, Waikiki Beach, a museum, ice cream, Hard Rock Café, a mall & more bars. If you don't have a car - don't get one. A waste of money if you're staying here-just get a cab.  For those that are interested....breakfast is free. FREE. And it is good by any standards. Not the usual 'continental' dope, but the real thing. Put it this way: the food served here would make any East Coast or New York diner owner cringe with envy, it's that good. Full buffet of -you name it- and an omelet station. At City prices this is a big $$ savings to be factored into the daily rates. As is the Manager's Reception with an open bar and munchies in the afternoon. FREE. Yup open bar. With lite food to curb you from $17.95 appetizers before $24.95 chicken entrees. FREE. When is the last time you heard this at a hotel. 1985? As one adds up the freebies, not nearly as costly as it initially appears.  I will return here with wife & daughter in tow next time. Not for one week though - at least two or more if all conditions allow (including wife). BTW: if you forget anything, there is a great mini-market across the street for ANYTHING from Genoa Salami to Jack Daniels to soap to socks. So don't fret - it's there.....where I should be too......

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Upon arrival, we were amazed by an immediate upgrade to an ocean view. We had originally settled for a less view to to stay in a budget for our hotel. The extras are included in the hotel prices as compared to other hotels. The hotel made you feel warm and welcome, just like family. The hotel was very clean and we'll staffed. The breakfast and evening receptions were amazing that included a small band on weekends. The hotel is close to everything, walking distance. I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Honolulu.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was our first time in Waikiki and we were very pleased with our choice for accommodation. All staff- from the front desk, valet, bell desk, housekeeping, breakfast and evening reception- were exceptional. The hotel was very clean and blended seamlessly with the surrounding environment with its open air atmosphere. The cards explaining different elements of Hawaiian culture that were left on the bed each day, along with the farewell CD of Hawaiian music, were nice touches. Our kids loved the pool and the complimentary buffet breakfast and evening reception were a great value. The only thing I would ask to be changed would be to install a fan in the bathroom. We miss Hawaii very much and look forward to our next trip!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I have stayed at this hotel a total of 3 times already and have booked already for later this year. From the moment you reach the reception to check you are treated like a returned family member. All the staff are so welcoming and remember your previous times you have stayed. The band that plays at the Managers reception are just fabulous , they know all the current and the old favourites so everyone can join in, to make a great night. From the guys at the bar, the breakfast staff, chefs at the egg stations, housemaids and reception it makes your visit a very enjoyable experience. I have recommended this hotel a number of times and each person who has gone to stay has booked again for a return visit , with the thoughts of never going back to another hotel after the enjoyable time that had at this truly wonderful hotel. It is a credit to everyone from the Managers to every staff member at how well this hotel is run.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is the third time I have stayed here and each time have been very happy with the location and customer service at the hotel. Staff are very friendly and approachable. The rooms or suites are great for families and are in good condition - the extra space to spread out is great. Housekeeping clean the rooms very promptly each day, which is great when you want to come and go from the pool or beach. Breakfast each morning includes a variety of choices which suits everyone's tastes. The nightly managers reception and entertainment is a great way to meet other travellers. The hotel is centrally located in Waikiki and close to the beach. We had a lovely stay and will definitely recommend to anyone who wants to stay there. We thought it was great value for money.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Upon arriving we were greeted with a chilled flute of juice and seated to check in. The whole process was less than 5 minutes and everyone was happy, friendly, and helpful. We were in our room within 10 minutes of entering the hotel. It was late, so we didn't pay much attention to the hotel itself at that time. We spent 6 nights and couldn't have been more pleased. The complimentary breakfast was perfect every day. The hotel was immaculate and convenient to the beach, sights, shopping, and dining. The afternoon manager's receptions were relaxing and entertaining. Each staff member that we saw was friendly, helpful, and working hard to keep the hotel a very pleasant experience for everyone. Definitely recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This has been the best hotel I have stayed in a long time. The service was great!! Cleaniness, comfort, ameneties, breakfast, attention to details, and view were AWESOME!! I wish all hotels was as good as this Embassy Suites at Waikiki. I hope they do not change and that with the years they continue to upgrade, renovate, and not allow the hotel to deteriorate; which is what happen to the Hilton Hawaian Village. This Embassy Suites is really a Class One hotel. The service received from the Staff was professional, friendly and knowledgeable on what they do. Additionally, the hotel is located in an ideal section of town. Everything is at walking distance from other hotels like Hilton Hawaian Village and to stores, attractions and beaches. The only draw back for me is the parking. I wish they had their own parking free of charge. 35 dollars a day is very expensive.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I was most impressed with the customer service at this hotel. Everyone from front desk, concierge, wait staff and housekeeping did a terrific job. Always friendly, courteous and helpful. The hotel is very nice and clean too. Great location for activities. Complimentary breakfast was excellent and the manager's reception was very enjoyable.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We have stayed at the Waikiki Beach Walk on three other occasions. The Hotel is centrally located, near the beach, surrounded by shopping just steps from the hotel. Breakfast is very good with omelet station - even miso soup! Manager's receptions allows you to test a variety of island cocktails, beer, wine, and more. We only have to go offsite once a trip for breakfast or drinks before we are reminded of the value the complimentary breakfast and manager's reception add to our vacation. Pool and attached hot tub is well sized and enjoyable. Poolside bar, massages, views are also good. Hospitality is great from check-in to check-out. We will be back!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The hotel was clean and in great condition. It was located where we could walk to any place in Waikiki or take a bus to other locations. Very helpful and friendly staff. I couldn't ask for anything more from this hotel. I will stay there again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Love this hotel! I will definitely be back! The staff was extremely helpful and polite. The rooms are cute, decor is a little cheesy but I get it. The breakfast Buffett was average, beautiful pool and plenty of restaurants on site.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I am a Diamond member of Hilton and trying to figure out why! I was "upgraded" to a two room suite (room 523) to enjoy a loud machine sound in my king bed room. Marriott provided me a better upgrade with a lower status in Maui. Ocean view and no noise. Going back to build my loyalty with Marriott!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Liked our stay. Very nice room, big and bright. Centrally located, but also very noisy at all times, day and night. Staff was really welcoming and efficient. Great full breakfast every day, and able to serve large crowds easily. Nights with free drinks, and live music a few nights a week. Drinks were not watered down, but snacks were boring and basic. Would recommend to retirees ( seemed to be swarming with them, and staff went out of their way to help if needed).

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Just home from a wonderful 10 day vacation staying at the Embassy Suites, Waikiki. We required a two bedroom suite because my husband and I were travelling with our daughter, her husband and their 21 month old daughter. The suite on the 17th floor, met our needs perfectly - well we did have to get a few items from housekeeping, like spoons, a knife, coffee cups and wine glasses, but they were provided promptly and without question. You can't cook a meal in the suite because there are no suitable facilities but hey, when you go on holidays, who wants to cook? Anyway, because of the location there are any number of eateries within a short walk and there are quite a few restaurants underneath the hotel. The suite itself had two bedrooms separated by a living area with lounge, chair and small table with two chairs. The bedrooms each had its own bathroom, one bedroom had a king bed and the other two queen beds. It was very comfortable accommodation, plenty of room for us all (including a portable cot for the baby) and a lovely balcony which looked north over the park with a glimpse of the sea even though it was classified a city view room. There is a kitchenette with bar fridge, coffee and tea making facilities and sink. The hotel has a laundry for DIY washing and drying of clothes for a small charge and the energetic could have a workout in the gym while waiting for the washing if so desired. There is a really nice touch in the form of a manager's reception each afternoon from 5:30 - 7:30pm where drinks and nibbles are provided by the hotel and on some days entertainment by a local group of professional musicians. The staff were all very friendly and obliging especially our housekeeper and those on the concierge desk. The location of the hotel is great, just a block from Waikiki Beach and the same from Kalakaua Avenue where there are more shops than any husband wants to know about!! Just think of a designer name and you'll find it there - heaven. Immediately outside the Embassy Suites in Lewers Street is a fountain which entertained our 21 month old constantly - a lovely family friendly area. We were in Honolulu in February and the weather was mixed, a couple of wet days to start, a few overcast days and a few sunny days. Temps. were mid-late 20's celcius (77-84 f) but the humidity made it feel much warmer. Honolulu is such a popular place that we had to make dinner reservations a day or two ahead in order to be able to eat where we wanted without queuing for an hour or more. We all felt very much at home at the Embassy Suites and wouldn't hesitate to return (soon I hope).

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed here for 1 day due to flight cancellation because of weather back east. Was given an upgraded room which was awesome! But the hotel staff that starts very early in the morning was preparing for the day and got a lot of conversation in the hall and banging against the wall as I guess they were preparing room prep carts for the day. I love this hotel and hope this was just an isolated incident. The room was clean and great for an unexpected stay!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I reviewed all the info on this hotel and to let you all know we were not disappointed. It did start a little shakey with a wrong room being assigned but the front desk rectified it instantly. The 1 bdrm (2queens) was great, everyone had some privacy and the 2 balconies were good to have. We looked out every morning to see the ocean. The room was clean and was always kept that way. The paper and the daily postcard was a nice extra, thank you for the coupon book and the cd. The breakfast was FANTASTIC and the omelets were to die for! Fresh fruit, bacon, sausage, potatoes, breads, cereal and oatmeal, you could not leave hungry! There as one gentleman that was so personable, he greeted everyone with a smile and a refill of coffee. There was a few working the breakfast but not at cleaning but planning their nite etc....the birds were different but you get use to them fast. The evening reception was nice, there were chips, dip, salsa and a veggies, what more could you ask for before going out for before dinner. The bartenders remembered you and what you drank, made you feel important! Any staff we met up with were always smiling and ready to help! There is a small store to get your juice, pop etc to keep in the room. We ate at yard ale, cheeseburger, Giovanni's and across the street at shorebird, everything was too much food but great! Took couple of tour days and the last day we rented a car and did our own touring all o which we can recommend. Oh yeah....forgot the pool.....very nice and the deck was a nice place to be a couple hours a day. The bar opens 12 -5 and the drinks were great and once again the remember you. The only negative to say about our stay was it was only 7 nites as we could've stayed longer? WE HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL, Thank you all,from the duvander family

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our flight home being canceled we needed a place to stay overnight in Honolulu. On my mother-in-laws recommendation we booked a room here. The staff that met us at in the lobby was extremely pleasant.Our room on the second floor overlooked the street which was actually fairly nice.Everything was spotless, the bed clean, and the bathroom sparkled.The managers reception was a bit over rated, but the breakfast was outstanding.On the downside our room backed onto a service hallway or something similar. There was a constant crashing and clanging from the back wall.We also heard every us that squealed to a stop right below our window.All in all though, the location, the staff, and the free meal in a city that charges for everything far outweigh any inconvenience.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The individuals I was traveling with were at the Hilton and after seeing the experience at the Embassy Suites they only want to be a guest at the Embassy Suites in the future. There was nothing that I could complain about during my stay. The breakfast is excellent and the Evening Reception is the bomb.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here for one night in early Feb 2014. We were travelling out of Honolulu the next day back to the main land. Decided I wanted a place that we could save a bit of money on breakfast and drinks - Embassy Suites was perfect as they have the Breakfast included and yes it is a full breakfast Cooked to Order (CTO) and in the evening the Managers Reception was perfect for a few night caps!The staff accommodated all our our needs, late check out, luggage storage and a need for 30 minute refresh upon our arrival back from a City/Pearl harbor tour. Strongly recommend if you only have a few hrs to talk with the Concierge and arrange a 4 hrs City/Pearl Harbor tour!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: complimentary breakfast and managers reception in the evening are really great. we are a family of 5 with teens and not having to go out for breakfast is a great benefit . pool and spa area were great and plenty of room and poolside furniture. 2 room suite is not huge but does the job ok

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We really liked the location of this hotel-there were a lot of restaurants around within a 5 minute walk of all standards and a couple of convenience stores across the street for groceries and snacks .The 2 room suite we had was great for our family with our children (grown up ) having their own bathroom .The breakfast was a welcome addition that enabled us to get by with just a snack for lunch .Plus the cocktails in the evening were good pre-dinner .We went for drinks in a number of the grander hotels and generally weren't impressed-a lot of them were like big barns processing people through-yes the Embassy suites was equally busy but at least it didn't have the price tag of some of its grander neighbours .I have only one minor criticism -there is no concierge desk as such where you can ask someone with local knowledge for restaurant recommendations .There is an expedia desk but we got the distinct impression that their purpose was to sell trips and their interest seemed to end at that .

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed for a week in January 2014. On arrival we were upgraded to a double-bedroomed suite! Superb views across to Diamond Head and the city. Rooms were very comfortable and well appointed. The kitchen area had a fridge and coffee maker, but no other equipment or crockery is included. We opted for the breakfast option, which offered a wide range of fruit, hot food including omelettes to order,plus breads and pastries. This is a large hotel, and breakfast can become rather busy at certain times. There are many restaurants nearby covering all tastes. A handy 7-11 store is close by too. We enjoyed our stay here, and would stay again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: After an exhaustive search, we selected Embassy Suites with an ocean view room. The hotel is a very nice, well maintained property with two separate towers in an area with dozens of restaurants, shopping, convenience stores, many other hotels, etc. within a 5-10 minute walk. The staff are remarkable: friendly, happy and driven by customer service, real, not "pretend", across all the staff, regardless of their function. Remarkable examples were Lei and Aldrin, staff at the breakfast buffet, who were very outgoing, greeted us warmly each morning and provided high levels of service. The breakfast buffet, and evening cocktails and snacks and free wifi are all part of the room rate. Some nights there is a local band that plays during cocktail hours.We can't say enough good things about this experience and have nothing to offer as negatives.Although the hotel is across the street from the beach, the views of the ocean and beach are superb and the beach is about a three minute walk.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My family of six stayed for 3 nights before heading to other islands. The breakfast and managers reception were an added value. My kids especially liked the unlimited soft drinks in the evening and the staff was very gracious. In fact, my 10 year old requested and got the autograph of his favorite bar tender - George - on our last evening. His "kiddie cocktails" were a hit but his kind demeanor was what made the difference.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here for a family vacation, and had a great stay. The staff was fantastic, and greeted us everywhere we turned. Great location, not on the beach, but across the street from the beach, and a near all the shopping too. Breakfast is fantastic as well. Great pool area too!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is an excellent hotel. Within walking distance to everything, including the beach. Beach an pool towels are provided in the room. You just have to return them to the room when you are done with them. Not a problem. You have to return to your room anyway to prepare for the rest of your day. They have a laundry room too, so you can take clean clothes back home if you want to.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Excellent hotel with excellent location to everything. The staff are so lovely and very helpful, only down fall is the breakfast buffet could improve. It was the same thing on repeat and not much variety to choose from.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The hotel was very nice...we enjoyed the location by the Beach Walk with many choices of shops and restaurants. the breakfast was excellent as well as the evening reception. Our rooms however were by the elevator shaft which was very noisy. One thing to request is to not be in an room ending in 01 or 11.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Let's just say I was inspired by embassy suites hotel on (beachwalk) to start blogging my traveling experiences. A friend of mine requested that I stay at ESH Waikiki. She shared that all the good bars, & restaurants with good beach access was located near. When we looked into our stay we were told we would have breakfast complimentary and drinks by the pool every evening for happy hour. Ok. Ok. Let's just say it was service galore! We pulled into the very well festive embassy lobby only to be greeted by the very attractive vAlet staff. When we pulled into the lobby, we were impress by the physique these young men possessed. Let's just say not only was it pleasing to the eye but they swarmed our vehicle like we were something special! Professionalism was assured and each handsome face said "aloha welcome to embassy suites hotel" I was assisted by a fine young man, middle aged whose name was Michael . I can't forget him because I was embarrassed when he asked for my reservation name and it wasn't on his list. Not only was I taken of guard but the staff had bell service On its way but valet took all of our many luggage out from our trunk and neatly lined on the curb. Before I could catch my breath Michael said " I'm sorry but I don't see your name here. Don't worry come on out, right this way as I find your reservation." I looked through my bags and realized the documents with my confirmation was lost in a bag that I left at the car rental agency. Now I was furious, Michael assured me he had contact information to every car rental at HNL airport. I couldn't resist. I apologized for my lack of attention and he escorted us to the front desk. He gave my information to front desk agent and our keys was given in no time. Michael then assured me once he got in touch with the car rental he would promptly let me know. Not even 45 mins after check in Michael phoned me informing me that my belongings would be delivered shortly and not to worry about a thing! When I retrieved my belongings at the valet desk 5hrs later Michael was there to assist me. He assured my relaxing stay was going to be starting soon and he had a bunch of information on where we could start. For the next 4 days the valet desk was comfort for us. They had our car waiting for every early morning adventure and addressed all our questions and concerns with maps, directions and great service. I must say I never thought I was going to fall INLOVE with hotel service from the valet staff. But I guess that's where every experience had started and ended for us. They were the first to greet us, and the last to see us off! Talk about aloha, I highly recommend embassy suites hotel and can't wait til the next trip!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The hotel itself is situated almost across the street from the beach. Registration is very tropical. They provide guave pineapple juice while you are checking in. The best views $$$ on the upper levels but worth every dime. The daily breakfast and evening receptions are a bonus. All the help including maid and bus boys were very friendly and genuinely nice. I give it 5 stars.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our family of 6 enjoyed our stay . The suite was a little tight for the 6 of us- it would be perfect for 5. The pool / spa area is great and we had a lovely view from our room . The location is central and the staff very helpful. The breakfasts were very good and the afternoon drinks and nibbles with live music every night were a very welcomed inclusion. I prefer the quieter islands , but if I were to return to Waikiki with my family, I would stay here again. It was very convenient to have a dining table and fridge and microwave , and we enjoyed the proximity to the beach.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Family vacation, first time to Hawaii, nice, safe area, happy to let the teenagers wander. Great accommodations, evening reception a bonus - loved the band, good location. Just be aware of the timeshare sales pitch - smile, nod and say no.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The room was a good set up (2 rooms-bedroom and living room) for male and female teenagers from different families so they could have privacy. The bathroom was roomy enough and there was an extra sink so one person could brush their teeth and another person could bathe. It was nice to have 2 balconies.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: There is no greater place in this world than Hawaii. We stayed at the Embassy Suites and I can only give glowing reviews. The staff were friendly, the rooms were clean, and the location was great.There was a made to order breakfast every morning which was a huge bonus and in the evenings there was a manager's reception complete with alcoholic beverages, finger foods, and entertainment. In a city where all inlcusive doesn't really exist, this was as close to all inclusive as you're going to get.I would stay here again without hesitation.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I used HHonors award points to book a four night stay at the Embassy Suites - Waikiki. It's a great hotel, and although it's not beach front like's it sister property (the Hilton Hawaiian Village), the hotel offered a much nicer stay. First and foremost are the suites. Well appointed, comfortable, generous size, and in our case a spectacular view. The manager's reception in the evening was a great way to wind down, and the breakfast, though chaotic and somewhat bland, was still preferable to setting out into the city. I have to take a minute to mention the staff here. They were incredibly polite and helpful despite how very busy they always were. Originally I was given an upgraded room (top floor/view/wraparound lanai), but after going up to the room (on the 24th floor I think) my son started getting upset at how high up we were. He's a preschooler and wasn't consolable about the heights, so I called down the front desk, explained the situation, and asked to change rooms. They were very understanding and accommodated my request quickly and easily for a low floor room (something I remember to request ahead of time now). The rest of our stay went off without any problems thanks in large to the staff.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had a very nice stay at embassy suites, overall a good experience, I wood avoid a room in proximity to elevator in the future, a complete breakfast buffet, and evening snacks, but other guests would make the spa/ pool area a garbage pail, sorry to say. the location is great for Waikiki and very close to the beach restaurants and everything in Waikiki,

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Smiling faces and friendly staff everywhere. From the guys at the Valet to the chefs making omelettes, everything about this hotel is great. We had a great room in the Hula tower and were given a great floor to soak in the views of Waikiki beach and the Fireworks. With a perfect location the hotel was a welcome base for us to see the beautiful island. Our family of 5 had plenty of room to move and I would recommend the hotel to anyone! We are missing it already. Mahalo Embassy Suites!!! Darren B, Geelong Australia

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Lei, medicia, nepo and every one else were very helpful. Hotel is great, live music and close to beach. Glad we stayed there. Would stay there again, especially with kids. Pool is nice. Walk to beach is basically just across the street and thru a hotel lobby. Can see ocean from pool

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My parents and I planned a last minute trip and stayed here at the start of January after hearing great reviews. Well we were not dissapointed. From the moment we arrived it was nothing but outstanding service. We were welcomed with a lovely tropical fruit drink and a fast check in- nothing better than getting off a 10 hour flight! We stayed on the 21st floor with a ocean front view and wow, it was breath taking. The room is not as modern as other hotels, however it had that lovely hawaiian feel to it, which in my opinion is what you want. The rooms are spacious and clean and have great views. For couples or people going for the more luxury side, I suggest going for the Aloha tower which is nicer. The free wifi is fantastic and the daily housekeeping is great. There was only 2 negatives. The first one was the breakfast. We ate here once as we couldn't again. It would suit possibly families, however if you like a nice breakfast I suggest going somewhere else. We were unable to eat the omelettes as they were awful, they had only 2 types of fruit, 1 cereal and the rest was oily, reheated food. The second one was the pool. The pool itself looks lovely, however if you are wanting to relax by the pool, get a bit of sun and enjoy the peace and quiet, this is not the place to do it. It is full of kids all day and it was because of that I didn't get to enjoy the pool area. Waikiki beach is only a couple of minutes away so I suggest going there. Apart from that it was a lovely, relaxing and enjoyable stay, I highly recommend staying here, you will not be dissapointed. I can't wait to return!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We keep on returning and recommending Embassy Suites, everything is great, the Breakfasts the Manager's Shout around the glistening pool, this Hotel is so central to everything 1 block back from the beach and just a short walk to catch the bus to Ala Moana Mall. Superb Restaurants within a few minutes from the Hotel. We had a 2 bedroom Apartment which gave us plenty of space for 2 couples.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My family and I were vacationing in Hawaii for our very first time. We were very happy to have booked our room at Embassy Suites. Having the extra room a suite offers was a real bonus with 2 teens along. We loved the location, close to the beach and close to shopping & dining. Our favorite part of vacation was the free Breakfast buffet every morning on the beautiful Grand Lanai. The cooked to order Omelets and the immense selection of breakfast entrees were a great way to start our day. We also enjoyed the managers 5-7 party with a drink and snack before heading out for the evening. Our room was cleaned everyday and the concierge was very helpful planning our sightseeing tours and Luau. We will definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I highly recommend this hotel. Our room was nicely appointed and having the extra living area was especially nice because with three people in the room, we were never in each other's way. The location, a block back from the beach, was a easy walk to restaurants and shops, and beach access is right across the street from the hotel. The concierge arranged our car rental for a day; we picked up the car from the Enterprise location in the Outrigger hotel across the street from Embassy Suites. The breakfast buffet (included in our stay) provided several choices along with attentive service from a friendly staff. Keep in mind that an ocean view is unlikely because this hotel is not on the beach and Waikiki beach is bordered by high-rise hotels. That did not bother us as we got views aplenty while on the beach itself. For a good restaurant nearby, try The Yard House; we enjoyed it so much we ate there twice.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We are about to check out of this hotel after a fantastic 8 day stay. I cannot fault this hotel and would highly recommend staying here. We stayed in a one bedroom city view room which was very spacious for our family of four and the benefit of a separate bedroom, large bathroom as well as microwave.
