Staff are friendly and extremely helpful, facilities are great and location is very convenient to the beach and shops. And not to mention the hot breakfast and daily cocktails included with your stay!! Would absolutely stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We recommend this hotel very highly. The staff are friendly, hard working and want to please their guests. The food and drinks are a great extra. The location is perfect for walking along the beach, shopping, getting the bus and trolley, variety of restaurants, etc. etc. Andrew, Aldrin and Lei are exceptional employees as are many others here. You are sure to make great memories, be pampered, and relax.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We love staying here. This time we had a corner oceanfront room with one side overlooking the marina and the other looking over Waikiki beach and the sunsets from our two balconies were stunning. The room is a good size with a kitchenette which we didn't use but handy. The hotel has a good buffet breakfast with two made to order omelette stations so you don't have to wait long to order. In the evening the complimentary cocktails with "pupu's" are a great bonus. They have a band playing several times a week to keep you entertained. It's great for a drink or two before you head out for the evening. The location of this hotel is very central to Waikiki beach, the beach walk shops and close to the bus stop to take you to Ala Moana shopping center. A great place to stay!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: All the usual amenities that come with an Embassy Suites (cooked to order breakfast, manager's reception, etc.) with customized selections for resort and international travelers (added breakfast options, live music at the reception and concierge). A special call-out for the concierge Krista who not only helped us with Honolulu plans but other island destinations as well. While there were other less expensive options in the area, this proved worth it for the location and services. Excellent option for families.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Embassy Suites Waikiki provide exceptional space and value for family travel, with 2 rooms, 2 bathrooms and a living room with kitchenette. Good size verandah to enjoy the view. We book the Hula Tower 17th floor and above and have enjoyed the corner rooms each time, with wonderful ocean views . The included breakfast - omelette in particular is sensational as is the fruit, we take our breakfast trays and enjoy our breakfast on our verandah. Managers drinks and music at night a bonus as well. The location is sensational on Beachwalk with a choice of many Resturants( Yardhouse a favourite)and close to all the shops, Ala Moana a $12 tax ride away. Staff efficient and friendly from check in to the concierge to bell staff. Rooms clean, beds very comfortable Yetan our housekeeper was exceptional.Highly recommend Embassy for location to shops restaurants and beach, value and service.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: You'll be very happy to stay at the Embassy Suites Hotel. Steps from the beach, great location close to the best restaurants and everything. Best service, very clean, I slept like a baby, great shower and you got the love the breakfast buffet! You'll have a great vacation!!! :) Cheers! Bella

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The hotel has the friendliest staff I've every come across. We were made to feel right at home. The condition of this hotel is immaculate. Location is perfect for everything you'll need in Waikiki. I can't wait to return.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My kids said "This is the best hotel!" This hotel got everything we want. Free Breakfast buffet, great location, nice big pool and spa. And the free cocktail and chips at evening (everyday) with live music (not everyday) was a big plus. The best part is the room. It is all suite hotel so you have living room and bedroom. The room we got is on 7th floor overlook the live performance area on Beachwalk Street. Next, the service is A+. We got dirty towels in the bathroom the first night, called to have clean one. They replaced the towels within one hour and gave us a big box of chocolate (gift wrapped). We wanted to stay here again this December if it was not fully booked.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Tight space, and old fabric smell. Was sorry to my family for the poor lodging experience, and hated knowing myself had to pay a bundle for it as was during peak season and had no choice. Recommendable only for those who need to control the budget tightly and will take joy in saving some money over other establishments.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We liked this hotel. A little outta the way, but so worth the stay. My family and I really liked this hotel. Room was very nice and clean. But the elevator was small. We had the free breakfast and it was very good, a lot of different choices.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Embassy Suites was a great choice for us - the room was spacious for our family - and the staff was the nicest hotel staff we've ever experienced. Everyone was friendly and super-helpful. The location was very convenient and if we return to Waikiki, we would stay there again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is a great hotel,location wise,room size. My family have just come back from spending 10 night there. Staff are friendly and always helpful. Everything is only a short walk away. The rooms were a good size and having the lounge in the middle meant everyone could spread out,which is important when you have two teenagers. This is our second stay here,now am just trying to figure out when we can go back.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great place for our family holiday - we had 2 brms on 17th floor with our two teenage daughters. We had 9 nights and it was a perfect base for our family holiday. So close to beach, shops and restaurants. We had a city view room but had a peep of the beach from our balcony. I was glad we were on high floor as was nice and quiet ( wouldn't have wanted to be on or near breakfast floor 4th)
user_location: Tauranga, Bay of Plenty, New Zealand

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We love to stay at Embassy Suites for the extra room. This hotel was fairly new. Rooms were quiet (we had 15th floor partial ocean view). Great for a family of 4 which included 2 young adult children. Easy walking distance to the beach and in the heart of shopping.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed here with the family before Christmas. Although definitely not 5 star, the 2 bedroom suite was spacious and suited out family with separate double beds for 12 year old son and 14 year old daughter. The view from the room was not fantastic, but we hadn't paid extra for a view so couldn't complain. The two great features of this hotel are the great location, right near lots of shops and restaurants, and the happy hour each night. From 5.30 to 7 the hotel puts on free food and drinks (including alcoholic) and sometimes live music. Unexpected but excellent! The breakfast buffet has a good selection, and the wait staff and bar people are excellent. The hotel is not on the beach but right across a very quiet road. To get gear sand, you'll need to take a pleasant walk along the beach for 5 minutes or so, but then your in the middle of Waikiki. Cooking facilities are limited to a microwave, and the decor is a little dated, but I'd recommend the apartment if you a looking for a family suite with separate bedrooms.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: loved this hotel, it was our last stop before heading home and the hotel topped off the holiday. Close to the beach, shopping. Staff were attentive. The breakfast was good and the drinks in the evening fabulous - wonderful start to begin and end the day! I would happily stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed five days with the family over Christmas. We would recommend it to anyone. It was close to the beach, shopping and the pool area was really nice in the evenings. The nicest feature of all was the breakfast buffet in the morning. The selection was great and with a family of six we were able to use the money we would've spent on breakfast for many other activities.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our stay was a wonderful one. The rooms was excellent with the view of the ocean. It was a perfect day since flying 18 hours just to get to Hawaii. We really enjoyed the food, employees, and service. The best hotel in Waikiki. We will come back again and we will tell our friends and family that we had the best vacation of 2013 in ESH in Waikiki.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We paid extra for an ocean view and they put us in a suite next to the elevators!!! Noisy all night and when we complained we were told they were sold out, nothing available! The day we checked out they offered a concierge suite where we could shower and change before our evening flight...and the suite was almost twice the size of ours! I usually LOVE Hilton but this experience was terrible. I will never stay there again!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Staff professional and friendly. Loved our 2 bedroom suite. The house keepers looked after us and our room so well. Top points. Great security with having to use keys to get to your floor. Perfect location, close to fantastic restaurants and shopping.Our family will definitely stay there again. No complaints here!!! Miss the Embassy suites

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great location,near the beach. Breakfast is cooked to order and fast. One of the most friendly staffs I have ever seen. Manager reception each evening and entertainment on the weekend. Pool located on 4th floor,away from street noise. I had a problem with the room when I checked in and they immediately moved me to another room, no hassle. They made it right.Outstanding bell staff,use them and find out for yourself.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel is great. My family and I shared a 2 bedroom suite the week before Christmas. The suites are spacious and very comfortable. The housekeeping staff is top notch and vacuumed our room and cleaned everything everyday.The daily breakfast was very good. My favorites were the salad, breakfast potatoes, and the cooked to order omelets. After reading numerous reviews on TA regarding the birds, the birds were not as bad as I thought they were going to be. My family and I ate breakfast every morning and we were never bothered by the birds. Don't leave your food unattended.The manager's reception at night was worth going. I tried the mai tais, the blue Hawaiians, and the white sangria-all were tasty.The location is perfect-just one block to the beach. I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Hotel is centrally located and within walking distance to all the best restaurants, shopping and beaches. The made to order breakfast every morning is fantastic. The evening reception with free beer, wine and mixed drinks provide an excellent way to finish your day or to start your evening. "Dukes" restaurant is just about ten blocks away. Ruth Chris Steak House is about 250 feet away from the main lobby. I definitely like the extra security of having to use your room key to access your room floor.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The Part Of Arriving, We were all so tired, and a man approached and he was so generous that we all had water cold, snacks, lounging chairs to relax and omg .... it was so pleasant and so awesomely house warming to know that a hotel came to our assistance which we were okay. We had VIP for 1 hour or so..... Thank You Embassy Suitesfor an awesome experience

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Very friendly & welcoming staff. I will be back and I recommend this place to EVERYONE. Everyone was extremely friendly and helpful which made the trip even better. Top Notch F&B crew, they remember your name and make you feel like your at home. Everything about this hotel is amazing and its worth the price you pay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Expected a better quality bed for this caliber hotel. Also, watch out for the dozens of birds flying all around your head as you're eating breakfast in the open air area. These birds are very brave and fly so close to you that you can feel the updraft as they fly by. I comment to the staff that they really need to do something about the birds. I ended up with multiple bird mite bites and poop on my clothing.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: All the rooms are suite and guests have larger space than other hotels, location is great, building is a bit old but every facilities including guest room are very clean. All the staff are very kind and I would like to recommend to families having children. My personal view is that the cost performance is far better than Trump and Haｌekulani, which are next to Embassy Suites. Would like to stay again in the future. Thanks all for the kindness.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The Embassy Suites hotel in Waikiki was in a great location and has very helpful staff. Breakfast is great and has a chef making an omelette of your choice. The complimentary cocktails/drinks every night from 5:30pm-7:30pm is even more of a reason to stay here.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Arrived early morning after a long flight from Australia to be greeted by a welcome drink and check in and breakfast straight away. Manager on duty, Garrick Otsuka upgraded us to an ocean-view room on a high floor. Beautiful.Overall staff is fantastic. Breakfast is a great way to start the day - the staff there even remembered us form a previous stay. Everyone friendly and polite. Evening drinks were wonderful bonus - great bar staff and live music very enjoyable.Rooms very clean.Great location. Easy walk to beach as well as shops and restaurants.Will definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: enjoyed our stay. appreciated receiving upgraded room that unfortunately backed up to elevators; fortunately on a higher floor and therefore not much traffic noise. large selection at breakfast but birds kept pooping on the dining tables. recognize that hard to keep them from an open air location. evening reception disappointing; drinks fine but snacks few and paltry in selection compared to other embassy suite locations. overall, enjoyed our stay, our location and the ambiance.....

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I stayed a week and well worth it.Excellent rooms, facilities and location.Quality service.Manager's reception each night from 5.30-7.30pm with complimentary drinks is a great way to start of the night.Only downside I wasn't impressed with the constant efforts of concierge to get me to go to the Hilton briefing sessions.Overall great stay and would go back without hesitation.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is a beautiful hotel that has a staff that understands customer service.I stayed here for seven nights and from the time I arrived until I departed no request was too big or too small. I don't remember everyone's name but Cary in the breakfast area was very helpful and knowledgeable when asked questions about the surrounding area.The laundry room was spacious and clean. This was a nice perk because I didn't have to worry about doing laundry once I returned home. The workout room is well equipped although I only used it 3 of my 7 days.Live entertainment during Happy Hour was awesome. Walking distance and or a quick bus ride to every place you want or need to go.I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The exceptional ways we were treated, from the first moment we arrived to the end of our 5 nights, made us want to stay another week and so we shall in 2014. The suites were large enough for my family of 4 and housekeeping was top rate as was our view from the balcony. All the bell staff were very helpful though out our stay and helped us with our transportation needs as well as some shipping needs. In addition all the Bartenders went way beyound the norm with there service and help every day and again at the evening reception.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Absolutely terrific service from top notch staff. The front desk staff (Malia and Halena) were incredibly helpful and knowledgeable. One of the lobby staff (Dean) has got to be the single nicest and most genuine people I've ever met traveling. He remembered my family from a short stay a year ago and went out of his way to make sure we were comfortable - even when my daughter was sick and fussy. The swimming pool is great for young swimmers, breakfast and the manager's special is nice because you can have a drink with other adults while your kids roam the outdoor area. The rooms are simple but nice and the location is perfect. I'm not the biggest fan of Waikiki but if I go there again, I will definitely stay at the Beach Walk Embassy Suites.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Made to order breakfast, a block away from the beach, on the strip, a great place to stay in Waikiki, just step outside of the hotel and you're in the heart of Waikiki. It was like staying at the major hotels or even better, with made to order breakfast. The breakfast buffet was superb.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I've stayed here several time and every guest is a VIP here! As soon as you approach the open-air check in desk you're greeted with a refreshment. The bellhops are very attentive, but not needy. The location is great for walking to shops restaurants and, of course, the BEACH. The breakfast is AMAZING and caters to Asians' diet. The live band that plays on the patio is AMAZING, the best live cover band I've ever seen and they feature a ukelele player that SHREDS on "Hotel California".

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This past May our family traveled to Honolulu to celebrate my father’s 80th birthday. Since this would be our first time in Hawaii, we all wanted to stay someplace that evoked a real “sense of place” and evoked a “tropical island vibe.” We also required a hotel that offered some good value for money for our six night stay. The Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach Walk fulfilled both of these criteria and made for a very pleasant stay for our family.We arrive at the Embassy Suites around 8:00 pm and checked in at the registration desk, which was located in the hotel’s open-air lobby and driveway. Our room was ready and as we completed our check-in arrangements, the efficient and professional staff served our group some fresh, cold guava juice as we waited. The feeling of warm tropical breezes helped set the tone for our upcoming Hawaiian holiday.This property is the only all-suite resort hotel in Oahu. Since we were going to be in Honolulu for six nights, having the extra space of a suite to “spread out” made our stay comfortable. Although hotel prices in Waikiki are generally not cheap, I found that the Embassy Suites offered excellent value for money. As I comparison-shopped for hotels, I found that for roughly the same rate as a standard room in other nearby mid-range / upscale hotels, I was able to book a suite with a full buffet breakfast included at the Embassy Suites.The Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach Walk consists of two high-rise towers with an open air Grand Lanai on the fourth floor separating the buildings. The Grand Lanai is the location of the hotel’s pool, breakfast area, bar and meeting rooms. Our room in the Hula Tower overlooked the hotel’s pool area and consisted of a living room with a sofa bed and a flat screen TV.The Suite also included a small dining area that featured a mini-fridge and microwave. This feature was really convenient since it provided us a place to store cold drinks and snacks over the course of our stay. We were able to stock up on provisions at the ABC Store located across the street from the hotel. This branch of the ubiquitous Hawaiian convenience & souvenir store chain (another one was located just down the street about a block away) also featured sandwiches, fresh refrigerated ready meals and hot takeaway options.The bathroom was spacious and well kept. The separate bedroom had a king-sized bed (rooms with two queen-sized beds are also available) with another flat screen TV. The room also featured a dresser and armoire. It was great having the ample storage space for our clothes.Although we were only located on the 7th floor of the hotel, we did manage to get a peak at the ocean in between the buildings (the Trump Hotel Waikiki is right next door) which made for some great sunset views from the room’s balcony. The balcony also featured a small table and two chairs so you could use it as a great vantage point for your morning coffee or a nightcap.A full buffet breakfast (6:30 am to 10:00 am) is included in the price of the hotel. The buffet offered a wide variety of traditional morning options including fresh fruit, cereal and bread / bagels. Hot options such as French toast, bacon, sausage, potatoes and steamed rice were rotated regularly. In addition, a cooked-to-order egg / omelet station was also available.The hotel also features a nightly Manager’s Reception (5:30 pm to 7:30 pm) with complimentary drinks and snacks on the Grand Lanai with Hawaiian entertainment on select evenings. Outdoor morning Yoga Classes are also offered on weekly basis. In addition, free Wi-Fi, a Business Center and a Fitness Center round out the amenities that are available.The Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach Walk is very conveniently located. Although it’s not located right on the water, the beach is only about a 5 minute walk away and we were able to incorporate a morning oceanfront stroll into our daily ritual.The adjacent Waikiki Beach Walk area features a wide variety of shops (including the two ABC Stores I mentioned earlier) and restaurants within easy walking distance. Just down the street is Kalakaua Avenue which is one of Waikiki’s main thoroughfares and home to most of Honolulu’s luxury hotels and designer flagship stores. My only complaint with the hotel is that I heard quite a bit of elevator noise (e.g. the mechanicals of the cab going up and down) in my bedroom. Although a minor annoyance, I didn’t find the sound distracting enough to merit a room change. That said, on any future visits I’ll be sure to request a room as far away as possible from the elevator to avoid this problem. While I’m at it, I’d probably also request for a room much higher up in order to improve my (partial) views of the ocean. In addition, the quality of the wine, drinks and snacks (consisting of primarily of potato chips and pretzels) could also stand to be upgraded.Although the Embassy Suites is part of the international Hilton chain, the hotel didn’t feel cookie cutter. Hilton made a real effort to infuse local Hawaiian flavor into the décor and atmosphere of the hotel. Each night, little cards that recounted bits of Hawaiian history (e.g., the origins of the Luau, Surfboards, Lei-Making, etc.) were left in our room. Hawaiian-themed artwork and furnishings decorated the rooms and public areas. Service at the hotel was consistently friendly and welcoming. In particular, the service staff at the breakfast buffet always were cheery and ready to assist. Their positive attitude really got our days off to a great start. I was also very impressed that when we were looking for the Business Center (which turned out to be located in the adjacent Aloha Tower), one of the office personnel stopped what she was doing in order to personally escort us to where we needed to go. That type of proactive action went above and beyond the call of duty.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Best complimentary breakfast I've ever had at a hotel, across the board but especially those omlettes and multicultural (Japanese-American) features. Friendly and responsive staff any time of day. Manager's reception was almost TOO good for unwinding at the end of a work day. Rooftop pool is expansive enough to swim laps. The Beach Walk location is a short stroll from a plethora of dining options. Concierge staff actually remembered me from a trip 18 months ago, I felt very welcomed.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: After a long nonstop flight from Newark, we were welcomed at check in with refreshing glass of juice (I don't typically drink juice but there was no "real" food for sale on our United flight). We were upgraded to a nice suite on the 20th floor. The full breakfast was nice as long as you can guard your food from the aggressive birds. As for the manager's reception, the live entertainment is nice (the band is there most nights but not all) but the snacks are lame compared to other Embassy Suites. Basically, it's one raw veggie, a chip of some sort and gold fish or small cracker like thing. We, like many other guests, would have preferred less alcohol selections and better appetizers. Overall, when the opportunity arises, I would stay here over most places in the area.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great place to stay. Free breakfast and evening manager reception are great. Pool is beautiful and hotel location is very convenient. Good for family vacation or work travel. Parking is a bit expensive. Might be cheaper and more convenient to use public transportation

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Hawai and its people know how to show you hospitality and Embassy Suites in Waikiki is no expection to this. The hotel staff were the best i have experienced, and we had a 1 bedroom suite on the top floor with views of the beach and the mountains. The rooms were clean, spacious and i have never slept so well! Free brekky for all guests and a complimentary happy hour, with great music and some nibblies for the kids. We have travelled Europe and Asia, and this was hands down the most smooth and memorable holiday yet....MAHOLO to Marsha and her team at Embassy Suites! See you again soon.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We got married in Oahu a year ago and decided to come back to Oahu for our one year anniversary. After scouring reviews of all the hotels, we chose to pick embassy suites as our special place. I even added a note on our reservation and asked if they could possibly give us a nicer room or upgrade due to our special occasion. I know we did nothing to deserve it but figured I would try and maybe considering the fact I'm a longtime hilton honors member who was also once a diamond member they would make one nice gesture. I cguess the nice gesture resulted in a low level floor right next to the elevator, facing the pool. It's only our second night here and i awaken to the screaming noise of people at the pool and our next door neighbors conversating right next door, with the busy elevator noise bustling all the hotel guests to the 4th floor for breakfast and out to the lobby to start their day. We come home after a long day and just wanted to take a nap but had to battle the loud band for the managers reception, then right after listening to a group of drunk people at the pool blast their subwoofer speaker as loud as they can for hours. I've called the front desk to complain but 30 minutes later, it's still my problem. I'm now awake and struggling to hold in my sadness from the poor choice of hotel we chose for what is probably one of our most special trips we could have planned. 3 more night to go here, I hope we make it through without anything worse.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This truly is a beautiful Gem. My family: 3 boys, my husband and I stayed here 7 days and it is absolutely a great place. The staff is Amazing, to start they greeted us with great big smiles and a drink for each of us while we checked in. Once done they helped us up to our suite and greeted each of my 3 kids with a very cool surf board. They could not wait to get down to the beach. The breakfast at the hotel is Amazing, a great variety to chose from, you can also get an omelet as you please. Lot's of food, fruit & desert, fresh coffee and different kinds of juice. They also have daily managers reception "FREE 3hrs" drinks/alcohol and appetizers and Amazing entertainment "live band" that plays every other day. I wish they played every day as they are pretty awesome. The pool area is pretty nice as well as the hot tub. Overall you cannot go wrong this is truly a very nice place and the staff is beautiful. The rooms are very nice and the beds are very comfortable. WE LOVED THE EMBASSY SUITES!!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is a great hotel. It is conveniently located and has many amenities. The rooms are nicely outfitted and very comfortable. What sets this hotel apart from all the other great hotels in the area is the staff. They are just great and go out of their way to welcome you. Whenever I am in Honolulu the Embassy Suites is my first choice for a hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here for a week. This is a great hotel. The rooms are fairly typical of an Embassy Suites. But it is the customer service and the location that put this hotel over the top. First is the customer service. Every emploiyee we had interaction with, even minimally, was terrific. You can tell that the staff has been well trained. Housekeeping was excellent. Service at breakfast, excellent. Front desk staff, excellent. Breakfast is terrific and slightly different from other Embassy Suites. If you want miso soup and salad for breakfast, stay here. You can get your made to order omelette also, but you get the miso soup in addition. At the Manager's Reception, the snacks are marginal, just like every other Embassy Suites, but here, you get live entertainment also. If you are enjoying the pool you can order drinks and appetizers. The work out room is well equipped, and the business center has the basics that you need. Wifi is strong. The location could not be any better. Restaurants are literally on site. And the ABC store across the street includes a deli. We were on the 21st floor with a view of Diamond Head and the Ocean. Beautiful views throughout the day. The breakfast area is on the 4th floor. I am not sure I would want a room on this floor just because of the heavy foot traffic for breakfast, the pool. and the manager's reception. On the other hand, you would not have far to go to get to these things.When we return, we will stay here again, We have stayed at the Hilton Hawaiian Village in the past, and it is also good. But if you want the additional space of a seperate bedroom from living room, then this is the place to stay. And finally, the General Manager here is well respected and loved by the staff. So it is no wonder that the customer serivce is at this level.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My partner and I stayed at Embassy Suites Waikiki in October 2013 for 5 nights. The free breakfast was great! Staff were super friendly. Managers cocktail hour serves free snacks and drinks (very strong!) nightly. The band was really good too. The hotel is in a great location. Would go back for sure! Our room didn't have a view but that didn't really matter as we were hardly in the room.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Comfort, convenience, and complimentary breakfast. With food costs being what they are in Waikiki, having the breakfast buffet amounts to about two nights free for two adults staying a week. The two rooms in the suite are a major plus. Top notch staff.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I stayed at this hotel a total of 3 weeks in June during a work trip...everything was nice except my departure. Since I had a late flight home and they were completely sold out I had to store my luggage. When I retrieved my luggage a practically brand new bag had the front of it completely torn off. I only noticed this when we returned the rental car since they took the luggage directly to my trunk and loaded it. When I called the hotel immediately I placed a report about the damage...I heard nothing back...I returned in Sept for work and had a manager look at my bag since I brought it back with me...they placed a report and took pictures. I was told a claim would be filed with the insurance co...I heard nothing afterwards...finally this week I get a letter in the mail from the insurance company saying my claim is denied because I did not follow procedures reporting this incident....I am furious...as a long time loyalty member of Hilton I find this ridiculous!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Arrived at the Embassy Suites at 9.30am and to our amazement our room was ready and we were able to check in. Our room was comfortable and clean. At first we were disappointed as we were on the fourth floor and obviously lacks any views but it suited us to a tee, as access to the the breakfast room , pool and the escalators were all at close proximity. The housekeeping was of a good standard, the convenience of having breakfast included is fantastic, the staff most welcoming and friendly. I could honestly say we have no complaints about our stay and would most definitely consider staying there again. The location is perfect with many dining options available.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel is amazing...I was greeted by the Front Desk Agent with a nice cold beverage, my check in process was quick and effortless, Great Job Front Desk Team...My guest room accomodations were clean and well maintained. Great Job Housekeeping..Comp Bar was great, bar tenders (male & Female) were very quick and held a good conversation. The breakfast was great with a variety of foods and tasted yummy. I asked the bellman for a taxi and he called a limo, wow...I will defiantley be back to this hotel. Very Happy with my stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Loved the overall experience. A great place for families to stay. Lovely pool, amazing staff who were always helpful. Complimentary breakfasts were out of this world and manager's drinks, complete with music and snacks were great fun. Bit disappointed with the rooms - they could do with a fresh coat of paint, but this was outweighed by the great service, facilities and location. So close to shops and restaurants!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: After reading so many reviews about this hotel, I was really curious to see how true they are. -we arrived around 10am, and because we requested a room on a high floor, we were not able to check in until 3pm. That was a very tiring day. As HHonours members, no special consideration was given. As we were there at a non- peak season, I would have expected they could manage an earlier check in.-yes there are birds at breakfast, but they weren't as bad as some of the reviews mentioned (and I have a Bird phobia!). They do have a room opened for guests to sit inside if they like. A few hanging mobiles around to deter birds- this was pointless and had no effect. They will need to put more effort into solving this issue.-breakfast was typical American style buffet. Made to order omelette is good, but not every day. More sliced fruit options would be nice- only 2 offered each morning. And never saw a banana or mango on offer! (Thought they would be aplenty given this tropical destination)- the nightly cocktails gave a great holiday feel to this hotel. The snacks are exactly what all the reviews say- definitely not a meal replacement.-always plenty of lounge chairs around the pool. Lots of beachfront hotels were very crowded with no seating in sight. The pool is only 4ft, which may have been nice to have a deep end.-byo cutlery/plates to the room. The ABC stores are everywhere, but grocery items are not cheap. We didn't have a car, so we didn't get to a supermarket.-location is perfect. Access the trolley easily to Ala Moana shopping mall, and restaurants.-restaurants I would recommend if you don't want to eat American fast food all the time are Kaiwa Japanese (Beachwalk), Yard House, Cha Chas Mexican, Agostinos (takeaway wood fired oven pizza only. $20 for any 20 inch pizza- best pizza on the island, looks dingy as it is a mobile wood fired oven on a trailer in a crappy car park, but don't be turned off. This is great pizza).-staff were friendly and always helpful- if you plan on sleeping on the sofa bed, be warned that it is not comfortable. This is why I scored the sleep quality average.-security to your rooms is good, since you need your room card to access your floor. However anyone from the street can access the pool area (also where breakfast and night cocktails are served). This surprised me since any non guest could go to breakfast or the nightly free cocktails without having to show any id as a guest!We did enjoy our stay- weather was wonderful having come from wintery Melbourne! We would stay again (once they upgrade the sofa beds!).

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: After flying in from Australia, we arrived before check-in time to friendly front desk service, a cold drink & were allowed to access our room straight away. The suite consisted of two queen beds & a lounge room with a fairly comfortable fold out couch- a small balcony from each room. A bar fridge, coffee machine, microwave & two large TVs. Very spacious & the decor was a cute pineapple theme. All was very clean. We travelled with two children, one of whom is physically disabled, and booked the suite with the bathroom to accommodate a person who cannot stand in the shower. The bathroom was very large, with a wide doorway for wheelchair access & the shower had a fold down seat and rails. The toilet also had rails. Location-wise you couldn't ask for better. Close to the beach, nice restaurants along Beachwalk & there is a small tour office & car-hire place about 100m along the Beachwalk exit. The pool is lovely, the range of foods at breakfast is extensive and the managers reception is a lovely touch every evening, with cold drinks & snacks and a terrific band most nights. We would not hesitate to recommend this property to our Australian friends & hope we can return one day. Mahalo.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is a very nice hotel located very close to the beach and right in town so close to restaurants and shopping. There were great free amenities including the wonderful breakfast and nightly reception although the snacks offered at the nightly reception could have been better. The room was clean, comfortable and we had a great view. We would definitely stay here again if we are ever to return to Waikiki.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: After being introduced to Embassy Suites in Denver, I sought one out in Waikiki and was not disappointed. Appreciated the seclusion of the lovely 4th floor pool and breakfast and reception area as its not accessible by anyone who might wander around. Great location. Valet Parking at $35/night is high but great when you've had a tiring day to just pull up and get out. Also fast service when car is needed. Appreciate multiple in and out.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Excellent stay! My wife, my 15 month old son, and I stayed here, and had a blast. We live on Oahu, and this was just a staycation for us. We have stayed in many hotels in the are in the past 6 years, but the Embassy Suites was the best experience I've had since we've had the little guy. The breakfast and pool were amazing! Highly recommend this to any families coming to Hawaii!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Location was good even though it's not right on the beach. Room was nice. We always prefer a suite so that someone can get to sleep in the bedroom with the door closed while someone else is still up watching tv. Free breakfast was very good, had a lot of choices. Free evening reception was good for drinks but could have used a little better variety in the food selection, it was just a few snacks, but overall it was worth it. Would stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The staff are excellent. The suites are modest but very comfortable and clean. The location was great for us. Beach across the road. Walking distance to the heart of Waikiki and to Alo Moana. Had great entertainment from the band and free drinks. Would stay again for sure.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Staff were great and let us check in early after a long flight and gave access to breakfast. Perfect position close to shops and beach. Breakfast was very good. I would stay again. Only drawback was parking was overpriced.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I just finished my stay at this hotel and I must say that this was one of the best experiences I have ever had at a hotel, and it had EVERYTHING to do with the amazing staff. Everywhere I went the staff members went out of their way to make sure my stay was incredible! The staff at the front desk was extremely hospitable and accommodating, and the concierge at the Hilton Grand Vacation were very friendly and helpful in helping us plan our island adventures. I often found myself surprised at the superior quality of service that I was receiving. The breakfast was top notch, (again amazing staff) and the pool area was relaxing and perfect for our needs – a place to recharge between beach sessions. I highly recommend this hotel. They truly exemplify the Spirit of Aloha that make Hawaii so great.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Hotel would be a great place for family's. Rooms are suites, bathrooms are excellent, full complementary hot breakfast. Hotel is very secure with room key for access. The elevator is secured this way as well. Keeps non guests from wondering the property. Definetly a must. I will use this hotel again on my next visit.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: suite layout good,furnishings a bit tired but impecibly clean, buffet b fast adequate but could benefit from some cold cuts and some cheeses,you can only eat so many eggs,managers drinks not that desirable,valet parking good and efficient but gets costly with continual tipping,pool area has plenty of seating ,but noisy because no separate kids pool,if you are a regular traveler to Honolulu and don't need ocean view every time , this is a good choice , position on beachwalk is nice.there is no restaurant or bar but plenty of choice on beachwalk or lewers.my favourite property in Waikiki is still the Sheraton Waikiki , the night view of diamond head is second to none,however their prices are very high for an ocean view diamond head view, but pool area is fabulous .I would stay at embassy suites again .

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We took a family holiday in July for 10 days. We stayed at the Embassy Suites the whole time and could not fault it for location, comfort, cleanliness and family requirements. Being an all suite hotel is a major plus as we could put our two children to bed each night (age 4 and 6) and still stay up and chat, eat, drink and plan our next day in the living room. The room had fabulous views straight through to the water and we could sit on our balcony and watch the goings on of Beachwalk. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom very clean. We ran into our housekeeping a couple of times and they were always polite and asked if we had enough towels and if there was anything more we needed.There was a kitchenette with a fridge and a microwave, coffee machine and some glasses. Yes you do need to buy some plastic cutlery but this is a small price to pay for such necessary facilities when holidaying with children. Front desk staff were very welcoming and I could have kissed them when we arrived after 12 hours of travel and they had our room ready 4 hours early! Everything is within easy walking distance of this hotel (even for a 4 yo). ABC stores aplenty, Honolulu Cookie Company (if you haven't been you need to!), amazing restaurants and cafes and great shopping. Lets not forget though, waikiki beach. Just a 5 minute walk and you are there. On ground level you have the Yard House, which we frequented. Put your name down in advance and take your pager and lay under a palm tree until they have a table for you (totally worth it). Take advantage of the nightly Managers happy hour. Complimentary cocktails, snacks and non alcoholic beverages for a couple of hours. We did this a few times. The kids loved the fruit and nachos and we loved the Mai Tai's......all enjoyed by the pool for a late afternoon swim and to watch the sun go down. Complemtary breakfast each morning was a hit as well. Fabulous, made to order, omlettes, gorgeous fresh fruit, cereal and a selection of pastries. Embassy Suites has everything you need and, for us, everything we wanted. We do plan on heading back to Hawaii in a couple of years and would absolutely stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I have just returned from an 11 night stay at the Embassy Suites Waikiki. In short, it was wonderful and the best time I have ever had at this hotel (this was my third stay). Occupancy rates appeared to be a little low and we were lucky enough to get an upgrade to a partial ocean view which was fantastic!Check-in was very welcoming and professional (thanks Sandra) and the bell staff were very helpful. The room was spotless and comfort levels were very good indeed. The maid service was consistently excellent with very friendly and efficient ladies every day. The beds were very good in terms of rest quality and the blackout curtains made sleeping-in very easy. I heard no noise from adjacent rooms or the street (from Level 17).The room had both wired and wireless internet access. The data rate and signal strength were excellent. I didn't watch much TV but channel selection appeared to be basic cable with one or two good kid's channels. The included breakfast is standard fare for Embassy Suites with better than average fruit selection, great omelettes and a fair selection of pastries, cereals etc. It does get a little monotonous after a while and we chose to have breakfast out every few days (Dukes is a good option). Service at breakfast is very good with Aldrin doing a fantastic job with a genuine smile and true enthusiasm.Evening drinks are really very well done at this hotel. The bar staff know their stuff and the free Mai Tais are deadly so look out. The snacks on offer are basic but keep kids happy until dinner. Live music is provided with an excellent Hawaiian band playing 4 nights a week (I think).The hotel pool is clean and well maintained and excellent for kids. It is not really a great place for couples to lie around and relax. The beach is a 2 minute walk away.The location of the hotel is hard to beat. It is one block from the sand and views are not as good as the beachfront hotels. However, there are dozens of quality eating options very close to the hotel. The Yardhouse is an excellent family dining option and it is literally under the hotel.This is not a true luxury property - there are plenty of those dotted around Waikiki. Rather, this is a great hotel which caters very well to families and offers very good value for money. My wife and 5yo daughter loved it here and we will definitely be coming back.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Nice hotel, good location, close to everything, but the beds needs to be replaced. the last thing you need when you have had a long travel day from the states is sleep in a worn out bed.. the free breakfast is great value, and lots of excellent restaurants near by.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Best all around hotel and well located. The hotel is in walking distance to the beach, restaurants and plenty of shopping which minimizes having to take a car out every time you want to do something. I would highly recommend this hotel for business or pleasure.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed here for 2 weeks and loved every minute, great staff, excellent location. Rooms have kitchenette, which is handy. Full cooked breakfast every morning, huge selection and variety of food. managers reception each evening made the stay even more enjoyable. Highly recommend this hotel and cannot wait to get back there. I can't rate this hotel highly enough and the staff were excellent. Mahalo

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel has amazing staff. Everyone we encountered was outgoing, helpful and friendly. The breakfast was great and always something different to keep it from getting boring. The manager’s reception was fun with entertainment. The suite was very clean. The hotel location is wonderful, so close to the beach, shopping and dining. We will stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I will never stay at this hotel again. You will not get your money's worth-- front desk is rude; Valet was getting it on with a guest while we were waiting to get someone's attention to get our car; begged and pleaded for a late check out as Diamond Level members with the HH program--- they do not recognize that here; no hot oatmeal; ran out of eggs one days; best servest was the lady that cleaned our room and Aldrin, the only one who appeared to be working during breakfast; was told that we were given an upgrade for a room we spent about 5 hours max-daily.... do not stay here- there are other hotels in the area...

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is a great, spacious hotel with an excellent pool for families with young children. The breakfast is more than adequate, and the evening reception with live music and snacks/drinks is a definate bonus. The location is very convenient to both the beach and shopping/restaurants. The rooms are clean and we loved having a suite.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: While this hotel was well presented and the staff all friendly and helpful if you're going to stay here make sure you don't get a room next to the lift shaft or one that faces to pool as the noise from both made sleeping difficult.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Not the quality we hoped for... very 'average'. The appetizers at the daily manager's reception each night consisted of plain potato chips and celery sticks with dips. Good location, but that was the best thing about this hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was our first stay at Embassy Suites and we loved it. Our family of 4 stayed on the 8th floor in the Hula Tower overlooking the pool with a partial ocean view. We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. The Buffet Breakfast and Manager's Reception were fabulous and we enjoyed both on most of the 12 days of our stay.The location is fabulous, so close to the beach, shops, restaurants and bus and trolley stops. No need for a car. We found the Expedia staff very helpful and booked various day trips with them.We found the pool great and loved relaxing on the comfy lounges and there were always plenty.Our only problem on one night was when we had a new family stay in the apartment next door and 2 young children were talking, laughing and jumping loudly at 11pm at night for quite some time keeping us all awake. We will be back for another holiday as soon as we can. September weather is fantastic, not too hot during the day and warm balmy nights.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed for a week in this hotel. Our room was a partial sea view on the 21 st floor. We could see the view as well as the sun coming up over the mountains first thing in the morning. Staff were very helpful, they will cash Travellers cheques up to a value of 200 dollars in the reception. Breakfast good, plenty of choice, go to the managers reception for free drinks late in the afternoon for 2 hours. Did not go in the pool as it always seemed to be full of children not leaving much room for anyone else.Lots of choices for places to eat but as the rooms have a microwave and fridge you could also use the ABC store across the road which sell ready meals etc. Recommend going on the round island tour and Pearl Harbour. A visit to the Army museum a few minutes walk away is a must see.We used the business centre on the 3rd floor to keep in touch with home and printing boarding passes etc. This floor also has a fitness centre but did not use it as we are on holiday!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite which was perfect for our party of 6 for our 7 night stay. They had our room ready when we arrived at 9am which was so good after our long flight. The rooms were a good size & the 2 bathrooms were spacious which was necessary when we all needed to get ready. The breakfast was great, we especially loved the freshly cooked omelets. We went to the managers reception before dinner for a couple of cocktails a few nights & that was a lovely bonus. The position is so convenient, only a couple of minutes to the beach & the Beachwalk shops & restaurants are right next to the hotel. Our only complaint was room service which was expensive & awful. But with such a variety of great places to eat so closeby this is not really a problem. We had a couple of requests during our stay & these were attended to very quickly & with a smile. Staff were great, helpful & happy.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My husband and myself recently stayed at Embassy Suites. We had a very pleasant time. From the moment of checkin! To when we checked out, everything was so easy! Rooms were clean, staff was awesome, breakfast had lots of choices.very convenient location to the beach, great shops and restaurants. Just an all around great place! We will definitely stay there again! Will highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The staff was amazing!! We had a group of girls celebrating our daughter's birthday and they were so awesome from front desk, valet and bell hop at check in and check out, to housekeeper who anticipated our needs to restaurant help. The great breakfast (hot options) and evening reception snacks/drinks made for an AMAZING value. Rooms were clean, pool was great...two thumbs up and definitely would recommend this property!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is our fourth trip to Hawaii and the Embassy Suites was the best place we have stayed. Rooms are spacious, breakfast and reception are outstanding, and it was really convenient to the beach and attractions.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We choose the embassy suites as it was one of the few places that provided a full cooked breakfast free and was handy to the beach and shopping.It is always hard to choose accommodation from this distance but assure you ours was a very wise choice. The staff could not have been more helpful and the suite was kept very clean throughout our 10 day stay We will be returning again next year for sure.Thanks.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: hotel is consistant ,always clean , friendliest staff , great breakfast buffet omelet station choices selections , always great memories when we stay here , see u next time mahalos from Hawaii ken lau

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here 3 days after our cruise. What can you say about this place!!!! The staff is excellent and will take care of your needs period. There is not one person we met that did not give excellent service to my family and myself!!! After we finished a disappointing cruise this place was amazing and Celebrity could take some much needed advice from a customer service expert like the Embassy Suites. Our every need was met and we were wishing we had flown to HNL directly and stayed here versa taking the cruise. This is a fabulous place. Everything is right at the door step! The breakfast was great and the area clean with very friendly attendants! Front desk, lobby and housekeeping superb!!! thank you for saving our vacation!!!Gary

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here for 2 nights before our Cruise and were pleasantly surprised. Our room was very clean with like new furnishings. The staff was very friendly and helpful. One particular bellman, Dean made it his mission to make us feel welcome and give us knowledge of the area. Everything you need is right around the property, very nice shops and restaurants. The beach is right across the street. Included in the stay was a good buffet breakfast and a nightly reception with free drinks and entertainment. We will stay here again and recommend to friends.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I stayed here for two weeks during a business trip. The hotel was clean, in a great location and was spacious. The staff made my experience - everyone from the valet, to the house keeping to the concierge. Pool was great for kids or just lounging around. Evening reception was one of the best i have had when it comes to drink options.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had the one bedroom suite with two queen beds and a double sofa bed for our nine day stay in early October. The hotel is in a great location within easy walking distance to the beach, shops and restaurants. The staff were always friendly and helpful, and if you requested any extra towels etc they were always delivered promptly.The daily breakfast and manager's evening reception, made the hotel a great deal for a family of four. We had room service for dinner a few times and the food was good, really big serves and well priced for a hotel.The valet parking is expensive ($35 per 24 hours) but is convenient when travelling with kids when you return from a long day at the beach. I was worried about the noise given we were on the floor with grand lanai, outdoor bar and pool, and we also overlooked the shops but we found we weren't bothered by any of the noise except for the room's air conditioning which was very effective at keeping the room cool but a bit noisy at night.Other benefits are the 24 hour business centre with Internet access and printers, and the free Wi-Fi in the room. The guest laundry facilities were also very clean and easy to access.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I stayed here for a week and what a great place! Great location, courteous staff they were very helpful, very good breakfast buffet and happy hour. I'll be sure to stay at an embassy suite hotel the next time I vacation.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: a bit disappointment , receive less towels for (3) registered guest, air conditioning was NOT cold enough, Parking valet charges $35.00 a day, had a problem, as night shift mixed up guest's keys, and I had to wait over 1/2 hour for my car and was late for a dinner reservation at Michel's

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Recently stayed at Embassy Suites for three nights and was not impressed. On the positive side, the location is excellent. There are plenty of restaurants and shopping in the area. The front desk staff was very pleasant and we had a nice drink while checking in. The valet staff was very friendly and helpful. There is an afternoon happy hour which we did not attend. On the negative side, we were given a room in a tower on the opposite side of the building from the reception area. While you need to swipe your key to call the elevator, there is nothing stopping anyone from getting on with you. This did not feel like a safe situation. We discovered our room was right next to the elevator. This made for a lot of noise all day and night. Added to the elevator noise was the noise from the air conditioner, which was very loud. The "suite" was tiny. Once the flimsy pullout sofa bed was extended, there was no room to move around. The main bed was very uncomfortable. There was one dated bathroom. You had to exit the bedroom to get to it. Towels were extremely thin and we were only given one small towel for each person registered in the room (3). There is a small refrigerator in the room, which was helpful. During our stay, one elevator was shut down for maintenance, which caused huge delays in getting up and down, especially during breakfast hours. Had one free breakfast poolside but was not impressed. There are plenty of better, but more costly, options in the area.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Bidet on the main floor before going on the elevator is awesome. Check-in is fastest I've ever had. Valet is 35 bux a night. Breakfast is solid. Lots of asian options for food and american style food as well. Very professional staff. Came with family and had 2 doubles and a pull-out sofa. It worked well for space.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I stayed at the Embassy Suites in Waikiki with my husband and 4 children. The hotel was extremely accommodating to families. We were greeted with drinks when we first checked in and in the early evening the hotel offered free drinks and snacks by the pool. The room was clean and it comfortably accommodated the 6 of us (there were 2 beds in the bedroom and a living room with a pull out couch). After we had dinner at a nearby restaurant (there are several great restaurants within walking distance from the hotel), we walked across the street from the hotel to the beach to watch fireworks from a nearby hotel. We then went swimming at the pool which was opened until 10 p.m. The next morning we all had the complimentary buffet breakfast which offered a great selection. Some of the items at the breakfast included: scrambled eggs, breakfast meats, fruit, and muffins. There was also a made to order omelet station. The staff members at the breakfast were extremely friendly and attentive. All in all, the Embassy Suites Waikiki is a very family friendly hotel and I would highly recommend it to anyone interested in staying in Waikiki with their family.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We recently stayed at the Embassy suites Waikiki with another family. Overall our two families had a wonderful stay. On arrival we were checked into two adjacent rooms, both of which were clean spacious and with a nice outlook. From that point on we were impressed with the staff who could not have been more helpful. The value you get with the evening reception and complimentary breakfast make this hotel hard to go past in the area. For our group of 8 it was perfect and just added to our great Hawaii Vacation.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights in late Sept-early Oct. The location across the road from the beach & walking distance to the shops & restaurant was very convenient. We had an ocean view room overlooking the pool on 9th floor which suited us. TVs in bedroom & living room. Comfortable room. Overall a very nice hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We spent a fantastic week at the Embassy Suites mid September. The rooms were very clean and spacious, we were on the second floor and it was very quite. The location is very convenient, right near the beach, the shopping and the trolleys. The breakfast and happy hours were great and the staff very helpful and friendly. I would highly recommend the Embassy Suites as a place to stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My husband and I stayed at the Embassy Suites Waikiki last month for our 12 year anniversary. We had never been to Hawaii before and this hotel made our first visit the best! The staff was wondeful and always helpful. We were so impressed how they always seemed to go out of their way to make our stay that much nicer. The room was perfect for us and we had a lovely view of the city and ocean. The location was also great and the 5 minute walk to the beach was not a problem at all. We also prefer to stay at Embassy Suites, no matter where we travel and this was the best experience we've had with the hotel chain. This wasn't the fanciest hotel on the beach, but the value and service are excellent. This was definitely one of the best vacations we've had in a long time and we plan on staying at the Embassy Suites Waikiki the next time we vacation in Oahu. Thank you!!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was our second stay at Embassy Suites Waikiwi with our 2 teenage daughters. Our first stay we requested a 1 bedroom, 2 bed suite and was very impressed with our end of Aloha tower room. We enjoyed our stay and room so much we had no hesitation in rebooking the same room type for our next stay. It was with much dismay at check in to find out we had been allocated a king bed with pull out sofa for the girls. I was told the hotel was a near capacity and they did not have any of the 2 bed configurations available. Its not like we were only staying for a couple of nights with little children, we had an 11 night booking with 18 - 16 year olds! to make matters worse the room was right next to the elevators! The next day we managed a room change, still only a king bed with pull out but an ocean view with 2 balconies overlooking pool and Outrigger Reef on the 19th floor of Hula tower but at a cost of an additonal cost to us of US$25 per night.Despite our bedding request not being met we still love this hotel and would return again without hesitation. The rooms are clean and well maintained. The linen and towels smelled fresh. The pull out bed was not comfortable for 2 and we made a single bed out of the swabs on the floor!! Although on the 19th floor we never waited long for a lift. The breakfast was always well replenished and fresh, the birds a bit off putting and dont leave your table or they come and pick food off the plate. The band that plays Fri/Sat/Mon/Wed night were fantastic and a highlight of our evenings along with the free drinks and nibbles, We used the tour desk to book a rental car from Enterprise Rentals located in the Outrigger reef drectly across the road and the drop off point was the Embassy suites so it was very easy and efficient.If the manager is reading this review, please know how disappointed I was your hotel didnt not meet my booking request but as your hotel is so fabulous in all other ways we will be back for a third time. I dont know why anyone would want to stay at the Trump towers, our room overlooked the hotel and pool area and it was super small and lacked any personality, no trees, no free drinks, no band, it was boring and bland!ABC store directly across the road for supplies and I can recommend the Yard House for great food but get your name down early as they are busy.Cant wait to get back.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My family and I (2 adults and 4 children, 10, 8,6 & 1) really enjoyed our time at the Embassy Suites. We had a 2 bedroom suite in the Hula Tower on the 11th floor. The rooms were very clean upon arrival and the daily maid service kept it that way. The staff at the Embassy Suites were all very helpful and polite. The beds & pillows in the suite were quite soft, which I liked but my husband had to sleep on the floor with the cushions off the lounge as they were too soft for him. My children loved the pool. I found the pool to be very busy and crowded. (No fault of the Embassy Suites, but parents really do need to keep their children under control while in such a busy pool. On numerous occasions I had the baby in the toddler pool and older kids would run through pushing & shoving. I get that we are all on holidays but courtesy is still nice). Breakfast was pretty basic but had food that we liked. The Managers Reception of an evening was loved by the children. A range of drinks and snacks were available between 5.30-7.30 and some nights they had a live band, very enjoyable. The location was fantastic. Close to trolley/tour pick ups, a short walk to the beach and shops and an ABC store just across the street. If we travel back Waikiki I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. Thank you for a great holiday memory.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: You will notice the Embassy is a special place from the moment you arrive. The desk staff is friendly and the bell hops very helpful. This hotel has two towers. We stayed in the Aloha Tower which is very nice. However the other tower is a little closer to the beach and has a better view of the ocean. Unfortunately, thanks to Trump, there is a larger building beside the hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Excellent accomodations! Great service and you can't beat their breakfasts and Manager's Reception. A live band was a special touch. Close to the beach. Easy access to all the restaurants and shops. We had no need for a car. I would stay their again in a heartbeat.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We travelled as a family with our 2 boys aged 6 & 8. On arrival we were all provided with a lovely cold juice and we stayed in a one bedroom suite with a pullout couch which was suitable for us.Our room was on the 17th floor in the Hula Tower which gave us a nice ocean view from the balcony/lanai. The room was nice size, with good bathroom amenities and little kitchenette with a microwave and bar fridge. Cleaning staff did a good job and loved the little history cards they left on the bed each night, great for the kids.The bonus of this hotel is the inclusions it provides. The breakfast that was provided has a good variety of foods and loved the omelette station. Especially loved that you could put the extras that you want in your omelette in your own bowl so you have control of what goes in. Another extra provided is the Managers Reception by the pool every night which was great! It went from 5.30pm to 7.30pm and serves complimentary beer, wine, spirits, selected cocktails, soft drinks, juices. Be aware though that the barman are great and they don't hold back so some drinks can be quite strong. They provide 3 different snack foods during the Managers Reception as well every night like potato chips, celery, carrots & dip, corn chips etc. On a couple of nights there is also a band that provides some entertainment. It was nice to have a few drinks at night while the kids enjoyed the pool.The pool is not huge when you compare it to resort pools but our boys still loved it. We did stay off peak season though so it wasn't too crowded. I could imagine during peak season that it may get quite crowded in there. There are plenty of lounges around the pool and never had any problems getting one. The Pakini Bar is by the pool which you can order food and drinks. They do stop serving drinks at 5.00 though due to the Managers Reception starting at 5.30 . It is a good location in Waikiki, there are plenty of nearby restaurants and shops on beachwalk and it is only a couple of minutes walk to the beach. Its would be a perfect hotel for a short stopover stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We've enjoyed two stays at this hotel. The staff were always courteous and helpful; at check in we were greeted with a welcome drink and friendly reception staff. The complimentary hot & cold breakfast options were great every morning. Rooms were clean and fresh; gym & laundry facilities were also clean. Room service was quick; We enjoyed drinks at the bar, lunch by the pool and spa. We'll definitely recommend this hotel to family & friends, until next time ~ Mahalo!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Wow, what can I say! My family 2 adults and our two teenaged children 14 and 16 had a totally wonderful holiday staying at the Embassy Suites. The two bedroom suite is just what we want on our family holidays as we like the extra room and space when we are all together in our room. Our room was excellent. I could not have asked for anything more, two bathrooms, 3 televisions and two balconies. The beds were very comfortable, air conditioning worked great, plenty of fluffy white towels and a quiet and clean room. The inclusions that this property offers just added to the excellent value of booking this property. The breakfast was great although I found the birds very off putting and irritating, the managers reception drinks was just so wonderful and the free entertainment was brilliant and free wifi was also another great bonus.We were on the 12th floor with a city view which was absolutely fine. The location of this property is number 1. Away from the busy strip but a very short and pleasant walk to the very centre of Waikiki. Fantastic restaurants at our door step and lovey shops and open grassed area at the bottom of the hotel as it's right on the Beach Walk. Top location!Pool area also great, plenty of deck chairs and plenty of sun too! Spa was excellent have never been in such a hot and great outdoor spa at any resort. Thumbs up to this great property. We all LOVED our stay here and want to return.Mahalo Embassy Suites!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great place to stay for couples or families. Excellent facilities backed by excellent friendly service. Hotel has great facilities , central to Waikiki and right on a great restaurant and shopping precinct called Beach Walk. Complimentary breakfasts, evening drinks and in-room wifi make this a good deal

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Rm 2108 had the corner wrap around balcony with the ocean view on one side and Diamond Head on the other - couldn't ask for a more fabulous room. As usual the breakfast was fabulous and the staff is always responsive and courteous! I just love this place. The cleanliness of the rooms and the ideal location of the hotel is top notch. The free entertainment, drinks, and munchies provided with the Managers' receptions can't be beat - plus the free entertainment on Beachwalk - a cornucopia a festivities!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This room is on the top floor, ocean facing and has stellar views. It is at the end of the corridor and has only one side attached to another room. We were treated to a wonderful view on a large balcony that flowed along 2 sides of the room. It was large enough to invite several friends that were not fortunate enough to stay at this hotel. They were amazed at our great sunset views and the rainbow on Sunday morning was stunning (almost double rainbow quality!). The Friday night sailing from the harbor brought smiles to my sailing enthusiast husband to watch dozens of sailboats coming out for a 5 PM sail framed by the sunset. It was wonderful. The room is large with a good Kingsize bed. The shower has a removable shower head but is positioned high enough that the tall member of our room had no trouble standing in the shower. The staff were very helpful, friendly and the staff in valet parking always had our car ready by the time we came down stairs. I love the access to the street from the Hula tower. I was able to attend meetings at the Sheraton with a half block walk and stay at the Embassy Suites, which I prefer. This is my second visit after a 5 year hiatus and the hotel is better each time. The evening entertainment is fun and the drinks are very substantial. Breakfast is just a joy with everything one could ask for in a breakfast, including a miso maker, made to order eggs and lots of side dishes that were healthy! The staff at breakfast don't get mentioned enough. They are wonderful. They went out of their way to catch my errant newspaper that was caught by a breeze, brought coffee and juice and cleaned up quickly. The afternoon bartenders have wonderful senses of humor and are quick to recognize returning guests from the previous night. There are several comments about noise levels from garbage and delivery trucks in the mornings. The noise level is markedly abated by keeping the windows shut at night and the air conditioner works better with the windows shut. I have been very happy with all of my stays at this establishment but this room is clearly the best in the hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The rooms are spacious and clean with great balconies. Buffet with full course breakfasts and omelets to order. Amazing perk.... free happy hour . Attentive and friendly staff. Staying in Waikiki can be pricey but with these perks make it very affordable in the long run.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The Embassy Suites is an excellent hotel providing a great breakfast and evening reception with music. The staff and their attention to detail makes me want to go back. The location is ideal. Close to the beach and close to shopping.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was our 2nd visit to E.S. Waikiki Beach and we were not disappointed. Every employee we encountered had a smile on their face and expressed the aloha spirit.I requested a very specific room upon check in (at 9 p.m. Sunday night) and got what I asked for: Top floor (21st), facing eva (west) in the Aloha tower.
