The balcony was long/narrow and we could access it from both the living room and bedroom. The only 'surprise' was the size of the bed. It was a queen and I don't see how a king could have fit in the room. That made for very tight sleeping conditions, but I didn't complain because the location was perfect.Breakfast was good with lots of variety. I had an omelet one morning and it was cooked just like I like it. The evening reception was nice, with entertainment on 4 nights. The drinks aren't strong and the scotch wasn't the best, but who cares when they're pouring and you're not paying? The hula dancer was graceful and serene.Overall, I would recommend this hotel for anyone wanting a terrific holiday in Waikiki. The beach is 1 block away and the Beach Walk stores & restaurants are at your back door. I'll be back as soon as I can.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at the Embassy Suite for one night before our trip to Kauai. Since my mother came with us on this trip, we needed the extra space and preferred a suite to an extra hotel room, and we needed the space for our 16 month old - the suite was a perfect set up. As requested, we were booked on a high floor so did not hear any traffic below. I booked a partial ocean view room but it was a clear view from the balcony. There is a small kitchenette with a fridge and sink - worked for what we needed to store milk and wash bottles.Upon arrival, we were greeted with a glass of cold passion fruit juice and check-in was quick. We didn't partake in the manager's reception but breakfast was awesome. Location could not have been better.Overall, a great value for a family and no doubt will stay here again - preferred hotel choice in Waikiki.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed on the 14th floor in a roomy one bedroom suite with two queen size beds and a sofa bed. A large living area, large bathroom, half kitchen and two balconies gave us plenty of room to spread out. Loved all the pineapple carpet and coverings. It was quiet, on Waikiki Walk, and the pool had plenty of room with a spa and a bar and was really nice. A buffet breakfast was included which was really great. The swipe cards for the lift and rooms are a bit of a pain, you have to use them very slowly and even then they don't work first time every time. However, that's the only negative. You get a wonderful reception at this hotel, and really looked after by the concierge. I called a cab once and a limo showed up! Parking is $35 per night. The beds were fantastic.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Best place to stay in Waikiki! You can't beat the clean rooms, helpful and friendly staff, close proximity to the beach and many amenities. The rooms and common areas are up to date and kept very clean. The staff is always willing to help and go out of their way to ensure a pleasant experience for their guests. Restaurants and shopping are right at your fingertip. This is the best hotel in Waikiki and at the right price point!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Had the need for 1 night staf before flying out early, and found the Embassy to be great. From drinks by the pool, and early night then a 6am check out. Unfortuantely we missed the breakfast but had free nimbles with drinks.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at the Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach Walk with our family of five for a few days in August 2013. We researched nearly every hotel in the area, and couldn't have been happier with our accomodations. We initially booked a one bedroom suite with a city view through their website. When we arrived and walked into our room, we found that we had been upgraded to a 2 bedroom suite! The room was beautiful, clean, and quiet. There is a small fridge/bar area, a living room, outside lanai, and two separate bedrooms. Our tower was the further away from the ocean, but our views from the 17th floor were phenomenal. While the other tower overlooked the noisy pool and surrounding buildings, our room overlooked a beautiful park, downtown Honolulu, and the ocean. We were one block from the beach. Waikiki really has been cleaned up since the last time we stayed there 16 years ago. The beachwalk has nice shops and restauraunts. If you are a runner, you can go on a really nice run in the mornings along the beachwalk, along the ocean, and up to diamond head. Breakfast was typical Embassy suites, and was ok. The pool is nice, but we mostly avoided "free drink" happy hour in the evening. The staff was friendly and helpful. There is an ABC store and a 7-11 on the street, so you can stock your fridge with sodas, etc. Restaurants like the Hardrock Cafe, Cheeseburger beachwalk, Jimmy Buffett's, etc are all within close walking distance. We found a small (around 5-6 tables) sushi restaurant across the street (can't remember the name) which had a bit of a wait, but was amazing. There is a restaurant in the hotel toward the ocean from ours, which was fun and right on the beach. We were able to have drinks, grill our own steaks/seafood, and enjoy the sunset there. Our whole experience was great. I would recommend this hotel for anyone. One other hint. If you are planning to go to pear harbor, you don't really need one of those stinky bus tours. You need to go to the national parks website and make your reservations for the Arizona memorial. You can pick your time for the Arizona, and pay for one or all of the memorials/museums (Arizona, Missouri battleship, Bowfin, Pacific air museum). I would recommended getting the audio tours for each. We made our reservations 4 months in advance. We took a cab to get there and back, which was reasonable and quick. Plan on taking most of the day for this amazing look into our history.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great location amongst the heart of Waikiki, walking distance to all amenities. Hotel itself is great for families, I travelled with a nearly 5 year old and 2 year old. Be warned the kithcnette comes with nothing - take/buy you own cutlery, plates, tea towels etc. otherwise everything worked well and was very clean. lobby staff are great. The mangers drinks are great as kids are welcome, free breakfast is also good - not a big selection but certainly big enough. overall nothing to fault and would recommend to other families for sure.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: 何時ものようなサービスに大満足です。今回は特に帰国時のデスクの対応はベルマンの気遣いと共に満点でした。朝食時の従業員の気遣いも素晴らしく、well-disciplined as I said in the title, people who work　here among other Embassy Suites Hotels never fail to attract guests' attention.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My wife and I did our first Oahu trip the week of Labor Day. The location is great, lots of beach, food, entertainment and shopping in walking distance. The room is what I'd expect from an Embassy Suites, nice and modern. I would recommend the Aloha Tower which is closer to the beach. We booked an Ocean view and talked our way up from the 4th to 15th floor at check-in, ended up with a great view. The free Wifi was great and with the high breakfast prices in Waikiki, you can't beat the free breakfast. The 4th floor Lanai pool was a nice place to relax, especially for the manager's reception.I see some reviews complaining about the parking fee, but most hotels in Waikiki that I researched had similar fees, and with this location you really don't need a car. If you want to do a drive around the island you're better off taking a tour IMHO because traffic and parking is not fun on Oahu. If you must drive, you can do a day rental from Avis that has an office at the nearby Sheraton.When we go back I'm planning on staying at the Embassy Suites again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My husband and I recently returned from our anniversary vacation at the Embassy Suites Beachwalk Waikiki Beach and could not have had a more wonderful, special time. At the start, greetings made by the entire staff were friendly and cheerful, including Andrew at the front desk who greeted us with a fruit drink and Jeff who brought us to the room. The suite was large, immaculate, with A/C truly efficient. The breakfast buffet was handled beautifully with many entrees and the cocktail hour reception in the early evening truly wonderful. Where can you have free cocktails and snacks plus entertainment on M-W-Friday? I loved the pool area with plenty of lounges and a bar to order food with Lewis, the best bartender in the world. But I also loved seeing all the small children having the time of their life in the pool as this is a truly family place with the pool safe at only 4 1/2 feet. In the evenings, I enjoyed the quiet of swimming until 10:00 o'clock; during the day, I loved watching the children with their parents and did not miss having just adults. Walking to the beach was a breeze; the shops at Beachwalk just outside the hotel are modern and interesting. You could not choose a better place; Coco Cove is a grocery store/deli on the ground floor which, by the way, is cheaper than ABC grocery across the street. Also across the small street is a tiny place called Henry's Place where Henry makes his own ice cream,sorbets and sandwiches. What truly makes the Embassy Suites wonderful is the way it is run by the general manager and the efficiency of the staff to satisfy our every wish. We were impressed with everyone's friendliness, even the maids who greeted us every morning as we left our room with a friendly "Aloha, have a nice day." This place truly emanates the Aloha Spirit. Thanks for a memorable anniversary; we will return.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The hotel is in a great location on Beachwalk. The rooms as always are large and comfortable. The comp. breakfast and managers reception are both great with a large slection of foods for breakfast and plenty of drinks for the reception. The rooms are high priced and on top of that they will charge you $35 a day for valet parking. I parked a car at 6:30 PM and retrived it at 6:30 AM and they charged me $70 for 2 days parking. Be advised, on the side by Aloha tower across the street there is a small car rental company that will let you rent a car for 1 day and bring it back, then let you rent it the next day and you do not have to pay for parking. I did not find this out until I had already picked up my rental. Their prices are in line with the rest.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The Embassy Suites hotel in Waikiki was absolutely great. We loved the location-just one block from the beach and it was the nice, wider part of the beach in Waikiki so plenty of room to relax and spread out your beach blanket. The rooms were clean and modern. The breakfast was terrific and the evening reception could not be beat. Even though the drinks were complimentary, the bartenders made them full strength and with a smile. The entire staff was courteous and wonderful. My only complaint was with the Jacuzzi by the pool. There were many infants and toddlers in the Jacuzzi and I think most know what happens when small children immerse themselves in warm water. Hopefully the Embassy Suites uses a lot of chlorine in it otherwise you are having a bath in others' urine. Also, these kids brought rafts, noodles and beachballs into the Jacuzzi. I think they thought it was a hot, bubbly kiddie pool and no one told them otherwise. Also, there was no sign restricting usage to adults only. But that was just one small downside to all of the other great things this hotel has to offer.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This place is fantastic! We have stayed as a family of four for the past 4 years in a row with our most recent trip in July 2013. The service is top-notch from the moment you check in. We have had the odd issue with clogged sinks etc but every issue was attended to promptly and to our satisfaction. We have stayed in both the one bedroom and two bedroom suites and both are very spacious and gave us plenty of room. The mini fridge and microwave are a nice feature for leftover meals. Rooms are always very clean and well stocked. The breakfast has something for everyone and is always fresh and hot. A great value when you are feeding teenage boys! The managers's reception at night is an added bonus and the entertainment on Monday, Wednesday, Friday and Saturday from Roland and his three sons is always a highlight of our stay. Please make sure to tip these guys because they really are good. My only complaint would be that it seems the hotel no longer offers rooms using Hilton Honor points nor upgrades for Hilton Honor members and the price of a room has doubled since our first stay in 2010. That being said, we are going to stay again next year in July 2014, would not stay anywhere else.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had a thoroughly great stay. Our room was an Ocean view as we had asked for and we had a corner suite which was lovely with two differing views. The Hotel is in a great location and has many restaurants and shops on the doorstep. Great place to stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great hotel and accommodations, close to shopping, restaurants, museum, beach. Quiet room, 2 lanais, excellent check-in, check-out service, prompt and friendly room assistance. Would definitely reserve rooms here again if in Honolulu.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Overall experience was great. Very impressed with the facilities and the location. Again, the only thing that I was not impressed with was the fact that My hilton honors points were not even recognized by the staff. In the past upgrade or other things were offered.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is a great place for families, and a fantastic value. Lovely staff, great location, and lots of little extras (beautiful pool, affordable - and really good - food, evening reception) that make the stay memorable.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We booked a 2 bedroom unit for family of 4 in August 2013. They only had the city view units available, but you could still see the water if you leaned out from one of the balconies. Very good breakfast. Staff did a great job of quickly cleaning the tables. We enjoyed the pool and loved that we could always find a chaise lounge. Loved hanging by the pool with an alcoholic drink!! We did laundry here, and the laundry facility was clean with a good number of washers and dryers. Nice beds. Clean rooms. We loved that it was at the Waikiki Beachwalk as we had a wide selection of restaurants and shops. The quick walk to the beach was nice.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed in a one bed room / two queen bed suite with my wife and 20 year old daughter 12 -19 July 2013. From check in to departure we could not fault service or staff nor the hotel amenities - cabana / pool, spa , fitness facilities and business center. A stand out was the included in tariff buffet breakfast each day and the managers reception each evening. Location on the Beach Walk meant you are minutes from everything in Waikiki and only 20 minutes walk (if you did not want to use the bus or trolley) from the great shopping at the Ala Moana Centre.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: everything was wonderful. Great rooms, great view, great service and the customer service was fantastic. we arrive early and they had no problems checking our bags and suggesting a number of enjoyable things to do for the couple of hours we had before check in. It seems that the staff could anticipate our questions before we asked. Definitely going back again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed with my husband for 2 days prior to our Hawaiian cruise. It's about a 20 min ride from the airport. Check-in was quick and easy and the passion,orange guava juice that you get during your check-in was a refreshing treat. This hotel is one of only a few in Waikiki that offer complimentary breakfast daily which was not bad at all. They not only make omelets to order, but will cook your eggs anyway you like. There is quite an assortment of breakfast items on the menu for you to choose from. In addition to the eggs, bacon, sausage, there is also and assortment of cereal, fresh fruit, bread, pastries and yoghurt. The hotel was clean, comfortable and we found the staff to be very friendly. My only advice is to try to get a room on an upper level - way up. If you have a balcony that faces the pool/bar, it can get noisy at night once the entertainment starts. The location is perfect. It's just across the street from Waikiki beach and just steps away from restaurants, shopping and about 2 blocks from the International Market Place. We would highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The hotel was fine--it was clean. However, ask if you are near an elevator--you can hear it all night long! No one on staff at the hotel seemed concerned that there was a pair of underwear next to the pool steps for hours. There was plenty of hotel staff but no one did anything about it. It was gross.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: As always, clean rooms, roomy, friendly check in, juice when you check in. The workers their remember you by your first name which really shows great customer service. Don't forget to get a massage poolside. Piilani has actually massaged my arthirtitis knees so good that I have arrived at her Cabana on crutches and left without having to use them. RemarkableI try to stay at least a few times a year. Jeff, Mellissa, Lewis etc. ALL their staff are incredible. NEVER had a bad experience, probably been here 15 plus times.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We really enjoyed our stay at Embassy Suites Waikiki! We would definitely stay here again when we travel to Hawaii. The staff were very accommodating and always greeted us with a smile during our visit. I like the rooms because it includes a (separate) living room, so I felt like I was in an apartment not a hotel. I enjoyed my time out on the balcony in both the living room and bedroom areas. Our room faced the street but I didn't mind "people watching" and observing action on the street. However, I enjoyed looking at the sky at night from the balcony, it relaxed me after a busy day. The rooms are quiet, I never heard any of our neighbors. The meals at the café are good, plus there is entertainment during their evening reception. We only had breakfast there and enjoyed it! We used the tour/travel services within the hotel, which saved us money from renting a car, which I recommend. (Valet parking is $35 a day.) The hotel is within walking distance from stores, restaurants (several located within the hotel), and the beach. Nearby is Kalakaua Street which is like Rodeo Drive. My 13 year old daughter enjoyed walking there at night because of the street performers and people shopping until 9 or 10 p.m. I'd definitely suggest booking reservations here! :D

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We first stayed in the Embassy Suites at Waikiki Beach Walk in May/June 2009. Our holiday was very much needed after a crazy few days before dealing with a natural disaster at home - but our pre-paid holiday could not be deferred, and we had a really great time. After staying in hotel rooms in Europe in 2008 with our then 18mth old, we didn't want another hotel room stay where we had to hide in the bathroom while she went to sleep. The Embassy Suites was a great option rather than getting a second room for a then 2.5yo. We could stay up in the lounge while she went to sleep in the bedroom.We went back to the Embassy Suites in 2012 on our second family trip to Honolulu. We enjoyed the location and amenities of the rooms so much we barely looked at other accommodation options in Honolulu. The nightly manager's reception was great on both trips to help tide our little one over and ensure she wasn't ravenous at 6pm if we wanted dinner at 7/7:30pm. We noticed that the entertainment quality was the same between 2009 and 2012, but in 2012 it wasn't offered every night. We were in Honolulu about a month earlier, I'm not sure if it was the time of year or due to economic reasons over those years. The breakfast spread is great; watch out for the pesky birds who are cheeky and will try to get at your food if they can. Love getting made to order omelettes each day, and having a range of healthy foods for our daughter to eat. The location at Waikiki Beach Walk is great, lots of restaurants nearby, and easy to get lunch at the food court of the Royal Hawaiian shopping centre across the road. (Actually stayed here in April 2012) The rubbish collection trucks in the streets below can be very noisy; they come by every second day. We were on the 16th or 20th floor, and the noise travelled straight up. I am a lightish sleeper in the mornings.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our family of four stayed in an ocean view room on one of the upper floors. The view was wonderful. The hotel is short block from the beach, so very convenient. For the most part, the staff are just great. The folks in the breakfast and evening drinks dining area are great. The concierges are also outstanding and offered great ideas for tours and activities. Additional staff attend to the pool area and do whatever they can to make the stay nice -- clean up, bring towels, etc. The one service exception are the bartenders, who are oddly grumpy. Barely a word when they serve drinks or when you stuff a tip in their jars. Not a big deal, but it is a bummer to work with staff who don't seem to enjoy their jobs. Nevertheless, we would definitely stay here again. Beautiful site and a very good value for Waikiki.One bit of concern, though. During our stay, there was a midnight fire alarm resulting in evacuation of both towers. Literally hundreds of guests in the lobby parking area. The staff in attendance were clueless, and seemed to have no interest in finding out what was going on or how to help. After about ten minutes, one fellow came out and yelled (but nobody could hear him...) that we could return to our rooms. We felt terrible for families with little kids and seniors who were greatly inconvenienced. Even worse, I would not trust these folks if it were a real emergency. Not comforting in a 20 story building. Embassy Suites -- you need to work on your evacuation and safety protocols.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: As a stopover from The Big Island before we were to return home to Australia we stayed at Embassy suites for 3 nights. The stay was good especially as we have a child and the extra space was needed.The location is fabulous!!The pool was really loved by my daughter.People that we met were friendly. Overall an enjoyable stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The hotel itself was newer and clean but lacked any feel of luxury whatsoever. We chose to stay here because of the value offered as a family of five. We need the space and would have to book two hotel rooms elsewhere. That said, we'll most likely book the two rooms next time. We have stayed at the Hilton Hawaiian Village and we much prefer the feel and tropical atmosphere there, along with the pools and wider beach. It's just a more relaxing vibe overall. We also found the lanai to be small and un welcoming. We stepped out to look and the view of the ocean to our right, but could not see it without leaning a bit to catch a glimpse. Another thing was that there were lots of windows from nearby hotels facing ours. Felt a bit like a fish bowl with the curtains open.The pull out bed (in my opinion) is useless for anyone over 70lbs. It is really thin and slopes. My six year old slept there for nine nights and didn't complain. Our ten and twelve year olds could not bear it. The breakfast and Manager's reception are basic as well. Convenient and nothing more. We got tired of it after a few days but went anyway because it was there. I did have to wonder though, how does one make even a donut taste bad? On the up side, the staff are wonderful. The location is close to lots of restaurants and shopping, and there is a Starbucks right across the street! The beach walk is lively and fun to explore at night. Also, the pool was great fun for the kids. They did miss having a slide, but they were allowed to use floats and balls in the pool, and everone had a blast. Over all a family friendly, good value accomodation, but lacking that resort feel which we certainly prefer.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I stayed there while visiting Hawaii for a Wedding. My partner and I had a great time during the week we stayed there. Even thou it is a hotel focus in the family we actually felt at home. The breakfast is amazing and the open bar in the afternoon is great. The room was very clean and we had a small issue with the A/C but Maintenance was there and fix it right away. We will be back!!!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I stayed at Embassy Suite with my family of 5 adults. The friendly front desk presented us with tropical drinks and got us checked in quickly. My room was on the first floor of the Hula tower facing Lewers Street. The 1 bedroom suite itself was roomy and spotless clean. I loved that they provided a ton of Evelyn & Crabtree shampoo, conditioner and lotion. The mini fridge came in really handy for our drinks. The downside to being on the first floor facing Lewers is that you hear all the delivery vehicles beeping at 4am. There was also roof construction going on across the street. I recommend a higher floor as I was up each morning before the crack of dawn.The breakfast buffet was fabulous. There are made to order omelettes and a huge variety of foods including fresh fruit. It's not a gourmet breakfast or the best breakfast I've ever had. But considering it's free, I think what they offer is great. As the eating area is open air, birds do get in. Always leave someone at your table with your food or the birds will be on it. I enjoyed the eating area being open as you feel the tradewinds blowing through. For those concerned with the birds, staff did open a couple of the ballrooms facing the eating area. You could eat inside in a air conditioned room. The manager's reception offers a few snacks usually chips, veggies and pretzel. There's a list of free beverages you can get from the bar. The best part is the live entertainment. When we were there, the band played a variety of music. I don't think they have entertainment every night but they did 2 out of the 3 nights we were there. The location of Embassy Suites can't be beat. It's 1 block from the beach. There's a huge variety of yummy restaurants within a 1 block radius including Roy's which is right downstairs. There's an ABC Store right across the street for souvenirs, snacks or toiletries.The pool was small but having stayed at the Wyndham Waikiki Beachwalk across the street, I can say the pool at the Embassy was bigger than Wyndham's. There was never a shortage for lounge chairs. The lounge chairs were nicely padded and perfect for afternoon naps. The only thing I wished was that they had a towel exchange so that you could get a fresh towel. You're pretty much stuck with the same beach towel until the housekeeper replaces them in your room the next day.Lastly, staff here were all very friendly and pleasant. I was quite impressed that our housekeeper noticed and replaced the light that had gone out over our shower. We were in a rush to the North Shore that day and forgot to report the burned out light. But when we got back to the room, we noticed it had been replaced for us. Awesome attention to detail.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This review comes a little late as I didn't know about this site at the time. The hotel is not right on the beach but not even a quarter block away from the beach access, so it is very convenient. Embassy suites staff was always polite, courteous and helpful. The rooms are fantastic. We enjoyed having a room to ourselves and our two children slept on the pullout in the living room. The breakfast 'buffet' is fantastic! Anything you could ever want is available, hot and fresh. We enjoyed the snack time, as our kids called it, from 6 to 7 pm. Drinks are free as well as the snacks. We'd suggest a few more condiments for the nachos though, as all that is offered is a bit of sauce. The other option is trail mix. It would be nice to have fruit, too, after a log day in the sun. Valet service is excellent and wait time for anything we needed at any time was provided promptly. Our travel agent booked one day short and the hotel was able to accommodate the extra day even when we noticed the error right at the end of our stay! I read one review that claimed the decor in the hallways was dated. Seriously? There is so much to love about this hotel that I can't imagine worrying about carpeting in the hallway. I also saw a complaint about the 'business' of floor 4. I think that floor is used mostly for families so that might be why. We also stayed on floor 4 and were very happy with it. We only had one night that a noisy neighbor had to be told to quiet down, by hotel staff, at 11 PM, but that was it. Staff made sure that everyone was respected. The laundry facilities on each floor are clean, well stocked and maintained. The pool is great also. We liked the fact that it is in an area that gets a lot of shade so that if you've had quite a bit of sun on the beach you can still get out and swim and be protected from heat. This is a hotel that has something for everyone. It is appropriate for couples and I'd come here even without the kids. The following year we stayed in a hotel that also had condos to rent...and we rented one. We definitely noticed the difference and missed Embassy Suites. So this year coming we are staying in a different condo that we found and reserved a year in advance. We are also finishing our stay with a few days back at the Embassy Suites. This is definitely a hotel we recommend to everyone.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My wife and I and our 3 boys (16,14,7) started our RTW holiday at the Embassy Suites and enjoyed all aspects of this hotel. The hotel offers complementary breakfast and each evening its Managers Reception with complimentary Drinks\Nibbles and Music is fantastic and creates a vibrant atmosphere. The location is great (only short walk to beach) with many retail outlets at the base of the hotel. The rooms accommodated the 5 of us with ease. Free Wi-Fi is always a plus.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Other than loud music played throughout the day/afternoon outside my window on the grand lanai, my stay was fairly enjoyable. I was at a lower level and the pool (grand lanai) was outside my window. Had to keep curtains drawn for privacy.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had a Wonderful stay at the hotel, and highly recommended to others and will return again. Clean and spacious suites, central location and walking distance to restaurants and shops. Roy's was just down stairs which made a great place for dinner, Yard House had great food also.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great hotel with all the nice amenities. I have no problem coming here year after year. It would be great if the hotel can figure a way to keep the birds away from the breakfast area, but of course that would be a challenge since is Hawaii.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here because I've always wanted to stay at an Embassy Suites, so what better place to try one than in Hawaii!! What an awesome experience!Every single member of the hotel we encountered was wonderful and treated us as if we were the only guests at the hotel. Loved the security feature that the room card/key provided, no access up the elevators without having a hotel card. I've never seen this at any other hotel, but wish they all did that.Breakfast was very good with a large variety of foods to make everyone in the family happy.Excellent location in Waikiki, you can walk to everything and the beach is just a block away!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here because I've always wanted to stay at an Embassy Suites, so what better place to try one than in Hawaii!! What an awesome experience! Every single member of the hotel we encountered was wonderful and treated us as if we were the only guests at the hotel. Loved the security feature that the room card/key provided, no access up the elevators without having a hotel card. I've never seen this at any other hotel, but wish they all did that. Breakfast was very good with a large variety of foods to make everyone in the family happy. Excellent location in Waikiki, you can walk to everything and the beach is just a block away!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The hotel does a good job of offering you a family package: free buffet, manager's reception, wi-fi, and a suit with a sofa-bed. Not too many hotels like this in Waikiki. Perhaps its catching on. However, Embassy is certainly one of the first and best in its class.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The embassy suites in WAIKIKI compares typically with any other Embassy suites, they do a great job trying to keep up with the hoards of people that go down for the free breakfast, the happy hour is ran quite smooth and enjoyable. Its just nice to have a room in Waikiki that is nota tiny box. Off of BeachWalk St this hotel put you in the heart of everything.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wiIeZtl0uTE&feature=youtube_gdata_player management please review your snacks don't look like it in the video what happened to you guys great location I love the beach and the staff is really nice you just need to update the hotel and swimming poolneeds to be deeper

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Other then the parking fee being 35.00 per day the hotel was great. It is very close to the beach. It can be a little noisy on the lower floors but is still a great place to stay. The breakfast was great, the hotel is very clean and convenient to everything around

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I paid 700+ for the stay high season August. I booked a 2br suite with was smaller than expected but overall I was satified with the breakfast, staff, cleanliness and location. We were able to easily walk to most things in the area and felt safe. My kids loved the pool and managers reception with had fruit, vegies and snack with all the drinks.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was our anniversary gift to each other--Celebrating in Hawaii!! We decided to take our kids with us so we needed a family friendly hotel. We chose the Embassy Suites because of the free daily breakfast, great pool and it was close to the beach. We definitely made the right choice. It was also close to downtown. We could walk every where we go. The hotel also has a great concierge and we booked several excursions. It was a great stay and we would recommend this hotel. Staff is very friendly and rooms were clean.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Expectations were exceeded. Everything from the staff to evening entertainment and the food was excellent. The 1st day I did have to have the mini fridge replaced because it did not work but maintenance replaced it within 2 hours of my request. Very clean in the room, hallways and lobby.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Wow! a really nice hotel! Unfortunately....I only stayed one night due to my travel arrangements from Maui, but I am so glad to have had the experience!The hotel is not directly on Waikiki beach..........but oh so close to it. I had a tenth floor suite with phenomenal views from the balcony. The staff is ultra friendly and helpful. Rooms are very spacious (low ceilings, but very nice). You get a very good nights sleep.The hotel is pricey..........but worth it! The valet parking is also expensive......but hey.......this is Honolulu....I had a late flight and was unable to get an extended check out (due to the hotel's popularity), but they provide a complimentary changing suite for you to use before your flight. I was able to spend the day in Oahu and keep my belongings stored. The belongings are not stored in the room, but you are given a key to the room when you are ready to leave and you can shower, repack or do what you need to do before you leave....wonderful!The breakfast is a full buffet and you are able to eat inside or out and there is a great selection of foods. The pool is on the same floor and it is nice....but very busy.Anyway.....did not have enough time to really experience all of what what offered.........but I enjoyed what I was able to.If you have the extra bucks..........this is a great vacation investment!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: From registration to check-out the hotel excels. Staff were efficientand friendly. From a special request to housekeeping to the dailyservices provided, all staff were helpful and more than willing tomake the stay more enjoyable. Location, buffet style breakfast and theevening reception are all big pluses and all included in the price. Onthe negative side there are a few early morning deliveries to wake youand you will be joined at breakfast by the birds, but really no bigdeal, just relax and enjoy. Overall would highly recommend and we doplan to stay again next time - coming back soon!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My family took their first trip to Hawaii recently. We stayed at the Embassy Suites in Waikiki for 3 nights. It exceeded our expectations!! It was clean, breakfast was delicious and the evening manager's reception was terrific. The entertainment was excellent!! It was close to the beach and great shopping. The staff was very helpful as well.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great stay, staff was amazing and rooms were clean and comfortable. Wonderful family place and location is ideal for everything! Breakfast is good and pool is clean. Would like to see more variety of snacks at afternoon reception but that does not influence my stay. Would definitely recommend.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had almost 3 weeks at the Embassy Suites earlier in 2013. We are a family of four, mum, dad and two young adult children. We booked this hotel as it boasted extra space, a kitchenette and was part if the Hilton chain. Our room was dark and depressing, outlook was awful and we were woken every morning by deliveries of goods to the Beach Walk by large trucks, this entrance to the Beach Walk was right by our room. Our kitchenette was a joke! We had no cutlery, crockery or cooking utensils of any kind. This trip was a celebration for our daughters 21st Birthday and was our third trio to Hawaii. We had been spoilt in the past by staying at the Hilton Hawaiian Village. We paid an enormous amount of money for the Embassy Suites but would never choose to stay here again. It was very disappointing and my Husband got food poisoning to boot. One day he was unable to leave the room due to the illness and we received an odd note pushed under our door regarding the cleaning of our room, despite having the do not disturb sign out. Cleaning was inconsistent time wise on a daily basis anyway.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I am ususally the first to say that Trip Advisor gives great advice on hotels - however after our less than perfect stay at the Embassy Suites in Waikiki I am not so sure what people are thinking when they rate this hotel highly. To begin with as part of the Hilton chain I assumed it would be like the Homewood Suites rooms (we stayed in Homewood Suites Anaheim a couple of years back and the kitchen facilities were excellent). Our room at Embassy Suites only had a small bar fridge and microwave - that was it - nothing to cook on or with so that was a real disapointment. However that did not compare to the disapointment both myself and the kids faced when we got to the pool area - it was horrible!!!! The pool was literally 4ft deep at its deepest point (not much past my waist!!!!). And the water was all cloudy and dirty looking like they had forgotten to chlorinate it - and this didnt change for the 6 days we stayed there!!! When we checked in we were given a room that did not have the bed formation we had requested 6 months before and had to resort to a 1st floor room to get what we wanted. And that was a big problem - the street noise was very loud and we discovered after the first night that the window in the bedroom actually had been cut - so it didnt seal at all - there was a 1cm gap between the wall the the glass - so you can imagine the street noise all night long was deafening. We were able to change rooms after two nights up to the 15th floor - thank goodness - but even then the street noise was noticeable - you would have to be on top floor I think to avoid it altogether. But as I really love my hotel pools it was the small and shallow excuse for a pool that really put a damper on our holiday. The staff were not very friendly - the porters at the lobby didnt even offer to take our luggage to the room and you had to go and ask for help when you went to the lobby - normally in US when they live on tips they are falling all over themselves to help - NOT at Embassy Suites! We wished we had stayed in Maui for more days and just flown through Waikiki for some shopping. I would definitely NOT recommend this hotel to anyone - go somewhere else - the beds were like rocks and so tiny (Queen = double in NZ terms obviously) - my husband and I had to share with the kids otherwise we would have fallen off the sides!!!! The only saving grace was the nightly reception of free alcohol - however again we were expecting the level of service that we received at the Homewood Suites where the nightly reception actually served up yummy food and alcohol (so you didnt have to go out for dinner if you didnt want to). At the Embassy Suites the only food on offer was some tasteless cornchips or raw brocolli and cheese sauce. The breakfast was included but was only ok - nothing to write home about. Certainly did not justify the nightly rate which was quite expensive compared to other hotels on offer. I just wish the pool had been nicer (and significantly deeper!!!!! and bigger) as I could have lived with room conditions - you only spend a small amount of time in your room - but when you are in paradise and the weather is gorgeous you want to be able to hang by the pool and read a good book while the kids have fun the in the pool - my kids didnt even want to go to the hotel pool it was so unexciting for them - we walked to the Hilton Hawaiian Village and hung out at the lagoon most days (if not shopping at Ala Moana). As you can guess I was not at all impressed by the hotel and that is why I give it a POOR rating - I hope I have saved at least one unsuspecting family from ruining their awesome holiday by staying there!!!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: From first contact to last, everything you hope to encounter. Asked at check in for a high floor (traveling with a child who likes high floors), and was given a room upgrade because that was the only way to move us higher. Mentioned leaving toiletries at home, and arrangements were made immediately to have sample sizes of necessities delivered to room. Breakfast buffet was distinctly better than other Embassy Suites we've stayed at, and benefitted from fresher and riper fruit than most. Rooms excellent, room service professional, and everyone from the parking staff to housekeeping were cheerful and social. The management here makes the whole operation look easy.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: just returned from a two week vacation in hawaii. The Embassy Suites is a great family hotel. We had a suite on the 14th floor with a partial ocean view. Room was very clean and spacious and the two queen beds were really comfortable. It was nice to have breakfast included with choices for every taste and served very fast. Pool was a decent size with plenty of seating and entertainment was good. Location is great for beach and shopping. Gymn is good and it is always useful to have laundry facilities. Everybody was very helpful from front desk to maids and servers and all contributed to making this an excellent vacation.Thank you

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We picked Embassy Suites after first reserving a room at another hotel that grossly misrepresented itself on the internet. When we arrived there, we decided not to stay there and started searching the internet for other options. We were EXTREMELY pleased with Embassy Suites.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was our second time staying at Embassy Suites and again were very happy with the choice. Having the two living areas is always helpful with a family. Heaps of room for luggage and for everyone to sit. The room was kept very clean. If I needed extra towels, no problem they would always come with extra. The location is fantastic. Close to everything and in a real family environment. Everyone we came in contact with was polite and helpful. We look forward to staying here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We just got back from a great family vacation about a month ago in Oahu. We stayed at the Embassy Suites in Waikiki. It is a great family friendly hotel in a great location. We stayed in a 1 bedroom suite with city views but we also got a partial ocean view. Ask for the highest floor you can get so you can get the partial ocean views. The rooms are clean and spacious. The daily complimentary breakfast and manager's reception in the evening was a great perk. The service there is also great! The location is right across from the beach and walkable to all shops along Waikiki. Try Roy's downstairs - great restaurant! This is our 3rd time staying here and we will keep coming back!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Nice staff! Breakfast is a must if you stay with a large selection as well as cook to order. When you return from the day, the evening reception is fun. While not on the ocean, it is truly two minutes away and is conveniently located to many other local shops. The pool area is large and did not feel crowded during my visits to it. Consider staying on a higher level for an ocean view as you will not have one on the lower levels of this hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Nice hotel. Very large and lots of people. We were comfortable in our room and enjoyed the breakfast as well as the managers social. The occasional entertainment was very good. Close to the beach and stores as well as lots of variety in dining.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel is our favorite in Waikiki. The location on Beach Walk Street is perfect with walking access to everything in Waikiki. The staff are very professional. They greet you with cold juice, they give you a free welcome drink such as a Mai Tai at the nightly evening reception where they also served snacks and had live music poolside. Our favorite perks- free full hot and cold brunch buffet, and free wireless internet. We love the spacious rooms, comfortable beds, and free wi-fi. Our kids love the pool with a kiddie pool within the pool as well as a hot tub. You really cannot go wrong with the Embassy Suites!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is a good place for a family and will come back again! We highly recommend this for a place for kids. The pool, hot tub, breakfast, friendly service was all great. I lost my purse and one of the breakfast staff put my purse away until I returned.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We were welcomed and cared for by the staff of this hotel above and beyond expectations. They were all friendly and went out of their way to be helpful. Our housekeeper, Lluellyn, was always there to greet us in the morning, inquire about our plans, and make recommendations. She went above and beyond keeping our rooms clean. Additionally, the hotel is immaculate, it is half a block from the beach and right among good shopping and good restaurants. I highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel has a very friendly and helpful staff, clean and spacious rooms and great breakfast too! Very close to the beach, the main Waikiki walk and other shopping. The pool on the 4th floor is a nice option, but the main benefits are big rooms, friendly staff and the location!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Embassy Suites Waikiki is the best place to stay for your hard earned money!! Nothing can beat their breakfast buffet and "cook to order" omelet station. They can accommodate you and your family with a 1 or 2 bedroom suite. The Manager's Reception is a great way to wind down upon arrival. Live music for all to enjoy at their heated pool with Jacuzzi and baby pool. Perfect for a family!! Bonus!! Location, location, location!! It is situated across the beach! Famous Lewers Street is in its backyard with so many restaurants/bars and shops to visit! Royal Hawaiian Shopping Center is steps away! Whether you're staying as a family or solo guest, this is the perfect place to stay! You will hug yourself for going for it!! We always do!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We have just returned from a 6 night stay at the embassy suites and we were happy with our choice. We stayed on the 16th floor of the aloha tower, after a slight hiccup with our room which was quickly sorted! We stayed in a 1 bedroom with two queen beds in the b'rm. I would say the rooms are very comfortable and clean and slightly outdated but as we were only there to sleep, it wasn't an issue and we were very happy with it. Beds are comfortable too. Breakfast was good, everything is help yourself including tea and coffee. Felt a bit like a cafeteria, compared to other b'fasts we have had in Waikiki, but the quality of food was fine and John looked after my girls every morning cooking their eggs with a smile and a chat. The pool area is really good with the spa and toddler pool being part of the swimming pool- making it easier to watch kids. I found it big enough and our girls had a ball every afternoon. The location is great on beach walk, close to lots of restaurants and shops. A short walk to the beach through the outrigger, but the beach there is very rocky underfoot so we walked further around in front of the royal hawaiian. Still, not far and the walk home, loaded with all our beach gear was only 10 mins at most. The managers drinks at night are great and very popular. It was great to come back to the pool for a swim, sip on a drink while we watched the kids. We did think mayb staying on the beach if we went back, but when u consider all the embassy offers- the suite rooms, b'fast/ managers drinks, location and pool set-up, we think we would be hard pressed to find better. A great stay in Waikiki.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My wife and I stayed here for our 10 Year anniversary. Location was perfect! Right on Waikiki Beach Walk. Stores just steps away with a bunch of high class restaurants to chose from. Suite was nicely furnished and clean. We would love to stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Such an awesome place to stay. We were there for 7 days with our three kids and loved it. The breakfast buffet is so good that the kids we were full until lunchtime! The rooms are spacious (we stayed in a two bedroom suite), and the beds were very comfortable. Service was excellent, the pool was big with plenty of seating and rarely crowded. There's a very short walk to the beach and stores (some very high end ones) are within walking distance. We joined the Hilton awards program and will definitely be staying at Embassy Suites again!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We chose this hotel because of the two bedroom suite option. We are a family of four with two teens and this worked out very well for us. The kids got their own room with two queen beds. I had read the reviews about the outdated furniture and I must admit, I got a little nervous. My fears disappeared when we got to our suite. It was very nice and it was clean. I didn't not get the feeling that it was outdated. I'm sure there are prettier hotels in Waikiki but the suite here really suited our needs and we were quite pleased. In terms of the birds at breakfast, yes they are a bit of a problem. I know that the hotel is working on it but our problem was not the birds but the mess they left behind. One morning we had to shuffle around quite a few chairs to fine some clean ones. Until the problem is solved they need to do a better job of keeping on top of the cleaning.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Just returned from a family holiday staying at the Embassy Suites at Waikiki and had a wonderful time. We had a sep bedroom room, our daughter slept in the bedroom with us (in a queen bed), our son on the sofa bed in the lounge room. Beds were sooooo comfy, love the American pillow tops...The all inclusive breakfasts were fantastic - and even a 15 year old boy could walk away full !!!... The Managers drinks from 5.30pm nightly were just the best !!! ALL Free ooh the Mai Tais with a bowl of healthy nibbles ended the day perfectly. In fact we did not need dinner...There was Wi Fi in the rooms, Car parking at $35 was expensive, but the Valet service was great they unpacked our car and bought all (my) shopping up to the 17th floor...Only negative about Waikiki - we were in peak season we could not book a restaurant, first in first served basis so unless we wanted to eat by 5.30pm we had to wait til late to get a table.... This was frustrating - thank goodness for the Embassy Suites and the free Mai Tais and nibbles..Stay at the Embassy Suites - you will not be disappointed

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: With such a large choice of accommodation to choose from in Waikiki it can get quite confusing. The Embassy Suites were recommended to us by friends who like us consist of 2 adults and 3 children. I looked around on the net,brochures etc. but in the end we decided this was a good choice. What appealed to me was that we could have one room with two Queen beds,then a separate living area with a double sofa bed. The complimentary breakfast every morning was fantastic especially the made to order omelettes. The pool is a good size and also has a spa...nice and hot! The hotel is a very short walk to the beach and close to many restaurants within walking distance. I found ALL the staff to be very friendly and helpful. Every question/request was met in a professional manner and always with a smile. The free WI - FI is great too. A good choice for families I would definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed recently 4 nights, you can't ask for better location, friendly staff and best deal! Breakfast included. Staff ready to hell with directions to our needs. We Lso got to watch one night while so e filming of a upcoming Godzilla movie . We would stay here again for sure.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The wonderful staff, the breakfast, the location, cleanliness of the rooms & facilities, the pool, free wi-fi, fitness center, business center, amenities, Manager's reception...awesome way to spend your vacation and/or quality time with your family.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed in the 2 bedroom suite so we had some space for relaxing and it was very good. The beds were mediocre and a bit soft, although the breakfast is free and it's in a perfect location near shops, restaurants and beach. We had a city view, but were able to see the ocean from the balcony. The parking was pricy, $35 per night, but we needed a car since we visited the North and East Shores and some other places. The food was basic, with lots of choices and a made to order omelet station. The pool was quite nice and in the sun for most of the day. I was debating staying at the Outrigger Reef on the Beach for the same amount, but the girls would have had to stay in the main room on a pull out and breakfasts weren't included. It was perfect for our purposes. Roy's is below us, PF Changs, and the Royal Hawaiian Shopping Mall. Go to Island Vintage Coffee for Acai bowls and Ahi or Salmon Poke which I reviewed separately.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel ticks most of the boxes for a great holiday. The 2 bedroom suites are quite big and ideal for a family of 4. Two bathrooms is also a bonus. The location is ideal, surrounded by shops, restaurants and bars, and only a short walk to the beach. The cocktails at 5:30 are great fun. It would have been great to have a wine glass in the room however!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Loved my stay at this hotel... Ok might not be a on the beach resort but its like 5 min walk... Service has been great and nobody is begging for tip even though its of the hilton hotels family.... Yeah its expensive but so is every hotel in honolulu plus here there is free breakfast and also free drinks at the managers reception from 5 till 7... Overall, loved it an would recommend it to anyone coming in this city...

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: 2nd visit to this hotel. Stayed in a 2 bedroom suite on the 8th floor which accommodated our family of 5. Breakfast and evening drinks always a bonus. Easy access to the bus and beach. Rooms clean but expensive in July at just under $700 a night for a 2 bed room suite.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed for five nights after two nights at The Hyatt Place. Don't spend your money on this place. The suite accomodations are not worth it. Stay at The Hyatt Place instead, and spend your cash on fun stuff! The hotel seems dated and kitchy. The ocean views were not good. Will not stay again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Nice clean suite hotel very close to the beach and next to the Waikiki Beach Walk which has lot's of great restaurants!Hotel was very busy, and the rooms a bit outdated, but clean.Good place for families with kids who want a lot to do at walking distance. Book early to get the best rates!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Have stayed here many times over the last 5 years. Enjoyed the pool and breakfast. Convenient location. Always a consistent pleasant stay. Will be back again. Parking is rather expensive, but this is Waikiki.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My family and I stayed here for two nights prior to our cruise around the islands. We were fortunate enough to have an ocean view balcony for July 4th - and the view of the fireworks from our balcony was amazing! The hotel is within walking distance to shopping, activities and several restaurants including a Denny's - which we ate at the 2nd morning so that we didnt have to fight the birds off of our breakfast. The birds at breakfast is the only negative thing I can say about the hotel. Everything else was excellent. The property was clean, roomy, and I liked the security feature in the elevators to try to keep non guests from the busy street entering the hotel room areas. The Managers reception in the evening was also a nice event with a really good live band, dancing and adult beverages. When we go back - we will stay here again!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great Hotel for Families and Kids, Short walk to beachPros: Great 1 Bedroom Suite, With Fridge and Microwave, Free Wifi, Great Breakfast buffet included, Managers reception from 5-7 with free drinks and Music every 2nd night, Great Pool and hot tub (very busy and packed with kids ) Close to great restaurants, Hardrock Cafe and Raman Nakamura are fantastic. Staff is greatCons: Only One - They need to solve Sea Gull problem in dining area for Breakfast. I hate to see birds on table surfaces, Any food that is left unattended will be swarmed by Gulls

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Hotel in great location at better end of Waikiki Beach. Situated on Beach Walk which has great choice of restaurants. Suite roomy except sofa bed could be more comfortable. Breakfast which is included is good value. Free internet is a plus.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Embassy is great for families and for the price.Accomodation was very comfortable but we should have booked and extra room sas it got crowded. The only downfall for us as a family of six was that there was no place to cook as it got really expensive for our meals. Location is the best and the buffet b fast was nice although the birds flying in and out didn't agree with my young daughter. I had to bring b fast up to our room which was unfortunate.The evening entertainment (band) were excellent loved that but again couldn't go with the whole family because of the birds!!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had all 11 members of our family stay here for 5 nights, in three rooms, to celebrate Grandma's special birthday. It was fantastic and memorable! The staff is personable, courteous and professional. The location is wonderful. The cleanliness of the rooms, hallways, public areas and restaurants was exceptional. The breakfast and daily manager's party a pure delight. A spectacular success for all!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The positives of this hotel are as follows:Well located, close to the beach, stores and restuarantsGood service, the staff were friendly and responsiveThe rooms were suites so you had two rooms available which is great for kidsBreakfast was included in the room rateLaundry facilities availableWifi availableThe negatives:The decor was outdated, there were pineapples everywhere this included: the curtains, carpet, lamp bases and chair fabric. The carpet was very worn in our room. The bathroom was small and a bit dirtyThe rooms were a bit cramped and our ocean view room only had a small window (no floor to ceiling window). The buffet breakfast was always busy and at least half of the dishes that I pulled out to get food were dirty (had egg/rice/grease on them) which was really offputting, also there were a lot of birds around the breakfast table which was gross. The lifts were slow, often full and had an odd odour.I was disappointed with this hotel given the positive reviews on this site.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at this hotel based on the reviews written here on TA. We were not disappointed. We were supposed to arrive on Tuesday 6/25 but due to a screw up by United Airlines we could not get to the hotel until Wednesday 6/26. I called the hotel to say we were going to be late and they assured me that they would hold my room. I then called back a couple hours later and told them I wouldn't be making it at all. They were fine with it and gave me two options of either paying and keeping my room so that when we did finally make it I could check in right away or not pay for the night and then check in after 3:00 pm on Wednesday. I opted to check in on Wednesday. We arrived at the hotel at 1:00 pm and we were able to check in immediately. The check in desk was outside and it had a tropical feel. We were given cold drinks while we checked in. We were in the Hula tower (I think that's the name) and we were located on the 21st floor. There are only 21 floors so I was happy to be out of the noise of the city. We didn't hear a thing at night. So I would ask for a room on the upper floors. I had a nice water view which I didn't request. The room was smaller than I thought it was going to be. We had one bedroom with two queen beds and then a pull out couch. We were traveling with our boys ages 18 and 21. It worked out pretty well for us. The bed was comfortable and I enjoyed sitting out on the balcony. We went down to the pool a couple days. It was really nice and relaxing. It's located on the fourth floor. We also stayed for the managers reception which is held most days from 5:30 to 7:30. Free drinks from the list offered, snacks and a live band, what more could you ask? The band was a father and his three sons. We enjoyed them very much. The free breakfast was great. It was in an open air outdoor/indoor area. They had a ton of choices, something for everyone. It does get crowded but we were able to find seating without any problems. We also used the laundry facilities which I found rather expensive but necessary. They charged $2.75 for each washer and $2.50 for the dryer. Being on east coast time we were up so early that we went down to use the gym in the Aloha tower. Great equipment. Go early or later, it gets crowded. We also parked a car there for $35.00 a night. You could get by without one. The beach, restaurants and shopping are within walking distance. I really enjoyed my stay here and would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Though this hotel is not on the beach and does not have a good beach view, we were really pleased with our selection. The hotel was really convenient. Heading out in one direction put you just a short walk to the beach where chairs and umbrellas could be easily rented. Heading out the other direction put you in the middle of lots of great shopping. There were plenty of dining options all around. The service, room, and breakfast did not disappoint. The pool area was nice and I especially appreciated the early morning pool-side Yoga!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed here for our 10th wedding anniversary..this hotel is amazing! From check in to check out!! Front desk was very friendly and courteous. The rooms are spacious and clean! The breakfast at this hotel is so so wonderful!! Everything one will need to eat! Cook to order Omletts, bacon, sausage, Waffle French toast, yogurt..well you get the point! And the daily manager's reception is off the chain too! love this hotel and will come back over and over again!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel is great - central location, one block back from the beach and amongst lots of great shops and restaurants. It is really clean and safe, the staff are friendly, and the rooms were quiet with good water pressure in the showers. Everything you would expect, without any problems. The complimentary breakfast has a great selection, however, most things are not really clean / healthy. We were able to request hard boiled eggs each day rather than having the scrambled egg / omelette mix, or sweet treats at breakfast time. Overall our stay was excellent and I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed for 3 nights in June, and also rented a room for the day. Beds were great and comfortable. Room service was prompt (food was okay), and customer service was great all around. When we first walked in, we were offered pog, which was a great gesture. The breakfast was delicious! I am still missing the pineapple! It is a short walk from Waikiki, and is located right above the shopping area. We splurged for a dinner at Ruth Chris, which was just below our room. We would love to stay here again!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: It is recommended that you ask for a room away from lift and a high floor room as the traffic can be quite busy and garbage trucks every day at 5.00am.Breakfast every day included however major hygiene issues with pigeons flying around and dirty pates and cutlery. Great sized rooms however would not pay more than usd180 a night.Great location in terms of access to Waikiki beach and could walk to ala moana shopping centre.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great location within walking distance to everything. Hotel rooms are very big and clean. The staff was super friendly. (Lacy especially). Breakfast was great as well as the evening happy hour. The live music 3 days a week was wonderful. Short short walk to the beach. Pool was never crowded. Will stay here again when visiting Waikiki.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great hotel in a great place. Waikiki Beach is a hopping place to visit. We stayed here on an overnight to see Pearl Harbor, eat at Morimoto's, hike up Diamond Head and tour the royal palace. Great trip!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: For Waikiki, this is a great value hotel, and in my view, probably closer to 4 stars!We stayed in a 1 bedroom apartment for 3 nights, it was well appointed and clean, only negatives were it had a limited kitchen and the lanai (balcony) was not functional, being too small to sit outside comfortably.On the positive, the complimentary breakfast has an extensive selection, and the drinks in the afternoon around the pool are an added bonus.The staff are willing to please and met our every request, no compalints there.Lovely restaurants on site, the steakhouse is pricey, but exceptional, and for more casual dining, we loved the Yard House - it had a great atmosphere and 130 beers on tap. Location is at the quieter end of town, at the newly renovated beach walk, this is the classy end of town, yet only a 10 minute walk from the main strip which we found nice with a young family.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: great location, great price. Would definitely stay in this hotel again . The breakfast buffet and managers reception worked well for our family of 5. THe room was comfortable and accomodating. Beds were comfortable and housekeeping was excellent. We always had more than enough towels and supplies. View from balcony wasn't that great - but we didn't spend a lot of time in the room. Hotel connected to a high end mall - very nice.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed at the ES Waikiki Beach Walk for 2 nights in June 2013. We were on on a family vacation (1st trip to Hawaii), spending 2 nights in Waikiki to briefly tour Honolulu and Pearl Harbor before heading to Kauai. We are a family of 4 with 2 teens (ages 18 and 16). We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite = 1 BR with a king, a separate BR with 2 queens, connected by a common room in the middle. Quality of the room was great, and we REALLY appreciated having the suite set-up with a family with varied sleeping habits. Beds and pillows were really comfortable. Flat screen TVs in each room. 2 ensuite bathrooms. Complementary wireless internet. We stayed on the 4th floor...the same level as the pool deck = where the breakfast buffet is located and where the manager's happy hours take place (live music on certain nights of the week). This did make for a busy location, but the convenience of being so close and almost never using the elevator were BIG positives. Noise wasn't really an issue, since the music was over long before bedtime. There was some street noise being on a lower floor but nothing disruptive.Valet service/parking at this hotel is expensive ($35/day), but the service was REALLY quick - I think the best I've ever seen. When we called for the car, it was always there waiting when we got to the lobby. In fact all of the staff were super helpful and friendly and really seemed intent on making our stay a good one. Another example = we got up early one morning to tour Pearl Harbor to ensure that we were able to get tickets for the USS Arizona memorial (left the hotel at 5.45 AM). Breakfast does not open at the hotel until 6.30 and there is no room service at that hour. The staff made up box breakfasts for us...with a cute written note to us saying "have a great day at pearl harbor" = nice touch!Location = the hotel is a 5 minutes walk from Waikiki beach and is right in the center of shopping/sights of Waikiki. From the 4th floor/pool deck, you can take a series of escalators straight down into Beach Walk, what looks like a recently developed shopping/restaurant area. Teens liked the location since we seemed to be in the middle of the "action". The Beach Walk area is a street that runs directly off of Kalakaua Ave, the Rodeo drive of Waikiki. Clientele at the hotel was mainly families with younger kids = location and great pool deck area make it a great choice. Overall we found this hotel to be a great choice (slightly pricey) and would certainly recommend it to others looking for a fun Waikiki family experience.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was our 5th stay at Embassy Suites in Honolulu. The staff from check in to check out was great. Breakfast was free and delicious. The staff and entertainment at manager's reception was exceptional. Located just a short walk from the beach and plenty of restaurants surround the area. Great time and very relaxing!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We loved the hotel, and staff, but wish we had booked a larger room. The hotel staff are very welcoming and were very accommodating to our many requests (I guess you could call us a "high maintenance" family-ha!) we mistakenly reserved a "two room suite" instead of a "two bedroom suite" it was my fault as the room descriptions were very accurate, We only stayed at for one day and decided to keep the two room suite. I wish we had 1 more bathroom, as getting 6 people out the door with only 1 bathroom required a true strategizing session :). The complementary breakfast was a full service buffet with custom omelet station. Everything from pancakes to miso soup and salad were presented beautifully and the very clean and well kept counters made us very comfortable with the buffet style dinning. The pool deck is behind the restaurant and has a delicious lunch menu and full bar available for poolside fun. The property is not beach front, but was a quick 5 minute walk to amazing Waikiki Beach. Beds were very comfortable, but the warned, the sofa bed is not good sleeping option for older children or adults as the bed is lumpy and uncomfortable. There are no feather bed, or tempurpedic toppers available. But young kids won't care. We went shopping and found the hotel was confident to many stops on the public transportation services routes. Only three stops from the shopping mall, and return was easy as well. Overall we enjoyed our stay at this hotel, and would recommend it to friends and family, I would love stay here again, but request the two bedroom suite for sure!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed in a two room city view apartment. The size was okay and bedrooms/bathrooms fine, clean and well appointed. Like mostly reviewers have said the breakfast and happy hours were appreciated and made the price more reasonable. Also when we did go by the pool there were always loungers available, a real plus in Waikiki. The location is also good. On the downside, the balconies were very narrow and I thought almost useless. For us this was quite important as we always enjoy some quiet time reading/coffee/evening drinks. Also the suites are really two hotel rooms with a lounge which was fine for us but could be an issue for others. We enjoyed our stay but it helped refine our thoughts that we really like the space, the laundry and the cooking facilities of a condo.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The hotel was very clean. The complementary breakfast and executive social were a nice touch to a pleasant one night stay. The executive social included free drinks and entertainment for two hours. It was a nice time to get the evening started. The free breakfast buffet had a very nice selection of eggs, fruits and pastries. I had a made-to-order omelette and it was outstanding. The hotel was walking distance to the beach, shops and nice restaurants.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great location to the beach and all the great shopping. Breakfast included and the managers happy hour from 5.30 - 7.30 every evening was really nice. Would definitely stay here again.Staff are friendly and rooms are cleaned every day. We stayed on 18th floor and even though didn't look at the beach the city view was great both day and night.Have a great business centre where you can get on the net, print out information all for free.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My family loved this hotel. The rooms were great, we had a 2 bedroom apartment with a partial view. It was in a very handy location, with great shops and restaurants surrounding, only a block to the beach. The staff were friendly and helpful. We enjoyed the free happy hour drink session each evening...great way to kick off the night.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed four nights June 20-24th. Great to have separate lounge and bedroom so other half can sleep while I'm on the laptop checking emails on the free in-room Wi-Fi at reasonable speeds. We had a room on the 14th floor (Hula tower) with a view of the pool and decent view of the sea looking towards the marina/airport.
