The room was very clean and well laid out with a small balcony with two deck chairs and table.Rooms -21 and -32 back onto the elevators (3) and although the noise can be heard it wasn't terrible although if you are a light sleeper and had the AC off you may want to avoid those rooms. The medium sized pool was nice but quite shallow (3~4 ft.) and was designed with kids in mind ? as there were always 10 to 20 of them splashing around... Luckily there are plenty of loungers away from the pool to enjoy the sun and great service from the pool bar staff ! The hotels location is right in the heart of all the best shops and a main ABC store opposite for all supplies.  Having a tour desk in the lobby was great and saved time figuring out where we wanted to go on day trips. Enjoyed the buffet breakfasts and went to two of the nightly drinks and nibbles events and the hotel puts on a great band for everyone to enjoy while the suns setting. Got a great view of the Hilton fireworks display on Friday nights from the beach end of the pool deck. Overall very happy with our stay and will be back next time we're in Waikiki.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Although it's difficult to be required to work while in the paradise of Waikiki, having the amenities of the Embassy Suites there made the total experience both productive and enjoyable. Knowing little about the area, the Valet staff was most helpful with directions as I needed to drive to various business locations. The location of the hotel was perfect for walking around Waikiki - very near the beach and wonderful restaurants as well as safe and secure. By having a suite, I was able to set up my computer for business yet relax in the living room setting as well. Great hotel, great staff, superb location!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had a city view suite for a week stay in June. There are a lot of hotels in Waikiki, but not so many with the 2 room suites which we wanted for us and 3 grandkids. This really worked very well, from the reception area, to the room, and the closeness to the beach. The breakfasts were phenomenal (cooked to order) and saved us from buying one meal each day in Waikiki (and that is $$$) - just don't leave your tray alone, or the birds will swoop in to sample the food!! We made a few evening receptions and the wine and entertainment was worthwhile - however the snacks don't replace the need for an evening meal!We had a great time and the staff was very friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Room was clean, comfortable and roomy for 2 adults and 3 kids under 12. Staffs were extemely helpful and friendly. Some went out of their ways to accommodate our needs. Hot breakfast and fresh fruits were great., but no Kona coffee. We even took some fruits to eat at the beach. The open breakfast area is great but there are too many birds lurking aroung and ready to steal your food if you are not watching.. One pooped on my plate while eating. Grosss........Do not sit outside. Location is great. the pool was ok, and can be a little bit crowded during happy hour. A walking distance from the beach and to great restaurants. Be prepared to pay 37/day valet parking. Great for families. Would highly recommend this hoteland will stay here again. Mahalo to the staffs who gave us papayas when we were craving them during brekafast.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Room was clean, spacious and comfortable. Breakfast was included and made-to-order chefs always friendly. Staff are all very welcoming, especially the bartenders at the managers evening cocktail reception. We witnessed a minor incident with a guest one evening and the events that followed can only be described as an execution of precision and professionalism. The guest fell and hit her head on the floor. The first person to assist was a member of the band. A second member of the band ran for help. One of the bartenders came to assist the guest also, while the second bartender closed-down the bar. The third member of the band placed chairs around the area on the floor to secure the scene. The reason I detail this is that extensive training is obviously part of the regime for staff of every nature. Each person knew exactly what had to be done. This just shows that the hotel takes great pride in training staff not only to ensure your vacation is enjoyable, but to respond to emergencies should the need arise. Incidentally, security does a fantastic job of remaining convert. Until that incident, I had no idea there were so many! Again, excellent business planning on part of management to deploy security in a non-intrusive fashion. Would highly recommend and would definitely return.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel ticked many boxes the service was extremely friendly and the rooms were very comfortable. The buffet breakfast was average apart from the made to order omelettes but still plenty of food. The free poolside cocktails were a nice touch just don't drink to many! Good hotels for families.Overall it was very nice hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I joined my daughter who had been studying at UH for the month of May, and we stayed for some R&R at the Embassy Suites Beach Walk during late May/early June. Our accommodations were very comfortable, with balcony access on two sides with 3 sets of sliders and views of the ocean and sunset. We took advantage of breakfasts and manager receptions on most days. Valet service was convenient and valets themselves were very accommodating. The pool is nice, clean, though we experienced many, many children which you would have to expect at a hotel that is so convenient for families. Restaurants in the area are very busy. I would strongly recommend making reservations unless you don't mind waiting at least 45 minutes for a table.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Reasonable option in Waikiki. A block from the beach, and close to the park. Surrounded by the usual shopping and dining options. OK pool. Nice to have evening cocktails and buffet breakfast included as part of the room costs.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great location, good for families,& helpful staff. The breakfast was great. The evening reception served good drinks and had entertainment on several evenings. The entire family enjoyed the stay. The suites give you room needed for children or other family members. Good value for your dollar and located close to shopping, beach and restaurants.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great hotel to stay. The Bell desk was very knowledgeable when they delivered our luggage to the room and concerned that we liked the room before they left. Excellent staff. 1 block off the beach was much quieter and a very easy walk to the beach. With the free breakfast it was a great start to the day.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The included breakfast and evening cocktail hour made this place a great deal for the two of us. Nice pool, good bar, friendly staff made our stay perfect.The room was huge and we had both a sitting room and a bedroom. The bathroom was larger than most hotels. Nice place to call home in the Waikiki area.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I went with 5 girlfriends to celebrate our 50th birthdays. We had a wonderful time! The complementary breakfast and Happy hour is great. All the staff were extremely friendly and we were on a first name basis by the end of the trip. the happy hour band was Roland and his 3 sons, they were fun, friendly and really good. We had a 2 bedroom, 2 bath suite and it was nice and roomy. I will definetly be back!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great location, clean rooms, high quality hot & continental breakfast. The staff was friendly and on-site expedia travel assistant helped us book our way into many events which otherwise were showing up us sold-out or not available on-line. Overall, very satisfied by the experience here, would definitely go back.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: What a pleasant surprise! Knew about the cooked-to-order breakfast and the no-resort fee (unless it's already built in the per/night charge) but did not know about the proximity to the center of Waikiki. We stayed in Waikiki Parc a few years ago and found it to be the ideal location for more bang for your buck, but Embassy Suites takes the cake. The lobby is only a few steps away from dining, shopping, and Kalakaua Blvd. In fact, there's a short pathway that leads you to the middle of Waikiki Beach Walk. If beach fun is what you seek, simply cut through the Sheraton lobby and find a spot in front of the Royal Hawaiian (this part of the beach has less corals and smoother sand than the beach directly in front of the hotel). The arrival was easy and direct. Once you are dropped off, you simply mosey a few feet to a sit-down counter while they server guava/passion fruit beverage. The suite is not modern but efficient especially with a microwave and mini-fridge. There are LCD TV's in the bedroom and the living room. The lanai can be accessed from both living room and bedroom but it is a tight squeeze. We stayed in Ste 1109, directly across from the Trump Hotel, where the view was awesome. It is an end suite with the living room view overlooking the grand lanai pool and the pacific ocean. The bed is extremely comfortable, though can't say much for the pull out sofa bed. The grand lanai is directly above The Yard House, Ruth Chris, and an entertainment stage where various Hawaiian singers/hula dancers performed every night (we stayed during the weekend of Pan Pacific Festival). SO, if you do not like street noise, ask for a higher floor. We had breakfast every day (prior accommodations with free breakfasts would only be enjoyable after the first 2 or 3 days - not this place). The omelet chefs were extremely friendly and helpful. Although some days are greasier than others, just simply ask for less cheese on your omelet. Remember, do not leave your food unattended while you grab your morning coffee or juice. The pigeons and tiny birds will have a feast on what could be your best omelet creation. The Manager's reception is also fun with complimentary cocktails and live entertainment. Since it's a family friendly hotel, there are TONS of children in the pool which our 11-year old enjoyed, but there should be a separate Jacuzzi where the grown ups can enjoy it without feeling uncomfortable. The only complaint I have is the constant humming noise of the air condition unit from the Trump Hotel. Since we were directly in front of its infinity pool and hotel back side, we heard their air condition through the entire duration of our stay. Non-issue when we're not there but very noticeable when trying to get a good night's sleep after a long hard day of having fun. Bottom line, we would definitely book another stay at the Embassy Suites. That we were sure of after the first day!!! Thanks, Embassy and staff for a great start to our summer.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I stayed there on June 2nd - June 6th. Very expensive to park here offering only valet at $35 per night. BE CAREFUL with the valet attendant named LAPAKE! He was very rude and tried to physically intimidate me. I thought we were going to have to call the police on him! I talked with a manager about this and he said that he would talk to the valet supervisor. He didn't seem to concerned though. Who knows if he ever did anything. None of their staff from the manager on down seem very happy to work there. I have Hilton Honors Gold status and was placed on the 3rd floor by the elevators and Ice machine. The room was clean with a living area and bedroom. There was a fridge and sink right when you walk in the door. The breakfast was good, and the managers special in the evening was ok. The pool area was ok but crowded many times. For the money there are a lot of other better options and for sure you will find better service at just about anywhere else on Waikiki.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The hotel is clean, roomy, and convenient for shopping and beach going. Staff is friendly and eager to help. The hotel made available beach towels in the room, so we took a short walk to the Waikiki Beach. Breakfast is very good considering the high grocery price in Honolulu. Elevators are directly accessible from the street using room card to operate. We stayed on the top floor and the view was great facing Hilton Hawaiian Village. I would have preferred the Diamond Head view, but the Front Desk was kind enough to give us a room when we arrived at 11 am. This is a no-frill hotel and great for families

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Fantastic Hotel in great location. Great value with loads of extras with buffet breakfast and managers cocktail party at night from 530-730pm and really friendly and helpful staff. Very clean rooms and pool area. Highly recommended /second visit.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed here for a week in June 2013. What sets this place apart is the free breakfast in a great setting next to the pool and the free cocktails (for 2hrs Mon, Wed and Fri) with a great local band to entertain you. We had a ball.Rooms were large and tidy. Service was good. My tip is book a high floor to avoid some minor street noise. Use the local buses ($2 return) for Ala Moana etc.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We were very pleased with our stay. Comfortable bed in quiet room with ocean view. Enjoyed the breakfast & reception. Pool was small but area wasn't crowded, always could find a lounge chair. We walked down to the beach every day - easy access with restrooms, beverages, lounge chairs & umbrellas for rent. Ft DeRussy Park had shaded area if you prefer grassy area. Appreciated access to restaurants & shopping. We were able to walk along beach, to zoo, etc. Didn't need a car, bus & trolley got us around town. Opportunities for improvement - birds in dining area were on tables if food was left on them. Staff was working hard to keep area clean but the birds sometimes won that battle. Staff helped us arrange an island tour which was great, but our Ali Kai sunset dinner cruise wasn't very good. 1 1/2 hour bus ride to pier, escort seemed inexperienced and overwhelmed, food was forgettable, drinks expensive. Wouldn't spend the time or $$ for that cruise again. Overall we had a wonderful time at this hotel and would return.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was our 2nd visit to Oahu this year, and this hotel was perfect for our family. For any families travelling with small children, suites are the way to go! (Our last visit, we stayed at another hotel within this chain, that was excellent as well, but when mama and kiddo get separate space and decent sleep, everyone is much happier :)). We had a double queen suite so we still had to share a room, but at least there was a living room and the bathroom had two doors, so sleep was hardly ever interrupted. However, walls are a bit thin, so you can hear EVERYthing your neighbors are doing around you. We were in the Aloha tower with a partial ocean view, which we could see if we stepped out on the small patio and looked between the buildings, Mr Trump's building was blocking the rest of our view, but that was fine. Housekeeping staff was excellent, and accomodated our needs. The nearest beach is only a block away. The room also was equipped with a fridge and microwave, which was great for our week-long stay. The free breakfast in their lanai by the pool was excellent with cooked to order omelettes and a variety of fruit, yogurt, pastries, and even an Asian twist with a miso soup bar. The only thing to watch out for is always make sure you have someone at the table watching your food while you grab seconds or drinks. The birds know where the good stuff is! The staff there is friendly and always willing to help. The manager's reception is great for unwinding at the end of the day, with entertaining music by a local family band, endless drinks, and light snacks. Don't expect to get a whole meal out of it, it's chips/pretzels & salsa, but good to tide you over til dinner. Sunday night entertainment while we were there was a nice treat with Samoan dance performances & fire dancing! It can get a bit loud, and can be heard throughout the hotel so might as well let the kids stay up and finish watching before heading up to bed ;). The pool area is well kept, and they have a kiddie pool area attached to the main pool, so the kids are safe, and you can relax as well. The hotel is a quick walk to the beach, and extra towels are provided in the room. Our kiddo grew especially attached to the penguins at the nearby Hilton Hawaiian Village, so it was nice to be within quick walking distance to catch their morning feeding time. The Waikiki Beachwalk shopping/dining area is right below the hotel, so there is lots to choose from there in terms of food/shopping/entertainment. Also across the street within walking distance the big Royal Hawaiian shopping center. If you have a car, parking is the most expensive on the island at $35 for valet (no self parking), so you might want to do some research on other options in the area if it's an issue for you. This was an excellent hotel, and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I had the opportunity to stay at the Embassy Suites, Waikiki Beach Walk for close to one month this year. That's a lot of delicious complimentary breakfasts ! The room I had was also well appointed and convenient, and I felt spoiled during and especially after my stay. When I have business again in Hawaii, I would like to return and enjoy my next stay at the Embassy Suites (and for the right price) ! Another note: Please include another stationary bicycle in the fitness center for guests. If there are more benefits that I have earned, please continue to provide them in my future stays. Thanks !

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Excellent Hotel. Great value. I don't have an ocean view, but I do have a view of Diamond Head. I do believe they have ocean view rooms here, but I see the ocean all day long from the beach so why do I need to pay extra for a room that has a view. The location of this hotel is one back from the ocean. We are right on Beach Walk so the location is perfect. We are right behind the famous Halekulani Hotel, which if you have $995 to $7,000 to spend per night for a suite you should stay there. Their advertisement has a Bentley in the carport. It is a beautiful hotel and fun to walk through. I am not quite there yet, but I know I am in good company if I am staying across the street.Back to the Embassy Suites. They have a fantastic staff. Everyone is super friendly. The room rate includes breakfast, which is a full on omelet station, fresh fruit, breads, bacon, sausage, hash browns, you name it. There is also a complimentary happy hour every day with drinks and appetizers. The pool is nice. It is not huge and it is not one of the fun pools right on the beach of Waikiki. It is on the fourth floor of the hotel and it is open air. My kids liked it. It is a pool, but this is Hawaii and it ain't about the pool for me. There is a view of the ocean. The ocean is 75 yards away and their is a sweet little private beach right in front of the Halekulani. When I say private beach, I just mean secluded. I don't know if there is any private beach at Waikiki. So you are allowed to go there and there is a public beach access from the street right near the hotel.The value of this place is great. I have a bedroom with TWO QUEEN BEDS, a living room and a small kitchenette (fridge, microwave and sink). The suite has two flat screen TVs, one in the living room and one in the bedroom. This is Hawaii, so it is not about the TV, but if it was you would be good. We have two kids so one adult sleeps with a kid and having the queen instead of a double is great. Hawaii has not figure out the two queen bed thing yet. This is the only place we could find with two queens. That is a bigger deal than you think. I am 6'4 and over 225 and I cant sleep with one of my kids comfortably in a double bed.I am right now in my living room typing away while my family sleeps in the other room. I did not have to leave the room to conduct early morning business. This is a great feature. I am a working class stiff and I need to stay connected. The Wifi is free and very fast. Everything about this place is value. The room is huge, the place is great. They washers and dryers on the fourth floor so you don't have to bring two suitcases. There is a fitness room with three treadmills, some free weights, a couple of Stairmasters, an ab machine, complimentary headsets, TV's on the machines. It is above adequate.I would definitely stay here again, unless I win the lottery This place is a no brainer if you have a family and you want quality and value for your money. There is an Expedia travel help desk in the lobby that is very helpful for setting up tours. There are tons of shops and restaurants all around. They give you beach towels. Parking is 35 per night, but you have access all day and night. We drove around a lot and were in and out so it worked out fine. Every place you go is going to ding you for that. There is a parking garage down the street I believe, but I did not figure it out. Valet is super efficient so the value is there. Use your car, travel around the island. Enjoy Hawaii. Aloha,

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Been meaning to write this for years. We stayed there in 2010(yes 2010, had to choose a date within the last 12 month so chose feb2013) for 3 nights as a getaway to do some wedding shopping and relax from the craziness of planning. As luck would have it, a tsunami warning was issued and our children were on an outer island with family. Our room was huger than the 4th floor so we didn't need to evacuate our room however not knowing what would happen and not having our children with us was stressful. Waikiki was basically on lockdown so we were stuck in the hotel. Staff was courteous, checking om us frequently and extended the buffet hours to accomodate guests being restricted to the hotel.Good location-unless you enjoy being in the heart of crazy waikiki.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here on our family trip with 2 adults and 4 children aged 15, 11, 4 & 2. The hotel comfortably fitted us all. The rooms are clean, tidy and modern. The beds were extremely comfortable. The staff were very friendly and helpful, we booked a luau through the hotel and were very happy with it. Right outside the hotel there are a number of restaurants and shops. The hotel is also within walking distance to Waikiki Beach and the Honolulu Zoo and aquarium and many other attractions we didn't' have time to see. I was only slightly disappointed that my request for an early check in was not met, we turned up after a long flight from Australia with tired and grumpy children hoping to have a rest but unfortunately we had to wander around the town for a few hours extremely jetlagged while our room was prepared. The pool area is gorgeous and the breakfast was awesome. I would recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Way overpriced for what we got. Close to energetic street area, but our room overlooking the pool was quiet at night. At first we were worried about affordable meal options, but turns out there are some within easy walking distance, including a Subway and Denny's, although we didn't eat there. The hotel was relatively clean, but it was annoying to walk into our room to find that the kitchen counter was full of crumbs and ants. Evening snacks consisted of too-strong drinks and three foods: large crunchy pretzels, nacho chips and fake cheese, and carrot sticks and warm dip. The staff was friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Awesome stay, great breakfast and pool. Complete fitness center and great staff service. This Hotel is close to the beach and all the downtown shops. Ideal for a family vocation. We would definately recomend it to others.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed for 4 nights in April with my partner and 2 kids (12 and 10) ..... Our room on the 20th floor was new and the bathroom was nice if small. We only got a one bedroom thinking the pull out sofa would be enough but really was quite "tight", my girls had nowhere to move, would be ok for smaller kids! They loved the pool and spa, although I thought the spa was way too hot. I usually complain everywhere that there are notenough sun lounges, but never found that here, any time of the day. Plenty of staff coming around during the day offering drinks and food. Loved the Managers drinks every day for the free cocktails, and the live music one of the nights was great, we didnt want to leave to go out to dinner (snacks were a little "dodgy"). Biggest gripe was the free buffet breakfast. It was absolutely awful, (except of course for the made to order omelettes where you can't go wrong!!) unless it came in a package, it was pretty unedible.....the scrambled eggs tasted like cardboard and everything else was high in sugar and they always ran out of fresh bananas.... also thought the actual breakfast area was "grubby" with staff struggling to clear up tables and the floor ...we tended to grab something and go and sit on the sun lounges.... Would stay again in a bigger room but probably go out for breakfast!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We booked 2 nights at Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach Walk before taking a 7 night cruise aboard NCL's Pride Of America. This was NCL's most highly recommended hotel, but even with the AAA or AARP discounts, an admitted splurge.The location is superb, close to Hilton Hawaiian Village and only 1 block from Waikiki beach.Unfortunately Trump Towers all but obscures all the great views formerly enjoyed to the West, (Ewa) side of this highly energized tourist zone...some lovely green views of Hale Koa and a park we've enjoyed in times gone by.On one side of the hotel is Lewers Street with dozens and dozens of on-trend but pricey shops, lots of eateries and directly on bus lines. Great for walking tours, shopping and noshing, too. It is a short detour through Trump valet on the other side of Beach Walk to Saratoga Road, with specialty shuttles, Hard Rock Café and more.Of special note, Roy's Waikiki is situated Makai, on the Lewers Street corner nearest the water, for a fabulous meal. Yardhouse, ubiquitous ABC stores and an upscale Italian dining venue are also quite handy and decent stops within the Embassy grounds. Two towers make up the guest rooms, some with ocean/partial ocean views but the majority with city views.We booked well in advance, a AC, (handicapped) suite with 2 Queen beds, nonsmoking. From the moment our Roberts shuttle dropped us at the covered valet entrance, I could see it was going to be a walk of at least 2 city blocks through the hotel before this semi disabled person could reach that blessed bed.Nicely greeted with a flavorful, iced fruit juice even though we were 1 1/2 hours before check-in, we were invited to leave our bags with the bell desk, and shown a comfortable seating area with sofas and upholstered chairs. Local newspapers and the addition of serve yourself iced water wih lemon slces was appreciated after a long flight and in the very warm, muggy tropical air.It turned out our room wasn't available as booked, however the helpful check-in clerk did give us an upgrade to a 2 bedroom suite that still provided sturdy grab bars in the bathroom that worked for our needs. We didn't budget for a view so weren't terribly disappointed when our city view, to the rear of the hotel gave glimpses of a slightly seedy condo with lanais sporting everyone's laundry, surf boards and da kine.We booked this hotel knowing a full, hot breakfast was included. A breakfast bountiful enough, that factoring in the resort's free cocktails and salty bar snacks would tide us over until dinner.Best were the omelets made to order and local Maui Gold pineapple. Melon, juices, coffee, tea, milk, waffles, pancakes, bacon, sausage, Spam or diced ham, cold and hot cereals and toast were very good. The yogurt, bagels and biscuits and gravy not so much, but a great value overall.The rooms were clean, the beds comfy and our midlevel suite, near stairs but the elevator, was quiet. Adequate maid service and assist from the bellmen met our travel needs. The sticker shock came with the 'discounted' price bottom line at checkout time. Let's just say, one night at this very nice but not wonderful place was the cost of a regular coach airfare from the West Coast.Yes, it was handy to be near the Royal Hawaiian Shopping Center and International Marketplace and Roy's but at what cost? The hotel I'd originally booked was situated between Ala Wai Canal and Kuhio Streets, a couple blocks from the action, but with 2 queen beds and a kitchenette would have run us only 1/3rd of Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach Walk.In conclusion, if budget is no concern, then I can heartily recommend this hotel as a solid 4 star value with location being foremost. In retrospect, we could have saved a nice chunk of change and still been overall satisfied with 2 days comfy stay in a clean, attractive surroundings, just without the bells, whistles and cache.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Attended a wedding at a nearby hotel this weekend. The Embassy Suites was a stones throw away at a very reasonable price. I have 2 small children and having a room nearby is an excellent choice for a quick nap/rest until our next weekend activity. The in-room mini wet bar (mini fridge, small microwave) pool, complimentary breakfast and night reception was a bonus! The only complaint would be the $35 daily parking rate (valet only) .

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The location, hotel staff, complimentary breakfast, managers happy hour, upgraded bathroom, clean guest suites, and family friendly pool is one of the many reasons why we keep coming back to stay at this hotel, even if it is just a staycation for us! My family and I enjoy our stay every time!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Location was great, close to the beach but still quiet at night. Pool was very much on the small side. Breakfast was excellent and 2 hours evening cocktails was fantastic value. We had two adjoining rooms which would be perfect for a family and was great for us on our girls trip. We had a room with two double beds and bathroom which joined a lounge area which connected to another bedroom and bathroom. Kitchen facilities were very minimal. No spoons or wine glasses, no bottle openers. Just 2 paper cups, kettle, microwave, and a mini fridge (no freezer so the iceblocks got thrown out).If you want to have a drink in your apartment or prepare any food you will need to go to the ABC store across the road to get paper plates, wine glasses etc. Staff were very helpful and allowed us to check straight in to our room at 8.30am. Balcony was very small but could just fit a few chairs. No sun bathing on the balcony. Over all a good stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Location...location...location. One block from the beach, right on the beachwalk, convenient to everything. We spent very little time in the room--it was big enough for sleeping. The breakfast was wonderful--made to order eggs, fresh fruits, bread and sweets. Even specialty items. The cocktail hour was a nice touch and the band was fun. The pool was clean and the hot tub hot. The one thing that was very annoying were the birds in the breakfast area. If you tried to stand up to get a coffee refill, a flock would descend on your plate and all but carry it off. We were told that they are protected by the Humane Society and that the hotel could in fact be fined if they attempted to get rid of them. There must be a bird specialist that could review the situation and rid that area of these filthy nuisances.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Overall we enjoyed our stay at the Hilton Embassy Suites. The rooms were a good size, everything was in good condition, functional and clean. The decor's a little dated it didn't have that modern look or feel but it was still very comfortable The complimentary breakfast was good, there were chefs making fresh omelettes and fried eggs for the guest which was excellent but the scrambled eggs in the bain-marie made from powdered egg mix were disappointing! Come on Hilton lets up the game here. Fresh pineapple and melon every morning was a joy to have with my yoghurt. We really enjoyed our stay at the Embassy Suites Waikiki, the staff are always on hand and really helpful, the location is great close to Waikiki beach, the main shopping strip of Waikiki and only a short walk to Ala moana shopping center an experience in itself. I highly recommended the two bedroom suites at Embassy Waikiki to families with children or snoring mother in laws ;-). Would definitely stay there again. Don't for get to try the Cheescake Factory, walk up Diamond head, take a surf lesson and do a North Shore tour, Turtle tours are who we went with and they were awesome.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Very nice hotel and the rooms were clean. Check in was quick and easy. The location was convenient to be able to walk down to the beach, or walk to dinner somewhere. Right on Beach Walk Avenue, so lots of shops to see. Just a couple complaints. First, I reserved and prepaid for a room almost 4 months prior to arrival. But when we arrived, (still about an hour before official check in time) I had requested an upper floor, with two queen beds. The clerk spends time looking for a room. (no idea why, shouldn't they have already had us set up in one?) then informs us the only room available was on the 3rd floor. I mentioned I had requested a higher floor. She then found one on the 7th floor, but it had only one king bed, and a pull out sofa. I took that room as she informed me they were "booked" that weekend and that was all they had. We went to the room and it was literally right behind the elevator shaft. My husband called back down to the front desk to tell them this was not going to be acceptable, we did not want to hear the ding of the elevator all night. They then suddenly found a room on the 16th floor, but it cost $25 more, since it has a "partial" ocean view. We went ahead and paid the extra just to get a higher floor and away from the elevator. This room was perfect, on the end so no foot traffic walking by the room. Later that evening, we were glad we moved up. We could still hear the music coming from the ground somewhere. I feel the desk clerk should have looked at all the rooms and offered this room to us first thing, instead of waiting until we complained. Also, housekeeping needs to be better at filling supplies. As the coffee and tea in the room was out. No biggie as we just got coffee at breakfast, but sometime to check. Breakfast was ok, and seemed to be done well.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We chose this hotel specifically because it was a family vacation, grandparents, kids, grandchildren. Their rooms are larger than average which is a huge plus. But this particular hotel was a little "tired". The hook fell off in the bathroom when we put a towel on it, the security lock on the door was literally hanging off the wall, the room was just old. There were stains on so many things. A little TLC wouldn't hurt, guys! And don't get me started on the "evening receiption". I have stayed at several Embassy Suites and never have I seen such low quality snacks. Cheese and nachos, guys? Really? There was a mixed something one night and I had to throw it away. It was just plain nasty. The breakfast gets five stars, however. And the location of this hotel is undeniably great. But if you are going to compete with the nice hotels in Honolulu, let's have some upgrades guys. We also paid a higher price for this and we could have saved by just going to Hawaiian Hilton Village just down the beach. For now save your money and go there!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My son and I visited Waikiki. The Embassy Suites was in a good location (1 block from the beach). The property was clean but was dated and the rooms were a little small. I expected a much better experience comparable to other Embassy Suites I have stayed at. Overall, just OK.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I stayed at the Embassy Suites Waikiki for four nights. The room was spacious (two bed-room suite, two bathrooms, kitchenette), however everything was quite old and well used. One drawer as well as one door of a cabinet were broken. I was happy, that everything was clean. The sund-beds at the pool were also old and beaten up. The location is right at the beach walk, my view was opposite balconies. There are also rooms with seaside views available.There is a reception every afternoon with free drinks. However I did not like the atmosphere there. Breakfast was ok with eggs made to order. Unfortunately the atmosphere was more like in a factory canteen.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The weather, the staff, the accommodations. Well worth it. Have enjoyed it from both leisure and business perspective. You can't go wrong spending a happy hour with the smiling and attentive staff during the evening reception. With its superlative made-to-order breakfast (no walking the streets looking for the 3.99 2 egg and pancake special that REALLY costs 8.00 with coffee and taxes!), it is the right place in Waikiki to take the family!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed in a one-bedroom suite for five nights.Pros - Great location within easy walking distance of Waikiki beach, shops, restaurants, Waikiki trolley, buses and shuttle to Waikele outlets. Ala Moana shopping centre is a bit further (20-30 minute walk), but can also get there by bus, trolley or taxi.- Clean and spacious suite. Handy to close the bedroom door when the kids have gone to bed, and for Aussies to store their shopping purchases in the extra room.- Friendly and helpful staff- Varied selection of foods at breakfast, including bacon and eggs, pancakes or waffles, bakery and toast and healthy items, eg fresh fruit and yoghurt. Keeps you going for the morning.- Evening reception with free alcoholic drinks, including cocktails, or soft drink and light snacks. Busy but snacks were replenished frequently. Different entertainment was provided; we saw an island band and a local hula school.- Mini fridge and microwave in the room.- Pool for the kids.ConsNothing major...- Higher floors are best. We were on the 6th floor and had a bit of street noise (not too bad). - The beach nearest the hotel is not the main swimming stretch, but great for sunsets. The famous part of Waikiki beach is only a 5-10 minute walk along the beachside.- Don't leave your breakfast unattended, as the sparrows will quickly swoop on it!- TV in the room outside the bedroom was close to the couch, but we weren't there to watch TV...Room prices vary a bit through different booking sites. We were able to get a cheaper rate through hotelopia than directly through the hotel's website.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Lots of room, fun pool (although with the hotel towers being so high.. it blocked much of the sun, ended up at the beach most days), lots of choices for breakfast - location was perfect. In the heart of waikiki. Would stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I stayed at the Embassy Suites for almost a week, the 20th through the 26th. I was taking a little birthday vacation to Hawaii for my first time, and I'm so glad that I stayed at this hotel. It is like a 5 sec walk from the beach and is surrounded by all the touristy shopping and food you could want. There is complementary breakfast every morning, which was decent but I'd definitely skip the precooked eggs for the made to order omelets. Every evening there was a manager's reception with drinks and snacks which was pretty good. The rooms are very spacious and the sheets so soft and comfortable. I loved the 2 travel coffee cups because I didn't feel the need to stop at Starbucks for coffee to go.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I traveled to Honolulu with my sisters for a week long sisters vacation. I cannot say one bad thing about this hotel. The staff was absolutely wonderful. Our room was clean and we had a lovely view. I had booked two reservations, one for our regular room and a second single reservation for the last day when I found out our plane did not leave until 9:30 at night. I fully expected to have to check out and check into another room, but two days into the trip they called the room and informed me we could stay in our room until we left. My sister recently had back surgery and we needed a wheelchair for certain events, they helped up with the rental and we did not have to pay a delivery or pick up fee. Breakfast was free and was excellent, the managers reception complete with a band was terrific. The valet attendants helped us load and unload the wheel chair and walker everytime we came in and out. We requested a mat for the shower and it arrived within minutes. It was a great experience. My sisters raved about the staff and honestly, we couldn't have asked for more. It is also within walking distance of lots of shopping, and the beach is across the street. I would go back in a heartbeat.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We spent 9 days at Embassy Suites and it was great. The location of the hotel is ideal, it is very clean and the staff is awesome from the front desk, housekeeping and the concierge. I highly recommend it!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The Embassy was the last stop on a 7 week holiday around the USA. It is a good quality hotel. Clean and well maintained. Breakfast was included in the price and was very convenient. The location to the beach is great. Just a short walk across the street. We arrived extremely early and unfortunately where not able to get an early check-in. Then when we asked for a room upgrade they wanted to charge the full price upgrade. Had stayed at another Embassy and they kindly upgraded us for a reduced rate, thought that they may have offered the same thing. In any case it's a nice hotel to stay at, even though I thought the price was a little expensive.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Checked in on the 24th of May, and was a smooth check in. This hotel knows how to treat customers. After a little shopping we headed down for the Manager's reception...ie. free cocktails and snacks for two hours. I don't have to tell anyone here that Hawaii is expensive, so the value of this alone is priceless. Hubby got a Blue Hawaiian, I got a Cab sav and son got virgin Mai Tai. Live music on M,W,F....band was awesome....I mean awesome. Snacks included nacho cheese and chips, snack mix and celery and carrots with ranch dressing. Atmosphere is fantastic and bartenders were keeping drinks flowing so there was never a long wait. We went out late, but our 17 year old son loves the room with free Wi Fi and two separate areas so the parents don't cramp his style. Beds are super comfortable and each room has 2 TVs and a highly awesome item...a refrigerator! Next day, full breakfast for free with omelet station, fresh fruit and several choices to accommodate any diet. This IS the best deal in town for everything, the room may seem a little higher, but the reception and breakfast make up for it, especially if you have a bigger family. Tons of shopping and restaurants just minutes away....don't miss this place, you will thank me later.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: What a marvellous holiday we had here! Hotel is excellent, very central, very helpful staff. Free breakfast, free cocktails, free entertainment - what more could you ask for? We had a quadruple celebration with 3 birthdays and a wedding anniversary and all received a card from the manager together with a bottle of bubbly and a lovely plate of cheeses, crackers and fruit. We all had a great time and would most definitely recommend this hotel. Four very happy UK vacationers!!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here for our last few days in Hawaii and it was great. We were upgraded to a 2 bedroom, 2 bath suite. Lots of space for us to enjoy. The pool was fantastic. The smaller attached wading pool was great for little kids and the rest of the pool was so warm and inviting. We love the complimentary breakfast buffet, and being able to enjoy it outside near the pool was wonderful. There are lots of restaurants and shops near by. Great location, the beach was only a few blocks away.We've always enjoyed staying at Embassy Suites, and the Waikiki Beach location was no exception. The staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms were very modern and clean.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at this hotel for four nights last month based initially on the location, availability and price. It was spring break, so the place was PACKED always. But even though the hotel was probably at capacity, I think the employees all handled the crowds very well, and with smiles. The hotel is in a great updated location and there are new shops and restaurants literally outside your doorstep. Many choices for shopping or dinner. Casual burger and pubs, to upscale Roy's right downstairs which is one of the best restaurants on Waikiki. We were lucky to be upgraded to a corner suite which had -3- balconies with sliding glass doors, 2 in the living area (corner side) and 1 in the bedroom. It's true what people say about the higher the floor the less the street noise, we were on the 10th floor, but still shut our patio doors at night due to the noise. Everything worked great. The free breakfast was good, with lots of variety for the internationally mixed guests. A nice touch was the omelets station where you put whatever you wanted in your omelet into a saucer and then simply handed it to the chef making the omelets. This really hastened the process and the line moved quickly even though the place was usually super crowded. The coffee station was also in a different area outside of the breakfast area adjacent, so it didn't congest in one area. The happy hour was also nice. There were LONG lines for everything and it was kind of a feeding frenzy for the bowls of pretzels and peanuts, carrot sticks etc. The lines for the drinks were usually worse, but it was spring break so it was to be expected. The band was GREAT, and made the happy hour so much better! The rooms were clean, nice little refrigerator and coffee in your room. TWO large screen TV's, internet, etc., There were chairs on your (small) balcony also so you could take a drink up to your room to get away from the crowds and sit out on your balcony to enjoy the view. One unique thing is the pool towels. They are in your room, so you bring them down with you and take them back. They will switch out for clean ones if you want also, and even give you extras. The nice thing about this was that generally, people took their towels with them when they left, so if a pool chair was vacated you would know, vs. a towel laying on a chair for hours, without any knowledge of if the chair was being saved, or the person being in the water etc., The pool is SMALL and crowded. The day we arrived somebody's child soiled the connected whirlpool, and they had to shut the entire pool down while they drained the whirlpool and then cleaned and shocked the entire pool. This took hours. People were complaining about this, I thought they should complain about the parents and appreciate that the hotel wanted to insure it was sanitary for the guests. You saw the same employees working breakfast, bartending, serving at the pool, and they were very friendly and down to earth. Hospitality desk guys are also very nice and helpful. Encountered nice employees everywhere which is so appreciated. I mentioned Roy's earlier, and this is a bonus for this hotel. It is literally connected to the hotel, and one of the best restaurants on the island. Don't be fooled by the seemingly small quiet area you walk by - (we were at first) the place is huge and opens up into a really great restaurant once you get inside. Great place to dine - steps from your room!Would definitely go back to this hotel again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Once we arrived, checking in went very quickly. Our reservations were for a 2 bedroom suite with partial ocean view. Much to our surpise, the 2 bedroom suite was quite roomy, we had our privacy with 2 bathrooms, clean, and great view of the ocean. We were on the 15 floor so we could see the pool below us which is on the 4th floor. Breakfast was great, more than we had expected. Happy hour was good unless you expect premium hard liquor or wine, the snacks to go along with the happy hour were just so, so but were stopped here before going out to dinner. The live band that plays twice a week were great! We do not plan on returning to Waikiki since this was our third trip there, but I would diffenetly recommend this hotel.Make sure you travel before the summer crowds and high season rates.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Clean, close to the beach, modern, helpful staff, large rooms, excellent free breakfast. A good place to stay in this area. We were treated very well by all the staff. Even the bell staff and parking attendents take the time to assure you are having a good stay. We were given printed, turn by turn, directions to local attractions just because they saw our GPS and wanted us to have a back up. They go the extra mile.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Very good hotel close to the beach. The extra amenities such as the courtesy suite was extremely helpful for our visit to Honolulu. The staff was friendly and courteous. Definitely would recommend staying at this hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed at this hotel 5/13-5/18/13 and loved it. While it's not on the beach it's close enough to walk, like real close. The staff was very welcoming. The rooms are suites and nicely kept. We loved the breakfast and evening manager reception, esp the nights when they had the live band. I strongly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Booked 4 nights only fortunately. Paid quite high rates and our first room was tiny right next to lift very noisy from lift and outside. Asked for changeof room staff very accomadating and gave us new room in other building bigger but kept awake by tv next door. All in all a very average hotel

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We have stayed here a few times but has got a bit expensive for what you get. Good rooms, staff friendly, coin laundry, breakfast is a good choice, managers drinks yum although the music can be a bit loud, they took away a bit of the atmosphere as they did not play hawaian music much. Andy was wonderful very helpful they could learn a lot for him. Would definitely stay here again

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Just returned from 10 nights at the Embassy Suites, staying on the 15th floor with two sisters.The friendliness of the staff was a big plus. The rooms were clean and the beds extremely comfortable. The breakfast selection was adequate and the managers "happy hour" wasenjoyable with the local musicians. One word of warning. We got a cab from the car park in theEmbassy Suites to take us to the Palace. He charged us $26. The return trip was $16 withCharley's cabs, a different company. I would definitely recommend this hotel as it is convenient to everything.Thanks to all at Embassy Suites

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Best Hotel on the strip. We asked for, and got the top floor overlooking the beach for the same price as the other suites. ( Stay on the top floors to get away from the noise below ).You are greeted by all when you get there. Served a drink and have someone right there to help you. The hotel is right in the heart of everything. You can get anywhere asap. Free Breakfast, beautiful rooms as the place was renovated, and you can't beat the price for a suite, which are few and far between.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at the Embassy Suites for five nights last week! I chose this hotel as had a super experience at the Embassy Suites in New York a few years ago and I was not disappointed. Lovely to have the extra living space and the buffet breakfast and managers reception daily make it real value for money. From check in the service was outstanding with an upgrade to an ocean view room. The pool area is perfect and for people like me who like to 'sticky beak' you can see the pool area at the nearby resorts (Trump Hotel etc) and Embassy Suites is comparable if not better! Located on the Waikiki Beach Walk - a large variety of shops and restaurants a stones throw away and of course the 'strip' with all the designer shops less than 2 minutes also. LOVED our stay here. Would definitely recommend and go back.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We loved the hotel and took advantage of the great breakfast and the fun evening reception -It was great when they had entertainment. Room exceeded our expectations and was extremely clean and comfortable.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Very nice location, Breakfast was fantastic to be included for room. Evening manager receptions with Mai Tai's, outstanding way to get the night started! Parking price is however way over priced, should be reduced for honors members!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed here for a week in April. Great location, clean, and any employee we encountered was just so nice. The fitness room was very nice also. Always clean, plenty of towels, water and a nice assortment of cardio equipment. The free breakfast was great. Saved at least $50.00 (3 of us) every morning by not eating out.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Parking is a little pricey. Most places near are around 40% cheaper. Staff is very friendly, and helpful. Evening social could be better. Other properties do better, this seemed to be a bare bones. Nice pool, and lots of shops near by as well as the beach.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We spent three nights and were not disappointed at all. This is really a great place to stay. It is conveniently located in Waikiki. We had rent a car and arrived at this hotel pretty late in the evening. The valet service is very convenient, efficient and well organized. The people are there to help you. The check-in staff was also very kind giving us all the explanation needed to enjoy our stay. The welcome was outstanding. We were upgraded and really enjoyed the room. It was very large, well equiped and everything was very clean. The housekeeping was well done every day. Internet access and speed was ok and its use very easy. The weakness of this hotel (not specific to this hotel in the US) regarding the room is the isolation against the noise from outside. This is really an area of improvement to get a better rating. The other point preventing us to rate it as one outstanding place is the breakfast area. The breakfast itself is ok, but due to its location, the birds have an easy access to your table. So, it is not recommended to leave the seat to look for some cafe, otherwise, you may see birds trying to eat the remaining part of the omelet or bread you may have left. Hopefully, they leave when you arrive!! If the hotel can improve this area and improve the phonic isolation, it could be rated as excellent on every aspects. Anyway, we enjoyed our stay and if we have the opportunity to visit again Honolulu/waikiki, we will come back to this Embassy Suites.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I was there 5 days business and 5 days visiting family and surfing. The embassy was a great choice and I was able to get a very good rate. The breakfast was excellent...if you are considerate and have enough common-sense to tip the bus staff and omelet cook...it's even better. Evening reception (with live entertainment 4 nights a week) was awesome. Parking is $35...not good; if you are military or retired military, park at close by Ft Derussey for $18 a day. They also gave me a room by the elevator at pool level, so it was noisy, but I got the room at a very good rate considering an excellent free breakfast and free booze in the evening.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: we stayed in a 2 bedroom apartment ocean view - Fabulous space for us as we were a party of 5 (3 adults and 2 kids). Fantastic included breakfast every morning and the evening reception (5.30-7.30pm each night) was a great way to unwind after a big day or to have a pre-dinner drink and nibble before heading out to dinner - All included in the room price is an added bonus !Wifi worked well all the time and the staff were very accommodating and friendly.We go to Hawaii every 2nd year for holiday and we usually stay at the Outrigger Reef across the road but decided since we were taking 88yr old grandma with us that we needed a big more space. Having the living room and 2 bathrooms was sensational.The kids thought the pool was great (hard to find a good one in Waikiki) We will stay at Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach Walk again as we love the quieter end of Waikiki but still only a 5 min walk to the International Market Place.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: we stayed for 7 nights and just loved this place, the rooms are suites so the separate lounge area was most welcome especially with four people. the wifi was included and worked all the time, this was great with the kids. rooms where great size we looked over lewers street which was amazing. the breakfast is also included, there was everything you could think of we found that when eating breakfast lunch wasnt really needed so this saved money. all the staff where great, esp our cleaning lady. Location is central to all the shops and trolleys. pool area is great wasnt over packed we could always get chairs to lay on. only dislike was that the beach section across the us it was awful just very busy, we didnt worry as we had been in maui the week before and had spent everyday on the beach so the fantastic pool area was welcomed. we would recommend the embassy suites to everyone. It was also recommended to us.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed for a week in mid-April. Stayed in a double room with views overlooking Halekulani.This was not our usual choice of hotels, as we usually prefer to stay at the Outrigger on the Beach or Holiday Inn as it is more central, but we were pleasantly suprised by this hotel. The room was extremely spacious for our family and the in-room facilities were excellent. Beds were spacious and firm which I liked. A small sink and microwave made it easy to re-heat those huge portions you get at the Cheesecake Factory. The cleaning was efficient and friendly (sometime a little too efficient as she would often try to start cleaning at 8am - a little early for us when on holidays!!) Breakfast was an average quality and selection, with things to suit most tastes. We only attended the Managers Reception once. This consisted mainly of pretzels and corn chips with free drinks. Valet and Front Desk were friendly and efficient. Our room was fast tracked even though it was early (10am) and front desk did actually call to advise when the room was ready, unlike some hotels who promise to call and never do. The location was not as far as we originally thought it would be and there were many choices for food around. For fine dining Roy's was around the corner, and for cheap eats the ABC across the road had a good variety of sandwiches and drinks.All in all we really enjoyed this hotel and would stay here again if the price was right. My only complaint was that the pool was really too small for the amount of people that used it and the beach in front of the hotel was really not child friendly as it was full of rocks. The beach in front of the Outrigger is still my preferred. Otherwise, this hotel was excellent and I would recommend it.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The embassy suites is not on the ocean but you can peek through buildings to see the ocean. What it gives you instead, (like most Embassy Suites) is a huge two room suite, with a full breakfast. However,this is not an ordinary breakfast. They cater to a variety of cultures. And the evening snack with full bar is amazing. They even have special "Hawaiian Drinks" to choose from. The rooms are accessed by using your key in the elevator then pressing your floor number. To come down in the elevators no key is needed unless you are getting off on the 4th floor. That is the Breakfast/Evening Bar floor. You will need your key anytime you want to go to the 4th floor. Otherwise go to the 3rd or 5th and use the stairs. The stairs start on floor 2 and go to the top. Another unique option they provide is an Expedia Sales rep on the main floor. If you want to travel anyway on the island, they can take care of it for you. There is no charge and they are very knowledgeable. We had some great tours thanks to them. Also, if you like a cold room, and I do, the rooms are very self adjusting comfortable. I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I have stayed at this hotel a few years back and gave it a good review.. This stay didn't disappoint either. We really enjoy staying at Embassy Suites... The breakfast was great and the managers reception was also a nice benefit. They had live music during the reception which was really fun and enjoyable. Also everyone was extremely friendly who worked there from the house keepers to the valet.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Took family to a conference in Honolulu and by far this was the best deal for the five of us. Centrally located, a block from the beach, walking distance to everything else. Room was clean, spacious, and all the necessities for a four day stay. Breakfast was plentiful and varied enough for everyone. Happy hour was a real plus. The staff were very friendly, helpful, and full of good advice. Definitely will stay again the next time we are in Honolulu.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed here for 2 weeks while on Oahu for business. Nice clean hotel with great staff. I really enjoy the 2 room suite when staying for a long period. They have a wonderful breakfast every morning with hot and cold options, and each night they hold a managers reception with cocktails and snacks. Across the street from the beach, but there is easy access around the other hotels. Highly recommend this property if you need a little more space and don't need to be right on the sand.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Where do two families, one from London and one from Sydney, meet for a special holiday to mark a mile stone for their mother. Waikiki of course. We spent months researching where to meet for this special occasion and after a long search Hawaii was decided upon and Embassy Suites a suitable choice for three generations. Located in down town Waikiki, five minutes from both the beach and shops, we couldn't of wanted a better location. A short cab ride from the efficient international airport we arrived at the open plan reception area to be greeted with a huge 'Aloha' and an effortless check in. Family deux has already arrived earlier from Sydney and were waiting for us at the Managers evening reception. Our room on the sixth floor was perfect. Two large rooms, one a sitting room, with sofa bed just in case the pre teens wanted to stay with us, and the other our bedroom with two very comfortable Queen beds as expected. A small kitchen area with coffee machine, a microwave and a kettle. See some hotels understand the Brits - tea. Our view was over the Grand Lai and pool with a view of the ocean to our left. As it was a warm evening we left unpacking to join the managers evening reception and see family deux. Big hugs and kisses all round. As we had travelled from LA we decided to eat at the pool side. The bar food was acceptable with sufficient choices for all three generations. Our ten day stay was excellent. The rooms were spotless and the maid service very flexible depending on what you were doing that day. The daily cooked breakfast was excellent. As we were a group of seven occasionally it was a little wait for a table. The fresh cooked omelets were amazing and the breakfast selection was multi national. The daily managers reception was a hoot and a good repartie was established with the bar men. The pool was safe and the hot tub HOT. Our overall experience of was faultless. Yes there are better hotels but for families with children you could not hope for a better hotel and location. One note. As the hotel has limited evening dining options the local restaurants are VERY busy we had to wait at least one hour at most places.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We regularly stay at Embassy Suites. You can't beat the complimentary breakfast and evening reception. Staying in a suite is a necessity for our larger family. The suites are spacious and comfortable. The kids loved the pool. They wanted to spend more time there than the beach. The beach is only one block away. The location on Beachwalk and the shops on Kalakaua Ave. were convenient. We stayed during Christmas and the hotel was pretty busy, but since it is so large, we hardly noticed it.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our Family had the best time in Hawaii. Embassy Suites was a BIG part of our overall experience. Friendly staff, Clean environment and great food! Hotel location was perfect for our needs. I highly recommend this hotel overall.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Having a suite with more privacy, excellent breakfast (with fruit to go) and the evening free drinkws were great for me and my brother. We would have preferred to be on the beach, but that is the trade-off.BUT - I would not take my wife here; the rooms are dated and not as clean as they should be (spots on towells). It needs to be renovated to be up to our standards for 4 star accomodation.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed for a week over spring break and were impressed with the hotel. Even though our assigned room was right next to the elevator, I was pleasantly surprised that none of us were bothered by noise. Not once! The room had a mini fridge and microwave which was handy. There was a safe in the room which was pretty big. I don't think it could accommodate a laptop, but it held our multitude of electronics.The pool area was wonderful. Plenty of loungers, and tables with umbrellas. We spent hours there while the kids would swim. You can order food and drinks and charge them to the room. The free manager's reception was held here as well. Drink lines were short most of the time, and even when they were longer, the wonderful bartending staff was very efficient so they went quickly. There were some basic snacks, like chips and salsa, or goldfish, or carrots/celery and ranch dip. The free daily breakfast was also held on the grand lanai where the pool was. You could choose to eat indoors or outside. There was made-to-order omelets, scrambled eggs, potatoes, rice, fresh fruit, pastries, bagels and toast with a variety of toppings, miso soup, salad, and probably a few things I have forgotten. The valet staff and housekeeping were really outstanding. We wanted to take the kids for short limo ride in one of the stretch limousines we constantly saw driving around Waikiki, but didn't know how to make arrangements. We asked a valet, who said he would handle it for us. He was very helpful and it was a great surprise for the kids. In addition to that special help, the valet staff were also quick to bring the car to us. Yes, the parking fee is $35 per night, but from my research in looking for a hotel, that is pretty standard. Housekeeping was very friendly as well and did a great job taking care of the room. One of the best things about the hotel is the free wifi and no resort fees. The only downside is that the hotel isn't beachfront. It's a five minute walk the lobby to the most direct spot on the beach, at most. We preferred to walk further to the beach in central Waikiki, where the ocean bottom was more sandy and not as rocky. The area surrounding the hotel, called Beach Walk, was wonderful. There were plenty of restaurants and shopping available right outside the door. We really enjoyed our stay at Embassy Suites Beachwalk.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: GREAT PLACE TO STAY, super nice staff members, clean spacious rooms, free breakfast and drinks in the evening reception, located right in the center of the shopping -restaurants area and 5 minuted walk to the beach. We loved every minute of our vacation! Cannot wait for next year!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: What a way to spend our 25th anniversary and my birthday. Our room was spasious, the service and staff were wonderful. Hotel location was perfect for walking to the beach, shopping, restaurants. Our room faced the beach walk and we enjoyed local entertainment from the view of our room.Would defenitely recommend this hotel

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We recently spent three nights in this location on their "Romance package" which included a dinner at Roy's (yummm), a bottle of champagne, and chocolate covered strawberries. We had a one bedroom suite which came with a small kitchen area which included a microwave, small refrigerator, coffee/tea maker and sink. That was nice for keeping cold drinks, and snacks, but was too small for storing groceries for in room dining. Our suite was nicely furnished and was very clean. The housekeeping staff does a great job, and is very friendly, as are the lobby reception staff and bell staff. Everyone was very helpful, and responsive to requests. The hotel is located on a one way street in a very congested area, which makes driving in and out a challenge. The fee for valet parking is $35, which is high even for Waikiki. Only valet parking is available. Like other Embassy Suites, breakfast is included in the room charge. The buffet is pretty standard, eggs, bacon, sausage, but this one also includes miso soup, rice, and kimchi. There is an omelette station, and tropical fruit is available. My only complaint with the breakfast is that there are lots of birds in the seating area. Birds are on tables, chairs-everywhere. I watched one perch on my husband's chair, and do it's "business", and that made me wonder about how often the tables and chairs are cleaned and sanitized. Not a very appetizing thought. The hotel was very crowded while we were there, and the staff in the breakfast area seemed to be having a hard time keeping up with clearing the tables, and I didn't see anybody washing tables down. If I stayed there again, I'd bring sanitizing wipes to use on the tables--but maybe that's just me being paranoid. The crowding also made for long waits for elevators, but that's pretty standard for Honolulu. I'd stay there again, as it is a nice facility, and the staff is great.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our family stayed in a two bedroom suite for eight nights recently. The suite was clean, quite (floor 12) reasonable size and came with a nice, partial view of the sea but the mini kitchen had no utensils, plates or glasses so there is nothing to open a bottle of wine or cut up a pineapple after visiting Dole Plantation, so its off to a ABC store to buy a few of the necessary items. There was a good selection at the breakfast but quality was lacking and we preferred to dine elsewhere. The swimming pool is suitable for children but adults will be disappointed and the managers reception gets noisy as guests take advantage of the free drinks on offer. The hotel is nicely located and a short walk to the beach, shops and restaurants.Overall the Embassy is comfortable and we did enjoy our stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I am a very picky resort customer when it comes to cleanliness, space, and bed comfort. My stay at the Embassy Suites Honolulu far exceeded my expectations, it may have been my best overall business lodging expereince in these areas. I would also consider brining my family here, as the pool facilities were very nice and the proximity to the water was also nice. There are an abundance of good dining venues a short walk away. The added vaule and quality of the breakfast was excellent.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: On arrival from the airport, the hotel staff gave very welcoming greetings and wonderful cold juice refreshments. All the bell staff, concierge and hotel lobby staff were helpful and efficient. This was a super hotel. Rooms spacious and clean. Small kitchen area with sink, table, refrig. great for keeping a snack or beverage. Coffee maker provided and the makings for tea as well. Room service for eating in. The bedroom and living room each had their own tv and aircond. control which worked well. Each room had sliding glass door to small balcony air cond. does not work with door open. Sliding doors had a child safety lock feature. The housekeeping service was absolutely wonderful and very respectful of privacy wishes and room needs. All the staff were professional, courteous and provided service with a smile. The breakfast buffet was outstanding. The egg chef made perfect omelettes with your choice of ingredients or just a single egg cooked however you wanted. There was no waiting in the buffet line. Once seated with your breakfast meal a refill for your coffee or beverage was offered at the table. The pool is convenient and clean. Many amenities available, The hotel has everything nearby:shopping, restaurants, activities, and the beach is a very short walk. Umbrellas and chaises are for rental on the beach.I would love to go back to the Embassy Suites and would recommend it for anyone who was staying in Wakikki.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Hotel breakfast and evening reception added a lot of value to our stay. Location is great. Close to many restaurants and shopping. A very quick walk to the beach. The pool area is nice and the pool is heated so it is still warm enough to swim on cooler days and in the evenings. We really enjoyed our stay and this hotel may become our home in Hawaii when we visit annually. A great place for families. We stayed with our 5 year old and 9 month old. I wouldn't bother with full ocean view. You only have direct view of ocean from a window. All Lanais face either Diamond Head or City and are very narrow. We paid for full ocean view and will not again as it was not worth it. Hula tower, poolside lanais get the best mid-day to evening sun.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: First time in Hawaii. Very impressed with Embassy. Great central location. Complimentary breakfast was of great standard compared to many other hotels we have stayed in. Rooms spacious. We are family of four and room wasn't boxy at all… Staff were extremely helpful and friendly. Kenny from Bell desk went out of his way to help me find my prescription sunglasses I had lost in Taxi. Thank you very much. I would not have survived the week without them. Highly recommend Embassy Suites :)

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: When I first arrived in Hawaii, I was actually at a different hotel. After a horrible experience, I was quickly looking for a new hotel. I saw great reviews for the Embassy Suites, and they had rooms available, so I decided to stay here, and I am so glad I did! I will and have been recommending this hotel to everyone I can! It made my stay over the top. All of the staff are so friendly, and the full breakfast and managers reception are wonderful! I would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone! It is definitely worth the price!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The Embassey Suites Waikiki is an excellent hotel, the complimentary breakfast and evening drinks are fantastic. We stayed as a family of four and found the rooms excellent for our holiday. The location of the hotel is in a great position to stay in, close to the main strip and close to the beach. The staff are fantastic.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The rooms at this hotel is clean and very nice. The staff is excellent everyone was very friendly. Your a block away from the beach, there is a nice green grass park right there also with lots of palm trees.One thing that just blew us away was the manager Helena, she went out of the way to make sure our anniversary vacation was perfect. Mahalo Helena, you deserve a big raise!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is such a fantastic hotel. The rooms are big and accommodating - mine had sliding glass doors in both the bedroom and sitting area, that went out to a big balcony.
