The complimentary breakfast was fantastic, especially the omelette to order station with tons of fresh ingredients available. The evening managers receptions was also really great - tons of heavy hors d'oeuvres and bartenders with relatively heavy hands pouring free drinks for you!Proximity to the beach is also great - it's about a 2 minute walk down to Waikiki beach. The only downside was the valet parking charge at $35/day - probably $10 higher than most of the other properties I looked at in the area. Although I would say that I easily had at least $10 worth of food and drinks each night at the manager's reception!I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone planning to stay in Waikiki!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here for one night following our NCL cruise and were definitely impressed with the suite and service. We arrived very early so our king room suite wasn't ready- not surprising as it was only 9:00 in the morning. We were offered a juice drink on arrival and a different room if we wanted to check in immediately. We decided to do some sight seeing, so declined the offer and returned much later in the day. Loved the area of the hotel, not on the beach but only a block away. Lots of restaurants and high end shops in the area with a definitely "vibe" at night. The complimentary buffet breakfast around the pool area was fabulous with a lot of hot and cold breakfast items to choose from including an omlete station. Serving staff were very friendly as well.On check out day we had a later flight so decided to leave our luggage with the bell hop and went snorkeling for the day. We were offered a complimentary courtesy room to have a shower and change before heading to the airport - this was fabulous as we had a long night ahead of us on a plane. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful as both the front desks and the bell hops. They flagged down a limo cab for us to return to the airport. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay on Waikiki beach.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We usually stay at the Hilton Hawaiian Village but chose not to this visit for several reasons. The Embassy Suites definitely has it's perks. Let me start by saying the floor plan of the rooms gives families some space. The free breakfast in the morning is definitely a plus. The location in terms of being close the eateries, shopping and Waikiki beach are all a plus too! We actually made it all the way to the International Market Place this time with our young son. We usually only get to Beach Walk (where the Embassy Suites is located) and our son is saying "I'm tired let's go back to the room" when we walk from the Hilton Hawaiian Village. Definitely more food options around the Embassy Suites too! Now for the not so appealing side...if you are used to a resort feel hotel this might not be the right choice for you. The hotel definitely gives you the feeling of being in Waikiki as a city. The hotel halls are narrow, the elevators slow, and probably will be looking at some part of another hotel (even with ocean view). Rooms are slightly on the small side despite being suites. The lobby is not impressive and the pool area has fake grass. The pool is also on the small side and located on the 4th floor. However, if all these things do not matter to you this is a great hotel. We did enjoy our stay here. I mostly loved the location being close to affordable family friendly restaurants, shopping, etc. I would stay here again just for having a living room and the bedroom separated, location of the hotel and the free breakfast in the mornings. They also have a manager's reception with free alcohol, sodas, and appetizers at night. We did not take advantage of this but may be a plus for some.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We always have a great experience at Embassy Suites in Waikiki. They have excellent service and are so helpful and friendly. The spacious rooms are always clean. The breakfast is so good. It is so centrally located so you can walk to anywhere. We love staying here!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My family and I stayed at Embassy Suites for 6 days at the start of March and I couldn't speak highly enough of our stay. From the friendly and accommodating staff that we first saw at check in and lasted until we checked out, to the complimentary fresh breakfast that we enjoyed every morning. The location is perfect, within walking distance of the beach, restaurants like The Yardhouse and The Cheesecake Factory and many high end stores. I'm looking forward to our return, whenever that may be. Mahalo!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We just returned from an 8 day stay at this hotel. We chose it because we wanted the seperate bedroom area from the living room and the little 'kitchenette'. It was PERFECT!We had an ocean view room that was spectacular - that even had a view of the mountains - BONUS!The room was tastefully done and very CLEAN!It was great space for all 3 of us. My friend and I had the bedroom with 2 beds - one for each of us. And my 20 yr. old son slept on the pull out couch all week without one complaint!The staff was excellent! (Well everyone except one of the female Consierge gals.. the guys were awesome - especially Matt Morici! Very helpful and friendly!BREAKFAST EVERY DAY! - They had a full hot breakfast available and included in the hotel stay that was outstanding! Also in the evenings they had a 'reception' with free drinks and Nacho's with Cheese, Pretzels, Corn Chips, Nuts and Fruit. AWESOME!Location - RIGHT in the center of it all! One block to the ocean and a shopping mall on the same block! The main strip that was hot and alive up until midnight EVERY night was only a couple blocks away! But yet it was not noisy for sleeping at all. Perfect!Weather - perfect.. awesome... can't say enough!I won't even look elsewhere.. if and when I go back .. I am staying HERE! Jackie

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Breakfast was wonderful- many options and very fresh and also free. We had a room on top floor with partial ocean view and it was absolutely beautiful. Rooms are spotless and big. They have wonderful entertainment at night with free drinks and snacks. Everyone was so nice and I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone. I sure hope we get a chance to go back to stay there again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Family had a great stay. We decided to have a night away before my husband's year-long deployment to Afghanistan. Value was very good for a family of five, especially with the GREAT breakfast that was included. Manager's Reception was very nice, as well. Generous cocktails for the adults and plenty of snacks for all. The hotel is located in a great spot to walk around Waikiki. Many family-friendly restaurants are nearby. The reception staff was very friendly and provided welcome beverages to the whole family. Nice touch.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel provided easy access to the beach and shopping areas in Waikiki. The staff was friendly and accomodating to our limited needs. The concierge service provided was able to secure us very last minute tour to Pearl Harbor. We would definitely stay at this property again in the future. The two bedroom suite provided more than adequate space for a family traveling with two teenagers. Thanks for a great island hopping stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I have often stayed with Embassy Suites when I travel and have enjoyed my stay each time. This hotel was no different. It is perfectly situated within walking distance of restaurants, shopping, and other sites. It is not on the beach but we had a nice view of the ocean from our room (Aloha tower, 14th floor). Waikiki beach is a very short walk and the Starbucks right across the street was very nice. Starbucks opens at 0430 so I liked to get coffee and greet the dawn on the beach each day.The hotel pool deck is the biggest of any of the surrounding hotels and is well maintained and beautiful. This is where they have the free happy hour each evening with live entertainment and where they serve the complimentary breakfast. Ahhh the breakfast! This is not a small perk! Miso soup with fixins, kimchi, fried potatoes, sausage, toast, waffles, fruit, omelette made to order, etc. And it's served until around 10:30.The suite was very nice. The ONLY complaint I have is their no smoking policy on the balcony. I had envisioned having a coffee and a cigar on the balcony at sunset. This would have been a $250 fine. So I had to sit on the curb outside like a leprous reprobate if I wanted a smoke. Initially I was put out by the mandatory $35/day fee for parking. It seemed like extortion. But once I was on site, I realized that it was worth it and the breakfast savings offset the fee. LEARN TO PARALLEL PARK if you rent a car. (Park at the zoo for $1/hr to go shopping / surfing).The hotel has a full gym, coin operated laundry room, computer / business center, and WiFi access.I cannot recommend this place any more highly! Great for kids or an anniversary getaway like my wife and I enjoyed. Aloha!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We recently returned from a short vacation here and it was an outstanding experience. All Embassy Suites offer free breakfast, and they vary in quality and variety quite a bit. This is the most complete, eclectic breakfast buffet I have ever seen at an Embassy Suites. My family loved the buffet and the rooms too, which are very large by Waikiki standards.What's also very nice about this hotel is when you arrive back from snorkeling or diving on the island, you drive right up to a walkway that is very close to the elevators. It;s easy to get out of the car and up to your room - no having to go through a large, elegant lobby to get there. The valet staff is great and everyone was wonderful too. A perfect place to serve as a base for a family vacation to Waikiki, you can also walk throughout the CityWalk area and get to the beach within minutes.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had a room with 2 queen beds and pull out sofa bed. It is hard to find hotels in Waikiki that will accomodate 5. We had a partial ocean view, which was great. We looked out over Diamond head and could see the ocean as well. The buffet breakfast was fantastic. My kids loved the omelet bar, there was food for everybody. The birds can be a bit annoying as they will swoop in and steal your food if you aren't watching. It isn't an issue as long as you always leave someone at your table to guard the food. The evening reception was great, free drinks for 2 hours. The band was okay, but sometimes they were way too loud and you had to shout to talk to people. We'd sit as far away as possible and then it wasn't too bad. The snacks were basic but still great for kids and adults alike. The hotel is close to the beach (5 minute walk) the beach is rocky though so not great for swimming, you are better off to walk down to Waikiki beach. The pool was good for kids, shallow which was great for my 10 year old as he isn't a strong swimmer. There were tons of lounge chairs, we never had an issue getting one. Very convenient location, restaurants and stores everywhere. Housekeeping was great, the ladies were so friendly. They always had our room cleaned by 10:30 each morning. When we requested extra towels and pillows we were given them right away. The staff went out of their way to make our stay a great one. We will definately recommend this hotel and will stay there again if we go back.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Few places can we stay, my wife and I, and four children in one room. TIP - the AAA price is great, infact, I wasn't an AAA member, but paid to sign up as one day's savings was worth the AAA simple membership. The breakfast was great for our family. While it was cook to order, we were well satisfied with the prepared buffet options. The service as great, and fast. We had to call several times to get more towels and pillows. Parking was rather expensive (by my standards). Beach access was very easy across the street. The managers reception on the one night we stayed was chips and pretzels. The bar tender was great making fun tropical (virgin) drinks for our kids....one guys was quite the comic, we'll remember him for a long time.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Just returned from our stay at the Embassy Suites. Accommodations, location, service was great. Complementary breakfast and manager's reception was outstanding. The one bedroom suite was perfect for myself, my husband and 16 year daughter. The room was quiet, the beds were comfortable and suite was very clean. Would definitely come back and will recommend to others.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Why should you stay? Friendly staff - housekeepers, valet, front desk, food and beverage, breakfast waiters....everyone has a happy faceFood and Beverage staff on the pool deck are great and always looking for ways to make your visit enjoyable....thank you Joe Carmona, manager and Dennis, Keiko, Micheleine, Keola,...we had a great timeAnother great reason....ah! the breakfast - so different from other Embassy's since Waikiki serves multicultural foods AND how about the manager's evening happy hour - free drinks, snacks, and local entertainment ALL included.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: All the greats per recent reviews: breakfast, happy hour & location. We booked it to have some extra room to spread out for our family of 5, price was right, plus one of few hotels that offers Queen beds instead of Full size. Staff incredibly helpful and friendly. Only negatives would be don't book it for the view (isn't one -- but we didn't spend much time in the room anyway) and the pool is small & nondescript, though my kids loved it anyway.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Flew in on direct flight on Hawaiian airlines from JFK to Honolulu with 3 adults and 2 kids. Travel time from airport to hotel is approx. 20 minutes. Located in a clusters of hotels on the relatively new Beach Walk area and literally a 5 min. walk to the beach, the hotel is WELL located. You have Royal Hawaiian mall a few min. walk and Ala Moana mall about a good 20 min. walk, at least 2 ABC stores literally outside the mall and a huge host of restaurants. Having a car in Oahu can be problematic as most hotels charge valet service 20-40$ a night. We wound up just renting a car for the days needed which is a lot simpler since the cost of a rental can be b/w 40-50 bucks anyway. We rented with national and they picked us up and dropped us off at hotel after rental closeby in Discovery Cove. Check in area very nice and relaxing offering drinks and relatively pain free. Got room on 14 floor towards the end of hall facing trump towers with partial ocean view. Upon arrival water on floor and safe did not work which was promptly fixed later that night. Room consisted of small kitchenette area with sink, microwave, coffee maker, fridge. Sleeper sofa, flat screen tv and room had 2 queen sized beds. Bathroom was fair sized with 2 sinks, bathroom and roomy shower tub. Breakfast daily included was buffet, with omelette station, japanese breakfast and good baked goods. Come early to avoid crowds. Managers reception nothing too special, music, nachos, peanuts and mixed drinks and beer. Pool was very crowded with kids. The employees were pretty much hit and miss, some were attentive and others honestly could care less about you especially in the am breakfast. Concierge was very helpful though. Overall if you are not going to spend a lot of time in your room and you are just going to stay in the Waikiki area and on the wakiki beach and you are looking to save some money by eating big breakfasts and drinks on some nights then this is the place for you.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel is in a great location. The suites are outstanding. Breakfast buffet is excellent. Band that plays at Happy Hour is entertaining for all age groups.I will choose this hotel the next time we stay in Honolulu.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Just returned from our stay at the Embassy Suites. This was our 4th time and it is always great. The rooms are clean, the staff are amazing and it is in a great location. The buffet breakfast is the best, with made to order omletts, bacon, fruit etc. There is something for everyone. The managers reception every evening is also wonderful and we love listening to the local father and son band, it is always a treat. We had a two bedroom suite this time which was great for our family with lots of space. Our only complaint was that the sofa bed really wasn't comfortable for our son. I think these could be improved on. We were on the 21st floor and had a great view of the ocean from the balcony. The beach is just a short walk away and there are lots of shops and restaurants close by. It is the perfect location and a bit quieter than the other end of Waikiki.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is an exceptional hotel and very accommodating staff. When we checked in we weren't keen on the location of our room so we asked to be moved to a higher floor. Well, Andrew Boyd went above and beyond to make sure our stay was perfect. Great hotel and experience - real Aloha Spirit!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Clean rooms, very quiet. Comfy beds. Short 5 Minutes to beach and high end stores. Breakfast Buffett and cook to order omletts are delicious.Staff is very friendly and helpful.We got a City View room on the 16. Floor with an amazing view of the Ocean!Ice mashine was broken the whole time we were there on every floor. :(

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We have just returned from a 5 night stay in room 1209 at Embassy Suites. We enjoyed our stay, my husband enjoyed the breakfast and I enjoyed the band that plays on Monday and Wednesday nights. The front desk staff are very friendly and helpful. It is a great location close to the beach. A couple of plates and knives and forks in the kitchen wouldn't go astray. The room was very clean and I found the sofa bed comfortable. The new ABC store across the street is great as is the happy hour down at P J Changs for an early dinner.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I have stayed at this property several times and each time it never fails to amaze me on the great service I receive from check in to check out! And I am hard to impress I have stayed at many different hotels like rich Carlton's, trump and the service here is just as good if not betterThe hotel overall is awesome from location to amenities. Breakfast is the best... The service at the pool is great... The managers reception offers free drinks! Live music and snacks! "THE SERVICE"From when you drive in to the embassy suites you are greeted with a warm welcome from the valets. They were so helpful from offering directions to unloading our luggage before the bell boy could even get to us. I would like to point out Michael who helped my grandmother who is 98 years old in and out the car each time we came and left. Michael assisted my wife with grandma and walked her to the elevators on several occasions. Also Anthony recommend a lot of local spots that we never been before on our past stays. All in all these gentle men were awesome truly the best genuine service I ever had! When I visit oahu I will choose the EMBASSY SUITES.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had a great time at the Embassy Suites. The hotel was in a great location (but not on the beach). We were there with the entire family. This included 4 adults and two teenager boys. We were able to stay in a suite with the entire family. The morning breakfast was awesome, and the evening reception was incredible. Both of these saved me a lot of money. The breakfast selection had everything you could ask for, and the evening drinks and live entertainment had the whole family dancing and meeting new people. Great Time!We were only there for three days, and did not spend anytime at the beach. I understand it was as hort walk away. THe location was great for evening dining with several nice places within minutes of walking distance. We would not hesitate to stay her again in the future.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: we recently stayed a week at the Embassy Suites. Orginally we were given a room by the elevator, & our request to be moved to a quieter room was quickly arranged. The breakfast each morning was really enjoyable, well set out with a good variety of choices. The omlette station was a big hit, & they also did great fried eggs on request! The managers reception was more disappointing - the music was way too loud to be enjoyable, & the snacks were poor. Drinks however, are complimentary. Our room had a very comfortable king bed, but the sofa bed our 13 year old had to sleep on was very uncomfortable & of a poor standard. We loved the location,its quiet even though just by Beach Walk, only a few minutes walk to the beach, & lovely stroll into the heart of Waikiki. Its also nice & close to the bus depot at the Sheraton ('Aloha Landing') where so many tours pick up & drop off. The staff were always helpful & polite, although we were very disappointed with the activities desk. The girl who "helped"us couldnt seem to find a 7 seater rental car for us to collect from Waikiki & informed us we would have to pick up & return from HNL airport. We walked over to see Avis at the Sheraton & organised one for the next day. She also talked us out of a waterfall hike with one tour company & advised us to use another more expensive company. We took her advice but were not impressed with the tour or the extra $$ we paid for it. Wondering if she was working on commission? The pool was very, very crowded at all times, with lots of younger children. Not a place you can go for a quiet, relaxing swim. There are several ABC stores close by, very handy! All in all, not perfect, but overall we were satisfied with our stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Because we are Hilton Grand and Hilton Honor members, our first choice is always a Hilton, especially the Embassy Suites. Because it was spring break, we knew it would cost us a plenty for an"Ocean View" room (No point rooms availiable)..We were on the 19th floor, end unit which was great because it was very quiet. However, when entering the room I expected to see what we had paid for "Ocean Front" room..The Ocean front is from the shutters behind the sofa or on the balcony when it wasn't raining because it was not covered, this room also had a city view. Embassy Suites included the breakfast, which is very good, and the manager's reception in the evening, where they offer complimentary drinks and snacks. The location of the hotel is great. It's not beach front, but we knew that, so if you want to go to the beach, it will cost $50 for an umbrella and two chairs. For the price we paid, I was disappointed with our average room that we had come to expect from Embassy Suites. The bed is quite hard and I woke every night with my back hurting. FYI, the Donald Trump bldg. across the street took up a large portion of the ocean view...Go Donald!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I booked this hotel based on many of the reviews posted here and have stayed at Embassy Suites in the past. Unfortunately, my recent experience at this hotel was just average. Everything was average - our welcome, the staff, the gym, and our room, which was dated, worn, and unfortunately not cleaned very well during our stay. Also, you pay $35/night for parking, which is outrageous, especially when I could not reach the valet at one point to retrieve my car. The pool area is very nice, but not well maintained by the staff. Also, the tile in the pool area becomes very slippery, due to water that accumulates t/o the day, and I saw 2 childen fall on the slick tile, including my own, who slipped and fell into the pool, while walking to get there. Thankfully, she did not seriously injure herself. Perhaps if they swept the area areas around the pool and/or better maintained it, that could help. Also,there were no pool attendants present t/o the day (except in the morning when they cleaned it) and only one server for the entire pool area.Highlights in terms of value and expectations of Embassy Suites included the breakfast, which is very good, and the manager's reception in the evening, where they offer complimentary drinks and snacks. The location of the hotel is great, but there is no beachfront (which I knew going in), so if you want to go to the beach, be prepared to pay $50 for an umbrella and 2 chairs.Unfortunately, for the price that I paid, I was disappointed with my average experience and what I've come to expect from Embassy Suites.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My husband, three kids, my 72 year old mother stayed from March 27 until April 2, 2013. Everything from the valet service to housekeeping was excellent. Everyone was very polite and cheerful. We were visiting from Pennsylvania and would definitely come back to Hawaii. The only thing I didn't like is the fact that we had a street view instead of an ocean view.The room was clean and it was fun to sit at night on the decks and watch the people on the street. It was a bit noisy, though as we were on the second floor.The breakfast buffet was excellent and the do your own omelettes were delicious. I didn't go in the pool or the hot tub, but both looked very clean. Would love to come back!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: In no particular order: Front desk staff were friendly, courteous and welcoming (appreciated the welcome drinks, as well as the wonderful water flavored with fruit). Each time we went to the front desk, we were greeted and looked after in an efficient, friendly manner. Self-parking at this hotel is not an option, but we have nothing bad to say about the valet service. We never had to wait for our vehicle. All the attendants were friendly, courteous and knowledgable when it came to giving us directions. We stayed in the Hula Tower in both a one bedroom and two bedroom suite. Recommend requesting an odd numbered room in the Hula Tower on a high floor. This will give you a sunset view as well as a view of the pool area. Definitely best rooms in the house. There are 21 floors in this tower, so the higher the better. No issues with the elevators. There are 3, and the wait was never very long. If staff are using the elevators, they always give way to guests. Must mention housekeeper Yuet Chan - never had service like this before <3 If you are tall, you may want to know that the bathtubs are bigger in the one bedroom suites. Two bedroom suite is spacious.We have stayed at other Embassy Suites, and my biggest issue is with the cattle call breakfasts. At this hotel, it isn't so bad. They don't pile the food so high that it looks like a trough. Food is continually replenished and the service area is clean. If you are staying for an extended trip, venturing out to other establishments for breakfast will likely be necessary as there isn't much variety day to day.The Grand Lanai where the pool is, breakfast is served and the manager's reception is held is a very nice area. Well planned. Great bartenders! Friendly and a good sense of humour :) This is definitely a family oriented hotel. Lots of kids in the pool all day long. Such a great location - we'd stay here again!Why did I give a "very good" rating on sleep quality and cleanliness? Picky points really, but I was awoken by a phone in a neighbouring room vibrating. Thin walls? Could hear conversations, too. Generally not a problem if you are an early to bed early to rise kind of family. Also in the sleep quality category - don't like the pillows - cheap small standard foam pillows. On the cleanliness side of things, I am the kind of person who wipes out drawers, shelves before I put my things away . . . I really think housekeeping should put more attention to this. Also, if you are going to store luggage on top of an armoire, it would be nice if the suitcase wasn't covered in dust. Most hotels don't do this kind of cleaning, so it really isn't a big issue for me.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: A made-to-order omelet station every morning makes you WANT to wake up for breakfast while on vacation. Chef John made my eggs perfectly every morning, you cant ask for anything more. n addition, happy hour reception EVERY EVENING by the pool- AMAZING. open bar for 2 hours, certain nights of the week had a live band which made it even better. i usually go to Hilton Hawaiian Village because i loved the bar there with the live music too, but this was up to par as well. im biased as a Hilton Hawaiian fan, but i have to admit, i would say both are equally great. this place isnt right on the beach and doesnt have their own lagoon, but it is right on the new beach walk, so the street is gorgeous, not like it was when i last went 2 years ago. Price at the concierge desk, very helpful. the valet guys and the bell desk team, wow, ive never had my car in valet parking delivered to me in under 2 minutes. and yes, no one goes on vacation to use the gym. but the gym is NICE. same equipment at my gym so i felt very at home. i wouldnt know which facility to pick when i visit next year!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed two nights before a cruise in January and loved the hotel. Check-in was wonderful after a long flight, and they served us fresh juice. The pool and grounds were well kept, and every thing was very tidy and clean. The breakfast was terrific. Staff were great and showed us all the interesting things within walking distance. Will stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our family often travels to Hawaii at least once every other year. We have stayed at various locations and Embassy Suites beats them all. This establishment meets our expectations, accomadations, and is very family oriented. Matt & Price were always there for us and guided us to best use the ammenities and free services they offered. Matt, the Expedia concierge, ROCKS! We never walked by without exchanging hello's which resulted in long chats that we had to cut short for other awaiting customers :) This is where we will stay hands down if for some odd reason we cannot get into the Hilton Hawaii Resort. Which Matt introduced us to and we love it, yeah, we bought a piece of that : D This location is good if you and your family want the busy seen and have much to do relatively near by. If we didn't hop the transit system we cabbed it. Reasonable in our eyes. Food, entertainment, and the beach are nearby. Can't wait to see Matt & Price again... BTW, I want to say Price is Bryson but my hubby says it's Price so heads up ;)

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We loved our stay at Embassy Suites in Waikiki. It was our first time to Hawaii, and were extremely happy with the location of the hotel in relation to beaches, restaurants and shopping. walking distance to everything we needed! breakfast included every morning was awesome.....and our room was good for a 2 week stay. The managers reception every night was great too - the live band always got up pumped up for our night out! cant wait to go back!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had our first Hawaii trip in February and the Embassy suites was great. The location is great, the beach is only a 2 minute walk away. The rooms are spacious and clean. The staff was generally helpful, especially the Bell staff and Meena/ Bobby at the tours/concierge desk. The front desk staff seemed distracted. The music afternoon manager's reception was too loud and the food was essentially celery sticks and pretzels, but the beverages were complementary. One tip: the ABC store across the street at 205 Lewers has a deli with great food at reasonable prices.Would be happy to return to this facility

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We received a very nice room upgrade from manager Bob Yeoman and his staff. We celebrated our 35th anniversary this year here with a seven night stay. From the check-in staff, housekeeping, breakfast and happy hour staff all were friendly and went out of their way to help us. The band at the happy hour was very good. The higher level floors are the quietest. The breakfast is quite extensive and they had fried rice one morning. My only concern was the number of pigeons in the breakfast area three or four of the mornings. The staff did a very good job keeping the table clean but the pigeons still came. I don't understand why people feed them - maybe signs asking guests not to feed them would help alleviate the problem.Thanks for another great stay!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I enjoyed my stay at the Embassy Suites in Waikiki immensely! We actually stayed in a city-view 2-bedroom suite - perfect for myself and my toddler, plus my parents. The master bedroom was spacious and comfortable, as was the en suite bathroom. Outside of the the master was the sitting area with a desk/table, couch, chair and TV. The second bedroom was actually an adjoining hotel room, complete with the bedroom and bathroom. The whole suite boasted 2 lanais that looked out at the property across the street, but in between the buildings we could see the Pink Palace and Diamond Head. And if you look to the left, we could see the ocean just past the Outrigger Reef. Overall a nicely appointed room. Note that this is your average Embassy Suites, as it took over the existing property. So our suite actually looked like (and was) a one-bedroom suite with an adjoining room.The buffet breakfast was delicious! There were so many choices, and everything was great. And the hotel is right on Beach Walk, where there are tons of shops and restaurants, and close to the Royal Hawaiian Shopping Center, and the beginning of Kalakaua is just right up the block. It's incredibly convenient.The service --- Wow, the service! I've never had such wonderful service ever, anywhere! Everyone was super friendly, and super helpful. From valet, to the bell desk, to the front desk, to housekeeping, to the wait staff at the restaurant. I've never experienced such incredible service! If I could, I'd rate the service alone 10 stars!Overall, wonderful stay. I'd definitely recommend this property to those with families, and anyone really. Super hotel!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our family of 6 stayed here for 3 nights and I would have stayed longer. The rooms were very clean and updated with comfortable beds & bedding. The views to Diamondhead were amazing from the lanai as well. All of the staff we encountered were ultra friendly - especially those that worked during the happy hour and breakfast buffet. The breakfast buffet was amazing with both the selection of items and the make your own omelets/eggs. It was truly a 5 star breakfast. And to have that built into the price of the room made this hotel very well worth the money. Another bonus was how close the hotel was to Wakiki Beach - less than a five minute walk. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Honolulu.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed there twice in less than 12 months.Clean, convenient, lots of room, good buffet,the kids loved happy hour.Staff always obliging.Very well run and nothing was too much trouble.All external activities were taken care of by the concierge.Will be 1st and only choice next time.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our family of 11 people stayed for 10 days at the Embassy Suites while visiting Waikiki. The proximity to the beach and shops, including the International Marketplace was great.The breakfast was definitely a bonus for us, as meals are so expensive in Waikiki, especially for a family our size.We also looked forward to the Managers Reception each night, and got to know the entertainers through a musical connection, it was just like reconnecting with old friends.Overall a great place to stay, as well as being affordable.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I really like embassy suites room size, breakfast, happy hour , great value , so I choose this location for our last day in honolulu.. It was a feat with taxi driver to get from the airport to hotel , with traffic, road were blocked to downtown( we cut through other hotel parking garages) . There had been a marathon earlier and now a parade was in progress. We were pleasantly surprised to be given an upgraded room from city view to ocean view room , and even more surprised upon opening the door room 1630 , two balconies one ocean view and the other double balcony side city/ ocean view, beautiful room ! But the best surprise occurred when were returned from happy hour and while enjoying our very last day in Hawaii on the balcony, were heard the loudest bang...followed by fireworks!!! How lucky are we, front row seats! We returned to the lobby immediately after and found our receptionist, thanking her as she beamed. Thank you for making our stay amazing.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Awesome hotel! We stayed here July 10 to the 18th, 2012 for $279 per night. Central location, about 10 min walk to beach access, within walking to shops, trolley stops and restaurants. Our room was facing Trump hotel and the Pacific Ocean. We were on a high floor and the elevators were reasonably fast. Complimentary full breakfast daily: bacon, sausage, hashbrowns, made to order omelettes, scrambled eggs, wide assortment of fresh fruit, cereals, bakery, beverage station; 4 different types of juices, coffee, tea, milk, even miso soup and rice. Complimentary evening reception nightly from 5:00 to 7:00pm with live band that was fantastic!!! They were a family of 5 (dad, 3 sons and a daughter). Sang new and older songs for everyone to enjoy. Included 3 different types of hawaiian drinks, wide range of mixed drinks, wine, beer, and the beverage station was open for juices and pop. Snacks accompanied the reception with fresh veggies and dip, chips, pretzels, and pub mix. Complimentary free wi-fi in our room as well as in public areas like the breakfast/reception area. Beach towels provided free of charge for their beautiful outdoor pool with lawn chairs and tables. Towels in your room. Our room had a large lanai with a table and lawn chairs for us to dry our wet and sandy swimwear, and slippers. We had a suite with a separate bedroom and living area with 2 queen beds, refrigerator, sink, coffee maker, and 2 flat screen tv's. A/C worked very well and the staff were courteous and friendly. My only complaint is the person that runs the Activities desk near the check-in counter. He was hawaiian and i think his name was Brian. He works for Hilton and was very pushy in trying to sell me "time-shares" to Hilton properties. I made the mistake of signing up with him to see a 2 hour presentation at the Hilton Hawaiian Village. I changed my mind the next day and cancelled. I also made the mistake of giving him my real cell number. He called me on my cell shortly thereafter, while I was having lunch with my family and would not listen to any of my reasons I cancelled. He kept going on, asking, "why..., why...., etc. This call must have lasted at least 30 min, wasting my expensive cell phone minutes. I was becoming very irate, raising my voice, and being very short with him. I had to restrain myself from telling him to f...off!! You're ruining my vacation!! Beware!!! All guests at this hotel...Do not sign up for these presentations (timeshares) unless you really want a Hilton timeshare, because they will not let you off the hook easily if you change your mind unless you give them a false number. Oh, I forgot to mention that they entice you with a $100 American Express credit card if you sign up. It's not worth it if your not committed.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great hotel in Waikiki for families. This is a great location to the Beachwalk and the shopping area and night life... The kids loved the pool the breakfast and we got a free upgrade to the corner room with a partial ocean view. Highly recommend this hotel for families, getting the free breakfast is worth the extra cost. Manager receptions with great snacks and drinks was great too.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Everything about this hotel was awesome.The rooms were excellent for the five of us.The bonus breakfast saved us around $60 a day.Proximity to the beach was great and the friendly happy staff could certainly teach us Aussies a thing or two.The best thing was Matt the concierge.He went above and beyond to help us with tours and a mix up we had. Matt was helpfull and caring and we were sad to leave without seeing him.We hope he gets a pay rise as he certainly deserves one. He would be a fantastic asset to any company so thanks again Matt. :)

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Good location close to restaurants and night lifeRoom ceilings are low and low in fitness centerCity view room is terribble view should have just booked the ocean view did/not realize as a gold member it was so hard to get an upgradeRoom was spacious Air conditioning was excellentBreakfast was great No restrooms near fitness centerI wish they had towels at the pool rather than having to go up to the room to go to the pool what a inconvenience

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We absolutely loved this place!! My kids constantly ask me when we are going to go back to this hotel. We stayed here during the perfect time of year,September right after everyone started school . The price for the room was very reasonable and it included a beautiful breakfast buffet. The room was very big. We have five in our family and everyone had somewhere to sleep. The location was great. You could walk almost everywhere from this hotel. The beach was very nice and we saw several sea turtles. We had a great time and I highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We only spent one night here at the tail end of our vacation and it was fantastic. We enjoyed a great band and the accommodations were top notch. The hotel was in the center of everything and very accommodating. Parking is expensive and we realized we may not even have needed a rental car but having one gave us the chance to visit Pearl Harbor. It was all good and we definitely recommend this hotel. We did not have a beach view but did get upgraded to a two bedroom suite and had a lovely view of Diamondhead! Everyone went out of their way to be friendly!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Waikiki was packed, but the Embassy Suites felt like a peaceful refuge from the crowds. There were always plenty of deck chairs, lots of tables at breakfast, short lines for cold drinks, plentiful towels. We loved the action and excitement of the beach, but the hotel was a much more relaxing place.The half day rate was a nice surprise for our checkout day when we had a late flight - we stayed until 7pm.The only complaint was the first morning we heard our neighbor's crying baby from about 5am on - a regular problem in Hawaii, where little ones wake up in their home time zones and hours earlier than local sunrise. The hotel should have had more soundproofing.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Excellent location! Great room sizes. Beautiful pool. We felt like we were in the center of all of the activities. The hot breakfast offered a huge savings for a family of six. Since breakfast was ready to go just before 6:30am each day we were able to enjoy it before our excursions saving additional money. The manager's reception could use some work, chips and salsa and pretzels basically, but overall a great location, nice, clean, super friendly.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Everything is so close by. Breakfast in the morning was the best! In the afternoon you can't miss the managers reception!!! I used the gym and found it to have the great new equipment and the business center was really nice! I was able to print my bording pass there for free. Botha are open 24/7(which is very convenient) Staff was excellent, they went above and beyond! LOVED IT!!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We are a military family and stayed here instead of the local military hotel for almost a month while waiting on housing. This is a great place to stay! The hotel upgraded us to a beautiful 2 bedroom, the happy hour and the band was outstanding, the staff was friendly and helpful, and the free breakfast was great. Plus the location was good (quick walk to beach) and we parked for pretty cheap (monthly rate) in the military parking lot next door. You also get free internet with your stay and the hotel has a great business center which was very helpful for our house hunting since there was everything we needed (printer, fax machine, computer, paper, etc...). My kids loved the pool as well. I recommend if you are coming in on orders and what a fantastic place to stay you stay here.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I have been meaning to write this review for awhile. My daughter and I stayed at the Embasssy Suites 2 weeks prior to Christmas. 2012. It was excellent, the location is perfect to beach and all shops and restaurants. The suite had heaps of room, we were so glad we chose to get a hotel with a seperate living area as we were staying for awhile. The cleaning standards of the hotel staff servicing our room were second to none, we even had to tell them some days" no don;t bother to vacum today". The bathroom is spacious and well appointed , the bedroom had 2 really comfortable beds with a TV in both the bedroom and living room.The kitchenette was an added bonus, all the equipment was is good clean order.Pool area great, breakfast which was included in our rate offered all manner of different food whcih was yummy, expecially the omelettes they cook in front of you to order.The staff were always really friendly and helpful.You are maybe one or two minute walk from the beach.This is really a first class hotel and we are definitley returning.Hawaii on all is the most beautiful, relaxing and fun place to stay, can't wait to return.Thanks to all at Embassy for contributing to our wonderful holiday.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: If you are on business in Hawaii, the unfortunate fact is that virtually all hotels on Oahu are located in Waikiki, so your choice needs to be based on ease of access within Waikiki, parking rates, well insulated rooms (vis a vis the tourists onn holiday partying in the next room) and attentive staff. The Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach Walk meets all these needs very well. Location is not quite at the "top" of Waikiki but near it, so you can enter and exit without having to drive deep into the "strip" area further Diamond Head. Valet parking (only option) is a little pricey ($35/day) but not unusually so for Waikiki, but the service is fast and friendly. (But you'll need to factor that into the room rate quoted if you plan to have a car.) Breakfast is good - fruit, yogurt, breads, eggs, bacon/sausage, rice, potatoes, Japanese dishes, kimchee for the Koreans, and a cook-to-order omelet bar. The only negative is the coffee. Choice of either a Nestle's instant-coffee-flavored "brewed" coffee, or the weirdly flavored Douwe Egeberts brand (yes, the company famous for pipe tobacco, which might explain the weird flavor. Best brew your own in the room (better coffee packs there) and bring it to breakfast, unless you are from the areas of the country that likes your hot water with a hint of coffee flavor, in which case, enjoy!)Internet wireless is free in the rooms and reasonably fast. The gym was good enough to keep up a minimal workout routine while on your trip. Room was very clean. (Be careful, however, unless you actually need the handicapped-accessible room, to get a regular room, as you can't hang your pants in the closet because of the low bars.)Because the Hawaiian economy is so dependent on tourism, the rates for hotels fluctuate wildly, this hotel included. So, if you can get it under $200/night, this will be a fabulous find. $200-$250 a night, a good deal, but over $250 a night, think about it. It will depend on the season, of course. During tourist season, your business better be really good if you're spending $400/night for a room...I would definitely stay here for under $250/night.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The hotel is all suites - some are better than others - the breakfast was just great - plenty of fresh fruit and they hand make an omellete for you - there's great coffee and the pool is wonderful - the beach is a 5 minute walk and its not too rocky as most of the ebaches are on Waikiki - the staff are okay - no problems but just not too freindly - but not rude - the conceirge is great loads of good advice for eating out. Restuarants abound as you would expect and American favorites like cheese cake house is just brilliant as well as the Hard rock - Tony Romas is awesome for ribs!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Staff: The staff were wonderful, from the hotel check-in to the wait staff in breakfast area. Our flight was later and we were accomodated extremely well even after check-out until we left the property about 3pm. We appreciated that very much.Breakfast: The breakfast was very nice and offered a great variety of foods.Manager's Reception: Our first night there, a band was playing during the manager's evening reception and a great variety of drinks were offered. The snacks offered in the evening were nothing to write home about, but provided good munchies (goldfish, carrot sticks, nachos). Room: Make sure you don't have a room right next to the elevator, we found that to be a bit noisy, but didn't ask to change rooms. (I'm certain we would have been accomodated if we'd asked.) The room and balcony were wonderful, although small for the cost.Location: There are so many restaurants and shopping areas available within walking distance that we enjoyed strolling for a couple of hours in the early evening. There is a Denny's restaurant across the street and a food court in the shopping mall very close by.Overall, if the cost weren't so extremely high, I would give this hotel an excellent rating.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: we stayed at the Embassy Suites for 10 nights in late Feb/Early Marc in room 2132 (top floor) in the HULA Tower.i LOVED having a lounge room as well as the bedroom, allowed more space for more shopping and we weren't having to step over our suitcases all the time. bed was super comfy, two tvs, lots of pillows, plenty of space in the bathroom and a big enough fridge for drinks and left overs.the location is perfect. lots of good and fancy restaurants close by (Denny's, Cheeseburgerland)and lots of the good restaurants only 5 mins walk away, (California Pizza Kitchen and Cheesecake Factory). the ABC Store next to Dennys was great. had the usual stuff and then extras like hot food, salads, awesome, best one we saw.the Service at the hotel was fine, most were very friendly and said hi as you walked past. we didn't get into the pool as we were out most days and the temp was only 24 degrees C, so not warm enough to want to cool down, but lots of people were there. the gym has digital scales, so you can weigh your suitcases when you have packed them for your flight home. The Buffet Breakfast was yes, mostly the same each day, but that gave our adjusting stomachs some consistency, so we were happy. there was fruit (loved the pineapple), cereals, breads, bagels, pastries, any way you like eggs (omlette or fried), sausages, rice, bacon, scrambed eggs, potatos and then a selection of hot sweets (pancakes or french toast or waffles), heaps to choose from. they also had lots of fruit juices and teas and coffees.The Pink Trolley "pick up" stop was only one block up adn two block over on Olohana St (king Kalakaua Plaza) and "drop off" point was Saratoga Road (Trump Tower), so really close and easy to get all your shopping back to the hotel.we found it all easy and comfortable. even though we were right beside the lifts (and everyone had warned us), we didn't find it too annoying. as we were on the top floor, the lifts didn't come all the way all the time. and it sort of gave us some background white noise, so we slept fine.i would highly reccommend this place. it was fantastic.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had such a good experience at the downtown Embassy Suites in Portland—we did get a bit of an upgrade to a larger suite then--that we decided to book with their hotel in Waikiki. We were given a room on the 16th floor with a bit of the ocean visible from the balcony. (Yes, there was a balcony with some chairs and two small tables.) As always with Embassy Suites hotels, breakfast is included and features made to order omelettes. Being Hawaii, there were tropical fruit slices available. Some of the other food will probably boost your cholesterol levels to unacceptable heights. But then you live only once anyway.While there was a 24 hour fitness center and a swimming pool available, we old folks stayed away from these strenuous activities. However there is also a Manager’s Reception from 5:30 to 7:30 pm where nibbles and alcoholic beverages are served. Unlike during our Portland visit, we managed to go three times.Obviously prices in Waikiki are somewhat higher than in Portland. But for us it is the extra space that comes with a separate sitting room that leads us to think highly of the Embassy Suites. We would definitely consider staying at this hotel chain again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I stayed at the Embassy Waikiki the first week of Feb 2013. The location is perfect. It's walking distance to many restaurants and shops. The parking does cost quite a bit, but their valet service is speedy at almost all times of the day. I stayed for a business trip, so only had a little fun time to enjoy the property. The pool is nice, but small. There is a hot tub and pool bar. The fitness room and business center were good sized and accomodating. In general, good service and the rooms were nice, spacious, and clean. I stayed in the Aloha tower on the 16th floor. The breakfast buffet is huge and has an omelett station. It was nice and open and you can eat your breakfast under a cover or in the sun. My only gripe is the elevators. There are only 2 and we had to wait quite a bit of time every time we used the elevators. Very slow. Other than that, the property is great and you can't beat the location. In the heart of Waikiki Beach Walk and there is beach access just across the street. Restaurant tip: Try Giovanni's across the street for their Coconut Macadamia Nut pancakes!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Everything from a great welcoming to a great view. Breakfast buffet was much better than normal in the states and included, so was the manager reception every weekday. The gym gym was good, and maybe the only minus is the pool.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Rooms are very quiet with comfortable bedding and while the mini-fridge and small microwave are nice there were no plates to heat food on. Breakfast buffet was very nice with many selections and arranged with two identical sides so there were no lines. Eating areas were both inside and out so you can enjoy being in Hawaii. I found the pool area to be very small for a hotel with so many rooms and because it’s really nestled in a high-rise section you have to wait quite awhile for the sun to reach the chairs. The location is about a 5 min walk to the beach which is a very narrow ribbon of sand and many of the rooms have a view of other buildings but rooms have a balcony with access from both the bedroom and living room. Manager’s reception was arranged well so lines were minimal drinks were so-so served in plastic cups and food was mainly salty snacks. Was nice to have the use of a hospitality room after check-out since I had an evening flight and could freshen up. I would have raited this hotel higher if the prices were more reasonable. The downside of the sudden availability of cheap airfare are soaring hotel prices.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: For the price we thought we would have had a nicer room and a better location to the beach. We enjoyed the breakfast buffet and the pool. There was enough food at breakfast and at happy hour to help us cut back on our expenses during the trip.The bathroom was large, but the beds weren't all that comfortable. It felt kind of worn and in need of some TLC. Rooms must get a lot of wear and tear. I guess.What made the pool great was the tiki style bar and bar staff. What a great group of people who do everything in their power to please.Breakfast is amazing. Get there early so you can get a nice table outside and away from the crowds.When you walk outside expect to be approached over and over by timeshare people who have an agenda to get you to a presentation and buy a place. It did get too much as we walked around on some days.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach Walk provided us with a nice stay. The staff was friendly and the rooms were clean. You are in Hawaii so the rates are much higher than back in the states. The rooms were nice but not as nice as the rate would suggest. Considering that you are going to spend most of your time not in your hotel room but outdoors, that is not a deal breaker. The breakfast was good with lots of options. It is nice not having to go out hunting for breakfast before going to the beach. Happy Hour / Managers Specials in the evenings are a ncie way to wind down before turing in to bed. The location is good but not great. Honolulu is okay but kauai and The Big Island offer far more opportunities and beauty.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed in an ocean view suite (#830) for 22 nights from January 20 until February 10 in the Aloha Tower. This is a corner suite with one balcony off the living room facing directly towards the beach and a second double balcony off the living room and bed room that looked over the park and toward the Hilton Village. This room had excellent views, especially of the Friday night fireworks at the Hilton.We found the suite to be in very good condition, with a tropical theme in the furnishings, flooring and wallpaper. The living room is a little smaller as it loses about 60 sq ft to the stairwell, but as there was just the two of us, we did not miss the extra space. If you were to use the hide a bed though things might get a little snug. The suite on the opposite side of the hall (829) is much larger as it is not impacted by the stairrway, but you lose the great side view to the park and HHV.Maid service by the regular maid was excellent and she would always wish us a good day when we saw her. She seemed to adapt to our schedule and always had the suite made up by the time we returned each morning around 11:30 from our 10k walk. On the two days that she was off, there was a noticable drop in the service as she would only replace one glass instead of two, forget to leave coffee or beach towels. Nothing serious, just a different level of attention to detail.The hallways seemed to need to be vacuumed and I do not think that happened during our stay.We did need to contact maintenance three time for minor issues (Burned out lightbulb, one tv lost connection,, ect) and all were quickly resolved. We did have one annoying problem on our second last day that should not have happened. We came back from breakfast and could not get into our room. Our key card, and the maid's would flash green then red and would not unlock the door. Maintenance needed to be called and the battery replaced. The card lock had been flashing yellow and then green since we checked in. Apparently the yellow flash was a warning that the battery needed replacing. The maids, or three maintenace personal should have noticed this when they were entering the room. If this had happened the next morning when we were coming up to the room after breakfast to pick up our bags to catch the taxi to the airport, the wait for maintenance would have been a very stresfull time.We enjoyed the included breakfast every morning. There is a wide variety of things to choose from. I do not understand why reviewers claim that there is no variety, as we had no problem over 22 days. Just have pancakes one day, an omlette the next, then french toast the next (all with LOTS of bacon of course). Maybe they are the ones that needed to have pancakes, an omlette, bacon, sausages and whatever they could fit on one large plate every day? There are brand name cereals, oatmeal, fruit, salad, yogert, pastries, toast, hash browns and the list goes on. Staff try and clean the tables as quickly as possible, and are very friendly and will often ask if you need anything and will bring coffee, juice or whatever you ask for. Birds are an issue, but they were present wherever there was an outdoor patio - which means most restaurants and the food courts.We never had a problem getting a lounge chair by the pool, and the pool seemed to be well used by children. The pool also seemed to be at least as big or bigger than those we saw at other hotels. Despite only being 4 floors from the pool level, we never heard any noise intrusion into our room, and hotel secuity closes the pool at 10 PM.We also appreciated the nightly managers cocktail reception. The bartenders did not skimp on the alcohol and the drinks were all free poured (no measuring). Wine, mixed drinks, beer and straight bar shots are all available. After 22 nights we knew the band's playlist as well as they did.We chose this property for the location and the price. The location is surrounded by great places to eat (and a few trading on thier reputation), not to mention shopping, and is a short walk to the beach. As this was our 4th visit to Hawaii, and as we had been to all the other islands, we just wanted to park in one place and relax. The price using an AAA rate and considering the included breakfast and evening drinks was reasonable to us. We looked at other nearby and next door one bedroom suites and the Embassy was far and away the least expensive. We did not want just a hotel room as 22 days in one room may have been a little too much togertherness. Having two tv's was also a big plus.The only downside to this propery is its "lobby" and that is using the term loosely. It is more of a parking garage entrance and is totally devoid of any character and is not very welcoming. The first respose getting out of the taxi was "oh oh, this might have been a mistake", but once you are checked into your room, all is well. And after that first Kona Longboard on the balcony, everything is even better!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Considering we paid $400 U.S./night for a one bedroom with a partial ocean view we were rather disappointed. The room was dated and the couch and carpet looked soiled. The maid came and made the bed and changed the dirty towels each day but we don't think she ever vaccuumed and on several occassions never removed dirty dishes/glasses or removed garbage. The pillows on the beds were about the same size as you get on an airplane - rediculous. The buffet breakfast was almost identical everyday which after 10 days got really boring. They didn't have enough staff in the eating area so the tables were often not wiped down or you'd have to stand with your food and wait for a table to be cleaned.Our telephone didn't work properly so no one could call our room for our entire stay. People calling would have to leave messages and then we'd have to call them back. We stayed here 2 years ago and it was fantastic but it has really gone downhill. I'd find a different hotel or rent a condo next time.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Embassy Suites is in a fantastic location on the Beachwalk. Everything is close by - restaurants, shops, the beach. The hotel rooms are spacious and comfortable with lovely furnishings. The complimentary breakfasts each morning and managers drinks every afternoon are awesome.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The hotel is very well located and was comfortable and reasonably priced. The managers receptions every evening were brilliant. The concierge staff were very helpful. There are numerous excellent eating and shopping venues near by.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The Embassy Suites is a great hotel in Waikiki - it in a great location right next to beach walk and within walking distance to all the great shopping, restaurants and literally a couple of minutes walk to Waikiki Beach. The staff were very friendly, the rooms clean and comfortable, and the hotel provided great breakfast options and every afternoon (5.30-7.30) the Manager's reception provided free nibbles and drinks (including wine, spirits and cocktails of your choice) while a live band played. My family stayed here in January 2013 and we would definitely not hesitate to stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: First time in Honolulu. Embassy Suites was a great place to stay. Close to shopping and the beach. Would highly recommend. Be aware that Honolulu is a very busy city and traffic can be an issue. Restaurant selection near the hotel is diverse.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is my third stay at this hotel within the last 5 years and I was stupid for trying the Hawaiian Village last time. Friendly Staff, excellent manager's reception at night and the BEST Embassy breakfast of all my traveling days. They had the typical omlet to order plus much, much more. A fusion of American and Japanese foods and fruits. I could go on and on but this is the place to stay. The only bad thing is the expensive parking at the hotel, so I was able to park at the Ft. Shafter-Hale Koa lot much cheaper.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My fiance and I really enjoyed our recent stay at the Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach Walk and would recommend it to anyone planning to vacation on Waikiki Beach. The location is excellent and safe, as the hotel is on the upscale Beach Walk and across the street from the beach. We were upgraded from a one-bedroom to a two-bedroom suite at check-in and were amazed by the amount of space we had. We had a city view room and actually preferred that to an ocean view room, since the city view has increased opportunities to see rainbows and is beautiful at night. The rooms were clean and nicely but simply decorated, and we slept soundly on the comfortable beds. The free, hot breakfast buffet with made-to-order omelets is an excellent value, especially considering that no kind of free breakfast is offered at most Waikiki hotels. We also enjoyed the daily manager's receptions, which feature carrots and dip and nachos and cheese; free drinks (alcoholic and non); and live entertainment (sometimes). In addition, I proposed to my fiance on Waikiki Beach, and the concierge worked with the staff to give me helpful suggestions (e.g., quiet spots on the beach to propose) and to have champagne, unusually excellent chocolate-covered strawberries, and rose petals awaiting our return the night of -- which was not the night we checked in, so the timing had to be right. The pool is heated and large, although not huge, and the hot tub is just the right temperature. The hotel may not offer the best value for solo travelers, but for couples of all ages for families, the Embassy Suites offers an excellent value.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We arrived a bit early & the Embassy checked us in. We stayed on the 20th floor ocean view. Great view of the ocean & pool area. The mattresses were great. Wish i could take the mattress home. Slept so good!!! Breakfast was good. Loved the 2 room suite. I would like them to have some lower prices for people staying longer than a couple days. Or stay 4 days get 1 free. Mau does that at some hotels. Their prices are a bit steep~but overall we really enjoyed our stay there. Nice place.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We are a family of 4 with 2 teenage girls just returned from 8 nights at the Embassy Suites, This was a fantastic place to stay, after a 10 hour sleepless overnight flight from sydney, we were given free fruit punch told they would try to check us in early which they were able to do even though the hotel was full, they also offered us free breakfast that morining, We were given a spacious, clean and quiet room on the 16th floor, the beds were extremely comfy, The free breakfast is good value and convient to not have to trawl around looking for somewhere to have that first heartstarter coffee. Every staff member we dealt with were friendly, professional and made us feel very welcome. The position is one block from the beach, we mainly walked to most places but a trolley stop is very close by. We had great meals at the "Shore Bird" and the "Waikiki Grill" I reccommend booking in the morning to get tables by the water.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was a great centrally located hotel. The included breakfast and manager's reception a great plus. The pool on the fourth floor was quiet without all the hustle and bustle of Waikki. A great place for all especially families with the included breakfasts.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Suites, great breakfast with made to order items, awesome manager reception. Great staff!Just steps away from a sweet beach. We will return. From the bellman to the waitstaff everyone here seemed happy and helpful.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our family of 4 stayed here for 8 nights from the 3rd January 2013. We stayed on the 3rd floor of the Hula Tower. After being cooped up in the one room on Maui for the previous 8 nights, we really appreciated the extra room in our suite. However, if you're looking for a fully stocked kitchenette, you won't get it here. No plates, cutlery etc provided. Having said that, with the free breakfast provided and manager's drinks from 5 30 to 7 30 pm each evening, you don't really need to eat in the rooms. You can't beat the location of this hotel. It's a street away from the beach and right in the centre of Waikiki, with hundreds of restaurants at your doorstep.We ate at the buffet breakfast each morning. There was too much to choose from, but it did have a cafeteria, summer camp feel about it. The manager's reception is a real bonus with free alcohol and snacks. We enjoyed the free entertainment and wifi throughout the building. I don't really think this is the place for a romantic honeymoon getaway. The decor is a bit tired, the carpets could use a bit of a refresh. The pool was busy and full of kids and it doesn't get a lot of sun. However, for our family of 4, it was the perfect base from which to explore Oahu. We had a fantastic time.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The complimentary breakfast and manager's reception (2-hour open bar!)makes the Embassy Suites Waikiki the bargain of the century! The location is great--close to the beach, public transportation and shops. The room was more than adequate; the suite concept is a major plus. It's nice to have the extra room to stretch out after a long day of sightseeing and travelling. Comfy bed and pillows.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The staff at the hotel were amazing, it is a great location, and the Manager's reception and breakfast buffet are like no other on the Islands. Great entertainment from the band and the hula show. Very clean. Nice views from the upper rooms of Ft Derussy park, Waikiki, the ocean, and the fireworks from the Hilton on Fri night. And I love the pillows! (very comfy)

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed for 6 nights on our recent trip to Hawaii. The staff were pretty good and I enjoyed the services. It was also fairly clean. The room was a bit small, but still pretty nice. Our room was located directly beside any other rooms and we never heard anyone else making noise on our floor. Our room did have a pool view though, making it loud during the day, but we personally didn't mind that much and it reasonably quiet at night, though our room was right by the elevators and we could hear them going up and down the shaft. The only time that was really bothersome though was on Friday night at about 9:30. The pool was warm, which was good, but it wasn't very deep. I also really enjoyed the food that was served at the manger's reception, they had "snack" items such as chips and vegetables, so we didn't make a meal out of it, but it was still good. The fridge was loud at night though, so we ended up turning it off (you can do this by opening the door and pressing the "snooze" button located on the left side). Overall, I would recommend it.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great location, can not beat the complimentary breakfast or Manager's Reception. The band that plays 4 nights of the week are awesome and fun to watch. Hotel is clean, friendly staff and professional!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: They "upgraded" my room to an ocean view, but it was really partial ocean, and I couldn't sleep well because they put me right next to the elevators. It was noisy all night--up and down the elevators went... Also, when I arrived via taxi, there were 2 bell/"workers" standing and talking to each other; I was ignored until I stood and stared at them. Then I just proceeded to carry my own bags. They seem to cater to families and large groups.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed during Probowl 2013. Location to shops, coffee and dining can't be beat. This property is not on the beach but the beach is just a short walk away. warning the close by beach is bit rocky under water so wear water shoes or move your beach blanket further down Waikiki. Room was clean and predictable for this brand. Pool was not so special. However, service from housekeeping, the bellmen, valet and waitstaff at breakfast and happy hour was a great surprise. Everyone was so friendly and helpful with suggestions. We enjoyed our stay here.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Amazing location, great breakfast, very helpful staff! We booked our reservation on the Embassy website 5 months in advance knowing that Christmas time is peak season and saved over $4,000. Even though the hotel isn't directly on the beach, the view was spectacular of both mountain and ocean. Since this was our first trip to Hawaii, we came with ideas but not a set schedule/agenda. After working with Matt M. at the concierge desk for 15 minutes, our schedule was perfectly arranged for our entire vacation with wonderful recommendations (be prepared to pay at the time you're making reservations). Just make sure you get to the concierge desk early- there was a huge line later in the morning and for the rest of the day it seemed. Matt made all the difference in our vacation experience! The boardwalk shopping provided great restaurant choices, stores, and evening hula dancers that happened to be seen from our balcony. When we travel we always stay at Hilton properties but this hotel by far was our best experience from the cleanliness, service, food/drinks, and location. We WILL be back to stay!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed two nights to unwind from the flight in to Hawaii and to do the Waikiki area, before heading for our holiday house on the North Shore. We had a 1 bedroom apartment on the 16th floor, and everything about our stay was good with the exception of the wifi connection, which continually dropped, if it was ever there to start with. Great pool area and bar, and there are plenty of ABC stores around to get supplies. Short five minute walk to Waikiki Beach. Kitchenette in room had a bar fridge, kettle, coffee machine and sink.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: LOVED IT, LOVED IT, I have stayed at a lot of hotels all over the world but this one by far is the best and if I didn't have to earn an income I would stay there for the rest of my life. Where do I start, we were staying at another hotel that was so bad we left there after two days. Very lucky to get into this hotel for the following 14 days thanks to Hotels.com. Location is a plus, wouldn't change a thing. THANK YOU EMBASSEY SUITES.Spacious, everything we needed. Coffee machine, kettle for tea, microwave, huge balcony 2 X TVs etc,etc & the most comfortable bedding ever. Housekeeping was the best, very friendly and helpful. Front desk customer service was exceptional. Free WiFi. Free breakfast with everything you could think of plus cooked to order omlette, happy hour ( 2 hours) with free cocktails, wine, beer, snacks & entertainment. I cried when I had to leave but am already planing my return. With all the extras this hotel offers you can't go wrong. Very good value. Highly recommened. See you soon.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
