review_body: Our room was loaded with dust. Electrical outlets didn't work. When we tried to plug devices into them, many times shocks would fly out of the socket. Several of them didn’t work. Two light fixtures did the same thing; shocks flew out when they were turned on. Bathroom was dirty upon arrival (urine stains on toilet seat. The maid left a wet, dirty towel on our floor and since we were gone most of the day, by the time we returned, there was black mold all over the towel. Also, the vents in the bathroom did not work. One nice thing the maid did was to leave us extra amenities to use in the bathroom such as soap and lotion. I had an asthma attack due to the dust and filth of the room. The carpets were old and torn. Also, the hinges on the wall for the locks between the two rooms had fallen off and there were only screws in its place. The blinds were so loaded with dust that you had to scrape it off. The curtains were filthy, had hand prints all over them (like mud) as did the windows. I would not spend that much to stay in such a low quality room again. Too overpriced for the quality.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at the ES from 1/22 - 1/24. For us, the stay was excellent. We were 1st time visitors to the Islands and stayed on Oahu and the Big Island for 7 nights. If you don't already know, travelling around in Honolulu can at first seem daunting as many of the roads either don't display signs or change the name of the street you are on. Beachwalk is a short one-way street and the entry to ES is towards the end. You drive into a covered area to drop off your car. Not sure if there was self parking or not as we chose valet. At a seated check-in they popped a couple of passion fruit drinks (non-alcoholic) in front of you....nice touch. We enjoyed their free breakfasts in the morning and their drinks in the evening at poolside. All the staff was amazing and very helpful. Our room was 1530 with an absolutely gorgeous view. It was a corner room with 2 different lanai's (porches for you mainlanders) and 3 different accesses to the lanais. Since I was still on mainland time AND I get up early anyway, I found myself on the lanais staring off into the beauty of Waikiki in the early morning hours. The dining close was good. Roy's is on property (it really doesn't say this, but it was right off our elevator), but we opted on our first night to walk down to Dukes and back to get a feel for our surroundings. There is a really good (and highly rated) ice cream hole in the wall right across the street from the main lobby. (Henry's place) and casual dining all over from sushi to hamburgers. We had absolutely no issues with cleanliness, noise, water pressure or bad service (the essentials in my book). I would definitely come back here again. One more note to travellers: You might think that the ocean views are the best and they might be for you, but the mountain views are also fantastic. You'll have clouds and fog wisping over rainforest covered mountians. You will not go wrong either way.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We could not have been more pleased with our stay at ES. From the moment we arrived the service was superb. The Valet was waiting with a smile, the Front Desk offered a friendly greeting offering each of us a passion fruit drink. Our room was ready and clean. The evening Managers Reception offered plenty of snacks while the breakfast was beyond my hopes. Service was excellant and the food was good, fresh, and plentiful, sitting outside was an added plus. There were six of us (7 counting a baby). The kids enjoyed the pool. Towels were plentiful. There is nothing I would change with this stay and I plan to go back next year. Thank you Embassy Suites :0)

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The room was spacious, clean, and had a sink, microwave and frig. Room service was reasonable and great food. Service was excellent. The breakfast was fantastic. Best hotel value on the beach. Location is close to everything and only a short walk to the beach.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Nice rooms. Awesome breakfast, go at 9:30 load up and skip lunch. Very helpful staff. They will point out the local restaurants and price ranges. Thats really all I have to stay and this stupid review wants 200 characters.KWAJT

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed 4 nights here- 2 kids and 2 adults. Other than not having 2 beds for the kids (one big one- not suitable teenage boy and girl) the suite was great- 2 TVs, and they were only two happy to make up the sofa bed for one child. We loved being able to see both the pool and the ocean from our floor, and the pool was lovely.The location was great but not at all noisy. It was great to just have shops cafes and other facilities just outside the front door, and the beach was just a short walk down the alleyway away.The breakfasts were fantastic especially the cooked to order omelettes and there was no shortage of anything.The bellhops were great and when our shuttle to the airport did not arrive, were more than happy to make the necessary calls and organised a taxi at the shuttle company's expense.The only downer was the slowness of the liftsWould definitely recommend and stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed at this hotel during my first time visit to Hawaii in September 2012 and was very impressed. Location: The location of this hotel was very central to many of the area attractions. You literally cross the street and you are at the beach. The were also many restaurants and shops in the immediate area as well.Room: Very comfortable beds and the pullout couch in the living room area allowed extra bedding. The bathroom was very spacious but basic and the room temperature was adjustable.Amenities: The best part of this stay was the free breakfast every morning. The breakfast is served buffet style but the breakfast options are vast and includes a omelet station. There is also a managers recepetion in the evening and snacks are served but I only made it once with my friends.I also took advantage of the computer room which was very clean and modern. It also allowed free printouts.The staff itself was very friendly and informative. I would definitely return to this hotel

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Love the breakfast daily and the manager's reception at night with live entertainment on some days. You can see the ocean from the hotel pool area and the kids love the pool. Within walking distance of great restaurants and shopping. This was our first time in Hawaii and it was beautiful, fun and safe for all ages.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: One cannot beat the amenities of this hotel, combined with its location (steps from restaurants, stores, boardwalk, beach, etc) as well as the regular benefits available to all Embassy Suites: cooked to order breakfast, two-room suite, happy-hour free drinks, etc.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here for 9 days in 2012. We had a great time. This Embassy Suites is not right on the beach but is only about 1 block away so it is still extremely convenient to getting to the beach. The location is outstanding. You are in the downtown part of Waikiki Beach Walk area with easy access to all the great restaurants and attractions. The breakfast selection in the morning was amazing and the cooked to order omelets and such were perfect. Each morning there was also large amounts of fresh fruit. The breakfast and manager reception area was excellent. It is on the 4th floor out on the roof. There are palm trees everywhere and a nice pleasant breeze is always blowing. Our rooms were just fine and everything worked and was clean. The only thing that is a king of minor hassle at times is that you have to do valet parking because of where the hotel is. Most of the time it was ok but a few times, they were pretty backed up and it took longer to retreive our vehicle. Not a big deal overall and I would still definitely recomment this hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Within a month, I stayed at this property on 2 different occasions. The second time confirmed that this will be my hotel for all of my return visits. The location is great - you can walk anywhere in Waikiki. It is about half an hour to walk to the Honolulou Zoo or Ala Moana Shopping Center. Great restaurants nearby and it is centrally located in Waikiki. There is public beach access within 3 minutes.The room has a living area with wet bar, microwave and mini-fridge. Buffet breakfast definitely saves money and it is nice to have the "eggs cooked to order" option. Manager's nightly reception is also part of the rate. There is a fitness center, laundry facilites, and business center on property. Wi-fi is complimentary too.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We have been to hawaii many of times and each time we have found our hotel not to be what it os made out to be. For the first tome we can say that we finally got what we wanted and were veryompresseed with embasssy suites. Thank you to all the wonderful staff at embassy suites, especially the bell men who were always willing to give us ideas about things to do in Hawaii and how to get there. The rooms were great which included a separate living a bonus was the buffet breakfast ideal especially with two young kids no need to worry about finding a place for breakfast. Third floor had a laundry $2.50 a load and $2.20for the dryer. Highly recommend the hula tower. The yard house (try the chocolate brownie) and p.f changes are great places to eat. All eating places are reasonably priced and kids meals are great although a bit repetitive. There is lots to do and see in hawaii;1 pearl harbor2 waikelle outlets a must bargains and more bargains3poleynesian cultural center4 chiefs lulu5dole plantation6 pacific aviation museum okay if you are into planes7 teddy beard work8 international market9 Aloa mono shopping centerThese are just to name a few things

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great location and really friendly and helpful staff. Hotel was a little "tired" although room had two separate areas and was serviced well. Kitchenette area could have done with some basic utensils. Contrary to many reviews here we did not find the breakfast provided particularly special. Same every morning, basic and long queues.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed here with our two teenagers and found it to be a great location.Very close to where you catch the tourist trolleys that take you around all three routes.Lots of restaurants at your door down in Beackwalk and along the main road.Staff are fantastic and room serviced well. Breakfast are plentiful.We had a two bedroom suite with two bathrooms and kitchenette. My only criticism or warning here is that the kitchenette does not contain much. It has a mini fridge, sink, coffee machine and kettle. There are two takeaway/disposable coffee cups. But, there are no proper coffee mugs or plates, no cutlery. Which I think should be there.There is a lot of convenience stores nearby so you need to purchase paper plates and plastic cutlery if you like to prepare lunches occasionally, as we do.If you do, I recommend bringing a sharp knife for cutting tomatoes and bread rolls etc, really hard to do with a plastic one.Pool is nice with a big spa that is really warm. I would stay here again as the location is great.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We found this hotel was far superior to any of the hotels we stayed in previously while in wakiki .Once you got the right room they were very roomly for a family of four. We loved the breakfast , those specially prepared omelettes my husband still dreams about, and the cocktails and entertainment in the evening. The hotel is very well suited and close to everything.Definatly recommend this hotel and we will back very soon....

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I stayed at the Embassy Suites, Hula Tower with my husband and 2 teenage daughters in December. Everything about this hotel was great. The rooms were lovely and spacious, clean, nice beachview from the balcony, beds were comfortable. The buffet breakfast was fantastic, lots to choose from, cereals, breads, fruit, yoghurt, hot foods. They also had an omelet bar where you got to choose from several ingredients to give the chef so he could make your personalized omelet, delicious! The location was great, very close to shops, a short walk to the beach. The staff were friendly and very helpful. We were greeted with a delicious fruitpunch on arrival. Would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is a very well situated hotel that is very much focused around family holidays. While not absolute beachfront it is very close and well situated in the heart of the Waikiki Beach Walk area. Rooms are good size but tired, as is much of the hotel - definitely time for a refresh/update (carpets etc). The pool is okay but frantic most of the time. We did not find breakfast up to the normal embassy suites standard and in the end did not use it - it had an industrial feel given the numbers of people going through. That said, there are plenty of reasonably priced options around the hotel.Service was excellent and all the staff we dealt with very helpful, could not fault them! I particularly liked the call on the cell phone when our room was ready in advance of the 3pm check in, having arrived on an overnight flight early that morning that was very much appreciated.Our kids had disrupted sleep on a couple of nights following some 'energetic nocturnal activity' in the adjacent room on the other side of our apartment.Overall, if you are on a bit of a budget with the family then this hotel is great, its close to the action and the breakfast and managers reception certainly reduce costs, there is no doubt about that. The staff are terrific. But if you are thinking that you are going to have a quiet relax by the pool type break you might want to rethink.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The entire staff was warm and friendly. We were greeted with a wonderful fruit punch upon check in. There is easy access to shopping, transportation, the beach, etc. The complimentary breakfast was a great way to start the day and the reception was a great way to unwind after a day of walking and sightseeing. There was also live music a couple of nights at the reception. We were able to take The Bus, which is what the public bus transportion is called, to Diamond Head and Chinatown. The free wireless internet was also great to have. I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at the Embassy Suies Waikiki from January 4 - 12, 2012. We arrived after a very long flight from South America. We were given room 1135 in the Hula Tower. They bring you a wonderful fruit juice upon check in. Jeff our bell hop got our bags to our room and was quite pleasant giving us information on restaurants etc. The room was ample for our family having two queen beds and a separate living space. The room was clean and comfortable. We did use the refrigerator to put our bottled water. The water was alway hot and there did not appear to be a problem at anytime with water pressure.House keeping was very pleasant throughout our stay. Our room was always nice and clean with plenty of bath and pool towels. The breakfast was pretty great and FREE. Which is what Embassy Suites is known for. I do not understand reviews regarding peoples food bordem. Everyday there was fresh fruit to include honey dew melon, cantelope, pineapple, apples, oranges and bananas. There were about 4 different cereal options and oatmeal. There was an omelet station. The buffet bar consisted of eggs, sausage, bacon, hashbrowns or pototoes, pancakes or french toast, miso soup, rice and salad. There was also several different yogurt options. There was a bread stations that had bagels, english muffins, bread for toast, muffins and various danishes. There was some items that were just okay, but for the most part the food was good. I do have to say the staff in the breakfast area was AWESOME. Shout out to Cary for all the great tourist tips. There were also several other gentlemen that was super sweet. Okay, I will address the birds, because WHY? It comes up in some reviews. YES, there are birds in the breakfast area. It is open and outside. It is not overwhelming or disgusting. The hotel was in walking distance of shops, hotels, and the beach. We went to Oahu because there were so many activities for us do with our six year old. If we went back to Oahu we would stay here again; however our next trip will be to Maui!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our whole family (myself , wife, 2 teenage children) found our stay in 2br suite very relaxing. Breakfast, drinks in the evening, one king bed and 2 queen beds with separate living room meant extreme comfort and space for everyone.Convenience with easy access to beach, shopping , transport and free wifi were all the added bonus.I missed this place when I moved to Sheraton at Waikiki for the last 3 days of our holidays and was put in a room which was 1/3 of the suite size in this hotel. There could not sleep at night or sit comfortably in the day either.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Right in the heart of downtown Waikiki, walking distance to shopping, restaurants & buses. Happy hour a bonus great way to meet others & free. Wireless Internet in room free. Queen suite had separate living room, great when traveling with kids. Very clean room was serviced each day. Bed was really comfy but byo pillow like sleeping on balls of fluff. All staff very friendly, definitely try for room as high as possible, street very noisy, there are 21 floors. Free breakfast get down as early as you can from 1000 they start to pack up & queues start. Not much variety or fresh food options, cereal options are pretty basic and the juice is like watered down cordial, scrambled eggs I think are powdered best go for the freshly cooked options. Overall a nice place to stay but a little overpriced. Also they charge $50 for incidentals,I was told would be credited back on check out but has not happened so far.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This place is extremely convenient due to the breakfast buffet included with the room (of course it's overpriced to include the food costs). It's great for a family with kids, as you'll save about $50 in food per day. They also have happy hour in the evening from 5pm to 7pm where they give you free alcohol and snacks.It's only located a 2 minute walk to the beach, and there are tons of restaurants nearby. The pool is okay, but doesn't get a ton of sun, due to the buildings blocking it, but the attached kiddy pool is good, as I know some pools in Hawaiian hotels are pretty horrendous.Parking is expensive here, so do not rent a car to park it over night. If you need a rental car, just rent it for the day.The only complaint is the value. The price of the rooms are a bit much, unless you factor in the breakfast, and have large appettites.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: What a show! They have a free Hula Dance show on Saturday December 29.The show was spectacular. The performers were from kids around 4 years old to adults in their 50s. They all performed well. They danced everything from the slow paced Hula to the fast paced tahitian dance. best of all was free.They have free appetizers (they call it "pupus") I purchased 2 Mai Tai for the duration of the show

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great central location in Waikiki and everything within our grasp. We had a 2 bedroom apartment and travelling with a teenager was accommodating as plenty of space for all. The rooms are well maintained and serviced, and the views nice to look out over with distance view of ocean. Shopping is on the doorstep and its great to stroll about of an evening, with the trade winds cool breeze. A full breakfast each day inclusive was delightful and there was a managers reception of an evening with complimentarty drinks, nibbles and entertainment provided. We enjoyed returning "home" after our days out.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed in the two bedroom suite with a family of five -- considered it a good value over the Christmas holiday as it included a full breakfast, manager's reception in the evening with snacks and beverages, and was only a short block from the beach. A very good location and had several highly-rated restaurants within a short walking distance. Our room was nicely appointed, in excellent condition, clean, and quiet. Staff was friendly and accomodating. Would definitely recommend!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: we were expecting wonders when we booked this hotel online 3-4 months prior to our stay. it didn't let us down. the service was great and best we have enjoyed for sometime, the staff at breakfast we friendly always regardless of the mass we left behind. the room was spacious and our two year old loved the space to play in. we booked a partial ocean view room and got this room on the 31st floor so that was great. the thing we enjoyed most was the service of the staff , from reception to porter, dinning staff to tour booking staff, all were great and hats off for the great work they doing.oh and we checked in at around 6 in the morning but since our room was ready they let us use it...that was a BIG plus with a sleeping kid.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was our lovely home for 7 nights and 8 lovely days in Waikiki and we had a ball. We were welcomed with some lovely nonalcoholic punch when we arrived. We stayed in the hula tower but was unfortunate to have a low floor (2nd) so the views from the balcony were not that great. We had a very close eye view of Denny's restaurant. Fortunately we spent very little time in the room to enjoy the balcony views so it didn't matter. The hotel was very clean and the staff were very friendly. The location is superb right smack in the middle of everything. Honestly this hotel wasn't my first choice especially since its particularly known for being a "family" hotel and we were three single ladies. I was concerned about being run over by children but there weren't a lot until it got closer to the weekend. I really wanted to stay in the Sheraton which was right across the street from our hotel and ON the beach. However, the breakfast buffet and NO daily resort fees were definitely the deal breakers and it didn't disappoint. The breakfast buffets in the morning were absolutely on point. We pigged oops I meant ate lovely every morning. From the freshly made omelette's or cereal, fruits it was a nice selection that saved you money daily. The pool looked a little small and we never got a chance to enjoy it because we were too busy living it up on the beach. The hotel didn't have a lot of stores inside but it really didn't need them because everything you needed from clothes, restaurants or the ABC stores and 7/11 were literally steps away. Unfortunately, we missed the managers reception the entire time we were there from enjoying Oahu. We had our share of the water in the lobby filled with fruit and ice which was needed. We used the business center which had about 4 computers to book our excursions and used Discover Hawaii which I will review later. Overall, we had a great time at this hotel and I would definitely return.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Free drinks and live 4 piece band that rocks!! Check out the ukelele playing - awesome. Rooms were well set out - plenty of room.Very clean. Our 1 bedroom suite had queen and double bed and a sofa bed which had sheets provided. Microwave available - but no dishes/utensils. ABC store across the road offered meals that could be then taken back to the room. Avoid booking a room on the 4th floor of the Hula Tower as this is the main entrance way to the pool and eating area. Need room cards to activate elevators, so make sure you get enough for each guest to avoid getting caught. Hotel is a block back from the beach but not a hassle to get to it. Can also walk to Ala Moana if your feeling energetic (20 mins) - nice along the beach. Complimentary breakfast a real bonus. Avoid the 9am rush - earlier is far more relaxed and there is less standing in queues. Kitchenette has an electric jug as well as coffee maker - great for tea drinkers , and a sink,so you don't have to wash up in the bathroom. Didn't use the pool area as we preferred to swim in the surf, but it looked suitable for young families. Fairly good value for money - but somewhat pricey for the Christmas period - as all places would be. Taxi trip to airport was approx $37. Limo service was same rate as a taxi

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I did my homework. Almost all of the reviews I read of this hotel were positive, and as the organizer of a Christmas family reunion, I didn't want to screw up. I wanted an affordable, well located hotel that included kitchenettes since there were three small children who eat a lot. Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach Walk fit the bill. We had a VERY Merry Christmas!You've read about the free breakfast buffet and Manager's Reception that are offered every day. When you're feeding a large group, this is going to save you a lot of money, and the fresh fruit and made-to-order omelettes, etc. were as good as they get!So what can I tell you that would be helpful? To start with, request a quiet room on an upper floor when you make your reservation. You definitely don't want to be on the 4th floor since that is heavily trafficked due to the fact that its the pool floor and breakfast/reception location. We had a corner room (1830) in the Hula Tower. Great ocean views. Two terraces. One bedroom with separate living area. Perfect.What else? Well, if you're planning on feeding small children or yourselves, for that matter, in your room, be aware that the little kitchenette has nothing in it except a coffee maker, small refrigerator and a microwave. You might want to bring paper plates from home or even some flatware and maybe a cutting board. There is an ABC store directly across from the hotel which has everything in it you'll ever need (beer, wine, food, drugs, etc.) and a supermarket a couple of blocks away.This is not a glitzy hotel, but it was perfect for our group. Comfortable. Kid friendly. Clean. Just what we needed. I got high marks for choosing it. You can ask my family.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed from 30.11.12 to 10.12.12. Absolutely thrilled on arrival at how great our rooms were. We had a two bedroom suite as we had our three teenage daughters with us, the bedding configuration etc was as we had asked for and we had a fantastic view of the pool area and sea peeks. Impressed with how quiet our rooms were. It surpassed what I had hoped for and all of us just loved it! Breakfast was fantastic, the staff were friendly and helpful. Manager's drinks at 5.30 were also awesome. Huge variety and, again, friendly people. Location great with many fantastic restaurants in the immediate vicinity to choose from. Very short walk to the beach, just across the road. Trolley and bus stops also just a couple of minutes walk. We did so much while we were there and it was just lovely to be able to come back to a gorgeous Hotel suite and relax at the end of a busy day. Totally recommend staying here, thank you Embassy Suites. The Williams Family.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: A perfect hotel in a perfect place. We stayed Dec. 6-12, 2012. The staff is friendly and professional. The breakfast is spectacular (from cook-to-order omelets to miso, lots of fresh fruit, breads, cereals, bacon, etc.). The rooms are spacious and comfortable. Living room and bedroom each have sliding doors and balconies. And to top it off, they don't tack onto the bill a daily 'resort fee' like many of the hotels in Waikiki do. If the Embassy Suites Waikiki didn't have a room for us, we would have changed the dates of our trip to a time when they did have a room. We also stayed there in December 2009 and had a similarly wonderful experience. Several of the same wonderful breakfast staff were still there, and started our days of with smiles.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had the most wonderful stay for 8nights Nov/Dec 2012.Staff were very friendly and helpful.Excellent service.Our first night was pretty noisy as we were next to the lifts,in the morning I saw the duty Manager who rectifide this problem and put us on the top floor which was superb.The managers reception each night was great and the complimentary breakfast was good with omlettes cooked fresh.Best location to shop and beach.We cannot fault these premises.We are hoping to make honolulu our holiday destination every 2 years and will certainly be back.This is our 3rd time staying at waikiki beach our 1st at the Embassy Suites.I would highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: As a family that usually stays in Embassy Suites when we travel we were highly pleased with this choice. We have watched the Embassy Suites brand decline quite a bit over the past 10 years and were not sure what to expect here. The room we had was very nice and well appointed with plenty of space for a family of five. The managers reception was perfect, they mix a great Mai Tai. Live music one night also. The breakfast Buffett was so nice and any lines that were there moved quickly so there was never a wait for anything. Even omelets as they had two omelette stations. The location that breakfast and the managers reception was beautiful. We were here for the Honolulu Marathon and at no time did we feel this property was crowded.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed in this hotel for 2 weeks over Nov-Dec 2012. The location for us whilst not on the beach was excellent. It was a block from the beach and the access to the shopping and restaurants was just a step away. The staff at the hotel were extremely helpfull and the standard of the suites and amenities was very good. The complimentary breakfast each day was surprisingly good for an American hotel with a selection of cereals and fruit, eggs cooked which ever way you wanted, as well as bakery items and other hot choices. The hotel provided a business centre and internet which again formed part of the package. Parking is always an issue in Waikiki and the hotel rate for guests was $30 for 24 hours. I would highly recommend this hotel and would have no reservations in using it again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The service and stay was very good, given the reputation of the Embassy Suites line. The staff were friendly and helpful. The breakfast was good, with omelettes cooked with guest-selected ingredients. The stay was comfortable.We were close to the elevator on a lower floor, but the noise was negligible. We wished we would be been on the higher floor, of course.One problem had to do with the breakfast area. There are a lot of pigeons preying on uneaten breakfast, which becomes unsightly on the weekdays when they are fighting for the morsels. We tend to sit further away from others so this feeding frenzy doesn't affect us while eating.Overall, the stay was excellent. It is close to the Waikiki beach walk, which is safe for tourist and convenient for relaxing on the beach as well as tourist shopping. Location was excellent, even though it was a block in from the beach.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Very good hotel, larger rooms than most in the area and the inclusive (free) breakfast is a huge plus. The breakfast is wonderful, full hot meal with made to order omelets. Very friendly and helpful staff. Right in the middle of the city so lower rooms hear a lot of traffic noise. Try and stay on the higher floors if you want more quiet. Like all of the hotels in Waikiki, they charge way too much for parking and it is valet only. Some hotels give you a less expensive option by allowing yout to park yourself. There might also be less expensive alternatives some where else, like a parking garage. I did not have time to look into other option.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: It is a little tired and the decor is dated. But it actually looks better in person than the promotional shots online. The suites are a good size. The beds were SO comfortable. The buffet breakfast had a variety of options.The hotel is certainly good value for money. The postiton is great. Everything is within easy walking access. But beware of the taxes, ours weren't included and there were 2 added at check out which were unexpected and increased the daily rate considerably.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My husband and I stayed at embassy suites waikiki beach walk (11/28 - 12/01) at room 1532 at the hula tower for our wedding anniversary & christmas shopping as well.. When we get to the hotel around 10:30 in the morning,we had a warm welcome at the front desk and gave us cold fruit juice and check us in (no long wait) so fast.. Our room was ready - one king bed suite, ocean view, lanai in which you can overlook the pool & breakfast area. Excellent location because it is near shopping and dining area in which you can just walk in. We take the city bus #8 when we go to ala moana shopping center which is about 5-10 minutes ride and $2.50 per person roundtrip. The hotel price is just right because you get complimentary breakfast,managers reception at night,complimentary wifi,newspaper everymorning,yoga classes every friday,saturday (if im not mistaken) and a lot more.. Our housekeeper did a GOOD JOB in our suite too.. Thank you so much to you & the staff of Embassy Suites coz we really enjoyed our stay..See you again hopefully next month (pro bowl season)..

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We spent 8 days in Hawaii at the Embassy Suites. Some things were really great, other just needed improvement. The rooms need a face lift. They are not bad, just not what we expected at an Embassy Suites. The breakfast was great! The manager's reception was a nice way to end the day. When we checked they hand local refeshing drink. The live music and dancing was a wonderful experience. The staff was great. Whatever we needed they delivered. Would stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We have just spent 8 great days in Hawaii at the Embassy Suites and something where great other not so but overall we had a great time and will definitely be going back again it was great we all agreed we need more time to see and done things. To start the room was just great but we were put next to the lifts and they were very noisy at night we couldn't move as we had three room next to each other (our family vacation) and to move us would have had us god knows where so we stayed with air conditioner on all night to decrease the sound the staff where great and very helpful as long as anything you booked was through them otherwise they wouldn’t even try and help just say sorry that is not one of our trips/bookings etc. The breakfast was very America with everything fried or cooked in fat and just massive amounts we ordered a peanut butter and jelly sandwich for our granddaughter and they asked us if we wanted fries with that – That has become the family smart comment now (do you want fries with that) the Managers cocktails of an evening is very good that was where we order the sandwich and the bar staff up there are the best great guys and always a smile and a joke so that is one not to miss. Over all we had a great time as stated some good some not so good and a small end note for any members on the Hilton HHoners club be very aware that if your rooms are booked through other means not the Hilton then they will not give you points for your stay I found this out after booking paying and staying that they will not give points for our stay so just be careful when booking it appears that Hilton only want you to book through there system and pay FULL PRICE to get points !!!!!! Just My experience

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My daughter and I stayed here for our 1st Hawaii visit for Thanksgiving 2012. What a great hotel! Breakfast buffet and manager's reception were excellent. Live music was great! Pool area was very nice. Hotel staff was awesome. We were greeted with beverages upon arrival. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We arrived at the hotel around 11.30am proceeded to the check-in counter where we received a beautiful cold fruit juice. To our suprise they advised that the room was ready - a 2 bedroom suite, it was beautiful, spacious for our family of 5 and had a partial view of waikiki beach. The location was excellent, close to shops, restaurants and the beach. Our biggest surprise was the free breakfast, it was the best I have ever had at any hotel in the world. From the beautiful fresh fruit, the omelettes made to order, the fruit juices, the bacon and scrambled eggs, the pastries, it was amazing, we never had to buy lunch. At night they supplied free nibblies and drinks.Well done Embassy, we will stay again and have told all our friends how good you are.The staff were so friendly and professional, they went out of their way to make our stay an enjoyable one. A special mention to the breakfast staff who were unbelievably helpful, one guy in particular who unfortunately we did not get his name, he went out of his way to make sure our table was clean well equipped with condiments, he also gave us little bags of sweets.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Thank you Embassy suites, you made our short stay in Honolulu extremely enjoyable. The staff were nothing but friendly, the rooms were just lovely and spacious! The pool area was a nice place to sit at night and have a cocktail and the tour desk was more than happy to help us with our sight seeing. There was free WIFI and we got tickets to the managers reception each night.This hotel is situated right in the heart of everything. The beach is only a couple of minutes walk away. We had breakfast included with our room and it was a really nice meal.I would most definitely stay here again and recommend it to anyone!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Six of our family members booked 2 rooms from November 14-20, 2012. We were upgraded to Ocean View- large suite with a great view and very clean! We were also allowed to check in one of our rooms at 11:00 am. Housekeeping was always near in case we needed extra towels etc. The staff was very professional and friendly. Live entertainment every night, except 1 night at the managers reception, in which we all enjoyed. The breakfast buffet was excellent and items were always refilled. Definitely would recommend this hotel to anyone. Can't wait to go again!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We go to Honolulu about once a year. We normally stay on the beach, but our favorite hotel was completely booked. We decided we would try this hotel because we generally enjoy out stay in other cities whenever we stay at this chain. This hotel did not disappoint us at all. Loved the location! It is located right in the heart of Waikiki an easy walk to all the great restaurants and shops. The rooms were a nice size. Everything was very clean. there was a small refrigerator and microwave, which were useful for left over from all the great restaurants (many within the hotel's complex). Although we weren't on the beach, we were just a block away. We were on the 15th floor so we had spectacular views of the beach and ocean. The bed was comfy. We really enjoyed the manager's reception each night with FREE drinks and a kind of nice live band Monday - Friday. The breakfast was okay, but you can't expect too much since it was free. There are a number of really great breakfast stops near by, but hey, they aren't free. We appreciated the free wifi, laundry facilities and small fitness room. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our stay was excellent - so many great things about the hotel. We were able to check in early, staff was wonderful, great included breakfast and the daily manager's reception with drinks and snacks really kick started the nights. The pool was usually full of kids (and only 4 feet at its deepest) but there was ample space around the pool for lounging. The gym had good equipment and was adequate for a 5 day stay. The coin-op laundry was a bit pricey ($2.50 wash, $2.25 dry) but machines worked well. Lots of nearby shopping and the next door Yard House bar/restaurant was a perfect hangout. Perhaps the best feature was the courtesy room we could use to shower and change clothes, since we checked out at 11am but went to the airport at 5pm. This gave us another full day at the beach. The hotel is outstanding and I would choose it again above all others.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Location is right in the best part of Waikiki. Hard rock and pubs all over the place. The morning breakfast is nice with a omelet chef and large range of coffees and teas. Partial ocean view looking across trump tower. Beds are comfortable and rooms are dated. Just a very relaxing experience.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We chose to spend a few extra dollars and stay at the Embassy Suites as a final 'feet up' stop after a hectic holiday on the mainland.We were not disappointed.Granted, it's not cheap - but the location, the included extras (buffet breakfast, manager's reception drinks), and the suites themselves make it worthwhile if you are seeking a family-friendly place to spoil yourself.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I was disappointed in the floor we were on #328 Hula Tower because I wanted to be further up and at first I would have done a negative review ..that said to be honest the room itself was very clean and comfortable. The beds were especially comfortable...The location of the hotel was convenient ....the breakfast was Embassy fair...the Manager's reception was good and had entertainment most nights we were there. The employees were the Best..helpful, friendly and just plain nice... Had I not been really tired each night the lower floor would have been too noisy but trying to get everything in a week's visit was tiring and the traffic would wake me but I fell back to sleep easily... Would I stay there again if chose Honolulu Waikki Beach ? the answer is a most definite yes..My sister and her husband had Room # 729 and It was a great room and they used their Hilton Points.....

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I went for a wedding back in April 2012. It was my first time staying in a Embassy Suites Hotel and I have to say I wasn't impressed. I traveled as a couple but I will recommend this hotel for a family trip with kids. The Pros:Location- Right in the heart of Waikiki BeachOpen Bar in the eveningsGreat Breakfast includedValet Parking Staff- Great customer service and professionals. Pillow top of the King bed! Great sleep quality! The Cons:Valet charges $20.00 plus tip a night (not included in resort fee)Decoration In-room is very corporateAC in our room wasnt working propertlyNot Personalize service (They don't call you by name and we traveled as a couple and they gave us a two Queen bedroom)Pool was very small for the amount of rooms this property has and it was full of kids and closes at 10:00PMEven though I wasn't a fan of the Embassy Suites Waikiki I enjoyed my trip to Ohau and like I said, It's great for family with kids, not for couples.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I stayed at this property from October 10-17 of 2012. The room was in fairly clean condition. I did have to ask for a new pillow case, however housekeeping was always around and extremely friendly and accommodating. Check in was a breeze and valet was always prompt. Manager's reception and breakfast was great and certainly added a bonus to my trip. Workout room was nice, but a couple machines were out of order for our stay. I would definitely recommend this hotel for families, but couples as well. Extremely close to all the shops and the beach. If you can find a good rate, I say if in doubt, GO FOR IT! I loved it and will return back there.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We enjoyed our stay at the Waikiki Beach Walk Embassy Suites hotel, a relative newcomer to the Waikiki hotel scene. Large, suite style rooms, full breakfast and manager's happy hour ( free mai tais!) included for about 2/3rds of what our friends paid for a smaller hotel down the street. However they could walk out the hotel and onto the beach while we had to walk a little further. That wasn't a problem for us. Because of the afforementioned ammentities, a lot of families use this hotel, so the pool area gets busy. Location is great...right across the street from the beautiful and quiet Halekulani where we would go each night for after dinner drinks. Another advantage...the cabs there were stretch limos and one was always waiting when we needed it . Felt like celebrities! If you fit the criteria, ask for the senior discount...saved us a bundle.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Just got back from 5 days in Waikiki at Embassy Suites. We did not want to leave!!! The location was fantastic. The employees were extremely helpful and very friendly - everyone had a smile...Check in was a breeze. We were originally given a 1-bedroom suite on the 3rd floor. We called the front desk and asked for a higher floor. We were given a 2 bedroom suite on the 7th floor. We didn't have an ocean view, but we did have a view of the courtyard and were able to watch the Halloween antics from our balcony.The happy hour entertainment was great. We loved the band that played several nights. On Saturday night, there was a traditional Hawaiian dance and song event performed by a local school. What a great show and darling performers.The breakfast was great! Happy hour was great, too. The only complaint I have is that the snacks for Happy Hour were pretty boring and were pretty much the same thing every night. It would have been nice to have a little more variety AND popcorn!! :)Concierge was very nice and gave us some great ideas. We didn't use their services but we'll be back and may use them next time.If you are willing to walk a little, I recommend the City A Express Bus to the USS Arizona. It only takes about 40 minutes from McCully St (about a 10 minute walk from Embassy Suites) and it only cost $2.50!!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We have just returned home from a 10 night trip to Waikiki, staying at the Embassy Suites with my husband and 2 nine year old boys.We were so excited as it was our first time to Hawaii, but I must admit our first impression wasn't a great one. The staff member who checked us in upon our early arrival was on the grumpy side and not overly friendly. I mentioned that my travel agent had put in a request for a high floor in a room away from the lift, and he just told us our room was on level 10 and that was that. Of course we got to our room to find we were directly next to the lift! It was a disappointing start to our trip, and as the hotel was full we were unable to move to another room for our first night. As I didn't want to deal with the same staff member who checked us in, I waited until later in the day when the next lot of staff were on reception and was very lucky to come across an absolutely wonderful girl by the name of Malia. She couldn't have been more helpful and immediately checked the availability of another room for us. Unfortunately there wasn't anything available for our first night, but she did find a room on a higher level and at the far end of the hall for the rest of our stay... in a corner suite. I'm so happy we did because I could hear the lift going up and down all night in our original room! I will definitely be contacting the hotel to sing the praises of Malia as she was so friendly, helpful and remembered us... even getting us a special fruit drink each day (which is only usually offered upon arrival) as my boys loved the juice. Everything was done with a smile and nothing was too much trouble.We ended up staying on the 15th floor of the Hula Tower on the corner suite, which had a long balcony facing one beach and another balcony (off the lounge area) facing another part of the beach. It was a good sized room with plenty of space for all of us, and a much better layout than the room we had originally been put into. It's definitely worth asking for a room on a high level and away from the lift!The hotel itself is lovely with a great pool (especially for kids as it's only 4 feet at the deepest end), fabulous manager's drinks and nibbles from 5.30pm to 7.30pm each night (cocktails, wine, beer and soft drinks), and they even have a band a few nights a week... a father and his 3 sons, who were great! The breakfast was good with a selection of fruit, pastries, sausages, bacon, white rice, miso soup, potatoes... and 2 chefs who will cook eggs any way you like. The concierge were helpful with booking tours etc and the valets were always happy and friendly. I can highly recommend a massage by the pool too!The location was perfect for us with plenty of restaurants and shops nearby, and the beach just across the road. It was also fairly quiet and we were far enough away from the centre of Waikiki so there weren't any crowds. For us having a suite was ideal as our boys slept on the sofa bed and we had our own separate bedroom. Much better than having us all squashed in to one room.We had a tsunami warning while we were there and the staff were very calm and happy to answer our questions and let us know what we needed to do. It was obviously scary for us having never gone through anything like that before, but we were put at ease.We wouldn't hesitate on going back to the Embassy Suites and will be recommending it to friends and family. But I will tell them not to be put off if they get a grumpy person to check them in because everything else about the hotel was fabulous!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed for 6nights, rooms are clean good size, staff friendly, they have breakfast and also managers drinks at night which is the cost of a tip which includes spirits and cocktails. We got speedy shuttle from the airport which as $29.10 for 2 adults 1way. A cab was $30 + tip which was quicker which is a better option. 1block from the beach, lots of restaurants. There is a shuttle ou get from tump which takes you to waikelle shopping centre $5 each way per person, you book at the trump hotel as the bus gets full. Just remember that when you get off the bus get your return time as otherwise you could be stuck there longer than you may want and costs heaps to get a cab back to Waikiki.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The last time we travelled to Honolulu we stayed at Outrigger Reef on the Beach but there was only my husband & I travelling. This time however we had our 4 daughters with us so after much research settled on the Embassy Suites. Having the choice of either 1 or 2 bedrooms + seperate living area with sofa bed was perfect for a family of 6 and the suites are very central to shopping, dining & beach! The 3 best things about Embassy would have to be the included hot & cold breakfast, the free 2 hours of Managers drinks each night & the entertainment by Roland Chang & his 3 sons Mon, Wed, Fri & Sat nights. We stayed on a specials packaged that also included free trolley rides for 2 days, beach chair rental etc & pizza & softdrink pack. So in comparison to other resorts that our friends were staying at I felt we had much better value for money. Most of the staff were very friendly especially those cleaning up at breakfast. The reception staff not very friendly although we were offered lovely Guava juice on arrival! Ask for high room... Hula Tower closer to the ocean! We would return to Embassy Suites Waikiki for sure!!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Excellent location with close beach access and ABC deli across the street.Good entertainment at mgr reception. Food at ABC was very good for takeout when you did not want a big meal. Other items were available for each or snacks. Walk across street and there is the beach .

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel is one of the most beautiful I've ever seen. Walk to shops. Anything you could wish for is right in the area. The reception was so warm and friendly I felt like sitting down for a chat. Everyone I met on the hotel staff were friendly and always cheerful. The complimentary breakfast showed off the best of Embassy Suites. The manager's reception served full glasses of wine from happy entertaining barkeeps. The snacks were just nibbles. Not enough to make even a light meal. Chips, vegetables, dips and nuts, etc. It is by the georgeous pool area and shows off the Hawaiian weather. Look on line for the SpeediShuttle between the airport and hotel Also check out the Discover Hawaii Tours. The concierge can help with this or you can go on line. I did not eat there and so cannot comment on the food.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Iv'e stayed here at least 6 different times, just don't stay on the first floor. The rooms are great and the breakfast is amazing. Pool is not deep. Make sure you stop by the pool and get a massage from Piilani. It is worth every penny. I have had at least 6 massages. The staff is exceptional, they are all very professional and friendly.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here on our trip to Honolulu for our son's wedding. the room was very nice and clean...We loved the lanai with the pool and hot tub. The breakfast each morning was wonderful with sooo many choices. We especially loved the fruit and the made to order omelettes. Yes the birds were a little bit annoying and bold...but there was an indoor room to dine if if you chose to do so. I loved eating my breakfast outdoors. We enjoyed the manager's reception I liked looking out the window at night and watching all of the people walking about. Great location...directly accross the street from the beach and on the backside we were attached to great shops and restaurants...walking distance from everything. The staff were very friendly. I will stay here again next year and would definetely recommend to friends and family.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed in the Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach for 6 nights. The 2-bedroom, 2-bath suite offered plenty of room and privacy for me, my husband and my in-laws. Upon our arrival, each of us were greeted with a glass of guava juice and received attentive service from registration, valet, and bell staff. We were pleasantly surprised when we checked into the top floor corner suite, Room 2103. Our room had a king bed in each bedroom and a sofa bed in the living room. Each of the three suite balconies offer expansive views of Diamond Head. Another benefit of staying on the top floor was there was very little noise from busy Kalakalua Avenue down below.Each morning, we were treated to a full breakfast buffet on the grand lanai consisting of cooked to order eggs and omelettes (I like mine over easy), bacon, rice, miso soup, cereals, breads and pastries, yogurt, salad, traditional and tropical juices, coffee and tea, and a changing variety fresh tropical fruit, potatoes, sausages, pancakes, and french toast. The friendly staff kept the buffet area stocked and clean as well as promptly took away dirty dishes from tables. The pool and spa on lanai was cozy, but offered enough room for a refreshing dip and relaxing time in the spa. The location was central to restaurants and shopping, and a block away from Waikiki Beach.I would recommend this hotel to families and those traveling in groups.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at the Waikiki Embassy Suites for 8 nights in October 2012 and had a wonderful time. As with all Embassy Suites, you get free breakfast, free cocktails, and separate bedroom suites. Breakfast was good with a good selection of fruit, meat (bacon, sausage, etc.), breads, and omelettes. The birds are slightly annoying, but it was nice to eat outside. The manager's reception also offers some basic snacks (chips, pretzels, peanuts, vegetables) and adult beverages (beer, wine, mixed drinks, and tropical cocktails). The free drinks definitely taste great after a long day at the beach. We were pleasantly surprised by the location, entertainment, and people. The hotel is located one block from the beach so it was very convenient to walk back and forth. Nearby restaurants include The Yardhouse, Ruth's Chris Steakhouse, Starbucks, PF Changs, and many others. The hotel provides free entertainment on certain nights during happy hour. We really enjoyed the band made up of a dad and his 3 sons. They played a wide selection of great songs, ranging from the 1960's (Beatles) to the 2010's (Gotye, fun, etc.) and everything in between. They even put their own Hawaiian spin on each song. All of the employees were very friendly and made our stay extra nice, especially Jeff at the Bell Desk. He went out of his way to enhance our experience on multiple occasions. The people at the activity desk were also very helpful giving advice and arranging tours. I would definitely stay here again and recommend this hotel to my friends. Aloha and Mahalo Embassy Suites!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great stay at the Embassy. The staff are friendly, service is efficient and excellent and the hotel is very clean, which was important for us since we were traveling with a young infant. We enjoyed the daily free breakfast, the complimentary in room wifi, and the free drinks/snacks/entertainment at the managers reception. The hotel is situated ideally just minutes from the beach, shopping and some excellent restaurants, whether you want fine dining or a casual meal. From the welcome drink, to the assistance with our luggage on departure, we were completely satisfied with our stay at the embassy and would highly recommend it.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is truly a Hawaiian dream hotel. Beautiful rooms, excellent service with friendly and helpful staff. You also get great value for your money with a free cooked to order breakfast and daily managers reception with entertainment. The Grand Lanai boasts a very large pool with a kids pool area and hot tub as well. At night when the torches are lit and you lie on the lounge chairs watching the palm trees wave in the warm breeze and see the stars twinkling in the sky you feel like you are far, far away in a tropical paradise.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I checked into the Embassy Suites Waikiki Beachwalk on Thursday, October 11 and this is by far the worst Hilton Property I have stayed at. The big japanese lady that checked me in that morning was just utterly unpleasant from the get go. Never did go out of her way to find a room when I got there, and told me to come back at 3pm for my room keys. Low and behold, she put my by the elevator on the first floor after waiting all day for this kind of room. Although I used my points for this stay, it doesnt justify why I get such bad service at check in and such a terrible room. I wished I could have given this experience a ZERO star because service is just not up to Hilton Venue Standards. Shame on you embassy for having these type of people representing your company.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Spent 4 days here with my wife - I normally list the good and the bad, but in this case everything was fantastic! We felt welcome and attended to from the moment we arrived. We received a "Welcome Drink" upon arrival, and were surprised with the upgraded corner room we stayed in (Balcony off both the Living Room and Bedroom). The room and bed were both very comfortable. Took advantage of the full daily breakfast every morning - great spread, and great cost savings! Also enjoyed the evening Manager's Reception and entertainment when we made it back in time. Location was absolutely perfect - short walk to Waikiki Beach, right on the Beach Walk (Bars, Restaurants, Shopping), and short drive to Island attractions. Staff was top notch, and all areas were very well maintained. An excellent value for where it is located, and what you receive - We will definitely be back again, Mahalo!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here in December 2011 and had a wonderful time (Family with 2 teens - 17 and 15). Perfect location in the midst of everything with shops and bus stops just outside. Not by the beach but we didn't mind since the beaches in Waikiki are packed and we had the "relaxed beach resort" experience on Maui. Great roof top pool and spa pool with "free" cocktails every evening. Breakfast included was great, even miso soup. Staff always friendly and wonderful vibe.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great location, great hotel and with all the "free stuff", it's a great hotel for Waikiki.The hotel is right accross the street from the beautiful beach. The complimentry breakfast was as good as always, at Embassy Suites. We had a room that overlooked the pool and it was a marvelous view of the pool, the beach and the surrounding area. Great location in Waikiki with the Hard Rock cafe within walking distance along with many wonderful shops and restuarants.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel was perfect for our family of four young children. The breakfast was very generous with many choices including fresh fruit. Our room was clean, modern, cozy, two balconies, small kitchen area with microwave, fridge, sink, and granite counter. Room service was excellent. The manager's reception every evening exceeded our expectations with unlimited choices in alcoholic drinks and decent snacks to go with it. Our favourite part was the children could swim in the pool while the adults had social time and drank and ate beside the pool. We even had live music one night capped off with the fireworks which we could see from the pool area. Great staff, clean and modern decor, excellent food and drinks.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: A genuine suite hotel with the most comfortable beds possible. Great full breakfast included and no need for lunch after that. Courteous and helpful staff. Best location in Waikiki for restaurants and shops and only a block from the beach.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The position of the Embassy Suites couldn't be better, close to all shops, beach and dining.The complimentry breakfast was a highlight for my teenage children, the quality of the food was fantastic.The rooms need a bit of updating and the airconditioner was a bit noisy but not enough for us to complain.It was a great hotel for families.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: great stay. Across road from beach but we still had ocean views. Lovely staff. Rooms clean and pool area very inviting.Manager's happy hour every evening was enjoyed by many and the kids all swam happily in the pool. Concierge staff always helpful with tour advice. Location is superb - the nicer end of Waikiki, out the door to restaurants and shops. Buffet breakfast pretty good. Our room lovely, clean and inviting. Would we stay again - absolutely. Our cabbie drove us to the airport, within 30 seconds of leaving the hotel he gets a call from the bell staff at embassy to say they noticed his tyre was flat as he drove off! Saved us a terrible breakdown on the freeway on the way to the airport. This just symbolised the professionalism of the staff at the embassy suites. they do a top job.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I have traveled to Hawaii many times but I must say this hotel is not my favorite hotel in Waikiki area. Front desk staffs were not friendly and helpful. No one smiles. Only think I liked about this hotel is a breakfast. Good breakfast and staffs who worked in the breakfast area were very nice. I do not think I will come back to this hotel again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at the Hotel for 9 nights in the october school holodays. We had a room in the Hula Tower on the 14th floor, the view was amazing and so beautiful to wake up to each morning. Room was perfect for our family of four with two double beds and a sofa bed.The staff were so friendly, welcoming and helpful, even the security staff would say Aloha! Managers reception each night is lovely and a great way to get to know other travellers. Breakfast each morning has everything available to cater for all tastes. The location is perfect with a walkway straight to the beach and surrounded by shopping, restuarants and the ABC shops, which sell everything!. We had been to Waikiki several times before and this hotel is perfection.The only thing to be mindful of is that lots of families stay here and there were kids everywhere( including mine) so if you are looking for a couples only time you may need to go outside of school holidays or stay at another hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The hotel is in a great location! You can walk to the shops and several restaurants. The beach is right across the street. The breakfast was top notch! The wait staff in the restaurant during breakfast was very friendly and helpful. Even though it was a buffet, they offered you personal service; always with a smile. Great views of the mountain and beach. Highly recommend this location. Great location to restaurants and shops. Staff was outstanding. watch out for the time share reps! they are all over the island.....

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Really enjoyed our stay here at the Embassy Suites, October 12, staff are friendly and very helpful - especially at breakfast, the help with booking day trips and planning our vacation was great, the evening cocktails & nibblies were enjoyable and even live entertainment on some evenings. Rooms & beds very comfortable and within walking distance of the main streets and beach. We will be back one day for sure !!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: location is great,the rooms and their views are great,the staff was helpful all the time,the valet parking crew were fast,the [ big breakfast in the morning ]food is super,the meet the manager every evening is super [ drinks and snacks ] excelent view for friday night fireworks.that area is the bomb for shopping.clean and organized.i wish all hotels were like embassy.the one in memphis tn was just as great.if an embassy isnt there,im not going.all the food and drinks were free,im talking quality buffet ! bands playing every night.AND NO BUGS,NO BUGS,NO BUGS INSIDE OR OUT,NOT EVEN ON THE CAR WINDSHIELD !

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: great value , great location close to the beach. nice restaurants within walking distance. great breakfast included. nice pool , very secure - need room key to get in elevator. would recommend.JUST BEWARE DO NOT GET A ROOM ADJACENT TO THE ELEVATOR ITS VERY LOUD ALL NIGHT LONG

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our first stay at an Embassy Suites and a good experience. Nice pool area and the pool was pretty quiet during the day. Always plenty of sun lounges and the pool was a good temperature. Only busy time was at Managers reception when all the parents were having some free drinks and the kids were in the pool. It seems to be mostly families staying here. The rooms were fine, not huge but was great having two separate areas. Room was very clean, in fact whole hotel was clean. Nice stay

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at the Embassy Suites for a week in September. This hotel is excellent for families who prefer not to stay in a hotel room. My family, 2 adults, 2 kids, had a 1-bedroom apartment. The bedroom was quite large with 2 queen beds, and there was a fold-out couch in the living area. There is a bar fridge and bench space, but I would not call the kitchenette self-contained, as we were used to coming from Australia. There was not even a teaspoon or a single plate, but there was a kettle, a coffee maker, and paper cups. Our room was very very quiet - we could hear the live music if the sliding doors were open but all music stops very early. We did not notice any bad smells as was mentioned by another reviewer. The pool is not spectacular but it is fine; there are lots of lounges and it was never very busy. I agree with another reviewer's comments that at times there were rowdy pool games going on that were not monitored by staff. The breakfast buffet was really good with a wide range to choose from. There was never a shortage of staff and all staff (bar one reception staffer) were very polite and helpful for the majority of our stay. The location is great; a short walk to the beach and just a minute's walk from the main shopping street.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We recently returned from a 7 night stay at the embassy suites. Such a fantastic hotel. We loved every minute of our stay. The staff were friendly and helpfull and our room for a family of 5 fantastic. We were in the aloha tower room 1203. Our house keeper did a fantastic job and we loved seeing her smiling face and enjoyed her talks about what to do in Hawaii. The breakfasts were fantastic as were the Managers receptions. The only suggestion I could make to improve our stay would be for management to ban ball games in the pool. Some of the "bigger" kids were just eat to rough and our smaller kids got hurt. However a fantastic hotel and we hope to return again soon.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: After an 11 day cruise from Vancouver to the Hawaiian Islands, we decided to extend our stay in Honolulu at the Embassy Suites. We were located in the Aloha towers room 1101. The room was clean, but the view was plain - not so nice part of town. . But I never expect much with Hilton rewards stays. They placed us next to the elevator (which made noise all night and all day), so nappers, this would not be a good room to stay in. We couldn't open our sliding glass door due to the horrible smells coming from the street level. But as I said, reward rooms usually are the worst locations unless you argue for a better room - which I wasn't in the mood after an 11 day cruise. Breakfast buffet was a great surprise with the addition of Miso soup, sticky rice and kimchi (which I loved!), so it made up for the smelly neighborhood and the noisy elevator. Big warning - never leave you food alone to get your coffee! The local pigeons have learned to quickly attack unattended plates and will walk all over your food looking for choice selections. We watched in horror as a flock of birds attacked one table while the entire family went to get their drinks. Manager special was good with a variety of choices mixed drinks and draft beers. I liked that they listed the available drinks on a sign so you don't have to guess what they can make. Drinks are not cheap along Waikiki, so I'd definitely recommend starting your evening there with the live music (big bonus). The location was very good for the price - two blocks from high society shopping; directly above the Yard House Pub - with over 140 beers on tap; and 1 block from waikiki beach thru a dimly lit narrow walkway (usually staffed by the local workers on their smoke break); 2 blocks from the Hale Koa Luau (highly recommended) and recreational beach for military members and families. It's wonderful that there are no private beaches, so you can plop your towel anywhere! If you want to see more, $30 can get you the waikiki on/off trolly for two days since parking at Embassy Suites was $30/night. Overall, a good location for those on a Honolulu budget!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My husband and I stayed here celebrating our 5th anniversary. I had read all of the reviews equally but know that a persons review is based primarily on a persons expectations. Our expectations were high based on Hilton experiences. I'm going to start by addressing some of the negative points others stated. First, lets address the breakfast. The variety of choices was pretty standard. We stayed for a little over a week and had pretty good variety for the time we were there. They do cater to the Asian clientele so there are some not so normal choices (of course an American point of view). As far as the birds are concerned. They are there, they don't bother you and swarm around you. They are there because breakfast is out on the patio. If they bother you just being around then you do have the option of wearing inside. However, the majority of the restaurants that you foot are "open" and the birds are there too. We didn't find them to be a bother at all. The rooms were great, no complaints here. We had a city view which we didn't mind. The best ocean view is from outside anyway. We stayed in the Aloha tower on the 16th floor. Our room was next to the elevator and yes you can hear it but the noise did not bother us. The key is to ask for the king rooms that are at the end of the hall instead. As far as proximity to the beach. The distance is not even a block. You can actually walk across the street and cut through the Outrigger Reef hotel and get to the beach in no time! Plus there is an awesome restaurant called the Shorebird there that is great for lunch. Roy's is located right inside of the Embassy. We celebrated our anniversary there and the food from start to finish was phenomenal!!!!! If you need souvenirs there is an ABC store on just about every corner to fit your every need for a reasonable price. Please feel free to message me if you want more info but this hotel is a must!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Everything about our stay was perfect. The room was awesome and the veiw of the ocean was exactly what I was hoping for. The staff were super friendly and made us feel like we were at home. This was the best traveling experence my husband and I have had in the fifteen years we've been married and we have been to forty-seven states.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had a great stay at the Embassy Suites Beach Walk! Our 2 bedroom suite was very roomy and comfortable, the free breakfast had a great selection, the Manager's reception was very nice and the employees were friendly and helpful! We would definitely stay there again!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Booked a 2 bedroom suite and everything was clean and spacious, this property is definitely more expensive than other Embassy Suites but is so much better, hardly any crowds for managers reception and breakfast which I really appreciated. Great location, close to beaches, shops and restaurants. Friendly staff and they let us check in super early, would definitely return.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: On my first trip to Hawaii, I had alot of Hilton Honors points, so I used them for 1 week at this hotel. Before deciding which Hilton property, I did alot of research and also talked to the Hilton agent on the phone. I ended up going with Embassy Suites and boy was I glad I did!The property is newer than the other hotel, but more importantly, is in a much better location along Lewers street with close proximity to great food and drinks. To name a few, Yardhouse, Halekulani Hotel (house without a key restaurant), Nobu, etc.The free breakfast, free drinks in the evenings, and the overall ambience of the hotel is very nice. If I could afford to stay here, I would stay here instead of the Waikiki Parc.We were actually upgraded to an awesome room with wrap around balconies facing the ocean because of my Hilton status at the time (helpful if you are a frequent flyer, consultant, or something like that).If I were to summarize, location location location.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great place to stay, especially for families. Had a 2 bedroom suite, city view, which was great - all the other hotels, stores etc. were lit up at night and we even had a firework display on the Saturday evening. The suite was very comfortable, great to have two beds in the second bedroom as we have older boys who do NOT want to share beds!!!All the staff were really friendly and couldn't do enough for us. The Managers drinks and snacks evening was very good - free cocktails and soft drinks and a wonderful band playing several times a week (really good musicians actually). Pool area good - lots of loungers available and pool towels provided. Food at pool Bar quite pricey but massive portions, so no need to buy a meal per person. Spa in pool is BOILING!! Couldn't stay there very long, much too hot for us when the weather was really hot anyway. As for the free breakfast, where do I start??? It was fantastic - so much choice - make sure you try the 'design your own omelettes'!! They'll keep you going all day!
