Didn't try the Fitness Suite but it looked as though there was a good assortment of excercise machines if you felt energetic enough to want to use them. The Business Suite was good, able to check e-mails and accounts and also print off boarding cards for our next flight. Would definitely recommend the Embassy Suites - location is great, a five minute walk from the beach but still central for shops etc. and everyone was so friendly and helpful. 11 out of 10!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Older style property, good condition, very friendly staff, breakfast, managers drinks and other services provided excellent. If you are looking for a reasonably priced hotel for a family break with helpful staff this is a place for you. We have been to Hawaii on 5 occasions and would rate this ahead of Westin and Sheraton properties for great staff attitudes, and a "no problem can do service"

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had a wonderful stay.. Our suite was awesome, the staff friendly, and Roy's Restaurant was absolutely fabulous!! We stayed in the Aloha Tower, 16th floor, two bedroom suite, partial ocean view with balcony.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We enjoyed our stay at Embassy Suites. We stayed in a one-bedroom partial ocean view suite in the Aloha Tower on the 7th floor. Our king bed was comfortable and was large enough to accommodate a provided crib for our toddler son. The suite was very clean although they could do a better job of dusting the shutters. The suite included a kitchenette with a sink and mini fridge so if you are looking to do any cooking, this isn't the place for you. The bathroom is accessed through the bedroom. We didn't hear or see too much of our neighbors but since our end room was overlooking the Great Lanai where the manager's reception is held, we could hear the music in the living area. It ended by our early bedtime so it wasn't a problem for us. Valet service was great and they always got us our car quickly and were eager to help with our bags or provide directions.Breakfast was good but not great, with a wide selection of the usual American breakfast items (cereal, toast, pastries, eggs, potatoes, bacon and sausage) and also some Japanese ones, including miso soup and white rice. Breakfast is from 6:30am to 10am and when we ate breakfast around 6:30-7am, the wait at the omelet station ranged from no wait to a couple of minutes.The swimming pool is medium-sized with a kiddie pool and jacuzzi attached and wasn't very busy when we were there. But if you're looking for romance in the Jacuzzi, I'm not sure if this is the place for it since its attached to the pool and there were several kids there during the only evening that we stopped by. Also, we did laundry once and it cost about $5 for one load (detergent, washing machine and drying machine). There were around 4 washing machines and 3 dryers but we didn't haven't to wait for anyone and the machines were really fast. The location was great. It's across the street from Fort DeRussy park beach, which has a wide beach with barely any waves (at least in September) so it was great for swimming with kids. It's one block away from the main drag of Waikiki where many corporate restaurants and stores are located. There's an ABC store, a 7-11, and Ramen Nakamura that are just around the corner. And for those that like the Cheesecake Factory (there was always a long wait so it seems like a lot of people like it), it's about a 10 minute stroll.Great place to stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed here with our family of six for 9 nights in August and had a totally wonderful stay. The hotel and staff were excellent. We had a 2 bedroom unit on the 14th floor with a city/partial ocean view and it provided everything we needed for a comfortable vacation with 4 older children. The 2 bedroom suites have 3 TV's, small fridge, microwave and 2 bathrooms. One thing to note, you're staying in a big city so it's going be noisy if you want to sleep with the balcony doors/windows open no matter how high your room is. The hotel is located in a very commercial part of Waikiki, there's lots of amenities and shopping but it's also a very active and busy area.The free breakfast became a treat we looked forward to every morning and should not be missed, kudo's to the nice breakfast staff. The manager's happy hour was also very nice, a great place to cool down from a day at the beach and have some free drinks before heading out to dinner. They serve alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks so all ages are welcome. We read some reviews where people complained about the quality of the drinks offered; Did you think they were going to serve free champagne and Chateau Lafite Rothschild, of course not. You're on a Hawaiian vacation, the tropical drinks, beer and sangria's were perfectly fine. There's lots of ABC stores nearby if you're looking for better spirits and wine.Our flight was delayed so we arrived late in the evening; the check-in staff was excellent and fruit drinks were brought out to us while we checked in. A very nice touch after a long travel day from Canada. We have been to Waikiki about 6 times and while this was the nicest hotel we have stayed in, it was also the most expensive. However, when you factor in the free breakfast, free manager's happy hour, the 2 bedroom suite and other hotel amenities, we found it to be pretty good value. We would stay here again.Nearby restaurants to consider:The Yard House - Very busy but excellent bar type food, great service, go at happy hour for the 1/2 price appetizers and reduced prices on drinks. The happy hour runs pretty late so you can save money by making it an early dinner and order a bunch of appetizers.Kaiwa Waikiki - Very good Japanese food but brutally expensive.Giovanni Pastrami - Would not recommend except for the take out pizza. Their pastrimi/smoked meat sandwiches were mediocre, the service was indifferent and they have the air conditioning temperature set way too low, it was like eating in a walk-in cooler.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: At first thought this hotel might seem a little pricy however when all things are considered it is actually a pretty good value. First off, the hotel is everything you want when you travel. The hotel is obviously well taken care of; it is in great condition. The rooms are very nice and spacious and the pool area is great. I was very impressed with how clean the rooms were and the staff was so friendly and helpful. It is an added bonus that as a guest you are getting a free breakfast and free alcohol at the manager's reception everyday; and this is nice breakfast buffet that even includes an omlette station. On the weekend they even had a live band at the reception. The location is nice as well, only a short walk to the beach. Overall, I have nothing bad to say about this hotel, I am very glad we decided to stay here for our vacation.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: For the last five years we have stayed at this hotel in Honolulu to celebrate our anniversary. From the moment you arrive to the bittersweet moment you leave... the place is head and shoulders above similar venues in Waikiki. The entire staff go out of their way to make your stay the best it can be, the breakfast buffet is great with more than adequate selection... the manager's reception is fabulous and the Chang family who perform there on a regular basis are fantastic with classic and modern Hawaiian entertainment. We have stayed at several high-end properties on Oahu, condos, etc., and this is the only place we consider now. Being a Hhonors members we are always treated with the utmost respect and our rooms have always been upgraded. If I could say one negative word... it would be that it is sad to leave.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our stay was wonderful, nothing was left out. We found the first person we met at registration to be warm, friendly, and helpful. The breakfast was outstanding and the staff were very helpful and friendly. The hotel was filled with extra touches including the fruit water in the lobby to the live band on Friday night. The suite was exceptional. Two large bedrooms with bathrooms and a setting area with tv and kitchen area were perfect. The view of the pool and surrounding area was perfect. The hotel location was amazing. close to everything. The hotel valle workers including Jeff were very helpful and his information very accurate.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed just one night until our condo was ready to occupy. Bellman was quick to meet my shuttle and whisk away three suitcases. Front desk sit-down check in service was lovely, as was the glass of juice I was provided. Breakfast the next morning was very nice and I appreciated the omelet station. Check-out was quick and easy and the bell desk was very accomodating as far as holding my bags for a few hours. The zinger was when I returned in the afternoon to retreive my bags, I asked for just two of them as I needed to walk across the street to my condo. The gentleman quickly offered to take all three to my condo for me on a cart! Was greatly appreciated since it had just rained and was getting quite humid right about then.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had only one day,it was great they upgraded our room. My daugter is sick so that was very nice. had a hard time with the elevator, figuring the hotel card out.parking was a little on the high side.If we can I would stay there al the time.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed at the ES for ten days as a family of three. Hilton Diamond member staying on points. Requested ocean view room two weeks prior to arrival and was refused but was granted when we checked in. Stayed in room 1432- view towards Trump hotel and out towards Hilton Hawaiian Village and airport. Great views of sunsets and the HHV Friday night fireworks. Staff at the hotel was superb. For example the man who helped us bring in our luggage remembered us by name throughout our trip and always asked my son if he was having a good time. Housekeeping was excellent. Hotel and room seemed to be in good shape overall. Nothing overly fancy, but nice to have the extra space of a suite for such a long stay. Valet was always quick and had our car ready for us before we made it down the elevator. Breakfasts were a notch above normal ES that I have had with a few nice local touches with fresh fruit and a fairly large miso soup/salad station. Lunch and dinner service served at the pool was very well done with a good selection of sandwiches and salads. Poolside bar was well stocked and reasonably priced 7.50 for a piña colada. Managers reception was always busy but they always had two bartenders on staff- and kept the line moving. Location- on the beach walk- kind of hard to find by car as the streets surrounding the hotel are all one way. If you make a mistake you can cut through the Trump parking garage to get back over the ES valet. The beach has two public access paths directly across the street from the hotel. Turn right to get to Ft. Durussy beach a very narrow and rocky beach. Turn left and the path right before the Sheraton hotel takes you out to a walkway that gets you to Waikiki beach. We found that the beach in front of the Royal Hawaiian (pink hotel) had great sand and some fun waves. It was our go-to beach when walking from the hotel. Five minute walk from hotel to this beach. The Beawchwalk retail area was nice- good souvenir shopping, a large ABC store, a Starbucks and quite a few restaurants. Highly recommend the Yard House for good casual food. I would happily stay again at this hotel and would highly recommend it to other families traveling to Honolulu on vacation.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We have stayed at this hotel 3 times in the past three years and each time they find a way to exceed our expectations!! We love this all suites hotel. The rooms are spacious and well appointed.On our most recent visit, we had an ocean view room and the views were breathtaking! We were on one of the top floors and our corner suite faced the ocean on each side! This certainly wasn't a "partial ocean view"!!My wife and I were travelling with a toddler and a young child and the spacious suite is perfect for this! The added bedroom allows for the kids to sleep at their normal times, without fear of disturbing them.The added value of the complimentary made to order breakfasts each day also offer value that most of the Embassy Suites competitors at Waikiki cannot match. Good variety of food, including the freshest fruits and customizable made-to-order omlettes! Delicious!I would like to also comment on the staff! FANTASTIC! I also want to ackowlege one of the bell staff. I think his name was Johnnie. On the first day there we settled in and were headed down to the beach with the kids in tow and we forgot to grab our beach towels. He was in our elevator on the way down to the beach and he noticed this fact. He offerred to grab us some, but we decided it wasnt such a big deal (the weather was typically beautiful). He insisted and stopped the elevator on the next floor and ran off to grab 4 towels for us! He was so friendly and wow...talk about service! Who else would even notice that we didnt have beach towels (among all of our gear), muchless who would go thru the trouble of ensuring we had what we needed to have a great time at the beach! Thanks Johnnie!The General Manager was AMAZING in accomodating a special request. He really helped out my family and helped ensure that we have the VERY best experience possible in his hotel! Its obvious why this hotel is so fantastic - it has a great leader! My only regret is that I didnt get the opportunity to thank him personally!Like I said, we have stayed at the Embassy Suites 3 times in the past 3 years and we won't stay anywhere else! Loyal for life!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great location, loved the breakfast. Staff very helpful and rooms good size. The free wifi kept the kids in touch with their friends! The managers reception was a great way to unwind, the house band were fab- would love to know their band name! Would stay again. Ahola!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Free breakfast each morning, a pool to cool you down at night, after hour free drinks and food at night to start you off before dinner. Rooms are very nice and clean with a big flat screen TV and free internet. Close to shopping, restaurants, and tour bus pickup.The pool is on the 4 floor so you don't have to go down to the lobby. No charge if you have to print something out on the Embassy Suite printer. The on thing I would change is the elevator let you out in the back of the hotel. You had to walk around to the front of the build to get to the front desk.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at ES mainly because we had the baby. Wanted more room. Great for that and would come back. However just remember that the suites are not the traditional big ones from other ES. Good. Location right on beach walk. Very close walking to yard house, pfchangs and eggs and things. Also to SAMs kitchen ( great local food stands). Right above Roy's. Breakfast included About 5 minute walk to edge of Waikiki beach main spots at Sheraton. And 3 minute from beach right behind the outrigger Bad. Pool opens at 9am. What is that. Elevators are slow ( meaning not enough elevators for the number of rooms$. They actually go very very fast. No real ocean view if your not up high. Laundry always full and machine for qtrs doesn't work. All in all a great stay would go back.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The location if fabulous. What really made our stay pleasant was the team members. I must say they are a truly engaged team. Great service from Valet, Front Desk, Housekeeping and Maintenence team. The several calls that I made, every call was answered within 3 rings and next thing is someone is knocking at my door with 5 minutes. When I needed my car, i never had to wait no more than a minute. Now that's what I call service.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Labor day was spent at the Embassy Suites Waikiki. We are from Hawai'i but decided to have a staycation to celebrate our 5th year wedding anniversary. My two boys enjoyed the pool, my husband enjoyed the manager's reception (free happy hour), and I enjoyed the delicious breakfast. Everyone was very satisfied! The only thing I did not like was the PARKING! $30 a day is a rip off!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at the Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach in June/July 2012. The location is fantastic - you are one block from the beach and right on the beach walk - right in the middle of everything. The pool was very family friendly. The breakfasts and happy hour snacks were wonderful. We were on the 18th floor with a partial ocean view... it was beautiful. The laundry facilities were good, but always busy. The room had plenty of space for my family of 4. I would stay here again in a heartbeat!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was our fourth stay at this Embassy Suites. Our stay was for seven nights in March. Sorry for the delay in posting. We already have our reservations for next March. This is such a lovely place. We received a complimentary room upgrade to ocean view. Just lovely. Our maid couldn't have been kinder. She gave us recommendations for the Legend restaurant in Chinatown. The complimentary breakfast and happy hour are great. We enjoyed the band more on our previous stays. This time they didn't play any Hawaiian music and the hula dancer did not perform on any of the nights we were there. We missed the Aloha spirit from previous years. Mahalo and looking forward to our next stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Mini-kitchen? Check! Separate bedroom? Check! Free breakfast and free hosted bar in the evenings? Check, and Check! Yeah, it's busy, but if you want to to save your money for activities OTHER than food, this is the place for you. Rooms are beautiful - just ask for an upper floor away from the elevators. Valet parking is $30/day, so be wary - but they deliver your car in a snap.The pool is small, but family friendly. If you are looking for romance, however, go across the street to the Trump.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We booked our room in February for our trip at the end of July. I was so surprised when we checked in and were told that we were upgraded to a partial ocean view. We were on the 20th floor and the view of the ocean was AMAZING. There was plenty of room for 2 teenagers and 2 adults. We were in the Hula tower and all of the artwork, furnishings and even the carpet had a Hula theme. We got up early to surf every morning and got back for their wonderful, cooked to order omelette breakfast - lots of breakfast choices with plenty of fresh fruit. Everyone had the Aloha spirit and made us feel so welcome.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had a 2 bedroom apartment. The rooms were quite large, which we enjoyed. The furnishings were very "Hawaiian" and made our holiday special. We were happy with the easy access and enjoyed the location. A few things we found a bit odd. Our apartment had a "kitchenette" but had absolutely no plates, cups or cutlery. Part of the reason for getting an apartment was so I could prepare some evening meals in ( I have celiac disease, and my boys are naughty at night) so it is easier to dine in. The breakfast that was included was a bit ordinary.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: When it comes to Embassy Suites properties, this one is the best of the best. Everything from the open air lobby, to the large open breakfast area, managers reception is top notch. Granted upon checkin, the front desk agent was not the most welcoming/lacked the aloha spirit, everything else about the hotel made up for it.The rooms are large suites with one or two beds in the guest room and a decent size living room which is awesome for families traveling together or large groups as was mine. Fortunately for us, we got an awesome upgrade to a top floor corner room with a wrap around balcony which boasted a decent view of the ocean.Breakfast was standard ES with a little bit of local flavor thrown into the mix for good measure. The evening managers reception provided plenty of drinks and cocktails to go around as well.Location wise, this property was nothing short of awesome! Personally, as long as I am really close to the beach, and have a decent view of it, I am good to go as I don't really see a need to spend all the extra $$ to be right there on the beach and give up the larger room, breakfast and managers reception. Also, being right on beach walk ave, there are a ton of restaurants right next to and around the hotel.Next time I am in HNL, you can bet I am staying at the Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach Walk.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: After researching many hotel options and getting input on the tripadvisor Honolulu forum, our family of seven (four kids ages 9-15, plus my mom) stayed at the Embassy Suites in Waikiki for two nights before our week-long Pride of America cruise and one night afterwards. It was a great fit for our family, since it is across the street from the luxurious Halekulani hotel and beach, and in the heart of the Waikiki Beachwalk shopping and dining area. All of the rooms are suites, and we chose a two bedroom/two bathroom unit that had a kitchenette unit (sink, small refrigerator and microwave), plus a living room with a table, flat screen TV and sleeper sofa. The bedrooms are spacious and comfortable and had flat screen TVs. We enjoyed the spacious units and island decor. Everyone slept well, with no street noise. Our first stay was in a city view room, but our second was upgraded to a partial ocean view at no additional charge. the view was lovely. We didn't use the pool as our kids preferred the beach. There are complimentary yoga classes offered some mornings. Others mentioned the boogie boards that could be borrowed...too bad we didn't know about that. Breakfast buffet is included, which we enjoyed since there are some Japanese options (miso soup, salad, rice with fun mix-in options) plus make your own omelets, delicious fresh tropical fruit, guava juice, and the usual hotel buffet spread. We ate dinner one night at House without a Key, the casual outdoor restaurant at the Halekulani, plus Sunday brunch. The well-regarded Hawaiian fusion restaurant Roy's, is in this hotel, which we will keep in mind for a future visit. Service was excellent, from the quick & easy check-in and complimentary tropical drinks to the bellhops picking up our luggage in our room and storing it while we explored Honolulu on our embarkation and disembarkation days. Parking is $30/day, valet only, but the valets were quick & helpful, and will give you printed turn-by-turn directions to popular attractions. The concierge was friendly & helpful, even though we didn't need him to book any excursions for us. We didn't attend the complimentary manager's reception as we had luau tickets that night. Our son left a nice polo shirt behind on our first stay, but housekeeping brought it back to us when we asked about it during our second stay. The location is excellent for the price. It is a very short walk to the beach, shopping, and fun Beachwalk restaurants. There are many ABC convenience stores nearby for any groceries, beach supplies, or souvenirs that you need. We would stay here again the next time we visit Honolulu.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: When you get to the hotel, a pleasant surprise awaits you which was enjoyed by the family. The convenience of having a complimentary breakfast with many items to choose from and happy hour before you go out for the evening is well worth paying a little more when you're dealing with a family. The location is also great being one block from the beach and also one block from the high end shops.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We looked into many hotels in Waikiki that could accommodate a family of 5. Most required two rooms which I was not comfortable doing so we chose the Embassy Suites Waikiki and could not have been any happier. The room was big enough for us and very clean. The breakfast every morning was excellent and the Manager's Reception was something my kids looked forward to every night. The hotels location was perfect, close to the action, but not too close. The hotel staff from the valets to housekeeping were very helpful and friendly. Our room was in the Hula tower. We stayed for 10 days and could have stayed even longer! I highly recommend the Embassy Suites!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Was a good value with breakfast and evening cocktails. Central location in Waikiki. We only stayed one night to be closer to the airport for a flight the next morning, very convenient to the airport. Breakfast had a good selection of food including an omelet station. I would recommend this location.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Good location. Clean. Helpful and competent staff. All amenities as advertised. Convenient to public transportation which covers the whole island. I was here alone on a business trip, but it looked like a great place for a family vacation. I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Have just returned from a lovely stay at this property. We had a 1 bedroom suite which, while not as large as the suite we stayed at in Maui, was spacious enough for my husband and I, along with our 2 year old. The location was perfect, a 3 minute walk from the beach and only moments from the main shopping street and restaurants. The pool was really nice, and staff were very helpful and efficient regarding any requests that we had. I had read other reviews saying that rooms beside the lift could be quite noisy so, when we were shown to a room right beside the lift, I requested a move. I didn't hear anything while we were there but, just in case, I was hoping that they could accommodate my request. Fortunately this was possible and we were able to move to another king room at the end of the hall. We were told that the king rooms are located either side of the lift on each floor, which is why this is such a comon problem, and then there's another king room at the end of the hall - the latter normally get allocated first. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others. Mahalo, Embassy Suites!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: ProsOverall friendly staffCommon areas are clean & well maintained (Pool is vacuumed daily)Great viewConsBeds too soft (awoke with a sore neck & back)Sewer odor in bathroom (room 1731…see below)Parking is expensive (see below)Rooms need updatingThere was a nauseating sewer odor emanating from the bathroom of our suite (#1731). The maintenance man inspected the area and said he couldn’t smell anything. The gentleman at the front desk offered no resolve claiming that the hotel was fully booked, and his demeanor suggested that I was attempting to negotiate something for nothing. After tolerating the odor for four nights, we were more than happy to leave the Embassy Suites forever. Sad considering that a $2 wax toilet seal would have solved the problem (wish they had better maintenance).The parking costs $30 per day, and is valet parking only. We felt obligated to tip the valet every time we wanted to use our rental car.I take my family to Waikiki twice-a-year for vacation, where we like to try different hotels. On our next visit to Waikiki, we plan to stay at one of the two hotels we enjoyed the most. For location, comfort, and hospitality, we will stay at either the Hyatt, or the Outrigger Waikiki On The Beach. We will never return to the Embas”smelly” Suites!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our family stayed in a two-bedroom suite for our week-long trip. The hotel was just perfect - huge amount of space, included breakfast, and close access to the beach. Although the hotel is not directly on the beach, we found that our travel distance to the beach was shorter than had we stayed at "mega-resorts" on the beach. The staff was great. I've never seen more efficient bell men and valets. We will definitely be staying here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is a PERFECT place to stay while in Waikiki. We just returned from an 11-day trip to Hawai'i and it all began with 4 nights at the Embassy Suites. We had a great room for our family of 4 (mom, dad and 16 and 10 year old boys). We were on the 5th floor which allowed easy access to breakfast and the pool - both of which are on the 4th floor.Breakfast each morning was wonderful and a great perk for my hungry boys. They were able to wake up... run down and eat while allowing mom and dad to sleep in a bit. Awesome.The food was very good and rotated through a few different choices on a daily basis. The made-to-order omelet station was my favorite part. Delicious.As other have said, they do have boogie-boards available to use simply for the asking. On their last day a family who purchased 2 boards offered them to my boys. We used them then donated them to the ES for others to use. The rooms are large and comfortable. Clean and very inviting. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom was large and clean. Parking is very easy but it's valet only. The valet's are very quick when it comes to bringing your car to you.The ES is in a perfect location and literally a walk across the street to the beach. There are a TON of shops, restaurants, ABC Stores, etc. all withing steps of the ES making it perfect for our family.When (not if) we return to Oahu, this is where we will stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I've stayed here five or six times now, either with family or on business and every time it reminds me I made the right choice. I've also stayed at all the other Hilton properties on the island, as well as the Outrigger across from the International Market area. The ES Beachwalk has large, comfortable and clean rooms, obviously super for families as well as couples/individuals that like more 'apartment-like' space. The pool is clean and well kept, with an interesting flooring and always at a good temperature. Happy Hour is well run, generous, as is the breakfast - this property tops traditional mainland ES breakfast offerings with a few Hawaiian / Asian touches. Location is fine, not too far from anything, and just a bit outside of the noisiest parts of Waikiki, so sleep is actually achievable (not so on mid-strip properties I've stayed at)! I've raved about this place on flyertalk and some other forums - as a HHonors Diamond, they've always taken my room requests under consideration, and the front desk and other staff have been helpful regardless of status. The GM (Bob, who has posted replies to reviews on this site) took personal attention to a request a couple stays ago, and that was appreciated. I just finished a letdown of a stay at the Rome Waldorf Cavaleri (supposedly one of the best in the HH family of hotels), and was let down enough that I booked a four-day stay upcoming in October back at the ES Beachwalk just to remind myself of what a fun Honors property is all about!I look forward to another great stay!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My daughter and I recently stayed here and we were just amazed how friendly, eager to assist, and their amenities, food and rooms were absolutely fabulous. The cleanliness was outstanding. We had looked for quite along while to find a place that ticked all the things we wanted. Internet free with our computers was good also.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We loved the Embassy Suites Waikiki Beachwalk. It is only one block from the beach. While this is not as ideal as staying right on the beach, the extra space at the Embassy Suites and the full breakfast more than make up for it. The Embassy Suites is also a short walk to many restaurants and shopping choices. If you have a car, the hotel charges $30 a night and it's valet only. The valet service was very friendly and efficient. Ask them for turn-by-turn driving directions to the most popular attractions. All the staff was friendly, courteous, and efficient. We were very happy with the breakfast options, the amount of space in the suites, the furnishings and amenities, and housekeeping did an excellent job each day. Would highly recommend this resort. We would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: It is not cheap, but we loved it here. There are 5 in our family, including 2 teen boys and to enjoy a 10 day holiday, we all need our own space. We had a 2 bedroom suite, and it was lovely. 2 bathrooms, large bedrooms, plenty of space, well appointed rooms and calm, serene decor. The floors/ rooms were quiet our entire stay. The full breakfast in the morning is worth it! We all started the day well fed, and the variety was impressive. We easily had light lunches with sandwiches or salads we bought at ABC or left overs we stored in the fridge and then had great evening meals out, only having to buy 1 meal a day was a huge saving. The staff were incredibly accommodating, warm and aloha friendly. Lei greeted us and brought us coffee every morning! She was so sweet! The pool was a bit small, but the kids never minded! We found the mornings less busy at the pool but by 2, people had come back from their activities and it got a lot more crowded. But we never had a problem getting loungers. the bar staff were friendly and the nightly managers reception was also great for free drinks and light snacks. We would get a couple of drinks before we went out or dinner. The location was incredible! Close to everything! 5 min walk to Grays Beach which we loved as it was tucked away and not crowded. The restaurants, shopping and ABCs were all within 2 minute walking distances, starbucks was close, what more could you want. We used the valet service and car parking for 3 days while we rented a car and it was convenient and comparable in price to anything else in other major cities. again, the staff from valet, to front desk, to house keeping, pool and food services were all top notch. I would highly recommend the Embassy Suites and would stay again in a heartbeat.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I looked long and hard for other family accommodation options in Waikiki but determined the Embassy Suites remained the best choice for us. I was not disappointed. The all-suite hotel is very good indeed and well suited to families with young children.The location is excellent with immediate access to some great eating and entertainment options in and around Lewers St. The hotel is one block back from the beach and many rooms lack spectacular views that can be found elsewhere.I stayed on Level 15 where there was no street noise. Room 1506 was across from the elevators and no noise there either.Room cleanliness was excellent with the chambermaid (Jenny) doing a first class job. Room amenities were also very good with two LED TVs with about 40 channels available. Sleep quality was excellent as the beds are very comfortable. There is a small fridge, microwave and coffee maker in the room. The WiFi internet access was surprisingly good (and free). The room appeared to have been recently refurbished and all furniture and fittings were in excellent condition.Breakfast is included and is generally of good quality. The cooked-to-order omlettes are excellent. Some of the other options get a little boring during longer stays and the 'orange juice' is pretty awful. Fruit is plentiful and very high quality.The Manager's Drinks session (5:30 - 7:30 every evening) is a really good feature. The Mai Tais taste great and they sure pack a real punch. The included snacks are basic e.g. chips, peanuts Doritos etc. There is live entertainment 4 nights a week and the Hawaiian band is pretty good. The price is right - everything is included in your room rate. The swimming pool is great for young children but not really suitable for adults wanting to relax or do laps. The pool is about 6m x 20m with an adjacent hot spa and small section for infants to paddle around. Water cleanliness was excellent but there is no lifeguard on duty.I found hotel staff to be genuinely friendly and efficient. I was able to get an early check-in although the hotel was near capacity.During peak seasons, this hotel is not cheap and less expensive hotel rooms are easy to find. For me, the value of a separate bedroom, good breakfast, free cocktails and internet access is worth the extra room cost. And the smile on my daughter's face every evening before bedtime said it all.This is a very good hotel and I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We have stayed here many times. We always kept coming back because the rooms are, usually, great, our girls love the breakfast and the pool, and the staff is exceptional. Our last stay just did not live up to prior stays. Despite asking for a room away from elevators (our profile has this request as well), we were next to one. We booked the "local" rate where, to our surprise, it was only $30 less than the standard rate! The desk staff ok, when they are usually superb. Just felt like the place was loosing its shine. For the rate we payed as "locals" the last time, I think we will go somewhere else next time.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at the Embassy Suites in June, 2012. We had a 2 bedroom family suite and it was perfect for our family of five. Each bedroom had a bathroom and the family room area was between the two rooms. Our room had a great view of Diamond Head. The hotel is in a great location on the Beach Walk - close to restraunts, shopping and the beach. It was also very convienent to catch the bus to various attractions. In addition to great location it offers a nice pool area with live music many nights during the cocktail hour. We also found the staff to be very friendly and helpful with any questions we had regarding the area. We would highly recommend this hotel when vacationing in Honolulu.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is a great choice for a holiday in Waikiki. The family suites are large and a great for families. The rooms are a little dated in decor, especially the bathrooms, but this can be overlooked. There is a lot of street noise, so it an be hard for children to sleep. The location is wonderful and access to the beach is close. The manger drinks are dreadful. The wine that tastes like mentholated spirits and corn chips with bright orange cheese substance are inedible. It would be better to have a discounted cocktail special and beer at this time and a small bowl of nuts. The breakfast is standard, with the fresh fruit and omelet great choices. I really like this hotel and would stay here again, but my expectation would be more realistic, than based on the previous reviews.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: thanks Joe for a wonderful time there my family and i enjoyed our stay at your hotel .we love everything about the .the service was great the family and the vine thank you very much.thanks Piilani for the massage's its was wonderful and very relaxing .massage everyday omg .my friend and i really enjoyed the massage now she is asking when can we get massage again but i told her .we have to talk you first .aloha

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel is a great place to stay especially with children. The suite rooms, the breakfast, the staff,and the location make it one of the best deals in Waikiki Beach. I have spoken to many people about their hotels in Waikiki Beach and this is the best deal compared to all the others

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I booked this at 3 a.m. on-line "day of arrival" due to unsatisfactory hotel already booked in Oahu. When I called my son and his wife from the airport they had just checked in and said "this place is heaven!" It is a half block---just across the street---from the beach, surrounded by many restaurants, up scale shops, public transportation etc. What a relief to have a full and excellent breakfast every morning without having to leave the premises---and son and wife loved the cocktail hour every night. Given the price compared to other hotels I considered, this was a real deal. Full business center to keep in touch with the office, etc. and Roy's restaurant in the hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Staying here 4/nights - 5days -too short! Everyone very friendly & helpful. Room very large & spacious. Separate bedroom w/2 comfortable dble beds, lots of storage, separate small balcony. Living room has dble sleeper sofa, table w/3chairs, & a larger balcony.. Entry area has sink, frig, microwave. Large bathroom. Outdoor pool on 4th floor. Also a large eating area for the FULL daily breakfast & for the 5:30-7:30 pm daily managers reception with snacks, drinks (alcoholic & nonalcoholic), & live music. Having an in room massage tomorrow - can't wait! restaurants & shopping within walking distance. Beach across street. Very clean property.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I brought my grandson (and his mom, my daughter) to Hawaii to celebrate his 10th birthday. Frankly, Hawaii was not on my "bucket list" but he, being born on Pearl Harbor Day, really wanted to go there. After a very long plane ride, we were greeted with a cold drink and without any hassle, checked in and were shown to our room. Our stay was nothing short of wonderful: the hotel is impeccable, the staff gracious and very helpful. We all enjoyed the breakfasts; my grandson loved the pool (it is a great family place) and my daughter and I appreciated the manager's reception. A very special thank you to Noleani..the Expedia concierge. She was nothing short of AMAZINGl...before and during our trip. I would definitely stay at ES should I return and have already recommended it to friends.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at the Embassy Suites for 5 nights just before the 4th of July. The room worked out great for our family of 4. We had requested in advance a high floor room in the Hula Tower. We have Diamond status with Hilton so I assumed this would be no problem. Our course, when we checked on they had us on the 6th floor of the Aloha Tower. They basically said my status with Hilton, which I have maintained for years, didn't mean anything when I book with points. My wife didn;t like this a pushed and after a few minutes we were given a room on the 18th floor of the Hula Tower, 1826 to be exact. The room was right across from the elevator, which worked out great. I read a lot of reviews that suggested getting a high floor on the Hula tower, which is why I asked. I quickly realized the only views in that tower are if you are facing the pool. Our side looked out a condo property, that is taller that the Embassy. If I stood at the railing of my balcony and looked right, I had a partial view of the ocean (see my pictures). This really didn't bother me to be honest. I think the views might be better in the Aloha tower, if you had a higher room. In that tower there are less obstructions and it looked like you would either have a Diamond Head view or partial ocean view. Also, the breakfast area is just as close to the Aloha tower as the Hula tower.The breakfast buffet is the value here. Saves $$$ and was very good. Also, unlike many Embassy Suites, there was not an issue of finding a table, even at primetime. Plenty of room. One tip, sit more in the middle of the room or away from the open areas because of the birds.The happy hour is just so so, but I guess I should complain about free beer. The wine is undrinkable and I didn't try the tropical drinks. The snacks are basically pretzels and chips and salsa.There's a great little sushi place across Beachwalk across from the 7-11. Small place but great sushi. I think its in the Breakers hotel.The beach is ony a block away and there are many rental stands where for $25 you can rent an umbrella and 2 lounge chairs for 4 hours. When you get the beach turn right towards the Hilton and go a couple of stands down where the beach is wider.The pool area is nice and was never crowded, to my amazement. The pool is shallow and full of kids, but its cools you off when you need it. There's a bar by the pool and they have a simple bar food menu.If you rent a car, the parking could cost more than the rental. $30/day for valet. There is no self parking.On points I would stay here every time. If I had to pay for my room, I could probably get 2 rooms at the Hilton Hawaiian Village or somewhere else for what they charge here.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Fantastic place for a visit to Hawaii. Very good value with free breakfasts and a managers reception every evening which is essentially free drinks (cocktails and all) and snacks with a good band most nights. Very good value as we hardly had to but any other food during the day.Location is pretty good, just a couple of minutes to the beach although it has a good pool of its own

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our family of 4 stayed @ the Embassy Suites May 31-June 9. We were in the Hula Tower, 19th floor, the end room facing Waikiki, #1929, the view was wonderful, although there are two other hotels that are in the front, you can see over the hotels that are @ lower level,,as the ES is not right on the beach. Everything in Waikiki is expensive, and we found that the great breakfast in the morning of made to order omeletts/eggs waffles, toast, fruit a good value. Bob the manager personally welcomed us, which we really appreciated. We recommend booking the island activities through the Expedia desk in the lobby, Noelani was a great resource, and could not have been more professional and helpful with her recommendations and assistance. The best beach deal is renting the two chaise lounges/umbrella right in front of the Beachcomber one block from the hotel for $40.00/day. Get there early by 10:00 to reserve the front row, right on the water, and reserve a spot. Further down the beach they can run $80.00/day. $3.00 Mai- Tais @ the Beachcomber starting @ 3:00! AS A WARNING: Our only bad experience, NOT CONNECTED TO EMBASSY SUITES while in Waikiki, was involving the "Parrot Dise" guy down on the beach next to the Outrigger, one block from the ES. He takes pictures of families with his parrots with the beach in the the background. He took our cash,(a bad sign) and did not mail us our pictures, as promised. We called several times after we returned home, and he actually had the nerve to hang up on us twice! Finally, because he rents the space from another hotel, and we asked security to investigate, did he finally mail us the pictures. You would think he had a reputation to maintain, but apparently this is his MO with customers and cash. The pictures were not anything great. Take that, Mr. Parrot!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel was actually very very good. It was clean, the staff was friendly and went out of their way. It was close to everything, it was reasonably priced and my family enjoyed it! I would recommend it. There is a free breakfast buffet which has just about everything and every night between the hours of 5:30 pm and 7:30 pm they have a free happy hour!!!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel was great!! The people are very nice and the complimentary breakfast was very good with lots of choices. It is one block from the beach and 100 feet from the Royal Hawaiian shops, which are great for shopping. The on site valet is nice, but expensive.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My spouse and I stay for the weekend and we love it, the staff was great and food was excellent I would recommend this place,the rooms where really clean!!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My family, including my daughter 11 and my son 8, my wife and I, stayed at the Embassy Suites last summer and had a terrific time. You can't beat the location, 1 block from the famed Waikiki beach and right on Waikiki Beach Walk, with plenty of shops, restaurants and galleries. You can walk to anything from the hotel. The hotel breakfast is terrific and is served in one of the most beautiful breakfast spaces we have experienced at any hotel -- by the pool on a large, bright, indoor-outdoor patio. But for the fact that there is so much to do in Hawaii, I could have stayed there all day. They have a happy hour there too in the evenings, which is a little short on the offerings, but again makes up for it in the ambiance. We took a quick walk over to the Trump property next store -- which is much more expensive -- and all agreed we made the right choice in teh Embassy Suites; much more reasonable and just as nice-- actually nicer in many ways. We loved it. Can't wait to go back.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our room was fine and staff were always pleasant. We stayed 6 nights and only frustration at the start was the poor wifi only available on eating pool deck and in foyer. Having iPad meant no connection in room . On second last day we were informed wifi was installed on the floor we were on and this solved my only area of complaint about hotel. We were on 20 th floor with part ocean view in aloha building and no issues with noise from street and we were opposite lifts but were not bothered in night with noise from this either. Used the gym and machines were adequate. Breakfast was great. Fresh omelettes were yummy and kids happy with selection on offer from eggs, pancakes, cereals ,fresh fruit, pastries and bacon. It's s close to beach - just take the side path next to outrigger and you are on beach in less than two minutes from foyer and there s a quick side entrance from foyer to acces the strip of Waikiki shops. Valet is expensive at 25 dollars but then again it is Waikiki parking. Valets are quick and helpful with advice on how to get to places.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My family stayed at Embassy Suites for a week and I was mortified when I brought my concern to front desk. The day after we check in, I went to front desk to tell a lady her name is Gina, that we were across from elevator and it was very noisy with everyone talking outside our room at night. She never once sympethized with the situation but what she made me feel like i was lying to her. She has no front desk skills and I felt she didnt want to help me out. I explain to her I could not believe how mean and so cold hearted she is and that I dont feel she is qualified to work at this hotel. (very poor customer I ever received while staying at a hotel) I dont know, but maybe we don't come here again because she really made my trip very unwelcoming. I hope no one has my experience I went through because it shouldn't have happen this way.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Spent eight days in Waikiki (1st trip to Hawaii) and staying at Embassy Suites was a perfect choice. Great rooms, amazing breakfast and manager's reception with entertainment and free cocktails was fantastic. It is in a great part of Waikiki, close to the beach and surrounded by great places to eat and shop. Any issues were handled promptly and staff were all really friendly and accommodating. Will definitely stay here again and highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: When i visited these hotel. I was very exhausted but i felt good!! These is big and has good workers!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I stayed at this hotel for a week over the 4th of july. I am Hilton Gold and request a high floor away from the Elevators.... They put me on Floor 7 right across from the Elevators no view for $299 a night. Breakfast was great a few years ago but seems to have really got cheap now the omelet bar was great but the Link sausage was small and terrible and Tater Tots in place of hash browns or home frys come on what a joke..... The room is nice but for $299 + $41.87 tax and $30 for parking a night shame on you come on. If you don't need a two room suite just stay someplace else.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Located in the heart of Waikiki. From the balcony, we had views of the turquoise ocean in one direction and the cloud-topped mountains in the other direction. Quick walk to the beach and all the restaurants. The famed Embassy Suites breakfast each morning. Managers reception each night for beer and mixed drinks. Big two bedroom suite for my family. Very courteous service for everything we needed. This was a great choice in hotel for our first visit to Hawaii. If we go back, we'll go to Embassy Suites again!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Spent a week at Embassy Suites in 1 Bedroom with pull out couch on 16th floor. Our only complaint was the bedroom was next to the elevator but most nights we were so tired we could sleep through any thing. Loved Fort DelRussy Beach and park right by hotel. Watched the Friday night fireworks from our balcony. The entertainment each night was great especially the band that played. Nice treat drinks and snacks at night. Breakfast each morning was a great bonus.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed for 4 days on a reward stay and absolutely loved it! Great location - it's easy to walk to the main attractions of Waikiki. The Beach Walk has many restaurants and shops. Roy's is right there with excellent food. The staff was amazing. Very helpful and with the aloha spirit. Room is very nice with the separate bedroom. Pool was never crowded - maybe people were at the beach. It was never a problem to get a chair in a prime location. There was entertainment on a few nights with dancers and music.The breakfast buffet was good. The only negative is the lack of wireless connection in the rooms. I'm amazed that a very new hotel would not have included wireless in the room. There is a wired connection, but I had my iPad and could not hook up. The front desk lent me a router which I really appreciated.I had a view of the Trump hotel pool. It was fun to watch the activity there.Would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. We stayed for a week. The staff was great and so helpful, there was live music and drinks by the pool each night, and the breakfast had everything you could ask for. What I loved was that the pool and eating areas are on the 4th floor. So you have a good view of Waikiki, but not all the outside traffic. I felt we had privacy and security this way. All the hotels directly on the beach had the beach traffic and crowds around their pool. As I walked down the beach, I was thankful we were in the hotel we were.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We just stayed there for 7 nights. We had two rooms (one King and two queens) for our group. Our room was on the 9th floor with a balcony that had a great view of the night skyline and my parents room was on the 10th floor and they had a balcony with a view of the garden area. The location was very close to the beach and shopping. The breakfast was wonderful, even for a picky group that included a vegan and a vegetarian. Happy hour was great and the staff was exceptional.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We tried the Embassy Suites in Waikiki this time for our family trip. We were happy with the hotel for its location, the great free breakfast, the free drinks and snacks, and the very comfortable rooms. We were on the 4th floor, which is the same floor as the pool and breakfast area, but our room was still very quiet even with a fair amount of people walking down the hall at various times. Waikiki is so busy and noisy that it is hard to think of this as a vacation retreat, but I think that the Embassy Suites is a good option for Waikiki. It is close enough to the beach and the main shopping areas, that walking around is fine. We did not rent a car this time since parking is $30/day and the rental fees can be quite high.We would probably either stay here again or maybe the Hyatt Regency for about the same price. But at the Hyatt, you don't get the free breakfast and drinks/snacks.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I stayed there for one night on a recent "girls weekend." We had a room on the 4th floor, with a patio that went straight to the pool area. While the hotel is not directly on the ocean, the pool is great - always sunny, good bar food, not too crowded. The beach is directly across the street, and is one of the wider section of Waikiki Beach. The room itself is spacious (all-suite hotel), very clean, and more comfortable and updated than some of the higher-rated hotels in Waikiki. The location is great; in the middle of the best shops and restaurants around Waikiki. The free breakfast was better than expected - full hot breakfast with several selections.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Definitely one of the best family friendly hotels in the area. Beautiful rooms, great pool with view of the ocean. The breakfast buffet is outstanding....incredible selection and very tasty.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at this Embassy Suites for 8 nights, while on Oahu for a wedding. We chose the hotel because it had suites, was close to the beach and a full complimentary breakfast was offered daily. We had an excellent stay here. The staff was friendly and very helpful. Everyone seemed happy here! The property is right in the middle of the action of the area, with lots of shops and restaurants. Everything was convenient. We booked a partial ocean view room because we also enjoy the look of the city, especially at night. We had a nice view, and yes, the hotel sits between other high rises, but that wasn't a big deal for us. I would suggest a higher floor in the Hula Tower (closer to the beach). Our 20th floor room was perfect with a lanai off of the living area and also one off the bedroom. The daily managers reception is a very nice touch with great drinks (including tropical mixed drinks, wine, beer) and snacks. There was a great band that played about every other night during this time. Housekeeping was exceptional. Overall, we couldn't ask for a nicer, more reasonable place to stay while in Waikiki!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Just spent 3 nights here. Our two-bedroom suite was perfect. Lots of room, very clean, and the beds were extremely comfortable. The hotel is in a very nice area, close to new shops and restaurants, and close to the old Waikiki market place. The free breakfast was outstanding! My whole family agreed that the hash-browns were the best we've ever had. I would come back to this hotel in a heartbeat!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We love staying at the Embassy Suites. The location is close to the shops and to the beach, and the staff are very attentive and perform as expected. A free buffett breakfast and free alcohol and snacks are provided every day. There is no self parking, only valet parking. When we first arrived, we noticed that the room was next to the elevator. The bellman suggested that if we did not like the location, that we would switch. We decided to switch rooms and we appreciated the advice.The beach that is close to the hotel (near the outrigger) is rocky. We walked to Kuhio beach which has better sand and better facilties. It is a short and pleasant hike.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We many times stay at Embassy Suites on our vacations and we were glad we stayed at this one . Prices are high in Hawaii and we really enjoied the mangers reception and free drinks by the pool. PF Changs was 1 block away we ordered carryout and ate it by the pool then swam great hot tub very up scale decor we loved the dacor of our room the service was top notch and out room was free due to hilton honors points. Try Roys Restaurant on the first floor it is expensive but some of the best food we have ever eaten!!! The free Embassy Suits breakfast was one of the better ones too.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Beautiful hotel close to everything in Waikiki. Open-air entry and friendly, accommodating staff to welcome you upon your arrival. Our room was clean and well maintained. Our location was perfect in relation to the morning buffet breakfast. We simply walked out the door, around the corner and filled our plates! The breakfast staff were exceptionally friendly and offered tips and island info when asked. We were so busy each day with exploring the island that we never made it to the happy hour. It was a perfect location and we would definitely stay here again on our next trip to Hawaii!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My family, consisting of myself and my two daughters 11 and 9 were in Waikiki at the Embassy Suites between June 19th and June 24th. When we arrived we were very impressed with how someone immediately greeted us, took our luggage, and helped us check in. The welcome drinks were delicious. We had booked a Government rate room so knew it would not have a view. We were early so were happily surprised to be able to check into our room immediately. We were on the 5th floor in the Aloha tower. We found the room to be clean, spacious, and were surprised to have a view of a flower garden. The room was never noisy and we never heard other guests around us or the elevators. Our housekeepers were friendly and kept our room clean. They responded pleasantly to requests for more towels, etc.. Our room was was one floor above the breakfast/happy hour/pool area so were able to take the stairs to get there.The breakfast was delicious. My kids loved the miso soup, rice and fresh fruit. I loved the omelets and great fruit. Even though it was busy we never waited in line long or had difficulty finding a table. Happy hour was enjoyable. The snacks were simple, but they were kept well stocked. We had music two nights and hula dancing on Friday night. It was a great way to start the evening after going to the beach, shopping, swimming, etc.. I'm glad they kept the snacks simple as there were so many great places to eat around the area.I really can't think of one bad thing to say about our stay. We did not run into one rude staff member. Everyone was friendly and helpful. Valet service really nice people. The pool was adequate and we had no problem finding a seat. Liked the hot tub. Just remember Waikiki is a busy and active city and you have to look for places to relax. Embassy Suites fits the bill and was close to everything, including transportation. I would highly recommend this place if you have a family.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My wife, two kids and myself had a great 5 nights and six days of stay last week. It was by far the best hotel, service, staff and stay we have ever had in the last 10 years. I would like to name a few (I apologize if I didn't get the names of our housekeeper, and some valet guys) who didn't get tired acknowledging us every time they see us anywhere in the lobby or at the hall. Lauren at the front desk who gave us a very nice room, high floor that we wanted and plenty of smile during check in and surprisingly checked us out as well. Johnny the bellman was so smooth in handling of our bags and very informative with regards to what we need to know in the room, hotel and things we can enjoy in and out of the hotel during our stay. Aldrin at the breakfast place was very pleasant with greeting us his aloha smile every time we ran into him. He always made sure we have what we needed while we're having the best breakfast an amenity you can't find from the other hotel. Our housekeeper who provided us an impeccable service daily and the valet guys who took care of our rental car like their own. Most importantly, my kids loved the pool. My 6 yrs old son sobbed as soon as our plane took off because he said he's going to miss not only the island of Oahu but especially the hotel that captured our hearts.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed here for 2 nights with my husband and two year old child in a one bedroom condo in the Aloha tower.The room was lovely and modern, though didn’t come with any actual cooking facilities as I was expecting – only a bar fridge and microwave. The bedroom (separated by a solid door – a rarity in one bedroom condos in Waikiki) had a queen bed, tv and access to the lanai. Bed was unbeliveably comfortable!!The lounge area also accessed the lanai and had a sofa bed, though I honestly can’t see how you would fold it out in that size of room – with a coffee table, arm chair and dining table there really wasn’t much room to move around for the three of us, but that was fine because we were always out and about.The bathroom was large and well appointed - and spotless! The whole room was very luxurious compared to other places I’ve stayed at in Waikiki for similar price range.The pool area was brilliant – a large number of lounge chairs so there was always one available, two bars and Astroturf which meant you weren’t walking on hot pavement. The pool was the best – a heated pool with a hot tub and kids pool, it was fantastic for my little one and the best I’ve seen in Waikiki.Morning breakfast provided a great variety and I like that breakfast started pretty early (6am I believe), which for early risers is great. The nightly drinks with the manager were great and my only suggestion would be that they add pina coladas to the offering – their margaritas were sensational and made up for it, though.Waikiki Beach Walk is a great little area very different from the rest of ‘old waikiki’ and while the restaurants and shops were great, I personally liked to walk up to the older part of Waikiki as the beach is a little nicer (less rocks) and it feels less resort-y.Overall, I really liked this hotel – how rare that you can find a family oriented hotel that manages to please the whole family, while adding class and luxury.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Clean, beautiful and spacious rooms. Lovely pool- perfect for children of all ages. Yummy and diverse breakfast buffet. Wonderful, warm and helpful staff. Truly a great place to stay! In the thick of Waikiki.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: i traveled for my 2nd year anniversary with my 1yr old son and 15 year old daughter my mom and hubby. I wanted to stay at the embassy because i felt confident it would be clean and the free breakfast. Im glad i did the hotel was nice and i enjoyed the happy hour. The hotel wasn't to crowed in august 2010. i love d the abc store directly on the bottom of the hotel.The food was great with a diffrent dish each day we stayed for 5 days and the food was different each day fish and potatoes danish omelets ect

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Elegant room furnishings, clean, well-maintained, excellent breakfast buffet and helpful and friendly staff. From the concierge, to the breakfast buffet attendants to their valets, everyone had the singular goal of making sure that you enjoyed your visit to their paradise island. Close to the beach, shopping and restaurants. There are so many to choose from, and we are so happy that we chose to stay here. It is so nice to have a living room, with microwave, fridge and sink, that is searate from the sleeping area. What a great value!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I recently visited Hawaii for the third time. This trip was the best by far. The hotel and their staff were outstanding. Special kudos to Victor and Helena. The staff at the breakfast buffet was great. The floor manager went out of his way to accomodate the kids. The omelet chefs worked very hard keeping the lines moving. The only problem was with housekeeping. That was quickly remedied by the housekeeping supervisor. We had a two bedroom suite on the 20th floor corner room. Got to see fireworks and a parade. The breakfast buffet is on on the 4th floor. Go early to avoid waiting on the elevator. You can use the stairs if your floor is nearby. The valet parking was also outstanding, never a wait if you call down ahead of time. The hotel also has beach toys left behind by other guests. Ask the valet attendants, to avoid the expense and telling the kids that the toys have to be left behind. The manager's reception is typical Embassy Suites, but you get plastic cups because it's next to the pool. Would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Wonderful place. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We had a 2 bedroom suite. It was great size and very clean. Great breakfast included.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here 9 days and from the minute we arrived to the minute we left all we experienced were smiles and an amazing willingness to help us with anything. The front desk staff greeted us with a yummy wecome fruit juice upon arrival while the bellmen chatted with our boys about basketball and sports. The staff at the breakfast buffett were so helpful with drinks and any questions about the island and fun things to do. I travel for a living and am in hotels 182 days a year and have never met a hotel General Mgr. Well, I did this trip, he was so warm and welcoming and in and around the property alot, always with a smile and info. If you have traveled like me you have met a maid or two on your stay. Well, you NEVER met maids like these. All smiles and dressed and groomed so neatly and spoke english-LOL! And one morning we came down to breakfast and the housekeeping staff were singing hawaiian songs-"they have their own choir", imagine that. Beachwalk St, that the hotel is on has been totally redone in the last 6yrs. The Embassy and all the shops and restaurants-2 levels outdoor, are also new. I remember the old St and WOW! what a beautiful change. I could go on and on, check it out yourself, you'll be glad you did.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: First off I love embassy suites! Full on breakfast and happy hour makes them my first choice! And the Waikiki location was excellent...breakfast was delish, staff always helpful and the rooms roomy. The only negatives I have are the elevators can be a bit frustrating...there are 2 and just always busy and the other was the appy hour snack choices were a bit lacking and the same every night. But I gladly stay there again. The beach walk has everything...restaurants,groceries and shops. It is lively no matter the time of day! Parking..30 bucks a day a bit steep. Thank you embassy suites for being accommodating and friendly making our vacay a great one!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Usually I am not a big fan of Embassy Suites hotels, but the location of this hotel makes it a standout. Across the street to the south is the gorgeous but very expensive Halekulani, and across the street to the west is the upscale, and extremely expensive, Trump Tower, so you are in good company. Plus the Beach Walk location is home to some terrific restaurants so you really don't even need a car if you stay here. In fact, we prefer this hotel over the Hilton Hawaiian Village due to its location and newness. The friendly staff tries very hard to make you happy. We have been fortunate to have been upgraded to large ocean view suites whenever we have stayed here. The hotel pool is always swarming with laughing children so I agree with other reviewers who have noted that it is not the place for honeymooning couples.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here overnight on our way to Kauai. We arrived late and were warmly greeted by the front desk clerk who upgraded us to a 2 bedroom suite as our requested room as not available. The room was very nice and comfortable. The hotel breakfast was excellent. They had an chef making fresh omlets as well as a complete breakfast buffet with wonderful fresh fruit. The service was excellent all the way around as was the hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: A family of 4, we stayed on the 21st floor of the Hula Tower from 6/6/12 to 6/14/12. Overall, I would say this is definitely a hotel for families. If you are looking for romance or are not a big fan of being around kids, this is definitely not the place to stay!This hotel has many positives: spacious room, great breakfast, contemporary(ish) decor (although a little kitschy), decent drinks & food at the pool, free happy hour, good location, quick elevators. We found the bell staff to be exceptionally friendly & helpful. The concierge was also helpful, if not very warm (which was fine). Check in was also easy & quick and they give you a yummy drink when you arrive, which is nice after traveling. There were also things we were not so crazy about at this hotel: the room we were in (2131) had poor ventilation - the bathroom has no a/c vent & when 4 people are showering, it is tough to put on makeup or dry hair in the bathroom because it is soooo warm in there. We had to crank up the a/c in the rest of the room to have any hope of getting cool air to go towards the bathroom. Also, there were odd smells and noises coming through the vents at various times. In addition, the beds have poor support & my husband and I had sore backs each morning; the pool is long but not wide & there are A LOT of young kids in it, so you are constantly getting splashed in the pool and in the hot tub - and while you expect to get splashed in a pool, it is more than one would expect; the part of the beach the hotel is near has a lot of coral near the shore & isn't nice to swim in - you have to walk a ways to get to the "good" part of the beach. My main complaint was the housekeeping staff. The room, overall, looked clean. The bedsheets were extremely clean, bright & white, which was great. However, there are little things that they miss - for example, the lights and mirror and ceiling surrounding the vanity in the bathroom in our room were covered in thick dust. There was a hair stuck to the ceiling over the shower that was there for all 8 nights we were there. There were several times when our room wasn't cleaned by 2:30 or 3:00 & on two such occasions, we were faced with the choice of having our room not cleaned that day or taking a shower in order to get ready after time at the beach or pool. One day we were in a time crunch & chose not to have housekeeping come in (they said if we didn't get the room cleaned right away, we couldn't have it cleaned as they would be leaving for the day). The other day, we opted to have the room cleaned since we had sand in the entry to the room & ended up being late to meet someone for dinner because we had to wait for the housekeeper to clean the room. Mind you, we left a tip each day for the housekeepers, but this didn't seem to help much in terms of the time our room got cleaned, nor did it get us the things we asked for - i.e. extra towels, etc. That was kind of frustrating. The worst, though, was the night the housekeeper left 2 "new" rolls of toilet paper for us (they are wrapped in a Cottonelle wrapper). I went to put a new roll out & the outer 50% or so of the roll was covered in a brown substance of some sort (coffee? cola? something else???). I threw that roll away since I had no idea what it was, and got the second roll out. It had the same stuff on it. It seemed pretty unsanitary to me, so I called the front desk & they brought us a new roll of tp. The next day, I came back to the room after the housekeeper had been there to find she had apparently taken one of the yucked up rolls of tp out of the garbage, took off the 50% of the roll that was brown & left the remaining 50% of the roll on the counter for us to use (which we did not, we threw it away again). She also gave us 2 more rolls of tp. Much to my shock, the next morning when I went to use one of the 2 "new" rolls of tp, I found they both had the same brown substance on them. At that point, I was pretty mad & I brought a roll down to the front desk. I explained how this had occurred 2 days in a row. Not sure what, if anything, they did about it, as we checked out the next morning & never heard anything else about it. When we are paying over $300 per night for a hotel room, I don't think it is asking too much to get some clean toilet paper. Sadly, that was our last impression of this hotel & had us leaving on a negative note. :( Oh, they also overcharged us for a day of valet parking, but we didn't realize this until after checkout - we called from home & they did credit us the $30, which was good. So, if you park here, just double check your bill.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel is great for families. We have been frequent visitors to Hawaii over many years but had not been back for 4 years (after having kids). We had a one bedroom suite with two double beds, which was fine for two adults and two kids. The hotel is still quite new and the service was great.
