We had previously stayed at the Moana Surfrider, and chose this hotel this trip simply because of the suites, there aren't too many in Waikiki that aren't rediculously expensive.The rooms are quite spacious and the complimentary breakfast was surprisingly good. The newly developed Beach Walk precinct around Lewers Street means there are many dining and shopping options at the hotels doorstep.We will be staying at this hotel again next trip.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had a wonderful experience in May 2012 at the Embassy Suites Beachwalk in Waikiki. I grew up in Hawaii and my parents still live there, so we went back to surprise my Dad for his 75th birthday. The manager of the Embassy Suites allowed me to go behind the edge of the check-in desk to greet my Dad from there when he came in (a funny surprise to him). This is just one example of the great service and willingness to work with customers. Other examples: we were upgraded (which means to a higher floor with a better view); I asked them to upgrade my parents too, not remembering my mother's crippling fear of heights. Even though the hotel was totally full, the hotel made a lot of effort to find her something on a lower floor and they finally were given a two bedroom suite for the one night they were staying; great bartenders - cheerful and quick; great smiling guys making omelettes in the morning; music and pupus (appetizers) were decent at the manager's reception each night. Not to sound snotty, but while we can afford hotels like the Ritz, we choose to stay at the ES for the space that two rooms provides us, plus the mini fridge and microwave are very handy, the breakfast spread (free) is awesome, the free drinks in the evening are great and free wifi. Just because you CAN pay more doesn't mean you don't want a good deal, right? The beds are comfortable, the lanai was huge with a great view across Waikiki beach... it was perfect. While not completely beachfront, we didn't care because it was a 30 second walk to the beach and we still had a beautiful view.I'd highly recommend staying here.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The hotel and location were great. However, the travel agent messed up and booked us a day short. I pointed out that the hotel policly was to give every 4th day free and that as we paid for ten days it would be appropriate to not charge for the last day there. That was ignored by the hotel manager who went on to overcharge me for the 11th day because he could. That and the ripoff $30/day fee to park at your own hotel would prevent me from ever returning or recommending this hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Booked a 2 bedroom suite to suit 4 adults & a child. Didn't seem to be many suite/apartments in Waikiki. Very happy with our stay at Embassy suites. Great breakfast daily & overall good value with managers cocktails for 2 hours each night. Wifi on 4th floor & lobby only, also fairly slow due to many people connecting. Great pool & bar area. Great location near waikiki beach & shopping/restaurants. Loved the Yard House restaurant behind the hotel- great beers. Would recommend to anyone looking for a family, with the great room layout,

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We are a family of 4 with two kids ages 3 and 5. I enjoyed having more space especially with kids. Having two televisions also helped because the kids had their own. The breakfast (made to order, and gave a variety of choices )was very convenient and saved us time from having to go anywhere. The manager's reception was a great addition to the breakfast because when we got back from our tour or outing we relaxed by the pool to have a few complimentary drinks and snacks while the kids jumped back in the pool. The rooms were clean and comfortable(beds) but a little dated (decor). Overall, we had a great experience there and would go back again. The valet guys very nice and helpful.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My husband and I stayed here during our recent vacation. It was great to have breakfast each morning and the manager reception with unlimited free drinks in the evening. The band that played during the reception was pretty good too. The rooms are comfortable and large. We didn't have any trouble sleeping at night due to noise because we use a white noise 'machine'. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who doesn't need to be right on the beach. It's easy to see why this hotel is rated so high on TripAdvisor!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for four days. We wanted to get a room more higher up at the Hula Tower because Tripadvisor reviews mentioned that it would be quieter there. However, the only room available in that tower was a two double bed suit on the 8th floor. So we were left with the king size bed suite in the Aloha Tower on the 18th floor by the elevator. It had a nice partial ocean view, and we didn't hear any street noise. However, the reviewers on Tripadvisor were correct to say that the elevator next to the room was very noisy. We called to see if there were other rooms several times the first day. We found out that each floor only has 3 king-size bed suites, and 2 out of those 3 rooms would be next to an elevator. Great... On top of that, that same night the hot water went out (which came back at midnight). I couldn't put up with all these anymore and made another call to front desk. Finally the front desk decided to upgrade us to a 2 king size bedroom suite on the 14th floor. It was a corner room facing the street and Diamond Head. Unfortunately, the corner bedroom with a nice city view was noisy - we could hear the DJ and the band through the night. We ended up sleeping in the other bedroom that was quieter. We could still hear the street noise, but not as bad as the corner bedroom. The connecting wall was kind of thin though. We could hear the baby next door crying every morning (my husband also heard the next door person snoring in the first room we got before).The hotel bedroom on the higher floors don't have wireless internet, only wired. The hotel does provide routers to get Wi-Fi. However, I had trouble connecting my Motorola Razr smartphone to Wi-Fi in the room. I was on their technical support line for 45 minutes trying to solve it. Their contracted technical support team sure didn't know how to fix that. I called them 3 times, and each time they asked me to give them the same info even though I gave them my reference number each time. They would ask me to do the same thing attempting to resolve the issue. After spending too much time on the phone with them, I've decided not to waste my vacation time to call them again. So every day my phone would keeping scanning for connection, remembering the network IP address, but would not connect. But at least after a long while, It would connect my phone to the Wi-Fi. Not sure why.Of course the good part about staying at this hotel is the free breakfast buffet. It really saved us a lot of money. Then on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Saturdays there is the manager's reception, which includes free cocktails, snacks, and live music. Don't expect too much about the snacks - they are just chips and trail mix.I do love the decor of the rooms. I also love the Crab Tree and Evelyn bath and body care products.The hotel is right by the shops and restaurants on Beachwalk and just few blocks from Waikiki Beach. It's definitely convenient.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed here as a family of four. There was ample space in the room for the family to spread out so we didn't feel on top of each other. Beds are comfortable. Our room was on the 5th floor and overlooked the pool, so there was no ocean view (not a problem). The downside was the noise from people at the pool, and the live music that played by the pool at night (may not be an issue for you).Breakfast was very nice.Great location - close to beach, stores, and dining.Parking is valet only and $30 a day.The only issue: There was a small fire at the hotel at around 0230 in the morning and we had to evacuate. The alarm was difficult to here, and directions from staff and management was nonexistent. Would have preferred better communication from those in charge.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Overall, a good 6 nt. stay for a family of 4 with a teen and a baby. Aside from the usual ES perks which drew us to book here (hot breakfast, managers reception, fridge, microwave, large suite, pool), we were happy with the location and the staff. With the kids in tow, the short walk to both Ft. Derussy beach and Waikiki via Don Ho Ln and the Sheraton property was just right. One day, we did walk down Kalakaua past the Police station to swim at Kuhio beach with a protected wall area for our little one. That was a nice spot to not worry about crashing waves onshore. Check-in was great with the pineapple juice and Gina was very professional and even gave us a good recommendation for Ramen Nakamura down the street. Our room was preassigned, but when we got up there it was right across from the elevator even though my HH profile requests to be away from the elevator. After a long morning of travel, my family convinced me to just let it be. However, there were a couple of nights when I was kept awake by the elevator. I regret not making the request to change rooms so will make it a point to see that our request is seen next time. The concierge desk (esp. Kylie, Noelani and Bobby) was very helpful with excursion tips, beaches as well as our rental car booking. We only used a car on a Sun and Tues so did not keep it overnight and pay the parking fee. The bell desk was also friendly and helpful (esp Dean, Johnny and Keoloni). We brought our own rafts but we also borrowed boogies boards from the hotel. I wish we had known about the boards sooner bc we only got to use them on our last beach day. Overall our stay went well, but the evacuation at 3am could have been handled better. We did not complain bc we were afterall in paradise, but there may have been some guests who did. The mgmt provided an apology letter for the inconvenience but going downstairs and climbing back up 8 flights w/sleeping baby in front carrier was not fun. The alarm and alert came through the rooms to evacuate once so many people followed. But I heard that some guests called down to the front desk and were told it was not needed. If only an announcement was made to disregard the alarm, we would not have brought the baby down and we felt bad for the elderly woman with a cane trying to make her way downstairs. While we evacuated for our safety, I felt it was executed poorly after realizing some guests were told not to evacuate. On our last night, a gas line broke and we did not have hot water until the next morning. A minor inconvenience and one caused by building maintenance vs. staff so we excused it. We might stay here again if I make sure that our room is not near the elevator.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: After years of staying at other properties in Waikiki, this one has become our "top-choice" (including among other Hilton family locations). Location makes it best; from the airport, it's on the "right side" of (closest to) Waikiki, so you don't have to get stuck in traffic travelling East on the very busy Kalakaua Ave (just look at a map). Granted, not a beach-side property, but as long as you know, the convenience makes up for that. Yet the beach is so very close, just across the non-busy side street. The pool is large and very comfortable. The evening Mgr's Special "happy hour" (pool-side!) is a great way to close out the day & kick-off an evening of fun. Complimentary breakfast common with Embassy Suites is 'above-average' and greatly appreciated in this Waikiki locale. Otherwise, restaurant's on/near the property (Roy's & Yard House) are worthy attractions in and of themselves. Adjacent to a US Army Museum... free & A/C. For military active duty/retirees, the Hale Koa military hotel is a short walk next door... with a well-stocked PX/BX... for all those souvenirs & necessities you forgot to pack!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I have stayed at this hotel several times in the past and it has never disappointed me. I have always enjoyed staying here and every chance I get I try to come back to the Embassy because of the accomodations and the staff. The location is great, the breakfast is top notch and the staff is awesome. Enjoy the stay here.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our family of 4 stayed here for 6 ngihts in May 2012. The 1st night we were given a room on the first floor. The street noise was annoying and we were awoken several time during the night. We requested to be moved and were given a room on the 18th floor. It was excellent! Very clean and comfortable and even had a view of the ocean. The staff was very attentive and pleasant. We needed more towels and help with the internet, and our requests were met quickly. Excellent location for shopping, restaurants, and the beach. The pool area is great and the breakfast was delicious. We had a perfect stay and would definately stay there again!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at The Embassy Suites for nearly two weeks in October 2010 - and heading back again for more of the same this October. Right across the road from the beach - we had great rooms, not too noisy with traffic. Great buffet breakfasts - although after a week you would be happy to have not so many choices and burnt toast and marmite at home suddenly doesnt sound so bad ...remember you have to walk off the brekky every day!Manager's cocktail function each evening was a wonderful way to spend the early evening - the bar tender boys were adorable, and live music some nights really put a smile on your face and encouraged a little chair dance from time to time. Enjoy ...! :-)

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My wife and I stayed at this property on May 10-12, 2012 and really enjoyed it! We found the rooms very clean and tastefully appointed, the swimming pool and pool bar really nice and the breakfast absolutely fabulous. Service at the hotel was very good, especially the concierge desk.Proximity to Waikiki beach is a short one block walk (I recommend you go early before 10:00) and beachwalk shopping is literally attached to the hotel through a short corridor.We would highly recommend this property.Bill & DianeLake Jackson, TX.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: After the 8 hour plane ride from DFW, the hotel seemed like an oasis! From the initial greeting from the parking valet, check in, and the room attendant, we were in the most professional, friendliest manner I have seen in a while. That did not change throoughout the 11 nights we were there. The hotel is very well appointed throughout...extremely clean and comfortable. The breakfast isn't some bagel and coffee bar, but a full set-up to include cooked-to-order egss. In the evenings they offer complimentary beverages and snacks and a great palce to catch up, unwind and simply enjoy. The breakfast staff and the bartenders are first rate! Always friendly and ready to assist in any way that they can. The hotel is centrally located and within a few minutes walk to great restaurants, shopping and the beach.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I have nothing negative to say about our family's recent stay at this fine hotel. Very friendly staff, great location at a very reasonable price. Free breakfast caters to all tastes and sizes of waistlines. Nightly happy hour(s) is not to be missed. We'll definitely be back!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We changed our hotel reservation in Honolulu from another hotel to The Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach Walk. We did so for 2 reasons. The first reason was the reviews on Tripadvisor. The second reason was we wanted to be in the heart of Waikiki and not have to walk or ride to where all the action is.The Embassy Suites is perfectly located. While not right on the beach, it is only a block away with an easily accessible walkway to the beach. The location is perfect for everything we liked to do both during the day and in the evening. We were right near so many restaurants including Roy's which is in the hotel. Enterprise car rental was only a few blocks away and they will pick you up at your hotel and bring you back to the hotel. The shopping was amazing. The beach walk street and the main street is lined with shops. There are shops for everyone from couture to hawaiian made crafts to souvneir shops. Public transportation is also close by if you wish to use it (Waikiki on and off trolleys, buses, etc.)The hotel staff friendliness, kindness and sincerity rates way up there with the hotels we have stayed when we traveled. We have stayed at many 4 and 5 star hotels, including the Halekulani in Honolulu. The staff was just as wonderful at the Embassy Suites. Cold juice at a sit-down check-in, personally coming over to you at the breakfast buffet to see if they can carry your tray, get you anything you need at breakfast, etc. etc. We were really bowled over. The reviews on Tripadvisor raved about the staff and boy where they correct.The hotel itself was terrific. Being a suite we had a very spacious room. We asked for an ocean view, high up away from the elevator. That is exactly what we got PLUS they gave us a corner room. You could see the ocean from the balcony in the bedroom and from both balconies in the living room. The room was always clean, the hallways smelled so fresh, and the linens were so soft. The bed was extremely comfortable. Our room was the south west corner of the Hula Tower (Room 1630). Since it was on the west side you could see the sun set from the balcony.The breakfast was quite plentiful and very tasty. Juices, cold cereal, instant oatmeal, eggs pre-pared and made to order at the omelet station, delicious hash brown potatoes, bacon, pancakes, various Asian breakfast items, muffins, donuts, wonderful banana bread, fresh cut up tropical and summer fruits as well as bananas, oranges and apples. You can eat inside or outside. We chose to eat outside where there were umbrellas and lovely flowers. I know some people complain about aggressive birds who try to steal your food. You will be fine if your party takes turns going in for their food and someone remains at the table to keep guard. After all, birds have to eat too. My husband and I love birds and didn't mind them at all. The hotel asks you not to feed them which is hard to do when they come begging, but out of respect for the other guests, it really is best that you do not feed them.We only went to the Manager's reception once because the one time we went we nibbled too much and ruined our appetite for dinner. They had peanuts, chex mix, pretzels, potato chips, tortilla chips, salsa and of course regular and alcoholic beverages. And remember it is included (NO extra charge).The pool was terrific. The temperature was perfect. Cool when you stepped in but not so cold it shocked you. They also have 2 areas with a hot pool and that was great too.The breakfast and manager's reception was included in the hotel price. We found this hotel to be well worth the cost and definitely would stay there again.Thank you, Embassy Suites, for a great stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: From the time I arrived I felt like this place is good. On an early arrival ,we booked bags in and was given a check number. Also given a lovely welcome drink. We were treated with respect and given all help we needed. We decided to use the day to go visit Pearl Harbour, so went to the tours desk and got all the directions and information we needed. On our return we arrived at our room and luggage was following close behind. The room was just lovely with 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms, lounge/dining area and small kitchen. We had no problems with the room at all it was spotless and plenty room. At this hotel you get a cooked to order breakfast and a buffet with everything you could want to eat each day for free. they have plenty of fruit and snacks to take for later. You can eat at the buffet or take it back to your room. Also they have what they call Managers Reception from 5.30pm to 7.30pm with free drinks and nibbles. Just great and met lots of fellow travellers. We also used the laundry and this was well equipped. This hotel is in a great location near the beach and the pool is awesome right next to bar and eating area. Dennys across the road and Beachwalk shops just downstairs. Hundreds of shops all around you. All in all I was impressed with this hotel. The staff were very helpful with all the questions we had and were ready to help anytime. Had a Great stay. Mahalo

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: For the money, this hotel cannot be beat!We stayed here for 9 nights in May 2012. We are a Canadian family from BC with 2 boys ages 7 and 11. With all things considered this really is the best value in Waikiki, especially if you have kids.Great salt water/ chlorinated pool (the pool deck is very large- don't let the pictures deceive you), awesome breakfast (tons of fruit and the usual goodies plus those fantastic omletes with lots of veggie and meat choices) and- are you kidding me- free drinks every evening!When I was researching this hotel, I was concerned about some people's comments, but I think there are some people out there that want everything for nothing. (I.E. When you are getting free drinks, don't complain about the snacks.)Staff was wonderful- Russel (Food Ambassador) made us feel at home every morning at breakfast. He grew-up on Oahu and took the time to assist us in planning our daily trips around the island. Very helpful and courteous, indeed.Our room was kept very clean by Sophia the Wonder-Maid and Dennis at the poolside bar makes a mean MaiTai for sure.We were lucky enough to stay on the 6th floor of the Hula tower looking over the pool deck and a partial ocean view facing West (great sunsets).We will definately be back. Thanks to all the staff at Emassy Beach Walk!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I have stayed here before so I got an ocean view upgrade which was nice. The only catch was my bed head was near the elevator shafts so I could here lifts moving day and night. Restless sleep and thus needed earplugs. Room was nice, small bathroom. Coin laundry on level 3, free wi fi by the pool. Breakfast included and free happy hour drinks from 5.30 to 7.30. Location is fantastic, pool is nice but heaps of kids so no room to swim. Execellent staff and service. I will stay back here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed there this past weekend for a family wedding using Hilton Points. Before we arrived I had an issue with the Hilton reservation system and the GM was very accommodating. The hotel was ok, not great. No Wifi. Pictures online are misleading. Had an overall feeling of dirty. Wouldn't be my recommendation. The best part was that Roy's was located on the main level of this hotel. Even though we ate at various places it was the BEST dinner!!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We recently stayed for a 1 night stop after a long, 10+ hour journey over before heading off to another island. We were very impressed with the location, staff, service and amenities. We were greeted very warmly upon arrival by the check in staff and the bellhop were very prompt at bringing up our bags and requested cribs as well as organizing transportation back to the airport. We'd preordered a cheese platter so we didn't have to rush out for food when we arrived...BEST IDEA EVER. Between this and the breakfast, our food needs were met.Our room was impressively large with 2bathrooms and a great view of the sunset. We didn't get to beach but it was only a short walk away, and in the heart of Waikiki so you didn't have to go very far for good food/shopping.At almost $380US (after taxes etc.) it was perhaps a little costly, but I do wish we'd stayed here instead of the Hilton resort on our return journey.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great location. Huge suites. Free breakfast w eggs to order, and fantastic service. They willingly changed our rooms 3 times until we were satisfied. All for a great price. Only negative was that the pool area not as fancy as the Hilton. I'd come back here in a heartbeat. I was very satisfied.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I didn't have many choices, because I wanted a 1 bedroom suite (separate living room with a sofa sleeper for my two young girls, so they can watch TV in the morning to let us sleep in a little!) The few Waikiki places that had 1B suites - I saw bad reviews on TripAdvisor for nice places, from bad service to bed bugs! I'd only wanted to pay around $200 a night, but no way I'd pay $200 a night and come home with bed bugs! I was actually looking into a Koko Resorts condo (free parking!) but I didn't like that they wanted you to pay upfront - before you even get there. So I ended up at Embassy Suites.The bedroom was a little crowded with 2 Queen beds. Would've felt better with 1 King bed. The furniture was nice. Mini fridge, microwave. 2 cup quick coffee maker or full 10 cup coffee maker. The one thing we loved about this suite - the bathroom had 2 doors, one to the living area, and one to the bedroom - so our kids didn't have to go THROUGH our room to get to the bathroom. The doors were loud, tho. Not completely sound proof - I could hear murmured talking on the bedroom side, a child crying on the living room side. Worried me that our neighbors could hear my husband snoring and our kids' tantrums! The “lanai” was really narrow – just the width of the chair! So you had to squish around/step over the chairs. Our girls kept scooting them around…really noisy. Came in handy for drying out towels, swimsuits and shoes, tho.Nice breakfast every morning. Miso soup! Fresh fruit, salad (for breakfast?), scrambled eggs, potatoes o'brien (with peppers and onions) yummy sausage, bacon, and a rotating carb (pancakes, French toast, biscuits with gravy). Made to order omelets (I never bothered to wait for that, and there was only a handful of things to choose from. Looked more like scrambled skillet than an omelet.) Instant oatmeal, cereal, yogurt, granola, bananas, apples, oranges. DELICIOUS and smooth coffee, milk and several fountain juices (my kids loved the Pineapple/Guava/Mango juice). You eat in the indoor/outdoor lanai. Charming sparrows, pretty little island doves, and only a few pigeons darting around, hoping to get something dropped. I liked the birds - they weren't aggressive, never coming too near or landing on occupied tables. Staff bus your plates away.Check In/Out: Very easy. Staff: All staff very friendly. Location: Walk to anywhere! We walked to the Aloha Tower Market Place (GO TO THEIR INTERNATIONAL FOOD COURT FOR LUNCH! Best value you’ll get in Waikiki!), the Hilton Lagoon, the beach (of course, just walk through the Outrigger), you’re right next to Fort DeRussy, tons of shops and restaurants. About 10 minutes to get on the H1 freeway.Secured floors: you have to have your card key to go to your floor and the common amenities floor.Pool: Smaller than it looks on the site – long and narrow, and it only ranges from 3 feet at the shallow end to 4 feet at the “deep” end. So for adults, you can’t really swim. Perfect for small kids, though. Warm and clean, not too heavily chlorinated. Nice hot tub and kiddie pool. Business Center: I used just to check into our flight – 4 computers, a printer, shredder, basic office supplies. Everything I needed except scissors! Manager’s Reception: Only made it once!. The spread wasn’t impressive – the night we went, just pretzels, Goldfish crackers, chips and salsa type of fare. And while I despise a weak drink – my free Mai Tai was WAY too strong! Could have lit a match and spewed fire! I feel conflicted, complaining about a free, too-strong drink, LOL!My only nit is just the hostage parking situation, which I know is the case for all Waikiki hotels. (No public parking lots to park your car so you HAVE to use their parking at $29/day AND they only have Valet parking so you HAVE to use their service AND you’re expected to tip them every coming and going? Even though you have NO OTHER parking choice? (But people can park there during the day for only $9???) And they do have a shuttle, but – not free! $11 per person. Whatever happened to free airport/hotel shuttle service? Nothing’s Free in Waikiki! So was it nice? Definitely. Nice accommodations, service and staff. Would I stay there again? I’m budget conscious, so…perhaps not. But it was a nice splurge. Aloha!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My husband and I had a wonderful stay at the Embassy Suites. The hotel and rooms itself seemed new and fresh. It was very clean and all updated. The hotel itself was situated next to the Royal Hawaiian Shopping Plaza so you were in the middle of many chain restaurants and high end shopping. There is a starbucks across the street in case the coffee at the hotel is not your cup of tea. This hotel really took the guess work out of everything. Even when waiting for your tour bus, the valet/bell men were always asking around to make sure everyone knew where they needed to be or if they needed any help. The pool was good sized. I can't speak highly enough of having the option of breakfast every morning being included in the price. We strayed from the hotel once to try to get the Hawaiian Spam and Eggs, and it cost us 35 dollars on that one meal. I could not imagine if we had to do that every morning. The breakfast was not just a continental breakfast. You can get your eggs done any way you needed, they had your breads/donuts/bagels, pancakes, french toast, salad, miso soup, fruit, cold cereals etc. It was well worth it. The Happy Hour was even better. For two hours every night you got your choice of drinks and each night was a different type of snack. Chips and Salsa, Chips and Nacho Cheese, Goldfish, Pretzels etc. Just enough snack to get you through before you make your dinner reservation. I am sure this also saved my husband and I in money. Go for the mai tais. The center of Waikiki beach and the International market is about a 10 minute walk away but across the street there is a pathway that will take you to a quiet part of the beach. Renting chairs there is about 30 dollars for half a day which is a bit steep but being a two minute walk from the hotel it was worth it. You can get cheaper chairs if you walk by the Dukes Bar. We ended up taking a cab from the hotel to Diamond Head. I thought it was too far to walk. By walking you can get to the zoo and most attractions, but Diamond Head is a bit of a hike. Its doable but its a hike to get there before you even hike the crater. Tolietries were Natural Botanicals from Crabtree and Evelyn. That was good to have in case you ran out of something and didn't want to use something cheap. Rooms all have a fridge and microwave. That was useful as well.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My husband and I are Travel agents and planned a trip to Hawaii at the last minute in February - the high season. We found the Embassy Suites one of the best hotels we have stayed at ( locations throughout the world) both in terms of what it provided and the price charged. The suites are beautifully decorated and contained a full size bedroom and full size living room with two TVs and lots of comfortable seating and storage space. The bathroom was large and very well lit. There was also a microwave and a refrigerator. Each day there was a large and varied buffet breakfast with excellently prepared food cooked to order and at cocktail time there were drinks, snacks and a wonderful Hawaiian band. This was all included in the price.The hotel has a glood size pool deck and swimming area. It is located on Beachwalk which has every kind of restaurant you could desire from popular chains to upscale dining. It is close to many high-end shopping.The beach is a very short block away and easy to get to. This area of beach is very clean and quiet as well as being close to a beautiful park which has many benchs to sit on as well as athletic activities. You are able to rent a good selection of water sports eqjuipment. Public transportation is readily available to all parts of the Island. We found the bus very reliable. The staff of the hotel was very helpful in assisting us navigate our way to many of the sight-seeing places of interest. We would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to all of our clients especially those who like a suite arrangement.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I had a wonderful stay at Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach Walk. I always love to stay at Embassy Hotels because the room rate includes a full cooked to order breakfast and evening reception. Their 4th floor Grand Lanai was the perfect setting for an amazing breakfast that had just about every item imaginable and also the perfect sunset for complimentary beverages and snacks at sunset. The location was also perfect! Steps away from the best shopping on the island and also from the beach. The best part of our stay was the staff! They went above and beyond to make us feel special and like one of their own family. Malia at the front desk was AMAZING! She and the rest of the agents at reception were friendly and as helpful as can be! I highly recommend this property for not only its location and service, but the immense savings of the amenities it includes.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My brother and I stayed here for one night at the end of Hawaii vacation. We had a condo on the quiet side and wanted to experience waikiki for only 1 night. I got this for free wit a coupon through Hilton Honors as I am a frequent traveler. The room was great, staff was very friendly. Breakfast was free and had everything you could ever want. We had a late evening flight and they gave us a late check out(12:30), then a pass to get access to the pool while they stored our luggage. When we were ready to leave they let us use a room for 30 minutes to freashen up and shower and change before heading to the airport. They had managers reception with free drinks and snacks and even had a band playing. Location is right in the middle of beachwalk which is where all the stores are in every direction. Top notch hotel all the way.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This place is not right on the beach but it's across the street and has partially obstructed beach views. I tried to check in early and it was no go, but they do reserve that for those who are Hilton award member types. That's all I can say that's negative about this hotel. So many positives. Clean, good amenities, free breakfast, free happy hour drinks and snacks, great pool and hot tub on the roof top, and very well located. Plenty of parking near by. Price is reasonable, has a govt rate, so military friendly. Oh and the rooms are big. I've stayed at a few places (4 to be exact) on Waikiki and this hotel by far had the biggest room. Well, it's embassy suites. Breakfast was buffet. And it was more than adequate. It had your usual bacon, eggs, and pancakes, but also miso soup, Japanese pickles, rice, which was a nice touch for the Japanese travelers. While I was here on business, I'd definitely come again with my hubby and/or family.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel is in an excellent location less then a block from the beach. You do not need a car and the concierge was helpful as we took 2 tours which we enjoyed. They have free breakfast and happy hour free drinks. Wonderful restaurants near in all price range also goodahopping near. Request the Hula tour if possible

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here for 2 nights in April 2012. We had a corner suite on the 11th floor facing the Trump hotel and the ocean which we could see between the two oceanfront hotels. Our suite had a king bed along with a small microwave, refrigerator, and small sink. This is similar to other Embassy rooms we have had. The breakfast is excellent with many options including cooked to order omelettes. This area has tables inside and outside. Also included is the manager's cocktail hour from 5:30 to 7:30pm which serves free beer and wine to Embassy guests only. We stayed here using HHonors points so the only charge on our bill was the $30/day valet parking charge. There is really no place to park in Waikiki so valet parking is a must. There are two public walkways to the beach across the street from the Embassy so beach access is easy. We were told that Waikiki beach is a public beach so you can walk from the Hilton Hawaiian Village along the beach side of all the resorts to Duke's statue in the middle and return by the main boulevard past all the shops back to the Embassy. Allow about 2 hours for the round trip if you want to take your time and stop and take pictures. There is a banyan tree at the Westin surrounded by tables. This is a good place to have lunch. We chose the Embassy over the Hilton Hawaiian Village because of the suite instead of a room, free cooked to order breakfast, and free drinks.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was our second stay at the Embassy Suites Beach Walk in Waikiki and once again we loved it! I think we might have enjoyed it even more the second time because we got to stay in the Hula Tower, which overlooks the pool area. The other tower, the Aloha Tower, is not quite as nice, so request the Hula Tower if you can. Our room was a one bedroom with a king bed and sleeper sofa in the living room. The rooms are not huge but they are comfortable and well appointed. Clean room, nice linens, two TVs, and air conditioning in both the bedroom and living room. The price for the room, given how very close the hotel is to the beach (literally across the street), was really great (ask for a AAA rate if you have a AAA card). The big plus for us is the wonderful breakfast they provide each morning, and when you factor in the money we saved on breakfast, the price is even better. They also do a happy hour each day at 5:30pm with free drinks and snacks, which we loved! The pool is nice, although I wish it had opened earlier than 9am. The location of the hotel is excellent - right in the heart of the Beach Walk area of Waikiki so many shops and restaurants are within easy walking distance. This is really the perfect place for us and I have absolutely nothing negative to say about this place. This is now our go-to place whenever we visit Oahu.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Only had 2 nights in Waikiki after a week on the Big Island, but we couldn't have been happier with the ES! Comfortable room that fit all 6 of us nicely. We had a nice view of Diamond Head, but more importantly, the location was great, the staff was very friendly, and I felt like I was staying in a higher priced hotel (than what I was paying). We were greeted with valet service and complimentary drinks as we checked in. To top it off, this was the best breakfast I've had at an ES. No big lines, a nice atrium or outside seating area, and food for both American and Japanese tastes. Would absolutely stay here again!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Loved the location, easy access to beach, restaurants and shopping! Also convenient massage center nearby;) Great pool for small children and tasty hot breakfast. Rooms were clean and comfortable! Must also give kudos to hotel's concierge Noelani at Expedia front desk...extremely helpful, patient, and pleasure to work with!! She helped us book the Dolphin Quest at the Kahala which was great! (And since we were on the resort we spent a wonderful afternoon on Kahala's private beach...very relaxing!) We had a great time and miss Waikiki already!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was our last stop of 7 on a 4 week trip around the USA. I'm glad we got the overall best for last!! Stayed in Hilton hotels and Homewood suites but never an Embassy Suites before. Very impressed with this hotel. Service great, breakfast & evening drinks (cocktails, wine, spirits, beer included) & snacks were excellent. Great pool and dining area. We had two queen bed suite looking onto beach walk on 6th flr. Suite was quiet at night, no road noise. Excellent location. Only negative was no in room wifi like Homewood suites have but you can get wifi in lobby or 4th flr pool and breakfast dining area. We stayed at the Sheraton on our way to US from OZ and liked it there but Embassy Suites would be my pick next to time we visit Hawaii!! Great overall value with the best breakfast!!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at the Hawaiian Hilton Village first then spent our next week at Hilton's new hotel off Beachwalk. The value for this stay was exceptional. Breakfast is included as well as wireless (we had to pay extra for both at the Hilton Village). They also offer a manager's reception for a couple hours, offering free drinks and snacks (which we did not go to). The location is close to shopping and just above the Yardhouse Restaurant (which has great food). The pool deck is lovely with great service and fabulous lunch and drink options. We were very impressed for the value of this stay and all they included in it. Loved the fact they have a large laundry facility to do any washing and drying you need...very handy when you are travelling. I have attached photos of our two bedroom suite. We opted not to stay in the lower room with the roll in shower as this worked just fine for our situation. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a great stay in Waikiki. It's close to all the waterfront hotels (Halekaulani and Sheraton) that offered fabulous waterfront bars and restaurants.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed here in February 2012 for a week while on vacation / business conference. We were booked into a room in the Aloha tower. So many good things to mention about this hotel - from check in to check out, the staff were all so friendly and professional. The buffet breakfast was really organized and tidy and we didn't encounter any issues of them running out of food or having to wait too long to get what we wanted. We were able to bring back some simple items (fruit, bagel etc) for us to our room for later and it wasn't an issue at all. It was good to see their GM walking about clearing tables, talking with guests during breakfast as he sets the tone for the rest of the hotel staff and they were all really friendly and helpful. Only minor bump we had was when our room card malfunctioned and it took about 20 minutes for someone to come up and let us in our room (while we were all wet and cold because we had just come back from the pool), but overall a very pleasant and enjoyable stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at the Embassy Suites in April 2012. The hotel was in a prime location in downtown Waikiki, located steps away from the beach, restaurants, and shopping. Our room had a living room, kitchenette (table/chairs, sink, microwave, mini-fridge), and separate bedroom. There was a small patio with chairs that you could get to from both the livingroom and bedroom doors. We opted to not pay the extra price for an ocean view room but we had a decent view of the city skyline. Rooms were clean (although a little worn), and beds were comfy. Staff was very friendly. We took advantage of the free breakfast each morning, which included made to order omelettes, fruits, bagels, muffins, yogurt, bacon, sausage, cereals, and lots more. The food was good, although the menu stayed the same every day. They also had a a Manager’s Reception each evening which included free drinks, snacks and live music most nights. The snacks were pretty minimal – pretzels, tortilla chips and salsa, hot cheese, fish crackers, potato chips, and nuts -- not all at the same time, just a basic mix of the above each evening. Drinks were a couple kinds of draft beer and assorted mixed drinks. We waited in line for one drink, which we tossed out after a couple sips -- husband didn't like the choice of draft beer and I did not like my mixed drink. From then on we just wandered through on our way to dinner and grabbed a handful of pretzel to eat on our journey, or stayed for a few songs from the band. The hotel had a Roy's restaurant which was pretty pricey (but then, everything in Hawaii was). I think there was another restaurant as well, but there were so many other restaurants within walking distance as well as lots of shopping. Pool was a bit small, but we didn't spend much time there. We booked several excursions during our week stay in Waikiki:- Pearl Harbor, USS Missouri, USS Arizona Memorial, and a drive by of the Punchbowl with Polynesian Adventure Tour. I would recommend this tour and company.- Rainforest hike to view a waterfall with Oahu Nature Tours. I would recommend this tour but NOT if you are also visiting the Island of Hawaii. There are much more spectacular waterfalls there for much lest cost to visit. - Starlight Luau at the Hilton Hawaiian Village. I chose this luau because of the complaints about the food at most of the other ones. It was just a short walk from our hotel to the 6th floor rooftop of the Hilton. Food was great and LOTS of it to choose from. The show was entertaining. - 6 hour kayak/snorkeling trip with Two-Good Kayaks. This adventure was by far the most memorable. If you book this trip, be sure to request KEVIN as your guide -- he was fun, very knowledgeable, and safety minded. - Hiked to the top of Diamond Head Crater. This was a free excursion for us. We opted to walk to Diamond Head from our hotel which took us about an hour, uphill most of the way. Not sure I would recommend walking from our hotel -- we were pooped by the time we got to our destination, then we still had to climb to the top of the crater which was about 1.6 miles round trip. It took us another hour to climb to the top and back down. Well worth it though.All in all, a decent hotel, but the area is VERY VERY touristy with lots of shopping, restaurants, and hotels. I would recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I have never written two reviews on any place before this. I love this hotel. We were satifisfied with our visit in 2010 that we selected it again.The staff at this hotel is awesome. We loved all the folks that worked the breakfast area. Always checking to see if we needed anything and that included the manager talking to us as well. They are great for ideas on things to do as well.You can't beat the breakfast at this property. It's by far still the best hotel breakfast I've ever had. The made to order omlette's are so good. They give you many choices to add to your omlette. The only downfall we had this visit was our room location. I was travelling on government orders so I knew I wouldn't get a high view room. I did ask and was able to get the 12th floor in the Hula Tower, but it was next to the elevator. We thought about asking for a room change after the first night but enjoyed our view so much we decided to live with it. Luckily it wasn't too bad, but I also use ear plugs. The 3 elevators are very busy.Even though this hotel is not directly on the beach it is close enough and very close to everything else you need.I'm disappointed I have to come back for work again next month and can't get the government rate during that time so I have to stay elsewhere.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: OMG...It was totally amazing!! We should have planned to stay longer! I truly was blown away!! The air quality, the friendlyness of the people and feeling so safe on the island of Oahu in Waikiki! The food was great, the Dance Clubs were off the chain, Sharkey's was hilarious and the Tours fun and very educational!! Also to see the island on our own time, we rented a White Mustang Convertible and drove down to the Dole Plantation,with the wind blowing in our hair!!!! We road the Train Express to view the plantation!! We also visited the peaceful, quite and uncrowded Haleiwa Beach, a great change from the Waikiki Beach!! The Yard, Hula Grill and Paradise Cove is a must!! If you want to let your hair down and get your grove on..you must check out Rumours which is dancing for the young and aged at the Ala Moana! Everyone walking around at night with no worries and if felt so safe!! I just can't say enough about my trip to Hawaii, other than you must go and experience this greatness for yourself!! You will definitely say at the end of your visit, "WOW WE SHOULD HAVE STAYED LONGER!!" I saved the best for last!! The Embassy Suites are just what everyone needs on vacation!! A Cook To Order Breakfast every morning, a nice cocktail (Mai'Tai) or soda with a little snack in the evening with live entertainment! All complimentary to the guests!! If you can get the Oceanview, this is a beautiful site to see every morning! But with the Oceanview you get a great view of the Fireworks every Friday night on your lanai!( balcony)I must truly thank the Staff and the Concierge for all their help and precise directions to the Dole Plantation! This trip was with my friend/traveling buddy, but I would love to go back with my Husband, just to put a spin on it!! I enjoyed myself and truly look forward to returning and doing it all again!! To all viewers if you like my views.. send me a message.. the meaning of (Malama Pono)~,~Aloha and hang loose!!(shaking pinky and thumb hand sign in the air!! wink~,*

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: As a person who travels quite a bit you forget how easy and comfortable a good hotel can be until you stay at a place like Embassy Suites - Wakiki. Traveling with a family (for a reunion of sorts) can be challenging but the free breakfasts, comfortable suites, adequate happy hour, close proximity to ocean and Beach Walk makes this a hotel with something for everyone.Comfy beds, sparkling clean bathrooms and the welcome space that a suite-styled hotel filled with a fridge, microwave and coffee provides, we happily stayed for six nights.Be sure to ask for a high floor with an ocean view (Waikiki can be noisy) and enjoy the great llocation. And if you need anything simply ask the helpful and eager to please staff.Thanks Waikiki Embassy for making my family trip a success.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I stayed at the Embassy Suites from April 10-15, 2012. My suite was on the 16th floor with a partial ocean view in the Aloha Tower. Check-in was fast and friendly and the cold fruit juice was welcomed after a very long flight. The view from the balcony encompassed everything - to the left was the ocean, in front was another hotel and the skyline, and to the right were the mountains. I had a one-bedroom suite and the suite was large and clean. The mini kitchen was an asset (fridge, microwave, kettle, sink). Making a cup of tea in the suite after a long day of sightseeing was a great benefit. I had a king size bed and although the bed was softer than I normally would like, it was just what the doctor ordered after long and physical sightseeing days. You could hear the traffic noise in the room with the balcony doors closed (I figured this was because the hotels are so close together that the sound has no where to go but up) but it didn’t prevent me from having a good night’s sleep. The breakfast buffet had lots of choices (cereal, the omelette bar, bacon and eggs, pancakes, yogurt, etc.) The only problem I had with it was that the drinks (coffee, tea, milk, juices) were not in the same area as the food. You had to go to where the seating was to get your drinks. It just didn’t flow well in my opinion. The hotel is in an excellent area with lots of shops (high end and not so high end) and restaurants. The beach is a short walk to the left of the hotel. I was so busy sightseeing that I did not get a chance to spend any time on the beach. I did, however, spend a couple of days poolside. The pool is not Olympic size but big enough to swim and cool down. The food and drinks from the Pakini Bar were excellent and I must give a shout out to Michalena (I hope I spelled her name correctly). She was run off her feet the entire week but always had a smile and spent time talking with the guests. Another shout out goes to Keoni at Bell Service. He was very friendly and assisted me with directions on where to get the various modes of transportation I took during my stay (I did not rent a car). The Manager’s Reception was very nice – the drinks cold and tasty and there were snacks available. The staff at the Embassy Suites were always friendly and willing to assist you when needed and they are indeed Embassy Suites’ best asset.I travelled solo and at no time was safety and security an issue. On the Beach Walk there is security everywhere, especially at night.If I were to return to Honolulu I would definitely stay at the Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach Walk.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is a lovely hotel in a great location. We are a family of five so finding a hotel where we only needed one room is fantastic.It was a squeeze but for the price! Welcome drink on arrival, free cocktails by the pool in the afternoon, and a buffet breakfast all included. Valet parking only expensive part of the stay at $30/day. Staff were wondeful would recommend.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Pros:-Spacious suite with separate living room, couch, sink, mini-fridge, balcony, 2 TVs.-Buffet breakfast (made to order omelette station, fresh fruit, juices, muffins, pancakes/waffles, salad, sausage, bacon, etc)-Great location: 1-2 blocks from Waikiki beach, Waikiki Beach Walk (nice shops and lots of places to eat - Yardhouse, Roy's, nearby malls), ABC store and Starbucks (right across the street for food or anything forgotten)-Friendly, warm staff (valet bringing our luggage to the room had great tips and open to answering all our questions, Expedia concierge - Ulrich, service staff at buffet were very helpful since I had 2 little ones with me)-Nice run (once you get to Waikiki beach towards the base of Diamond Head) Cons: -Parking is $25-30 overnight and only valet. (This is normal since you are in the city. Try to rent a car by the day and not park overnight. Concierge helped us with that.)-WiFi only on lobby floor and one other floor-Plain room decor -Price at $350/night (but daily buffet breakfast, great location, and spacious room makes up for that for us)

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I recently stayed at the Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach Walk. I stayed there primarily during my business trip, but had my family with me, so enjoyed some of the more "vacation-y" elements of the hotel and surrounding area as well. First, the rooms are great. Clean, spacious, well-equipped. It is great to have the second room when traveling with a family. I felt the advantage of the second room outweighed any of the disadvantages of this hotel, but that isn't going to be case for everyone. Second, the breakfast was great each morning and a big bonus. You could stock up an an extra piece of fruit for a snack later on. Only downside to breakfast was the coffee = abysmal. (Note: There was a Starbucks in the Outrigger Reef at the Beach across the street.) The Manager's reception each day was nice if you wanted a free drink, but the snacks were mediocre at best (nacho chips with salsa or cheese sauce), so never a replacement for dinner.The pool was a decent size (for a roof level pool), but it got very crowded and it wasn't the best place to hang out with young children. My 4 year old was easily overrun by adults tossing around a football and teenagers with water guns. The hotel is less than a block to the beach. You walk out of the hotel, cross the street and walk a path between to beachfront hotels to the beach. The walk was 5 minutes.The beach was less crowded and closer than Waikiki Beach, which was nice, but the walk down the path was unpleasant. It was full of hotel employees on their smoke breaks and the first two days, we saw homeless people drinking alcohol. Hard to explain that to the 4 year old.Primarily, I was in Waikiki for business, so I do want to comment on this hotel with a few things related to business travel. First, the rooms are only wired for internet. I traveled with my iPad and was not able to access my work email. I kind of thought that wireless internet was a given these days. It was only available in the lobby, but the connection was weak, so it was hard to connect. I usually just made use of the business centre. Second, parking is only valet. This is common in Waikiki, but pricely - $30 per day + tips. Keep this in mind. Business travelers are probably better served by staying outside of Waikiki, as traffic is busy getting over the Ala Wai canal.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed seven nights in mid-April. The location was great, convenient to everything in Waikiki. The accomodations were excellent, as expected with Embassy Suites and new hotels. Views were great from 19th floor, Hula Tower. The staff was exceptional. Extremely friendly and accomodating. We booked Big Island/Volcano trip with the concierge, as well as the hard-to-get Royal Hawaiian 'Aha 'Aina. No problem. Valet parking staff and Bell staff were extremely friendly and willing to help in unexpected ways. Breakfasts and Manager's Receptions were great, as we expected. The absence of wifi was offset with the availability of wired internet in the rooms. The bar/wait staff at the pool was friendly and their service was friendly and quick. I am glad we did the research on hotels in Waikiki through Tripadvisor and Fodor's. This one worked out extremely well. We highly recommend it!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here in April for 3 nights in a 1 bedroom suite with 3 kids which was a little cramped esp sharing 1 bathroom with 2 teenage girls but we survived. We were on the 18th floor and had ocean views which was lovely.The staff were very friendly and helpful compared to other high end resorts we stayed at while in Hawaii. The breakfast buffett very nice. Pool area never crowded always could get lounge chair. Bar staff actually came to you to get your order compared again to other expensive resorts we stayed at that didn't.Great location easy walk to Waikiki's nightlife. Enjoyed my stay at the Embassy the most compared to the HHV and Westin Villas in Maui glad this place was recommended to me would stay here again for sure.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stay over four nights during Easter Weekend and really enjoyed our stay. The location was great and was in walking distance to most of Waikiki's highlights. The pool area was quite nice with chairs always available. We were upgraded to a two bedroom unit which was great and had lots of space for the four of us. All the staff we dealt with at the hotel were very helpful and friendly. We had booked a family package and got a pizza dinner for one night included and our excellent server even brought us a delicious complimentary cookie plate at the end of our meal. We liked having the breakfasts included and especially enjoyed the omelettes made to order. We even took in the evening happy hour which was a nice break while the kids swam in the pool. Only thing we did miss was WIFI in the rooms , was only in common areas and was a bit sketchy even there, but overall a very nice stay

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Although we booked a 1 bdrm suite, my wife and I were pleasantly surprised to be upgraded to a 2 bedroom 2-bath suite. What to do with all that space? Since we were travelling with friends and their two teenage girls (4 ppl), we told them to cancel their reservations at another resort and stay with us. The hotel allowed them to stay with us and charged them for far less than what they would have paid at other hotel. The suite still had enough room, we weren't bumping to each other -- each room on opposite ends with the living, dining room and kitchen in the middle. PROS: great accommodations, good breakfast, super pleasant staff. The hotel is in the heart of a lot of high end shops (eg, Fendi, Rolex, Chanel) CONS: No wifi in rooms--only in pool area and lobby. Although drinks during happy hour were great, the food was terrible.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at the hotel for 6 nights and had two rooms. Staff was excellent. Very helpful and friendly.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had a pretty good room on the 16 th floor. Cool view of Waikiki beach. Staff super friendly and very helpful. Breakfast was a bit busy but lots of selection. Pool too small for number of people trying to use it.Good location of hotel on Waikiki beach walk. However the lack of WiFi availability in our room was very annoying as in modern day world like to use Internet to research and plan for next days holiday activities. Internet Access plugin in room too old fashioned to use with AirMac.. Also had work emergency and spent a good hour on grand lanai trying to use free but extremely slow wifi, after spending another hour figuring out how to use my cellphone as hotspot finally got work finished- an evening wasted. When asking at front desk about options was told I could be put on waiting list for router. Ok that's my rant about computer access issues, but otherwise ok stay..

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed at the Embassy Suites, Waikiki Beach Walk during the second week of April. Our room was in the Hula Tower on the 16th floor which gave us an ocean view--very nice. The hotel staff is very helpful in getting you registered and settled in your room. The beach is a three minute walk from the hotel. The property has its own pool on the fourth level. This is also the level where you get your free breakfast every morning which includes fruit and cooked to order eggs and omelets with the usual breakfast items. Here is where the Manager's Happy Hour is held each evening beginning at 5:30 PM. The shopping district is close by as are numerous restaurants and cafes. We really enjoyed our stay here.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: While this hotel is in a good location we found it quite noisy the walls are like paper so you heard every thing in the other rooms and in hall ways, we had a room in the Aloha building and we could here everything on the street, I found the rooms abit dated and pool quite small but the complimentary breakfast was great and staff very helpful I would have to say I would not stay here again I think there is alot of nicer hotels in just as good location the noise was abit much.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The staff and hotel grounds were perfect. Made to order breakfasts and complimentary Manager's reception were excellent. My family and I enjoyed the nightly entertainment. Very close to the beach, restaurants and shopping. Daily valet is $30.00 though but there is no free parking in downtown Waikiki anywhere except at the Ala Moana Mall.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: (this is for a trip taken from 3/30 - 4/6)An excellent property with a great staff.The entire trip was made better with our stay here. (I have unreasonably high expectations). The reception desk had been waiting for us (with our late arrival at 11:00pm - and no call ahead). The 'bell' team members (hey, at 40+ you are not a 'boy' and I don't like the word 'hop') were very friendly and helpful. The valet service rocked. With one exception of a team member who seemed a little 'on to the next task' oriented, all others were very attentive and on the job. We never seemed to wait more than 5 minutes to have our rental car back in our hands. Always remember to tip them. They are worth it. BTW: Parking is $30 a night, and is worth it.I have no clue about the pricing for the room as it was a package deal. Not a cheap one either - but worth every penny spent.Embassy Suites always has a free breakfast buffet, and this one was no different. Do not forget the fact that this is a busy property with plenty of guests, so you will see a lot a people for breakfast. It is from 6:30 to 10. The food is good (not cold cereal and toast) and hot. Massive dining area called the Grand Lanai. The staff are on the job and all the tables are cleared fairly quickly when someone walks away.The room itself was great. We had a two room suite, and it was spotless and quite. Hawaii is notorious for having paper thin walls in any of the Honolulu rooms. Our room did not seem to follow this claim. However, we did have a room at the end of the hall, and the master bedroom was basically in the corner. I have no idea if the second bedroom heard anything from the other room next to it. Our room was on the same floor as the Grand Lanai, and actually right beside the entrance to it. But we never heard anyone of the hundreds of people going to breakfast each morning.The pool (on the Grand Lanai) was nice, but you should always remember that any family hotel will have tons of kids in the pool, no matter where you go.This was no exception. The rest of the pool area of the Lanai had lots of sun bathing chairs / seating. Also on the Grand Lanai was a bar (the Pakini Bar), and a Massage service. I used both. Both were excellent. The massage was given by a very talented woman who has been licensed for 15 years, but practicing ./ studying since she was 4. The style was Lomi Lomi, which I have had a hybrid of before, and enjoyed here. The bartender was also attentive, but also left you alone to stay on top of his other work. After a few Long Island's you don't care much anyways. It is an open air bar (as is true of many places in Honolulu) but not many people. Most of the customers are parents sitting around the pool watching the kids splash and play.The house keeping staff was very courteous and would stay away if you were in the room at the time they came by. They would always come back later, and you always had a clean room before 3.Check out was a breeze (as is with all Embassy Suites I have ever been to), and we were on our way after the bell staff picked up our baggage (one more then we arrived with :-) ) and the valet had our car brought around.Was it worth it? Yes. Are there cheaper places to stay? Yes. (We could see them all from the the room's own private Lanai.) Is it on the beach? No. The beach is just a block away.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at the Embassy mainly because of the size and we travel with two teens. The room is good size and love the breakfast that they offer which is very good at this hotel. This hotel is not on the beach but close about a 6 min. walk and you are there on the beach. The beach that is close to the hotel is crowded, but you can rent anything from chairs, umbrella and boogie boards from the many huts on the beach. The pool is small at the hotel but you are close to the beach so we mainly went to the beach. Hotel is attached to shopping area and variety or restaurants. Highly recommend Ruth Chris that is behind the hotel. Expensive but great. I would stay here again for the convenience.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Embassy Suites was recommended to us by our travel agent after our original booking at Outrigger Regency on Beachwalk was so called "overbooked" by the wholesaler for the peak time we travelled (January 2012).We stayed at Embassy Suites for 5 nights with our 2 children (aged 6 and 4) and my parents who had their own 1BR suite on the same floor as us in the Aloha Tower.Overall a very pleasant but expensive stay. Certainly a fabulous location and we experienced a high standard of service from the staff when checking in at reception, as well as breakfast and particularly the concierge desk who were 'spot on' with their advice on Pearl Harbour. (ie. to do a tour that included the Battleship Missouri memorial)Managers reception was a great feature (no queues when we were there) and we really enjoyed the variety at breakfast, even my husband with coeliac disease at least had some gluten free options. The birds would normally not have bothered us however my poor husband did get "pooped on" during breakfast one morning and the children were certainly kept entertained with the staff firing their water pistols at the birds. A unique breakfast experience for our family indeed.Had requested a high floor away from the elevator or stairwell but ended up on the 6th floor fairly close to the elevator. Fortunately there was not a noise issue for us and we all slept really well.Kids loved the pool area and watching the nearby friday night fireworks. The service from the Pakini Bar during the day was also excellent. MAHALO for an awesome stay!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We first stayed at the Embassy Suites in October 2009 with my wife and 6 month old daughter. We loved our 7 night experience so much that we returned in January 2011 with our new addition (8 month old son)! On our last trip we had a room on the top floor overlooking the ocean!! Amazing views!!!We have so thoroughly enjoyed our 2 stays at the Embassy Suites that we have just booked our third trip to stay there for 8 nights in April 2012!We love everything abou his hotel. It starts with the warm Greeting from the bell staff and front desk staff (complimentary refreshing beverage) and gets better and better from there. They are very accomodating and inviting for families with small children!The pool area is a great big hit with the kids! The daily breakfast is an amazing way to start EACH morning, especially the made to order omelet station (but the variety in general is great). My wife loves the rosemary roasted potatoes and we all devour the best fresh tropical fruit!It's a great location very close to the beach and close to great shopping and amenities (At the beachwalk development and close to Royal Hawaiian Centre).It's more pricey than a lot of other hotels in the area, but well worth the extra money and great value overall. Beig an All-Suite hotel, the rooms are spacious and great for familes with kids (the whole family doesn't want to go to bed at 8:00 PM). We won't stay anywhere else in Waikiki!Our three year old daughter will be making her third trip to Waikiki and the only hotel she knows is the Embassy Suites - our home away from home! Our destination of choice!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here at the end of March through early April for 7 nights. Since I used Hilton hotel points, with going rate of ~$300 a night, we saved roughly $2000 minus $210 for valet parking fee. If I had to pay $300/night certainly I would've picked different hotel, but for what we had, it was a good stay.1. Location: 3 stars Great and not so great. Great for dinning, Waikiki activities, shopping (if you like). Walking distance to pretty much everything we needed. Safe and good ambience location with Beach Walk stores.Very bad for sleeping at night. For two night I was awaken by noise, talking, and music playing from downstair room. My room was right next to linen room but still could hear neighbor very loudly. Stree noise was at times very loud even at 10th floor. Even my deep sleeping kids were disturbed in the early morning by delivery trucks and bus noise and backing beepings.2. Amemnities: 4 stars. Breakfast was a big plus, saved time and money but similiar menu 7 days in a row was getting tired. We didn't use pool. It looked discent but very small. Lanai is small and narrow. Microwave and small fridge worked good.3. Staff: 5 stars. pretty much everyone working there was great especially bell boys and parking staff. Check in clerk upgraded my room from 2nd floor to 10th with a partial view (you really have to put your neck out over the rail of to see a glimpse of the ocean) after I insisted that I didn't want a noisy room.Conclusion: If you want convenicence of Waikiki, breakfast, and suite (with free hilton points), it should be good stay. If you have to shell out a lot of money, I would consider something else.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I am not one that does review often, but feel that I have to do this one. I have stayed here three times in the past three years and just love it. It is the only hotel I will stay at when I am in Honolulu.As everyone mentioned, the hotel is in a wonderful location, very close to the beach, shopping, transportation and everything Waikiki has to offer. It is an all suite hotel, so very suitable for family traveling with young kids. The free breakfast and evening happy hour also helps with the cost when staying in Waikiki.However, the best feature of the hotel is its staff members. I have been to plenty hotels. I have stayed at Ritz, Waldorf... But I never felt being treated so family like in any of the other places. I have contact the hotel concerning my reservation before our arrival; Kay Lee from reservation corresponded with me promptly and took care of all my request. Upon checking in, Rita made us felt so welcome with her smile. At breakfast, Russ walked by and stopped to talking to us every time and made suggestion for things to do. During breakfast on our final day there, Aldrin (I hope I spell his name right) came by and gave my daughter small sacks with candies and color books. She was so happy when she got her gifts... One thing I noticed is that all the same staffs are still there through our three visits, that says something about the hotel. I would highly recommend the hotel, especially to families. The only thing I would wish the hotel would do is to add Wi-Fi. Within our family of three, we have 5 devices to access internet, one connection port is not enough. Plus even the hard connection was down half the time we were there. I guess it tries to get us disconnected from daily chores.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel was so centrally located. We loved the free happy hour and free breakfast. The hotel also went out of the way to show guests their appreciation. Great housekeeping too (thank you Josie.) We learned you can also see the Friday night fireworks right from the pool deck while lounging comfortably on a beach chair. Everything about this hotel offered the comforts of home and even better!!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was a very nice stay. The hallways are slightly dated but well kept. The room (1209) Was nice, had a beautiful city view and nice partial ocean view. And the people were as nice as could be. Highly recommended.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Everyone really liked this hotel - about 2 blocks from Waikiki Beach and right in the middle of more shopping than your feet will be able to take. Valet parking ONLY $30.00 per day additional fee- no parking available elsewhere... Lots of public transportation available for getting around.if you choose not to have a rental car.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was my 2nd trip to Hawaii and this time we stayed 12 nights (5 at the Hilton Hawaiian Village and 7 at the Embassy). The next time I'll skip the Hilton (which is fabulous) and just spend the enitre time at the Embassy - the breakfast was an added bonus, the room was spectacular and the free happy hour was a great way to wind down in the afternoon.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My family of four (girl-12 & boy-9) stayed in the Aloha Tower for four delightful nights at this wonderful hotel. We stayed in a beautiful up-to-date 2 bedroom suite that had wonderful Hawaiian details (love those hula girl lamps). For a family of four whose kids refuse to sleep on a sofa bed anymore, these 2 bedroom suites are a vacation lifesaver since other hotels will never "guarantee" connecting rooms. We had two spacious bedrooms, two bathrooms, attractive bar area with sink, microwave, and fridge, a comfortable living room and three flat panel TVs. Our two balconies over looked the pool area on the forth floor. Unfortunately, our view of the ocean was partially blocked by the obnoxiously over-sized Trump hotel next door. The hotel is literally on top of the Waikiki Beachwalk redevelopment of high quality and high priced restaurants and shops. It is a great place to people watch. I laugh at those tourists who come to Oahu to buy unbelievable overpriced items (that you can buy on the mainland), and then hope that others ogle their expensive purchases wrapped in Gucci or Chanel shopping bags. I have never been the person to spend valuable vacation time that I could be spent at the beach or discovering the rich Hawaiian culture and natural wonders, but instead spend hours shopping for items that aren't even from Hawaii. After much people watching, one curious thing I noticed is that people are slimmer here in Oahu than on the other Hawaiian Islands (and definitely the rest of the U.S.), and the reason -- they're not Americans.Regarding dining, Roy's Asian Fusion restaurant on the ground floor is a must. We also enjoyed the beach front Shorebird Restaurant in the Outrigger Reef Hotel that separates the Embassy Suites from the beach. Duke's was also fun but make reservations; we waited 90 min. and didn't eat until after 10pm. DO NOT go to the Oceanarium at the Pacific Beach Hotel which sells itself as a buffet surrounding a gigantic aquarium. We thought it would be fun for the kids, and it's recommend in several travel guides. We refused to stay at a place where the only patrons appeared to get the buffet free with their hotel stay. The place smelled, the patrons were seated like sardines, and the aquarium looked like a gigantic silo.
