Speaking of food, one reason the Embassy Suites hotel chain is popular with families is the breakfast that is included. This Embassy Suites breakfast was JUST OKAY; there other hotels have much better breakfast. Go for the cool-to-order omelette station--it's the only tasty food available. Otherwise, the juices were watered down, the bread choice limited and sometimes stale, the pre-made scrambled eggs dried tasted rehydrated, the sausage tasteless, and the fruit selection was boring (mind you, Hawaii is a tropical fruit paradise but not at this hotel). I will say the friendly staff could handle the large number of guests and there were plenty of clean tables to dine at. However, get down to breakfast well before the 10am close because right at 10 am, the staff swiftly closed the glass sliding doors, and you can't go back in to get seconds.Overall, the hotel's service was top notch especially valets/bell hops who handled your baggage or auto with very friendly and quick professional service. If you have a question of what to see and how to get there, go to the valets rather than wait at the concierge desk.Stay at this hotel because it is in close proximately to the best attraction that Oahu has to offer and within walking distance to fine restaurants and the famous Waikiki Beach.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed in Rm 429 in the Hula Tower March 11-15. We were a little nervous after seeing reviews about the noise and traffic on the 4th floor. Our room was in the corner of the building, away from the elevators and pool. We had lanais on 2 sides, one with a gilmpse of the ocean and the other with a glimpse of the mountains. We enjoyed sitting on the lanais and watching the people walking around outside. Our room was quiet. We didn't hear anything from either the pool or elevators or the traffic outside on the streets. The breakfast was great, especially the cook to order omelets. Our room was clean and everything was in good repair. The sheets, mattresses, pillows and towels were comfortable. The one-bedroom suite was roomy enough for our family of 4. On the first day, housekeeping was a little slow to clean our room. We mentioned this to the housekeeper we saw on our floor and this was remedied. We had no other complaints. There seemed to be plenty of room around the pool and breakfast area. We don't go to Hawaii to hang around the gym or shopping, but in passing these looked adequate. A hotel employee went out of her way to help us with shipping a package home. She offered us a box and some bubble wrap from her office when she saw us waiting by the closed UPS store in the hotel. There was a good selection of restaurants nearby. We especially liked Giovanni Pastrami, practically across the street. They have a variety of great $5 happy hour food options such as personal pizzas, onion rings, nachos, etc. These are very good. 1 to 1 1/2 items per person is more than sufficient to make a meal. Their regular dinner offerings were good too. We would highly recommend Embassy Suites to anyone.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We spent a week here in February and overall were pleased. However, our room location was the pits - 2nd floor, next to elevator, delivery side. The breakfast cannot be beat for families. With meals averaging $50+, a free breakfast is a huge help to the budget. Very reasonable serving hours also. My husband was on business and it was also great for him to be able to catch a bite early before heading to work, while the daughter and I could take our time. The hotel is located just across the street from the beach (of course, there is a hotel in the way, but you are welcome to either go through the hotel or there is a public, sidewalk entrance). This hotel is super close to the Hale Koa and HHV. Beach chair rentals fairly reasonable ($15+) and include 2 chairs & an umbrella. Get there early and you can get your pick of prime spots, but even a bit later (9:30-10a) there were still front row spots available.Housekeeping was good. Plenty of towels everyday, including beach towels. A very small complaint is that all of there promo photos show a kukei (sp?) nut necklace (lei) on the bed as though it is a welcome gift. There was none for us. Housekeeping does put a little card on the pillow each night describing a local tradition, which was quite lovely, but again I sort of expected the lei.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our family (my wife & I and our two sons ages 4 & 6) travel regularly (and we seem to get to Hawaii every year). Each time we have visited Oahu, we have stayed in a different place (both independent and chain hotels as well as private vacation rentals).This Embassy Suites is like most of its counterparts throughout the chain in that it offers a clean, efficient hotel suite comprising a living area with a pullout couch, sink with bar fridge area and a separate bedroom. Also, like the rest of the members of this chain, this Embassy Suites offers a full breakfast with a cook to order omelette station.The Pluses:- Very convenient location on the Waikiki Beachwalk area with a wide range of restaurants and other tourist amenities- Exceptional free breakfast! Omelette station offers a wide range of fillings: cheese, sausage, bacon, ham, fresh chopped tomato, green pepper, onion, jalapeno peppers and even lomi-lomi salmon (which I found to be overly salty). Other menu items include a range of breads, pastries, bagels, English muffins and pastries/muffins, packaged cereals/oatmeal, a few Japanese friendly choices (Miso soup, rice with seaweed and basic Japanese pickles & condiments), juices, coffee (somewhat watery and of mediocre quality) and tea (basic selection). Although some of the menu items vary (pancakes one day, french toast the next and biscuits & gravy the day after), the core menu items are consistent. For us, with two kids in tow, the breakfast is convenient and probably saves us $50-$60 daily (compared with an equivalent hot breakfast with tax and tip elsewhere).- Clean and efficient- Decent kids swimming pool (no real deep end so not suitable as a lap pool for adults)The Minuses- Not on the beach and minimal views to speak of (at least from our room).- No Wifi in the room (only single plug-in internet in the living area). Lobby wifi does not offer a wide range and tends to be spotty- Generic Embassy Suites interior design (slightly tropical, but nothing to write home about -- at least no major negative surprises)- Efficient room size, but no sense of expansive space (perhaps we have been spoiled buy some exceptional hotel rooms and vacation rentals in the past).- Minor mistake upon check in (we had confirmed a large king sized bed for my wife and I but the first room we were provided only had a double in the bedroom; the timing for the mistake was poor because we had arrived late at night and it was the equivalent of 2 am in our home city so the last thing we wanted to deal with was a delay in getting our kids to bed; we ended up in the right type of room, but on the second floor of the hotel which resulted in some street noise entering our room).All in all, if you want a hotel close to the heart of Waikiki and are travelling with kids, the Embassy Suites is a reasonable choice (and better than average value if you want to have a hot breakfast daily and are travelling with kids in tow) as long as you are aware of the property's limitations.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We spent one full week here, mostly pleasure but a bit of business. We got to know the hotel quite well. Here are the plusses and minuses. PLUS: 1) the suites are spacious, with microwaves, fridges, etc. Beds are comfortable, everything works, two LG large screen TV's per suite, etc.; 2) free hot home cooked breakfast in the morning, free manager's reception with cocktails in the late afternoon. These are great amenities; 3) location is only 1/2 block from the ocean and the boardwalk. MINUS: 1) the gym is pitifully small for a hotel this large; 2) parking of your rental car is very expensive ($30/day) -- I strongly recommend using the Hale Koa parking lot 1/2 block away, which is about half that price (and much less if you have military ID).All in all, we think this is a great place to stay while in Honolulu. The location is fantastic for walking in exciting Waikiki. We loved it.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: If a private beach means a lot to you, this is not the place to stay, but if you don't want to bother renting a car, this is for you. Included in the price is a huge buffet breakfast (standard at all Embassy Suites hotels), as well as happy hour cocktail and nibbles (also standard). The location is wonderful for walking Waikiki and dining at a huge variety of nice restaurants. Avoid a room near the elevator - it is quite noisy, and ask for a high floor if street entertainment noise bothers you. However, the staff is most accommodating, the 2 room suites amply spacious, and a bus to downtown is a block away.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I stayed here for three nights and enjoyed it. The breakfast every morning was amazing as well as evenIng Manager Reception. The rooms are nice and abit above average. It's nice to have a Seperate bedroom. There was carrying noise from both the room above and beside. Nice big bathroom and always hot water for the shower. The pool area is nice and all staff were very, very nice. I would definitely stay here again but not for the 349 price tag.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great stay for one night at this Embassy Suites. EXCELLENT check-in process. It was fast and the juice drink others talk about was perfect for the kids. We had an 8th floor room in the Hula tower, wow. It had the perfect view even though I had not planned on having one.The bell-hop with the bags was great. The valet was fast coming and going. We stayed for one night with 3 boys before heading to our timeshare. The b-fast was awesome. The quantity and quality were great. The birds that I read about in other reviews actually served as a fun thing for the youngest 2 boys, 4 and 5. No lines at 7:45-8am. I wish we stayed there longer. The only knock was loud garbage trucks at like 4:30am. That was bad, but the view the night before made it worth it. The jet-lag didn't help either.Overall, classy place. Check-in and check-out were super smooth. We used HH points and even though we had no real status, silver, our room was great.The rooms were in good shape. Our room was a corner room and so it was different from the floor plan, but it was nice having balconies on 2 different streets.Would stay again in a heart beat.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Best place to stay in Waikiki! HUGE buffet breakfast and happy hour included in stay. One block from the beach. Clean, spacious room.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel is OK. The reservation process I found unorganized and stressfull...esp. when you make any changes. The hotel itself was fine...kinda tacky local decor. but clean and nice enough. The staff I found extremely nice! The parking was a complete price gouge! $30 a night. They only have valet. I only stayed one night for an event in Waikiki (I'm a local) and I can't imagine the tourists paying $30 a night on top of their hotel bill! Unbelievable!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I had read all the really positive reviews. I have to say it is surprisingly good value. The staff are wonderful, the rooms are good. We stayed here twice during Feb-Mar. 4 days before heading to Maui and then 2 days before heading back to Australia. I do have to say with toddlers I did appreciate having the suite - made life so much easier and better - at least it meant that they could sleep and we could still stay up and watch TV. We originally had two doubles in the Hula Tower as my mother-in-law was also staying with us. A double bed doesn't work for me and my partner - we're both too tall... so I slept on the sofa-bed which is surprisingly comfortable for a sofa-bed. Although the Ocean View was well worth it. Our second stay had us in the Aloha Tower right next to the elevator. We considered asking for another room but decided against it as we were only there for the two nights. We were lucky with that room that we did get a partial ocean view but mostly we got a view of the park and the Trump Tower.The breakfasts I thought were ok. Nothing particularly special although it was one of the few buffet breakfasts we encountered that did have cereal. It would be nice to see a bit more variety though. The staff at breakfast were always very helpful though.We went to the managers reception once and yes well... wine & cocktails in plastic cups? Tortilla chips & salsa? I was again expecting something a little different.The pool area is delightful. Our twin girls had hours of fun there. The hotel is centrally located which is a bonus and the staff really are more than prepared to go out of their way to help with directions and assistance.Overall it was a pleasant experience staying here and I would quite happily return if we're ever in Waikiki again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Your staff is amazing. In the morning, when i was looking for a something at the breakfast buffet that my wife had asked for and was leaving without finding it, this very kind employee took a look at my anxious face and asked if he could help. He then went out of his way to make sure i found what i was looking for (some specific yogurt) and walked with me with genuine interest in making sure i was satisfied, just as I would be to a guest at my house. His sense of interest was genuine (you can usually see through the superficial attempts at being nice) and his attitude warmed my heart for the day. The concierges were both fantastic with not just recommendations, but follow through with phone calls to confirm my casual question for fresh brewed kona coffee availability in the area (Honolulu coffee co - it was fantastic).Finally, i have to mention Tony at the valet was beyond amazing. He was helpful to a degree that i would have difficulty putting words to express. When we were in a situation and had to leave our rental car at the airport instead of at the rental office, he remembered our rushed family from earlier in the day and made a special personal trip to make sure it was returned to the rental agency. The fact that we felt we could trust him to do that was already a big deal, but his personal follow through and the continued staying in touch as he completed the process was such a reinforcement of basic principles of helping your fellow human beings in distress that it has inspired our family to make sure we pass it forward by going out of our way to make sure we can help others. In short the staff's attitude was inspirational! and we will definitely stay here when we return to Hawaii again (after this experience, who would not want to go back to such lovely people.). Your hotel has done a great job in encouraging this behaviour - this is not something you can train people to do!! Thank you for the lesson in hospitality...

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here at the end of February for a quick layover on our way to Kauai. Checkin was a breeze, we were exhausted and we were welcomed with fresh juice, an upgrade to a 2 bedroom suite and Dean the bellman! We checked in quite late and the staff was still bright and cheerful. Dean was a bright spot with alot of Aloha spirit, he was really professional and went out of his way to make us feel welcome. Our 2 bedroom suite had 2 queens in one bedroom and a King in the other, as well as a sleeper sofa. No view, but we were not staying for more than just one night. The breakfast was wonderful, maybe not the largest selection, but a decent omelette, and nice fresh fruit. The open air, and view of the pool were nice amenities to have during breakfast. I felt like the value of staying at Embassy was worth it even for a quick stay. We will most definitely stay here again, and I won't hesitate to recommend this to my friends and family.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The included breakfasts and Manager's Reception each evening are a nice touch. The front desk staff, housekeeping and wait staff in the breakfast room go out of there way to make this a pleasant experience.The hotel might be showing its age in some of the furnishings but the rooms were clean and so were the linens and towels.We stayed for a couple of days before and after our cruise on the Pride of America and I would recommend this hotel whatever the reason for your stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed at the Embassy Suites at Waikiki Beach Walk while on vacation. Price wise, it is typical of Waikiki rates. The staff were very helpful and friendly. From the bell boys to the front desk for check in , one is made to feel very welcome. We were upgraded to a 2 B suite (the 1B suite that we booked was not available), the rooms were really spacious, the bedding and linen comfortable. Of course the place is not very new, but it's clean. They have a hot breakfast included in our room rate, which was served on the 4th floor dining room. The place is crowded, but if one goes at the right times (6:30-8:00 or 9:30 after) the lines are not as long. The selections are okay, especially since they have the made to order omelets (which I always prefer). But they do not have hot cereal like oatmeal, and cold cereal selection is limited. The buffet has a variety of selections. The only thing I did not really like is the fact that the breakfast dining area is partially open to the outdoors and there are birds flying around, plus on the colder days, it gets pretty windy and chilly at certain seating areas.The location is great, about a block or 2 from the beach, also close to Aloha Landing (at Sheraton Waikiki), where all the tour buses pickup and drop off. And the evening cocktails (complimentary) is always a plus. Also enjoy the lemon water set out in the lobby, after a long day touring and walking around, it is refreshing to be able to drink something cold. There are lots of shops around the vicinity of the hotel, as well as restaurants within walking distance. It is a great place to stay in Waikiki Beach.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My family and I spent two nights 1/13-15, from the bellmen to check in person you are welcomed with a smile. The cold juice that everybody was given while you are checking in is a nice touch. We arrived late from the mainland and everybody was tired. So we ended up ordering room service 8 minutes before they closed for the night. The room service order was delivered promptly and again with a smile. The manager's rececption on Saturday night had a live band playing. I have stayed at many Embassy Suites and that was a first! I forgot to pack a razor, called housekeeping and promptly had one delivered one to my room. The breakfest in the morning is great. My only complaint is that some people feed the birds at breakfest, so the birds have become accustomed to sweeping in for the food on the tables. I wish the management could do something about this. We had a late flight back home and needed to use a hospitality room. They only gave us a half an hour for four people to shower and change. And when that time was up they called the room to remind us time was up. With three females in our group that is not very much time! All in all we had a great time and would definitely stay there again. Aloha

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at the Embassy Suites from Feb 12-19. As a family of 4 with 2 teenage children the room set-up with a total of 3 beds was perfect. The rooms were spacious, the view of the ocean if I sat just right on the balcony was more than we could have asked for, considering we were in a standard room and not paying for any kind of water view. The cleaning was always done well and on time,the morning breakfast was more than adequate, the evening managers reception a nice way to relax before heading out for dinner. The location was ideal, a walk across the street and down 2 blocks for beach access, all the shopping and dining choices you could ask for right out the doors of the Hula Tower. It was our first trip to Honolulu it was a great trip, we are already planning our next trip back, and will definately be staying at the Embassy Suites again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was the most fantastic hotel experience we have ever had! The location near the beach and the amenities were unbeatable. What set the hotel apart the others we have stayed in over the 20 years, was the super friendly and professional staff. Russ and his crew at breakfast, the house staff and front desk were all perfect! The only reason this review gets five stars is because there is no roomm for more. Highly recommend to others!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My wife and I stayed at the Embassy Suites from Feb. 6 - 14. This was our second time staying there. We had stayed there a year ago, and when we were planning another trip decided to stay there again.A lot of what brought us back was the staff and cleanliness of the hotel. The staff was fantastic - again. The lady cleaning our room - Josie - was wonderful. She was always cheerful and pleasant, and the room was spotless every day.The breakfasts were also wonderful. Omelets, fresh fruit, bacon, pancakes. It actually saved us money, in that we didn't need to have lunch. The staff there was great too - always smiling and happy to help you out.I booked the room directly on their website, and asked for a room as high as possible, and overlooking the pool. They were able to accomodate us and even upgraded us to an ocean view room. It was beside the elevators and you could hear them, but they didn't bother us. I guess each night we were tired enough from walking and sightseeing that we fell right to sleep.We also took advantage of the Manager's Reception on a few of the nights we were there when a band was playing. They were very good, and on the one evening, the people wouldn't let them quit! They played until 8:15!Certainly if we ever go back to Waikiki, we will consider staying here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at the Embassey Suites for seven nights from 2/14 - 2/21' and we had a wonderful experience celebrating our 50th Wedding Anniversary.The breakfast was excellent, the staff very friendly, and the cocktail hour was a nice addition.Our only complaint was that the guy who checked us in gave us the worst room possible next to the gym and elevator even when I told him that we had called four months ahead to request a room in the other tower on a higher floor. He lied and said that the hotel was full and could not help us. We found out that the hotel was not near full. We then contacted a young woman who I think was named Laura, and she was so helpful, friendly, and certainly customer oriented. She said she was fairly new, so the hotel definitely needs to keep her!!Also, the pool area was never crowded, so it was pleasant to enjoy the sun. Go down to the right about three blocks to a nice, sandy beach, We will definitely stay at this hotel again!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We have stayed here previously and have really enjoyed our stay each visit. However, this time we stayed in the Aloha Tower and it was not as nice. Not very convenient to the breakfast/managers reception/pool area or to getting to street level. So I would recommend the Hula Tower. The rooms in the Hula Tower seem larger and better views of the ocean. In the past, the hotel had great entertainment for the nightly managers reception including hula dancers and local cultural presentations.... not the case anymore which was a huge disappointment especially for the kids, BUT you can't beat FREE Mai tais and blue Hawaiian's! The snacks are adequate but could really be taken up a notch. Did I mention breakfast? You can't beat this breakfast bar!! All the traditional American fare in addition, they have great salads, rice, Polynesian sausage, miso soup, etc. You really can't beat it! The wait staff is always nice and helpful.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed here several times on Hilton Rewards points, the free breakfast here is great, a full buffet, and a cook to your order section. Manager reception every night is better than the ones on the mainland. Also, provides some type of entertainment, such as a band, Hawaiian dancers, etc. It’s one of the harder hotels to books on the Island with rewards point.Their rates are compatible with the other hotels in the same locations, but you do save a lot on the breakfast. Kids can fill up at night at the Manager special in the evening. Rooms are spacious (they are suites), clean and comfortable.It is about 1/2 block from the beach, and all the shopping area are close by.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had a great stay at the Embassy Suites! It was by far the nicest place we stayed in Hawaii. My husband booked a 1 bedroom suite with the CAA rate ($215). When we arrived, they gave us an upgrade to a 2 bedroom suite because we were on our honeymoon! That was a great surprise - the bedrooms were huge (each with a king bed and ensuite), and we had 2 lanais and a sitting room, plus an entranceway/mini-kitchen. Our 1 year old baby was along for our honeymoon, so the extra space felt very luxurious!The rooms are spotless. They give Crabtree & Evelyn shampoo, etc. which was a treat. Lots of storage to unpack clothing. A tv in each room - not that we watched much with so much to do in Waikiki.Breakfast - included at the hotel, and it was substantial. They have GREAT made-to-order omelettes, and the very friendly omelette man got our toddler a hard-boiled egg when we asked.Manager's reception - it was fun. We went down the nights the band was playing, and hung out in the pool & hot tub. There was a good, lively atmosphere around the eating/pool/bar area, especially when the band was playing. The band was surprisingly good, and played a good variety of songs.Pool - The pool is the perfect temperature. Refreshing, but not too cold. Apparently, many pools in Hawaii aren't heated so that was a treat. There were lots of kids in the pool in the evening, which made our little one very happy. There is a main pool, a kiddie pool (about 1.5 feet deep?) and a hot tub. All were great.Beach - good location. Short walk to beach a block in front of the hotel, but after the first day we walked a few blocks farther, and swim in front of the Royal Hawaiian (we cut through the hotel grounds). It was WAY better for swimming. Beach in front of the Embassy Suites is ROCKY when you go like 5-10 feet into the water. In front of the Royal Hawaiian it is a nice, sandy bottom, and a bigger beach. But you'd have to be crazy to stay at the Royal Hawaiian, when you can have a huge suite at the Embassy Suites, a free breakfast, and enjoy a 5 minute walk to the exact same beach for 1/2 the price.Only negatives (they matter about 0.1%):1. The coffee in the rooms sucked (but then, what hotel room coffee isn't?). BUT - easy fix. My husband got us the best coffees I've had in my life every morning from the Starbucks across the street on the Beach Walk (lattes with a splash of liquid syrup).2. Also, our key card quit working a few times. The front desk thought it was because of being near cell phone, but neither of us own cell phones, so the reason is a mystery.We'll definitely stay here again when in Waikiki. It's great having a bedroom that is separate from the living room, especially when you have kids.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed 8 nights in Feb 2012. Booked on basis of favorable TripAdvisor reviews and our previous experience with Embassy Suites. We have been to Waikiki several times and like the Beachwalk location for its beach access and proximity to restaurants and shops. We are an active couple in our early 60's and were travelling with a family member in their 80's. We had a two bedroom two bathroom unit on the 18th floor. It was an ideal layout - bedrooms and bathrooms at opposte ends of the unit with a shared living / dining area - offering lots of privacy. Our unit was high enough that we had an unexpected view of Diamond Head and the "Pink Palace." The kitchen facilities are very limited, as have been described elsehwere. We had not intended on preparing any meals but had anticipated bringing in some meals. However, there were no dishes or utensiles. At best, the kitchen might be suitable for making some snacks. That was the only disappointment, even knowing about the limited kitchen from other reviews. The included breakfast buffet was very good with a great selection of fresh and prepared food. The manager's reception was also good although with less appealing snacks / appetizers than we have previously had in the Seattle and Nashville Embassy Suites. The Precor equipped gym was excellent with a good selection of of cardio and resistance equipment, all in good working order. The pool was very nice with plenty of lounges. However, in Feb it only catches sun in the afternoon. All members of the staff were very friendly and helpful. The housekeeping was great.We highly recommend the Embassy Suites Waikiki and look forward to our next stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Spent 3 weeks here in 2/12. The service staff, from the valets, bellmen, front desk, housekeeping, food and beverage were all top notch, extraordinarily friendly and helpful. The room was clean, modern and comfortable...I can't think of a single thing to gripe about! Hats off in particular to Keola, Aldrin, Lei, and May Juan...you made this a great trip...

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My husband and I stayed here for 6 nights in January. Our room for the first night was not acceptable in that it was on the main floor (technically the 2nd flr), very noisy and no lanai. We did complain the next morning and to their credit - they made it right. Our second room was on the 14th floor overlooking the pool with partial ocean view - just lovely! The staff is very friendly, room cleaning always done in a timely fashion, breakfast staff very accomodating. Poolside service was a real treat and we spent an entire day enjoying that. While it did not start out great the management made it right for us and because of this we would not hesitate to stay here again and we would highly recommend it. The location is great - a bit down the street from the really busy part of Waikiki but convenient at the same time. Lots of great places to eat nearby. Can't wait to go back!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our family was here for three nights at Christmas and this hotel was fantastic! The staff were extremely friendly and accommodating. The breakfast is wonderful and the seating area is perfect - "outside" yet sheltered on three sides. The manager's reception every evening was a great way to mingle with other guests. The beach is a very short walk away, though you really can't see it because other high rises block the view. The suites were perfect for a family of four. The only down-side was that our rooms faced that livelier of the streets that surround the hotel and things got loud at bar time. Otherwise, highly recommended!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Had 2 days in Honolulu before we boarded for our cruise. All hotels near the beach are expensive, but from what I hear from others is that none have free breakfast. It was great. Full buffet, omlette station, fresh fruit, I could go on & on. Very good.Also from 5:30 to 7:30 is the managers reception. As you may know from another Embassy review my husband likes his beer. 2 types on tap & oh the MaiTais. Had a great band with a beautiful Hawaiin dancer. Very nice evenings.Hate to say I wasn't too pleased with our room. We were on the first floor of 15. Would have liked something with more of a view.Their consier was great helping us to get on a great tour of the island,Also it's about 1/2 block from the beach, and in a great area with lots of shops & restaurants.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Traveled with wife, 8 month baby and parents. Double beds comfy. Bathrooms spacious. kitchenette includes microwave, sink and fridge. Balconies small. Not much of view from our room. Fantastic service. Very nice breakfast (included). Happy hour daily (free well drinks). Nice valet service for $30/day. Nice pool (windy). Has Yardhouse downstairs. Subway 1 minute walk. 2 minute walk to beach. Nice newly updated street with high end stores. Driving can be difficult but this great location provides nice access to most of what you need in Waikiki. Would highly recommend this for families.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at the Embassy Suites Waikiki for ten days on our way moving off the island. We had such a great experience!First, I wasn't happy with the original room we were given and they happily moved us to another that same day. Our bell hops were all so friendly, too. The whole hotel was clean and comfortable and fairly quiet for the location. Our room was a good size and the king bed was so comfortable.We thought the free breakfast was fantasic and the managers reception was wonderful, especially when the band played. The pool was warm and the hot tub even better.We were not disappointed in our stay and were sorry to leave!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Clean, comfortable, well-appointed suites. This is a great hotel! The beds are comfy, the water pressure in the shower is good, even the soap products -- Crabtree & Evelyn -- are top-drawer.Breakfast is plentiful and well organized. There are two omelette stations, with three burners at each, so never a particularly long wait for food. The manager's reception is a nice way to end the day -- but not as good as in other Embassy Suites we've stayed at:1) Snacks are nothing more than chips, salsa, and Chex mix or peanuts. 2) The mixed drinks weren't up to par. The bartender is generous with liquor but something -- mixes, juices (?) -- wasn't quite right. If you stick to beer or white wine -- not red! -- you'll be okay. As with other hotels in the area, parking is expensive -- $30 per day -- with valet service only. (Think twice whether you even need to rent a car; after the fact we realized it wasn't worth it.)

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great location nice hotel. Expensive however with managers cocktail reception and breakfast thrown in it was good value. We enjoyed our stay here immensely however if I had one bad word it was the quality of some of the guests at breakfast. The daily rugby scrum for food was shocking! We actually saw people sprinting to get food then loading up with excess amounts which unfotunatley some Americans are infamous for. Birds were a pest but again this is down to guests feeding them from the table. Great holiday, great location, good hotel with great service but some guests need reminding its a 5* hotel

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was our second visit. Not on the beach but just a short one block walk through the Outrigger Reef across the street. Only two blocks from the Pro Bowl block party. Great free breakfast buffet and manager's reception had 2 hours of a great band with a few hula dances 4 nights out of the 7 we were there but apparently they are in the midst of changing the schedule so check every day. The TV schedule said Monday, Wednesday, and Saturday. The 2 room suites were nice size and included small refrigerator and microwave. Very reasonable considering the surrounding resort rates and no breakfast or free drinks. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful.Public transportation is easy ($2.50) and ask for a transfer when getting on and you can use it to get back. Take shuttle from airport to hotel and back for about $20 round trip.Don't miss the free Army museum which was easy walking distance and in a converted WWII bunker.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had a one-night stay in Honolulu en route to Maui and booked the Embassy Suites for the location and the free breakfast. We were pleasantly surprised to discover a very nice property in a great location near the beach. Is it the Four Seasons or the Ritz-Carlton? Of course not, but for the price, it's a very good deal at a very nice property.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach Walk was a wonderful place to stay. It was perfectly located in the main area of Waikiki near many shops and restaurants, as well as the beach. What more could you want? On top of that, the room was huge and very clean. It was a bonus to have separate rooms for a bedroom and a living area, which made it feel like a home away from home. It's always great to have a microwave and refrigerator, which I took full advantage of to store drinks and snacks. Having breakfast every day was such a perk since many hotels don't include this for free. However, the quality was only OK and there weren't many choices (I don't eat eggs so couldn't take advantage of the cook-to-order omelets). Again, it was free, so I'm not going to make a big deal about it and I was satisfied every morning. It was also another perk to have the manager's reception every evening that provided free alcoholic drinks and a few snacks. I’ve never heard of anything like this being offered at other hotels. The Embassy Suites staff was friendly and very helpful. The hotel also provided a few nice gifts in which to collect you would have to post a pic. of Hawaii on Facebook or turn in a card to the front desk during the 1st 24 hours. These gifts I noticed could've been bought at the gift shop so it saved some money on gifts that you would've purchased. They also provided equipment (limited) for Internet service in the room, but it wasn't the most effective. However, it wasn’t a big deal, and I loved my stay there and hope to return again one day!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We, family of 2 adults and 2 children aged 17 and 12 from the "Gong" NSW Australia, recently stayed for 12 nights in January and I can say that it was enjoyed by all. Our room was spectacular with lovely ocean views from the 19th floor of the Hula Tower. It had 2 queen beds (very comfortable) and a seperate room for tv which had a sofa bed which was handy for our 17 year old daughter.The location, the comfort of the rooms and the staff were superb. The free breakfast was handy and had fresh eggs or omeletes freshly made and had a good selection of food, cereals, fruit and yogurt. The staff were very helpful and the rooms were cleaned daily. The pool area was nice and clean and had enough chairs for all and was never too crowded. Good location of the hotel as it was only a short walk to the busier area of Waikiki and not far from the Cheesecake Factory which has a great selection of food. Looking forward to our next visit and I would certainly recommend for families. Maholo

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I'm a fan of Embassy Suites to start with so was glad I wasn't dissappointed. We were greated at the front desk with a lovely cold fruit drink - a nice start. Staff were really friendly and helpful inspite of it being a full house on Pro Bowl weekend. We booked a POV room, however on check in I followed the advice of other "Tripadvisors" and asked for a room away from the elevators (quiet). We were upgraded to an ocean front suite on the 14th floor Hula Tower - nice! Suite lives up to my expectations from an Embassy Suite - great bed, nice linens, 2 flat screen TV's.Inspite of it being a full house, managers reception and breakfast was well run. Staff were buzzing around doing their jobs well and with smiles. I must say they have a good customer service program from the housekeeping staff, valet, and serving staff - well done!Pool area is on the 4th floor - nice loungers. The area gets sun from about 10:30am. The palm trees offered some filtered shade as a reprieve from the hot sun.We have stayed in at least 10 different hotels in Waikiki over the years and if you can afford it, treat yourself to the Embassy Suites.Location is at the west end of Waikiki, 1 block from the beach and foot steps to too many good restaurants to mention. Also nice vacinity to Fort Derussy park for a nice walk in the morning. A good route is along the boardwalk down to the HHV and back through the park.Booked through a travel agent who was able to get a better than posted rate. Much better than any online rate I could find.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I completed a stay at The Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach Walk 19 January 2012. I was extremely disappointed with the treatment I received from a member of the front desk staff by the name of Ms. Malia (first name). I arrived at the property 16 January at approximately 1:20pm. I checked in with Malia at the front desk. She advised me my room was not ready.I asked her what type of room did they have for me. Malia advised it was a city view room. I asked if they had an HHonors Gold upgrade to ocean view available. Malia advised they were selling out the last three weeks and no upgrade was available. I asked could I buy an upgrade to ocean view. She advised they had ocean view available for $70/night. I opted not to buy the upgrade because I should receive it complementary, per my HHonors Gold benefits. So, I waited for my room to be ready for occupancy. Malia provided my room key at 3:07pm. Check-in is at 3:00pm. I went to the room on the 14th floor of the Hula Tower only to find a housekeeper's cart blocking the door and the sound of a vacuum coming from the room. I turned, walked back to the lobby and advised Malia that the room was not available because housekeeping was not finished. Malia called the housekeeping staff and advised me to go back to the room because it was ready. By now, it is 3:20pm. I advised Malia to find me a room that was available for occupancy because I just left the 14th floor and know for sure it is not ready. Malia sarcastically asked me if I wanted to speak to the housekeeping staff. I advised her that it is not my job to speak to housekeeping and I need her to find me a room ready for occupancy. At this point, she consulted the manager. He called housekeeping and they advised the room was not ready. Then, he provided me with an ocean view room that was available for occupancy. I have several problems with the above scenario. Within the same conversation, Malia told me no upgrades available but was willing to sell me one for an extra $70/day. The room not ready for occupancy was not available until after the 3:00pm check-in time. The room provided by the manager was also after the 3:00pm check-in time. In addition, I waited 1.5 hours for my room to be ready and they had the upgrade available but refused to honor my HHonors Gold benefit upon check-in.Malia challenged my first hand knowledge that the room was not available by telling me to turn around and go back to a room not ready for occupancy. To add insult to injury,she sarcastically asked if I wanted to speak to housekeeping which is clearly not my job and inappropriate. This incident affected my entire stay at The Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach Walk. I was flabergasted regarding the lack of customer service notwithstanding that I have Gold status with Hilton. The suite had a tv in each room. One remote control was missing. I called the front desk and they had maintenance to deliver a remote within a reasonable time span. In addition, the housekeeping staff knocked on my door twice disregarding the do not disburb sign. Plus, they called me. The second time they knocked on my door was after the phone call where I advised them that I did not want service that day (17 January). The hotel is in a prominent location. The rooms were spacious and well appointed. However, I will select one of Hilton's numerous competitors for my next visit to Honolulu.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is a top-notch Embassy Suites! It really knows how to do the free breakfast with a myriad of fantastic food choices and it manages the crowds extremely well. (If you have kids, always stay in a hotel that offers free breakfast. It saves you time in the morning and money in the long run.) We really enjoyed all the details placed in the service at this hotel, from the tropical glass of juice welcoming us at check in, to the colorful cards placed on our beds every night giving us cultural information on Hawaii -- great for kids to collect and take home. The staff was always willing to accommodate us in every way. We weren't crazy about the pillows, so when we asked if they had any other pillows they gave us three different options! The manager's reception is a great way to relax and get a free snack and drink if you have been out all day sight-seeing. They had great musicians playing during this time. The pool is right there so kids can get an evening swim while the music plays. The hotel couldn't be more centrally located - a block from the beach and close to many inexpensive restaurants and shopping. You can't get a better value, especially for a family. It's nice to have the suite and the two TVs - it gives family members a bit of breathing space, especially when you're tired at the end of the day. The microwave, and refrigerator are handy too.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The staff was always friendly and we had a great time there during our 9 days....Before we arrived my husband had asked not to be on the 4th floor or by an elevator... as suggested by other reviews.. So when we got into our room, it was by an elevator so we requested to be moved. Did not have a problem as there was another room available.. The breakfast every morning was great. You could have anything from A-Z. Manager's reception was also was good and we had entertainment plus snacks.. Was nice not to have to go somewhere else for breakfast and to relax by the pool in the evenings. The hotel is located within walking distance to the beach and many restaurants/shops.... We rented a car and took it out several times. I would recommend not renting a car for your stay since you pay $30 extra to park and if you only go out a few times, it is worth it just to rent as you go... There are trolleys and lots of buses there to get around. The Concierge desk there was very helpful with our stay there. The only complaint I have is that when we checked out at 5:15 am, the young man who brought our rental did not even bother to help us load our luggage. The only thing he did was stick his hand out for a tip . When we arrived we got lots of help and every time we took our car out, my husband gave a tip.My husband has been a loyal Hilton customer for 24 years and this was one of the reasons why we stayed there since we were celebrating our Birthdays and 40th Anniversary......I hope that our next stay will end on a better note...

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This Hotel stay was a pleaseant surprise for my wife and myself. Being in Waikiki for 6 weeks it really was helpful to start everyday with Breakfast downstairs, from fresh fruit to an omlette bar and most any thing else you could want. This Hotel is located at the perfect spot to go any direction you want in Waikiki , not to mention being across the street from the Beach....

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We traveled to Oahu with three children, and chose the Embassy Suites because of the suite set-up and the included breakfast buffet. It also came highly recommended by a friend of ours, who traveled to Oahu with her two children several months ago.The hotel did not disappoint in any way. First of all, the check in was a wonderful way to start our Hawaiian vacation. We were given an exuberant aloha and alcohol free mixed drinks. The room itself was very clean, and it was cleaned thoroughly for almost every day of our stay. We did skip the cleaning one day when the maid service was so late in coming that we couldn't put off our children's naps any longer. The next day the maid service came much earlier, and did for the rest of the stay.The morning breakfast buffet is incredible. The omelet station offers almost any combination of ingredients a person can desire, including Lomi Salmon. NOTE: Lomi salmon is not the salmon preparation mainlanders are used to. It tastes VERY different, and the chefs will let you try a small sample before you have it used in an omelet. Do take them up on this if you have never tried it before.There was one small moment of crisis during our last breakfast morning when the Passion Orange Guava juice ran out. There were definitely riot conditions present, but the hotel handled the situation quickly and professionally, dispatching someone to put the machine to rights before anyone started to suffer juice withdrawals. It was impressive.The Manager's Reception was a lot of fun for both adults and children. Our younger kids were able to swim and completely tire out before bedtime, while my husband and I could enjoy ourselves with the complimentary drinks. The live band was fun to listen to, playing a Hawaiian take on various popular songs. The highlight was definitely the Hawaiian version of Cee-Lo's Forget You. The hotel is perfectly situated, close to the beach and right off Kalakaua. It really is right in the heart of everything.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The staff are very friendly. Garrick the manager is nice and helpful. It's not a beach front property but the beach is just across the street.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was our second visit to Embassy Suites Waikiki and it did not disappoint. The hotel is located towards the airport end of Waikiki beach but only a short walk to the beach and many fantastic restaurants ans shopping. The rooms are great because they are all suites and you have a bedroom (two queens in our case) and a pull out sofa in the lounge. Two TV's - great when you have kids. Our family of five had plenty of room and we could not fault the hotel. We had been given rooms close to the lifts on both of our stays and were not impacted by ringing lift bells. We had tossed up the idea of an ocean view room but you don't spend enough time in your room to justify the extra. The amenities are great - pool are is fantastic although it's only 4ft deep but great with the kids and the pool side bay is fantastic. And you cant beat the free breakfast and evening managers reception with free nibbles and cocktails!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We just finished a superb week at the Embassy Suites. Our family of 5 (3 children 10/8/6) fitted easily into a 1 bedroom suite with 2 queen beds and a pull out sofa. We paid extra for a partial ocean view and were rewarded with a stunning corner room in the Hula Tower.Everything about our stay was outstanding, from the excellent staff to the amenities and fanbtastic breakfast. We never had a wait for the breakfast buffet and the food was great.After reading all the previous reviews we had some concerns, but we have since realised that some people must just like to whinge and whine.We will definitely be back.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We were very unhappy to arrive in our room late one night and found a huge amount of noise from the elevators. We immediately asked for a room change and were refused (despite HHonors gold status). We eventually talked to quite a few people at the desk (and the manager) and learned that "95%" of the king rooms share walls with the elevators. I finally gave up on sleep at 4AM with all the clunking of the elevator going up and the shaft, the chimes are at least turned off between 11PM and 7AM. So, do not expect a quiet king bedroom. The queen sized room we were moved to faced the Trump tower and we had near constant beeping from their garage (warning pedestrians of cars). For the heart of Waikiki, this isn't awful on the noise front, but it is certainly not quiet.Our experience with staff was that everyone was fantastic, except for the front desk. The desk staff did not seem to feel it necessary to apologize for mistake after mistake (which included having the wrong check out date, us catching it and even double checking with them on the day in question, only to find ourselves locked out that evening). Valets were quick and helpful, bell hops wanted to help every way possible, breakfast staff great, and housekeeping wonderful.There are two towers with approximately 11 suites per floor in each. Elevators require key cards to operate, which is good for security but problematic for efficiency as people hold doors on floors while they look for their keys or when the elevator ends up going the opposite direction the people wanted because they didn't find their key card in time. Aloha tower has two elevators which are small and horribly slow. 5-10 minute waits from the 12th floor were not uncommon. Hula tower has slightly larger elevators (which means fewer delays for people rearranging to fit in) and three elevators for guest use. So, if you have a choice, go for the Hula tower.Rooms were sparkling clean and housekeeping staff really wonderfully friendlyThe breakfast was interesting, the Hawaiian take on the standard Embassy Suite experience. This included some nice additions like being open 3.5 hours instead of the typical 3. Seating is outdoors, so if you have a bird phobia, plan on carrying your tray back to your room. Also, in case of rain, the more limited under cover seating will lead to crowding, however, on most days there was an abundance of seating choice (unlike most Embassy Suites). There is a huge Japanese clientele and so breakfast has a few alterations for them: omlette choices are self serve to select toppings (reduces language issues), miso soup and a salad bar are offered, and you should expect to be joined at your table often despite many wholly unoccupied tables being available. I was not surprised to find rice at a Hawaiian breakfast, however I was surprised that island fruits were rarely on offer during our 10 day stay. Also missing are any whole grain options (muffins, bread, etc.) so a grocery run may be in order if you are attached to any of those items. With a microwave and fridge in the suite, there is flexibility on storing and preparing one's own food. The manager's reception had amazing selection on alcoholic beverages (mai tais, blue hawaiis, red and white sangria, etc) but pathetic options on food (tortillas without salsa and goldfish crackers were the typical offerings. Sometimes pretzels or peanuts were added to those constants. Nothing fresh.).  The hotel is a block to the water, so to get to the beach you need to go through the Outrigger hotel across the street, or along one of the public access walkways to either side of the Outrigger. There is very little sand left in front of the Outrigger, and it gets used for tourist sail boat landings, so it's not a great place to set up for a day on the beach. Fort DeRussy is next door which does have a long wide expanse of sand, however, it is treated as a city park, so there are quite a few homeless people for those to whom such things make a difference. A longer walk takes you to the Hilton Hawaiian Village where there are all the services (bar, restaurants, beach rentals, etc.) that people may expect from a Waikiki vacation.Do check for parades-- this corner of Waikiki will get totally blocked in by parades, and for the long ones, like the Honolulu Festival in early March, you may not be able to get in or get out for many hours.There is wi-fi only in public spaces, so be sure to bring an ethernet compatible device if you want in room internet. Also, there is only one connection per room unless you bring your own splitter (we found one at WalMart on Keeamouku street for $25). Beach towels are something else you may want to purchase yourself-- the hotel provided ones are tiny and they only give one per person. Also tiny are the balconies-- ours was under 2 feet by 8 feet. There was no way to use it for sitting outside. Other rooms had more reasonably proportioned balconies; ask if this is important to you.But, the location puts it in easy walking distance of the Friday fireworks at the Hilton Hawaiian Village, restaurants are plentiful at the doorstep, the pool is wonderfully warm (unusual in Honolulu in my experience) and the staff (other than front desk) is fantastic. Having a two room suite is really nice to those who like a little more elbow room

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Despite having booked 2+ months in advance requesting a high floor away from the elevator I received a room directly in front of the elevator whose chimes penetrated the thin walls. The agent claimed he could not accommodate my upgrade request "because almost every guest had Hilton Honors Gold or above" like me. Highly doubtful, especially for the 30-40% Asian guests.I was offered an equally inferior room on a lower floor overlooking noisy Lewers St.Lessons: don't expect reps from this property to honor frequent guest status, or tell you the truth. I refuse to believe at 6pm they could not offer a better Hula Tower room; Aloha Tower has inferior views. Good status won't get you a quality room unless occupancy rates are quite low which apparently does not happen for this property. Also Ipad users no wi-fi in room.All told not the kind of Aloha experience I've had when the hotel was newly on the market.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Pros -SO close to everything - awesome location even though it is not on the beachmanager's happy hour with potent and delicious mai tais and live entertainmentexcellent hotel staffamazing free breakfastsOnly 1 con (and we knew this going in)TONS of kids crazy and rowdy in the pool. We don't have kids, so we just went down to the beach. No big deal, but just wanted you to know if you want quiet and relaxing days by the pool, this is not the place for you.WE LOVED our 9 night stay at the Embassy Suites. We highly recomment it to anyone visiting Waikiki.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was my 1st time at this hotel and the 2nd for my wife. Manager, Rob Yeoman, was extremely helpful as was all the service staff including concierge.The rooms were spacious, well appointed and meticulously cleaned and maintained. Service was terrific–anytime we need any help in the room, someone was immediately there. The rooms are quiet and some excellent views, particularly the Southwest corner facing rooms. Breakfasts were plentiful the location right up from the beach and alongside the new Beach Walk could not be better. the managers cocktail party every night was a welcome respite from busy days to put your feet up, hear some music and have some free nibbles and drinks. An excellent value at Christmas time.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I travel a lot and have completed many surveys, this is my first ever 5/5 rating. I especially appreciated all hotel staff - registration, valet parking, breakfast staff, bell captain and staff, bartender, and housekeeping. All were friendly, efficient, effective, and helpful. If you want acitivty this is the place. Short walk to beach, lots of great shops and restaurants. Beautiful area day and night.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at the Embassy Suites Waikiki in March of 2011. For the 9 days that we were there on the second last night of our stay we had the tsunami the stuff there managed its perfectly i did not feel unsafe for one minute they made it clear what there plans were going to be and they regularly updating there guests. I am planning another trip this coming September and I look forward to staying here again at the Embassy Suites. The location is great, the staff is lovely and the hotel is always kept presentable. I loved my experience there. Its always a bonus when there is a happy hour each night and the buffet breakfast of a morning time. Thank you.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Very nice property, enjoyed our stay. The cold juice at checkin was a very pleasant way to start a great stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Having loved this hotel when we stayed last January it was our first choice when returning to Waikiki for our December/January stay this year. We were not disappointed - if anything we found this a better hotel this time around. The true heart of this Embassy lies with it's people. Every staff member we met offered warm, outstanding service from check in to check out. However we must make special note of Johnny and Keoni on the bell desk as well as Dennis at the Pakini Bar. These guys truly offered outstanding customer service - going that extra mile to assist with any queries. If Hilton runs an "employee of the month" program, these guys deserve to win.Our first six nights were spent in a two bedroom suite as for this period we had another friend travelling with us as well as our fourteen year old son. The suite was spacious and wonderfully clean. The king size bed was more comfortable than that at home! Our only gripe was that as it faced out onto Lewers Street and the night clubs next to PF Changs the Friday night was exceptionally noisy. However, this only bothered us on the one occasion. The two bedroom suite was actionally a one bedroom with a connecting door leading through into another bedroom/bathroom. This was ideal as it meant at night we could close a door from both sides and have our own privacy.Our second five nights were spent in a one bedroom suite. All I can say is Room 1209 was the perfect room. We looked out over the pool area with a fantastic ocean view and the room was wonderfully quiet and dark. The housekeeping staff at Embassy do a great job - everything was spotless and their daily services were timed to minimise disruption.The daily breakfast always provided plenty of variety , from fresh fruit, ceral and yoghurt to scrambled eggs, bacon, waffles, pancakes and made to order omelettes. Having the cooked breakfast was a great start to every morning and meant we never had to eat again until early evening. The evening Managers reception also provided great value with free cocktails, beer and wine. However, we did find that, although the band provided excellent entertainment, after being there for more than a few days the repetition of the same sets night after night did become tiring.Once again the proximity of this Embassy to the beach, the extras provided (breakfast, Managers reception), excellent pool and spa area and most importantly wonderful customer service makes this hotel excellent value. Best tip is to join Hilton Awards and sign up for the MVP program. Dependent on travelling dates the MVP discounts offer great rates for this hotel - we saved approx. $150 a night. using this rate.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at the Embassy Suites Waikiki in Dec/Jan 2011 and were so impressed we booked again this year.We had a great partial ocean view from our room in Hula Tower 1923). From the time of booking, to reconfirmation, speedy check in, staff hospitality, spacious suite, great breakfast included, Manager's reception( great way to start the evening) and location. Embassy Suites provides it all at a reasonable price. We are a family of 4 ( 2 adults & 2 chn 14/24) and love the location ( 5 min walk to beach), shop and resturants below ( Yardhouse - sensational food / Cheeseburger/Gyu-Kaku - favourites). The guys at the Bell Desk booked us in for a shuttle to Waikele Premium Outlets for $15 return each, much cheaper than a taxi. Foodland at Ala Moana is a great supermarket for in room dining deli choices salads/salmon/meats etc ABC stores close by as well..Highly recommended Hotel!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Embassy Suites has always been a great hotel brand for families due to the separate bedroom, pull out couch, and full breakfast buffet included with every room/stay. Over the past couple years, these properties have been getting rather old and tired. We booked this Embassy for the location, family advantages mentioned above, and because I stay at Hilton brand properties throughout the year for work (HHonors Points). We were pleasantly surprised to find this is one of the rare NEW Embassy properties with excellent amenities. Pool, buffet, Managers Reception with entertainment, beds, bathroom, location, and views are all outstanding. Mini fridge, sink and microwave are your kitchenette items. The only things to be careful of is the concierge desk and parking. The concierge is run by "Expedia" so all of your general questions are opportunities to sell you an "excusion" or tour. Parking is $30 per day, but then you need to remember they want a $5 tip each time they retrieve and park your car. One trip per day is now $40. If your just planning on remaining within the Waikiki area with a couple of excursions, most of them will pick up/drop off at your hotel for an extra $20 pp. Nevertheless, we loved this hotel for our family of four, and if we return to Waikiki, we'll definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We really enjoyed our five-day stay at the Embassy Suites. It is close to the beach, in an area that is not overrun with tourists -- but which is close to everything. The room was big, as are all Embassy Suites rooms, with a large bathroom, microwave, and refrigerator. The service is what makes this hotel stand out. The personnel at the Bell Stand were so helpful and friendly that we wrote a letter of commendation to the manager. As in all Embassy Suites, the free breakfast is excellent, and the Manager's Reception each evening is fun. It is always nice to have free drinks. This hotel even has a free show with the reception -- almost like a luau. This has to be one of the best hotels in Honolulu. Highly recommended!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We just returned home after a really great family trip with our 5 and 1 year old boys. Over all things were great we did stay over new years. Both kids enjoyed breakfast and we all ate wel despite the crowds. Tony from the wait staff was awesome with my son. He got him pancakes special when they were not being offered and sent him away from breakfast with a goldfish snack. Hr certainly went above and beyond. Thank you! That being said, we did and hve a tough time on new years eve. I know that the hotel can not control the noise from other properties but the staff was not helpful and offered no assistance when our windows were vibrating from the trump tower music. Not only that but we got a phone call at 2am telling us there was an emergency to evacuate the building. Again, mistakes happen but not one staff member apologized for the sleepless night. If we nt back I would not stay in room 201. Way noisy. We listed to the elevators each night.All in all we had a great trip and will most likely be back. I will request a better room location though and perhaps a larger space....

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My family of 6 stayed at the Embassy Suites Waikiki for 2 weeks during Dec-Jan. We were so impressed with the spacious layout of the 1 bedroom suite in the Aloha Tower. We had a partial ocean view room on the very top floor. However, this was an added bonus to the overall hotel. The Embassy Suites catered really well for my young family. The free buffet breakfast was a real standout every morning. Especially the friendly and efficient staff. Yes, other people have complained about the queues out the door and not having enough seating. However, you do have to understand that this is peak season and maybe waking up a little bit earlier might help also! We are a family of 6 and everywhere we go is always a struggle for us to sit. So we make sure we are a bit more organized in getting to certain places. Overall, we loved the food on offer...well most of it and we just appreciated having this free breakfast every morning!The location of the hotel was excellent. It wasn't in the centre of all the action, but very close by. It was just enough to not be caught up in the madness of Waikiki, but very accessible to get to the shops, restaurants, bus etc... The beach is around the corner and there is a pool on location which catered well for both young and old. The 'Manager's Reception' during the evening was fantastic. If you love a free cocktail drink or two this would suit you well. Or if you just like free entertainment and snacks on offer like we did, this too would impress you! The band was really entertaining and played really good music to suit all tastes. A real plus for them!!Our overall stay at Embassy Suites was fantastic! We loved Hawaii and staying here made it more so relaxing and enjoyable. It may not have the full amenities of a 4/5 star hotel which others have complained about. But it does cater well for large families, couples and those that want a spacious, clean and upmarket suite in Waikiki, without having to book a private condo or multiple rooms elsewhere. We would definitely stay here again!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Embassy Suites Waikiki breakfast was wonderful and we loved the evening manager's reception! Each night we attended they had local entertainment along with cocktails and light snacks. Suites were more 'compact' than other Embassy properties I've stayed at but the beds were very comfortable and we had a nice view of the pool and a bit of the ocean. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Great location close to the beach! Just walk across the road and you are on the sand! We would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We have just returned from a 2 week stay at the Embassy Suites. The hotel is in a good location being only a block away from the beach. Not far to walk if you have little ones. We stayed in a 1 bedroom suite in the Aloha tower. The first night we were in the other tower (forgot the name) and the rooms were a lot smaller. Don't stay in the rooms close to the pool/breakfast area these would be extremely noisy as breakfast starts early and privacy would be an issue. Very disappointed with the free breakfast, limited choice and huge lines each morning. Total chaos and not enough tables. We ended up giving it a miss after a few days and ate else where. I really don't like to criticise but the staff were not at all helpful and looked as though they were there against their will the whole time. The only helpful person was Tony in the carparking area, he was a delight. I know it was xmas and the hotel was full but people have come a long way and paid a lot of money to be on holiday they don't need an attitude when they arrive! Probably would not stay at this hotel again. Too many other choices in Waikiki.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We chose this property so we could have a separate bedroom for our kids. The staff were uniformly helpful and polite. The property lacks the panache and amenities of other hotels nearby such as the Sheraton, but has good location on the Waikiki Beach Walk. Our rate included free breakfast buffet, but we were turned off by the horde of people trying to funnel through the cafeteria style line and the hand sanitizing stations at the doorway. We walked one block to the Sheraton and had a great (but expensive) buffet on a terrace overlooking the ocean. Overall, the hotel had a decidedly utilitarian feel to it. but suited our needs fine.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I was very impressed with the stay at this hotel. This staff was exceptional and made sure all of our needs were met.The only downside, was that you had to pay $35 a day for valet if you had a car. When using Hilon honors reward points for your stay you should not have to pay for parking. Overall I felt the staff was terrific and would stay there again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is a very nice hotel a block off the beach in Waikiki. We were staying at a resort elsewhere on the island of Oahu and wanted to spend a couple of days in Waikiki without the commute. This hotel was perfect for my family (4 ppl). We were able to walk around town and stop in to the hotel to rest or get things we needed without going out of our way. The pool area was very nice, and the managers reception offered more choices of drinks than a typical Embassy Suites. We also enjoyed the free complimentary cooked to order breakfast, but if you stay there, get to breakfast early to avoid the lines.Would stay here again for sure. Only down side is the $30 parking fee per night, and no discount for HHonors members which is a bit dissappointing

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is the only full service suite hotel n the heart of Waikiki. We stayed from Dec 14-17 before our cruise with the Pride of America. Bedroom and living room were spacious for a family of 4. The pictures made it look bigger though. Breakfast included is a big plus and worth the money especially if you are a family since breakfast is for everyone in the room. Made to order omelettes were a treat and lineup was not bad at all since the cook had 3 pans going at the same time. Very varied selection of breads, yoghourt, fruit, sausage, bacon, potatoes. Beverage station had coffee,tea, milk, juices. It's not right on the beach but just a 3 minute walk. This was a perfect spot to watch the fireworks Friday night provided by the Hilton Hawaiian Village. It starts at 7:45pm and last for 3 minutes so don't be late. Very convenient location with an ABC store and Denny's. especially when we arrived on a late flight at 11:00pm with nothing else open. Denny's was right there and most likely one of the more economical restaurants. Also 3 minute walk to the Waikiki Trolley pink line which will take you to the Ala Moana Mall ($2.00 each way). This location is on the more quiet site of Waikiki but still convenient and close to KalaKaua Avenue which is the main drag. Very friendly and helpful porters, giving us lots of information about tours, transportations etc. Only complaint was there was no wifi in the room and even in the public areas, it was weak.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our family of five had reserved a 2 room suite for our four day stay in Waikiki. The rooms were fine but plain. The cocktail reception was so disappointing with low end alcohol, long lines and screaming babies. Unfortunately, it got worse at breakfast. It was chaos. The food was awful and the lines, aggressive birds and huge crowd actually made my daughter ill. On a positive note, the staff was friendly and helpful. We moved to a different hotel on our second day and we were so much happier.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel looks fancy and his many amenities but it is still is down to earth and fun with excellent service! We brought kids and loved it just like the adults did. It was a small walk to the beach and shopping was every where to be found! The morning buffet is excellent and was a great way to start the day! The room we had didn't have much of a view but we weren't in the room enough to care about that - it was clean and housekeeping staff was very helpful.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We always book Embassy Suites when we know we are going to be jet-lagged because the extra room means you've got somewhere to go if you can't sleep in the middle if the night.Our room wasn't brilliant, we were close to the street so it was quite noisy but that's Waikiki for you. We had to keep the windows and doors closed because of the noise.We had an accessible bathroom - appreciate that the hotel offers them for those who need it. We didn't need it and would have preferred a room with a bath rather than one with a wet floor when we took a shower. We were only staying one night so it didn't matter enough to try to switch.Pleasantly surprised that we could order decent cocktails for free at the Manager's Reception. Don't usually go to those so not sure if it's typical but we thought it was great.  Also love the included breakfast.The pool area was nice and big and there was a hot tub so that was all good.Location is very central so lots of places to eat and shop but noisy if your room is near the street.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Unless you are a person who needs to be right on the beach, this hotel is a spectacular value, and the location can't be beat. You are steps away from the beach and shopping, there is a fabulous restaurant (Roy's) on-site, the rooms are immaculate, and the staff is very gracious. The breakfast buffet is a genuine spread (not just coffee, cereal and muffins) and who can complain about free cocktails in the afternoon ;) I have stayed here twice, and I like that you are close enough to all the action, but not completely immersed in the madness of Waikiki.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I read a lot of reviews before making my reservations. My wife and I stayed in this hotel for 5 nights in December 2011. The service was excellent from check-in to check-out. The reception, bellstaff, valet and others were outstanding. We had a room in the Hula Tower on the 21st floor with a beautiful view of the ocean. The location for shopping and sightseeing was outstanding. The outstanding breakfast every morning just topped things off.This is the place to stay!!!! Thanks Embassy Suites for making our Oahu visit just perfect.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
