review_body: Checked in after Thanksgiving. I'm here till after Christmas. Even though I'm slumming it on the corporate rate, they treated me very well. I'm a Hilton Honors Diamond member, and they offered me the best room they could in the Aloha Tower the day after I checked in. I later asked if I could move to the Hula Tower to get a view to the west, and they again went out of their way to offer me a great corner room just high enough to see water and view the Friday night fireworks from the Hilton Hawaiian Village. I'm very happy. Corner suite with two balconies and two view choices (south and west).The manager's reception is great too. Plenty of music, and great drinks all on the house. The bartenders make a strong mai tai, and the snacks are just as expected. You're not going to make a meal there, but it'll keep you going long enough to enjoy your drinks. There's always the YARD HOUSE for a great diner, on the ground floor, Diamond Head side of the Hula Tower. Try the Chicken Enchilada Stack. You will not be disappointed.Fantastic people. Helpful, friendly folks at the front desk. The valet doesn't make you wait for your car. Heck, the only thing that'd make this the perfect hotel is if they added BBC America and the Vs Channel to the cable TV line-up so I could watch TOP GEAR and NHL Hockey.Great place. I'm enjoying the heck out of this stay.Eric from Eagle River, AK

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is a great location! You are not right on the ocean but you just have to walk across the street. We have stayed here twice and may do a third trip in 2012. We have not stayed here for long periods. We like to stay in Waikiki for only a couple days at a time since we prefer less crowded areas and this area of town is VERY crowded. It is a fun change though. The pool is small but it never gets too crowded and has a nice child pool area within the large pool. You get tickets for free drinks at the managers reception in the evening. One evening each week there is a hula show and it is great (and free)! My daughter LOVES it. Throw in the free drinks and you have a lot of happy people. There is also a great free breakfast each morning. Clean, updated rooms, nice free perks, great location! I am sure we will be back again!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is the nicest ES we have stayed. The rooms were comfortable and clean, the breakfasts were fab, and no one could accuse them of watering down the drinks at happy hour. Next time we are in Waikiki, this is where we will stay, hands down.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: On November 22, 2011, my husband and I and two friends stayed at the Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach Walk. We chose the hotel because of the terrific service and rooms we had at the Dallas Embassy Suites. Since I was the one responsible for choosing the hotel for our friends and us, I was hesitant, but what a terrific stay. Starting from the open air check-in process (with pineapple juice, no less) to the made-to-order breakfast and manager's reception, we couldn't have asked for a better hotel. The staff was super friendly, and our room was always clean. We stayed in Room 1111, which was next to the elevators. There was some noise from the elevators, but nothing that was over the top. I loved the extra large balcony with views of the ocean, downtown Waikiki, and the moutain ranges. I like the thought that I can visit any Embassy Suites and can expect the same service just from the fact that I have now visited two hotels of the same brand and received great service. Thanks for a wonderful stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I stayed in a two-bedroom, two-bath suite on vacation with friends. The hotel has great ocean views (it's one block from the beach), two balconies from which to view paradise and great breakfast buffet. In addition to the typical Embassy Suite breakfast buffet and omelet bar, this hotel's buffet included miso soup and the best fresh pineapple on earth. The happy hour featured tasty, free mai tais.The suite was clean, well-maintained and attractively decorated. The hotel is located in the heart of the Waikiki tourist area, with lots of shops, restaurants and other hotels nearby, as well as a big international market with reasonably prices souvenirs and clothes. The staff was friendly, informative and very responsive to our needs.I would DEFINITELY stay at Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach Walk again!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I almost don't want to share this review with everyone, because it's already beginning to become difficult to get a room! Our time at the Embaassy Suites Waikiki Beach Walk was amazing.From the valet, to the pool attendants . . . the front desk staff . . . everyone was wonderful.When we checked in the valet took care of everything and directed us to the front desk, where we all (kids included) were given a special Hawaiian drink, and the check-in process was a breeze.We checked in late, but were able to get there before the traditional Embassy Suites evening reception (snacks and drinks) outside by the pool. It was better than any other Embassy Suites I've been too . . . same food and drinks served, but the atmosphere, the music, and the tropical air made it even more memorable.Adding to the fun, was that on Friday nights, the Hilton Resort has a fireworks show. They can be viewed from the ocean side of the roof by the pool area. Very fun bonus for the kids.They also had a Hawaiian band playing each night, with a group of wonderful adult and child dancers who did hula.Then of course there is the always wonderful Embassy breakfast buffet . . . . This Embassy Suites had it down. Food was great, plates cleared from tables quickly, and just being able to eat breakfast outside and enjoy the fresh Hawaiian pinapple, mango, and guava . . . it was close to heaven.The pool was huge and in excellent condition. The pool had depths for all ages, and pool-side eats and beverages available. On top of all of this, for a family of five, the suite size was generous as always, with enough beds for everyone. Beds were confortable and even with the Waikiki location, the night was quite.If there had to be a downside to this Embassy Suites, it would be the location. It is not "on the beach" . . . it is across the street from the beach, with another hotel blocking it's view of the beach. It has no private beach access or shore front. It isn't too far from a public access point, and it isn't difficult to make your way between the hotels that are beach front to find a spot, but if you are only going to Waikiki for the beach, there would probably be better hotels for you. I think the Embassy Suites does rent beach equipment/chairs, etc . . . but we opted to just bring our beach towels down. All-in-all, it is probably the best hotel deal in Waikiki, or in all of Oahu . . .

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I recently travelled in October and stayed at the Embassy Suites. I had researched this hotel on Trip Advisor and originally was booked to stay at the Hilton Hawaiian village. Am so glad we chose the Embassy Suites. From our very early arrival we were looked after well. We were given breakfast and full use of the hotel facilities while waiting for our room to be ready. The staff go out of their way to smile and say aloha!. We had a one bedroom apartment on the tenth floor of the Hula tower and were thrilled. There was little street noise and we had a view of the ocean from our balcony. The suites are immaculate and the beds and bed linen are to die for. In fact it was probably the most comfortable bed I have slept in.The beach is only across the road so a very convenient location and ABC stores are abundant within easy walking distance. Breakfast was excellent. All you can eat and we were encouraged to take fruit and yoghurt for later on in the day. The chefs made conversation with you and cooked your breakfast how ever you liked. The evening manager's special...welll what can one say!! Free open bar....yep free cocktails kept me amused!! They also provided dips and chips and nibbles. The entertainment was fantastic. i travelled with my Mum and my two boys aged 12 and 14. This was the perfect place for us to stay. The boys spent hours in the pool, which is larger than it appears in the photos. The spa and pool were both extremely clean. The lanai area was perfect for evening cocktails and watching the sunset while the kids swam in the pool. The hotel also has a business centre with free internet and printing facilities...clean, well maintained and fast internet.Overall if you choose to stay here you will not be disappointed. Enjoy!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My husband and I stayed at Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach Walk for five nights. We were in Oahu for a wedding. We had a fantastic corner room on the 19th floor with beautiful ocean views and two balconies! The breakfast buffet was exactly as you'd expect from an Embassy Suites property. Fantastic front desk staff and friendly, helpful breakfast staff each morning! Very close and easy to walk to the beach. The pool seemed nice but we never had the opportunity to spend any time there. Roy's restaurant is on the ground floor of this property.We'll definitely return to Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach Walk.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My wife, three children and I stayed here on our last night in Hawaii before returning to NZ. Although we were only there for 2 days, we were blown away by the amazingly generous staff. Our flight home was at 11:30pm but we had to check out around lunch time that day. The bellboy, Johnny was a tremendous help. He stored our luggage for us and told us of things we could do to fill in the time. He told us that if we were back by a certain time he would also take us up to the restaurant and we could watch the fireworks too. By the time we came to leave for the airport, he had gotten each of our kids a packet of M&M's and wished us safe travels. Because of Johnny our last day was made truly memorable and we will definitely be back soon. Our rooms were extremely comfortable and spacious. Quite and relaxing too. Location is very convenient - walking distance to the beach and a mall. Good food but we were also able to walk to other places to eat. Overall even though it was a short stay, we would without a doubt stay there again :)

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The hotel was great, but the daily happy hour left a lot to be desired...chips and salsa for appetizers! Wow, after spending $5500 for 1 week, I found the daily happy hour to be less then appetizing! Drinks were ok, but actually no to little food during happy hour. That hotel can do better then that and in fact several guests commented that the hotel used to have a great spread during happy hour. I have stayed at many Embassy Suites in the United States and have found the happy hour to be wuite good, what a disappointment! The hotel is conveniently located near shopping and restaurants and very quite at night. I was there to attend a wedding, (not at that hotel) otherwise I would not have gone to Hawaii. I don't think I will stay there in the future as there are other hotels that are less expensive in the same area that are just as good.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My husband, son and I checked into Embassy Suites Waikiki on November 1 and stayed until November 6 for a family vacation. We arrived at 7:30PM. Upon arriving to the hotel by taxi from the airport, we noticed that the check in process was done outdoors. What a great way to greet guests. My husband and I were treated to a small glass of juice, I think it was pineapple and grapefruit. Delicious! The check in staff person was cheerful. We felt very welcomed. Our room was on the 18th floor facing Diamond Head. The room was very clean. The bedroom had two double beds along with a pullout couch in the living room. The cleaning staff was friendly and efficient. We enjoyed our two balconies, one in the living room and one in the bedroom. The only downside was road noise while the doors were open. When the doors were closed, only a slight bit of road noise could be noticed, but nothing that would keep us up at night. Breakfast was what we come to expect from any Embassy Suites we have visited-excellent! There was cook to order eggs, plenty of fruit (lots of pineapple), sausage, rice, miso soup, salad, etc. No complaints here. The hotel is within walking distance of the beach, maybe a block or so away. There are several restaurants located around the hotel along with plenty of shopping. We used the trolley and bus systems to get around Waikiki and other locations around the island. A great way to see the island without renting a car.  Speaking of renting a car, we did rent a car for a day from the Dollar Car Rental a mile from the hotel. The Embassy Suites conceirge warned us upon arrival that if we rent a car, do not leave any belongings in the car. We unfortunately did not heed that warning. BEWARE... if you rent a car and stop along Highway 72 for sightseeing, rethink that decision or if you do, do not leave ANYTHING in plain or limited sight. Take it with you when you exit your car. Our car was broken into and items were taken from the car within the five minutes we were 200 feet away from the car. From talking to the police and locals, smash and grabs from cars along this route is routine. Short of that unpleasant experience, we would definitely stay at this hotel again. The staff is excellent, the hotel is beautiful and the location is great for getting around Waikiki.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We booked here for 4 nights using Hilton Points. This was a great use of points. I contacted the hotel ahead of time with a couple of requests and they were honored. We were given a corner room in the Hula Tower on the 5th floor. We loved this location. We had 2 balconies, a view of the ocean and one floor down to the pool, hot tub, breakfast area and happy hour area.We arrived on a Monday around 3pm Checked right in. The beach is just across the street. We enjoyed the location. It is an easy walk down toward the zoo or toward the Hilton Hawaiian Villiage in the other direction. We enjoyed the free happy hour from 5:30-7:30. Bartenders were very friendly. Snacks were mostly just salty munchies. On Tuesday and Thursday night there was a live band that was quite good. On those 2 nights there were a few more options for happy hour snacks but it was still pretty limited. The free drinks were good and you could get pretty much anything you want.The pool was nice, just the right temperature. The hot tub was nice too. Open till 10pm. It was never very crowded while we were there.We were able to get extra towels from the maid to bring with us on our day trip.The room was very comfortable. The bedroom had 2 double beds and the pull out sofa was actually very comfortable to sleep on. We had a small fridge in the room and 2 TV's but I dont think we ever turned them on.the free breakfast was awesome. I don;t know how anyone could complain about this. Lots of variety and everything was good. Eggs cooked to order, pancakes, french toast or waffels,bacon, sausage, plenty of fruit, yogurt, pastries ect. The juice was really good. We gave a couple dollars to the coffee server and he was so appreciative, ditto to the nice lady who cleaned up around the food at happy hour.All of the staff at the hotel were very f.We did not use the valet parking. We rented a car one day from Thrifty about a five minute walk away.There are tons of places nearby to eat. The ABC store is right across the street. We got some lunch one day at the pool. The food was good but fairly pricey as it usually is at a hotel eatery. We had our own drinks at the pool and noone commented on that.Overall, I would revisit here in a heartbeat. It was very clean and the location was awesome. It did not matter that we were not right on the ocean. it is close. Having the 2 rooms for the four of us was great. I was traveling with my college aged children and we had plenty of room.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: There were 3 friends traveling together so we opted for the 2Q plus sleeper sofa suite. The room itself was fine and had a nice big bathroom. The second sink outside the bath was very helpful to us. The room was clean and the staff was uniformly exceptional. The hotel's location was great for us since we weren't looking to hit the beach here. Plenty of restaurants within walking distance.I agree with others here that the breakfast is top-notch. Lots of choices: fresh fruit, bacon/sausage, eggs (incl omelets made to order), several juice choices, cereal, yogurt. Was nice to eat outside in the balmy weather...now if we could just keep the pigeons away!Wish I'd seen the note about self-parking near the Trump. $30/day is pretty steep for parking.I also have an issue with an extra person charge starting at the 3rd person in a suite that has 3 beds (incl sleeper sofa). The whole reason we got a suite was so we could each have our own bed. It seems a bit of a money grab not to allow that. I mean, does it *really* cost $60/day to serve one more breakfast and clean one more set of linens?The hotel also desperately needs wi-fi in the rooms. Granted the description promised only high speed internet but without wi-fi my friend's non-3G tablet was useless except in the common areas.Do pick up one of the coupon books available at the reception desk. Coupons for most of the businesses along the Beach Walk.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We checked in and the staff were very helpful, friendly, etc., and it stayed that way for the whole stay. Really good people. Room was kind of a modified suite with one room being very small and had a strange shape. We were disappointed in that and they got us another room that fit our needs (and reservations) better. Still, it was not the Embassy Suites I have been used to seeing after traveling extensively around the USA - the kitchen was a joke! A tiny minifridge with a microwave and a coffee maker? C'mon, that is not a suite or half kitchen in any way. So, that was dissapointing as we planned to buy some groceries and make some snacks and drinks in the room but we just couldn't with this basic hotel room arrangement. Really, you can get a minifridge and microwave in a Holiday Inn Express or Best Western.The room was nicely furnished and very clean, bathroom was very nice as well.But the breakfast was the real deal here. It is very good. Great assortment and lots of hot and cold selections for everybody. Fresh cooked omelettes cooked to your liking with any ingredients you would like and other hot food and fresh fruit, vegetables, etc. Really quite good.Now for location. While it is basically half a block or maybe a block to the beach, this is the worst part of the beach in Waikiki. Can't really go into the beach here unless you plan on swimming out in the deeper water. Guess that is why nobody is in the water at this part of the beach, and there really is no room for sunning here either - quite a walk to either the Hilton beach or back to the main part of Waikiki beach in front of the big Pink hotel (Royal Hawaiian). Rocks everywhere making walking in the water rather treacherous.Overall a very nice hotel but the walk to the real beach is quite deceiving. If you are in it for the comfortable rooms (but not real suite), good service and fabulous breakfast then this is the place for you - but not for the location being close to the beach. I think for the price they charge (even when discounted) there are much better choices where you can even get a half or full kitchen.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The title of my review says it all :).I have stayed at this hotel twice - each stay was six nights. Each stay was on an HHonors reward reservation. As an HHonors Gold, I have visited my fair share of Hilton family properties across the USA. Let me explain why I feel this is the best Embassy Suites you'll find:- The service is top notch. Everyone, from the servers at breakfast, to the housekeeping staff, to the folks manning the evening reception, were all extremely friendly. The spirit of aloha is truly alive here. Outrigger runs this hotel under the Embassy Suites brand - so unlike the majority of Hilton properties they actually take customer service seriously :).- The rooms themselves are excellent. I was comped an upgrade to a larger room on my most recent visit this past September after I submitted a request. The 2BR/2 bath suites are spacious and our suite was the perfect size for everyone traveling along - including 3 patio doors opening up to 2 different lanais!- The morning breakfast and evening manager's reception were both excellent (and as mentioned above, the staff manning these events was exceptional). I guess if I had to find something to "complain" about, it'd be that I wish there would be hot food at the evening reception. But honestly, I was fine with the chips, goldfish, and pretzels to accompany my complimentary mai tai's and blue hawaiians! The breakfast is vastly superior to most Embassy Suties breakfasts you'll find, and blows away the standard Hampton breakfast. You'll find a rotating starch (pancakes, french toast, etc) in addition to the standard eggs, pineapple & other assorted fruit, sausage, bacon, omelettes, and full compliment of pastries and cereal. POG juice is available as well.- Everything is very well maintained - saw several people painting railings and they had contractors replacing the carpet in the common areas of each floor. Granted, the hotel is relatively new (2007), but it's good to know that they are serious about upkeep.- The location is right in the heart of Waikiki. Other than maybe the main Outrigger hotel, or the Sheraton, you will not find a better location. The mall is right across Lewers St, allowing you to gawk at the people dropping thousands of dollars on coach bags and rolex watches. Tons of dining options within walking distance... though the best restaurant on Waikiki (IMO), Roy's, is located in the Beachwalk complex right next to the Hula Tower's elevators. And since you are in Waikiki, you will see at least 3 different ABC stores from any exit to the hotel!- My only real complaint is the parking, which is $30/day, valet only. Expensive, even for Waikiki standards. The upside is that rentals at HNL are dirt cheap ($8/day on hotwire for mine), so the overall price isn't obscene. And yeah, you will want a car, because any trip to Oahu isn't complete without at least a day or two visiting Kailua Beach Park or the north shore beaches!To sum it up, you can't go wrong selecting this hotel for your vacation. I would not hesitate to give it my highest recommendation.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I have been more than a few times to this area and as anyone will tell you, you get nothing for free in Waikiki. Well this location is about a half block (if even that) off of the beach, but it has a free buffet breakfast in the morning with the freshest pineapple every morning and also a wide variety of breakfast items. Oh did I say that was included.... also they have a free happy hour every day with beer and mai-tai’s along with some minor food. The room I have had both times here has looked over the beach area and also onto the pool area. Some of the sunsets I have had have been spectacular and have made the experience even better! Also located on the property to compliment the hotel is Roy’s restaurant that has great food to complete your day. And if you want more casual then you can walk down the street to one of many location places. However, my favorite is Duke’s that has a wonderful bar that is just feet away from the ocean and a view of Diamond Head. Just as a sticker shock issue, parking at this hotel and others in the Waikiki area is not cheap. Here it is now $30 a day valet, but it is as many in and out as you want. If you don’t plan on driving around the island then just get a shuttle or taxi to the hotel! ALOHA….. and enjoy!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We traveled to Honolulu for our wedding with our immediate family and it was important for us all to stay in close proximity. We stayed at the Trump and I booked a 1BR suite at the Embassy for my parents and brother for 7 nights. The location couldn't have been better. Embassy is located right next to the Trump and is about 3 minutes walk from one property to the other (you can cut through the Trump garage to get to the Embassy lobby). My in-laws stayed at Outrigger Reef which was also literally across the street from Embassy. Location wise everything worked out fabulously for us.My mom has to watch her diet and eats frequent small meals so having a fridge and microwave was extremely important. The sitting room was nice so when my bro stayed up late to watch tv/ surf web, he was not disturbing my parents. My parents were happy with the free breakfast and manager's reception. The pool area on the 4th floor looked quite nice and was a good size. Sure, the room could use some upgrading but all in all it was a solid hotel that worked for my family. Would definitely recommend for families.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Large two room suite in good conditionGood location close to beach and shopsGood service – request for room change handled promptly and efficiently – original room beside elevator, ice machine and maids quarters was too noisyExcellent buffet breakfast included, Managers cocktail hour was hard to beatPool area in the shade for most of the day due to neighboring buildings

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My husband and I spent a wonderful week in Waikiki. This was our 5th visitto Oahu and 1st visit to Embassy Suites. We usually use the Hilton brandhotels and this will be our #1 choice from now on coming back to theWaikiki beach area. The room was the best,1 bed that was so dreamy, 2TV's I got to watch what I like, a microwave and refrig, and thehousekeeper was very friendly (Carlita) and very professional and thebathroom spotless. This was our relaxing vacation and having very good foodplaces near by was awesome. Roys, Yardhouse, BLT , Giovanni's, Hard Rocklots of Starbucks. I am not a shopper but if you are, lots of them nearby. We had a vehicle and Valet group was fast and courteous. This hotel ismuch better than the big Hotel, easy to get to your room and enjoy thestay. Will be coming back when we get the time and money.This was a 37th Anniversary present to each other and we are happy with our decision.Dawn

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The lobby is open, airy, and the everyone was welcoming. We received our welcome drink as we checked in, neither getting the drink or the check-in took long. The walk to our room was even pleasant since the hallways we walked through were always open to the outdoors, usually at either end. Our room was excellent, it had a mini-fridge, sink, and microwave in the kitchen area. A desk, couch, flat screen TV (VIZIO 32") and a sliding door to the balcony. View from the balcony was awesome, we could see a lot of water. Asking for a high floor will get you great views, it looked like the lower floors may have their views blocked by other hotels. The breakfast was very good, they had food fit for eastern and western tastes (Omelets / Miso Soup, and lots more). Seating for the breakfast is all outdoors, and most of it is covered. The free happy hour (5:30 - 7:30) was also pretty good. Unlimited free drinks, not including the tip jars for the bartenders, and snack food. The drink menu included wine, tropical drinks, and standard mixed drinks. The snack food when we there was corn chips/salsa and goldfish the first day. The second day is was pretzels / potato chips / peanuts. Location was good for us. Easy walk to the beach, right next to shops/restaurants. It was nice to have something at that time. We took the embassy suites arranged airport shuttle back to HNL, it cost us $22 ($11/Person) plus tip. The cab we took to the hotel cost us somewhere in the $30's. If I were going back to Honolulu again I would not hesitate to stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Arrived at noon but the room would not be ready until 2:30-3:00pm which was not a big deal. Provided the whole family with a drink and locked up our luggage till we could check in. Came back to hotel a little after 2:30 pm. Was told we were upgraded to a partial ocean view room on the 20th floor on the Aloha tower. FYI, I am Hilton Gold. Asked if rooms were available on Hula tower as I had heard there was a better chance for water views and less noise. Was allowed to check out the room on the Aloha tower which was great, 20th floor facing Diamond Head and Waikiki beach. Chose the original room. Baggage was brought to our room. The entire staff was very friendly. Free breakfast buffets every morning were what you would expect at an Embassy, good but not incredible. The highlight is the made to order omelettes which were incredible. The manager's reception was great for adults as they served great drinks that were not watered down. The snacks were pretzels, peanuts, carrots and celery with ranch, and chips with either salsa or cheese dip. While at the pool on two consecutive nights we were given boogie boards by other guests that were checking out. We gave those boards to other guests on our last night. Internet is available in rooms via ethernet cable. Wifi is available on the 4th floor which is pool\breakfast\manager's reception area. Zero complaints with the Embassy and we will stay there again. Close to everything, friendly staff, and nice room that didn't feel cramped even with 5 people.To view the fireworks on friday night set up viewing the bar near the pool or once it starts stand at the wall to get a better view.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This property was an excellent choice for our party of 7 where we booked two 2-bedroom suites which were ideal - very spacious, each suite having a central lounge with balcony and 2 separate double bedrooms each with a private bathroom and balcony. There was also a separate area with sink, fridge and microwave but you need to take your own cups, plates, cutlery, etc. The views were not great but that's because the suites are located a block back from the sea but that did mean that the lovely beach was only a 5 minute stroll away. The location was great at night as, being part of the Beach Walk complex, the suites had everything you need 'on the doorstep' such as a good choice of restaurants, shops and bars (we like the Yard House with its huge variety of ales and other beverages!). Reception staff were friendly and accommodating and we were lucky to receive one of the suites ready on arrival at 07.30 after our overnight flight from Nevada. The complimentary breakfast at the Embassy Suites was very much appreciated and really good - omelettes were made to order and very delicious - since returning from there, I now eat my omelettes with jalapenos in! Other items were plentiful and substantial. The Manager's Cocktail Party each evening was amazing, drinks were full strength and plentiful. The nightly entertainment was ok but we were a little disappointed that we did not see tradtional hula dancers there but we saw a good free hula show along the seafront about 25 minutes walk from the Embassy Suites. The pool at the Embassy Suites is on the small side but this was not a problem to us considering the wonderful ocean just a short stroll away ideal for snorkelling and viewing an array of tropical fish. The nearest beach was picturesque even though a little narrow especially at high tide but if you turn right and walk 5 minutes in the opposite direction of Diamond Head, the beach becomes wider and the beach bars sell food and drinks cheaper than those nearer Waikiki centre. Our favourite beach bar was 'Barefoot Bar' with cocktails for around $7 and chicken and chips around $5, not forgetting the mega ice creams for around $2. Had lots of excellent food and drink in Waikiki but the place with the most amazing evening atmosphere for us was the Shore Bird Restaurant on the beach just across the road and down the path from the Embassy Suites. There you can sit listening to the waves lapping on the shore whilst enjoying good food and drink, watching the changing colours on Waikiki Beach as the sun sets and Diamond Head becomes a mere silhouette in the night - amazing place - we hope to be back very soon. People were welcoming and friendly, had some great days out - Pearl Harbour, Big Island by air, climbed Diamond Head (fantastic views - will do that again!), Honolulu Zoo (always wanted to see a Komodo Dragon), Waterpark, Submarine experience, Catamaran Evening cruise. So many other places to see on Oahu - a week was not long enough - will hopefully return!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I searched and searched so many hotels in Waikiki and finally found "the one". The Embassy Suites were absolutely amazing. I travelled with my mum and we booked a 1BR suite; it was spacious and clean and although our balcony faced the side of the building, we still had a great view of the water. The staff were super friendly and attentive, the daily-included breakfast was great; such a fantastic selection of food! The hotel was only a comfortable 30mins walk to Alomoana Shopping Ctr but we had to get the bus back to our hotel as we had so much shopping! We had access to all eateries, shops and the beach was seconds away. I am already planning my next trip back to Hawaii in early 2012 and will stay at the Embassy Suites without hesitation. I can't recommend this hotel more highly.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Located a couple of blocks from the beach this hotel is very nice for the price range. - Big nice rooms complete with separate living area with couch, refrigerator, coffee, microwave, and balcony- Very Clean Property- Nice Comfortable Beds- Room Key Needed to Access all Floors on Elevator- Tour Desk for off site activities- Fast Check-In/Check-Out- Great Staff- Full Service Breakfast Buffet - Right on the BeachwalkI would stay here again!Safe Travels! Land and Sea

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We were staying in Waikiki for only one night before going to the Disney Aulani Resort. I reserved a 2 bedroom suite (after reading several reviews of the area on Trip Advisor). We pulled up in our rental vehicle, Valet parked and were pleasantly surprised at how easy the check-in was. Jeff was our Bellhop and he provided us with top notch service in addition to several points of interest. Our room was beyond expectation, we had a beautiful view of the ocean, 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, a refrigerator and 3 televisions! We went down to the Managers reception which was fun and then had the breakfast (large buffet with omelet station) in the am (both compliments of Embassy Suites). Johnny another Bellhop was there to help us get situated in the am and provided us with several suggestions for food and fun. I would definitely recommend Embassy Suites even for a long stay. We were 1 block from the ocean, but that didn't matter, you could see it and didn't have to worry about all the people unless you wanted to. Thanks Embassy Suites for making this a very enjoyable experience!!! PS - Parking is $30 a day you pay almost EVERYWHERE in Hawaii, just consider that part of your expenses.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We are staying at the Embassy Suites Waikiki right now and for the next 4 nights. I had asked for an accessible room.When my husband and I arrived,to our great surprise, they had upgraded us to a 2 room suite at no extra charge. One of the rooms is an accessible room. I couldn't be more pleased and want to thank the hotel for this nice gesture.Our rooms are on the14th floor and we have a clear and beatiful view of Diamondhead from our balcony. Kudos to this hotel for treating us so nicely.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel, unlike many Waikiki hotels, offers spacious rooms with refrigerators and sitting areas. The breakfast buffet is top notch, and the pool area is clean and relaxed.The location is so convenient to the Waikiki Beachwalk, and very clean updated pleasant area with shops, restaurants, and free entertainment. We could go to Ruth's Chris Steakhouse without ever setting foot on the street.The most notable thing about our stay, however, was the housekeeping staff person that acted like she was personally dedicated to making our stay perfect. She went above and beyond to give us whatever we needed.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I recently stayed here for 10 days with my family and had a fantastic stay. The rooms were clean and tidy and the staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms were quiet and had great curtains so you could sleep in.Our children loved the pool area and spent many hours happily swimming at the pool with us relaxing on the side.It is a quick walk to the beach, the shops and restaurants.Would definately stay here again. We had a 2 bedroom suite on the 18th floor in the Hula tower (front tower). We had a lovely view over the pool and out to the ocean.We enjoyed the breakfast each morning, there was a good variety.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had a standard suite on the top floor with a great ocean view. The room was stocked with great amenities including a pullout couch, huge deck, and very comfortable accommodations. The service was super friendly. The pool was big with a carve-out for toddlers and we easily found lounge chairs to sit in - in fact the entire property was spacious and well appointed. The managers specials were fun and relaxing and included live music. The breakfast buffet was super awesome and had great variety of quality food. The property itself is in a very good location, walking distance from everything that we wanted to see in Waikiki. We'll definitely stay here again the next time we're in the area!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Good place to stay, everything was fine, room with an ocean view - just! But up to date, very clean and spacious. Staff friendly, and with the bonus of breakfast and evening cocktails thrown in, good value for money. This is essentially a family hotel so be prepared for that, but an excellent base for visiting Oahu.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We LOVE our "Home Away From Home at the Embassy Waikiki". I have never felt the need to post our review of the property, but upon reading a few recent semi-negative comments, I feel I must post our review.We have stayed at this property 5 times over the past 4 years (beginning 2008) and we are anxiously awaiting our next visit. :) We have researched other properties in Waikiki, just to see what they have to offer. Obviously, after 5 visits, we have ultimately decided that Embassy Waikiki was the best choice for us :) This hotel is so awesome and we have so many friends that work at the Embassy. This hotel is very loyal to their staff, and we are greatful for that. I don't even know where to begin to tell you how wonderful Embassy Waikiki is, and I probably will not do it the justice it deserves in my review. I guess I will spend a few minutes disputing some of the negative comments We think the Lobby is great: Granted, it is not your "traditional Grand Hotel Lobby". It is a small lobby, and yes, there are cars coming & going for drop off/pick up. But, we find this type of lobby comforting. This lobby does not have your typical "tourist" coming through walking around and/or shopping. There is no need for people to walk through our lobby, all the stores and restaraunts are immediately outside the lobby. We have walked through many hotel lobbies in Waikiki and we find it comforting to know that the only people walking through the lobby of our hotel are guests of the hotel. The elevators are not that slow....come on give me a break. We always stay on the 21st floor. If slow elevators were a problem, we would not choose the 21st floor. Besides, your on vacation, your not suppose to be in a rush....spend some time chatting with your elevator buddies...it's fun. :) ...it's the ALOHA spirit, it makes people smile and makes everyone happy :) Rooms are awesome, very spacious. Housekeeping staff is wonderful , very attentive, and very friendly. :)Breakfast is fun. Yes, there are birds. If you choose to eat outside, of course there are gong to be birds. The birds are great...watching the birds makes breakfast a fun way to start the morning. We thoroughly enjoy watching the birds in the morning :)Pool area and Pakini Bar are awesome. You can get shade and sun at the pool area...which is great if your husband prefers the shade and you prefer the sun :) Pakini Bar has a very nice view and an awesome tradewind breeze. You can also find alot of good conversation there, if you choose to.Managers Reception is great :) Keola, George, Dennis, & Lacey make you feel like you are at home with friends and family. They are awesome and we look forward to seeing them again :) There is a family band that plays two times a week during the Managers Reception. They play "old type rock music". They are a GREAT band, and their musical skills are VERY impressive. There is also a fantastic dance show. I think it is 1 night a week. That is also a really good time. The little kids that perform are so much fun to watch. :) These little kids are SO proud of their performance. It's great to see :)Location of the hotel is awesome. You can walk to shops, restaraunts, bars, various beaches, the zoo, the aquarium. If you want to do further sight seeing take the bus or do a tour bus.We have never experienced excessive noise in our room. Granted, if you are an extremely light sleeper, like me, you may have difficulty sleeping and every single noise you hear may wake you. But overall, that stuff happens at home also. I have never found "night noise" to be a major problem while staying at Embassy Waikiki. And who cares if it does happen....aren't we in Hawaii to Hang Loose and Chill out ?????.....)We LOVE Oahu and we love the EMBASSY SUITES and their STAFF. If you choose to stay with them, we hope you find the ALOHA SPIRIT while you are there :) Mahalo for reading my longgggggg review :)

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: While this hotel isn't directly on the beach, it offers so much more, you don't even notice (especially if you get an ocean view room). The staff here have been phenomenally nice and helpful. The best part are the rooms. This is by far the cleanest hotel room I have ever had in many years of travel. The bathroom was immaculate, the furnishings all in excellent condition and the bed was devine. Had one of the best Embassy Suites breakfasts here - a chef making omelets who was entertaining and knew how to cook one without overcooking it. The location is right across the street from Waikiki Beach and multiple restaurants within this short block including Ruth's Chris, P.F. Chiangs, Subway, Roys, Cheeseburgers, Giovanni's and Hard Rock Cafe (to just name a few).I'm so very happy I chose this hotel and I would highly recommend it. (There were some complaints here about it being smaller than most Embassy Suites and I suppose it may be a bit smaller but you're in Hawaii. How much time are you really in the room? Besides, the pluses far outweigh a little bit less room)

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is the best place to stay to experience Waikiki! The service is excellent! The hotel is clean! It is located across the street from one of the best beaches (not too crowded). We stayed on the 16th floor with a "partial ocean view". It was more like a full ocean view....lovely! It may seem a bit pricer than other hotels, but when you have a full breakfast, snacks and drinks each night,it ends up saving you money. It is expensive to eat out in Hawaii. The hotel food is excellent! From the buffet breakfast to the poolside menu. The evening managers reception included chips and dip, a few nights of live entertainment and almost any drink you could imagine and not watered down. Highly recommend This hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Good location in Waikiki. Opted for the ocean view and had the best view on the 14th floor in the Hula wing. Though this suite is smaller than others due to the stairs, it had the best view especially of the sunset. Close to beach and central to everything in Waikiki. Buses close by also. The included breakfast was adequate though felt cafeteria-like. The evening reception was ok, nothing special. The use of the business center was great, eliminates need to take laptop. However, internet is available in room if you choose. Fitness room adequate. Nice pool and area. Staff friendly. Good restaurants downstairs. Room was well taken care of.In short, good hotel, especially for families. If you are used to a more intimate setting, then look elsewhere.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed 6 nights in Sept. Being a Hhonors member does not really get you any special consideration. I am a gold member and if I was upgraded, it was not stated so I am not sure. What I am sure about is my request for a higher floor was honored. Our room in the Aloha tower on the 16th. floor had a nice view over the city and a tiny view of the ocean if you made a hard left look from the balcony. No real complaints with the exception of proximity to the elevator. My request to be away from the elevator was not honored. The room was right next to the elevators. They are noisy at night when the staff uses the service elevator in the very early a.m. It does wake you up if you are a normal to light sleeper. We could have requested to be moved but did not as we were already settled in. Just be aware that if given a room adjacent to the elevators to ask to be moved if you are a light sleeper before you settle in the room. This Embassy Suites is managed not by Hilton, but by Outrigger management group. Perhaps that is why there is no fanfare for Hhonors members. Being a Gold member gets you very little to zero in the way of perks. As I said. Usually I am given a pretty good room upgrade when breakfast is included or at the Hilton's we get a free breakfast. Maybe being on the 16th floor with a good city view is an upgrade, I am not sure. Being right next to the elevator is not.I emailed the reservations desk twice to ask that I be on a higher floor and not near the elevator. I even offered to pay for the difference for the best view and upgrade if available but I never got a response back. The breakfast and breakfast staff were great. They really do perform. The omlette chef is very busy and deserves special recognition. He will make your eggs or omlette to order. The people who walk around bussing tables and filling coffe cups are very friendly and do a great job. The managers reception is nothing special. A very limited drink menu with low shelp liquor and bud and michelob as beer choices. I was disappointed they didn't have hawaiin beer as there are many and one choice of local beer would be nice.The wine was not drinkable and tasted like screw cap variety. The guys who work the bar expect you to tip them and just do their job. They don't put out the positive vibe that most the other staff do. This was mediocre at best, but then most of the Embassy receptions are. The pool is small but works. There are lots of lounge chairs but very few in any kind of shade for that option. The location can't be beat. Being between Lewer's and Beachwalk make it convinient to many shops, restaurants and the ABC stores. It's a short walk to the beach. It just seems to me that things have changed since I was last in Waikiki two years ago. There seemed to be a larger contingent of homeless types from the Mainland lurking around the beach area between the Outrigger Reef and Fort DeRussy. They use thepublic bathrooms as their primary bathroom for bathing, etc and take up a lot of the shaded seating daily. Don't expect toilet paper in those bathrooms or paper towels to dry with after washing your hands. This seemed to be the area where they hang out as opposed to the beach area in front of the Royal Hawaiian or the Sheraton. The city authorities seem to tolerate them much like San Franciso does theirs.All in all I love Waikiki and if I had to pay for the room, the Embassy would still be a very good value.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We found the hotel to be well located to the beach and all the dining and shopping in Waikiki.The rooms were spacious and comfortable. We had a one bedroom suite with kitchenette and microwave. The pool area was fine with plenty of lounges available.The included buffet breakfast was great. Although there were a large number of guests at breakfast everyday things seemed to run smoothly without too much waiting around and I must comment on the friendliness and effiiency of the wait staff. They were polite and always smiling and ready to lend a hand (perhaps the porters could learn something from them!) We did have to collect our own luggage trolley and load our 8 bags and wheel to reception ourselves.We would stay at the Embassy Suites again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Family of four stayed at Waikiki ES and found the location fine for us. It is not on the beach but access is not hard either (just a quick walk out to access point or through the Outrigger). We walked around in the area and felt comfortable at all times. The ABC stores are everywhere to buy your missed items or bottled water or souvenirs so no issues on that. If you care for Hard Rock or Dennys, both are a quick walk nearby. Very cute Italian restaurant, Aaroncino (bit pricey) also close.Now to the hotel itself. The suite style rooms are comfortable to spread out in and we had the mini fridge which helped too. There have to be very few rooms that have any noteworthy views due to the angle of the hotel. We actually used points for our stay and got rewarded with the view of a parking lot rooftop and some ugly buildings (think it was the Hula Tower). We insisted that at the number of points for our stay that we had used (earned by loyalty to the Hilton brand) that we be moved at least to the main tower - the Aloha Tower. We had another mediocre view of the front side and tall buildings but a couple of palm trees to at least lessen the disappointment. So suffice it to say we didn't go out on patio for much. Also, there was a lot of street noise that did travel up but to be expected in such a bustling area. It did not interfere with sleeping. We liked that the bathroom had 2 entries - one through hallway of suite and one through the bedroom (made it easier to circle in and out getting ready). The manager's reception had chips/dip, hummus/bread, pretzels, goldfish crackers, chex mix, chips/salsa. We also enjoyed non-alcoholic mai-tais, soft drinks. There was also live musical entertainment with a hula dance to get you in the Hawaiian spirit, but it was every other night. Breakfast buffet was busy every morning but great for us - choice of just about every morning meal type option. Very clean food service area relative to other hotels we've stayed at and you have your choice to eat enclosed or out in the open portion of the terrace.Overall, we think the service was standard ES, maybe a bit less. There is a $30 per night parking charge for forced valet parking so count the tips each and every time you need your car brought around. The elevators were a bit slow with some waits required, not really a big deal but annoying when carrying beach items.Bottom line, nice enough and "economical" relative to the other area choices for a family of four to stay at, but beware you get no special consideration for HH points usage or status. If we return to Waikiki, we'd choose to be more center of action around the Hyatt or Westin since we think those properties also seemed nicer.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel is wonderful. From the moment you walk in and are welcomed with a tasty fruity drink, to the front desk helping to find the room with a view that you'll just love, to the perfect breakfast and great evening reception, you will feel like you are on vacation. The manager of the reception caused our whole work team to want to switch hotels and move over to the Embassy. In fact on our next trip in a couple of weeks, we are all staying here. For those of you who are like me and want a clean room, you won't be disappointed. The cleaning folks are so kind and get to know what you like throughout your stay. Take it from a picky traveler, you will absolutely love the place!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed for a week at the Embassy Suites and greatly enjoyed our accommodations. We had an ocean facing suite and were able to watch fireworks Friday evening from the balcony. The swimming pool was perfect for young children, with the deepest section only 4 feet deep. Our 7 year old son loved the pool and greatly improved his swimming. The breakfast buffet had standard Embassy Suites items (omelet bar, pastries, etc.) as well as some Asian choices, including miso, rice, pickled vegetables, and salad. The pineapple and papaya were ripe and delicious. We enjoyed Mai Tais and Blue Hawaiis at the nightly cocktail hour, and took advantage of Happy Hour food specials at nearby restaurants like Yard House, PF Changs, and Wolfgang's. The hotel is right next to a mall and there were lots of choices for dining and shopping. A military museum is across the street and a short walk away, with beach access directly behind it. We were able to rent kayaks and beach chairs with an umbrella for a reasonable fee. We highly recommend this Embassy Suites and will definitely return.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Not many properties on Waikiki offer decent suites at a decent price. This is one of them. Don't expect luxury but do expect comfort, convenience, relatively good value and reasonably good location. Not on the beach, but close enough to Duke's - in my opinion the center of Waikiki!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed for a week at the Embassy Suites and loved it. The park just to the north was perfect for the beach and we were within walking distance of a lot of stores and restaurants. Breakfast is one of the best and real full meal and the Managers reception has great drinks (but the snacks are weak). Some reviews complain abou the lobby and garage, but it worked fine and fit the atmosphere. Parking fee is high, but you figure it as part of the room rate and compare. We booked through Costco Travel and got a very large discount, floor near the top. We asked for a quiet room and got it. Best of all was the staff, from the front desk, bartenders, breakfast staff and most helpful maid I have seen. You pay a pretty good rate, but if you want a top notch experience this is it.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I researched for hours (thank you, tripadvisor!) before finally chosing our hotel for this vacation. The breakfast was amazing! The great thing about their breakfast is that you will not need to buy lunch until late or even just do an early dinner. Anyone who complains about the breakfast is beyond ridic.The rooms are nice sized, nice tvs (not that it matters), views are great, happy hour is FANTASTIC. It was open bar--not stupid drink tickets or anything. They had some snacks out too which is nice. I highly recommend trying a Hawaiian Tea. 90% alcohol and 100% tasty.My better half was worried about not being on the beach but you are less than half a block and there are great views! The pool is fantastic too. It would be a great location if you wanted to take your family, but as a couple with no plans to ever have kids, we LOVED the lack of screaming children peeing in the pool. I love Embassy Suites because they do not nickle and dime you. No charging coffee or wifi. Loved it.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Of all the locations in Waikiki, we loved this one the most. With six of us traveling the two-room suite was perfect! We had our "privacy" and the kids had their own space also.Great breakfast which was included so it saved us some money. Complimentary happy hour got the evening started out right and kept the college age kids(all over 21) occupied. :) Short stroll to the beach, the great shops and superb restaurants. The walks were pleasant even for my 80 year old father-in-law!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This property is perfect if you are travelling as a family - with a seperate lounge you have plenty of room to spread out and have your own space. we were in the tower nearest the ocean and from our balcony could see the ocean without paying for the iew.The breakfast was great - the food wasn't as good as we expected from previous reviews but did the job and saved time on busy days. We realised towards the end of the stay that you got discounts at many of the beachwalk restaurants because you stay here. the managers drinks were a great touch - we would sit by the pool after being out all day and have a few cocktails before going to one to the many nearby restaurants for dinner. we can't fault this place and are going back next year

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We splurged and got the 2 room suite which was spacious and made the trip for our family. Two bedrooms (1 w/ King and 1 w/ 2 queens) with 2 bathrooms and a livingroom w/pullout sofa kitchenette gave our family of five a comfortable and relaxing space to unwind. The breakfast was a favorite part of our teenagers stay with everything they wanted from omlettes, bacon, eggs, pastries, fruit and more. The included evening snack allowed the kids to fill up on sodas and snackmix/chips.Easy walking distance to beach and restaurants, and ABC convenience stores. I wish we could find a hotel like this for every family vacation. The suite was a splurge but the comfort and included breakfast made it worth every penny. I'd stay here again.Only word of warning was on day 3 of 5 they tried to make us switch rooms and left message that our a/c was broken and we should call them switch rooms for our "safety". I really think they just wanted to give our room to someone who had complaints. We didn't see message until about 10 hrs later and our A/C was working fine. We didn't call management back or switch rooms and they never tried again to make us switch.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The place is not waterfront, it's in a busy area of Waikiki. All kinds of noises at night. Some people are complaining they can hear street noise, however we are on the 9th floor and you can hear all the trucks, buses, and people who just want to scream in the street during wee hours.Concierge staff are great. Valet and Bell staff are great (especially Dean). The breakfast and manager's reception staff who prepares your omelet & drinks are great. However, the staff who were supposed to pick up all the dishes from the table ( both breakfast and manager's reception), looks annoyed and only choose guests who they would like to talk to. You can tell, they are fake, just trying to do their job. I watched them for a week of our stay and could not believe those ladies who did not even visit our table , not even once during our stay. Sad to say, but they are fake. Hopefully, the General Manager will observe these fake people. Housekeeping staff on the 9th floor (Hula Tower) are kind and always talking to my family. Love their attitude and kindness. The room is clean and spacious (mainland ES are bigger though). TV selection is very limited. Again, no Disney channel or FOX news. The hotel is clean and in good location. Expensive for what you get though. $30/day valet, $350/night for one bedroom suite.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My family of six always stays at an embassy suites when we travel so I knew what to expect of their properties. I must say, my recent vacation fell a little short of my expectations overall. I was overly shocked when we were placed on the second floor next to the busiest street ever!! Especially after I called numerous times to ensure we would not get stuck with a low floor due to our late plane arrival. All of my efforts to call ahead and pre-plan did not matter a bit. The cigarette smoke that floated up to our 2nd floor room was endless, so we could not leave your balcony door opened to experience the sights and sounds peacefully. After the first night of noisy torture I decided to put my anger aside and try to enjoy our highly anticipated and very costly vacation that I spent months planning. Having the property feed my family every morning and supply my husband and I with endless nightly cocktails sort of took the disappointment away. The overall nightly environment of the properties location was also a plus. I suppose if you stay in the Waikiki area you should expect noise and congestion. My lesson learned is that a vacation is what you make it, and if you spend your time complaining about the small stuff you miss out on the lifelong memories. As I begin planning our Hawaiian vacation for next year, unfortunately the Embassy Suites will not be on my list of possible properties. Which is very diappointing for me because I have been a loyal customer for years?P.S. Room assignments seem to be a luck of the draw. Maybe the front desk staff should make an effort to read the request that customers take the time to submit before assigning rooms. Maybe that would prevent them from losing loyal customers. The breakfast buffet staff were the shining stars of this property. They actually made an effort to give a good vacation experience. Mahalo

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: If you're expecting this is a typical Embassy Suites it's not, since it was purchased from another hotel. Still, they've done a good job delivering the ES experience, and the breakfast and manger's reception is actually much better than the typical ES. the location IS the thing here, though...superb. Only complaints are the valet-only parking, which can be excessively slow, AND cost $25/day. That's the only thing keeping this from 5 stars.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Read the reviews before we got here and planned on spending 4 nights here before heading to the Kahala Resort for a week.Right from the get go we were NOT impressed with the reception desk being 100 feet from the cars pulling in. You can drive right by this place and easily miss it. The property seemed dated and the room furnishings were plain at best. Nothing terrible, but definitely NOT anywhere near a "resort" property. Views were trashy since the area around the hotel in dumpy. Long walk to the beach to fight the masses there. We had a 2 room suite that was NOT worth anywhere near the money. Checked out of this depressing place after one night and went to the Kahala Resort which was absolutely amazing. Cost a few $$ more but worth every penny. First class resort with gorgeous uncrowded beaches. We were swimming with the dolphins 3 hours after we arrived right in the lagoon on the property.Best travel move we ever made was leaving this tourist trap as quickly as possible.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Good location. Close to shops and restaurants. Great breakfast supplied. Great rooms. Clean. Staff very friendly. Nice pool area.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Embassy Suites was just ok, nothing special. Customer service was good, but inaccurate. We had to get our keys made three times before we had a full set that worked.Room was fine, but I was cheap and got the "city view". Turns out we were only one floor up from the street. We had to turn the a/c fan on high just to drown out the evening street noise, and all of the truck deliveries at 6 a.m. still woke us up.Cars are all parked by valet for $30 a night extra. No choice, and can't access your car yourself.On the plus side, the breakfast is excellent, and they actually have an open bar manager's special in the early evening. Hotel is one block from the beach, with a beachfront park just a half-block over.So that food doesn't have to cost you an arm and a leg, there's a convenience store right across the street, and a shopping mall and food court down the block.If we go back to Oahu, we won't be staying in Waikiki at all. Take a look at the new Disney property on the south west corner of the island. Even better might be some of the condos right by the Disney property. We stayed in condos for the other two islands on our trip and much preferred that to our stay at the Embassy Suites.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We used Hilton points and stayed at the Embassy Suites for 3 nights in June. The property is nice in that we got a few breakfast and an afternoon cocktail time. The savings on a free room, breakfast and drinks with snacks in the afternoon made a big saviings to us traveling......credit cards make a difference.....The suite we had was in the second tower furthest away from the beach. The room was actually two rooms with a large bathroom and a separate living room area. It was well designed for a family traveling together or a couple. We didn't have a view of any water, but I liked it all the same. The pool, breakfast area, cocktail area were all on a higher floor. We had perfect weather the entire trip...... The birds were a little agressive at breakfast time so one of us stayed with the leftovers when we went back for more food.....The Hilton Embassy Suites is a very good place to stay in Waikiki.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: There with my teenaged granddaughters. They absolutely loved it..as did I. Wonderful staff!!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Family stayed here January 2010 (it wouldn't let me choose back that far in the drop down). Had an ocean view room on the 18th floor. GORGEOUS sunsets and views of the ocean. Breakfast was fantastic. Made to order omelets, fresh fruit, and anything else you could think of. Very quiet. Great balcony to sit out on during the evening to smell the ocean breeze and listen to the music from a neighboring hotel. Right across the street from a short walkway to the beach. Sometimes hard to get a good seat at the pool. Poolside bar was awesome as were the snacks available to order. Chef came around one day with chocolate covered strawberries for everyone. Couldn't say enough good things about this hotel. But it is pricey, as is everything in Honolulu

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We recently stayed here for two nights on our way to Maui with the family. We have two young children, so we needed a place that was a suite, and as I was booking a bit late, all the oceanfront sites were gone (or were $800+/night!). For about $350/night we got a "partial ocean view" suite that was 100% ocean view out of the main window. The suite was small, granted, but it was two separate rooms. The staff immediately brought up a travel crib and my older child slept on the pull out in the main room. I liked that the bathroom was off the bedroom, rather than the sitting room, so we could use the bathroom at night and not wake the kids. There was terrace access from both rooms - terrace is TEENY, and not for those who are afraid of heights, but we could see ocean, the city lights, and the hills behind us from ours.Best thing I think was the full breakfast every morning - and I mean FULL. Omelet bar, yogurt bar, hot food, cold food, whatever you could think of. And they clearly cater to an Asian/Japanese clientele as well with miso soup and rice available in the buffet. We really enjoyed that the breakfast started at 6:30 which was key for my early risers. The manager's reception in the evening was worthwhile, with free drinks and generally live music of some type - my children liked the hula dancing exhibition. The pool was nicer than expected - felt more "secluded" than a rooftop pool generally does - although quite cold given that it does not get alot of direct sunlight. Has a nice shallow section that is perfect for non-swimmers.It's about 2 blocks from the beach and was an easy walk with two toddlers (I was a little concerned about that as the reviews had that it was anywhere from 1-5 blocks). Within walking distance of Duke's and several other fun restaurants, as well as shopping right outside your door, if that's your interest.The staff was so pleasant and helpful with only one mildly annoying exception. I would also echo others' comments about the elevators - they are SLOW during peak hours (mid-morning and early evening).I was really happy with our stay and would stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Not very impressed with this property. Although the location is good for a non-ocean front property, it is very disappointing. The rooms are suites, but they fell claustrophobic. The ceilings are low and the layouts are copped up. The decor is quite dated. The WiFi for the room is something you have to rent and setup yourself...really? The TVs are tiny. Not that I need a TV in Hawaii, but the screen on my laptop is bigger. The bathroom is small and motel like. I normally enjoy foregoing the air conditioning in Hawaii to enjoy the plentiful trade breezes, but the orientation of the hotel and nestled among other taller buildings hampers this small 'green' luxury. The pool is a generous size with good views on the 4th floor, but it is neither quiet nor relaxing. This hotel definitely caters to the crowd, so anyone looking for a sanctuary in Waikiki should look elsewhere. The parking is valet only with a large loading/unloading area which is nice...though location on one-way side street can be a little tricky especially considering there is only one way in for a hotel bounded by three streets. The lobby area is okay, but could use some presence and better flow as the main entry/circulation point to a large hotel. Last gripe...the elevators are very slow. Believe it or not, but each tower of 21+ floors is serviced by only two. An additional third elevator is service only. Not to leave this review on a totally negative note, there is a free drink given at check-in, free cocktails during the manager reception every evening on the pool level, and a hot breakfast with the room rate...yes, eggs! Of the Hilton properties in Waikiki, I would rate this above the one Kuhio, but below the Doubletree and Hilton Hawaiian Village.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I love this hotel especially with the kids. The rooms are spacious, the kids and I loved the breakfast. Oh my gosh, the views are spactacular!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was the second time in 2 years my family of 4 (kids now 9&12) stayed here. My first review in March 2009 (with many Pros and Cons and 20 "Helpful votes" is here: http://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowUserReviews-g60982-d615153-r26356099 )Once again the property exceeded our expectations (which were higher since we've been here before and knew what we were doing.) We found the staff quite hospitable and couldn't wait to help with the little touches (extra towels and coffee) that help make a long stay with kids more enjoyable. We remembered several of them at the front desk, bell desk and pool, so that was nice and comforting.The highlights for us included: incredible breakfast, spacious suite, wonderful managers reception, a clean and everything in great condition gym, easy walk to the beach, surrounded by ABC convenience stores and an all-around relaxing atmosphere. A few tips we learned from our second stay:- VIP Car Rental (literally across the street from the lobby) has cars for $50/day - just walk-up, no reservation needed, opens at 7A. However, the cars have 100-150K miles! they are old, so expect to trade convenience and value for a junker. (Who cares for one day trip to Hanauma Bay. - There is a Coco Cover (large convenience store) about 10 minute walk (N on Lewers, turn R on Kalakaua, opposite side of the street) with a huge assortment of prepared foods and a salad bar (much larger and fresher assortment than the ABC stores) so you can save on a dinner or two buying them here.- If you've departing on a red-eye and don't want to miss the beach on your last (forget a late check-out, occupancy is to high) consider spending a little more to reserve your room one extra night. This way you can spend the day at the beach, return whenever, shower and pack at your leisure then cab to the airport 10:30P, etc. A much better solution then "checking your bags at 11A" and wondering what to do the next 12 hours.Finally, the highest compliment I can give the property is that my family plans to return for a third stay, next summer.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite with our 17 year old twins. We loved every part of our stay and wish we could find something as fantastic and value for money in Australia as we travel as a family often. We were a bit taken aback as to what is classed as self contained compared to what we have here in Queensland. The staff were always so friendly and made us feel very special. We had only one problem staff related and that was with the lady on the tour booking desk. She had a bit of trouble being friendly! Our room was clean and nothing was too much trouble for the housekeeping staff. The breakfast was amazing and the Manager I think his name was Bob stopped to talk to us every morning of the long weekend, it was refreshing to see him helping out the staff, he was very down to earth and friendly. I would love to stay with the Embassy Suites again! I also loved the managers function of a night. it was fantastic!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The Embassy Suites on Waikiki is a very good hotel. Located just one block from the beach, its location was excellent for us. Our 2-room suite was clean and comfortable. Unfortunately, we didn't have a lanai which was too bad because the hotel doesn't otherwise face the beach so our view was of the Trump tower across the street. Our room was also next to the elevator which makes noise 24-7. We requested a move but no other rooms were available. The hotel service was first rate. The buffet breakfast was excellent with a wide variety of fresh foods. We also enjoyed the pool area. We would stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We just returned from our second stay at Embassy Suites Waikiki Beachwalk and the second time did not disappoint!! Valet..Great!! Always had a smile and conversation!!Bell Desk..Great as well!! Front Desk..Very helpful..Great Location..Morning cook to order breakfast was always Good!!..Managers nightly Happy Hour was Great!! Will be staying there again..For Sure!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The service was very good upon check in. Everything went smoothly which was nice after our long flight. The bellhop was very helpful and showed us around the room. We were in The Hula tower on the 8th floor facing Lewers St. We could see the water in the distance on the right. The sitting area was spacious for our family of four. Our 8 and 6year old enjoyed watching tv in that area. A small dining set was where my husband set up his laptop. No wi-fi, but high speed wired connection in room. It was reliable in the room, especially after calling the 1-800 number to set-up. There was no clear instructions on how to do it. Getting a connection in the breakfast area was touch and go on some days. We didn't mind the cafeteria style buffet breakfast. Loved the made to order egg station. I felt it was an added value considering the restaurant prices in Waikiki. We had very good maid service. Once time weren't given enough pool towels. This was quickly remedied by calling maid service and within a matter of minutes voila towels. There is no pool towel service and you are responsible for your own towels. It was easy enough to take towels to the pool and bring back to the room. They were promptly changed the next day. The pool was nice but small sized. It suited the need of our kids. There was a toodler area and a hot tub. On the first day one of the staff gave the kids an inflatable innertube and a foam board to use in the pool. We rented a car for two days and did end up valet parking it for $30 bucks for one night. There is a nice gift shop in the hotel and an ABC shop just across the street. Also an Expedia expert desk who helped us with some directions . They can also book tours for any island. The hotel was just minutes walk to Waikiki beach and the International Market. We enjoyed the nightly Manager's Reception. Right at 5 pm there was a line up for drinks but that quickly cleared. Snacks were ok. Loved the band who played a few times a week. They sang all sorts of music; retro 70 and 80's music, Hawaiian and even had a little hula performance. The best part of the room was the kitchenette. We would find that the mini fridge and microwave was great for leftovers from the sometimes huge restaurant meals that the kids or ourselves found difficult to finish. Also there were days when we were tired from the days activities and just got take out to eat in the room. Overall Embassy Suites was a great place for our family needs. The two queen beds were fine, the room was great for relaxing after a long day of sightseeing or enjoying the beaches. The pool proved to be a great for our young kids. The breakfast was filling. The staff was helpful and friendly. The six days we stayed there from July 3 - 9 were great and we would gladly recommend staying there.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
