review_body: We loved all the things in this Hotel: perfect location, very good breakfast, rooms spacious and clean and friendly staff. Of course, we recommend and we'll be back again!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Just got back from Waikiki, super hotel-the hotel is lovely, lobby staff is so friendly. Valets are prompt, breakfast staff efficient, the pool area is relaxing. Bartenders are so friendly at the managers' reception, where every evening there are free beverages and snacks. The rooms are spacious, plenty of room in a one BR for the four of us, my husband, myself, and two teenagers. Even with a partial ocean view it was lovely. I recommend it to anyone.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This Embassy Suites had all of the services expected; great breakfast, nice pool, fun happy hour, and large rooms. It also has sophistication and class. The beautiful lobby, great location (close to shopping and the beach), and attentive staff made our visit memorable.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Picked the Embassy Suites to stay in because of price, location, positive reviews and they offered a 2 bedroom suite. Arrived at the hotel around 3pm and much to our surprise the room was ready, unlike the 3 previous couples in line ahead of us whose were not ready yet. The rooms were clean and spacious. While I had requested a high floor, our room was on the 5th floor. This was the only disappointment of our stay, as the views were minimal at best. And since our room was close to the delivery dock I heard the delivery trucks beeping sounds between 6 and 7am in the morning. (The other members in our group are heavy sleepers and heard nothing). A high floor in the other tower would have been better. We enjoyed the breakfast buffet daily. It was a little crowded but made it through the omelet line fairly quickly every day. Valet parking attendants were always quick and friendly. While this hotel is not located directly on the beach (it’s only a short walk though), the location is great for being pretty much in the middle of all the restaurants and great shopping locations.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We are a family of 4 - 2 adults and 2 teenage boys. We stayed one week at the Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach. The rooms although a little small are well appointed. The location being one block off the beach was great. There were a lot of nearby shops and restaurants although prices are very high. Take advantage of the excellent hotel breakfast! We stayed on the top floor of the Hula Tower. Great view and well above the street noise.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed for six nights as a group of seven. Our rooms were spacious and clean and facilities were good. The included breakfast and manager's reception were great. The location is very central to Waikiki shopping, restaurants etc. Our two little boys loved the kids pool (although you should be aware that the pool is very busy and full of kids so is not a place for adult relaxation).

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is the 2nd time we've stayed at the Waikiki Embassy Suites and we love it here! The location is convenient, close to the Hilton Hawaiian Village and next to Fort de Russy. We were upgraded to an ocean view room on check-in and got the very top floor, corner room with a wrap around porch and a beautiful view! King bed was comfortable and our teenager slept on the pull out sofa with no complaints.The breakfast buffet is quite good - fresh fruits, eggs, made to order omelets, rice, bacon/sausage, potatoes, assorted pastries, cold cereal, several different juices to choose from and you can go back for more if you are still hungry.Nice pool but really crowded this time (our last visit was in spring, not summer). Visited the exercise room twice - nice selection of equipment but I wish there was some floor mats to do some stretching and floor exercises. The business center was convenient also with several computers and a couple of printers - great for checking in on line for our flight home. If you are planning to do laundry while at the hotel, buy your laundry detergent and dryer sheets across the street at the ABC Store. And bring lots of quarters! Wash is $2.50 a load and drying is $2.25 for 36 minutes.Only wish the daily parking wasn't $30.00 a day!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed here with my husband and 2 kids (ages 2, 5) for 2 nights in an Ocean View 1 bedroom suite, 2 queens in bedroom + full-sized pullout in sitting room.PROSCheck in was easy and staff polite. Excellent bell-boy, knowledgable of hotel, room, etc.Suite was very roomy, We had plenty of room for luggage, pack'n'play, toys, etc. Excellent bathroom - roomy, 2 sinks, very nice soaps/shampoos/lotions. Table & 4 chairs for eating, kitchenette with sink, fridge & microwave.Hotel was filled with families, which was good since we had 2 small kids with us.Breakfast was excellent - make to order food as well as buffet with eggs, bacon, sausage, fresh fruit, cereal, breads, multiple juice choices. And the miso soup was great too!Managers reception at night was good. Line was long at times, but moved quickly. They had a live band the 2nd night we were there, playing "beach" type music.Beach access was easy - just across the street and not a far walk.Roy's is in the bottom level - EXCELLENT restaruant. I'll do a separate review, but I cannot say enough about the food, service, and how well they treated our children. Highly recommended, date night or with your family.The manager came and spoke to us during breakfast, and even gave us innertubes for the kids that were leftover from other guests. Location is great - you can walk to so many things, and many shops in Waikiki area.Large pool with spa, was cleaner than many I've been in that are so crowded (see CON below). CONSOcean View - I realize that it's not a "beachfront" hotel, but I don't consider a partial oceanview as "Oceanview". We paid more for the view... and it was just OK. Mostly had a view of the Trump hotel next door, and overlooked the Embassy Suites pool/patio area. Not sure I'd upgrade if I stayed there again... wasn't really worth it.The 2 small balconies were pretty small. Would have been nice to have had just one long one versus two short ones. But on the PRO side, they were still nice to sit out on day and night.Beach in front of Outrigger (closest beach access) was tiny. And crowded. Nice view of Diamondhead, but this alone might be reason enough not to stay here, unless you are willing to walk much further down the beach to find a less-crowded spot. We visited many popular beaches while in HI (Lanikai, Pipeline, Hale Koa) and this was by far the least enjoyable.Pool was VERY crowded most of the day. Morning just after opening was about the only good time to go. Chairs 1st row around the pool were hard to come by, but otherwise chairs were accessible.Hotel was noisy most of the time - peopel above us stomped around at 4am waking us up, people inthe hall were very loud. But... I guess expected in a family-friendly hotel...bring your earplugs!The overcrowded pool & poor beach were probably the major cons, but overall we were happy with our stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The hotel is in a great location, only a couple of minutes walk from the beach and the rest of Waikiki. The pool is not the biggest but adequate as the sea is so good for swimming! Hotel and rooms very clean, with comfortable beds and useful features with the fridge, coffee machine and microwave. Very good space in the rooms and the balcony is useful and is big enough to sit outside. The complimentary cocktails and nibbles at the evening managers reception and the breakfasts are a great plus of this hotel - both were very good very much enjoyed. The 24hr gym is a bonus, and the laundry room facilities are reasonable and very useful. All in all a very nice hotel and would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel is in a prime location - walking distance to almost everything. Right across the street from hotels that are on the beach - very close to beach. There are shops and restaurants all around the Embassy Suites. One day, we saw a hula show right outside the hotel - it was lovely. Yes it is in a busy area and even though we were on the top floor (great view), I could still hear the buses and trucks outside. This was not too bothersome at night as the activity slows down. Anyway, this kind of noise does not bother some people. For early morning, if you are a late sleeper and if bringing a loud masking sound device such as a small turbo fan or sound machine, and wearing earplugs works for you, then stay here. With those two items, I was able to sleep well. Beds were very comfortable. Lobby is open air and shares space with the drive up. So, cars, taxis, and vans drive in and out all day. Tour buses pull up in the street right along the side. The lobby space is nice but would not be a place to just sit and relax and look at a view. Check in was quick and they give you a glass of tropical fruit drink to enjoy during the process. They also keep cold, fruit-infused, water available in the lobby. There is a person manning an activites desk to help you book activities and also to give general information about the area. Breakfast was nice each morning in an open air space with many birds flying/hopping around and trying to pick up crumbs. No waffles, but they serve pancakes every other day. They also offer omelets and fried or scrambled eggs every day. Happy hour is good if you drink alcohol but the snacks were things such as pretzels, goldfish, potato chips with onion dip. Not much to talk about there. Pool is nice but a little small, crowded and not what you would call a "resort pool." Hot tub but was good but crowded like the pool. Laundry facility was nice to be able to use and only a tad pricey. The Hula tower is closer to the beach and has the best views. The ground flood of this tower, where the elevators stop, is open to the public (not closed in) but you have to have a card key to get off at any floor so that provides security. Right around the corner from these elevators is a Coco Cove convenience store which we frequented for such things as milk, snacks, etc. Very handy. All in all, we would stay here again and really enjoyed the beautiful view and excellent location.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My husband, four daughters (aged 15-to25) and I stayed at this lovely hotel in July for 7 nights. We sourced this hotel as we wanted suites/apt style accomodation so we had the space without having to book three rooms so we bookd a one bedroom suite and a two bedroom suite. On arrival we all received a lovely refreshing fruit punch drink. The checkin process was efficient. Even though checkin time wasn't until 3pm, both of our suites were made available straight away (12noon) which was great after our overnight flight in. The happy hour /managers reception each day was great. Compliementary drinks including spirits and snacks was always a great way to get together after a busy day shopping or relaxing day on the beach or by the pool before heading out to dinner. Some nights they had entertainment to which was enjoyable and added to the atmosphere. Lots of good shopping and restaurants close by, and not too far to main street shopping. Beach was only a short walk one block. Every was very handy including the shuttle bus landing at the Sheraton to pick up tour buses. The buffet style breakfast each day was great - lots to choose from, including fresh made omelettes to order. Beds were very comfy. Only down side was that my husbands and my room was right next to the lifts so it was noisy until about 11pm with lift traffic, and then again in the mornings from about 7am so it was hard to sleep in if you wanted to.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My family tries to do at least one or two "staycations" a year. Usually over longer weekends. This year's choice was embassy suites for the 4th of July weekend. We had two, 2 bedroom suites to accomodate our large family. The rooms were clean, always well kept, and big enough for everyone to stay and still feel comfortable. Everyone had more than enough room to go move around. It came with complimentary breakfast and a manager's reception. The breakfast had a very diverse menu and even an omlette station. the fruits were always fresh, and the meats, eggs, and other breakfast items were very delicious. the manager's reception was just as good. Lots of variety in the snack department, and plenty of drink for everyone. The kids had fun at the pool, and the close proximity to the heart of waikiki made it easy for us to just take the kids on a short walk to teddy bear world, or shopping. Overall, it was great fun. we'll definitely be back.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Spent four nights with wife and teenage son. Just a block from beaches (very crowded, but that's to be expected), but not abig deal for us because we were there for touring Arizona Memorial and shopping. We weren't disappointed. Lots of restaurants for all budgets, lots of shops on Beachwalk and more shopping malls within easy walking distance. If you want great seafood, go to Roys on site - expensive but food is absolutely wonderful (try the special pineapple martini for a kick). For steaks, go to Ruths Chris on site. Only problem we had was they put us in a handicap accessible room on first night with full-size beds across from elevators, not the queen -size beds away from elevators that I reserved/requested months before our visit. Moved us on second day to room with queen size beds (but still across hall from elevators) - fine from then on. Also, parking is valet only at $30/day. Understandable in crowded city location. Just think about NOT renting car for entire stay. Everything you need is right by hotel and you could rent car for one day to do the tourist stuff if you don't want to take cabs or buses (Arizona Memorial and Battleship Missouri are must sees). Valets and porters are uniformly friendly and attentive - reflects well on hotel. We ate at the daily breakfast - excellent. We didn't use pool or attend the manager's later afternoon get-together, but it looked okay in passing (long lines for the free drinks, though). We'd definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Excellent service and friendly staff. When I go back, I will stay here again! I love Embassy Suites. Awesome musical trio during the manager's reception.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is my second year staying at this location. I absolutely love this hotel! Great location, breakfast is always good and the managers special is just as good. It amazes me what hasn't changed in a year (employees). The same bartenders for managers special, same entertainment for managers special also. It is good to see a familiar face.This year we stayed on the 5th floor right next to the elevator and it was nerve wrecking hearing the "ding" every time the elevator was called , every time it reached its destination, and every time it was on level 4 which is the floor you get off to go to breakfast, swim and managers reception. The best floor is 4th floor but not next to the elevator. You hear the actual mechanics of the elevator going up and down. The location can not be beat. I've stayed at the Hilton Hawaiian Village in 2007 which was a nice spot but you cant beat what you get for the price at Embassy Suites. If you have kids, you can not go wrong. I will back at this same location same time next year and I cant wait!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Highly recommend this hotel. Stayed here for a weekend with two other mother/daughters, after several days staying solo at a nearby Ramada. We had reserved the least expensive room available, but were given the option to wait an additional two hours to check in (still ahead of normal check-in time) and we ended up with an ocean and mountain/city view on the top floor. Centrally located, such that the teenagers in the group were able to go out by themselves to shop and easy beach access despite not being beach-front.. The staff was super friendly and the room was very clean. Tons of towels were brought to the room and the bellman gave us lots of tips about restaurants and car rental places.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We usually stay on the north shore but this time we decided to mix it up. We had great time. The hotel is at the beginning of Waikiki at the new beach walk. Crowded but not to bad. We loved the breakfast each morning in the dining area, Hawaiian music playing was a nice touch. We walked everywhere and rented a car for one day. The evening reception was the only negative but it was free so really can't complain, though the cheezits were pretty lame for the embassy suites.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The breakfast buffet and happy hour reception is a great value for large families or groups looking to save some money. Use it every day and you can get stuffed and drunk for the same price you're paying for the room anyways!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I have never written a hotel review before, but this was great. We're not used to 5 star treatment like a Conrad or a Ritz Carlton or something, but this Embassy Suites has great people and facilities and felt like a 5 star to us.Positives-Clean (met my wife's standards)-Our room had ocean view on between Outrigger Reef Hotel and Trump Hotel. Beautiful-Accepted Hilton hhonors points-Free breakfast with 3 1/2 hour window to eat. Scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, miso soup, rice, cereal, breads, cook to order omelettes, fruit, etc. I don't know how anyone could complain about this. It does get busy between 9-10am but we ate early.-Nightly snack reception. Long line for alcohol, but snacks and soft drinks fast and easy with decent entertainment some nights-Every person we interacted with was courteous and polite. This doesn't happen without good management and being a decent place to work.-Check in was sit down and have a glass of pineapple juice. Set the relaxed mood from the beginning-Concierge service found us a rental car a few blocks away when nothing was available online. We didn't need a car for most of the days, but went to the north shore a couple of days. Decided last second. Also Hertz across the street at Outrigger Reef hotel but rental desk closes really early and late dropoff is only available for their guests-Valet parking team hustles to get your car-Cab from airport about $35, most things were in walking distance so we only rented a car a couple of days-Reasonable oceanside lunch at the Shorebird across the street in the Outrigger Reef hotel. Beachwalk shopping on Lewer st. behind the hotel has many food options. -Ocean and Beach across the street has public access through Fort DeRussy park and is great. Not as busy as Kuhio beach like you see as waikiki beach on TV, but you can walk down the beach if you prefer packed beaches.-On hhonors points, it was a great deal for 3-4 years of saving up points. Even at full price for a family of four the huge morning breakfast and evening snack offset some of the cost.-Overall, the people here helped made it our best vacation everVery minor negatives-Weak wireless internet in room, service kept dropping or blocking access (better downstairs on 4th floor reception lanai). The also had a business center with a printer I used to print our return boarding passes, but had to wait quite a while on teens checking facebook (not hotel's fault) and the computers are very slow-Parking is $30 per day which seemed kind of high to me, but it is Hawaii I guess (contributed to us not having a car all the time, but we didn't really need one)This was close enough to the busy places, but far enough away to seem quieter. Across from the beach, but only 2 minutes away. Access to some great restaurants within a block. The hotel staff made the stay exceptional.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was an outstanding hotel in the heart of the city. Just a short walk to everything. We has a 2 bedroom suite tih a little ocean view which had more that enough room for the 6 of us. I would have to say that the breakfast and evening drinks is one of the best features. The pool and the eating area is outstanding very large area. The breakfast sometimes had lines but not a very long wait for your food. The hotel staff was always friendly and very helpful. I would recommend this hotel for anyone especially if you have a good size family.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My family stayed here for 10 days in June. We had a great two bedroom suite on the 16th floor that was roomy and comfortable. It was a great experience from the moment we arrived. The welcoming reception staff offered fruit juices upon arrival which was very welcome after a long overnight flight. We did not have to wait to get into our room even though it was earlier that check-in time. The wonderful Greg who unloaded our bags from the airport shuttle, waited while we booked in and then took us and our bags to our room, delivering each bag to its preferred location. He was a refreshing change from the norm and a delight. The service in this hotel is beyond all expectations, from the friendly bar staff to the housekeeping. The rooms are well maintained and the hotel clean and well appointed. It is located in the best area too with terrific shops just downstairs which rival the huge shopping complex nearby. The beach is just a short stroll away and this is good because it is far too crowded around the hotels there. It was a great hotel for families and the consierge desk was very helpful too with trips and activities. I cannot fault this hotel but if I had to pick one thing, I would suggest they consider having a kids club. My seven year old granddaughter would have enjoyed her stay even more if this had been available. As it was, we were very busy during the day but if we return in the future it would be a great bonus. We will definately do this by the way!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed in Embassy Suites for 3 days. it is a great place which is in the midst of the waikiki beach walk area which has tons of shops, restaurants and parks. It is about a block from the beach. We checked in at 8:00 PM in the night and was welcomed with a welcome drink. We got a partial ocean view room with patio in the 11th floor and it was great. The breakfast was excellent and it was on a lanai close to the pool. The reception staff was very helpful and the bell captain was awesome in pointing to many events that happen in the waikiki area and around. (We did not buy any tour packages from the hotel. ). The parking is expensive ( $30/ day) but then it is expensive anywhere in the beach area. There are couple of malls nearby about 1/2 a block and tons of restaurants about a block from th hotel.The hotel is very clean, staff is very courteous and great breakfast are the highlights.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: While this hotel is in a great location and the staff are excellent that is about all the good I can say. We were very disappointed with the room size. It is not a two bedroom apartment by Australian standards and we hated the "free" breakfast so much we only went once. The endless queuing and use of trays made me feel like I was in a cafeteria back in the 60s. The managers reception was once again a very long queue which we never joined. If you enjoy queuing and taking advantage of freebies then this is the hotel for you. If you are after a bit of class and room to move both in your room and in the pool, go elsewhere.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My family and I stayed for one week and I was pleasantly surprised for how great this place was. Originally we worked with AAA for a place to stay and they indicated that all hotels for our family would require two bedrooms since I had three young children. However since they are ages 11, 8 and 4, I had a hard time believing this and so I started calling hotels on my own and the Embassy Suites said that I could book a one bedroom that had two queen beds with a pull out sofa which would accomodate our needs and would immediately save $1,000-$1,500 vesus what the travel agent was telling us, so it became a no brainer to do the work myself and book the Embassy suites.In comparing hotels to book with one bedroom sutes, I knowingly booked this hotel with the $30 per day parking rate because I knew that on a total cost basis it was still a better comparative rate with those with free parking. I believe that across the street there was a local car rental place so if you want you can probably rent a car when needed. But if you plan on staying only in the Waikiki beach walk area, then you don't need a car and the main areas of shopping and the beach are all within walkable distance or you can easily take a cab or trolley. We were able to get a room on the 11th floor with an ocean view and it looks like each room has a balcony, which my children enjoyed eating snacks on while relaxing. The internet is free if you bring a computer as we did, but nonetheless they have a business center with internet access which is open 24 hours a day, and printing capabilities that is included for guests so this is terrific for those that don't want to carry a computer. The exercise room has several machines and free weights so anybody can get a good work out in this facility, and the laundry room is a great added convenience. Since we were there for one week, when we used it on Friday is wasn't a problem getting a washing machine but it was more busier during the week. The only downside that I saw was that the sleeper sofa isn't as comfortable as a bed, but with the three children I have slept in many sofa sleepers on vacations and it is no worse than most.The housekeeping was excellent as they cleaned out room well and provided us with plenty of towels. The breakfasts are a great time saver and added value, and the they try to vary the menu somewhat between pancakes, french toast, biscuits and gravy, etc. each day in addition to the standard eggs, bacon, sausage, fruits,etc. that they have every day too. In addition, for the daily evening reception the snacks are just items like goldfish, chips and crackers, and it is always since to get drinks for only a tip, but on a few nights during the week they provided musical entertainment during the reception and the folks that we watched were quite entertaining.Plus the service of the folks we met at the front desk, employees in the eating areas and walking through the halls were all very friendly and helpful. Overall I have stayed at many hotels during my life which has included some quite fancy ones, but for family value this has been the best place that we have stayed at and the Embassy Suites in Waikiki deserves a great rating, and so whenever we go back to Waikiki this will be the place that we will want to stay at.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed here for 3 nights with extended family and we were all extremely satisfied. The breakfast is excellent with many choices, including a cooked-to-order omelet guy who will also happily cook eggs in any style if you don't want the omelet. For the size of the hotel, we never had to wait long for the breakfast line or happy hour line in the evening. I was happy that the bartenders poured a true drink and did not try to skimp on the alcohol. Everyone at the hotel had a smile on their face and were happy to serve. We opted to not have our room cleaned each day and the maid was still happy to give us extra towels or anything else we needed. As for our room, we had a 1-bedroom suite with a huge balcony that was nice to use in the evening while enjoying a drink and the views. We also took advantage of the fridge and were happy to see that it actually kept our drinks cold! We've been to many hotels where they don't work, so having one that works is always positive. The pool and hot tub were also very nice. Location is wonderful - short walk to a few beaches and many restaurants and shops. No matter what side of the hotel you are on, there is likely an ABC Store within 30 yards. If I had to pick something negative, I guess I could say that the elevators were often extremely slow, but it's hardly anything that would ruin your experience.I would definitely stay here again and highly recommend it to anyone.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Beautiful pool and welcoming staff. We were served juice upon arrival which hit the spot after an 11 hour flight. The ammenities continued throughout our stay. The gym was had plenty of equipment and free weights. The staff was helpful and always smiling. housekeeping worked really hard. A bit of a walk to the better beaches.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We only stayed at the Embassy Suites because we had gift certficates. I was initially not excited by the thought of staying at a place that I thought was "family friendly" (i.e. nothing but kids running around). The hotel more than exceeded our expectations. The rooms are very sizeable and have all the amentities one could need (coffee maker, microwave, refrigerator, deck, pull out sofa bed). The service was impeccable - everyone was very helpful and friendly. The location is terrific - a 2 minute walk to the beach and a 2 minute walk to the shops. And finally, my favorite features - the free breakfast buffet had lots of selection as did the free happy hour every night! We would definitely stay at this hotel again - it is well worth the money!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed for 3 nights in a 2 bedroom suite. The room was plenty large enough for 5 of us...and having a sitting area and 2 baths was a real plus. The location is good - right on the beach walk....so quick access to shops restaurants and the beach. They upgraded us to a partial ocean view which was nice. Our kids enjoyed the pool and breakfast. The managers reception each night was great...good selection of drinks...no need to find a happy hour.Waikiki is a little too "busy" for our taste, but if we were to come back, we'd stay here.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at the Embassy Suites in Waikiki during an extended family vacation. We booked 2 suites - one for myself, husband and 2 young kids (ages 3 and 4), and another for my parents and sister. We found the hotel amenities worked very well for us - a bedroom with 2 queen beds and a separate living area with a pull out sofa, dining table and chairs, and small kitchenetter (small fridge, microwave and sink - an absolute God-send for us given our kids' young ages). The first day we arrived we took a cab to walmart and stocked up on some milk, snacks and ready made meals that we heated up in the microwave for a quick lunch for the kids. Although not fancy, the room was very clean and comfortable.Breakfast was included and was very good - lots of choice including a full egg/omlette station, cereals, fruits, breakfast meats, patries, etc. There was a manager's reception every evening with free drinks and cocktails (although the cocktails disappeared pretty quick) near the pool, usually with some live entertainment.The pool was great - again, not huge or fancy, but big enough to accomodate all the guests comfortably. The hotel is located on a shopping promenade and it was great to spend the evenings strolling and window shopping - very lively area. Although not on the beach, the hotel was about 3 to 4 blocks away. For those travelling with young kids, walking this distance while lugging all towels, beach toys and other stuff, not to mention your kids, could be a hassle, but we were fortunate as there were so many of us that we could each handle one thing. All in all, this was a good, solid hotel that really worked well for us in terms of room amentities, food and location.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: we had a 2 bedroom suite very good beds, lanai, sitting area small fridge, Perfect location with 2 young adults. Much to day in the mornings and beach in the afternoon. Lots of restaurants and shops. Loved it.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We celebrated our 20th anniversary in Hawaii last summer with a cruise bookended by stays at the Embassy Suites in Waikiki. Wonderful location, wonderful room, wonderful service! Not only are there great shops & restaurants everywhere but the breakfast & nightly Manager's Reception were fantastic. The only slight downside was the noise from the late-night partiers outside. The on-site UPS store was a nice amenity that allowed us to mail souvenirs & extra items back home to avoid lugging them to the airport. The staff was pleasant & efficient. One day we were gone all day, and when we came back we had a note in our room to call the manager to get a special code to open our safe--evidently we had left our safe unsecured with cash, jewelry, cell phones, etc. We got the code, and everything was there. I don't know of a better compliment for a hotel than that. It's so nice knowing you don't have to worry about anything!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at the Embassy suites for eight nights and found the accommodation to be of a very good standard. My travelling party consisted of two adults and a toddler and there was plenty of room for the three of us and our luggage. We received excellent service upon arriving at the Embassy. We hired a vehicle and as soon as we arrived, the porters assisted us with our luggage and directed us to the check in counter. Our room was not available at the time and our luggage was stored until the room became available, which was after 3pm. Valet parking is very efficient and the valets extremely courteous and helpful. Parking costs $30 a day.The room itself was spacious enough for two adults and a toddler. We received an excellent room on the tenth floor which offered views of the pool and Waikiki beach. The room was dark and quiet in the evening. The floor plan consists of a separate bedroom, which we had two queen sized beds and was spacious enough for us to store our luggage. The bathroom was also spacious, providing enough room for two adults to move around. The living area consisted of a sofa, TV, small table with four chairs as well as a small refrigerator, microwave and small sink. Free wifi is also available and was mostly reliable.The location of the Embassy is perfect to all amenities and a short walk to Waikiki beach. It is also well located to the Ala Moana Shopping Centre which is approximately 20-25 minutes brisk walk or you can catch the bus along Kalia Road. Complimentary breakfast is a hot and cold buffet and provides a variety of choices including eggs to order including omelettes, miso soup and a variety of yoghurts and danishes. The assistants are extremely helpful and often will walk around topping up coffee etc. In the evening a ‘Managers Drinks’ is held from 5:30 – 7:30 pm where free drinks and snacks are available including cocktails and spirits. We certainly believe we got value for our money when we stayed and the Embassy Suites and if we are to return to Honolulu, we would definitely return to the Embassy.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We spent 12 fabulous days at the Embassy Suites in Waikiki which are just wonderful. They are modern, clean and kept in pristine condition. The luxury of having that extra space makes a big difference to a long stay.The staff at the Embassy Suites were extremely accommodating and the Food & Beverages Manager (you know who you are Russ Moeai) went that extra mile to make us feel very welcome indeed.You couldn't get a better position for access to the beach, shops and eateries. I have no hesitation recommending you stay at the Embassy Suites for convenience, comfort and value for money.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: From the time my 13 year old granddaughter and I checked into the hotel (at a sit-down check-in desk where you are greeted warmly and given a delightful fruit beverage) , to the minute we got into the shuttle to leave for the airport and home, this hotel experience was much more than we had expected it to be. Our suite was a living room and bedroom and was beautifully furnished and immaculate. Each room had a flat screen TV and there was a game console. There was free wireless internet in our room and we also had occasion to use the business centre, which was very well equipped. which was. We live in Canada and we had complimentary long distance phone calls home (up to 30 minutes....not sure if this is each day or each stay). The bathroom amenities are from Crabtree and Evelyn - nice touch there. A tiny kitchenette has a small fridge and microwave and coffee maker with excellent coffee - not the standard swill! The housekeeping staff were pleasant and gracious and kind. They actually cared if you were happy with your room. The bed was king-size and probably one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in. Our room had a small lanai - not spacious, but outfitted with comfortable chairs and small tables and we have a partial view of the ocean on one side and the city/mountains on the other. Our room, on the 14th floor, was in an excellent location as we experienced no street noise at night or early in the morning.Each morning the complimentary breakfast was served on the 4th floor - near the pool, and offered just about anything you could desire for breakfast and it was fresh and delicious and the choices were numerous and the staff so accommodating. It was also open from 7-10 a.m.; so good for early risers and those who like to sleep in. In the evening there is also a manager's reception that offers music (on some nights); complimentary snacks and drinks. Very pleasant. The pool/hot tub area is surrounded by beautiful palm trees and there is a bar where you can order food/drink and the area is kept spotless. One thing I noticed is that many people came down to swim without towels thinking they would get them near the pool as you do in many hotels. But this hotel has the pool towels on a bottom shelf in the bathroom and there is a note in the room info book that if you do not return the towels to the room, you will be charged for each towel missing. We saw many towels left at the pool and wondered if these guests did not realize they would be charged for these towels and if they received an unexpected charge on their account. There is an activities desk and we found the staff most helpful and very interested in helping you get the excursions you wanted and gave excellent advice on different transportation options. Their knowledge was invaluable. The hotel is very close to the beach. There is a small walk-way just across the street from the hotel (we had to ask where it was - it isn't obvious at first) that will take you right to the beach in three minutes. The hotel is located on the Beach Walk area of Waikiki where there are great shops and restaurants and the whole area has a fun and vibrant feeling to it. It also felt safe, which was important to me as a woman travelling with a young granddaughter.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: loved, loved. loved .the embassy suites ,from the moment we checked in everthing was perfect . our room was fabulous,loved that we had a extra tv and lounge sitting area , with two teenagers its good to have some space ,especially with all our shopping bags !! .....cooked breakfast, fantastic to start the day ,terrific nightly managers happy hour ,loved watching the family entertainment of dancing and music, and enjoyed having a few refreshing cocktails in paradise,kids in the pool , doesnt get anybetter than that .. definetely book for next time ,our 9th visit to waikiki......its the best yet !!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My wife and I spent our 31st anniversary at the Embassy Suites Waikiki. Everything was perfect from the top floor oceanview suite to the location (a few minutes walk from the beach, shopping and dining). The (included) breakfast buffet is excellent and the manager's reception offers a perfect opportunity to relax at the end of the day. The hotel was kind enough to arrange a vow renewal ceremony for us on the Grand Lanai. And our housekeeper, Yuet Chen, was an absolute gem. We would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We choose this hotel on the reputation of hilton. We have stayed at the embassy several times in different locations. Some better than others. From the moment we arrived from the bellman to the valet parkers, housekeeping staff and the servers at the breakfast buffett every person were wonderful to us. . We felt very catered to and the hotel itself is very nice clean and felt upscale. We loved that it is on one of the main streets. A very short walk to the beach and every room has a balcony to look and sit out on. We took walks every morning while it was still dark as the time change for us is three hrs behind and we felt very safe and enjoyed our morning walks. Location is excellent for taxis, city bus and shuttles everywhere for two dollars one way. About three blocks from the international marketplace and the walk is very close. There are alot of restaurants close by, yard house, dennys, pf changs , Ruth's cris is there as well, And Roy's is in the hotel. Would recommend this hotel highly, The only thing we thought was expensive was onsite parking which is 30 a night but you can find places close by to park for 5 dollars.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our family of 3 arrived early for a 7 night stay, and were told our room wasn’t ready and we couldn’t check in until after 3PM. It was a bit annoying, but as we’d not paid for the extra day we had half expected that to happen. The staff took our luggage and stored it for us, so we could go off and explore the local area. They also gave us a key card in case we wanted to access the pool area during that time. When we eventually checked in we went to our 2 room suite, with 2 balconies, on the 18th floor, with partial ocean views. Mostly though, it looked over the apartments opposite us and the rooftops of surrounding buildings. The bedroom had 2 queen beds, plenty of spare pillows, lots of space to unpack and hang our clothes and a TV. The other room had another TV, dining table (where the PC internet access point was) , couch (which folded out to a bed if you needed it) and an arm chair. In the entrance area was a sink, small bench, small fridge, coffee machine, microwave oven and ice bucket. The coffee, tea, sugar, long life milk and disposable cups were replenished daily. (There were no plates or cutlery in the room for our use though which I thought a bit odd) The bathroom had a shower over a small bath, a toilet and a vanity plus the usual toiletries which were provided daily. There were also plenty of bath and pool towels stored in here. Breakfast in the mornings was always busy and sometimes there was a wait for food to be refilled or the plates to be replenished. Only once did we struggle to find a table to sit at. It was the usual cooked fare plus an omelette/egg station. There were also breads and bakery items, cereals, fresh fruits, juices and coffee & tea. Some of the food even changed daily. The evening drinks and snacks were usually quite busy too. We only ventured there twice as were usually still out and about at that time. On one of the occasions we met a gentleman who worked there (I’m thinking from memory, he was the manager of the area?) and he sat with us a while and gave us a wealth of information on things to see & do plus places to eat. He even went off and got us bus routes and timetable printouts. His help was much appreciated . Location wise, it was perfect. When we booked via the net, I was worried it was going to be too far away from the main strip of Waikiki, but once there we realised everything is close and within walking distance. On Lewers Street, which is where the entrance to the tower our suite was in, there were lots of places to eat, plus a Subway and best of all a large ABC store where you could pick up most bits and pieces you might need during your stay (eg: food, toiletries, drinks, souvenirs, etc…) And, the beach was pretty much just across the road and either thru the Outrigger Hotel or down a little pathway next to that. Also, if you exit via the main entrance on Beachwalk Street, there is a cheap car hire place just opposite, which we used and found good value. If you want to save the $30.00 per night to park in the hotel, you can use the post office car park in the next street, by Fort DeRussy Park for $5.00. We enjoyed our stay at the Embassy Suites, and would love to return someday soon.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My family (wife, 2yo daughter and I) stayed here for 10 nights. Check-in was okay but, as expected, it was not possible to check-in before lunchtime. (This is an issue for those travelling from Australia as the flights arrive at about 9:00am.)The room (510) was exactly like that in the website photos. Cleanliness standards were very good and the beds are comfortable. The curtains are very effective in black-out mode. The air-con is good. The free internet access is okay but there is no wifi in the rooms.A big factor in selecting this hotel was the complimentary breakfast and the evening cocktail reception. The breakfast is more than adequate but not very exciting after a few days. There are some good healthy options and the fruit was excellent. The made-to-order omelettes were fine.The evening manager's reception was pretty good too. The standard of wine and cocktails was very good indeed. The snacks are just chips, pretzels and salsa. Often there is free entertainment too. The regular Hawaiian band is pretty damn good and there is also some traditional dancing.The hotel pool is very good - especially for smaller kids. Cleanliness was excellent. There was no problem with overcrowding while I was there.On the down side, the room service menu is very limited and the one meal we ordered was very ordinary. However, the hotel is located immediately above some excellent restaurants - so you don't have to walk far to get a quality meal.I've been to about 5 reasonably priced hotels in the Waikiki area and this is the one I will come back to.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My husband and I visited Oahu for 6 days in early June and chose to stay at Embassy Suites and we are very happy we did. I considered almost every other hotel in the area and chose ES because of the location and the extras they provide. I am sure there were other hotels in the area that were fancier and that were directly on the beach, but there was basically nothing wrong with our stay. The beds were comfortable, it was nice to have the separate living space with mini-fridge and microwave, and it was very convenient to have breakfast there. The breakfast was actually really good and they had a few different things each day for those that like to switch it up. We were in the tower that was closest to the beach and lucked out getting an ocean view on the 5th floor-it was amazing-we could see the ocean from our couch! We printed a few things while we were there and it was very easy to use their business center. The free internet worked when we were plugged in, but we were unable to get the wi-fi in our room. As for the location, the beach is a 5 minute walk and all of the shopping and restaurants are literally steps outside your door! The only issue we had was that they didn't come clean our room on our second to last day and we were gone for quite some time that morning/afternoon. We called down and were brought up more towels within 5-10 minutes. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone looking for a nice, convenient, comfortable hotel with a great location and lots of extras!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed recently for our honeymoon the staff us friendly and very helpful. We were list and driving around in circles I called the hotel and the front desk clerk stayed on the phone with me until we pulled in to the hotel what a way to start the stay service with a smile going above and beyond to make you feel welcolme and like family!!!!! Breakfast each morning was delicious. Location was very convienent to shops and dining. After a long day of sure seeing so nice to get back to the hotel for a relaxing drink. Rooms were very clean and beds ate very comfortable. Can't wait to go back to Hawaii for our anniversary

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Reserved a room with king-size bed. The room we got was buried in a back corner under the pool---so there was a constant motor noise rattling the room. We asked for a room change. After the requested 4 hour wait, the hoped-for room did not come forth. As a result we received an fantastic upgrade--from floor 2 to floor 20---and with a great view. Embassy came through in spades.The only complaint was the check-in area which is shared with the drive-in garage. Noisy, exhaust odor, and since we sit four feet across the desk from the person who checks you in, the environment makes hearing difficult...and there is a PC screen between you and the hotel staff person. The room staff was excellent--be sure to reward them, they do go the extra mile. Overall, ES was an excellent choice for us, and dining on the beach is only a short walk away. Also, request the surf tower.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is a basic embassy suites hotel. Breakfast is great, the managers reception is fine. There are about 3 choices of snacks and only drinks on the rocks. They pride themselves on pouring them strong no doubt.The gentleman at the checkin desk gave us a room on the sixth floor in the aloha tower. He told us it was facing Diamond Head. Well, it may be facing Diamond Head but our view is squarely into the surrounding hotels. Good lord, we might as well be in any large city in the mainland--Philly, San Fran, etc. Take the advice of other travelers and get into the Hula tower--high up!The other travelers alerted us that the beach could be accessed through the Outrigger across the street--that's the easiest way to do it. It is $30 a day to park. You also can only go up and down in the elevator if you insert the key card to your room.We had a FABULOUS house keeper Nu Yang who kept our room spotless and well supplied with soap, shampoo, and conditioner which we appreciated. Hats off to her!After getting the poor view and feeling like we were in any large city on the mainland, we would not stay here again. We'd pay more and stay on the beach.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is my 3rd time at this amazing hotel. What other Waikiki hotel offers free hot breakfast, free Internet, and all rooms are suites? There isn't one! Will continue to go back every year!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is my 3rd time at this amazing hotel. What other Waikiki hotel offers free hot breakfast, free Internet, and all rooms are suites? There isn't one! Will continue to go back every year!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I stayed here with a group of girlfriends in February. The Embassy Suites was great - spacious and comfortable and close to everything. The breakfast was fresh and tasty and the cocktail hour fun and appreciated. We had a lovely time and I would go back. However on the downside - we arrived after a long haul flight to quite possibly the rudest front desk person I have ever come across. She could not have been more unhelpful, and we did not get to check in until 3pm. I would advise anyone travelling a long distance to book a room for an extra night, as despite assurances via email and phone calls earlier we were not able to get an earlier check-in. This would have been understandable if even once, the staff member had expressed a hint of apology or kindness! Also, we thought we had booked an ocean view room, and it was not. Apparently there is no link between bookings and front desk as they would not/could not help us out at all and said it was our fault (we suspect the hotels booking site had a problem as when we booked we assumed we were getting Ocean View as the room was more expensive that a Partial Ocean View).

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Embassy Suites is exactly what I hoped for. From check in to check out, service was great. I couldn't have asked for better. Room was upgraded to partial ocean view without an extra charge, the breakfast buffet was absolutely delicious. Concierge was very helpful and the managers reception was nice and entertaining. Rooms were spacious and very clean and the price was good. The only thing that could have made it even better for me is if they had firmer pillows. Otherwise, everything was perfect. A great time was had at the Embassy Suites. Will definitely book here again if I'm in the Waikiki area.Mahalo

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: First, the hotel was wonderful. We loved our stay and I would give it five stars on everything except for two serious points - the conceierge and front desk fell short.First, the negatives. The front desk had one person who was less than friendly. She must be the same one as in other reviews because everyone else was great. The second issue with the desk - one day after shopping, my husband and son, loaded down with bags, got back to the room to find his key wasn't working (I was returning our rental car and wasn't there for this). A housekeeper called down to the desk and they said they were sending someone up. My husband waited 15 minutes and no one came so he had to troop with our 2.5 year old and tons of bags back down to get new keys. No apology, no explanation of why no one ever showed up. It would have been fine if they had told him he had to come down, but not just not show up was a pain.Finally, the concierge - OMG - USELESS unless you are buying one of the tours they want to sell you and prepare to be hard-sold for stuff that might not be what you want. But need to find a local kid-friendly restaurant, a certain store, or anything not in their Expeida training (the conceirge is owned by Expedia) and they are utterly useless. Utterly. If you have a hotel in a tourist destination, you really need a concerige that can do more than sell tours to Pearl Harbor and luaus. Now - the good.First - the room - 1428 Hula Tower. FANTASTIC! Excellent partial beach view from the lanais. Plenty of space for a messy family of three. My husband noticed the truck noise in the morning but I slept through it completely and I never sleep through it. Also - we ended up loving the two queen bed setup as our son wanted to sleep with one of us from about 1am on and it was nice to be able to trade that off. Note that the hotel does not have pack n plays but they had cribs that my 36" tall 30 lb toddler fit in fine. And the room was SPOTLESS every day despite the pounds of sand we dragged in from the beach every day. Friendly and lovely housekeeping -they were amazing. A couple of tips - the bell staff has a closet full of boogie boards, floats, chairs, buckets and shovels, and all sorts of other free beach gear. They just ask you give it back or pass it on. All free. And if you want wireless in your room, you can ask for a router that plugs in on the dining table in the room - you can keep it the entire stay and it's free and gets a good signal. Oh, and room service was FAST and the burgers were really good as were the salads. However, the hotel was only 85% full when we were there so it might be slower when the hotel is more full. We however did order at various times of day and always got great service from them. Second - the manager's reception. OMG - the drinks. Yummy and stroooong. Get the Hawaiian Punch if you want to go Island. The Mai Tais are also awesome. Oh, and you can easily take drinks up to the room. I would go down and get our drinks while my husband put our son down for the night, then we'd sip them out on the lanai.Third - the location - WONDERFUL!!! Seriously, closer to the beach than some of the towers at Hilton Hawaiian Village. As for walking through the alleyway - can't figure out why anyone would do that. Simply go through the Outrigger. It's what the bell guys told us to do and it was perfect. Also - when you get to that beach, rent chairs and Umbrellas from Steve at the rental stand there. 1/2 the price of the umbrellas anywhere else. He is AWESOME! He gave us beach toys and a boogie board. He's the nicest guy and actually is the person who we ended up using as our advice person on where to go.Yes, the beach does have rocks, but swim shoes take care of that, and it's lovely. It just got voted the third best beach in the entire U.S. And the restaurants right there are good too. As for non-beach stuff - you can walk to anything you'd want to. It's right by the serious shopping, HHV is just up the beach, Dukes is the other way up the beach, there are good restaurants in the building, what more could you want? We loved it. Our son wanted to stay up late every night to go see the fire (torches) on the main streets at night, and we loved all the free music events all around the area. Overall - we will visit again, without a doubt. We had a wonderful stay and with the exception of the minor desk and conceierge glitches, we loved it.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel was great! They have an hour or 2 of free drinks a night. Every morning they have a pretty good breakfast. Beds were comfortable. Hotel was clean. I just thought it was an overall great hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I have been reading the other reviews and they basically are all in agreement that this is a great property is a nice area of Waikiki. The location is close to shopping, restaurants and the beach. The rooms are clean. spacious and the staff is very accomodating. The only problem we had was the hideabed was not comfortable for our daughter who traveled with us. The king bed was very comfortable.The fresh juice upon check in was a nice touch. The complementary breakfast was exceptional--very fresh and alot of variety. We only stayed 3 nights as our main destination was Maui. We did not get a rental car so we arranged for a tour to Pearl Harbor which picked us up at the hotel. One day we walked to the beach and paid to rent chairs and an umbrella. We were not impressed with the beach as it had coarse sand and alot of pebbles. There were alot of rocks in the water which you had to avoid. This was our first trip to Honolulu and we do not plan to return. Altho the Embassy Suites was outstanding, the traffic in Honolulu is horrible-- Bumper to bumper on our way to the airport. Make sure you leave plenty of time and take an earler shuttle if it is prime time for travel in the city.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My husband and I traveled to Oahu with our 2 young children (ages 3 and 5) for 9 days based heavily on the reviews on this site for the Embassy Suites. We were not disappointed. Upon arrival, we were greeted by a friendly bell staff and escorted to the front desk where Jay greeted us with cold drinks and quickly checked us in. We were booked in a city view room on the 10th floor. After spending a brief period of time in the room, we decided to see if an upgrade was available with ocean views (this room offered no views) and called the front desk. Jay highly recommended an oceanview room on the 20th floor in the adjacent tower. The $50 a night upgrade we spent for this room was the best money spent on our trip- what a difference this room made! The living area was much larger and there were 2 separate sliding doors leading to the balcony (one looked directly at the ocean, the other was of the ocean and city views), as well as a 3rd door to the city/ocean view balcony from the bedroom. Rooms were clean and comfortable with flat screens in both the living room and bedroom (no DVD player). The beds were comfortable and the bathroom was spacious. The wet bar featured a small fridge, microwave, sink and coffee maker. A very pleasant surprise was our housekeeper, Yuet, who was phenomenal. Every day in the hall she greeted us by name and she was so friendly and accommodating- always asking if we needed anything and giving us plenty of towels for the beach and extra coffee when she noticed that we drank all that she put in the room. However, on the days she had off, housekeeping was much different as our room was still not cleaned by late afternoon and it was mediocre at best on those days (coffee wasn't replaced, floors were not vacuumed, seemed like making beds and putting towels in were the only thing done those days). Yuet was a big part of making our stay more comfortable and we left her a nice tip at the end of our stay to show our appreciation. We were concerned about the distance to the beach from the hotel but this was not a problem at all - the beach is directly across the street and a very quick and easy walk. Breakfast service was very efficient with the large crowds, and the buffet offered a large selection of fresh fruit, traditional American style breakfast items as well as a few Japanese items (miso soup and rice). It was very well staffed and tables were cleared quickly. The manager's reception was also done quite well - the bartenders (Dennis was a favorite) were very friendly and poured strong drinks. The bar is directly next to the pool so kids can swim close by during the reception and there are plenty of tables and chairs surrounding this area so it never felt crowded. I do not recommend the room service. The food was not good and pizza arrived badly burned one night (our front desk friend Jay promptly removed the charge). However, there are plenty of nice restaurants located in the hotel (Ruth's Chris, Roy's) and others very close by, so if you're staying in for the night it's worth a quick run over to a nearby restaurant for carry out. The best are the tiny Japanese restaurants within a block of the hotel which were so small the front desk staff didn't even know about them- wondeful, authentic food if you're looking for something off the beaten path and out of the crowded, commercialized restaurant world of Waikiki. The international market is a fun culinary scene too (about a 10 minute walk from the hotel). This is definitely a family hotel, so if you do not wish to be amongst a pile of kids in the pool, this may not be the hotel for you, but if you are traveling with young children who have fun making new friends it is a great option. The staff is friendly, the hotel is clean and comfortable, and is a great value for this type of property- we were very pleased with our stay and would definitely recommend it.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Just spent 7 days at Embassy Suites. Hotel staff friendly, Ocean View room had an ocean view, beds comfortable and service was good. Kitchenette is very basic, fridge & microwave. No cutlery or plates, cups etc. Breakfast included in the room tariff was satisfactory, and manager reception each evening was good.With the door to the balcony open there is quite a lot of street noise, but fine with it closed. Overall value for money was very good. Close to all of the good bits of Waikiki, plenty of restaurants and shops nearby. Beach one block away. I would stay in this hotel again, and will as a stopover between USA and Australia to break up the flight. As a destination however 7 days in Waikiki is enough, no plans to return as a holiday destination.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The embassy suites Waikiki is perfect for a family of 4-5 to stay. If your traveling for your honeymoon or romantic 1 on 1 vacation it wouldn't be for you. First off I stay at Hilton brand hotels on average over 60 times a year so with that said I would def stay this embassy is cleaner then most. The rooms are fresh and new feeling still and the location was they main sell, besides being able to cash out my Hilton honors points for all 7 nights! The 5 of us in my party stayed in the hula tower 2bedroom suite on the 15th floor. It wasn't called an ocean view but you can still see the ocean over roof tops from the balcony. The beach is a 2 min 1 block walk away and def wasn't disappointed with that. As all embassy suites offer free breakfast and happy hour drinks, it did save us alot of money.The pool is small and so is the sun deck. If your looking for a place with a huge pool try the Hilton village. If I was traveling alone or with one person I would opt to stay at the Hilton, But at the same time you got to love how easy it is to able to walk right out of the hotel and be in front of the ABC store for your everyday needs, & a block from EVERYTHING else! 30 bucks a day to valet! 210 a week! I spent 218 total for my rental car so the fact I paid just as much to park it was a complete rip off! But what are u gonna do its WaikikiBottom line Great place for families, and overall good value. I would consider staying again in future.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We loved this place. Having spent 17 nights on a cruise ship travelling from Sydney to Honolulu, it was great having the space of a suite. We had lovely views of Waikiki, from our ocean view room on the 18th floor of the Hula Tower with two balconies.On arrival at about 9.00 am, we were told our room would not be ready until 3.00 pm but as we were only staying for two nights, we had planned to get out and about anyway so this wasn't an issue, The receptionist staff were friendly and helpful :). We were given a key to get to the pool deck on arrival because the room wasn't ready, and we were even invited to have some breakfast (we had already eaten on the ship but it was a nice welcoming gesture).The suite was great - the bed and sofa bed were very comfortable, lovely balconies, two tvs etc. Having come off a cruise ship without guest laundry facilities, I really appreciated the 24 hour guest laundry. We didn't really have a chance to get the free breakfast because we were out early both mornings (tour to Pearl Harbour and leaving for the airport) and it would have been good to have breakfast open from 6.15 rather than 6.30 am, but this is not a big issue.We loved the manager's reception and the great entertainment - as we had limited time, it was nice to soak up a bit of Hawaiin culture right in our hotel! I'm not surprised Embassy Suites is rated highly by the reviews on tripsadvisor. It was good value, great location, very comfortable accommodation, good facilities and great attitude from the staff.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Had just come from a 5 star resort in Maui so arrived here with some trepidation not really knowing what to expect. How surprised we all were! From the moment we arrived - with drinks on arrival - the personal service and friendliness of the entire staff is to be applauded. Our room (we had a suite) - two rooms joined by a common lounging area with small kitchen - was perfect for the four of us travelling together - and had great balconies as well. The breakfast was terrific and the Manager';s Reception of an afternoon from 5-30 to 7.30 with free drinks (anything!!) and nibbles was great.For the purposes of this visit I could not fault this hotel EXCEPT for the very ordinary gymnasium that they have. The gym is hot, oppressive and is a bit like a dungeon - was much nicer to run down to the beach anyway!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was definitely one of the best hotels I have ever been to!My family and I all love Embassy Suites, so when we found out there was one in Waikiki, we had to book! We arrived that day to have our car doors opened for us with smiles all around. When we came to check in at 11am we didn't expect the room to be ready, but, viola it was! A great bonus was while checking in, all 4 of us got given a Hawaiian fruit cocktail (Non alcoholic! ;) ) Very speedy check in!Before we arrived we had requested an ocean view room (which we got :D ) it was amazing, huge lounge, average embassy suites bedroom, and huge bathroom. It's much brighter than most Embassy suites as this one has two towers (Aloha Tower and Hula Tower) not an atrium. Breakfast was great, cooked to order Omelettes, Pancakes (only on select days), A few Japanese dishes, and bacon and egg ect. Very nice, you could sit underneath a roof or sit outside in the nice warm fresh air, but it does get a little windy so don't loose any napkins! The hotel is a 3-5 minute walk to the beach, and is located right on Waikiki beach walk which has a lot of shops (which I will explain in more detail at the end of the review)The pool area is very nice, quite quiet in the morning but it gets very very busy during the evening! The hot tub at the pool is very nice but very hot!I thoroughly recommend staying at this hotel as it has everything you want while staying in Hawaii! :DWaikiki beach walk:Very very nice shops, I recommend going to an ABC store as these stores sell great Souvenirs, towels, swimsuits, sun cream, food ect. Also make sure you stop by Honolulu cookie company as the cookies here are AMAZING!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My wife and I stayed here on points. We didn't have a car (rented one for a day only) and our bill on checkout was $0.I always smile when people write (great free breakfast and great free drinks at reception), since all Embassy Suites have these.We requested an upgraded room PRIOR to arrival (quiet, with a view of ocean) and stayed in 1030, a corner suite with a view of the ocean (between the other buildings). The room was high enough that noise from the street and pool area was muted, although you can't escape the trash pickup that happens daily in the street below (but in the bedroom, which is a side entrance in this room, we heard little). Room was clean and maid service was excellent. Breakfast was similar to other Embassy Suites (including the #1 in the world in LaVista, NE that I've stayed in). Manager's reception was a notch above, mostly in the food served and the entertainment provided. I was told by another guest (and signage confirmed this), that the reception's food used to be in the breakfast area and was more elaborate. Most nights included multiple choices including fresh vegetables, chips and salsa, and more. Only complaint for breakfast and reception was irregular bussing of tables, and sometimes they weren't wiped down (Embassy Suites doesn't provide an area for you to bus your own table). Location is great, right in the Beachwalk area. Convenient also to buses. We walked the 2.7 miles to Diamond Head the first morning in the pre-dawn, arriving at sunrise. What a great experience. We chose this hotel over HIlton Hawaiian Village based on it being new and providing the breakfast and reception, and our choice was a good one. Great experience.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great breakfast, huge selection, great manager's reception every night. Both save a family a decent amount of money per night. As well, the rooms are huge, the beds comfy, the location excellent, the barsized fridge is handy, etc etc etc! We'd love to stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at the Embassy Suites for 6 nights as part of a holiday from Australia. We arrived at 7am due to the overnight flight, and unfortunately were not able to get our room until about 1.30pm - I don't think there was much the reception staff could do as the hotel was quite full, but I also wouldn't say he went out of his way to be friendly and helpful, and energy levels were certainly lacking. He also told us he couldn't let us up to the pool floor (travelling with a tired infant, we just wanted to grab some loungers in the shade and rest for a couple of hours) until 10am as the pool didn't open until then - complete rubbish as we were in the pool area by 8am most mornings!Anyhow, once in the room, the stay was nice. Decor is a little dated as with a lot of Waikiki hotels, but room had all amenities and was generally very clean. The pool area is great, especially if you have kids, as is the hot spa tub. Food & beverage service is excellent too.This hotel has three big plus points :1. It is all-suites, which anyone with a baby/toddler will know is an essential!2. Location - you are near everything, close to the beach, main shops, trolley stops, best restaurants/bars and generally nothing is far away3. Complimentary breakfast and manager's drinks : breakfast on the whole is good and the staff are great. Again, if you have kids this is ideal. The manager's drinks is a nice touch; good selection of cocktails, beer, wine etc from 5-7pm, all complimentary. The bar-people are great, and don't expect to have just a dash of alcohol in the cocktails! They also have local bands on 2 or 3 nights and the atmosphere is great.I'd definitely recommend this hotel to other travellers, and we would return ourselves. The only thing I would ask of the hotel management is to shadow your reception staff - generally the staff in this hotel are fantastic and extremely helpful, it's just a pity that the first people the customer meets look so fed-up!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I had previously requested an early check as I was arriving at 10am from Sydney but was told to secure an early check in I would have to pay for the night before. I did not pay the extra but hoped I would be able to get in the room before 3pm. The receptionist on check in was not very helpful and did not create a good first impression of the hotel. I was disappointed to find other guests staying in standard rooms getting their keys much earlier than us but as we had upgraded to an ocean view room we had to wait & wait. Finally getting the keys at 2.30pm. When I did get the keys I was impressed by the room and the views. During my two night stay I found all the other hotel staff helpful and polite. Shame the receptionist could not have a been a bit more polite.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed here for one night before morning flight back to the mainland.The check in process was "welcoming" with desks to sit at and fruit beverages to all. The check in process did take longer than any Hilton-family check in that I can recall (and I've done a lot as a Diamond member) -- as they asked for the names and ages of each of my children (odd) and asked for my AAA card and typed it into their system. The room itself was clean and reasonably well-appointed. At the Embassy Suites we stayed at on this vacation (including this one) we discovered something that actually results in less sleeping arrangement flexibility than desireable when traveling with teenagers -- the rooms with two beds have two DOUBLE beds (not Queen beds) and the Embassy Suites that we stayed at including this one did not have roll-away beds as an option....so two doubles, and a wirey sofa bed. Not ideal for us. Because of the small beds/sofa beds as well as rather loud A/C noise and traffic/street noise, we did not sleep as well as we would have liked.The hotel only has valet parking available which is priced at a steep $30 per night!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is the place to stay when in Waikiki. The rooms are spacious (bed a little soft for me), the free cook to order breakfast is perfect and the location is amazing. It is one block from the beach and right on the Waikiki Beach Walk retail/restaurant area. You can walk the entire length of the beach with more hotels/shopping/restaurants just minutes away. The staff was more than friendly and accomodating. We were upgraded and the balcony view was beautiful. Only a ten minute car ride to Diamond Head. We would stay here again and enjoyed out stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: From the moment I arrived, I was given the royal treatment at Embassy Suites, Waikiki. And I was there on rewards points! When you check in, you don't stand, you are offered a chair. Then someone brings a fluted glass of tropical juice, with iced water with lemon also available nearby. Everything from then on continued to be a pleasure. My one bedroom partial ocean view room had TWO TVs, TWO lanais, a microwave and very comfortable furnishings. The free buffet breakfast was comparable to the ones I paid $15 and more for earlier in the week. They even had great miso soup on tap! Plus serve yourself fine coffee and juice and made to order omelets. I had stayed earlier in the week at a "luxury" hotel on Kalakaua Ave. but felt like my vacation didn't really start until here. I wanted for nothing. I would have stayed the whole week here if I could.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here for 10 nights Feb 17 to 27. We were located in the Hula Tower Oceanfront. This hotel is not located on the ocean but rooms ending in "29 and 30" are on the oceanside of the hotel. You will pay a bit extra for one of these rooms. We were on the 21st floor (top floor) and had a huge wrap around balcony. Only this top unit has the wrap around, lower rooms have 2 seperate balconies. Avoid rooms ending in 21 or 32 as the elevators run directly threw these rooms which makes the rooms noisy and also much smaller. The Aloha Tower looked identical to the Hula Tower but set further back from the beach. I don't think the Aloha Tower rooms would have much of a view - a very good view of Trump Tower, but that is about it.The entire staff was friendly and very efficient. The morning breakfast was good and plentiful. Internet access was generally OK, but a little slow at times. We really liked was how we didn't feel nickel and dimed to death here.
