Free breakfast, free WiFi, free in-room safe, free in room coffee, fridge, microwave, etc.The pool was very nice. We loved the rubber padded bottom of the pool. Keep in mind this is an Embassy Suites SO kids, kids, kids... everywhere. That would be the only reason we wouldn't stay here again. Tip to parents - we are ALL on vacation, keep an eye on your kids, don't make others watch them for you.The local restuarants are very good. Big thumbs up to Roys for their Beachwalk Sushi. Great burgers at Yardhouse. When you need some comfort food try Pastrami Cafe.If you really want to splurge get a message across the street at SpaHalekulani. WOW. (ask for Brian and get a Lomi Lomi).All in all we had a great time and would recommend this hotel. The only drawback (for us) was the kids.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Very nice, clean, and comfortable hotel. The staff was so friendly! We loved the breakfast every morning, but especially loved the managers reception every evening. Great entertainment and again such friendly helpful staff.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed a week at this hotel and the only thing we can say is AWESOME. It is so nice to see customer service and workers who take pride in their jobs again. The hotel was clean, quiet, increadibly friendly and in a great location. My husband and I have rated it the best hotel we have ever stayed in. We travelled with 2 children under the age of 2 and the staff were so helpful since we often had our hands full. The breakfast was amazing each morning and saved us a ton of money. The pool was also beautiful. We will stay here again for our next vacation to Hawaii.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I have just returned from a 9 night stay at the Embassy Suites, there were 4 in our party, my husband, myself and our two teenage boys. We had a one bedroom Queen suite, which was great, must more room than the traditional hotel room. We loved the free breakfast each morning, and it is great you can take it back to your room if you wish. I really can't fault this hotel, all the staff were very nice and accommodating. Loved the location, I have staying in Waikiki 5 times now, and this would be my favourite location. Restaurants, shops cafe's etc, at your doorstep. Felt very safe unlike other parts of town. The beach is one block away, a couple of minutes walk. Our kids spent a lot of time in the pool and spa.I wish we didn't have to leave yesterday, but I will be back, I just loved it.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The employees were wonderful, especially the breakfast staff, the bartenders, the omelete chefs, the front desk staff and the management. Everyone was super cordial and eager to help us enjoy our restful vacation. Jay, and Andrew were exceptionally great at the front desk as were all the staff ( except one). Jo was super kind and pleasant as the Food and Beverage manager, Keola and George were great at the evening reception as was everyone from 5 to 7:30. It was great to have live music and the dancers expecially when it was the native music. The custom made omeletes were super, (even more special when John smiled and remembered what my preferrences were all the time of our stay) as was all the fruit and vegetables on the breakfast buffet. Aldren and Amona were tireless in serving coffee, clearing tables, and offering such great cheer and smiles every morning at the indoor/outdoor eating area. We love this location, right by Fort Derussey and the great walking area along the beach. I would like more room to tell potential travelers all the great things about this hotel. The weather was perfect, the ocean views from our room a memory we will enjoy until we can return. Thank you and Blessings for all the kindness. We can not thank all of your staff enough. You are sincerely appreciated.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Long time user, first time reviewer. My wife and I decided we needed to say an extra thanks to a great hotel. The people, from the clerks, to the valets, to the room stsff, to the restaurant workers-- they were so friendly and helpful. They truly had the spirit of Aloha. The hotel is in a great location, the rooms were excellent, the food was plentiful, the pool was fun. A great place for kids; probably less so if you are looking for a romantic getaway. This is a family-oriented place, but I expect everyone knows that.Thanks again. We will certainly stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Excellent service from check in to check out. One time order of a cheesburger from Room Service was great - food arraived fast and tasty! Bell desk service folks were very nice and helpfull. Best part of the 'Suites' is having an ABC grocery for snacks right under your hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at the Embassy Suites Waikiki Beachwalk February 17-22, 2011. We were on the sixth floor of the hotel which was great because it did not take long to get up and down and we were only two floors away from breakfast and the pool (both on the fourth floor). In a nutshell here are the pros and cons of our stay:Pros:Amazing breakfast every day! Made to order omlettes, fresh fruit (apples, oranges, bananas, pineapple, papaya, canteloupe, watermelon) bacon, eggs, rice, soup, yogurt, mini muffins, bagels (with cream cheese), doughnuts, toast, cereal (4 choices), pancakes with syrup, tropical juices, milk (regular and chocolate), and sodas.Enormously large bathroomEvery suite has a full bedroom (we traveled with kids so it was nice to have two rooms, both with TV's, when the kids needed quiet time)Both the main room and the bedroom have walk out lanai's with two chairs each.Good sized pool with large hot tub and shallow pool for small children (see con area for comment on this)Large area with plenty of lounge chairs next to the poolVery friendly, helpful staff (bellhops went out of their way to accomodate us more than once)Maid service was excellent - she left us extra soap and shampoo - enough to get us through the week without having to call and ask for more.Airconditioning worked perfectly (some hotels are either too hot or too cold)Nightly Hawaiian entertainment (Manager's Evening) - every night you can come to the 4th floor for Hawaiian music and dancing, snacks (carrot sticks, broccoli, cauliflower, fishy crackers, chips and salsa, chex mix - every night is different) and you can get a complimentary drink from the bar.Free High Speed InternetHotel is adjacent to the Waikiki Beach Walk Shopping Center (www.waikikibeachwalk.com)which includes restaurants and stores like Ruth's Chris Steak House, Roy's Waikiki, Subway, Red Mango, Quicksilver, Sunshine Swimwear, and Wyland Galleries. When you check into the hotel you get a voucher that can be redeemed for coupons at the shopping center. It is worth picking up the coupon book.Short walk to the main Waikiki shopping strip and the International MarketplaceConsNOT ON THE BEACH (beach is about one and a half blocks from hotel - easily accessible, but it's not ON the beach)Parking at the Embassy Suites Waikiki Beachwalk will cost you around thirty dollarsShallow kiddie pool is directly next to the deeper five foot end of the pool instead of the three foot end - a small child can EASILY climb over the edge of shallow pool side and fall into deep water (dumb design)No Disney channel - only NickelodeonOur room faced another hotel - the view was not great, though I think the upper floors on the other side of the hotel faced the ocean and might have partial viewsThe traffic from outside was a bit loud, but not too bad when the sliding glass doors on the patios were closed.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We recently spent eight days on two islands. Four of those days were spent at the Embassy Suites Beachwalk and our stay here was one of the most comfortable and pleasant stays we have ever had at any hotel. The entire staff, from the check-in clerk to the bellmen and valet parking attendants went out of their way to ensure that we were comfortable and getting everything we needed to make our visit pleasurable. One of the bellmen in particular, Dean, was so kind and courteous to not only us, but our granddaughter as well. The complimentary breakfast was very excellent and we enjoyed the manager's reception each evening which also included entertainment. This is by-far the friendliest staff of any hotel we have stayed at. If we ever go back to Honolulu we will definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We just got back from our stay at the Embassy Suites in Waikiki and really enjoyed our stay there. The hotel is located just a block off of the beach, and our room had a good view of the ocean. Each room is a suite, ours was a one bedroom with 2 queen beds in the bedroom, and a sofabed in the living room. The beds and pillows were great. Got good sleeps every night we were there. There is a fee for partking, if you have a car. But the valet staff are fantastic. Very quick to get you car, and always pleasant and happy to serve.The breakfasts are included at the Embassy, and they were great. Made-to-order omlettes (or fried eggs), bacon, sausage, scrambled eggs, pancakes, fresh fruits - everything you might want in a breakfast. We found the breakfast saved us money - with a good breakfast, we didn't really need much for lunch, and just ate a good dinner later on.The Beachwalk area is a really nice area too. Not as busy or loud as the other hotels around the International Marketplace or other ones along Kalakaua Blvd. Nice shops, and good restaurants.I would highly recommend this hotel, and will probably stay there again if we go back to Oahu.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I've stayed at a half dozen properties in Waikiki, but none have matched the level of service I am receiving at the Embassy Suites. The staff members are especially friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean, and the grounds are well maintained. Waikiki tends to be noisy, but the windows here do a good job of keeping the noise out. The complementary breakfast and manager's reception are typical of Embassy Suites but the attitude of the employees makes this place special. There are plenty of restaurants nearby, and Roy's and Ruth Chris Steak House are on property. Both were fabulous. The pool area is large enough to accommodate the number of guests and is not too windy. Entertainment is provided by the pool in the evening. I'm spending eight nights here and am currently half-way through my stay. No complaints! There's a tour desk in the lobby and a medium-sized gym in one of the two towers.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Beautiful hotel and good location in Waikiki, but the incredible staff was what impressed us the most. We experienced true aloha spirit from each staff member without exception. We loved the Hawaiian style decor and artwork throught out, as well as the special local flavors of the breakfast. Miso soup was a wonderful surprise we enjoyed each morning!We will recommend this hotel to all our friends and plan to be back next year.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here for 5 nights just myself, hubby and our 1 year old after nearly 2 weeks at the Aston Waikiki Sunset with another family. This hotel blew the other way out of the water! Although the front of house staff weren't entirely warm & friendly, you were greeted with a seat & a drink which was nice. We booked a 1 bedroom through Expedia, it was a nonrefundable rate but was advertised as ocean or city view. However on arrival we discovered the ocean view cost a lot more & they would only offer us city view at that rate. After some badgering on our part they offered us a discounted upgrade rate to an ocean view which we took. We were told the room was full ocean view, but on entering you could only see a small part of the ocean if you went out on the balcony & turned your head. We called the desk immediately & were advised that's the best they had, a full ocean view would be available as of the next day. So we agreed to spend the night in that room & move the next day. On calling downstairs the next day they told us the other room wasn't ready yet, we'd have to check out & waste some time until that room was ready. So we got the bellboy to collect our luggage & take it downstairs to store, but when we went to check out they advised the other room was ready. Lack of communication & fairly poor service on their part, but we got to our room finally. The rooms are very clean and a decent size. The full ocean view was slightly bigger and had 2 balconies (corner room) with a beautiful ocean view from the 20th floor. Very worth the upgrade! Free internet via cable in the room, and free wireless on the pool deck. Free safe (which we didn't use), and free local calls and first half hour free to calls anywhere in the USA. Great value I thought considering none of these things are provided free in many other accommodations that cost more!There was a very substantial buffet breakfast every morning on the gorgeous pool deck, and a managers reception every night with free drinks (alcoholic included) & some entertainment. Very good value, and a beautiful setting. Pool was too cold considering it was meant to be heated, the ocean water was warmer! Location was great, located just on beautiful Lewers St (a big change from the streets around the Waikiki Sunset!) with lots of nice restaurants nearby. Beach across the road via a walkway, however apart from being a pretty beach it was not really for swimming. A couple of steps into the water and you encountered hundreds of sharp rocks which cut your feet, so unless you were planning to swim the whole time you were better off just sunbaking on the beach. Definitely not for little kids!Approached the activities desk once (supposed to be an Expedia local expert?) wasn't overly friendly or helpful...didn't seem to know much and didn't offer much help. Needless to say didn't approach him again, just found our own things in the abundance of catalogues around the streets.Overall a great stay, would definitely come here again!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I am a very fortunate traveler as I have been to the Hawaiian Islands many, many times in my life and have stayed in various hotels in Waikiki. I finally brought a friend of mine from the East Coast to the Embassy Suites and he's still talking about our trip. As the other reviewers have stated this hotel definitely offers the best value for your dollar with the free amenities alone. That would be the cooked-to-order breakfast, 2 hours of complimentary drinks at the manager's reception (which we definitely took advantage of) and the high speed internet. For a weeks' vacation you're talking huge savings right there, and the employees were more than happy to offer advice and suggestions when needed. I must thank one of the valets Greg for holding on to a personal item I had misplaced in the lobby and remembered me a day later when he saw me. That kind of service can't be ignored when dealing with hundreds of guests. I loved the microwave and refrigerator and the seperate living room area for added space. And if you wanna see the ocean, I suggest staying in the Aloha Tower like we did, you will get a better view than the Hula Tower IMO. A quick two minute walk to the beach and you're in paradise, enjoy!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We have had the pleasure of staying at the Embassy twice. Once with our adult children and once with my wife. Both stays were great. The hotel is located close to shopping and the beach. On our last visit the Trump Beach Walk somewhat inhibited the beach view, but it wasn't a big deal.Staff was very helpful and took care of our every need. Several times each day we were asked if they could be of help. The breakfast and manager's reception were particularly nice when we had our entire family with us. We would have a excellent made to order breakfast, leave for sightseeing and then return in time for cocktails and snacks. We would then visit one of the excellent restaurants within walking distance of our room. This really helps keep down expenses when you are with a large group of adults.Pool is clean quite and adequate. One caveat is that parking is very secure, but is not free.My wife and I will be taking her parents there in May. We are very excited to be able to return to this property, it feels like home. I would recommend it to anyone that is going to be staying in Waikiki.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Have just returned from a week staying at the Embassy Suites, chosen mainly because of the excellent reviews on this site. Arriving after a long flight from Australia at 6.00am we were extremely tired and regretting that we hadn't booked a room from the night before so we could shower and go straight to bed. It was still dark when we arrived at the hotel, but we could see enough that we were impressed by the lovely open air foyer and felt immediately like we had arrived for a holiday. Being greeted by the reception staff with a tropical fruit juice was a lovely gesture and we were offered a room that we could check in to immediately. However, as this room was on a lower floor we asked if we could pay for a day room just so we could shower and change and wait till a room was available on a higher floor. We felt the $100 we paid for this was great value as far cheaper than paying for an extra night's accomodation. After showers, we headed down to the beach - a two minute walk down a beach access alleyway, then ate at the Dennys across the road from the Embassy before returning to the hotel. On our return at 10.30am our room on a higher floor was ready and we headed up to the 14th floor of the Aloha Tower. The room was perfect for our needs, two queen sized beds (extremely comfortable) in the bedroom and a queen sofa bed in the lounge. However the highlight was walking out onto our balcony and being able to see the sea - something we hadn't been expecting.The location of the Embassy was perfect, so close to the sea, excellent restaurants and shopping. The cooked breakfast daily was excellent value. A wide variety of foods and juices - everything very fresh and well presented. Yes there was a problem with the birds in the outdoor area, but the staff did a wonderful job of shooing these away and keeping the whole area clean and tiday. We made the most of the Managers evening reception - very strong drinks - all free and a good selection of nibbles.We will definitley return to the Embassy - this was a great family destination.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My family and I couldn't have been happier. This Embassy Suites hotel is one of the best. First of all, the staff is extremely helpful and friendly. Second, the hotel itself is very well maintained and fairly new. Also, the breakfast was well prepared and fresh. Finally, the area was great for Waikiki and we could walk everywhere. It does cost a bit more than I think it is worth, but I loved everything about it. So, I guess if you want a hassle free experience in a bustling city, you should consider the Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach Walk.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: In May, 2007, my husband, Dan and I stayed here for six nights and seven days. We are both disabled veterans. Dan is a lung patient with respiratory problems. The hotel employees knew about my husband's disabilities before we arrived and claimed if we had a problem with this hotel we would be moved to another hotel. This was not the case as Dan continued to get sick from the lobby which is still designed like an underground parking lot with running exhaust from cars. Smoke alarms were going off and on all day. Also fumes from construction filled the upper floors and pool area. We could not open our room's windows or sit on the balcony because of the disel fumes. We were denied access to the management as we had asked for the manager, to change hotels, every day. Our travelers rights were violated. The front desk personnel and concierges refused to help us get a manager or directions. We have a set, limited income and could not afford another hotel. The last night when it was too late to change hotels, an assistant manager talked to us. By this time we had to drop out of activities due to the hotel environment making Dan ill. What I liked best was leaving this hotel. Dan has since put in a civil rights violation claim and I have witten to their corporate office and guest assistance for reimbusement for monetary losses on activities. So far, I received an email stating that everything would be resolved in three days. Resolution never happend. If you are traveling with kids, older people or disabled people, do NOT stay at this hotel. Here is the major point in our experience with this hotel: In the event any problem occurs on this property, the hotel management is unavailable and nonresponsive, still, in 2011 and your problems will most likey never be resolved in our opinion.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Very nice place to stay. Buffet breakfast, which is very good, is included; if not, hotel would be a little bit over-priced. Located in the posh area of Waikiki, with lots of high end shops around. Beach is about 150m, but not great. Better walk towards central Waikiki beach. Free daily Manager's reception is nothing to brag about - appetizers are all of sub quality. Check-out is 11 AM, but they have hospitality rooms for those who want to freshen up before heading to the airport later on the day. Staff is very friendly.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed there for 7 nights mid January, 2011. We booked a 1 bedroom king suite with an ocean view. We had a very good corner room on the 9th floor that gave us views of the ocean from every window. We had 2 balconies, 1 not only had an ocean view but also overlooked the pool area. The bedroom and bathroom were both a good size. The bedroom did not have a closet but an armoire for hanging clothes, dressers with good amount of space and a flat screen HD TV. The entry way had a small kitchen area with a microwave, small fridge, coffe machine and sink. The living room area had a desk for your laptop with hard wired free internet, a couch and a dresser with a Flat screen HD TV on it. Not huge if there are more than 2 people but plenty of space for 2. The location was great with the only thing better being right on the beach if you want to pay alot more money. There was beach access less than a block away. We are not people who like to spend a lot of time on the beach so having a great ocean view was more important than being right on the beach. Easy walking distance to lots of shopping and dining places.  The hotel provides good breakfast options that are included in the room price as well as a free cocktail reception for 2 hours in the evening. The snacks at the cocktail reception are pretty basic but give you something to nibble on while you have a drink or 2. A good variety of drink choices at the reception. All the staff we interacted with were very friendly. We had some mixed success with the internet. At times it would go in an out while we were trying to use it but at other times it worked well and was fairly fast. Overall with the location, the benefit of a suite, having breakfast included and the manager's cocktail reception I thought it was excellent value compared to the numerous other hotels I looked at when researching the hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel is in a great location for shopping and beach. Nice view from our balcony. Lots of room in the suite and staff was friendly and helpful. Enjoyed the cocktail reception and breakfast. We came from a relaxing vacation in Maui and it was a nice change of pace to be in a bustling area with shopping and dining close by.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We have stayed at the Embassy a couple of times. It is nothing outrageous, but it is clean and close to a lot of things.Breakfast is great, wide variety, great perk of Embassy.Beach is very close and an easy walk.Pool is nice and our kids loved it.The only negative things was maid service was slow and not very good. Upon checkout we were told we would have to go up the escalator. We then talked to a manager who gave us a key so we could use the pool etc all day. Lastly, the cab to the airport was suppose to be $35. When we got there the cab said it was $50. Make sure you confirm the price in front of bellman and cab.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Met expectations, would recommend, would stay againLocation: Excellent, less than 500ft from hotel entrance to edge of Ft. DeRussey park.... 3 minute walk to actual beach. On the quieter edge of Waikiki, not on the main street... close to the action without suffering the noise. That being said, there is noticable service vehicle traffic in early mornings that precluded keeping the patio doors open all night long.Hotel layout: Two towers, each oriented NE-SW, the Northern tower has rooms x0x and x1x, the south tower has rooms x2x and x3x. West side of South tower faces pool area, which could be noisy. Lobby on street level, Beachwalk St, b-fast and evening reception, along with pool area, on 4th floor.Safety/Security: Room key needed for all elevator movement, up and down. Area felt safe.Room: Using OLCI, we were offered corner room as upgrade (HHonors Gold), though not specifically identified as such; I called the desk to run through the room options listed, desk agent mentioned that 809 was corner facing ocean.Room met ES standards, was clean, with sliding patio doors in both LR and BR (possible not all rooms have this configuration).Breakfast: Met ES standards. Other posters had mentiond birds in bfast area; we noted 3 or 4 in the three days we were there, not a factor IMHO.Reception: Strong drinks, friendly 'tenders, AYCE goldfish crackers/chips n' salsa/carrots, etc.Pool: warm and clean, fair sizedParking: We're military, and were able to park at the Hale Koa ramp (bring ID card to ramp office, multi-day pass avail, we paid ~$38 for 3 days. 5 min walk to ES. The Valets were fine with us leaving the car for the 5 min it took to run our bags to the room.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We arrived on Saturday the 15th at 3:00pm and were promptly greeted with outstanding staff. They gave my husband, son and I a fruit juice drink that was so wonderful. Went to the room and could not believe the size. They boast this is the only all suites hotel in Waikiki- 2 flat screen TVs- one for the parents and one for the son, who was able to connnect PS3 and enjoy the free wireless internet. We went to PF Changs for dinner and returned for cocktail hour. On Monday, Wednesday and Saturday they have a live band and hula dancer. They were really wonderful. You can get exotic cocktails for free to include Blue Hawaiian and Mai Tai. My son had the virgin Mai Tai-- 3 to be exact.Next day we enjoyed the wonderful shopping. We started off with signature Embassy Suites cooked to order breakfast. AWESOME! There were 2 stations of everything so everyone did not crowd the area. Dining and reception are outside, and as you know- the weather is awesome. Son and I went to enjoy the pool and then we shopped the rest of the day. Several happy hours occur down town and I encourage all to look into the MANY that you can sit oceanside and get cheap eats and drinks but do not have to suffer with the quality. This hotel is LOCATION- LOCATION!Outstanding= you would be a fool to go anywhere else for the value!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I picked this hotel the day before because it looked clean and had a hot breakfast.When I first got there they didn't have a room for me but I think that might have been a screw up with my airline/agent. After waiting at the front desk for maybe less than an hour they put me in a room up on the top floor (or near the top) and said i could have that room for the night and they would contact me the next day. When I woke up the next day I contacted them and they said i was all good and could keep the room they put me in. I had some time to kill after i checked out so they stored my bags for me and said I could book time to freshen up in one of there rooms they have saved just for that. That was fantastic! I spent my last day on the beach and walking around Honolulu. By the time I got back I needed another shower. That was definitely a great perk! The breakfast was really good everyday. Awesome kona coffee. If your travelling by yourself don't leave your food unattended because the birds will get at it! Really nice staff at the breakfast as well.Also in the evenings there is a managers reception with complimentary drinks for two hours. I didn't realize this until half way through my stay. That was really nice too! If I could afford it I would be going to this hotel all the time. But since I usually travel alone and get dinged for the single supplement I will be staying some place else my next vacation. I ate at the restaurant Roy's for a treat on my last night and used the hotel coupon for the lava cake dessert! OMG I am so glad i decided to go! It was delicious! Would be a great hotel for a family since the beds are in a separate room from the living quarters. Plus there was a flat screen TV in each room! Very nice staff, extremely clean hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I always look for suite hotels so that our teens have their own sleeping area; a refrigerator is handy too. The rates at Embassy Suites were quite reasonable so it seemed like a good choice -- and it was!A week before our trip to Hawaii, my husband broke his ankle. He needed a walk-in shower so we switched to an accessible room. Whoever designed this knew what they were doing. The room was near the elevators and around the corner from the 4th floor pool and hospitality area, so convenient for swimming, breakfast and evening drinks (complimentary). At breakfast and drink time, there was some noise from kids (and parents) running and yelling in the hallway, but it was not frequent (and could not be heard in the bedroom). The pool and hot tub were very nice, but the pool was in shade (which might be good in the summer, but not so good in winter).The service was great. On arrival we were greeted with a glass of juice, and the bellmen who helped us were very friendly (and patient with my husband's pace). I'm normally not a fan of valet parking, but they were very quick to bring the car each time we needed it. Also, there is a nearby stop for the trolley that runs to Ala Moana shopping center. The business center was well-equipped, which made it easy to print boarding passes. An added bonus, Roy's Restaurant is on the premises; it is great. I would give the hotel a good review under any circumstances. For us, the comfort and placement of the accessible room really helped save our trip.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our family of 4 ( 2 adults plus daughters 23,13 ) stayed for a week over the New Year . Speedy check-in, efficient friendly staff. We had a 2 bed suite on 17th floor in Hula Tower ,great view, quiet,comfortable beds. Plenty of space for a family of four. Breakfast was plentiful( sensational omlettes) and drinks at night by pool, fantastic! Excellent location on Beach Walk and 1 minute from beach. Great resturants close by, Yardhouse was a favourite. Great shopping close by and Ala Moana within walking distance.ABC general stores close for food,drinks, sandwiches etc. Laundy facilties on 3rd floor a bonus as well. Excellent value overall, great stay and would hightly recoemmned Embassy Suites. Look forward to returning one day.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great location central to some great places to eat and across the road from the beach. Rooms nice and big, air-con, fridge & microwave. Breakfast and two hours of drinks included in the hotel rate.Do yourself a favour and think about staying here. You won't be disappointed.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The Embassy Suites in Waikiki maintains the chains cleanliness and service standards. The full, made to order breakfast is great for teenagers. The Manager's reception included tropical drinks which was great for the adults, however the snacks were subpar from other Embassy Suites we have stayed with.  The hotel is close to the beach and shopping, so everyone was happy in our group. Again, for a family with teens, the 2 room suite works really well for a 4-5 night stay. As with any hi-rise building, keep your drapes closed at night. My daughter saw a naked man in the building next door.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The service was truly in the spirit of the Islands. Everyone from the moment we checked in to when we sadly departed wanted to help us have a wonderful experience. We got great recommendations for attractions and restaurants with great directions too. The breakfast and manager's reception were truly value added that no other hotel has matched. The location was great and having valet parking for the car was so easy. Try to stay at the Aloha towers on a higher floor to avoid some of the street noise. Malia was a real gem at the front desk. I can't wait to return to my home away from in Hawaii.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed here with my wife and a 4-year old son for 3 nights before going to Kauai.For the money paid, I could not find anything better in Honolulu.Great suite, on the 4th floor. We were 50 feed away from the pool and breakfast area.The breakfast was great. Lots of choices. Good cooks.Manager's reception was good, strong drinks, quick service.Pool, could have been bigger and better. But it was enough for us.Location was perfect, 10 minutes from shopping. Restaurants right there.Next time we're in Honolulu we're staying here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I am here now with the wife and 2 kids. Suite allows us to put kids in seperate room so wife and I can get away from them at night and in the morning. Housekeeping excellent as they work around our schedule which changes daily. Wife and I do not take advantage of the huge breakfast, but the two boys love it. Manager's reception at 5:30 huge. I prime the pump while sitting in the jacuzzi. The bartenders are not stingy ... Very little Rif-Raff here - I have met Australians and military types (relocating) at the pool - all very friendly. Lots of Japanese who are also very friendly. Restaurants like Ruth's Chris, Yard House and Cheesecake Factory all very close. Internet in the room very reliable and fast. I use the gym every day which has free weights and universal - spotless. TV's in gym are positions so you can watch ESPN during workout. Not crowded as females stay to the treadmills/eliptical machines. Laundry room big help. All machines work great and they have a coin machine and one arcade game for kids while loading/unloading. No complaints except it rained yesterday and it's raining, today.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our room was directy across from the elevator and right next to the ice machine and we never heard a sound. We had the complimentary breakfast every morning and the only disapointment was that although there was a lot of fruit most of it was not close to ripe. What a let down in a state known for its fresh fruit. They have a nice large pool, which was a must for our family, but it wasn't heated. You would think not a big deal in Hawaii but, while in the shadows of the other buildings or at night it was too cold for most of the adults and even some kids. For us pool time is family time and dad just couldn't handle the cold pool. He was in the hot tub, with almost all the adults, while we played in the pool. There are ABC stores everywhere and they have very competitive prices and lots of variety. This hotel is about 1 block from the Royal Hawaiian Shopping Center which has a lot of dining choices. Visit the International Market Place, about 5 blocks away, and don't forget to haggle. If you have any questions about what is around to do ask the bell desk or any of the valets they are extremely helpful (although at 25 a day for parking a little expensive) and never steered us wrong. We truly enjoyed our stay Embassy Suites and would definatly stay there again!!!!!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel is excellent.The rooms are beautiful and very clean.The staff were helpful and kind.We were impressed at the service given to us when we had 19.00 flight- they offered us a room to wash up and clean before we went to the airport.Well done

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Have been to Honolulu 5 other times and this is by far the best hotel we've stayed in while there. Excellent Check-in staff (Helena was awesome!!), excellent breakfast buffet staff and manager's reception. The best bfast buffet: excellent food, excellent variety, very clean, and well maintained. All the employees at the buffet were very helpful and had a true "Aloha" spirit. They went above and beyond any breakfast buffet we've been to at a Hilton Hotel. Our children really enjoyed the hula show at the manager's reception. Valet was excellent and never had to wait for our car. We enjoyed our ocean view suite which had an excellent kitchenette, large spacious bathroom, plush beds and two balconies. We had neighbors, but never knew it. Hotel is very quiet and not noisey like many Waikiki hotels. Great for sleeping and relaxing... even with small children! Our children enjoyed the pool while we enjoyed the hot tub! Great facilities! Can not say one negative about this hotel!! As a hilton gold member, this is probably one of the best Embassy Suites we've stayed in by far! This will be our hotel of choice while in Honolulu! Thank you for a wonderful hotel... now can Embassy Suites go to some of the other Hawaiian Islands, too?

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: If I tell you what a bargain this hotel is, then y'all will want to stay there, and the next time I want to go there won't be any rooms available. Anyway, the location is fine, the rooms are very clean, the help is accomodating, the breakfast is exceptional, the "open bar" happy hour is a blast. You gotta like kids cause there's plenty of them. When you consider the whole package, i.e., the room, the breakfast, the happy hour booze bonanza, and the proximity of lots of good stuff, you just can't beat this place.............!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Well located, the suites are clean of adequate space,modestly furnished but nonetheless comfortable. Breakfast is abbundant served in a chaotic environment offering self-service mong hundreds of people. Hotel staff is polite and helpful. One of the main hotel tower elevators is left unattended,possibly dangerous as it opens on to the street.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I enjoy the Embassy Suites Waikiki. I'm a Hilton HHonors Diamond, so they upgraded me to an ocean view room. Cool, I thought. But since most Embassy Suites rooms are fairly identical, I wouldnt have pressed for an upgrade anyway. If you arent familiar with the Embassy Suites concept, all rooms here have two room suites, with a bedroom and living room with sofa bed. flat screen Tv's in each room, and a microwave, refrigerator, sink sort of "kitchenette".The Embassy Suites Waikiki has two bedroom suites also.Anyway, we've stayed here before, back in 2008, so we knew what to expect. We got room 1809 in the Aloha tower, which is on the right side of the hallway facing the ocean. I wouldnt recommend any "09" rooms on any floor. This side of the hallway contains the stairwell. Not only does it make the room smaller, but we could hear the stairwell door slamming as people entered the stairs. Where they were going from the 18th floor, I dont know. Being at the SW corner of the building, it had an extended balcony, which you could enter from the living area or the bedroom, although it is very narrow. I'm 5 foot 11 inches, and when I sat down, my knees were at the railing. this side also directly faces the Trump International, which blocks any real view of DeRussy park. The "Ocean view" is past the breakfast pavilion and pool floor below, the other tower, and past the Outrigger on the Beach. YOu could see it from the balcony or from two windows behind the couch. Since there isnt any seating on the other side of the room, you cant enjoy the view sitting down.There should be better views on the other side of the hallway. So if you are looking for real ocean views, remember, this hotel is not directly on the beach. However, the room was still very nice. OK King size bed, clock radio with mp3 hookup. Very understated Hawaiian themed furnishings. Decent sized bathroom, however our previous room without an oceanview had a bigger bathroom with entrances from the living and bedrooms. This hotel has full breakfast daily plus an evening managers reception. Breakfast was good. there is an omelet station with many toppings to choose from, pancakes, french toast, fresh fruit, pastries, breakfast meats, and also a few international dishes such as tofu, miso soup and fried rice. There is also coffee, tea juices and soda. From 5-7pm, there is a "manager's reception" with light hors dourves. There is supposed to be entertainment, but there wasnt on the one night we went, Sunday. Our previous visit, there was entertainment every night. All said, I would recommend this hotel for it's proximity to Waikiki beach, the Waikiki strip and the Waikiki beach walk, which is right downstairs. There are restaurants ranging from the Hard Rock to Ruth's Chris and Subway, and ABC (Hawaiian convenience store), PF Chang's, Senor Frogs (with live music), galleries, stores etc.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I travel to Hawaii fairly frequently. I have stayed at all the big name hotels in the Waikiki area and I find the Embassy Suites to be head and shoulders above the rest. The location is great with good access to all Waikiki has to offer. The complimentary breakfast is outstanding, John makes the best omelet with a continous smile as he prepares the food. You can't have a an empty cup of coffee or glass of OJ around Aldrin because he's always there filling it up with his great sense of humor (and removing your used plates, too). Our house keeper, Lleulynn "Lynn" (7th floor Hula Tower) on this trip was so friendly and accomodating to our requests she seemed like family. She always went out of her way with a warm smile to assure we were comfortable in our suite . Since I was here on business I needed a very quiet room and for the second trip in a row we were given choices by Victor to make sure we were absolutely satisfied. He believes in speedy customer service with a smile. He even kept us updated on room change status by calling my cell so we would not have to wait til we got back to the hotel. Does it sound like it was a great experience? It is an outstanding and very clean (rooms, pool area, dining, etc) hotel but the people make it great. I will always stay there when there are vacancies. The Bennett's - North Carolina

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: A modern property located towards the beginning of the Waikiki strip. A two minute walk to the beach. Excellent shopping and dining a 2 minute walk away. A warm and friendly staff. I especially liked the breakfast buffet, and Manager's Reception. It makes starting and ending the day memeorable and relaxing. I would recommend this hotel for business travelers, visitors, and Kamaaina. For military members, this property is located very close to the Hale Koa military recreation area, which includes Fort Derussy beach, and Army Museum. I highly recommend a visit to the museum. This property is not for the budget traveller, and is priced on the higher end. Still a good value.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Just returned from 5 nights at Embassy Suites and we had a pleasurable experience The location was perfect with only short walk to the beach. The staff were friendly and very helpful. The buffett breakfast was excellent however the dining room did feel a little like being on school camp at times. The pool was heated to a nice tempertature and spa hot. The pool staff served us complementary chocolate coated strawberries which was a lovely touch. We could also order cocktails without getting out of the spa. There are plenty of shops and restaurants downstairs and a handy convenience store on lobby level. The rooms are large and comfortable, decor very nice, and we didnt hear any noise from adjoining rooms. The bed pillows are smaller than what we are used to sleeping on. Overall I really liked the location, best part of the beach only 5 minute walk. The least favorite thing was dining room at breakfast however you could take a tray up to your room which we did. Oh, and Roys Restaurant downstairs is excellent.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I am finally posting a review after staying at this hotel 4 different times over the past 3 years for a total of 32 nights. I traveled alone with my wife once (Nov 2010) and the other 3 times ( March) with my kids (12 & 14).I am a Hilton Honors Diamond Member and have stayed all 32 nights on points. I travel a lot and love to stay at the Embassy Suites Brand. This hotel is the best of the ES. To the check-in from Kalae and Jaymar ,to the awesome bartender, Dennis, you won't be disappointed. I used the gym everyday and it's a nice one. 4 treadmills and free weights up to 50 lbs. The hotel is almost 4 years old now. I have stayed in the one bedroom and the two bedroom suites and they are both gorgeous. Someone who posted a comment said that the furniture is dated? How, when the furniture isn't even that old? Rooms are so clean and everything looks new. The breakfast here is twice as big as the normal ES breakfast. The managers reception every evening is a great deal as well. Unlimited free drinks for 2 hours, and I mean, unlimited. Someone complained about not having better food??? Who cares, you get free drinks. What's that worth per person or a family? Awesome hula dancing will keep you entertained. Again, the entire staff at this hotel is super nice.  The Yardhouse underneath is excellent and so is Roy's and the Ruth Chris Steakhouse. Not sure why someone would complain about spending $5-$6 to wash and dry a load of clothes? Most hotels don't even offer washer and dryers. What would it cost to have all your clothes dry cleaned? Pack light and you can use the washer and dryers. I used them everytime. There is also a nice business center next to the room where the washer and dryers are located. Free internet in the room was very beneficial. Although I didn't pay for a night during my 4 stays, I would say that it's worth $250-$275+ tax, especially for a family. I went to the ABC store across the street and bought bread and lunch meats and other snacks and kept them in the mini fridge. They were so nice that they brought me an extra mini fridge when I asked for one. You can eat lunch in the room and save a lot of money. Subway is also next door. Waikiki is very reasonably priced compared to the outer islands. I NEVER rent a car. You don't need one in Waikiki. When I do need one for a day or two, I walk a few blocks to the Hyatt and rent a car there. If you want to drive around the island just rent a car for a couple days. You can walk everywhere in waikiki. I've been a dozen times and have never rented a car at the airport. The location is not beachfront but only a block away from the beach. I have stayed at the Hilton Hawaiian Village and it's on the beach, but not in the prime location like the ES. I guarantee you, the ES is in the best location in Waikiki. Hilton Hawaiian's prices for food and drinks are twice the cost of the ES. Sure, there are like 16 restaurants at the Hilton, but the hotel is not of the same caliber of the ES. I don' like the location of the Hilton Hawaiian.I love the Embassy Suites Waikiki and its people and will be back for years to come.You can't go wrong with this property.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We really enjoyed our stay at the Embassy Suites at Waikiki Beach. The staff was super friendly, the rooms were clean. The made to order breakfast was great, a few birds on the lanai, but not bad at all. The evening drinks were delicious and not watery, they also had some snacks to go with that. A short walk to the beautiful beaches. This hotel is centrally located for walking to shopping too. The only thing negative we can think of is that every morning at 6am you can hear the trash trucks banging. We were on the 22 floor and didn't hear street noise at all except for the trash trucks. We will definately stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My husband, son and I just returned from a terrific week at Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach Walk. All of the staff was friendly, helpful and very polite; the room was clean, the location was terrific,. We were fortunate to receive an upgrade and loved the room and the ocean view. The walk to the beach was both easy and quick. It was nice having a microwave and refrigerator. The breakfast buffet is an added plus and represents a significant savings in this tight economy. Although we rented a car public transportation and tours are readily available.We enjoyed lunch in China Town, our trip to Dole Plantation, our tour to Pearl Harbor, our dinner cruise, dining at Ruth Chris steakhouse, and Tanaka of Toyko. Regarding Tanaka of Toyko, we were not familiar with the Changing of the King's Guard in King's Village so we were a little surprise when we exited the Japanese restaurant and saw the guards marching through the shopping area. The performance was so impressive that we walked back the following night. We then learned that the full team drill, which takes place at 6:15, is only performed 3 or 4 nights weekly. I prefer to pack less and wash laundry while traveling. The coin laundry was clean, easily accessible and affordable.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was a wonderful, centrally located hotel; just a block from the beach. We walked everywhere in Waikiki. The breakfast on the Lanai was great every morning and yes there were a couple pidgens and small doves but no seagulls. Staff was very friendly and we loved our juice drink when we checked in. The managers reception in the evening was like any Embassy Suites but my main complaint was the poor choice in appetizers, if you could call them that. For such a high class hotel they served a low class appetizer. Come on, fish crackers and potato chips? Are you listening ES? At least they could have supplied some appetizers from the menu. We would have gladly paid for them. I have seen this done at other ES. Roys right on the corner: great, great food.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The Embassy Suites Waikiki was a treat. I'd definitely recommend and stay again in the future. The service was warm and welcoming, the rooms were very clean and spacious...comfortable for a family of 4. We were surprised by the lovely lanai and ocean view (partial). The kids enjoyed the pool, and the beach was just a couple of blocks away! Good breakfast, and relaxing Managers reception.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at the Embassy Suites for a week with our girls (ages 1 & 6) this is a great hotel for families. We arrived late on Friday night and were able to check right in and within minutes they brought a crib up for the baby. The Breakfast in the morning was great. The people that work in the breakfast area we so friendly & helpful. By the end of the week... they knew what drinks we liked with our breakfast and would bring them to our table a few minutes after we sat down. Also the bartenders in the evening were great & very funny. We ate lunch at the pool 2 days. The food was good... a little slow to come out. But it was hot when it came out... so you know it was fresh! The hotel is in a great location. We walked down and used the beach in front of the Hilton Hawaiian Village and The Lagoon. Great for small kids and another day we walked down and used the beach outside the Outrigger Waikiki. We also walked down to The Ala Moana mall. The only thing we would complain about was the pillows. All in all it was a great clean hotel and we would go back.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I stayed at Embassy Suites for 12 days in October/November for the 4th time & it was as wonderful as always. The location on Beach walk is fantastic. The sea views from our rooms were wonderful, the staff as friendly as always & go out of their way to make you feel like you are part of their family. Breakfast being provided is a huge bonus & the omelet station is wonderful! The managers nightly reception with free drinks just starts every evening off with a smile. Sadly they no longer have nightly live entertainment but is now 3 nights a week (the hula school that come in once a week is a highlight). We all miss everyone at Embassy already- especially Joe, Chef Glenn & Dennis & George on the bar! Mahalo for another wonderful holiday

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The Embassy Suites were well situated, provided very friendly and attentive service. We had a room next to the elevator which was quite noisey and once we asked to be moved it was done with no fuss and immediately. The complimentary breakfast and managers reception were an added bonus. I would highly recommend the Embassy Suites which were great value for money.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: this is a great hotel the rooms are big you hove your own little kitchen .the free breakfast very monring is great and the staff are all very friendly and the best thing of all is that every afternoon they have what is called drinks with the manger from 5.30pm to 7.30 pm .Ther are all these cocktails you can have and they are free and there is music and dancing on some nights..

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We checked in to this gorgeous property and were amazed by the genuine friendliness and helpfulness of Kalae at the front desk to Johnny the bellman who gave us an extensive overview of the property and our room on the 14th floor of the Aloha Tower. We had a beautiful view of the ocean and pool. Our first 4 days were courtesy of Hilton Honors via 4 stays=1 free night promo and points. My wife and I stay exclusively at Emb Suites and Hilton properties and have to say this is an extremely well run and maintained property owned and operated by the Outrigger Corporation. They literally have a crew of help staff during the breakfast buffet not just to bus tables but to help you with anything you might need, amazing. The complimentary drinks served from 5:30-7:30 nightly were as good or better than anything you might pay $6.00 up at a restaurant. The entertainment during happy hour was top notch local talent who actually were very friendly and engaging without being obnoxious. My wife and I highly recommend visiting this Embassy Suites and discovering how well a lodging+ experience can and should be!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel does not meet the standards I expected from an Embassy Suites. The rooms are TINY and poorly laid out. The beds sag and cause back pain. The pillows are the same as you would find in a much cheaper motel. The furniture is dated. Our bathtub was half the normal size and again the rooms are small and very crowded. A large person would not be able to walk between the bed and the dresser. The cleaning and breakfast staff are the only bright spots.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We have stayed at the Hilton Hawaiian numerous times, but since both the Hilton Hawaiian and this Embassy Suites cost the same amount of Hilton points, I wanted to try this out. IMHO, this blows the Hilton out of the proverbial water. Sure the Hilton has fireworks and is on the beach and is a larger property w/flamingos and penguins, but it is also older and farther from the main strip in Waikiki. If you've stayed in Waikiki before, the Embassy might suit you better. They offer free cooked-to-order breakfasts, free happy hour (I discovered gin & tonics on this trip, as well as the fact that I find Mai Tais disgusting), free in-room internet and the all-suite factor is a big plus for our family since we have 2 little kids. You can still walk to the beach and see the fireworks, but it's closer to a lot of the stuff going on in Waikiki. It's also right on Beachwalk, with lots of touristy stores and restaurants which would be the equivalent of the facilities Hilton has in its resort onsite. I also liked the fact that everything is newer (although I believe Hilton has been updating for the last several years--I've heard the lagoon has a really cool pool now). Basically, they're both great properties, but this one has the edge in my book. Now you can decide for yourself.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: this hotel is the best place to stay in downtown waikiki, awesome location in regards to the best places to eat, shop, and go out at night to party..... not to mention the free breakfast and free booze @ happy hour, makes it the best deal in town.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Overall, the stay at Embassy Suites was pleasant, but not too much at this hotel stood out, which was disappointing for a new Embassy property. The breakfast was really good and there's a great restaurant called the Yard House is basically inside the building. The workout room was very nice for a hotel, especially since there are two TVs plus individual units on the cardio machines. Unfortunately the place had some downside:Yes, there are birds at Breakfast and they’re really bad if its rained. There is outside and inside seating at breakfast, so they’re scattered enough of most days, until it rained and everyone was concentrated under the covered area.The self service laundry charges were absurb. I’ve never seen a small washing machine cost $2.50, then $2.25 for a 36 minute dryer, which we had to pay twice on to actually dry our clothes. We paid $15 for two loads of laundry, which is more than double compared to anything else we've ever paid. The manager’s reception is nice, but it lacked any hot appetizers. At $225+/night in the offseason, is it really too much to ask?The pool is very small, which we knew about, but didn't expect there to be no employees enforcing the rules. There were unattended children running and screaming along the sides of the pool, making it impossible for anyone else to get in and enjoy themselves. The soundproofing seemed poor for a newer hotel. I was on a very high floor and could hear both outside noise, and the couple in the room next to us both fighting and “making up”.Overall it was an okay trip, but I guess I had higher expectations for a brand new Embassy in a prime location such as Waikiki.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here the last 3 nights of our honeymoon. We were upgraded to a partial ocean view on the top floor overlooking the pool. I wish we had come here first and then continued on to Maui since Waikiki is very much hustling and bustling like any other city. I knew that when I booked, but didn't account for how I would feel at the end of the trip. We booked Embassy Suites because of the free breakfast and managers reception. They did not disappoint. There is a microwave and mini-fridge in the room for quick meals and reheats, but for the most part you will want to head out to try the restaurants. We made good use of the free internet access while lounging by the pool on our last afternoon in paradise. I recommend renting a car for a day or two for North Shore and other side trips. The $25 daily fee is steep, and they tried to charge us for 2 days since we had it parked in their garage overnight. We argued that we took the car out of the garage before 8am that morning, and $50 was ridiculous for the few hours it was on the property. They kindly removed the second charge. I thought that was nice of them, as I was sure we were stuck with it. We also got an elevator key for our last day after check out. This allowed us to visit the pool and enjoy the music one last time. Overall, great place to stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We loved everything about this hotel...the breakfast buffet, the proximity to shops & the beach, the room, the evening drinks and music, non-smoking facility, & the outstanding staff particularly the valet parking staff. We will definitely stay there again next time we are in Honolulu.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The Embassy Suites may not be right on the beach (you have to cross the street for that) or offer much in the way of views, but it is worth the trade offs for the extra space in the rooms (separate living area with pull out sofa), amenities like microwaves, coffee makers, refridge and newspapers. The breakfast buffet, (which runs for a generous 3-4 hours) is excellent: fresh fruit, omelete bar, hot foods, cereals - and plenty of seating. The location is excellent for seeing all of the attractions of Waikiki.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Simply put, this hotel met or exceeded our expectations in every category.We have never stayed at a hotel where the staff was as friendly and accomodating...front desk & valet were great, bartenders at the Manager's Reception were awesome, and all of the housekeeping staff were very pleasant. Most notably, Mr. Johnnie from the bell desk and Mr. Aldrin from the Grand Lanai were incredible. My boys went looking for these guys every day to talk to them...they/we loved them...such a wonderful experience!The rooms were fine...I was smart to pick the Embassy because of the suites....we loved the additional privacy/refuge when traveling with the kids. Breakfast buffet offerings every day were fresh and superb. Pool & hot tub are very nice...plenty of seating, never an issue. Pool waitresses were very friendly and the food was good and came out very quickly after we ordered.Location was great...steps to the beach & tons of shopping/eating choices.ONLY serious complaint are the dirty birds at the Grand Lanai at breakfast. I had read the reviews on Tripadvisor and thought to myself...how bad can it really be. Well....it really is gross. I wish that the hotel would figure out something to do about them. The workers do a great job of trying to chase them away and work feverishly to clear tables...but something has to be done. Overall, don't think twice about booking the Embassy...it's a great overall value...you will not be disappointed.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at Embassy Suites for a two week vacation, having never been to Hawaii before & only going by reviews left by others, we were extremely impressed. Because we had stuffed up our dates due to crossing over the international date line from Australia (still blame my husband for that one ha, ha), we arrived a day earlier than expected & 6 hours earlier than the 3pm check-in, staff were a little dry at first, but once they under stood our predicament they offered us a nice cool juice & were able to accomodate us on the first floor for that night (just ok room, but not bad) whilst the remainder of our stay was on the 8th floor with full ocean veiws which we were not expecting, but happy to take. Friday night fireworks from the Royal Hawiian were in full view from our 2 x balconys as were also the 4th floor pool area which my nine year son enjoyed alot. Managers reception was awsome with free drinks, whatever you want including some pretty stroooonnnggg cocktails all served with a very warm & friendly smile. The buffet breakfast included a made to order omlete station & an amazing array of fresh fuits, bakery favouites, crispy bacon, pancakes.... the list goes on & on with something a little different every day.(oh & the birds were not that bad, they were actually quite amusing). The housekeeping staff were very friendly & efficient as our room was usually maintained while we were at breakfast, by a lovely lady called Sophia. Some nice reaturants & shopping were all close by & all quite reasonably priced. We will deffinately make this our chosen place to stay when visiting again in the future.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel was fantastic. The rooms are spacious, modern and it's a very inviting hotel. We recently stayed with family and this hotel made our wedding and honeymoon even more special. The breakfast was fantastic, the drinks of an evening were fantastic and the whole vibe of the hotel was friendly.The only problem we encountered was that we arrived on a long haul with two small children and they said they would call when the room was ready and it wasn't after until the official check-in of about 3.30pm which was the only disappointment in this hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Pros - Great breakfast choice and Managers Reception each evening, Nice pool (small but not busy), close to beach, large rooms and comfortable beds, helpful valet staff, near to restaurants, etcCons - Bed bugs, unhelpful front desk staffOverall I would recommend this hotel as it was excellent value for the price we paid

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Embassy Suites Waikiki is perfectly located at the Beachwalk. The breakfast in the mornings is delicious! The service from Russ (Manager) and his crew in the mornings is so wonderful, made going back the the Embassy Suites Waikiki better with each visit. The rooms are spacious and the shopping downstairs is perfect! If we want to save on dining there is Dennys downstairs across the street. If you like beer there is the Yardhouse downstairs of the hotel that has over 90 beers on tap, the food is excellent! The nightly managers reception has dips and chips but the music is awesome and the hula is wonderful! You can even order food from downstairs and bring it into the reception and sit and enjoy the entertainment. The laundry facility is clean, the business center is fabulous, the workout room is wonderful! This hotel is great for families and first timers to Honolulu! The only downfall is the Trump tower is an eye sore and the pool is too small...but other than that....it's wonderful!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We have just returned from Honolulu and stayed at Embassy Suites for 11 days. If you are looking for a great Hotel with fantastic staff, really lovely suites clean and well presented, with complimentary breakfast everyday, complimentary business centre and in one of the best parts of Waikiki (Lewers Street) close to trolley buses, good restuarants or Dennys across the road, and of course Waikiki Beach then you have it all here. This is our third trip to Honolulu in the last 3 years and the first time that we have been happy with our accomodation. Because it was my husbands birthday they put us on the 14th floor in a lovely suite, with an ocean view from our lanai and it was so quiet we had uninterrupted sleep every night and definately no earplugs required. Nothing is a trouble to the staff, after a phone call to tell them we could not open our safe after putting the wrong code in they were there within minutes and also weighing our luggage for us before leaving. One of the best things about the Embassy Suites is that you have a separate bedroom to your living room. There is no kitchen but a sink, microwave and bar fridge. As my Husband does not sleep very well this was just what we wanted as he could sleep while I was reading or watching TV. Overall a fantastic Hotel. We will stay there again when we go back .

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at this hotel 3 nights and felt it might be the best nonbeachfront hotel in Waikiki.Rooms are very nice and the staff was very helpful particularly the valet staff.The comp breakfast was the best at any Embassy Suites I've stayed at.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: You cannot beat this Embassy Suites for a comparable price. I have gone to many, many Embassy Suites and this one beats them all. Excellent service, breakfast, rooms, manager's reception with free drinks overlooking the ocean, nice, nice pool and patio area. Check out the website and it shows most of all the excitement. Read all the reviews. They mostly receive top reviews and everyone wants to go back for more and for longer, like me. I had a fabulous honeymoon here. Walk to the beach and all the fun spots. This Embassy Suites put you right where you need to go with lots of pampering. I want to go back right now and I plan to soon. You cannot go wrong with Hilton. They have a really nice pool area and fitness center.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I have to say, my family has stayed in Embassy Suites all over the USA. Dallas, Los Angeles, Tucson, Houston, and I could go on. With 3 children, the free breakfast and for my husband and I, the free afternoon drinks have always been a deal breaker. Making the cost of the suite seem like a bargain. This Embassy Suites was no different. We got a beautiful room, I saw the mountains from one bedroom window & the beach from both balconies. I called housekeeping after coming back from the beach the first day to ask why my room hadn't been cleaned and they had someone up in a matter of minutes. I had to apologize later to housekeeping because I found out they HAD COME BY and my daughter told them her mom was asleep and to come back later. Poor communication on our part. The only complaint I have is qwith the front desk staff and the manager. First, we called before we left tosee if we could get a room with a view. The young man answering the phone definitely did not have the "Aloha Spirit" nor was he : Hanging Loose". He was rude and hung up on my husband when he asked his name. The last night of our trip, August 21, we had to evacuate the building, we were on the 18th floor. Alarms went off and we headed down the emergency stairs. I ended up helping a lady get her handicap dad down all those flights of stairs. The whole time we saw no one from the hotel or anyone giving any instructions. We get out to the street, still no sign of any hotel staff, and we stayed for about an hour until we noticed other guest going back in the building. Did not know why we had been evacuated and still are not clear almost a month later. Some of the breakfast staff told us it was because someone smoked in the stairwell and set of the alarms. The front desk was plaesant enough but not people oriented. To add to the humor, I complained to the corporate office and got a really nice email from the manager. "They are working on the incident that happened that night." What ?? What good does that do me now. Regarding getting hung up on, "If I was calling from a cell phone, I may have dropped the call." For some reason that pissed me off more than anything. Oh yeah, he offered me one night free at the hotel the next time I am visiting. I found that funny !! I live in Arizona so it isn't like I am going to stop by next week. Beautiful hotel, very good Food & Beverage Staff, Housekeeping was fantastic, Management and front desk- YOU GUYS SUCK !!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Very pleasesd with this hotel, it had everything we needed. Breakfast included was more then enough with cook to order fried eggs or omlettes, bacon, sausages sometimes ham available. Pastries, bagels & cream cheese, bread for toast, scrambled eggs in buffet, fruit, salad, miso soup and rice, french toast, pancakes hot syrup and biscuits and gravy, cereal, pineapple crisp, can't go wrong there. One trick was to put the pancakes or french toast through the toaster again to freshen it up. Pops and juices with different teas and coffee also availalble. Grab your fruit here for snacking the rest of the day you will not regret having something healthy handy. Birds in the eating area are annoying but you're outdoors, hard to avoid this I guess. Never had to wait in line for long. Grab your free paper and head over to the pool area after, very relaxing. Brought breakfast back to our room a few times and learned the maid will not take away these items you must put them outside your door. Maid service could have been better I put an empty bag of chips on the floor and they were still there when I came back? I even placed a housekeeping tip out each day. Was asked if I wanted the bed made up today???? By the way the beds were a bit hard and we all had trouble sleeping. Head to the lawn chairs in the afternoon good for a nap. Manager's reception drinks were good didn't have to wait, took back to room before heading out for dinner. Nibblies were bits and bites and chips. Kids had mocktails or pop. My kids brought down large refillable glasses for their pop so they could have some later too, same at breakfast time. Pool was very good,warm and fair sized could get some excersize. Never a problem to find a lawn chair or a shady spot. Massage offered also $20 for 15 min. Didn't try. Beach across the street. Great view Hula tower prefered. Looked at HHV fireworks fridays and Trump tower and pool room 731 great spotand view. Could watch teens at the pool and see line for drinks and breakfast here. Could hear the elevator even though we were not next to it. Service here was great, valets were attentive and friendly. Used hospitality suite because of late flight out and they held our luggage while we shopped that day and Johnny brought all our stuff over to that room with a scale so we could properly pack. Very helpful. Close to everything and beautiful surroundings, well looked after, but also very new. Internet was good. Pink shuttle to and from Ala Moana practically outside the door. You can get everything in town though. Don't eat at Senor Frogs food sucks pepto night but atmosphere was fun. Cheesecake factory was great and leftovers for everone same price. Go through your coupon books(tons) save some money for good stuff. Over all felt extremely comfortable at this hotel I will definitely recommend!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My spouse and I had stayed at two hotels in Honolulu and we booked this property separate from the travel agent and had no regrets. We were assigned a room in the Hula Tower where our balcony over looked the pool, and you had a partial view of Waikiki Beach. Rooms were clean and the hotel showed it's dazzle!Pool area and Pakini Bar (Kieoke and Dennis) had provided us with excellent food and beverage service. We later took a stroll and swam at Waikiki Beach which was a quick half a block away. This hotel is very convenient to central Honolulu including the International Marketplace and a mall in close proximity. Other US Embassy Suites properties can take a lesson from this one regarding Housekeeping and overall how well this property had been maintained. The employees here at the ES Waikiki Beach truly understand "customer service."Again this is a "Primo" hotel, and have plans on returning next year with family and friends.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I traveled with a group of 11 people recently, ages 10 up to 79. Everyone liked this hotel! The staff at check-in was very friendly and offered us these great drinks. Sadly, the drinks contained no alcohol (after spending 12+ hours flying to Hawaii, you really just need something to take the edge off!). Even without the booze, the drinks were excellent! We were all upgraded to 2 bedroom suites, which was wonderful! The bellmen were lots of fun and very friendly. Once we were settled at check-in, we went to our rooms and the bags arrived shortly after. The rooms were quite nice. The living space was a little small for 4 people, 4 suitcases, and 4 carry-ons, but we managed by putting all the suitcases in the bedroom with the king sized bed. One thing I find with almost all hotels - lack of drawer space to put personal items away. Clearly a 2 bedroom suite is meant for more than 2 people, yet there were only a few small drawers in each room! Since we were only staying for 2 nights, we lived out of 1 suitcase packed just for that purpose. All mattress were very comfortable and no one had back pains in the morning. We were in a 2-bedroom suite in the Aloha Tower. These were nice, except the view was not so great! The balcony (and I use that term loosely) was very narrow. There were 3 chairs and 1 little table on the balcony, but you really couldn't move around outside because it was VERY narrow. We were on the third floor and had a wonderful view inside the rather dumpy apartment building next door. Don't forget that you're in the city, so the buildings are going to be close! Across the street from our room was the Trump building, which was better to look at.The bathrooms were very nice. Lots of counter space by the sinks. Showers operated normally (meaning that the water actually went down the drain so you weren't standing in a few inches of water while showering - gross). The hotel shampoo, conditioner and soap were of better quality and smelled very pleasant.The hotel backs up the the Beach Walk, which had tons of shops & restaurants. It's a little difficult to find because you walk down a hallway and end up at the Beach Walk. The hallway isn't really marked, so you have to ask around for a way to get out there. The pool was pretty nice. One thing to remember - there are no pool towels outside! The pool towels are kept in the bathroom of your room.
