I couldn't find the towels at first and had to have my 13-year-old niece explain where to find them! So before calling downstairs looking for towels, search the bathroom! The pool itself was very nice, although not that large. And, it's located on the 4th floor! The view from the pool area is really pretty. It was kept very clean and there weren't too many crazy people/kids running around. Another thing to note - the hot tub was HOT. I saw many parents with infants in the 100-degree plus hot tub! Please warn younger children ahead of time that heat like that isn't safe for young children (especially babies - what were those people thinking?).We were able to get the free happy hour and free breakfast with out stay. Be aware that both of these things get very busy very quickly, so get there early! The night that we did the happy hour, the bar line was VERY long! They only let you go 1 at a time up to the bar and you cannot stack drinks, so if you plan to drink alot, get your drink and get back in line for the next round. The same is true for the breakfast - if you want to hit the buffet and eat, arrive shortly after it opens or it's super crowded and there will be almost no place to sit!The only negative we had here was that the fire alarm went off during the night one night and it didn't alert the entire building. We had family on the 8th floor who never heard the initial alarm, but did hear the all clear sound. When they inquired at the front desk later that day, they were told that some floors are louder than others! I believe that's something management should be looking at, right?Other than that, the place is great. Close to dining, shops and a short walk over to the beach! What more could you ask for?

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is an excellent choice if you are planning any type of visit to Oahu. My family traveled here with Granpa, small children & teenagers alike without complaint. The hotel is in a great location & there is easy access to the beach & shopping. The hotel also offers a wonderful comp breakfast each morning & cocktail reception EACH evening as well !! The staff are courteous & plentiful....I can honestly say that I have not one negative thing to say about our stay here. The pool is not olympic size but very adequate considering you are a stones throw from waikiki beach. The rooms are clean, bright & well decorated. A bit heavier in the pocket compared to other "national branded hotels" however, I must stress this, the added value of valet parking with in & out priviledges, comp breakfast, cocktail reception, location, service & quality is definately worth the added expense. You can't go wrong in choosing this location for any length of stay. If you are island hopping, do your shopping here !! There are great bargains if you are adventerous enough to visit China-town otherwise the multiple vendors in the International Marketplace have tons to choose from. Take your time & browse , but not to long, where you might save a dollar or two here between vendors the prices triple on the other islands for the exact same merchandise. I regret not doing all of my shopping here, it was an expensive mistake.Senor Frogs was a great place to eat, alot of fun & middle of the road pricing. Pearl Harbor was busy, busy, busy ....go early!! North adventure shark tours was ( kinda short ) completely invigorating & a must do if you love the ocean & everything in it !!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We are on our last night and decided to review the hotel now because we are so happy with our experience!We are a family of 3, myself, my husband and our 3 year old daughter. We are also traveling with my Mum. We wanted a hotel with a seperate bedroom so when our daughter went to bed the whole family didn't have to! We arrived a day before my Mum and booked a 1 bedroom suite for the first night and a 2 bedroom suite for the remaining 10 days. Our pleasant experience started on checking in. After a long night flight from Australia we arrived at the hotel at 7.30 am, we were greeted with a fresh juice and a pleasant smile. Lorena at the registration desk gave us our room straight away and upgraded our first night stay to the 2 bedroom suite so we didn't have to change rooms the next day! Thank you!Our room was great, 2 separate bedrooms, each with en-suite, with a separate living room in between. The rooms are a good size (one had a King bed and the other 2 Queens), the furnishings are good and the hotel generally very well kept. Our room was sold as a partial ocean view and that's what we got although the view was better than I expected. Our room overlooked the pool. We had a coffee maker, sink, fridge and microwave.The facilities of the hotel include a pool which is great. It is a really good temperature with a very warm spa. There are two very good areas in the pool for kids. The entire pool is very kid friendly with ample seating which is very clean and there is plenty of sun on the pool area for most of the day.Included is also a Manager's Reception on a few days a week ( we didn't use it but looks to include drinks) and a free breakfast which was great.The location of the hotel is wonderful. It is right in the centre of the beach walk shopping area. There are plenty of great restaurants around and right across the road from the Outrigger Reef and Shore Bird restaurant! The beach is a block away and the bus stop for the Bus to Ala Moana Centre is a block away.Tonight we have just found out that our flight home has been delayed 14 hours. We needed to extend our stay for a day because our flight now doesn't leave till 11pm tomorrow night! We went down to the registration desk to book a 1 bedroom suite (the smallest room here) for the extra night and Tali gave us our present room for the extra night so we didn't have to move!I cannot recommend this place highly enough. The rooms are comfortable, the beds are comfortable and the staff have gone out of their way to accommodate our requests.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Hotel lived up to all the good reviews. We traveled with our teenage grandchildren so the suite gave us more space than a hotel room. Breakfast was the typical Embassy Suite buffett but never were there long lines. Even the omelet station moved along with speed. The staff was very friendly and always happy to be of assistance. As stated in other reviews the beach was just a short walk across the street. There is valet parking but never had to wait for the car more than a few minutes.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great rooms, beautiful pool area, delicious breakfast and only a one block walk to the beach. This was our first time in Waikiki and we really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. It isn't the most luxurious hotel, but the amenities are well done, and everything is extremely clean. We traveled with our 3 young daughters and booked a 2 bedroom 2 bath suite that was just perfect for us. There are a lot of restaurants and shops within 1 block, and almost everything in Waikiki is within walking distance. For the price, this hotel can't be beat!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great location, lovely big rooms , modern. Nice pool. Breakfasts included tasty! Friendly staff. Couldn't be improved upon in waikiki with kids!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We greatly enjoyed our stay at the Embassy Suites....great central location, across the street from beach, great breakfast buffet and wonderful happy hour!! Lots of great restaurants and shopping within walking distance. We enjoyed our hike to the top of Diamond Head...views are incredible, the maze at the Dole Planation, the Arizona Memorial, touring the Missouri, snorkeling at Hanauma Bay breathtaking. We found having a car rental a must. We drove to beautiful beaches: Bellows Beach, Waimanalo Beach, Sandy Beach, Halona Blow Hole. What a beautiful island! The staff at the Embassy Suites was very friendly!! We can't wait to return!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our family of 5 redeemed Hilton points to stay 3 nights at the Embassy Suites as the final few days of our Hawaiian vacation. We had a great experience and would return to this property.We were in a one bedroom one bath unit which was quite small compared to other Embassy Suites we've stayed in. For a longer stay the small space could have been a problem, but it worked for only three nights. Interestingly, we were told (very politely) upon check in that the max occupancy for the room is four people, but they'd let it slide this time. Just thought that was odd considering we've stayed in Miami, New York City, San Juan, Puerto Rico; and Irvine, CA in one bedroom units and have never been told that. One of the kids did sleep on the floor as the pull out couch is pretty small.While this property isn't beachfront, it is only one block from the beach - maybe a three minute walk at most. There are tons of places to eat within easy walking distance as well as two ABC stores on the same block for sunscreen, snacks, souvenirs, etc...Free breakfast is plentiful with lots of choices. Lots of crowds and hungry birds too, but nothing that seriously bothered me. A few tips: you can see the Friday night fireworks (courtesy of the Hilton) from the pool area. Just be sure to be on time as they start on time and last only 5 - 10 mins. Also, the line for the bar and complimentary drinks nightly looks intimidating, but moves quickly. Bartenders were very generous with the alcohol and very friendly. Be sure to take the elevator to the top floor and go out on the tiny balcony area for a beautiful view of the ocean and Waikiki. Last, if this is your first time to Waikiki, please don't expect a tranquil, peaceful paradise. Waikiki is a big city with tall buildings, honking horns, yelling people, etc.. The area around the hotel is no exception. Overall, this property was clean, well maintained, a good value, a good location and run by a friendly staff. It's not a resort hotel or one for those looking for pampering or oceanfront location, but otherwise I think most everyone would be pleased with it.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at the Embassy for the first four nights of our honeymoon and would definitely recommend it to others. I have read many other reviews on this site nit picking some little things, but I would strongly suggest this to travelers for all purposes. Upon arrival we were promptly greeted with a cold glass of fresh juice and many alohas. They allowed us to check in early with no questions asked and check in took a very short amount of time. The concierge was very helpful in suggesting places to dine as well, I believe Kari was her name, was even helpful in suggesting things to do in Maui as we continued our honeymoon there. The rooms were very clean and had more than enough room for the two of us. There were no closets as mentioned before but there was a desk that you could set a suitcase on as well as floor room to utilize. Our view was decent and was of the city skyline. We were located next to the elevator but it didn't pose a problem for us as we were on the 18th floor and not many people were staying above us. If you were to get a room ending in 01 on a lower level I would suggest requesting another room away from the elevator.They offer complimentary breakfast in the morning and drinks in the evening. The breakfast is fantastic and offers many options. They had a build your own omelette station that they prepare for you, pancakes, French toast, cereal, fresh fruits, potatoes, yogurt, bacon, sausage, pasteries…the list goes on and on. The seating is outside both covered and uncovered so there are birds that hang around in hopes of landing some food but aren’t too troublesome. The manager’s reception in the evening offers a wide selection of beer, liquor and the tropical drinks you would expect to find in Hawaii. They also had chips and salsa available as well as live entertainment that was very enjoyable and personable. The pool area is located on the 4th floor where the free breakfast and drinks are served and is keep immaculate. The pool in and of itself is nothing special but more than enough to accommodate the many guests. We went down to the pool early one morning and found the staff scrubbing the sides of the pool. They take great care of the grounds.We dined at The Yardhouse several times over the course of our stay because they had an AWESOME happy hour that started at 2 and included half price drinks, appetizers and pizzas. The selection is huge and the atmosphere is excellent. It was one of the first places mentioned by others when we asked for suggestions on where to eat and we totally understand why. The hotel is in a great location and within walking distance to anything you want to do in Waikiki such as the International Marketplace, the beach, many different higher scale shops, restaurants, etc. I have read in other reviews complaints on it not being higher class or not being right on the beach and I don’t understand why. The rooms were more than enough for the two of us and we really didn’t even take full advantage of all the things that it offered to us because we were too busy out enjoying what the island had to offer. The beach was within a hop, skip and a jump. We have no regrets in choosing the Embassy and would do so again in a heartbeat. We took the money we saved on breakfast every morning and pre dinner drinks in the evening, and put it towards extra activities and tours and we suggest you do the same!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Embassy Suites Waikiki was pretty nice; just need to recommend getting to breakfast early (before 9:30) since they had a tendency to run out of plates/utensils/food towards the end of the complimentary breakfast (huge breakfast bar with wide selection and eggs made to order if desired).Location was very convenient to everything and rooms were first rate. Wholeplace very clean and family friendly....definitely a 4.5 out of 5 starexperience

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: As a Hilton Diamond member who has been in a lot of Embassy Suites, these rooms are small by Embassy standards. We were in a one bedroom and there is enough room to pull out the couch, but if you have a lot of luggage it will be a little tight for an extended stay. We were traveling on reward points and were booked in a room overlooking a parking lot and viewing the city. Granted I was a non-rev, but I expected more.That being said, the hotel is nice and the staff is very friendly (outside of one staff member). It is a block off the beach and is a short walk to the public access area. As stated in earlier reviews, the valet service is excellent and we didn't have to wait long for our car at all. They were also excellent at helping us find our way.The breakfast was good and the only time I was offered Miso soup and an omelet. Since it is outside, the birds are a small issue, but weren't a nuisance and the manager's reception is a nice experience and does add value especially if you are traveling with your family. Overall, the Embassy is a nice place to stay and I would suggest the two bedroom if you are traveling with the family. Lastly, Roys and The Yard House are in the hotel and great dining choices.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The Pros – The hotel is in a great location right in Waikiki and very near the Ala Moana mall. Rooms are very roomy with a kitchen area. There are lots of space storage to unpack. The best part of this hotel which keeps us coming back to this location is the full buffet breakfast. They offer several great choices. There are several restaurant choices in the area. Roy’s Restaurant downstairs offers a nice lunch. The Cons – Room is not right on the beach but it’s just a block away. Our room was right next to the elevator which was very noisy. Kitchen is not equipped with cookware, dishes, bowls and utensils. The balcony is very small and narrow and not enough room to sit outside. The hotel does not offer any fanfare on the outside and it’s not an impressive building as other hotels in the area are, however, it is quite a gem!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I had two weeks in Waikiki with my partner & two daughters (16 & 24). Booked a 2 bedrrom suite at this hotel. Was delighted with the location, room layout and design. Friendly staff. The buffet breakfast was ok (not sensational) - very difficult to eat healthy. Great bonus with the free drinks every evening from 5.30 to 7.30 - included cocktails, beer wine & well drinks. Probably would not go back but this was because Waikiki is way too overdeveloped - nothing wrong with the hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I have never written a review on this site but do read it when I am travelling. I have recently returned from a ten night stay at the Embassy suites and what a place! I am a well seasoned traveller with very high expectations. Right from check in, when the 5 of us were offered a ice cool juice and were allowed without asking to check in 4 hours earlier than allowed to, up till the last day this hotel provided the highest and friendliest service. We travelled with our 3 teenagers and had a two bedroom suite that allowed each child there own queen size bed, and with three TVs in the suite there was never any disagreements about what show to watch. The breakfast was huge with my hungry boys being more than satisfied. The cleaning staff, bell boys , valet parking all were so friendly and helpful and at times when we offered a tip it was not taken as they were more than happy to help. The location was perfect as you only had to cross the road down a path to be at the beach and we could see the ocean from our balcony. Was very central to pick up trolleys to the Ala Moana shopping centre and right behind Trump tower where you get the bus to the outlet shopping. We were very sad to check out of our home away from home , dont hesitate to stay here especially as the breakfast was included in the price which would have cost us a lot more and they had a wonderful happy hour with free drinks every night for two hours by the pool. Keep up the good work Embassy we will be back!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I've actually stayed at this hotel twice (Aug 2009 and Apr 2010) for business, but just joined up and am getting around to writing the review. I will likely be traveling to Hawaii semi-regularly for work, and see no reason to switch hotels any time soon.Positives:- Very new and clean hotel. Spacious rooms and accommodations.- Fantastic staff. Friendly staff from the front desk clerks, to the valets, to the housekeepers, to the breakfast cooks, servers, and bartenders and they all at seem very good at their jobs as well.- Spacious rooms and bathrooms. Basic suite has sleeper sofa and "work desk" in addition to sink/mini-fridge/counter.- Great Embassy Suites breakfast and reception. Breakfast is very good with lots of fresh fruit, variety, and Hawaiian/Asian touches as well. Drinks are reception are VERY strong...watch out, kiddies.- Located on Beach Walk, near numerous restaurants, bars, and upscale shops.Negatives:- Only outdoor (covered) seating for breakfast, although you can take it to your room (trays offered). Staff has to fight off birds for you to eat in peace.- Parking is expensive, although not at all out of line for the area - no self-park option, that I'm aware of.- Beds are not overly comfortable and rooms do not have a built-in closet, so space can be a bit limited in the various furniture.- Potential for less than exciting views of other hotels.- Hotel is not right on the beach (access is a short walk through Outrigger - equivalent of maybe two or three blocks).Since I have a lot of negatives, you may be wondering why this is a five-star hotel. Because they're all nitpicks (but I wanted to be complete). I've never been to a hotel where I was more pleased with the overall experience - everyone smiles at you and learns your name, and it means a lot. I was there for eight days in August and had various people welcoming me back months later.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: If you're going to Hawaii, and want to be on the beach, most of Waikiki is not the place to be! This is only a block from the ocean, but it's more like being in the middle of a big city (which it is) than a beach location. This is a new Embassy Suites, but not a new hotel ... evidently, it's run by the Outrigger company (a Hawaii based hotel operator), and they took two of their older (adjacent) Outrigger hotel buildings and combined them into one Embassy Suites property (they gutted the buildings and combined 2 of the old small hotel rooms into 1 larger suite ... still a bit small for an Embassy Suites hotel, but reasonably sized for Waikiki.Our room was behind the elevators (even though my HHonors profile specifies otherwise) but it was 4th of July weekend and very crowded ... unless you like big crowds, stay away from Waikiki on the 4th of July. Our room did have a view (over the pool, across a couple of streets, past the Trump hotel, but a nice view of the ocean ... ask for a high-floor room, in the front building, facing west).The parking is valet only, but on property, and the valet service is great (we didn't have to wait more than a couple of minutes for our car).As with every Embassy hotel, a full breakfast buffet is included (outdoors, next to the pool on the 4th floor), but it's fairly crowded (many families) and not the most relaxing experiance ... the numerous birds don't help either (although the buss-staff continuously cleans off the tables after people leave the eating area, they can't get to everything as quickly as the birds!).One of the great features of the hotel is the Roy's restaurant on the ground floor ... don't miss it!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was a stop-over to see Pearl Harbor and Waikiki. The hotel is very nice and the service (especially the valet and bell service) was great. The pool area was not huge but it was nice and high and overlooked the ocean. The manager's reception was nice but the lines were long for drinks so stock up and get in line early. The breakfast was fabulous and the omelette station was super. A great location to get to the beach and nice shopping. Roy's is right around the corner.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Being a frequent traveler to Hawaii, I would stay somewhere else next time for sure. Not that it's not good but there are so many other better choices in this price range. Air conditioner was really loud, we were by the stairwell and there was a lot of noise, not people but more mechanical noises coming from it. Rooms seemed cramped for an Embassy Suites. Breakfast was good especially the fruit, really fresh. Check in took forever, not because of people but because of the incompetent lady who checked us in. It was okay but not for me.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I can only say one bad thing about the Embassy Suites Waikiki and that was the bed wasn't the most comfortable. Other than that, everything was excellent. You couldn't ask for a more friendlier staff all the way around, from the front desk, to the maids to the cooks and helpers at breakfast. We arrived on 3 July late in the evening, it was a very busy weekend and received a low level street view room. I went to the front desk the next day to see if we could possibly be moved to a higher floor. Since it was 4th of July weekend they were completely booked but were able to move us on the 5th for the rest of our trip. They moved us to the 20th floor in the front tower with a corner room, it couldn't have been better! Thank you Victor for taking care of us! We didn't need a car as everything you need is within walking distance. The breakfast is by far the best I've ever had at any hotel. We were excited every day to get down to breakfast. The made to order omlette's were delish! If we are back in Waikiki again we will stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: After a couple quite long flights to Hawaii, we made our way to this hotel, hoping our room would be ready as we arrived. I traveled with my parents and my teen brother, so we decided to take a cab from the airport and it was around 50 dollars. We stayed there for a little more than a week.Upon our arrival, we were received by a really helpful bellboy who took our bags directly to our room (two towers make up the hotel), and also explained us most of the amenities that the hotel has (from the pool, the complimentary breakfast, the manager's reception and drinks policy, the fitness and business center locations) as well as the nearby interesting things that we could find.On the other hand, the person who checked us in wasn't as nice as the bellboy, since it took him some time (about 15-30 minutes) to find our reservation, but during our wait we were offered some pineapple drinks.The room was completely decorated in a Hawaiian style, and I loved it! The couch, the lamps, the mirrors and even the carpet had Hawaiian motifs like pineapples, waves and palm trees! It was roomy, enough for 4 people, beds were comfy and so were the pillows. Our room had two 'lanai' where we had a nice view to other hotels and to the adjacent shopping mall. The bathroom was extremely clean and we were glad to be provided with beach towels. However, we usually had to ask for an extra towel since the cleaning lady would always leave only 3.About the location, it’s in a great place since you only have to walk for about a block to get to the beach, and also a block to get to Kalakaua Avenue where all the fashion stores are located, as well as the Waikkiki Shopping Plaza and the Royal Hawaiian Shopping Center. However, if you feel like going elsewhere to shop, the bus stop was also near. For example, we had to walk about 2 blocks to grab a bus to the Ala Moana Center or you could just go to the back of the hotel, in order to face Lewers St. to catch the trolley that would take you directly there.This hotel has other nice features, like the Manager's reception where you can have some drinks (juices, margaritas, blue Hawaii, etc), snacks (chips, cookies) and there were also musical shows. The one I loved the most was on Saturday evening: it was a dancing show with hula and other Polynesian styles.Something worth noting is the fact that there were also other free entertainment shows going on at the adjacent malls, from live music to lei making classes.Other feature is the complimentary breakfast, nothing really special about it, other than the fact that you should not leave for food unattended while getting something else because the eating area is "guarded" by little hungry birds that are waiting to steal your meals. The business center was a little small, with a couple computers but still quite prepared with printers, fax, etc. However, there was free (wired) complimentary internet is the room. Also, the pool needs a little improvement, it was kind of small for such a big hotel, and it had really high amounts of chlorine.On the other hand, the fitness center was, in my opinion, great. It had the right amount of training equipment and it was always clean. Also, the laundry center, there were lots of washing and drying stations, as well as a soap vending machine and a coin dispenser.In a few words...I recommend this hotel mainly because it was nicely located, nearby lots of stores, there was free entertainment, the rooms and installations were clean, and the staff was friendly.The only things I disliked, the fact that in order to use the elevator, you always had to have your room key, otherwise, it just wouldn't work. Also, the 4th floor, where the breakfast and pool areas are located, well, basically anyone could have access to them since they were connected to the adjacent mall.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We were going to split our time between the ES and the Hilton Hawaiian Village, but we liked the ES so much we decided to spend entire vacation there. The staff was great. Always helpful from the front desk to the breakfast stewards. The only issue I had was the valet parking. They were nice enough, but it is probably a tough job impressing the customer when the customer is paying an additional $25 per day (plus tip).Anyway, the room was very nice. Very clean and the bed very comfortable. We didn't have any problems with city noise. There was a baby next door, but he or she was asleep when we were ready to go to bed. The breakfast was great (as usual for ES). The business center had issues with the printers and one of the computers, but the help phone was right there and Emily came up and fixed the problem within 5 minutes. It was a very convenient location for shopping. We took the Navatek cruise and had to walk to the Sheraton for the shuttle bus. It was a quick 5 minute walk thanks to the directions from the front desk. The bellmen (baggage service) were very effecient. Housekeeping was usually good. They never banged on the door at 8, but on the Sunday we were there they didn't come until 3:30. Maybe they have a different schedule on the weekends. But really no complaints with housekeeping. All in all it was a very enjoyable stay. Next time we want to try Maui, but if we ever get back to Waikiki we will definitely check out the Embassy Suites again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Embassy Suites are fairly predictable: Nice room, Good Buffet Breakfast, Good service, free internet. This one was no different, but for rooms starting at $199.00 a night, charging a DAILY FEE for parking is ridiculous. This hotel is not ocean front but it is close enough to the beach that parking becomes difficult. Having free parking for hotel guests, would make this place a lot more desirable. As a parent with children I was also hoping for a bigger pool or multiple pools. I will look for a different place to stay next time I visit.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: What a Hotel and what a location. 2 minutes to Beach and 1 minute to great shopping. Never seen so many brands on one block to shop from. A Shopping Paradise. Relax at Maui and then shop till you die at Honolulu.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My husband & I were travelling with our 2yo toddler; so we really wanted to find someplace that had a +1 bedroom, so we'd have an extra room for when our tot needed a nap, etc. But having stayed in a so-so condo in Maui, I was leery about staying in another condo. So when we saw all the rave reviews for this Embassy Suites, we jumped on it and booked our 5 day stay there. It was a bit more than we wanted to pay, but we figured with the free breakfast buffet, it was worth the extra money. Overall, we were extremely pleased with our stay. The staff was very nice, accommodating, and friendly. One porter, in particular, (his name is Johnny) was very nice and even lent us a bunch of beach gear (chairs, beach toys for our daughter, boogie board). He also gave us a lot of great tips on tours, including our self-guided tour of USS Arizona Memorial/Mighty Mo/USS Bowfin. (Hint: There is a shuttle bus that stops by the hotel that can drop you off at Pearl Harbor for $14 RT, rather than taking the prohibitively expensive guided tours.)As for the rooms themselves, they were good-sized and had plenty of amenities. The beds were very comfortable and our cleaning crew was prompt and did a good job (this is a tall order since we have a very active toddler who likes to scatter stuff). Oh, and their toiletries were actually quite nice. I’m a shampoo and conditioner snob; and even I liked the Embassy’s offerings.The breakfast buffet was a good deal- plenty of selection and tasty. In fact, we never had to eat lunch because we were still so stuffed from breakfast.My husband very much enjoyed the Manager’s Happy Hour from 5:30-7:30. The drinks were strong and there was a wide selection to choose from. On a few nights, they even had live dance entertainment.If I were to give any critiques of the Embassy Suites Honolulu, I would say that it does get loud in the evening/night due to its location right in the middle of the hustle-bustle. So we couldn’t leave our windows open at night. I would also recommend maybe upgrading their windows to a more sound-proof variety, as we could really hear the sirens go off from fire/police trucks at night.Also, they should implement some sort of bird control around the food pavilion. The huge pigeons & sparrows were running/flying amok whenever someone would leave their unfinished plate behind; or if there were some crumbs on the floor.Overall, though, we highly recommend this place and would stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: First let me start by saying we paid $445.00US per night for a 2 bedroom part ocean view suite. We stayed for 8 nights at this very nice hotel, our rooms were very clean and comfortable, especially the beds. The hotel has two separate towers, we stayed in room 1123 which was on the 11th floor in the "Hula" tower, this tower overlooks the pool deck on the fourth floor, and has ocean glimpses. The room had two separate bedrooms, each with it's own bathroom and flat screen Television, the main lounge area had a sofa couch and single lounge chair, and another flat screen Television. It had a small kitchenette, a fridge, microwave and sink, but it didn't have any crockery or utensils at all, we had to take a spoon from the breakfast area. The balcony had a nice view of the pool deck and water views. The pool deck is where they serve breakfast and in the evening drinks from the bar. The buffet breakfast which is included in the nightly rate was fantastic, everything you could want, and a great omlette bar, where you selected the ingredients and the chef cooked it for you. In the evening between the hours of 5.30pm and 7.30pm they had free drinks from the bar, yes thats right free drinks for two hours, cocktails, beer, wine, spirits, as much as you wanted, with a friendly reminder to be responsible about it. The hotel is in a good spot, a short 5 minute stroll to the beach, it's away from the busy part of Waikiki, very family friendly and quiet. I thought the hotel was great, but it wasn't the cheapest, so I expected it to be nice. The reception upon check in wasn't all that friendly, but the rest of the staff were great, in particular the bar staff.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was my first time to Hawaii and I'm very glad to have booked my stay at Embassy Suites Waikiki. I was attending a college graduation of a relative and turned my stay into a vacation as well. I was going to be on Oahu for 12 days. I had booked my room many months in advance with the AAA rate, which was very reasonable when compared to other hotels that I had looked into. Upon check-in, I was pleasantly surprised to find that they upgraded my 1 bedroom city view room to an ocean view room on the 20th floor (2032) right next to the elevators. While I was aware of some previous negative reviews that complained about the noise of the elevator, it did not bother me. One - I have a slight hearing disability and two, I'm a sound sleeper. I actually liked that I was next to the elevator to quickly get to and leave my room. Having free breakfast every morning was great! Didn't have to worry about leaving the hotel to find a place to eat. Overall staff was wonderful. Location was great! Close to the mall, walking distance to the International Marketplace and lots of restaurants to choose from. Valet parking was pricey at $25/day but it was a necessary expense. Some other folks said that a car is not necessary, but I found it preferable to explore the island at my own leisure on certain days. I did do some excursions where pick-up or transportation is provided to Waikiki area, but still preferred to get around the island on my own. I recommend visiting the Polynesian Cultural Center - pay for 1 day with pick-up service and you can return there within 3 days on your own to visit PCC and explore some more. I also recommend visiting Kualoa Ranch, where I did both the 2 hour horseback tour and 2 hour mountain biking tour. The views of the mountains and valley at Kualoa Ranch are magnificent. There's a post office 1 block away. This was a big plus because I bought too much stuff and it was cheaper for me to ship stuff back home than risk being overweight with my luggage. USPS has large flat rate boxes that cost about $15/box.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We just returned from a week long stay in the Embassy Suites at Waikiki. The whole experience was perfect! The breakfasts and happy hours were wonderful, and the staff was a 10! Would highly recommend this hotel to everyone! We had a two bedroom suite for 5 of us and it was ideal.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is a great hotel. Nice location (2 minute walk to beach) and very large rooms. We had a two bd/two ba room on the 21st floor with a good view of the beach. This corner room has a balcony accessible from the living room and each bedroom. Breakfast was hot and fresh each morning and the happy hour is great. Very strong drinks and a great variety. They had live entertainment two nights. Very friendly staff from check in to maid service. Can't think of anything negative to say.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was our 2nd stay at the Embassy Suites (last stayed 2008) and on this occasion we had an corner ocean view room which was absolutely immaculate. The cleanliness of the Embassy Suites is Excellent there was not even a scuff mark or speck of dust anywhere in the room. The Airconditioning was very efficient and the room very quiet. The room was spotless.Our room was serviced before mid-morning every single day (we always say good morning etc and tip the maids at hotels which shows your appreciation and does go a long way and everyone's job is important).The hotel reception staff, the maids, the bar staff, the wait staff were very friendly and efficient. There is entertainment in the evenings along with the drinks and very basic snacks. We ate the breakfast each day but preferred to have hot tea and toast although hot food was available. The internet is free, a fantastic gym and very clean laundry rooms with plenty of washers and dryers available. (Detergents are available for $1.25 alternatively you can buy Tide at ABC Store for 85c).Valet parking was a little expensive at $25 per day, however the staff are quick to bring the car down to you. We will be staying here again and would definitely recommend the hotel.The location is excellent but not directly on the beach.And lastly, there was NO trace of any bugs or bed bugs in our room in the Hula Tower. We did not even see one let alone any dust or dirt or stray hairs.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Thanks to all the reviewers who supplied valuable information and tips, we had a superb time here at ES. The whole operation runs very smoothly and we were very comfortable the whole time. Check-in is handled while seated. Each receptionist acts as an advisor as well, pointing out facilities and explaining operations. I was very impressed with their level of competence and patience.We had an ocean view unit with king bed, with views of Fort de Russy on one side and the ocean on another. Although the unit was very clean and bright, it is a bit smaller than in other ES's. Since the bathroom opens from the master bedroom, anyone sleeping in the sitting area would have to walk through the master bedroom to use the facilities. This would be OK for families with small children, but not for older members. With just the two of us, however, the arrangement was perfect. The room attendant was very efficient and acted like a French concierge, always watching carefully to see who came and went. I appreciated this sense of security.Happy hour is extremely well organized and the bartenders are skillful in pouring and mixing drinks quickly. There is even a sign board featuring available spirits and drinks. Three nights a week entertainment is featured. But it is at breakfast where I found exceptional service. With a dozen employers overseeing operations, tables are quickly cleaned. In fact, there is a sense of team spirit in the works here. I suspect workers are quite pleased with their jobs. Yes, some of the dishes might be greasy at times but there is plenty of fresh fruit, which is usually replenished within minutes. Roy's is an institution and provides great variety. There is even a four-course vegan menu with 3 oz. wine pairings for $49 ($35 wihout). For an informal lunch by the beach, head on over to the Outrigger across the way and have their mahi-mahi plate lunch at the Shore Bird. $15. But for a special treat, sneak over to the Halekulani and snag a table at the House Without A Key for extra special mai-tais, prepared with very high quality rum and fresh mix--not overly sweet. Then order a fresh grouper for $23 plus $5 for side dishes. (Request Ian--he is that good.)If you have not seen the whole island of Oahu, E Noa offers a Circle Island tour that includes lots of stops and plenty of time to take pictures or even short walks. (On line)Our check out was very fast and accurate. Our shuttle to the airport arrived and we left with many happy memories.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Freaking NASTY!!!! We got bedbugs there. SICK I have to throw away all my luggage. I called the hotel to tell them and all they said was OKAY. THAT IS IT. Now I have to get my house sprayed and wash everything!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed in Hawaii for a few days after holidaying in Disneyland. We stayed in a great two bedroom suite to accommodate the 5 of us and the rooms were so spacious and the beds so comfortable. This hotel is in a great location and value for money. With breakfast included daily it was even more value. The pool area is great and the whole atmosphere surrounding the hotel is perefct. With so many restaurants and shops adjoining the hotel complex you are spoilt for choice. With free Wifi in your room its so easy to stay in contact with family and friends back home. Would love to stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at the Embassy Suites Waikiki due to a funeral so our stay was not exactly vacation but not business precisely. Having grown up and still have a lot of family in Hawaii, I’m fairly picky about Hawaii hotels since we have alternatives. That said, I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone. We found the hotel to be very convenient with a helpful staff, nice rooms, most of the amenities you could want and all for a reasonable price.The hotel is located one block from the public beach at the Eastern end of Waikiki. I think it is a little quieter than the Diamond Head end but with very easy access to the beach. Rooms are fairly generously sized. We had two queen beds with a dresser, wardrobe and flat screen tv in one room. The other room had a sofa, chair, coffee table, work table with wired high speed internet, a dresser/tv stand, flat screen tv, a few chairs. There was also a wet bar area with a small refrigerator and typical bathroom. Overall furnishings were tropical resort themed, e.g. pineapple designs on the couch but tasteful and not overly garish. Everything was very new and well maintained. There was a loose hinge on one dresser door which the hotel staff quickly fixed after we informed them. The hotel seemed fairly small actually which made it more intimate.We found the hotel to be very clean and comfortable. The breakfast was included which made it very convenient and easily made for the difference in price compared to other hotels. The staff was helpful always; housekeeping always left thank you notes for tips, food service staff went out of their way to be helpful and bell desk staff was fast and friendly. The location of the hotel itself was convenient as well, but getting in and out might be slightly confusing for some people since the entrance and exit are on a one way street leading to nowhere precisely. We did not make use of the usual vacation items, e.g. pool, guest services, kid’s activities, so I can’t really speak to them.The major drawback was that the hotel was valet parking only. At $25 a day, the rate was high but either comparable or lower than other hotels in the area. We always got our car quickly and there was never and issue of the lot being full. Room service, of course, was expensive and mediocre at best. We ordered room service a few times and the best part of the meal was the fresh fruit.I would stay there again and would highly recommend the Embassy Suites Waikiki to anyone but especially families with children

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed 3 nights and were very happy with:- the location, right across the street from the beach and shopping is at your door step- daily breakfast was excellent, - food and service at the pool was very good- stayed in a 2 bedroom / 2 bathroom suite which was perfect for 4 ppl- loved having "Roy's" restaurant in the same complex- great to have complimentary internet and long distance callsA good choice of hotel when staying in Waikiki !

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Sorry for the Delay.We stayed at the Embassy Suites Beach Walk during the week of 8 Apr 2010. The location is fantastic, really close to shopping and a short walk to the beach.The breakfast was wonderful as well as the evening manager's reception. Everyone we encountered were kind and professional.Ohh, great fitness center.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel is located one block off the beach. Walking distance to shops, restaurants (right outside the door) Waikiki Beach. Try to get a room 8th floor or higher for partial ocean views (they aren't too bad - can see the ocean, mountains and the city).Staff is extremely friendly and always cleaning. Pool is scrubbed every day. Buffet Breakfast good selection in an enclosed glass room (prevents birds) - the seating for breakfast is outdoors. Cocktail hour - one free cocktail that actually has alcohol in it. Nice convenience store on the first floor (for wine, beer, first aide, water, flip flops etc).Don't worry if your room is by the pool - all noise is pretty much gone early in the evening.I would stay here again without hesitation. I consider myself a clean person - this hotel is acceptable to me. It may not be the most expensive hotel but it's affordable, clean and friendly - you can stay there and not cry because your vacation has been ruined (like the Westin in Maui).

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I don't know why anyone would stay anywhere else in Waikiki. We were so happy with this hotel. We had a slight problem with our original room(Aloha 408) where there was a constant strange mechanical noise. I couldn't take 5 minutes of that. I think it was from the pool area since that is on the 4th floor as well. The front desk immediately found us a room in the Hula tower (931) with views of the pool, ocean and mountains. Our one bedroom suite was spotless and very large. Plenty big for four of us. The location was perfect for us. You could walk everywhere and there was a nice park across the street next to the Outrigger. The beaches at this end were much less crowded than down past the Royal Hawaiian. The breakfast was enjoyed every morning and the reception had great drinks and small snacks that were a nice treat while hanging at the pool or watching the entertainment. The staff were friendly and the parking attendants were very fast when we needed our car which was every day. We really appreciated the great saleswoman in the gift shop who gave us a tip on a sunburn cream!Also, if you plan to take surfing lessons, the only choice should be Hawaiian Fire Surf!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We were staying here on Hilton points so I don't know how much the room would have cost. We were on the 20th floor in the Hula Tower and had a good view of the ocean. The suite was a bedroom with King bed and balcony, and living area with balcony, mini frige, microwave, coffee maker, desk, internet, HD TV. We thought the location was great--one block from the beach, yet away from all the beach activity/noise. I know some people prefer oceanfront properties, but this was close enough. The breakfast buffet was great each morning with an omlet station. We also enjoyed the evening receptions with complimentary drinks and snacks. We would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Although this hotel is not right on the beach it is the BEST hotel a family could stay in. I have 4 teenagers and they ate the free breakfast every morning. They had pancakes, eggs, bacon, sausage, hashbrowns, fruit and juice every morning. They had plenty of energy to swim, snorkle, and surf all day. For lunch they would just walk across the street and get a burger from Hamburger in Paradise. They gave the boys free refills on drinks all week because they bought a cup the first day. In the evening the boys had happy hour for free at the hotel and then we had a light dinner. We saved so much money on food we were amazed.We got two rooms and every body had their own bed. The laundry room is another perk. They have quite a few washers and dryers and it is easy to do a quick load. You can pack light and wash one load. This hotel is very teenager friendly.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel best place to stay in the heart of Waikiki. Hotel staff try to get 10/10 from every guest. They deserve 20/10. Room was very comfortable, breakfast was amazing. Cleaning, room service, and whatever you think were the best. Every evening we had manager's reception around the pool deck, and relaxed. If we needed something, it was brought five minutes after we requested. I can tell that don't think another place to stay. Enjoy your vacation.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed for 4 nights in a 1 bedroom suite (2 adults & 2 kids - 10 & 12) plenty of room for 4 in these lovely suites and good options with 2 queen beds in the bedroom and a sofa bed in the lounge. Overall the staff were good but not great, but the facilities and suites absolutely top notch. Free buffet breakfast every morning was great and 2 hours of free drinks and snacks every afternoon by the pool excellent. we were a bit worried about noise being on only the 6th floor, but this was not a problem at all. Location is fantastic with restaurants, shpping, beach and transport right on your doorstep. Overall we found Embassy Suites very hard to fault - would definitely recommend to anyone wanting a great place to stay right in the heart of Waikiki.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great location, a block away from Waikiki beach. Staff was outstanding. We had a tour scheduled with pick up at 6:30AM. Breakfast times are 6:30-10AM. We went at 6:15 just in case they had something out. The area was still closed but the dining attendant, got us muffins, bananas, and yogurt in a to go sac for my wife and 2 young children with a smile.The suite is on the small side but adequate for parents with small children. With teenagers you would probably need a larger place. Great location to beach and nearby eateries.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed 2 nights at the Embassy suites in waikiki before boarding a cruise ship. We shared a double suite with my sister & her husband and it was less expensive than our getting 2 rooms. Add in the evening cocktails and a cooked breakfast and it was a prtty good deal in an expensive city to visit. Our suite was on floor 11 and so we had a partial beach view. The rooms were smalledr than Embassy suites I've stayed in on the mainland but adequate. beds comfy. the elevators were slow and floor 11 is too many steps for me to consider walking. We didn't use the pool, but it looked nice, adequate chairs etc. All in all a good choice for our 2 nights.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We used points to stay at the Embassy Suites in Waikiki Beach Oahu for 3 nights. There were four of us and when we saw the size of the room we were giving each other high fives. It was nice and large. We stayed on the 17th floor with great city views. Yes - you are about 1 block from the beach and not directly on the beach - but we knew that. The location is primo for playing tourist in Oahu. Plus as usual with Embassy the breakfast and happy hour were supurb! Johnnie who helped check us in gave us great advice on neighboring restaurants with half off food and happy hour prices between 3-5 pm. His advice was great. The rest of the staff was equally friendly and helpful. We would strongly recomend this hotel unless you want to be directly ocean front.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Just returned from a week in Waikiki staying at the Embassy Suites. Whenever we have done previous beach trips (several in Mexico and the Caribbean) we have always stayed in a resort on the beach. Our boys brought a friend on this trip so we needed 2 bedrooms. That limited our choices and the Embassy Suites was our choice in that it provided 3 rooms and 2 bathrooms. Not right no the beach but close.The hotel was clean. The happy hour drink line was always swift. The happy hour entertainment was good and the breakfasts were always very good. Easily would pay $10 to $12 per person elsewhere in Waikiki for the type of breakfast buffet provided. The staff was always very friendly and exhibited the "Aloha spirit" unforced. One of the managers in the breakfast area (Russell) spent several minutes with us in the AM giving us great North Shore tips with a map when we told him that was our plan for the day. Modest but well earned tips for the friendly and hard working cleaning ladies resulted in plentiful beach towels as needed.The only drawback; the beach is about a 1 block walk. Not so bad but that part of the beach is not the best. We would always walk down the beach (toward Diamondhead) a couple more blocks to be in front of the Royal Hawaiian beach area. Better waves, better beach area, Duke's nearby for beverages and/or lunch. Not a big deal considering that we did a lot more on the island besides hanging on Waikiki beach.Tip: talk to the bellman about checking out beach stuff (chairs, umbrellas, boogie boards, etc). Guest leave a lot of this stuff behind and the bellmen check them out to you if available. Don't complain if not. This is an unadvertised service.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here on the last night of our Hawaii vacation, coming to Oahu for the last day so we our boys could see Pearl Harbor and have dinner at Duke's. The staff is friendly and the location is excellent for walking to shopping, restaurants and beach. The rooms are much smaller than your standard Embassy Suites. I'm an Hhonors member and my profile requests rooms AWAY from the elevators, so of course they "upgraded" us to room 1121, right next to the elevator. Since we we're only staying the one night, I decided it wasn't worth asking to be moved, but the elevator did make a small room even smaller. But we we're only actually in our room long enough to sleep and shower. They are very generous with the alcohol in the drinks at reception. Our flight home in the morning was at 8 AM and the breakfast didn't open until 6:30, but we went down at 5:45 and they put together a couple boxed for us with fruit, yogurt and danishes and turned on the beverage machines so we could have something really quick on our way to the airport, we we're very thankful for that. I would stay again if in Honolulu, but would be very careful as to what room I was placed in.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: For the week of spring break the price for our 2 bedroom suite for our family of 5 was good compared to others. The location for access is super for walks to food, shopping and beach. Our family enjoyed the nightly managers reception. The breakfast had some variation and never had any complaints. Especially loved the fresh fruits and omlettes made to order.The pool area (only one) was small considering. They could fit a second one on the rooftop somewhere either for adults of smaller children, Grumpy adults do not like kids splashing them so it really was taken over by the kids. The pool side massage 20 minutes for 20 dollars was nice. And yes, there Mai Tais and Lava flows were a good value and tastey!Terribly slow elevators that made you wait forever (Aloha Tower). Our 2 bedroom suite on the 17th floor had a peek of diamond head and overlooked the beachwalk area. although the location was convenient, the noise from the street was not very relaxing. I suppose you just hear the partiers all night often no matter where you stay in downtown. We would probally book again for our family but maybe choose another hotel for a quiet couples vacation.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stay at this hotel. First, they helped me out wiht a great room -- get one with a 08 in the end and you get an ocen view -- very, very nice view of the beach. You are close to all that you will need -- PF Changs is across the street, a starbucks for in the morning, and the cheapest board rental that we found on the island (15$ per hour for a paddleboard -- really cheap). Then we went to the managers reception and had a great maitai and Margarita -- and they did not spare the tequila or rum. I am a frequent traveler and Hilton Honors member, thus have witnessed a ton of 'manager's receptions.' This was by far THE best in terms of the drinks. The food, however, wass non-existent -- chips and goldfish. The drinks, however, made it all worthwhile. After dinner at a terrific best PF Chang's (across the street), it was time for bed. Waking up early courtesy of jet lag, we started at the Starbucks, then watched the dawn over the beach and the waves -- only one block away -- so nice. Met the family for a terrific breakfast -- everything was great. I might suggest more local fruit and fruit juices, but other than that, the omelettes were the best I have had in a long time. They extended our stay for an hour gratis and then held our bags so we could tour before getting on our cruise ship. When I return to Hawaii, I will definitelys stay at this hotel. Oh -- and the staff defines friendly. Stay here -- you will not be disappointed.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: It took three attempts to get the right room.The first room, 4th floor, was alongside the elevator, we had read reports of elevator noise and did not even take the luggage from the porters trolly. We shut the room door, listened, and the bells from the arriving elevator did the rest. We asked for another room. The response was immediate and we were taken to another room at the end of a corridor on the 6th floor which seemed fine. But that evening when we turned the air conditioning off we could hear the shrill whine from an air conditioning duct two floor below us. It took ear plug to get to sleep. Next morning we asked for another room, and were given three choices, and the room we selected was fine for the next 5 days.Great service to satisfy their customers, but it begs the question, what to do when the hotel is full?Notwithstanding the room, the rest of the stay was great, excellent breakfast, eggs cooked to requirements, plenty of food choice, hot food hot, cold food cold.Evening managers drinks a great way to meet other guests and plenty of drink choices with nuts, chips and nibbles as finger food. Entertainment on three nights a week.The hotel position is good, close to the beach, perhaps three minutes stroll, and close to shops and transport. Good pool area, plenty of chairs to lay on.Car parking is high, $25.00 a night, left a car for one night and charged to two, but overcharge was credited without question once it was pointed out.Fantastic gym, perhaps the best equiped gym I have come across in a hotel, modern equipement, all working and very clean.Small suites, bedroom and lounge, but more than adequate for two person.Friendly and amiable staff throughout and nothing was too much trouble for them.Would stay again, but when booking would ensure the room was away from the elevators and building ends.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The staff there was fantastic. Everybody was very pleasant and helpful. When I was assigned a room behind the elevator, they were very gracious about giving me a different room. The room was very nice with a balcony. Unfortunately rooms on low floors don't have much nice scenery to look at but it was still very nice. The breakfast and manager's reception are incredible. It's not on the beach but it is only a short walk to it..

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Every staff member we encountered was extremely pleasant and accommodating. Our room was very nice ... we had the 2-room suite. We were amazed at how thoroughly the room was cleaned each day -- even the railing on the balcony was wiped down! Our most FAVORITE thing about this hotel was the fabulous full breakfast that was served each day, buffet style. I have never eaten so many different omelette combinations in my life!The one and only thing we were somewhat disappointed in was the food served during the manager's reception each day. Based on photos and videos we had seen prior to our stay there, we envisioned heavy hors d'ouvres ... instead, each day the food was either peanuts and chips/salsa, or chex mix and chips/salsa. I will say, however, that the free drinks more than made up for the snacks!!Even though this hotel is not situated ON the beach, we were less than a block away from the beach -- it was easily accessible. And being in the center of Waikiki Beach was very nice ... most everything we needed was within walking distance (although we had to take shuttles or the bus to more of the "tourist-y" type locations).

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: What a great place to stay! We travelled with 5 teens between 16 and 20 plus my wife and I. We had two one-bedroom suites. The rooms were VERY nice offering plenty of space. Lanais (balconies) out the living area and bedrooms were well used for reading and relaxing. The free breakfast was INCREDIBLE! Omelets/eggs to order, fresh fruit and various breakfast measts were well enjoyed by all of us. Every night there was a manager's reception with 3 types of draft beer, wine, high balls, mai tais, blue hawaiians, etc. ect. Snacks were a little lacking (pretzels, chips, nothing really out of the ordinary) but heck after a couple drinks who cares! Staff was very nice and helpful. Can't say enough good about this hotel. There are two towers - stay in the Hula Tower as these rooms have at least partial ocean views (If you are on floor 9 or above). Our rooms had great ocean views. The only negative is that the hotel pool closes at 10:00 pm which I believe is entirely to early for a vacationing crowd.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We really enjoyed the Embassy Suites Beachwalk. We booked the lowest price room and when we checked in, they had upgraded us to a two bedroom suite, Room 124. The room had a fridge and microwave and wired internet (fast!). The first night we noticed truck noise at 3am outside on the street, but never noticed it again. The breakfast is outstanding, including custom cooked omelettes at no extra charge, pancakes, french toast, fruit, yogurt, bacon, etc. The hotel offers a free happy two-hour every evening. Location is very good. Nice shops behind and 5 minute walk to Kalakaua Blvd. One block off the beach and the pool is large with unobstructed sunshine. We really liked this hotel. Thanks Trip Advisor for telling us about it, and for Roy's Restaurant inside it.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: First is the location, Beach Walk is in the center of most things, and a walk to the beach. Next the staff, were wonderful, from the moment we arrived until we left. They were helpful, kind, and quick to get whatever you needed from clean towels to special orders at their free breakfast.We arrived just before check-in time, we had a one bedroom standard room. When we arrived at our room its was not made up and there was luggage still in the room, {the people had a late flight out and decided not to check out until after dinner, but didn't tell the staff} I called down to the desk and in a few minutes were in another room on the 15 floor with a wonderful view. The new Beach Walk Area has dozens of shops, galleries and restaurants. right down down stairs. Great place for people watching.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Just returned from 5 days/4 nights at Embassy Suites Waikiki. It was an excellent hotel for the purpose and we will absolutely stay here again the next time we return to Waikiki.Our reason for selecting this hotel was our desire to have 2 separate sleeping rooms, as we have 2 young children including an infant who cries a lot at night. We didn't want the other child to wake up throughout the night, and the room served this purpose admirably.We were in Room 721 overlooking the pool/courtyard area and with a limited view of the ocean. The room has 2 separate lanais each big enough to hold a couple of chairs; 2 flat-screen TVs; a wet bar with a fridge, microwave, and sink. The inside room is the bedroom with a king bed, while the main room contains a sitting area, a small dinette set, the wet bar, and the bathroom. We were next to the elevator, and could indeed hear the elevator in the evenings and at night. This could be a problem for very light sleepers, but for us it worked wonderfully as the screaming infant was less likely to bother the next-door neighbors (sorry upstairs and downstairs!). A pair of earplugs, for light sleepers, would have been more than enough to deal with this minor issue.The room is in excellent condition. Spotlessly clean, very fresh/new-looking, with granite surfaces on wet bar and in bathroom. Provided are big comfortable beach towels, comfortable if not super-soft bath towels, and the usual toiletries.Service: valet parking only, generally very speedy with the only drawbacks being 1. no call-downs permitted and 2. spendy at $25 per day, though that is comparable to all Waikiki hotels. We requested nothing special from the hotel regarding services, but I did ask the concierge/activities desk once for a running route suggestion and he gave me several good ideas.Breakfast: Embassy Suites provides a full complimentary breakfast with the room, and it did not disappoint. It includes seasonal, local fruit (alas, papaya only one day, but pineapple every day, also variously watermelon, canteloupe, honeydew), eggs, french toast, pancakes, meats, oatmeal, cold cereal, baked items, miso soup, rice/nori for those wanting a Japanese-style breakfast, and absolutely scrumptious made-to-order hot omelettes (available egg-whites only if you prefer) including fresh vegetables such as spinach, tomatoes, mushrooms, etc). Local Lions coffee and fresh island-style (passion-guava) juices rounded out the offerings. Very satisfying way tot start the day.Reception: every evening there are free drinks (beer, wine, mixed tropical drinks, well drinks) and chips/crackers at the pool. We enjoyed it although we are not big drinkers. I suppose if you wanted to you could get liquored up for free before hitting the town! It's a very nice, relaxed, inviting atmosphere.Pool: It's in very good condition and nicely landscaped. There is an elliptical hot tub measuring perhaps 20x10 feet and was nice as we had very cool weather during our stay. The pool does not get a lot of sun during the day due to nearby buildings but that is not unusual for Waikiki.Beach: literally a 5 minute walk across Kalia street. While not technically beachfront, the hotel's location is 'just about' and not far enough away from the beach to even mention it. Great location on a quiet side street off Kalakaua - close to the action, but the noise won't bother you.There is a free business center with free internet, fax, and printing; a free fitness center in excellent condition with free weight dumbbells to 50 pounds and several treadmills; and free internet in the room.All in all, considering the 2 rooms, included breakfast, free internet, fitness center, business center, evening reception, and location, this was an excellent stay and a good value. We will absolutely stay here again!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our experience at the Embassy Suites in Waikiki was excellent in every way. We booked our trip through Continental Airlines, but we are all members of Hilton H Honors. My husband and I were traveling with another couple, so we had a two bedroom/two bath suite. We were upgraded to an ocean view suite on the fifteenth floor. The beds were heavenly, and all furnishings were comfortable and inviting. One bedroom had a king bed, and the other had two queens. The room with two queens had a door to the hallway making it easy to come and go without disturbing anyone in the other rooms.We really enjoyed eating breakfast there each morning, and also enjoyed the evening receptions. The food services manager was quite attentive to guests each morning. He gave each of us a book about Hawaii to bring back to the grandchildren. We had beautiful accommodations on the four islands we visited during this stay, but we all agreed the Embassy Suites in Waikiki was our most enjoyable experience. GREAT JOB EMBASSY!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel is spectacular. Spacious suites that are exceptionally clean! The service is outstanding, and the value tops all other hotels in the area. Complimentary breakfast, happy hour and wireless internet are all included in room right. It is a short walk to the ocean, but the hotel is steps from dining and shopping. I can't wait to go back!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Booked as a reward stay, I'm Diamond. Got room 508 (Aloha Tower), not that great a room due to it's location, too low and lots of cooking smells from the kitchen. Thought I would have been given a better room, my fault for not planning ahead, but this was my first reward stay at an Embassy Suites, I must say that I get a lot better rooms booked on award stays at Hiltons. Also hotel was booked up (95%) and could not change rooms. Regardless the room itself was very spacious and clean though. If you stay here get a room at least on the 7th floor or above, most rooms can't see the ocean, "Rear Window" effect for many rooms due to bigger and higher hotels and condos that surround this property that all have balconies (lanais) that are looking straight into your room. Breakfast buffet, although a lot of food is worse then most Stateside Embassy Suites I've stayed at, in my opinion. Lots of fresh pineapple, but after that its a dismal choice of scrambled eggs or cooked to order omelets, all very ho-hum. The hotel is surrounded by an amazing array of restaurants and stores, if you come to Waikiki to shop and eat then this is your destination. The beach is at least a 2 block walk, but the beach here at Waikiki is nice, not too crowded. Parking is very efficient, but costly at $25 and valet only which adds up if you tip the hard working valets. The streets around the hotel are not easy to drive on, very congested with rental cars, taxis and tour buses. It takes at least 10-15 minutes to reach the hotel from the H-1, but if you are only coming to stay at this hotel then no worries. I would not stay here if I was paying for it.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Positives: Location, Spacious Room, Friendly Service, Good AmenitiesNegatives: Avoid room #'s ending in 21, because your right next to the elevators. $25 per night for valet parking, no self parking.My wife and I really like this place because of its location on Beachwalk, near restaurants and shopping. Waikiki Beach is just one block a way. The rooms are spacious & updated. Morning Breakfast and Evening Reception are good deals. Would definitely return again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We enjoy this hotel so much this was our second stay in the past year (we also stayed with the kids for 10 days in March '09).Check-in is friendly, quick and easy. The staff are very accommodating if you have any questions, need to arrange any sightseeing, or in arranging late check-out requirements.While the property may not be right on the beach, the location is excellent with lots and lots of places to eat and drink within minutes on foot. The beaches are close by too; it is literally a 2-3 minute walk to Fort Derussy Beach Park (just across the street), or about 5 minutes to the heart of Waikiki beach (just east of the hotel...Waikiki beach is really so much nicer, and certainly better for swimming than the beach at Fort Derussy Beach Park, but on the other hand, if you're just looking to get some sun, Fort Derussy Beach Park isn't nearly as busy). And it's only a 2 minute walk to Kalakaua Avenue if you need a shopping fix.This hotel is also excellent value. When you consider the morning buffet breakfast with made-to-order omelet bar is included, and the complimentary drinks at the nightly manager's reception, it is really hard to beat the bang for your buck you get here relative to the other hotels in Waikiki. Like most other Embassy Suites, the rooms are very spacious (every room also has 2 balconies (one off the living room and one off the bedroom), the beds are comfortable, everything in the room was in good working order, and kept very clean. In fact, the entire property including the outdoor pool area on the fourth floor "Grand Lanai" is kept exceedingly clean. The only disappointment this trip was there were some slight cutbacks since our visit last year. Namely, the take-away coffee cups available in the mornings have shrunk to about half the size they were last year, and the hula dancers performing at the nightly manager's reception now only perform 2 nights per week instead of nightly. When I asked about the coffee cups and hula dancers, I was told it was "due to the recession, sir". But that's really just being nitpicky and is no reason for not staying here. If this is the worst of the cutbacks, there is no worry that we will definitely be back again! We highly recommend this hotel!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We got "stranded" in Waikiki after the massive snow storm in our home town and extended our stay in Hawaii by staying at the embassy suites for two nights. The hotel was fine and the breakfast and managers reception were also a nice touch but the hotel not on the beach like so many others, the pool is shaded for part of the day and the rooms are ok even though they are two rooms, they are two small rooms, with two small tv's. The view was decent for something this far away from the beach. The front desk was not the friendliest group of people I have ever encountered but they try to take care of you. There was not acknowledgement of my Diamond HHonors status but they did upgrade me to an Ocean View room. Finally, the High speed internet in the room was wired and did not work most of the time and not because of user error. I have to admit that we stayed at the Royal Hawaiian at the beginning of our trip so this review is biased because of that.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: spacious rooms, ask for ocean view suite - great views of the surfers and waves.Staff are great and fun! We booked tours at the desk with no headaches and no request is too small (or large).Wonderful breakfast included - including a made to order omlete bar. Pool area is always clean - actually the entire property is really clean!Happy hour includes good family entainment and all drinks (including the fancy booze drinks) are free.The beach is a block away ... a easy and pleasent walk. Shops in walking distance - and the main shopping area is just a block away. lots of fab restaurants for every price range.We will be back!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I was scheduled to be in Honolulu for three days and changed hotels several times before deciding to stay here. I researched trip advisor and read the reviews. To say the least I made an excellent choice. The location is one block from a strip of excellent shopping in one direction and a half a block from the beach which I could see clearly from my window. The morning breakfast was good and teh manager's reception had some of the best drinks all included with the stay. The business center was fully stocked with whatever supply you could possibly need and included free copying and faxing. I extended my stay two days due to cancelled flights in the states due to weather. The hotel was very accomodating. The staff was extremely helpful and made me feel as a valued guest. I could find nothing negative about this property, the location or the staff!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel is a great place to stay! It's only one block from the beach and is surrounded by great restaurants. The valet service was quick and efficient every time. The check in process was friendly and very easy. The rooms were spacious and every room had a balcony. The beds were very comfortable and the TV's were large LCD models. They had an outstanding free full breakfast in the morning, one of the best I've seen, with someone there to make omelets on order. The happy hour from 5:30 to 7:30 every afternoon provided free unlimited drinks up on the 4th floor outdoor deck next to the pool. They have a free business center with five computers in which to access the internet. The bartenders were great fun talking to.
