This hotel is not only family friendly, but also very military friendly and falls under the military per diem rate for the area. This is my hotel of choice in Honolulu from now on.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed in Jan. 2010 with spouse for one week. Chose this hotel based on the extremely positive reviews here and we were not led astray. Location is directly across the street from the beacfront properties Halekulani and Outrigger Reef, so if you must have true oceanfront, look elsewhere. If you don't need OF, stop looking and stay here. Location is great and if you plan on using tours or the bus, you really don't need a car. As others have noted, this hotel is part of reclaimation project called "Beachwalk". Exit hotel and turn right (and either through alley/beach access or thru the Outrigger) and you are on the beach. Turn left and there is an array of Restaurant selections (all ranges; Ruth's Chris to burger joint) and shopping. Keep walking for about a block and you hit Rodeo drive level shopping (tip: husbands, hide the wife's credit cards). Check-in was breeze and we were upgraded to OV room at no charge. Room was very clean and exceeded our expectations. Two balconies, very comfy king/good sheets, nice sized bathroom, two flat screens, free (but slow) wireless, decent in room coffee, fridge, microwave. The complimentary breakfast was much better than we expected (we liked that they change a few of the items daily). The MGR reception/happy hour far exceeded our expectations, with live music every other night (surprisingly good live entertainment). The staff is fantastic overall, esp. Joy (breakfast) and George (MGR recp). We had a car, which requires you to choke down hard on a $25/night charge. That would be my only complaint. Overall, this hotel is a fantastic value, especially so considering the location, free wireless, breakfast and MGR reception. Highly recommend it.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I stayed at this Embassy Suites the week of Thanksgiving 2009. Amazing in every way. Check-in was a breeze, and room upgraded upon arrival. The Suites are spotless, and internet was speedy and free. The welcome amenities were in the room, and chilling in the refrigerator. The staff went out of their way to make your stay enjoyable. The bartender's at the evening reception were personable, and poured a great drink. The Manager was on-site, and always pleasant to talk to. The breakfast included in the rate is top notch including American and Japanese items. The location is great. Yes, this property is not on the beach... it is across the street from it. The beach is literally a 3 minute walk from the lobby of the hotel. Restaurants, both chain and local eateries, along with excellent shopping are literally at your door step. I had a great Thanksgiving dinner at Ruth's Chris Steakhouse that is connected to the hotel, that the concierge arranged with a smile. The Valets in the car park are some of the nicest guys on the island, and are always ready with directions. So fast, the car was up before you could even sit down. Can't say enough nice things about this hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: All the rooms are two-room suites, with 2 TVs, 2 phones, microwave and refrigerator, and the price was well within range of the others in the area. Complimentary breakfast, drinks in the evening, and internet access add to the value. Unfortunately, only valet parking at $25 per night is an option. Do NOT accept a room ending with the number 01. The bedroom is directly adjacent to the elevator shaft and the sounds of the car moving up and down, coupled with the ding as it arrives on a nearby floor, are very annoying when you are trying to go to sleep. But for any other room, this is one of the best deals on Waikiki. Great staff, too.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I've stayed at various Embassy suites for both pleasure and business trips and have always come to expect good clean rooms with an excellent complimentary breakfast and Manager's reception in the evening. I didn't know whether I could expect the same experience at the Embassy suites in Hawaii, but I wasn't disappointed.When we arrived we were unexpectedly upgraded from a 1 Bedroom King (w/o an ocean view) to a 1 Bedroom King with an ocean view. It happened to be on the top floor (21st floor) and had a wrap around balcony with great views of the ocean and mountains. In the attached photos you'll see the Reef OutRigger (and their pool area). Also, you can see the path on the left of the OutRigger that leads to the beach, or if you dislike the path (I read one reviewer who complained about this path) you can just as easily cut through the pool area of the OutRigger.Our unit was a little smaller than most, because a portion of it was cut off by the emergency stairway, but we didn't complain as we had a great view with the wrap around balcony. Our unit had two flat panel lcd TV's and two separate air conditioning units - one for the bedroom and one for the sitting room. The air conditioners were on separate thermostats and both were very quiet. The King mattress was really comfortable and my wife loved the sheets and pillows.The unit came with a micro, mini fridge, safe, and wet bar. The in room coffee was very good as was the maid service. Every morning between 6:30 AM and10:00 AM we had a complimentary breakfast where we had an amazing choice of items such as: scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, toast, muffins, cold cereals, salad, fruits (pineapple, melons, cantaloupe, apples, oranges..), miso soup, rice, seaweed wraps, seawood seasoning (for the rice), juices (apple, orange, grapefruit). Plus, you could order your own fried eggs to your liking, and/or have an omellete with your own added ingredients (mushrooms, onions, bacon bits, vegetables, etc.). There were also pancakes, French toast, and other foods that I never did try and some that I couldn't identify.In the evenings there was a Manager's reception between from 5:30 to 7:30 PM that included free alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks. The bar included wines, beers, and some cocktails (Mai Tais, Manhattan, Tequila Sunrise, Whiskey, etc.)On our last day our evening flight was at 9:30 PM, so we thought we would be stuck for hours with not much to do but (window) shop, but the hotel kept our luggage in their storage room and gave us access to their complimentary room (first come first serve) to shower and change clothes. So, after our 11:00 AM check out, I went to Hanauma Bay for some snorkeling and came back in the late afternoon for a shower and change of clothes before catching our flight back home.This is a great location for shopping, restaurants and night life. Attached to our Hotel is the Yardhouse and for a fancier restaurant, Roys'. Just around the corner is Senior Frog's, theCheesecake Factory, high quality Japanese and Chinese restaurants etc. Also, just aound the corner is some amazing shopping, if you can afford shopping in the high end shops. There's also some cheaper shopping in the same area, so there's shopping for every budget. And, as I found out an ABC store on every block.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Awesome hotel with awesome staff. Our house Keeper was spot on. Her last name was Chen and she was a great help. She made sure she made contact with us every time we were in the hallway and asked if we needed anything. She was not fake at all. her attitude was great and sincere. I can't think of any negative to say except that there was a thin dark haired guy working at the pool taking orders. We was too worried about his hair and never took our order. The only other thing we could have done to get his attention was trip him which would have been fun but not appropriate.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: In over 400 stays with Hilton/Outrigger properties I have never been hassled and interrogated over the appropriateness of my rate. I am a state government employee and showed a photo ID to qualify for a rate $14 below the AAA rate. After traveling 20 hrs to get to Hawaii I was treated like some kind of scam artist.I have stayed at this property four times and have to report that management appears intent on maintaining a $239+ price point while reducing amentities. Gone are the bedside chocolates, happy hour entertainment, welcome music CD and breakfast papaya, etc.While Embassy Suites offers good value and is my preferred Hilton flavor I have never been treated so poorly. I reported this to senior management who never responded; a mid level manager was less than apologetic.In the midst of a substantial downturn in the Hawaiian travel industry I would have expected graciousness and appreciation. So much for that Aloha spirit. If you qualify for a discount rate expect to be interrogated over whether you truly qualify.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Was in Honolulu last month and enjoyed that so much, I didn't think this trip or stay at the Embassy Suites would surpass our last hotel. It did! Most of the other reviewers are quite accurate in describing the pros of this 3 year old hotel, but it was even a step higher, and better than I expected. Room had partial ocean view, comfortable beds, and a separate room with hideaway & another TV. Yeah.It was a treat to have a great breakfast, with eggs/omelets prepared to order. Every morning they would have bacon/sausage/eggs/pancakes/miso soup/rice/fruit, etc...but each morning they tried to have at least one something different....portuguese sausage, bread pudding, or papaya halves for a little variety. Appreciated the TV set-up for Sunday mornings important Football game at breakfast!The 2 hour 'happy hour' with snacks was such a Plus! No pre-mixed drinks, bartenders hand mixed each Mai-Tai, Blue Hawaiian, Hawaiian Punch, Margaritas, etc, with wine and/or beer available. Never were we cut off, nor did the drinks lose liquor as the night rolled on. Thanks guys! Make sure you have a few $$ for their great service. Friday night there are city fireworks about 7p? Saturday night was Hawaiian entertainment. Only problem with this sweet happy hour, you weren't really hungry for dinner. Suggest crossing Lewers and getting a pizza to take back to the room. Lewers Steet/Beachwalk Shopping had several levels of shopping/window licking...and a hopping crowd the whole few blocks.Another good near-by restaurant to get a reasonable meal was 'Eggs & Things' on Sarasota...a enjoyable walk. Go for the Calamari Steak or the Ahi Tuna at Dinner (see my Tripadvisor Review).Dukes @ the Outrigger is another hopping place, day or night. And their meal prices aren't too expensive.We rented an Advantage car for $13/day, but parking is a beast. Parked near the Banyan way across Waikiki for $10/day...and Pop took the bus ($1/senior citizen rate) back to our end of the beach and walked to the Embassy. Save $15/day...so we could spend it somewhere else. Granddarlin enjoyed their pool and with such beautiful surroundings, I was reluctant to make us retreat indoors. Access to the beach, was to cross Kalia Street to the narrow access between hotels. The Shorebird Restaurant is at the beach end of the access. The Outrigger Catamaran Sailing/Snorkeling guys set up their chairs/umbrella and (Jason or Rabbit) will explain their sailings. We booked the 10a Turtle Snorkel & Sail 2-1/2 hrs(M-W-F) for $42/$47. Not far off-shore is a 'turtle cleaning' station where sea turtles come, to have fish clean them. Catamaran & Equipment was good. Offered $1 soft drinks or $3/$5 Onolicious adult beverage. Saw many sea turtles, and even some came to water's top to say hello to us. Also saw whale blows, and sailed into several pods of spinner dolphins. Awesome for kiddos & adults alike.Snorkeled at Turtle Bay, Hanauma Bay, and swam at beautiful Kailua Beach....Beautiful.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed three nights at the Embassy Suites in the Hula Tower. Check in was quick along with the Aloha welcome. While I did get a partial ocean view in the Hula Tower, I had to deal with being right in the middle of the hallway directly behind the bank of three elevators and to boot, the ice maker and soda machines. To my fellow Trip Advisors-- If you stay in the Hula Tower make sure you realize if you get room number x21, you will hear the constant din of elevators and general hallway noise. I have learned that in my travels it is imperative to bring earplugs.Exercise room was great. Breakfast was awesome and the location is a plus. Suites are a little smaller as compared to other older Embassy Suites across the Country

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed 7 nights at the Embassy Suites in Waikiki during a business trip. It's what I expect and a bit more from an Embassy Suites and I was very satisfied with my stay.Location: It's located towards the western edge of Waikiki just as you begin to enter the heart of Waikiki. You're conveniently located to all that you'd want to visit in Waikiki (stores, restaurants, beach, etc) without being directly in the middle of the hustle and bustle. There is public beach access directly across the street and it's not a long walk to Kuhio Beach Park and Kapiloani Park. You could even walk to Diamond Head if you were so inclined. And for Waikiki the Embassy Suites has relatively easy access to the H1 and Nimitz Hwy to get you out of Waikiki.Rooms: The rooms are standard Embassy Suite style one and two bedroom suites that are large and comfortable. The room has a fridge and microwave and HBO comes free on the TV for those that care about that sort of thing.Amenities: The breakfast is a complementary buffet with an omelet station, french toast, pancakes, bacon, sausage, variety of fruit, home fries, rice, miso soup, pastries, and toast/bagels. There is also a managers reception each evening with free drinks (beer, wine, cocktails) and snacks (nuts and chips). The gym there is pretty nice as far as hotel gyms go. There are treadmills, ellipticals, bikes, dumbbells up to 50lbs, and a universal cable gym.The free Internet is not as fast as some hotels I've stayed in but not as slow either. It's adequate for checking email and general web surfing. Just don't expect to download music and movies at a fast clip.Be aware that as with most hotels in Waikiki it is valet only parking. It is $25 per day for hotel guests.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed a week at Embassy Suites Waikiki for friend's wedding.Large clean 2 bedroom modern suite, excellent front desk staff, well-appointed location.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My husband and I and our 3 children stayed at the Embassy with my parents and brother's family. We had three rooms and we had an amazing time. The staff were all extremely helpful and courteous. We had considered staying at a less expensive hotel but were so glad we didn't. This hotel is worth every penny and we loved the breakfast and complimentary happy hour in the evening. That alone was worth the money. It's nice that the pool is right there on the same floor as the breakfast and happy hour so the kids can swim. There is also lots of shopping just 4 floors down which is convienent! If you are considering a stay in Waikiki I would recommend this hotel. We will definately be back again! Mahalo and Aloha!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed 4 nights is a one bedroom suite in the Aloha Tower. The check in is nice with a fruit drink and a complimentary hawaiian music cd. I requested when I booked a quiet room and we were given a room on the 6th floor facing the street. It was so noisy the Yardhouse pub/restaurant had a live band on a monday night and it got louder and louder until 1am then after the music continued.The next day I asked at reception if we could move to another room higher the girl who seemed disinterested told us it was fully booked. Also the room was next to the linen room so we also heard the maid early in the morning banging around. The walls are so thin we heard the people above continually moving around and scraping their outdoor furniture. It doesnt make for a restful holiday thank god for valium for the other nights!!!!!We were looking forward to staying at the Embassy Suites,The breakfast buffet was good and we didnt need to eat lunch and also the evening drinks was nice.The pool area had a large pool and Hotel provided great towels.If I was to stay again it would be in the Hula Tower on the top floor -21 facing the pool area not near the linen room or lifts

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at The Embassy Suites in November 09.We were recommended this hotel by a colleague.We had booked a partial ocean room,and when we checked in, it was a dark room with a miniscule glimpse of ocean through 2 buildings.We upgraded to a 1 bedroom Ocean front which was beautiful.I thought the value for money could have been better,as some hotels charged less for the same type of accommodation (this is after we had to pay for a better room),and they were absolute beach front.The complimentary breakfast was one of the reasons we also chose this hotel,as we thought that would save us some money.The breakfast was ok... except for the fact that so many guests would take food out from breakfast area,thus leaving us with the excuse of "we've run out",when asking for fruit or yoghurt...point to other guests.. please be more considerate to your fellow guests!!There are plenty of ABC stores in the area,and they do SELL fruit and yoghurt.The bird/pigeon situation was out of control at breakfast...at first we thought it was amusing,but seeing plates of food getting thrown out,because the birds had started to eat it,because the guest had gone to get drinks,is a total unnecessary waste.Eating the same breakfast for 7 days was a tad boring too. Coffee was horrendous..I noticed a lot of guests were bringing in Starbucks....that is not a good sign.The wait staff had a job cleaning up after the guests and the birds!!! Maybe the area could be closed in...just a suggestion.Managers drinks were fine,we only went once and the band was fun and a great way to start the night.Other than that, the room was clean and tidy,and you couldn't fault anyone that worked at the hotel.The free internet was great... though a bit slow,wasn't a problem for me though.Checkin and checkout was fine.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Everything about this hotel was A+ from the staff, to the cleanliness of rooms, location...this hotel was the greatest. Awesome breakfast, fun happy hour, clean and spacious pool area, courteous and helpful staff. Fantastic city and beachfront views.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed Dec 5th -11th in Aloha Tower (The one closest to the ocean). Very nice hotel. Breakfast was easily the best Embassy breakfast I have ever had. Lots of variety and set up very nice.Free internet was a welcome surprise even though it was somewhat slow.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is a great hotel for families and couples! When arriving, you are greeted in a beautiful, large open lobby with complimentary drinks. We stayed in a two bedroom, two bathroom suite with a living room and balcony. The breakfast is amazing. There is so much to choose from, ranging from American, Hawaiian, and other cultures to accommodate the diverse tourist. There is even an omelet bar to create your own. The hotel has a happy hour on the swimming pool deck everyday for 2 hours where complimentary snacks (chips, salsa, queso, chex mix, fruit, veggies) and drinks (alcoholic and non-alcohol) are served with live Hawaiian music. The rooms and hotel in general were very clean and the service was wonderful. The concierge desk was more than helpful with planning our activities on the islands, and one representative, Lilli, even went out of her way to come eat dinner with us and give us authentic Hawaiian spices to take home and enjoy. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking to vacation to Honolulu. Great location, great service, great hotel!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I have stayed at this hotel serval times for work, and out of all the hilton properities in Waikiki I think this is the best one. the staff was always very friendly and helpful, the room always clean, and embassy suites is all suites. The manager's reception was always nice, but generally had to be cut short to ensure that you were easting without a 2 hour wait. Breakfast is also a plus. There are only 2 negatives to this hotel in my opinion, the paper thin walls between the rooms. You can hear conversations and/or the TV in the next guest's room. I lost sleep over this more then once. The other negative is the slow internet connection in the rooms. It may be a free connection but it can be painfully slow and unresponsive in some applications.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We traveled to Honolulu for 4 nights and stayed at the Embassy Suites Waikiki. Overall, we would say it was a very typical Embassy Suites, so we knew what we would get. Upon check in, we found that we would get a room with 2 queen beds instead of the king bed that had been requested and verified over 5 months earlier. Not a big deal, but mildly disappointing. The room was very comfortable, but since we had just spent 5 nights at the Grand Hyatt in Kauai, our standards were probably set a little too high. The bath tub was the smallest tub I had ever seen---not a problem for a shower-type person, but it really seemed out of place for such a nice hotel. The breakfast and the cocktail hour were very nice and helped with the expenses! Location-it is not on the beach. Close to some great shopping and restaurants, but if you want a beach vacation, you may not be happy with the location. The biggest disappointment with the E.S., though, was the concierge. Every time (at least 4 times) we approached the concierge, they always made an excuse of why they couldn't help, and referred us to the bell captain. Luckily, the bell captain was helpful. It seems that the concierge closes fairly early, and if it is close to their end time, they were not willing to help. We talked with another couple staying there who was clearly given wrong information by the ooncierge---they were told the trolley did not go to Diamond Head. We knew that was wrong because we had just purchased a trolley ticket and visited the site. Why would they purposely give wrong information? The only thing we could think of was that they prefer tours that they might get a commission on. Enough, though! Overall the Embassy Suites did a fine job and we were very satisfied with our stay. It's hard to be disappointed for long when you're staying on a beautiful island with great people and lovely weather. We had a trip of a lifetime, and were happy to be in paradise for awhile! Make up your mind to have a great time and don't let the little things get to you! Attitude is everything!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The hotel is wonderful and extremely well run. Our stay was pleasant from the manager reception to the check out process. I will definately stay here again. The staff went above and beyond to make our stay very enjoyable.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I did extensive research on which hotel to stay in for our trip to Waikiki (traveled with my husband and our 2 young children). I decided to book the Embassy instead of the Hilton because I thought we'd save money with the free breakfast and drinks, and the location seemed better. Boy was that a mistake! We coudn't even see the ocean from our room or the pool area--and the city noise was deafening. I felt like I was in NY City instead of Hawaii! The rooms were typical Embassy Suites, which are nice if one is skiing in Tahoe, but very dark for a tropical location. The walk to the beach was a nightmare with 2 kids and all our gear. The public path is stinky, narrow, and crowded--and the beach area there has a lot of coral. You need to walk another 15 minutes to get to the good part of Waikiki beach. By the second day we all had blisters and were miserable from the walk. The next morning the conceriege said we could all buy a day pass at the Sheraton's pool (which had water slides so the kids were jumping for joy). After walking all the way there, the Sheraton said the pool is for registered guests only! My heart broke at the look of disappointment on my kids faces! On day 4, I was sitting by the pool trying to talk on the phone, and the garbage trucks were so loud I couldn't hear a thing. I couldn't take it anymore! So I called the Hilton and we transfered to that hotel. What a difference! The pool, the Lagoon, the grounds, the room...it was beautiful! I would definitely stay there if we ever visit Waikiki again. I like the Embassy Suites hotels, but their Waikiki location was not our idea of what a Hawaiian vacation should be. Stay at the Hilton instead--especially if you have kids.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great hotel! I stayed here for business but picked it for when my family came to visit. It has a nice workout room (several ellipticals, treadmills, couple of bikes, some hand weights, ball, nautilus weights, tvs on some equipment), GREAT breakfast...made to order eggs/omelettes, manager's mixer with alcoholic drinks (no kidding...alcohol), "appetizers" are pretzels, goldfish, chips, salsa, dip, nice pool, really nice service people (very friendly), free access to wi fi on grand lanai, free internet hard connection in the rooms, access to computers in business office (free) with printers (free), laundry ($2.25 per wash), easy access to the beach, shops and food. Only complaint... $25 per day for parking (if you don't mind a 1/2 block walk...try the Hale Koa parking in Fort Derussy (on the other side of the Trump Hotel)...much cheaper!) and the swimming pool although a good size for doing laps was always full of people. It would be nice if they would allow people to swim laps in the a.m. I went and of course 5 minutes after getting in the maintenance staff came to clean the pool.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Rooms were large and clean. Bathroom also a good size. The lobby area was a little like a train station and impersonal. The breakfast was substantial but the table area felt like a noisy boarding school dining area. Infact we disliked it so much we took the food on trays back to our room to eat.The pool area was ok but way too noisy and busy for me.The hotel is great for families but would reconsider staying here again without children mainly due to the pool area.Liked the property overall.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I stayed at the Embassy Suites Beachwalk for 4 days in November. The hotel was clean, check in was a breeze and everyone was very kind and helpful. The daily breakfast was always fresh and tasty. The bartenders at the daily managers reception were pretty funny! It didn't take them long to figure out exactly what we wanted when we approached the bar! The entertainment during happy hour was very good. Very Hawaiian! My thanks to the assistant general manager, Mark. He was a big help to me when I needed assistance for the group that I plan to return with in January. This hotel has easy access to the beach and close to the International Market Place for lunch or shopping. I loved this hotel so much that I will be returning in a couple months with 25 people!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My husband and I just got back from our first trip to Oahu. We usually visit Maui but decided to visit Oahu this time. We are Hilton Honors members and we wanted to use our Hilton points, so we decided on the Embassy Suites. It did not disappoint. We were greeted by the friendly valet staff when we pulled in to the very cool open air atrium. Even though we were using our Hilton points they upgraded our room upon request at no extra charge, Our room was very clean and comfortable. I thought it was going to be a problem with the room being located next to the elevator, but it didn't bother us a bit. The view was mostly of the city and would have been a spectacular view if the Trump Tower was not there. We really enjoyed a full breakfast every morning and the manager's reception. This is one of the reasons we choose Embassy Suites whenever possible. The staff was very friendly and helpful, especially the concierge. The hotel is conveniently located next to restaurants, shopping and the beach. One con is the price of parkingwas a little high @ $25 a day. We will stay there on our next trip!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We did a ton of searching on this site and are happy we stayed at the Embassy Suites. My husband did need to work for a couple of days so I was on my own with my 2 kids under 5 and the hotel and location made it all easy. We could walk to a lot of shops and restaurants (2 good ones at the bottom of the hotel-Roys and Yardhouse).Pros: spacious room, huge breakfast with absolutely everything every morning (we filled up sippy cups w. milk, grabbed extra yogurt and fruit for the day too), pool only went to 4 feet, and had a special 1 1/2 ft. deep section that was perfect for my little one. We could order lunch poolside. There is a small fridge and microwave. The hotel had a great hula show and a band on the weekend during "manager's hour". When I decided I wanted to rent a double stroller, the hotel set us up with that. the hotel can also set up babysitting (don't know for how much). So it was very family friendly. We were high enough up on an end unit so we had a great view. Rolling crib was easy to move my son in and out of the main bedroom without waking him. A/C was mostly loud enough to drown out noise in the other room. I slept on the pull out couch a few nights and it was fine as well. All the service personnel were friendly and anytime we needed something in the room, they were at our door in minutes.Cons: Parking was $25 a day, but it was kind of the same everywhere. The beach was a long block away down a narrow path and once we got there, there wasn't much of it (water was nice there though) with great views of Diamondhead. All the concierges weren't so great- they sent us to a great free hula class but it was serious and really for adults only, when asking for a local place to get a quick bite to eat, they recommended only fast food chains. There is no restaurant in the hotel so the only place to get food after the morning buffet closes is at the pool bar (good menu though). Beach rentals seemed cheapest by the Outrigger Reef condos if you walked along the beach a bit to the north.We were very happy there and would stay there again, it is right in the heart of great shopping and you can take the bus fairly easily, although we rented a car and saw all of the island.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Embassy Suites what a great place to stay for a relaxing holiday, we were 2 couples and had a 2 bedroom suite in the Aloha Tower on the 10th floor for 10 days. The breakfasts are superb with plenty of choice and the omlettes are amazing, the Managers shout at 5.30 every night around the pool was an excellent to place meet other guests. The staff were all very pleasant and nothing was too much trouble. To have a guests laundry within the complex is also a plus 5 or 6 washing machines and dryers and also a coin changer. The cleanliness of the rooms and the work of the housemaids is a credit to the Hotel and it's staff a very well organised business. We have stayed in other Hotels in Honolulu and this is by far the best we have stayed in - we will be back.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Nice hotel. We had a couple of problems with the high speed internet, but the maintenance staff responded promptly and set up a temporary solution until the problem could be resolved. Staff was very helpful.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I had read every review I could get my hands on before booking our 10 year anniversary vacation to Hawaii and finally decided on the Embassy Suites hotel. I was not disappointed. When we arrived, I asked the person checking us in at the front desk if we could get a room with a great view since this was our first time to Hawaii. We paid for a city view, but they were able to upgrade us to an ocean view room on the 20th floor of the Hula Tower. Amazing views.The breakfast each morning was huge with lots of variety and allowed us to either skip or have a very light lunch. Eggs, yogurt, sausages, bacon, omelets, pancakes, french toast, bagels, muffins, cereal and fruit. The manager's reception was also a nice bonus. We would wander down and grab a few drinks before heading out to dinner. Helped to save on the bar bill at the restaurant.The rooms were spacious, clean and well designed. We loved having the two rooms (with the door that closed between them) in case one of us got up earlier than the other. We didn't park a car overnight, mostly due to the $25 charge, but rented a car for 2 separate days and the activity desk was very helpful booking that for us. Between walking and the bus, we were never far from any activity.All in all, we were very happy with our stay and would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Hawaii. Great spot. Great staff. Great hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We just came back from our Hawaiian vacation, and stayed 3 nights at the Embassy Suites. It was a great time! When our taxi pulled up, there was someone there to see if we needed help with our bags. Check-in was fast and our room was ready even though we got there before 3pm. They had upgraded us to an ocean view in the Hula Tower. We were on the 14th floor and really enjoyed spending evenings sitting out on the balcony and soaking it all up! Our suite was comfortable, roomy and CLEAN. Same can be said about the bathroom too! The breakfast buffet was excellent! Scrambled eggs, potatoes, fruit, french toast, pancakes, rice, breads and pastries and the omelet station - just to name some things. The Kona coffee is delish as well as the guava juice. The evening manager's reception was a great way to start the evening. A good choice of beer, wine and tropical drinks to choose from, and the snacks were decent too. We enjoyed using the pool and hot tub, and the pool bar was nice to have right there. (if Lewis is bartending - he is great! A local that can tell you lots of great advice for the island). The beach is just a short walk away, and we set up in front of the beach by the Hale Koa/Ft Derussy area. There is a stand to rent kayaks, surf boards, etc - but we rented 2 loungers and an umbrella. A little pricy at $40 - but it's for the whole day, and if you plan on staying out all day - definitely worth it to have an umbrella to escape from the hot sun now and then. The whole Waikiki Beach Walk area is new and nice and there's lots to choose from to eat or shop. There is an ABC store across from the Embassy Suites, & also a Coco Cove located on property for drinks, snack, souvenirs, etc. (Definitely utilize that mini-kitchen and fridge to save $$$). If you go down Lewers St - hit Moose McGillycuddys for Happy Hour (4-7pm). Great drinks for just a short walk away. I could go on and on. Can't say enough about this place! All of the staff are helpful and super friendly. A great Aloha Spirit here!! We spent the remaining 4 nights on North Shore - which is a nice balance from busy Waikiki. We waited until we checked out of Embassy Suites to go rent our car. Not worth it to have a car in Waikiki. I believe the ES charges $25/day to park. And why bother - you can walk everywhere. The ES is great to arrange an airport shuttle to take you to the rental places. Just call down to the front desk and they will get it done for you. Also - there are a couple of concierges that walk around at breakfast if you want them to arrange fun things like luaus, dinner cruises, etc. We did some parasailing through their help. Highly recommend it!! We plan to make a trip to Oahu every year... and we will definitely be coming back to stay here! ALOHA!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The embassy suites hotel offers many amenities that other places would charge for. The free cooked breakfast was more than we thought it would be. They offer an omelet bar with a friendly talented chef prepares your custom omelet. Plenty of other standard hot breakfast items as well as the cereal and juices you would expect. We were on the 17’Th floor with an ocean view room that we could lay in bed and look out across the sea. Standing on the balcony we were able to see both the mountains and the ocean. The staff was very helpful and attentive to our requests. The manager’s reception in the evening was a great way to either start of the night or to relax after a long day. The drink selection was excellent and the ambiance of the pool area at night was amazing. The breakfast area, pool, and manager’s reception are all on the fourth floor which makes it much more private than other pools that we walked by at other hotels. I expect that my wife and I will be coming back here again soon.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: First time to Hawaii and was very impressed with Embassy Suites. Service was always wonderful and fast! Perfect location, away from too much noise and hussle of the rest of the hotels but right on the most beautiful strip of new restaurants and stores. Our room was immaculate and if I didn't know any better I'd of thought the hotel was brand new. Breakfast was always fast and delicious and abundant. We also were upgraded to an ocean view room in the Hula Tower. We would stay here again and recommend it to everyone.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Everything was great. We were upgraded upon arrival (we didn't get a chance to ask) and had a wonderful room with an ocean view. Service, including bellmen, concierge, and registration desk staff was excellent. Late check out was offered. We spent our last few hours at the beach and in the late afternoon we were given use of a courtesy room to shower and change before taxi to airport. Aloha spirit to the max...smiling faces EVERYWHERE and offers of help. One minute walk to Waikiki and right out the door to Beachwalk shopping, restuarants and the main drag. Got a great rate for retired gov't workers, which really sweetened the deal. Overall would return and recommend without hesitation.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: What a great hotel! From the moment you check-in, to the moment you check-out you will not be disappointed! This hotel is a block away from Waikiki Beach and it is very impressive. It has great nighlty entertainment and is very clean and the rooms are spacious. The only bad part is that there is an Intercontinental Hotel going up right next to it that will be close to 40 stories high, so its view can be obstructed.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was our second time to stay at the Embassy Suites in Waikiki. We were very pleased last year and were hoping for another great experience.My husband works in Honolulu on business each fall and last year he decided to give this new hotel a go. He was pleased enough that he came back again this year to stay. I traveled out with our youngest child and spent 9 nights at the Embassy Suites visiting with him. Once again, we were very pleased.The suite was a traditional 2 Queen 1 bedroom suite with pool views and partial ocean views from the 7th floor of the Aloha Tower.The breakfast is still fantastic. I love how they let you put your selected omelet toppings in a bowl and then hand then to the chef. Both omelet stations were open each morning and there were two sides each serving the same selection. Along with the traditional American breakfast offerings there were Japanese selections too.The dining area is well staffed with people ready to clean your table or assist you as needed. Concierge staff would also walk around and assist you with any directions or tours you might be interested in booking. My son and I were able to book a tour to Sea Park with the hotel's concierge and it was pleasurable to be able to do this easily while enjoying our breakfast.We also had a chance to meet Chef Glenn who sent cookies, chocolate covered strawberries, and milk to our room later on that afternoon! What a lovely treat! Thank you Chef Glenn and hotel staff! The construction on the Trump tower is near completion so the noise near the pool area was so much better this year. The staff keeps the pool area very clean and it is a nice place to relax but please don't miss the beach! The walk to to the beach will take you about 5 minutes and it is well worth your time. Towels are available at the pool on the 4th floor.Our room was serviced by two very nice ladies during our stay. They were kind enough to clean our room first thing in the morning so that we could come back and eat our lunch in there before heading to the beach and pool for the afternoon. The room was kept very clean and we were told that if we weren't happy, to please let them know. There were two things that were very different from last year. The Manager's Reception really cut back on the snack selections. Throughout our stay they either served chips without salsa, peanuts, goldfish crackers, spicy potato chips, or a Chex mix. They rotated between 2 of these offerings each night. The other thing that was different is that there is no longer a bed turn down service each evening. I'm sure that the economy has something do with these cuts but we did miss both the greater selection at the evening reception and the turn down service. Perhaps when the economy improves, they will be returned.The location is still excellent. Many more restaurants and shops have opened up along the Walk downstairs from the hotel. You can shop at high end designers such as Burberry, Prada, Coach, or Juicy Couture. Along with those high end shops, you will find local art galleries, jewelry shops, ABC discount stores, and even a Macy's Department Store. You can dine at The Cheesecake Factory, Cheeseburger in Paradise, Jimmy Buffet's Margaritaville, PF Changs, Ruth's Chris Steak House, Roy's, Duke's - you name it. These and many more are all within walking distance of the hotel.Our biggest complaint this year - the internet connection in our room was VERY SLOW. It was just as slow in the business center. It was so slow that I could not print out boarding passes for our plane ride home. I tried to do this in both our room and in the business center. It has been very frustrating from my husband when he needs to log on for work and the speed is like the old dial up connection we all started with years ago.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Just got back from a business trip stay at Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach Walk and had to write a review. From check in to check out this hotel and mainly the hotel staff impressed us at every turn. We had a two bedroom suite on the 5th floor that was shared by 4 women. The room was lovely with nice furniture, carpet and paint. The bathrooms were updated and spotless. Comfortable beds and a quiet (by Waikiki standards) location. The best thing about our entire stay was the fantastic staff. One of the bellmen, Jeff, was so great! Whenever he saw us he would ask what we were up to or even notice if only one or two of us were together instead of the whole group! Apparently the limousines in Waikiki charge the same as taxis and Jeff made sure we had a limo whenever possible. Kudos Jeff!The breakfast buffet was a great treat especially on those early mornings when we had meetings. Again, the staff was awesome! Happy hour was the only thing I would improve on. The drinks were good and the bartenders very friendly but something more substantial than chips and salsa and goldfish crackers would have been nice.Pool area was nice (4th floor) and really clean as was every other part of the hotel. Guests can check out towels to use at the beach (a very short walk) and they are very generous with how many you can take.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel is in a great location, about a 1 minute walk to the beach. Waikiki is so built up it makes it difficult to see the beach from anywhere other than on the beach itself. So the views aren't too great. But all in all this hotel is lovely, the staff is helpful, and I would stay there again. Lots of good shops and restaurants nearby!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We returned to the Embassy in Waikiki and may continue to do so every year. This time it was just two nights with the remainder of our vacation at a resort. If you are looking for a resort type of vacation this may not be your place. No beach, no fancy servers to wait on you hand and foot but it sure is a lot of fun.We received the same dry reception as last time when we checked in. (Maybe that's something that they could work on) Our room was ready on time with an upgrade. Housekeeping is wonderful. These were the cleanest rooms on our trip. Friday night managers reception was a bit of a dissapointment. I rembered lively guests and entertainment but all we found with our drinks were chips (no dips) and a subdued atmosphere. The bartenders were the same as on our last trip, very personable. We were alerted to the fact that offseason entertainment is only three nights a week so at least we had something to look forward to on Saturday. The entertainment did not disappoint. This is a fun place and almost everyone gets involved. Hawaiian music and dancers along with a little comedy. (Or was the comedy just the drinks?)There is no onsite restaurant but they serve great lunch type meals at the pool. Breakfast is better than the chain breakfast places with a buffet style and made to order egg dishes. Dining is right downstairs on the boardwalk. Upscale restaurants right aside fun pub type eateries.The beach is a short walk with everything that you could want available. (Chairs, umbrellas, surf boards, shark tours?) So, if you want a quiet resort type vacation you might want to check out another place. If you're looking for fun, food, and a great bunch of people, the beachwalk area is perfect and Embassy is the best of the lot.If you're looking for a fast internet connection, well, maybe you shouldn't be on vacation.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We used some points that I had accumulated via business trips to stay here and from the moment me arrived the staff was super friendly and very helpful. Always a smile. The room was large and clean, not the best view for sure but we could see a slice of ocean if we looked to the right . Otherwise we saw only tops of roofs and some apartment/hotel lanais. The manger receptions breakfast was awesome way to get started and the food was great. As was the afternoon reception cocktails...great bartenders. Great way save meal expenses for nice dinner when on business. We were on Vacation so we just got tuned up then went out. : )

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: are you serious? this hotel has some serious internet connection issue. it is extremely slow. at one point, the server went down, and I had to be the one calling the front desk, who then transferred me to another agent somewhere, to fix this problem. even then, the problem was not fixed.that was the main issue i had with this hotel.other than that, the location is great, staff is great (except not doing anything about the internet connectivity), good breakfast, etc.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We were checked-in within a couple of minutes of our arrival. We got a corner, ocean-view room on the 11th floor in the Hula tower. Couldn't have asked for a quieter and brighter room with a decent view. The room was kept clean with daily house-keeping. The best part, though, was the breakfast buffet. The second best was the free cocktails every evening at the manager's reception. The check-out was a breeze just like the check-in and they held our luggage, which was quite helpful. I liked the location of the hotel, it was within easy walk/travel of key shopping/attractions.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our 3 night stay here was marvelous. The rooms were clean and spacious, view was great (17th floor, ocean view) and the staff were exceptionally helpful. Breakfast was large enough to last to dinner and it was open from 6:30 to 10:00, I think. Evening reception was the usual, but nice to have from 5:30-7:30 as the sun set. Breakfast and reception were adjacent to the pool and hot tub on 4th floor outside. Hawaiian musicians and dancer were there the 3 nights we stayed. Staff came to talk to us 2 mornings to offer suggestions of where to go and what to do and were the most friendly we encountered in our 15 day stay in Hawaii. I highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My stay at Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach Walk was exceptional! I loved everything about this hotel. Their free breakfast was fantastic. No cheap layout of so-so food. It was a real dining experience. And the nightly reception was marvelous. Free food and an open bar! The hotel's location was perfect as well. A short walk to the beach. Took less than 5 minutes. We went down to watch the sunrise over the Pacific every day. Also, it's close to major streets. Walking to shops and restaurants was no problem. We were able to go anywhere we felt like without a hassle or having to spend alot of money to get there. And the staff - excellent. Always extremely helpful and courteous. They never made you feel like you were bothering or interrupting them. Rather, like you were a friend asking a question. And to top it all off, the rooms were kept immaculate.  I can't wait to get back!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our stay at the Embassy Suites was everything and more we could have expected. The larger rooms were great, ocean views were unbelievable in the Hula tower (especially since we were upgraded), breakfast was fantastic (really miss the omelettes that I had every morning) and loved that you could get a chair by the pool at any time of day. Managers reception in the evening was also a nice treat and relaxing time for us.The location was also a plus. Having the beachwalk right underneath was great because you didn't have to go far for anything.We loved the food at the Yard House and must say that travelling with a child with a severe allergy to nuts everyone was very helpful in making sure that the chef knew about his condition. This goes in saying about every eating place we visited on the island.We especially liked the beach in front of the Royal Hawaiin and didn't find the walk to be that much of a hassle, even with a ring, lilo and boogeyboard. It was nice to get a shaved ice on the walk back anyway. Towards the afternoon we would all come back to the pool and stay there till managers reception. I didn't mind the fact that the pool is only 4ft as I knew the kids were safe at all times. They also liked to order a snack and eat by the pool.Wished we could have stayed longer. Definately look forward to coming back to the Embassy Suites in the future and will be sure to recommend to other travellers.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at the Embassy Suites Waikiki the first two days and the last two days of our recent trip to Oahu. Without a doubt, this was the best hotel experience I've had in the many visits we've made, and that includes a stint at the Halekulani.From the minute you arrive at the valet stand, the staff is super-friendly. They smile, greet you, and seem happy with their jobs. Check-in was quick but unrushed (yes, it can be both!), and I was completely satisfied with both rooms we had. Our first room was a 1-bedroom with a partial ocean, but primarily city view in the Aloha Tower, and the second was a 2-bedroom suite on the 21st floor in the Aloha Tower. Rooms were clean and well-appointed, and this is the first hotel I've ever stayed in where I was actually able to use the provided conditioner and have it work on my hair.The morning breakfast had every possible food option under the sun, and I was a big fan of the miso soup and rice. I had an omelet one morning, and the young woman doing the prep was delightful and friendly. The evening Manager's Reception served up some potent mai tais and margaritas, and was also staffed by friendly folks. The pool area was spectacular, not necessarily in size...but in quality. It boasted saline chlorination, and a super-soft liner that felt downright bouncy. The hotel's location right on the newly renovated Beachwalk area is perfect...close to dining, shopping, and the beach. We were so pleased with our stay, that we plan on going back next year and staying the entire week. When I'm on vacation, I want to be around happy people...and I don't think we encountered a single staff member at the ES who didn't smile and at least say hello, if he or she didn't actually strike up a full conversation.Of note...both visits were made with HHonors points. I always wonder if somehow service will lack because you technically aren't paying for the visit. In this case, the answer was no. Bravo, Embassy Suites!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was my second stay at Embassy Suites & I could honestly say that there is nowhere in Waikiki I would stay but here. I have stayed at a number of different hotels in Waikiki over the past decade and none match the Embassy Suites. The staff at this hotel make you feel as if you are at home in a way no other hotel does. A lot of the staff make you feel as if you are part of their family and the management of this hotel should be very proud of the way their customers are treated. Fantastic breakfasts, an incredibly accommodating executive chef, wonderful bar & food staff and the nightly entertainment is what will keep us coming back year after year. The pool area is great, the rooms comfortable, the business centre with free internet is fantastic. The gym is great. There are no negatives to staying at this hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was our first visit to Hawaii but certainly not our first stay in an Embassy Suites. The service was great. They were extremely attentive to our needs and when housekeeping failed to bring us enough towels, once requested, we got them almost immediately. Daily breakfast was tastey as well as healthy. It was enough for all of it's customers. My only disappointment was that we paid "extra" to get a suite that was 'oceanfront". Only 1 chair could be seated on the balcony to enjoy the ocean and it was located on the very corner of the balcony. .Had I known that, I would have just reserved an inside siute. Don't pay for an "oceanfront"suite because you won't get your money's worth.It was extremely difficult to find the pool to get your beach towels. I would definitely saty there again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I live on Oahu and my Aunt and cousins flew in from Hawaii & Kauai for a 2 night girls get-away. We had a great stay at the Embassy Suites! The staff was very professional, super friendly and very accomodating. Our room on 14th floor Hula Tower was great and spotless! The breakfast was more than we expected and drinks poolside were a bonus! Reading some previous reviews about noise and crowds..it is Waikiki! There are huge rises everywhere..do your homework before booking your vacation and maybe consider the Kahala Resort or being closer to the Zoo where it is a little less congested..Location is perfect for walking everywhere..we hit Halekulani for sunset, pupus and mai tais and Hula Grill the next night for dinner! Mahalo nui to RJ at the pool..who hooked us up with the best Bloody Mary's we have had in awhile! It was an enjoyable stay!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is a great place to stay if you have kids. Having the suite makes traveling with the kids a dream. It's a great value if you consider that at most hotels you would have to pay for a 2nd room. Another awesome value is the complimentary breakfast. Wow, what a spread with a very nice selection of entrees to choose from. We have stayed at many Embassy Suites and this is the best breakfast that we have been to. The evening reception was also a nice amenity that this hotel offers. The pool area is small compared to other resort hotels, but it was fine for us. The walk to the beach was a bit of a challenge with the kids. Also, make sure that you have water slippers if you are going to the beach. The sand felt like sharp rocks. The hotel is centrally located to many shops and restaurants, although it is quite a walk to the other side of Waikiki. There are plenty of great places to eat in that area. The staff at this hotel is incredibly helpful. We were very pleased with the service. For us, this was a great place to stay with our kids.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: First time staying at this Embassy Suites. It was perfect for us. This was a one night stay - a layover on the way back home. The suites were great - plenty of room to spread out. We had a city view suite, which actually had an ocean view as well. The suites appeared to be recently renovated. Great shower.I think the location is great - right amidst the Beachwalk area which has plenty of shopping and dining options. Quick walk to the beach. Taxi ride was $37 to the airport. Staff was very friendly. Nice pool area, though a bit loud from the traffic.Look forward to returning!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here during a recent trip in May 09 and just got around to writing a review - but the hotel was just great! We were upgraded to a 2 bedroom suite which was a bonus, but from upon check-in (including the complimentary mango mimosa cocktails) the entire stay was just fantastic.From the free drinks / cocktails in the late afternoon / early evening to the breakfast with a great omelette station, and the clean / comfortable suites, we were very impressed. The hotel was also in a very good location right next to Waikiki Beach Walk, and minutes from the beach. Although not the cheapest in Oahu, this was well worth the money. We would definitely return again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Long story short - stay away if you're a sensitive sleeper (or get earplugs). If you absolutely need the extra space and have a big family to feed in the mornings, the value can't be beat.We reserved a king bed room away from elevators, of course they didn't have any king beds available when we checked in, and nothing away from the elevators. So, our first night was in a room that wasn't affected as much by the elevators as the service entrance below - trucks in and out (backing out...beep...beep...beep) from about 5am on. We had to check out at 11am, store our luggage and then come back later to check in to the king bed room away from the elevator that we reserved in the first place. They upgraded us to a partial ocean view room, so this was a plus. However a huge pain and waste of our vacation time to have to move around with our 10 month old who needed his naptime. MANAGEMENT - next time let your guests stay in the old room until the new room is available - after all, it wasn't us who messed up the reservations.Other than the room situation, staff is on par with a 5-star resort - they're a true asset to this property.ProsExceptionally cleanFriendly and helpful bell staff, fast parking attendants, quick to helpFree drinks/breakfast/music - bartender is awesomeWalking distance to beachLots of new shops within a block, Roy's, Yard House, PF Chang's, mall across the street, etc.ConsNoisy roomsMight not get the room you reservedIn a valley of highrises Lots of traffic on the roads coming into this hotel area (down by Waikiki Marriott is less traffic and closer to the open space of Waikiki beach)Weak WiFi in the rooms - had a faint signal at 1MpsI prefer the Waikiki Marriott which we stayed at a couple years ago...quieter, close to the big beach area of Waikiki, less road traffic, closer to Diamond Head and Hanuama Bay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We arrived at the hotel via a rental car and were greeted by the parking staff who immediately called the bell staff. We also discovered that one of my children's carry-on luggage was left behind at the rental car counter. The bell staff immediately called the rental agency to place the luggage in the rental agency's office for us to pick up later. Much appreciated for his effort.Since we arrived at around 2pm, the room was not yet ready and the staff apologized. Since the kids were hungry, we asked for suggestion and were directed to a Burger in Paradise near by (which was so-so). We returned shortly after 3 and checked into our room.Our room was a 1-bedroom with 2 beds on the 15th floor with a city-view facing Fort Derussey. The room was very clean and the bathroom was spacious. We were right across the street of the Trump Tower, which is in the final phases of construction but did not bother us. The city-view was pretty at day or night-time.Our kids liked the grand lanai which has the pool area and the breakfast area. There was the big pool (3-4ft deep), a baby pool connected to the big pool (1ft deep) and a jacussi. Beach towels can be signed out freely and we took them to the beach. One tip, rinse off the sand in the pool area showers before trekking to your room. We made our entry area and bathroom super sandy one day and, fortunately, the cleaning staff was awesome and made everything spotless the next day.The breakfast has lots of standard hot foods (bacon, pancakes), cold foods (pineapple, watermelon, papaya), baked goods with toaster, and an omelet station. We usually just ordered a couple of eggs over-easy. Hotel staff would come over to clean the table and chat with the patrons. They often mistaken us for Japanese (which consisted about half the patrons) which we weren't. They were quite fluent in Japanese from what I saw. They give the kids a bag of candy each morning and ,upon knowing that it was our last day, gave each of us a shell lei as well.There are a lot of things to eat nearby with a lot of shopping. There are many ABC Stores near by which is good for getting snacks, drinking water, bamboo mat and toys for the beach. The beach is about 5-10min walk away via either side of the Outrigger Reef but the sand is pretty rough there. We either go to Waikiki (15min walk) or walk 5mins farther towards Hilton Hawaiian Village where the sand is nicer.There was so much to do that we had never turned on our two TVs. The valet parking was a little steep but the service was fast. Business center was great with free printing (for check-ins, etc). Coin-op laundry. 24hr fitness center. All in all, we had a wonderful, wonderful stay. The only minor drawback was that the hotel was not next to the beach, which is only an issue if you have young children. But with so much other wonderful stuff, we would definitely come back to this hotel again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed at the Embassy Suites on Waikiki for one week with my family. The hotel was outstanding and the location was perfect for us! The staff was extraordinary from check-in, help with luggage, house keeping, valet, and concierge. The hotel also had a self-serve laundry room for guests (only opens with a room key) that was very convenient. I had read some earlier reviews about rude staff, and noise from construction next door, but I encountered neither. We stayed in the Aloha Tower on the 9th floor, and did not hear any noise from the Trump building going up next door, but we were on the side of the building away from the construction. The breakfast was also very good, especially considering the number of guests they had to serve each morning. There were several restaurants and stores located literally out the back door of the hotel, and even more restaurants and shopping within a 5 minute walk.I would definitely stay at the Waikiki Embassy again!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: For you seasoned Embassy Suites travelers, you know what to expect. I'm happy to report that this hotel lives up to the expectations, and then some. All the staff were friendly, from the valet to the breakfast cook. We weren't bothered by the open-air design of the front desk, lobby, and garage...and is in-line with the tight spaces in Waikiki. The construction at the Trump Hotel is in its final stages, so there's still some heavy traffic. But there was no construction noise heard from our 8th floor Hula Tower room. If you're there on a Friday night, walk to the beach and see the fireworks hosted by the nearby Hilton. On our last day at check-out, i happen to mention at the Bell Desk that our flight home wasn't until 10:00PM. They promptly offered us their Hospitality Room, so we could return and shower/freshen-up after our final day of sightseeing. We had a great stay, and I echo the rest of the positive reviews posted on this site.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed at the Embassy Suites August 5-12, 2009. There were nine of us travelling - my wife and three daughters ( 14, 11 and 7) my sister in law, her husband their 15 year old daughter and 15 year old niece. From the moment we arrived we were provided excellent service. Check-in took but two minutes - they brought us a welcome drink and escorted us to our rooms. From that point on they never forgot my name - always greeted with a smile. The breakfast buffet and manager's reception( great entertainment) were excellent. The rooms were beautiful, clean and very comfortable. The air conditioning was great - seperate controls in the bedroom and living room. Bathrooms are very comfortable and roomy. We coordinated some events through the hotel. Please see Cindy Meyers during breakfast - she is an event coordinator that is second to none. She not only gave us excellent advice, but gave us a detailed map of places to see and things to do. Her advice was right on the mark. They even provided us with a limo to go to dinner !!! Shopping strip is in front of hotel.  Yes, they are building the Trump towers next door, but you will hardly notice it. Can't wait to go back.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at the embassy suites waikiki the first week of Aug. 2009. The Good:The staff- contrary to what some other reviews say, they were very welcoming and accomidating. by the way- there is a review on here that says that the cleaning crew comes late in the afternoon, this is completely false. The cleaning crew came to our room and clened our room everyday at 10am diligently.The location- waikiki beach and the international marketplace are only 2 blocks away along with various high end shops and food. Right in front of the hotel is also a beach. I wouldnt go so far as to say that it is private, but there are certainly less people that go there than waikiki. The View- there was a reviewer on here that complained about the fact that oceanview is on the higher levels, if you were call in your reservation, they will tell you this, not to mention, if you look at where this hotel is located, you can tell that there is a large hotel right in front of it, so it is obvious that the lower levels, you are not going to see anything. My family and I stayed in an oceanview hotel, and believe me, the view IS WORTH IT!The Check- In Area- I just love the fact that it is outsideThe Lawn Area- they hold a luau there i believe with a very nice native singer. Even without that, the area itself is beautiful with the fountainThe Torches- Hawaii! although they are all over waikiki, they are just beautiful and really give an authentic hawaiian feel. The Bad:Elevators- trying to work the elevater can be tricky, but there was a reviewer that said that the people that check you in do not explain how to work it, this is completely false. There are other reviewers that do not seem to understand that the reason why the elevaters are the way that they are is FOR YOUR SECURITY! The hotel, as others have stated, is very open to the public, so the elvaters is to give the people a little security!The Breakfast- I wouldnt say that it is terrible, just ok. the area in which yuo eat is outside so there are birds around all of the time so do not leave your food alone for too long because they will get to it!Happy hour- do not go for the appitizers, theyre horrible. Go for the drinks and entertainment

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Large property in great location. Many shops and restuarants outside the door. The Beach is just across the street. The Hotel has two Towers the Aloha and Hula Towers. Was given a room in the Aloha Tower for our first night on the 20th floor, no real view and No balcony, from what I could see only 20th floor of Aloha tower on the Trump Tower side has no balconies. Moved to the Hula tower for our next six nights. Had a high room on the 16th floor with a nice view of the ocean. Suite had two Balconies, enjoyed our time drinking our morning coffee and watching the surfers, each day.The Breakfast is wonderful, many items to choose from. The evening Managers Reception was also fantastic. On Saturdays, the Managers Reception has Hot food to offer.I would recommend going to the Shore Bird Restuarant across the street, we ate there twice during or stay.The staff is wonderful and I cannot wait to return.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed at the Embassy Suites Beachwalk in Honolulu with my spouse and 2 teenagers. My sister and her husband traveled with us and stayed in a room across the hall. One of the main reasons for selecting this hotel was the full breakfast buffet, and it more than lived up to our expectations. Food was good and plentiful. We usually consumed enough to sustain us until the early evening manager's reception (even the 2 teenagers), so that saved us a considerable amount of money. The housekeeping and pool staff, bellmen, and breakfast crew couldn't have been nicer, friendlier or more accommodating. The hotel lobby /reception staff, on the other hand, were not impressive. The hotel had issues with their computer system during our stay -- couldn't print room keys when we were checking in, so that delayed our ability to get in our room. Then on 2 separate mornings we were awoken before 7 am with fire alarms, only to discover it was another system problem. While greatly relieved the hotel wasn't really on fire, it was not thrilling to be awoken in that manner and at that early hour. While housekeeping and other staff we encountered during the day couldn't apologize enough for the problems (which obviously were well beyond their scope of responsibility), the lobby staff NEVER apologized or did anything to compensate for the inconveniences.Hotel is in a great location - and will be even better once the noice connected to the construction of Trump Towers across the street is completed. Convenient to shops, restaurants, beach, transit...everything you could want.Would definitely consider this hotel on a future trip to Waikiki.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We were at the Embassy Suites Beach Walk on Waikiki for five nights in mid-July and it was the perfect hotel for our family. We had a suite on the 17th floor facing Diamond Head with a very small view of the ocean. This hotel is not on the beach, nor does it claim to be. But, the beach is a short 5 minute walk away. The parking is valet-only for $25 per day. This may seem like a lot, but we found it wonderful to have the car available whenever we wanted it and the valet service was very speedy. The guys handling the cars would always ask if we needed directions or maps and were happy to answer questions. Check-in was easy and we were welcomed with a juice drink and quickly given our room keys. We were in a one bedrrom suite with a pull out sofa in the living room. We had a small fridge, microwave and sink.which was fine for what we needed. We had a small balcony off the living area and another off the bedroom. The bathroom was very large with double sinks and granite counters. Housekeeping provided plenty of fresh towels and toiletries each day. We did not find "noise" to be an issue...and we are quite picky! There was a hula show/band down on the lawn each afternoon/evening - but they were done by 7-730pm. We enjoyed having the music and entertainment right there and available each evening. Breakfasts were great for a family on the go. There were plenty of options including made-to-order omlettes, breakfast meats, juices, fresh fruit, breads & pasteries, cereal and yogurt. There is a huge eating area and we never had to wait for a clear table. Manager's party in the evening was nice, too. We would have a drink before heading out to dinner. Each night, there was live music and a hula dancer. This was a nice touch and added to the vacation feel of the property.The location is in the heart of the Beach Walk and includes lots of restaurants, shops and the always handy ABC Store. Within a 10 minute walk, you have unlimited choices in food and shopping. We found everything we needed for evening entertainment and meals without having to drvie anywhere. If you are looking for a hotel with "views", then you should stay somewhere else. We wanted more room, a lower rate, and a central location for our time on Oahu. I would highly recommend this to families, as the breakfast and evening drinks are a great bonus.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at the Embassy Suites for 4 nights in June and had a very positive experience. The location, one block from the beach and in the middle of great shopping and restaurants, was ideal. The free breakfast and happy hour helped us save some money, as well. Other pluses included an extremely helpful and efficient front desk staff and and great workout room.As others have stated, the construction on the Trump Hotel is annoying, especially if you are at the pool. We didn't spend much time there (you are in Hawaii, go to the beach!) so we were affected. Our room did overlook the pool, but we were not bothered by any construction noise as long as we didn't have the lanai doors open.Overall, a great value and location.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is a great hotel for families visiting Waikiki! The beach is just a block away. Lots of restaurants in the area! The swimming pool is perfect for small children! The buffet breakfast is perfect and the evening reception is a great service!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Wonderful Location - just a few minutes walking to the beach. Everyone in the hotel was so nice and welcoming...Aloha Spirit. The breakfast buffet was fabulous...the best breakfast buffet I have ever enjoyed in my life. Beautiful room! Everything was absolutely perfect! Can't wait to go back!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We spent a week at the Embassy Suites on Waikiki Beach and loved it! The Beach Walk location is fabulous - lots of restaurants and shops, live music every night, we were never bored! The hotel itself was wonderful - nice staff, beautiful pool/lanai area, big spacious rooms, comfy beds. The breakfast buffet was exceptional, each morning a little something different and lots to choose from. I really like the concierge's walking around in the mornings giving tips and answering questions about things to do. Of course they booked tours for you but several times we just got suggestions which were helpful. The wait staff was equally helpful - Joy especially was super nice. The managers reception in the afternoon was very popular although we just listened to the music from our poolside balcony most afternoons. Loved all the Tiki torches and the waterfall! The staff was very meticulous about keeping the pool area and lanai clean and presentable - it was always beautiful and the housekeeping staff was very polite and did a great job as well. The only possible downside was the having to walk down to the beach - I liked the soft sand in front of the Royal Hawaiian vs the rocky beach in front of the Outrigger across the street. But this was really minor - I'm from South Florida so I'm a little pickier about my beaches! All in all a great hotel and I will definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Very difficult to get to hotel if you get there between 3 and 4 as Trump construction workers are leaving work then. When checking in be prepared to give any kids' names and ages. I am not sure why they needed that information, but they sure insisted on it yet they could never figure out there were four of us staying in our room so every day we had to call for another set of towels that they would deliver long after we needed them. Breakfasts' were great, but Manager's Happy Hours were lacking in decent food, but drinks were good. Pool had a big ball of hair floating in it, so I decided not to swim. AC is loud. Clock radio was atomic, but for some reason never showed the correct time and there was no way to set it to the correct time. Didn't matter though as the clock did not have light, so you couldn't see it at night anyway. Bell hops were great. They loaned us some boogey boards for free. Beds were comfortable and shower was good. You have to use your key card to operate the elevator - unfortunately everyone had a difficult time getting it to work.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We just had a great stay at the Embassy Suites. We used our Hilton Honors points and were upgraded to the top floor. Fantastic view. The free breakfast was a real saver. Made to order eggs and omlettes, fresh fruit and juices, breads, potatoes, pancakes, lots of Japaneese options (soup, soy beans). This kept us full until late afternoon.
