The managers evening reception was great for us. Lots of veggies and a few other snacks plus free drinks! Service was wonderful. Rooms were clean. Beach access was not a problem. I am a stay on the beach person, but here it did not matter. We just walked across the street and through the Outrigger Reef Hotel. It was also a short walk to the part of the beach near the Hilton. The pool was nice, but we did not use it. We only went to Waikiki beach 2 days. We had a car and beach hopped most days. We saw every beach on the island. They were all very different and wonderful. The construction at the Trump Tower next door was not even noticeable. No problem at all. There is a little noise from the street, but you will get that from any hotel here.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This ES hotel made our week-long Hawaiian experience delightful and carefree. The staff were exceptional, offering to help carry hot drinks, provide detailed map and travel information, etc. Reception was welcoming and relaxed. Our 1 bedroom suite was fine, the kitchenette with sink, refri, and microwave were handy. The best thing about staying here is that life is so easy and comfortable. Down to the 4th floor for a full breakfast buffet, and for the 5:30 Manager's reception with free drinks and snacks and live music and dance. One block from the beach. The neighborhood has been recently remodeled and we had fantastic live Hawaiian music and hula dancing there each night in the plaza. Parking was pricey, but what a luxury to have your car ready in 2-3 mins to head out to explore the island at will. There is a new very tall hotel highrise going up across the street from the entrance but it looks like most of the external work is now done as of mid-July. There was construction noise on the street level during the weekday, but we were never in the hotel then anyway. Fun tips: get to the north shore for a day, the beaches are incredible and uncrowded, eat lunch at a shrimp truck there, Giovanni's was to die for, it was recommended to us by Gary who works on the 4th (eating and pool) floor. Go to Hanuama Bay for snorkeling especially for kids, but get up there early its about a 20 min drive on H1 and the parking lot is usually full and closed off by 8:30 AM. You can rent snorkels, masks and flippers on the beach.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We always enjoy staying at Embassy Suites hotels, and this one did not disappoint. We were here for one solid month, as per a work relocation, and it was a very wise choice. Everything about the hotel was excellent, with one--actually two, but I got around one--issue. The issue at hand was fairly minor, so I would highly recommend this hotel.Pros: The breakfast is outstanding, even compared to other Embassy Suites. Not only does it have the traditional omelet station, but it has a two-sided buffet line with everything you can imagine, plus a daily specialty item. Every day they have fresh fruit selections (pineapple, different melons, papaya), miso soup, all b'fast meats, eggs, potatoes, pancakes, waffles, etc. There's really nothing you're missing, whether you're from the US, Japan, or anywhere. The juice selections run the gamut, to include the popular Guava blend juice, which is excellent. Okay enough about the b'fast. You also get the manager's reception, which has hors d'ouvres and free drinks (some like to partake...and partake and partake, which is a problem, but nothing worth complaining about). There's also free music nightly. The rooms are typical Embassy Suites--spacious and comfortable. You get a microwave, fridge, and sink. The bathrooms are big and very nice. And unlike most area hotels, EVERYTHING is included, like internet access and phone calls. There's an in-room safe and most rooms are ocean- or partial-ocean view. The balconies are small, but you can sit out on them and enjoy the views. All-around service is great and we were treated very well by everyone. The location is extremely convenient to the beach, restaurants, the rest of Waikiki, and downtown. You lack for nothing. The rooms are clean and the chocolates provided for the turn-down service are quite tasty. Cons: I don't just blindly issue rating points. You have to earn it with me. And this would easily make 5 points on the TripAdvisor scale save for two things. First is the valet-only parking. It's $25/day, not including tip, which is typical for Waikiki, but still outrageous. If you're only staying for a few days, or you didn't rent a car, it's a non-issue. But still, it's excessive. This is the issue I was able to avoid. As a DoD employee, I parked at the Hale Koa lot, right next door, for $3/day (w/unlimited in-and-out privileges). Cha-ching! The only other con I couldn't avoid was this--the hotel is one of the loudest, internally, I've ever experienced. I will never fault a hotel for the outside noise (rarely if ever their fault). But in this hotel, you can hear almost everything in the adjacent rooms. Up and down or outside, no problem. But as stated we were here for a month and we could EASILY hear every little thing on either side of us. The walls are not only thin, but they seem to actually CARRY noise. Couples arguing, kids screaming (or talking loudly), radios, etc. were all heard quite clearly. I would still strongly recommend this hotel to others, but that was one big problem. Not enough to ruin the trip at all, but still an issue that needs addressing. But to sum up, if this hotel is an option in your price range, go for it. Very nice!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We ended up here for 3 days since we couldn't get the Wyndham for our entire 2 week stay. There were 7 of us: spouse, 3 kids (ages 10-16), and my in-laws. For the same price of a 1 bedroom 1 bath suite at the Embassy, we got a much more spacious 2 bedroom 2 bath condo with washer/dryer at the Wyndham. The hotels are across the street from each other.Pros:Outstanding bell and valet service - prompt, courteous, offered lots of suggestions and adviceGreat breakfast buffet of both American and Asian foodsLarge and sunny pool with roomy poolside area - chocolate covered strawberries one evening at the poolsideTerrific business center to print out boarding passes, etc.Wonderful fitness roomCons:Construction across the street - obstructed view, noisySmall rooms

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: At arrival forthcoming employees immediately assisted us with our luggage. Also the front desk staff was very friendly. We were very pleased to be here after checking out after one night at the Hilton Waikiki, which we didn’t like at all. It was in the morning but they did their outmost best to give us a room. So, we had to wait only half hour and shortly after 11:00 a.m. we could go to our suite. We also received two welcome CD’s with Hawaiian music. In the lobby is a tour desk for tips and trips, a friendly lady arranged a luau at Germaine’s for us that evening. We had tickets booked online ourselves for the Polynesian Culture Center the next day inclusive of transport with sightseeing on the way out, everything to be highly recommended. This is not an Embassy with an atrium; there are two buildings with the pool and restaurant on the 4th floor. Not all the suites have the same size; we had a small suite on one of the top floors with no balcony (most rooms are more spacious and have balconies), close to elevator. The living room is small with good quality furniture and a wet bar with fridge and microwave. The bedroom is also small but the King bed was excellent. The bathroom is spacious and clean; there are many soft towels. The details made this a very pleasant stay, the welcome letter and the sweets in a basket (I am a Diamond HHonors member and don’t know whether these gifts were for my status or that everyone else will receive the same). When we returned in the afternoon of our first day they had put a bathrobe in the suite. Every evening our bed was made up for the night with a fresh flower and sweets on a pillow. Housekeeping is excellent. There was such a sweet and friendly (older) woman who made up our room every day. Every time we saw her when we left our room, she greeted, wished us a nice day and asked if everything was okay.On the 3rd floor is a business center with 4 computers for free Internet and printers. On the 4th floor is the pool area with many sun beds. There is a bar with friendly staff and they have a menu with reasonable prices. The restaurant is on the 4th floor as well. The breakfast is outstanding for an Embassy with many fresh fruits, yoghurts, rolls, bagels, cereals etc. There are two cooks to make omelets, very special that you can pick your own ingredients (lots of choices!), put them in a cup and hand it over. Everything was very clean and well maintained.The happy hour is also in this area. All drinks including wine, beer and cocktails are free. There is always live entertainment when we were there 2 singers and a lady that danced the hula. We had a late flight and spent the last afternoon at the pool. There is no separate bathroom with shower in the restroom area, but fortunately there was a hospitality suite available to refresh before our flight. We had a wonderful time at this Embassy and the hotel saved our trip to Oahu after the awful stay in the Hilton Waikiki, we were very happy that we changed hotels.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My family of 5 (including 3 kids) had a great time over 8 nights at this hotel in Waikiki. We didn't rent a car to save money and the location was just great. Just outside the hotel was access to central Waikiki. Let me start with the free stuff in this hotel: free cooked-to-order breakfast every morning; free manager's reception with light snacks and freeflow cocktails for 2 hours each evening; free hi-speed internet; free printing in business center; free 1st 30 minutes of each local and domestic (within U.S.) call; free fitness center. For the breakfast, they also had one or two special items each day like kimchee fried rice and warm apple cobbler. The pancakes and optional coconut and apple toppings were so good. What's different about the omelet station at this Embassy is they let you choose your own omelet ingredients in a bowl from a small buffet station; then you hand your bowl to the cooks who make your omelets. The location is perfect: Roy's and the Yard House are on the 1st floor, just downstairs. Within 5 minutes walk, you have access to what seems like a hundred shops, restaurants, and eateries. The staff are so friendly from housekeeping to the assistant general manager who often greeted us at the reception each evening. The property was extremely clean and well maintained. We had a room on the 7th floor, but I do have to sympathize with others who have stayed on the 4th floor since that is a "common floor" with access to resort amenities like the pool and breakfast area so it can be a bit noisy. Anyway, if we go back to Waikiki, we will definitely stay here again. We have stayed at the Hilton Hawaiian Village and this place beats the Hilton by far for space, comfort, and value!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I stayed at the Embassy Suites Beachwalk for three nights in July. It's difficult to give this hotel an overall rating because some aspects were excellent while others were poor.First the good: the bell and valet service are outstanding. I usually don't valet my car and was upset that valet is the only option here, but the service was fast even when busy and the drivers were courteous. Bell service was also prompt and polite, even during check-in and check-out times. A half hour before check out time (11 AM), we called for luggage assistance and someone was at our room within 5 minutes. Another great perk at this hotel is the complementary offerings. The breakfast is wonderful. Made to order omelets, pancakes, fruit, fried potatoes, rice, scrambled eggs, cereal, pastries, plus a few other options that rotated daily such as biscuits and gravy, spam and fried rice, french toast, and poached eggs. Included is a drink fountain station with standard soft drinks, juices (including passion-orange-guava), and Kona coffee. Each evening they offer a manager's reception that includes crackers, chips, and veggies as well as free drinks. The location is either good or bad, depending on your point of view. I'm not a fan of Waikiki because its too crowded and miserable to drive through. However if you're looking to stay in the heart of Waikiki, this is a great option. Plenty of shopping and restaurants right outside the hotel and the beach is right across the street. Be aware that there is a lot of construction going on around this hotel. A building is being built right next door and its closed off Beachwalk St to only one way (and sometimes closed completely while construction equipment moves through). That makes both driving and walking a bit more difficult in the area.Now for some of the not so good. The room is technically a suite with a separate bedroom and living area/kitchenette. However the rooms are incredibly small. We had two large duffle bags and two small suitcases and there wasn't enough room to put them out. In fact, more than one suitcase would be difficult to fit. There is no closet, however you are given an armoire with hangers. The kitchenette includes a fridge, microwave, and sink. There is also a large balcony that spans both rooms, although our view was of the new building next door even though we were on the top floor. The bathroom, however, is very large and nicely finished. And the rooms are also very quiet. I couldn't hear the noise on the street or the people in the hallways.Wired internet access is supposed to be included with the room, but ours didn't work. I called LodgeNet, the service provider, and they were unable to help. They said they'd have the next level tech call me back for further assistance, but they didn't call back for 24 hours and then it was an hour before we were checking out. There is also a business center with internet and printing, a kiosk to print airline boarding passes, and free wireless access on the lanai level and lobby.The front desk staff was not nearly as helpful as the rest of the service at the hotel. I called ahead to see if I could check in an hour early and was told they couldn't guarantee anything but I could "try and see". Well I knew I could try and see, but I was calling to see if it would be worth the trip into Waikiki. Upon check in, the person helping me didn't even remember to ask for my Hilton Honors certificate (I using points for my stay). When I called them to inform them of my problems with the internet service, I barely got a response. A few other notes: while I didn't use the pool, I did see it while eating breakfast and it looked clean and nice. Plenty of chairs around for sun tanning. For anyone who has visited the Dole Plantation near the North Shore and has had a Dole Whip (pineapple soft serve ice cream), the convenience store in the hotel called the Coco Cove also serves them. To my knowledge, this is the only place outside of the Plantation where they are served.Overall I liked this hotel. The small room size and issues with the internet and front desk didn't outweigh all the positives the hotel has to offer. And if you're looking to burn some Hilton points but don't want the craziness of the Hilton Hawaiian Village, this is a very good option in Waikiki.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I stayed here for nine nights with my husband and two children (aged 5 and 4) in a 1 bedroom apartment.We enjoyed our time here, using it as an inexpensive base to explore Waikiki and the rest of Oahu. The rooms are modern and clean and the separate living/sleeping area was very handy with two active kids in tow. The kids also loved the pool, spending many happy hours alternating between the spa and kids pool. The beach in front of the hotel wasn't great - a bit too narrow and rocky but a short walk to Waikiki Beach proper will find you on a better stretch of sand.Breakfasts were generous and filling. The omelette bar was great and the evening reception was a nice touch. There are also many good restaurants nearby catering to all sorts of budgets on the Beach Walk. I have to put in a good word for Roy's, on the ground floor of the hotel, which unfortunately, we only discovered on our last day. While they only offered a limited tapa's style menu at lunchtime when we went, it was sensational - how I wish we had gone there for dinner!Concierge were polite and helpful and both the activities desk and reception always happy to assist with directions and information about public transport.There are free Hawaiian cultural activities in the gift shop on the 2nd floor every afternoon (hula dancing, Hawaiian language, ukulele), I think it is called Mana Hawaii which is both lots of fun and informative. You can find out about these at the activities desk at the hotel.Overall we found this hotel, though not fancy, satisfactory for our needs and of great value.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: After lots of research on the forum, we settled on Embassy Suites and were not disappointed. All email queries were answered promptly prior to out arrival and at check in staff ensured we could get our room early after our morning flight arrival. My first impressions of our one bedroom suite was that it wasn't that big but it was in fact well designed with lots of storage and the three of us in reality had plenty of room. My teenagers had the twin beds in the bedroom(and their own tv) and I took the sofabed so I could get up earlier without disturbing anyone and it was surprisingly comfortable. It would have been great to have a teatowel or papertowel in the kitchen area. Breakfast was plentiful, not gourmet type food but sufficient and we enjoyed the hospitality of the manager's reception a few times. I could always get on a computer at the business centre if I needed to. Location wise it is hard to beat. So close to the beach and the shopping action but not too frantic and noisy. I only ever was conscious of the Trump tower construction when I was actually swimming in the pool otherwise I seemed to tune out.I would definitely stay there again with my teenagers but would perhaps consider somewhere else if I was just with my husband

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We enjoyed our stay at Embassy Suites, the rooms were spacious, the breakfast was very good, the mangers reception was also very nice.Downside: very noisy, busy location off of lewers Street. we enjoyed the Sheraton Princess Kuialini location much better

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was our 2nd stay at Embassy Waikiki Beach Walk.When we first stayed there back in March. We liked free breakfast and free cocktails in the evening and spacious clean room with sofa bed in the living room. Loved pool and jacuzzi. However my daughter got bug bite from Crib on the 1st night. other than that it was great. So we went back.This time we requested 2 queen beds so that we do not have to use sofa bed every night for my 4 year old son. When we got to the room there were 2 beds but it was not queen size. So we called front desk and they said it is 2 full size bed. I noticed bathroom door was different and it was sliding door. I asked front desk clerk if this was ADA room which is for wheel chair guest. Then he said YES and he did not realize that it was ADA room when he checked us in. Which I doubt it. We were tired so we kept room. Actually this ADA room felt more spacious than the room we stayed last time. Location of the fridge and microwave is different from standard room. My daughter did not get bug bite from crib this time!! Same as last time we enjoyed breakfast/ cocktails/ pool/ jacuzzi. The valet staff was excellent!! However Valet staff is outside contracter. The lady at valet desk remembered our last name on the 3rd day!! F&B manager at breakfast area was kind and nice too. All the staff was friendly. Yes activity agent/Concierge was very knowledgeable as well.Although I have never stayed at any other Embassy Suites, this is my favorite hotel in Waikiki. Great location!! Yes Trump and other hotel is in the view. But we did not stay in the room daytime so it did not bother us. We will definitely come back again to this resort.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The staff was very helpful and accommodating. The rooms were modern and clean. The buffet style breakfast was very good with many selections available. The managers reception provided complimentary drinks and live entertainment. The pool area was very nice and provided a view of the ocean. The beach was one block away. The location was near many shopping areas and attractions which could be reached by walking. All the staff from the lady who cleaned, to the bartenders, to the valet service was most helpful. An activities coordinator was most helpful arranging various trips and services. We checked out at 11 am but had a 10 pm flight. The staff offered us a complimentary room to freshen up before leaving that afternoon. They held our luggage that day and called a cab when we were ready to depart for the airport. Overall, we were pleased with the hotel property, the staff and the service they provided. With the buffet style breakfast and the manager's reception, this especially made this hotel a great value for the money.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at the Embassy Suites in Waikiki for 3 nights at the end of June 2009 before 6 nights in Maui. We've stayed at Embassy Suites many, many times in several different States over the years but this was 'NOT' your typical Embassy Suites. We reserved it 6 months prior for $175 per night with a King size bed. We ended up with a Queen size bed and was told no Kings were available. The room was so small, not the usual large two bedroom suites that you think Embassy Suites is known for. We were on the 9th floor and the view was nice except for half of it was taken up by the new 20 story building under construction next door. The noise of the pounding pile driver lasted throughout the day on all three days. I realize that's the chances you take and construction noise is sometimes unavoidable. The pool was small and nothing special. The breakfast buffet was decent but just didn't feel like the other Embassy Suites for some reason. Don't be fooled by the 'Beach Walk' in the title. The only walk to the beach from the hotel went down a narrow concrete walkway with an up close and personal view and smell of the Shorebird Restaurant garbage dumpster. The walkway is filthy and several of the local drunks stagger through it day and night. When you walk out any of the entrances/exits, you end up having to fight off the same tour vendors hounding you until they're out of shouting distance of you. They have their booths set up within 20 feet of the hotel walkways. I would never stay at this hotel again and would not recommend it...at least not to a friend.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: As many of you know, the breakfast at the Embassy Suites is incredible. The rooms are great and were clean also. But, because it was located one block from the beach, in between other tall buildings, you could be anywhere at all in the World instead of Hawaii. You couldn't see any beach or gorgeous mountainscapes. it was close to the main strip of Waikiki and there were lots of shops and restaurants very close by. In Oahu, unless you leave the Waikiki area and head either east, west or north, it's like being in South Beach.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I have no negative comments to make regarding the Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach Walk. Check-in was good. It was explained to us by reception that we needed to use our room key in order to use the elevator. We stayed in the Hula Tower and I liked the ocean view from the room. The room had a fridge, microwave, kitchen sink and also table and chairs for eating if one desired to eat in the room. The decor was modern and very comfortable. The breakfast was great - one could have a 'cooked to order breakfast' or there was a good variety of other food - fresh fruit, yoghurts, cereals etc. The location of the hotel is very good - just a walk through the street in front of the hotel to the beach and the hotel has shops all around. Because we were out sightseeing all the time I didn't try the pool. Trump Tower apartments, next door, may have had noisy construction going on in the past but the apartment building is now up and is at the painting stage. I would stay at the Embassy Suites again and would recommend it to my friends.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My wife and I had planned a romantic get away for over a year and with the great reviews posted on this hotel. We booked it. Of course it was our mistake because we didn't read the bad reviews posted. There is good info in them and all true.I rate the hotel a 1 star. The hotel is rated as a 3 star but there isn't a restaurant in the hotel, the reception desk is in the parking garage...really, it's next to parked cars!The rooms are very small for suites and overpriced. Little to no view from the surrounding buildings. Only the rooms on the end of on tower has a view to the ocean if your on a higher floor.There is a security issue as other people have stated with the 4rth floor. Anyone can access the 4rth floor and come in the hotel with the escalators from the street on the back side of the hotel. No security is checking if people are staying in the hotel. The floor is also where the pool/breakfast areas are. We watched many people come into the pool area from the escalators that did not appear to be staying in the hotel.Breakfast is a standard breakfast. Nothing to really get excited about...just filler food with really no seasoning. Spam fried rice was interesting to say the least.The Managers Special in the evening is a plus but be carefull when tipping. I gave "Two Buck Chuck" a $20 to break so I could tip him and he had only given my back $17. I didn't notice unitl I had already tipped him $2 that round...so he got a $5 tip. The amount of the money isn't important, but just be aware if this type of shadyness.The other reviews are correct with the room walls being paper thin. Don't expect to get your "freak on" and the people next door not hear you. You can hear what people are saying in the next room.We finally had enough of the hotel and went to the Hyatt. The Hyatt gave us a much cheaper rate, had better ammenities and customer service was very classy.Embassy Suites needs to put thier workers through customer service or etiquette classes on how to treat and speak to customers. For example: Say please and thank you, we're sorry for your inconvenience, how may I help you and smile. NOT what do you want? (This was actually said to me)Last thing is housekeeping...super slow cleaning the rooms. The other reviews are correct stating the rooms are being cleaned late afternoons. Most people are trying to prepare for the evening during the times the rooms are being cleaned. Very inconvenient.So enter at your own risk.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: my husband and i stayed there for 11 days,it was a pleasant stay,very nice view we had,free breakfast and cocktail excellent,...i am so happy also that i saw my friend george who is the bartender, we are very please and we are coming again this august for 10 days,hope to see you all there......again thank you very very much..

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I must say I am shocked from the positive reviews posted about this hotel. What are some of these people thinking?The terrible service started from check in. We arrive at 2 PM and was told our room wasn't ready, which was understandable so we waited in the lobby. After awhile the reception desk was calling customers names telling them thier rooms were ready. We sat there an hour and a half being totally ignored (330 PM) and note check-in time was supposed to be by 3PM. We finally had enough waiting and walked up and asked what was the hold up and they said "Oh, your room is ready". So I asked when they were going to tell us that because they knew we had been sitting right in front of them for 1.5 hours. Of course we got attitude and a lame excuse of we didn't know you we here (We were really sitting 20 feet right in front of them). So...we finally get our room keys and like the other reviews stated, they didn't explain the room key in the elevator to get to your floor. Once we get to our room we notice the room was not what we confirmed on the reservation. We booked a king bed because I'm a very tall person and the room had what looked like a regular size bed. So...I called and they moved us to another room on the 4th floor (Note not once an appology for the trouble nor did they offer to move our bags).4TH FLOOR BEWARE!!! The other reviews were correct that anyone on the streets can use the escalator from the street to enter your area. We also went to other floors from the 4th floor stairs (The Hotel is not secure) Additionally, the 4th floor is where the pool and breakfast areas are...so it's really noisy...LISTEN TO ME! REALLY NOISY!!!ROOM - The rooms are pretty small. It appears this hotel was converted to suites. The walls are paper thin. We had someone next to us with a screaming baby for 3 days. You can actually have a conversation through the walls.POOL - As other reviews states, there is no where to get away from rowdy kids. They're in the hot tub and all over the pool...what are the parents doing? Watch your kids people!!! It also appears that some local people are coming to the pool with kids.STAFF - The bell guys are on the spot! Nothing but good things to say about them. RECEPTION - smile, say your sorry when you need to and stop acting like you work in beverly hills.FOOD - Breakfast is a most a C- Example: Saturday is supposed to be grilled salmon, however when I looked it was baked mush. I asked the staff where is the grilled salmon and they originally said we only have baked. Later a female staff member came up to me and said the chef told her to tell me it was grilled. I then said I think I know grilled versus baked/steamed and she then said "I know grilled has grill marks on it". SO WHY LIE ABOUT IT PEOPLE!!! It only pisses the customer off more than you already have.HOUSEKEEPING - Slow slow sloooooow!!! 4pm average for room to be cleaned. No wonder people aren't getting checked in on time.ENTER AT YOUR OWN RISK!!! AT first you will be excited to be in Hawaii, but with the substandard service, pretty soon the pinapple will not be so sweet.OVERALL - The spouse and booked a week of rest and relaxation which turned out to be FRUSTRATION.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was our second visit. We stayed 7 nights. We requested a x29 room on the booking and we got it. The view was great. Without exception the staff we encountered were warm, friendly and helpful. This went for everyone including maintenance guys you meet in the corridor, housekeepers and servers at breakfast clearing plates etc. A nice touch, we arrived from Sydney late morning and of course our room was not ready. The receptionist gave us access to a hospitality suite where we could all get changed into beach gear, re-arrange our bags and store the. We then haded to the beach and returned later to check in - perfect. We love this place and will be returning next year, with some other families we have recommended it to.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: It;s already been said- the Embassy Suites is well located with nearby shopping and close proximity to every chain restaurant you can think of. The beach is nearby. The breakfast and cocktail hour were well appreciated by four parents traveling with four teenage girls. Accommodations were the usual Embassy Suites rooms that work well for a family. The pool was great and the entertainment offered poolside during cocktail hour was terrific. Our only complaint was that the "snacks" offered during cocktail hour were basic fare- vegies and chips. Many Embassy Suites have something more varied. However, I'm sure that the size of the cocktail crowd prohibits them from offering more.An excellent value.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My husband and I traveled to Oahu with our 12 year old son and 8 year old daughter for a week in June and stayed at the Embassy Suites. We chose this hotel because my husband often stays at Embassy Suites for business and we had also had a great experience the previous year at a Washington, D.C. Embassy Suites. We knew that it would be a nice place to stay and provide us with a hot breakfast every day. Well, I am happy to say, it provided us with much more than that. The staff was very attentive, taking care of our room needs, our needs at breakfast, as well as, our entertainment needs. They were very helpful in getting us set up with surfing lessons that turned out to be a highlight of our trip. The hotel was very clean and beautiful. We enjoyed the evening reception with drinks, food, and entertainment. The valet parking staff was also very friendly and prompt, even when they were extremely busy. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay close to the beach and shopping. It is at an ideal location and within walking distance to many activities. We hope to visit again in the future.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is definitely the nicest of the several Embassy Suites we have been to. It is in a good location in the middle of the Waikiki area (though a block from the beach), the staff is helpful and friendly, the rooms are exactly what you expect - comfortable and roomy, and the morning breakfast and afternoon reception are excellent. The live music and great snacks were particularly appreciated in the afternoon after a long day in the sun. I would say its worth staying here, unless you really want to be right on the beach.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The decor is a little dated and you definitely feel like you are staying in a chain hotel but, overall it's still a great place. It's one block from the beach, right in the middle of Waikiki shopping and dining, your stay comes with a huge breakfast buffet and evening cocktail reception. As a solo traveler I felt like I had a bit too much room at this hotel but, it would be perfect for a group of friends or families traveling together.Because of it's location in the middle of Waikiki Beach Walk- this hotel is definitely not quiet. On the weekends the noise and music outside continues late and one morning a radio station set up outside the hotel and I was awoken to Abba blasting outside my window at 8am! The room service ends early but, there are plenty of restaurants around that are open late.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We just returned from a weeks stay in Honolulu at the Embassy Suites. We specifically chose this hotel because we needed the extra space with two teenagers and wanted the convenience of a hotel breakfast. There's not much more to say about this place that's not already been said - great location, super friendly staff with "can-do" attitudes, large selection of good breakfast foods, great manager's reception with strong drinks/good snacks and lovely music/hula dancing, a nice pool area and across the street from the beach. Plus, there're lots of nice shops and restaurants in the Beachwalk area. It's not a "resort" - doesn't claim to be one. The valet parking is expensive at $25 per day but I knew this before even booking the hotel (thanks TripAdvisor) but having a car saved huge amounts of our precious vacation time. If we are fortunate enough to return to Hawaii before our children are grown, we'll happily stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: From a welcoming tropical fruit juice drink when checking in, to our quick and easy check-out - our week at this hotel was great. Everything we needed was taken care of. Hypoallergenic pillows, comfortable beds, (even the pullout), the great breakfast and even being able to book our beach activities right at the hotel was great. We had avoided Waikiki Beach for the last few trips to Hawaii - usually preferring Maui, because of the crowded, noisy and dirty area that was near the Outrigger Main - we were pleasantly surprised by the changes to this part of the beach with all the new restaurants and shops in this area now. We'd love to go back.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel offers a fabulous location, and is extremely clean with well equipped rooms. It can be a little noisy whilst the Tump tower is under construction. This is particularly noticeable when around the pool. Complimentary breakfast is very basic, with not many healthy choices....think fast food style. The only other disappointment was the lack of umbrellas around the pool to sheild you from the sun and provide shade. There were none!! The pool is on a terrace on one of the upper levels, and it lacks atmosphere.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Spent 6 nights in the Hula Tower, room 1428. Had a limited view of the ocean. Very clean, and nicely decorated. Great having the microwave and refrigerator. Quiet except for when the lady in the next room woke us up using the phone at 4am. A knock on the wall took care of it.The full cooked-to-order breakfast was great. The nightly manager's reception was good too. The intertainment got boring after a few days.The people at the activities desk were very helpful. The laundry room was nice, although pricey at $2.25 a load to wash and $2.25 to dry.The location was good. The beach is right across the street. Plan to stay there again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The Pros – Great service! We were offered a drink at check-in and a nice Hawaiian CD that I listen to all the time, still. The person who helped us with our bags stopped at the storage room and pulled out a body board for us to use during our stay. Our room was a nice size. There was a lot of room for our family of three. The best part was the breakfast! The selection was excellent and there was something new and different every day. The evening reception drinks were very refreshing and the Hawaiian singers and dancers were beautiful. Roy’s Hawaiian Fusion Cuisine downstairs was oh so good and child friendly for a fine dining restaurant. The Cons – For the price, I would have given 5 stars if this hotel was on the beach and if our room had an oceanview – it is Hawaii, after all.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at the Embassy Suites Beachwalk for 4 nights over Easter break and loved it. Fantastic cooked to order breakfasts, nice sized rooms, friendly employees, fast and efficient valet parking (albeit a tad pricey at $25/day). The Beachwalk area is connected to the hotel and offers a great selection of restaurants and shopping. The beach is only 1 block away.We have nothing but great things to say about the place. We liked it so much we just booked another 7 night stay for February 2010.For comparison's sake, I can tell you we also stayed 4 nights at the Hilton Hawaiian Village in 2007, and in our opinion the Embassy Suites Beachwalk is head and shoulders above the HHV when you consider value, location, customer service, and even atmosphere. The HHV is way off the beaten path, and while it has direct beach access, you are really no closer than the 1 block walk from the ES to the beach. HHV is quite a long walk from the heart of Waikiki, whereas the ES is a short 5-10 minutes to the heart of things.Also, Valet Parking access in and out of the ES is MUCH quicker than walking to the self-park lot at HHV. We could leave our room and be on the road to other parts of Oahu in under 5 minutes. Double or triple that for the HHV.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at the hotel for four nights. Nice large room. Great pool area. Helpful friendly staff. When we moved into the room, the bellman asked how long we were staying--when we said four days, he said that we would probably get construction noise in that tower on that side starting at 7 AM on Monday. So--the next day we switched to the other tower on the street side (away from pool)--and guess what, heard the trash trucks at 435 AM. Pool can arrange umbrella and two chairs in front of the Outrigger Reef for $20.94 for all day.The breakfast was the great Embassy Suite buffet that you would probably pay $15 or more person at any other hotel. The happy hour was good too. ON Saturday night there was salad and pizza but the rest of the nights just fresh vegetables, chips, crackers, etc., and a special dip (changed each night.) There was also entertainment each night. I know on the restaurant section House without a Key at the near by Halekalani (sp?) is highly rated--mostly for the evening entertainment. Meals and drinks are a bit pricy and the entertainment is about the same as at the Embassy--so save money and listen here.Lots of restaurants nearby along with plenty of shopping including 3 ABC stores within one block. Couldn't believe all of the high end shopping available--Gucci, Chanel, Prada, Coach, you name it--its there. Most looked pretty empty--but the Japanese tourism is a bit down.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We enjoyed our stay at the Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach Walk hotel. Despite the construction in the area, there was minimal disturbance during our stay. The staff is very friendly and helpful. It is in a great location with good restaurants nearby. The beach is just a short walk from the hotel. The complimentary breakfast was delicious and the evening Manager's Party by the pool was enjoyable. We would not hesitate to stay there again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Wow, what can I say about this hotel. I couldn't ask for a better location or vibe. Right from the check-in with my free mai tai, I knew I was in for a good week. Situated right on the Waikiki Beach Walk, so you are close to the action. I think there was something going on at all times of the night. The pool and bars were fantastic and it was a great luau feel with the fire torches burning at night. Happy hour was excellent and they even had entertainment every night to go with the drinks. Bartenders did not skimp and the asst. general manager was even out there making sure everyone was happy. Beer, wine, and liquor drinks were all available. Definitely do not stay here if you were expecting to be right on the beach, you are about 2 or 3 blocks away. Trump towers are going up next door, so expect some noise. Breakfast was kind of slow in the mornings, but I was here for business and most for pleasure. I can deal with people taking their time as it is Hawaii after all and more so a vacation spot than business. Parking is only valet. Definitely check out Ruth's Chris right in the hotel and also Duke's Canoe Club Waikiki right down the road. I can't wait to go back to Honolulu. Mahalo Embassy Suites Wakiki!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: THE GREAT:1. Planning for our stay at the hotel began a few months prior to our stay. The staff went out of their way to ensure that we had a room in a suitable suite for my wife and parents facing away from the Trump tower (3/4 through construction). 2. On arrival we found the environment to be very friendly, facilities close to shops and beach. Roys' restaurant at the hotel is one of the best in Hawaii, and House Without a key is one of the best cafe/bars to catch a sunset - is just across the road. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. 3. Free in room internet. 4. The shared lounge of apartment style rooms creates a great atmosphere for a trip with relatives, parents, children.THE NOT SO GREAT!1. The pool was small, and had ninety percent of users as kids under 12, but the upside of this is this shows just how great this hotel is for families with kids.2. The pool can be accessed easily by none hotel guests, and I had to chase away three kids looking to steal belongings around the deck chairs. WOULD I STAY HERE AGAIN?Yes if I was coming with a family, not if it were my wife and I. There are more romantic hotels with better views that cater more to adults.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My family two adults and two kids( 15 & 10 ) stayed one week in April 2009. Our room was exactly what we booked and it looked like the photos on the website. The staff were friendly and helpfull (apart from one at the concierge desk who just gave us leaflets and didn't answer our questions). the house keeper always made our room up quickly and left plenty of towels. The breakfast which is included was great, lots to choose from and the managers reception every night had snacks, (pretzles and vegies) free beer and cocktails, and live entertainment. A short walk to the beach( you can get towels at the pool) and one block to lots of shops. There were restaurants close by to suit everyone. parking was $25 a day like most places.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: stayed with my teen-aged daughter for 9 days. important to note that even though the hotel is not on the beach, it is still closer to the beach than our room at the hilton hawaiian village which is on the beach. this hotel has done everything right but somehow comes out as completely unmemorable. free phone calls to the mainland, great free breakfast, free business center and internet, new and spotless rooms and great concierge but still, I will not remember this hotel in a year from now. the embassy suites has no lobby to speak of - rather, just a giant driveway. i guess their lobby would be considered the fourth floor where cocktails and breaki are served and the pool is located. this "lobby" is furnished with clean, new, utilitarian tables and chairs that you might find in chicago or toronto - boring! i like to tip housekeeping all at once at the end of the stay, partly as a test. after the second day, the cleaning went rapidly downhill. by day 5, the room was not getting cleaned until 4 or 5 pm. this never happens at a fairmont or four seasons hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Perfect accomodations for extended family of five. We needed two bedroom accomodations for my husband, child and I and his mother and adult son. We loved the evening entertainment in the covered area by the pool which also houses the breakfast. It was one of the highlights of our trip. The distance to the beach was OK for us. The area around the hotel - the BeachWalk had everything you could ever want, just a walk out the door and there it was - shops, restaurants, a beautiful architecturally perfect area, so clean and inviting. We enjoyed strolls in this area. Cheesecake Factory and PF Changs are in walking distance; Macy's; a whole world of all of our favorites were within a few blocks. We went spring break in March, pool seemed too cool, was disappointed in that.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I thought the Embassy Suites was a great value for what we got. I had no complaints about the hotel, except for Trumps Condo's going up next to it. But overall, the free breakfast was awesome, the room was superb, and the view was fabulous.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We arrived a little earlier than anticipated and our rooms were not ready. We were offered cool drinks, a couple of Hawaiian music CDs, and a bellman to whisk our luggage away while we went and got some lunch. The rooms have a separate bedroom, a living room with a table and a little wet bar/countertop which was adequate for light meal/snack preparation. Small fridge and microwave. Good laundry facilities, business center (4 computers), fitness center and decent pool. The breakfast is fabulous. Fresh fruit, hot & cold cereal, scrambled eggs, hash browns, sometimes rice or fish, pancakes, french toast or waffles, bacon, sausage or ham, chef making omelettes, breads, bagel, pastries, juices, and other beverages. A great way to start the day. The Manager's Reception is not like the Homewood Suites Manager's reception which is really a dinner. In this case, really cheap drinks (maybe free - don't know), pretzels and a couple of kinds of fresh veggies - nothing substantial. There is plenty of high end shopping, easy beach access, and a variety of restaurants(including a couple of sports bars) close by. The only downside was the noisy air conditioning in the bedroom.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I love shoppping so the Embassy Suite was a great place to stay. One block from shopping. The breakfast buffet was great. The only decent night for the Manger's Reception was Monday. The rest of the week was just chips and vegetables. They do make great drinks at the Manger's Special. The staff is very friendly and helpful. I followed the advise of a fellow Trip Advisor and had the pineapple whip at the store on the bottom floor and it was excellent. The beach is across the street.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: After much deliberation and e-mailing back and forth to Brent from Embassy Suites we paid in advance for a great rate for 9 nights. We (2 adults 3 teens 1 child) arrived very tired from a long flight from Brisbane, Australia at about 10a.m. and was greeted by a friendly face, cool drink and very smooth check in. We were very happy to be told we could have our room straight away as they had installed a shower chair, hand held shower and toilet seat raiser for my daughter in a wheelchair.We arrived at our room on the 20th floor in the Hula Tower. Brent had said he would look after us and he did...... we had a lovely partial ocean view 2 bedroom suite and it was quiet... we didn't hear any noise from anywhere and wouldn't even know the Trump Tower was next door at all! The room was beautifully decorated, modern, clean and well set out. We had a king room and 2 queens in the other bedroom plus a lounge area and kitchenette separating the two.One of the reasons we chose the Embassy Suites was the complimentary breakfast and wow did it save us $$$$$. I am now addicted to omelettes with jalapenos and I can say that after filling up on the fresh fruit, omelettes, eggs, bacon, pastries, cereal every morning we NEVER needed lunch or even a snack our whole visit. The Manager's Reception in the evening was great and it included cocktails and spirits etc... whatever you wanted and believe me they were not watered down... they were strong and good! These were served with corn chips, carrot sticks, broccoli, dips etc which were a nice little starter to your evening before you headed out.The staff were all wonderful, friendly, helpful and went out of their way to help. Our housekeeper, in particular, (can't remember her name) was so lovely and always kept us provided with fresh fluffy towels, shower caps, shampoos etc. Nothing was ever too much trouble and she always had our room done by the time we had finished breakfast. We became very attached to her and there were hugs all around when we had to leave. She even gave my son a box of chocolates on his birthday.I can heartily recommend this hotel to anyone... especially families as it will save you heaps of money with the free breakfast and it really is a relaxing, clean, friendly, welcoming place to stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The location was great. Breakfast was awesome! Manager's evening cocktail party was even better. The rooms were spacious & comfortable. Great pool area with live music. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The only drawback is the $25/day parking fee, but that seems to be the standard in Honolulu. Overall, a great place to stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We have just returned from an excellent stay at the Embassy Suites. We prepaid and got a rate of $209 for a one bedroom, two bed, suite. When we checked in we were given a welcome cocktail, two free CD's of Hawaiian music along with genuinely good service. We were also told they were out of two bed suites and were giving us a complimentary upgrade to a two bedroom suite. We had so much space, two bedrooms, a living area and small reception/mini kitchen area. We loved it. The location is ideal, above the Beachwalk complex of restaurants & shops and in between the beach (one block) and Kalakaua (which is the main shopping drag along to Waikiki with all the fine shops and restaurants. The breakfasts were outstanding with mountains of all you could eat food along with custom made omelet’s of your own desire. In the evening’s free booze and snacks at the manager’s reception along with live Hawaiian music. We stayed in the Aloha tower and had zero noise issues. Valet parking was a breeze and the guys were happy and running off to get your car which always arrived quickly. We had free internet access and they also allow you to print over the WAN to the reception printer for free. We could not fault this and felt the value was awesome. We cannot wait to return and are telling all our friends about this great hotel. The Yardhouse Pub directly downstairs & a 15 yard walk through a “tunnel” in the Beachwalk complex is a blast, 130+ draft beers and good food (The Spicy Thai Pizza is great)

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We (2 kids/2 adults) typically stay at Westins/Lowes, but we wanted a 2/2 with a bit more economical rate... this property exceeded our expectations.Plusses:- Clean, fresh, new, friendly - Incredible comp breakfast (nothing was left out and the lines were never long) - Manager Reception was full bar!, (but FYI: cold snacks can NOT be dinner.) - Excellent location - easy walk to everything, including 3 ABC stores for all supplies, food, & kids sourvineers, even a thermometer. - New and always empty health club w/ treadmills, weights and a bunch of other equipment 24 hrs- Computer room 24 hrs, with 4 (yes 4!) PCs Minuses:- No upgrade on arrival, we got what we booked, (partial ocean view) period. (Oh well.)- Not helpful w/ late checkout... 1P was max (and we had midnight departure.) HHV offers free "convenience room for 30 min use to shower and change" (But they do have 10X more rooms.) Other Misc:- Some other TA posts complain of noise - we heard very little, (only during the day) and certainly not enough to "ruin the vacation" - Chose taxi to/from airport and rent a car on two separate days mid-week. Used Enterprise for $30/day only 10 min walk to get car - very easy, cheap and friendly - FYI Found free street parking 7P-6A on next street over (in Feb) - Walk to beach is strait 1 (short block) but understand, that beach is VERY narrow (25-50 ft) and very rocky/coral... you can sun and dig, but not good for much in the water. We walked 10 minutes (easy on pavement) North to Hilton Lagoon which kids loved, then other days 10 mins South (hard walk on beach and cement) to Sheraton beach which was a bit crowded, but easy 50-100 ft of beach and shallow enough to go out 1,000 ft and the water is only up to your knees. This was teh Waikiki we remembered and an absolute winner with the kids.We would return to this hotel again without quetion. We certainly were happy and overall got a great value.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We just returned from our 14-night stay in Hawaii. We stayed just 2 nights in Oahu then went on to Maui and Kauai. The Embassy Suites in Oahu was right in the middle of the city life plus right next to Waikiki Beach. We had reserved a one bedroom non-ocean view and they were out to gave us a 2-bedroom. 2-bedrooms are perfect for families. Suites are spacious and very clean although the hotel didn't look like it was built as recently as it says. The breakfast buffet is great! Everything from custom omelettes, to eggs, bacon, sausage , bagels and pastries. It starts at 6:30 so you can eat and get on with your day. The manager's reception is a nice touch too with free drinks and snacks. We didn't use the pool as we had rented a car and just toured the island for the full day we had there. We drove to see Pearl Harbor. They take you out on a boat to see the memorial and the Arizona. We drove around the southeast part of the island stopped at Nuuanu Park which was a beautiful view but incredibly windy. Stopped at Hanauma Bay and checked out the view. Supposed to be good snorkeling but everyone is stepping all over the reef so not sure how good the snorkeling actually is. We also drove up to the North shore but we didn't think it was all that impressive. The southeast drive has so many picturesque lookouts. We drove back to Waikiki (there is NO where to park so you basically have to fork over the $25/day valet) watched the sun set on the beach, walked around all the shops and you'll see so many Coach stores it's quite silly then had dinner at the Yard Restaurant where they have every beer imaginable on tap. It's a very loud but fun environment. Had the ahi crunchy salad which was pretty good but very spicey. And tried the pomegranate mojito which was quite yummy. It was a nice short visit in Oahu and then off to see Maui and Kauai. Oahu is a big city and didn't really feel like what our vision of Hawaii would be. We flew into Honolulu and our main reason was to see Pearl Harbor. I would choose the Embassy Suites again as it's great to have breakfast included and we like having a suite.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed for 12 days in February. We chose this place as we were a party of six and needed the extra room. This is a newer hotel with great amenities. The breakfast is great - saves you having to spend so much on food. Also saves the hassle of deciding where to eat first thing in the morning. At the manager's recption they have free cocktails and minimal snacks. Nice entertainment., too. There is a store downstairs that sells everything. Laudry facilites, fitness room and business center too.The location is just across the street from the beach. Easy ,quick access. Rooms are nicely decorated and fairly spacious but lack enough closet space and waste baskets.There are no eating utensils though , just glasses and mugs.This place is just about ideal except for the noise and the construction of the Trump tower. Try to get on a higher floor in either tower but facing the Diamond Head way.If you face the other way, you will be faced with the construction and it is noisy during the day. Unfortunately the constuction site looms over the pool area and the view is obstructed. I don't know how long the construction will continue - looks to be done soon.We were in the Hula Tower on the other side facing way from constuction. I was relieved until I found out we were on a lower floor. I had put in a request for higher floor but was told none was available. Our view consisted of an ABC store. Very noisy! I was awakened every night by people hollering and carrying on outside. Every morning around 5:30 I was awakened by delivery trucks etc. This was the worst issue to deal with but it certainly didn't ruin my vacation. The reality is Waikiki is a busy, noisy place. You realy don't spend much time in your room and hey - you're in Hawaii! It is beautiful!Bottom line - I would stay again with six. If we were only two I would stay in a hotel right on the beach with ocean view.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel had it all, great amenities, a nice pool and clean large rooms. What was it lacking? The walls were paper thin! I loved the pool and hot tub, the managers reception and breakfast were fabulous too! Only a short walk to the beach (but no designated space that I found). The beach was okay, but a bit rocky, probably could have moved either direction to find a better spot for deeper wading.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed here for only one night on a stop over between islands. Had a standard two bedroom suite that was typical for Embassy. Check in was flawless (enjoyed the complimentary welcome drink). as mentioned earlier room was well equipped with nice flat screen tv's and comfortable beds. It is perfect for traveling with small children giving you some extra space when you need to put kids down to bed early. Small micro, Fridge and sink (plus coffee maker) were adequate. Hotel is older, but they have done a good job of keeping in modern.Beach access is pretty simple (five minute walk) and the pool was fine. Could be a bit better. Bar located at the pool was a bonus (but the 6 dollar bud light a bit extreme). Evening managers reception was great with beer/wind/hard booze. Throw your tip down before they pour and you are bound to have a stronger drink!We really stayed here because of the fantastic morning breakfast provided by all Embassy's. This did not disappoint. You name it, you can have it for breakfast. great food and easy to get in and out.Constructions makes getting in and out of Valet a bit of a challenge, but the we were not bothered at all by construction noise. it was not a big deal.weather its a one night stop over or a week in Waikiki this would be an outstanding property to stay at. If we ever return to Waikiki we will for sure stay at the Embassy again! Great job once again for the Embassy Suites.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We chose Embassy Suites because of its good rating in TripAdvisor. It does provide a great value with a full breakfast every morning (with the expensive cost of food on Honolulu this was a real benefit) - and the Manager's reception every night - good drinks and some snacks + entertainment. This saved us on buying drinks at dinner - again, a big savings. Gym is nice, but internet connection in the biz center is slow.Downside is the location - it's close enough to the beach, but the Trump hotel that is being built KILLS most views.(I had asked if construction was still going on and they said "no, just to the interior, so there's no noise" -- NOT true - contruction was still noisy except on the weekend) You feel a little 'sandwiched' in. Pool is ok. Nothing spectacular - and we were put next to the elevators, so we could hear it going up and down all night. $25 per day parking (+ valet tip) was a bit excessive, but the size of the suites are nice and the value is outstanding.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Having that separate sleeping area was great, especially with a toddler who's bedtime is at 7 pm ( we didn't have to tip toe around worrying about waking her up). The service was excellent--they even had beach toys that we were able to borrow. Breakfast was suprisingly good, with lot's of selection. It was nice not having to worry every morning as to what we would feed the kids. Everyone at the hotel was very friendly and helpful. We would definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed for 3 & 4 nites at the Embassy either side of a trip to Maui. We stayed in the Aloha Tower the 1st time (9th floor) which does look straight at the Trump Condo`s currently being constructed. The 2nd time we stayed in the Hula Tower (20th floor) which gives you great ocean view. We had a 2 bedroom suite which was large with good bathrooms. The beds were comfortable and daily housekeeping service excellent. One point to note is that the airconditioning is noisy & goes on & off during the night as the temperature fluctuates. This can be annoying. The pool area is fine not huge so could be challenging if the hotel was full. The breakfast here is over rated. Eat in the hotel to save money or otherwise there are heaps of places nearby. The biiget plus for the property is the location. It is right amongst the newest shopping area (Beachwalk) and is 75m to the beach. You can walk to Ala Moana in 15 minutes. We visited with our 3 teenage sons and felt very safe and happy there. The staff were all helpful and friendly.If you can stay in the Hula Tower get above the 4th floor which is where the pool and restaurant anre located.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: After reading many glowing reviews of this hotel we were very anxious to spend the last four days of our Hawaiian Christmas holiday in this hotel. We were terribly disappointed when we arrived and learned that our reservation made ninth months in advance was not exactly what I had requested. Our two bedroom suite was in the Aloha tower on the fourth floor. Just to let others know, this floor can be reached by the outside escalators coming up from the street, so anyone in the area can have access to the rooms in this tower, on this floor. They tell you that you have to use your room keycard in the elevators to access your floor. Also, the walls are so thin you can tell what the person in the next room is doing and saying. Because of our experience here, we cut our long awaited vacation short by three days (we only stayed one night ) Thank goodness we had visited the big island for the week prior to coming here and experienced the real beauty of Hawaii.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Enjoyed three nights in Oahu with DH and young teens at this Hotel. Front desk staff and Concierge Staff were welcoming, friendly, and knowledgable. The hotel is a great value and excellent location. Waikiki Beach is a simple walk across the street; shops and restaurants an easy walk in the opposite direction. Breakfast is outstanding. Rooms were large and clean. Pool is small but very pleasant. Trump Tower construction does loom over the site - we were not disturbed by ongoing construction noise and Trump Tower makes the hotel easy to find when you're walking or driving around!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I have stayed at this property twice Both times in August.Stayed in Both towers,Hula tower is the newer side and room was a little better because newer.I got a better ocean view in the Aloha tower though.Rooms were spotless and comfortable and plenty of room compared to some others in the area.The breakfast is very good and enough to eat for most of the day!The fresh papaya we really enjoyed.Happy hour drinks are fine the snacks are a clear after thought that lack originality and kinda made me not feel good.Ordered from the bar some simple food a couple times and was tasty.First visit the pool was closed half the time and this was a disappointment to my mom.All in all we would return if we got a good deal.would never pay full price however.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My family and I had the pleasure of staying at the Embassy for 10 nights in December 2008. When we arrived in our rental car, the valet greeted us and directed us to registration. The registration staff greeted us with complimentary champagne and fruit drinks for our 2 teenagers. They upgraded us to a corner unit with ocean view after we asked for a king bed in our 1 bedroom suite. We were located on the 7th floor in the Hula tower and overlooked the pool on the 4th floor. We also had a view of the Trump Tower construction; however, it was never bothersome during our stay. The room was absolutely perfect. I had read about the complementary nightly manager’s reception and thought it would be something we would only do if we happened to be around. We missed it the first night we were there. The second night we decided to attend and were so completely impressed by the complementary snacks, cocktails, and entertainment that we made it a point to attend most every night during our stay. We especially enjoyed George the bartender’s winning smile (and delicious drinks). We also already knew about the complementary breakfast and planned to take advantage. What we didn’t realize was how incredibly awesome it would be. They provide a huge variety of hot foods … scrambled eggs, sausage links, omelets, pancakes, french toast, muffins, pastries, toast, etc., etc. Plus, plenty of fresh fruit and yogurt. I gained 5 pounds during our stay … it was that good.We didn’t mind the $25 price tag for valet since it was so convenient to pull up and hop out. We took our car out every day during our stay, sometimes a couple of times per day – the valet always asked us if we needed directions somewhere. Remember, you get free breakfast every morning and free drinks/entertainment/snacks for 2 hours every night. Valet fees were a wash as far as we were concerned.I never asked our housekeeper’s name, but she was a lovely person, and I enjoyed our brief conversations in the hall. She also did a great job of cleaning up after our family and always left us an abundance of clean towels – she knew we had 2 teenagers.Did I forget to mention the hotel sits on a street (Lewers) that has shopping and restaurants within a couple of steps and is only a block away from the beach? Convenience! We felt perfectly safe letting our teenagers run down to the shops and the beach. More shopping and restaurants were located just a couple of blocks away – easy walking distance.We were so impressed with our stay. We would highly recommend this hotel for anyone … families, couples, honeymooners, etc. If we find our way back to Oahu, we will definitely choose to stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We were very pleased with our 5 night stay. There were ample personable staff in the receiving area to help with your luggage and to check you in. Our room was clean, attractive and very comfortable and we had a view of the beach and ocean. Our first room was a view of the street. We requested an upgrade and it was completed without question. The concierge staff were very helpful regarding tours, restaurants, and other activities. The pool was outdoors on the 4th floor. Nice pool, ample lounge chairs and a fresh towel area. There were two bars. Usually only one was open at a time. At 5:30, there is a manager's reception with fresh vegetables and snacks and nice live Hawaiian music. The breakfasts, included in the room cost, were also on the 4th floor, just beyond the pool area. There was a very ample and wide variety of choices, including some one who was preparing omelets to order. The fruit was fresh and delicious. The hotel is one block from the beach and one block from a main road that has restaurants, clothing stores, jewelry stores, convenience stores, a world market,, etc. It was lit up at night beautifully. Some areas had tiki torches lighting up their areas. The hotel was in a good neighborhood and you always felt safe. The hotel is very family friendly. There is construction of a new hotel across the street, but it was not an issue while we were there. Everyone we met was helpful, polite, and in many cases, fun. We were very pleased with the hotel and will return.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We just returned from a 7 night stay at the Embassy Suites Waikiki BeachWalk, and highly recommend this hotel. This was our third trip to Waikiki/Oahu (having stayed at Outrigger on the Beach and an Ohana hotel previously), but this time we had two children (a 3 year old and a 16 month old) in tow.We used HiltonHonors points for the room, which was located in the Aloha Tower on the 12th floor. It was the second room back from the side facing the ocean, so the view from the bedroom lanai was fabulous. I'd definitely recommend the Aloha Tower over the Hula Tower, which is set further back from the ocean. The staff, throughout our entire stay, were consistently polite and friendly. Dean, a bellhop, was such a great help with everything and made a point of saying hello to us and our girls every time we saw him. The staff in the breakfast area were fantastic as well, especially Russ. The room was very clean, and well-kept, and the maid service was fantastic. (Of course we tip daily, but I can't imagine it would have been different if we hadn't.) The beds were very comfortable, as was the crib for our baby. The refrigerator/sink set-up was the same as any Embassy Suites, but the refrigerator was remarkably clean and cold, which was very appreciated given our necessary storage of milk for the baby.We utilized the fitness room daily, and were very impressed with it, especially in comparison with other hotels we've stayed at. We're members of LifeTime Fitness (a very nice gym) and Embassy's fitness room had the same caliber of workout equipment--Precor ellipticals (3) and Precor treadmills (4) and one Precor recumbent bike, all of which had individual TV screens. While the room is relatively small, there are plenty of free weights--both dumbbells and barbells--and stability and balance balls. The hotel also provides headphones with disposable earcovers which is a nice touch. Very impressive facility!The breakfast buffet each morning was absolutely fantastic. Lots of fresh island fruit, and an ever-changing menu of proteins and breakfast items. The omelette and ready-to-order chefs were pros (please remember to tip them; so many people didn't) and I devoured my delicious egg white omelettes each morning. Having easy access to fresh juice/coffee/milk was so nice, especially given the prices in Waikiki. ($9.50 for a gallon of milk the week we were there!) The dining area was always kept very clean, as was the pool area. That hasn't always been true of every place we've stayed, so we appreciated that extra attention to detail in these areas. The pool was pretty chilly, especially for our children, but that kept it nice and uncrowded. The walk to the beach is very easy, so we spent most of our vacation there.  We didn't frequent the manager's reception every night, as we're not big drinkers. But the few nights we did, we enjoyed the live music and hula dancer. The snacks weren't worth forgoing dinner for, but as "freebies" they were fine. We loved having a Coconut Cove store located in the hotel itself as it sells Dole Whip, saving a trip out to the plantation. Only $2.50 for a huge cup of it, and it's dairy-free which is a huge bonus for those who have allergies. There are two ABC Stores within a stone's throw of the hotel itself, of course, and the Waikiki BeachWalk restaurants are very good, especially the Yardhouse (great kids' meals!) and Cheeseburger in Waikiki. For those with small children (under age 5), there's a great little playground with lots of shade, in the park between the Hale Koa and the Hilton Hawaiian Village, just behind the beach area. Our only two (minor) complaints were the pushiness of the pool concierge who kept trying to sell us on over-priced tours and transportation. Since we've been to Waikiki a few times previously, we knew she was pushing certain companies over others, which wasn't to our benefit financially. We actually received better advice from the buspeople in the breakfast area. The second complaint was the ugliness of the Trump Tower next door. The building is a monstrosity, towering over every other building in Waikiki, and seems so unnecessary. But the construction noise didn't bother us at all, as it seemed to be only on the uppermost floors. This isn't the fault of Embassy Suites, but it does detract from its otherwise great location.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I stayed here for 3 nights. It was very well kept and managed. They have good security including card-managed floor access, which unfortunately did not always work and I sometimes had to ride to several different floors before getting to my own. They also very carefully check your car for damage before accepting it into valet parking, and make you sign indicating all pre-existing damage, no matter how small -- tiny bumps, dents, and scratches included. Understandable but off-putting, I guess they have had a lot of guests who try to cheat them on that. Music on the mall below would be loud from about 5pm to 7pm each night. That's all the bad though.The room was very nice, a real suite and nicely decorated. Great view of Diamond Head from the 17th floor, though no sunset from my tower. The maid service was very good and attentive - if you left early for the day they would try to clean your room right away so you could use it in the early afternoon.The business center has several PCs you could use for looking up local attractions on the internet. The evening reception includes very tasty snacks and drinks, and live Hawaiian entertainment which changes each night. Perfect for anyone to attend, including families. Surprisingly well done.The morning breakfast is pretty good and has a large selection, though they undercook their bacon (what a shame!). The made-to-order omelets were excellent. They also offer things like miso soup and edamame to cater to their Japanese guests, though it was a fun change of pace for adventurous folks from other places too, like me.I would stay here again without hesitation, though I would probably request a room away from the Waikiki Beachwalk mall, so that I would not be disturbed by the music in the evenings.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We have just returned from the Embassy Suites, staying 6 days and 5 nights. This hotel is over-rated. Yes... the complimentary breakfast is wonderful, and the management hosted cocktail happy hour is a plus, but the hotel fell flat on other issues. We were disappointed to find that the only room they could give us was a room located right next to the ice machine and the elevator in the Aloha tower ( We booked our vacation in July, so our vacation was not a last minute decision). We offered to pay for a partial ocean view, but was told this was not available. Our room on the 17th floor over-looked the Beachwalk area and had a view of Diamond Head, so the room did have a very nice view. However...at night it was very noisy, especially when we wanted to sleep. We thought the loud music was coming from the Rum Fire (a new nightclub at the Royal Hawaiian shopping center), but we were informed the loud music was coming from the Yard House, a restaurant located below the Aloha Tower. Switching rooms was not an option, as we were told the hotel was 90% booked. Another drawback are the very uncomfortable beds--way too soft and lumpy. The mattresses look very old and dated, far older than the age of the hotel!
