hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I can't say enough about Embassy Suites Waikiki. We had an absolutely fabulous experience here! We were one of the few lucky ones to get a corner ocean view room so we had windows along two complete walls. We could see the ocean from everywhere in the room. The staff was extremely helpful and pleasant. The housekeeping service was exceptional. Breakfast was delicious and a wonderful time and money saver. We had the opportunity of walking through a few other hotels in Honolulu while we were there and everytime I was SO glad we picked the Embassy Suites. I recommend it wholeheartedly!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My husband and I went to Oahu for our honeymoon and stayed at the Embassy Suites through a hotel/air/car package and got a good rate. Embassy was clean and everyone was very nice, as most people in Hawaii are, but as a honeymoon hotel, it wasn't exactly what we had in mind. It depends what you like, but hotel seem to have a lot of families with young children. We think it is great for that purpose, especially with the free breakfast. We were fine with the average decor and offerings because we went outside the hotel a lot, for dinner, breakfast extras, etc. We like more the contemporary setting and loved the Mona Surfrider to hang out- great not having to pay to stay there- and also Halekulani and Waikiki Parc-where Nobu is located- one of the best meals we had in town. We were able to do these extras without the stress of paying too much at a hotel per night, so in that sense, Embassy was fine. It was clean, the construction wasn't the best backdrop at the pool, and sort of banal. Good rates though and good for families.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our family (4 adults) recently stayed at the Embassy Suites (Oct 18-27) in a Partial Oceanview 2 bedroom / 2 bathroom suite.This was my 6th trip to Honolulu but my first stay at Embassy Suites and I loved it. Our suite was in the Hula Tower (1523) and was extremely spacious, especially for 4 adults. We had 2 seperate bedrooms, 1 king and 2 queens each with their own ensuite bathroom. The living area was comfortable with a sofa lounge (this also folded out for a bed if required), sofa chair, dining table & chairs. We had 2 balconies, one larger off the master bedroom & living area and another off the 2nd bedroomEach room had a plasma/LCD TV (3 total), in room internet access is free which we found great. There were 2 safes and 2 fridges which is handy when there are 4 adults.The room had a small kitchenette area which also had a microwave & plenty of pantry/drawer space to food etc.The overall presentation of our suite was immaculate. The rooms were nicely decorated in modern Hawaiian decor and our room was cleaned thoroughly each day (thank-you Purie).Breakfast was included in the rate and there was plenty to choose from each day (toasts, bagels, muffins, bacon, sausages, hashbrowns, steamed rice, fresh fruits, cereals, yoghurt, made to order eggs, juices, coffee/tea). We found this a great start to the morning as we then just snacked at lunch or sometimes didnt eat lunch & just had dinner in the evening. They also have a free Manager's Reception for guests every evening in the same area with nightly entertainment, nibbles & drinks/cocktails.The pool area is spread out & spacious and offered plenty of deck chairs available (perhaps because we were there at less crowded time of year). The pool is lovely to swim in and has a soft padded flooring (does not hurt your feet). The spa is also lovely and hot !!We were in a fantastic location, right on Beachwalk and easy walk to shops & restaurants nearby. It was also handy short walk (5 mins) to TheBus stop on Saratoga/Kalia.The Trump Tower being built next door is almost complete in height on the outside (they were laying concrete for floor 34) and to be honest the construction that was going on really did not bother us at all (we sat in the mornings & late afternoons & watched them build). They were putting in balcony rails and some lower levels were being painted inside so perhaps the inside fit-out will not be as noisy as the outside contruction has been for some reviews I have read in the past.Overall, we loved the Embassy Suites and I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to anyone.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Fantastic hotel in the heart of Waikiki. We stayed with two small children and enjoyed our visit. They have a full breakfast with lots of variety. The pool is a good length and does not have a deep end, which meant that our 8 year old could go in the pool alone as long as we kept an eye on her. There is also a toddler's wading area which is connected to the main pool. The water is slightly heated too, which makes it more enjoyable. The beach is easily accessible across the street. A perfect location and wonderful hotel!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: On our 1st visit to Hawaii, my husband really wanted to see the Pearl Harbor Memorial. We booked our 2-night stay in Oahu using tripadvisor.com and we were very happy with Embassy Suites.Lovely greeting, lovely, spacious, very clean, comfortable room. very accomodating staff, nearby shops and easy taxi service to and from sites and the airport.I wouldn't hesitate to recommend the Embassy Suites Beach Walk or the Pearl Harbor Memorial. I liked the PHB so much more than I expected and it was a highlight of our trip.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The hotel is very nice. It is in a great location for Waikiki with shopping, nightlife and the beach just steps from the hotel. The only downfall was the housekeeping and the morning paper. The house keepers must have opened our room door without knocking 5 times a day and it was weird how the news paper was left on our in room desk....meaning that a hotel employee came into the room and left it while we slept....creepy.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Only stayed there two nights, but what a hotel! Superior service, wonderful warm welcome, and outstanding breakfasts! This is a great choice if visiting Waikiki.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: excellent hotel. rooms were new and clean. we had a 2br 2 bath suite. breakfast was great and breakfast setting was outdoor and excellent.only 2 bad items. $30/day to park and you had to walk through an alley to get to the beach.Will stay again for sure!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I had stayed here for the Best Western Convention. Being a General Manager myself, I cannot say enough about this beautiful hotel. Upon checking in I was greeted by Andrew Boyd Front Desk Agent. He was so out going that alone impressed me. Everyday when I would come back to the hotel he would greet me and asked if there was anything he could do for me & was everything alright in my room. Always had a smile on his face. The housekeeping staff did a wonderful job on my room each day. The Managers Welcome party from 5:30PM to 7PM had great snacks & each night the entertainment was enjoyable. The breakfast each morning sould not have been better. A wide variety of items to select from. The hotel is right in the middle of everything especially excellent restaurants & shops. Being here for 8 nights I could not have selected a better hotel to stay while in honolulu.My thanks goes out to Andrew for making this an enjoyable stay & to the General Manager.Keep up the excellent work.Sincerely - David Birt

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The Embassy Suites in Waikiki was great but the rooms were a little small. We had two adults and two kids in our room. It wasn't a big deal because we were always busy and spent very little time in our room! We got our room for $230./night, the location was great! Some people complained about the walkway to the beach, I just went through the two hotels in front of us with no problems. I also used their showers to get the sand off! If you can't pull that off you're a rookie!! Parking does stink at $25 per day but if you can't afford that maybe you shouldn't be vacationing in Hawaii! I also really enjoyed the Beach Walk right below the hotel, ABC store was right across the street! By the way we stayed in the Hula tower on the 10th floor. After a night of drinking the hotel key in the elevator to get to your floor was a hassle but ..........If you include the breakfast and happy hour this place is a great deal! I don't think I'll be going back to Waikiki for about another 10 years (I prefer Maui) but if I do I'll look at the Embassy Suites first and if the price is right I'm there!Also, the Trump Hotel construction next door did not bother us at all!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here for a week in early October. It was a wonderful stay and the perfect location for our family. The hotel was lovely and conveniently located between the beach and the Royal Hawaiian Mall. Breakfast was excellent, especially eating in the open air cafe. We never waited long for anything and the staff was very friendly. Housekeeping was wonderful and our suite worked out great for us: me, hubby and 2 girls ages 6 and 10. Most days we did sightseeing but were back to the hotel by around 5pm. The manager's special was nice - there is live entertainment and hula every night. The appetizers aren't anything special: veggies/dip, chips/dip, chips/salsa and open bar. However, it was very relaxing for us to head down there, enjoy the music, some snacks and the kids would swim until bedtime. It worked well for us to hang out and just order some food at the hotel by the pool. A nice way to end each day. You can walk to many locations or easily catch the bus. Two negative comments: the room was advertised to have a king bed but it only had a queen. Also, be wary of the concierge. One morning the gal introduced herself at breakfast and proceeded to tell us that our plans were all wrong, would never Other than that, I can only say good things about this place. Very family friendly, very clean and well maintained and more.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: THE SUITE: We stayed in a two bedroom suite in the Aloha Tower (closest to the beach) on the 14th floor. We chose the partial ocean view, which was great because we had views of the city, the mountains, and the ocean depending on which direction we looked. The suite was spacious and very comfortable for 4 people. We didn't hear any noise coming from the other room or from any other suite. The bed was extremely comfortable and no matter how tired/sore we were from the day before, we woke up every morning feeling rested and renewed. Very clean. Reasonably priced and well worth it!THE BREAKFAST WAS AWESOME and was complimentary!! It filled us up for the whole day until dinnertime. Included: Fresh fruit, pancakes, sausage, eggs, hashbrown potatoes, bacon, french toast, made to order DELICIOUS omelets, bagels, muffins, cereal, yogurt. We ate breakfast at the Shore Bird at the Outrigger Reef one morning, and while the view was good the food did not even compare and cost $25.LOCATION!! Perfect. Shopping and dining at the new Waikiki Beachwalk was actually connected to the hotel. The beach access was a block away and took us 5 min to walk there. The beach area in this location is less populated and you can rent everything you need right there and pretty much have your own private beach.STAFF: Friendly, helpful, provided us a wheelchair rental for grandma, kept the rooms clean and only came when we weren't there. Bell service came and got our luggage on the last day and stored it for us so we could check out but still go do things before we needed to be at the airport. The front desk arranged our taxi to the airport, a limo!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: If you want excellent service, beautiful, spacious room, and prompt service, choose to stay at Embassy Suites. My sisters and I vacationed in Waikiki from October 21 through October 29th and had wonderful service from all the Embassy Suites staff. This was my 3rd trip to Oahu, one sister's 2nd trip and the other sister's 1st trip and all of us agreed that we have never experienced better accommodations and service. When we asked for 5 towels in our room, within minutes they were provided as well as five hand towels. Our check-in (took 15 minutes at most) was seamless and the friendly, helpful staff were wonderful. One example of the excellent customer service provided was the friendly, helpful Activities coordinators (especially, Cyndi, Heidi, and Christina). They were available during breakfast and their approach was friendly and helpful without being invasive. Conversation began by asking if we were having a good time and what our planned activities were for the day. They, then, offered any help with suggestions, experiences, and offers to make registrations. We accepted their offer to make our reservations for Star of Honolulu and Polynesion Cultural Center (twi-light dinner and show). In both cases, we had great reservations (7th row for the PCC show and front table for the Star of Honolulu show). We couldn't have been happier with our stay. With 3 women sharing a room, the spaciousness of the suite was awesome and fit us perfectly. Large bathroom, two lanais, queen size beds (very comfortable), and huge rooms (both living/dining room and bedroom) made our stay an absolute joy. We will never choose any other hotel again now that we know how it feels to be pampered. There other amenities provided such as free use of the business center to check email or print boarding passes, free phone calls, and unbelieveable breakfast choices were perfect to suit all our needs. We also had an unusual request to weigh our suitcases for our return trip, and the bellhop service came through for us by providing a scale and weighing our suitcases prior to check-out. All I can say is you won't be disappointed choosing Embassy Suites as your hotel of choice.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My friend and I went to Hawaii for the Best Western Convention for the year,and for me this was my first time in Hawaii, my boss had previously been there and highly recommended us to stay at the Embassy Suites he really wanted us the managers to have fun and enjoy our trip and time away from work since we are also in the hotel business so we took his recommendations and his assistant also had read the reviews on Trip Advisor and got us convence that it was the best place to stay in Hawaii,We were glad that we were there. We arrived there on the 17 and stay there for 7 nights ,the minute we arrived they offered us a drink and I had the pleasure to be check in by Andrew Boyd, he is very profesional and extremly friendly, after that he became our best friend in Hawaii, employees like him really make a huge difference in the hospitality industry, we would see him every evening and was always as charming.The manager reception was another plus for us , every evening we went for some drinks and snaks, music was always good,and the hot breakfast is outstanding, on the previous night before we left I got a hold of the chocolate straberries and boy are those yumi,yumi.... the bell supervisor gentelmen was also another really bright employee from the Embassy, I wish I could still all those star employees and bring them to add them to my current team in San Diego.I would definitly recommend this hotel to any one that is looking for a great stay in Hawaii,either for pleassure or business,they got you all covered .THANK YOU to all the hard working employees at the Embassy for making my stay a memorable one!!Thank you Andrew , the chocolate straberries gentelmen,the bell men supervisor and our friendly housekeeper, she does an excellent job!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The Embassy Suites in Honolulu isn't actually on Waikiki Beach, but it's close enough to provide easy access without the higher cost of those on the beach. It's a typical Embassy Suites property, with a complimentary breakfast and manager's reception above the norm. Breakfast includes excellent fresh fruit in a very nice setting. The reception features live Hawaiian music and dancing, with tropical drinks as well as standards.Thanks to a new Trump property, any view of the ocean is likely to be limited, so don't get too excited about a room on the ocean side.The hotel is conveniently located near plenty of restaurants and shops, as well as public transportation - a great value.The desk staff and bell staff were extremely friendly and helpful. It's really a very good value for the location.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: October 7 - 11, 2008Last week, my wife and I celebrated our 40th wedding anniversary in Hawaii and 1st official honeymoon. We had the enjoyment of staying at the Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach Walk for four days. This was our 4th visit to Oahu. The 1st three were a combination of work and pleasure. Work for me and pleasure for the family. This time it was all pleasure just me and my sweety.We had read all the reviews on the Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach Walk subsequent to flying to Hawaii. Previously, we had stayed at the Hilton Hawaiian Village Resort and the Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort and Spa. Both were excellent hotels but our stay at the Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach Walk exceeded our expectations. We flew to Hawaii from Orlando, Florida via Atlanta. An extremely long flight, 11 hours plus, with very uncomfortable seats on an older Delta 767. We intentionally planned this stay as a way to adjust to the time change and an opportunity to revisit the island of Oahu prior to our first cruise around the islands on the Pride of America. Upon our arrival we were greeted by the entire staff at the Embassy Suites as though we were family. Everything we inquired about the hotel was factual. The employees were great, very helpful and exceedingly accommodating providing nearly flawless service.We booked a one bedroom suite which was extremely spacious (including the bath room). Although it was located next to the Trump tower, it was very quiet although our ocean view was a 20 story building. The ‘living’ room had a flat screen television, as did the bedroom. The FREE breakfast was outstanding and consists of omelets’, breakfast potatoes, several assorted pastries, yogurt, eggs, bacon, sausage, pancakes, French toast, cereal, etc., and a very large selection with plenty of fresh fruit, an extra added value. The food was always plentiful and hot. Everyone was very polite; guests were patient and waited in line to get their food. Most hotel beds are satisfactory but we slept like angels on the beds at the Embassy, very comfortable bedding and pillows. The location is within walking distance of great shopping, great food and the beach, less than a block away.Our room was located on the 4th floor, the Hula tower, and great access to the pool, complimentary breakfast and manager’s reception area. We enjoyed the nightly manager’s cocktail party which included cocktail meatballs, eggrolls, fresh broccoli and cauliflower, and fried zucchini. The reception also included great live entertainment, even hula dancers. (Awesome!) The room came with a fridge, a room safe, a microwave and a miniature kitchen sink. There was also complimentary coffee and a package of microwave popcorn. We also received a complimentary newspaper delivered to our door each morning, although I did not have too much time to read it. You will have to get accustomed to using a valid keycard to operate up any of the hotel's elevators except when traveling to the Lobby. (Great safety feature) The free internet was an enormous bonus, great way to keep up with your e-mails! Super turndown services every night and great maid service.Parking was expensive at $25 a night, (unlimited in and out privileges) but their exceptional valet attendant service and not having to find a parking spot made this a moot point. Valet and hotel staff was abundant, courteous and quite valuable with directions and information. We rented a car (Thrifty) and were able to explore the entire island at our pleasure and time table. The Concierge, Dean, was fantastic! We inquired where we could rent snorkeling equipment and he took us to a back room and supplied everything we needed, at no cost. He even recommended how to get to Hannama Bay and when (time-wise) to avoid any problems.The hotel’s location is ideal. We were able to go everywhere we desired and had planned on foot or by car. And if you are looking for great restaurants (food) they are easily within walking distance although a bit expensive. We had dinner our last night at the Outrigger Reef on the Beach located between the beach and the Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach Walk. Excellent food, service and a great price! In addition, for you shopping fanatics you will be in paradise! Finally, we were just a 2-3 minute walk from the beach which was very convenient.I would most definitely recommend the Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach Walk to everyone I know, and in fact, we will be coming back to stay here again, with our entire family (grandchildren included), in the near future! Would I recommend this hotel to my best friend?Definitely!! Overall, a remarkable hotel. We received very good value for the money and will definitely go back to this hotel.I recommend this hotel for:Young singles, An amazing honeymoon, A romantic getaway, People with disabilities, Older travelers, Great pool scene, Families with young children, Families with teenagers, Tourists – just about anyone!I selected this hotel as a top choice for:Location, Beach, Sun, Outdoor Adventure, Great food, Cultural, Shopping, Museums and great value for money.Disliked:We really hated to leave but our anniversary/honeymoon cruise awaited us.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Embassy is great. From the valet parking; to the check-in where you get a glass of OJ. The valet and bell people were terrific. The service was wonderful.We had an ocean view room, 2 queen beds in a separate room with a hide-a-bed in the living room. QUIET room in the Aloha tower on the 21st (top) floor.The highlight to me was the manager's reception. I know some reviewers think this was tacky. But the food is "snack" food by design. They serve hamburgers, chicken fingers, nacho's for the kids etc. for a price. But, the bartenders make strong drinks. Well worth the "free" price. Throw a dollar or two in the tip jar and your set.. Breakfast buffet had everything you would want. Omlettes, French Toast, Pancakes, Cereal etc.The beach near the hotel (across a small side street) and down a short path is small and doesn't have many waves to bodysurf. We went down toward Kuhio Beach to get more waves and see more people. That's what you do in Waikiki anyway, people watch.Highly recommend this hotel. Walking distance to everything fun on Waikiki

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I recently stayed at the Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach Walk with my two sisters, and I loved every minute of it! From the moment we stepped out of our car, the entire staff were extremely friendly and helpful, including our favorite valet Daniel, who always opened our doors for us, gathered our bags, helped us with directions, and even helped us clean the sand out of our car:) The check in was seamless, and we were able to enter our room right away, even though we checked in two hours early. We stayed in a two bedroom, two bathroom suite, with a partial oceanview. The room was extremely large in size, and it was great to have an extra bathroom for us four girls to get ready in! There were two sliding glass doors that went out to one large balcony, and from the balcony we could see Waikik beach. I must tell you that even though we did not pay extra for an ocean view, the staff at the hotel placed us in this room anyhow. I am not sure if it is common practice or if these rooms were not previously sold, but I thought it was nice that they upgraded us for free, as most hotels dont care and stick you in the room you reserved no matter what! The hotel was in a great location, we could walk to the beach, tons of restaurants, great shopping at the Beachwalk and Royal Hawaiian Shopping Center, and the International Marketplace. I read many reviews about other hotels before we booked, but this seemed like a great value when you include the free breakfast and the managers reception, and it delivered big time! Alot of other reviews complained about the food at breakfast, but I felt that there was always a great selection and plenty of food to go around. I never once felt like we were a herd of animals being pushed through the doors, as others have previously wrote. There were two different sides of the buffet room, so it was rarely cluttered with people, and every day there were different items to choose from, including yogurt, toast, bagels, fresh fruit, pastries, bacon, sausage, ham, spam and eggs, rice, potatoes, apple crisp, cereal, and of course, made to order omelets! The food was great, and they also had water, orange juice, guava juice, pineapple juice, apple juice, soft drinks, and coffee available for drinks! There was so many items to choose from, I never got tired of eating the breakfast, and the food tasted great! Checking out was also seamless, and they have a kiosk where you can check in for your flight and print your boarding passes! I would most definitely recommend this hotel to everyone I know, and in fact, I will be coming back to stay here again next year!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: After doing a lot of research and review reading My sisters and I decide to a spend a relaxing week away from the mainland at the Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach Walk and loved Every minute.Upon arrival we received a complimentary drink and Cd although arriving 2 hours early from an exhausting flight we able to check in early . We had a two bedroom suite which was extremely spacious and accomadating we didn't get a partial view suite but were given one by the gracious staff. we were located right next to the Trump tower and heard nothing . Despite other reviews, the breakfast here was outstanding and by the way it is FREE large selection and lots of fresh fruit made this an extra added value. I personally find it very hard to find a comfortable hotel bed even at the most luxurious hotels but The beds here were great . The location was perfect within walking distance of great shopping ,great food and the beach. If You need beachfront access from your hotel room tent city is about 20 up the H1 ! literaly the beach is steps away . Paying for valet parking isn't on my list of favorite things to pay for but our valet Guy Daniel made it totally worth every penny, never waited more than 3 minutes for my car . Loved our stay so much we will be returning next year!!!!!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Before staying at the Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach Walk hotel I read the reviews here and had very high expectations. For the most part, the hotel delivered on these expectations. I would like to highlight a few things that stood out beyond what you'll read in the other excellent reviews on this site.**THE GOOD**SPACEThe rooms/suites are very spacious and practical. This is the best feature about this hotel.CHECK-INFriendly staff at check-in with mini mocktails and a free Hawaiian CD.VALET PARKINGAlthought a little steep at $25/day, they were very friendly and efficient.LOCATIONThe hotel is surrounded by a number of excellent restaurants including Roy's and a fantastic little Italian place called Arancini. Tons of shops are also within walking distance.**THE BAD**THIN WALLSThe rooms have really thin walls and you can easily hear conversations in adjacent rooms. If you have noisy neighbors and you're a light sleeper, you might have sleep issues. HOTEL POOL BARThe Pakini bar at the pool closed at 5pm on most days we were there, which was fairly disappointing considering the excellent location and ambience at nighttime.BREAKFASTThe buffet breakfast had a cafeteria feel to it with a large open area with tables. Food was fairly basic and the selection was quite limited. For instance, there were no real options for different bread types (just bagels or toast - no rye, wholewheat, multi-grain, etc.) or cereals (no muesli) and there were no boiled eggs (hard or soft) or sandwich meats/cheeses. Having recently been to stay at a similar level of hotel in Helsinki (Finland) this was the area that really stood out as a disappointment at the Embassy Suites. The one good thing was that they had some Japanese breakfast options. OVERALL FEELThe hotel didn't have a luxurious feel to it. Doors, furniture, fittings, the shower-in-shallow-tub did have a slight mid-range hotel feel to it. Maybe I expect too much but I was hoping for a bit more of a luxury experience at this hotel. For this reason, I would not recommend this hotel to honeymooners or others who want a really special experience in Honolulu.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We are a family of 4 and had the pleasure of staying at the Embassy Suites. We had requested a partical ocean view room and was delighted with the room we received. Our corner suite had views directly over the pool/breakfast area and out to the sea. Being a corner suite meant we had a extra set of windows along one wall offering this great view. We loved having a seperate bedroom with 2 comfortable queen beds and a seperate living area with a very comfortable sofa bed. The breakfasts are adequate and alway replenished quickly, if I was to be very fussy I would have liked a white tablecloth on the table rather than eat off a tray! The managers reception is nightly offering an open bar from 5.30 - 7.30pm which included cocktails, spirits, wine, beer and soda, they also provide entertainment and snacks. Embassy Suites has ideal location, shops and great restaurants on the ground floor. We ate at Ruth Chris Steak House and The Yard House both meals were great and only steps to your hotel lobby. The beach is only a short walk across the road. Our room was very quite but over the weekend The Yard house at the bottom of the hotel becomes a nightclub at 10pm so we did hear some music from that but not enough to bother us. I would definately stay there again and recommend to friends and family.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here for 4 nights in early September '08. I would say everything was pretty much perfect except our "partial ocean view" was basically of the new Trump Tower. I suppose I should take my wrath out on Trump more than Embassy Suites. Also, by requesting a king bed in one of the two bedrooms I think I doomed my party to such a view. Requesting two queens in each room might have prevented our plight. The description of partial ocean view was actually quite accurate. If you stood away from the sliding doors about 15 feet and looked out, all you saw was the ugly grey, frame work of the Trump Tower. However, if you were on the balcony or even on the couch closer to the doors (and closed the curtains two-thirds) all you would see was the ocean and the sail boats. If you look at enough pictures you will realize this hotel is not exactly on the beach. But there is a view of the ocean between the corridors of the hotels in front and that view is pretty spectacular in itself. I hate to keep bringing up the Trump Tower but I can only imagine how wonderful a view there must have been just a year prior - because behind the Trump Tower is a government facility (meaning no high rises) which is more of a park, and behind that is just coastline and ocean. By the way, the Trump Tower construction is up to about 20 floors and I believe by the time it is done it will be over 40 floors.Enough about the view and the Trump Tower. Just go in with the expectation that there might be a bit of construction Monday through Friday and it does basically overlook the pool.Speaking of the pool, it met our needs. I can see how it might be small during the summer time when it is full of kids, but I was able to do some simple lap swimming every morning when it opened at 9am. And it has a nice shallow section for small kids. So the pool was just right.The breakfast was fine. True, it is the same food every morning but what do people expect? I find it to be a nice time saver having a breakfast buffet downstairs, not to mention it is a lot cheaper than eating out. They have a nice omlette station and a good selection of fresh fruit. And of course they have the usual selection of pastries, potatoes and bacon/sausage.The parking is a pain at $25/night. Most tourists need a car in Honolulu to get out of the city but if you are only there to see Waikiki, maybe consider shuttling in direct from the airport. There are lots of restaurants within walking distance, not to mention all the shops too. Getting to the beach required a short trek (maybe 5 minutes) from the ground floor to the public beach access outlet. The nearby beach is basically at the very end of what most know as Waikiki Beach. It was convenient for me to take my toddler. All we needed was a pile of sand and some ocean water. But I think the main beach scene was a bit farther away. Getting back to the hotel, the ammenites were satisfactory. The fitness room was open 24 hours. It seemed clean with a decent selection of a few treadmills and free weights. Most of the equipment had TV screens and there were some other screens in the corner of the rooms. It was stocked with towels, a water cooler and disposable earphone covers for the TVs. Don't expect anything huge. It was small but served its purpose.The rooms were quite well furnished. Everything seemed quite modern. The microwave and refrigerator in the room are Embassy Suite trademarks that I basically expect when I travel now. The in-room safes are large enough for a laptop and the free in-room internet connection seemed fast enough for work purposes.Housekeeping was a bit slow as some reviewers have previously mentioned. Being on the upper floors did seem to slow down the staff getting to the rooms. But they did a fine job once they got there.I would normally have given a 5 star review but that Trump Tower is so annoying. It almost would have been better to request a "city view" and just stared at the hotels on the other side. But it is always nice to be able to see the water, even if you have to close one of your eyes when looking out the windows just to get an unobstructed view! Other than that, this Embassy Suites was just fine!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My family stayed at the Embassy Suites Beach Walk for 6 days to celebrate my husband and son's birthday. It was their first time to Hawaii and Embassy Suites helped make the experience a memorable one. From the staff, to the suites, to the daily free breakfast - this hotel exceeded our expectations. Like many other reviewers, the only inconvenience we experianced was the noise from all the construction going on next door, but was really not that bothersome at all. The beach was literally across the street and shops and restaurants are abundant in the surrounding area. The "beach walk" is especially pretty at night, as the streets are lined with lit tiki torches. If you are traveling with your family (especially those with younger children), Embassy Suites is the place to stay! We can't wait til our next visit.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We were in Hawaii for two weeks and we stayed at the Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach Walk for the last four days of our stay. We were there from September 19th through the 23rd. I really hated to leave. I have stayed at many Embassy Suites and I must say, this is the best one I have ever stayed at. We asked when we checked in if there were any ocean view rooms available and we happened to get the last one. We were on the 16th floor in room 1630. The view was spectacular. We had stayed at the Hilton Hawaiian Village our first three days of a two week visit and we had a perfect view of the Rainbow Tower. Since it was Friday we had a terrific view of the fireworks that Hawaiin Village shoots off every Friday evening. One of the reasons we stayed at Embassy Suites is the breakfast. Since everything is so expensive there it was nice to have a full breakfast in the mornings and not have to pay a lot for it. But the main thing I was impressed with here was the service. I thought I was staying in a five star hotel. The staff was always very friendly and we even had evening turndown service. Every evening my wife and I would return to the room and there would be some kind of chocolate macadamia nut treat and flower on our pillow. The convenience of the microwave and refrigerator was great. Did I say the view was spectacular? We had a balcony on two sides of our room, One was long which covered the living room and bedroom and the other was on the ocean side of the living room. Yes, there is a Trump Tower going in right next door but it did not block our view and we didn't hear much noise from the construction. The Embassy Suites has a pool on the 4th floor which was very nice. On the same floor is the eating area for breakfast and the Manager's reception. The Embassy Suites has owned this property for almost two years so everything is new and inviting. The room motif was Hawaiian and very comfortable. Access to the shopping areas along Waikiki beach was close and easy to get to. I loved it here and didn't want to leave. I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel to anyone. It was a wonderful place to stay.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed at the Embassy Suites Beachwalk from September 14 to September 19, 2008. Wonderful facility and close proximity to the beach. Room was very spacious, clean, and with modern ammenities. Main reason we booked this hotel was for the free internet, free breakfast, free refrigerator, free microwave, and close proximity to the beach. Noise from the building construction next door was not an issue. Would highly recommend property when visiting Honolulu. For trips within Hawaii, suggest contacting Roberts Hawaii.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here for three nights at the start of our two week vacation. We are fans of the Embassy, and it is not the first time we have stayed at one of there properties. The room was comfortable and clean, the fridge is nice to have. The hot breakfast buffet and managers evening reception are the added bonus for us. Wakiki is very expensive, and having the buffet in the morining to start your day was wonderful, and the reception in the evening to have a cocktail and snack before heading out to dinner was also wonderful. Reception snack changed daily, so that was nice and there is also nightly entertainment. Reception bartenders very friendly. The beach is one block up and there is a paved path between the Outriggar and another hotel but it is narrow and lined with rat traps (this is not maintained by Embassy) and smells like trash. When walking to the beach come out of the hotel near the front desk and turn left, cross the street and turn right there is another path to the beach that is very nice. Most of the staff was very nice, some of the front desk staff could have been more friendly and the staff member preparing the omletts was downright rude. Donald Trump has to be the biggest you know, and he is building a 20 something story hotel next door, they were on floor 22 when we were there, so the construction noise can be a bit annoying when at the pool. However, remember this is a big city and it is noisy regardless. Our view was of his building, but I did not mind, I found it quite interesting, and we could see the rest of the city also. One of the best things is you can take the escalator down from the pool/reception area on the 4th floor and you are smack dab in the beach walk area of shops and resturants, very cool.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We spent four nights at the Embassy Suites. The rooms were nice and new, plenty of room for four.We had a bedroom with two queens and a pull-out couch in the living room. More than adequate drawer space for all of our clothes. A table with three (where was the fourth?) chairs and a little wet bar/fridge area. We were in an end room so we had wrap-around windows, it was very light and bright. We hadn't reserved an ocean view so it was a nice surprise to have one.We were in the Aloha tower on the 15th floor, at that height and with only about 10 rooms per floor, it was very quiet. There is construction going on right across the street but we were not disturbed by it. There was a lanai the length of our two rooms but it was very shallow, I was not comfortable out there.They had a nice buffet breakfast every morning. The food was kept fresh and hot. I had a problem with the printer in the business center and the assistant manager came and took care of it within minutes. The pool was nice and very clean with some sunny and shaded areas around it. The beach is less than a block away.The down side is that the place is built on a postage stamp. There is no real lobby to speak of, the reception area and concierge are off to the side of the valet parking area. So it doesn't have a homey, stay a while, atmosphere. And the elevators are TOO small, simply not enough elevator capacity. More than once there was a line for the elevator. Valet parking is $25 a night! Almost the most expensive in Waikiki, as per the prices I saw in a newspaper article while we were there. DO NOT stay on the 4th floor - that is the pool/breakfast level.Overall we were pleased with our stay. The price was what drew me in, quite reasonable for a two-room suite compared to many single-room hotel rooms, and we were not disappointed. Nearly brand new, clean and comfortable, just a couple blocks from the heart of Waikiki.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I did a three night stay at the Embassy Suites Waikiki while attending a wedding. Pros:Felt like a very new (or very recently renovated) building, compared to the other hotels in Waikiki. Sit down at registration (and pineapple juice as a welcome apertif) is friendlier than the traditional hotel approach of belly-up-to-the-front-desk.The room comes with a fridge, a room safe (didn't appear to be big enough to hold a 15" laptop), a microwave and a miniature kitchen sink. There was also complimentary coffee and a package of microwave popcorn. The fitness room was nicely equipped with a lot of Precor equipment: 4 cross trainer machines, a bike, treadmills, a Nautilus type machine, dumbells from 2 to 50 pounds, Bosu, and exercise balls and weight balls. Each of the Precor machines had built in TVs, so if you bring headphones (or not -- there are ones you can borrow on a shelf along the wall) you could watch the same cable TV channels that you'd see in your room. They did a nightly turndown service, very thoughtful.Separate lanais (balconies) for both the "living" room and the bedroom.You need a valid keycard in order to get up any of the hotel's elevators.Free phone calls up to 30 minutes in length for local and mainland. If only all hotels did this...Good & Bad:Free Internet via Ethernet! This is a very welcome amenity. Caveats, if you tend to run programs that generate a lot of connections (e.g. Skype, or even accessing web pages that have a number of frames within one window), you might bump into the hotel's overwhelmingly severe restrictions on their internet connection. I frequently saw "your service has been slowed down" or "your service has been suspended" web pages instead of the web pages I attempted to open). On the last day of my stay, I chose the "static IP address" option instead of the "standard IP" when logging into the hotel's internet provider and my network problems appeared to go away, so this may be a solution you can try if you have the same problems that I had.Free Breakfast for all! Free evening Manager's Reception for all! I do not believe the rate you pay actually makes any difference, and that every guest will be able to do both the breakfast & reception (not a single employee at the dining area was checking any key cards or the green slips of paper they handed to me when I checked in). The dining area on the Hula tower's fourth floor terrace is where you'll find your breakfast treats. The breakfast options did not seem to change from day to day, but they did provide Hawaiian music entertainment on stage for a couple of the receptions and breakfasts I made it to. Breakfast runs from 6:30 a.m. and ends a few minutes before 10 a.m. (contrary to the anything the hotel published, which typically state "10:30 a.m.").Cons:If you're driving, you will pay big time to park ($25 per day for valet service). Take a taxi or bus if you don't have a need to drive outside of Honolulu (you can probably rent a car from a local agency for cheaper than the airport, if you just wanted to drive for a couple days of your stay).Construction next door to the Hula tower can be a little loud during the day (they are at the point where they are blowing air horns when the cranes are doing any heavy lifting or dropping stuff down to the ground level). The Trump Tower also spoils the "partial ocean view" of at least the back half of the side of the Hula tower that faces the new building. I asked for a late checkout and the latest I was able to get was noon (normal checkout time is 11 a.m.). As soon as the clock hit noon, my keycards deactivated. When I asked the front desk about this (as I had left a box in my room while loading up my car), they said all keycards automatically expire at noon on checkout day. So I kind of doubt you can get any late checkout beyond noon, no matter what your Hilton Honors status is (I'm currently Gold). Judging from the number of times the maid attempted to barge into the room the morning I was to check out, the hotel sure seemed to be eager to get rid of me.Would I stay here again? Yesss... as long as the rate stays competitive with other hotels. The free breakfast and other amenities gives this hotel an edge over the other Waikiki hotels I've stayed at.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed for 7 nights in one of the 1 bed suites. Our family, 2 adults, a 5 yr old and a 2 1/2 yr old thoroughly enjoyed our time at the property.The location is so central that you can easily explore waikiki from your doorstep.We were very impressed with the managers cocktail party each night. Open bar for 2 hours with some local entertainment. The included buffet breakfasts were also very nice and were perfect when travelling with a couple of young children.There are so many good restaurants within 100 metres of the property. For a special occasion you could not go past the service and food at Ruth Chris's Steakhouse next door to the property.I read a lot of reviews that refer to the construction noise of the Trump Hotel next door. In one week at the property we heard some construction noise when we were at the pool once and this was only minor.Other reviews also talk about the noise from the elevators. Our room was across the hall from the elevator doors and we heard no noise whatsoever from the lifts.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We just returned from 8 days at the Embassy Suites Waikiki Beachwalk and could not have had a better experience, especially with a one bedroom suite, complimentary cooked breakfast and cocktails for the rate we paid. We stayed at the Moana Surfrider the last time we were in Honolulu and Embassy Suites was by far a better property.Everyone there was most helpful and friendly. But to be honest, we found practically EVERYONE in Honolulu to be like this. It was amazing. We asked for a room not next to the lifts and on a high level and we got it. One reviewer said that breakfast was a bit like Disneyland and yes, it was quite crowded and hectic, but the staff cleared the tables quickly and there was always a ton of food. They also changed things around, e.g. sometimes waffles, other times french toast. (The waffles were just a bit dry, the french toast was excellent - and both times there was warm maple syrup available).My 10 year old befriended the omelette maker who made impressive omelettes.I loved the fact that we had the choice of either sending our clothes to the laundering service or using their well-equipped and well-priced laundry. I loathe spending over $1 to have a pair of underpants washed!The only thing that I would recommend to the hotel is to provide a retractable drying line in the bathroom over the bathtub.The location of this hotel is great. We could get every where we wanted on foot or by car. And there is a wonderful variety of food, in all price ranges within walking distance. And great shopping! Would definitely stay here again and have been recommending it to everyone.We didn't want to leave.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I stayed at the Embasy Suites on Monday, August 18th. I had read the trip advisor comments and look forward to my visit. I wanted to stay at my first hotel choice so I called to see about a cancellation. The hotel said no due to the less than seventy two hour notice. However, they told me the hotel was "over booked" and they were sending guest to other hotel properties. I said, I am willing to give up my room so another guest will not have to be moved. She looked up my reservation and saw that I was not one of the guest that was forced to move. The hotel allowed a guest to be moved, after I agreed to give up my hotel room. I would check if you book this location during high season that you will not be moved to a different locaction because the hotel was over booked. I went early to do my check in -and both times on the phone and in person-the ladies were just short and rude-everything is black and white with their responses to you. I asked for my check in package to review for any interesting deals, since I was not going to be there until later. The package was not available. I check in later and found out that Roy's had this awesome deal-$39.50 for a three course meal! I was so upset they did not give this to me earlier-I took my time to get my package-and found out only from five to six you could take advantage of the discounted price-that would have been good news to know-Also-your benefits only are offered during the exact time of staying-not a moment before or after-I wanted to know after I checked in-can I go to breakfast-nope-your room is not ready until later-you can not take advantage of benefits until check in time at 3 pm. I went to the managers reception-you literally receive a few raw vegetables and chips and salsa-no island fruit-I thought the caliber of the hotel could have been better-the manager was asking for a coupon that is needed to show for the reception-only to me-the guest in front of me-he said-how was your stay-anything that I can do for you-so-if you are older-no problem-you will be treated fine-if you have good genes and are older, but look younger-he treats you different-the drinks-if you are a well drink or beer person-unilimited drinks for you-but wine person-do not bother-two buck chuck would have been a better choice than what they served-the room is comfortable-functional-flat screen in both the bedroom and sitting room-but noisy-from outside and with people next door-you can hear-plus-no views from the hotel-unless you were pretty high-I would not recommend because other places give you more bang for your buck-but the morning buffet-you have everything-plenty of food=and the bell men-they are the best-I loved them-they were so friendly-and helped me with keeping my bags-my over all impression-not focus on customer service-I use this website all the time-I hope my honest opinion helps another person-I am also a hilton honors member-another reason for staying-and if you are one-they have nothing to give you here

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This was our second stay at the Embassy Suites Beach Walk. The first stay (summer 2007) was better than our recent visit.What we like: relatively spacious rooms, new hotel, close to shopping and restaurants, close to beach, nice breakfastDislikes: 1. Trump tower construction noise is a modest annoyance during breakfast and occasionally caused stopped traffic on the only access road to the hotel2. Concierge desk (in lobby, and next to the breakfast area) will not give honest opinions and good guidance because they are actually working for themselves via kickbacks. Case in point: one concierge at breakfast tried to sell surfing lessons for $70 (and tried a pressure-sale by saying that the lessons were almost sold out), when you can actually walk-up and get lessons at multiple locations for $40).3. We had a smoker in an adjoining room, and the hotel staff would not track him down and make him stop. We had to switch rooms, and lost a view of Diamondhead and beach in the process. The manager did discount our room rate though.4. The southern tower is better than the northern tower (forgot the names of each tower). The northern tower only has 2 elevators, so you have no choice but to cram as many people in as possible, or never leave your floor!Advice: 1. select the southern tower if possible2. ask the bellhops or the valet parking staff for guidance instead of the concierge staff! Unlike the concierge, they were very helpful. The valet staff are especially nice.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We spent 5 nights and 6 days at the wonderful Embassy Suites Waikiki. We were very nicely greeted when we arrived and were given a fresh cocktail while we checked in. We had reserved a room with a partial ocean view and ended up with one in the Hula Tower on the 19th floor that had the best view of the ocean one could have. All three of our sliding glass doors in our end suite each had a balcony that looked out at the ocean. Our one bedroom suite was beautifully decorated and the housekeeping staff keep it very clean waiting very patiently each day for us to leave on our outtings. The full chef cooked breakfast each day (6:30-10) had anything one could ever want for breakfast. The pool was great, very clean and had plenty of room for everyone. There was a bar that was open every afternoon and evening at one end of the pool and there was always plenty of cold ice water for drinking if you didn't want bar service. Every afternoon the manager's special with free drinks and snacks helped relax you and get you ready for a nice evening in Waikiki. They also had live Hawaiian entertainment during the managers special hours (5:30-7). Parking was expensive at $25 a night, but since we are retired Navy we were able to park right next door at the Armed Forces Hotel for $7 a night. The front desk at Embassy actually recommended that to me when I called. We ate one night at Roys right in the hotel and it was one of the best meals of our trip. The location was terrific with so much shopping and many great restaurants close by. Also the beach was less than a block away. We really couldn't have asked for more on our vacataion to Hawaii.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We had a one bedroom suite and it was nice and roomy. Decent view although the new Trump Tower being built next door has almost destroyed their view for most rooms on the West side of the hotel. The down side right now is the noise. The Trump Tower crew starts work about 7:00 AM and the Outrigger next door is also undergoing rennovation. We are not late sleepers so it was not that big a deal, but it is very noisy on the West facing rooms. If you are going now, try to get an East (Diamond Head) facing room.The breakfast buffet is good, great selection, but the atmosphere is kind of like eating at Disneyland. Crowded, noisey, not at all relaxing.Overall though, this hotel is a very nice value given the room size, friendly staff, services and location.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My family of five (2 adults & 3 teenage children) stayed 3 nights in a 2 bedroom/2 bathroom suite at the Embassy Suites from 18th to 21st August 2008.The suite was fantastic 2 large bedrooms, lounge room, 2 bathrooms and a lanai off each of the main rooms. This was a perfect place for my family to stay otherwise we have to book 2 hotel rooms which in Hawaii can become quite expensive.We found all the staff to be very pleasant and friendly. The complimentary breakfast which included nearly everything and manager's reception were greatly appreciated.The hotel is situated in a great area which over the past few years has been rejuvenated and is close to great restaurants and shops.I will be returning to Hawaii in October with some other family members and I have already rebooked the Embassy Suites Waikiki Beachwalk.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Great location - close to the beach, shopping and restaurants! Everyone from the front desk staff to the housecleaning staff were friendly and accommodating. The room was large and roomy, clean and had a decent view. The best part was the breakfast provided by the hotel - a large variety of cooked foods, fruits, cereals, etc. and included a "cooked to order" omelet. The complimentary drinks, appetizers and entertainment provided during the manager's reception was also a bonus. I would certainly recommend this hotel to our friends and when we return to Waikiki, I will certainly return to this hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Very nice hotel! Clean and new. Staff are friendly and helpful. Big breakfast and free drinks from 5:30 to 7:30. One small error, if you have a room high the the towers the cleaning personnel don't arrive until after noon. But, its not a big deal. The hotel is a short walk from the beach and shopping. Good for everyone!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at the Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach Walk for three nights earlier this month via the Hilton's HHonors Diamond rewards program. Our stay on Oahu was brief, followed by a more leisurely visit to Kauai, but our experience was perfect. The room was spacious, clean, and furnished very nicely with appropriate island/beach decor. We stayed in a suite, which is perfect for a family consisting of night owls and early birds! We were on the 16th floor of the Hula tower and had a decent view of the ocean. While not on the beach, the property is across the street from it and within walking distance of restaurants and shops. I barely noticed construction at the new Trump property and do not think it would detract from anyone's visit, to be honest. Staff at the Embassy Suites was top notch: genuinely friendly without being condescending and responsive. The activities director (an Australian gentleman) gave us some great suggestions for discovering the rest of the island and directed us to the perfect North Shore beach to hang out with sea turtles! The (complimentary) Evening Manager's Reception offers drinks, snacks, and entertainment (music and hula) and the breakfast buffet is impressive. Both help set this hotel apart, especially with the high prices in Waikiki Beach. I would not hesitate to recommend this property to family and friends and if we are fortunate enough to ever return, will most likely stay here.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My family just returned from Waikiki Beach. Several reviews stated that noise was a factor. During our stay, the noise was not a factor. We were in the Aloha Tower. The breakfast buffet was excellent, especially the omelet bar! The evening reception served awesome mai-tais. The munchies were the same every evening, chips and salsa, veges and dip, goldfish crackers, etc.We had a rental car for a day, and the valet service got our car out quickly each time. They let us check in early at 1:00 pm and we received our complimentary drink upon arriving and received our complimentary Hawaiian CD. It was really convenient to be next to the new Waikiki Beachwalk with all the new restaurants and stores close by. I would definitely recommend this hotel!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I took three of my children to Hawaii for a high school reunion in June and stayed for 8 nights at the Embassy Suites Waikiki Beachwalk. I had requested a quiet room with a view, and we were thrilled to get a corner room on the 18th floor looking toward both the beach and the mountains. Every day I would wake up early, go to the Business Center, check emails, make phone calls, print documents, and send faxes; the facility for business necessities was good and well-kept. After taking care of any business needs, I would go to the Fitness Center located right next door and do my daily work out consisting of a treadmill, stairmaster, yoga ball, and weights. Many days it was quite full of people, but no one seemed to be waiting for the use of any equipment for very long.I would meet my pre-teen and teenage children for the great breakfast located between the Hula and Aloha Towers; made to order omelettes, a good selection of fruit, and specific local foods like miso soup and portugese sausage were available every day. The best part of staying at this hotel was its proximity to restaurants and stores. I would let my kids venture to the Roxy store and down Waikiki during the day, and I would meet my childhood girlfriends at Roy's or the Yard House at night. It was a wonderful hotel to stay in for the length of time I stayed. The only complaint I had was that guests had a $25/day mandatory valet charge and that at times it would take a while to get my car. Other than that, I would say our stay at Embassy Suites was about as good as it could get.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My family of 4, 2 adults and 2 late teens, had a very nice stay at the Embassy Suites in June of this year. I had read a lot of the reviews and was prepared for the construction noise and possible slow elevators. We never had any problems with the elevators and we had the tower away from the construction and never heard any noise. We never used the pool, so I cannot comment on the noise factor there. We were on an upper floor and never experienced any street noise or other tennants noise. My wife is a very light sleeper and she had no problems. We had a one bedroom and it worked well with the four of us. The breakfasts each morning were a wonderful way to start our morning. Nice that it opened very early in AM. After a very busy day, it was nice at the evening reception to sit with a drink and some veges and chips before dinner. Walk to the beach was quick and heart of Waikiki Beach was only 10-15 min away. Many many restaurants and places to shop also were close. ABC stores were plentiful and close. We did rent a car and I was prepared for the 25.00/day valet parking. They were quick and friendly and it was nice having them take care of the car. Long review, but it was difficult trying to decide where to stay, and my family was glad I finally decided on Embassy Suites. I would not hesitate to stay here again

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My boyfriend and I stayed in a one-bedroom suite when we visited Waikiki Beach last weekend for his family reunion, and our entire stay was a treat, starting with the complimentary welcome cocktail as you check in. I found our room to be cool, clean, and comfortable, with a beautiful city view, mini fridge and microwave for our convenience, and even two flat screen TVs. The complimentary fresh cooked breakfast was wonderful every morning (the omelette station is a must), the pool was beautiful with a bar of yummy island cocktails, and the overall appearance of the hotel was lovely. The hotel is a very short walk from Waikiki Beach, and in the middle of a promenade of quality shopping, touristy shopping, and restaurants. Think Rodeo Drive, but with lit island torches. And the staff was very helpful and knowledgable of the area--they were able to make recommendations and get us transportation to wherever we needed to go, for a reasonable few dollars. The only downside was the construction of the Trump tower next door, which provided a little noise, and a not so lovely visual from the pool, and some rooms. But otherwise, I would highly recommend the Embassy Suites for an island stay experience that is truly sweet.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel was a wonderful place to stay while on vacation with my extended family. There were 14 people in all, and no one had a bad thing to say about the hotel. (VERY unusual, especially for my mother and I ... both hotel SNOBS!) The rooms were clean and spacious. There was a small refrigerator, coffee maker, and a microwave. The included breakfast was outstanding, probably the best one I have ever seen. There is everything you could possibly want to eat in the morning. Made to order omelette's, fresh fruit, breakfast potatoes, several assorted pastries, breakfast meats, etc. You can even sit outside in the sun which makes for a great start to the day.The staff was extremely helpful in every way. The people in the gift shop/ store were so welcoming they treated us like we were family. They even learned some of our names. :-) Any staff we encountered or asked questions to were more than willing to give us help or opinions on activities, dining, etc. The managers reception every night was awesome. For 2 hours, you could get free cocktails and snacks in the same area breakfast was served! (Right by the pool)This hotel is not located right on the beach, however it was a short walk across the street and did not seem to bother anyone in our large group. The location was wonderful. It was located right on the 'Beachwalk' where there are numerous great restaurants and wonderful shopping. Honestly, it was the perfect location on Waikiki. If you get the chance, check out the Hula Grill. We had an excellent meal with great service, and the view of the ocean was incredible.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is a very clean and new hotel. There was good noise insulation from the outside. Very quiet. Room looked over gorgeous pool area with balcony. Could see the ocean through the buildings and hear the nightly music and hoola dancers perform. We had a 2 bedroom suite for four kids and ourselves and it was perfect space for all. Buffet was yummy and fresh every morning. Strawberries dipped in chocolate were offered free every afternoon by the pool. Delivered personally by the head chef. Nice touch. Entertainment staff and pool staff were gracious and welcoming. Coctail hour was nice with snacks. My kids looked forward to the food everyday and helping themselves. Shopping was great nearby...beach was rocky...walk down further to use Waikikii Beach. Trump noise was not bad at all. Pool perfect for kids at only 4 ft at deepest with jacuzzi. Try a Lava Flow from the bar. Was great!Clean, Comfy,Family Friendly, Fun and convenient to restaurants and entertainment. Could walk to everything from this location. Perfect for large family with kids like our. Have fun when you go here. Aloha!!!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our family of 6 just got back from a week's stay at the Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach Walk. I'd rate it an 8 on a 10 scale. Vacation got off to a shaky start as we arrived at 11 am local time, but couldn't check in until 3. Our vacation package (Pleasant Hawaiian) included a welcome cocktail, but staff informed us that this was discontinued due to construction on the adjacent Trump Tower. Apparently, something about dust filters, which we felt was a lame excuse as no offer of exchange or compromise was made. We were also led to believe from our travel agent of a partial ocean view room, but this wasn't the case. Similar to other guest reviews, we were informed that we could upgrade for another $75 per night. We declined and accepted the 2 bedroom suite assigned to us in the Aloha tower. (The better ocean views appear to be in the Hula tower). The daily morning breakfast was fine for most of us and resulted in considerable savings in the meal expense category as this is included with your room rate. It was also a crack up watching the birds flying into the open air dining area to nibble on the guests' meals while they were at the beverage counter. (Hint: Best to get your drinks before finding a table). The nightly Managers Reception...eh...I only went one of the nights. The drinks are free and STRONG, but I'm not a big drinker. You should be able to get a good buzz if that's what you're looking for. They also have Hawaiian singers and dancers for your enjoyment, but only broccoli tips, celery, and greasy potato chips to nibble. Upon check in, you are issued a paper meal ticket, and we were strongly cautioned not to lose it, as they wouldn't be replaced. Funny thing is, the whole week we were there, nobody ever checked it. We also had issues with the construction noise from the aforementioned Trump Towers. You'll likely hear frequent BOOMS! during the days and especially around the pool area which isn't sheltered from the ongoing construction . The hotel manager (Dan?) arranged for those in our party to walk over and enjoy the pool amenities of the nearby Reef Hotel. This made those in our party happy. There are only two elevator shafts per tower, and sometimes this can be an issue even though the elevators seem to be high tech. Keep your key cards handy at all times. You'll need them to get to any of the floors going up or down, except for the lobby. This is likely in place to prevent freeloaders from entering the buffet or pool areas on the 4th floor. Soft drink machines are on alternate floors only. The 24 hr gym is small and stuffy, but has high end cardio machines with tv's attached. They also have a 24 hr laundry room that came in handy. The have reliable wireless internet in the lobby and on the 4th floor, but we had a devil of a time with the in-room ethernet. Advertised as 50x fast, but was often times slower than dial-up when we could connect at all. When we called about this, we were given the usual "server issue" response. One of the days we asked the concierge to help us with renting a minivan. They tried two companies that they "partner" with but then sent us off to another hotel when we asked about Hertz. Episode illustrated to us that the concept of "Spirit of Aloha" gets a little fuzzier to define when a dollar isn't to be made or had. All in all, it's hard to have a bad vacation in Hawaii. This was about my 10th time to Oahu. Many of the locals will tell you to go to the other islands to get the real taste of Hawaii, and I think I'll take their advice next time.Cheers & Aloha!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: 7 of us stayed at the Embassy Suites for my mother in laws 60th. We had 2x2 bedroom suites and they were great. Always clean and a great size. Staff were very helpful and I dealt with most of them during our stay asking directions and recommendations. Food is hard for us Kiwi's to get used to. Not our usual breakfast but hubby made great use of the omelette chef. Yes there is construction going on as the new Trump Tower is being built next door but it never bothered me. I have kids and am used to switching off to loud noise. I liked the location and the fact it is not on the beach front did not bother me as we were going to Maui and only went swimming at Waikiki once since it is not exactly a great beach. I would definately return.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: OK. I stayed here just last week and was here for 6 days. I came with my girlfriend and chose this because it was one of the most highly rated here that was available. This is my experience while checking in...I got there and (because I'd read about the construction and also warned not to get a room next to elevators) I requested a room away from both. I was told that the only rooms with King beds was next to the elevator. I was also told that there were none with Kings away from contruction. I was given the option to pay an additional $50 per night to get a room with 2 beds on a high floor away from elevators and Trump construction. I was extremely annoyed because I felt like I was the victim of the old 'bait an switch'. It was terrible way to start a vacation. Nevertheless, i paid it because I'd rather pay more for peace than ruin my entire vacation. Once I got to the room , it had a wonderful view and the decor, etc. was nice.This is the list of pros and cons based on my experience there...Pros:Location (right in the edge of Waikiki and you can get to just about anything on the beach from here)Newness (the room was updated and modern)Staff (friendly and courteous)Business Center (Internet access..whoo hoo!)Breakfast (the breakfast buffet is probably the most memorable thing about the hotel)Managers Reception (can't go wrong with free drinks. the snacks were not that good but it WAS free)Cons:Pool (always crowded with wayyy too many kids. Can you consider an adults-only hour or two a day?? One day, a young girl threw up in the )Location (the front of the hotel is on the Trump construction side and it's a pretty small narrow street. Some tour buses are not allowed down this street because they don't fit.)Fitness room (This was small and while they DID have quite a few treadmills, it's inadequate for weighlifters)Final thoughts: If you're looking for a hotel with lots of 'stuff' then this is the wrong place for you. The Hilton Waikiki Village has shops on th epremises and a private lake, etc. It seems to be more adult friendly. I've heard that they nickel and dime you to death and it's older and tackier. If the hotel for you is one that's clean, and provides a good home base so that you can explore the island. I'd recommend the Embassy Suites.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Before I booked this place I knew 3 things from reading Trip Advisor:1) Construction noise (thanks Donald)2) Lots of kids3) It ranked #5 in Honolulu, where there are about 8 million hotelsAfter having stayed there for 6 nights, I can confirm that there is in fact construction noise, a fair amount of kids (no big deal really) and it was a clean, nice hotel in a great location for a decent price. I paid $249/night AAA rate and I didn't feel overcharged at all.A couple things to note:1) If you select a room with a king-size bed you will be next to the elevators and they will annoy you all night long. We moved to a room with two double beds and while not our first choice it was much quieter and we were happy.2) The construction noise is very real and very annoying. However, our second room was in the Aloha tower on the side away from the construction and noise was a non-issue after that. If you have a room on the side where the construction is happening it will probably bother you. Something to consider.You will not, however, be able to escape the noise while at the pool. If you wait until 3pm to visit the pool you will avoid the noise.3) I was unaware of the free breakfast when I booked the hotel and was very pleasantly surprised. The food was good and there was plenty to choose from. This is NOT the cheesy continental breakfast most US hotels offer. They also have a Manager's Reception each evening with free drinks and snacks.4) Valet parking is mandatory and costs $25/day before tips. We were able to rent a car for the day for $38 and returned it that night. That might be a better solution if you're a cheapskate like me.Overall the staff was friendly and helpful. Suite setup is great and bathroom is quite large.Location is great with plenty of shops & restaurants nearby and the beach is a 5 minute walk.The ABC Store (2 right outside the hotel) will have everything you'll need at reasonable prices. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family and would not hesitate to stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We really enjoyed our stay at the Embassy Suites Waikiki.Pros:Great breakfast - nice buzz in the mornings.Pool are and bar were nice.Room was perfect - clean, modern plenty of room.Great location.Evening reception everyday was super - we didn't even know about this so it was a great bonus.Cons:3 pm check-in sucks if you arrive early after a long flight with young kids. The reception staff are clearly trained to just tell me people to whistle dixie if they arrive early - no flexiblity about it and the bad news was not delivered with any charm. This really soured our first day at the hotel. I was fully aware that the check-in time was 3pm but it's the first time I have not been able to get checked-in early anywhere in a hotel which was far from full.Construction going on beside the pool area is ugly and at times noisy but it was not a big problem for us - rarley payed it much attention.We will be back - and we'll try to book a later flight so we don't have to deal with surly reception folks.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This has got to be one of the best hotels I have ever stayed at. The staff is very friendly and helpful. It is a great value for the price as there is a buffet breakfast every morning, which was fabulous, and a managers reception every evening, this just consisted of snack type foods such as chips, nuts, snack mix, veggies and dip, etc. We did spend some time in our room and enjoyed having such a large area to spread out in. The room is very well insulated, it was very quiet. Our room was on the 5th floor right above the beach walk and you could only hear noise when you opened the slider. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The Bad:My stay started off to a rocky start. Trump is building a tower next door, I asked for a room on the opposite side of the construction and the front desk agent insisted it was. I asked a few times during the check in. When I got to the room I think it was as close to the construction as I could have gotten. When I went back to the fron desk, they said they had no more rooms. After 30 minutes and calling Hilton Honor's Diamond desk they finally gave me a room with two double beds in the other tower. They wouldn't give me an upgrade to a king bed, eventhough I'm a Diamond member with Hilton.
