The pool during the day is also loud because of the construction.The Good:Although I had a bad experience while checking in, the good well out weighed the bad. The service was great aside from the front desk. I met Mark, Assistant General Manager, the first night there and he remembered my name the entire trip, eleven days. Every night he greeted me by name at the manager's reception. The breakfast was great every morning and the staff was very nice and helpful. The hotel's location was ideal, although not on the beach, it was just a minute or so walk, but really close to restaurants and bars.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Embassy Suites was great. The building was very new and clean. The staff was friendly. The suite was large and comfortable. The breakfast and manager's reception were great. Proximity to the beach was good. If I was in Honolulu, I would definitely stay there again, however, if I was in Oahu, I would probably stay in a less crowded part of the island. Waikiki is nice but way too crowded - there are much prettier, calmer parts of the island.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at Embassy Suites for six nights recently andthoroughly enjoyed our stay! Good location, nice staff,excellent breakfast in a spacious setting that felt like a smallapt instead of a hotel. The pool is very small and very noisyso to enjoy the experience a walk to the beach is mandatory,it's a short walk so no big deal. We had no problem withthe construction next door as we were up early to enjoy thesights. I would recommend the hotel drop the eveningreception even though there are free drinks, the so calledappetizers consisted of chips and melted fake cheese and goldfish, I would rather they focus on the excellent breakfastand skip the evening offering. Patrons are still getting goodvalue for their dollar without the evening reception. We found early bird specials at that hour to be a good value and better tasting then the manager's reception. I would like to extend a special mahalo and aloha to Jenny, our housekeeper during our stay, she did an excellent job and was very sweet!!We will be back, thank you Embassy Suites for an enjoyable stay!!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We traveled for the first time to Waikiki with our 2 year old so having a seperate room was key. Yes there is construction which kinda sucks but it only goes on during the day and the evening are quiet which was most important to my husband and I. We had a corner room with an amazing view of the ocean. We took advantage of the free breakfast every day. Also, it wasn't crouded at all and I felt prices in Waikiki weren't as expensive as everyone says. We had one lunch at the Hilton where it was outlandish but learned our lesson and didn't eat much at the resorts. There are amazing sushi restaurants and all sorts of other places to eat at. The beach near Embassy suites is also a lot quieter than the other parts of Waikiki which we really liked. We had friends staying at the beautiful Mona surfrider but they couldn't sleep at night since the hostoric building has such thin windows.We would definitely go back to the Embassy suites but don't plan on enjoying the pool while construction is going on it isn't relaxing at all. We were at the beach everday so it didn't really bother us.Good luck with your travels.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: It was nice to have a night in Waikiki, playing tourist. After reading all the reviews before our night, there was no surprises. Yes , hotels amenities are as advertised. That saying is true that you can't satisfy everyone, proof in the previous reviews, but this Embassy does a great job.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: After a travel agent couldn't find us a two bedroom apartment in Waikiki, (We have a 20 year old and a 19 years old and I didn't want to be cramped in one room like we have been, on our last two trips to Waikiki!!) a friend of mine mentioned Trip Advisor. What an incredible site! We came across Embassy Suites and crossed our fingers and booked it. Everything we read about the hotel was true. The staff were wonderful, so helpful and accommodating. The night before we left we had to send an important package back to Australia and they really went way beyond the call of duty to get it home for us. Even after we left there were problems with the courier and the staff took care of it. I couldn't recommend this hotel highly enough.The rooms were beautiful, the food was fantastic, the pool was awesome, as was the staff. My husband had an ear ache and the guy behind the tour desk actually took David around the corner to the doctors!! We love Waikiki and this hotel will always be our home away from home. We intend to come every year.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here 4 nights.Ok, first~ you drive up to check in, and drop your car off. You are in like an entrance to a parking garage, but NO! This is the "Lobby"! For real! You walk past the parked cars and taxis, and this is there is the check in desk is, outside, next to the parked cars. WEIRD. Outside, next to the parked cars!No atmosphere at all!!! Good: I Like the suite set up, our partial ocean view was between two construction site, above the pool. There was a 'kitchen' area with mini frig. We liked the Large rooms, bathroom was big. Roy's restaurant was next to the elevator, we dined there once and sat overlooking a busy street. (ugggg) "The Beachwalk" was attached to the hotel was nice. Shops and restaurants. ABC was across the street, near our elevator: ...convenient!! Morning breakfast buffet was included our rate, and was great. Food was good. Bad:The huge construction site next door. I read this online, but it did NOT sink in: Hello: Read my lips: HUGE CONSTRUCTION SITE NEXT DOOR......!!! Within your whole visual realm. It was Ugly. This was ALL that we saw when we went onto our balcony and all we heard come Monday morning! We went to the pool and heard jack hammering!!!! Do NOT stay here if you want peace and quiet. Across the street was another hotel remodeling. We would leave the hotel and pray nothing would fall on the car in between the two construction sites!I wished we had stayed elsewhere. I apologized to my dh because I was in charge of hotels. :(Embassy is behind another hotel that is ON the beach. There are a LOT of children and their parents at this hotel.The one day we spent at the pool? FILLED WITH CHILDREN. I don't dislike kids, but it was not our scene. If you have kids and don't mind construction sounds~ this is your Hotel!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We were there for two nights. Our entrie family was in Honolulu to take a family reunion cruise. The hotel staff was wonderful, and tried to accommodate our every wish. And they did it with a smile. The rooms were fantastic. The breakfast was great. The entertainment in the evenings were super and relaxing. Now that out vacation is over, somtimes I just go tto the website and look and the hotel and wish I was back again. I would stay at this hotel over and over again. My entire famil feels the same way. We really had a large group staying there and I did not hear one complaint from anyone in our party. All I heard was when can we get back to this hotel again.To The hotel staff thanks for such a clean hotel. And thanks for making our vacation a happy one.The Washingtons from Texas

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I used my Hilton Honors points for this stay. The first room we got was next to the elevator and facing the construction. Iwas expecting that since I was using points. I laid down to take a nap as soon as I got there and all I could hear was the elevator going up and down and the dinging. I called down and asked to change rooms and they said no problem. We got a new room but were still facing the construction. The also did not offer to move our luggage. The issues I had with the hotel were the erratic elevators and the noise at the pool. The pool had a group of teens in it unsupervised and they were loud and horseing around. No one from the hotel would stop this even though they saw what was going on. If I were going back I would not pick this hotel.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: In the past I have been a guest at the Hilton Hawaiian Village and was very happy! The thing that always got me was all the extra stuff I had to pay for.. As a loyal Hilton Family guest, when I saw this new Embassy Suites I jumped on the opportunity to stay here, and this is the perfect place to stay. It is in the Hilton Family, and you get more then a room! The room was more then a room, it was a suites, as are all the rooms. Not your typical Embassy Suite type room, but still nice.. The suite had a small counter top with a snick, microwave, and mini -frig, a nice sized sitting with with balcony, the bedroom was also a nice size. Both the bedroom and sitting room had a flat panel TV. The bathroom was what I would call basic, nothing special. A good size and clean. Here is the best part, all the free stuff. There was a nightly managers reception around the pool area, with a limited open bar, more then beer on tap, you can get all types of mixed drinks. There was also a very nice hot food buffet. The breakfast was also very nice, with a large layout.. All this is in your room rate.. but wait there is more.. FREE Internet, and PHONE calls.. You get like 100 min free phone calls anywhere in the USA. Parking was the only extra free $25.00 per day, they only offer in-and-out valet parking. It was a nice service, but I do not like to tip someone every time I want my car.. As a Hilton Diamond member I really did not notice any thing special from all the other guest. The staff was nice, but you are just a number to them. I think you get this at any big resort area hotel. I would stay here over and over.. You get a nice bang for your buck.. You can walk to the beach in 5 min, and many rooms have very nice views.. A very good family place, and I was very happy with this place.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: When we first arrived at the hotel we thought all was great. My husband and I are diamond members so we were upgraded to a very nice corner suite. The view from our balcony was nice. This will most likely not last for long since Trump is building a mega resort across the street. The accomodations in the room are decent however the beds are very uncomfortable. The housekeeping team at this hotel was horrible and made our stay less than great. Each and every day of our six night stay we had issues with them. They left dirty towels in our room one day, dirty glasses for several days, and on numerous occasions we had to call housekeeping to get toiletries that were meant to be left in the room. When we called to complain we were given the runaround. In fact when we asked to speak to the GM we were told that they did not know where he was and had no way to contact him. The area is very nice where this hotel is located but be very weary of the service at this property. We were very dissapointed with this property and will definitely not return to this property on our next trip to Hawaii.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I recently stayed here for 4 nights and it is a good location, Yard House is attached on the Lewers side. The rooms are usual Embassy Suites style with separate Living Room and Bedroom, sofa bed, fridge, etc. The staff was relatively friendly, seemed more friendly to Asian guests than us white mainlanders. I have stayed at the Hilton Hawaiian Village and they have great beach access and ocean views, although the rooms are not as nice and do not include breakfast. The beach is one resort from the water, walkway between the Outrigger Reef across the street. Anyway, it's about a $30 taxi ride from the airport if you don't rent a car, and they only have valet parking, no self park. Not Harley friendly if you plan on renting, they will not allow you to park them at the property.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I give the hotel 4 stars, and I'd add half a star after the Trump Tower construction is finished. It is a nice hotel with a friendly courteous, staff, good location, and the free amenities are a huge bonus.The Construction Issue:The noise wasn't too bad, it was noticeable but not overpowering during breakfast, and they stopped around the same time the reception began. We were in the Hula Tower and did not hear any of it from our room, even with the lanai doors open. Overall, it was noticeable but not distracting or too much of a nuisance. If you are sensitive to noise, then I would suggest staying at a different hotel.Value:The free breakfast is a great value, and it's probably save a couple 40-50 bucks a day, and even more if you are bringing a family. It was not too crowded and there was plenty of food. French Toast, Waffles, Pancakes, Eggs, Cereal, Oatmeal, Omelettes made to order, Bacon, Sausage, Fresh Fruit, Yogurt, Bread (White and Wheat), Bagels, Baked Goods, Coffee, Milk, Juice, and soda were all readily available. The food is fresh, and of decent quality. It's what you would find in a normal restaurant, not crappy cafeteria/dorm food.The manager's reception had snacks such as peanuts, chips, salsa, egg rolls, crab potstickers, cocktail sausages, salad, and other small snacks. They had well drinks, and the beer was Bud Light and Michelob Amber Bock.Staff/Service:One of our main complaints was the concierge service. They were unable to get us a rental car in Waikiki when we simply looked online and booked it ourselves through Budget. They were helpful in calling cabs and giving us shuttle information. I say book the activities on your own, but use them to get you taxis, shuttles, and other basic info. We had one housekeeper who wasn't very good, but another who was very nice and friendly, and waited till we left the room to start cleaning. Overall the staff was friendly, and accommodating, but again, book the activities yourself.Location/Facilities:The hotel is perfectly located. Its about a 1-2 minute walk to the beach, and there is plenty of shopping and restaurants all on the same block and within the area. The little Coco Cove convenience store is nice and a good way to pick up water, drinks, snacks, or other things that you don't want to walk very far to get. They also have Dole Pineapple Whip! The pool and spa area is nice, and was not very crowded. The bar is a little expensive but if you want to have a drink and relax by the pool its a nice convenience. The workout room was well equipped, but it was a bit too stuffy and hot, they definitely need more ventilation and fans. There is also free water in the workout room so if you have a refillable bottle you can just go in there and fill it up if you don't want to pay for water. The business center was very convenient, and the free printing is extremely helpful. Overall, I liked the decor, and the building was new, clean, and nice. Parking is expensive, $25 a day, so I suggest looking for parking elsewhere.I'd recommend this hotel, the free breakfast is a really nice touch and can save you a ton of money especially if you are bringing kids.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We just returned from a trip to Waikiki & Kauai. We spent 3 nights at the Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach Walk and we were not dissappointed. The location is great, just a very short walk to the beach. The new beach walk is very nice with lots of shopping and restaurants. We had no problems with noise as others have mentioned. The rooms were clean and comfortable. Embassy Suites is always my kids favorite because of breakfast and "Happy Hour". We were very pleased with the breakfast (lots of really good pineapple!) and in the evening Mai Tais and "all the Shirley Temple's you can drink!" We would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We spent a week at the Embassy Suites in a one-bedroom suite. The location is far better than most--just across the street and down a short walkway to the beach. Just down the hallway from the registration desk are several shops and fun eateries. The room was fine but a little smaller than other Embassy Suites we've stayed in. One pleasant surpise was that our city view room had a nice view of the ocean from the balcony. The courtesy breakfast was hit with the kids, offering pancakes, french toast, potatoes, omlets, scambled eggs, sausage, bacon, and breads every day. The kids loved the pool, which was very clean, with a little shallow area just right for our young ones. The hotel has a coin laundry facility, which after talking around, I found was rare for Waikiki.Our main disappointment with the hotel was the lackluster housekeeping. Several days there was still a lot of sand on the bathroom floor after "cleaning". OUr kids made some big smudges on the coffee table and sliding glass door on the second day that were never removed. Overall though, it was a pleasant experience and I would recommend this hotel if you need the space offered by a suite.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We just returned from a trip to Oahu and Maui. We stayed at the Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach Walk for three nights. The service was excellent after enduring an 11 hour flight. Valet took care of the car...bellhops at the ready for your luggage...sit down check in with fresh juice. The room was very spacious and clean. While there was not much of a view from the lanai(s)...there were two...they were very private.We were on a family vacation with two kids so the comp. breakfast was awesome. The omelets were wonderful. We also took advantage of the evening managers reception which was nice as well...appetizers, free beverages and entertainment in the pool area.The concierge was very helpful for directions and dinner recommendations.The location was good...a block away from the beach and beachwalk and an ABC Store just down the block!If we have an opportunity to return to Oahu, we would definitely stay at the Embassy Suites again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Hotel was very nice. Friendly staff. Only complaint I got is the construccion near the hotel. Noise all day. There is a lot of shops near the hotel and my favorite restaurant" Cheese Cake Factory".

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: EMBASSY SUITES BEACHWALK - like no other Embassy Suites we’ve ever stayed at. The entire Beachwalk/Lewers neighborhood in the heart of Waikiki has been demolished and REBORN, and it’s star attraction in the brand new Embassy Suites Waikiki Beachwalk. The suites are beautifully decorated in tasteful island style for the new millenium. There’s a flat screen TV in all rooms [not the baths, though] , kitchenette with microwave, refrigerator, sink, coffee maker and food prep area. The baths are beautiful with lots of under-sink storage and quality soaps, shampoo and the like. Buffet breakfast with omlette station is included, as are afternoon drinks and pupus by the pool with entertainment. The business center has free computer access and next to it, the fitness center is adequately equipped for everyone except maybe the professional bodybuilder. On site, much to our delight and also to that of the elegant Halekulani across the street, is ROY’S signature restaurant, and an instant local hit as the coolest new Waikiki hangout, the Yard House. Two stories of shopping adventures onsite. AND both a Coffee Bean and a Starbucks across the street? Perfect.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: After reading the reviews, I booked this hotel. We have stayed at other hotels in Waikiki, yet this one was the best yet. It is very new and clean. We stayed in the Hula tower on the 18th floor. The suite had two rooms and a small dining table. It also had a partial ocean view and two balconies. I was most concerned with the noise issues. We brought earplugs and never used them. Yes, the noise starts at about 5:30am but, hey it is the city and all the hotels have the same noise issues. Even on the 18th floor we could hear the traffic, but that is what you get at the majority of hotels here. This hotel is literally one block off the beach near the north end of Waikiki a few blocks from the Hilton Hawaiian village. The beach here is clean and uncrowded. Perfect. For A hotel not being on the beach, this was the next best thing,The breakfast and live music in the am was awesome. It reminded me of a cruise ship type breakfast because of the huge variety of food. Cooked to order,too. Evenings also had a drink and small finger food reception every night. The people that worked here, worked hard to keep the place clean and tidy. The chef prepared a special plate of strawberries for my son . He came out and met my son and it was quite something. Thank you Glenn. The people were great. The location is close to many great restaurants and the International Market for shopping. It was a great hotel choice. The business office was wonderful and had the internet access and printers. The suites are so perfect for a family and the breakfasts and evening reception were awesome. Sure beats staying in a standard hotel room.We will be back....

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Absolutely great hotel with an incredible location! The rooms are very spacious, so if you have children, this is a perfect. Even if you don't have children, you will love the 2 room suites and flat screen TV's. The hotel is a 3 minute walk to the beach and a 2 minute walk to the Waikiki strip. There are restaurants and shops just minutes away. Plus, Embassy Suites is one of the only hotels to offer a complimentary breakfast buffet...it is really worth going to by itself. Be sure and call ahead to get the best rate. We used the government rate and paid a great price. We would definately recommend this to everyone we know.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We just came home after 8 days at the Embassy Suites and had a wonderful time. We thought it was a great family hotel. We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite with our 3 children and my mother-in-law which was perfect for us. Both bedrooms and the main room had a flat screen television. The rooms were spacious and clean, and we had a partial ocean view which was nice. The construction from the Trump tower did not affect us - we never heard any construction noise as we were on the opposite side and the few times we were at the pool we didn't notice the construction noise either. We loved the area we were in - lots of great shopping, good restaurants and just a short walk to the beach. A previous review mentioned that the guests at the breakfast buffet were pushy and rude, but we didn't experience that at all. I found that everyone was very polite and people were patient and waited in line to get their food with no problems. The staff at the hotel were friendly and always helpful. We enjoyed the nightly entertainment with drinks and food in the evening the few times we were able to go. We had a pretty busy itinerary so we only went down 3 times in the 8 days we were there, but the entertainment was great and it was nice to sit down and relax with a drink before going out to dinner. We would definately stay at this hotel again and would recommend it to other families going to Waikiki.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My family of 5 and my parents stayed here for two nights at the end of our trip to Hawaii. Originally, we were booked to stay at the Hilton Hawaiian Village, but were able to add a night to our vacation but not to our reservation. Hilton let me know that they had availability at Embassy Suites. Having stayed at the Suites in Maui, and having such a positive experience, I thought that this would be a great alternative and booked the reservation, letting them know that my room would need to accomodate 5 people. (3 children, two adults, which did not seem to be a problem with the person taking the reservation --although he did inform me there was a fire code in Honolulu which allowed only four people in a room.) I also booked a suite for my parents and requested that the rooms be adjoining or close to each other. My last request was that if possible I would like a late checkout as our flight did not leave until 5pm. I prepaid the reservation and all seemed good.In terms of location, the hotel was a good choice--actuallly better than the Hilton Hawaiian Village since it was closer to the shops and other action of Waikiki. A negative to the location is that there is alot of construction going on across the street at Trump's new building and also at the Outrigger across the street. Construction starts early (although not a problem for us as my children are early risers) Also, the construction had more of an impact for us staying in the Aloha tower, which directly overlooks Trump's building, so much of the view is scaffoling and cranes.Another negative was with our checkin experience. Upon checkin, the woman informed me that I had too many people booked in my room, which was against fire code and that she would "let me go this time". I informed her that Hilton had directly taken my reservation and that I had been forthcoming with the number of guests which they accepted and took my prepayment in full for. She still insisted she was "doing me a favor" and was quite rude and condescending. The interaction was embarssing to me as other people checking in heard the exchange. It was quite an unfriendly way to be greeted and left a bad taste in my mouth from the start. Next, she informed me that there was no way that my request for adjoining rooms could be honored. She could not even offer me rooms in the same tower. When I requested to speak to a manager, he informed me that although I had requested the adjoining rooms, I had not indicated that I was traveling with others--which left me slightly confused because whey else would I have requested adjoining and and prepaid two rooms if I was not "traveling with the people--and quite honestly, what is the difference in requesting an adjoining room and indicating you are traveling with someone?The next negative was our room. We were taken to room 110 in the Aloha tower. In this room, there were no lanais, so the room felt like a closet as our only view was the Trump construction through a small window--no lanais or fullbig windows to open up the room.On a positive, my parents were in room 729 in the Hula tower. Their room had an ocean view, 2 lanai's--really nice. In general, rooms were clean, spacious and rather up to date decor--contrary to another Outrigger property we had stayed at in Waikiki on another visit. The manager's reception was ok-- Food offerings included cocktail meatballs, eggrolls, sliced sub type sandwiches, fresh broccoli and cauliflower, goldfish and on another night, fried zucchini. Not a bad selection for an appetizer to hold you over until dinner. Each reception included entertainment. Breakfast had many offerings. Eggs, breakfast meats, made to order omlettes, pancakes, fresh fruit, etc. There was definitely something for everyone. The pool is on the 4th floor. It is a nice pool and has a great toddler section. Only problem, it is kind of breezy on the fourth floor (wind seems to really move between the buildings. Also, pool is right alongside Trump property under construction.Other amenities offered were free wireless internet access, complimentary first 30 minutes on each long distance call, free printing, good selection of television channels. Regarding houskeeping, although we were on the 1st floor, they did not get to our room until after 3:30, when were coming back from being at the beach all day. We had to ask them to give us 20 minutes to clean up and then leave our room again so it could be cleaned. I should also note that our last request, a late check out, was also not honored. I called the evening before checkout and they told me I could call in the am and they would let me know if they wold honor it. So I called 7am the next day, and they said no, but when my family was ready to shower/dress for the airport, it might be possible to utilize a hospitality room if one was available. When I asked if I could reserve one, they said no--it was first come first serve, however, 1pm was usually not a problem. At 1, I went to the front desk to make my request (mind you we had checked out of 110 at 11 am). At first the woman told me they did not give out hopitality rooms between 1 and 3. I told her this was a contradiction to what I had been told. She hesitated a while, went in the back and gave me a key to room 101. When I took my boys upstairs to change, it turns out that this room was in the middle of being cleaned--sheets ripped off the bed, dirty towels on the floor etc. I'm not sure what a hospitality room should offer, but at minimum I would think clean towels. Interestingly enough, I am not sure why I could not keep my room until 1:30 as housekeeping had obviously hardly started cleaning this floor. One thing to note: I had a conversation with another woman who had a family of five staying there. When I asked her what Type of room she had, she said a one room suite like my own. I asked here if she was given a hard time. She said no--she had booked through the Waikiki suites directly and they said they would let her put her family in there, although it was against code, this one time. Our last negative experience: We inadvertently left our ipod on the desk in the suite when we checked out (very careless on our part). We realized this upon checkin at the airport. We immediately called the hotel and asked them to please double check our room. Interestingly enough the ipod never turned up.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We spent 2 weeks at the Embassy Suites Beach Walk with only positive experiences to report. Our stay began with a very hospitable check in and the hospitality continued through the rest of our stay by all hotel employees we encountered. We stayed in a one-bedroom partial oceanview room. The room had a small fridge, microwave, sink, a flat screen TV in the bedroom and main room, free internet connection and 20 minutes of free long-distance calls. Included was full made to order breakfast daily and a compliementary nightly manager's cocktail reception. The breakfast is a huge buffet with something for everyone including chefs to cook eggs to suit you. The nightly managers reception included beverages, appetizers and local entertainment (of which we always enjoyed). Staff at the Conceirge desk were always helpful with booking tours or providing directions if necessary. The pool deck was kept immaculate. We were impressed to see that the rock planters and waterfall in this area were scrubbed down with brushes several times a week. Everywhere on this property was clean and well maintained. Embassy Suites is just off the beach, close to Fort DeRussy. Restaurants and shopping are plentiful in this area. Several restaurants close by offer discounts to Embassy Suite guests. Some of our favourite restaurants were the Yardhouse, an italian restaurant across the street (can't remember the name) and Senor Frogs. I would recommend this property to anyone. We paid around $300.00 per night and it was worth every penny. When we go back to Waikiki, there is no doubt in my mind that we will stay there again!!LinetteSherwood Park, Alberta

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our family stayed at the Embassy Suites March 14-20th. We chose this hotel based on previous reviews and we actually split our vacation between 2 different properties - the HHV and here.Nothing really new or different to provide on the perks for this location: The rooms are big and the location is central - it's easy to get everywhere. Front desk and bell staff are friendly, location is excellent with lot's of restaurants, coffee and shopping nearby. All the staff at breakfast and the evening reception were wonderful, drinks were strong. They have singers and entertainment, which help to drown out construction noise during the breakfast and evening reception.However, many of the other items that other posters have listed as positives just didn't thrill me. I found it difficult to relax. Here's what I didn't like:1. Contruction noise is non-stop from both the Trump Tower and the Outrigger Reef. It's really distracting during meals and at the pool. The constant view of the construction site was also a negative.2. Behavior of guests at breakfast was absolutely zoo-ish. Think of a high school cafeteria or the early bird special at Country Buffet. Loud, crowded and pushy. The food, however, was good, nice variety of items. The evening reception was more civilized but the food wasn't as good.3. The pool was a decent size for waikiki but it was crowded with wild, unsupervised kids. No one seemed to be monitoring rough behavior while the parents drank at happy hour.4. Houskeeping never made it to our room on the 4th floor until after 4pm each day. It always seemed to coincide with us returning from the beachI know many guests have found this hotel to be wonderful for the amenities offered and it wasn't a bad stay for us. I guess I was just expecting something a little more peaceful. I will return to Waikiki but I probably won't come back here.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Enjoyed the first two nights of our (almost) annual Hawaiian holiday at the Embassy Suites. Good place to crash upon escape from a Midwestern winter and to get ready for a week of R & R. We even managed to arrive just in time for the manager's reception that continues until a respectable 7:30 PM with complimentary live entertainment, wonderful hors d'oeuvres, and first class beverages available. Plenty to tide us over from a day of travel until the morning.We did reserve early (6 months in advance) and paid the premium price to guarantee an oceanfront room. But it surely was quite nice to be able to sit on one balcony of our room and watch the ocean or sit on the other and watch the Trump construction that other reviewers have mentioned.Compared to many other Embassy Suites they have a very efficient breakfast setting with plenty of capacity -- and even live breakfast entertainment on one of the days we were there. No waiting and really nice inside or outside seating options. (If outside, don't leave your plate unattended to get a coffee or juice -- the birds who live in the neighboring palm trees come for breakfast too!)Keep in mind that Waikiki is an "urban resort". It's sort of as if Midtown Manhattan had been relocated into the middle of the Pacific. If you want to get out of city, you need to choose a different setting (we spent the rest of our time in Kauai.) However, if Waikiki is your destination, this property is located almost exactly at mid point of the hotel row and a really easy walk from any of shops, restaurants or markets. Even Cheeseburger in Paradise is, in our opinion, an easy stroll and well worth it. The nightly street performers are just a few blocks away, but so is the widest and best sand beach on the strip. One general hint. We've found that simply taking a cab to or from the airport is by far the most convenient route to the beach hotels and, for two of us, not all that expensive comparatively speaking. Also, given what you're going to spend for your vacation anyway, it's not much of an additional investment over the hotel buses. In fact, on the way back to the airport, the bellman put us in a stretch limo whose driver was glad to charge us only the standard cab fare (about $35 at present.)  In summary, we've stayed at several places on Waikiki. This may not be our favorite but it certainly is a great place that we would highly recommend. Families would probably find it to be a dynamite setting for location and value both. As grandparents, we enjoyed just watching and listening to the numerous families who happened to be there at the same time we were. Thank you for sharing your joy with us -- unknowing though it may have been!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We just returned from a 7 night stay at the Embassy Suites in Waikiki with my three daughters - ages 9, 7 & 6. I'd have to say that I have an overall favorable impression of the hotel after our stay.Everyone on staff was pretty friendly and polite. Our room was clean and comfortable. We didn't have a beach view, but our room overlooked the pool area, and we had very quick access to the pool which was convenient for the kids.The breakfasts win the show in my eyes. Having full breakfasts (it's a buffet and you you can order omlette's or eggs) was big for our kids who woke up every morning pretty famished. The manager's cocktail reception is nice in that you have an opportunity to enjoy some drinks and light snacks prior to going out to dinner each evening.Location wise was OK. It's just a couple blocks to the beach which can be a long walk for our kids after a long day at the beach, but not too overhwelming. You do have immediate access to the main strip on Waikiki so you can access all of the shopping & dining very quickly.Overall a very enjoyable stay - one hotel I would visit again. It didn't completely "wow" me to get 5-stars, but was the perfect fit for our family vacation.One note - the consierge area that booked all of the activities were friendly, but not all that helpful. I think they had their own agenda to sell their various tour packages, so make sure you do your own homework on all of the various activites and prices.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My husband and I just got back from a "mini getaway" 4 night stay at the Embassy Suites, Beachwalk, and enjoyed EVERY MINUTE of it! We are actually locals, and decided to book a hotel for the weekend since I am 32 weeks into my pregnancy, wanted to relax before baby comes and didn't want to fly. We have stayed at other hotels on the island before (Hilton Hawaiian Village, Ihilani, Turtle Bay and Double Tree hotel) but Embassy was by far THE BEST. We thoroughly enjoyed the full breakfast buffet every morning! Since we knew there was a mini refrigerator and micro, we brought deli meats and breads, left over pizza, fruits and drinks and packed it up for lunch and spent the afternoons at the beach right across the street. It was nice to also come back to relax by the pool, only to get MORE pupus and drinks at the manager's cocktail hour. The breakfast, our snacks and manager's cocktail hour held us over for the whole day. We didn't eat at a single restaurant our entire stay, except for going downstairs every night to get a coffee and some Beard Papa's cream puffs or Mondo Gelato (with buy 1 get one free coupons we got from the hotel) to relax and people watch. We took advantage of the many free nightly music groups at the hotel, or spent our odd hours reading the complimentary newspaper delivered to our door each morning. The hotel was extremely clean and the wait staff at the open lanai eating areas were very efficient and friendly. My husband and I plan to return each year with our new family as an easier alternative than flying away for vacation! We're HOOKED!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed here for business for 5 days. Funny thing was, booked this hotel because another was sold out. Really nice, new., clean and very friendly staff. They really went out of their way to help and accomodate. Had a nice 2 room suite on the corner of the Aloha Tower of the 9th floor. Nice view and in the middle of it all. It's not directly on the beach but 1 block away. Only 2 blocks from the "hopping" downtown area shopping and restaurants. The only disruptions were sounds of the garbage trucks in the am but it was only minimal. Breakfast was great. Lots of options and the manager's reception was really nice with Hula dancing in the pool area. I would definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We loved this embassy suites. It was right in the middle of everything. Just a short walk to the beach, many restraunts, shopping and people watching. We had to upgrade to a 2 bedroom suite because the fire code in Hawaii won't allow 5 people in a 1 bedroom suite, which didn't make a lot of sense but the manager made it good. We were right on the beachwalk and the activity below was fun to watch. We even had a peek a boo view, if you stuck your head off the balcony really really far.I was irritated about the valet parking fee, but in the end enjoyed not having to find a parking spot when we were coming back from a long day, and having that feature made us feel rich because we would not pay for that if it was an option. The valet attendants were great as was the reception staff. I would stay here again for sure. I would recommend the yardhouse and the holokai grill for dinner. The yardhouse has a ton of beers on tap, and a small happy hour, not many foods on the happy hour menu. the Hula grill above Dukes has a great happy hour.Something else that we did to cut costs is that Wal-Mart is very close to the hotel, we went and got those rolled mats for the beach, they were 1.39 a piece there, and we got water and munchies for the hotel room. We also bought a compact cooler, we really could have used an umbrella and I wish I had thought about it while we were at wal-mart. Try the swap meet for great souveniers, there are coupons in the oahu book at the front desk to get in.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Our family spent a week at the Embassy Suites in Waikki Beach.Our ages ranged from 84 years old to a 6 months old., total of 11 people . It was the PERFECT place to meet the needs of all. The hotel itself was very, very nicely kept and very clean, which was of upmost importance to us, with children. The decor was most relaxing, I must say the hotel exceeded our expectations. The suites are quite nice and rooming, allowing us to all visit with one another in the suites comfortably. The breaskfast itself made it,! What a wonderful way to start each of our days, the children loved being able to have all of their favorites, like pancakes, waffles, french toast, omlets, and AH! the fresh fruit was in abundence, we ALL LOVED IT! A BIG plus and savings for such a large group as we were. The access to the beach is such a short walk, very safe and comfortable in the mist of a big city feel. The shopping is over the top and just outside your from the hotel lobby, from souviners, to high end shopping. We dined at severl local restaurants, I don't think you could find a bad one. The choices are nurmerous, from chains to independent business with great service. The staff was most helpful for suggestions, and attended to any request we had, they even participated in our own little birthday breaskfast celebration of our granddaughter. I don't think you could go wrong! Wonderful evening reception that often took care of a light dinner for all.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The staff at the Embassy Suites are wonderful and professional. We had a wonderful view of the ocean that will soon be taken away because Donald Trump is moving in next door. The manager's reception was the best. They provided entertainemnt during breakfast and the manager's reception. The hotel is in walking sitance of the beach and all the shopping anyone could ask for.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Lobby decor was nice but didn't like the driveway going through it. The sit down registration was interesting and the welcome drink could have been better. We had a corner two-room suite which was excellent. Though there were no closets there was enough room for all our belongings. Loved having two bathrooms and a center family room. The Trump towers was going up and the noise level was not that bad but sadly the wonderful view we had will be gone in a few months. The walk to the beach was nice and there are many choices of eating places. The pool is small and was having tile issues so it was closed for one day. Would have like to have had the option to swim at a sister hotel for the day but the beach is right there so we happily walked across the street. Happy hour was a nice option and the drink menue was extensive at the Pakini bar. The students that worked the pool area were helpful and friendly. The breakfast bar was a treat but after three days you get tired of the same options. We would have like to have had some more "traditional" Hawaiian choices for breakfast. What happened to the "spam"? We did have a nice time her but it is unlikely we will stay here again. The housekeeping staff were polkite and worked well. The price was just a little high for a family of five. ALOHA

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We started out our 2 week vacation at this hotel and it was a great start to an amazing vacation. We explored 3 islands while vacationing in Hawaii. This was a great hotel! View will become less spectacular mind you once the resort that is in construction next door is complete. Close to shopping, beach, etc.. Only spent three days here before travelling to Maui and the big island. Good business centre, great variety for the breakfasts that are included, awesome view, friendly and helpful staff. Loved it!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: The last few times we've been on Oahu, the staff at various hotels have been indifferent at best. At the Embassy Suites, the opposite was true! All of the staff, from the front desk, to the housekeepers, were all friendly & helpful. My hubby & I got upgraded to a suite on the top floor, and had a partial view of the ocean & full view of the Trump tower construction. We were sheltered from excessive street noise & absolutely loved our view! The breakfasts were plentiful, with lots of options...even egg white omelets! The evening reception was enjoyable as well...with music & friendly bartenders! We'll be back!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Stayed 2/1/08-2/5/08 on the 15th floor in unit 1501, right next to elevator, but did not hear elevator at all. Beautiful hotel, located right next to Waikiki Beach Walk. Full service breakfast every morning, which included omelets made to order, all types of fruit, pancakes, waffles and french toast. sausage and bacon. Nicley done. Beach one block away, many restrauants to choose from. Only problem to comericalized, it was like being in Chicago in June. On the 5th we went to Maui, that was like being in the South Pacific.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach Walk is exceptional, from the cleanliness and spaciousness of the rooms to the proximity to Beach Walk, which has several excellent restaurants and tons of shops, to the free breakfast which is great, this hotel is a strong value for the price. Waikiki Beach is literally across the street accessible through a public access walkway between beachfront hotels. I cannot say enough good things about the service at this hotel. What we really liked about it is that the hotel is located right in the middle of Waikiki and you can walk literally anywhere. The only drawback was the noise from Trump Tower going up on our side of the building, yet that construction starts around 7 – 8am. The construction noise varies in intensity; yet it is an issue for those that like to sleep in I am sure. You definitely want to stay in the tower closer to the ocean for better views. You can see the location of the hotel relative to the Beach Walk at this site: http://www.waikikibeachwalk.com/ This is a great place for families and is packed with kids, and the pool area is used primarily by families with children too small to go to Waikiki Beach. Bottom line is this hotel is really great at service, and is an excellent value for families.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at this Embassy Suites for a week. We upgraded to a full ocean view after the first two nights next to the elevator. Do NOT stay next to elevator as it is extremely noisy. The Ocean views were fabulous. Three sets of sliding glass doors, two from the living room, one from the bedroom. Housekeeping kept the room very clean. While the noise from the street was annoying in the morning, since we were on the 17th floor, I don't think it can be avoided. My husband found the Trump Tower construction fascinating to watch, although I did not quite share the sentiment.The breakfast was simply the best, fresh pineapple and papaya and other fruit every morning. The omeletts to order were very good. Indoor/outdoor breakfast area was kept very clean. Entertainment was certainly an added bonus. Nighttime reception was very worthwhile. Try the mai tai drinks. Many "umbrella" type drinks to choose from and the music and hula dancers were quite good.The staff was all very friendly, front desk, housekeeping and concierge. We needed to use the Bus since we did not rent a car, and the concierge was always happy to give us complete directions to get us to our sightseeing destination. You can get almost everywhere on the local bus system. We found this hotel the nicest Embassy Suites we have ever stayed at, and it was a completely enjoyable week.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Beautiful hotel, excellent service, .....their suites are very good for families vacationing in Honolulu, 1 king and 2 queen bed suite!!!!... breakfast is good..extra complimentary Hula lessons were nice for the kids...one big negative was the street noise from the garbage trucks at 6AM...I don't think any hotel room in Honolulu,unless you face the beachside, can escape the dreaded clanking of the garbage trucks. For an expensive room however, I wanted complete silence in the AM. This wasn't the hotel's fault though. Overall, A+, you pay for it though.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I have stayed 4 times at this hotel. In the past, I received a bathrobe upon request. Now I am informed that only Hilton Diamond members are eligible to receive one.[Though the on duty manager made an exception this time].IMHO, when a hotel has bathrobes, they should be available to all guests upon request.I cannot imagine a 4 star hotel that would refuse a request for one.So for me, there will not be a next time.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My family of five (kids aged 7, 5, 10 mos) just got back from a five-day stay at this hotel. There are just not enough superlatives to describe how perfect this hotel was for our needs. For one, we got the 2-room suite at almost half its price by booking through NWA World Vacations. The generous breakfast buffet was perfect for us mainlanders who were awake and hungry too early in Hawaiian time. This was an awesome buffet with many many cook-to-order choices and bountiful tropical fruits too. I ate my lifetime supply of papayas and pineapples here. And there was even a ukelele performer providing live music every morning. They also have an evening reception with free cocktails and free food (egg rolls, meatballs, tuna sandwiches, etc)! How awesome is that. Kids loved it. And while you eat all the free food and swim in the pool in between, there was also an evening performance with slack guitar or ukelele music with a graceful hula dancer too. The hotel is also a block from Waikiki Beach and is adjacent to a great selection of stores (including Beard Papa, Mondo Gelato, and Teppan Sushi) so you really don't need to venture far to get a full Hawaiian experience. The hotel also gives guests a free CD of beautiful Hawaiian music. It is a special (smart) touch that transports you right back there when you are back to your ten-below-zero hometown.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: After escaping from the Waikiki Parc (see separate review), my husband and I were thrilled with the accomodations at the very close by Embassy Suites. Although we paid $100/nt more for our room, the extras more than made up for it.Jay at the registration desk was very helpful in picking out a good room at the last minute. He gave us a city view corner room on the 7th floor, but it turned out the room had a decent ocean view from the lanai. Our room overlooked the Grand Lanai where the food/entertainment and Beach Walk shopping center is located. Amazingly, there was no noise waking us up during the night.The suite was a great size considering how much junk you accumulate during a week in Hawaii. Beds and couch were comfy although the pineapple prints turned me off. Great flat screen TVs and big bathroom, however.The complimentary breakfast and happy hour helped facilitate our busy trip. We loved having the entertainment while dining. Breakfast was full of usual standards plus miso soup and salad. The happy hour food was passable to very good-- really, I was surprised at the delectable meatballs.What I really loved was all the little extras. Free internet! Popcorn and snickers greeting us upon arrival and turndown service every night.My only beef with the Embassy Suites, beside the decor, is the valet service. I hate that you half to show your keys to the valet guys and then wait for your car. Why can't we call down and have it waiting for us?

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This hotel is clean and offers a lot of space for your money. But it is not a quiet hotel. I stayed on the 11th floor and had a good view above the shopping center, but the noise from the restaurants and street below came right through the sliding glass door when it was closed. The other side of the building is also where all the trucks, buses and other vehicles approach the building so it isn't much different. Plus, the new Trump hotel/condo/retail shopping is being built so the view of Ft DeRussy Park is going away. It is very close to the beach and everything else in Waikiki. Here's the downside for those who care. The front desk staff is quite unfriendly. No eye contact and very few "alohas" after you check in. Not even the concierge desk or bell staff cares if you are a guest or not. Especially not the valet parking staff. They all seem to get along fine, but unless you approach them to want something, they do not acknowledge your presence. I found that highly disrespectful for a hilton property. You get better service at other hiltons, such as the Kuhio Prince on the other side of Waikiki. However, the housekeeping staff and pool staff are very friendly and service oriented. They are the saving grace of the hotel. The front desk manager has a lot to learn about service and should take some lessons from the other managers.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Visited for a week/1/12 - 1/19, 2008. The property is very clean and well maintained. The inclusive breakfast buffet is huge and delicious/the manager's evening reception with free drinks and snack s along w/entertainment was alot of fun. Location was great/1 block from the beach - pool looks kinda small but was never crowded or hard to get a chair. The hot tub/spa was wonderful. Staff was very nice/concierge helpful! The ONLY drawback here is the construction noise from Trump. I upgraded to an oceanview room when we arrived on Sat aft. Sunday was wonderful - could sit on the lanai and enjoy the ocean views BUT on Monday morning at 7:00 am - I was woken up by the construction noise. I opened the sliders to try to enjoy a cup of coffee along with the newpaper and the noise was deafening. The only day there is no construction is on Sunday - yep - they work on Sat too! AND when Trump goes up about 10 more floors (they did 3 floors - the week that I was there) - there will be an obstructed view (if any) of the ocean. So if noise doesn't bother you...stay here...Roy's Restaurant in the hotel was fabulous and you don't need a rental car at this location as everything is within walking distance. Try Captain Bob's snorkeling trip - complete with grilled hamburger lunch - it was alot of fun ($83/per person).

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We were in Maui for a wedding and decided to spend a couple of days on Oahu to see Pearl Harbor. We'd never been to Honolulu before, so we booked a suite at the Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach Walk with our Hhonors points. Since we were not regular paying guests, we did not expect to receive the wonderful service that we did. When we checked in, the staff gave us the name of a local sushi restaurant that was incredible and was right across the street , named Sushi Koh (see our other review). There was construction going on across the street and they gave us a room on the opposite side so the noise wouldn't bother us, and we didn't even have to ask for it. The staff was very friendly and helpful, the breakfast buffet was great. Hospitality hour bartenders were awesome, although the appetizers weren't so hot. Didn't really matter, when rating the whole experience! The hotel, while not right on the beach, is located on a street with lots of boutiques and restaurants, in a park-like atmosphere. Once we saw the beach scene on Waikiki, we didn't want to go to the beach anyways - it's sure not Maui, that is for SURE. The pool area was very nice, except for the construction zone overlooking it, across the street. Didn't bother us at all. We hardly noticed. Free internet service in-room and in the lobby. As a matter of fact, I am writing this review in the lobby while we wait for our airport shuttle - that's how impressed I am.On our last day on Oahu, our flight did not leave until 8:00pm. We requested a late check-out (1:00 pm), but were told it was not available for that room. However, they offered an alternative - to switch rooms that morning, and we could have that room until 1:00. We switched rooms, and left for our early morning Pearl Harbor tour, which was arranged by the Embassy Suites very competent bell staff. When 1:00 arrived, we checked out, checked our luggage, and were given a special key to the swimming pool floor so we could use the pool and services for the afternoon, including beach towels. Not only that, when it came time to get ready to leave for the airport, they let us use a hospitality suite for 1/2 hour to shower and change clothes, free of charge. We have never been offered this extra service before and we are very grateful to have had the opportunity to rinse off the chlorine and suntan lotion before going to the airport.Although Waikiki Beach is not our style, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Embassy Suites and were extremely impressed with the level of service we received. We would recommend this hotel to anyone planning a visit to this part of Oahu.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Only had a chance to enjoy this hotel for one day - spent most of our time on the BI but had an early flight out to Tokyo.Close to the beach. Nice shopping area close by. Wasn't as touristy as I would have guessed.Good Happy Hour and bar service. Very clean and very polite and helpful staff.Seems to cater to Japanese crowd - I thought I was in Tokyo when I had breakfast - 1/2 American and 1/2 Japanese breakfast items like salad and rice.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed here for 3 days back in August. The hotel was very clean, and the service was friendly. The breakfast buffet down on the pool deck was a nice benefit. However, if you're in the Aloha tower on the pool side, you will get some noise from the pool area and from the construction right across the street. Trump is building a hotel that will almost entirely block out the ocean view on that side. So if you can, ask for a room in the other tower.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: In dec of 2006 my girlfriend and i went to oahu for new years along with my parents. we first arrived and our first hotel was suppose to be the outrigger east, we got into our room and it was a dump, so we left and my dad found us 2 rooms joined at the embassy suites. when we first arrived they were slightly unorganized mostly because it was the around the first few weeks the hotel opened. they sent us to our room and as we were being showed around they bell-men politely said " i hope you enjoy the rooms, you people are the first ever to sleep in the beds, to use the bathrooms, to watch the tv " how unreal is that its like moving into a new house ... we were in awe. this hotel is by far the best hotel for waikiki, i have been to oahu every year since i was 4-5 years old and this is my best experience, it was so nice we didnt care how close to the beach we were. unreal breakfast, unreal maitis, unreal atmosphere, once you arrive you never want to go, i think anyone who goes to this hotel will be instantly pleased, im goin back this feb its just so tempting, hope you feel the same way. thanks

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We always try to stay at an Embassy Suites on our vacations and the new Beach Walk Embassy did not disappoint. Located on the new Beachwalk you are just a few blocks away from the beach and main shopping on Kalakaua Ave. Kalakaua Ave reminds me of Michigan Avenue with all the shopping you could imagine. We had the most luck starting the day early, having breakfast around 7:00AM and heading out by 8:00 for our activities. The breakfast lines are small enabling you to get an omlet easily and a nice array of fruits and usual breakfast faire. Also rice and miso soup are included which was a nice touch. You have the choice of eating inside or out on the lanai on the fourth floor.The rooms are new and clean with great service by the staff. Everyone was very friendly and helpful. The manager's reception was very popular with a host of drinks to choose from and nice appetizers. It gave us all time to unwind and decide where to go for dinner.We would definitely stay there again. The location is hard to beat. If you enjoy staying at Embassy Suites, you will like the Beachwalk.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We chose this hotel for a pre-cruise stay of 3 nights and were delighted with our choice. Our room, 421, was perfect. The decor was 100% Hawaiian complete with the hula lamp. We thought the bedside CD player was a nice touch although the complimentary CD wasn't worth bringing home, There was ample storage for our 2 suitbags and 2 suitcases and no noise problems whatsoever with the Trump hotel being built right beside the Embassy Suites. Both our patios opened up to the pool area and this location was great for sunning, breakfast and the nightly Managers reception. Be aware, if this hotel is being chosen for relaxing in the sun, the sun didn't hit the pool area until 9:40 at the time of year we were here. The only negative to the room location was the food carts rolling across the pool deck area early in the morning but, since we were awake anyway, it really wasn't an issue. The location of the hotel itself was perfect; beautiful shops and lots of restaurants within steps and only a short stroll to Waikiki Beach. The breakfast buffet was excellent and the nightly Managers reception had nachos and cheese or chili each night as well as the usual snacks like nuts, chips, pretzels. The nightly entertainment was very enjoyable and the talent excellent. They also had a group playing poolside one night and they were great. The complimentary internet is a nice touch. The valet parking was $25 but well worth it for convenience and the staff were so friendly and efficient. We had lunch at the pool bar and the food was excellent; grilled mahi mahi sandwich with wasabi aioli and macaroni salad, and cajan chicken breast sandwich with a delicious pineapple-mango chutney with hot, tasty french fries. The meal included 2 small frozen non-alcoholic smoothies - $23.98. We had a lovely meal at Yardhouse which is right downstairs but were disappointed with Giovanni Pastrami. The Honolulu Cookie Company is right across the street and their products make great, inexpensive, lightweight gifts to take home.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights. I have to say it truly is a great place to stay if you travel to Honolulu. The hotel is well kept inside out. Rooms and hallways are clean. The breakfast buffet embassy is known for tastes even better here. All staff are very courteous and helpful. I would have given it 5 stars if our room had better view of the beach. One caveat: they are erecting a high-rise condo right across the street from the hotel. It may block views from Aloha tower when it is complete.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: This is a brand-new (rehabbed) hotel and it is great. The location was great - across the street from Waikiki Beach and adjacent to the beautiful new Beachwalk, which has restaurants and shopping. It is also just a block from Ala Moana Blvd., the main shopping street. The outdoor pool is awesome and much bigger than most Waikiki pools. The hotel is clean and nicely furnished and the rooms are spacious and comfortable (though a little smaller than other Embassy Suites properties, but this is Waikiki). The free open-air breakfast is wonderful, with many choices, high-quality food, and live entertainment. The breakfast alone will save you a bundle (and a lot of hassle) if you are traveling with family. Truly a great value for the money.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at this hotel for a week and had a wonderful experience. We found this hotel to be in a great location, close to the beach, great shopping and restuarants. The rooms were very nice and clean. The full breakfast everyday was a big plus! The food was excellent. The staff at this hotel was exceptional. This hotel had everything we needed including a laundry room and gym. It is very close to the beach about a minute walk. We will be back for sure!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Just spent 8 days staying at the Embassy Suites Hotel in Waikiki........I had a heck of a time choosing a hotel, especially after reading 'trip advisor'! It was an eye opener - especially the photos... frankly after reading the review for my first two choices I changed my mind! Then a travel agent mentioned the Embassy and I started doing some research.Well I'd definitely give it 4 out of 5 stars. I was looking for some place that would have one or two bedrooms, as I was travelling with 3 older teen age children (1 boy, 2 girls and myself - which made sleeping arrangements a bit challenging). One think I can't understand is when booking the accomodations we could n't get a guarantee on bedding layout, nor would they give us a guarantee on having a 'lanai'? Whats with that - we got both........but the uncertainty was a bit unsettling.At any rate lobby was impressive, open air concept.......but stifling hot because theres no airconditioning! plus taxi and valet parking in the open lobbying area made it a little noisy and stuffy.However they did serve cocktails to all of us while we were waiting - which was a nice touch - and a cd with hawaiin music and info on the Embassy Suites was a gift upon check in.One thing that was interesting was that when we originally booked out 1 bedroom suite, we were told there were no 2 bedroom suites available. Had there been, it would have been more but it would have been manageable. However when we checked in - they said there were 2 bedroom suites but they were 150/night more with no view? Oh well.The rooms themselves were clean and tidy - actually I was impressed with how clean it was. We were on the top floor (20th) had a lanai!.......but man we were so high - it was major vertigo overlooking the balcony onto 'Beachwalk'.....views were great.......oceanview - but not oceanfront..........eachhotel decides how to describe their views so be specific when you make a request.The rooms were small, and that was disappointing (4 grown people)........there was one queen hide-a-bed couch in the livingroom, 1 sofa chair, a kitchen table with 4 chairs, a microwave, small bar sink and small refridgerator. There were no utensils, corkscrews, waterbottles or mini bar...The bedroom had 2 queen beds, one night table, on desk, one chest of drawers and one single wardrobe.There was no place to put suitcases - wouldn't fit under bed, and clothes? yikes very tight squeeze.But there were cd players, 2 tv's and very nice design, bedding, lots of pillows - but we had to ask for extra blankets, and it was great having a mini kitchen - although in the end really all we used was the mini fridge........Also great toiletries, had to ask for more towels every day (3 towel sets for 4 people????) and on average you'd have 2 showers a day, morning, and after beach?Beach was about 2 blocks away....not bad...but if I had a choice I'd pick a beachfront location next time. Having had both, its definitiely a preference........Concierge was mediocre...misdirection for busing etc.Advice? Take a cab just about anywhere if there are more then 3 of you! Its cheaper.......Also limo costs as much as a cab so make the request!Absolutely the best deal is their free buffet made to order breakfast......its amazing and inclusive in the room cost (the breakfast would probably be a minimum of $15-20 per person anywhere else?Also in the evenings they have a managers special from 5-7 - cocktails are free then - super! but the appetizers were, veggies, dip and nachos???? hmmm.All in all great, decent service (calling front desk and having someone answer could take 15 minutes.......but when they did answer they were helpful.This may sound critical.........it is particular, and overall I was happy with the experience......its just we notice what 'isn't' faster then we do what 'is'.........Super clean, immaculate, halls, rooms, bathrooms, close or rather on the Beachwalk, so shops, Starbucks.......everything relatively close. E-mail me with any questions if you like! Aloha!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed for two nights on November 3-5, 2007. I realized too late that the hotel is located in the most traffic congested and noisy area of Waikiki (most of Waikiki is congested and noisy). The Embassy Suites are twin towers about a block inland from Waikiki Beach and next to beautiful Fort DeRussy Beach Park. It's just a short stroll to the beach, so no big deal. There are alot of new shops and restaurants in the revitalized Beach Walk area.The rooms are well appointed, cozy, and the service is attentive. There is a small pool on the 4th floor plaza that seemed to be filled with screaming kids and teenagers most of the time. The breakfast area is like a brightly lit, noisy, high school cafeteria with little charm. The two pool bars were also overlit with bright flourescent lighting and very uninviting. You WILL stand in line for your breakfast, your drinks, your snacks, and the elevators. If it rains, you will get wet trying to get to the cafeteria for breakfast from either tower. Everyone at the pool gets to watch and hear the new Trump Tower construction team work loudly until 2009. We also had a close up view of the construction from every window and balcony of our room, and the workers could watch us in return.Parking was an overpriced $25USD day plus tips for speedy valet service. Don't forget anything in your car, like a cell phone, as it is a hassle to retrieve later.The poorly designed open air front desk area must have been designed by the same design team who put bright flourescent lighting in the bar/pool/dining areas on the 4th floor. The sweaty staff and guests also can smell car exhaust through the humid lobby. Lobby needs to be glass enclosed and air conditioned for a quiet, relaxing environment. For a more peaceful stay, I would recommend the nearby Halekulani, Hilton Hawaiian Village Resort, Ilikai, or the Hawaii Prince Hotel on Ala Moana Blvd. You will not feel like you are on a kid-filled Disney Cruise at these properties.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: Brand new hotel - opened Dec. 2006! VERY clean, open and wonderful. The staff is amazing! Very friendly and helpful.This hotel is in a GREAT location! Seriously, a 1 minute walk to Waikiki Beach. We had an ocean view room. However, Trump is building a 32 story building right next door so those ocean views will probably disappear in another year. : ( The pool area is on the 4th floor and very nice.An elevator ride downstairs and you in the heart of the shopping and restaurant area on Lewers Street. There is a manager's reception every evening with drinks and hors d'oeuvres. There is breakfast for hotel guests in the morning.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: My wife and I stayed here for a weekend between a couple of business meetings, and we loved this hotel - it's one of the nicest I've been to lately. I'd stay there again if I go back to Honolulu. The hotel is close to Waikiki Beach, but you probably can't see it. Walk across the street and between the Outrigger hotel buildings to get to the beach, which is now just a narrow strip of sand. In fact, the waves were hitting the sea walls on much of the beach. We rode from the airport on a shuttle bus, and were immediately greeted by cheerful and helpful staff. No matter what we asked about at the activities desk, they were able to help us determine what to do and how to get there. Our suite was very nice, with the expected very comfortable bedding and pillows, plus they had nice plasma TVs. Since I had already been on the road a week, we took advantage of probably the nicest hotel guest laundry room we've ever used. The evening reception and complimentary breakfasts were very nice, and the 4th floor rooftop lanai was very relaxing, although it was quite breezy one evening when a storm blew through. You can save a bunch of money by taking advantage of these complimentary foods rather than paying the expensive Hawaii prices elsewhere. There are many great places to eat nearby, but you might try either Ruth's Chris Steakhouse, or some great seafood at Roy's - both are in the Embassy Suites buildings. If you go to Roy's try the Ahi and the Butterfish!

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We stayed at this new Hotel for a week. On arriving we were greeted with a drink and extremely pleasant and helpful staff. Our bags were immediately taken care of. I must say in deference to some others that the staff were great all week. We had a 2 bedroom appt and it was brand new and terrific. We did not book an ocean view because we do not stay in our room during the day. If I wanted an ocean view I would have booked a beach front property. The price was very good when you consider the Hotel standard, breakfast included, Managers drinks every day - for 2 hours (NOT WATERED DOWN AS SOMEONE SAID), free Internet, free gymnasium and fabulous location on the new Beach Walk. I would gladly stay again and have recommended already to many friend. I agree that it is a family friendly Hotel. And to the person who was concerned about someone not getting a newspaper, it is a HOTEL not a Newsagency. There were plenty of ABC shops on the beachwalk for this.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: We recently spent a week at the Embassy Suites Waikiki Beach Walk from October 5 through 12. The hotel is located in the new Beach walk area connected to the main Waikiki strip. The location provides easy walking distance to the public beach, shops, and restaurants. The free breakfast is great each morning providing made to order omelets and fresh fruit. The managers reception each evening provides fresh vegetables, chili, chips, along with an open bar and live entrainment. Overall, the hotel goes out of its way to make your stay feel special. Our room had a double lanai with views of the ocean, mountains, and city.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I stayed at this hotel and I must say that based on the reviews for the most part it sounded great. The room was just okay and really not worth the asking price though. I was also really disappointed with the staff. The front desk ladies were quite uppity. I was in the lobby waiting for a taxi when a nicely dressed lady with baby went to the front desk and asked for one of the "free" newspapers that have coupons in them. She also asked if she could purchase one of the papers with a price on it. She was told that she could not have one as they are for hotel guests only. She was not even asked if she was a guest. She was also told she could not purchase one of the pay type papers. She was not told where to get one either. The lady at the desk was VERY snobby and her tone of voice was down right rude. I was truly embarrassed for the poor lady who asked for the paper as she had class and was polite and well spoken. She seemed taken aback by the front desk lady and you could tell she had her feelings hurt. I am not talking about the newspapers that you get from the store. This was the type that they give away free and states "FREE" right on the front. This clerk had no class and was down right mean. I would NEVER stay here again. The spirit of aloha my foot. Not here anyway. More like aloha where's your money now go away.

hotel_name: Embassy Suites By Hilton - Waikiki Beach Walk
review_body: I was very disappointed in this hotel. I looked very hard into this new hotel in Hawaii to find it only disappointed me. The swimming pool was under renovations, which did not open till two days before we were leaving. I booked this hotel for the pool since it has a section for children. I have a 19 month baby. The told us to go across the street for the other hotels pool. Which was not nice and overcrowed. If I am paying all this money for this hotel and since this hotel is new, why is it under renovations already! I phoned a couple of days to confirm my reservation and they mentioned nothing about the pool or the crazy fee for the parking! The room was small, especially the sitting area. Our shower was clogged and the blow dryer did not work properly. They screwed up on our reservaton and did not move us till the next day. They tried to make it up to us by giving us a discount on the parking when we left, but this is definitely not a five star hotel. Try a three star hotel!
